58.description: I was disappointed with Dagostino's. I had read some reviews that the one in wrigleyville had some of the best thin crust in the city. I thought the pizza lacked flavor and the crust tasted like cardboard. I would not go back.

56.description: I always feel like when I give three stars it is a little mean. Not this time. D'Ags is really  just A-ok. I mean when it is 11pm where the hell else ya gonna order from? Mc'd aint deliverin' and you really aint goin out anywhere so why the hell not?If you order traditional, known pizza combinations you are safe. Veer into their specialty pizzas and the uncharted territory becomes very murky and quite unpredictable. I mean really really unpredictable. The BBQ chicken pizza is chunks of chicken breast with cheese on top then BBQ sauce is seemingly added on top. And it seemed like where the tomato sauce should be was BBQ sauce too. I was confused to look at it and my taste buds were entirely perplexed.Ordered garlic bread with marinara. Got charged for the marinara but not the garlic bread. Only got the marinara. Not the garlic bread. Why the hell would anyone order a side of marinara sauce with BBQ chicken pizza? The idea made me want to vomit.Never been to the brick and mortar restaurant. Pretty sure I'm not missing much. I'll continue to order from here basically because it is in my hood and the options are limited late night. Will I like it? Who knows, it's like a crap shoot with this place.

29.description: Love the thin crust pizza.  Sausage is a little sweet which i like.  Solid place great menu.

42.description: Why the heck do I even try to give this place another try? Ordered through GrubHub. Had to pick up food for my entire companys dinner meeting. GrubHub said order was ready for pickup.Once again, I come over and they haven't had anything cooked.Messed up my company meeting + a surprise birthday party about a year ago.Place is terribly managed. Get your sh!t together man.

23.description: D'Agostino's is good, but its nothing phenomenal. My boyfriend lives near this location, so we'll stop in every now and then to grab a pizza. We went in last weekend and sat at a high top in the bar area. The bartender (I think his name was Mike) Served us. We got a thin crust and a half antipasto salad (perfect for 2). The Salad was really good, it was our first time getting it, and the thin crust is always pretty tasty. I like that the sauce is sweet.  Everything came out in a timely manner and our server was really nice. My only complaint is that we sat right near the area where the servers congregate in front of the kitchen window, so we heard every bit of their personal conversations. I worked in restaurants for years so I understand how it goes,especially since the place was dead, but we would have liked to not hear every detail of their night's plans or how they wished they would be sent home soon. I've also noticed that almost every time I come here, I am absolutely freezing. I am not sure if its because there are so many windows or just a coincidence. Overall the food is good, the servers are nice and personable, definitely a nice place to stop in to grab a pizza and a casual drink or two.

47.description: Love Dags!  Great neighborhood place! So cheap you cannot bitch about anything being not haute cuisine.  Great drink specials and  Their pizza is actually very good. They have a full bar and have great food and drink specials. Service is attentive from both the bartender and the waiters.

8.description: I really want to like D'Agostino's.  I live really closeby and the service has always been great.  I just really don't like the pizza.  I've had the thick and the thin, and a couple bites in, I start wondering if I have a cold.  Where's the flavor?  I'll be back again in 6 months in hopes that they've changed their recipe.

31.description: My all time favorite pizza place. The pizza is thin, not too much cheese and the sauce is on the sweeter side. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because there are times I order and the pizza is under cooked because of adding too much cheese when I order a pizza with a chunky topping like pineapple. Most of the time the pizza is perfect. I guess it depends on who's working that evening.

34.description: Currently my go-to place for delivery (only b/c I'm outside of Piece's delivery zone). This place is great for thin crust square slices.  The crust holds up very well - not soggy at all. The Greek salad is also excellent and comes with a delicious dressing.

16.description: The food is always good.  The delivery is fast and they deliver alcohol too.

13.description: Used to live down the block from this place, pizza is awesome. Thin crust, sweet sauce, good price. Got a taste for thin crust pizza and your in the area

11.description: Take out customer service is always on the ball! On a pinch this place is great. I usually pre-order before I get on the blue line and then walk over. I must admit there fries are the bomb! However I was disappointed in there mini burger sliders. The meat tasted too tough... The BLT here isn't too bad, but try there jalapeno poppers. They do have a large selection of food and appetizers to choose from.

39.description: Another mediocre pizza joint. Its not bad pizza but its not great pizza either.Its one block over so its easy to order from for us.  If we weren't so close I don't think we would be ordering.If you're excited about middle of the road pizza then come here.

37.description: HORRIBLE!  We ordered a pizza and it came completely burnt and not edible.  It was so burnt that the crust and cheese were charred black.We also ordered cookies as desert and they were completely stale and hard as a hockey puck.I won't be ordering from here again.

0.description: I LOVE THIS PIZZA! I gotta tell you.. without fail.. the pizza comes out A1. We usually get double pepperoni (make sure you call and specify any additional toppings) sausage and jalapeno. I had gotten the giardinera from here before and it's overwhelmingly spicy (but that's just me personally). Again, I cannot stress enough that this pizza comes out amazing every time. LOVE. Also, the wings. The wings here are amazing. They are always on point with getting us the sauce that we need and delivering the wings naked (as preferred!) We order from here at least 3 times a month!

38.description: Love the thin crust pizza. They must add sugar to the sauce. Pizza is so deliciously sweet. Also get many of the meals. Pasta sauce is great. House made Italian dressing is yummy as well. Always very quiet, yet family friendly. Servers are so friendly. Excellent value. Daily specials. Wednesday 1/2 price pizza. Take leftovers for a second meal. #1 neighborhood go-to spot.

51.description: Amazing. My favorite thin crust in the city. The sauce is delicious, a little too sweet for some but I think perfect. Expert tip: ask for extra sauce on the bottom for maximum efficiency. The delivery is always quick and correct. My only complaint is the fact that they only let you use one coupon at a time when they saturate you in them via snail mail and text. Really? You have a monthly special yet you cannot use a coupon for free delivery in conjunction with that? Doesn't really make much sense...sigh...I will be back again...and again....and again...despite this issue.

27.description: We love their thin crust pizza so much that I frequently drive out of my way to pick it up on the way home.  (We live in oak park and can only eat so much Malnati's.). Haven't tried other menu items but they look, smell and sound wonderful.  (As does the ice cream selection). I Always get quick, friendly service at pick-up and can usually use hazards to park right outside the door.  I love that when I call they already have my contact info and can even guess what I want to order.  If I had one suggestion it would be to open an oak park location.

32.description: It took 27 minutes for them to put together 2 salads and an order of chicken wings while I waited.  The food is just so-so.  I wish they were better because they are so close to my job, but every time we order from here, I am reminded of why we don't regularly order here!  Their air conditioning is not functioning also.

54.description: I use to eat lunch at this place all the time a few years ago, from time to time we would have to give them a break because lil dude behind the counter had a fucked up attitude, but the pizza was good so we would always end up going back, i would sometimes day drink on my lunch break and they made a pretty good martini , well the other day i was hungry as hell and just so happened to pass by this place. we had to stop for a slice so i went with the usual deep dish sausage plus sauce with a ginger ale for $5. It was the same massive slice of goodness i remember the kinda sweet sauce, tons of cheese(you must eat this hot or it will turn into a big ass brick of cheese) big bites of sausage good filling slice of pizzza

48.description: 2 stars because the customer service sucks other than that the pizza is good. This is my 5th or 6th time here on a half off large pizza Wednesday. Every time except maybe once I've experienced bad customer service. Once my aunt and i ordered a ground beef pizza because she cant eat pork only to eat most of the pizza before realizing its actually pork sausage and after asking an employee are they sure its beef she says yes its italian beef sausage then we got home and called and spoke to someone else who said they don't have beef Italian sausage on another occasion I received a medium pizza and was charged for it which actually costed more than the large. When I asked about it the server lied and said it was a large he just made a mistake on the bill but instead of arguing I just made a note to never eat here again! But here I am once again but this time the rudeness started at the door. No way should I walk in a non-busy restaurant and stand by the bar as 3 employees walk by and barely glance at me for like 2 minutes before I'm acknowledged. And even then I don't get a "hello" I get a "dining in?" I started to say I was but not anymore and walk out but I was hungry. Out of the 5 times I've been here I've only experienced satisfactory customer service once and that was from a guy I had classes with months before. I live right down the street from this place and the pizza is great but the employees need reevaluating.

44.description: Lasagna with a block of meat and seemingly broccoli. I was born and raised in this neighborhood, resulting in higher expectations for this long-standing restaurant. I have been away for 10 yrs and time has not been good.

24.description: Enjoy stopping in for lunch.  Regardless eat in or carry out,  the service is top notch and the food delicious.  Enjoy their pizza very much.

7.description: DO NOT EAT HERE !!!!!!disgusting I ordered delivery The wings were cold and chewy . They also had visible freezer burn scabs on them . I assume from being in the freezer too long or not stored at proper temp ....Disgusting The rueben was chewy and cold. They slice the corned beef incorrectly with the grain so that it is chewy and fatty . Disgusting I asked for the burger well. It was red . No attention to detail . Disgusting They forgot my salads as well . I called in . They sent out replacements , but it took like 2 hours This place is not only a joke , but their food is disgusting!!!!DO NOT EAT HERE !!!!!!!!

49.description: Out of town friend prior to D'Agostino's visit: "Lou Malnati's and Giordano's is awesome!"Out of town friend after D'Agostino's visit: "Lou who?"Malnati's may have a lot of hype and out of town group think, but Chicagoans know what good pizza is.

40.description: we order from here all the time (i'm talking 3-4 times a month) but this time they forgot all our condiments, we called and they said they'd deliver it (we're 4 mins away from the restaurant), after 30 mins we call back and the chick tells us the guy should be here in 10 mins because hes out delivering somewhere else first. ummmm, hello customer service?! if you forget something that customer should be getting their order delivered first as you're the one that effed up. annoyed.

53.description: Believe it or not, I was actually in the neighborhood for a Girl Scout Leader training two blocks down the street on Halsted and Chicago.  This place was recomended by the staff at the Journeyworld facility.  I was here today with two girlfriends/co-leaders for lunch.  The restaurant space behind the small bar area is pretty sparse and lacking in atmosphere.  But the service was friendly and efficient.  The $6.95 salad and garlic bread special with the order of a drink, $3 for Bud Lites and $4.50 for Blue Moon's, is a pretty good deal.  I had the Tuscan.  It wasn't the greatest salad ever but it was pretty good with lots of crispy fresh romaine and not too much dressing.  I wasn't really too full afterward but the garlic bread helped.  I would stop by again at one of their other restaurants when in the neighborhood.

30.description: I am extremely disappointed in the service.  I have been here countless times and have never received such bad service! !  It's a Sundayand there are only three tables in the entire restaurant, one table was only  drinking ,with two servers.  I set up a table for 7 because they couldn't do it for us.  They brought us the wrong order. We weren't asked once if we wanted refills on our drinks, or water. I had to look for the server because we needed condiments.  Katie S. did not come and check if our food order was OK, or if we needed anything else.  I had to look for whenever I needed something.  Extremely inattentive!!

46.description: This place is a great neighborhood pizza and beer stop. (Their pizza is awesome) their drinks aren't too over priced (which is good for the area) and their bartender Liz is awesome. I had mentioned to her that I was building a website for a non-profit I work with and she actually offered to take a look at it for me. Not only did she take a look at it but offered some really great insights as well. This place is well worth a visit :)

1.description: So this used to be my hangout spot when I lived close by, so it holds a soft place in my heart.That being said, the last couple of times I've been here have been a bit underwhelming. The garlic parm wings used to be tasty as heck, the last time I got them they were meh. I did have a grinder though, Italian, it was way good. I mean I usually come here for pizza, wings and beer but the last time I was there I wanted an sandwich and man did this deliver! Oh and they deliver! I typically don't like delivery though. I want to come to a place that I can sit at the bar, chat with the bar tender or other locals, watch some sports on the televisions, and enjoy a cold one. This is that place if that is what you are looking for. Decent food and a great environment.And man the beer specials are insane. With the new happy hour laws, they have reduced drinks from 3-6. Oh and on Saturday all beers on tap are only $3! They've got craft and mass beers on tap.The ice cream here is pretty good too. Check out the place. Stay for a bit. Have a beer.

55.description: "Yay! I'm a fan" is an accurate rating description. Been doing dine-in and delivery for 9 years.  Not much has changed in those years - and that's good.  For what it is, it does a great job. Pizza is delicious - my fav is the BBQ Chicken Pizza.   Delivery is always speedy. Nice little outdoor space. Im glad its in the neighborhood.

9.description: Really disappointing experience. The pizza is excellent. The service was absolutely terrible and the follow through was even worse. We ordered pizza for a birthday party and asked that they be delivered around 12:30. Now I know that ordering on a Friday during lunch means its busy and hard to nail down a time. BUT. The pizzas came at 11:40. When I complained I got a really SO WHAT attitude. Thanks. Cold Pizza. Soggy Pizza. Sitting around for 40minutes.

26.description: The pizza is yummy and the SERVICE WAS AWESOME!!! We sat at the bar and KATIE, our server was so fun & sincere. She's very relaxed yet prompt, which really made for an enjoyable experience for my girlfriends and myself! We will definitely come back and hopefully our new friend will be there! ;)

25.description: Eh, pizza sauce was pretty bland. Crust was ok. There's many other pizza places I'd rather go to. I probably won't go back. If you like great thin crust pizza, you may want to keep looking, because you're not going to find it here.

12.description: Delish pizza but overall overpriced. Lived in the area for 5 years and have eaten inside, and ordered delivery multiple times. The last time my pizza was very burned-almost inedible. I called and spoke with a manager who didn't seem to believe me or care. I offered to send photos, and they told me to go right ahead. I was assured my next order would be credited appropriately. Next order-they took a whopping $5 off my bill and didn't care about my last unpleasant experience-or the fact that I WAS a frequent customer/under the impression I would receive an apology/appropriate credit (for a pizza at least). Take care of your "regulars" or they will find other places that do, Chicago is one of the main pizza hubs in the world after all-plenty of options!

59.description: I like this place. I order take out from here often.The restaurant is bigger than I expected. Sit down table seating on the side and a bar with bar table seating.Prompt, friendly service. Appears they have specials (food & drink) throughout the week. Pizza is decent for a quick slice. Sandwiches are tasty. They have Pepsi products...yay.I will be back.Bike parking on the street.

21.description: I would give the food a solid 3.5 stars, and I still order frequently- but I never seem to get what I order. Seriously this place could screw up free lunch- I mean EVERY SINGLE TIME I order from here something is missing, not correct, or the pizza shows up kinda cold. They offer gluten free pasta options but the staff never know what half the menu or what gluten free really is. Multiple times I've ordered gluten free pasta I got regular- which is problematic. I still order from here because it's convenient, the pie is decent, and heck- I'm a gambling woman ;-)

17.description: I drove by D'Agostino's on my way back to work and decided to stop in and see what they had on the menu.  I'm so happy I did!!!  I ordered the Southwest BBQ Chicken salad (with hot chicken).  It was delicious!!!!  I'm super picky about salad dressing. The BBQ ranch dressing was YUMMY - perfect for the salad ingredients.  I will definitely be back!

10.description: I was here one day; just in the area, wanted to have a quick bite and sit outside. When my order was taken there was a total of 9 ppl in the restaurant. 5 were already done eating. I ordered a very simple chicken parm sandwich with sweet potato fries. Do u know it took 32 mins to get my food!!! Again the place was empty!! When I got the food it was awful and flavorless. THE fries were burnt the sandwich had no flavor. I'm never going back here again.

5.description: This was so bad that it made me angry ... angry that I wasted calories, stomach-space, time and money on a meal here when I only had a weekend in the Windy City. If you told me they were serving frozen pizza from the grocery store, I'd believe you. That's how bad it was. It even had that recently-but-not-completely thawed look to it. After writing this review, I'll have to go back to my review of Santullo's to add a second star. For my recent trip to Chicago, D'Agostino's literally redefined bad pizza!

3.description: Meh, I dont really like their pizza.  The deep crust is too doughy and flavorless.  The thin is good, but I prefer a good deep.Its overpriced and not delish.Meatballs tasted like frozen ballsOnion rings were chewy and super greasyI wont be ordering from here again.

35.description: Pizza is usually fantastic, but delivery is hit or miss and lately has sucked. Delivery dude can't even operate the door buzzer to get into the building, and this after taking 1 hour and 20 minutes to arrive?? Pizza was cold, refused the order and sent it back. I have loved Dag's for years, but lately the service is really bad...

19.description: Currently my go-to place for delivery (only b/c I'm outside of Piece's delivery zone). This place is great for thin crust square slices.  The crust holds up very well - not soggy at all. The Greek salad is also excellent and comes with a delicious dressing.

28.description: Used to live down the block from this place, pizza is awesome. Thin crust, sweet sauce, good price. Got a taste for thin crust pizza and your in the area

45.description: I am in Chicago visiting a friend and wanted to try Chicago pizza, in Chicago.....and we stumbled upon the right place! I live in Nashville, not exactly pizza capital but raised in New York, and I know the discrepancies between NY and Chicago pizza....all that aside, this is some of the best pizza I have ever tasted! Loved the sauce and fresh cheese, homemade sausage, really great little place. Friendly service, when I return to Chicago, I will visit again and tell other friends in the Chicago area.....job well done! I am now a believer in Chicago pizza, thanks to D'Agostino's :)

33.description: The food is overpriced considering what you get. We ordered the BBQ thin crust pizza and it looked like a $3 oven pizza you buy from a convenient store. Okay place for grabbing a beer after hopping off the CTA. I might give other menu items a try

43.description: I will think twice about ever coming back to this place.  I got carry out -- two sandwiches, a kids meal ("chicken tenders" with a side of fruit), and  three bottled drinks -- and the total came to over $30.  My biggest complaint, aside from value, was the quality of the kids meal. The "chicken tenders" we're processed chicken nuggets I could have gotten in the frozen section of the grocery.  They probably did.  The fruit was a joke...  The apple that was peeled and sliced sloppily (parts of the core still remained) was brown and rotten on the bottom third of the apple.  I could not believe that they would serve such poor quality food at that price.  I didn't have time to go back to the restaurant to let them know how disappointed I was; however, I doubt I will ever make time to patronize this place again.

2.description: I've had pizzas ordered form here for work meetings, and they are usually pretty good. I've ordered things personally from here, and gotten decent service and decent food. They have a large selection of gluten free options. I've never felt like anything was good enough to write home about.Today though? I am not returning, on principle.My guy and I are starved, hangry in fact. Why? We waited over an hour for our food, only for a guy to call us from a different location to tell us that we called and ordered at the wrong location and he needed our card number again. After my guy hung up, I said, "no, I know I told you the right number." We double checked and called back, yep. We did call the right one. The woman who took the order was slow and not a good listener. She got the address wrong, even after having repeated it multiple times. Instead of calling us back to make sure, she up and sent the order to another location, that's who called us. So obviously, the original location calls us back 10 minutes later and says, "Hi, can we have your order and credit card number please, since we had to void it we don't have it." I won't recap that convo, but she basically she apologized lazily, didn't offer us any compensation, and acted like it was just a small deal. So, we said, never mind. Because let me tell you, to hangry people in search of comfort food on a Sunday night, it's a HUGE deal.So ultimately, you mean to tell me that it would have taken us 2.5+ hours to get our food from a place that is 4 blocks away, and they want to run us in circles and THEN act like it's not really a big deal and is a small mistake??? No one is perfect, but they really could have handled this whole thing differently. Not amused. Starved. Not going back. Is it wrong to mention that all I've had since 1pm was coffee, and it's now 11:30pm and with a lot of food allergies, I literally have NOWHERE to get food from, it's late, I don't want to leave the house, and now the coffee has eaten a hole through my stomach. Great job D'Agostino's, you've managed to pi$$ me off, starve me, and give me an ulcer. That's great work right there.Now, on top of this, I should note:Do not expect high quality meats here. Do not get a gluten free burger, I think McDonald's patties are probably better quality. The gluten free bun was ok, the gluten free pizzas are good, but I haven't tried anything else out of fear. Now I really won't. I also wouldn't attempt to dine in at this location. It basically just has a bar.

18.description: I would give the food a solid 3.5 stars, and I still order frequently- but I never seem to get what I order. Seriously this place could screw up free lunch- I mean EVERY SINGLE TIME I order from here something is missing, not correct, or the pizza shows up kinda cold. They offer gluten free pasta options but the staff never know what half the menu or what gluten free really is. Multiple times I've ordered gluten free pasta I got regular- which is problematic. I still order from here because it's convenient, the pie is decent, and heck- I'm a gambling woman ;-)

41.description: So we stumbled upon this place after a race downtown, and I was a little scared because it only had 1 1-star review on Yelp.  For shame, Yelp, this place is awesome- how about showing it some love?It's a small hole-in-the-wall joint off Milwaukee and Ogden.  If you blink you'll miss it.  Fortunately my girlfriend is a regular here and was able to navigate us here.  If you're going north/east on Ogden, turn before Milwaukee and there's a small parking lot in back.Anyway, the food.  Good stuff awaits you here!  I had a grilled veggie wrap with mushrooms, zucchini, squash, and red peppers.  All rolled into a spinach tortilla and served with sweet potato fries.  Totally delish!  My girlfriend had the chopped salad which was huge and had a huge amount of good stuff in it.  I thought it was over-dressed a bit, so maybe order the dressing on the side.  Our friends had a steak sandwich and the buffalo chicken wrap.  Everyone said their food was awesome, so there were no misses.Service was super fast and friendy, and the waitress got the orders right.  I would definitely come back here for a pizza or anything else again sometime.  4 well-deserved stars.

52.description: Gross. Just ordered the margherita pizza and had to throw it out after 2 bites.  It was way OVERLY loaded with raw garlic. The must have used a soup ladel to load it on.  Literally disgusting, at one point we were actually chewing whole pieces of raw garlic. Nasty.

50.description: This is my usual Friday Lunch joint provided my boss isn't on a power trip.  While this place is known for it's specialty pizzas, I prefer their sandwiches, paninis, salads, and wraps.  I really like their Chicken Cordon Blue and Club grinders.  I also love their BBQ Cheddar Bacon Burger on days when I have a bigger appetite.  Any of the above topped off with a side of sweet potato fries and you will be leaving fat, full, and happy.  If you are fiending for pizza and don't order a specialty pie, skip the slices and grab some of their pizza bread.  You won't be sorry.  The staff is always great and if Janetta is around, you will know it as she will be checking up on and chatting with you.  If you have time for a beer definetly grab a Kentucky Bourbon and oh yeah...don't sleep on the Gorganzola Walnut Salad.  Try it with their Cilantro lime vinagrette.

4.description: Carl who delivered our pizzas just now was so nice! 5 delicious pizzas got delivered in the time quoted despite the snow!

6.description: Pizza by the slice was pretty solid.  The Italian Beef sandwich was great.  Service was quick.  Fries were hot.  Did not like aggressive panhandler that made four trips through the place during lunch.

22.description: Been ordering delivery or pickup sporadically  from this D'Agostino's for nearly 12 years.  The second star is only because their food is edible.The menu is huge with lots of options, which is appealing.  I've never come close to genuinely liking anything I've eaten from there, though.  I recently ordered their "Create Your Own Pasta".  They only offer Spaghetti and Mostaccioli.  Not a big deal.  Pasta is pasta, so far as I'm concerned.  I opted for the Mostaccioli with Alfredo Sauce, which is a $2 up-charge, bringing the meal (which includes a small soup or salad) to $10.25.  I received a container stuffed with Mostaccioli, with maybe a few tablespoons of watery, flavorless, most-definitely not homemade Alfredo Sauce on the bottom of the container.  To add insult to injury, it was dotted with giant pieces of cracked black pepper.  Very unpleasant and inappropriate. I understand this is not fine Italian dining, nor am I even opposed to using a good-quality, commercially manufactured Alfredo Sauce, but come on!  Be a little more generous with the sauce and season it and TASTE IT before serving it!  It's embarrassing!  So, $10.25 for a pound of noodles and an almost equally crappy tiny container of soup.  I was relatively pissed off to put it mildly.  The kitchen manager is a genius or a rip-off artist depending on how one chooses to look at it.  They must make a killer profit on these pasta dishes.Their appetizer menu, while containing many options of bar food, is comically overpriced.  With exception of garlic bread and fries and maybe a couple other small things, appetizers start at $7.95.  Onion Rings and Jalapeno Poppers... $7.95.  What?  We don't order pizza from D'Agostino's.  Several other better options in the area.  I do recall their sauce being too sweet, and the utilization of what seems to be cheaper part-skim mozzarella cheese.  The cheese is unpleasantly rubbery and flavorless rather than greasy and flavorful with a "normal" creamy texture.  I can say that their broasted chicken is quite good, but can be too salty.I've never eaten in their dining room so I'm not sure about that experience.  The phone order takers have always been pleasant.  I can't recommend D'Agostino's food whatsoever.  It's just pizza and bar food overpriced and poorly done.

15.description: I ordered the Tuscan salad with anchovies and really enjoyed it. My sister had the Mozzarella Basil Panini and it could have used a bit more basil. Our server Ceaser was very attentive. Not sure what their official dog on the patio policy is, but he kindly accommodated us and our two pooches. Ogden is busy with traffic and therefore it can get loud, but the patio was nicely shaded.

57.description: Echoing other reviewers... I like this place. Neighborhood bar/restaurant. Good, inexpensive food for delivery, eat-in, carry out. Love the thin crust pizza. Service is very good, and friendly. Favorite place of many locals to hang out and grab a bite to eat.

20.description: Ordered delivery and gave them the benefit of the doubt due to bad weather, but they just simply never showed up and then it was past midnight and they were closed, but they definitely made sure to charge my account.

36.description: D'ag's is just fine. It's a decent New York Style thin crust, sweet sauce, nice and greasy. A slice of cheese and a can of coke will cost you $4 at lunchtime, one of the best lunch deals in the neighborhood.Is it the best pizza in town? Nope. But it's cheap, consistently good, and the service is always really friendly and awesome. They have a rewards card too, so your 10th slice is free. Tip: don't get the cannoli, it's stale.

14.description: Eh, pizza sauce was pretty bland. Crust was ok. There's many other pizza places I'd rather go to. I probably won't go back. If you like great thin crust pizza, you may want to keep looking, because you're not going to find it here.

58.description: I have been here three times since they opened.  Each time I hope that the service has improved with time, and instead I see that in fact, the food is not any better, and the service is slower. Don't expect to: a) place any kind of order in less than a 1/2 hourb) actually get that food served in the next hourc) get any kind of service or attention from the wait staff. The location is fabulous, but the food and service don't justify the wait or the inflated prices.  It would also be nice if they took the time to wipe the grease and spots off of the glass tables in the lounge area. Yuck.  I don't think I'll be going back to give them another try.

56.description: I am giving this place 4 stars. However, it would have received 5 if the atmosphere was a little different. Nonetheless, the staff are friendly, the food is good, and so are the drinks. Foodwise, I highly recommended the lobster mac and cheese and the buffalo wings. As for drinks, the "that's what she said" and "summer snow" are absolutely delicious. The quiet location on the river offers a unique and beautiful of the city. I definitely recommend that you check this place out!

29.description: The staff here is rude, aggressive, and get into people's faces for no reason. Horrible experience. I was part of a birthday party 40+ people and one of the girls who was with us was physically shoved by a big tall bald bouncer..for no reason! I'm scared to go back here it's unsafe!

42.description: Wow. I was really hoping this was a great place. It is not.Never again. Loud. Over-priced. Mediocre food. Anywhere that there is a whole part of the menu devoted to "skinny" drinks is not a good idea. We had to ask for the three blaring music sources to be turned down. Awful.

23.description: Came here to eat their Horchata French Toast...doesn't that just sound amazing??!The service was very slow and the french toast was good but needed more Horchata flavor

47.description: I bought the brunch for 2 deal on YouSwoop and was excited to go try it out. The menu looked good and the photos online made it look like a cool place to go for rooftop brunch. When we first got off the bus we saw the building and honestly thought it had closed down. There were no cars in the parking lot and the building looked janky and out of business.  Once we got inside there was only one woman working. We were hoping to sit on the roof as they advertised online, but instead sat on their outdoor patio facing the parking lot. All our food came out separately in 20 minute intervals, so by the time I got my food, my friend had finished hers. All around awkward. For what the food is priced at it was not that good. We were disappointed in the restaurant and had been excited to go based on YouSwoop reviews and their website, but were let down. Even with a deal it wasn't worth it.

8.description: Visited last night for some drinks and had a great time. I loved the large open rooftop. So much room Def didn't feel crowded at all. I wish I would have tried some food. So I Def will next time. Nice rooftop away from downtown  and not as busy or packed but still with a great view. I will return.

31.description: An organization I'm a part of recently held an event at this venue and it was absolutely THE WORST EXPERIENCE we've ever had. The security and staff were not only rude, but physically abusive of our guests. Out of an event of roughly 300 people, they physically pushed/forced over 50 out the door. When asked for explanation, considering we had paid Estate for their venue for OUR party with OUR guests, guests were told to "f**k off" and called "b*tches." The majority of our guests paid additional money for open bar access for 4 hours, but coincidentally, security felt the need to throw people out (many who had purchased the open bar access deal) within the first hour of our event -- a sketchy business move that cheated hundreds of our guests of what added up to be thousands of dollars. Besides the rude and unprofessional staff who removed people from our private party at our leisure, the venue itself was not fun. Guests weren't dancing because there was no clear spot for a dance floor, and compared to the many other venues we've hosted events at, this was by far the most dull, had the worst food (and not much of it at all despite paying a hefty sum for it), and was on the smaller side (especially given the price).I will never be going back to Estate, and given the horrible time that the majority of my guests had, I don't think anyone in the organization will ever be returning again.Edit: Even more disappointing, after our organization's feedback, management promised at least a partial refund to a representative of our organization for members of our party who had been thrown out, which was much appreciated. However, more than a month later, this still hasn't been fulfilled/two e-mails following up about it are left unreturned. Wholly disappointing and aggravating experience with this venue.

34.description: The bartenders here are jerks. The entire staff in general should just be fired. This place has potential, but the food is mediocre and the service staff is rude

16.description: I went here for St. Patty's day this year.  They had an amazing all you can drink special, but their food policy and bar staff made for a less than customer friendly atmosphere.  Their female bar staff all have chips on their shoulders.  They gave all my friends a ton of attitude.  The female bathroom attendants were much nicer - sadly.  They also had a policy that you could not order food unless you ordered a minimum of $25.  When you have an open bar special and you have restrictions on food, that does not seem like the safest of strategies. Regardless, we did have fun and during the summer, I am sure this place is pretty cool since it is on the river and has a patio.

13.description: If you've ever had to take a massive dump at a restaurant then read this review.  I loved this plave already but now I love it even more.  We have all had that time when we had a really good dinner then had to take a massive dump.  Well I just finished my order of Rock Shrimp & then had to take a massive dump.  I walk in the bathroom which was spotless & clean.  I picked out one of the stalls & got down to business.  The one thing that made me love this restaurant even more is that while I was taking a massive dump I was not in some flimsy bathroom stall, I was in a really nice one with real walls & a wooden door.  It was not some cubicle style bathroom stall with a flimsy door with a crack in it so some one can watch you while you take a massive dump, it was a real stall with a real wooden door.  Another plus about the bathroom was that while I was taking a massive dump I could hear the DJ playing good music.  I almost started to rock out while I was taking a massive dump but decided not to.  After my massive dump was over I returned to the bar for an iced tea.  My meal here was delicious.  One of my favorite items not just here but in general is the Rock Shrimp that Estate Ultra Bar has to offer.  It is shrimp deep fried & served with jalapenos to give it extra flavor & spice.  The portion size is very good as well.  Monday nights are pretty crowded & they offer 50% off of drinks & 25% off of food for industry.  Overall this place is awesome.  The bathrooms are nice, the staff is friendly & the food is great.

11.description: Came here to eat their Horchata French Toast...doesn't that just sound amazing??!The service was very slow and the french toast was good but needed more Horchata flavor

39.description: This review is strictly for the rooftop. I came here on a Tuesday night for a party and enjoyed the view very much. It's one of the best views in Chicago. You have to check it out!

37.description: Rooftop view of the skyline was beautiful. The Manager, CARL, could not have been more rude to some of the guests in our party!!  Extremely ignorant!

0.description: Great place to watch any sports event, lots of tvs, a good selection of beers and good wings. It can get super crowded so if you want to score a table for any sports event I suggest getting there a little early.

38.description: Eh, not that impressed. I was expecting a little more. Service was slow. But the waiting staff was super friendly. She almost told my boyfriend that they didn't have Blue Moon because she didn't want to go downstairs and get it from the bar.Food was alright. Not a bad place to visit once, but most likely will not be back. Please note we were there during the day

51.description: Great cocktails and amazing staff. Oh and the rooftop has the best view in the city!

27.description: Each year our company throws an annual holiday party a few weeks prior to the new year. The location which we've held it at over the past couple years had a change in management, so in searched for new locations. I came across Estate Ultra Bar and spoke with them. I received all the necessary information promptly, as I requested. Given the size of the venue and their willingness to host a private party made my decision making process very simple. There was an increase in our total guest count, and they accommodated to this, just days before the party. The party ran smoothly, with outstanding quality of food and service. I highly recommend Estate Ultra Bar for large parties and I am looking forward to visiting during the summer months when their rooftop is open! Thanks for a great party!  Definitely order the lobster Mac and the Caprese salad!

32.description: I wish I knew what it took to get the staff to be nice here. I believe the people that said they had a good experience here, but unfortunately, after four tries, and twice being turned away for dress code*, I can't go back. I want to like this place, because it's really close to where I live, and there aren't too many bars along the elston corridor. I think they are aiming for a crowd that is coming in from the suburbs, not locals, for a few reasons:- the location is not convenient to straightforward transportation - you have to take a cab or drive- there's a lot of effort put into valet service and space for parking (good idea when you're drinking at a bar, huh?)- the strict dress-code doesn't lend itself to someone walking down the block to get lunch or a drink - at all hours, not just eveningsI feel the food is overpriced and not of great quality. With so many places upping their game for fancy cocktails, the drink list here really leaves something to be desired. It took a long time to get our food and drinks, for it not being too special.For the nighttime scene, it's too much pomp for not pulling big name DJs. I'll put up with dress codes, crap service for bad drinks if they get awesome people to play, but they don't.*The dress code thing: first time - bad on me - I didn't know you wanted to keep it super dressy. Second time, it was because my friend was wearing leather strappy sandals. They said dudes can't wear sandals. It was in the afternoon before the Bears game and we were just trying to get some drinks and something to drink. Then I've seen them let super scrubby looking people in during the evening, so I don't quite understand the rules or what they're going for.I guess I just get the feeling they don't want me and my friends there, but then I am really at a loss for what kind of people they're trying to draw. So that's perhaps why I say they seem to want to draw a suburban crowd, because they certainly aren't being too friendly to their neighbors.

54.description: We went to a bowl game viewing location here that had been planned for a month, which one would anticipate would be enough time for the staff to prepare for a big night. Apparently, it was not. Our package was to include beer and food. However, they were out of all but four beers and ran out of their signature beer nuggets before our package even began. The wait staff tried to keep up with our large group but seemed extremely overwhelmed. Maybe for small gatherings and dinner this place would be good, but this was not impressive to say the least.

48.description: Went for early lunch. Perfect weather, got a table outside on the terrace. Our party of 3 had Dock Benedict with lobster, the burger chicken sandwich. The food was really outstanding. The chicken filet was exceptional! The burger excellent and the lobster and eggs delicious. And last, the Mimosa was really good.  Worth the drive for the food!

44.description: This place is off the beaten path, but worth the trip. The rooftop bar is awesome and there is a gorgeous view of the skyline!I worked with Natasha to plan a company outing and she was nothing short of fabulous. They were extremely accommodating and she made sure that we were taken care of at all times!Our group arrived late and they held the tables for us. They had already prepared our food, but since we were late, they had to throw it away. The food came out a little slow, but that was our own fault. When I went to go ask about it, Natasha added on a few extra food items to our package! She checked in on us multiple times and we felt very taken care of at all times. I would highly recommend this for any medium/large outing! We had a blast!Thanks Estate!

24.description: I went here for St. Patty's day this year.  They had an amazing all you can drink special, but their food policy and bar staff made for a less than customer friendly atmosphere.  Their female bar staff all have chips on their shoulders.  They gave all my friends a ton of attitude.  The female bathroom attendants were much nicer - sadly.  They also had a policy that you could not order food unless you ordered a minimum of $25.  When you have an open bar special and you have restrictions on food, that does not seem like the safest of strategies. Regardless, we did have fun and during the summer, I am sure this place is pretty cool since it is on the river and has a patio.

7.description: Simply put estate is the WORST experience you can pay for in the city. Be prepared for a RUDE and ARROGANT staff, OVERPRICED drinks and management that is looking to RIP YOU OFF.While trying to enjoy a nice date the following happened.- Waitress brought the entirely wrong dish which I could not eat due to allergies. - Refused to exchange it and ignored us the rest of the night. We spoke to the manager who said, "You get what you get bro. I don't give a shit about allergies, if it's such a problem why don't you just order something else." They refused to take off the wrong item off our bill and as I walked away I over heard him laughing to a buddy after saying "Geez what a fucking retard." - We also discovered an extra drink on the bill that the waitress tried to sneak in. This place is a TOTAL SCAM. With so many delicious and friendly establishments in the city I'm shocked anyone would WASTE their time and money here.

49.description: If you've ever had to take a massive dump at a restaurant then read this review.  I loved this plave already but now I love it even more.  We have all had that time when we had a really good dinner then had to take a massive dump.  Well I just finished my order of Rock Shrimp & then had to take a massive dump.  I walk in the bathroom which was spotless & clean.  I picked out one of the stalls & got down to business.  The one thing that made me love this restaurant even more is that while I was taking a massive dump I was not in some flimsy bathroom stall, I was in a really nice one with real walls & a wooden door.  It was not some cubicle style bathroom stall with a flimsy door with a crack in it so some one can watch you while you take a massive dump, it was a real stall with a real wooden door.  Another plus about the bathroom was that while I was taking a massive dump I could hear the DJ playing good music.  I almost started to rock out while I was taking a massive dump but decided not to.  After my massive dump was over I returned to the bar for an iced tea.  My meal here was delicious.  One of my favorite items not just here but in general is the Rock Shrimp that Estate Ultra Bar has to offer.  It is shrimp deep fried & served with jalapenos to give it extra flavor & spice.  The portion size is very good as well.  Monday nights are pretty crowded & they offer 50% off of drinks & 25% off of food for industry.  Overall this place is awesome.  The bathrooms are nice, the staff is friendly & the food is great.

40.description: 1 st.       first time I went was on a friday and not such a good experience. As soon as i drove my new truck inside the parking lot a valet guy wanted to park it. i told him i insisted in parking it considering i seen how valet parkers treat other peoples vehicles. he said valet parking is 8 dollars so i rather parked it myself to save some money. when i was walking out to the truck another guy tried to charge me the 8 dollars either way and i told him i parked it not one of his guys. so i got charged so i wont have to argue.2nd the bartenders in the first floor were nice and did not tell me anything about having to spend a certain limit per credit card swipe. i went to the balcony and ordered a drink with my friends and they didnt want to give me my card back until i spend at least a 30 dollar minimum which they didnt even tell me before i ordered my drink.drinks are kind of pricey. 12 ounce beer 8 dollars. 5 ounce glass of wine 10 dollars.the only good thing where the bathrooms like another reviewer said. i try to go on an empty stomach to bars because i don't like to sit on pist on toilets in bars. the bathroom was super clean. there was a guy always inside cleaning it up. putting soap on your hands when you were washing them and they have a massive amounts of cologne,gum,cigarets,etc for you to buy, (i think).another good thing are all the beautiful ladies i saw there that night. mostly 25+too bad im not returning.

53.description: From the parking lot, there is a pretty awesome view of the city skyline. Would like to come again when the weather warms up so that we can enjoy a couple cocktails on the patio.Overall, I liked the look and feel of this lounge. The drinks are tasty and strong, and the dj spinning played some good mash-ups of hip-hop and pop that I tend to prefer. Didn't get to try any of the food, but I'd rather just come here for a couple drinks and the atmosphere. Pretty chill and not so loud that you can't necessarily have a conversation. Get ready to pay $12-$15 for each drink, tho.

30.description: That's right mike. I right reviews when I've had a bad experience and as I look at reviews from estate. There sure are a lot of bad ones!! Cheers!

46.description: Went for the first time on a Friday night to enjoy the supposed great view.View was great...the whole city skyline.  Go check it out if only for the view alone.  Great ambiance.  When my friends and I went, it was maybe half full---that was nice because not alot of people had table service so people could sit on the comfy couch seating area (which is otherwise reserved for table service only).  But then again, it was half full--not exactly a bumping place to be.  We did end up leaving around 1230 am to go somewhere else.  Maybe it got fuller right after we left, I don't know.  Bar service on the patio was very slow---the bar tender girl was nice and good, but she was the only one, which made service slow.  My mixed drinks were ~$9 each I believe.Also, bathrooms were VERY nice (at least the ones downstairs).  Dress code:  most people were mildly dressed up.  no jeans, tshirt, and gym shoes.  But you don't exactly need to dress like you're going clubbing or anything.  although there were plenty of us ladies that were dressed that way.Overall, I'm definitely coming back.  I think it's at least worth checking it out on your own and judging for yourself.

1.description: Been here twice, neither time was great. One time I came here for a friend's reunion party, and the entire place is pretty much empty except for our giant group. The margaritas were good though. The other time I came here it was packed, but only because we actually had a major event there. Then one of the bouncers saw me sipping from my friend's glass (purely because neither of us wanted to drink a lot so we decided to share), quickly assumed that she was trying to pass drinks onto a minor, and started throwing us out. We tried to explain to them the situation and presented our IDs (Authentic Illinois Driver's Licenses, it's not even like we were using some obscure foreign ID). The bouncers clearly seemed to have an "Oh shit maybe I made a mistake" look but quickly decided to continue kicking us out instead of apologizing that they've made a mistake. They even threatened to report me to the police for drinking underage.... so we told them that we'd gladly answer to the police since we were clearly of age, and walked out. Oh well, this experience actually became a great story for us to tell, reinforcing the Asian people just look too young stereotype.

55.description: We went to Estate for a special deal to watch the NIU vs. FSU game.  When I pre-purchased the event tickets, the website said the deal was from 5:00pm-1:00am. I have an EMAILED receipt stating this time frame as well. When we go to the bar, at 5:45pm, we were told the deal didn't start til 7:30 and ended at 10:30pm. I didn't pay for that time frame, I paid from 5:00pm-1:00am. No one contacted me telling me there was a change of time, so once we were there, almost 2 hours before the deal we already purchased started, we had to pay for our drinks, meaning we HAD to spend more money. We had an additional $60 dollar tab for our group. Since the bar knew they were offering a drink special during the game, they should have been more properly staffed. There were 2 bartenders and a bar back. The bar back was very nice, and pouring beers, getting cans, but he wouldn't take food orders. He said we had to order from the bartender. I think it confused a lot of people. Besides being under staffed, they also were under supplied. The deal offered select cans and drafts and before halftime, they were out of 3 of the 5 beers being offered. The only option people had was Bud Light and 312 drafts, and some people don't like draft beer for fear of dirty lines and a huge headache the next day. They ran out of Stella before the first quarter was over. I know it was busy, but the bar was offering this deal, they should have known to be ready for a crowd. Lastly, "beer nuggets" during the game were included in the package. They set tiny bowls on the bar and it was pretty much a free for all. People were 2 rows deep at the bar reaching over people's heads to grab what they could. I didn't see one bowl get replaced once emptied. So not only were the "nuggets" already sparce, once they were gone, that was it. They were gone. We asked for a new bowl since our surrounding patrons hoarded them, but we were told there were no more. Overall, it was a horrible first experience. The only good thing about our time at Estate was seeing old friends and alumni. We left at halftime, annoyed and hungry.

9.description: The manager and owner is RUDE  and DISRESPECTFUL. HORRIBLE customer service. What was advertised on their site is completely false. The manager refused to give us our money back after we paid the online fee. You can't advertise first come first serve seating and only have access to a few bar stools. After having talked to the manager about FALSE ADVERTISEMENT, he told us "you don't like it, just GO!", and turned around and walked away as if he had a busy bar to tend to. At this point, the bar was pretty empty and he continued to sit outside and hang out with other customers. I definitely DO NOT RECOMMEND this bar. This deserves NO STARS.

26.description: Ugh...I wish I could give this place more stars. But the service here sucks. The bartenders are so rude its ridiculous. Unless you're a man waving big bucks or flirting with them, good luck getting their attention.  And this place is so convenient to me but I'd rather deal with the hoopla of the Viagra triangle than this.The 2 stars are for the food. The food is pretty good but you do have to deal with the rude staff to get it.  Not interested.

25.description: Have thrown many events there for personal and business functions and find great value and service. Parking a breeze, food while not Alinea is still top notch. The menu is diverse enough to keep me coming back for more great nights with great service enjoying amazing views from the roof top deck.  Definitely will be back again this year. Only catch is they are open seasonly.

12.description: Be careful when you come here very heavy handed door hosts make sure you bring a friend with you if are using the restroom my friend was attacked in the restroom.

59.description: I went to Estate with a few friends on Labor day (Monday afternoon). It was our intention to have brunch and sit on the roof. However, we were told that there is NO brunch because it was not the weekend (fair enough it technically wasnt, we assumed that they would do brunch on the holiday, not a safe assumption), and the rooftop is only open at night (a big mistake in my opinion! They are missing out on the summer brunch crowd, who are looking for a great rooftop (check), with a good food and drink selection (check), and located ON the water/ breathtaking view of the city (check). All of which this location boasts, but does not utilize to their advantage!! Additionally, you would think that Estate would indicate somewhere on their website that their roof is only open at night we assumed it would be open when the venue is open (the website says call for rooftop hours of operation, my bad). We arrived around 12:30 and the place was DEAD. But we sat out on their first floor patio right next to the water. We soon forgot about not being able to sit on the roof, although there is a cover over the entire back patio, so you won't be getting much color on nice summer afternoons. But the view is great and you feel like you are on vacation with the boats flying by and docking up to come in for a bite to eat. We ordered some of the specialty drinks and although they are pricey they are VERY tasty (I highly suggest the summer snow or any of the sangria choices they were all phenomenal!!).  We ordered our lunch options and they were all fine. The only mistake the waitress made was she forgot our calamari appetizer, but brought it during our meal and it was not a big deal at all. I will admit for being SO dead the service was a little slow, but not unbearable. It was a summer afternoon, so we were pretty laid back and parked up for the afternoon. Our waitress was more than accommodating, we asked her if we could see the roof since that's where we wanted to sit originally and she walked us right up there and took our picture. I have to say I would defiantly go back to enjoy a few of their specialty cocktails on that roof! The furniture and decor would remind you of a club in Miami or Vegas. The cushions were bright orange with white trim, eye catching but still elegant.  The view is very pretty as long as you do not walk to close to the parking lot side. That side looks more like a construction zone as I would assume that areas is still up and coming. Unfortunately for them that side is where the city sky line is, makes for a pretty picture just make sure you stay far enough from ledge. The parking and taxi situation I can imagine would be a huge issue. We drove because it was a Sunday afternoon and we were not planning to drink to heavily. But if it were a Friday or Saturday night it would have been a different story. The parking lot is pretty big, but not big enough if the club was full. My suggestion would be to use UBER. They come on demand and with this location being very secluded (not many businesses and certainly no other bars surrounding it) taxis probably don't come that far off the beaten trail ..... UBER would be your best bet! I'm going to look into it for the next time I visit that rooftop!

21.description: The staff is amazing and the atmosphere is perfect.  Their team goes over and above to make sure everyone has a great time.  Natasha , the event coordinator , came out and made sure everything was great.  I'm definitely throwing more of our company events here.

17.description: Have thrown many events there for personal and business functions and find great value and service. Parking a breeze, food while not Alinea is still top notch. The menu is diverse enough to keep me coming back for more great nights with great service enjoying amazing views from the roof top deck.  Definitely will be back again this year. Only catch is they are open seasonly.

10.description: I had my birthday party here a couple of weeks ago. The food was great, affordable, and just right for sharing with a group. I had set up a wristband bar package for my party and the whole night was a great time. The party was very easy. The only complaint one of my guests had was that the drink prices were too high. The drinks are definitely expensive, but if he had taken part in the drink package I don't think he would have had any complaints.I didn't drive, but some of my friends did, and they said parking was $10 if you parked in the bar's lot, and hard to find elsewhere. That's the city for you.

5.description: Worst night of my life at this place! Going to sum it up: 1. Clueless hostesses who claimed they did not have "enough" wristbands to let my entire party onto the rooftop for a party we pre-planned weeks before, and not to mention had to place a ($500 non refundable deposit for-who does this) 2. The service was slow, and unresponsive to simple questions3. Manager was rude and rather than enjoy the 1,000$ we are spending at your club you try to rotate our table before our bottles are done4. Security staff- brainless and rude5. Treat your customers as If you owe them something for coming and spending their Money, we owe you nothing!

3.description: When you are in the event planning business you get to see more than the every day customer.   I absolutely love Estate. We began working with Estate  last year. From making reservations for dinner to setting up girls night out events, the entire staff always accommodates.   Drinks- priced right, Food- amazing (try the shrimp tempura) Staff- always smiling and helpfulif you are stopping in on a Friday or Saturday and you think there is no when there, think again.  Make your way up the stairs to the rooftop where the DJ plays the most incredible dance, top 40 and throw backs that has everyone wanting to dance.   Its sexy, fun and yes there is bottle service and cabanas.   Table reservations are fairly priced and actually less expensive than River North clubs.If you are visiting Chicago, this is a place you must experience and if you live in Chicago, come by and checkout the rooftop.From boaters during the day to club hoppers at night..everyone fits in.

35.description: Went on a early Saturday around 9 p : Overall look of the place is great and great view of Chicago skyline: We Sat in the roof top area. Service started off slow but once the night went on the service became speedily.  Drinks ( had wine no mixed)  was ok but no worth the price they charged. Food was really good. You have to try their Lobster mac and Cheese was amazing .As the night progress I didn't care for the crowed.So I left around 11pm .

19.description: I have never felt so much regret going into a bar.  I will give Estate this, the rooftop provides a pretty view of the city sky line and is good for groups but it is definitely not worth the money that must be spent here.  Estate charges $9 for basically all of their drinks, including miller lite, shots of rumchata, and well mixed drinks ( on the rooftop at night, i'm not sure what the deal is at other times).  With that, the minimum credit card amount is $30.  The bartenders are impolite and the atmosphere is unbecoming.  I made the choice to go but I felt robbed and crappy after leaving this place.  Estate at least should step up their service and how they treat customers who are spending a lot of money on an experience they can get elsewhere at a much lower price.

28.description: Booked a Private sorority formal and it was Murphy's law. They bar staff was rude, the drinks were weak, and security literally swore and pushed people out of the door to kick them out for no wrong doing.

45.description: Went there tonight (a Tuesday) and have a few mixed thoughts on this place.  First, nice decor and great view of the city skyline.  Nice hostess that brought us upstairs to the rooftop dining and bar area.Maybe it was the private event downstairs, but is there a need to bump club music on the patio on a Tuesday at 6pm?  The menu was limited tonight, but I can respect that, can't overwhelm the kitchen when an event is going on.  No worries, I ordered the filet which came out the way I ordered it.The server was attentive and very nice, but it always bothers me when I can see multiple servers sitting down and texting in the wait station that everyone can see.  Is there a manager up there?  Table touch?  I don't mind spending $60 at dinner, but a check in from a manager should occur... again maybe it's just me.Oh and one more thing, charging $8 to valet my car 20 feet away from me in a parking lot?  I'll gladly pay for valet when there is no parking in sight... but when there is an entire lot... meh

33.description: I love the rooftop. It's great looking at the skyline. However it  depends what night you go because sometimes the crowd isn't that great.

43.description: Wow I had the best birthday ever here!! We started off with the champagne supernova which came with a sparkler! and cake pops! It was superexciting!! The rooftop has a beautiful view of the city skyline. And what else can I say, the bartender, Peter, was pretty hot and the nicest person we met in Chicago :) He made us a bunch of special birthday drinks which were all amazing!!! Our favorite was the killer special!This definitely exceeded my expectations of the best birthday ever and I would love to come back!

2.description: Not sure how this place is still open!  Was there on a Friday night and my guess is that there were less than 50 people there on the entire lounge (including the staff! Lol). My old fashion was great however they seem pricey ($12) given the portion. A shot of Jamo was $8 which my friends also said it was a lot for this place. They have downtown prices without the crowd or luxury. You have people wearing snapbacks and gym shoes which does not help the nightclub scene they are trying to portray. Doubt I would come back here since my favorite whisky joint is not far from there!

18.description: I wish I knew what it took to get the staff to be nice here. I believe the people that said they had a good experience here, but unfortunately, after four tries, and twice being turned away for dress code*, I can't go back. I want to like this place, because it's really close to where I live, and there aren't too many bars along the elston corridor. I think they are aiming for a crowd that is coming in from the suburbs, not locals, for a few reasons:- the location is not convenient to straightforward transportation - you have to take a cab or drive- there's a lot of effort put into valet service and space for parking (good idea when you're drinking at a bar, huh?)- the strict dress-code doesn't lend itself to someone walking down the block to get lunch or a drink - at all hours, not just eveningsI feel the food is overpriced and not of great quality. With so many places upping their game for fancy cocktails, the drink list here really leaves something to be desired. It took a long time to get our food and drinks, for it not being too special.For the nighttime scene, it's too much pomp for not pulling big name DJs. I'll put up with dress codes, crap service for bad drinks if they get awesome people to play, but they don't.*The dress code thing: first time - bad on me - I didn't know you wanted to keep it super dressy. Second time, it was because my friend was wearing leather strappy sandals. They said dudes can't wear sandals. It was in the afternoon before the Bears game and we were just trying to get some drinks and something to drink. Then I've seen them let super scrubby looking people in during the evening, so I don't quite understand the rules or what they're going for.I guess I just get the feeling they don't want me and my friends there, but then I am really at a loss for what kind of people they're trying to draw. So that's perhaps why I say they seem to want to draw a suburban crowd, because they certainly aren't being too friendly to their neighbors.

41.description: This bar is a joke.First you can't go on the roof until you purchase a bottle.I can live with that though.Than we waited 30 min for menus and another 30 for drinks.We ordered few flatbreads -nothing special.My wife ordered Tuna tatare and what came was ridiculous .5 tiny potato chips with tuna mixed with something on top of it for $12. They can't be serious serving this to people.5 star hotels, best bars wouldn't dare serve something like this. Never go there again and others shouldn't too If u don't want to waste money and time.

52.description: This place has come a long way :) I remember coming here when it first opened and had a pretty good time, and then heard about it every single day in the summer. Man was it crazy fun. I went back again for dinner and drinks with a date. They changed the menu a bit (Yummy, I rec the steak skewers!) and the specialty drinks are unique but still not too wicker parkish so I actually enjoyed everyone I tried, even the sorta girly ones. The staff were all awesome and really made my date a little more exciting. I had a blast, will be back and cant wait for the roof top to re-open

50.description: Horrible. I never leave reviews like this but I had to for this experience  1)  spent hours in the bathroom after leaving this place    2) service was horrible.  They did offer to take 20% off the bill (without us asking) because they realized service was terrible    3)my iced tea glass came out with white gunk stuck to the inside.  I had to go back inside and track down someone (we were out on the patio) to get me a new glass.  I sat for much too long on a hot summer day waiting for someone to bring me a clean glass of tea   4) When my tea ran out we sat for a very long time again with nothing to drink with our food before anyone came out to ask for a refill   5) angus sliders had no flavor and were hard  6) deviled eggs tasted like chemicals (perhaps that was what made me sick? or was it the unwashed glasses?

4.description: Had a blast there for my Birthday! everything was great! only one thing: high heels and lounge outside are not great combination, couldnt move at all, was scared to get stuck! but place is great!

6.description: There is good reason you see so many 1 or 2 star reviews for this place. I don't usually take the time to rate a business I do not like, but this place isn't worth anyone's time.

22.description: Was there this past weekend for a birthday party. After reading the reviews, I really didn't expect much. Boy did they prove me wrong! Lets start with the place itself. It's absolutely beautiful both downstairs and upstairs. Restrooms stood clean and smelling good. Now for the staff. Everyone I came into contact with there was super nice and pleasant. Big shout out to Sabrina who is not only really sweet but so adorable! The bouncer was a big teddy bear and valet was super cool! NO ATTITUDES from the staff what so ever.... DJ was really good too. I wasn't feeling the music at first but all I did was request to change the music and my wish came true :) All in all, this place is awesome. Will definitely be back!

15.description: As soon as i walked in with my family, we got a criticizing stare. They recommended a $25 package; I got it. The list doesnt mention that the options have to be mixed  drinks. I ask for Beam on the rocks, the bartender gives me an attitude, saying, "i cant give it to you on the rocks, only mixed drinks". Fine, so i chose house wine (which is also an option). Im told they are out of it. So you sell me a package deal that doesnt have the option in stock or i cant even get it on the rocks? I go upstairs, try to order an old fashion and they dont have the ingredients for it. I pick out a table and im told i cant sit there because it is for parties and bottle service only. I say fine, bring me a bottle because as you can clearly see, i am with a party. I attempt to order something else besides the bottle given and im told i have to go to the bar or downstairs to get it; very inconvenient but whatever. I finally relax and try to have a good time and a loser tries to pick a fight with my father for being a "dinosaur". We finally get our bill and im being charged 300 for 1 damn vodka bottle. Needless to say, i am very dissatisfied with the service. The rooftop view was awesome though.

57.description: I am in LOVE with this place! Love the tapa style menu, and the sliders are amazing!! The staff is very friendly and I would definitely come back. The food came out right away and it was delicious. You HAVE to get the lobster mac and cheeseee... sooo good!! :-)

20.description: This bar is ok on the river with a great view. But, don't be fooled if you aren't part of their approved crowd they will find a way to disrespect you. We got kicked out because we would not pay a tip to the bathroom attendant. Apparently, we were not allowed to sit in certain seats on the rooftop deck and had to pay tips to the bartender and bathroom attendant to be able to stay. So all I say is...Chicago has a scene and this place tries to compete with that scene..but it's cheap trash pretending they have money. Don't go. They don't deserve service from respectable people. It's a trashy crowd. Go to River North at least they respect your service and the crowd is better looking.

36.description: I searched half price wine places on Wednesday's and thankfully this place popped up for me. My friend and I sat at the bar. Firstly, the view outside of this place is gorgeous. The service was phenomenal and the wine was even better. we also ordered food as well. Definitely recommend this place and will definitely be back!

14.description: Eh, not that impressed. I was expecting a little more. Service was slow. But the waiting staff was super friendly. She almost told my boyfriend that they didn't have Blue Moon because she didn't want to go downstairs and get it from the bar.Food was alright. Not a bad place to visit once, but most likely will not be back. Please note we were there during the day

58.description: I've been to this place many times and I have never Been disappointed! Food is great I love this place, I recommend the the mixta with beans, arroz con gandules, and cabrito!!

56.description: I have been eating here with family and friends for over 17 years. It is number 1 in all  Chicago. I just hope it stays with the family. The alcapurrias are the bomb and the pernil always fresh and tender. Best in town! If they only cooked the bacalao in a different way...

29.description: Been looking for a Jibarito fix since Borinquen on California closed. I was seriously impressed with theirs.  Got Lechon jibarito and steak on onions. Both were great. Wish I could have found this place sooner.  Side note: online menu pretty dated. Actual prices about 20% higher in restaurant, still absolutely worth it.

42.description: This place is so good. I love the flan too. Nobody makes flan like this place. I have been coming here since I was a child.

23.description: **Warning review from a Pregnant woman craving Flan-Dont get the flan. lol Sorry but it was like cinamon tasting custard. I am Puerto Rican myself and If I had the time would have made it myself. This was about two weeks ago, I finally decided to create a Yelp account and review the few places I visit. Small mom and Pops looking shop been in the area for over 50+ years so they get two stars for that. The RIce is pretty good except for some reason they charge for the gandulez a different price when everyone know puerto rican rice should have gandules. The sandwich was bland. Overall dont eat flan here and make sure to specify your rice selection.

47.description: I can't believe this place as four stars.We had the Steak Jibarito, Mofongo, Roast Chicken, Pastilletes (sp?), Pionono. Jibarito was actually the best thing we had. Chicken was OK, pretty tender, but could be more flavorful, Mofongo was a shame. SO dry and flavorless, definitely not what I remember from having it in San Juan. Pastillete and Pionono were cold and hard and chewy - not good at all.Service was horrible. 5PM on a weekday, two servers and near empty, and yet they got our order wrong three times and definitely met with apathetic faces. Not going back. Will try somewhere else for some nostalgia.

8.description: Fantastic Puerto Rican food. Been coming here since a was a youngster. Would recommend this place to all that want fine Latino cuisine.

31.description: I love cafe central! personally, I think they make the best lechon and jibaritos (from what i've tried all over Chicago) The place isn't fancy, but it is clean and the waitresses are attentive. When we go we usually have the papa's rellenas, the steak jibaritos (AMAZING WITH AMERICAN CHEESE) and the lechon plates which come with arroz con gandules and beans. just try it! you won't be let down.

34.description: So being Puerto Rican myself, I think I know whats authentic tasting. I came here with a co worker for lunch we ordered a few different things a pastel, arroz con gandules, jibarito & a lechon sandwhich and all of these items were salty salty salty! The pastel had a grainy taste to it (which is not normal) and everything else was just extremely salty! There was no real flavor as authentic Puerto Rican food does. Then, the icing on the cake is the bill $27! This place is way overpriced for less then mediocre food

16.description: This places gets worse each time I go.  It used to be a staple when my mom came in town to visit (as we are Hispanic and sometimes just don't want to cook ourselves), however it has been replaced.  During our most recent dinner my bistec was very, very dry and my platanos (maduro) were under cooked.  The staff is still as friendly as always, but the food isn't what it used to be.

13.description: What else can be said about this place that hasn't been already said.  Food is exceptional, service is exceptional, location is clean and well maintained.  You must come and experience the food for yourself, and you too will become a regular here!!

11.description: This place was pretty cool. Used Yelp to find it. Looking for Cuban food but this came up in the list. Food was close, but I believe this is Puerto Rican food. I ordered the rotisserie chicken with rice / beans / sweet plantains and my husband ordered the mofongo (meat stew). I also got a cappuccino, which was strong and awesome.This is a totally low key, cute place that looks like your typical old school American breakfast place. Don't let the ambiance fool you - the food is all Latin American and delicious.
