Everyone in there seemed like local, neighborhood folks, all looking for a hot, home cooked food!I would return, this food was so good, I just ate my leftovers about an hour ago!

39.description: This place was yum! Made a social trip from River North with an L-Train ride and a semi-long walk. Well worth the journey for the fabled jibarito. We opted for the pork version, and were definitely not disappointed. Their garlic and green sauces were fantastic as well. If I'm ever back in Chicago I'll give this place a visit again.

37.description: Awesome Puerto Rican food. Great service as well. We showed up late and even though they were closing down the kitchen they still served us and treated our party great. I recommend this place.

0.description: Authentic.When you're scooping the food out of a cafeteria-style warmer behind the counter, you know it's Authentic.Original.When the decor hasn't changed in 50 years, with purple picket fence trim, counter revolving chair seating, and mosaic dried food tile picture windows, you know it's Original.Delicious.When the salt is not overbearing, the spices generous, and the non-English-lady serving it is probably also the one who cooked it, you know it's Delicious.Flan.I love flan. And they made my favorite flan ever. Firm custard body and light-sweet caramel honey glazing. Ooomph! So good.I will be back!

38.description: For a place that's been around for nearly 50 years, you have to respect the fact that they've made it through thick and thin with the economy... which means a place like this is definitely worth checking out.My realtor and I were scouting locations, and got hungry while we were in the area.  He recommended this place, and as usual, he's spot on!We walked into a diner-esque spot with it being pretty dead (considering it was mid-afternoon) and told them that we were just looking for a quick meal before our next appointment.  Super friendly service, lots of smiles, and quickly prepared food.  Here's what I chowed on:Jibarito - Nicely made, fresh crisp plaintain (that replaces the bread) with perfectly cooked pulled pork.  It ranks up there with one of the better jibarito places in Chicago, mostly because it was freshly made!  Tostones - Nice natural sweetness and fried to just the right flavor.  Can't complain here!French loaf bread with spice sauce (complimentary) - What a way to start.  That sauce is some really really good stuff!  Worth spreading on not just the bread, but any sandwiches you may get (jibarito)!  Verdict:  Easily affordable place with great home made food.  Worth checking out if you're in the area and wanting an easy going meal at a very laid back friendly restaurant!

51.description: If you like local diners this place is for you. Today I had the  Jibarritio with fries. The food is prepared fresh and it tasted decent. However, the fries and the plantains tasted like they were cooked in the same oil.   The prices are budget friendly  and they have a variety of Puerto Rico dishes. This a good spot if you want to grab a cheap bite to eat.

27.description: Yay this place Is cheap, fast and yummy. The customer service could be a little bit friendlier but I also think the lady assumed I had already ordered, when that wasn't really the case. No worries, the yummy steak sandwich made up for the waiting. :-)

32.description: Awesome awesome place! It didn't look like much from the outside, but once the food came out, I knew it was good. I went with my grandma and aunt (who swore it was great). They were right! We had the sweetest server. Rocio, I think her name was. She was very helpful when we were picking out what we wanted to eat and brought our food out very quickly.We ordered the mofongo and the rellena de papa as appetizers. They were delicious! Mofongo was quite garlic-y but I enjoyed it. Then my aunt and I got the guisado de res (beef stew) with white rice and beans. They even sell Maltas there, so I got one to drink! Grandma ordered the lechon with arroz con gandules. I tried her lechon and it was great! Everything was superb and the portions were huge! I ate a ton and couldn't even fit dessert. I ended up taking lots of food home! Bottom line: if you want to get the most for your money, come here. Delicious food and great service. Just beware it is metered street parking which is something like $3/hour.

54.description: This place was pretty cool. Used Yelp to find it. Looking for Cuban food but this came up in the list. Food was close, but I believe this is Puerto Rican food. I ordered the rotisserie chicken with rice / beans / sweet plantains and my husband ordered the mofongo (meat stew). I also got a cappuccino, which was strong and awesome.This is a totally low key, cute place that looks like your typical old school American breakfast place. Don't let the ambiance fool you - the food is all Latin American and delicious. Everyone in there seemed like local, neighborhood folks, all looking for a hot, home cooked food!I would return, this food was so good, I just ate my leftovers about an hour ago!

48.description: Amazing!!!! Clean, very nice food, nice calm atmosphere! The price is very low for the quality and quantity served

44.description: Honestly bang for the buck wise, I love this place more than any other restaurant in town.  The shredded pork jibarito they have from Thursday-Sunday for $6.50 is to die for.  Everyone I have told about this place  loves them as well.  How many places around town can you BYOB, and have an under $20 dinner for two and leave stuffed to the gills? not to mention the appetizers that cost $1.50 and the massive portions on their dinner plates!  I love this place, hopefully not too many more find out about it because I like the fact I can just walk in and eat right away at 7pm on a Friday.

24.description: We are still driving into the city to visit this unassuming small diner that has the most delish Puerto Rican food north of Tampa. The establishment reminds me of a diner, a very authentic San Juan diner. The menu is in English and Spanish. The place is always loaded and lots of locals eat here. There is also a very busy to go traffic in and out. The attentive and friendly servers have been working there for longer than I have been going...17+ years. The prices are reasonable, the portions huge and BYOB. Can't wait to go back.

7.description: I loved this places food! I will def make another trip back. The steak jibarito was delicious, my mom ordered the goat stew I think which I tried & it was good. The rice & pigeon peas were good & the French bread with the jalapeño salsa was amazingly good not too hot. The only reason I'm deducting a star is because the atmosphere. We sat in the back of the restaurant & it was a bit noisy & very chilly inside. My mom was cold..

49.description: Jibarito was good but needs more meat.  Arroz con gandules has pork, would be better without it.

40.description: Bad service, the restaurant is dirty and the prices on the menu are wrong. Went to buy a breakfast sandwich was charged $7 but the menu said $5.95 I asked why was I being charged more and simply was told they changed prices but not the menu. So that's what I owed. Waste of time!

53.description: Arroz con Gandules is a hit or miss. Im a fan of aaroz con gandules, so this place is not the place to go to get my fix on. The jibarito is good, but sometimes the plantain has no taste, not even some garlic glaze on it :(. The Habichuelas, however, are tastey. The service is fast and friendly both dine in and carryout. I been here about 3 times, but I think because I was trying to force myself to like it.The breakdown: it is okay, that is all.

30.description: I had been waiting for a table at Flo across the street, and, while memory serves, it probably would have been fabulous, some women we're seated before me who had arrived after I put in my name. So, I am here, and I am enjoying space, the music, the people, my Malta, and the awesome aromas that continue to be made around 50 years later. A Chicago institution at this location since 1967!

46.description: Best kept secret in the neighborhood.  Real authentic Puerto Rican food, like your grandma would make.  The waitres are all so nice.  Pork Jibarito lke you wouldn't believe, stews and apps all very tasty.  I really love this place.

1.description: The food was fresh, not greasy at all...But was lacking salt and flavor. I didn't like that the jibarito was $8.50 and did not include rice and peas...Most places do. The tostones were not crispy. Had no salt or anything on them. The steak was not skirt steak, it was like that frozen steak. And the American cheese slice was so thick and just ugh. I did wind up ordering the rice, but forgot to try it.They charged $1.25 for a CAN of pop. Damn that's pricey.I gave them 3 stars because the woman who took my order, Sandra, was really sweet...and the food was fresh, even though it didn't taste all that great.

55.description: Chuletas de puerco con habichuelos . Love this place! The green onion garlic whatever it is , so delicious! Ive been here on other occasions , tried their guisadas , even chicken soup, never had a bad experience.

9.description: **Warning review from a Pregnant woman craving Flan-Dont get the flan. lol Sorry but it was like cinamon tasting custard. I am Puerto Rican myself and If I had the time would have made it myself. This was about two weeks ago, I finally decided to create a Yelp account and review the few places I visit. Small mom and Pops looking shop been in the area for over 50+ years so they get two stars for that. The RIce is pretty good except for some reason they charge for the gandulez a different price when everyone know puerto rican rice should have gandules. The sandwich was bland. Overall dont eat flan here and make sure to specify your rice selection.

26.description: After many people have repeatedly told me how delicious this place is, I continued to just think "it's just puertorican  food, I've had it before". Well let me tell you I was wrong. Finally decided to try it yesterday, I opted for the beef stew. I'm impressed on how flavorful it was along with how big of a portion they give!  Super happy I gave this place a shot, can't wait to go back and try more items on the menu.

25.description: This place is a gem!!!!!! There's a reason they've been around for so long. Great food & nice owner/staff!

12.description: This place is easy to pass by, hasn't been renovated in 50 yrs and is from "the old neighborhood" but don't let that scare u from coming in. The roasted pork stew is awesome and the staff is very friendly. I live across the street and eat here quite often. Big portions, authentic, friendly.....I see so many people waiting at Flo for weekend brunch....who don't realize a pretty good alternative is across the street.

59.description: Good Puerto Rican food but the beans are not well seasoned and the steak n onions could be better. Decent portions and gotta love the chicken.

21.description: let me just say my family and I love trying new restaurants. especially mexican or puerto rican. honestly, i have never had such tasty lechon in my life. or the arroz con frijoles con pollo.. i forgot how you call it but damn! its the bomb diggity!!! Ive been going to cafe central for about 2 1/2 years now.. but my family has been going there for longer. this spot is def a place to get u some good pr food. no doubt about that!!! =]

17.description: This place is a gem!!!!!! There's a reason they've been around for so long. Great food & nice owner/staff!

10.description: Great puerto rican food! And good service as well you must try the beef stew or a steak jibarito

5.description: Cafe Central is really good at cooking plantains - whether it be sweet maduros, soft flesh with a thin casing of caramelization or thin but sturdy slices of tostones. We started with an enjoyable papa rellena with minced jalapeno-cilantro relish. The orange color and sweet taste of the mashed potato encasing ground beef made us think there might be some sweet potato in the mix. The jibaritos were perfectly sized and cooked. The staff was friendly and the restaurant was cool and quiet on a Tuesday evening.

3.description: I was craving a Jibarito, but the place I wanted to try was closed. I strolled on over to Café Central and this place cured by craving. Upon arrival we were told to seat ourselves. Our waitress was really friendly and the service was fast. Me and my family all went with the steak Jibarito and it had great flavor. Very filling sandwich. If a restaurant has plantains though I can't leave without ordering a side. I'm glad I did! The plantains had just the right amount of sweetness and I left satisfied :) Also have to mention this place is very affordable.

35.description: Not sure what restaurants getting these great reviews. Expensive, bad food, talk about lack of flavor. Got charged $14 for "steak" dinner, which was a very cheap piece of meat. One appetizer was good, the other was raw/uncooke, the rice and gandules were just ok. Not going back

19.description: We are still driving into the city to visit this unassuming small diner that has the most delish Puerto Rican food north of Tampa. The establishment reminds me of a diner, a very authentic San Juan diner. The menu is in English and Spanish. The place is always loaded and lots of locals eat here. There is also a very busy to go traffic in and out. The attentive and friendly servers have been working there for longer than I have been going...17+ years. The prices are reasonable, the portions huge and BYOB. Can't wait to go back.

28.description: Ended up at this place on New Years Eve when all the coffee shops were closed. I only had an appetizer as it was close to closing time, but it was really good. Maybe I can try a meal next time and rate this place even better.

45.description: Hidden gem right here straight up. This place is really good for some puerto rican comfort food.  Ive had the chicken there and all the different stews.   The jibaritos are dope too.  The majority of meals are under 10 bucks here.

33.description: This place is such a gem! I lived in Miami my whole life so I'm accustomed to great Caribbean food and I daresay Cafe Central lives up to the expectations. They provide a great value relative to the amount of food (definitely a single dollar sign!) plus this amazing gift from the plaintain gods called a JIBARITO ! Please try it - I promise you won't be disappointed!

43.description: I love this restaurant. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but when I'm craving a jibarito, I completely forget about Humboldt Park and get my butt over to Cafe Central. The atmosphere is casual and laid back, the food is so reasonable priced, and it's BYOB. How can you beat that?! The jibarito itself is what brings me here though. It is perfectly proportioned and much easier to eat than others I've had. The plantains aren't too greasy, and it is well constructed all around.

2.description: Jibarito! Mofongo! Kola Champagne! Game Over. O Happy Days! (Clap)I woke up with a hunger in my tummy for a Jibarito.Found this place was a short bus ride near so,When we walked in we were greeted with warm smile and hello,It was lunch time and most of the tables were occupado,So my wife and I grab a seat at the counter and got some menus, napkins, spoon, knife and fork,ordered Mofongo, and 2 Jibarito, 1 Steak and 1 Roast Pork,To drink we got 2 Kola Champagnes, Its like cream soda and goes perfect with the plantains,Waitress came by with some fresh bread and we wondered what this green sauce could be,Asked her and she said it was made with jalapeno and actually gave me the recipe,She said 'now you can make it yourself at home,'And I knew from that kindness it would set the tone,So when the Mofongo came out I loved that is was kept separate from the broth,Cause you just take a spoonful and dip it in the sauce,A flavor explosion with tiny bits of Pork Cracklin', I could barely think,Had my singing 'God must have spent a little more time on you' like a member of N'Sync,Then the Jibarito made its triumphant debut,My wife and I shared as the sandwiches are split in 2,Jibarito was nice and hot and the veggies tasted fresh,Then I took that green sauce and mixed it with the meat and it was literally the best,Feeling Full, Sassy and glad we took a Chance, We walked home as we saw the our afternoon Shadows danced,Took a flan to go and it was tasty we ate it in a hurry,Shout out to you if you got the reference to Homeward Bound: The Incredible Journey

18.description: For a place that's been around for nearly 50 years, you have to respect the fact that they've made it through thick and thin with the economy... which means a place like this is definitely worth checking out.My realtor and I were scouting locations, and got hungry while we were in the area.  He recommended this place, and as usual, he's spot on!We walked into a diner-esque spot with it being pretty dead (considering it was mid-afternoon) and told them that we were just looking for a quick meal before our next appointment.  Super friendly service, lots of smiles, and quickly prepared food.  Here's what I chowed on:Jibarito - Nicely made, fresh crisp plaintain (that replaces the bread) with perfectly cooked pulled pork.  It ranks up there with one of the better jibarito places in Chicago, mostly because it was freshly made!  Tostones - Nice natural sweetness and fried to just the right flavor.  Can't complain here!French loaf bread with spice sauce (complimentary) - What a way to start.  That sauce is some really really good stuff!  Worth spreading on not just the bread, but any sandwiches you may get (jibarito)!  Verdict:  Easily affordable place with great home made food.  Worth checking out if you're in the area and wanting an easy going meal at a very laid back friendly restaurant!

41.description: Not pleased. Sat down about 5:45ish.. After browsing the menu decided on a potential order. The waitress informs me she does not have my item so I ask for a few minutes. She comes back shortly after and I order.. They don't have that item either. I go with my second choice. Don't have that either. She informs me of my 2 choices.. That's all they had left due to a busy day.. I love Puerto Rican food.. But I can't see running out of the essentials while running a restaurant. Kind of a turn off

52.description: I WANT to love this place but I just like it.  I live just down the block and have been a few times.  I've never left upset but also never been blown away.As everyone said, the jibarito is a must have.  The chicken is delicious.  The green salsa on the table is tasty but not amazing.  Not sure why salsa comes with bread?Service is always a little slow and apathetic.  They don't seem to care if you are done or ready to order.  They just kinda do their thing.  I've had decent service once or twice, then sat there for 15 minutes with no one coming to the table on other occasions.Decent place.  I prefer it over Flo.  If there is a line out the door across the street, you should check the place out for a quick, easy, cheap, chill option.

50.description: This is probably one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.  THE BEST steak jibaritos you can find!! Service is great, they have a wide variety of other menu options and a huge pop selection (including Coconut pop!!).  This place is amazing!!

4.description: I love love this place. Food is delicious and the price is unexpectedly reasonable. The main reason that we came to this restaurant is because my husband  wanted to try the jiburrito.  Jihurrito is a Chicago creation,  so we know we can only get it here.   We got the steak and shrimp jiburrito, both were  delicious.   The shrimp was slightly messy to eat.  I also really enjoy the soup  called asopao. It was very yummy, and tasted very homey and comforting. We also tried their fried  plantain, I like the ripe one than the green one.  I love the service here, our waitress was sweet and always checked up on us.  This is a mom and pops shop, so don't expect fancy silverware and ambience,  just expect to be treated like family.  You are eating at home.

6.description: Awesome awesome place! It didn't look like much from the outside, but once the food came out, I knew it was good. I went with my grandma and aunt (who swore it was great). They were right! We had the sweetest server. Rocio, I think her name was. She was very helpful when we were picking out what we wanted to eat and brought our food out very quickly.We ordered the mofongo and the rellena de papa as appetizers. They were delicious! Mofongo was quite garlic-y but I enjoyed it. Then my aunt and I got the guisado de res (beef stew) with white rice and beans. They even sell Maltas there, so I got one to drink! Grandma ordered the lechon with arroz con gandules. I tried her lechon and it was great! Everything was superb and the portions were huge! I ate a ton and couldn't even fit dessert. I ended up taking lots of food home! Bottom line: if you want to get the most for your money, come here. Delicious food and great service. Just beware it is metered street parking which is something like $3/hour.

22.description: Live down the street and happen to walk in cafe central the other day.Wow! My new favorite restaurant in the neighborhood.The lamb stew was amazing. Like, amazing.Jibarito was super solid. All appetizers were wonderful too

15.description: Yay this place Is cheap, fast and yummy. The customer service could be a little bit friendlier but I also think the lady assumed I had already ordered, when that wasn't really the case. No worries, the yummy steak sandwich made up for the waiting. :-)

57.description: I live 2 blocks from cafe central so when im feeli g pr food and dont wana cook it or run to Humboldt park i go here...lechon nd ribs is by far the best...the arroz con gandules nd arroz Amarillo both taste exactly da same just gandules nd summer sausage added...pastelillos accupurrias always diffrents and never consistent on taste.came bout 2weeks ago was gonna dtop bout 50 bucks till big ass roach decided to vosit me...im done

20.description: If I had a Puerto Rican grandmother, this is how I hope she'd cook: great flavors, big portions, piping hot.  Love this local BYOB eatery--I'm becoming a regular!

36.description: Warm diner-like atmosphere, friendly service, and delicious food. Our waitress helped us figure out what to order, explaining things like the difference between sweet and green plaintains when it was obvious we weren't familiar with the cuisine.I had the asopao, a soup with pigeon peas and sausage. My husband had fried pork chops which came with two sides. We also split a mofongo, and if you're a pork rinds fan like me you will love trying this.Restaurants like this are a good reminder that you can get tasty, quality food and it doesn't have to cost more than $10 a person.

14.description: Stopped here on a whim because I was hungray...It was the best carne guisado aka beef stew with rice and beans. The portions could easily feed 2 people but I ate it all because like I mentioned before I was hungray. Also ordered a steak sandwich for my son and snuck a bite and it was amazing too...Worth the drive for sure...

58.description: I just moved right in the area, from New York. I love sandwiches, subs, hoagies, grinders, WHATEVER you want to call them. Asking around, everyone said Vinnie's and Bari are both fantastic. I still haven't tried Bari, so I can't comment on that. But this is about Vinnie's anyway, right? Right.I went to Vinnie's yesterday for lunch. The food was fantastic. I got a 9" italian sub, everything was fresh, and it was plenty big enough where I wasn't hungry at all until after dinnertime.What really stands out is the service here. The woman who served us was SO genuinely friendly and helpful. Like others have said, the service makes you feel like you're a regular even if it's your first time there.There's also some outside seating, which is always a plus.I've only been once so I can't speak for everything on the menu, but between the service and what I DID have, I highly recommend Vinnie's.

56.description: Another great sandwich!

29.description: As I was walking down the street after my annual Christmas shopping extravaganza at the local goodwill. In an area full of cliche, try-hard, Italian places, I happened across a very unassuming sub shop. I thought I would pop in and quell the hunger baby growing inside of me. The dining area is small, but it has the feeling of my grandmothers basement in a good way! The owners seem to take a lot of pride in the place, and it shows. Everything was very clean and the Christmas decorations were a testament to their Italian roots.The most important part of a sandwich is the bread, and they hit the nail on the head in that respect. Super cheap, great food, cool atmosphere, what else could you ask for. 5 stars.

42.description: I agree with everyone about how nice the owner is.  She was as helpful and sweet as could be.I had an Italian sub with hot peppers which was excellent and even a little spicier than I expected.  Will go back.

23.description: I would come back simply for the warm inviting exceptional service! The beauty taking the orders and cash is the Best! My sandwich was fresh and delicious  from top to bottom! I will be back!!!

47.description: Vinnie's is a great sandwich place in an area with a lot of good Italian sandwiches places. I go there for lunch quite a bit and it's always quick and tasty. Fresh bread and ingredients, great gardinera, and lot's of choices. Even though I always go with the large Italian. For a good sandwich in a pinch, Vinnie's is the place.

8.description: D'amatos bread, nicest people, great sandwiches! I wish they didn't discontinue carrying pepper jack cheese but that never made the sandwich so no loss of stars. I try to equally distribute my business between Bari and here because I like the giardinera better from Bari. The pesto mayo turkey sandwich is my favorite.

31.description: Vinnie's is amazing! Their sub's are the best I've had in Chicago. I always get the daily special (turkey, pesto, mozzarella) or their tuna sub, you can make your own as well. The owner is also the biggest sweetheart! Vinnie's is so good that one of my friends ate their almost every day of the week for months. I unfortunately moved out of state and now always make it a priority to eat here when I'm in town.

34.description: I used to come here more often when I worked in the neighborhood, now it's my go to spot for lunch when I'm in the area.  The tuna is great and the daily special (usually turkey w/ pesto mayo) is delicious! Friendly staff and decent prices! You will not be disappointed.

16.description: I drove 18 minutes one way to get the 12" Italian Sub with hot peppers. The bread is so flaky and crunchy and moist and delicious, the vinegar and oil is to die for, the meat is so fresh, I will definitely be back.

13.description: I honestly don't know how the Jimmy Johns at Grand/Ogden stays open with Vinnie's down the street. The tuna-salad sandwich is the best I've ever had, and the turkey special with mozzarella and pesto mayo is equally awesome. Plus you can get a 9" sub for under $5, which is kind of insane considering the quality. Love this place!

11.description: Had the vinnie's special #1 on their menu, i loved the sesame bun! It was my first time eating here and I originally wanted to try the half sandwich half soup option but unfortunately they did not have soup on their menu yet. I really loved the interior of this little sub shop, it feels very welcoming and has an old school vibe to it. They very carefully take your order to ensure you have everything you want on your sub. My sandwich was delicious! The deli meat and bread were fresh. The lady ensured me that next week soup should be available, can't wait to go back and check it out. Highly recommend this place for a tasty sandwich.

39.description: One of the best italian subs #2 with hot peppers and the rumor is true the woman behind the counter could be the one of the sweetest people ever.

37.description: Super friendly service. Limited selections with a couple of Italian themed sandwich options. Got the ham and cheese sub which was simple and delicious! Firm crusty bread, soft on the inside and a bit stretchy - PERFECT. Very fresh toppings unlike the limp and slimy toppings from a national over publicized franchise we all know.

0.description: Heading out on a road trip, I stopped to pick up an always delicious sandwich from Vinnie's. Though it is huge and at times a bit messy for the car, it is worth every satisfying bite. My partner and I typically order two and split them to enjoy two different flavours. We always get the special with chicken and pesto mayo along with a wild card decided on the fly. This time we got an Italian with hot jardinière. Success, as always. Be prepared for this huge sandwich and enjoy as soon as you can. the oil can sometimes get to the bread making it a bit less crunchy and delicious.

38.description: I live around the area & there's a lot of submarine competition around here. I've been to Vinnie's quite a few times for subs & they're delicious! The ingredients are fresh, great prices, & they're very sweet inside! Definitely recommend :)

51.description: Now this is what a sub should look like and taste like. Vinnie's definitely isn't lacking in the quality department. Every time I'm in the area, Vinnie's is a must.

27.description: So yummy and friendly service!! I also love the decor - very charming!! I got the Italian which was delish once I added some extra dressing. Yum!!

32.description: In LOVE with this place!!...discovered on Yelp!...delicious,  family owned, friendly, quaint ....and did I mention DELICIOUS!!!....The tuna can NOT be beat!!....my new favorite spot for a sammie!

54.description: I remember when Vinnies first open with a kicking menu.  Eight and half years later,  They have out done themselves.   Very few places in Chicago where you get a good meal and peaceful atmosphere.  I really did enjoy sitting outside with a fresh sandwiches and knowing the price was worth the experience.  I use to go to Bari but not any more.  When I come to town, Vinnies Sub Shop is where I would lay my hat for some Good 'Ole Chicago Sandwich.

48.description: Best sandwich in Chicago. Period.  I used to be a loyal Bari sandwich customer for years....  That was until I saw the LIGHT.  This place can not be touched.  The owners are a wonderful couple and first time walking into this place you will feel like you've been there 10 times before.  The bread is outstanding and the deli meat is piled on.  I will be a customer for life.

44.description: Honestly the only way this place could improve in my opinion is the bread. I wish it was a little softer and warmer and I wish they had a meatball sub on the menu.Besides that this place is perfect.It's family owned and they are the nicest people in the world. The atmosphere is exactly what you want when eating a sub served to you with a huge genuine smile. It's calm, casual, and intriguing.I will definitely be back here the next time I'm in the area.

24.description: I'm no sandwich guru by any means. Normally if in west loop il hit up JP grazianos or other small family shops. Decided to try out Vinnies and I'm a fan. Lady behind counter is sweet Just as every one stated. Bread was soft. Giardinerra had a little heat but flavorful and the #1 was great even though I don't normally go for ham but thought id try their "specialty".Good sammich. Will be back

7.description: I am not a serial reviewer but since I probably don't walk into Vinnie's without the encouragement from the other customers, I think it's only right into the same. I have been driving by Vinnie's for years and stopping by Bari's for all my sandwiches. I won't be driving by much any longer. From the moment you walk in, you get that unique neighborhood treatment that immediately created a bind between homely local joint and dedicated loyal customer.  Treatment that to be honest is not part if the Bari experience at all. The lady running the place could not have been nicer. It's "hon" this, hon that from when you walk in to when you leave. I felt like I was buying a sandwich from my favorite Aunt's sandwich shop. She explains the menu perfectly, in detail and in a way that really helps. They cater and deliver. I got the Vinnie's Special and it was humongous, loaded, fresh,delicious. Had the sandwich been have as good as it was, I still would have been going back because how well I was treated there but the truth is, the food matches the 5 start treatment. I cannot recommend Vinnie's enough and it's why I took the time to write this. This is the type of place we as customers need to frequent and support to help keep these special local neighborhood joints in business for as long as possible. Especially when this food service so thoroughly deserve it!

49.description: My favorite place for a sandwich in Chicago. The service is great! Who can beat the friendliness of Darleene? The food is great too! Who can beat the craftsmanship of Omar? My kids absolutely love it. We always feel welcome at Vinnie's. It's not a big place, but there is always a few chairs available if you need to park it to eat your sandwich. And the place is decorated in extravagant manners according to the season. You should see the display they've got for Halloween! I highly recommend it! The best sandwich place in Chicago!

40.description: I live down the street. Always opted for Damatos or Baris. I decided to try this place out today. I had the Vinnie's special with onions and hot peppers. As everyone has said, the woman at the counter was incredibly nice. The sandwich was great. The best thing was the bread. It was much softer than Damatos or Baris, which can be hard sometimes if you go later in the day. I'll be back.

53.description: One of the best sub shops in the city. It's cheap, the food is good, the subs are HUGE, and the service is incredible. Every time I walk in, I feel like I'm part of the family. The nicest people work there, I love it. A++ keep up the good work!

30.description: Went to Vinnies today for the first time - outstanding.  The service was great and the sandwich was fabulous - fresh bread, good meats, etc. The place is clean and friendly. Vinnies is now high on my list of great Chicago joints!

46.description: It doesn't happen often, but there are times when I just don't feel like cooking dinner. It happens even less often that I want a sub for dinner.Last Saturday, both of these rare phenomena did indeed occur, and this is where Vinnie's delivered. Well, not delivered as in "brought to my house," but delivered as in "filled the void" and "hit a home run."After it was deemed that I wasn't cooking, I decided to pick up some viddles for dinner, make some tasty cocktails, and have an impromptu picnic across the street from my house. I headed to Vinnie's after I remembered reading such glowing reviews. This unassuming little sandwich shop on Grand Avenue is fantastic. There's a huge variety of subs, available in two sizes: a nine inch or a twelve inch. Unless you're ravenous, a nine inch should suffice. There's plenty of options--all kinds of meats and cheeses, and lots of choices for vegetarians as well.In order to try as many as possible, I asked for a tuna salad, smoked turkey/provolone, and a 'capri,' which had fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil. Sandwiches are made fresh to order (obviously) and can be customized with the de-rigeur toppings of lettuce, tomatoes, oil and vinegar, onion, pickles, mustard/mayo, and seasonings. And for a small upcharge, they have premium add-ons like artichoke hearts, eggplant, or pesto mayo.And because my fiancé feels that no picnic is complete without potato salad, I grabbed a side of that as well. I was on my way in no time. Three nine-inch subs and the potato salad came in at around $17. Wow, that may be the least amount I've ever spent on food for a picnic. The highest price here for a sandwich is only $6.75, and that's for a twelve incher. You can't even buy the ingredients at the grocery store to make one for less money. This is cheap eats heaven!But of course, cheap means nothing if the food's not good, and this food was GREAT. Super-fresh ingredients, perfectly crusty bread, and just the right amount of well-balanced fillings. I also liked that they didn't use a heavy hand with the condiments. These sandwiches were damn near ideal.The potato salad on the other hand, was forgettable. I'd bet a million dollars it came from a five-gallon drum; completely mediocre and not worth the calories. Skip it, and go straight for their delicious sandwiches.Henceforth, Vinnie's shall be the standard bearer of subs.

1.description: Fantastic food!  I come here really often and consistently get excellent service.  I love that they always double check your order in detailed writing to ensure that you get the best tasting sub possible!!!  Not only is the main lady a sweetheart but her daughter/sister/cousing (I'm not sure if they are related)  is also super nice!This is what hospitality is all about and they truly understand it!Thanks Vinnies!Rick

55.description: The battle between Bari & Vinnie's is constant in our household, but in my opinion, Vinnie's wins out for subs.  Though we definitely frequent both neighborhood Italian spots.  Everything is deliciously fresh!  Try the mozzarella and prosciutto!

9.description: I usually go to Bari for my Italian sub fix but Vinnie's is just as good too! The Vinnie's Special is my go to sandwich there! I believe they pack a little bit more meat then other sub joints too.. Super nice service with the same local faces and great sandwiches you can beat that! Old school neighborhood feel that's refreshing in a world fading away with corporate America, fad food groupie places, and chains restaurants

26.description: Love this place: great sandwiches, super speedy, very friendly--"Hi Sweetie" from owner Darlene--and no other place I know can equal the decor!

25.description: I love this place so much. I usually get the prosciutto mozzarella sandwich, but the others are awesome as well. What really keeps me coming back is the bread and customer service. The bread is flaky on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I feel that the bread is the foundation of a good sandwich. When you bite into these sandwiches, you hear a loud, satisfying CRUNCH. Make sure you have that paper in front of you or on your lap because crumbs will go places. And the customer service is the best. The owner (Darlene?) is the nicest person I've ever met. She's always there when I come in and she talks to me like she's known me for years. She makes you feel welcome the second you get there and makes sure you get your food quick and efficiently. She's the best. This place is the best...around.

12.description: Love this place: great sandwiches, super speedy, very friendly--"Hi Sweetie" from owner Darlene--and no other place I know can equal the decor!

59.description: The woman (now fiancee) and I made the trek to Vinnie's a while back to see how it stacks up against Bari. I ordered an Italian sub and she got the vegetarian so we could do an apples to apples comparison. While the sandwiches were very good and I do not have any major complaints, they are not in the same league. Would I put my "D" in it? Perhaps, but not with the same amount of passion I would with a Bari sub...Overall, there is good value here, but with Bari so close, I would say to go there. Although our cat did quite enjoy the meats on the Italian...she is now on a diet.

21.description: Love the sandwiches and "Hi Honey" from owner Darlene.  No wonder, then, that Vinnie's is one of my favorite go-to's!

17.description: I'm no sandwich guru by any means. Normally if in west loop il hit up JP grazianos or other small family shops. Decided to try out Vinnies and I'm a fan. Lady behind counter is sweet Just as every one stated. Bread was soft. Giardinerra had a little heat but flavorful and the #1 was great even though I don't normally go for ham but thought id try their "specialty".Good sammich. Will be back

10.description: I wish I knew about Vinnie"s years ago.  I bring friends and co workers with me to get the look what I found bragging rights. I think if you give Vinnie"s a try you will become a regular. The lady that always smiles and makes you feel welcome behind the counter is the definition of good old school  customer service. I am so glad I found this gem.

5.description: Best sub I've had in years ! Fresh bread , fast service and very friendly . The price was also very fair . I had the Italian and already want another one. Much friendlier than the joint down the street . See you soon !!

3.description: I would definitely consider Vinnie's a "best-kept secret" of the West Town and River West neighborhoods. The unassuming storefront is easy to walk past, but the subs are delicious, made to order and the staff are friendly and provide fast service. Highly recommended.

35.description: I'm born and raised IN Chicago (city of)...50 yearsVinnie's #1 for subs. I've been to ALL the sub shops.Vinnie's runs it and SO clean!!!

19.description: Always amazing.  Wish I still lived so close.  Leaving Chicago and had to stop in one last time a couple weeks back.  You will be missed but I couldn't leave town without leaving a 5 star review.  If you haven't been, do yourself a favor and go!  They deliver now too, so no excuses.

28.description: I drove 18 minutes one way to get the 12" Italian Sub with hot peppers. The bread is so flaky and crunchy and moist and delicious, the vinegar and oil is to die for, the meat is so fresh, I will definitely be back.

45.description: Besides my own mother I don't think there's a woman that I adore more than Darlene the owner. She's sweet enough to give you a customer service cavity and extremely hands on at Vinnie's working the register and chatting with customers almost every day.You can really taste the love that goes into the sandwiches here. They've got fresh Damatos bread slightly underbaked for the better, perfectly cured meats, spicy Giardiniera, and fresh fixens that put the finishing one of the most simple savory sandwiches. Try the Italian with a side of potato salad, talk to Darlene, and I defy you to not be in love with this place.

33.description: This is the best sandwich shop in the city, by far!Great tasting sandwhiches, of which I always get the VINNIES SPECIAL. So good! Quality of bread & meat is great & tasty.The customer service (owners) is the best. It's a small private owned business I feel good about supporting. They really take pride in their food and treat each customer special. I often times call ahead to place my order, then park in the flashing zone and run in. Never an issue. Always ready...in & out. I admit, I always take a few bites before pulling off. ;)I've also ordered sandwiches for parties & have them cut into 3 inch sections for serving. Always a hit!I've gotten sandwhiches here about 20 times, always a pleasant experience and always consistent. One of my favorite Chicago locally owned establishments!

43.description: Quite honestly, if I had to choose amongst several shops in/near downtown, I would sooner head a block East to Bari. My all-time favorite Italian sub shop is Fontano's. At Vinnie's, the service was fast enough and the guy behind the counter was certainly friendly, but I was not impressed with the quality of the sandwich so I went once and that was it.

2.description: Uncle Vinnie's Sub. With pickles.  That is all.

18.description: Amazing! I have been on the hunt for a decent hoagie since moving back to Chicago from the MidAtlantic. Bari was once my go to place but they just haven't been satisfying me lately. I think I've found my new love with Vinnie. The turkey special, more than a mere vehicle for their delicious pesto mayo, is the best!

41.description: I tried to place an order over the phone. The lady taking orders was extremely unprofessional and rude. Mid conversation, I decided that I would not order from this place because she was so inappropriate. I will never consider ordering here again.

52.description: Great subs made very quickly.  I'd even add another star for the ambiance and Chicago accents from the lovely ladies behind the counter.

50.description: I Know its a little controversial, but I prefer Vinnie's to Bari. This place has THE BEST Capri ever! When you dine-in its really relaxing, perfect for a quick lunch break. The Owner of Vinnie's Dar is seriously the sweetest lady, and all of the other employees are also super sweet. I pretty sure the girl who works when shes not there (which is almost never) is her daughter, because they look just alike. Anyways, eat here its amazing!!

4.description: Great Italian subs at a reasonable price.  These subs are huge!  The people are super friendly!  I will be frequenting a lot.

6.description: Been a Bari regular for 10+ years. Never thought of trying a different sub in the area. Just had Vinnie's and I am impressed. Actually extremely impressed. And the place is FAST and organized (unlike Bari).

22.description: I've been trying several times to get one of Vinnie's special Lenten Pepper & Egg sandwiches but every time I tried they were sold out. Last Friday I had to go out of town for the weekend so I just had to get one. Called as soon as they opened and placed my order. Now I am only sorry that they don't make them year round. They were the best Pepper & Egg (I also had them add American Cheese to them) sandwiches I have had in years.  The eggs were done to perfection and the peppers were perfect without there being any greasy taste to them like I have had from some places. The taste was absolutely perfect with just the right amount of seasoning to them. Had me wishing for more for days. I know I am definitely going to be pre-ordering again thru the rest of Lent to make sure I get them again, because they have been so popular that they sell out fast. If you can you have to try one to see for yourself and I guarantee you won't be sorry.

15.description: I love this place so much. I usually get the prosciutto mozzarella sandwich, but the others are awesome as well. What really keeps me coming back is the bread and customer service. The bread is flaky on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I feel that the bread is the foundation of a good sandwich. When you bite into these sandwiches, you hear a loud, satisfying CRUNCH. Make sure you have that paper in front of you or on your lap because crumbs will go places. And the customer service is the best. The owner (Darlene?) is the nicest person I've ever met. She's always there when I come in and she talks to me like she's known me for years. She makes you feel welcome the second you get there and makes sure you get your food quick and efficiently. She's the best. This place is the best...around.

57.description: I got the chance to try Vinnie's Sub Shop since my new work is located near it. I absolutely love this place after going only once. They have every chip flavor under the sun as well as a bunch of soda varieties. I had the ham and cheese and it was delicious. Going back today to try this tuna that everyone is raving about.

20.description: Open til 6:00 PM Weekdays and 5:00 PM Weekends.  They also have delivery!The staff is very pleasant.  My subs are normally very good, but on my last order they used miracle whip instead of mayo by accident.  Generally though, they offer very good sandwiches in a neighborhood with much competition from places like Bari's and D'Amatos Bakery.

36.description: Really enjoy this place on my days off for lunch. The subs are made fresh and packed. Usually I get the #1 Vinnies Special, but today I branch out to the Italian Veggie. Don't forget to take a peek at the beverage cooler. They carry all sorts of delicious craft sodas and beverages plus the fountain variety.

14.description: Open til 6:00 PM Weekdays and 5:00 PM Weekends.  They also have delivery!The staff is very pleasant.  My subs are normally very good, but on my last order they used miracle whip instead of mayo by accident.  Generally though, they offer very good sandwiches in a neighborhood with much competition from places like Bari's and D'Amatos Bakery.

58.description: Simply the best sushi I've ever had in Chicago, their ingredients are fresh and the quality of the food is magnificent! This by far is now my favorite sushi bar place. The staff is attentive, polite and extremely friendly.

56.description: Terrible delivery service. Says it takes an hour when they really mean almost two hours. When I called to inquire all they could say was 'don't worry. It's out for delivery.' I'm not worried...I'm hungry! Good food but terrible customer service.

29.description: DELICIOUS! Appetizers: Coco beef, sea thru, and Miso soup.. All 3 amazing! (Can't go too wrong with miso soup though) ;) Entrees: Sea monster, large sashimi platter, midnight something (can't remember the rest of it) Im more of a shellfish fan and the sea monster was perfect! My husband loved the other plates as they were more "fishy" lol Although I use yelp all the time, I rarely write reviews, but the food all around was too good not to hopefully convince someone to try this place out ;) Cheers! God bless!

42.description: Great selection of sushi and we liked every roll we tried. The outdoor patio is the best part -- on a relatively quiet street, fenced off, and plenty of plants to make it more quaint.

23.description: The sushi is fresh and the service is good. White tuna nigiri is some of the best I have had in the city thus far. It is BYO. I wish they had a pairing suggestion list so I knew what to bring in order to enjoy the food more.

47.description: Really great place.  I love their food, you really can't go wrong with anything.  Their staff has always been nice and accommodating.  I'm really glad that this place is here, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good dinner.

8.description: their sushi comes fully loaded and the restaurant is romantic. I also am a fan of any BYOB sushi spots that are open late. service was slow, BUT very kind and the appetizer and desert menu was good. Parking was horrible, but the sushi was just good. Ive had fresher tasting and simpler rolls that didnt need all the bells and whistles and weren't so heavy elsewhere. Its not bad, but not great.

31.description: Living in the area, I figured this BYOB sushi place packed with people would be good... Between two people we ordered 4 rolls. The tempura shitake mushroom maki came out first, but there was no sign of the tempura. I mentioned this to our server and she was confused by what I meant. She went to check on the order and never came back. We brought bottles of beer and since our server never came back, we couldn't have more than one since we needed a bottle opener. When our last three rolls arrived by another server, we noticed that one was not what we ordered. Since the other wrong order never even got mentioned again, we decided to eat it and forget about it.Overall, it felt like one disappointment after another. I think I'd rather walk a few blocks further for the same quality of sushi, if not better, and get better service.

34.description: We are visiting from Des Moines Iowa and really enjoyed the restaurant. The lovers roll was great and the shashimi was very fresh. We will return.

16.description: The service is terrible. We went there with a part of 4 and over half the restaurant was empty. We got there at 5:45 and they told us they wouldn't serve us until 9:30. Like what? Do you not want our money? I would recommend never going here. They make you feel dumb for even trying. And the food isn't even superior to anything nearby.

13.description: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and it did not disappoint. I love sushi and love it even more when it involves BYOB. We only ordered sashimi and nigiri and the fish seemed to be great quality. The prices weren't ridiculous, either, and there isn't a corkage fee. Inside tables are pretty close together which is something that usually bothers me, but something about the ambiance and layout of the restaurant just worked.Only complaint is it's a little off the beaten path and we had to Uber.

11.description: I took a friend here for her birthday and we had a great time. I got my daughter (4yrs old) sweet potato rolls, and they were delicious! For the adults, we ordered a few signature maki dishes and the large sashimi platter, which had a variety of fish including salmon, tuna, super white, yellowtail, seabass, tako (squid), shrimp-and I think there was more but I can't think of them. The sashimi display was beautiful-very appealing. The fish itself was nice and cold and sooooo fresh!! I cannot stress how fresh the fish was. The platter also came with a bowl of rice, which was really soft and fluffy, which was a nice addition to the array of fish slices. The signature maki was soooo good. I like how the chef rolled them and the size that he cut each roll. Everyone in our party received a bowl of miso soup, which was more flavorful than I've had, and it was even tipped with peppers, which I've never seen anywhere before. If you check in, you get free sweet potato tempura, which was so good, my daughter and I were fighting over them. Our server, Yahni, was amazing and funny-knew the menu and the food very well, and was very helpful. The atmosphere wasn't too uppity, like sushi restaurants sometimes feel. There were crowds of all ages around us; people on dates, a group of 8-10 college age girls, married couple,etc... The staff were very welcoming and polite to all groups. The restaurant is BYOB, so don't forget to bring your booze, but if you do, no worries, there's a liquor store nearby, just ask an employee and they'll be able to point you in the right direction (like we did). 4stars for food quality, fish freshness, beautiful menu, different menu items than other places (which were really good), price, and service.

39.description: I like Seadog a lot. It's definitely a little bit on the pricier side for sushi, but they have some of the most satisfying apps in the West Town sushi game. We got the free sweet potato tempura app which was pretty much just a few thin slices of sweet potato fried in tempura batter, with a side of spicy mayo. Pretty good. But then we also got the Sea Thru, this genius concoction of smoked salmon, cream cheese, jalapeño, avocado, and house soy sauce wrapped in a thin, crisp soy paper. It's seriously one of the greatest apps, albeit super Americanized I admit. The rolls are solid. They are medium-sized, good proportion of rice and filling, and not overly drenched in vinegar. I'll definitely have to head back for second shot at the apps.FYI: No tables for more than 4 people in the back patio.

37.description: Went the other night with my husband we thought it was pretty good and seemed really fresh. We sat outside and had salmon sashimi, the spooky, spicy salmon rolls, salmon carpaccio, miso soup and one other roll I can't remember the name of. I will say that I was a bit thrown by the sashimi orders. I asked before I ordered how many were in an order and was told 2 per order. I got 3 orders and had five, I thought my husband was pulling my leg and then got 2 more orders and had 3. I then asked the server, since I knew my husband definitely didn't have one off this plate and I was told it was by weight...? What? Let's do one or the other please and don't tell me there is 2 per order of it is by weight. Whatever, but really? I don't know why we haven't tried this place before since it is right down from where we live. I would go back and would recommend it as well. In my opinion it is right there with Butterfly on Grand and it is byob as well.

0.description: DELICIOUS! Appetizers: Coco beef, sea thru, and Miso soup.. All 3 amazing! (Can't go too wrong with miso soup though) ;) Entrees: Sea monster, large sashimi platter, midnight something (can't remember the rest of it) Im more of a shellfish fan and the sea monster was perfect! My husband loved the other plates as they were more "fishy" lol Although I use yelp all the time, I rarely write reviews, but the food all around was too good not to hopefully convince someone to try this place out ;) Cheers! God bless!

38.description: Long wait to be greeted. We ordered a Jasmine tea, got the standard small cast iron pot of nice tea. We asked for sugar, they said yes but only had fake options, gross. Started with a very good spicy miso. Then had a heavily breaded "tempura" shrimp, then two extremely over sauced rolls with tiny amounts of fish. An order of two scallops, butterflied to seem like 4, over cooked and over sauced as well. We tried to order an asparagus beef and green tea creme brule but our server said because we split up our order it would take an hour for anything else. So we left. Boo.

51.description: I want to give Seadog 5 stars so bad but there a couple things holding Seadog back.  Let's start with the positives.Spicy miso is so on point it's ridiculous.  Their patio is awesome in the summer -- it's in the back and not surrounded by other loud bars.  The salmon nigiri is so good, love their rainbow roll and they carpaccio recently added to the menu is awesome as well.The cons are the service.  The host is kind of moody and we've tried to make reservations for larger groups 8-10 for a weekend night at least a week in advance and they are never able to accommodate. Mind you we have been "regulars" for 3+ years.  Either way I love Seadog and will keep being a "regular"

27.description: The first time I came here, I wasn't too impressed since my friend got a really dry roll with just bonita flakes (avoid this one if you can!). This time, I was very impressed by my midnight sundae sushi! It was incredible. The fish on top was very fresh and tender and I liked how the sauce was salty yet sweet at the same time.The space is really tight and I really think they should expand. The waitresses were squeezing past us since the space is just so bad for a restaurant. It's also BYOB and you can get free sweet potato tempura if you check in!

32.description: Triple S roll is where its at. Love this place and the sushi!

54.description: Fresh sushi, attentive staff, reasonably priced.BYOBQuaint, dark, perfect place to go on a saturday night with your girlfriend.Was there last night and will be back again for sure.The sashimi platter is top notch.

48.description: This place is BYOB, which I guess is typical of sushi bars in Chicago... and the staff was totally prepared with wine/beer glasses and ice buckets, even opening our bottles and pouring our drinks for us.It was totally empty inside when we arrived, but then the server led us to the patio out back, where we got seated at the last available table. So I guess the reservation for dinner Friday night was necessary.The menu had all the standard stuff you would find in a typical sushi restaurant, and my bf told me to order whatever I wanted. He chose Fresh Philly maki ($7, fresh salmon, avocado, cream cheese) and Unakyu maki ($8, fresh water eel, cucumber, eel sauce) from the regular menu, but I had my eye on the special Michelin guide recommended menu. And the verdict? DELISH!! The Michelin recommended food was way better than the other rolls. We should have just ordered everything from that menu. Totally worth the extra cost. The makis here had the least amount of rice I've ever seen in any restaurant. I know people always complain about too much sushi rice, but I actually would have preferred a bit more rice in the rolls. There was barely enough rice to cover the seaweed, and either it wasn't seasoned enough or there simply wasn't enough rice for a balanced ratio of fish vs. rice in my mouth.This wasn't an issue with the items from the recommended menu, as there were so many flavors exploding in my mouth... but for the regular makis, the lack of seasoned rice made the rolls taste quite plain. So I'm knocking one star off for that.

44.description: I love this place. Try the Triple S and the Little Sea Monster if you like tasty and basic. Lover Maki, Volcano, Halloween are all decent as well. Fish is always fresh which is obviously a make or break at any sushi place. Spicy Miso is good. What I really like about this place is the price meets or beats any other sushi place but the food is always top notch. BYOB

24.description: Came here on a Friday night looking to get some take out. They were very polite and got me my food in ten minutes! // Midnight sundae - 14$ - it was pretty yummy but by the time I got home.. It was cold. I think it is suppose to be served hot with a strange but nice cream top. It was actually a bit hard to get all 8 pieces down. The cream is a little much but it was pretty tasty otherwise. I would order this at the restaurant and share with friends :-)// Ebi Tempura - 6$ - this one was delicious. Probably my favorite Ebi tempura I've had in a while. The shrimp was perfectly fried and crisp. // Crunchy spicy tuna - 8$ - Pretty good.This sushi place is delicious and always consistent. Definitely check it out if you are in the area.

7.description: i'll be honest, I came here with very low expectations. I've never really found any sushi place in Chicago that impressive (the fish just isn't as fresh here as I'd like). On top of that, within the first few minutes of our arrival, we were greeted with nothing but attitude. the hostess was SO rude, i could hardly believe how he spoke to us. however, bad attitude aside the rest of the meal was quite pleasant. we started with the vegetable tempura, which was standard but it came with a really delicious spicy mayo dipping sauce.for dinner we got a series of rolls - spicy white tuna, spicy salmon, sea monster and the dragon. all of it was overall pretty good and satisfying. i loved all the sauces here! i think the rolls were well made and had great flavor profiles. on top of that i was impressed by the PRICE! it was a great affordable sushi dinner. if you're into rolls + love byob, this is definitely the spot. the only thing holding me back is the service.

49.description: I'm not sure why all the rave reviews. Service is very slow here. Between the apps and makis, it took 35 mins. Server was nice, but forgetful. We ordered the sea monster without cream cheese, but he forgot. So we had to wait for another one. The makis are all drenched in their overly sweet eel sauce. I left feeling like I've only had desert. Also, we never received our free sweet potato tempura for checking in on Yelp.

40.description: Fantastic sushi spot with excellent prices. Sushi is some of the best I've had in Chicago, certainly one of the best BYOB places downtown. We ordered the Little Sea Monster and the Triple S rolls which were both excellent. $42 for a full dinner for 2 is excellent value!

53.description: I've been eating at seadog for years now.  It's been my go to sushi spot in my neighborhood but I will no longer be recommending it to friends.  The service lately and especially tonight was HORRIBLE!!!  Upon entering the restaurant and giving them my name for an outdoor table I was never informed that I wouldn't be sat unless my party was here.  Even when I went back up to the host stand to change my party from three to two I was told that he would let me know when my table was ready.  I was the only one waiting and therefore it was obvious that the rest of my party wasn't here.  Which is why I was very disturbed when another couple arrived and was sat immediately.  When I asked I was only then informed that I would be sat when my party arrived. Had I know I would have grabbed an appetizer next door since I was hungry and planned to eat something while I waited.  Communication is key in the service industry. They are lacking.

30.description: My favorite sushi in the city! They have a never ending menu of creative delicious rolls, plus all of the classics. My absolute favorite roll is the Triple S which is tempura sweet potato with salmon and spicy sauce on top--UNBELIEVABLE! It is so fresh, I can't wait to go back.

46.description: Came here last night for an intimate dinner with some girlfriends and this place did not disappoint!  Great ambiance and beautiful decor, but we especially loved the outdoor seating on a gorgeous summer evening. We ended up ordering a spider roll, a dragon roll, a volcano roll, a hamachi avo roll, and a salmon avo roll. Everything was fresh and flavorful, and what I really loved is that they used whole cuts of fish (hamachi and salmon) with not a lot of rice on the rolls. By checking in, we also got the sweet potato tempura, and that was great as well. The service could definitely be better, as we had to ask for sake glasses a couple of times, and our food came out a bit slow. But since this place is BYOB and we didn't have anywhere else pressing to go to, it didn't bother us too much. We definitely had a great experience here, and cannot wait to be back!

1.description: I've been here many times, and it never disappoints. BYOB, great sushi and a solid atmosphere. My go-to is the little sea monster, it's the best. Today I had the secret garden for the first time, which is the most kick-ass veggie roll I've ever had. Obviously it's 0% healthy, basically being a deep fried salad! So fun and unique though. We also had the dragon roll (lots of fish, solid spice level) and then tried the lovers roll which is on special for February. That one was my least favorite, too much rice and not enough flavor (the little heart rolls are adorable though!)I always forgot how GIGANTIC the rolls are! At so many sushi places you need 3 rolls/person and then you're hungry an hour later. We split these 4 rolls between 2 and couldn't even finish them.

55.description: The sushi wasn't the best ever but the service was good and it's a hip venue so maybe I just ordered the wrong thing (rainbow roll)? This is a pretty hip sushi place but small for groups. The signature maki rolls are all a piece of art. But, don't expect your rainbow or California roll to look as pretty :-( I had the free sweet potato tempura for checking in on Yelp and it was really good. Very thin slices of sweet potato are tempura fried. I wanted more sweet potato but it's so nice and crispy I stopped caring about the fried to potato ratio :-) I ordered the rainbow roll at like $9 and it was cool but not as marvelous as I expected. The service was prompt and moved things away quickly, no complaints there. Maybe next time I should find a signature maki that I want but I don't like my whole sushi fried or with cream cheese so no luck there...

9.description: The first time I came here, I wasn't too impressed since my friend got a really dry roll with just bonita flakes (avoid this one if you can!). This time, I was very impressed by my midnight sundae sushi! It was incredible. The fish on top was very fresh and tender and I liked how the sauce was salty yet sweet at the same time.The space is really tight and I really think they should expand. The waitresses were squeezing past us since the space is just so bad for a restaurant. It's also BYOB and you can get free sweet potato tempura if you check in!

26.description: Very standard, would have given 4 stars if the food can come faster. The free sweet potato tempura is good.

25.description: Great sashimi and everything is pretty fresh. I do think the price is decent and the service is ok. The best part is fresh ingredients and BYOB

12.description: This is for delivery. I wish it wasn't the case because I love the food. But I always forget it's not worth it. They quote 1:15 for delivery, which I accept. But more than half the time it takes 2 hours. If you can't deliver in reasonable time, shrink your delivery zone. And if you can't deliver in the time you promised, offer a discount or refund. You're better than this, or I thought you were

59.description: This place has the worst customer service I have ever seen and I've dined in Australia and Europe where they don't care about customers because there is no tipping. I chose not to write a review after my first bad expereince chalking it up to chance and that we'd come again. After this second experience where we chose to place an online order that was confirmed by email and when I arrived to pick it up they told me it was never received. Again, ok, but to then be rung up for 100% of the order at full price with minimal apology and nothing for while I waited showed me how little they value their customers. To top it off when my order was "ready" I walked home only to find out they had forgot to include the most expensive roll. I called back and they said they would have it delivered with no apology. Seadog there are so many better places with better sushi that will be getting my business from now on.

21.description: I've been coming here for years, it's always consistent and good but I felt compelled to share my most recent experience. We got there right when they opened for dinner at 4pm on a Saturday since we had an event to get to and were in a hurry. We thought we'd be the only ones there and we could get out of there quickly. Only partially correct - we were the only ones there, but the meal took a RIDICULOUS amount of time. The staff was more concerned with knocking out takeout orders than with the people in the restaurant. 30 minutes to receive two rolls and an appetizer? Another 30 minutes to receive one more roll? FOUR sushi chefs working on takeout orders? Give me a break. Don't think I'll be returning

17.description: We received an open table gift certificate and Seadog was on the list for sushi places that we could redeem it. After reading over the menu options and looking at customer reviews, we decided to give them a try and happy we did. We ordered way too much but there were so many things we wanted to try and didn't mind bringing some home. The staff was very kind, helpful and the presentation of each plate was truly art! Food was delish and it's byob too. If your in this area and craving sushi, for sure check it out.

10.description: Came here on a Friday night looking to get some take out. They were very polite and got me my food in ten minutes! // Midnight sundae - 14$ - it was pretty yummy but by the time I got home.. It was cold. I think it is suppose to be served hot with a strange but nice cream top. It was actually a bit hard to get all 8 pieces down. The cream is a little much but it was pretty tasty otherwise. I would order this at the restaurant and share with friends :-)// Ebi Tempura - 6$ - this one was delicious. Probably my favorite Ebi tempura I've had in a while. The shrimp was perfectly fried and crisp. // Crunchy spicy tuna - 8$ - Pretty good.This sushi place is delicious and always consistent. Definitely check it out if you are in the area.

5.description: At the recommendation of a friend, I decided to venture to Wicker Park to try out Seadog. I had been seeing a lot of sushi photos on Instagram and that had spiked my appetite accordingly. I arrived shortly after the doors had opened for business one day to get my sampling.An appetizer that grabbed my eye was The Island. It was sushi, but prepared unlike any sushi that I have had before. This was a dish of crispy sushi rice atop ebi tempura. There was a honey mayonnaise in the recipe that gave the sushi a pop that I enjoyed without use of soy sauce. The interesting maki roll was the Spooky Maki. This sushi roll was made of unagi, jalapeño, and cilantro served with a spicy mayonnaise and unagi sauce. The unagi sauce was rather sweet. After patting much of the unagi sauce on the plate, the sushi pieces were delicious.While the sushi definitely is a highlight, the service seems a bit disconnected. I don't mean that as in disinterested, but more along the lines of mildly off-putting. Perhaps it was timing. I won't take that away from how good the food was, though. It will be a while before I return, though.

3.description: That hostess is the definition of SASS.  In a bad way though - sorry boo, gotta tell it like it is!  If you have a reservation, be prepared to offer your first name.. then last name.. then phone number.  In that specific order or NO you will not be seated even though there's plenty of tables and most people are walk-ins.  Jeebus. Well, good thing I can sass it right back. Sheesh.  I thought maybe he was tired after a long shift but after a discussion with my friends have consistently had to deal with his attitude problem. You know who you are!!! And I bet everyone who frequents this restaurant does too.However, the food was actually really good!  I was pleasantly surprised!  I think my level of expectations have been crushed after too many mediocre experiences that I really wasn't expecting much at all from this restaurant.  We got the sweet potato appetizer (mmmm!!), seaweed salad, tempura, and a few sushi rolls (I think three different ones).  Amongst five of us, we were STUFFED.  I was preparing myself to pay the usual 40-50 dollars per head... esp since we were covering the birthday girl's meal... it ended up being 20 bucks including tip.  SAY WHAT!!  my mouth dropped to the floor and I swear I heard angels sing hallelujah!If this place was more expensive, I'd probably rate it a 3 but it's a definite steal so that makes it a 4.  If the hostess wasn't so rude and sassy, I'd bump it up to a 4.5 or 5.

35.description: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and it did not disappoint. I love sushi and love it even more when it involves BYOB. We only ordered sashimi and nigiri and the fish seemed to be great quality. The prices weren't ridiculous, either, and there isn't a corkage fee. Inside tables are pretty close together which is something that usually bothers me, but something about the ambiance and layout of the restaurant just worked.Only complaint is it's a little off the beaten path and we had to Uber.

19.description: Picked up some to-go recently. Even with a packed house, a line out the door AND a small kitchen, my food was ready within the promised 30 minute timeframe. I splurged and got the $25 large sashimi platter, which claims to have 12 "orders" of seafood. The generous supply of ocean dwelling creatures tasted fresh and I enjoyed every bite. Nothing out of the ordinary good. Just a nice plate of fish.The accompanying huge portion of wasabi, as well the the perfectly temped sushi rice on the side made for some delicious bites.

28.description: I took a friend here for her birthday and we had a great time. I got my daughter (4yrs old) sweet potato rolls, and they were delicious! For the adults, we ordered a few signature maki dishes and the large sashimi platter, which had a variety of fish including salmon, tuna, super white, yellowtail, seabass, tako (squid), shrimp-and I think there was more but I can't think of them. The sashimi display was beautiful-very appealing. The fish itself was nice and cold and sooooo fresh!! I cannot stress how fresh the fish was. The platter also came with a bowl of rice, which was really soft and fluffy, which was a nice addition to the array of fish slices. The signature maki was soooo good. I like how the chef rolled them and the size that he cut each roll. Everyone in our party received a bowl of miso soup, which was more flavorful than I've had, and it was even tipped with peppers, which I've never seen anywhere before. If you check in, you get free sweet potato tempura, which was so good, my daughter and I were fighting over them. Our server, Yahni, was amazing and funny-knew the menu and the food very well, and was very helpful. The atmosphere wasn't too uppity, like sushi restaurants sometimes feel. There were crowds of all ages around us; people on dates, a group of 8-10 college age girls, married couple,etc... The staff were very welcoming and polite to all groups. The restaurant is BYOB, so don't forget to bring your booze, but if you do, no worries, there's a liquor store nearby, just ask an employee and they'll be able to point you in the right direction (like we did). 4stars for food quality, fish freshness, beautiful menu, different menu items than other places (which were really good), price, and service.

45.description: We went to Seadog to celebrate my birthday, and we had made reservations for the patio.  It did not disappoint!  Cute, quaint outdoor area with nicely spaced tables made for a romantic spot for my boyfriend and me.  I checked in on yelp and received a free sweet potato tempura appetizer. We choose three rolls and two different kinds of sashimi:The Lover Sea MonsterMidnight SundaeFlounder sashimiHamachi sashimiEverything was fabulous!  The rolls were big, with large pieces of fish and just the right amount of rice. They were well made, staying together nicely.  The sauces that accompanied each roll were perfect.  The sashimi pieces were fresh and generous portions. Service was great as well.  We'll definitely be back!

33.description: At the recommendation of a friend, I decided to venture to Wicker Park to try out Seadog. I had been seeing a lot of sushi photos on Instagram and that had spiked my appetite accordingly. I arrived shortly after the doors had opened for business one day to get my sampling.An appetizer that grabbed my eye was The Island. It was sushi, but prepared unlike any sushi that I have had before. This was a dish of crispy sushi rice atop ebi tempura. There was a honey mayonnaise in the recipe that gave the sushi a pop that I enjoyed without use of soy sauce. The interesting maki roll was the Spooky Maki. This sushi roll was made of unagi, jalapeño, and cilantro served with a spicy mayonnaise and unagi sauce. The unagi sauce was rather sweet. After patting much of the unagi sauce on the plate, the sushi pieces were delicious.While the sushi definitely is a highlight, the service seems a bit disconnected. I don't mean that as in disinterested, but more along the lines of mildly off-putting. Perhaps it was timing. I won't take that away from how good the food was, though. It will be a while before I return, though.

43.description: Picked up some to-go recently. Even with a packed house, a line out the door AND a small kitchen, my food was ready within the promised 30 minute timeframe. I splurged and got the $25 large sashimi platter, which claims to have 12 "orders" of seafood. The generous supply of ocean dwelling creatures tasted fresh and I enjoyed every bite. Nothing out of the ordinary good. Just a nice plate of fish.The accompanying huge portion of wasabi, as well the the perfectly temped sushi rice on the side made for some delicious bites.

2.description: The Good: Service was friendly, prompt and attentive. The Sushi was fantastic, I highly recommend the Dragon Roll and the Midnight Sundae, wonderful marriage of flavors there. The smoked salmon rolls were on their A game that night, I absolutely loved them. Nice ambience, this is a good place to bring a date. Of course, you can't go wrong with BYO when sushi is involved.The Bad: Not a lod of "bad" per se, but the place is in a small space so the tables are a little crowded. If you're a friendly person, you'll be fine, just know there is a high chance you'll be interacting with one of the tables around you if they have to get up as their chair will probably scoot into you.
