We were there on a Saturday evening so the lighting made it slightly difficult to read the menus, we had to whip out the phones to make out the small print detailing what was in each sushi roll.The good far outweighed the bad here, I'm sure we will come back to try some of the other rolls on the menu.

18.description: I came to Seadog Sushi Bar with one of my good friends and had a good time dining here. The fact that it's BYOB made my experience that more enjoyable. The atmosphere was very intimate and cozy. The server was friendly and offered up good recommendations.I enjoyed my experience here and I will definitely be back to Seadog Sushi Bar.Appetizer Recommendations:*Soft Shell Crab*Asparagus Beef*The IslandSushi Recommendations:*Ebi Tempura *Sea Monster*Tango*Lover

41.description: Unprofessional environment; staff seems distracted,  uncommitted and lackadaisacal.  Feels like a VFW hall?  Fish was fine, nothing to return for. Not sure why it's so highly rated. Bathrooms were dirty.   Ambience is much better at Yuzu, which is also byob, and there's some love going into the food and the staff are  friendly.  I've given this place multiple tries and have never left satisfied. Salmon sashimi was good.

52.description: We came here on a date night a couple of Friday's ago and enjoyed our time! The space up front is pretty small and crowded, but I suppose it made for good people watching. We tried a variety of rolls and all were fresh and flavorful. I would definitely come back.

50.description: My boyfriend and I met his sister and brother in-law for dinner at Seadog before going to a play. Because of that we appreciated the quick service and attention of our waiter.  Everyone loved their meal. The atmosphere was nice. It was a small dimly lit space. Tip: If you're looking for a place to park there is a small paid lot (free on Sundays) at a tech college a block down.

4.description: Yay for byob with no fee! We liked the spicy tuna salad a lot. The maki rolls were fairly fresh we opted for more regular rolls since many of their rolls had cream cheese or was fried.

6.description: Sushi was good. The menu has awesome pictures that show what you're ordering. Check out my pictures for food details.

22.description: Top notch sushi. The staff is courteous and they want you to have a wonderful experience. The fish is SO fresh. I am incredibly picky with sushi - and this place is just great. It's a bit pricey, but if you want the freshest, best tasting sushi, it's definitely worth paying!

15.description: Great neighborhood find. The sushi is quality, and menu extensive. Whether you like simple rolls and maki or rolls with tempura or other additions, Seadog has great options to cover a wide variety of tastes.You get a free sweet potato tempura appetizer for checking in on Yelp! BYOB, patio available, good level of service. The patio outside has Italian bistro lights and is nestled in a neighborhood with low ambient noise, so it is great for taking a good bottle of wine for a date or celebratory dinner.Their spider roll (Soft shell crab, avocado, cucumber, mayo, tobiko) is particularly good. It highlights the crab and does not have a lot of froof to hide that great flavor.Prices are reasonable and range between $9-14 for an 8-piece roll. Splitting rolls is a great option for a table- I recommend between 1.5 rolls for one person with a moderate appetite and 1.5-2 rolls for someone really hungry.

57.description: This place is my new favorite sushi place in Chicago.  Awesome food, fresh, super flavorful and beautifully served. Sushi is great, tempura appetizers very good and we tried also entree - the red snapper in chili sauce which was out of this world and cooked perfectly. Service is very professional and fast. On the top of all great things about this place this place is BYOB not even cork fee. Must try! Great for birthday celebrations with bigger group!

20.description: Amazing fresh sushi and appetizers, will definitely come back very soon. They also took us late at night with no problem!

36.description: Great neighborhood find. The sushi is quality, and menu extensive. Whether you like simple rolls and maki or rolls with tempura or other additions, Seadog has great options to cover a wide variety of tastes.You get a free sweet potato tempura appetizer for checking in on Yelp! BYOB, patio available, good level of service. The patio outside has Italian bistro lights and is nestled in a neighborhood with low ambient noise, so it is great for taking a good bottle of wine for a date or celebratory dinner.Their spider roll (Soft shell crab, avocado, cucumber, mayo, tobiko) is particularly good. It highlights the crab and does not have a lot of froof to hide that great flavor.Prices are reasonable and range between $9-14 for an 8-piece roll. Splitting rolls is a great option for a table- I recommend between 1.5 rolls for one person with a moderate appetite and 1.5-2 rolls for someone really hungry.

14.description: I like Seadog a lot. It's definitely a little bit on the pricier side for sushi, but they have some of the most satisfying apps in the West Town sushi game. We got the free sweet potato tempura app which was pretty much just a few thin slices of sweet potato fried in tempura batter, with a side of spicy mayo. Pretty good. But then we also got the Sea Thru, this genius concoction of smoked salmon, cream cheese, jalapeño, avocado, and house soy sauce wrapped in a thin, crisp soy paper. It's seriously one of the greatest apps, albeit super Americanized I admit. The rolls are solid. They are medium-sized, good proportion of rice and filling, and not overly drenched in vinegar. I'll definitely have to head back for second shot at the apps.FYI: No tables for more than 4 people in the back patio.

58.description: Visiting Chicago, did a ton of research and landed here. Awesome experience. Professional, stellar cleanliness, friendly. Found out the 3rd weekend of every month all of shop profits goes to animals...that just made it better! Brian was great, my bf is super happy with his tattoo. Great choice-highly recommend!

56.description: I've gotten 4 piercings here and I'll definitely be back again. The place is extremely clean and the service is great. I couldn't have asked for a better experience!

29.description: Totally professional and clean. Insight Studios made me & my daughter feel comfortable. We were educated on care for our new piercings. Everything about the visit was excellent.  Thank you!

42.description: I had asked 6 people where to get my nipples pierced and 5 of them insisted on Bob Jones.  Not only was he professional and swift, but he made me feel very comfortable with how nervous I was.  He made my experience relatively painless and I wouldn't go to anyone else for a piercing!  Chicago's best.The counter girl was a bit cold, they could upgrade on that one though.

23.description: I came into Insight about two months ago to get my nipples pierced as a 21st birthday present to myself. It was a Sunday afternoon and was told there would be a 30-45 minute wait, which I was fine with. The girl at the counter was super nice. She took my number and said she'd call me when the piercer (Bob Jones) was about ready, so I went to get coffee. About 30 minutes later I get the call and I head over.Of course I was nervous. Bob made me feel as comfortable as humanly possible for someone to feel before they're about to get holes in their boobies. BTW... He looks just like Mads Mikkelsen from Hannibal, if anyone watches. This isn't important, it's just crazy to me how much he looks like him. Anyway, the process was quick and... as painless as possible. He informed me that he has been piercing for about as long as I've been alive (20 years) and I took a lot of comfort in knowing he's definitely pierced hundreds of nipples before. After the procedure he passed me AND my best friend who accompanied me blow pops! And an antimicrobial soap for me. Fast forward to a couple months later: my piercings have healed beautifully. I will come here for any future piercings and always refer people here. It's reasonably priced, the staff is awesome, and Bob is really professional.

47.description: I went in to get a septum piercing and everyone was just lovely. I don't have any other piercings so I was a little nervous, but Bob walked me through everything and made me feel comfortable. I had originally picked this studio because of their charity work with animals, and it really shows when you go in and see all the cat pictures and what not. I loved it. The place is clean and v easy to get to by public transport. I'm going to go back for sure.

8.description: Unless you're ok with having your personalInformation compromised, I'd pick a different place, if I were you.I can't in any way comment on the quality of the work that the "artists" there do, as I didn't get a tattoo from them. It is apparent though that none of the people there (and perhaps the owner too) know much about solid business practices. Claiming that this is "the law", but not being able to elaborate further on that, they insist on taking a photocopy of your driver's license, which contains a lot of private information. True, you're entering a contract and signing a liability waiver, but beyond verifying the information on your DL no law to my knowledge stipulates that they need to keep a copy of it. And... I wouldn't actually have  had much issue with it, had it not been for the fact that the young receptionist who looked like life had been very unkind to her, was leaving some of the signed contracts just lying around. And those that she had "put away" were kept unlocked, in a cabinet right behind a counter which at least half of the time was unattended. Honestly, if I wanted to i could have walked away with a few contracts and the personal information of the people who had signed it..  So, naturally, I questioned them, and that's when  they became very combative and rude. Arrogantly pointing to the numerous customers waiting, they told me in no uncertain way that they don't give a fuck about my privacy concerns, and that i can walk away if I want to. I tried de-escalating the situation that was about to get out of hands, by explaining again, calmly, what my concern was, but they really didn't care, and the dude I was talking to asked me to leave. It's ironic that in their site they prominently claim to take customers safety and privacy seriously. If only wishing made it so! Needless to say, there will be a complaint with the city and the state, and I hope their license will be audited. What they do is careless, and lackadaisical.Maybe their work is good, but I personally am not taking a chance with my privacy. It is the kind of approach that can ruin the entire business and bring severe legal repercussions.

31.description: It was my first tattoo - I was able to get wendell frazier (wendellfrazier.com)! My review will be in 2 parts:1. Insights Studio - Very cool place, clean and neat and the guys there are super helpful and friendly. It makes a huge difference when you are going in a bot nervous ahead of your appointment. I high recommend. In a city of a many studios you can get caught up not knowing where to go. 2. The artist - Wendell is a first rate gent and a professional - he was able to get my ideas on paper and come up with something I am so very very happy with. I didnt know what to expect going in but his calm and friendly manner was very assuring. The whole session took about 3.5 hours. Price wise he is very reasonable. I know everyone is trying to book out the top artists in the city - but serious check this guys work out.

34.description: Bob runs a great place here. I always get my piercings from him. This place is the cleanest tattoo parlor I've ever been to. I always feel welcome and everyone is approachable and nice. Don't go anywhere else. I recommend Insight to all my friends.

16.description: My friend went to get a tattoo here by Wendell Frazier. She thoroughly enjoyed the entire experience from the moment we stopped by to get a quote until the very end when we shook his hand and got his business card. His business card is so precious by the way, I won't tell you why, so make sure to get one. The place is very chill, welcoming, looked clean, and spacious. They have this little vending machine with metallic cat buttons, though when it dispenses, it gives you a really cute or ugly cat lol. There is also a basket of chocolate up front, yum. Anyways, back to the important part of this review, the man is talented! When he started drawing up, it took a few tries until it was absolutely what my friend imagined, but despite have to redo, he was very accommodating and never lost an ounce of patience. During the tattooing process, he would talk to us and even share a little bit about himself. He has tons of tattoos himself, even on his head. It was a cool look that he was able to pull off without looking too intimidating. Overall, my friend describes him as: amazing, the best, love him, go to him, nice, caring, friendly, funny, and above all talented! Definitely check out his portfolio because we were impressed.

13.description: Insight was an awesome studio! I got my second tattoo here and they were super clean and professional. Johnny did mine and was very patient and helpful with my piece. He actually stayed after hours to start and finish me and my sisters matching tattoos which was so considerate. Definitely ask for Johnny if you're looking for someone that's entertaining and makes you comfortable!As for the shop itself, I thought it was a little pricey but worth the craftsmanship. I'm not from Chicago so possibly normal for the city. I paid $120 for my piece which is an Aries and Taurus sign combined about 3.5 inches long. Definitely recommend this place! Will be coming back if I find myself back in Chicago.

11.description: Bob Jones is your man for professional, high-quality piercing.I looked around at many shops trying to find someone to pierce my six-year-old daughter's ears.  Her mom and I both had our ears pierced in malls as kids, but had heard of the benefits of "real" piercing and wanted to find someone to do it.  However, 5-8 different places said they absolutely would not pierce a minor - "especially that young." Insight had no issue with it, you just have to bring proof you are the parent (birth certificate and ID worked).  The place is immaculate, clean (and bright white, so dirt can't even hide).  We went in last night and met Bob.  He is a pro's pro.  My daughter has a very good tolerance for most annoying kinds of pain - shots, etc. are not usually an issue.  However, I think the build up to this event (she had been wanting her ears pierced for months) and the anticipation of pain really built up some anxiety and she was a bit freaked out by the time she sat down in Bob's piercing room.  Not to worry; Bob showed her every piece of equipment to be used, repeatedly asked if she or we (her mom and I) had questions, and promised (yes, promised, I thought this was dicey with a 6-year-old but went with it) that the pain would be no big deal.  The first ear was done before she knew it. She even commented that it didn't hurt very much.  Nonetheless, in the 5 minutes between the first and second piercing, she inexplicably (to a non-six-year-old) started to lose her nerve.  She has the lip quivering and the tears welling, and I'm thinking, "Oh man, this might be a one-ear situation." Bob then (with some limited help from us) TOTALLY "talked her off the ledge."  The second piercing was done, and she was smiling at her new "big-girl" look in the mirror a minute later.  When my ex asked for a picture of my newly-pierced kid with Bob, he went a step further and took her into the photo booth in the front of the place for a round of great, silly, pics with him.  Truly an awesome memory for me, her mom, and most importantly, my girl! The results have been great: very well placed, beautiful jewelry, and no after-pain.  He explained after-care very well to both her and the adults.  Bob Jones is just very, very good at his job!  If he can get a nervous six-year-old through two piercings, you'll be more than fine.  Yeah, it was considerably more expensive than getting shot with the piercing gun at the mall, but very worth it.  Highly recommended if you feel you need additional holes!

39.description: There's a reason why this place has had 500+ reviews with 5 stars! I called ahead of time to see if I needed to make an appointment, but was told that if I was just getting piercings, I didn't need one. I walked in with my roommates and saw how truly clean the place was. I only had to wait about 15 minutes as there were a couple of people ahead of me. When it was my turn, Bob took me to the back to do my nostril and Monroe piercings. I was super nervous at first, but he was completely calm which calmed me down. He's extremely professional, yet so friendly that it made the experience that much better. He went through the whole process of how I needed to take care of my piercings and was very patient and thorough as he answered any questions I had.Afterwards, my roommate decided to get a small tattoo on her rib. Her artist was Ryan and he was amazing. He asked her a couple of questions of what she wanted and then he drew a beautiful "Love Always," exactly the way she wanted it. He was really kind and honest when she asked all her questions. She is a very careful person, especially with something like this so she asked many questions. Ryan made us feel very comfortable throughout the entire process. Although it was a simple tattoo, he made it look perfectly beautiful and did it almost painlessly.Overall, neither of us could've imagined it happening any better. Everyone who works here knows exactly what he/she is doing and it's so wonderful to be in such a great environment. A huge thanks to Bob and Ryan! :)

37.description: The receptionist was super nice, and Bob, our piercing artist was great. He made us feel comfortable and did an awesome job. Will come back

0.description: I went into Insight Studios on President's Day to get my ears pierced. Apparently everyone had the same idea and there was a bit of a wait. Which I didn't mind at all since I had planned to spend my afternoon getting this piercing done. The facility was clean and bright and full of nice people. The woman at the counter taking names was attentive to those in the waiting area and was always keeping herself busy. She was also really patient with me when I was trying to pick out my jewelry and not being very decisive about it.I got my tragus pierced by Bob Jones and the whole experience could not have been better. He was social, kind, and most importantly - swift with his piercing! It didn't hurt as badly as I thought it would. The piercing room was clean and by the time I walked out of the studio, my ear already stopped hurting. I think one of the most impressive things of all is that I had wanted to pierce my other ear as well but Bob wouldn't do it because they wanted to leave one ear available for sleeping on your side, answering your cell phone, etc... What?! They could have made more money but instead wanted to do what was best for the healing of my piercing. Making sure it's done right over making money?! Amazing! I will obviously go back for the Conch piercing when this heals up!Love my cute little new piercing!

38.description: I came here the day before my birthday to get a nostril piercing. The woman at the counter was all kinds of awesome, explaining all the different prices for different jewelry and informing me about the sweet discount for leaving a yelp review (which i took forever to write lol). I had previously purchased my own jewelry from Claire's, and the piercer accepts outside jewelry IF it is approved. In my case it wasn't, but he explained why without being condescending or rude.When the time came for my piercing, I explained that I was super nervous but Juan was so down to earth and chill! Needless to say, my piercing looks fantastic.I would highly recommend this shop and this piercer. Keep up the great work guys!

51.description: Insight was an awesome studio! I got my second tattoo here and they were super clean and professional. Johnny did mine and was very patient and helpful with my piece. He actually stayed after hours to start and finish me and my sisters matching tattoos which was so considerate. Definitely ask for Johnny if you're looking for someone that's entertaining and makes you comfortable!As for the shop itself, I thought it was a little pricey but worth the craftsmanship. I'm not from Chicago so possibly normal for the city. I paid $120 for my piece which is an Aries and Taurus sign combined about 3.5 inches long. Definitely recommend this place! Will be coming back if I find myself back in Chicago.

27.description: I got my belly button pierced here for my 18th birthday! I was nervous (and the people there didn't really calm my nerves any) except the lady at the counter. My piercer was Santi who was very knowledgable about piercings but wasn't really comforting which I was expecting because I was scared out of my mind! I'm sad he didn't let my sister record me getting my piercing. But, all in all, I love my piercing and the pain was only temporary. I was glad they provided me with a brochure and anti-bacterial soap to help me better understand and clean my piercing. Although I'm don't plan on getting anymore piercings, I'd definitely recommend this place because it's extremely clean and sanitary. I paid an upwards of $100 for my belly button piercing.

32.description: I came here to get my nostril pierced and am super satisfied with my piercing. Santi did an amazing job and I was out of there after 10-15 minutes! He definitely lives up to the hype. He was professional and informative. He did everything quickly and properly. He was very friendly, but not overly friendly; he was very chill! He even gave me a lollipop after the piercing!! If that doesn't scream Grade A service I don't know what does! He even gave one to my friend who came with me for moral support! More than satisfied with my piercing here and will definitely come back for future piercings and tattoos even.

54.description: I had my Philtrum pierced by Bob Jones at Insight Studios, he is also the owner of this amazing shop :) I have come here for all my piercings and have always had the very BEST experiences. They make sure this shop is managed well, great artists, kept clean and inviting. The people that work there are educated, friendly, and talented. My piercings with Bob and Santi have always been precise. They educate you, your included on the placement which I appreciate, and they are just really kool down to earth people. There is a good vibe in this shop- that is a big reason this shop is always busy. My Philtrum is awesome, I absolutely love it! It has healed so nicely. It is tiny and feminine. I'm so looking forward to trying different jewelry, just like I do with my septum piercing- I love changing it up! I love the septum and Philtrum piercing together- I think it looks awesome :) I would never go anywhere else for  a piercing- they are just too good here :) I'm so happy I yelp and check places out because this is how I found this place. I know reviews are so important and I hope this review reaches people that have any concerns, because you don't need to feel that way at Insight. THEY ARE THE BEST!

48.description: I'm not entirely sure why, but I loved Bob. My nipple piercing fell out () and I was worried that it was going to be incredibly painful to put it back in. It wasn't. It was quick, painless and professional. And Bob gave me a discount on the new jewelry! Thanks Bob, you rock!

44.description: Very happy with my piercings - rook by Santi and conch by Bob Jones.  I will definitely be back for more.  The shop is located very conveniently by the expressway, since I'm coming from the NW burbs.  Very clean, staff is friendly and knowledgeable, you get a blow pop afterwards :) love the cat theme too!  I highly recommend Insight for piercings, although I'm sure they are awesome with tattoos as well.

24.description: I got my eyebrow pierced here a few days ago. I had one 5 years ago that migrated out while I was asleep. It was in a part of the eyebrow that is thinner. I decided to get a new one on the opposite eyebrow. The guy who did my piercing was so nice and attentive to my questions. He placed the piercing further along the eyebrow where it's thicker. He told me that I had to keep it in for 4 months (I wasn't told that the last time I got it). It looks great and there are no bad signs. I missed this piercing (I didn't get a new one because I knew I'd find jobs that wouldn't allow it). It's my favorite piercing and it looks fabulous on me!It was a little more expensive than I expected, but well worth it. This place is obviously very professional. As soon as I walked in, the place looked very sterile, just like a place that you'd want to go to to get a piercing or tattoo. Go here. You won't regret it!

7.description: I love this place! I walked in about a month ago for two small tattoos, and although I waited a long time (almost three hours!), it was worth it! I was seen by Ryan, who was really friendly and apologetic for the wait. He drew up my tattoo perfectly and just as I imagined. These were my first tattoos and I was nervous but Ryan was great at making me comfortable and calm, especially right in the beginning. I would recommend this studio to anyone wanting to get a tattoo or piercing. It was extremely clean, bright, and really welcoming. Everything was thorough and well organized. I can't wait to come back to get more done!!!

49.description: Insight Studios continues to impress me, every time I go in for something for myself or to accompany a friend. A few months ago I had my nose repierced, and today went in to have the jewelry changed after realizing I couldn't remove the seamless ring myself.Insight continues to be sparkling clean with great staff. Bob is a real pro, and I am continually impressed with their charity work, particularly their support of Treehouse. It's easily the best shop in Chicago!

40.description: Bob Jones wonderful with my six year old daughter for ear piercing today.  Patient, kind, professional.  All instruments autoclaved and sterile.  Quick and comfortable for my daughter.  We are very happy and highly recommend for children ear piercing.

53.description: I just got my septum pierced by Bob. He was very professional and accommodating. By far the best piercing experience I've had out of quite a few piercings done over the years. He made sure it was exactly where I wanted. Highly recommend. He was amazing.

30.description: I came in here with a friend because our other friend recommended it to us. We were a walk in and only had to wait about 20 minutes to get started with her piercing, the front desk woman was very polite as well as the piercer about all of our questions.Our piercer (wish i remembered his name) was very hygenic and made the process as painless as possible. After he finished, he gave us plenty of advice for cleaning piercings and even sweatshirts with their logo on it!Really had an amazing experience here and I wasn't even the one getting work done. i'll definitely be back when i start my sleeve

46.description: I have been to Insight Studios twice: tattoo and nose piercing. Both experiences were great. I did not wait long for services, and when I received it, the techs were professional and attentive to me as the client. They were not simply trying to provide a service, but to make sure I am happy with the service that I am receiving. I was made aware of every move as it was happening, and I could not of been more comfortable and pleased with the work I received.

1.description: This review has two parts.1) the overall experience - 3 stars. I went to Insight to have my nose (nostril) pierced. I called ahead to see if they accepted appointments and I was informed that no, they don't. It was "first come, first served." I asked about the current wait time (25-30 mins) and headed on over. Once I arrived to a clean, bright studio, I was told the wait time was now 40 minutes. I opted to run out to grab some food and came back within 30 minutes. After waiting another 20 or so, I checked in and was told that the wait time was still 40 minutes. I was a little frustrated but decided to wait. I waited 45 minutes before checking in again and being told it would be 15 minutes, as there was one person ahead of me. I ended up waiting another 45 minutes. All in all, I it was more than a 2-hour wait and I had to constantly check-in for (inaccurate) updates.2) the piercing - Bob Jones was my piercer and he was kind and professional. He informed my friend that there were no videos allowed, but that we could take photos. He recommended a different ring that I had chosen because of my small nose size, and was thorough in his explanations. After the piercing, he handed me a blow pop.

55.description: I had my nose pierced here and I'm happy I did! Very quick, almost painless, and their facility is very clean. The only suggestion I have is to have a larger selection of body jewelry in the shop.

9.description: First piercing ever and really in love with it. Everyone was very professional, helpful, friendly, and quick. The atmosphere was very calm, clean and comfy. I got my piercing done by Santi and I know that when I get my next piercing I'd love for him to do it again. Plus he was ready with the lollipop which is bonus points all on its own.Looking forward to getting my first tattoo here as well.

26.description: I got my tattoo here with Wendell a couple days ago and I couldn't be happier. I keep looking for flaws and can't find one, the work is incredibly well done, so great... Had to wait for an hour because he was late, but understandable, stuff happens and honestly, it was so worth it.

25.description: I love this place! I walked in about a month ago for two small tattoos, and although I waited a long time (almost three hours!), it was worth it! I was seen by Ryan, who was really friendly and apologetic for the wait. He drew up my tattoo perfectly and just as I imagined. These were my first tattoos and I was nervous but Ryan was great at making me comfortable and calm, especially right in the beginning. I would recommend this studio to anyone wanting to get a tattoo or piercing. It was extremely clean, bright, and really welcoming. Everything was thorough and well organized. I can't wait to come back to get more done!!!

12.description: Since my previous review, I've gotten two tattoos by Brian. The first, I got in the summer, is a quote from a Junot Diaz short story. I mulled over this tattoo for about two and a half years before I finally got it and Brian made it perfect. The second, I got this past Saturday, is Lucy van Pelt from Peanuts on my ankle. Not only is my Lucy perfect, but I asked Brian if he could make her brown like me and he did. She looks amazing. Brian is professional, calm (which is really nice when you're getting a tattoo), and really nice. My friend was with me and decided she wanted a tattoo as well, and Brian hooked her right on up.Would definitely recommend this shop and am definitely going to see Brian again.

59.description: Johnny McDevitt was amazing. His honest recommendations were so very appreciated. He's a great artist and even better person. His work on my Spartan tattoo was excellent. I highly recommend seeing him. Thanks again, Johnny!

21.description: I walked in during the last hour of operation on a Saturday and was immediately greeted by Taylor. She was super friendly and very informative. Even though they were closing soon, Bob Jones took me back for a piercing and let me tell you he is awesome. He made me feel comfortable and he made the piercing as quick and painless as possible. I will definitely be coming back to Insight Studios soon!

17.description: I just had my jewelry changed but it was a pleasant experience. They stock good quality jewelry, have a nice dedicated piercing area and the blow pops are a nice touch.

10.description: We went to Insight Studios based on the Yelp reviews praising Bob Jones.  I am jumping on the band wagon- Great experience!  Our 10 yr old was getting her ears pierced for her birthday & Bob was personable & thorough- putting her at ease.  He explained everything to her, showed her placement, discussed aftercare & asked for her approval prior to piercing.  (He was great with us as well)  Big thumbs up.

5.description: I first came to this studio all the way from Kentucky for a small tattoo with Jeff Paetzold about 4 years ago. My experience was SO awesome that I decided this was the place to go and have never looked back! I now regularly drive from Wisconsin for work with Johnny McDevitt, who is one of Insights many talented tattoo artists. The staff is incredibly talented, professional and cleanly and are happy to answer any questions you may have about the artwork, piercings or after care.  They are also professional enough to let you know when they think what you want won't work, while also suggesting a way to change it so that it can! I have now been to their shop for 4 different pieces, two of which took 3 or more sessions to complete and I couldn't be happier. If you want an incredible piece of custom work or a high quality experience, Insight is where you need to go!!

3.description: My boyfriend and I got our tattoos done here in January (my 2nd and his 1st) and the experience was wonderful! James Eastwood did our tattoos, and he was awesome to work us in quickly even though it was their monthly Saturday that they donate the proceeds to charity (another awesome thing about this place!). He did a great job of sketching the tattoos that we wanted and making changes, and was great about cleaning his working area thoroughly before doing our tattoos. We love the tattoos and would highly recommend James!

35.description: Brian Buchak all pro!!!Did a fantastic job on my first tattoo. He did exactly what I wanted. He didn't get frustrated after I changed the size 3 times. Man of few words so if you expect  tattoo artist/therapist like on TV he's not for you.

19.description: i was referred to Santi at Insight Studios by my usual tattoo artist since his piercer gal was no longer at his shop with him. i have been longing for a septum piercing to go along with the nostril ring i did by myself when i was 14 years old, and i didn't want a crooked one, so i found myself here!the shop is super clean, they are very professional, and super NICE! i've been to a lot of tattoo shops over the years, some pretty scummy and some mediocre, but this one has been one of the best. the wait was not long, got to pick what type of jewelry i wanted, directions for after care explained clearly by the piercer, and given to you in a pamphlet, and even got a blow pop at the end!if i ever decide to get another piercing i know exactly where i am coming! although my fiancee will definitely kill me the next time i come home with more metal in my body.. ;D

28.description: I got my septum pierced by Santi, I was nervous at first, the friendly staff on the front desk put all my worries at ease and were super professional. I quickly felt comfortable. Santi did such a great job with my piercing. I am so pleased and happy with it, I would recommend this place to anyone. They are the best. I will continue to come for all my piercing needs.

45.description: This review is a bit outdated, since the bulk of what I've been to the studio for was last year, but I have been back several times since and am always completely satisfied with the experience!I have been to insight for three piercings (two nostril and one surface piercing on my nape) and one tattoo since moving to Chicago three years ago. I had researched a bunch of places before going in for my tattoo consultation and I picked it both because of their affiliation with animal shelters and because the artists portfolios look like the style I was wanting.Santi has always been professional, clean and attentive to answering my questions-- he changes his gloves a million times and double checks that the piercing location is exactly where I want it. When my surface piercing started getting irritated, he took a look at it and gave me some good advice about cleaning solutions to try and told me we could try a different jewelry after the irritation had gone down; when that still didn't work, he took it out for me yesterday (about a year and a half after I had gotten it); sad, but necessary. When I got my tattoo last year, Jeff met with me beforehand to look at my reference materials and figure out size, placement and pricing. On my actual appointment day he was prompt and even stayed late to finish the initial outline (it ended up being two sessions). I don't know if he normally charges a different hourly rate for work that takes longer, but he stuck to the original price he had quoted me and I was extremely happy with the finished product! Again, clean, professional, friendly and was good about checking in to see if I needed breaks (since it was my first ink). Again, love the studio, love the people! I'm sure if I had more expendable income I'd be back here again and again.

33.description: Stopped in with my BF right before leaving our Chicago mini-vacay and they helped us get in, get inked, and get out to make our flight. Taking home permanent souvenirs of our visit. Thanks James and Kelly!!

43.description: Brian did my tattoo and he was fantastic! He really took the time to make my tattoo my own. I came in with a rough outline of what I wanted and he truly made it a work of art. Definitely would recommend Insight to anyone, especially for a first tattoo! They were clean, thorough and professional. If I were to get another tattoo I would go back here!

2.description: I have lived in Chicago for almost 4 years now, and would never go to any other tattoo or piercing shop because Insight Studios is the best I have ever found. I have had almost all of my piercings done there, around 11, and at least 5 tattoos, and I can rave about all the artists and piercers I have come in contact with at the shop. I have always recommended my friends to go to Insight because they are the cleanest, friendliest, and most talented shop that I have come by. Every piercing I have gotten has been in perfect placement that I had asked for, and the space where you get pierced always has a nice clean smell because it is always sanitary and in the best condition possible for each client. The whole shop in general has a nice clean smell when you walk in, which makes you feel that much better for picking the best shop to come get work done. I could go on forever about how much I love this shop, the people, and the amazing work everyone produces. I wanted to comment about the guy, Pavel G.,who ranted about the shop not understanding why they needed a photocopy of your id, how the people there were "rude", and had no idea what they were doing, because I was right next to him the whole time it happened, and he twisted everyones words around.FIrst, every tattoo shop requires to get a photocopy of your id, which he was refusing to give them. The new receptionist in no way looked as if "life had been very unkind to her". That is a very rude thing to say about someone who is just trying to help you in the best way she can, and she NEVER left any signed contracts lying around the shop. There would have been NO way anyone could have just picked them up and walked away with them. They were always tucked in the back of the desk area, where they should have been. Next, in no way was anyone combative and rude to the man. He kept saying the same thing over and over again, and when he became very frustrated and rude to the shop workers, he twisted their own words and said that they did not give a fuck about his needs, when it was the exact opposite. At the end he was making a huge scene and was asked politely to leave and kept saying, so you want me to leave because you do not care about my needs, which was not what was being said. Overall, the man twisted everyone's words that he came in contact to, and was a terrible customer for any shop in general.

18.description: After miserable experiences at over rated tattoo shops, I was convinced it was impossible to find a shop I can trust.  The biggest challenge for me was seeking an artist I can share my thoughts and imaginations to and getting their help in translating that into a tattoo.  I then discovered Insight Studios and Corey Kruger. Insight Studios has much more to offer you than just a 5 star rated shop on Yelp. From the second I walked into the door, I was welcomed with a warm hello (they always have pretty and sweet girls working the front desk).  As I was filling out my privacy form, I couldn't help but to notice 2 things: the cleanliness of the shop and the great energy of the highly skilled artists working there.  I was lucky enough to meet Corey.  Corey immediately welcomed me and was up for any idea I had.  His biggest concern was making sure the lay out and shading made sense over an old tattoo I was trying to cover.  He was extremely professional, patient and thorough with every detail.  The best part of it all, you get a free bottle of Insight Studios after care lotion!! I thought this was exciting until I learned they have a "Tats for Cats Benefit" every now and then which is when they take the proceeds made from tattoos and piercings and it's given to the Treehouse Humane Society!!! I mean seriously?! Does this place get any better?? My next appointment with Corey is already scheduled and I can not wait to have the red carpet treatment from start to finish again at Insight.  Love these guys!

41.description: Insight really helped me! The end on my Neometal nostril stud was in very tight. Stuck! I couldn't change it, and a piercer from a different shop tried for several minutes, then suggested we cut the jewelry off. Insight to the rescue! I stopped by Insight, and Santi had the end out and replaced in under a minute. Easy peasy. He saved me a lot of pain and worry. The receptionist is really nice too. Plus, free blow pop! :)

52.description: Word of advice: confirm your appointment beforehand or your artist won't be there.I paid over $40 round trip for an uber to this place after scheduling an appointment only to be told no one had been able to get hold of the tattoo artist, and I didn't want to wait 3 hours for some random person to put something permanent on my body.

50.description: When trying to find a tattoo shop in Chicago to do my next tattoo, Insight seemed to have some of the best reviews, so I decided to give them a try! .....Unfortunately, I never even made it into the shop. I sent a quick email asking if they gave price quotes, and didn't receive a reply for a week. Well, I then sent my image to them, and never even got a reply to that. I was just trying to get an idea of how much to have on hand, and planned to make an appointment with the reply. I get that they're probably busy dudes, especially given the good reviews from others, but I'm surprised that anyone even gets in there with such a lack of communication. Super bummed about this experience.(Lol... quick edit to ensure everyone who reads the owner's retort that I was indeed not "window shopping"...... I found somewhere with great service and had my tattoo done after I realised the people at Insight had no intention of working with me. Definitely a serious customer.)

4.description: My husband likes wearing a hoop in his ear - the kind with two balls on the ends.  Yes, it's "supposed" to be a navel ring, or for nipples or noses or other "approved" areas.But here's the thing, guys; I find it enormously ironic that although he chose to come in here for a piece of $30 jewelry, you all treated us like "outsiders" for lack of what you have clearly deemed "appropriate" jewelry usage.  You really can't expand your imagination to accept that he might want to use his hoop in a different way? Seriously, the snide looks, the rolling eyes aren't appreciated.  I've seen the tattoo work you do, and from the other reviews, sounds like you're tops in piercings as well....but your attitude is elitist and unwarranted.30-40 years ago, just having a piercing placed a person on the fringe of society and over time, acceptance of those who choose alternative (for lack of a better word) body art has become more mainstream.  But again, don't you see the irony in determining that only your definition of fringe is acceptable?

6.description: Experience with piercer was great

22.description: i was referred to Santi at Insight Studios by my usual tattoo artist since his piercer gal was no longer at his shop with him. i have been longing for a septum piercing to go along with the nostril ring i did by myself when i was 14 years old, and i didn't want a crooked one, so i found myself here!the shop is super clean, they are very professional, and super NICE! i've been to a lot of tattoo shops over the years, some pretty scummy and some mediocre, but this one has been one of the best. the wait was not long, got to pick what type of jewelry i wanted, directions for after care explained clearly by the piercer, and given to you in a pamphlet, and even got a blow pop at the end!if i ever decide to get another piercing i know exactly where i am coming! although my fiancee will definitely kill me the next time i come home with more metal in my body.. ;D

15.description: There's a reason why this place has had 500+ reviews with 5 stars! I called ahead of time to see if I needed to make an appointment, but was told that if I was just getting piercings, I didn't need one. I walked in with my roommates and saw how truly clean the place was. I only had to wait about 15 minutes as there were a couple of people ahead of me. When it was my turn, Bob took me to the back to do my nostril and Monroe piercings. I was super nervous at first, but he was completely calm which calmed me down. He's extremely professional, yet so friendly that it made the experience that much better. He went through the whole process of how I needed to take care of my piercings and was very patient and thorough as he answered any questions I had.Afterwards, my roommate decided to get a small tattoo on her rib. Her artist was Ryan and he was amazing. He asked her a couple of questions of what she wanted and then he drew a beautiful "Love Always," exactly the way she wanted it. He was really kind and honest when she asked all her questions. She is a very careful person, especially with something like this so she asked many questions. Ryan made us feel very comfortable throughout the entire process. Although it was a simple tattoo, he made it look perfectly beautiful and did it almost painlessly.Overall, neither of us could've imagined it happening any better. Everyone who works here knows exactly what he/she is doing and it's so wonderful to be in such a great environment. A huge thanks to Bob and Ryan! :)

57.description: I've been her more times than I can count. Every time is just as great as the last. When you walk in the door, Taylor at the front desk is very friendly and helpful every time. She gets you signed in quickly and is happy to chat with you when your wait is long. Tattoos --I've had four tattoos done here. Two of my four were done by James, who is amazing at what he does. His lines are straight-- something that I hear every time people see one of my tattoos-- and his ink has stayed darker than my others. I am going to insight in a week to get a larger piece done by him, and I cannot wait!!Piercings--Santi did my septum. When he first pierced it, it wasn't in the center of the sweet spot, so hours later it was already moving. I quickly found him on Facebook, and shot him a message with a photo attached of my moving septum. Without hesitation, he told me to pop back in at any time, even if it was after closing time. I came later that night, and instead of trying to maneuver the piercing (it could have been due to swelling), he just pierced it again higher up. I haven't had any problems with it since! Santi is also a super cool dude. And who could forget Bob Jones. That dude is awesome. He pierced my nostril for me first. I honesty didn't feel a thing when the needle went in. When my nostril started having a bubble next to it (something that happened the last time I got my nose pierced), he immediately got back to me and told me how to care for it, telling me not to worry. Bob also pierced one of my nipples. I was NERVOUS, to put it loosely. People told me how much the clamp hurt- even before the needle went through. He told me it really isn't anything to worry about, that it'll be done in a second. Before we even pierced, Bob made me feel super comfortable- I mean, I had to take my entire shirt off and have him touch my boob. When the clamp went on, I was so distracted by how the clamp didn't feel like anything at all that I barely felt the needle go in. Don't believe what people tell you- nipple piercings barely hurt. Or maybe Bob is just a great piercer. I would go to Bob for ANY piercings, seriously. Insight is the place to GO, y'all!

20.description: My husband likes wearing a hoop in his ear - the kind with two balls on the ends.  Yes, it's "supposed" to be a navel ring, or for nipples or noses or other "approved" areas.But here's the thing, guys; I find it enormously ironic that although he chose to come in here for a piece of $30 jewelry, you all treated us like "outsiders" for lack of what you have clearly deemed "appropriate" jewelry usage.  You really can't expand your imagination to accept that he might want to use his hoop in a different way? Seriously, the snide looks, the rolling eyes aren't appreciated.  I've seen the tattoo work you do, and from the other reviews, sounds like you're tops in piercings as well....but your attitude is elitist and unwarranted.30-40 years ago, just having a piercing placed a person on the fringe of society and over time, acceptance of those who choose alternative (for lack of a better word) body art has become more mainstream.  But again, don't you see the irony in determining that only your definition of fringe is acceptable?

36.description: I really wish I could give 3.5 stars - I am very torn between 3 & 4. I called ahead to see if my friend and I could get tattoos at the same time - or if an appointment was needed. I was told someone was open if we could come right away - so my friend & I got to the shop within 10 mins... but still waited well over an hour. The studio itself is really nice, very clean and bright. The super cute blonde girl working the reception area was very friendly and beyond helpful. She was just plain awesome. The receptionist explained to us and other walk in customers that the artists do everything "custom" so it was great to just come in with an idea and the artist would draw something up. Of course they had pictures of work they had done, but there was no typical "samples on the wall" set up like most shops. My friend and I were getting similar tattoos - very simple 5 word phrases in black ink. We were given an iPad with a program to view the different fonts. We each picked out what we liked and were told to email a screen shot so the artist would have it for reference, which we did. When it was finally our turn we were assigned to Johnny and the samples he brought to us were NOT the fonts we had selected. No big deal, they would reprint them. Then when I asked if my phrase could be made into a circle rather than just a straight line, he said "You'd have to bring the picture in that way, I don't know how to do it." This baffled me, because they're supposed to do "custom" work. I didn't understand what was difficult about putting my words into a circle.. but was glad he didn't agree to do something he could have possibly done wrong. So I agreed. He then told us there was a problem with my font uploading in their system (or something like that.) I told him we used the program THEY supplied us.. but he insisted it wasn't working on their side. I reminded him we emailed pictures of the phrases/fonts we wanted - and asked him to print it out that way. After 3 or 4 trips back and forth - he was finally able to do it for us. However, even after I sat down in the chair and we had gone over my selection several times he STILL had the wrong tattoo printed out for me. (At that point, I really almost walked out.) We were able to eventually iron out all the kinks and get things going... When my boyfriend and my friend followed me to his booth he said "oh, you can only have one person with you." I pointed out that the people in the booth next to him had 3 in their group, as well. His response was, "well.. they know the owner." (Really?!?) So my friend returned to the lobby area. Ugh.Beyond the confusion, Johnny was very nice and professional. It was my first tattoo and he definitely made me feel comfortable and explained everything he was doing step by step. He asked me several times if I was doing ok, if I felt alright, etc.  He also took plenty of time to make sure I knew how to properly care for my tattoo at home.My simple black 5 word tattoo costed $100 which I felt was a bit pricey but not surprising for the trendy area. You get $10 off if you check in on Yelp. I didn't learn the cost until 2 seconds before he started and after waiting for 90 minutes I couldn't convince myself to back out. I am confident I could have gotten the same tattoo of the same quality at a different shop for a few bucks less. (To add a bit of insult to injury, once I got home and REALLY looked at it, I noticed a flaw in one of the letters.. which I am sure nobody else will notice, but it will definitely drive me nuts for the rest of my life.)All in all, not a terrible experience but I unfortunately will probably NOT return to this shop for my next tat.

14.description: I go here for Johnny! Stalked him all the way from the mean streets of Aurora because that's how much I love his work and how comfortable he makes getting a tattoo. Highly recommended:).I'd also like to note that my tattoos are not yet complete, I don't make it out to Chicago a lot!

1.description: The owner is simply AWESOME. My son wanted to purchase a very specific bike for himself. My son contacted the shop asking about store hours. The shop was closed for 2 months this winter BUT the owner came in just for my son. Spent a generous amount of time helping my son learn and pick out the right bike. I love supporting small businesses and Let's Roast Cycles made that so easy. Thank You

9.description: 5 stars does not do this place justice. Incredible service. They go above and beyond for their customers and have helped me numerous times with my bike. Go there and buy everything. Then tell your friends and have them go there and buy everything.

23.description: I love this bike shop. I bought my first commuter bike this summer and have been frequenting this shop since it opened. Not only is the store right next to my house, but the staff (and their furry friends) are super helpful!  Good prices and honest work!

25.description: I've been in a few times, once just to check it out and one to get my road bike repaired, and both experiences were great. It's a great, laid back space, and the guys who work there are easy going and knowledgable. I took my bike in expecting a $70 tune-up and when I went to pick it up they ended up charging me $40 (the lower end tune-up) since they didn't need to do a lot of work to get it into good shape. They are a great addition to the neighborhood and I am looking forward to checking out some of their social rides.

12.description: These guys should be your first choice for bike repairs and maintenance.  They're always straightforward with tips and costs/timing, and are willing to help out with minor repairs cheap and fast.  Retail selection is pretty limited, at least for non-BMX bikes, but they know their products well and sell bikes they believe in.

21.description: Still amazing, outstanding customer service... People stop in when you ride by I promise you won't regret it. Bob and Logan are the best. Digger is the best pup, and the community in there makes me hope for a better cycling community in Chicago. Nuff said

16.description: Helped me out right away when I was in a bit of a tough spot during my commute today. Hadn't ever been in the shop before, but the guys were super nice. I didn't ask for much, but they put down what they were doing to help me out for free. Much appreciated.Also: they had some pretty slick Fairdales on the wall/floor. Would definitely like to check them out in more detail at some point.

17.description: This is the first time I've written a review for a business before actually becoming a customer. I feel compelled, though, to compliment Let's Roast Cycles on their strong customer service, and explain why I hope to make this my primary bike shop in Chicago even though it focuses mostly on BMX bikes. I will follow-up on  this review after I've purchased their tune-up for my Trek mountain and tested it out.I've been biking by Let's Roast everyday on my way to and from work in the Loop but never stopped in. Finally checked it out the other week when I was having trouble clipping my brake cable back into the bike. I felt stupid for needing help but the co-owner, Bob, was very gracious and fixed the bike.Bob and I had a nice conversation about biking in Chicago and about their tune-up packages. Their packages are very reasonably priced--actually the best non-Groupon deal on a tune-up I've seen in the neighborhood.They also run Thursday evening social rides which sound like a fantastic way to meet new people and de-stress from work. I hope to join one of these rides soon.So in conclusion I was very impressed with Let's Roast Cycles during my "pop-in" and I'm excited to become a customer soon!

10.description: Great job and quick service!!! The price is just right.. I got and both my tires fixed before the heavy riding season starts!

5.description: Stopped by to ask for an estimate and they gave me one. I took my bike in a couple of days later (it was in a horrible condition) and Ian did his best, not to mention an amazing job, bringing it back to life. Very affordable as well. Thank you, Ian!!! YOU ROCK!!!!!!!

11.description: Needed a bike tune up, and Let's Roast did a great job while not charging me the cost of another bike for a basic tune up.  My work was done quickly, and the staff took the time to ensure I was completely satisfied with the work they did.  I really appreciated the knowledgeable, honest, and ethical staff.  They didn't try to sell me anything I didn't need, and they were not condescending about my lack of bicycle related knowledge.  Check them out!

22.description: This is the first time I've written a review for a business before actually becoming a customer. I feel compelled, though, to compliment Let's Roast Cycles on their strong customer service, and explain why I hope to make this my primary bike shop in Chicago even though it focuses mostly on BMX bikes. I will follow-up on  this review after I've purchased their tune-up for my Trek mountain and tested it out.I've been biking by Let's Roast everyday on my way to and from work in the Loop but never stopped in. Finally checked it out the other week when I was having trouble clipping my brake cable back into the bike. I felt stupid for needing help but the co-owner, Bob, was very gracious and fixed the bike.Bob and I had a nice conversation about biking in Chicago and about their tune-up packages. Their packages are very reasonably priced--actually the best non-Groupon deal on a tune-up I've seen in the neighborhood.They also run Thursday evening social rides which sound like a fantastic way to meet new people and de-stress from work. I hope to join one of these rides soon.So in conclusion I was very impressed with Let's Roast Cycles during my "pop-in" and I'm excited to become a customer soon!

0.description: Best shop on the West Side.These guys are the real deal. They are more interested in treating you as a person than a customer, there have been several times I have gone in with something loose or a weird sound and they have checked it out for free, even on my insisting on payment! When my crank shaft got warped they ordered the parts that I needed and were able to take care of me in just 30 minutes. Fantastic service and guys who really want to teach you about bikes. They are guys who were used to getting snubbed at other shops because of being more BMX focused. It doesn't matter if you aren't a "serious biker." If you want to take care of your bike and learn a few tips to do that I can't recommend this shop enough.

20.description: I've been meaning to write these dudes a good review for a couple of weeks now. I pass by this place daily on my way to work. Never had a reason to stop though. But a  little while back my chain broke just before I was about to cross 90. Thought I was screwed but these guys fixed my chain real quick and I was goo to go.Chill people, cool store, and quick service. They didn't tell me that I should put brakes on my bike 'for your mom.' Charged me $5 for fixing my chain in less than 10 minutes so I'd call that fair. If you don't like animals though, this place ain't for you. They have a couple of cool ass dogs around and a cat.

19.description: These guys rule. So nice, honest, and helpful.  Good prices and down to earth staff.

2.description: I was in this shop yesterday. Fist and foremost, very customer oriented. I picked out a set of wheels, added some basic accessories and a helmet all under $600.00. I am very satisfied with my purchase and the bike is sick.I was not pressured to buy above reasonable prices, plus they honored my Veteran status and afforded me a discount.Very personable and attentive. You can tell they are true riding enthusiast that enjoy engaging with the average rider to give the the most comfort and best price for their experience. Unlike other bike stores I have written reviews for.Go spend your money here - you will not be disappointed!

18.description: Still amazing, outstanding customer service... People stop in when you ride by I promise you won't regret it. Bob and Logan are the best. Digger is the best pup, and the community in there makes me hope for a better cycling community in Chicago. Nuff said

13.description: Great staff and quick service!  Friendly and pleasant to work with while they fixed our flat.  Owner discussed sweeping the streets of debris to try and help the riders!I'll be back for a tune-up/tires in the future.Thanks All!

4.description: This is the best beard, I mean bike, shop ever.I was howling down Milwaukee, headed for Asado Coffee Pickwick Lane at 22 E Jackson, a place I had never been, but entirely willing to meet. The light turned green and I roared across the intersection. Only, halfway across, Bike's chain encountered some trauma and by the way my frantic pedaling proved fruitless, I instantly concluded I would need to stop and put it back on.At the curb I swiftly upended Bike and reached for the misbehaving chain. But there was no chain. I was confident Bike was supposed to have a chain. So I was surprised. My gaze redirected to the way from which I had just come, and there it sprawled forlorn and tragic. It became clear to me: my life would never be the same again. Thinking "Coffee, Coffee, 22 E Jackson," as I headed for the Loop, a portion of my brain had nevertheless recorded seeing a bike shop not So far back on the right side. Yep. These people fixed up Bike with a new chain, and even let me scrub the black oil off my hands with their- oh, you know that stuff men keep in their shops for scrubbing oil off, with the sandy stuff in it? So in about 10 minutes I was again headed for 22 E Jackson. You will not believe this probably, but when I came back through Chicago a few days later, I was howling down Milwaukee, headed for Wormhole Coffee, and there was road destruction right in the bike lane. A five inch straight up elevation in the pavement. Like a square missing in a pan of brownies. It was dark and I was looking around me, but it would have been unavoidable anyway, and phzzt goodbye back tire. The next morning Let's Roast Cycles cheerfully fixed everything in less than 15 minutes and they did not make me feel dumb for not knowing about bikes. They were happy to help, and respectful to my old Bike who has been with me these seven years.I give them six stars.

24.description: Helped me out right away when I was in a bit of a tough spot during my commute today. Hadn't ever been in the shop before, but the guys were super nice. I didn't ask for much, but they put down what they were doing to help me out for free. Much appreciated.Also: they had some pretty slick Fairdales on the wall/floor. Would definitely like to check them out in more detail at some point.

6.description: I've had some really bad experiences with bike shops here in Chicago. Let's Roast provided the best service I've ever received. It's a small local shop with friendly staff who were approachable. You can tell their passion is bikes. But man, their tune up is the best I've ever had on my bike. They go to the nines to bring your bike back to life. I bought my Bianchi Pista five years ago and I ran it into the ground last year. It rides like I just bought the bike yesterday. All for $60, which is the least expensive tune up I've ever paid for.What I was REALLY pleased with is that they realized my brakes were unrepairable. Instead of installing them and charging me for the brakes without my permission, they called me up to ask if they can install new brakes. That is honest service any customer would appreciate. Will be a returning customer to Let's Roast and will highly recommend this place.

15.description: I got my bike and had them remove all the green colored pieces and swap out for black and upgrade the pedals. I picked it and it was perfect!!! Everything I wanted and more was done. Since then I've stopped back in to get lights, a lock, and replace a blown tire. I love this place from start to finish. I'm a customer for life!! Stop by and check out all they have to offer. It's the most welcoming bike shop in the city area.

7.description: I am very glad to have found these guys. Good guys doing good work!I plan on getting a Sunday Model C this month and look forward to years of customizing, tuning, and of course riding!

8.description: On this morning's commute I got a flat and was fortuitously close to Let's Roast Cycles. The sign on the door said "Closed" but Logan was kind enough to open the door and assist. I needed a new tire and tube. Logan fixed it in 10 minutes and had me right back on my commute. I was able to make it to work on time. I extend my gratitude to Logan and Let's Roast Cycles for saving my morning!

3.description: Great customer service. Pleasure stopping in and talking about my bike. They are always quick to provide tips and share their knowledge on upkeep and service. If you're looking for a great bike shop in west town this is the one I'd recommend.

14.description: You guys.After a range of so-so-to-good relationships with bike shops over the years, I've accepted that I have oddly specific requirements for what makes up a good  shop. That being said, here is why this is a fantastic one:- Super smart mechanics (Like, they're real good, man)- Cool bikes/Rad clothes- A tiny white dog!- A big black cat!- Dudes with long hair- Chill vibes, brahThis shop has all of that. After messing with a really old derailleur of mine, they got it working better than I was able to from hours of adjusting it. Still, since it wasn't up to what they considered a gold standard, they gave me a killer 'scount (First: that's cool slang for discount. Second: don't get greedy and go looking for handouts. that's rude). Finally, on top of alllll that, they do a Tuesday night BMX ride, which is great for me--a guy who looks like a total doofus on a BMX and needs to meet cool/young people who can make me look less like a doofus/teach me dope tricks. Anyway! In summary, this place is the business, but please don't shop there because I hate when my favorite places get busy.

58.description: I've been going to Roots for a few years now and I have no complaints!I have to agree with Aimee B, everyone is very friendly!I've been going to Jackie since I started to go there and she always does an amazing job! Not only does she give great cuts, but I go to her anytime I have an event or just want to do something fun with my hair! Beatriz also does a wonderful job, I've had to go to her a few times when Jackie wasn't available and was happy the results every time. If your looking for a new salon, Roots is definitely worth checking out!

56.description: If you're in need of a new stylist or simply are not happy with the one you have you need to pick up the phone and make an appointment here with Erin! I am probably a stylist's worst nightmare. I expect great service yet I always go in undecided of what I want. Usually, I end up leaving not impressed by either the service or the atmosphere. At Root's I was over whelmed by the atmosphere. The staff is wonderful, the decor is top notch, and my hair came out great! Erin was able to recommend and follow through with a great cut that was both trendy enough for my friends and yet still appropriate enough for work. And did I mention the color is superb?

29.description: Allen is fantastic! He's cut hair since his youth. At one point in his life he was a massage therapist which is why I can go into the salon with a headache and feel it go away as he shampoo's my hair. Allen is also a painter - his painting hangs on the wall behind reception - and currently in a program at the Art Institute. I walk out of the salon - not with a hair cut - but with a sculpted work of art.

42.description: Allan at Roots is amazing. He has been styling my hair for over 10 years! His shampoos are great and his attention for detail is why I keep coming back. Roots is a cool very chill salon!

23.description: It's all about Cicily Cicily Cicily!  I have never had such perfect eyebrows before I went to her.  She is an esthetician extraodinaire!  I have not had my eyebrows waxed since 12/09. Seriously. I'm one of those people that thinks I can keep it under control.  Then I looked in the mirror, and I was horrified!  13 months of no wax, what was I thinking?  How did no one say anything to be about  my 1980's eyebrows?Anyway, Cicily came highly recommended from another friend, and I am so thrilled to have found her.I highly recommend her for all your waxing needs!

47.description: Roots has a cool atmosphere and fantastic stylists and service providers.  Wes does amazing things with my hair.  I also had a fantastic facial at an introductory, discounted price and it was wonderful (forgot her name).   I felt very pampered and relaxed.

8.description: My hair cut was excellent and my stylist took time in the consultation to listen to my concerns. I have thick curly hair and one wrong move can  ruin the cut. But she took time and my hair looks great. My only problem was she added color to two pieces of my blond hair and charged me a lot more then I was expecting.

31.description: I love this salon. But more than that I LOVE Kariman's haircuts. She worked with me the other day to get just the haircut I wanted---we sat and looked at picture after picture after picture and then talked and talked and then she went to work and my hair is even better than any picture we saw. She is a hair genius, just extremely gifted. I have never gotten so many compliments on my hair as I am getting now. And she is delightful to hang out with which is good because she really puts time into her color and her haircutting. Basically I would follow her anywhere. Kariman plus me = Forever.

34.description: go to Ryan.  don't ask questions...just do it.  he is fantastic.

16.description: My friend recommended I go to Roots and ask for Allen. I was 100% ready for Allen to chop my hair off. It's hippie long and was seriously unattractive. After a very thorough consultation, Allen said "i'm gonna give you victoria secret hair" Me: "so you are not cutting it off?"  Allen "Nope, I think long hair suits you, Im gonna give you victoria secret layers"  I heart Roots and Allen.  Already made my 2nd appt. I moved here in March of 2009 and have not found my hair stylist til NOW.  Thanks!

13.description: A great, well-priced place to get your Feather Extensions or meet your other "slightly alternative" styling needs! They have a good selection and some of the most reasonable prices I've found in the area! I haven't gotten other hair services (I'm a total Prink Salon devote', thanks to the amazing Jessica), but it looks like they have good prices!I got a GIft Certificate here also for a Bachelorette Party gift to my sister-in-law and they put it in this beautiful card and bag with ribbon and everything; I loved that they went the "extra" mile to make it special! TIP (on tips!) They only take cash! I had no cash, so I had to tip Brittany the next time I came in to get my feather extension tightened (but I didn't forget my cash this time, because I'm a woman of my word!!!!)

11.description: I stopped in Roots a few Fridays ago and let me tell you, this place is amazing. How can you not love a salon and stylist that makes you feel like you are at home? Brittany was my stylist and let me tell you...I left there looking and feeling my best. Brittany has never steered me wrong and the dedication that all of the stylists show is so apparent. She is amazing and I will keep going back. If you need a hair cut in Chicago, go here. You will not be disappointed.

39.description: i have been coloring my own hair for a long time and have finally had enough.  i'm pretty nervous about other people messin' with my hair; guess i've had more bad experiences than good. needless to say, keli changed my opinion for good!i have long curly hair with a lot of gray that i've been dying red for years. my hair was a wreck to say the least.  after keli worked her magic with color, she began cutting and i was gritting my teeth.  by the time we got to the blow dry, i was practically jumping for joy in my chair!  my curls were alive and bouncing!  and my color looked straight out of a magazine.   keli was very professional and the shampoo massage rocked!  i can't say enough good things.  the salon was lovely inside, nice music being piped in and no seemed stressed out or in a hurry.  i expected my hair operation to take weeks to fix, but i was in and out under 2 1/2 hours!thanks again keli! and thank goodness for roots salon!

37.description: I've been going to Roots for over a year now and have never been disappointed.  The staff is always warm and friendly from the minute you walk in the doors.  It's nice to have coffee or tea while you wait on one of the big comfy couches and read a magazine.  They sell Aveda as well.  I could smell Aveda all day.  Their staff is the tops when it comes to talent.  Erin Weber cuts my hair and it's always awesome!  I've been to so many stylists who just do what they want to your hair, but Erin really listens to what I want while still applying her knowledge as to what would look best.  I highly recommend her!   I know there's always coupons and specials as well, which makes it more affordable than a lot of salons of this caliber in the city.  All in all, Roots is a number one class act with a super friendly and highly talented staff.  5 stars.

0.description: Brigitte did such a great job taking me back to my natural color after a brief, poorly considered and ill advised attempt to be a redhead. I totally trusted her from the very first moment I sat down in the chair, and enjoyed talking with her during the lengthy process of coloring my longgggg hair. She suggested going darker at first to allow the color to fade naturally, and it worked like a charm! Plus I majorly enjoyed my life as a raven-haired badass for a couple weeks. It's been about six weeks and I have zero roots - praise!Anyway, Brigitte is super talented and really sweet and her prices are super reasonable.Plus, Aveda products! Hooray.

38.description: Keli is the best! killer men's cut. I've gone to her for my last two cuts all the way from Boston. worth it!

51.description: Like the atmosphere in this west of the Kennedy location. Of course your experience here depends on the stylist, and happily I found Allen Addington who moved to Roots recently. Five stars for Allen for sure, with four for Roots. With years of experience, Alan is fabulous working with hair--doesn't create a style du jour thinking it will work for everyone. End result is easy care and manageability, which I love. Allen got the color right as well. He's finished two years at the Art Institute, has a great eye for color and design sense.  You will get his full attention in this non-frenetic salon. Go!

27.description: Keli, Cicily, and the rest of the team at Roots are outstanding. I love this place!  The staff are warm and friendly. I am always greeted with a smile and my wait time is minimal. The place is calm, relaxing, and smells great. Keli does a fantastic job with hair. She listens, looks at pictures, and makes suggestions, but ultimately she will do what YOU want! I get compliments on my cut and color for weeks after my appointment. Cicily is my go-to-girl for eyebrows!

32.description: I just moved here from Vancouver, BC to Chicago and needed to find an esthetician for my waxing needs....aka, I needed to find someone who will be gentle with my private parts while you take hair away from there.  I found Cicily at Roots Hair Salon and not only is she gentle, but extremely good! I would definitely recommend Cicily to anyone who needs a great esthetician.  Just make sure you have cash for a tip because you cannot add tip on a credit card.  I have to go back to the salon to give her a tip!

54.description: This is the fourth salon I've been to in the city in nine years.  I went there on my roommates recommendation, and he shaves his head at home!  I now love it, I go to Bridgett who is fantastic.  The conversations in the salon are great to listen to and since I don't care too much as to what happens to my hair as long as I can go to work the next day, I just tell her how much I want taken off. I highly recommend Roots.

48.description: I have been super happy with Roots since I started going here about 2 years ago.  When I was new to the city a friend recommended Jessikah, who was my stylist until she left town this past summer.  Definitely miss her, but Brigitte my new stylist is also great.  It's comfortable and relaxing inside, and yes, the people at the desk are super nice and friendly!  I can't stand a snooty attitude at a hair salon, and never get that at Roots.

44.description: My stylist, Ryan, relocated here several months ago and I'm very pleased with the change. Roots is relaxed, cozy, and unpretentious, but the service is top notch. I am not one to stay with a particular stylist year after year, but Ryan is the exception! Besides being incredibly talented, he is a wonderful person, easy to talk to and never pushy. It is always a pleasure, and not a chore, to visit.
