24.description: Natalie is the best stylist I have ever had....I look forward to seeing her to talk and catch up as much as I do to get my hair done! I have been going to her for years, and send as many people as I can to see her (and they are always very happy). Good location, fairly easy to get parking. I recommend the salon, but most especially, Natalie.

7.description: Man, I'm disappointed to see one star reviews.  HOWEVER -- my experience was awesome. This is my second haircut at this place. The first was in May (3 months ago)Today I called at 12:15pm and asked if they still have their lunch discount deal. Then I asked if they had any spots open right then. Then I hung up and walked out the door to get to Roots.Walked in, Edwin greeted me by name, got me to the same stylist as last time (Brittney). She asked me how the last haircut worked out and if I wanted to do anything different. I said no. She cut I hair. I look great! Here's the thing, I didn't tell them who I was when I called. They keep good records on their customers and execute beautifully.To speak about Brittney for a moment. I went in and was randomly placed with her for my first time. Turns out my wife went to her as well by convenience. I gave simple instructions of I want something that looks stylist but simple to maintain. She went to work and I walked out looking great!. Even this last time where she mimic the success she had with a few update tweaks. Honestly I am pretty picky about my hair stylist. I used to have a guy up at Basic Salon in Lakeview and mourned when we left the area as a hour trek to get my hair cut is too much. After several tries at other places around Chicago (State Street Barber, Snap, etc) she is my person now!Great service, nice people and good hair. What more can you ask for?PS: they have a discount for men if you go during lunch Tuesday to Thursday.

49.description: Location - PerfectAtmosphere - RelaxingHaircut, color and style (with Wes) - Spot-onPrice is my reason for giving 4 stars. After tip, it was $200. Granted, I have a lot of hair and it was one of the best haircuts I've ever had. Still, I think people would like to be aware of the investment.

40.description: Ryan Babbitt rocks my socks off. I have somewhere in between wavy and curly hair, and for so long I settled for a very basic slightly layered cut that would lay right and look good about 1/2 the time. Considering I wear my hair EVERY SINGLE DAY I don't think 1/2 the time is good enough.Enter my curly-haired friends Marjorie and Cassy who were both sporting new cuts that accented their curls, their pretty faces, and were fun, bouncy and bright. I got Ryan's name and booked for the next week. I'm seriously never looking back.In addition to being a completely accredited hair stylist Ryan has a BFA in visual arts (sculpture, if I'm not mistaken?) and it really shows in how he cuts. He thinks in 3D, he thinks about the whole picture, and he really listens to you. He doesn't force you to buy any product but is happy to explain the pros and cons of what they sell and make recommendations if you ask. I love him.**roots in general is awesome. The folks are friendly, comfy waiting area stocked with new magazines and trail mix, and they stock Aveda products - hello Rosemary Mint lotion. At my last haircut my boyfriend had taken the car during my appointment to run errands, and my purse was in it. roots was shutting down and I wasn't able to pay, I felt SO BAD. No one made me feel bad at all about it and someone stayed with me until I got my purse back and paid.**

53.description: John...you are an amazing friend and a great stylist.  In fact, my ex-boyfriend asked me permission to still come to you post break-up because you are that good!!  It always smells great in here and is clean and friendly.

30.description: This place rocks it rocks. I think I get my hair cut by Keli- She's pretty cool and down to earth. Does a great job with my thick hair. I always get compliments on my hair for weeks. After trying another stylist at a different salon after my initial haircut with Kelli, I'm happy to say that I returned to her like the prodigal son (daughter?). I'm here to stay and the place smells heavenly and everyone that works there is ultra friendly.

46.description: Surprise massages 3 paces away from my doorstep? I'm not lying. I live above Roots, so I can't help but enjoy its convenience. Once, my boyfriend said, "don't plan anything for 11.30am" so - at 11.30 am we left the house, and I had no idea where we were going... we walked three paces, carved our names into wet cement, then arrived at Roots, where he had booked a 1 hour massage for me. It was FANTASTIC. Erica was my masseuse, and she was very sweet though my back wanted her to be a bit more firm. (not so keen on this fairy fingers Swedish massage business.) During the massage, the CD player (playing silly new age relax-athon wave stuff) broke, which didn't bother me, but Erica was worried that it had ruined the massage. So she's offering me half price off the next massage. Nice. I love Roots. I've also had a haircut and a free bangs trim here, and found everyone to be friendly, laid back and professional.

1.description: Jackie is the most wonderful stylist.  I am always excited by my cut or color, Jackie outdoes herself every time. She truly wants her clients to be thrilled with their hair, and she goes to great lengths to make sure you are satisfied. Jackie's sense of humor, and unflappable nature make her a delight to be with, and I'm very grateful that I ended up in her chair by chance a few years ago.  Jackie does my cut, color and also keratin.  Jackie continues her education and is always learning and looking for the most current and effective ways to use products and processes.  I can't imagine anyone else touching my hair.

55.description: Its cool you get hot chocolate and truffles before you get cut, but $40 for a dudes haircut?!?! F that noise bro...

9.description: I stumbled upon this salon two years ago when I first moved to Chicago, and I will never go anywhere else! My stylist (Brittany!) has never led me astray. She always knows exactly what I want, even when I am not sure myself, and I am definitely booking her to do my hair and makeup for my upcoming wedding!The entire staff is always friendly and welcoming, and the cheese and wine tasting they had a few weeks ago for all their clients was so much fun! Even though I have moved out of the immediate area, I will continue to patronize this establishment, and I always recommend it to all my friends!

26.description: My reason for 5 stars: Kelli! She executes my very specific requests perfectly and because of that my hair is radder than it's been in years. I get compliments on it everywhere I go. I mean, total strangers will just stick their hands in my hair and ooh and ahh over how nicely textured it is. It's really creepy and probably not hygenic, but it just goes to show the extent of her skill. I wouldn't've trusted anyone else to shave the side of my head when I finally decided to take that plunge! So if you like very modern, edgy, unusual styles, go to her.They also have a super cute, cozy wait area and friendly, professional front desk staff that always remembers to offer you refreshments, which just tops the whole experience off.

25.description: My friend recommended I go to Roots and ask for Allen. I was 100% ready for Allen to chop my hair off. It's hippie long and was seriously unattractive. After a very thorough consultation, Allen said "i'm gonna give you victoria secret hair" Me: "so you are not cutting it off?"  Allen "Nope, I think long hair suits you, Im gonna give you victoria secret layers"  I heart Roots and Allen.  Already made my 2nd appt. I moved here in March of 2009 and have not found my hair stylist til NOW.  Thanks!

12.description: Carrie is my stylist, very nice and competent. Head massages during the shampoo feel great and relax you for the cut. With long, wavy hair, Carrie always understands how my hair works and knows how to keep it looking pretty!

59.description: I had the complete opposite experience.  I've been to this place a handful of times, and the staff there was just ok as far as friendliness goes.  They're not really willing to make sure they will do anything possible to make sure a customer is happy.  If you have a bad experience, don't expect them to be overly helpful in fixing it.  Also, this place is a little pricey overall.

21.description: i have been to sooo many salons in the chicagoland area for the last 10 years i have lived here... and 2 weeks ago i found this place and i fell in love. I had a wedding to attend and Brittany was sooooo perfect. she was gentle, easy going and fun to talk with... i have super duper curly hair and she got it slick straight without hurting my head... The staff is so nice and the atmosphere is very chill and relaxing.

17.description: Carrie at Roots is absolutely the best stylist in the city..  After 15 years at a Naperville salon, I spent years searching in the city for a hairdresser as good as my reliably- perfect stylist.  Carrie knows exactly what kind of style I want & takes her time to ensure that I'm happy- I always am..  And, at a rate lower than any of the upscale salons I've tried, the added bonus keeps me coming back.  For special occasions, her blow outs are a real treat, and very reasonable.

10.description: It's all about Cicily Cicily Cicily!  I have never had such perfect eyebrows before I went to her.  She is an esthetician extraodinaire!  I have not had my eyebrows waxed since 12/09. Seriously. I'm one of those people that thinks I can keep it under control.  Then I looked in the mirror, and I was horrified!  13 months of no wax, what was I thinking?  How did no one say anything to be about  my 1980's eyebrows?Anyway, Cicily came highly recommended from another friend, and I am so thrilled to have found her.I highly recommend her for all your waxing needs!

5.description: It's not the salon that makes the stylist, it's the stylist that makes the salon. I went to Roots twice to see a stylist who has since left. She was OK and Roots is close to my home, but it was nothing to get excited about. Then, when the other stylist left, I was rescheduled with Kelli, and Kelli got my hair blonder than any other stylist ever said was possible, perfect ashy tone, and she gave me the perfect mix of edgy yet conservative pixie cut. Many stylists have not been able to achieve these desired results as I have super dark, curly/frizzy hair and want an almost white, smooth blonde pixie cut. I have been bouncing around salons/stylists for a year now waiting to be impressed. Now thanks to Kelli I am finally confident in Roots.

3.description: Jackie is the greatest.  I am not, never have been, and never will be a stylish guy.  That's why I go to the experts, and because of Jackie, and the woman at Nordstrom that tells me what to buy, I fool people all all the time and they inadvertently think I'm some cool stylish guy.I've been going to Jackie for years and she does excellent work and I trust her with any ideas she has.  She's super creative and awesome, and now that she's back at Roots, so am I.

35.description: I got an amazing facial at Roots a few weeks ago. Cicily, go see Cicly, she is the bomb! So friendly, funny, and most importantly knows her skin (which you can tell by looking at hers, it's like porcelain!) I got the Elemental facial, which is customized to your skin and focuses on a healthy balance. Loved it, Aveda products smell SO good. Although it felt like more than a facial,  It started out with a warm foot bath which felt so good after walking about a mile in the cold, AND got little massages throughout the facial. How good is a hand massage ?!?!  She didn't push any products, and educated me on inexpensive habits that would help my dry sensitive skin. As far as the salon goes, it was friendly, had good music, and a good vibe. I'll definitely be back.Thanks Roots!!!

19.description: Want the best eyebrows you've ever had? Cicily. Instant facelift from an awesome lady!

28.description: Ryan Babbitt is the best stylist. He's cut my hair for the past couple of years, and I always get the perfect style. He's just that good. The Roots Hair Salon staff is the best - courteous and informative. If you like Aveda product, they have the entire line. Even a cup of tea for you when you arrive.

45.description: *Alan*He gave me a crazy awesome shampoo massage that was totally awesome and lasted forever. My hair wasn't in the shape of a trapezoid when I was done. Sold. I'm also super psyched that they have *twice* been able to fit me in 20 minutes after I called. Also, the first time I used a coupon, which made it much more affordable than other salons in the area, and even sans-coupon I think it was worth it for a big city haircut. Also, if you would like to buy me a present (my 3/4 birthday is right around the corner) the earrings by the register are totally up my ear alley. Ew.

33.description: Allen did an amazing job cutting my hair.  I told him the length I wanted and that I needed to be able to put it in a pony tail and let him decide the rest.  He took his time, cut layers, and styled my hair very nicely, and in an easy to maintain way.  I have been to various salons in Chicago and will definitely be back to see Allen.

43.description: After I moved out of the area, I went to a salon in my new neighborhood a few times, but it just couldn't compare to Roots. Add to that the fact that the two stylists I went to at the new salon in the 'hood both quit... I decided it was time to duck and run.Although Roots isn't conveniently located for me anymore, it's well worth the trip. My former stylist here has since left, so I tried Erin (other Yelpers had good things to say). She was fantastic--sweet, funny, and able to give me a slightly different style without sacrificing too much length. Exactly what I wanted. I left feeling like a new woman. And they offer complimentary trims on the news bangs I'm sporting. Nice.

2.description: I have been seeing Jackie for a few years now and she is amazing! I have followed her to a few salons and will go anywhere in the city she goes, that's how good she is. Jackie takes the time to really listen to what you want and talk it through before diving into the cut/color. She's got some serious talent! It is clear by her techniques that she really cares about her craft and making sure you get exactly what you want. A few other pros....she is FUNNY! And serves wine/beer. Go see her asap! Roots Salon is a warm, welcoming space that played awesome 80's tunes the whole time and just had a positive vibe in general. I can't wait to get my hair cut again :)

18.description: This place is EPIC! I saw Carrie, who was professional, precise, and personable. I highly recommend her. She works Tuesday, Fridays, and Saturdays.The most important thing to me is the haircut, and I'm in love with mine. I was looking for a professional / put-together look that wasn't too stodgy, and Carrie instantly understood what I was looking for and what kind of cut would look best on me. She walked me through a quick way to style my hair and what to use, and was not too pushy with the product. Sometimes I feel awkward when stylists try to sell me products, but I felt like Carrie was recommending a product that she thought would work best for my hair and schedule. She gave me a sample, told me where I could find it, and let me decide. I am WAY more likely to buy the product this way than with the pushy sales tactic I've gotten before. On top of it all, she's very intelligent, and I had a great conversation with her. I know she spent a lot of time on my hair, but it went by really quickly because she was so easy to get along with.AND, the place looks beautiful - it's modern, sleek, and warm. The staff will offer you refreshments as soon as you walk in. If you don't know your schedule, they are extremely accommodating to walk ins, which is a HUGE plus for my busy, unreliable schedule.  This is a real deal professional salon, and I didn't feel like it was prohibitively expensive. It's in a really convenient location for Rush and UIC students, people who live around the west loop, the near west side, river west, goose island, etc etc. Parking is really easy. I'll definitely be back. I feel like I've found my go-to salon and my go-to stylist. I've lived in the city for 7 years, and this is the first time I've felt this way. Keep in mind, also, that while they take credit cards, you cannot tip on your card. Don't get caught with your pants down like me - bring cash! And then go see Carrie and tip her well!

41.description: Brittany is the shit. I followed her when she switched over to roots. She been my hairstylist for over a year now and i never want that to change. All of my friends go to her now. She makes me feel incredibly comfortable and always makes me laugh when i'm in her chair. Best damn colorist!The salon as a whole is wonderful too. I love how environmentally conscious they are and i really enjoy the relaxing atmosphere. The rest of the staff is really friendly too.Try it. You'll like it.

52.description: Roots is great all of the ladies are nice and they have some great talent!They also just hired on a massage therapist Erica.  Got a massage from her yesterday it was awesome!  She hit all the right spots.  I was so relaxed after, and the price was very reasonable!  I took advantage of the 20% off sale they have now.  And its also good that they offer shorter massages for someone who doesn't want to spend as much money.  Will definitly be back.

50.description: Warm and hip décor, super friendly staff, great music, amazing stylist....what more can you ask for? I had a 10 am appointment with Ryan and asked to move it due to a surprise spa treatment that my boyfriend got me for my birthday. Unfortunately, 10 am was the earliest appointment they have as that's when they open. That didn't stop Ryan and the owner from coming in a half hour early to open up the shop for me! That is above and beyond exceptional service. In addition to the great conversations with Ryan, I left feeling and looking like a million dollars. I'm hooked and will be back to see Ryan again and again.

4.description: My new neighborhood Salon!  I've had my hair colored by the same person for 15 years now but am always looking for a great salon and stylist especially.  I have found that in this place!! I love the cozy and clean atmosphere as well as the scent of Aveda products!Keli is my stylist and I have gone twice to her now and have already re-booked. She is the creative director and I can see why.  She really listens to you but also give the best professional advice! Not to mention a great personality to be around.

6.description: I LOVE this salon for many reasons, but mostly because Jackie takes amazing care of me there! My color has amazing pop, my cuts are just what I want, and I just feel taken care of. I've been with Jackie for a few years, and I'll follow her anywhere. But this salon is the perfect fit!

22.description: Want the best eyebrows you've ever had? Cicily. Instant facelift from an awesome lady!

15.description: My reason for 5 stars: Kelli! She executes my very specific requests perfectly and because of that my hair is radder than it's been in years. I get compliments on it everywhere I go. I mean, total strangers will just stick their hands in my hair and ooh and ahh over how nicely textured it is. It's really creepy and probably not hygenic, but it just goes to show the extent of her skill. I wouldn't've trusted anyone else to shave the side of my head when I finally decided to take that plunge! So if you like very modern, edgy, unusual styles, go to her.They also have a super cute, cozy wait area and friendly, professional front desk staff that always remembers to offer you refreshments, which just tops the whole experience off.

57.description: I went to this salon for a little over two years, and always had a very positive experience.  I highly recommend Bria - she listens to what you want and has great ideas when you don't exactly know what you want.  They also give you really great Aveda tea while you wait, too!

20.description: I am VERY particular about my hair cuts and color and absolutely LOVE Natalie! She gives me her honest opinions and I always leave happy. I've gone from blonde to brunette and back and forth and she is always right on with colors and recommendations. Sent my neighbor to her and we are her biggest fans! Everyone there is super friendly and I would recommend in a heartbeat. Can't say enough good things :

36.description: Brittany has given me a phenomenal cut and color both times I have visited her at Roots. She was able to lift a few shades of semi-perm home hair color off my head and even squeezed in a cut for my damaged ends that I hadn't made an appointment for. Great! The new color turned out perfect and I don't hesitate to recommend her expertise! She is a collaborator in hair design, go visit her, you won't be disappointed.

14.description: Ryan Babbitt cut my hair whilst I lived in Chicago. I moved out of country in May of 2010.  In February of 2012, I'm going to interview for a job in Chicago. Regardless of how much time I'm there, 3 days or 3 years, I will make an appointment with him.  I look at old pictures of my hair, while in Chicago, and get misty.  He's a genius with some scissors (clippers I think they say).

1.description: Every now and then I find some really cool stuff. Just bought a metal mask for my outdoor terrace pillar for$6.

9.description: Seems like the only times folks wander into this place en masse is during Halloween in search of that perfect hideous prom dress to recreate your Carrie moment. But there is so. So. So. SO much more worth checking out. The basement alone is like, so full of ridiculousness you don't even know. A big rack of vinyl containing obscure classics such as "Sing Along With Mitch!" and "Sing Along With Mitch: Even More!", for example. Atari games, 8-track tapes, old computers, old typewriters, ice skates, golf clubs, china. The mind boggles. The ground floor is all furniture, rugs, old kitchen stuff, chairs, couches, etc. and while some deals are pretty good, some of the pricing seemed a little steep for what (and where) they were.Second floor is where the magic happens. Clothes, clothes and more clothes. Leather jackets, fur coats for $100, shoes, handbags, etc of all shapes and sizes. The back room is full of glassware, obscure bar items and old tools, and today folks I scored the best score ever: a 15" "gold" bottle full of whisky (tax seal still in place) shaped like Elvis which has a music box base that plays "My Way". No I am not making that up - who could?

12.description: I love thrift stores and have got some good buys at this one even though as others have mentioned a lot of the stuff is really overpriced.I bought a pile of baby clothes recently and all of them had the price stapled onto the front. Even though I was very careful removing them, they still left holes, quite large ones at times especially as some were double stapled. I think it's a shame that the lazy labeling system is ruining perfectly good clothes. I would live to buy more clothes from them but this really puts me off.I've emailed them directly and am going to mention this in-store. It'll be interesting to see if they try and come up with a new method.

21.description: From what I've heard, this location has seen better days.  However, I always seem to make out like a bandit.  This 3 leveled Salvation Army is a thrifters heaven.  I usually go to thrift stores in search for dresses, tops and of course cheap jewelry and I always leave the store with at least a few things...and spending less than $20.  Like all thrift stores you have to pick and choose your battles, but if you're good at finding treasures this is a great place to go.I've been able to find Bruno Magli shoes, Velvet dresses and a Christian Dior sports coat.  Not bad finds.

16.description: From what I've heard, this location has seen better days.  However, I always seem to make out like a bandit.  This 3 leveled Salvation Army is a thrifters heaven.  I usually go to thrift stores in search for dresses, tops and of course cheap jewelry and I always leave the store with at least a few things...and spending less than $20.  Like all thrift stores you have to pick and choose your battles, but if you're good at finding treasures this is a great place to go.I've been able to find Bruno Magli shoes, Velvet dresses and a Christian Dior sports coat.  Not bad finds.

17.description: This place charges more for their used items than stores for the same item new. Don't waste your time looking for a deal

10.description: LOVE THIS PLACE! You can find so much-as long as you are willing to do a little digging. But if you are a thrifter, you won't mind the hunt. The first floor has a ton of great furniture-so many projects were running through my head as I walked around. The second floor has tons of clothes and an "antiques" room (basically glassware, old art, and ceramics). Prices are amazing-all of the times I've been there my stuff has come out to about half of what I thought it was would have been. Watch out for when you go-the last time I was there it was about 93 degrees outside and for some reason their air conditioner was not working (or not on??) and it was terrible-definitely put a damper on looking around. Also there are no fitting rooms, the employees will encourage you to find a corner and spot each other for onlooking creepers. If you're cool with doing your thing, you should have no problems here! Other than that the store is great and is very much like a treasure hunt!

5.description: So, this building is pretty freaking awesome looking. It was fun to kinda explore through it. That being said, the building was the only redeeming quality. I don't know how someone is expected to thrift in the dark, but the section with the clothing has NO lighting, making it hard to see what you're looking at. Plus, most of the clothes seem a bit over priced. Also, they had music playing from somewhere in the corner. I couldn't hear it very well, so it was more of annoyance than anything.Honestly, I would recommend going here once - to see how interesting the building is, then never going back.

11.description: I was amazed at how organized and clean this location was compared to a few other stores.  I was torn between 3 & 4 stars because of the furniture pricing (as others have mentioned) but the employees really bumped it up to 4.  The ladies working the 2nd floor were incredibly sweet and nice.The clothing was not as good as the SA on Clybourn, but I did find a banana republic sweater I remember eyeing in the stores last year for $3... yahoo!  We had so much fun going through the 2nd floor "antiques" and lower level doo-dads... I'll probably swing through when we drop of donations every few months.

3.description: This place is ok to check out every once in a while, but don't get your hopes up too much. The clothes section on the 2nd floor are very dimly lit and dusty. A lot of the things are also really really worn, so the "finding an almost new name brand piece" day dream will stay a day dream. The main floor is mostly furniture and household decor. They do have some quality stuff, but also at quality prices. Sofas and desks are at least $200. I also saw them selling 5 place settings of china at $20 - $30, and many cup and saucer sets at $10.50. C'mon, at these prices I could have gotten brand new china on sale. The basement, or the bric-a-brac floor, is where I usually spend the most of my time since I collect china. Even though they mark up a lot of their stuff, the person setting the prices is definitely not an expert and usually marks up nice looking at first glance but in fact mediocre to poor quality items, especially they are sets. With a lot of digging you can still find some hidden gems. I was able to walk off with 2 Royal Worcester bone china plates at $1ish each the first time and 2 Royal Doulton bone china tea cups at $1.56 the second time. I also found an extremely rare Tuscan Naples saucer for about $2. On a pure economical standpoint I'm not sure if they were really worth the time, but since I think of it as "a treasure-hunting pass time" I still enjoy it.  Service is also not very friendly and the cash register can be left unattended for long periods of time. I mean I know I shouldn't expect much from a thrift store, but the nearby Goodwill people are much nicer.

0.description: One of the largest Salvation Army's I've ever been to. In all my Salvation Army reviews I say how I don't like to support them due to their anti LGBTQ ideals. But honestly I'm a poor college student, and also a brand-named maniac. I love finding/wearing brand names for cheap so that's why I keep shopping here. The men's section is a totally secluded area on the second floor. Last time I was here everything was half off and I have to tell you about my finds.Topshop Men's Cardigan - $2 (Retail at around $60-80)Banana Republic Tee-Shirt - $1 (Super soft retails at around $30)Arizona Co. Tee-Shirt - 50cents (Nothing special probably retails for $10)These were unbelievable finds for around $4 including tax! I don't know why people don't thrift shop because I can replace my entire wardrobe for less than the price of a new jacket.My only complaint about this store is it's really hot and humid on the inside, I assume because they don't have central air or maybe it's broken. Customer service is awesome though, and the workers are very friendly.If you want to find great name brands for less, shop at this Salvation Army.

20.description: Seems like the only times folks wander into this place en masse is during Halloween in search of that perfect hideous prom dress to recreate your Carrie moment. But there is so. So. So. SO much more worth checking out. The basement alone is like, so full of ridiculousness you don't even know. A big rack of vinyl containing obscure classics such as "Sing Along With Mitch!" and "Sing Along With Mitch: Even More!", for example. Atari games, 8-track tapes, old computers, old typewriters, ice skates, golf clubs, china. The mind boggles. The ground floor is all furniture, rugs, old kitchen stuff, chairs, couches, etc. and while some deals are pretty good, some of the pricing seemed a little steep for what (and where) they were.Second floor is where the magic happens. Clothes, clothes and more clothes. Leather jackets, fur coats for $100, shoes, handbags, etc of all shapes and sizes. The back room is full of glassware, obscure bar items and old tools, and today folks I scored the best score ever: a 15" "gold" bottle full of whisky (tax seal still in place) shaped like Elvis which has a music box base that plays "My Way". No I am not making that up - who could?

19.description: 2nd floor in the back is where all the old bridesmaids and prom dresses go to become funky costumes. It used to be cool stuff from the 50's & 60's now it's the 80's and 90's ... time marcheth on. They have an "antique store" on the same level. It has gotten overly inflated on prices but you can still trap a catch in there. Some prices are a joke - but there are deals to be had... retailers dump inventory so you can find new things too. I usually find better regular clothing at the S.A. on Clybourn.

2.description: This is an awesome Salvation Army.Compared to other thrift stores, it's good. Compared to other Salvation Armies, it's awesome. This is one of the largest and most filtered salvation armies. By that I mean the store sorts through tons of junk to find things that are actually decent and purchasable. I have purchased everything from kitchen plates/silverware to clothing and a coffee table. The goods they select to sell in this store are decent and I will return here when I need cheap furniture or thrift clothing

18.description: This place has racist employees, who scrutinize and treat minorities differently. Check out the posts for the same location on the other Yelp group. My wife and I won't be going back.

13.description: Ridiculous overpriced indeed! I was thinking it was me! But yeah they want millions for their crappy old furniture! Come on  greedy bast@&" ! You got it for free! The reasonable thing to do is market afortable!You suck!! Salvation army! We r in a recesion !! Helloooo!!

4.description: The lack of air conditioning and lighting made my time here short and unpleasant. I have a love of all things resale and have picked my way through many Salvation Army's. I like this one the least. The prices were decent and there is a lot to look through- if you can see it. Truthfully, I was so hot I just kept looking for fans to stand in front of instead of any hidden treasures (and with the lack of decent lighting, they were truly hidden). I would go back in cooler months and bring a flashlight.

6.description: I seriously love this pace. There is ALL kinds of stuff here and you can pick up literally anything. Like I wish I would have frequented this place while I was in school, cheap school supplies. Full set of *old* golf clubs? Not a problem. Lamps? Computer accessories? Cables for electronics? Check, check, check. Not to mention all the clothes you can pick up here. I recently got a job back in the white collar world and after wearing scrubs for the last 3 years I was short on, ahem, white collars. Picked up a plethora of clothing and restocked my wardrobe for minimal amount. I even picked up some belts for the cheap and honestly I think I finally have more than two colors. It is also a great place to dump off a bunch of things you don't need. My fiancé and I recently moved back to Chicago from out of state and dropped off a bunch of things we no longer needed/used in Missouri. If you do this, don't forget to get a recipe because its a TAX WRITE OFF! Yeah!So go there, get some new stuff, drop off some old stuff. They even take credit cards.

15.description: This store is 3 levels - basement, main level (entry level), and 2nd floor.The main level is unfortunately NOT worth your time.  It's their furniture level - and they get some cool looking furniture, but it's always SO overpriced.  I mean, 2nd hand store pricing should not be ridiculous in my book.  However, both the basement and 2nd floor ARE worth your time.  Basement is "Bric-a-brack" - and has tons of fun glassware, games, random art, etc.  The 2nd floor is chock full of clothes - and the clothes prices are totally reasonable.  You have to spend some time (since there are a ton of clothes) - but you can find some great stuff.  Things to note:  there is no dressing room, so it's a try-it-on-over-your-clothes kind of deal.  Also, they make you check your purse when you come in... so I just usually leave mine locked in my car and just come in with my wallet and keys.

7.description: this location is so so. I love a good deal, so thrift shopping for me is so fun. This location has three floors. It is messy, even for a thrift store, but does have some nice things here. The furniture is a no-go though. Some of it is nice, but EVERYTHING is over priced. Negotiating is worthless here too, the manager always says no. She'll just tell you how much it would cost in a regular store. If I wanted to pay the price of a regular store, I would have went to one. Plus they get the stuff for free... just saying. Honestly though, I like it though.

8.description: The prices are ridiculous, simply ridiculous.  I'm pretty sure there is something shady going on behind the scenes here and I really doubt this place is looking out for the mission of the Salvation Army.  Service was incredibly rude as well.

14.description: This is the most over priced thrift store I have ever been to. The prices are totally outrageous.  Its too bad since it is such a huge store.

58.description: If you're in the Noble Square area and need wine, definitely go to this place.  The service is outstanding and they know how to surprise you with a great wine.But what makes this place stands out is their delivery service.  If you're dining at a BYOB (at least in the Noble Square area), they'll deliver wine to your restaurant.  So if you have a bad bottle or you need more, just give them a call and they'll take care of you.Highly, highly recommend this establishment and we plan to go to them as much as possible.  I'm not sure how far they'll delivery, but I'm more than happy to try and see what the limits are.Again, great selection, great service and great people!

56.description: This is only steps away from Lush on Chicago Avenue, which is a mush larger and more expensive bottle shop.I am a huge fan of The Noble Grape - I buy novelty beer and very good wine from them at least twice a week... I don't know how well that speaks for me.  I have been to their tastings and they are pretty good and very generous with their pour.The place is fairly small but they have such a wide selection of wine and beer (haven't dabbled in the liquor section - that seems dangerous) that I keep going back.  And the staff has been more than helpful - they are actually very knowledgeable of their product!I was so happy with my first visit, I have gone back at least twice a week, like I said... and I signed up for their wine club.  Their wine club is probably the greatest deal around the neighborhood.The only downside is that they don't actually sell the food, meat/cheese, crackers, etc that usually come along with a bottle shop with a wine club.  It would be nice to purchase some grub when I get some good recommendations...

29.description: Excellent Service! I went there last night needing a good wine (~$20 range) for dinner but had no idea what we were going to eat yet. I'm a big craft beer drinker and just starting to get into wine, but don't realy know much yet.The guy working there was great with advice, listened to my limited input of what i knew about what i liked and made a great recommendation for an Italian wine (only $16) that pairs well with any food and had a full body but smooth finish. He also did a really good job of teaching me a lot more about wine variety & pricing vs quality. Obviously I had to buy some good beer to go with. The 4-6 Pack selection is not huge but has a very good variety and had some beers I had yet to try. I picked up a 6'er of a spiced belgian ale that was way smoother than the 9.4% abv! The individual bottles of craft beer ($6-18) selection was very impressive. Picked up a tall boy bottle of the Lagunitas Hopp Stoopid which i'm looking forward to enjoying with some good BBQ soon. The Yelp 10% discount for checking in is a bonus too.Very satisfied

42.description: Love this store. Doesn't hurt that it's within walking distance of my apartment, but the selection is really good and the staff is so friendly and helpful. I love wine but can't afford $20+/bottle, so I appreciate the options available in the $10-15 range. Also really like how everything is laid out because it somehow makes it easier to browse and select a bottle. I also read a review for a local restaurant that the Noble Grape delivers?? Umm, if this is true sign me up.

23.description: I love this place, every time I go in they are super nice and treat the customer very well. I know what I like in a beer and what I dont. They have some amazing limited edition beers and always help me find something that I like. I have been going here for over a year, and prefer this place, though small, to binnys and a lot of other places.The owner is nice, the staff is friendly and jestful and the prices are good compared to the large stores. If you are looking for PBR then this isnt the place for you. If you want nice wine and beer at a reasonable price with people who will help you and understand their products then this is your place

47.description: Great selections and friendly staff.

8.description: Great selection of wine and craft beers. I stop by this place after work a couple times each week. Consider myself a frequent customer. I have always had great experiences with the service. The owner is awesome and incredibly knowledgable. They're always trying to change things up with a new assortment of craft beers and wines every time I stop by. Wine tastings and samples, etc... these guys know what they're doing. Today was the first time I've had a bad experience. I read some of the negative reviews here on Yelp and was surprised by what I read, until today. I like to try something new each time I buy, which usually means I ask a few questions. This isn't typically a problem at this place, however today it seemed like the dude working the register was irritable, got annoyed with me, and I was well aware of it. I am a nice guy and don't often upset people, which is why this caught me off guard a bit. When I'm buying alcohol, I'm excited. It's my time to relax after a long day of work and enjoy a novelty purchase that makes me feel good. Also, I'm really interested in the process of brewing beer and the different kinds. I like to learn from you dudes and It sucks to have some grumpy guy ruin that for you. I'll come back, but this experience definitely ruined the homey vibe I got from this place previously.

31.description: Great wine & beer shop for anyone looking to BYOB to Ruxbin to pair with a delicious meal.  The staff here are very helpful and steered me towards some nice picks for Pinot Noir and IPA.  I ended up being a little more adventurous with Dogfish Head's Saison du Buff and Brewdog's Bashah Black Belgian Style Imperial IPA, both of which were fantastic.  You get 10% off your order with a Yelp check in too, always a plus!

34.description: We were very please with our recent trip here. Awesome selection and great price points. The sales person was really nice and knowledgeable and he even opened for us a little early! Really awesome beer selection as well. We joined the rewards program and plan to go back often!

16.description: I love this place. We've been here several time before and I have purchased good wine at all of the visits.  They great you with a complimentary wine taste which is always a catch - I almost always ended up buying the wine being advertised. Nice vibe, dog friendly place. Gotta love good people in your neighborhood.

13.description: I like this place a lot. The staff is very down to earth, knowledgable, and helpful. It's right near many byob restaurants and their hours are also really convenient. Whenever I go I pick up this amazing white wine called Ranga Ranga for just $14. It was recommended to me by one of the sales guys awhile ago and I'm now addicted to it. They have a great selection of craft beer and sake, too.

11.description: This is a great neighborhood spot, and I visit it often! I love wine but would probably not qualify as a connesieur, so I sometimes find wine shops intimidating. Not the case here. It is cozy and down to earth with a helpful staff and good hours. The rewards program is great (I think it's 10% off for every $100 spent) and I love the staff picks under $15. I hear there is another wine shop up the street (Lush) but this place is my spot and they haven't given me a need to look elsewhere yet!

39.description: Great selections and knowledgeable staff.

37.description: I really like this local wine and beer shop. Great selection as well as a helpful staff.... Plus they DELIVER!

0.description: Great for local BYOB restaurants. Deep and interesting selection of beer and wine, some cold. Limited space, they don't have everything, but what they do have is great!

38.description: Great selection, amazing service, knowledgeable staff...flat out amazing! Not to mention, piratically of their beer they also have in the back chilled! Fantastic! Especially for those evenings when you didn't plan ahead ;)Go for the Atomium. You won't regret it...(I hope).

51.description: Hello Noble Grape. Thank you for saving me from wandering into yet another poorly stocked liquor store in the neighborhood while on my way to my favorite BYOB. For anyone who has not yet had the pleasure of scouring the area for a decent bottle of chilled wine, let me assure you most other establishments (you know, those with a bar built in) will disappoint. I was delighted to find Noble Grape--good selection and knowledgeable, helpful staff. Plus I received a 10% off coupon. Cool.

27.description: I don't go ANYWHERE else.  Why give corporate Binny's your money when you can support the small business man?  Especially one as knowledgable about wine and beer as this one.  I can go in and say, "um, what pairs well with .... sushi... stress... flying pig... whatever!" and come out with the perfect recommendation.  For those used to buying your wine at Dominicks... do not be scared of this wine shop! There are TONS of inexpensive fantastic options.  This is not a snooty experience.  (ALSO... BEER!!!)

32.description: Seriously great customer service. They are always willing to help you select the wine or beer you are in the mood for, and possibly even convince you to try something new. They will show you great stuff that wont break the bank. Put your name in their database, the points you earn well worth it. I actually have to convince myself NOT to go there daily

54.description: Cute little wine shop that carries a great variety of liquors at reasonable prices.  It's a perfect location for this strip of BYOB restaurants.  So smart - why didn't I think of that?  My last stop in was for some sake before heading to Arami!  I got a milk something nigori sake, which was very good!  It was the last one in stock, so I took it as a sign - not disappointed.  I also got a plum one, which was sweet and yummy as well.  Both of these were under $20 bucks and complimented our sushi very well and gave us a nice buzz.  This is a great store and saves time if you're eating anywhere around them - Arami, Habana Libre, Butterfly, etc.  So go ahead and grab an extra bottle - they have a bunch to choose from!

48.description: The Noble Grape is everything a little neighborhood wine shop should be. Friendly service, more than amazing selection in all price ranges and great hours. They're open until 10pm during the week and Sundays and open until midnight on Friday and Saturday. I picked out a couple of really nice reds for dinner last night. Seriously, head here before your BYOB night out, or dinner parties. While I was shopping, they had a wine tasting in the back which was helpful in picking the perfect one. Now if only I could have a nice wine shop in my neighborhood.

44.description: Awesome store with a fantastic selection. The staff here are really nice and helpful without being in your face at all. Lots of great wines in the $15 dollar range and only a couple blocks away from Ruxbin, my favorite BYOB. They also have a very good beer selection. This store is set up really nice and I just love browsing because there are lots of wines I've never seen before. They are also open late and and have chilled bottles of almost everything available if you are on your way to dinner. In every way this place is pretty much perfect.

24.description: Local place to grab wine near BYOB restaurants. Wine tastings on Wednesdays and Fridays. Joined a "mailing list" to get points & no longer be carded AND they also sell beer and regular alcohol. I don't know much about wine. I like red wine, and honestly I judge them by how much I like their labels. I wander in. Its a small "local" feeling place with pallets of wine bottles arranged by price and country of origin. I normally wouldn't write a review about picking up wine, but I just moved in the area and after telling the guy that works there (that I was new to the area) he genuinely welcomed me to the neighborhood and you know what... that was my first "Welcome To The Neighborhood". It kind of made me want to make this place my regular spot to grab booze. Not to mention they're open until Midnight later in the week, which I am all about. The prices are fantastic, I said, "four people are coming over I have $40--- where are your coolest red wines that will allow all of us to drink?" I walked out with three bottles of really good wine... (with cool labels)I think I'm going to start saving the coolest bottles to back light and display above the kitchen cabinet. Yep.. I'm that guy now

7.description: Honestly I used to like this place until I had some self realization. First off if your looking for good wine at better prices go to Lush two stores over.Secondly, the owner who I am pretty sure is the big round guy with a beard and struggling head hair is a complete douche. I see him there all the time and he always seems annoyed that people were there. There were countless times where I was just waiting for some help and he's just drinking wine and bullshitting with friends. He just doesn't give a shit.I used to like the small wine/beer selection they offered and didn't mind paying the extra markup in price, but now I won't be going back because I feel like I am "in the way" when I am in his store.

49.description: Incredibly awesome shop.  Went to grab some wine to bring to a BYOB sushi joint around the corner.  I am a wino but hardly a connoisseur.  The staff was knowledgable and the selection was out of this world.  I wanted to try everything, but settled on an expensive pinot noir by Owen Roe and a moderately priced bottle of Botani.  The experience of the small wine shop was beyond my expectations.  I highly recommend.

40.description: Just moved a block away.  This could be dangerous for both my liver and my wallet.  I apologize to both wallet and liver in advance.Love this store.  Good beer selection.  Awesome wine selection with prices ranging from $10 - $100 if not more.  Wine tastings twice a week.  And the staff...very helpful and my kinda people.

53.description: I love this shop- they literally have never given me a bad bottle of wine- and trust me- I go there enough. Love the owners and the people who work there- very casual and friendly. Definately go here over Lush!

30.description: Slogan don't lie--the noble grape is an approachable wine shop. Rushed here before going to EL ideas for a bottle of white. I love drinking and I love wine... but I know nothing about white wine. The shop was empty when I walked in, but I think the guy behind the counter would be just as helpful if there were more. Instead of pointing me to a great bottle of white that he likes, or is popular in the store, he asked me what I liked and what my price range was. The exchange wasn't lengthy--but it got me a bottle that I really enjoyed! Putting your name in the database allows you to gain points for every purchase. I didn't quite pay attention to what you get since it'll take me a while to get to my 100th dollar purchase. If i lived closer, I'm sure I'll be all up on that.

46.description: The Noble Grape has a great selection of very reasonably priced beer & wine. We attended their wine and beer tasting event yesterday and some of the stuff they had was fantastic. The staff is very friendly and obviously know what they're talking about. Will definitely go back for more.

1.description: We were way to early for an appointment nearby that we popped into the wine shop for an after dinner drink of 'something'. The two guys there asked if we needed help, but saying no, we were just looking--they gave us some room to look slowly around the shop....without hounding us. we selected an unknown Marsala, the employee written description of it was what got us-among the description of the flavors, it said ' alcoholic full body attack ' no commas

55.description: "I'm going to Coast for sushi with the girls and I want something dry, bubbly and delicious.""Got it."And with that the very nice guy working at Noble Grape pointed out three suitable sparkling options, all under $15.  I'm thinking he either picked these choices for me because I look cheap or the prices are all that inexpensive.  Hmmm... I'm hoping for 'all that inexpensive,' but I digress.  Suffice to say that a decent bottle of wine at Noble Grape won't break the bank.  "Do you have anything cold?  Or one of those spinny machines that chills the bottle in a few minutes?""Nah... I don't have any of that fancy crap.  I have a refrigerator where I keep at least a few bottles of everything that is served chilled so we have it on hand."Well then!  Speedy, informed and polite service with a side of already chilled champagne?  Noble Grape, you are top notch!

9.description: Awesome beer selection and helpful employees. I know shit from shinola about wine, but it looks like they have a lot of it.

26.description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place. Small businesses are awesome because they treat you so well. When you walk in here, they greet you with a smile and walk over to see if they can help you. They don't scream at you and eye you like you are going to steal from them but genuinely try to connect and help their customers. That was shocking! The first time I walked into the store, I backed away like a scared animal. This was new territory to me and I wasn't sure if I walked into a cult meeting. A few seconds later I realized this is customer service. I have heard legends about it, but never really seen it in person.All joking aside, I love this place and I love knowing that they are a local business you can support. Their knowledge of wine is pretty awesome too! I had a dinner party and asked them for pairing suggestions, took notes and at the party, I started talking about the fruity notes and how you can taste a hint of the oak barrel in the wine. Everyone thought I was a Sommelier even though I can't tell the difference between the different wines, all I know is what tastes good to me. Please go here, please give them your money.

25.description: I live right down the street from NG, so it's come in handy on a lot of occasions.  I come here to get my fix of craft beer.   First off I'll say they are a lot friendlier here than Lush and much more approachable.  They have a good selection of craft beer and do a nice job of getting in a fair amount of the "big" releases.I'd give these guys 4 or 5 stars if it wasn't for their high prices.  I definitely pay  $1 or $2 more per bottle or per six pack than binny's or whole foods.  For example, I came in on Friday to get a six pack of some IPA's.  I saw the Zombie Dust from Three Floyds.......the register rang up $15.  I thought it was a mistake at first, but no....$15.   I know that I've only paid $9, $10 or maybe $11 for this in the past at a number of places in the city.   Pretty disappointed they jacked the price up on a beer that really isn't that hard to find.I'll come back, but will just be more selective on my purchases.

12.description: Not bad, this joint is. :) A ton of good and many off-the-beaten-path wine, liquor and beer selections, plus more. Came in with friends and left with a large beer by recommendation. I'll say I wasn't in love with the beer. I let the worker pick for me. Maybe he thought I would want a beer that is super sweet, and mine ended up being good but too syrupy for my taste. HOwever, they have a very good selection. I'd recommend it to anyone who needs a good pick or wants to venture to try something new.

59.description: Why I'm a fan:1. It's within walking distance from my place. (I reward convenience.)2. They are super friendly and not at all pretentious. (Loving wine does not mean you are better than me!)3. They are very helpful!  I suck at picking wines and they make me look good when I bring a bottle for a hostess. 4. I am a fan of their sparkling wines and champagnes.5. Their stock ranges from the pricey (but not too) to the 'affordable even for someone working at a non profit.' And have I mentioned that it's within walking distance?

21.description: I love this place. We've been here several time before and I have purchased good wine at all of the visits.  They great you with a complimentary wine taste which is always a catch - I almost always ended up buying the wine being advertised. Nice vibe, dog friendly place. Gotta love good people in your neighborhood.

17.description: Good prices, great selection, super helpful people.  Last night stopped by and they had a couple bottles open for tasting and the guy was really helpful explaining about the wines.They also have a decent selection of craft beers.The way the store is set up is I think a little more about form over function, but it is still pretty easy to find what you're looking for and it's a cool setup.shame on me for forgetting to check in until we were walking out - it seems they have a 10% discount for checking in on yelp!?  gonna cash in on that bad boy next time.

10.description: I find it awful funny that when I walk into another business, that does what I do, they're highly disrespectful. Like I'm not a spy, to spy on your prices, I'm here to buy things we don't have, and probably never will. Just because you had nothing in the price range that I wanted, because my shop sells those things as well, doesn't mean you can be rude and very disrespectful. They had things that I only saw at the Village Cellar, where I worked ages ago, which I liked. Hell, they even carried my favorite Zin. But they seriously just lost a customer. I am very hurt to be looked at as a spy or whatever, especially when I've purchased there before. There is no such thing as brand loyalty to me, so I'm very hurt that the guy there would talk to me in such a scolding way.

5.description: I frequent this place way more than I should, but it is a great neighborhood staple with a good selection and a rewards program (10% off for every $100 purchased).

3.description: I loved this place! Open till 10 at night, really friendly people offering great wine suggestions at reasonable prices. They also have quite the selection of spirits. If I lived in the neighborhood, this would be my local stop for tipple of all kinds.

35.description: I ventured into this store in need of some decently priced wine.  Immediately I was greeted and asked if I needed any help.  I was honest and said I needed 2 bottles of wine, trying to keep them around $10 each, chilled, white and if possible, with a twist off cap.  (This was for a last class celebration.  I forgot my bottle opener and didn't know if anyone else would bring one.)  There was no snobbery and the guy who helped me fulfilled all of my requests.  I ended up discovering a new type of wine from a small business I will happily support again.

19.description: They have an extremely helpful staff that ensures you leave with exactly what you are looking for. You can escape with a delicious bottle for $10 or break the bank and spend over $100. The selection is great and I will continue to walk down the street to this location.

28.description: Always great and there is something new to discover every time.  Love it.  Can't wait to see what the new expansion is going to bring to the table.

45.description: So, listen, this place is great.  I've had a couple friends that have worked here and I know for a fact that they know what they're talking about.  They have a lot of affordable and delicious wine and also a lot of awesome individual bottles of local beers and microbrews for sale.  The absolute ONLY reason they are getting 4 stars is because Lush is literally a block away and Lush has food.  I'm so sorry, Noble Grape - I will always come here to BYOB to Butterfly, but if I want to go to the same place for wine and snacking, I will have to go to Lush.

33.description: Some might say that it's a bad sign if everyone at the corner booze / wine shop knows you. I actually feel guilty that it took me so long to write a review. I like that they have the cheap wine table, and they could care less if you don't feel like dropping $20 on a bottle of wine. They'll show you the best $10 bottle they've got. But usually I buy beer here. They have a great selection of craft beers and their proximity to our apartment means that we never keep beer at the house. We just slip out the alley and turn the corner and there they are, also on the way to the many BYOB restaurants nearby.They do regular wine tastings and there's no pressure to buy anything. Good folks!One time we were asking for advice on a wine to go with our whitefish and their staff person said, "So you want a red?" And we were inclined to not ask advice again, but that person no longer works there. I'd stick to Alex for wine advice, but like I said, we usually just buy beer! And they have a frequent buyer thing so I get 10% off a lot.

43.description: If you're looking for some good wine you should stop by Noble Grape. I think you'll be surprised. The staff is friendly and willing to help you find something you'll love. The prices range is helpful and like many of my other reviewers have mentioned they have great hours. Asking questions here won't leave you feeling dumb in fact no snobby people here!

2.description: We had wine delivered from here when we were dining at Ruxbin. We called and asked for 2 bottles of pinot noir and gave a price range and they brought two wonderful bottles very quickly. This place is great!

18.description: I've been in here before with no complain but today put a bad taste in my mouth.  A single case of a highly sought after beer arrived this morning.  My friend calls to notify me of its arrival and let me know its limit 1 bottle per person, $6.  I was there within 15 minutes, and was so happy to find a bottle of this finally that I purchase some more beer from his store.  I didn't even notice at the time but I was charged $10 for the same beer.  That price is more than double what most stores were charging and it was increased suddenly after they realized the demand.  That is unacceptable business practice and I will not be visiting this store again.

41.description: A sweatier version of myself ran into The Noble Grape on a sweltering Sunday en route to Pitchfork in search of a flask.Why? Oh, you know why.(chickhazvodka)None of the nearby lower rent liquor stores stocked flasks and I feared the same here, but I desperately yearned to avoid crappy, overpriced festival beer for three straight days.No, they don't sell flasks... but I did purchase a cute, totally portable potable: A 375-ml bottle of Tito's Vodka which fit neatly and inconspicuously into my purse. Please don't tell!A quick look around the store told me I should return to give the thoughtful wine and craft beer collection a more proper peruse. And so I did, which resulted in a cool Cabernet buy. But bad girls (see above) get bad karma, and tonight I found that awesome bottle of Cab absentmindedly chilling in the fridge, probably zapped of all its big, juicy flavor.Ah, what could have been... guess this means I'll have to come back!

52.description: Love it!!!!Everything about The Noble Grape is excellent. I cannot wait (crossing fingers) for more locations, especially one in the West Loop!The atmosphere is warm and inviting, and the staff is extra knowledgable as well as friendly. I love their selection of Malbec, and the last one I just purchased will be opened tonight! The prices are very affordable as well.I have been to a few wine tastings, and I love them. The fact that they have samplings every Friday is great!!!The tastings themselves are very informative and I am always sipping on something new and tasty.I also love the email's about new and upcoming wines that are in season. Thanks for keeping me up to date.

50.description: We love this place! The owners and other staff are super knowledgeable about all of the wines in the store and are always available to help you make an informed choice. If you are interested in learning more about wines or just feel like a quick taste...every Wednesday and Friday, there are tastings. We went to one where wines from Italy were being sampled - we learned so much and we left with a few really great bottles. Also, sign up for their emails and learn of their featured wines. Also, they have a points system so for every bottle you buy; you earn points that allow you to save in the future! This has become our go-to spot for wine. Side note - they also have beer!

4.description: Wonderful selection of wine for several BYOB restaurants in the neighborhood.  Lots of Orin Swift selections if you're a fan.  We left with a bottle of Caymus.

6.description: As a neighbor, I suppose I'm biased, but I love coming in here. Every now and then, I buy a few bottles for myself and the fiancé, and sometimes when I'm on my way to meet friends at a BYOB, or before a party. Every time, the staff is helpful, never imposing - and even has advice about I which wine to try based on what kind of food will be served. It's easy to find a good bottle under 12, and if you need to impress someone, they have even more under 25. If you've chosen a white, they'll have a cold one from the fridge in the back.They have tastings frequently throughout the week, and are generous with their pours! I usually buy at least one that I've tasted, and I know that's the point, but hey, they buy some amazing stuff for their clients! I can't say enough good things about this friendly and unpretentious wine shop on my block.

22.description: Good prices, great selection, super helpful people.  Last night stopped by and they had a couple bottles open for tasting and the guy was really helpful explaining about the wines.They also have a decent selection of craft beers.The way the store is set up is I think a little more about form over function, but it is still pretty easy to find what you're looking for and it's a cool setup.shame on me for forgetting to check in until we were walking out - it seems they have a 10% discount for checking in on yelp!?  gonna cash in on that bad boy next time.

15.description: Cute shop with friendly staff. Dog friendly and have a good selection of wines and craft beers at reasonable prices. They have tastings on Wednesday and Friday too.The staff member was knowledgeable and picked out a wine that fit our taste buds. We left happy and will definitely come again.

57.description: Cute little wine shop. Great selection, really reasonable prices. Me and my husband picked up a nice Rioja to take to Habana Libre.It was only $12 and it was perfect. I love finding places where you can get good, cheap wine. The people who work here are also really nice. If I lived in this neighborhood I'd definitely be a regular.

20.description: I come here way too often for my wallet and liver's good, but I don't really care.The selection is awesome and the staff is always nice and extremely helpful.  I am an absolute idiot with wine and beer in the sense that if I like something I can't describe WHY I like it, other than it's good.  However, the staff here is able to narrow something down when I ask for a recommendation for something new and I almost always love it.  There's a number of BYOB places around here that running to the Noble Grape is absolutely perfect for.

36.description: This is a cute little mom and pop shop which offers deals to Yelpers who check-in, I love how knowledgable they were and the wines they offer [in addition to a few other alcoholic selections]. Most of their products have reasonable prices as well. It's worth checking out if you're Yelping in the area.

14.description: Local place to grab wine near BYOB restaurants. Wine tastings on Wednesdays and Fridays. Joined a "mailing list" to get points & no longer be carded AND they also sell beer and regular alcohol. I don't know much about wine. I like red wine, and honestly I judge them by how much I like their labels. I wander in. Its a small "local" feeling place with pallets of wine bottles arranged by price and country of origin. I normally wouldn't write a review about picking up wine, but I just moved in the area and after telling the guy that works there (that I was new to the area) he genuinely welcomed me to the neighborhood and you know what... that was my first "Welcome To The Neighborhood". It kind of made me want to make this place my regular spot to grab booze. Not to mention they're open until Midnight later in the week, which I am all about. The prices are fantastic, I said, "four people are coming over I have $40--- where are your coolest red wines that will allow all of us to drink?" I walked out with three bottles of really good wine... (with cool labels)I think I'm going to start saving the coolest bottles to back light and display above the kitchen cabinet. Yep.. I'm that guy now

58.description: Years ago when I went to Simply Thalia in the pedestrian walkway between the Red Line and Blue Line at Washington Street, I was left a bit nonplussed about the food, as it was painfully apparent that it was for a rather milder palate. I returned and had a flight of appetizers, which I had found to be much better than the watery curry dish I had the first time.Fast forward to 2013 and I visited Thalia Spice, the parent restaurant. (Pause ... still pausing)The service, much like at Simply Thalia, was inviting. They had lychee juice, so that was a good beverage option. The ginger chicken soup reminded me of tom yum gai (chicken). That was the highlight and a soup option I would gladly indulge during the cold months in Chicago. Where it all fell apart was with the Indian chicken makhani. Indian food is my favourite ethnic cuisine and that means I have a tendency to be more critical of said cuisine because I love it so much. As wonderful as the presentation was, the dish failed in terms of flavour. The average American may find the chicken makhani to be very appetizing. However, having a palate that is accustomed to a bloom of rich flavours, I cannot cosign that the dish would satisfy those who love spices.Thalia Spice seems to cover the gambit of Asian cuisines. That could be both good and bad. It's good from the standpoint that a patron can have one-stop options for their dining experience. It's bad from the standpoint that something gets compromised and shortcuts get introduced into the cooking at times. Not all Asian cuisines are all similar and those with trained palates like authenticity when it comes to their meals.

56.description: I appreciate having this place close to my work, but that's mostly because there really isn't anything close to my work. I liked Thalia Spice but overall, there isn't anything about it that's too memorable. The food was good, and the lunch deals are especially nice. But for not being too crowded, the service was extremely slow. I would expect that they are used to people being in and out pretty quick during the workday, but they didn't seem to pick up on that at all. There is a nice outdoor seating area that I'll try to take advantage of next time. I'd go back mostly because it's convenient, but not because it's one of my favorites.

29.description: Horrible on line ordering app.   No way to adjust order, needs to be fixed. VM when tried to call on order.   Ordering from butterfly... .

42.description: I got delivery from here and was not at all impressed.  It took 1 hour 15 minutes to arrive and the food wasn't great.  We split sushi and panang curry.  The sushi fish did not taste all the fresh.  The panang curry was too creamy and peanuty.

23.description: Fusion restaurants typically offer my favorite types of cuisine. However, Thalia Spice is Pan-asian and was a lot of ok tasting foods. They have a lot of food on the menu from Thailand, China, Japan, India, Philippines etc but none if it was really impressive. If you're going with a group of 6+ that have a wide range of tastes on their palate, I'd say its worth it.Service wasn't that stellar either. Note to all the service snobs out there - this is not the place for you. It wasn't busy and food and drinks seemed to take forever.

47.description: Went there this Friday. Food was really tasty and flavorful. They had half price wine bottles, which was an added perk.The -1 star is because the waiters kept rushing us to order since it was so close to closing time. The dim lighting makes it more romantic and perfect date night atmosphere. I can't wait to go back and try new dishes.

8.description: Two stars was a generous rating for this spot. Not sure if it was just because it was a Sunday night that I went here but the service at this place left a lot to be desired. It's a smaller place and there was only one waiter working but there were only 2 other tables. Had to wait 5+minutes to even get a menu at our table. Now onto the food. I got the YAYA noodles with chicken which were pretty decent however the dish had hot and cold spots. The veggies were cold and the noodles only warm at best. Not sure why that was. The two people I was with both had issues with the temperature of their dishes as well.Decided to order a sushi roll and got the Thalia roll. The roll was the only reason I didn't give this place a 1 star rating. The roll was a little too saucy for me but it had good flavor and tasted very fresh. I would consider going back to this spot but only if I was just ordering sushi.Good luck on trying this spot out.

31.description: We decided to try this place as it was recommended to us from a friend.First off, even though my Groupon was for 2 people, we were unable to use it because we were at a table of seven (for a Birthday party) and they did not allow split checks.  Who, in this day and age, does not allow split checks?!  I really don't understand why they could not have subtracted the value of the Groupon from the group check, and kept it moving from there, but ok whatever.Secondly, most of the alcoholic drinks were watered down.  We had to send 2 lychee martinis back and should have sent the 2 Thai-grias, their take on Sangria, back as well.Lastly, the food itself was just ok. I had the Rising Sun Maki roll and the Chef's Roast Duck.  Out of seven people, only one person thought their food (she ordered the spicy eggplant) was exceptional.  My maki roll was good, but my duck was just ok.  Out of the group we ordered the Thai Chicken Wings, Pad Thai, Thai Fried Rice, and the Filipino Adobo Chicken.  Everyone else also thought their food was just ok.  Not bad, but nothing special.  Overall, I feel that if the service had been better concerning the Groupon, it would have more than made up for the lackluster food and the watered down drinks.  So, we will go back as we have an unused Groupon and, hopefully it will be better.  For everyone else, I say if you are in the area and have a taste for Asian Fusion food, then stop by - but don't expect to be blown away.

34.description: A solid neighborhood option. 3.5 star food but they are friendly and remember your face. Great option for legit gluten free/celiac, very careful. I wouldn't go too far out of my way, so luckily I live 2 blocks away.

16.description: Years ago when I went to Simply Thalia in the pedestrian walkway between the Red Line and Blue Line at Washington Street, I was left a bit nonplussed about the food, as it was painfully apparent that it was for a rather milder palate. I returned and had a flight of appetizers, which I had found to be much better than the watery curry dish I had the first time.Fast forward to 2013 and I visited Thalia Spice, the parent restaurant. (Pause ... still pausing)The service, much like at Simply Thalia, was inviting. They had lychee juice, so that was a good beverage option. The ginger chicken soup reminded me of tom yum gai (chicken). That was the highlight and a soup option I would gladly indulge during the cold months in Chicago. Where it all fell apart was with the Indian chicken makhani. Indian food is my favourite ethnic cuisine and that means I have a tendency to be more critical of said cuisine because I love it so much. As wonderful as the presentation was, the dish failed in terms of flavour. The average American may find the chicken makhani to be very appetizing. However, having a palate that is accustomed to a bloom of rich flavours, I cannot cosign that the dish would satisfy those who love spices.Thalia Spice seems to cover the gambit of Asian cuisines. That could be both good and bad. It's good from the standpoint that a patron can have one-stop options for their dining experience. It's bad from the standpoint that something gets compromised and shortcuts get introduced into the cooking at times. Not all Asian cuisines are all similar and those with trained palates like authenticity when it comes to their meals.

13.description: This place is on the corner of our block and we go there occasionally for take out and very rarely for dine in. Our favorite is the duck curry, although the last time we ordered they said the new chef took it off the menu, but still gave it to us anyhow. I have never been disappointed with what I ordered, however the staff is mildly unfriendly. That doesn't bother me too much though because they always get my order right and it's reasonably priced. Recommend for good take out.

11.description: Went here after purchasing a Groupon. I actually live a few blocks away and have never been here before. I went in on a Sunday and it was pleasant, not to packed but just a hand full of people. The service was a little spotty but not bad. The food and drinks are good. This place is a little more expensive then a few other Thai places I frequent. The Crab Rangoon was the best part of our meal! Not sure that I will go out of my way to eat here but I will more than likely come back one day.

39.description: This is a great place for relatively inexpensive Thai food.  I always try to stop on here while I'm visiting Chicago.  Their asian spice fire fish is great, but very spicy.  Ask to have it medium hot instead of the way they make it.  For non-alcoholic drinks, try their fresh ginger ale.  Warning it's kinda on a random side street in an industrial looking area...cabbies sometimes miss it when they are driving.

37.description: faux Asian! decent tasting, but do not come here expecting anything authentic or remarkable. also, there is an up charge for gluten free!

0.description: Thalia Spice is a great place to enjoy all you can think of Asian Fusion Dishes. The drunk noodles and dragon roll sushi are the best! As well as the Pink Fire! Amazing!!!  Oh, highly recommend the red bean sticky rice dessert! - very refreshing.All the servers are great and nice to chat with! The decor of the restaurant is romantic and well-though, great place for a date and simply enjoying Asian Fusion, plus great cocktail!!

38.description: Love the ambiance and has more space than it appears.  Made reservations for 8:15 but didn't look like we needed themWe started with the crab rangoon (super fresh and recommend) and the coconut shrimp.Generally I love coconut shrimp. However this looks like a nest of coconut with shrimp somewhere buried inside so not an appetizer I would have again there.For a drink I had the Thalia-angria (like sangria). Again I love sangria and was stoked about this but it arrived with a little too much rum in it for me.  The sake variety was good and yummy (per friend).When I saw Rama on the menu I became very very excited! I haven't had it a long time and was really looking forward to the peanuty goodness! The sauce came out on the side (waitress gave an option).Upon mixing the sauce with the chicken and veggies it became a lil watery :(My friend ordered the river boat noodles which was beefy brothy goodness with noodles and such.  If you're into the soup type meal I recommend it!
