Yummy!It is rumored that the sushi here is amazing particularly the Kama sutra roll but we'll have to wait for next time as our bellies were full!

51.description: Nice cozy little place. There are two dining halls and has a nice decor to it. Dark, candle lit and very intimate. Had the Clay Pot Muscles, Malaysian Chicken bowl, their menu won't show it but they have some sushi too. The menu is larger than what's shown online. Nice special rolls.All the dishes were unique and tasted great. A bit pricey but a nice place to check out now and again. Their drinks are unique too.

27.description: This is a good spot to order for take-out for those living in the neighborhood, unless you have the patience for mediocre service. Decided to have dinner here on a Friday night. The restaurant's ambiance is cozy and intimate and the food is tasty. For an appetizer, I ordered the coconut shrimp which was a delicious way to start the meal! To try something new, I went for the Filipino Chicken Asado that did not disappoint me.Overall, the food is good but the service needs improvement.

32.description: This place is on the corner of our block and we go there occasionally for take out and very rarely for dine in. Our favorite is the duck curry, although the last time we ordered they said the new chef took it off the menu, but still gave it to us anyhow. I have never been disappointed with what I ordered, however the staff is mildly unfriendly. That doesn't bother me too much though because they always get my order right and it's reasonably priced. Recommend for good take out.

54.description: What a fabulous little spot! The bi-level dining room in front is cozy and hip, the outdoor seating is well-maintained, and the formal dining area on the side is super cute. Our servers were attentive without smothering us. I chatted up the bartender for about an hour after our lunch, which was a nice surprise. He gave me several useful recommendations for crisp white wines and tasty variations on gin cocktails. I watched him prepare some ginger ale from scratch for another customer, which looked amazing. I was hoping for a taste, but no such luck. I'll have to order it next time. As for the food, everyone's dish was fresh, delicious, and artfully presented. The portions were huge, so I would recommend splitting a dish unless you're hungry enough to gnaw on your foot. Can't wait to try some of the other menu items and hand-crafted cocktails!

48.description: I've ordered take-out from here a bunch of times and the food has always been excellent.  My girlfriend and I finally decided to dine in last night.  The bar area is on the smaller side, but with nice decor.  There is a dining room as well, but most of the patrons were in the bar area and we did not want to dine in silence.  For apps we ordered the spicy edamame, lettuce wraps and samosas.  The edamame was good and not too spicy, the lettuce wraps were small but tasty, and the samosas were some of the most flavorful I've ever had.My better half ordered the Yaya Noodles with chicken.  The dish was excellent and very light considering it was a noodle dish.  Thalia Spice loses a few points because they were out of my first choice of an entree, the Filipino adobo chicken, but the Indian Chicken Makhani was more than an adequate substitute.Finally, as an added bonus we learned they have drink specials every night, and stumbled into $5 lychee and mango (and a couple of other flavors I cannot remember) martinis on Thursdays.  A check-in on Yelp also earned me a buy 1 get 1 brunch voucher.Our only complaint was the table of loud, f-bomb dropping and obnoxious millennials next to us complaining about their jobs, co-workers and supervisors.  This is of course was no fault of the restaurant and they were more than happy to let us move tables before our food arrived.We will be back for great food and whatever the daily drink special is again.

44.description: We got the vegetarian egg rolls, Korean Kimchi mundos, volcano bisque soup, tofu pad thai and chicken fried rice, mango avocado sushi and some california rolls and to wash it down I had a thai ice coffee and later an appletini. Everything was pretty tasty but my favorite was definitely the mango avocado sushi.  I've never had that combination before and it was so good.  The ambiance was good and the prices were fair.  My friend introduced me to this place and I'm glad he did. I can't say I'll be here too often because I live out in the burbs but next time I have a date in the city I think this would be a good place to take her.

24.description: I enjoyed the dark, date like atmosphere.  The service is why I dropped a star.  The girls were very sweet, but less than attentive.  We sat for 10-15 minutes and no one took a drink order so we order our drinks and food together.  After we finished our meal we waited another 10-15 minutes until someone asked if we wanted our check.Besides the service, the food was fantastic.  We had Pad Thai with Tofu and Curry.  Both had great flavor.  I don't love overly spicy food, and the curry left just the right amount of spice after each bite, it was delicious. The pad thai was made with thinner rice noodles than we are used to, but it was a nice change up.Next time we are in the area, we would for sure return!

7.description: I ordered from here last night with a friend. It was OK but it gets 2 stars because of a major misstep.First of all, the Tom Yum soup was pretty good. It was watery but still had nice elements of citrus and spice. My friend enjoyed her green curry dish, too.I was excited for scallops on top of mango and avocado salad. I love all of those things! The scallops were tough to get down, so I left a lot of them uneaten. They were a bit dry and gummy, and the taste was very fishy. You'd think the salad would be better, perhaps able to disguise the scallops' taste. But no. The avocado was OK, but the tomatoes used in it (surprise guest...but I like tomatoes so it was OK) were a bit mealy. And the mango chunks themselves were slimy and well past their prime. The mango had acquired a bit of an "off" taste that was bad on its own, and extra bad when combined with the "off"-tasting scallops as well! I think you can do better re: Thai places in the city.

49.description: Although the service was a little off (kind of slow and fumbled...) I can't say that the food wasn't by any means. Started with the Crab Rangoon, very delish and fried just right. We had the Drunken Noodles and Green Curry, and have to say was some of the best green curry I've had in the city. Flavored perfectly with a generous portion of veggies and brown rice. Wine list is very decent, although it would be better as a BYOB. Decent bottle of white runs about $25 so you're not in too deep for a dinner for two. Side note, couldn't figure out what the place used to be -- but convinced it used to be a club in the early 2000's and definitely still has that vibe with the separated rooms which would make for a good club, but a bit of awkward seating arrangements.

40.description: Terrible place. Food was cold and disgusting.

53.description: I would definitely go back again! My friends and I had such a great time trying this restaurant. We all got the martini specials, apps, entrees, and dessert. All of the dishes were good, but I believe it was an eggplant entree that everyone agreed was exceptional.The service was pretty good. The server was very patient with all if our questions. However, I think there was some confusion with one of our entrees, and it wasn't what we thought we were getting. No matter- they handled it well and ended up not charging us for that. The restaurant was on the small side, but not too busy when we were there on a Thursday evening.

30.description: We went with a man who never tried sushi, maki or shashimi. We were able to get him to try all 3 ( not an easy task) but he is now a believer! Yum!

46.description: Food was very ok and nothing impressed us and very not healthy.Service was no good showed lack of a good management.The weird thing is I don't know why choose this place, for lunch(too expensive) for dinner, not good enough, for brunch the food is weird, location is tricky isolate in the middle of no where hard to park. If you want to bring a date don't come here. They will not be impressed.I saw a guy piss off by the service.You don't want to be embarrassed. Overall, not satisfied with this place. Will not be returning - think three times before visiting. Don't waste your time.

1.description: A group of eight friends decided to celebrate a birthday here. As we made reservations earlier in the day, we were quickly seated. We order a variety of appetizers: lobster chip ceviche, crab rangoon, saigon roll, coconut shrimp, and chicken satay. Out of the appetizers I tried, the saigon roll was nothing extraordinary but the crab rangoons were phenomenal. Without a doubt, the best crab rangoons I've ever had, and I've had a lot in my lifetime. Unfortunately, a potential bias to my lack of interest in the saigon roll was that it was not made to a restaurant-quality standard. Despite this mishap, the Thalia Spice team was very receptive and remedied the situation quickly. Not only did they negate the cost of that appetizer, they gave us two extra servings of the crab rangoons. We, again, ordered a variety of entrees including various sushi dishes, chicken pad thai, and the pad prix king. I primarily had the pad prix king, which is a tilapia dish. I was underwhelmed with this dish. The flavor profile was average. As a point of improvement, as a group, we mentioned multiple times through the night that we were celebrating a birthday. No acknowledgement of this was made by the team, such as notifying us about dessert specials or providing a surprise. Overall, our waiter was quick and attentive to the group's needs. Despite the mishap noted above, I'm more than willing to come back to explore the menu further. It was an enjoyable night out with friends.

55.description: You can certainly tell this place isn't what it used to be and I think their original chefs have now left. The service was terrible - they simply forgot about us. When we ordered the roti with the curry and requested tofu, they brought it with chicken and insisted it was tofu. when they finally agreed to take it to the kitchen to confirm, turns out it was indeed chicken. our noodles didn't seem to be prepared with the same attention to details as it used to be - it was more oily now and hastily prepared.

9.description: Fusion restaurants typically offer my favorite types of cuisine. However, Thalia Spice is Pan-asian and was a lot of ok tasting foods. They have a lot of food on the menu from Thailand, China, Japan, India, Philippines etc but none if it was really impressive. If you're going with a group of 6+ that have a wide range of tastes on their palate, I'd say its worth it.Service wasn't that stellar either. Note to all the service snobs out there - this is not the place for you. It wasn't busy and food and drinks seemed to take forever.

26.description: Got the green curry here and asked for it to be extra spicy, and surprisingly, it was decently spicy! It was a tad salty but pretty darn good. I had a Groupon deal so the price was also very reasonable.

25.description: Went here after purchasing a Groupon. I actually live a few blocks away and have never been here before. I went in on a Sunday and it was pleasant, not to packed but just a hand full of people. The service was a little spotty but not bad. The food and drinks are good. This place is a little more expensive then a few other Thai places I frequent. The Crab Rangoon was the best part of our meal! Not sure that I will go out of my way to eat here but I will more than likely come back one day.

12.description: We thoroughly enjoyed every item we got here and for the groupon price, we ordered a lot. The crab rangoon and salad wrap appetizers were tasty, though the salad wraps were challenging to eat and had way more salad than filling. I probably would skip them next time but did not regret having tried them.We ordered two rolls, the Thalia Roll, which was my favorite, and the Sweet Fuji, which was also delicious, and YaYa noodles, which I wanted to devour and am so thankful that they deliver because I will be ordering these as my go to weekend noodle. My only issue with this restaurant was the background noise, which was either water falling or oil frying, I couldn't figure out which, but it was loud and continuous and definitely took away from the relaxed ambiance of the place.The groupon was a groupon booking one and for whatever reason, the reservation and the groupon didn't go through, but they gave us the deal anyway and would work it out with groupon later. I'd almost steer you away from the groupon booking, because it has given me problems more than once- I much prefer the voucher groupons- but I'd hate to steer you away from trying this place out.

59.description: Used to be one of my favorite, local neighborhood spots but it has become extremely expensive for very ok food.  We often ordered in from this place and our last few orders have been pretty disgusting and overpriced.  Most of the food/curry's are watery with tons of oil skimming around.  Better places in the neighborhood to go too!

21.description: Don't believe in the hours that are posted on their website and menus. They wouldn't even accommodate some one who lives less than a block away from the restaurant 15 min before their closing.

17.description: Just finished our meal. Loved the variety of Asian dishes on the menu. We went mostly Thai tonight. Really liked the crab Rangoon and the roti canai bread - awesome. The green curry got even better as I ate it. The Lard Nar was strong as was the Pad Thai.

10.description: Love this place.  Great Thai food.  Good service good value.  I have never had a bad dish at this place.

5.description: Thalia Spice has great food. My friend and I sat outside in the summer and ordered two different pad thai dishes. The food has a lot of flavor and the service was good. I would definitely recommend the the pad see ew (might have spelled that wrong) but it was delicious!

3.description: Thalia's food is really good with great vegetarian selections.Food was delicious and the drinks were a surprisingly excellent. Waitstaff was a little slow to get us a table, but very sweet and accommodating. I look forward to my next visit. All in all a great experience!!!

35.description: I have lived in the neighborhood about 5 years now and I have been here many times since it is very convenient to me.  At first I thought it was "good" but it really has always been average and has never anything new and it is just very very average.  Strike 1.I have tried to become neighborly with them on several occasions and they just aren't interested whether you live in the neighborhood and can come their often or not.  Strike 2.So over the years I have stopped going to them frequently because they aren't that great but the other night I decided to try them one more time.  One of the things I got an appetizer on the menu (The Sea Sampler).  It was listed on the menu at $13.  When I got home I noticed it was listed on my receipt for $19.  When I went back to tell management, they showed it listed in their computer at $15.  They did give me my money back but offered no remorse, just confusion that it was listed as 3 different prices.  Exactly what they should have done but no more.Strike 3.

19.description: Gave this place one star because after waiting for an hour to get one of our entree's while everyone else got there food who came after house we got nothing but free dessert that we didn't even want. This place doesn't know how to take care of customers and how to serve food in a timely matter. We got my sushi dish first then our appetizer and then 45 minutes later my boyfriends green curry came out. You can get this food anywhere else in Chicago nothing special here.

28.description: This is BF's and my new neighborhood favorite. Great location...nice quiet street corner not far from the hectic river west/north neighborhoods. Everything we've tried has been fresh, delicious and comes out quickly. My usuals: crab rangoon- not a speck of grease and the sauce is a perfect pairing.Lettuce wraps- a nice change of pace for me, since I usually settle for a boring salad. Rising sun roll- right up my alley.VOLCANO SOUP!!! Changed my life!

45.description: First dine in experience was great. Food was very flavorful. Everything in my dish was fresh and high quality. I will definitely be back for more.

33.description: Great food, amazing service and atmosphere. The lunch specials are tasty and affordable.  Good selection.

43.description: Great place to eat. Very fresh food and unique dishes. Service was great too. Our favorite dish was the lobster chip ceviche. It is definitely a little out of the way but worth going to if you can get there. A fun date night place especially if you order tapas style.

2.description: Ordered takeout here. I had the pad Thai and coconut shrimp. They only give you two coconut shrimp, but they were big in size. The pad Thai lacked the peanut sauce and was very underwhelming. There are better Thai places to order from.

18.description: A regular at this place. Vegetarian specialities.For drinks don't miss out Jack Meets Thalia...made with fresh ginger. Really strong taste. Also try out the Asian beers. For apps, try the kimchi mondu (steamed veg dumplings)For Sushis, do check out Sweet Fuji, its veggie and delicious. For entrees, go for Pad Prix king tofu...best dish I ever had.

41.description: Got the pad Thai lunch special. Speed, cheerful service. Portion size was adequate but no leftovers. Food came out piping hot. Tasty. Wish I could have tried some of their drinks!

52.description: The ambiance is a little better than your average mass chain Asian restaurants but the food quality is mediocre at best. I had the buhn mi for lunch and there were several things that was disappointing. The bread it was on was the soft sub bread you would find at the local grocery stores deli department. The traditional Vietnamese BAHN mi is served on a French baguette. The Indian pork curry that it was stuffed with was over sauced and in between cold and hot. A very unsettling lukewarm where bacteria would find a nice home in. The vegetable dressings was inconsistent throughout the sandwich. One half had cilantro and the other didn't. I requested extra jalapeño and received 2 slices, and the daikon was overwhelming, to the point it was battling between the pork. All in all, I suggest the restaurant to pick an Asian cuisine and become an expert in that region before trying to tackle 7 different cultures.

50.description: We went there for NYE dinner. Only about half the place was full. The service was horrible. Our appetizers came before our drinks. The waiter forgot to write down our dinner order and had to remind him to write it down. We ordereded a mojito and they forgot to add the mint. We talked to the owner and he said he is aware of these issues. The food was pretty good but for the price i would rather go somewhere else.

4.description: I was here for a rather large group dinner. I liked that we were seated at a table in the bar area...almost felt like a private party. Being that we were with a large group, we ordered a variety of appetizers. Clay pot mussels, lobster chip ceviche, mango seared scallops, chicken satay, and some Laotian beef. Everything was pretty tasty, but none of those items would be the subject of my cravings! We washed down our appetizers with the sangria...which I really enjoyed! I loved the lychee in it...yum! :) For my main course, I ordered the Panang Curry. It comes with rice, but I substituted it w/ the naan. The menu calls it naan (Indian paratha), but it was more like Malaysian roti. I think they should clear that up on their menu...naan and paratha are two different types of breads. Sorry for that side note. Anywho, the curry was decent. Good amount of spice. My only gripe is that the "naan" that I ordered (mind you there is an upcharge) was so tiny for the massive amount of curry they served. My "naan" was finished in a few bites and is nowhere the size of a "real" naan bread. So, skip that upcharge and stick to the rice! We didn't order dessert. Service was decent. They forgot a couple of our friends' meals. That always annoys me and shouldn't be a mistake that is made in restaurants! And my "naan" came out about 10 minutes after my curry. Nice place to check out.

6.description: been here a few times as I lived close by. This is a small space but quite nicely laid out and decorated. They serve your standard thai and Asian food and carry some Japanese beers as well. I really liked the food and pricing was rather decent for the area as well.I did go there once when one of their cooks was out so it took them forever to make our dishes but later refunded us most of the money. definitively a nice place I would recommend if you live close by.

22.description: I ordered from here last night with a friend. It was OK but it gets 2 stars because of a major misstep.First of all, the Tom Yum soup was pretty good. It was watery but still had nice elements of citrus and spice. My friend enjoyed her green curry dish, too.I was excited for scallops on top of mango and avocado salad. I love all of those things! The scallops were tough to get down, so I left a lot of them uneaten. They were a bit dry and gummy, and the taste was very fishy. You'd think the salad would be better, perhaps able to disguise the scallops' taste. But no. The avocado was OK, but the tomatoes used in it (surprise guest...but I like tomatoes so it was OK) were a bit mealy. And the mango chunks themselves were slimy and well past their prime. The mango had acquired a bit of an "off" taste that was bad on its own, and extra bad when combined with the "off"-tasting scallops as well! I think you can do better re: Thai places in the city.

15.description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Chicago. The food is excellent. If you like sushi they have a large selection . The Vulcano soup is my favorite and for desert the best will be the mango sticky rice -yummy .Don't forget to tray some of the Martinis .

57.description: Food was quite good (although portions are smaller than expected), and the place is nice.  What troubled me today was service.  We went there for lunch and our waitress was a little weird.  I think she might be training, or just started today -- I don't like being judgmental to people who are just starting on a job.  I start new jobs over and over again and I know how it is.Still, It's always good to hear some feedback so we can improve our skills. This lady took a long time to bring our food (which I think was sitting at the kitchen for a while, once people who got there after us received their food first).  She was a bit lost and not really paying attention to us.  When I asked her if my food would be coming shortly, she had a puzzled face and just answered "I'm sure it will" and then there was this weird silence followed by me saying "well.. can you go check with the kitchen please?"  She wasn't well informed about the drink menu, kept just asking if we would like to order any beverages... ?Then we asked for the check while eating (we were in a hurry) and she never came to take the tab.. we ended up asking another server to bring the change.I don't really want to be a b***.  I respect all professionals in this industry because I've tried  working in this environment and failed miserably --  that was just NOT for me.  I know it's hard work and a lot to do.  I am not even saying that she should've acted this or that way, once again, this is just a feedback.  The restaurant has been there for a while and food is good.

20.description: Just finished our meal. Loved the variety of Asian dishes on the menu. We went mostly Thai tonight. Really liked the crab Rangoon and the roti canai bread - awesome. The green curry got even better as I ate it. The Lard Nar was strong as was the Pad Thai.

36.description: We thoroughly enjoyed every item we got here and for the groupon price, we ordered a lot. The crab rangoon and salad wrap appetizers were tasty, though the salad wraps were challenging to eat and had way more salad than filling. I probably would skip them next time but did not regret having tried them.We ordered two rolls, the Thalia Roll, which was my favorite, and the Sweet Fuji, which was also delicious, and YaYa noodles, which I wanted to devour and am so thankful that they deliver because I will be ordering these as my go to weekend noodle. My only issue with this restaurant was the background noise, which was either water falling or oil frying, I couldn't figure out which, but it was loud and continuous and definitely took away from the relaxed ambiance of the place.The groupon was a groupon booking one and for whatever reason, the reservation and the groupon didn't go through, but they gave us the deal anyway and would work it out with groupon later. I'd almost steer you away from the groupon booking, because it has given me problems more than once- I much prefer the voucher groupons- but I'd hate to steer you away from trying this place out.

14.description: Love the ambiance and has more space than it appears.  Made reservations for 8:15 but didn't look like we needed themWe started with the crab rangoon (super fresh and recommend) and the coconut shrimp.Generally I love coconut shrimp. However this looks like a nest of coconut with shrimp somewhere buried inside so not an appetizer I would have again there.For a drink I had the Thalia-angria (like sangria). Again I love sangria and was stoked about this but it arrived with a little too much rum in it for me.  The sake variety was good and yummy (per friend).When I saw Rama on the menu I became very very excited! I haven't had it a long time and was really looking forward to the peanuty goodness! The sauce came out on the side (waitress gave an option).Upon mixing the sauce with the chicken and veggies it became a lil watery :(My friend ordered the river boat noodles which was beefy brothy goodness with noodles and such.  If you're into the soup type meal I recommend it! Yummy!It is rumored that the sushi here is amazing particularly the Kama sutra roll but we'll have to wait for next time as our bellies were full!

12.description: Dinky parking lot, hard to get out once you are in. It's just a sandwich!

7.description: This location has parking making a convenient stop. I personally enjoy the quick delivery. They always get the order right, yay!! The delivery guy even smiles after an 8 flight walk up and a jumping dog!

19.description: yes glad they are in the hood, similar to others, good sandwiches and clean, no problems when I stopped in.

1.description: Where's my $12 sandwich?? it's been over 30 mins. #notfreakyfast #freakyslow

2.description: Come on guys, do you think you can try a little harder? I was a part of a group order today - as we tend to go with Jimmy John's 1-2x a month. And, they tend to be on point. Things do go wrong, some people are missing a cookie here or there or sides. It happens. But calling this place - or even using the corporate site to provide feedback is for naught. I guess I'm just done with this location. My order was missing two things, no big deal. I just wanted to let them know I didn't get the pickle or mustard packets. I seriously was not going to ask for a re-delivery. I called - all I got was serious, serious attitude that I was wrong. Woa buddy, calm down and brush that hipster biker beard of yours. So, when I order, I'm going to skip this Jimmy John's. I don't have time to attitude even if you're  one of the better sandwiches around.

9.description: The crew that works here...awesome.  Way cooler...and friendlier than the normal Jimmy J's "Hey-Hiii-Whats-UUUUpp" standard friendliness that we're all used to when we walk in a Jimmy Jay's.  There's just something about the way I'M greeted by this multicultural haven of sandwichdom every time I walk in.  Yeah, it's a sandwich you say.  I say, Good for you Steve Urkel, way to be smart...but YOU walked in here in the first place. Whether Bari's open or not, you stepped in here.  Embrace the love, the "unwich" and $1 day olds that they happily throw a poor man's way.  If you DO walk in here, be HERE not "I wanna be over there," and passive aggressively pout.  Don't be mad because you didn't get what you wanted first, you spoiled, eating out already idiot.The guys and mean-muggin' gals running the store, the sammich counter and to-go orders, they do work and they have fun doing it.  They have fun doing it for YOU.  Just ask 'em.So yeah, I like this place.  They like me and I did NOT receive any day olds in exchange for this review.  Or a pickle.  But I got a smile.

6.description: So 1st they forget the bacon on the Club Lu Lu. Then when the guy shows up withthe right sandwich, he inspects the one I'm giving back - I guess I get that. But seriously? You think I am lying about bacon? Then the replacement sandwich is on the wrong bread & has none of the extras I ordered. 2 sandwiches & they get both wrong. Will never order from this location again. Bad a sandwich place cannot get their sandwich right TWICE! ...........

18.description: Food is fine, but they never fail to screw up something in the order if you're having it delivered. Wrong flavour chips, a condiment missing (or an extra one,) whatever, they'll figure out someway to mess it up.  Delivery is great, the bikers are nice.  I just get the feeling the sandwich makers smoke waaaay too much weed.

10.description: I come here sometimes because it's the only quick option. The other reason is my mom likes JJ's, because the bread is softer than a traditional sub. She also loves salty foods, all you need to do is look up the sodium counts on these sandwiches and you'll see that they're up there. Some of them have more than a Big Mac.The atmosphere puts me on edge and makes me angry, I finally realized why the other day. For the rare times people choose to eat in you'll notice they're shouting at each other because the music is to damn loud. Now I know why the place is largely empty the music drives people out like those ultrasonic bug killers do, perhaps it's also driving out any bugs too. I need to plan better, I need to get my order into Bari first, pick it up then go and get my mom's. Life is too short, calories are too high, if you're going consume a large amount of calories and salt for that matter, it should at least taste good.

13.description: Ok, weird to be reviewing Jimmy John's, but it has a huge perk - open until 10:00 p.m.  Bari closes early, and I would never eat Jimmy John's during Bari hours, but its good to have close by for last minute eats.

16.description: i actually pick up from this JJ's all the time as it's the closest one to my house...today i was sick though and just felt like having it delivered...the store that normally delivers to my house closes at 9pm (and is oddly a mile further from the Ogden location), so I called the Ogden store to see if they could help me out...they "checked on it" but were not allowed to deliver to my location due to it being outside of their range...even thouhg it's literally 6 blocks from my house and much closer than the 9pm store...anyway, i still generally like the place, but due to the customer service i got from TIM, i'm tossin' out only 3 stars...thanks for the assistance and outside of the box management in my time of need...Tim.

17.description: I stop in here for a sandwich to go once or twice a week. I'll say calling these sandwiches "gourmet" is quite a stretch but they are good. The parking lot is small but I am grateful there is parking, period. Service is always very friendly and extremely fast. As in, there is a song on my car radio when I turn the car off. When I get back in my car with my lunch, the same song is still playing. And let the record show, today's song was "Here I Go Again" from Whitesnake, not "Paradise by the Dashboard Light" from Meat Loaf,  or, Heaven forbid, "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida" from Iron Butterfly.

15.description: Ok, let me start by saying I was ordering reluctantly because generally I think Jimmy John's product is low quality crap. (which accounts for two missing stars) Follow that with my bosses used to have them deliver quite frequently, and about 60% of the time something was screwed up.  But the thing to note is that this location has delivered to our address probably 100 times. It is four blocks away.So I'm starving, in a hurry, and locked to my computer.  Jimmy John's was the answer.  I place an order and about 5 minutes later (which is usually how long it used to take for them to deliver) he calls back and tells me that I am out of their delivery area.  we are 1639 Ferdinand, they stop at 1600.  Now.  They used to, but they don't now.  Despite the fact that the amount of time I was on the phone with them was far longer than it would have taken a rider to get back and forth. The geographically impaired manager even tried to give me the phone numbers of stores that were three and four times further away than this one. "Maybe they will deliver to you." So now I am hungry, and angry, and without a crappy sandwich.

0.description: This Jimmy John's is the best! GREAT SERVICE... VERY  polite ... And DELICIOUS! SHOUT OUT to Nate , he makes the best sandwiches, is very generous and makes you want to come back  Nayeli

5.description: Done with this chain for good. Turn down the fucking music. This ain't a nightclub. And no need to keep the air conditioning at 50 degrees. Enough is enough.

11.description: For a brief moment in time, my office was one block outside of the delivery zone for this location. It was a bummer. Every now and then, they'd let us slip through the cracks and allow delivery, with us tipping handsomely for the trouble. Now it appears we're back in the zone, and we still tip handsomely.Everyone who works here is really awesome. We've never had any trouble with incorrect orders, and our sandwiches arrive lightning fast, even when its rainy or temps are in the negative. We totally appreciate it, dudes. You're the best!

8.description: the whole point of ordering jimmy johns is to get a decent sandwich super fast.  this is the the second time where i have waited 45 minutes for delivery from this location. absolutely will not be ordering from this place again.

3.description: So I don't really need to review Jimmy John's from a food perspective, so consider this for the employees/delivery/parking lot.So the crew that works here is awesome, I've been in to order personally probably 4-5 times, and they are extremely friendly, attentive and fast with the order. I know that is to be expected, but they seem to really try to make sure you have the best experience possible. Smiling counts! :)I've also ordered delivery, and just like their commercials, its been freaky fast, so kudos there too.The one gripe is the Parking lot. It is a very small lot, and being connected to a starbucks brings a lot of traffic, and a lot of cars that don't move for hours since people chill out in there. I've gotten lucky with spots, but could see that being a major pain, if driving there, you may want to take any spot you see on the way there. This would usually be something to bring a review down from a 5, but I don't think there is really anything they can do, so they can keep the star.Overall, great Jimmy Johns to order in store or get delivered, you get exactly what you expect!

14.description: Why the hate? This place is great. I like it more than Bari deli a block down that everyone raves about. (bread here is softer).  Way better than subways. Just as good but different from potbellys so not comparable (potbellys is more toasted bread). Thoroughly enjoyed the Italian w hot peppers. Thoroughly enjoyed writing this review as well.

4.description: It's Jimmy John's. You've never been here before?Well as to this location, all in all, it's good.HOWEVER, for eating in, the music is always way too loud and 95% complete crap.It was so bad today I was inspired to come write this review!

12.description: I usually hate shopping for clothes, especially jeans. Probably because I'm more picky with my clothes that my food (which says a lot), so it normally takes me hours just to find a style I like and then i get really agitated once i realize they just dont fit my body type.So I tried Zipfit a couple years ago. I found a style I liked and they fitted me within 30 minutes. I still get compliments on the fidelity jeans i got then to this day.  Its weird you dont realize that something fits you well until someone who knows this stuff does it for you.I think the best part about this place is that since they have my size and measurements saved in my profile, I can just order new styles online at anytime, and its shipped straight to my door. Shipping is free and i have 30 days to return if my belly grew a bit and i forgot to tell them :)

7.description: Whether you love shopping or hate the sound of it, zipfit can help. The service was great. Liz was knowledgable and had a good selection of jeans. It was a simple and easy process to find what I was looking for without any hint of hard sell or commitment. I walked away with an order for jeans that were then expertly tailored to my specifications. When the jeans arrived, they were a little too long. Zipfit offered me the option of return or refunding the tailoring at my local place. I opted to do it locally to save time and was promptly credited the value to my account. In all, very happy with the service. I'm hopeful to see a greater selection soon, as I really do love the service and will buy more.

19.description: Great service!  The fit was great.  I can be sort of hard to fit based on my body shape, but ZipFit Denim nailed it.  Strangely the price was same as other stores, despite getting a more customized service.  Would recommend to others for sure - big time saver

1.description: I find it terribly difficult to make my way to a department store, let alone find something that fits me well. ZipFit alleviates both issues of efficiency and fit. I don't have to go into a store anymore and now when I order online, I know I'm getting the exact right pair of jeans, fitting the exact right way, no matter what.Also...their Chicago showroom is a fun space and environment is great. Not to mention they'll come to your office for a fitting if you're too busy to even get there!

2.description: ZipFit is the best! Liz and the team make the experience of getting high quality jeans and clothing simple and fun. For me, trying on clothes in the store was a painstaking process. ZipFit solves that problem by getting you measured and allowing you to then shop online with the confidence that everything will fit perfectly.Schedule a fitting with them or have them come to your office and take care of everyone at once, you definitely won't regret it!

9.description: There's nothing that is more American than entrepreneurship and denim. And when it's backed by an amazing team that does their job to a perfection and enjoy what they do, you get Zipfit. I usually despise shopping for jeans, trying on multiple pairs in 50 different stores until I find one I like. Zipfit has made me a believer in a new way: they use an algorithm (awesome) to take my pair I like and match it across all their top named brands for the perfect fit. And I never have to try on another pair again! You get free alterations, and when UPS messed up my shipment Zipfit sent me a free pair of socks. Who does that?! Best experience I've ever had buying denim. Every guy needs to experience the Zipfit way!

6.description: Great jeans and service. Buy once, never ever worry about hassle of shopping the right fit and size in the future.

18.description: I accidentally discovered ZipFit at it's original location.  I walked in skeptically, like I do in most stores with jeans, expecting to be disappointed...again.  It's pretty customary for me to find jeans I love just to realize I can't get my thighs or butt into them.  Alex, the young lady who helped me, confidently blew my mind.  By the time it was said and done, I'd bought three pair of jeans.  I've not looked back since - when I need jeans, I call on ZipFit.  Moreover, the ladies of ZipFit have gone out of there way (years later) to ensure my satisfaction with their product.  Their personal touch and responsiveness is what customer service is all about.  Trust me, you will not go wrong with ZipFit!

10.description: I made an appointment last Wednesday for the following day after work, showed up and was in and out in about 8 minutes flat.  It was great.  They ran my specs through their algorithm and I tried on 2 pairs of pants and the 2nd ones were the best jeans I've ever tried on.  They were at my house 2 days later.  My wife can't wait until they expand into women's jeans.

13.description: Not until I bought my first set of Fidelity Jeans did I ever have anyone compliment my jeans...or my butt! At 50-something, it's gotta be the jeans. You get what you pay for with ZipFit. The sizing is great. The team is professional and courteous and being able to order a new pair that fit so well online....priceless!

16.description: I am the LAST guy to go shopping for jeans.  I admit freely that fashion is not the first thing on my mind, if it is there at all.  So when I got introduced to ZipFit, I agreed to have a fitting just because it sounded like something that would make life a little easier and I didn't have to buy any jeans of course...  The ZipFit people are great and the fitting turned into some really nice jeans that really really fit!  Never thought of buying jeans as a fun experience, but it was and I will do it again and again with these guys.  Thanks for some great jeans (not to mention a very cool shirt...)!

17.description: Just got another perfect pair of jeans from ZipFit! I got my first pair about 2 years ago - their staff helped me find the jeans that looked great and fit perfect. Since then, I have just been able to order jeans online and they come sized custom and perfect!

15.description: I got fitted for a pair of jeans, and settled on Fidelity Caminos.  They fit my body perfectly and I really love the way my butt looks in them.  Seriously a perfect fit, I'd recommend them to anyone, regardless of body type.  They fitted me and a friend and we have two totally different builds and we both love the jeans they put us in!

0.description: Awesome experience   I went in wearing Levis and came out confident and very comfortable.  I really love the feel and cut of their clothing   The cool thing is that not only can ZipFit fit me in the store but they can fit me online anywhere.  I like that versatility   I am a tough size and they had it, along with lots of color optionsMy wife is happier too because she wanted me to upgrade  She says the lines of these jeans flatter me a lot more than cheap Levis  Well worth the price, and the experience was seamless (pun intended)

5.description: Another fashion gem in Chicago! I love the convenience Zipfit offers, not to mention their ability to match my style and build, for the best fitting jeans.  Liz is kind and incredibly knowledgable. The other great element is they keep all your dimensions on file so reordering can be done without a hassle.  I love not having to go back to a tailor every time I get a new pair of jeans.

11.description: They do an incredible job. Not only are my jeans fantastic but when I got a whole in the crotch (like I always do) they arranged a full replacement on the house and the jeans were returned to me perfectly hemmed. How could you not love such an  awesome business?!

8.description: I'm really difficult to size. I'm about as odd sized as they come.  Alex did great job of finding the brand and fit based on my feedback.  I learned my exact pant measurements, and now I have 2 go to brands and fits(that I never heard of, not a big fan of shopping) that are now my go to for denim: Paige Federals and Joe's Brixton.  Hecks yeah!  The denim is pricey, but what's the cost of having that go to pair of jeans that you look money in?

3.description: During a visit to Chicago we stopped in ZipFit Denim Store so my fiancé' could get fitted for a pair if jeans.  The staff were OUTSTANDING and really know their products.  It only took 10 minutes to be fitted with a pair of Agave jeans, which were the perfect fit.  Needless to say he now owns five pairs of these jeans, different colors of course, and will not wear any other brand of jeans.  We also have purchased underwear and socks that he loves.  Now that they are selling women's apparel, it is my turn to be fitted.I would highly recommend ZipFit.  You will never buy jeans anywhere else.

14.description: I've been using ZipFit for years now, and I'm happily satisfied with the quality of the jean recommendations; I always walk out of the store with an impressive pair on. Since I live in NC now, it's not a problem for ZipFit to deliver a tailored fit to my doorstep. For me the sign of a good fit is when I receive unsolicited compliments while I'm out; that's happened since I've been a ZipFit customer, so needless to say my ego is on steroids lately. These guys are awesome, check them out!

4.description: I hate shopping, really hate it.  I've ordered too many pants and clothes online, with mixed results and wasted money.  But with ZipFit, it doesn't feel like shopping.  I worked with Julianna Conenna.  She is delightful and has great taste.  I would hire her as my personal shopper if I could.  No sales pressure, whatsoever.  She just found pants that fit me.  She has great taste in shirts and sweaters too.  She met me after work during the week, which was really convenient.  No more on-line pants shopping for me.

3.description: What a great place to do stand up and hear up and coming comics.A place where you and your friends can hang out with laughter that is good for the soul. Meet unknown and known comics because you never know who may stop through to tell a joke.Don't meet me there beat me there.

1.description: Checked out the "Ha Ha Hotties: All female comedians" show last night. $12 a ticket and the show was approx 90 minutes with about 6 or 7 comedians. In the description of the show it says "Other comedy clubs might have a good female comedian or two, and a few might even have a looker in the line up. Ha Ha Hotties, however, is the best of the best, the funniest of the hottie-est. There's nothing bomb about these bombshells." I disagree a bit with this statement, at least the latter portion of it. The ladies which started the lineup were... Take one; young lady from Texas, her overall show was just hard to watch.  Imagine, in your seat gritting your teeth, trying to hold a half ass smile so that it alerts the comedian to change topic or save herself! Bad to terrible, with a few minute giggles. I'm glad there was a gradual transition of comedy from bad to fucking hilarious. A few comics which stood out; Stars: Kellye Howard was the closer, her routine was a fucking riot. (I'd seen her at the Comedysportz, also a great show. IF you get a chance check her out or find her You-tube clips. Chicago comedian) Couple other memorables which closed out the night, they announced her as Curve magazine's 7th funniest Lesbian comic, Tamale is her name, sexy and funny. Bailey Bing, Chinese American comedian that tackles comedy with that dry slow sarcasm that asks if your really paying attention. The in betweens were take it or leave it. If your friends caught some advertisements and are thinking it's a show of sexy comedians in sexy gear...   it's not.  It's different, different styles of comics and a pretty good time. The place itself.. we were seated in a small theater in the basement. Seats are so close to each other an average sized person in a jacket will be uncomfortable between people. (Which reminds me of the urinals in the Men's room. Obviously someone funny spaced those things. They have these metal dividers nailed into a tile wall with just enough space that a petite girl would be able to manage using. I'm a fat man that needs space damn it!) The walk down stairs is cold! The bar downstairs was closed and there wasn't a waiter. Drinks, I got two 312's and a Coke which ran $14 dollars!! Shit!, if you like crappy Bud light you can get a bucket for about the same cost and are allowed to bring it into the theater.If you join their mailing list you can score a Bo-Go coupon good till March 2009. At the very end they do a random drawing to pass out tix to future shows.  Most people are unaware that there is a free parking lot across the adjacent street.

2.description: So good!!   The EDGE is  a great mix of first timers, and killers.  No pretension, no comedy snobs, just a great place to fulfill your dream of doing stand up, or getting over your fear of  being in front of a crowd.  Its also a great mix of races and genders so you get all types of funny points of view.  They also sell beer which is always a good idea no matter where you go.  I wish it were still open!

5.description: The Chicago Center for Performing Arts has some really great shows.  We have attended a few that have been outstanding.  It's something different and fun to do.  However, the BYE BYE George (Bush) show was HORRIBLE!!!! The host came out and tried using insults on every race and ethnicity to make us laugh.  He had absolutely no talent.  If you are going to do a show about George Bush or politics in general, try to get your facts straight or your better off telling jokes off a laffy taffy wrapper, buddy.  AND one of the comedians who was suppose to be the headliner was reading her jokes from a piece of paper....and to twist the knife, she kept loosing her place on the paper.   I felt like I was in someone's basement in high school.The funniest part of the whole evening was when a young lady in the audience loudly proclaimed that she will never get those two hours of her life back.Save your

6.description: The shows on Friday and Saturday nights have recently been moved from 1030pm to 900pm. Thankyou!

7.description: The Edge is a great place for comedy!  The theme shows really keep the material fresh and audience members come knowing they will see new (and ORIGINAL) material.  My friends and I have had a great time ever since we began attending the shows last summer.  Highly recommended!!!

8.description: Went for the first time and after confusingly navigating to actually find the show we were pleasantly surprised.  Cheap tickets and acts that rival the insanely expensive Zanies.  Cheap bar, good comics, people should check it out.

0.description: The club is called "EDGE COMEDY CLUB" - if you don't like comedy go see Blue Man Group. Edge puts up the best comedians in Chicago. Good times. I'm glad we have a place that puts up regular stand up showcases.

4.description: I like open mic nights probably more than regular nights with a handful of "pro" comics. Maybe it's because I love variety, or I love watching people bomb. I've been to the Open Mic night when there have been 20-25 comics who show up. It's like a machine-gun of short sets, some funny, some abysmal... but always entertaining. A lot of people who do Lincoln Lodge, or Zany's or Fizz on Wednesdays come to CCPA to test out new jokes, which to me is more interesting than watching a polished routine.I've been to a few of the other shows... the last one was downstairs in this cool little theatre... that must be the cabaret... it's a great set-up with enough space for a good crowd, but still close enough to the comedian. Dave welcomes a lot of new talent in this town and does a good job of lining up themed shows, which is more than I could say for a few other bookers in town. Overall.. big-ups. I haven't been to ALL the clubs in town to compare, but I'm always guaranteed a good time when I go.

address: Chicago Center For the Performing Arts

1.description: Whatever you do, do not think of going to this place!  It smells musty and the clothes smell just as bad, like smoke. They all seem to be have dug out of basement of your grandmother who had poor taste in clothes and shoes.

0.description: I love a place with a good story and this places has tales to be told. Allow me to to spin you a yarn:I had the day off and walked in because I had never noticed this place before. I was greeted by a slightly frazzled women. She introduced herself to me as the lazy retailer. And through what turned into a 20 min convo I found out why. She basically has every college students dream. Though she works daily in the upstairs design firm, she closes the store to go to the beach, when the snow is too heavy or target is having a sale. Because I am lazy SOB i appreciate this haphazard schedule, but it would make shopping there in the summer difficult. In regards to the merchandise it is basically an estate sale. Legend has it her grandmother born 120 years ago collected these items and when the owner's grandmother and close friends died she because the master of 1,500 sq. ft of boxes of clothes, dishes, shoes, and jewelery. These are the items which stock the small store front. So the first reviewer is right it is your grandmother's clothes, but there is a certain charm in things that are truly vintage. The clothes weren't my speed or my size, but I feel in love with nearly every piece of jewelry laid out. You have to ask what the prices are, which can be annoying. But it is a good opportunity to haggle and bargain which are my favorite. Be warned they are not accepting credit at the moment, but plan on doing that fancy iphone app swipe thing soon. Go if you're around the area but call ahead!Happy thrifting!

58.description: Well, leave it up to Yelp to help me find yet another perfect spot.  Just moved back and picked them based on the Yelp reviews and it did not disappoint.  Called Friday and was able to squeeze in on Saturday.  Granted I am a guy and the difficulty of cutting my hair is pretty basic but Leslie did a great job.  It's awesome to nail it the first time and never look back.  Thank you Yelp and Leslie!  Awesome Sauce.FYI:  You can't tip on the Credit Card, bring some bills.

56.description: After an unfortunate incident wherein I found myself at an Airbnb apartment equipped with bachelor-esque amenities (bottle of Head & Shoulders + used bar of soap), my scalp was literally itching for a professional blowout and some TLC courtesy of a round brush and fierce scalp massage.I was able to make what essentially amounted to a walk-in appointment (I called an hour before closing) after searching for blowouts in Wicker Park on Yelp, and Shelly did me soooo right. She gave me a perfect blowout that resulted in four days' worth of compliments and inquiries into my hair colour, cut (of which I hadn't had either at Robert Jeffrey), probably thanks to the thorough washing and smoothing Shelly gave me. Once my hair was dry and sleeker than I'd seen in months, Shelly noticed I needed a bang trim so she gave me a quick one (my bangs have never looked better!) and then had the nerve to only ring me up for $35 for the whole shebang (I'm assuming $30 for the shoulder-length blowout and $5 for the trim). An absolute steal, and you can bet when I return to Chicago for summer music fests I'll be paying this salon another visit for a blowout!

29.description: Moving to Chicago was great... having to find a new "person" for my locks was not something I was looking forward to. Robert Jeffrey and Megan at the Wicker Park location were and continue to be equal to the task!! She is easy going, does exactly what you want or gives input depending on what mood you are in that day, effortless convo, and does a great job keeping my highlights and cut fancy fresh! Once I totally spaced and missed an appointment and they were so nice and understanding about it. They never push product on you either which is atypical for a salon of this caliber.  Always try to and do fit me in when I inevitably schedule last minute. Would recommend Megan and the salon to anyone!

42.description: Annie is the best! She's been cutting my hair for the two years I've lived in Chicago.  She carefully guided me as I grew out a super short cut. Amazingly, from pixie length to below the shoulders, my haircuts were always great. In complete earnestness, Annie is a magician. Actually she's a super smart, sweet professional who knows her stuff. Today she colored my hair for the first time and she did an amazing job. She's brilliant.

23.description: This place is fantastic... it always has been.  The previous salon at this location TRIO was wonderful and I wasn't sure how Robert Jeffrey would do once taking over.  They have surpassed my expectations and I will continuing getting my hair done here.  My favorite stylist is Christie - She is fantastic.  I have really thick, course ethnic hair and she has mastered cutting it.  She has given me both long-layered hair cuts and medium to short and always manages to make my hair look fabulous.  In addition I have come to find out what an amazing colorist Christie has become.  I went from hair jet black, over-processed hair, which I thought would have to be cut off or stripped.  Without stripping it or damaging it any further, Christie got me back to a light to medium brunette.  Absolutely love Christie and Robert Jefrey Hair.Let me add... the staff here is incrediably friendly and I have taken notice as to how well they work together.  This place get fives stars!

47.description: I couldn't have been more impressed. I had an appointment with Megan for a partial highlight and cut. Not only did the services exceed my expectations but she offered me useful advice about hair care throughout the appointment! The interior of the salon isn't any fancy but it gets the job done. Overall, fantastic experience!

8.description: Love Love Love KATE at Robert Jeffrey!!!I want to start out saying my hair is very important to me....so when it comes to choosing a stylist I am very Particular.  After having the same stylist for 8 years I decided to make a change due to budgetary reasons.  My hair was costing me $300 every 6 weeks....My friend referred me to Kate.  Since my friend had great hair, I decided to give her a try.My hair is 90% gray, wavy, extremely thick...and has been dyed dark brown for about 10+years.  In an effort to reduce the obvious gray re-growth we decided to give being  blonde a try.  The first day was time consuming.....She spent 7 hours on my hair  and 3 hours the second visit. It looks like I was always a natural blonde....Quite a feat.I would highly recommend Kate for Color, Color Correction, and a great haircut.

31.description: Annie is fantastic! She's one of the best stylists I've been to in my whole life. She does a phenomenal job on my hair, is never rushed, and takes time to get everything completely the way that I like it. I would highly, highly recommend her!

34.description: Love getting my hair cut by Meagan. She always listens to what I want and does a fantastic job with the actual cut. Plus, she gives a great shampoo...my favorite part of getting my hair cut. I am not usually very talkative during haircuts, mostly because I think it feels great and like to just relax during. Meagan doesn't make me feel uncomfortable in silences where some stylists just have to talk the entire time they are cutting your hair.I have referred my roomie and my boyfriend to Meagan. Go see her!

16.description: Elida is the absolute best!! Exceeds your  expectations every time!! The best stylist I've ever been to!

13.description: This was my first time here at RJ and I have a great experience. My stylist was Christie and she did an awesome job. She was super nice and gave me exactly what I asked for. I have pretty long hair so I typically just cut a few inches and re-layer but she took her time and made my hair look fab. The Bumble products they use are great. One that I wanted was out of stock and they took my number down to call me when it's back in. Really good customer service. I would definitely recommend and have already set my next appointment.

11.description: Elida is excellent at what she does! Always knows how to pick out the best and cutest ideas for you! I came in wanting a basic plain color and I left with a dark red balayage that I absolutely love! 100% happy with my visit and will be back again soon! Everyone go see Elida!!! :)

39.description: Awesome.  GREAT Men's haircut.  I've been to several salons in Bucktown and this is by far the best.

37.description: After a year of self-inflicted punk buzz cuts, I finally decided to grow my hair out.  A few months of this resulted in a truly horrific growing-out-your-hair-mullet, so I gave this salon a call.  They managed to fit me in for an appointment the same day, which was really niceMeagan was fantastic--I'm TERRIBLE at describing what I want done with my hair, but she took my vague "kinda short, but, like, shaped, and I guess a trim" and produced the cutest haircut I've had in years.  I was doing the check-myself-out-in-windows all the way home.  Well worth the money and right off the Blue Line--I'll be coming back!

0.description: I got a really great haircut here from Tori. Now, I have a history of mega tears when I don't like my hair. My husband gets nervous every time I make a hair appointment because of the probabillity of needing to comfort me afterwards. Let's just say he was super relieved to get my excited texts from Tori's chair.  I'm not proud, but I'm sharing to provide context....Anyways, I wanted a trim and some highlights. Trying to learn from past experiences, I showed Tori not only pics of what I was looking for, but also some examples of what I did NOT want. This seemed to be very helpful. I really love how my hair came out! She somehow managed to synthesize the various pictures and my probably confusing explanations to create the look I wanted. As a bonus, Tori is very sweet and personable. The price is reasonable. I will return.

38.description: First experience trying out a salon in Chicago after moving from LA & being reluctant to try a new place. Received a simple cut & style from Annie. What I liked most about this experience was how she gave me tips on how to style my hair throughout the process & did not push me to cut off more of my hair then I wanted to (as hairdressers often do). Love that they carry Moroccan Oil products. Extremely reasonable prices... they offer 20% off for your first visit!

51.description: Meagan cut and colored my hair for the three years that I lived in Chicago and she is amazing! I now live in San Francisco but still go to see her every time i'm in town, even if its just for a fabulous blow out before going out. This past weekend we took it to the next level and had Meagan do all of the hair for my sister's wedding. She did everything from updo's to sleek bobs and soft curls and everyone looked FABULOUS and loved their hair. Meagan is the bomb. End of story.

27.description: CJ is awesome, I've gone to him a few times. He always listens to what I would like and offers his own ideas as well. Great skills, and great conversation- thanks CJ!

32.description: I'm addicted to the Keratin treatments, and I saw online that they did the Keratin Express for $99, which is a fair, standard price.The stylist did an excellent job, and the staff was very professional and friendly.When I went to check out, I was told that it would be $125.  I was told that the website was "under construction" and was going to be under construction for the next month or so.  I picked up a price card in front of me and I didn't see that price anywhere either.  I asked the lady at the front desk how people are supposed to know the prices.  She simply repeated that the website is the best avenue, but will take up to a month to reflect accurate prices.  No where on the website does it say that it is in the process of being modified, and who knows how long it has been "under construction".  I hate that salons are so elusive with their prices, and one of the things that this place is known for is it's "fair" prices.I tipped the stylist, paid and left.  I was clearly frustrated.  I received a call shortly thereafter apologizing for the misinformation, and that they were going to honor the listed price.Conclusion:The services were great, but I think people should know to expect at least a 25% mark-up on prices listed on the website.  It may be a good idea to call and double-check the pricing within the "next month or so".

54.description: Simply put, Jen Levi is dream come true for gals with curly hair.

48.description: Meagan is the best stylist at Robert Jeffrey!  I see her for regular haircuts and she always does an amazing job.  Plus she is hilarious so we always have lots of fun when I'm there.  Naturally I asked her to do my hair for my wedding.  She told me on the big day that she had been practicing in her free time how to achieve updo perfection for me...I mean, that is above and beyond!  It turned out so perfect, exactly how I pictured my hair to look on my wedding day.  And she did a fabulous job on all the girls and mothers too.  I love Meagan, book an appointment with her today!

44.description: This one's for you CJ!I'm new to the city and was in desperate need of a trim.  After checking out other Yelp reviews for salons in the neighborhood I settled on Robert Jeffrey.  I left a VM on Tuesday morning and was called back that afternoon and got booked for the coming Saturday.  Kaitlyn (?) asked who I wanted to see but since the reviews for all the stylists were so great I told her I was indifferent so we booked for CJ.When I arrived I was immediately greeted by the two sweet ladies at the front desk who took my coat and made me a cup of coffee.  Just a couple minutes later CJ was ready for me and did his magic.  Like I said, I just needed a trim and told CJ as much.  I'm usually pretty carefree when it comes to my hair so I asked just that we keep as much length as possible.  CJ did not only that but made my hair look SO healthy and light.  Needless to say, I'm VERY happy with the experience and will definitely be going back.  The price was fair, the salon was clean, light and airy, and CJ was nice as could be.  Even got a few recommendations of other places in the neighborhood to check out.

24.description: The absolute worst haircut I've ever gotten. I made an appointment the evening before my appointment. They scheduled me for 11am even though they didn't actually open until noon. I ended up going in at noon and was very understanding and forgiving about the mix up. When I actually sat down for the haircut I was excited to try something new. I showed the stylist various photos of EXACTLY what I wanted. My hair was originally a little bit above the top of my waist. I asked her to please only cut it so it was touching my shoulders and still pretty long. A long bob is what I was essentially going for. 3-4 inches is at most what I expected. She instead cut about 6 inches, way above my shoulders. My hair now lays somewhere below my chin at my neck. I hated it as soon as she finished and I grow even more upset as the days go on. So, three days later and I'm still fuming. Perhaps others have good luck here. I will never return.

7.description: I saw Kate last week for the standard cut I request when I go to salons--cut the dead ends and trim my layers. While I know it's nothing crazy, I'm really happy with my cut. I thought I had just lost my natural wave over the past few years, but apparently I just hadn't been to see Kate. I've bounced all over salons since coming to the city a few years ago and have never returned to a stylist. However I'll definitely be returning to Kate in the future. Thank you for bringing back my natural waves!

49.description: Annie is the best colorist I've been to in the Chicago area at any price and experience level. My sensitive skin issues don't exist here.  Not sure what magic Annie puts in the color,  but it works.  For years I wanted my blonde to somehow mix with my very white gray.  No no no is all I heard until Annie.  Again, it is magic and the most complimented color I've had on this old head of mine.  Thank you Annie!

40.description: I am only writing this because I am moving out of state and can now let out the secret of how great this place is. After hating Art + Science (so pretentious) I have been coming here since it was Trio (RIP) and tried a number of the stylists that were alright before finding Jen, my hair soul mate, another jew from Boulder. Seriously, she's the cutest thing ever and has that enviable hipster look with just one too many mismatched accessories that somehow works that so very few can pull off. She's damn good at wavy hair, and I even trusted her to do bangs, which I never thought I would let anyone do. Always a perfect cut and love the Moroccan oil products they use. I will miss you guys!

53.description: I have been to RJ many times.  I have never had such great service as I have here!! Sandra Huizar does my hair and she is amazing! I used to get my hair done somewhere else and the girl COMPLETELY ruined my hair! Thank God Sandra caught me just in time.  My hair still needs more time, but because of Sandra, I can see such a difference! All the workers there are super friendly and I never feel uncomfortable there.  RJ always has beverages for you while getting your hair done, they always have smiles on their faces, and it is in a great friendly neighborhood.  Go to RJ to get your hair done! You will not regret it! Sandra is amazing and loves what she does, but you can tell her coworkers are the same!! Thanks Robert Jeffrey!!!!!! =)

30.description: Christy is great! I called in for an appointment last minute Saturday AM, and they were able to schedule me with herabout an hour later. She was professional, attentive and made it her top priority to give me a great cut and comfortable experience. I love my haircut, and will definitely go back to her.

46.description: This place was beyond wonderful. Meagan is a sweetheart who not only fixed the disaster that my hair was before, but also made it look really good for my face and for its texture. She only charged me half because she mainly cut the front part and also gave me samples to take home so my hair would stay pretty. I am so glad to have found an amazing, well-priced salon here in the neighborhood. What a lovely lady and a great experience.

1.description: I had not visited any salons, since moving to WP.  The ease of online booking, the positive reviews, the reasonable prices, and being opened on a Sunday is what brought me IN... What will bring me BACK is the great experience I had there! It had a calm atmosphere with staff that all seemed very friendly. Elida cut my hair, and she was wonderful! She asked questions to ensure I would get what I wanted, and gave honest feedback when I asked for her opinion. She was gentle through the entire process and easy to talk to. Not to mention, I left loving my hair! I definitely would recommend her!

55.description: Having come from five years of terrible men's haircuts by the haircuttery I thought that the only way to get a good haircut was to spend over $50.  Not so.  I get my hair cut by ANNIE every time and I've always been really happy with it.  Not only does she give great affordable haircuts but she is super friendly.  I never have a problem getting an appointment within a reasonable amount of time and I certainly will never have to look anywhere else for a haircut as long as I'm in the city.  This place has earned its five star rating.

9.description: Kristen is my TV hair superstar. She's been with me for over 5 years and has taken my hair to the next level.

26.description: I always compare looking for a hair stylist to looking for a boyfriend.  It is just as hard to find someone who understand your sense of style and aesthetic.  I am very glad to say that I have found MY stylist in Chicago.  Jen is an amazing hair stylist and colorist.  She listens and give you what you ask for (Tips: Bring a picture to show her what you are trying to achieve).  I have been going to her for 2 years, and I always get compliments for my hair.  I have thick dark Asian hair and I get highlights to give it more dimension.  My highlights are always artfully weaved in that gives my hair some "natural" dimension.  I have recommended friends of different ethnicity to give her a try and I always come back with positive feedback.  She is also an awesome person and give you really good product advice is you need anything.  I absolutely love everything she recommended me so far.

25.description: Mariah did an amazing job ! She is a fellow blonde and knows the deal w highlights ! No stripes no brassyness and gets close to the scalp w bleach. She made it look natural and gave great dimension. She was super chill and not awkward at all. Robert Jeffery salon is lucky to have her! Good job Mariah ! I'll be back -

12.description: Nicole, the friendly and considerate woman who answered the phone when I called and Elida the stylist who gave me my hair back really saved the day! I was having the worst day ever, it started with a terrible customer service experience at a different salon that brought me to tears and it ended with Elida at Robert Jeffrey  making me feel beautiful again. I had never been to this salon before but I'll be a regular now. I was scrambling hoping by some small chance some salon in the city would be able to get me in on very short notice to put in tape in hair extensions (no small task) so that I wouldn't have to spend a single day out in the world feeling bald and ugly and Elida agreed to see me within hours. I even showed up to the appt without the tape! And had to rush back home to get it making myself half an hour late (I was such a mess!) but Elida was nothing but kind and willing to help! She worked with me on everything and was very flexible, she gave me a great deal on the price and she did an EXCELLENT job in placing the extensions! I've had them in a couple times before and always hated how they never quite fell and layered like real hair, I have been to nice top salons and so I just figured this was how it had to be and that maybe my own very thin fine hair was to blame, but this is the first time I've felt that my hair actually looks perfectly layered in with the extensions, they don't look blunt and fake, Elida's placement was perfect! Thanks again to you and all the ladies there for their warm smiles and kindness, their willingness to help someone out and Elida's care and attention to detail and talent! You really saved my day! I highly recommend this salon and Elida for all hair extension needs!

59.description: I can't say enough about Jen Levi.  I recently moved to Chicago and Jen cuts both my hair and my partner's hair.  She's a pro with both of us and we have VERY different hair.  My hair is extremely curly and my partner has bone straight, thick hair.   I was very impressed with the entire experience with Jen but I think I was most impressed with her consultation.  She really took the time to ask me meaningful questions and really got to know my hair and the way it falls before she even looked at her scissors.  When she did start cutting, she used some great techniques that I had never seen before.  To all you curly-haired people out there -- I am now void of the random, straight-hair fly-aways!  We are so happy to have found Jen; we would follow her anywhere!

21.description: I used a Living Social Deal to try out Robert Jeffrey Hair Studio. I had a fabulous visit.  The staff was attentive and friendly.  My stylist Jaimee (sorry I'm misspelling his name) gave me a wonderful treatment, cut, and blow.  I've not had as good a cut in quite awhile.  Truly appreciate the full service! I hope to be back!

17.description: Went last week for a haircut. It was an "ok" experience. I don't particularly like my haircut but I don't hate it either. It's not exactly what I asked for but hair grows so, oh well. The shampoo-ing kind of felt like I was being baptized... half of my forehead was wet, water was dripping into my ears and down my neck. The woman doing it was a little rough and she seemed rushed. Not a relaxing experience like I've had at most salons. The thing that rubbed me the wrong was, and actually prompted me to write this review, was the front desk associate. She was texting on her phone in plain sight when I walked in (she was also doing this when I checked out) and didn't even put it away when I was right in front of her. She wasn't very warm or welcoming which wasn't ideal since it was my first time at the salon. The other thing I thought odd was that she didn't acknowledge that it was my first time and she didn't ask if I needed to schedule my next haircut or if I needed products. I didn't need to do either but just thought it was odd considering that's usually the protocol for salons and it made me feel like she just wanted me to pay and leave.All said and done, it wasn't terrible but I probably won't be back unless I'm in a bind because it's so close to my apartment.Bottom line: "Ok" experience but I'm not too excited about dropping ~$80 for an "ok" haircut and an "ok experience"

10.description: I got highlights and a trim by Megan today. She knew exactly what I wanted even though I was having difficulty describing what I was looking for. My hair looks great (she really brightened it up) and she's as sweet as can be. I'll definitely be back!

5.description: I am an Atlantan, who travels frequently for work, my hair stylist in ATL is out on Maternity Leave (how dare her have a child!) Le Sigh, my hair was in dire need of a color and cut. I visit Chicago frequently for work, and began reading yelp reviews for different salons. Robert Jeffrey Salon, Wicker Park, has tremendous yelp reviews, and so I went for it. Unfortunately, I had to schedule, re-schedule, & re-schedule AGAIN because of : Flu, Reroute of the plane, and a death in the family. Originally, I was supposed to see Kate, but as I was sitting on the Jumpseat of the plane heading to Chicago, I decided to give it a shot and see if I could be seen last minute. Kate was not available, but Tori was. I said sign me up! I was not sure what to expect, as Tori did not have any reviews on Yelp, but I may or may not have stalked her IG: Tori.RJ and I liked what I saw! So, I hopped my happy self on the blue line, and off I went to Wicker Park.Upon arrival, I was greeted in a friendly manner, the receptionist asked to hang my coat, and asked if I needed anything. I then met Tori, gave her a background of my hair, and let her consult me on what she thought. The consultation was great, she was friendly, matter-of-fact, and listened to what I wanted. I showed her a few pictures, that honestly, confused myself. I wanted dark, but with a bit of ombre, but not blonde, also not red, not to bronzey...the list went on and on. She went to the back, whipped up some color and bam it was PERFECT!Exactly what I wanted, EXACTLY. How is it that I have lived in ATL for 25years, and have not been able to find ONE stylist to do exactly what I want, but I on a whim, book an appointment in Wicker Park on a Monday Afternoon, and its perfect! My hair cut is simple, blunt, straight across, Lob.
