She nailed that too, Im not sure what is difficult for most stylist to understand when i say, "Keep it simple, keep it blunt, keep it a lob" But apparently a straight across haircut, is HARD. Tori Killed it, in a good way. I am ecstatic with my holiday hair, and WILL absolutely be coming back to see her. Just gives me an excuse to work in Chicago some more.5 stars! From one Tori, to another!

3.description: I'm very picky about my hair, and Danni did an excellent job. She understood my concerns (as silly as they are) and I ended up with very pretty, very healthy looking hair. I would recommend her to anyone that needs color done. My boyfriend had his hair cut by Tori, and she also did an amazing job. She also recommended a type of wax for his hair, which I thought was kind considering that we were completely clueless about what to use. There was also a super nice gentleman that shampooed my hair that educated me on how to take care of my length and what products to use. The salon was beautiful and everyone was helpful. I enjoyed my experience and will definitely return in the future. Thanks guys!

35.description: Another fantastic experience with Shelly. Good conversation, never being too pushy. She is always so good with helping me figure out what I want to do without pressuring me into something I don't want. She also is personal enough to remember what I liked from last time.Thanks for another fantastic visit!

19.description: Love getting my hair cut by Meagan. She always listens to what I want and does a fantastic job with the actual cut. Plus, she gives a great shampoo...my favorite part of getting my hair cut. I am not usually very talkative during haircuts, mostly because I think it feels great and like to just relax during. Meagan doesn't make me feel uncomfortable in silences where some stylists just have to talk the entire time they are cutting your hair.I have referred my roomie and my boyfriend to Meagan. Go see her!

28.description: SANDRA is a GODSEND! She's the best stylist and gives the best blowouts in the city. I'm very particular about blow outs because I feel like most stylists have no idea what they're doing (like you'll end up leaving with damp hair??)Any way, sandra has given me EXACTLY the cut i've wanted every time and I leave with a  big voluminous blow outI recommend her to all my friends and everyone has switched to her and visits her religiously.can't praise her enough! love!

45.description: -MEAGAN-Love this girl. I'm new to the area and have been to a couple of different salons but now I'm home.I came to Meagan for a color correction and she worked wonders. Best part? I told her how much I loathed how my hair hangs on to red and when the color application had a slight tinge of red she set me up to come back the next week to fix, no charge. I didn't even need to bring it up/ask. She is super easy to talk to and I felt very comfortable with her from the start. She is now my girl :)

33.description: appointment based on their excellent yelp reviews.   The receptionist was super nice.  And that is the only positive thing I can say.   The stylist never cane to greet me.  And after waiting 20 minutes AFTER my appointment - with nobody coming over to at least apologize for the wait - I decided to leave.   The stylist told the receptionist (still didn't come to meet a new customer) that it will be 2 minutes.  I left anyway as I figured it was a lie.    HORRENDOUS  first impression

43.description: First time going and last time. I was very unhappy with the hair color they use (Wella I believe). After a week of being there my grey hair was coming through already. The color seemed translucent over the grey roots if that makes sense. The person that did my hair did a good job but I think if you've been doing this for over 5 years you should know what color to use and appropriate processing time to completely cover pesky grey hair or maybe I just need to blame the quality of their hair coloring products.

2.description: At last! I've finally found my go-to salon! I had my hair cut and colored this week by Kristen and it looks so great. The cut was just what I was wanting! It was a drastic change from my long hair to a much shorter cut (right at my shoulders), and it was executed so well. I know who I'll be seeing for my future hair cuts. This was my first time ever coloring my hair and I was slightly nervous for the change, but Kristen made it look so natural! After the the first day with my new color, I wanted to go a little more drastic so Kristen had me come back two days later just to add a few more lighter pieces. It made all the difference in the world and I'm 100% satisfied! I couldn't be any happier with the job and service that I was provided here. I would strongly recommend to anyone looking for a new hair salon!

18.description: I used a Living Social Deal to try out Robert Jeffrey Hair Studio. I had a fabulous visit.  The staff was attentive and friendly.  My stylist Jaimee (sorry I'm misspelling his name) gave me a wonderful treatment, cut, and blow.  I've not had as good a cut in quite awhile.  Truly appreciate the full service! I hope to be back!

41.description: What an awesome salon!  I was impressed right when I walked it with how clean and open it was.  Not to mention it was very busy and everyone in there was smiling and laughing which made the energy in the place so fun! I got my eyebrows waxed by Meagan and that girl knows what she is doing!  Not only did time go by so fast because talking to Meagan is like talking to a long lost best friend, but I have never seen my eyebrows look so good.  Even my roommate noticed them when I got home!  I've also met some other stylist out on the town before and everyone is super friendly and welcoming.  If you want a salon that not only knows what they are doing, but also knows how to treat people try this place out!  You won't be disappointed!

52.description: Shelly is awesome! Normally I hate going to new hair salons because I am very picky with who does my hair due to horrible experiences in the past. I decided to try something new because although my previous hair stylist was nice and good, I just felt a little awkward going there because I wasn't comfortable in the atmosphere. My friend referred me and I also checked out the reviews on yelp for this location.As soon as I walked in I was greeted by Shelly and she also shook my hand (which I think that's a huge plus --- very professional) AND she offered me something to drink. The entire experience was awesome. I felt very comfortable and at ease to ask questions. I did not have to repeat myself as to what I wanted done. She was quick, efficient, and did a wonderful job. My hair turned out amazing! The color fit me perfectly, It wasn't too light or too dark and it blended very well. I am very pleased to have met Shelly as my new official hair stylist :)

50.description: This is probably the best hair cut I have ever had. Thanks, CJ!

4.description: I have now been getting my hair cut (never tried coloring) by Sandra at Robert Jeffrey for four years, and I couldn't be more pleased. She's easy and pleasant to chat with while cutting my hair, and I always leave feeling beautiful. Definitely recommend.

6.description: I have been going to this salon for about 6 months after a referral from a friend to go and see Kate. And she has never disappointed! I have had color twice and 3-4 haircuts, I have loved her haircuts but I am obsessed with her color!   I have been getting blonde highlights for about 15 years and I don't think that my color has ever looked better.  It has such shine and the ombré looks great for all the months between highlights!  She's even encouraged me to step away from my hot rollers and try some different styling methods.  Love Kate and would definitely recommend her to anyone!

22.description: Annie has been my stylist and colorist for 2+ years now. She is seriously talented with short and long hair, and is always ready to do something new to satiate my ever-changing hair preferences. Color-wise, we have done everything from bleach and tones to creative colors (pink and copper last summer) to strawberry blonde. Cut-wise, she always pulls off exactly what I want, even when I come in with only vague ideas. She can even do lines/designs with clippers! She is also just a genuinely wonderful person and a pleasure to be around.

15.description: So so happy with this salon!! I've had my hair done by Elida each time I've come and it's been amazing. She does both my color and cut and I have been extremely happy with it. Even if I don't know how I want it cut she always gives me her opinion. She doesn't push you to buy anything either which is nice. If your looking for a salon that isn't to overly priced with good customer service and good stylists then definitely check out this salon! I recommend Elida, she's one of a kind :)

57.description: I just want to say that Shelly Wilson is awesome at updo's!  Actually she rocks at color and haircutting too.

20.description: The stylist didn't say more than five words to me throughout a two hour highlight and cut and while the color was mediocre, I had to ask her to stop cutting because she was using blunt scissors. Definitely not worth the premium prices.

36.description: When I first moved to Chicago a few years back, I was looking for a great place to get a men's haircut and had no clue where to turn.  Fortunately, I lucked out and came across Jen after reading other yelp reviews.  She gets it right every time, and even when she transitioned from the lakeview location to wicker park, I didn't hesitate for a moment on whether I would travel every month to see her specifically. This is a top notch establishment in every way, and if you're looking for a new place to go for a men's haircut you have no need to look further.

14.description: The absolute worst haircut I've ever gotten. I made an appointment the evening before my appointment. They scheduled me for 11am even though they didn't actually open until noon. I ended up going in at noon and was very understanding and forgiving about the mix up. When I actually sat down for the haircut I was excited to try something new. I showed the stylist various photos of EXACTLY what I wanted. My hair was originally a little bit above the top of my waist. I asked her to please only cut it so it was touching my shoulders and still pretty long. A long bob is what I was essentially going for. 3-4 inches is at most what I expected. She instead cut about 6 inches, way above my shoulders. My hair now lays somewhere below my chin at my neck. I hated it as soon as she finished and I grow even more upset as the days go on. So, three days later and I'm still fuming. Perhaps others have good luck here. I will never return.

1.description: DO NOT ARRANGE A PICK UP DONATION WITH THIS PLACE!i am livid right now! I arranged a pick-up two weeks in advance for several items including a sectional sofa, washer, and dryer among several other things. Like the reviewer above, I waited and waited only to have them not show up and not call. I call to see what happened and they tell me their truck got full so they didn't pick up my stuff.Um, what?!?!?!!!?? You knew what you were picking up for the day why didn't you prepare accordingly. Further, why did I have to call YOU to find this out.  Then these fools tell me they can pick it up on the 1st. But there's just one problem, I NEED TO BE OUT OF MY CURRENT PLACE ON THE 30TH! I have absolutely zero room for all the items I'm donating at my new place and no time to sell. Disgusting. I'm trying to give away items (nice items not junk) and this is how I'm treated. Ugh!

2.description: I schedule a donation pick-up for an estate.  The potential pick-up time was to between 8am - 4pm on the given day.  On the day of pick-up I waited and waited and waited.  I called around 12:30pm to validate  the appointment.  4pm arrived and no one ever came.  No one called.  Nada.These people are completely unreliable.  I will never do business with them again.  They are completely unprofessional.

0.description: Salvation Army will never ever receive a penny from me!!I have been waiting since 8AM for a couch pick up and no one showed up. I called several times and each time I was cut off by the dispatcher and transferred to a voicemail. After the 4th call and bitching at the dispatcher I finally got connected to a human being. And he tells me the driver started from the wrong side and there are 4 people ahead of me and can't guarantee they will pick up the couch.What kind of business are they running?! No accountability and horrible customer service. I will donate to goodwill, screw Salvation Army.

3.description: Professional, personable, and the best lashes! Yetta consistently does a fantastic job that will have you/your lashes looking gorgeous. I've gotten so many comments and compliments on my lashes. Parking is free, scheduling appointments is quick & easy, and she does a quick and phenomenal job.

1.description: Go to Yetta! She is the best, it was my first time getting legit  eyelash extensions, (not including the places you go to get glue and lashes on your skin!) and I couldn't be anymore pleased with my now 2 experiences here. Yetta made me feel comfortable and didn't pressure me into getting something I didn't want or need, her prices are definitely reasonable for the quality you're getting. I am the first person to complain when it comes to my eyes if something doesn't feel right and I was surprised how that was not an issue here from your appointment until it's time for a refill I haven't had any issues. The new location is easy to get to and didn't have any problems finding parking. I will definitely be a regular here!

2.description: Yetta is the gem - I've had lash extension in a number of places and this is one that I keep returning to. Although I've always loved the results, Yetta is one that I would recommend because her extension lasts better and does not destroy my eyelash (i.e. when the extension falls off, they don't bring my lashes with them!). Her prices are very reasonable, and is easy to book via styleseat.

9.description: "Yetta is so friendly!!!! The bonus is she makes my eyelashes look fabulous!! So natural too! My closest friends can't tell what I've had done yet notice there's something different about me! LOL! When I do finally say what it is they can't believe those aren't my lashes. Yetta you are the best! So relaxing too! I always fall asleep while she's doing my lashes. "

10.description: I came here right when it opened after going else where and received a terrible eye infection. I loved the way they looked for the first couple of hours that I decided maybe it was the place and not the actual eyelash extensions. When I met Yetta she had this vibe about her that makes you feel so loved in her presence and I love that she's in charge of everything and there's no talking to a bunch of people that all tell you different things! She sticks to her word and I am always more than pleased walking out of my appointment!

4.description: Love this place! If you want high quality professional grade lash extensions with the service to match, this is where you go. Yetta is always accommodating to the personal needs of her customers. I've been going here for almost a year and always walk out with an amazing customized set of lashes. I've tried out a couple of other places including Chicago lashes and they don't event come close to comparing. She takes great care to give you the look you want every time, customizing it to your standards. Try doing that at a salon and they'll just wedge you into the "Kim k" or "natural" look category. Nothing exciting about that! If you're reading these reviews and are trying to decide which lash salon to go to, you've found the answer at Lash Luxe!

6.description: Loved Yetta! So friendly and easy to talk too. Answers all your questions beforehand and even during. Super knowledgeable, you can tell she really loves what she does.  Will be back!

12.description: The place must be phenomenal, I'll say it plain and simple I think my better half is beautiful naturally, however I know when she's all smiles and giggles after one of her many "errands" it's generally because she is more than pleased by putting one over on me.I kept telling her how amazing she looked and she finally spilled it. She went on ranting and raving that she had never had better work done and she knows her stuff when it comes to beauty. I know she would have never told me about the lashes since she knows I am not a fan of anything that looks too artificial however since they look amazing and natural  I'm signing her up as a lifetime client. Thanks Lash Luxe , nothing like a woman beaming because she looks beautiful.

5.description: As a male, walking in a women's salon can be intimidating, but Yetta made me feel super welcomed and relaxed. She explained the process, and what would fit me better in order to no look  "drag queen" like. Lol! :) I laid face up, and the hour just flew by talking to Yetta non stop. She is so approachable, and personable. Trust me, you will walk out with not only anew lash stylist, if that is even a term used, but a new friend! :)

13.description: I agree with all of the compliments for Yetta.  She is professional, experienced, and pleasant.  Her prices are reasonable and she does quality work.  I visited her after having a poor quality job done elsewhere.

11.description: I really never make reviews , but here I go! I was soooooo happy with my lashes! She was very professional & takes her time setting the individual lashes. The outcome was so beautiful and I was extremely pleased! I had a bad experience elsewhere, thankfully the technician was able to remove the previous lashes, she even gave them a nice protein treatment! I came back a month after and she set some wonderful good quality lashes just in time for my birthday! Highly recommended! I will be coming back.

8.description: One word : Professional ! It's so hard to find a business owner that up holds that quality on top of excellent service. I'm beyond picky when it comes to sanitation , especially dealing with something as sensitive as my eyes . Cleanliness is everything, and this place is immaculate ! Not only did I feel comfortable , I actually felt that Yetta listened to what I wanted. I hate the strip lash bulky look, and I definitely didn't get that. All natural individual lashes  ! And I have gotten so many compliments from everyone . I will never go back to any lash salon/tech ever . It's all about that personal touch that I received , can't get that anywhere else .

0.description: I am so happy that I found LashLuxe and Yetta here on Yelp!A few weeks ago I was in Miami and treated myself to a full-set of lash extensions.Of course when I came back to Chicago I had to find a place that would do the full-ins.  I expected to have to go Downtown or Lincoln Park, but I found Lash Luxe in the Irving Park/Milwaukee area, also known as "6 Corners." Yetta's reviews were great, and the location is so easy to get to, and there is lots of street/metered parking. All of the stars were in alignment, so I thought I'd give it a try!!I have my new lashes, Yetta is a doll and a real pro at eyelashes, and the shop is lovely!! Her area is very comfortable, and we chatted through the whole appointment as though we'd known each other forever!! And I have lashes!!I wake up, and I'm already made-up with these long, luxurious lashes in place.I made my next appointment before I left.Lashes, a nearby Starbucks, a few blocks from the Kennedy, a fun appointment, and easy parking???You can't go wrong!!

7.description: Yetta is awesome! I have gone to her a few times now and she is the best. She is very knowledgeable and answers all of your questions. Making you very comfortable with the process. She does a fantastic job with the application of the lashes, highly recommend!

28.description: I saw this listed as one of the top 10 up and coming  new restaurants in Chicago in a Chicago Magazine article today. I read the reviews here prior to going. This is place is in my son's neighborhood and we happened to be up in Chicago today. We absolutely LOVED everything about this place. The cocktail I had was amazing ~in fact I had two !! Our server {a lovely young lady} who was very knowledgeable about everything on the menu was fantastic ! The fried green tomatoes were very good, as well as the calamari.....Our entree's were amazing ...Salmon was delicious and worth the money.....P.S. Robyn M.....that is the going rate for a entree in a white tablecloth restaurant.....you dear should stay home and cook if you don't like the cost of a nice restaurant. This is an upscale restaurant, the interior is amazing, and clean. We really liked the owner coming to our table and asking how everything was.....she cares !!! She even gave us a taste of a specialty drink they make. The Jazz band that came in and played was excellent.We will defintely  be back !! Oh and the Gumbo and Bread Pudding are WOW, WOW, WOW !!! Oh and Robyn M. this is my first review {but I go out ALOT and prefer the better restaurants in Chicago} but once I read your review earlier and went and tasted the amazing food myself I felt I had to express my viewpoint to counteract your unfair and rude review.

1.description: HORRIBLE customer service at this place! My friends and I PLANNED a birthday dinner for a good friend. Not only was our table not ready, but the owner acted like she couldn't accommodate our party (but wait.... We had RESERVATIONS!!!!). She talked rudely to us, her poor waitress, and acted like a total fool in front of all the other customers. Needless to say... We WILL NOT BE COMING BACK!!!Oh yeah, and chef???? Whoever you are, when you get tired of working for a B&@$! like her..... I know a lot of other better places that I will recommend!!! And.... We LEFT and had a WONDERFUL dinner at another place!! Hey Dawn.... God doesn't like ugly!

9.description: So sad that I have to write this review for an establishment I have been wanting to visit for a year now.  My birthday celebration was supposed to be here my friends organized it and made reservations.  However the owner/manager Dawn was so rude that we ended up at the restaurant next door Bella Notte.  Dawn was so inconsiderate, rude did all of this in front of us and the entire restaurant.  She did not apologize for her behavior and could care less if we left.  She almost ruined my birthday but thank God for Ramon and Belle Notte for accommodating us at the last minute.It is a shame that customer service does not exist in some establishments.  I will never ever support this restaurant and would not recommend it to anyone!!!

29.description: M Vie is pretty beautiful on the outside and inside.  However, they are new and the décor is still 'getting there' and there is one aspect of the restaurant that I didn't love - no windows in the entire restaurant.  Once you enter, you really are closed off from the outside  world, which I guess can be good if you want privacy.  But now, the most important thing: the food!  We liked every dish we ordered - the Gumbo was AMAZING - hearty, spicy, full of shrimp and sausage.  It was so  good and so filling I almost didn't need to order anything else.  We also had the fried oysters, which I never had before and really loved too.  The salmon was good but a little bit on the dry side. Mashed potatoes and mushrooms were perfect. No room for dessert.  Great service, a beautiful bar and nice clean bathrooms made it a winner for us and we would go back, but most likely would do takeout, especially on that ridiculous Gumbo on a cold night!

23.description: Fantastic everything - food, service, live music, ambiance! I took my husband & friend, a well traveled VIP, to M Vie.  We were very impressed! If you want to get away from the touristy crowd this is the place for you.  It's sophisticated yet modern, upscale yet relaxed. The restaurant is very small, giving it an exclusive vibe.  It doesn't even have a sign, you just have to know to go behind the wooden door.  Once you're inside, it's all the way live. We went on a Tuesday night when there was the live band, playing jazz and old school R&B.  we reminisced and had such a good time we didn't want to leave.  The food was delicious. I took photos of everyone's dish and posted them here.This is also a great place to have an intimate party or reception on other nights of the week when it's less crowded. I have my birthday party here on I think Friday or Saturday and it was perfect because everyone was able to come sit and enjoy.

5.description: During my first visit to MVie, I was impressed with the cozy space, and the owner who worked right alongside her staff.  I was there for a friend's birthday and had a great time, until the end of the night when I found that the bartender lost my debit card. After searching thoroughly, the owner apologized and said the bartender must have mistakenly given to someone else. She assured me that if I called my bank and asked to have any charges made to the card cancelled, she'd accept the cancellation. She also gave me her personal number and told me to call her first thing in the morning to follow up, so that she'd know that everything had worked out. I called the next morning as requested at what I thought was a reasonable time, I think around 11, and she acted as though I was bothering her ... I told her that I was able to cancel my card. She apologized again and we ended our discussion.  As she promised, the charges were canceled and I was able to get a new card from my bank problem.I went back with a friend, because she was considering M Vie as a location for her party, but she had never been, and she wanted to see the space.  We walked in, and there was no signage, and no hostess, but we were shot dirty looks from behind the bar. When we got to the bar we realized that we'd unintentionally walked into a private event. My friend talked to the owner to hammer out some details.  She didn't remember me when I reintroduced myself, but no biggie. I reminded her that I was recently there for a private event and the bar lost my debit card .  She snapped back that someone returned the card the day after my visit, and that I could have it back if I wanted. Of course I replied no thank you, because as I told her during our previous phone conversation I'd canceled the card, so it was of no use to me. My friend nonetheless decided to host her party there. I attended her party and walked in prepared to pay cash, just in case. I brought a friend with me, and we ordered drinks which were made well. My friend asked someone working behind the bar to borrow an ink pen. Unbeknownst to him, he was talking to the owner who told him that one of the servers would have a pen, and then walked away. I'll let my friend decide whether she wants to  yelp about the details of her experience planning a party at M Vie. I just know that before my experiences at M Vie, I have never been to a bar or restaurant with such a lack of professionalism, and with such little regard for the customers. I love supporting small businesses, but I can't be treated rudely when I'm spending my hard earned money. Perhaps the owner will be glad to know that I won't be back.

31.description: You can't tell this place is open until you open the door! I didn't eat dinner but the drinks were fantastic. Great new spot for the neighborhood. I will be back to check out the food.

25.description: I went here with a friend last night, and what a nice surprise for the neighborhood! We kept walking by during the summer and wondering what was hidden behind that lovely wooden facade with no signage. When we finally went inside, we discovered a great little cocktail bar. The drinks were tasty and strong, the fried green tomatoes were delicious, and the jazz was great. Be sure to have the Old Chicago cocktail...so yummy! I'll definitely be back to try their other dishes and take advantage of their half-priced bottles of wine on Fridays!

12.description: I've dined here a few times and never disappointed. MVie has delicious food, mouth watering cocktails, live entertainment and excellent service. It's an enjoyable hidden gem in the city!! Oh, and the owner is extremely friendly and works as hard as the staff.

21.description: We went, we saw, we won't go back. This place has a great layout for a bar.... maybe. A restaurant? Nah. Service? Eh. Hipster behind the bar was too busy looking at himself in the mirror that sits behind the yellow glow of the bar. At first glance, we thought "nice drink list." When we asked for suggestions, favorites, etc. we had the drink menu handed back to us and told that there is a description below the name of the drink. Yes, even my c- average in school afforded me the luxury of learning to read. That wasn't the question....Music? Eh, there were about 10 people in the bar, so everyone pretty much had to listen to what the owner/manager/intoxicated patron(?) that was there when our group of 5 arrived. Not sure what the 12 people that gave this 5 stars were thinking (or if they are all part owners/managers there), but I have yet to see more than 2 people walk in or out of there at any given time when I drive down Grand Ave.

16.description: Another amazing night spend at M Vie for my birthday on Tuesday.  The MoFitz Project played and man was it fabulous!!!  I drive from Indianapolis to go.  I can't wait to go back!!

17.description: We went, we saw, we won't go back. This place has a great layout for a bar.... maybe. A restaurant? Nah. Service? Eh. Hipster behind the bar was too busy looking at himself in the mirror that sits behind the yellow glow of the bar. At first glance, we thought "nice drink list." When we asked for suggestions, favorites, etc. we had the drink menu handed back to us and told that there is a description below the name of the drink. Yes, even my c- average in school afforded me the luxury of learning to read. That wasn't the question....Music? Eh, there were about 10 people in the bar, so everyone pretty much had to listen to what the owner/manager/intoxicated patron(?) that was there when our group of 5 arrived. Not sure what the 12 people that gave this 5 stars were thinking (or if they are all part owners/managers there), but I have yet to see more than 2 people walk in or out of there at any given time when I drive down Grand Ave.

10.description: I really wanted to provide raving reviews for MVie. Unfortunately I cannot.  I had high hopes for MVie. I recommend the owners focus on being an intimate place for specialty drinks, music ie Jazz and offer small plates and awesome desserts. The appetizers were much better than the entrees. Quick Summary: A quite, obscure and intimate place on the near west wide that serves over priced food and drinks.Details:It's extremely easy to miss because the restaurant does not have an type of signage. It's right next door to Bella Note. There is a beautiful wooden door and an ATM machine outside; I found the ATM machine a bit peculiar because I didn't know if this meant the restaurant didn't accept credit cards.I opened the  wooden door and still no signage to indicate I was at the right place. I was meeting my dear friend for dinner and drinks. The main door opens up to a small space and a large dark curtain that you open up to a glass door. I open the glass door and was pleasantly surprised to see tables and a dimly lit room with a bar. I was warmly greeted by a hostess at a wooden podium right next to the door. Again, I found the placement of the podium oddly placed because the dining space is very small. Nevertheless, I immediately saw my girlfriend and sat down to white table cloth service. Service: Our waiter was friendly and attentive throughout the night and tried very hard to make sure we were having a good time.Drinks:It took a long time for the bartender to make our drinks. There were only 8 people in that night that's including the staff. So, it wasn't busy and not everyone was ordering drinks. Our drinks came out separately. You never serve drinks separately. There was another long wait before my friend's drink was served. Did they distill the alcohol to order? I had a pomegranate margarita strong ;0) and tasty. My girlfriend seemed to enjoy her fruity martini.Was it worth the wait? No. Nothing impressive or to rave about. Bread:Served 2 mini croissants. Cold and semi dried out mini croissants served with butter. Marianos and Costco make fresh and tasty croissants at a reasonable price. Appetizers:We tried the fried green tomatoes and fried chili shrimp.We were served approximately 6 fried green tomatoes that were covered in shredded iceberg lettuce for a garnish. Why iceberg lettuce as a garnish?! Don't know.The green tomatoes were crispy on the outside and firm on the inside and not greasy.We were served 4 large shrimp. Crispy and hot drizzled with a sweet chili sauce on top. It reminded me of the sweet chili sauce you can buy at the grocery store.Dinner:Unfortunately we came the day (Saturday at 6:30 pm) when "pork chops were on back order and only 2 ribeyes were left." We regrouped and decided to order the blackened chicken and the "special" baked chicken. The waiter recommended the baked chicken because he personally tried it for lunch earlier that day and loved it. My girlfriend didn't like the blackened chicken fillet and mashed sweet potatoes. It was a thin flattened chicken breast fillet with Lowry's seasoning salt on it. She ordered an arugula salad that had currants, green apple slices, and mound of blue cheese on top. My "special" baked chicken with gravy on the side was shockingly dry. Did I get a portion of the same baked chicken my waiter ate earlier that day for lunch. That's the only way to dry out a baked chicken by keeping it in the oven. For $23.00, I was served a dried out small leg and a very small thigh. If it were any smaller it could be called a Cornish hen and I'm not exaggerating in the slightest bit. I was absolutely shocked. I've never been served such a small portion of chicken in a restaurant. Typically a dark meat never dries out during the baking process. but somehow MVies chef succeeded to dry out a little leg and thigh. There was absolutely no flavor or semblance of seasoning. Thankfully, I substituted the rice with an order or mashed potatoes but had to pay extra $6.00. That was the only highlight of the dish but the mashed potatoes were overly worked and not light. Did I was served a dollop of mash? Lastly, my meal came with a petite salad with balsamic dressing. Here's my problem...it was a cold iceberg salad similar to what you'll find at the grocery store...the pre-made Dole salad bags. The so called balsamic salad dressing was just italian dressing that you'd purchase at the grocery store too. balsamic dressing is brown in color this was creamy white. It appears the chef's only speciality is knowing how to fry food. :0/ Background music:Loud 90s r&b slow jams. So disappointed. $114.00 between two people should provide good food and excellent drinks.Overall, the two stars are for the waiter's attentiveness and attempt to make us feel comfortable throughout the night; and the interior decor. The concept of an intimate dining experience is spot on but MVie really needs to get a new chef.

11.description: Management staff is horrible if you are not an A lister don't go here because you will be escorted to the back door.  My friends I were here last night and because we had an additional guest show up they were in flamed until we had to leave!!! I was told by friends ahead of time not to go and I should have listened!!

26.description: I had a fantastic evening at M Vie! The bar and bartender were raved about in everything I'd read so I knew I had to order a cocktail. I tried a new drink, "October Nights"  and it was AMAZING!  I love a specially rimmed glass and mine had a gingerbread rim.  YUM! We also had the shrimp chilli appetizer which was the perfect combination of sweet and spice.  My nephew and I fought over the last couple of shrimp in that one.  I ordered the pasta with chicken for dinner and my teenaged niece and nephew had buffalo wings.  Our food was hot and freshly prepared.  We definitely enjoyed it.  We also ordered the mashed potatoes and a side of broccoli which were quickly devoured by my youngster. Finally, we ordered bread pudding and ice cream. The bread pudding was JUST the right texture for me (I do not like it soggy).   I had a pretty tough crowd with me (kids) but we all found something we really enjoyed.  Highly recommend the cocktails!!

27.description: Went there on a Saturday night. With a  party of eight . And it was a table of two. No one else in the restaurant . The service sucked the food took to long to come out .food was over price and nasty. The waitress was also the host and the bus boy. I give it 1/2 star . The drinks was good . But I won't go back.

0.description: Great food, , great and fastService, and great atmosphere!!! Gumbo is the best...Thanks D...

20.description: Good place for food, music and drinks.  The service is great and the ambiance is perfect.

19.description: I love M Vie, the owners, the bar staff, the wait staff, the food and the drinks. I love it so much, that I have spent every Tues during my birthday month behind the BROWN DOOR!!!  A must experience spot!!!

2.description: Worst Customer Service Ever!!!!My friends and I made reservation for a dinner party of 7. We arrived and had an extra guest( a child). The owner took about five - ten minutes to seat us as she openly discussed with the waitress how it was going to be a problem. We were standing while all of this was transpiring. The owner / manager DAWN then states it going to take longer as she needed to reconfigure "her restaurant". Body Language is everything and especially voice tone . My friends and I were disturbed, disgusted, and her attitude and demeanor did not warrant spending money with or supporting her business.We immediately left, and went next door to Bella Notte where we were greeted with a smile, we were seated within 15 minutes without reservations.Lesson to be Learned- treat people with respect as you never know who you are being rude to. VMA

18.description: Wow. This place is a joke. The owners, servers, etc could care less if they are open of not. It's pathetic. The bartender who was also the server(?)   is the niece of the owner and who like her aunt just doesn't care about service on any level.  If fact, we were there at 6:30pm on a Saturnday night, and she was the only one scheduled to work.  I guess it's a good thing that not a soul other than myself and wife were there. I wouldn't spend someone else's money if I would ever go back, which I won't. The service, and over priced food&drinks makes this place just a complete waste of everything.  DONT GO!!!!!****1 star because you can't do 0 or negative.

13.description: Saw Joclyn perform and she was amazing!! The food was also yummy!! And if you are looking for amazing cocktails...Great experience!!

4.description: The customer service is great, the food is outstanding and the drinks.... delicious.  We had the fried pickles and shrimp and grits.  They were fantastic!  It was our first time going and the bartender was so nice and his recommendations were spot on.  The music and the friendly people sitting at the bar mad this one of my favorite spots.  It is pricey, but a nice treat.

24.description: Although this restaurant was difficult to find because of signage, the SHORT RIBS were amazing!!! This place is cute, quaint, and the bathrooms are beautiful. A hidden gem. CHECK IT OUT!!

6.description: This one is a winner y'all!!! I went here on the recommendation of a friend & so glad we did. Great food, music and service. Highly recommend the fried green tomatoes, gumbo, lamb chops, short ribs, and bread pudding... absolutely delish!

22.description: Wow. This place is a joke. The owners, servers, etc could care less if they are open of not. It's pathetic. The bartender who was also the server(?)   is the niece of the owner and who like her aunt just doesn't care about service on any level.  If fact, we were there at 6:30pm on a Saturnday night, and she was the only one scheduled to work.  I guess it's a good thing that not a soul other than myself and wife were there. I wouldn't spend someone else's money if I would ever go back, which I won't. The service, and over priced food&drinks makes this place just a complete waste of everything.  DONT GO!!!!!****1 star because you can't do 0 or negative.

15.description: Great atmosphere created by the tue nite band MO FITZ PROJECT! However the food and service were equally good but nowhere near great. The bar is very nice good creations the pours could be a little heavier for the prices but the do have Great and eclectic selection!UPDATE:  just tasted my wife's chicken sandwich 'twas HORRIBLE....chicken breast is cooking 101!

7.description: I came here a couple weeks ago on Thursday night for a b-day/going away dinner. First things first, the live music was great.  The ambiance really doesn't allow for a conversational dining experience because of the music but we all had a great jam session nonetheless. Secondly, the food was really good.  I split the fried green tomato appetizer, had a cup of gumbo and the caprese salad.  No complaints here. My only recommendation would be the timeliness of the waiter service. While I appreciate, they aren't rushing you out the door to turn tables,  It took a while for the drinks to come out, we ordered them right when we sat down and they came a few minutes before our food.  We weren't necessarily in a rush but this was a bit of a nuisance.  Also I had a train to catch, I asked for our bill and about 25 mins later we still were waiting.  Luckily, for technology I sent the money to another person in our party via Chase Quickpay and they paid for me, otherwise I would have missed my train.  FYI they only take 4 cards on a bill, so if you have a large party bring cash.

8.description: I really wanted to love this restaurant, a good number of friends recommended it. Another Yelp reviewer was my 'date' for this adventure so I won't repeat in detail the cons. I will second the unwelcoming attitude of the hostess who inquired if I had a reservation for the open 50 seats. I did search if I needed to make one but the website stated it was only needed for parties of six or more and they aren't an Open Table participant. Additionally the valet service drew a map for me to the awesome mahogany door that really could use signage. I will actually repeat the summary that I posted on my fb page-where incidentally I did not identify the restaurant. Goes something like this...Trying to be supportive, but if you bring me croissants from the grocery store and unripe semi fried green tomatoes AND you are out of lamb chops, pork chops and only have two steaks left...are you really a restaurant or another version of my kitchen? IJS?All in all our server was awesome, attentive and very apologetic for things beyond his control. If it weren't for the fact that my friend and I were more interested in catching up than the food we would have easily slipped out to a nearby location, like maybe Mariano's or my kitchen.

30.description: Interesting that both of the other reviews for this restaurant have never reviewed  on Yelp before now. I smell a rat! This place will not last.The waiter was actually scared to speak.  I had to have him repeat the specials three times because he was speaking to his feet.  I could not believe they had a waiter at a new place that was actually one of worst waiters I have ever come across. NO personality and stumbling over every interaction.The food was mediocre at best.  Fried Green tomatoes we average and the salmon was actually cooked well and tasty but NOT worth the $26 price tag at this type of casual restaurant with no ambiance and the owner interrupting us asking for feedback while I'm in the middle of an evening out with my husband. If you want feedback and testers offer a free opening and ask for comments.  As a Paying customer this is not my job.

3.description: Talk about an intimate dining experience!  I can picture someone taking their significant other here to propose to them.  Why?  The exterior of the restaurant is very discreet (but not in a bad way); beautifully donned in the finest wood on the outside, it is easy to miss this place since there is no sign out front besides the chalkboard sign on the ground.  I believe however that this gave the restaurant its intimate, "get-away-from-it-all" type of essence.  The inside of the restaurant is dimly lit with beautiful old-time, but modern, Chicago style furniture.  The restaurant is fairly small and has a walk-up bar where you can sit, drink, and dine. I can picture this place in a movie where all of the affluent, jazzy men and women convene for intimate meetings, romantic dinners, or private business discussions (oh how daringly eloquent!).I ordered the Sweet Pepper and Veggie Pasta with Chicken.  Man... the last time I remembered eating something so fresh and delicious was when I visited Dublin, Ireland where everything was grown and produced locally (not packaged and frozen).  The prices are a little on the high side here, but the quality speaks volumes on behalf of the prices.  I get nostalgic (and hungry) every time I think about it.  From what I hear, the owner really puts her foot into the quality of the food here to make sure it is top notch.Other dishes one must try here are the Shrimp and Grits, the Gumbo and for dessert, the Ms. Chris Bread Pudding.  All of these are excellent.  As far as the drinks, my husband ordered a Moscow Mule, and he was super stoked to see it be served properly in a copper mug instead of a cocktail glass (many restaurants fail at this).  5 big fat stars.

14.description: Fantastic everything - food, service, live music, ambiance! I took my husband & friend, a well traveled VIP, to M Vie.  We were very impressed! If you want to get away from the touristy crowd this is the place for you.  It's sophisticated yet modern, upscale yet relaxed. The restaurant is very small, giving it an exclusive vibe.  It doesn't even have a sign, you just have to know to go behind the wooden door.  Once you're inside, it's all the way live. We went on a Tuesday night when there was the live band, playing jazz and old school R&B.  we reminisced and had such a good time we didn't want to leave.  The food was delicious. I took photos of everyone's dish and posted them here.This is also a great place to have an intimate party or reception on other nights of the week when it's less crowded. I have my birthday party here on I think Friday or Saturday and it was perfect because everyone was able to come sit and enjoy.

58.description: Small, cozy but spacious! LOVE the serve-yourself coffee and water bar.  Laid back, homely feeling.Came here with a few friends to catch up.  We were able to sit and relax without feeling as though we should quickly eat and leave to allow others to enjoy.Friendly people, yummy pastries!

56.description: This review is long overdue but definitely needed. I had such a wonderful experience with this bakery and Gina was a pleasure to work with. I wanted a custom Gender Reveal cake made for a party my husband and I were throwing and I had some very specific directions (decor, color, cake, etc.) and they exceeded my expectations. Wonderful service, prompt communication and just an overall pleasure to work with. The cake turned out absolutely AMAZING and I still have people talking about how beautiful it was. I've even referred other friends here to get their baby shower cakes made and they were just as pleased. I will be calling Lovely for every one of my son's birthday parties for sure (Gender cake revealed we were having a boy!). Thank you so much for making that party a success.

29.description: love them love them love them

42.description: This is definitely a place to check out if you are looking for a change from the usual coffee-chains you frequent. The setting they have inside their store is also quite interesting, but despite being there multiple times, I can't figure out the meaning behind all the placeholders there. Moreover, their prices are also reasonable making it all the more a reason to go here, considering the fact that there are pretentious places within a mile that sell $4 coffee for a small size. I've always had a positive experience at this place so I wanted to reflect that here on Yelp.

23.description: Lovely is awesome. It's our go-to neighborhood bakery cafe. Some of my favorites are their croissants, coconut macaroons, and scones. Their coffee is absolutely fantastic as well. Highly recommended.

47.description: Cool vibe, nice staff. Love the coffee and the tea selections. The chocolate bourbon cupcakes, oh my! I recently became a fan of their soups also. One minor adjustment/suggestion is the (lack of proper) brewing method of the tea. The boiling water pretty much ruin the taste for citron green tea. So far, I only stick with rooibos or mint.

8.description: Scones have always been a pastry at the bottom of my dessert list. Come to think of it, they're not even on there! I think the ones I've experienced in the past have been super dry and bland. I gave the blueberry scones at  Lovely a try since I was starving and they looked amazing. Glad I did because they were so good and converted me!Their bagels are also my favorite. They have a nice crisp outside and perfectly chewy interior. Their simple lattes are pretty great, too. I'm not ashamed to admit that I've had their bacon chocolate chip for breakfast before! The charming, vintage decor is indeed "lovely", as is the cute little patio! I am sad that I didn't end up moving to the neighborhood because I'd be there every morning!

31.description: If I lived in Chicago, I would be living here. As in get a cup of chai in the morning, sit down to skip class and write a paper, maybe get a slice of blueberry almondine tart or a carrot cake muffin, look at my watch and realize that oh, heavens, it's time for lunch!, and grab something off their list of employee faves. I might then grudgingly go for a walk to digest, but conveniently, they're on N. Milwaukee, one of the best walking streets in Chicago. After walking off all my food, I might be tempted out of hunger to unfaithfully fill up my tank at another one of Milwaukee St.'s stellar options for edibles, but after awkwardly walking in and out of various restaurants, I'd shake my head and find my way back to Lovely, having come to terms with the fact that they have the best goddamn menu at the most reasonable prices in the Midwest. I have even been forced to admit that their bakery even tops the quality and pricing of my local pie and cake headquarters (sorry, Hubbard!!) because I mean seriously, $2 for a slice of four-tiered cake??? Not to mention that their communal and seating are cute, cozy, and plenty (though I can see crowding happening on weekend mornings), and staff are fabulous and food is quick to arrive. 10/10 will visit again. At all costs.

34.description: Very nice place for breakfast or brunch. Love the overall experience and good vibes of the people and place. Simple menu but hits the spot. Bring your laptop or book and enjoy the environment. My recommendation: Pesto sandwich with a side of tomato soup and chai tea.

16.description: Can't want to visit.. I'm watching the food network Channel . Watching  Unique sweet from Chicago. Can't wait to visit Chicago. I want a bran muffin...ymmmmmm!!!

13.description: I was visiting chicago with a friend and we stopped by here after dinner.  It has a rustic interior with hip hop music playing, which was a strange combination but... i liked it!  We tried the cafe latte, chai latte, chocolate scone,  and  carrot cupcake.  All were very delicious,  and it was a great place to warm up and recuperate after walking around all day.  The cafe is very spacious with many large tables, free wifi, and outlets.  This would be a very nice place to study if i were a student in the area.

11.description: My dad ordered an apple pie and a pumpkin pie for Thanksgiving from here. The pies looked amazing and they even made little leaves out of pie crust to put on top which was a cute touch. They looked cute, but honestly they weren't the best pies I had. The apples in the pie were still too crunchy. I think the pies were way overpriced, and would have prefered a pie from Bakers Square instead. I would love to come here and try their other baked goods which Im sure are delicious. Maybe pies just aren't their specialty.

39.description: Um yes. Beautiful cappuccino's, fantastic chai tea, and tastey soups and sides. I go here every morning before work to get my fix.I'm really anti starbucks (I don't like paying double for burned drinks) so I was super happy to find this place.They let you get whatever you want on your free drink punch...hollaaaaaaa!Great music. Awesome lemon/cucumber water and free wifi!

37.description: Great cappuccino!! And a very very nice place. Perfect for a cup a coffee to have enough strength to end your day! Blueberry muffins are a must. Lovely, lovely.

0.description: Adorable neighborhood coffee shop with great coffee. "Lovely" lured me in with its design of rustic elegance/French Country decor. It has a nice ambiance that isn't too loud. Many big tables to choose from if you need to study, read, etc. Also, free wifi! My eyes directly go to the beautiful selections of delicious treats from petite bacon donuts, carrot cupcakes, peanut butter cookies, and blueberry muffins to name a few. The coffee was delicious! Usually mochas are my go-to coffee, and this place nailed it.For the night owls, get here early because this place closes at 6pm.

38.description: I do still love the look and feel of this place, but I'm no longer sure about their baked goods as I'm a gal who avoids partially hydrogenated oils.When the new mega-Walgreens showed up downtown, I saw that Lovely supplied some of their cookies. I was excited! I grabbed a bag and then read the ingredients (something not available at the bakery) and PHOs were there. NOOOOO!!!!So I wrote an email to Lovely asking about their practices with PHOs, but got no response. I followed up a few weeks later once again politely asking to find out what baked goods they made without them, as I still liked them overall and wished to continue shopping there. But still got NO response. So sad. The folks were truly lovely but I won't be going their anymore for anything more than coffee.

51.description: My roommate and I wake up every weekend, texting each other "It's time to see the Mustache Man!" aka Jordan at Lovely. Upon arrival at the coffee shop, we are greeted by his friendly Canadian face (ey!) and his one-of-a-kind mustache. Our order usually consists of large coffees (Ipsento brew), occasionally a quiche, and cookies --- hello bacon filled goodies. Their blueberry scone and cheddar scones are perfection. Everything here is fresh, delicious, and happy (because of the mustache man). There are some other local coffee shops in the area, but nothing compares to the "homey-ness" and vintage feel-good ambiance of Lovely.

27.description: There's something especially sweet about this bakeshop/cafe. The services is always friendly; and the pastries are always fresh and delightful. Really nice light and great place to plug in and get some work done, or play a game with a pal.

32.description: Super super cute and great spot for an event.  Their outdoor patio also looks adorable.  Can't wait to go back in the summer.

54.description: I almost don't want to write this review. Not because the place is bad, but actually the complete opposite...it's awesome, and I want it to stay that way.1. It's large inside, really large, almost cavernous. I like that. 2. Gonna be there for awhile? They have a bottomless cup of coffee. A few other places up the street don't offer this. I understand why, but mega points for these guys offering me as much bean juice as I can drink.3. Ample baked goods. They're a bake shop, after all. Lots of sweet and a few savory treats. Competitive prices. No over the top pretentiousness. Lovely.4. Nice staff. No coffee jerks here. Or none that I've experienced.5. Best part...I have NEVER seen it so busy its hard to find a place to sit. LOVELY. JUST LOVELY.6. Outdoor seating. They have a large side area which is fenced in. It's great.Total hidden gem of a shop.

48.description: Fantastic goodies, if supposed to be coconut it's mostly coconut, if pecan, it's mostly pecans.  Everything tastes as you remember it when a child.  Nothing is made with cheap fillers. They decorate intricate cakes with detail and care, as I do my own. Very yummy, will stock up next time.  It's worth the drive!Ignore the competitors here and their "cheap" shots.

44.description: As a freelance writer, I'm always looking for a good coffee shop. This place has great food, decent seating, and wonderful light. It's a great place to work from. The only thing I don't love about it is the location -- I wish it was a bit closer to the the heart of Wicker Park!

24.description: Such a lovely name for a lovely bake shop! Lovely Bake Shop is the perfect little shop to enjoy great healthy sandwiches, delicious bake goods and of corse pretty lattes! A quaint interior, large wood tables or great stool seating at the counter. Plus a nice outdoor space on a Spring or Summer afternoon!

7.description: Lovely is just that, lovely! I've been coming here for years and a month ago had my wedding here...that's how much I love it! Bob, Gina and the entire staff did everything to make our day spectacular. Our wedding was about 50 people and everyone died over the food and the space. They even arranged our flowers for us!! Can never thank them enough for such a wonderful moment in our life!!

49.description: Amazing coffee and yummm bakery! We had German chocolate cupcake and chocolate whoopie pie. Both were simply delicious. Service is friendly and prices are reasonable. Worth trying.

40.description: Really, really good iced coffee. Seriously - other places should take note. This shop is a delightful oasis on a hot day. It seems like a popular spot for many freelancers, whose quiet focus transforms the seating area into the perfect spot for anyone needing some quiet time. I would like to come back here and read for a couple of hours - the space is perfect for that. The Lovely staff live up to their namesake with friendly manners and generous advice for sightseeing.

53.description: The bread pudding is so good! It's really rich and huge in terms of size, so I would recommend sharing it with someone :)

30.description: Lovely made my wedding cake, on very short notice, and did a beautiful job. We talked on the phone; I emailed a couple of pictures; and I got precisely what I wanted.  Does this sound crazy? Well, I had three weeks to arrange this wedding, and I was sick with pneumonia, so I cannot tell you how nice to was to work with such talented and professional people. I got a 2 tier chocolate wedding cake with chocolate cream filling, vanilla buttercream frosting that was SO AMAZING! Not sweet, just buttery.  They made the frosting a nice shade of lilac, lined dots around the edges of the tiers, made beautiful lilly sugar flowers sprayed with some opalescent silvery color, and I had the prettiest cake you have ever seen.  But what really matters is the taste. This cake was the best wedding cake I've ever had - it was moist and flavorful.  I worked with Tricia - thank you so much for your help!  They could have made me feel nuts for doing this on 1 week notice (some places when a 3 month notice!), and Tricia did not.Thank you to Lovely: A  Bake  Shop for making me a such a lovely and tasty wedding cake, and helping to make my wedding day fun and stress-free.

46.description: I stop by a lot for a sandwich, coffee or a cookie. They have a really good fresh sandwiches, good lattes and good baked good.  One summer day me and friend went here for lunch. We split a turkey sandwich and an apple. We sat on the nice street side patio and had a lovely time. In the shop there was the most wonderland delicious smell that I ever smelled: the guy said they were making their granola that day. It smelled so wonderful that I had to leave before I ordered all the fresh granola. I only wish this place had longer hours. I recommend stopping in anytime.

1.description: Went here today, and was very surprised I have not stopped in before. Huge area with amble seating. As you walk in, the smell of baked goods hit you in the face and I couldn't be more excited!!!! The workers were great as I told them it was my first time here, and will be back often.

55.description: I can't say enough how much I love 'Lovely'! I have ordered three special occasion cakes here, to date, and every time I was knock-out impressed! The prices are amazing for the fantastic cake designs they deliver and really just can't be beat. I am a stickler for cakes.. they have to LOOK and TASTE amazing and Lovely always delivers on both of those aspects. Most recently I contacted Trisha over at Lovely to design my friend's baby shower cake. I sent her a few images I had found on the net of designs I liked and we collaborated and discussed via emailed exactly what I wanted. She was friendly and super helpful. They make their cakes at a specific location but had it delivered to the location on Milwaukee for pick up on my request - which is closer to me - and I found that to be a shining example of amazing customer service.What I got is better than I ever could have envisioned! (Hopefully I can get an image of the cake on here soon via my yelp app.) I ordered an all white vanilla cake with little fondant baby boy blue shoes on top, yellow, blue, and green fondant flat circles sporadically on top and around the cake, and a little blue and white cameo with a little boy designed on it placed on the front side and the cake was finally rimmed at the bottom with little white fondant balls. Everyone at the baby shower, especially the Mom to be, was floored by how beautiful the cake was and we all didn't even want to cut into it and wreck it!! I got the 8'' round and it was WAY MORE than enough for 14 people and cost only 100 dollars. I mean that just a ridiculously good deal!Final Verdict:If you have a special occasion and need a fantastically designed and super tasty cake that EVERYONE will be floored by - get your cake from Lovely! Ask for Trisha!

9.description: What a cute little bakery! My friend that lives a life of luxury loves to visit this place before her afternoon nap. Yesterday I joined her and what a treat  The environment is really pleasant. Most people there were reading a book, studying, etc...and it's a nice quiet environment to do so. I also notice they have board games available to play.We both ordered the hibiscus tea. I don't like tea and I didn't like this one, but I'm just not a tea person. We also got the bread pudding. Delicious! In order to be good in my book the texture has to be just right. I don't like mushy or soggy bread pudding and this one was great. I also loved the sauce it was surrounded in. The next time I'm off I'll have to come back and try something else.

26.description: Such a cute and quaint cafe. They have a mix of old tables and funky chairs which adds to the atmosphere. Community tables and lots of people meeting and working

25.description: Amazing pastries in this quaint setting with perfect coffee and light lunch options. I always come here when I'm in the area and you should too. It's worth the trip.

12.description: There's something especially sweet about this bakeshop/cafe. The services is always friendly; and the pastries are always fresh and delightful. Really nice light and great place to plug in and get some work done, or play a game with a pal.

59.description: I have ordered from here twice on Grubhub. I have never been to the actual restaurant because it is a bit far from me. Ordering online is kind of risky but I am I have tried their curried chicken salad sandwich and their vegetarian sandwich as well as their whoopie pies, brownie, and soup. The two sandwiches weren't amazing taste wise but they are very and fresh they seem to be good quality and reliable. The desserts were very moist and I would say they are definitely excellent. I guess they are better for their baked goods than their sandwiches. The meals were very well packaged and so professional looking. I pay attention to things like this.

21.description: We live around the corner from lovely. We often get breakfast/coffee on Sunday mornings. It's a very cute bake shop with lots of seating options. Everything I've had from lovely has been great. (I'm not a big fan of bacon in my chocolate chip cookies but my husband loves them!)They're small and sometimes don't answer the phone if we're trying to place a to go order for breakfast in bed, but other than that small complaint I definitely recommend.

17.description: I can't say enough how much I love 'Lovely'! I have ordered three special occasion cakes here, to date, and every time I was knock-out impressed! The prices are amazing for the fantastic cake designs they deliver and really just can't be beat. I am a stickler for cakes.. they have to LOOK and TASTE amazing and Lovely always delivers on both of those aspects. Most recently I contacted Trisha over at Lovely to design my friend's baby shower cake. I sent her a few images I had found on the net of designs I liked and we collaborated and discussed via emailed exactly what I wanted. She was friendly and super helpful. They make their cakes at a specific location but had it delivered to the location on Milwaukee for pick up on my request - which is closer to me - and I found that to be a shining example of amazing customer service.What I got is better than I ever could have envisioned! (Hopefully I can get an image of the cake on here soon via my yelp app.) I ordered an all white vanilla cake with little fondant baby boy blue shoes on top, yellow, blue, and green fondant flat circles sporadically on top and around the cake, and a little blue and white cameo with a little boy designed on it placed on the front side and the cake was finally rimmed at the bottom with little white fondant balls. Everyone at the baby shower, especially the Mom to be, was floored by how beautiful the cake was and we all didn't even want to cut into it and wreck it!! I got the 8'' round and it was WAY MORE than enough for 14 people and cost only 100 dollars. I mean that just a ridiculously good deal!Final Verdict:If you have a special occasion and need a fantastically designed and super tasty cake that EVERYONE will be floored by - get your cake from Lovely! Ask for Trisha!

10.description: My fave cafe in the city - the best Chai Latte and they have almond milk which for some reason the chain coffee houses haven't figured out is a great alternative. I have eaten lunch a couple times - sandwiches are pretty big and good. I've only had the giant brownie for baked goods but it was outstanding!All around great place with a cute decor and very spacious. Staff have always been friendly and quick.

5.description: I popped in here yesterday morning before heading into neighboring Revive Nail salon for a cupa. I just love this shop. It's so wonderfully decorated. The staff is really nice. They provide great pastries and treats. In the summer (or nicer weather in general) they have a cute outdoor seating area. Its pretty large and has lots of seating. Great neighborhood spot. Highly recommend Lovely, as it is just that... LOVELY!

3.description: I am a guy who loves coffee and freshly baked pastries; and this is a great place to guy.  Forget the fact that I live 3 blocks away, they have great homemade (hint hint) pastries as well as freshly brewed coffee and a variety of syrups to choose from to add a little flavor to your coffee or hot beverage. I got a 16 oz latte with vanilla syrup, plain bagel with cream cheese and a coffee cake. Bagel was fresh, I asked them to warm it up and it was perfect. Coffee cake is delicious (again homemade). Anyone who wants a quick cup of coffee to sitting down and having a short meeting, this is the place to met up and enjoy a few moments of life.

35.description: I was in Chicago for just a weekend, and I stopped at Lovely every morning on my way to MultiKulti. Let me just say that they make the BEST ICED CHAI LATTE ever!!! I live in L.A. and can't find one nearly as good as theirs -- not even close.

19.description: Um yes. Beautiful cappuccino's, fantastic chai tea, and tastey soups and sides. I go here every morning before work to get my fix.I'm really anti starbucks (I don't like paying double for burned drinks) so I was super happy to find this place.They let you get whatever you want on your free drink punch...hollaaaaaaa!Great music. Awesome lemon/cucumber water and free wifi!

28.description: I have been here a handful of times, because my tattoo shop is a block down, and I have gotten the quiche every time. Because I only come every month or so, I get to try a new flavor every time, and I haven't been disappointed yet!I wasn't sure about the price for a slice of quiche at first ($7-8), until I realized that it came with a side of mixed greens and bread with butter! It has always left me satisfied as a great lunch in this cold weather.I had the coffee once or twice, and it was a fairly good latte, but nothing that really set it apart as spectacular for me. It tasted a lot like any other latte I would get at a small coffee shop or bakery. Nothing to complain about, though!Service was swift counter side, but I do end up waiting five minutes or so at my table for them to bring my food. I'm not sure about the speed if you choose to-go.All in all, I will return for more!

45.description: This is my favorite coffee shop in Chicago! It has outlets, it has wifi, the service is excellent, and the baristas super friendly! Also, it has a lot of light and feels spacious. The food is excellent. I would recommend the quiche of the day. The salad that comes with it has a great vinaigrette.

33.description: Scones have always been a pastry at the bottom of my dessert list. Come to think of it, they're not even on there! I think the ones I've experienced in the past have been super dry and bland. I gave the blueberry scones at  Lovely a try since I was starving and they looked amazing. Glad I did because they were so good and converted me!Their bagels are also my favorite. They have a nice crisp outside and perfectly chewy interior. Their simple lattes are pretty great, too. I'm not ashamed to admit that I've had their bacon chocolate chip for breakfast before! The charming, vintage decor is indeed "lovely", as is the cute little patio! I am sad that I didn't end up moving to the neighborhood because I'd be there every morning!

43.description: It's a cute coffee shop/bakery place with good coffee and food.  The decor is unique and has some cool vintage furniture. i always get their "latte" and it has been consistently great! I tried their sandwiches and quiches and they are also very good.  On the weekend, it can crowded after 12 and I find it a little too hectic and overwhelming.  Otherwise, when it's not crowded it is very relaxing and a good place to meet with friends, read, or do work.

2.description: I came here today for lunch during my weeklong Chicago visit. I really was only expecting to pick up a baked good, but ended up getting lunch. All in all, an awesome spot! Check it out!Ambience: AWESOME. Really cute: very welcoming with plenty of seating. I'm not sure how it is during the weekends, but during the week, it seems easy to grab a table all to yourself.Food: Good. While this wasn't the best curry chicken salad I've ever had, it was good (lots of grapes and the croissant was nice). The salad that came with it (one of the side options - you can also get Terra chips or fruit) was fresh and quite good (maybe a bit heavy on the dressing if you're concerned with these things). The bacon chocolate chip cookie was good, but I think it might have been better if it weren't as crispy.Service: Very good. Everyone was very friendly, and, despite being a visitor, I felt very welcome.If I lived around here, I'd come regularly: it's an awesome space with friendly service and good food!NOTE: No American Express - other cards accepted.

18.description: Amazing pastries in this quaint setting with perfect coffee and light lunch options. I always come here when I'm in the area and you should too. It's worth the trip.

41.description: Lovely is my favorite cafe in my neighborhood.  I love it because it's got a great atmosphere and the people working there are super friendly.  It is decorated with a ton of vintage furniture so you kind of feel like your in a home.  The food is good but a bit limited for me because I am gluten-free.  It's not too crowded or loud so I tend to go there to do work.

52.description: Great space with friendly service and amazing baked goods. We had the chocolate bacon cookie and the chocolate croissant and were totally satisfied with our choices! I'll have to be back to try the rest.They have Ipsento coffee so that's great, and they are so reasonably priced, they even have cheap refills and a "bottomless" option. Great place to get some work done or just enjoy your Sunday afternoon!

50.description: they have a great relaxed vibe... and always good zucchini bread!  theyre quiche is consistently delicious and generally they have plenty of space to spread out with a laptop or a book.

4.description: I can't think of a better name. This is just a lovely bake shop in the Noble Square neighborhood. It has plenty of room to work and free wifi to connect to. It's a cute bakery with a vintage feel. Everyone is always very nice and helpful, even when I come in at 7am and we are all waking up!  As you might expect the baked goods are the star. Plenty of amazing treats!  The coffee is good, nothing too amazing but it's a bakery first, not a coffee shop. If you're in the hood, stop by to warm up in the winter or relax on the patio when it's nice out!

6.description: Such a lovely name for a lovely bake shop! Lovely Bake Shop is the perfect little shop to enjoy great healthy sandwiches, delicious bake goods and of corse pretty lattes! A quaint interior, large wood tables or great stool seating at the counter. Plus a nice outdoor space on a Spring or Summer afternoon!

22.description: Such a great little spot that I frequent a lot. Their whole menu is perfect and the coffee is bomb.

15.description: I have been here a handful of times, because my tattoo shop is a block down, and I have gotten the quiche every time. Because I only come every month or so, I get to try a new flavor every time, and I haven't been disappointed yet!I wasn't sure about the price for a slice of quiche at first ($7-8), until I realized that it came with a side of mixed greens and bread with butter! It has always left me satisfied as a great lunch in this cold weather.I had the coffee once or twice, and it was a fairly good latte, but nothing that really set it apart as spectacular for me. It tasted a lot like any other latte I would get at a small coffee shop or bakery. Nothing to complain about, though!Service was swift counter side, but I do end up waiting five minutes or so at my table for them to bring my food. I'm not sure about the speed if you choose to-go.All in all, I will return for more!

57.description: Best chai soy latte in the city, plenty of outlets for plugging in, free wifi, and super warm in the winter. This place is quickly becoming one if my favorite coffee shops in the city.

20.description: Great coffee served to you by super nice people. What more can you ask for? One of my favorite places!

36.description: What a cute little bakery! My friend that lives a life of luxury loves to visit this place before her afternoon nap. Yesterday I joined her and what a treat  The environment is really pleasant. Most people there were reading a book, studying, etc...and it's a nice quiet environment to do so. I also notice they have board games available to play.We both ordered the hibiscus tea. I don't like tea and I didn't like this one, but I'm just not a tea person. We also got the bread pudding. Delicious! In order to be good in my book the texture has to be just right. I don't like mushy or soggy bread pudding and this one was great. I also loved the sauce it was surrounded in. The next time I'm off I'll have to come back and try something else.

14.description: If I could, I would give this place a negative star. Nothing "lovely" about this place with their rude service/attitude. Asked a simple question & got a smart aleck response..that should have been a red flag to not order...yet I realize there are condescending people in this world and decided to give them a shot. Well low and behold the barista decides to attend others and withhold making our lattes...the nerve of some people. I will never patronize this unlovely cafe & I will make sure to let all my healthcare colleagues  know to stay far away from this place..even if it's the last place to get caffeinated!

28.description: I'm so happy I was referred here. These dudes are more than helpful. They are knowledgeable on all of their products and make sure you leave with what you need. They get all the dang stars.

1.description: Great place! Although the city is cheating us with taxes, they give a great discount, 15% off 3 or more bottle of juice!

9.description: They have this line called chaos that I don't see at many other shops at the moment , that stuff is great. Especially the Black Flag Waffle. If you are looking for some quality juice that is made in Chicago give them a visit. Not looking for some juice sent from the gods? No worries, they have a awesome selection of mods and other accessories ( and many other lines of juice) The workers truly enjoy their job and are very helpful .From beginner to expert vape enthusiasts , this shop is a must see. They have everything you need at a great price.And that Matty guy is pretty cool too.

29.description: I stopped by the new location with my cousin this past weekend, and OMG! I love it! I've been vamping for almost a year now, and pretty much have frequented every vape spot in the Chicago area, but Vape is my new favorite! The set up is cool, the decor is nice, and now they have plenty of space to chill and get your vape on.  If you went to their other location, you are in for a real treat when you see this one. I always have a fun time when I stop in, the guys are super knowledgeable about all they're products and they have any and everything you need as a beginner or a seasoned veteran. Plus, they carry a wide variety of premium e-juice like Mr. Goodvape and some others that are the bomb! Oh, and they're prices can't be beat!Thumbs up guys on the upgrade, you now have a customer for life!

23.description: This is as good as it gets for Vape shops! They are super knowledgeable and extremely helpful. If you're just starting or advance, they treat everyone with respect.
