They have earned my business as a customer! The quality of juices they carry is epic and they have a great tasting bar. Plenty of room to relax and vape for a while too. Anyone looking to get into Vapes or wanting to try something new, check this place out!

5.description: These guys are the best!! I'm trying to quit smoking and they are so helpful in doing so. Friendly staff and great customer service. I've recommended this spot to a few people and everyone is completely satisfied with the products. Numerous flavors and the juice bottles are affordable and last long. Definitely coming back.

31.description: I'm new to the vaping world, so my buddy suggested going to vape, so once we got there it was a really cool experience... The guys were very knowledgeable about the products and the juices that they carry, and they were very personable.. And I must say that the easydoesit juice is great!!! I'll be back...

25.description: THE premiere vape shop in Chicago. Yes, I started this out with a bang. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. They have a very wide variety of everything. Very nice e-juice bar where they welcome you to sit and sift through a vast menu and try each succulent flavor for a premiere vaping experience. As a Detroiter visiting Chicago I can recommend this shop to anyone. Thanks guys

12.description: Great selection. Knowledgeable, friendly staff. This is why I'm a return customer that travels from the suburbs. Highly recommended.

21.description: Go here when you are ready to get something more than the easily breakable and disposable vaporizers you can get at a headshop. Wide variety of liquid flavored and they let you try them!

16.description: JoJo was super helpful. The space is welcoming with a contemporary feel. Lots of great flavors. Prices are good. Lots of different styles of vapes available. JoJo offered me solutions to the problems I'm having with my current vape before he tried to sell me a whole new device. That's integrity right there. I'll definitely go back for refills on my flavors. Highly recommend if you're looking for knowledgable staff.

17.description: My mom gave me one of her vape pens which she used to kick a 30+ years smoking habit. I was skeptical because I had tried vaping before, but didn't know what I was doing and would go back to cigarettes. I ran out of cigarettes yesterday and decided to go cold turkey. 24 hours in, I was feeling super crazy and everything in my body was like GO TO THE STORE AND BUY A PACK OF CIGARETTES. I went up to Vape and Matt helped me enormously and showed me what to do properly. He let me try so many wonderful tasty satisfying flavors. I left feeling so much better and with the true hope that I can quit this time!

10.description: So I was looking for my first mod. I've been reading about them online and I was ready to take the plunge. I was greeted right away by Eric who was fully knowledgeable and broke it down super simple. I didn't feel rushed or any thing. I got a basic mod with a Kay fun tank. It's super simple and easy to use. Even got a ruthless ez duz it on Ice. I absolutely love it. Thank you. Love the atmosphere inside. They have a pretty decent juice bar with a tablet full of flavors to choose.

11.description: THE premiere vape shop in Chicago. Yes, I started this out with a bang. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. They have a very wide variety of everything. Very nice e-juice bar where they welcome you to sit and sift through a vast menu and try each succulent flavor for a premiere vaping experience. As a Detroiter visiting Chicago I can recommend this shop to anyone. Thanks guys

26.description: Ok, I don't normally leave reviews for every place I visit, but I couldn't pass on this one.  When I went into Vape I was 100% new to vaping.  After reading the excellent reviews I decided to check it out and what an experience!! The staff was extremely helpful, and the guy that helped me out went to lengths explaining the differences between devices and the pros and cons of each. As you can see in the pictures they also have a juice bar where you can test any and every flavor you would like.  This was a fantastic experience and I would recommend anyone looking for a great Vape store to give this place a try!

27.description: I stopped in yesterday for a mod, while they didn't have the exact mod I was looking for, they did everything in their power to hook me up, and I left with something even better than what I came for. Their selection is bar-none the best I've seen in the Chicago-land area and the prices rival even online Chinese vendors. I was able to taste every juice I could handle, and they would not settle until I was 110% satisfied. I can't say enough good things about this shop, the staff, and the products. If you're shopping anywhere else, you're missing out.

35.description: Nice selection... Hope to see more products on my next visit. I only bought a spacer thing for between my Vivi Nova and Vision Spinner. Nice juice selection... Will ask to sample next time. Didn't bring my vape. Nice friendly peeps, nice overall feel to the shop. A/C works, *phew* :) There is street parking and a Dunkin just a couple steps away, you can get your happy hour on.  thanks!!

0.description: If you haven't switched from smoking to vaporizing you really, really should! This place is tiny, attached to a car wash. But it had the product I needed, and at half the price. I was so excited I did a dance. Quick service, good location. Friendly staff who were explaining to the customer before me how to use an E-cigarette. Now its moved to a larger location with even greater selection. Do hit this one up!

20.description: JoJo was super helpful. The space is welcoming with a contemporary feel. Lots of great flavors. Prices are good. Lots of different styles of vapes available. JoJo offered me solutions to the problems I'm having with my current vape before he tried to sell me a whole new device. That's integrity right there. I'll definitely go back for refills on my flavors. Highly recommend if you're looking for knowledgable staff.

19.description: My boyfriend Ho-Train and are town from Seattle and stopped by this random Vape Shop! Great selection of juices and mods! They are super knowledgeable about mechanical and variable voltage mods and answered all of our questions! Hands down a great place to stop by and have a Vape session! We will be back!

33.description: Vape is an amazing vapor shop with high end mods, tanks, atomizers and a great selection of premium juice. The prices are more than reasonable and the service is five star. Every Chicagoland vaper should stop in.

2.description: Great place. Grabed the ipv3 from vapegut. .....And didn't see bearded clam..place is one of the best in city. Owners are cool and carry the best authentic mods

34.description: My boyfriend Ho-Train and are town from Seattle and stopped by this random Vape Shop! Great selection of juices and mods! They are super knowledgeable about mechanical and variable voltage mods and answered all of our questions! Hands down a great place to stop by and have a Vape session! We will be back!

32.description: So glad I discovered Vape today which is walking distance from my home. They just opened up two months ago so this was the first time I found out they were there. Bought a bottle of a berry / mint / watermelon concoction just to try something out since I was there anyway and I like it a lot. Going to head back in when I have more time and get a battery and sample some juices. Been ordering online so-far but you know, the cost of postage and the waiting . . . so glad something opened up nearby.

18.description: Vape is the ONLY vape shop anyone should patronize and I'll tell you why. These guys give a shit and it shows. Everything about the place is solid. Staff, helpfulness, selection, shop appearance. These guys are true vape enthusiasts and they have a genuine love for spreading knowledge of all things vape related. I went in to this shop over the summer as a beginner with my lady. Neither of us knew dick about vaping. Paul, one of the employees started us off on our vaping journey with care, compassion and mature guidance. He explained everything we wanted to know and didn't talk down to us or make us feel dumb for not being seasoned vapers. I have been to other vape shops in the area and no one compares to the level of service that is provided at Vape. The juice bar is my favorite part of the shop. All their flavors are on Ipads and it makes selecting and discovering new flavors fun. The staff are experts on their products. Often I ask for a recommendation and am rarely disappointed with their suggestions. It's shops like this that keep me from shopping on the internet. I know I could save a few bucks but I like giving my business to Vape. They have actually talked us out of spending money when myself or my fiance got overzealous in our spending. Only hiccup was one time a short Filipino dude shorted us like 200 points on our frequent shopper rewards card but we got it sorted out the next time we came in. Don't even bother with other vape shops. Vape is the only place you need to go. You will not be disappointed!

13.description: I stopped by the new location with my cousin this past weekend, and OMG! I love it! I've been vamping for almost a year now, and pretty much have frequented every vape spot in the Chicago area, but Vape is my new favorite! The set up is cool, the decor is nice, and now they have plenty of space to chill and get your vape on.  If you went to their other location, you are in for a real treat when you see this one. I always have a fun time when I stop in, the guys are super knowledgeable about all they're products and they have any and everything you need as a beginner or a seasoned veteran. Plus, they carry a wide variety of premium e-juice like Mr. Goodvape and some others that are the bomb! Oh, and they're prices can't be beat!Thumbs up guys on the upgrade, you now have a customer for life!

4.description: My friend went here and bought 2 mods from them and got a $250 mod that shocks her finger whenever she presses the firing button, she went back to exchange for the $150 Petri mod, which was better. But the next day, Mattie charged her $10 for a new build?!?! (Who charges for builds???). Plus, when she wanted to use her fivestar points, same guy Mattie had excuses why she couldn't use her points for juices. But other than that, other employees are nice! But those experiences really turned us off from going back.

24.description: Best vape shop in the city hands down!!! Has a wide variety of vaporizers AND juices. Not to mention the staff is great, very knowledgable and patient! Me being new at vaping, Eric helped me tremendously to guide me in the right direction with my purchase. Definitely recommend this shop to everyone!

6.description: I couldn't have had a better, easier experience at Vape.I'm a pack-a-day smoker, and I'd planned on moving to vaping for some time, if only so I could start running again. I went into Vape after reading the Yelp reviews, and I'm glad I did. They gave me a great walkthrough on the basics of vaping, and didn't try to hard sell me on any piece of equipment. They gave me exactly what I wanted -- something simple, something good for newbies.I spent probably too much time trying out different juice flavors. After asking how much I smoked, we found a nicotine amount that would work for me, and went through several flavors. Never once did I feel rushed, and never once did I feel like they were pulling me towards specific products.All in all, it was a perfect experience for a beginner, and I can't wait to go back once my juice is finished. I'd recommend this place to anybody.

22.description: I love this place....High quality juices, tanks, mods, etc. Great customer service and very knowledgeable and patient staff.  Special shout out to Joe who hooked me up with a great kit and great juices.  Very comfortable atmosphere.  If your in the area. ..make sure you stop by for a visit. .. You will not be disappointed! !!

15.description: I'm very new to the vape scene and have juggled between having some friends build ones for me or to just by a quality one from a quality store. After a quick bite in the city I hit Google for the nearest vape stores by me. There aren't many by where I live, so I figured here's my chance. It's a bit hard to spot driving down western, and I missed it once. Walked in waited for the people before me to finish their order and was quickly shown everything there is to know. Before you know it I was buying a vape and couldn't be more pleased. Hopefully this helps me quit smoking cigarettes. But on to the shop, product was good, service was very patient and helpful and answered all of my silly questions. I'm telling you I have completely no knowledge of vapes and these guys guided me from A to Z. If your new to the scene this is the place. And if you're a seasoned pro they have a good amount of mods, nice setting, chilled atmosphere, and a ton of juices to TRY before you buy!

7.description: Is there a 6 star option Because these guys go the extra mile to make sure you had a good experience in their vape shop. Even though there are a lot of vape shops in the Chicago area I think Vape beats them all. I drive 25 miles to get product from these guys and will continue to. keep up the good work!

8.description: Walked in to buy a 150 watt mod and a couple batteries. Had gotten a quote for a whopping 10% off for black friday. One guy wouldn't even get off the couch, and the other guy tried to sell me a $10 Ego kit for $60 or something. What I mean to say, is that he talked down to me. Then I was told that the quote I got on the phone "was not real". I walked out. Save your time, money, and breath, do not shop at Vape.

30.description: Just got into vaping and was pleased to find Vape around the corner from my house about a week ago and I think I have already been in 3 times. I have been to tons of tobacco stores that sell limited amounts of e-cigs and vaporizers but none of them seemed to know anything about what they were selling. Vape is the complete opposite. Joe and Daryl answered every questions I had and their prices are really reasonable even when compared to the online stores. If you're in the area, stop purchasing online...support a local business and stop in to Vape.

3.description: Excellent place. I was just there (by recommendation from St Lucia's Smoke Shop) with intent to take the step from entry level ecigs to a proper 'intermediate' vape setup. The staff members helps me do this with ease, especially Royal (I think that was his name).Thanks. Will definitely be back soon for some more juices.

14.description: Honestly the best customer service I have had in a while. I always come in with problems and they maintain a positive attitude and set me up. They do great builds and are the experts of the Chicago vape scene. Matty knows what he is doing and he gave a great customer experience. I work in the service industry, and I am pretty stern about good service, and Matty is awesome!!!!! Thanks Vape!!!!

1.description: I am the office manager here at my company and am used to ordering many things for our office and employees. I have never EVER had an experience like this with complete lack of  customer service. I ordered custom TITLEST golf bags that were supposed to take up to 6 weeks. It has been over 3 months and I can not get anyone to answer the phone or an email regarding the almost thousand dollars we spent on these things. DO NOT order anything from here.Melissa

9.description: Have been going to proline off and on for the last three years. When I first started going was not impressed with the selection or service. Over the last year (I believe under updated ownership) the shop has really improved. Have all clubs anyone would be interested in purchasing, updated apparel, and wide selection of grips and balls. The practice facility is legit as well. Would definitely recommend this shop. I just purchased some titleist irons and was a great experience.

12.description: I went there for a golf lesson. I am an absolute beginner so was kind of scared/hesitant. Met with Marcus who immediately put me at ease. He gave me a solid demonstration of a "good swing" and then happily got handsy to adjust my posture and grip.Not too much a fan of all the non-golf discussion, but may be it is just the culture.All in all, a great place to learn the game if you live downtown and are starting up.

21.description: Overall, Proline is a decent golf place.  Having seen a few in my times since my dad used to rep golf products, they have a pretty good selection.  It's convenient for downtown since they actually have a parking area right nearby, so you won't have to lug your newly purchased clubs to your car.

16.description: I know golf, I was a PGA Golf Professional specializing in golf equipment and instruction.  I am out of the business but stay up to date on all the latest trends and participate in many blogs.  I would say they are cheap at best.  Not in a good way.  I have to say they are golfs equivalent to a auto service station.  Imagine that time you took your car in and everything was wrong because they thought you knew nothing about golf.  The shop is disorganized and has mostly used ebay stuff.  Save yourself the drive and parking $$$ and just use ebay.

17.description: This is a great golf shop.  All the sales people I've dealt with there are knowledgable and helpful, prices are good, my club-fitting was great.  I don't understand the negative reviews from the Calif. customers -- perhaps they had on-line or tel. purchase problems.

10.description: BUYER BEWARE! I purchased a 10 lesson package with them and had only used 6 or 7 to date. When I stopped in today to see exactly how many lessons I had left I was told by the Owner that the Pro who had given me the lessons was no longer working there so I was out any remaining lessons. I was shocked and said that my purchase and receipt was from ProLine Golf, not the particular Pro himself. The owner then said "it was just rung in our cash register but the deal is with him".  Huh?!?! That makes zero sense - so basically if you buy any lessons there and that particular Pro leaves, you are out of luck. Solid business policy...

5.description: Gabe is a great teacher, I recommend him to anyone from beginning golfers two more experience golfers.I've taken many lessons from him and I always come away with a better understanding of my golf swing which allows me to play better golf. His understanding of the game is impeccable , he's teaching mannerisms are relaxed and comfortable don't be afraid he might laugh at you but it's only because he loves what he does!! (Bombing it pass my weekend playing partners!!)

11.description: Awesome place to work on your game! Great brand new practice aria! Staff super friendly and customer service amazing. I'll recommend Proline to all my golf buddy's !

22.description: This is a one stop shop for the golf enthusiast in your life!  With Christmas just around the corner its a great place to find gifts!  The prices are pretty reasonable.  CHeck out their website too, its got some great deals!

0.description: Gabe helped me out with wedge loft adjustments during a practice session shortly before a golf trip. I really appreciated the friendly customer service. There are plenty of hitting bays so ample room to practice when the weather isn't cooperating. If you love golf, then you should check this place out.

20.description: A great store for anything golf related. Plus they have 2 adorable chiuahas (I don't know how to spell that).

19.description: This is a one stop shop for the golf enthusiast in your life!  With Christmas just around the corner its a great place to find gifts!  The prices are pretty reasonable.  CHeck out their website too, its got some great deals!

2.description: I would NOT recommend booking any sessions at Proline Chicago. When trying to schedule (after I already paid) they wouldn't return any of my emails for two months. When they finally did we scheduled my next session. I showed up only for my trainer to completely blow me off and not show up! The staff called them and covered for him and gave me a free towel. They told me he would contact me to reschedule...he never did. I finally insisted on another instructor to finish my sessions.I wanted to keep working with Proline but Chicago has no shortage of golf facilities and I'm now going elsewhere.

18.description: In order to buy Japanese forged Miura clubs, the customer has to go through Miura's dealers and has to buy shafts and grips from that dealer. ProLine Golf did the poorest job possible as the grips were the wrong size and the shafts were the wrong lengths without consistent increments. Not wanting to put myself in their hands again, I had my guy re-shaft and re-grip the clubs. When I returned the shafts and had ProLine Golf verify the errors, I asked for my money back on the shafts and grips. I was offered less than half of what I had just paid. Wanting to preserve some value, I had to send in the club heads to get their shafts re-installed. And I had to pay all return shipping!  Run don't walk from doing business with ProLine Golf. And while you are at it, pass on Miura clubs. They offered no help and hid behind the dealer, whom of course they had chosen. By not selling club heads only, Miura has disqualified themselves from the custom club category. They just make expensive clubs with no quality control. And ProLine Golf does not have the craftsmen and service to be in the game.

13.description: I've had nothing but good experiences with Proline Golf. They're knowledgeable, and professional. They're really good.If they don't have it, they'll get it. I recommend them.

4.description: Gabe is an amazing teacher.  My girlfriend gave me golf lessons for Christmas from living social. I've never had any lessons previously, but seriously wish I did so years ago. From just one swing Gabe could tell you about 10 things you've done wrong and can pinpoint precisely how to fix your mistakes. He explains them in a way that makes so much sense when you try swinging again that it will forever improve your game. He even has a video golf app on his phone that he can quickly draw angles with to show you exactly where you have mistakes in slow motion.I'd absolutely recommend him to anyone and surely even the most avid golfers could learn a few improvements they never would have realized before.Going into the lesson, I'd bring up specific points that you're struggling on, and if not just say what you want to improve the most and start swinging.

6.description: Went into practice on the simulator and Gabe noticed that I was using a bad swing practice. He stopped and help me adjust my swing to correct a nagging slice.  Very friendly and knowledgeable - didn't know what to expect while I was there but was very pleased with the service.  Would - without a doubt - go back to Proline Golf.  Great place, lots of room and state of the art equipment.

15.description: My brother and I checked out Proline.  The people I met there were really nice and really seemed to know what they were doing.  I ended up backing out of actually going forward with anything there simply because of the cost.  My brother invested in a couple of new clubs and went with a package deal and has been very impressed with the results from his golf swing analysis.  For me, though, the services just seemed out of line with the cost and the equipment was nothing out of the ordinary.

7.description: I came in recently to have my clubs regripped after hearing good things about their work from a friend. Their work certainly did not disappoint and they had very good prices.Overall, it's a really relaxed, pleasant experience in the store. The employees are happy to let you try out the clubs and get a good feel for what you're buying. Their simulators are top quality and the employees are very knowledgable. This is a different experience from some of the larger golf stores in that there doesn't seem to be as much pressure to buy something after hitting it a few times in the simulator. The employees are serious about you having a good experience and coming out with the right equipment for your game.

8.description: I am a huge fan of Proline Golf. Near the intersection of Chicago Ave and Halsted, Proline offers lessons, club fitting, indoor golf and practice and a lot more. They have free parking and a friendly staff and real accurate golf simulators. I took lessons from the Manager Gabe Rios. He is definitely the best pro there and can fix your game. His laid back approach and ability to quickly diagnose and help fix my swing was great! I also attended a Men's Night which was really cool. Gabe had food catered and drinks served. He did a clinic for the people attending and put the Hawks game on the big screen. Afterwards, we all smoked cigars on the back deck and I truly enjoyed it.  This is the best Golf Shop in Chicago!!!

3.description: Friendly staff. Terrible selection. I'm sticking with Goldsmith/PGA Superstore.If you're desperate to find something, or just too lazy to drive to Downers Grove, then go ahead and try this place out.  They had a very limited variety of clubs and putters to test (didn't have a single Nike putter when I went there). If you're really into golf, and want to find a great selection of items, then head over to the PGA Superstore in DG.

14.description: Got some unique golf items you won't see at dicks or golf galaxy, like mizuno hats.

3.description: I see Kat for massage here..She's awesome!

1.description: I've seen a lot of people for massage over the years. I've been going to Kat for about a year now. I highly recommend her. She has changed how my back and shoulders feel, not just right after the massage, but all the time. Kat is a great find and at an affordable price. The Healing Room is a peaceful and quiet space, the perfect vibe for the great bodywork that I get.

2.description: Clean, calm, soothing space.  Lawata pinpoints the spots you need to work on, or can deliver the most relaxing full-body massage you have ever experienced.  She is an independent massage therapist, and is in great demand.  Book early and often, you won't regret it.

5.description: Loved the time, attention and quality of service given to us by the practitioners here.  Street parking can be a little bit of a challenge, but better than a lot of other downtown locations, and better than a pricey garage.

6.description: My fiancée bought me a massage on Lifebooker. This review is not going to cover the actual service provided because I didn't even get past the front door. I scheduled my appointment for Oct 15 at 5:30PM (I have the email chain as verification) and even sent an email earlier on the 15th to confirm, which was never responded to. I also called three times trying to confirm and none of calls were returned. Since I had the email that backed up my appointment time, I still decided to go. Needless to say, it was a worthless trip. I stood outside the building knocking on the door for 10 minutes before Lawata Brown, who was going to perform the massage, answered the door. She had scheduled another appointment and offered to reschedule, but I am not going to waste my time to travel there again. I hate it when my time is not valued, especially since I am a customer. I don't expect anything more than I pay for. What I do expect, is if you offer a service, at least be competent in running your business. Scheduling should be the easy part....

7.description: The Healing Room is a lovely space that is very nice and quiet becuse the therapist work by apointment only.  You won't find a snoby lady at the front when you show up and there will not the the heavy smell from that chick getting her roots done.  When I go to the Healing Room for a massage I see Charlotte Phillips.  I love my visits!!!  Charlotte is always very professional and puts me at ease.  I work in a high stress job but I almost always get so relaxed I fall asleep during a massage.  Plus, she keeps records of what we have worked on and where my problem spots are so I don't have to tell her everytime.  Give her a try and you'll be back.

0.description: Lawata Brown is my go-to Massage Therapist. She is fantastic and I would definitely recommend her.I met Lawata last year after purchasing a Lifebooker Loot massage package. It was easy to set up an appointment. I prefer email and that's how we scheduled our first meeting. I've seen her many times since then.Lawata's space at the Healing Room is conveniently located in River West with street parking either in front of the studio or around the block. I've gone to see her on different days at various times and I've never had an issue finding a spot.  Her space is very clean, quiet and calming. I like the sound machine that she uses in the massage room as I find it to be relaxing. Some people may not like it, but I'm a fan.Lawata is very engaging and passionate about her career and is educated on various massage techniques.  When meeting and interacting with her, you can also tell that she leads a very healthy lifestyle. Throughout my massages, Lawata asks the right questions and applies the right amount of pressure as needed. If I have any trouble spots, she focuses on those to ensure that everything is worked out. She also makes sure that I am comfortable at all times. I have often fallen asleep on the massage table because I am completely relaxed. When I get up, I always feel more energized. She's great!Please Note: This is my first review. I often use Yelp and other reviews to get information regarding different businesses before frequenting them.  Before purchasing my LIfebooker Loot, I researched Lawata and found this link that describes her services: youtube.com/watch?v=rbps…

4.description: I used to be a regular at Urban Oasis; however, I decided to try the Healing Room because there was a great coupon on Lifebooker. At first I purchased a single visit because I wanted to experience the service before committing to more. I used the 1st voucher on Sunday, July 15th. And, I was sooo IMPRESSED with Lawata's expertise and technique that I purchased the maximum number of 3-visit vouchers that Lifebooker allows immediately after the appointment; and I have since purchased enough of the 3-visit vouchers to get weekly massages until May of 2013. In fact, I have a standing appointment with her every single week! OMG! I just did the math. I've been there 13 times since the 1st visit and I have ALWAYS been pleased with the service. (I had to cancel 2 appointments due to illness and workload.)She consistently goes above and beyond - whether it's the mixing of techniques, the use of just the right fragrances, the right balance of hot and cold, etc. And, most importantly, the persistent pain that I that had in my left shoulder for over 6 years is dissolving for the first time.I'm a HAPPY customer!

58.description: Great neighborhood place! Great beer selection and food to match. Nothing beats a place lit by red lights!

56.description: very friendly staff that does a great job with service.  daily specials are a plus and on the rare occasion, you may find that they have zombiedust brew by three floyds.  stop in there during the summer when the front windows are open and you get to hear some nice sounds from the motorcycles outside.  pool table in the attached room.

29.description: Great bar if you like good music, a decent beer list, and surprisingly good bar food. Try the buffalo chicken sandwich - it's hard to beat.

42.description: Good beer selection and pretty good food for a bar. They usually have a movie on and the atmosphere is loud, I'd recommended Five Star for a group.

23.description: This is what a bar should be.  Good draught beer selection.  Fantastic burgers and great daily specials.  Rail whiskey is Old Crow, a delicious bourbon than isn't easy to find in Chicago. Neighborhood vibes and beautiful bartenders, what more could ask for?

47.description: Friday is pop punk night! This place is pretty decent. We always go with a large group of friends, so we normally have a good time. I've never eaten here, but the drinks are pretty much the same as any other bar. I come to Five Star for the atmosphere and the music. Pretty neat hipster hangout.

8.description: I had a french onion dip and my wife had a turky burgar. Both really good.Service was great. Friendly, quick, and very helpful.Beer choices were awsome. Its hard to find gumball head on tap in chicago. Aslo glad they have a huge bourban selection, moscow mule, old fashion, etc.. A little pricy for shots but its worth it every once in a while.Also had 3 dollars shot special though.The environment is cool.Ill defiantly be a regular here since im a block away. Just not on weekends so its not so crowded.

31.description: The food here isn't bad but it's not that great either. Certainly nothing to go out of your way for but since I live close I go here quite often when I want something other than tacos . The service here has always been pretty good. The stripper pole and naked picture in the bathroom are pretty tacky. This place is full of hipsters who I generally find annoying but maybe not as much as 'bros' . This place also fancies itself as a sort of biker bar....think Wild Hogs

34.description: Men's Bathroom art, semi private room w/ stripper pole, rock music, and  waitress/staff made for a great 1st experience. Even the bouncer was nice.

16.description: I often think of these pork nachos.  Truly amazing.  It's a little pricey and the rest of the food was just okay so get a few drinks and that pork nachos and you'll be set.

13.description: Great neighborhood bourbon bar with a diverse menu. And it totally made me laugh that they carded me, but the server said they card everyone. Darn.I had a lovely old fashioned and a veggie burger. And both were really tasty. The table shared the curry poutine fries (and I of course immediately texted Canadian Jennifer to tell her). My friends had the French dip, the panzanella salad (after lamenting the removal of the amazing veggie chili) and the a special steak dish. Everyone liked their food...except for salad which was kind of boring.Our server was great and the atmosphere is inviting. Plus TVs if you need to watch sports etc. And my old fashioned was only $9.

11.description: Good Bloody Mary and GREAT Poutine (vegetarian). Very friendly, attentive staff and the vibe was fun. Bondage barbie dolls hanging from the lights - hilarious.

39.description: Food is good.  It's a hipsters paradise in there.  Beer selection is good.  Decor is awesome.

37.description: I live next to the bar and come here often. They have a great beer selection and the food is pretty good.  I guess just regular bar food, tasty and greasy, nothing too special.

0.description: The review is in the name. Wait. Has someone else already said that?  Well, this place is in a cool little pocket of Chicago between Nobel and Ashland. Close to flo and beauty bar. It's a cool strip and it looks like some new places are going in. Anyways. This bar is great. They have a really comfortable space, cool bartenders that remember you the second time you walk in the place, great beer selection, decent bar food selection. They are a whiskey bar, so try the old fashioned as well if you are in the mood.

38.description: Came here with friends after a climbing session to grab a bite to eat. A very solid establishment with a large beer selection, tasty appetizers and entrees all normally priced for this area of Chicago. It's casual, it's open late, it's average-to-loud noise level with TVs throughout, and their food is pretty good. When I was there, their decor included naked barbie dolls hanging by strings off the lamps above. Edgy, but a little weird. I think the place would have been just good without.I liked their poutine fries - but it's a strong, soft cheese - so if that's not your thing, pick something else. That's down my alley so I liked it, but some of the others that tried it - not so much. I'm not normally in this neighborhood so I generally wouldn't frequent this place, but if it was suggested again, I'd be down to go back. Their beer selection is solid.

51.description: Happened upon this little gem after dinner on a Saturday night. Great vibe and fun music... Just a fun time, check it out!

27.description: at times some of the best music, at times some of the worst.

32.description: Second time here.  We followed our friends that were participating in the Chiditerod.  Crowded, loud, interesting decor (ex. color bust of Elvis' head), somewhat awful music choices at times (Sir Mix-A-Lot's "Baby Got Back" is lame, frat party fodder), good cocktails (Sazeracs and Old-Fashioneds especially), and lots of greasy, highly indulgent food options (poutine, pulled pork nachos, fried pickles, etc.).  Large bar spans the majority of the room, with seating around its perimeter.  Booths line the bar's walls, and high-top tables are interspersed along the windows that front Chicago Avenue.  I've been back and I'd come back.

54.description: This place exudes pure class. I am always greeted with a giant bear hug from the door guy who usually engages me in a stimulating conversation about existentialism while I mill over my perfectly made bourbon in a glass. The bartender on Sunday nights, pretty brunette with tattoos and a badass T-Rex shirt is the best! Her infectious energy and delightful sassy demeanor make for my favorite kind of bartender. I saw some other patrons giving her a hard time for charging them for their drinks. I would have probably had them kicked out but I lack the type of grace and compassion that the Dalai Lama and employees at Five Star share. The other guy that helps behind the bar when it gets busy, I think he's the manager, is quite friendly and I like the way he talks. He should be on the radio. They just got a great new chef and the menu has matured to more than just bar food. My advice: go to Five Star on Sunday nights (or any night), challenge me at pool (you will lose), and don't drink Jameson/Bailey's shots unless you transport yourself to Wrigleyville circa 2002.

48.description: Chill, casual bar with great specials. No frills, leave your ego at the door-type place. Nothing spectacular about it, but also nothing all that awful about it either. I enjoy coming in for the hot chicken wing specials - I have yet to find a nearby special that awesome! The beer selection is pretty dope and they have tons and tons of booze available if that's your poison. Also, I appreciate that they are a "rock bar" and usually have solid tunes on in the background. Only knock I have is that all their whiskey prices are for a shot! If you were going to charge me $2 extra for neat or on the rocks, why didn't you inform me before you poured? Deceiving business practices = not cool, guys. Come for the beer and wings!

44.description: Surprisingly good food. Duck Reuben is off the chain! Hope they keep that on the menu.

24.description: It was a gorgeous day perfect for outdoor eating and trying a new spot, and Five Star Bar was the lucky winner for my Saturday lunch. I wanted to sit in the sun, but my boyfriend and I compromised on a table inside right next to outside. The doors were all open so it felt like we were eating in a covered outside eating area. Our table was also conveniently located to the all the chalkboard menus listing all the Specials. My eyes gravitated to the Frozen Mule and the Open Faced Pork Belly BLT. I had been debating on Moscow Mules and Vodka Gimlets and typically choose the latter and kept telling myself that the next time I'd get a Mule and this was the perfect treat in a frozen cocktail version, nonetheless! The buffalo wings were the standard and pretty good. I like mine a bit spicier, but maybe I can request that next time. The Pork Belly BLT was unique and it was tasty but I have mixed feelings on this as I wasn't sure if they gave me a bundle of their Romaine lettuce by mistake. I almost thought that they just forgot to break a few stalks off. I just accepted as it was. I was tempted to go to the back area just to see check out the stripper pole that was mentioned by other reviews and take a spin on it for shits and giggles, but then shot that idea down as I didn't want to get judged for it. I probably would also need quite a bit more liquid courage before I got to that point. What was extremely impressive to me was our waitress. I think she was the only one and had such a positive attitude and she was so on top of everything. The drinks got refilled and she gave me a head's up when the machine for my frozen drink would take a few minutes. As busy as she was she checked up on us and was super sweet. Prices are reasonable. What a great neighborhood bar.

7.description: Best..wings..ever! Now at 50cents a pop on Wednesdays, they're still worth it. I love em because they remain crunchy even after they're tossed in the buffalo sauce, not that microwaved soggy crap. The place itself seems to have died down crowd wise over the years, I guess the craze is over. Still a good spot to catch a game & grab a bite.

49.description: Great place to come for a casual bite to eat with cheap beers.  I think they have food and drink specials 5 days a week (Sun-Thur) and you can stretch out your nightly budget.The crowd is pretty neat -- bikers to hipsters, to your suits after work.  Food is above average for a bar and again, is decently priced.Come here if you want to hang and have less care for the rest of the night.

40.description: Wednesday night's wing special hit the spot with $2 Tecates. Hip hop and soul music on the speakers. Good vibes.

53.description: 5 Star Bar, 5 star review and 5 year GiGi!!  Excellent and perky was Gi Gi - service was A1.  Can't beat $2.50 Lone Stars sitting in the sun and those $1.50 gringolandia tacos that remind me of Jack in the Box. Just the right amount of grease and crunch.  I'll be going back from some more...Groovy curved bar - but I like being outside after this winter.

30.description: Hands down the best wings in west town. Chill Vibe. Good music. Streamlined menu. Creative brunch specials and creative bartenders.

46.description: Went in Sunday 9/17Sat at the bar and there was such a strange odor, it honestly was difficult to eat and drink,  I guess they had free iced margaritas looked like a group was there for that,  legit kids running around the bar. It was ok

1.description: I want to give this place 5 stars, I really really do.  However, I can't.Everything about this place is awesome.  It's right behind my house, it has tasty tacos (get the one's with pineapple.. so yum!), and it has an outdoor patio for the summer.Here's the problem.I've been there twice: Once for Wing Wednesday, and once for Taco Tuesday.Wings were good, very good actually.  They were cheap, only thing is you can't do carryout. Bummer.Tacos are delicious.  The problem is the service.The waiters/waitresses are a little on the dismissive and rude side.  That's a bummer.When I went for Taco Tuesday, I had specifically asked the price for tacos and how it worked, so they told me, and I ordered 9 tacos to eat (by myself).  Well, turns out that she charged me for the price of regular tacos, not the special price... so, I'm never going back there. Sorry guys, just not worth it for rude service and being charged normal prices on regular days.Note: I still tipped her well. Smh.

55.description: Super rad joint. Definitely a neighborhood spot, but they certainly welcomed my n00b ass into the mix. The fried pickles were homemade and on point (with the normal pinkish hot mayo dipping sauce, but on the hotter side) and the brand new vegetarian poutine was unlike any poutine I've had in Canada. But that's ok because it was still delicious with it's smokey BBQ fake meat and dense cheese.I will definitely come back. Not only for the great food, but for the fantastic beer selection and service!

9.description: My boyfriend and I are here pretty much every Wednesday for the fifty cent wings. The wings are delicious! However, The times we've gone, our waitress was either ride or not helpful which I could understand because the place does get busy. The first time we went, we ordered 20 wings and ranch. We only got 17 of our wings and no ranch. It wasn't a huge deal because we were full after we demolished the wings. But we were charged for the ranch we didn't receive and three wings we didn't receive. when I mentioned it to the waitress she said "you said everything was fine" and I replied "it was fine. It wasn't a huge deal. But we didn't receive all of our food so I'm not going to pay for food I didn't receive." And she walked away with an attitude. The second time we went was better. I love their wings so that's why I'd go back. My only suggestion is make sure you rember exactly what u order so you don't get jipped.

26.description: I come here at least once a week. The food is good (for bar food) and I love the tacos on Tuesday and Thursdays. The music is always on point. It's a great place to watch a game or meet for happy hour. Service can vary as there does seem to be a high turnover with servers- some are awesome and and some are not so great.

25.description: One of my favorite spots in Chicago! Hate that wing night has gotten so pricy but hell they are worth it at full price (best in the city and I know my wings, ask for them well done ) so why not just go on Sundays and get the deal on the burger instead?! The beer-mosa, GREAT music and very friendly tatted staff make my end to the weekend so much easier to deal with. Did I mention the yummy pulled pork nachos that can feed a small army.....

12.description: 5 Star Bar, 5 star review and 5 year GiGi!!  Excellent and perky was Gi Gi - service was A1.  Can't beat $2.50 Lone Stars sitting in the sun and those $1.50 gringolandia tacos that remind me of Jack in the Box. Just the right amount of grease and crunch.  I'll be going back from some more...Groovy curved bar - but I like being outside after this winter.

59.description: I love this place! I live in the neighborhood and this is my go to spot for a casual night. They have a great beer selection. Live DJ on Saturdays. Food is good too. Fish tacos are my favorite...along with fries & ranch (the ranch is bomb.com).

21.description: Not as crowded as it used to be. The wings are now $.50 on Wednesday. They do have craft beer on draft and the domestics in cans as well. The order came pretty quickly because they weren't busy. I still felt like the server was trying to kick us out of our table though as the night progressed. Oh well, I'll still be back to munch on some wangs!!!

17.description: So, not that I follow specific beers around the city, but I somehow found out that Five Star Bar had Mosaic Promise on tap (ok, through Beer Menus), so that is where I set out to journey to. We packed our satchels, set the compass, and off we went. It was kind of "hopping" for a Tuesday.  An unusual percentage of people in black from the neighborhood seemed to be gathered. The décor was a bit Vegas biker, but was cozy, anyway.  We grabbed a spot at the bar and kind of sat there mumbling to one another. We noticed the room with the stripper pole from where we were sitting and conjectured that more drunk guys had tried it out than girls.  Anyway, back to the matter at hand.  The beer was great, but pricey.  We had a grilled cheese with jalapenos, and a burger.  I feel the need to warn you that the pickled jalapenos are sweet, and ruined my sandwich. The burger, it was reported, was just ok.  The tab, was like 72 bucks before tip, which, as always, filled me with great regret.  So, don't drink a lot here.  That's all.

10.description: Wait staff awesome - food DISGUSTING! Come here for drinks; if you're hungry go anywhere else for food.

5.description: Sat a table for about half an hour without even getting drinks. Our server was informed we were there, dropped of menus, and then ignored us until her replacement showed up. Our actual server was very friendly and great at what she does. It's unfortunate that our terrible experience with her coworker will be what I remember about this visit. I've never been so blatantly mistreated at any location.

3.description: My husband and I frequent this place every blue moon, especially during football season each year.My husband and I had order two house special drinks which in some senses made up for the lost in translation with our food order to the kitchen. After receiving our snack of fried chick peas, and the server not really attending to us even before the bar became a bit busy, we both agreed to take into consideration that she was the only one serving the entire bar alone with the outside patio; so we were giving the benefit of the doubt. Unfortunately our experience was getting worse the longer we were at this particular establishment. After my husband asking after 30mins on the status of our food, and the server never once coming up to our table and expressing the issue with the kitchen. My husband was finally able to get the servers attention. Their excuse was since there was 15 tables/orders of food that went in at the same time that we had to wait, and the food would be right out shortly.Unfortunately after having to wait over an hour for a kale salad and a grilled cheese sandwich my husband, and I decided to walk away from our order. I think what put the icing on the cake was watching another table arrive after we checked on our order (after 30mins) who where only there for about 15-20mins were served their food before us. The other unfortunate situation was the server actually gave us an attitude for wanting to cancel the order of food, and close out the tab. I honestly feel they were lucky we were willing to pay for the drinks and the fried chickpeas. The irony is the kale salad, and grilled cheese sandwich seemed to miraculously appear once we canceled the order. Hopefully those that dare to venture this establishment go with caution, try going on a better day or time. However my husband and I agreed we will not be back.

35.description: Good food and good drinks. Usually they play good music and always have the game on. Love coming here in the summer on my motorcycle - there's always bike parking (that you can see from the bar), which is nice to make sure some skinny jeans wearing, overly emotional hipster jackass doesn't sit on your bike and have his picture taken to upload to instagram.

19.description: I went to Five Star on Saturday night with friends and was pretty surprised they had 5 Rabbit's 5 Lizard on draft and for just $6 for a glass. I saw this as a great deal and drank a couple. My friends had never had anything from 5 Rabbit before so I explained a bit about the brewery to them and I think they appreciated it a bit more. :) 5 Rabbit is my absolute favorite brewery in the whole wide world.Five Star has a pretty good mix of craft brews and domestic usuals.I've been to Five Star a few times before and always enjoyed the chill atmosphere however never have been big on their super loud music choices. It's still a pretty fair mix of hipsters, bros, yuppies, etc. Our server was great and we had a lovely time guzzling down brews.

28.description: One of the best burgers around! Great neighborhood bar with outdoor seating and pool table. Daily specials and $7 burgers on Sundays!

45.description: I'm here practically every Wednesday for the wings special. The wings are really good but what I love the most are the fried pickles, seriously the best fried pickles in town! Five star has quickly become one of my favorite places :)

33.description: Live right down the street and absolutely love this place. I was new to the block and didn't know where to go get some food so I walked in and immediately fell in love. Been here 5 times in the past month. Burgers are perfectly cooked, fried pickles are amazing, pulled pork nachos = yum. Best of all, service is great too. Perfect neighborhood joint.

43.description: Great neighborhood bourbon bar with a diverse menu. And it totally made me laugh that they carded me, but the server said they card everyone. Darn.I had a lovely old fashioned and a veggie burger. And both were really tasty. The table shared the curry poutine fries (and I of course immediately texted Canadian Jennifer to tell her). My friends had the French dip, the panzanella salad (after lamenting the removal of the amazing veggie chili) and the a special steak dish. Everyone liked their food...except for salad which was kind of boring.Our server was great and the atmosphere is inviting. Plus TVs if you need to watch sports etc. And my old fashioned was only $9.

2.description: Had a burger. It was nothing special. What was annoying is that I ordered a drink (gimlet), with a particular ingredient (Roses Lime Juice). What I got was a complex concoction that tasted more like lemonade. When I asked for the drink with Roses, the bartender than says they don't carry it, and she made her own special blend. That's great, but I know what I like, and what I want. I don't need a "mixologist" trying to re-create a classic. If you don't have an ingredient, just let me know, and we can save a lot of time and effort.

18.description: It was a gorgeous day perfect for outdoor eating and trying a new spot, and Five Star Bar was the lucky winner for my Saturday lunch. I wanted to sit in the sun, but my boyfriend and I compromised on a table inside right next to outside. The doors were all open so it felt like we were eating in a covered outside eating area. Our table was also conveniently located to the all the chalkboard menus listing all the Specials. My eyes gravitated to the Frozen Mule and the Open Faced Pork Belly BLT. I had been debating on Moscow Mules and Vodka Gimlets and typically choose the latter and kept telling myself that the next time I'd get a Mule and this was the perfect treat in a frozen cocktail version, nonetheless! The buffalo wings were the standard and pretty good. I like mine a bit spicier, but maybe I can request that next time. The Pork Belly BLT was unique and it was tasty but I have mixed feelings on this as I wasn't sure if they gave me a bundle of their Romaine lettuce by mistake. I almost thought that they just forgot to break a few stalks off. I just accepted as it was. I was tempted to go to the back area just to see check out the stripper pole that was mentioned by other reviews and take a spin on it for shits and giggles, but then shot that idea down as I didn't want to get judged for it. I probably would also need quite a bit more liquid courage before I got to that point. What was extremely impressive to me was our waitress. I think she was the only one and had such a positive attitude and she was so on top of everything. The drinks got refilled and she gave me a head's up when the machine for my frozen drink would take a few minutes. As busy as she was she checked up on us and was super sweet. Prices are reasonable. What a great neighborhood bar.

41.description: It's my neighborhood bar and I take every chance I get to eat and drink there. Beer is great and if I am not mistaken, they had zombie dust at some point which is... just plain awesome! I usually get a burger but not afraid at all of anything on the menu because they know what they are doing back there.

52.description: Stopped in Five Star Bar while apartment hunting on a Sunday afternoon. The Yelp reviews were pretty good, and there were a lot of cute dogs sitting outside while their owners ate. I am a bit of a cute dog stalker and like to be as close to them as possible at all times. I walked in with a friend to a half-empty restaurant and none of the staff acknowledged us for what seemed like a few minutes. Two bartenders chatted in a corner while looking at us, a waitress walked back and forth in front of us, and a busboy made eye contact with me and kept walking. They were not busy and they definitely saw us, so I was definitely annoyed. I almost left. Then the waitress told us to seat ourselves. Oh, ok. It would've been pretty cool if someone had told us that when they first spotted us.Service remained pretty meh for the rest of the meal. Their menu is standard bar food, perhaps a bit elevated. I had a cocktail that they had on tap-- blood orange something. It was sour and refreshing on a hot day, but I wish they would've served it with a slice of blood orange instead of a regular one. It's the little things... we started with the chips, guacamole, and pico de gallo. The chips were just how I like them-- thin, crispy, warm, and salty. Mmmmm. The guac was great as well, with a lot of lime and big chunks of jalapeno. My friend and I both ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich. This sandwich was huge! The chicken breast was legit-- huge, and clearly freshly deep fried and dredged. As a buffalo sauce connoisseur, I thought their buffalo sauce was average. It needed a lot more tang to stand up to the heftiness of the chicken.Overall, fine neighborhood place for bar eats and drinks.

50.description: Been here for the food and not the bar scene. My husband loves the wings. First visit we ordered carry-out. They were awesome. Returned and sat outdoors. Ordered a margarita that I didn't love. Resorted to a beer. But once again, the wings were amazing.

4.description: Came here after dinner with friends at butterfly. Love any bar that specializes in beer n bourbon. This spot has a nice appeal to it. It looks a little like a diner with all the booths. Theres a pool tale in the back, and interesting pics in the bathroom. Was only here for one drink but it was pretty chill with a group of friends

6.description: One of the best burgers around! Great neighborhood bar with outdoor seating and pool table. Daily specials and $7 burgers on Sundays!

22.description: Wait staff awesome - food DISGUSTING! Come here for drinks; if you're hungry go anywhere else for food.

15.description: Bev and I went for lunch after the Greektown Festival downtown, thought we try something different. We seated ourselves, grunge atmosphere, outdoor seating patio nice, waitress was nice & friendly,  we ordered draft Pabst $3 and Fried Chickpeas $2  which was delish great snack. Our food actually didn't take long - it was all burgers for $7 not bad for that price. I ordered the handmade veggie burger with fries/ pickle, Bev had a cheese burger with fries/pickle. The fries are very very salty (had to wipe of each one before eating) but otherwise good. Might go back again not sure!

57.description: Have only been here once but they have some of the best wings around, so this review is for them. Go get them!

20.description: Best..wings..ever! Now at 50cents a pop on Wednesdays, they're still worth it. I love em because they remain crunchy even after they're tossed in the buffalo sauce, not that microwaved soggy crap. The place itself seems to have died down crowd wise over the years, I guess the craze is over. Still a good spot to catch a game & grab a bite.

36.description: Five Star used to be 5 stars in my book. Awesome music, great service, amazing food. My husband and I used to go here at least once a week for food and drinks, but rarely go anymore at all. What has changed is the once kick ass menu has been drastically altered, and many of our old favorites are long gone with nothing intriguing in their place. No more samurai or mushroom swiss burgers, no more shrimp po boy. The once fantastic chopped salad has been replaced by the lame kitchen sink salad, an imposter that is impossible to eat without a knife as it's basically a bunch of whole lettuce leaves and a grilled, never cut all the way through chicken breast. Not sure what prompted the menu change, but needless to say it was a bad move! Please bring back the good stuff so we actually want to come back to our old fave neighborhood spot!

14.description: Thank you Five Star Bar for capping off a great bachelorette party for me (bride-to-be), and 28 very special girls! Although we did not reserve a table/room, the manager was super accommodating and gave us the back room which had a stripper pole...perfect for our girls night out!! :) Manager bought me a shot on the house...service was excellent....food was great (ordered the mac and cheese and pretzels w/ beer cheese). I think we ordered a few more apps but my memory wasn't the greatest at that point in the night. My bachelorette party was absolutely perfect, and the spontaneous trip to Five Star Bar turned out to be a fantastic idea! Can't wait to go back.

1.description: Your own art gallery that doubles as a Salon, with the Artist personally attending you.  You'll get tea, astrology advice, one on one consultation and an unbelievable haircut. Since Jeff's other passion is restoring art, his eye for color and shape is unmatched.

0.description: After 3 bad haircut in a row over 20 years ago I found Jeff!  I've been going to him ever since.  Recently a hairdresser and colorist asked me who did my hair - she loved it!  Jeff is the best - i've never been disappointed and that is saying a lot after all these years.

12.description: cut-THROAT liquors! Say hi to the crackheads on the way in, but pick up the pace on the way out.Booze selection: sucks unless you're a wino.  I've never seen so many bottles under $8 in my life.  They do have large cheap packs of cold beer, so it's a good party stop I guess.  But I'd really feel more comfortable buying cheap beer from a 7-11.  Ah well, gotta support the local liquor racket.  I'll be here again I'm sure....Oh and the bar has a sign "THE BAR IS NOW CLOSED (FOR GOOD)"   Swank.

3.description: Been coming here for7yrs, only cause it's close. The staff is great EXCEPT for the manager. You'll know here cause she's knee high to a cockroach. If your at. Of beer is $2,47 she'll take 3bills and .47c exact but not if it's all change so the home go w.o. never pays off lottery winnings and will bar you if you look crosswise at her.better go across Asland to loop lies.

1.description: If there's such a thing as a dive liquor store this is it. The cheesy neon sign, the minimal selection, sketch characters in and outside the shop, the dust, and the open area in the back of that looks like it used to be a sweatshop or something. Just a few of the attributes that make Rothschild far from a Binny's experience. It IS pretty darn cheap though so if you need just a plain old bottle of bourbon or crappy six pack it does the trick.

2.description: Dirty,  no selection,  over priced.  I paid with my card and they asked for my ID, no problem. However when  they wrote down my drivers license number on their receipt,  I thought that was super shady for a six pack.

9.description: I love me some Rothschild Liquor, but I'm deducting a star as I wish there was a bit more to the beer and wine selection.  The staff is usually quite nice, but some of the lottery junkies that loiter around can be annoying.Great place to load up for a party--$15 30 packs and ice.  What more could you ask for?  A WALL of liquors and some oversized bottles...oh there they are!Try to bring cash, because the credit card system in place is lengthy.

10.description: if you want low end liquor with the neighborhood drunks hanging out in front, go for it.  But please support better-operated businesses like Lush or The Noble Grape.  The neighbors and cops hate this place for GOOD REASON.

4.description: I hate to love this place. But I do.  It's so ghetto.  Normally, there's a rickety old dude standing by the doorway who's just peed himself and it's now running down the sidewalk and he wants to open the door for you.Yay!  Who doesn't love pee hands?The staff here is always friendly and have a sense of humor -  The beer selection is surprisingly not terrible at this wonderful joint.  It's open late and it's down the street from my house.  Yes, Rothschild, I'm giving you FIVE Yelp stars just for being you.

6.description: I will gladly pay a premium for high quality.  I will also pay a premium for an experience.Moving North of the Mason Grand ave. line from the South side i mistakenly thought that I would miss out on some of the grimier experiences in Chicago.  I was mistaken.  After working for twelve hours in the cold rain all I wanted was some hooch and a bath tub.  I double parked with the flashers on and entered The Rothschild,  the name invokes the aristocracy of Great Britain,  but the facade says get your buzz on here.Nothing here is to scale,  too bright,  the cieliongs are too high,  the beer area too small,  and the room goes back beyond my line of vision.  This back room will be investigated at another time,  I am quite curious as too what kind of dice games and other shenanigans break out.There is a cash station,  this is a special point of interest for me.  If you hang out near the cash machine you will here ghetto slang that is being pushed further and further West.  This was captured through a cell phone conversation,  "no mutha fucker,  $2 in yo savings,  and da checkin has $6!"  How bhout you get your mutha fuckin ass off the couch and show me how to get monies out a dis box!"   These same fine young ladies who were entertaining me were seen a weak later waiting for the Rothschild to open at 7 AM.Prices are not that cheep,  but the experience will get your nervous system in tune.  Rumor has it you can sit and drink in the back,  look for me,  the guy avoiding the inevitable gentrification.

15.description: it's not that bad!! it has it's charms. sure, it's a limited selection and it's old, but it's been there for ages! and when the tap room was still open, it was the CHEAPEST place for a drink in the world! granted you have to deal with some vagrants, but that's life!

0.description: Customer service is especially awesome - wish I would've taken down her name. She had blue eyes/contacts.It was Tuesday evening, felt especially stressed. Went in looking for wine, and asked what wine they had of highest content. The surprising reply I got was:Honey, if you wanna destress tonight, leave that frou-frou shit and get ghetto drunk. *hands me Buzz Balls drinks. These are the only balls you'll need tonight.Hilar.

5.description: They've got pretty nasty customer service. Came across a really rude employee that lacked any knowledge or patience for Rothschild customers. News flash, we're the reason why you have a job! Won't be coming to this store.

13.description: Yeah, I agree w/Molly.  This place is pretty boss, it just reeks old-school Chicago.  Rothschild is a Chicago staple.  It's pretty ghetto but charming in its own gritty and urban sense.  Pretty normal prices for beer & liquor.  I'll stop here if I'm in the neighborhood and want to get some BYOB.I'd be interested to hear about anybody brave enough to try some of their other locations... they seem to have the monopoly on some pretty choice selections of the West and South sides.  Yikes.

11.description: I had my birthday party here a few years ago. What can I say, I am one classy lady!

8.description: When I lived over here, this place was a godsend - the only place to buy booze within walking distance of my place, key since this neighborhood used to get totally sketchers after dark.The clerks were always nice to us and willing to special order things if they didn't carry it.  They also didn't laugh when my friend Cheree and I would come in every single day for two years and buy 2 packs of Camel Lights and 2 huge cheap ass bottles of wine - white for me, red for her. In fact, they spotted us on a number of occasions when we didn't have enough cash -they knew we would be back. Nope, they have nothing against alkie regulars over here.The bar, which is apparently closed now, was fun to drink in on occasion, but I had a stun gun, so I didn't worry about the patrons that actually looked like they could pry themselves from their barstools and try to savage/breathe/hit on you.  Friendly enough if you kept to yourself and cheap as hell, if a bit depressing.  A place where old guys come to drink themselves to death quietly, if you know what I mean.Great neighborhood booze-o-rama.

14.description: The one on Chicago Avenue is a death trap.  They are open until 10pm.  You need to get buzzed into the bathroom.  Be afraid.  Be very afraid.  If you said the wrong thing in this place, I would imagine that everyone in the bar would take turns shanking you...

7.description: I love this place because it is so out of place in my rapidly gentrifying neighborhood. It has lots of sketchy people outside, inside and working behind the corner. It has character. It has tons of dust and dirt on the shelves. But then again it also has at least 3 different sizes of every kind of liquor possible. Its definitely call Rothschild Liquors for a reason -- because it has basically no beer or wine. This is the kind of place I go to to get a flask size bottle of gin to keep in my stocking garter. (You know, for when I want to be Marilyn Monroe in Some Like it Hot.)

58.description: I wanted to give nail fetish a chance despite all the negative reviews.I actually called to make an appointment for an appt 1 week ahead of time, they told me they were booked for that day but they could put me ont he waiting list..and they actually did call me back!  So i went!The place is really very cute, LOTS of different colors to choose from which is always nice..the place is very clean, and they offer you water or sangria when you walk in (score!)The girl I had must have been new.  She was really really slow....BUT...maybe because I was in a rush I was getting flustered....2 hours for a mani/pedi??But i will say...it looks amazing.  Like impeccable.  She was very sweet, and really you could tell she was trying so hard to be perfect.  What I didnt like was the chairs where you sit for a pedicure.  I'm really short, like 5 feet even and I could sit in a relaxing position because she couldnt reach my toes....so that kind of stunk.  I dont know if I'll be back..but the one thing I advise people ...call like 1-2 weeks ahead of time (leave a message they do call bacK), for an appointment..and when you go, allow yourself 2 hours at least...so that you're not rushing like me!

56.description: I went in today for a mani/pedi and used the groupon I had purchased a couple of month ago. What a great experience - Jeta, my nail technician, was amazing, focused, detail oriented and very nice. I took her recommendation on the nail color I was debating and was very pleased with the outcome - beautiful hands and feet. Very clean place and nice staff - and YES, they do offer you water, tea or sangria the moment you enter the door. Will definitely go back here again!

29.description: Eh. Like most others, I snatched up the Groupon for Nail Fetish last spring. After leaving repeated messages, calling a bajillion times, and never hearing back from them, I was FINALLY able to schedule an appointment last week.Pros: Decent color selection, friendly staff, nice sugar/salt scrubs made in-house.Cons: Took me 9 months to make an appointment, weird semi-janky location (including the door being locked at all times), and my manicure was pretty chipped the next day. Pedicure wasn't super great, either. I probably wouldn't go here again, but it wasn't horrible.

42.description: ughhh horrible, i never even got to go, like other i got the groupon in APRIL and its SEPTEMBER.  i called and left numerous voicemails, they never called me back. their customer service really leaves something to be desired.

23.description: I absolutely love!!!!!! Love Nail Fetish I have been going there for years and hands down this is the best place I have been too. I do not go any where else, the products are all so good, the nail techs are all GREAT. They take there time, you are not rushed, they are not rude like some places that I have been to, It's in a good spot you don't have to worry about parking. I recommend it to all my friends, you have to pay for good services and that's what I do. I would rather have a Mani & Pedi for 1 1/2 then 25mins, everyone should go there.

47.description: I was pleasantly surprised by this place! I bought the groupon as well, this was one of the best mani/pedis ever, they were polite and the service was wonderful.

8.description: This is my go to spa. Very friendly staff. Ana is my fave. I have taken my best friends here when they're in town. I have even taken my mom multiple times! I have no complaints at all!! I recommend the no-chips!

31.description: i had a groupon for this place for months but i could never get anyone on the phone. i finally left a message and they responded within a day. when i went into the salon, there was no one else there and the place looked rundown. the benches were dirty and it looked as if someone forgot about the place for a couple of weeks. i was surprised, however at the oatmeal milk bath soak, the oatmeal scrub and the shea butter upgrade for my pedicure. it felt wonderful and made a big difference. i loved the shea butter so much, i bought a tub of it! the manicure left much to be desired and my nails weren't even soaked in water. overall, i think the place has potential but they have to try harder to provide professional services in a nicer and cleaner setting.

34.description: The girls here are so sweet and really gentle. They give the best manicure I've had in SO LONG! They are only getting 4 stars instead of 5 because they are so hard to get a hold of. I recommend booking at least a month in advance and don't expect a call back right away. If you can, go in and book your appointment and after you are finished with your manicure, schedule the next right away. They are busy!!

16.description: Eh. Like most others, I snatched up the Groupon for Nail Fetish last spring. After leaving repeated messages, calling a bajillion times, and never hearing back from them, I was FINALLY able to schedule an appointment last week.Pros: Decent color selection, friendly staff, nice sugar/salt scrubs made in-house.Cons: Took me 9 months to make an appointment, weird semi-janky location (including the door being locked at all times), and my manicure was pretty chipped the next day. Pedicure wasn't super great, either. I probably wouldn't go here again, but it wasn't horrible.

13.description: Oh boy - this place definitely suffered from being unprepared for a Groupon rush about a year ago. I have visited here pre and post Groupon and have actually had really great experiences. You definitely need to call ahead for an appointment. They only have a few women doing nail services so it's not really walk-in friendly. Now that the Groupon rush seems to be over, it's easier to call in and schedule an appointment. I really love the ladies who do nails here. They take their time and do a really nice job. They also introduced me to no-chip manicures, which I was highly skeptical about. The no-chips here lasted me about 2 weeks! Fabulous to get just before a vacation :) Despite the earlier fumbles, give this place a try. The space is clean and beautiful and your nails will look great.

11.description: $8 polish change?  I'm sold!The polish change includes basically everything that a mani does, minus the cutting of the cuticles!  Nice hand/arm massage.  Nice smelling scrub.  Nice!My manicurist was SO darling!  I was so indecisive about my polish color that she actually helped me weigh the pros and cons about each color.  Talk about service!  Also, we had this fun little convo about volunteering and other non-alcohol related activities. The salon itself is cute and cozy!  It's kinda hidden as it's on busy, busy Ashland, so keep on the lookout.  One plus is the abundance of street parking.  Give it some love, people!

39.description: Ok, I totally agree with the Groupon experience. I bought 3 of these and tried for months to get an appt but no one ever picked up the phone! I was finally able to booke one 2 months in advance, only to have my appointment somehow disappear from the books. BUT, after the hooplah died down, I called in early September for an appointment and they were able to fit me in the next day. The service was very good and I was happy customer. The Groupon experience almost made me give up on this, but now I'm excited I still have 2 more left! I'm hoping this place can make amends for the Groupon debacle.

37.description: I was nervous after reading the several reviews from Groupon users. I braced myself for poor customer service and my vm not to be returned. Maybe it's just because I waited so long to use mine and it's now October, but I didn't have much of a problem at all. I called yesterday and left a message asking to make an appointment for today. Someone called me back a few hours later, and while there was definitely some confusion on the phone regarding which openings they actually had, I was able to make an appointment at a time convenient for me. When I went in today, I wasn't very impressed with the decor. I didn't find it particularly relaxing or even attractive, to be honest. However, I was greeted right away and offered water and tea. I chose my polish colors, and then I waited about 20 minutes before my service provider, Ana, brought me back to the pedi chair. I was 10 minutes early, but it wasn't busy in there, so I'm not sure why I had to wait the extra 10. Anyway, the services themselves were pretty good. Ana did a nice job, was friendly, and didn't force me to talk. Overall, I'm happy. My nails look really good. I would go back there again if I couldn't get into my regular place for whatever reason, but I probably won't go regularly. Their prices are a lot higher than what I usually pay, and the atmosphere is not my favorite.

0.description: I feel bad that this place got so many bad reviews!  And most of them are from people that just couldn't get in with their groupon.  This place is nice.  Nothing fancy.  No neck massage like you get at some other places (at a higher price point), but the specials that they have at this place can't be beat.  I was in desperate need of a pedicure today, and I just happened to get an email from Nail Fetish about their $14 pedicures today only!  Perfect!  I've been here several times for mani/pedi, but only when they have specials (which you have to sign up for via email).  Each time, I've been very happy with the results!

38.description: So I finally got around to calling and scheduling an appointment for me and my sister. We both used a groupon for mani/pedis. My sister was quite happy with her service and her nails look great! As for me, I loved the pedicure. They give your legs this scrub down that leaves your skin very soft and moisturized. It felt heavenly! My nail technician, Yesenia(?), did a great job on the pedicure and she was very graceful about redoing one of my toes after I clumsily smudged it. I would visit again for the pedicure. The mani was ok. If you're particular about your nail shape, as I am, be very specific about it. I requested a rounded square, the exact shape my nails were already sporting. What I got was a purely rounded nail. I don't care for the shape at all but I may be a little more concerned with that than most people are.
