51.description: I wish I could write a review of this salon, but I can't because they REFUSE to answer their phones or call you back!!!  In this day and age, I am glad for them that they are so independent that they don't need the business or gain new customers. I, like many of the other reviewers, purchased a Groupon but have been unable to use it because this establishment  chooses not to  have any type of customer service or care about gaining new customers. Even if I didn't have the groupon, I still would not have been able to make an appointment because they don't return calls.. At this point, I am contacting Groupon to get my money back! They lose!

27.description: Like other reviews below I also had the same issue with trying to get someone on the phone to schedule an appoitment. I do have to say they always called back, but unless I was right by my phone, I would miss the call and then have to leave another message for them to call me back. It took me two days until I was able to talk with someone. When I did talk with someone, they told me that they were booked through the month of April for evening appointments. Unfortunately, I work during the day and had a groupon that expired on April 27. I had asked when their first available appoitnment was and asked if I could get an extension on my groupon being that I called one month in advance and that they were booked. The lady refused to do that and told me to call groupon to get a refund. I think this is poor customer service considering I am calling one month in advance. I am asking groupon for a refund and suggesting they do not use this company again.

32.description: I found this place through the Groupons I bought to use here.  I called and got a return call within a couple hours.  They seemed to have plenty of availability of appts.  I bought three and have used two so far. When I walked in for my first appt, I forgot the Groupon and they told me to bring it in the next time, very nice! I upgraded both times to the no-chip mani and was very pleased with the results.  I like the products they use which have shea butter in the lotions and creams.  The place is not big but comfortable. I like that they have movies playing behind the manicurists' back which I could watch considering the no-chip mani takes about 45 minutes.  The pedi chairs are not the massage chairs and for a 5'4" girl, I had trouble reaching foot rest.  Overall, I liked it.

54.description: I have not actually had the experience of getting a mani/pedi at Nail Fetish, despite what must have been 20 attempts to get an appt! I have to agree with all of the other ladies who also purchased the Groupon deal in April to try this place out. I was actually very excited to try out a new place, but was SO VERY dissapointed in the lack of customer service that Nail Fetish offers to their customers. I went through similar cycles as some of the ladies above with calling, leaving a message, and then getting a random call back days to weeks later during working hours when I couldn't answer my phone. To add to the frustration, I would return the call and have to leave a message again; starting the process all over again. After almost 4 months of trying to get an appt, I asked Groupon for a refund. It shouldn't be that cumbersome to get a mani/pedi! I will continue to go to nail salons that have a live person answering their phone or accept walk-ins. Wish I had a better experience.

48.description: I'm joining the chorus of annoyed Groupon purchasers.  I've tried getting an appointment booked since may, even requesting dates a month out, to no avail.  While I am sure they are trying to keep slots open for customers paying full price, my experiences just trying to get an employee on the phone are probably universal.I've spoken with an actual person only once.  Every other time I've had to leave a voicemail, and they either don't call back or do it only after several days have passed.  On 8/2, the outgoing message said they weren't open until 8/6, and don't bother leaving a message.  I called again on 8/7 and they still had the same outgoing message!I'm glad Groupon has great customer service - I got my purchase credited back - but this place seems to have bitten off more than they can chew, and their reputation deserves to suffer.

44.description: After having my appointment, I must say it was one of the best pedicures I have ever had. She took her time, and did a through, careful job. The place itself is very relaxing, a soothing environment. They still receive three stars because of the horrible experience I had trying to get an appointment... and I took a look at their prices ridiculous high.

24.description: Like everyone else I was a groupon customer as well and very turned off by how hard it was to get appointment.  I finally got one last Saturday.  I called and there was a cancellation.  The girls who return the calls try to be so pleasant and I know how frustrated they are because I was one of those frustrated customers on the other side of the phone.  I strongly recommend that people who have still yet to turn their groupons in to try last minute or day before.  So, I was slightly unsure of what my experience would be especially after reading the reviews on here, but I was very pleasantly surprised.  I must say that I had a wonderful relaxing experience.  The products they make in house are superb that shea butter made my feet fell so soft.  The scrub was fabulous on both my legs and hands.  I realized why they don't pick up the phone or why it was so hard to get an appointment.  There were only 3 women there doing nails and they don't stop what they are doing to answer the phones but when they were done they started returning calls right away.  They also only book a client every 1.5 hours to give t he maximum attention to their customers and a relaxing atmosphere.  We all have experienced when there are so many people waiting over your shoulder  and you feel rushed.  This did not happen here.  They explained they like to keep it a relaxing/spa atmosphere.  I also appreciated it when Ana did not stop my pedicure to answer the phone.  One week has gone by  and my nails still look great and my feet are as soft as ever.   I will definitely be going back after the groupon deal expires of course :) .

7.description: I love GROUPON.I HATE Nail Fetish. You have to book apointments more than a month in advance. Probably the worst customer service I have ever experienced and I didn't make it in the door. Its called the service industry for a reason, you have to make your clients happy so they want to come back to you. FAIL.

49.description: Not a happy camper.  I also bought a Groupon.  I've called at least three times now trying to make an appt.  Each time, I got a voicemail saying to leave a message and someone would get back to me.  They never do.  I've asked Groupon for a refund.  Nail Fetish is clearly not equipped to provide good customer service.

40.description: Blah Blah I'm sure you're all sick of people whining about their Groupon experience.  So I'll try to keep away from that topic.Well, just a little bit.  Many calls were made w/o answers or returns, walk-ins where I was sent away, etc.  I finally was able to make an appointment (2 months out and at the end of summer when I don't really care anymore, but whatever).Anyway, my nails do look pretty nice.  But such is always the case w/ freshly painted nails.  The experience was not fun at all.  It hurt!  A LOT!  My cuticles are all scabbed now from her cutting them till they bled.  and the massage?  It was like a joke!  She was just digging her knuckles into places you dont massage as hard and she possibly could over and over.  She actually was laughing at me cuz I was squirming from the pain!I also kinda felt like I was walking by one of those booths in the middle of the mall where they try and sell you stuff when you walk by.  Those really annoying ones where you look down or pretend your on your phone or something.  They interrupted my conversation with my friend every few minutes to discribe a new product to me and explain that its available for sale.  AND they had a person there making jewelry and she stopped over to introduce herself and her business and make me take a look at that.  Really?  I just want my nails done guys.  Leave me alone and let me talk to my friend!

53.description: I am one of the many annoyed customers who purchased the recent Groupon promotion for the Signature Manicure/Pedicure.  I have been trying to get an appointment for about 2 months with much frustration of leaving messages and being put on the waiting list. I was able to get in the same week I called at the last minute due to a cancellation.The salon itself is very cute, clean and inviting with a relaxing atmosphere. I waited about 15 minutes before starting my pedicure. The leather pedicure chairs were beyond comfortable (although far from the tub so for the shorties like me, I had to add an extra pillow and scootch down in the chair just so my feet would reach the pedicurist - kind of annoying) and they offered my water right away. The homemade scrub they used was great and felt amazing!This is NOT a place to go if you are looking for a quick, 45 minute in and out mani and pedi - my technician Yesenia took her time and did a nice job, but I was there for over an hour and a half. If you're not in a rush, this was a great experience and they did a nice job on my nails. (On the plus side, they had You, Me and Dupree playing on DVD on their flat screen TV so that kept me entertained for a while.)I probably won't be running back due to my horrible experience with trying to make an appointment - nobody picks up the phone, so I don't see how I could schedule an appt in the future, especially if you want same-day service. (On the plus side, it's been almost a week since my manicure and my nails still look great with barely any chips.)

30.description: as many other yelpers have commented - the groupon was a total disaster.  it was difficult to get a hold of anyone at the salon, countless messages left, etc.  the salon was somewhat rundown.  the person who worked on my nails had shaky hands and poor customer service skills.  at the end of my appointment nail polish could be found all over my cuticles and on my hands.   i would never recommend anyone go to this place.

46.description: Guess what my review is going to say. Go on, take a shot at it. If you guessed: I bought a Groupon, called many times over many months, left many voicemails, never had any returned, actually walked in one day only to be told NO because of the Groupon even though they were empty, then you are correct! Or you are one of the many, many others that also bought a Groupon only to find out that Nail Fetish thought Groupon was like winning the lotto and they didn't actually have to do anything for the money. Best part was I left a message on Sunday for an appointment (without mentioning the Groupon) and they still didn't call back till Thursday afternoon. Alas I've had my money refunded by Groupon so now I'll have to resign myself to having voicemails returned in a timely fashion.I do wonder how much money from the sale Groupon holds back for refunds.....

1.description: Wonderful place! Very beautiful atmosphere. Never been to a nail salon this clean and uses gloves for pedicures! Highly recommend this place.

55.description: So I see that everyone or at least a lot of people were having the same issues with this salon.  I too, like a previous writer, bought this Groupon Promotion for a wedding I was going to be attending.  My friend and I both were making calls to make an appointment.  We called about a week in advance.  They did not ANSWER our call nor did they call us back.  We decided to show up, I mean how bad can it be right?  We get there, and there was a worker, sitting not doing a thing, then the receptionist came by and greeted us.  By the way it seems like she also does nails and was not doing anything either.  As we told her we tried calling for an appointment she blamed us for not speaking clearly on our messages.  Funny how both my voice and my friend's voice are so not CLEAR. We then tried to get a mani/pedi but as most of you have said, she informed us that their next appointment would be a month away.  I could not believe what I was hearing.  A MONTH FOR A MANI & PEDI, I can easily get elsewhere for the same price or just a few dollars more?  Ridiculous!  Must I remind you readers, there were "2" workers doing NOTHING, just sitting there reading a magazine.  Now I get it, they already have our money so they don't care.  However, it could have been a couple bucks more for tips and maybe some extra service.  Plus the referral to others.I'm coming up to my appointment now and are NOT looking forward to it.  Hopefully the service is worth it, but I must say, the venue and the location is not that spectacular.  I rather go somewhere by Lincoln Park or some trendy neighborhood than next to car dealerships and no other businesses walking distance. This review and others may seem mean, but if they're going to sign up for a promotion like this (Groupon), they should dot their I's and cross their T's before they  start to offer their services.  If they don't have the sufficient staff or can't deal with a promotion this big, DON'T DO IT.  It only makes your business suffer.  I am not making this up, the people have spoken.  See I haven't even gotten the service done and already I don't want to recommend ANYONE to go to this place.

9.description: Walked in without appointment to see if they could take me for a quick manicure. Two employees were doing each others nails and looked annoyed that I interrupted. Not the best attention to detail on the actual manicure part. Picked an Essie Polish that was pretty much bone dry. I offered to pick a new color as soon as I realized, but she said no. Instead, she kept adding thinner to the polish, and my nails ended up looking worse than if I were to do them myself. Very disappointed, will never go back!

26.description: Bought a Groupon for this place and just asked for a refound: getting an appointment in there is impossible! Very poor customer care. The most frustrating experience. Will not suggest it to my worse enemy.

25.description: I love GROUPON.I HATE Nail Fetish. You have to book apointments more than a month in advance. Probably the worst customer service I have ever experienced and I didn't make it in the door. Its called the service industry for a reason, you have to make your clients happy so they want to come back to you. FAIL.

12.description: Got the Groupon, had similar problems as others as far as getting an appointment. NOTE a few weeks ago Groupon actually emailed me and said this business was having trouble scheduling appts, and would refund your groupon if you hadn't used it yet - I would have done that, had I not already snagged an appt.Would not go back. Unfriendly manicurist, no one acknowledged when I came in the door, no one helped me move my stuff around with wet toenails, no dryers for hands or feet.Slightly warmer decor than other places in the hood, but way worse customer service. I will go back to Pinky Salon, but not to Nail Fetish.

59.description: I absolutely love Yesenia - and I had a wonderful experience here.  She did a fantastic job on both the mani and pedi - best I've had in Chicago actually - I think I've found my go to salon and technician.  Fabulous, relaxing boutique atmosphe with comfy chairs and incredible, homemade scrubs.Also thought I might comment on the group on debacle that appears to have everyone up in arms here - I had the group on as well and had no trouble getting an appointment.  I called and left a message and received a return call the following morning and they were able to accomodate my date and time request.  I think everyone needs to just relax - they sold over 4,000 of these, did you really think they could just fit you in the next day?  Simmer down and enjoy the pampering - this salon is totally worth it.

21.description: Worst. Customer. Service. EVER.I left about 10 voicemails to try and schedule an appointment to use my groupon and never once received a call back. Not the best way todo business.

17.description: Guess what my review is going to say. Go on, take a shot at it. If you guessed: I bought a Groupon, called many times over many months, left many voicemails, never had any returned, actually walked in one day only to be told NO because of the Groupon even though they were empty, then you are correct! Or you are one of the many, many others that also bought a Groupon only to find out that Nail Fetish thought Groupon was like winning the lotto and they didn't actually have to do anything for the money. Best part was I left a message on Sunday for an appointment (without mentioning the Groupon) and they still didn't call back till Thursday afternoon. Alas I've had my money refunded by Groupon so now I'll have to resign myself to having voicemails returned in a timely fashion.I do wonder how much money from the sale Groupon holds back for refunds.....

10.description: I have been coming here for a couple of years and I love it! I'm dissapointed that they have bad reviews - all because of their groupon. I personally love them! Love their service. The girls are so friendly and I love their selection in colors. Their no chip selection is also fantastic. Everything always looks so clean. It is also helpful that they make appts. I hate waiting to get my nails done and rather book with them ahead of time to avoid the long wait at other salons. I also love that they give you sea salt scrub to wash your hands and use the same for pedi's; it's so relaxing and refreshing! Their prices are also very consistent and inexpenive. If you're in the neighborhood you def have to give them a try! They usually have amazing promotions!

5.description: Perhaps, if you are looking for a spa where you will be pampered in white bath robe, this may not meet your expectation. But, if you are looking for a friendly, neighbor spa that also offers fabulous specials, Nail Fetish got your back!!!I've known owners for years and they are very friendly & professional ladies!  I never had problem making appointments. The place is always neat too!! That's very important!!! On the top of that, Nail Fetish got a variety of No-Chip colors that never makes me bored.  Both Anna and Yessi (sorry if I misspelled!) have years of experiences with No-Chip services, and i guarantee you will be happy with the results!!

3.description: This is my neighborhood spot. I love it, the girls are nice and they do a good job!

35.description: Went here last week (finally) to use my Groupon I have had for a few months.  I have tried to use it before, but got voice mail answering machine and rarely got calls back to reschedule.  They were closed for a significant part of August, but whatever.Once I got in, I was happy with my service.  My mani/pedi technician Ana was really friendly.  Quiet at first, but if you open up and talk she will do the same.  We had a nice conversation while I was sitting in the massage chair and getting my legs pampered.The nails were great as well.  They had a cute movie on in the background as well, and didn't seem to rush clients in and out at all.It's not the cutest place in the world, but they do a really nice job.  Mike has lasted over a week without chipping which is probably a new record.  So even if you don't get free wine and less gossip from going here, you get quality service.I'll be back even without a groupon!

19.description: In April, I bought a coupon from Groupon for a mani/pedi and I have not been able to get an appointment.I bought the coupon specifically to use in the summer months for wedding related events that I will need to attend.  I am currently trying to schedule a manu/pedi for the end of July (a full month ahead of time) and was told that there are very limited appointments available.  Furthermore, you never get to speak to anyone.  You have to keep leaving a message, then wait for a return call (which you never know when is coming), and the cycle continues.If you don't have the resources to run a promotion (like the one on Groupon) then you shouldn't run the promotion.  I live a block from this place and once I use the coupon, I do not ever plan on coming back.  Its just not worth it - no matter how great the mani/pedi.

28.description: rude rude people....couldn"t pay me to go here!!

45.description: I know that I'm just beating a dead horse, but I wanted to be sure and review my experience so the star rating is accurate.I, too, bought the infamous Groupon for a mani/pedi for $24. Now, I bought this Groupon in April. I called to use it for a wedding I was attending in May. No go. I called back in a few weeks to schedule an appointment for a wedding in June. No go. I called back for an appointment for a wedding in August. You guessed it, no go! It wasn't like I was calling the day before, I gave them at least a week's notice and have a really flexible schedule. I've been getting my nails done for a decade now (yeesh!) and have never run into this problem before. I finally decided it wasn't worth playing phone tag anymore and decided to ask Groupon for a refund this morning... more than 4 months later. There are plenty of other nail places in the city... you'd think Nail Fetish would realize this and try to be more accommodating.

33.description: If I could give 0 stars, I would. I purchased a Groupon for this place earlier this year and have never been able to use it. Every time I have called to make an appointment, they can never accommodate my request. I have tried 3 times to make an appointment with no luck. I'm just going to get my money back from Groupon because this place is not worth my time. I'd much rather give my money to a place that actually wants my business  I'm not surprised by all of the other negative reviews people have posted. This place needs to learn Business 101, Customer Service 101 and any other 101 courses that are out there.

43.description: Quality manicure and pedicure. I FINALLY got to use my Groupon and it was worth the wait. I wasn't 100% sure I'd like this establishment - the cushy exterior I was expecting to see when I arrived was not there, but in its place was a friendly place I would gladly visit again. I had my services done a week ago and both my fingers and toes still look great (I didn't even get the no-chip service).

2.description: Monthly special of $30 mani-ped, sold! My 6pm appointment went pretty smoothly. I was offered water in which I partook. Nothing fancy here, no UV lights for drying or fans even. You just wait it out and get sprayed with the aerosol nail drying can. I like the pressure of the massages for both my arms and legs. The girl that did my nails did a nice job. I like knowing that I can come here now, especially since I live so close by. The have various specials that they email you about if you get on their distribution list, and they have a punch card as well.

18.description: Could NEVER get an appointment with Nail Fetish!  I called and called and called.  I left message, after messgae, after message.  NO RESPONSE!I decided that I would:1.) Cancel my Groupon (which is simple....just call Groupon customer service...the best customer service in the world!)2.) Write this review on YELP to help others in my situation3.) Patron all the other wonderful mani/pedi spots in Chicago!P.S. The only reason I didn't give only 1 star to Nail Fetish was that I've only given a 1-star review for the US Postal Office, and I don't feel ANYONE can be as bad as the USPS :-).

41.description: I was a Groupon customer - it did take a little effort to make an appointment (which downgraded this to 4 stars), but once I was there, my experience was wonderful! The mani/pedi took almost 2 hours, but that was probably because my salon technician saw that I was happy to sit there for half an hour after she was done to watch Mean Girls on the TV. My pedicure lasted me 3 weeks, and my manicure went 5 days without chipping (a record for me!). The experience was very, very relaxing and I left there with a zen that I have never had after a mani/pedi. Usually I feel rushed, but Nail Fetish did an amazing job. I would probably go back again, but I have a feeling that I won't get an appointment anytime soon... maybe next year?

52.description: Could NEVER get an appointment with Nail Fetish!  I called and called and called.  I left message, after messgae, after message.  NO RESPONSE!I decided that I would:1.) Cancel my Groupon (which is simple....just call Groupon customer service...the best customer service in the world!)2.) Write this review on YELP to help others in my situation3.) Patron all the other wonderful mani/pedi spots in Chicago!P.S. The only reason I didn't give only 1 star to Nail Fetish was that I've only given a 1-star review for the US Postal Office, and I don't feel ANYONE can be as bad as the USPS :-).

50.description: What's the point of having voice mail and email when they end up in a black hole?I've been trying to get an appointment giving choices of a 15-30 day  lead time to respect the flooding of customers from the groupon deal.  I think this is more than reasonable.  Last communication was a vm I left 6 weeks ago and counting.  To make it easier, I sent an email to accompany the vm I left 6 weeks ago and still radio silence.  Since so much time had passed, I decided to give it another try.  Who knows?  Maybe my messages got "lost" in the shuffle with everyone else.  I left a vm on a Sat in hopes of a Thursday appointment.  Still nothing - is it that difficult to return a 10 second phone call of a simple "yes" or "no" when I left the date and time I wanted to come in and they had 3 business days to call me back?   Clearly my money isn't worth their time which is fine by me.

4.description: I've been going there for years. Ana and Yesenia are friendly and pretty much great! They keep the place clean, organized, their business has been going for a few years now for a reason. So I highly recommend them, my manicures and pedicures last because they take their time, and both Ana and Yesenia are good at what they do.

6.description: My appt was at noon. I was seen on time. The place was clean and the ambiance was very nice. Yesenia gave me an awesome pedi and no chip mani. She's great! If I had to criticize one thing it would be that they have a limited "no chip" selection. They we out of most of the bright colors on the color chart.

22.description: I had a groupon too but I already expected that making appointment would difficult from the amount sold.  I can't hold that against them considering I am getting a deal.   David did a great job and really took his time with my mani/pedi.   The mini hand and foot massages were short but very enjoyable with nice pressure.  He was attentive to details and really took his time.

15.description: I have seen a lot of the bad reviews given to Nail Fetish and it is unfortunate because it is a good place to go.  I started going earlier this year and initially thought the owners were not very friendly but I understand they were going through a lot because of the "Groupon" fiasco.  Once I started going more frequently I found the place to be serene and the service to be good.  I like Yesenia for my no-chip manicure but Ana is just as good.  I would recommend the salon to anyone.  It is best you call to make an appointment instead of walk-in because there may be a wait.

57.description: I was really excited to try a new place in the city, and the website looked amazing- too bad you can't get anyone to ever pick up the phone, and they took down the online booking tool.  I'm not interested in waiting for days (really) for a return call only to miss it and have to call them back again.  Catch 22?  Why not hire someone for only a few hours to take calls and messages.  What a poor set up.  There are a million spots you can just walk right in anytime you want, I won't be waiting two months for a pedi- this isn't The Peninsula for heaven's sake!

20.description: Got the Groupon, had similar problems as others as far as getting an appointment. NOTE a few weeks ago Groupon actually emailed me and said this business was having trouble scheduling appts, and would refund your groupon if you hadn't used it yet - I would have done that, had I not already snagged an appt.Would not go back. Unfriendly manicurist, no one acknowledged when I came in the door, no one helped me move my stuff around with wet toenails, no dryers for hands or feet.Slightly warmer decor than other places in the hood, but way worse customer service. I will go back to Pinky Salon, but not to Nail Fetish.

36.description: despite so so reviews on yelp i purchased a groupon on yelp for nail fetish.  Let me just say this--NOT YOUR ORDINARY nail salon this was more like a salon.  Not only is this place stylishly decorated----the staff is extremely attentive.  My mani pedi lasted 2 weeks.  I could not be happier.  The only problem is that I moved to the burbs and nail fetish is just too far away :(....

14.description: I hate to write this review. I frequented this place quite often for pedicures. I loved that you could basically pull up - parking no problem - and get a service. Only had manicure once - I though the whole get up and wash your own hands was weird so I didn't do that again but I was going for pedicures every other week or so.  About May I noticed my big toe nail was looking weird ...at Nail Fetish she removed the polish and said "you have a fungus" and showed me how discolored the nail was and that it was detaching. I was horrified. I went to a podiatrist who additionally confirmed this - $599.00 later after 2 lazer treatments - tons of lacquer applied daily - 9 months later my toe nails are still messed up. I live alone, don't belong to any gym, and hadn't been to any other salon when this occurred so the only place I could have gotten this is nail fetish. I contacted the salon and they denied saying I had to have contracted somewhere else - I explained it was impossible but I offered that they had not lost a customer I know these things happen if hey could please just tell me what to bring so I have my own appliances. They were not interested. So it's unfortunate but now they have lost a customer. Just be careful for someone that is a little vain when it comes to my feet this has and continues to be a devastating experience.

58.description: Total hack jobs! They removed a mole on my arm and left me with a staph infection that caused scraring and pain over a year later.  They did nothing to address this other than giving me a perscription for the staph.  Not only that, my wife had moles reoved on her body and they left her seriously scared.We have both followed up with seperate dermatologists and both have confirmed that WPD should have used stitches for the wounds and failed to do so.Never going there again and I recommend you do not either!

56.description: Very nice and clean office. The doctor I saw seemed very knowledgable and gave me some great tips on achieving healthier skin. The wait time is a little bad. I was scheduled for a 5:30pm appointment and wasn't called in until 6pm.

29.description: I've been coming here for 6 or 7 years for my annual skin cancer screening and prescriptions for eczema. I love Dr. Meyer Horne - he is super nice and professional. I don't have major skin issues so I can't speak to that, but I've found this practice to be very well run. They are extremely busy so getting appointments takes a long time, but that works OK for the nature of what I need.

42.description: My review is solely based on my phone call to their office, and the waiting period to make an appointment in order to see a Doctor.  I appreciated the friendly voice on the other end. She was very professional and knowledgeable. She answered all of my questions patiently. I was impressed that I actually got a human being on the phone and not an automated computerized voice mail. For this alone, I give them five stars! Impressive. However, I was informed that I would have to wait over two months to get in to see a Dermatologist. I thought "WTF"! My issue will worsen during that two-month waiting period. No thank you. I cannot, NO, wait a minute, I will not wait over two months to see any doctor. This is unacceptable. Seriously, what kind of a business even allows patients to wait 2 or 3 months to see a doctor? Not a very smart one. I can understand having to wait 2 or 3 months for an appointment if it was 1814, but this is 2014. IMO, they need to add (hire) more doctors to their staff, so that they can schedule a patient's appointment within a reasonable period of time (less than one week would be nice). The two month or more waiting period is simply ridiculous. DISCLAIMER: My review is not based on the treatments that a doctor provides here. I am sure the doctors are excellent and provide a much-needed service. I am sure they are very competent doctors. I can tell from reading the reviews that the patients are very satisfied with the doctors and happy with the end-result.

23.description: This is my second review for this office and it hasn't gotten better. They charge you a large fee to provide you your medical records from the office. This is the ONLY medical facility I've ever encountered so far in my lifetime that charges a fee to send a copy of your own personal medical records to yourself or another physician. How is that even acceptable? Needless to say, I would not return back here. Very disappointing.

47.description: I can't even understand the poor reviews written previously.  Dr. Meyer Horn is simply the best Physician I have seen.  From his on time appointment keeping to his accessibility to discuss problems to his actual treatment.  He's the best in the city and this office is great!

8.description: I have been seeing Dr. M. Horn regularly for over 12 years.  He is a fine doctor.  However, his office staff and, particularly, the office manager leave a lot to be desired.  I have overlooked their rudeness for many years, as well as the fact that many times they don't answer the phone during their regular business hours.  Today, I was denied access to the doctor because I did not want to leave a credit card number on file with them.  In this day and age, when everyone is concerned about identity and credit card information theft, they should not be making this a condition to see the doctor.  My health insurance has always paid them for their services, other than the copay, which I've always taken care of on the spot.  Leaving my credit card information with them is unnecessary; I have never had to be billed after a visit.  I explained this to the office manager and encouraged her to look at their records.  She repeated that I would not be allowed to see the doctor unless I followed their rules.  So I left.  They have their rules and I have my principles.

31.description: I never give reviews if I haven't received service but I have to make an exception here. I called for an appointment because they are listed on my insurance company's list of doctors.  I called for an appointment to get a basic screening for skin cancer and was told appointments for screening will be April or may (3 or 4 months from now). I expressed my concern that if appointments are that difficult I would rather go elsewhere. It was explained to me that the long wait was only for cancer screenings but other things like acne are only a couple weeks. This scheduling hierarchy seems completely backwards to me. I need a dermatologist for other than this initial screening but I guess it will not be here.

34.description: This place is horrible.  1 month wait to see a real doctor versus Asst.  Poor customer service, rude reception staff, and Fast food type approach to medicine.  Will never go back and suggest looking somewhere else.

16.description: How did I end up here? Well....my facial Groupon at Avanti Skin Care was expiring so I called to make an appointment. I was then notified that Avanti was no longer in business and was bought out by Dermatology & Aesthetics of Wicker Park, but they were honoring the Groupons. Nice! My facial was excellent, but it was definitely different from other facials I have had in the past. This place is primarily a dermatology office, so when I got there it felt more like I was waiting at the doctor's office than a spa. Even when they came to get me from the "waiting room" it was funny when they called my name. I had a hard time getting out of the mindset that I was there for a facial and not a checkup.Once in the room she went through various questions regarding my skin care process and we got started with the facial. She did a really good job explaining products, but in between treatments she was I'm assuming making notes on the computer, which was a little distracting. Once the facial was complete she recommended some products and provided samples.When I get a facial I'm more into the relaxation part so I will probably stick to getting them done at spas, but I did appreciate the knowledge and treatment provided to me.

13.description: I had been going here for years but had a series of unfortunate experiences so felt compelled to let others know about it. I think in general one should think of this place as a glorified spa - I would not go here for more than minor cosmetic issues. I just don't trust Dr. Robinson as nice as she seems because of a few incidents. The biggest one happened when I went to have a pregnancy-related mole removed in April 2015 - Dr Robinson botched the procedure and it left a pretty bad hypertrophic scar on a prominent place on my chest. I returned three times to have it treated and she had some very young assistant inject the scar with cortisone after the doctor left the room. Instead of making it better, it actually got worse. Thankfully I then moved to Boston and went to see a dermatologist who treated the scar herself (imagine that!) and it disappeared with one treatment. I'm so angry that I wasted all those years going to see Dr Robinson - not to mention all the money I wasted on their spa products which they never failed to push at each appointment whether it was needed or not. I think it's fine to get a facial here - for anything that requires a real doctor, I would go elsewhere.

11.description: As a new patient, I would have expected better treatment as well as an attempt to inform me of a variety of things. Still looking for a new dermatologist, since I am not looking to be involved with a snotty office that has valet.

39.description: I took my son here when he was an infant to see Dr. Lio for his eczema.  Dr. Lio was very informative and everything he suggested and prescribed for my son's eczema worked wonderfully.The reason I'm only giving them 3 stars is because it's nearly impossible to get an appointment here to follow up.  I also tried to switch to this office from my own Dermatologist and decided to throw in the towel.  3-4 month waits for a skin cancer check?  No, thank you.

37.description: I have several skin issues, ranging from medical conditions (hereditary) to some strictly aesthetic/cosmetic concerns.  I have seen various dermatologists over many years (20+) and am so relieved to have found DR. NEHA ROBINSON and DAWP.She is the most thorough, informed and personable dermatologist I've ever been treated by.  I very much appreciate the way she explains in simple terms, my diagnosis and then has a discussion with me on the best course of action to take.  Dr. Robinson is on the conservative side as far as cosmetic treatments (botox, fillers, etc) go, which I personally prefer to a "you've obviously had some work done" kind of look.  The office is very organized, and the nurses are very friendly and attentive also.

0.description: The 5 minutes I spent with the Doctor were great and I ended up having a tiny spot on my nose that needed laser.  Although expensive (like all dermatologists). It did fix my issue and the laser technician was very nice.  I did really appreciate them being able to fit me in for the laser the same day and not making me come back for a separate appointment.

38.description: Horrible.  I went to this sham of a business and was fleeced then they ruined my credit w/ some ridiculous overages that I was trying to resolve w/ my insurance company.  $500 copay for removing some stupid mole on my shoulder that my PCP recommended I have looked at?  You have to be kidding me...  Don't waste your time and go anywhere else.  Office staff are horrible and then I was reported to creditors again a year later after never even being seen in some clerical error.. If you are a guy they will also try to up-sell you on hair pills as well even if you don't need them. Place is a joke and not worth their insane wait times either-

51.description: If you are a new patient, beware that it will take you months to get in here. Also I feel like a lot of times my appointments are rushed with the doc. They must always run behind because I usually have to wait 20+ minutes after my appointment time to get called back. Par for the course I guess. That being said, I really like Dr. Lio. Even though my appointment is somewhat rushed I do feel like he does a great job and truly cares.

27.description: Dr. Horn is amazing. He worked with me since I don't have insurance and made things as inexpensive as possible. He truly is a wonderful doctor and the facility itself is great.

32.description: Had a really good experience here. They were able to book my appointment a week in advance which I feel like is unheard of in Chicago - most places make you wait a darn month or MONTHS! My nurse was super friendly, knowledgeable, and professional and made me feel very comfortable! Final Verdict:I would recommended this place for sure to anyone looking for a dermatologist!

54.description: The best way to describe this office is a big sorority with girls with bad attitudes. Dr Robbinson walks in the room with her entourage of 2 nurses following promptly behind her, spends a whopping 3 minutes with you while barking at her assistants to type feverishly into their new age computer tablets. This is not a place that cares about their patients or treats them with any respect.

48.description: It took months to get in here for my 1st appointment, now after having worked with Dr. Lio on some skin issues I have I can't seem to get any follow ups!Getting someone to answer the appt line is an EXTREME RARITY and  getting someone to call me back to make the appt is JUST AS DIFFICULT. I have left several messages (they claim they will get back to you that business day). Dr Lio seems kind of rushed whenever working with me, but still thoughtful. I was interested in possibly getting some Botox done here and they wanted a $100 consultation fee which I found outrageous! I'm already a client and pay specialist fees with my top of the line insurance as it is. I think this place thinks too highly of itself, will look elsewhere for dermatology services.

44.description: Skip this place and go Somewhere else! After purchasing all the recommended face washes and products to clear up my skin issues the problem still persisted and worsened ! I totally regret going here at all! Rude receptionist for the billing department too! Never coming back . I don't even want to give one star***let me clarify by saying this at no means degrades the quality of doctors In this office just a bad office employee!

24.description: Alright, I'll get right into it with the pros and cons. Pros: -Dr. Robinson is a dermatologist sent from above. Seriously. I have a family history of skin cancer and do not take my (many) moles lightly. She provided me with the most thorough skin exam I've ever had (and I've had a lot over the years), and explained what she was doing the entire time. The appointment never felt rushed, and I felt in great care throughout the appointment. -It's a beautiful and up to date office. -Wait time was minimal. I was back home less than an hour from my appointment start time, and I live 15 min away! Cons:-SCHEDULING! I called in early October to make an appt. with Dr. Robinson and couldn't get in until mid APRIL! That was insane, but I made the appt. anyway since it wasn't urgent. If you need an urgent appt, this is not the place. -Some might view the fact that they ask to keep a credit card on file a con, but honestly, it makes sense. If I were a dr.'s office with so many patients, I'd prefer backup too. People don't pay their bills, and especially on time. This is nothing new. -Got a semi "snooty" vibe from the front desk girls, as others have noted, but honestly, who cares. It's the dr.'s that matter. You're not there to see the receptionists. Does it set a bad tone? Maybe, but that's quickly fixed once you're in with the doc.-Parking could be an issue, depending on what time you go, but that's 90% of places you visit in the city.

7.description: Positives: All of the people at the front desk were amazing and very helpful. The physician assistants I spoke with were both knowledgeable and helpful.  I cannot speak any higher of them.  Amazing!Not so good:  The Doctor.  While Dr. Robinson seemed pretty knowledgeable, I do not appreciate the way she treated me.  I waited in the room for almost 30 minutes before she walked in.  I could hear her discussing me directly outside the door for several minutes before she even walked in.  By the time she walked in, it seemed like she didn't want to be there and made me feel like I was wasting her time.  Twice she interrupted me and told me that I needed to stop talking and to let HER talk and should ask my questions at the end of the exam. (I'm used to having more natural discussion with my doctors and have NEVER been treated this way before!).  After the exam, she wouldn't even go over any pricing regarding my treatment options.  I was told someone else would call me later in the day to go over that.  NO ONE ever called or followed up.  I am extremely disappointed given all of the positive reviews of this place.  I try to treat everyone with the same kindness and respect.  Is that too much to ask?  Maybe Dr. Robinson had a bad day, I don't know.  One thing I know is, I'm not going back to somewhere I'm clearly not wanted.

49.description: Not only could you never reach these people via phone..they also have no interest in their patients..only the money - as far as I can see...they recommended an expensive treatment that didn't work.  Wouldn't call me back when asked questions about it..and when I said it didn't work and I wasn't going to make a new appointment ..there was absolutely no follow-up or question or concern.  This is pre cancer people...I would have at least asked what were the concerns of the patient...this business cares not at all for their patients.

40.description: I really wanted to be a patient here. Here is my story.I called Dermatology & Aesthetics of Wicker Park (DAWP) in December 2013 or early January 2014 to schedule a skin check for a particularly worrisome discoloration on my forehead.  My fiance, an ER resident, said I should get it looked at as a small bump had developed on it.After leaving a voicemail during business hours I waited a few days before I heard back from them.  I explained my situation in detail, but the receptionist seemed more concerned about whether I had health insurance or not.  I do.The earliest they could "fit me in" was sometime in May - nearly five to six months out.   The receptionist said I would probably be able to get in earlier if I was available on short notice - which I am.  I live less than a minute walk from their offices (literally a minute, not figuratively).  Time passed, the discoloration on my forehead remained, but the troubling texture resolved itself.I never heard from DAWP.  I wondered sometimes if I would ever get a call, as discussed, to walk over in a hurry and slide in before sometime in May.  I never did.May comes - I never thought I would not have heard from DAWP, but I have not. Then, while at a convention for work in Las Vegas I get a call, it is DAWP!  I am late for my appointment!  What appointment? The one that had zero follow up for five to six months?  No reminders.  No communication.  The appointment that was perfunctory since they should be able to get me in well before that?Fortunately in the interim my discoloration did not metastasize and kill me.  The one way a dermatologist can actually save lives...and they are not interested in doing it in a timely manner.It gets better.  Since I neglected to show up they want to charge me $25 dollars for a no show fee.  The money is trivial, but on principle I dislike this.  Before continuing, I hand delivered my payment today, the day I received the invoice in the mail.  I pay on time, in full, even if I disagree.I work as a commercial real estate broker.  I have spent days, even weeks, preparing materials and presentations for customers who ultimately pay and do nothing.  If I wanted a fee up front I would tell them clearly what that fee would be.  They could then accept or decline that fee. When I hand delivered my payment the offices of DAWP were busy and bustling.  I do not think they need me as a customer and I do not think they cared about my health.

53.description: I am a patient of this clinic and have called 3x this week to make two appointments and can't get past a voicemail.  The one time they called me back (not within the same day as they promised), I was in a meeting and asked if there was a way I could get back to them more directly.  I was assured that the voicemail problem was resolved because they implemented a new phone system on Monday.  I called back about an hour ago and got the voicemail!  Their system doesn't allow you to hold to speak to someone, it automatically bounces you into the vm system.  I have never had such a difficult time trying to make appointments in my life.  The irony is that both appointments would be "out of pocket" for me since they are considered cosmetic, and cash straight into their pockets.

30.description: Don't bother trying to be a patient here.  They ignore messages left to make or cancel appointments, and try to push all of their products on you throughout your visit.  Go elsewhere.

46.description: In the search for a new dermatologist, I received many recommendations from friends that Dr. Lio was an outstanding dermatologist.  All recommendations came with the warning that it may take some time to get an appointment, but in the end it would be worth it.So following the advice from said friends, I made an appointment roughly 3 months ago, and finally had my first tete a tete with the famous Dr. Lio himself this week.  I made the mistake of looking for the address on Yelp and began reading some questionable reviews and worried I had made a huge mistake waiting 3 months for an appointment that was beginning to sound like it might become the appointment from hell.  I noted the many points of contention and made sure to be ready for them, should they arise. I was taken aback initially by the commotion in the waiting room - it was packed at 10am on a Monday.  There are several receptionists - one to each Dr. from what I could tell.  This made check in efficient, but  I can see why it's hard to get an appointment.  This office made my last dermatologist's office look like a morgue.  I did not have to provide a credit card to keep on file for this visit, but was told on my next visit I would need to.  I'm not as skeptical about this process as some other reviewers...it is what it is.  It states clearly they're not going to charge you without you knowing, and though I've had fraudulent activity on credit cards before, I'm not too worried about it.  It's a Dermatology office...not one of those people on State Street and/or Michigan Ave. who ask you to hand over your credit card to purchase some discounted salon package.  And for the record those people are the worst. ("Can I ask you a question about your hair?")But I digress...Dr. Lio did not rush along the appointment which I appreciated.  Of course that could be because I told him I was visiting him because I didn't like my last dermatologist.  What I appreciated most, was when I told him what I was doing to try to control some minor adult acne issues, he didn't shrug his shoulders and tell me that I was already doing everything I could like my last Dr.  (I mean...really?!).  Instead, he offered an alternative solution and was very optimistic that it would solve my problems.  He also said I had great skin for my age, aside from some sun damage on my shoulders and chest.  Hey.  I'll take it!I've been using his prescribed treatment for four days now, and haven't seen much change.  I'm hoping I can update to five stars when I do (if I do??)!  Either way, my experience here was far superior than that of the Skin Care Center.

1.description: Dr Meyer Horn has been my derm for a loooong time. I started seeing him back when he was at Northwestern. I've followed him each time he moved the practice. We've been thru a lot together with my psoriasis. From topicals to Enbrel, to getting leukemia from Enbrel (IMO), to more topicals, methotrexate, Otezla, etc etc. He's always been an extremely kind doctor who immediately puts you at ease. He explains things very well and forms a game plan for what will work for you. I can't speak for the cosmetic side of the business, but they seem to be very busy with that as well. Only thing I don't like about the new building on Elston is the valet parking. I had the car valeted the first time I went and when I handed the attendant my ticket I noticed my car was immediately outside the door, about 3 spaces down. I basically walked with him to my car. What was the point of that? Lol....really just a money grab with the small lot they have. I now just find a spot up or down Elston and walk a block or two to the practice.Other than that Dr Horn is great!!!

55.description: For my first time at a dermo office, he spent a whopping 7 minutes with me. I waited 6 weeks to have the privilege of seeing him, and he spends a total of 7 minutes with me. Add to the crappy experience that the red thing on my face that I went to see him about in the first place is still there. Guess maybe he should have spent more time with me. I would not see him or refer him to anyone.Jen F

9.description: Had a really good experience here. They were able to book my appointment a week in advance which I feel like is unheard of in Chicago - most places make you wait a darn month or MONTHS! My nurse was super friendly, knowledgeable, and professional and made me feel very comfortable! Final Verdict:I would recommended this place for sure to anyone looking for a dermatologist!

26.description: As a new patient you have to struggle to get a call back to set up an appointment--it took three calls over the course of twenty four hours even to speak with a patient scheduler. Once we did, we brought our son in to see Dr. Emily Arch, who behaved imperiously and almost scornful, as if she had much more important appointments to attend to than ours. Kindness, perhaps, is a dying sentiment among specialists. Furthermore our insurance required a prior authorization by Dr. Arch in order to cover the medicine prescribed--this also was not done in a timely manner and required follow-up both by our pharmacy and ourselves.

25.description: I read some previous reviews and due to the mixture I was a little hesitant, but I decided to give them a chance as I didn't want to go back to my follow up appt with a different dermatologist. I called on a Wednesday early evening and was able to get scheduled for Friday morning via Allison on the phone. The staff was friendly, explained everything in detail and I waited to see Lidia. I first saw her nurse who listened to every detail I gave and was even shared her own knowledge on some things I mentioned. After she left the room, Lidia came in and was able to repeat everything I told the nurse (great communication on their ends) and explained to me exactly what I was dealing with. She gave me steps to take, background on my skin issue and was very polite. I almost left the room without asking some other questions I had and Lidia was kind enough to take me back to the room and take a look and talk about other concerns I had. It is very rare to come across someone who seems to truly care about you, informative, willing to help and genuine. I am so glad I took a chance and came here. My skin is clearing up already! Lidia is amazing!

12.description: Wow -- just realized I wrote this over two years ago and never posted it! Oops... thankfully everything is still true. I'll be headed back for my annual mole check later this month.  Original:  I just had my first appointment here yesterday and I was very pleased with my visit. Dr. Emily Arne was very professional with the cancer screening she did for me, which involved her checking my whole body for moles. Staff was pleasant and the office was modern and clean. I've definitely found my new dermo!

59.description: I have just started with Dr. Lio but so far I'm very impressed.  I have had acne since age 12 and it has become psychologically very damaging for me.  I came to Dr. Lio with a very frustrated attitude, and so far everyone there has been very willing to listen and not to push treatments that have not worked in the past (many derms do not care about that).  They are also calling to check in on my progress & are great about getting back to me, which makes me feel very well cared for.  So after that I've decided to trust the advised course of treatment and stick with it long-term.  Fingers crossed.

21.description: Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me. After submitting a request to be contacted to schedule a dermatological consultation via their website's "click here" option, I did not receive a response for a couple weeks.  I understand that every office/business may experience occasional staff shortage or busy periods every now and again. No one is perfect. So I gave them a second chance. This past week, my husband, who is already a current patient, called to request that someone contact us ASAP to schedule an appointment regarding an urgent skin condition/concern. That call was placed on Thursday. Today it is Sunday, and still no return call. I can't speak as to the bedside manner of the doctors since I have never received the professional courtesy of a timely return call to actually schedule an appointment, but I can say that I won't be reaching out to this practice again to request an appointment in the future. Their customer service bar is set pretty low.

17.description: Outstanding experience with Meyer Horn and nothing but great feedback about Neha, Keren and the rest of the team. I bring my family here and will continue to do so in the years to come!! #exceptionalcare

10.description: I received a call from the office manager after my last review. She was very apologetic and seemed very sincere so I figured I'd give them another try given my long history with Dr Robinson. I like Dr Robinson and trust her. She really is great. I will assume the last non-appointment was a fluke that can happen to anyone. However, I really dislike this forced valet. I would understand if the location were somewhere with a lot of congestion like Michigan Ave, but in an industrial corridor like Elston seems ridiculous.

5.description: If I could give a zero I would. This is a very poorly run office. I have been going here for two years and have never had a good experience but consistently put up with it because I liked Dr. Robinson.Today was finally the straw that broke the camels back. I showed up on time, but they had moved the office to a new location (which no one told me when I scheduled the appointment). I called, they told me to come in. When I got there, they said they could only do 10 min of my 40 min treatment. I asked to speak with the office manager. While talking to her (she offered no suggestions, I was the one making alternate recommendations) they gave away my ten remaining minutes to another patient.Again, similar situations like this have repeatedly happened. I will be transferring my medical records.

3.description: Not a fair check in because I only went to pick up some vitamins but I was surprised at how far they moved. They are north of North Avenue on Elston. The parking seemed messed up - that is an industrial area with a huge parking lot yet they have valet for $5.00...I didn't ask maybe you can park it yourself for free? I parked on Elston and walked in. The new place looks really nice but I'm sad it's not as convenient as the previous location.

35.description: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!  If I could give zero stars I would!  My son had a leg full of bumps, some getting red and a friend recommended this practice.  We went there, were immediately greeted by a women who's likely incapable of smiling, and asked for my insurance card.  I happily shared my card and was handed a clip board of paperwork to complete.  The first two pages were standard but the third required me to choose between 3 options: give them a credit card to charge if payment wasn't received within 30 days, leave 150 cash as a deposit or pay in full.  What insurance company pays their bills in 30 days?  I certainly have no control over when they pay.  When I completed it and retuned it she said she needed my credit card.  This was like no request I've ever had at a dr, since I've been battling cancer for 2 plus years I feel qualified to make that statement!  I let Smiley know I thought they had enough info to find me if payment wasn't made in full.  She then said I could talk to an office manager to which I replied that'd be fine and she went to the back.  We went into a treatment room, saw a very nice Dr assistant who explained what he saw and said they would treat it with a liquid and it'd go away.  He left and a women came in to tell me about their billing policies.  We talked through why I didn't want my credit card in their system in this age of compromised credit cards and she let me know she'd review the policy with staff and doctors.  I thought we'd moved on...but she accused me of using profanity in the lobby, in front of my 6 yr old son.  To which I responded I did not, I asked my son, did I use any bad words out there, no, have I ever used bad words in front of you, no.  She says Ok, we just want to make sure our patients feel comfortable here.  Of course I responded by asking if she thought I was comfortable there and asked that I get everything back where I wrote personal information and let her know we would seek treatment elsewhere.  She was then so polite in asking if I wanted a referral.  Something tells me they will charge me for a visit anyway, but I've asked the insurance company to refuse any charges because we were not treated.  Please don't waste your time.  To update, the "office manager" sent to talk with me looks an awful lot like the women's photo here on yelp identified as Dr Robinson.  How professional!!!!!

19.description: Dr. Horn helped me love my skin! I didn't think it was possible...My acne was always a source of insecurity for me as long as I can remember. When I was younger I saw some other doctors about this issue and tried several remedies. My mom took me, so I don't remember if they were specifically dermatologists or not, but I do remember that nothing worked. As soon as I moved to Chicago, I searched for some dermatologists in Chicago. I didn't think to look on Yelp at first, but when I did, I found Dr. Mayer Horn. After reading the reviews on all of the doctors in the office, I still chose to make an appointment with Dr. Horn. Oddly enough, during the time that I was waiting for my appointment, I developed a weird type of rash. My primary care doctors misdiagnosed me twice and then finally suggested I see a dermatologist. I had plans to go to Vegas in the next several days, so I was in a panic. I called the office in a frenzy and begged them to see me. The rash really was itchy and kinda scary looking. And being that it was the summer, it was difficult for me to hide it. They took me in that next day. I forgot the nice doctor who took me in that time, but he took a sample and was able to identify my rash immediately and prescribe the proper medication. I was relieved to find out that it was not contagious and I could get on a plane.Of course, I still had to wait to see Dr. Horn about my acne issues. When it was finally time for my appointment he gave me a regimen after asking about my current routine and lifestyle and prescribed some medications. The progress was slow at first (as it usually is), but it's been a few years and my skin looks better than ever. I get compliments all the time about how it's so glowy and clear. Of course, I tell all of them about Wicker Park D&A. I still make a visit annually in order to get refills and ask about any new concerns. Dr. Horn is very pleasant and kind. But most importantly, he is knowledgeable and truly takes the time to answer all of your questions. I didn't have insurance for some time, and the office gave me coupons so that I could continue to stay on my regimen.I know some other reviewers said that this office is uncooperative, but if you speak to someone who is unkind on the phone, call back and ask for the office manager. Also the nurses and doctors are more than happy to listen. I often get Marjorie (sp?) as my nurse and she is the best. I would feel comfortable telling her if anyone is rude, but I haven't had that problem yet. You will have to wait for an appointment. It is 1-2 months out on average but it's worth the wait. If you have waited this long to seek help about your skin, what's another month or two?

28.description: Okay, seriously, Is Dr. Robinson not the cutest doctor you've ever met? Honestly, that woman should not look that good sitting inches away from your face peering at all the terrible things you constantly obsess over. She's got what looks like perfect skin (a testament to her craft obviously), so one tends to feel a little inadequate...sigh*She has the sweetest bedside manner (and voice to match) and instantly puts you at ease. Anyway, moving on....Restating the obvious, yes, the lobby is gorgeous. The receptionists (except for a few) are a bit snooty. Calling to make an appointment over the phone can get a little frustrating because either a. It just rings and rings and rings and when they do answer, you're put on hold for quite some time orb. There are no available appointments for the next 3-5 months. I kinda wish this place wasn't so popular because i would really like to see my dermatologist sometime this year:)Even if you arrive on time or earlier than your appointment time, expect to wait. I've never waited longer than 5 mins in the lobby, but i have waited over 30 mins in the exam room. Except for one time, i never felt rushed. She usually takes her time. Literally saved my skin so she gets an A++. If you're thinking of going, go! You will be kicking yourself wondering why you didn't go earlier!

45.description: I had gone to this group years ago, but my original dermatologist left, so I thought I would try a new guy. Bad move!! Not only did they make a follow up appt for me 3 months down the road (which was unnecessary), but then never called with a reminder or emailed a reminder. AND had the AUDACITY to tell me that they were charging me regardless! I will not be going back.....TERRIBLE customer service, I think they may even be worse than comcast (and they are hard to beat when it comes to bad customer service).(half hour later) They actually just called me back and refunded the $25 since they never sent a reminder which they were suppose to....I will up them to 2 stars.

33.description: DO NOT GO HERE.  Being a great dr. does not mean that those covering for you have the right to inflate services in order to bill insurance companies more.

43.description: I have just completed my cycle of a severe eczema flare up treatment with great success under Dr. Emily Arch. My relocation triggered the most severe flare up I had experienced in a while and I searched the web and found Dr. Peter Lio, who also heads the Chicago Integrative Eczema Center. When I called DAWP and let them know that I needed immediate attention, they scheduled Dr. Arch for me within a few days.Dr. Arch is a compassionate, receptive, and knowledgeable dermatologist. She gives very specific  instructions on different medication usage, advises you on avoiding triggers and provides you with varying treatment options. (e.g.  I opted out from taking oral steroids.)At the front desk, I struck a particularly good rapport with Thea, but the office staff are friendly and professional in general. When there are billing glitches, the billing manager is quick to handle it. The nurses always play a big role in whether you like a medical institution, and they are efficient, professional and happy , which makes a difference to the patient. A special thank you to Lilian for her care and attention.I would definitely recommend coming to DAWP if you suffer from atopic dermatitis/eczema.

2.description: On time, professional and fast. Went in for a general derm consult. The doctor I saw (Emily Arch) was quick without feeling rushed. She gave me a regimen for skin care that makes sense and didn't try to push any extra stuff on me. I was able to get in same day, and the whole experience was open, airy and somewhat spa like. All the support staff were super nice as well!Would definitely go back.

18.description: This place is very pricey. I paid over $171 out of pocket for each office visit after my insurance premium was applied. I went on 4 different occasions to have my child's wart removed. I didn't think the treatment was very aggressive. The first three times liquid nitrogen was poured in a cup and a cotton swab was used to treat the wart. On the fourth visit a dispenser was used which seemed a little more aggressive and took care of the problem quickly. I've been to other dermatologists in the past for my self (Northwestern on Easton St.) and I paid $50 for each office visit. Return visits for the same problem at Northwestern were billed at a lower rate. This place is just outrageous with their pricing!

41.description: I had my first appointment with Dr Meyer Horne and he is the best. I've been suffering from adult acne and nothing had been working. I tried changing my diet, I've tried chemical peels and almost every over the counter medication. It's been so stressful dealing with it. So after missing like 3 appointments due to personal reasons I finally got to see Dr Horne. He was so nice and personal about everything regarding my acne. I've been to other dermatologists and I hate when I see their PA instead of the actual doctor and see no results. Nothing was rushed with him. My skin started clearing up in a week. I have pictures that shows the improvement.

52.description: Fed up to the back teeth with the administrative staff here, I have just fired Wicker Park Dermatology. Trying to get a re-fill prescription for one of my kids has been a total nightmare and a huge waste of my time. I understand that they won't refill prescriptions without seeing a patient (although surely if there's a lack of acne, the creams are working.) However, they tell you this and then tell you that they can't fit you in in the near future. Eventually I was advised to phone the triage nurse, who would refill a one-month emergency prescription IF my pharmacy faxed the office. The pharmacy faxed twice and heard nothing; I heard nothing so assumed there were no problems. I have just followed up with WP Dermatology to be told that no, they won't re-fill the prescription despite what they told me last week. I am staggered that no one thought it would be courteous (or perhaps good customer service) to let me know. When I pay the fees that are billed at places like this, I am paying for good administrative service as well as medical advice.Won't be going there again.

50.description: I've been a patient here for about 3 years and it's always a nightmare to get an appointment and they are always running about 30min behind. During my last visit I waited an entire hour! I've dealt with it because I live so close but honestly I'm not seeing the results I want and I'm done begging to get an appt. There are thousands of dermatologists in this city and it's time to move on. All that being said, the nurses are very accommodating and nice. Receptionists are so so.

4.description: I had a great experience at Dermatology and Aesthetics of Wicker Park. I was a new patient today and went to see Dr. Emily Arch- who was so great. I wanted a skin exam as I have lots of freckles and sun spots, and being an overly healthcare minded nurse, I like to get yearly skin exams to have someone who knows a lot more than me take a look at my freckles.Her nurse (not sure of her name) was very friendly and helpful at the beginning of the appointment and even verbally welcomed me as a new patient. Dr. Arch was very friendly and cordial and did a thorough job on my exam. She also gave me some great education about what to continue to watch for to prevent melanoma and skin cancer.I am a guilty tanning bed user in a previous life...and at previous dermatology offices I feel like they are literally mad at me for admitting my old habit. I mean, there's nothing I can do about that and I am obviously taking precautions now, so help me out a little! Dr. Arch was very kind and didn't make me feel like she was going to cast me out of her skin care world for my previous tanning bed use in high school.Highly recommended!

6.description: Loved the old location.  Valet is a pain in the ass and everyone at this office is patronizing about it - had to walk two blocks to get cash  from an ATM ($2.90 fee) to pay for valet.  All things considered I think I might just find someplace new.

22.description: I had a great experience at Dermatology and Aesthetics of Wicker Park. I was a new patient today and went to see Dr. Emily Arch- who was so great. I wanted a skin exam as I have lots of freckles and sun spots, and being an overly healthcare minded nurse, I like to get yearly skin exams to have someone who knows a lot more than me take a look at my freckles.Her nurse (not sure of her name) was very friendly and helpful at the beginning of the appointment and even verbally welcomed me as a new patient. Dr. Arch was very friendly and cordial and did a thorough job on my exam. She also gave me some great education about what to continue to watch for to prevent melanoma and skin cancer.I am a guilty tanning bed user in a previous life...and at previous dermatology offices I feel like they are literally mad at me for admitting my old habit. I mean, there's nothing I can do about that and I am obviously taking precautions now, so help me out a little! Dr. Arch was very kind and didn't make me feel like she was going to cast me out of her skin care world for my previous tanning bed use in high school.Highly recommended!

15.description: I went for the first time and had an appointment with Dr. Rani.  I found everyone I interacted with to be very kind and helpful.  I was even impressed with the valet here!  When I realized I didn't have any cash with me, the guys running the valet were still eager to help me and were as kind as ever.  I'll be back for future dermatology appointments that's for sure!

57.description: Dr. Horn helped me love my skin! I didn't think it was possible...My acne was always a source of insecurity for me as long as I can remember. When I was younger I saw some other doctors about this issue and tried several remedies. My mom took me, so I don't remember if they were specifically dermatologists or not, but I do remember that nothing worked. As soon as I moved to Chicago, I searched for some dermatologists in Chicago. I didn't think to look on Yelp at first, but when I did, I found Dr. Mayer Horn. After reading the reviews on all of the doctors in the office, I still chose to make an appointment with Dr. Horn. Oddly enough, during the time that I was waiting for my appointment, I developed a weird type of rash. My primary care doctors misdiagnosed me twice and then finally suggested I see a dermatologist. I had plans to go to Vegas in the next several days, so I was in a panic. I called the office in a frenzy and begged them to see me. The rash really was itchy and kinda scary looking. And being that it was the summer, it was difficult for me to hide it. They took me in that next day. I forgot the nice doctor who took me in that time, but he took a sample and was able to identify my rash immediately and prescribe the proper medication. I was relieved to find out that it was not contagious and I could get on a plane.Of course, I still had to wait to see Dr. Horn about my acne issues. When it was finally time for my appointment he gave me a regimen after asking about my current routine and lifestyle and prescribed some medications. The progress was slow at first (as it usually is), but it's been a few years and my skin looks better than ever. I get compliments all the time about how it's so glowy and clear. Of course, I tell all of them about Wicker Park D&A. I still make a visit annually in order to get refills and ask about any new concerns. Dr. Horn is very pleasant and kind. But most importantly, he is knowledgeable and truly takes the time to answer all of your questions. I didn't have insurance for some time, and the office gave me coupons so that I could continue to stay on my regimen.I know some other reviewers said that this office is uncooperative, but if you speak to someone who is unkind on the phone, call back and ask for the office manager. Also the nurses and doctors are more than happy to listen. I often get Marjorie (sp?) as my nurse and she is the best. I would feel comfortable telling her if anyone is rude, but I haven't had that problem yet. You will have to wait for an appointment. It is 1-2 months out on average but it's worth the wait. If you have waited this long to seek help about your skin, what's another month or two?

20.description: Wow -- just realized I wrote this over two years ago and never posted it! Oops... thankfully everything is still true. I'll be headed back for my annual mole check later this month.  Original:  I just had my first appointment here yesterday and I was very pleased with my visit. Dr. Emily Arne was very professional with the cancer screening she did for me, which involved her checking my whole body for moles. Staff was pleasant and the office was modern and clean. I've definitely found my new dermo!

36.description: How did I end up here? Well....my facial Groupon at Avanti Skin Care was expiring so I called to make an appointment. I was then notified that Avanti was no longer in business and was bought out by Dermatology & Aesthetics of Wicker Park, but they were honoring the Groupons. Nice! My facial was excellent, but it was definitely different from other facials I have had in the past. This place is primarily a dermatology office, so when I got there it felt more like I was waiting at the doctor's office than a spa. Even when they came to get me from the "waiting room" it was funny when they called my name.
