I had a hard time getting out of the mindset that I was there for a facial and not a checkup.Once in the room she went through various questions regarding my skin care process and we got started with the facial. She did a really good job explaining products, but in between treatments she was I'm assuming making notes on the computer, which was a little distracting. Once the facial was complete she recommended some products and provided samples.When I get a facial I'm more into the relaxation part so I will probably stick to getting them done at spas, but I did appreciate the knowledge and treatment provided to me.

14.description: Okay, seriously, Is Dr. Robinson not the cutest doctor you've ever met? Honestly, that woman should not look that good sitting inches away from your face peering at all the terrible things you constantly obsess over. She's got what looks like perfect skin (a testament to her craft obviously), so one tends to feel a little inadequate...sigh*She has the sweetest bedside manner (and voice to match) and instantly puts you at ease. Anyway, moving on....Restating the obvious, yes, the lobby is gorgeous. The receptionists (except for a few) are a bit snooty. Calling to make an appointment over the phone can get a little frustrating because either a. It just rings and rings and rings and when they do answer, you're put on hold for quite some time orb. There are no available appointments for the next 3-5 months. I kinda wish this place wasn't so popular because i would really like to see my dermatologist sometime this year:)Even if you arrive on time or earlier than your appointment time, expect to wait. I've never waited longer than 5 mins in the lobby, but i have waited over 30 mins in the exam room. Except for one time, i never felt rushed. She usually takes her time. Literally saved my skin so she gets an A++. If you're thinking of going, go! You will be kicking yourself wondering why you didn't go earlier!

58.description: I heard a few people tell me this place is the spot so why not try it.  I did during lunch.  I thought the decor was cool, contemporary.   I ordered the jerk chicken meal which include slaw and a side of my choice which I selected the coconut & rice w/beans.  Sound delicious right????  Well...the food is prepared already, similar to a Chipotle restaurant.   Hmmm...the ones I go to have u wait 20-30 minutes.  I sat down and started to eat my meal which the chicken lacked the jerk seasonings I'm used to.   The slaw was ok.  The coconut w/rice & beans was ok, not spectacular.  The rum juice was good, strong.   I assumed the black female in the kitchen was the owner but the owner is white.  Nothing wrong with that but this spot is a contemporary jerk place.  I prefer the hole in the wall jerk spots like Uncle Joe's, Fire Jerk Chicken, Kingston Jerk Chicken(now closed) that have all Jamaican based cooks.  The customer service was great which made up for the lack of taste.  Also the music was great.

56.description: Went to Jerk this evening with friends and it was great!  Really chill laid back atmosphere with a very accommodating staff. The best way to describe the food is its a commercialized "Chipotle" style Jamaican food restaurant!  Although, it doesn't taste authentic, it's still good food. But it's exactly what they advertise a "Modern" jerk chicken restaurant.  I'm giving them 5 stars because the staff is amazing!! I wish I remembered everyone's names cause I would mention them,  but they were very chill and courteous!  For those writing reviews in regards to the ethnicity of the staff because there"not Jamaican" 1st of all you don't know that!  And 2nd get a life! Thanks Jerk for the great night! ;)

29.description: I was excited to try this place since there's not many Caribbean restaurants in Chicago and Jerk looked good. The staff here was friendly and provided good service. I ordered the jerk chicken with the jerk BBQ sauce along with a side of sweet plantains. The plate comes with a side of sour dough bread, hard dough roll, and coleslaw too. I asked to try the other sauces on the side too and they let me! Of the 3, my favorite was the jerk BBQ. Rude Girl just tasted bitter and the lime cilantro didn't have enough of a kick to it. Overall the food was okay. My favorite item on the plate was the hard dough roll.

42.description: Jerk was very good and affordable. However the night we were there they only had chicken as a meat option (pork and beef are other normal options). Friendly staff. The jerk sauce is very spicy. The Jerk BBQ sauce is nice and sweet. The beef patty is really spicy too! The sweet plantains weren't too sweet, more green. Jerk Mac&cheese was very tasty!! I'll be back to check out the beef and pork.

23.description: I was really excited about trying this place, and even more excited when I tasted the food!! AMAZING! AMAZING!AMAZING!! The music was great, & the environment was awesome! Dining in is a must!!

47.description: I come here quite a bit b/c it's close to where I work. It used to be amazing but recently I have noticed inconsistency that's been a deterrent to me coming here more. One night my chicken was pink and I had to dig through my salad for all the chicken to throw it away lest I die. Tonight I came back and my order was wrong. I'm guessing this place needs BETTER management STAT. Such a shame b/c the food has been really good in the past. Make sure you check your order if you come here and if there's a line, GOOD LUCK. UPDATE: The owner saw this post and contacted me. He was apologetic and refunded my order without me having to even ask. Looking forward to seeing this establishment run with his level of leadership some day. The food is truly great - when it's executed right.

8.description: I went to this place for the first time on Friday, I was craving some Jamaican food and thought this would do the trick but boy was I wrong, don't get me wrong the food was good but very spicey, it tasted like everything was cooked and the had jerk seasoning added to it, the flavor was over whelming as every bite had jerk seasoning!! . The atmosphere is great seems like a cold spot to eat and drink on a Friday night and have fun but the food needs a little tweaking by tweaking I means less jerk seasoning on everything!!

31.description: This place absolutely positively sucks...I knew it was going to be a problem when they started measuring out the chicken.. Island slaw is awful, plantains dry and overcooked, and the 1/2 of cup of rice and beans were ok. Two dinners for 32 dollars?????????? Man please never again. Please please go to Tropical Times near Maywood for a good Jerk meal....

34.description: The best way to sum this place up U.S. That it is the jerk chicken equivalent to honey butter fried chicken. If you understand the good and bad if that place then you get what I'm saying. Portions small, price is high. HOWEVER...I walked away full and satisfied and not stuffed like a Thanksgiving turkey....Soooooo maybe three on to something. I enjoyed the mail and won't have to pay for it in the gym. Rude girl sauce is on point...but just spicy, but super spicy.

16.description: Let me start off by saying, the employees are great. They were very attention and cared. They gave great recommendations and tips to essensuate the flavor. However I didn't think the food was as great as I imagined it to be. It was mediocre at best plus the price was a little pricey for a fast food takeout restaurant . The ambiance was awesome.   It had authentic Jamaican music so I was jamming as I ate my food. I ordered the double jerk chicken and yuca fries. The menu needs to be more organized.

13.description: This place was awesome. Had the pulled pork with yuca fries and mashed yuca. It was delicious. The place is cute. Will go back.

11.description: Hooooooodang Gang! Jerk is ON FIRE, literally! Your mouth will be on fire. This food truck is always the one with the longest line on the block. Waiting in that line is worth the wait, believe me my Yelpers. There's only 3 or 4 options on the menu. Jerk chicken, Jerk fries, a veggie patty (...I don't know why anyone would go to get a veggie patty, but I'm sure it's probably delicious), and a few dessert options. The Jerk chicken comes in a square container on top of a nice thick piece of Texas Toast. The portion is definitely enough for two servings, but since I'm a Jerk chicken addict, I usually eat the whole thing. A delicious little hush puppy comes inside your Jerk package of heaven. Make sure you try the Rude Girl sauce, your taste buds will be happy you did. BUT, if your sensitive to heat, I'd go with the BBQ sauce instead. The Jerk fries are spicy seasoned fries and you get a huge portion of them. Dip 'em in the Rude Girl sauce and you'll be flamin' up!Yelp, you don't know what you're missing if you haven't had this truck. It's pretty darn amazing. I heard they have a store front which I will definitely be visiting as soon as I find it!

39.description: We kept calling the restaurant many times to create a catering order for 25 people. Left messages - no response. Finally got ahold of the manager who said that we should just order on DoorDash - which we did. Nobody called to confirm our order and suggest to maybe place 20 orders of chicken in the same container. Same with the sides. Order came in and it was absolutely impossible to serve to a group. Chicken over-spiced and absolutely not authentic. The bread was rough and not good. Will never come back.

37.description: Ok so allow me to tell you about THE WORST jerk chicken I've ever had in Chicago. That's right - the worst. Brace yourselves, this post is long. Anywho, while I was in the middle of doing a 20 block walk as punishment for eating a cupcake, I realized that I got food poisoning from my favorite fast food Asian joint that rhymes with bow wao. I was at the point where I couldn't trust a fart so getting to a bathroom was mandatory. I was starting to freak out because I was around that super industrial area on Halsted Ave but I saw Jerk and felt a tad bit relieved.I'm one of those weird people who can't go to a restaurant's public restroom without buying something because I hate conflict and honestly wouldn't know how to react if an employee told me "No." *Restrooms should be open to the public but that's another story for another day.* I follow Jerk on twitter and they seemed appetizing so I decided to grab an entree to go for later or to share if I was feeling charitable.  I chose the pork *oink oink*, sweet plantain, festival, slaw, and ciltantro lime aioli (THAT SAUCE SHOULD'VE BEEN A RED FLAG BUT WHATEVS). I proceeded to calmly ask where the restroom was even though it felt like I was about to explode & there was a tumultuous war going on in my innards. When I was finished in the restroom, my food was packaged and ready to go. Cool. Or so I thought.I arrived home, excited as all get down to consume my food. However, what I tasted made all dead Jamaicans roll around in their graves. EVERYTHING WAS DRYER THAN OPRAH'S PHONE ON A FRIDAY NIGHT. I have no idea why this place claims to serve jerk....maybe the grilling preparation? Idk. The meat had NO seasoning. None. Ningun. I had to use my own seasoning and some SWEET BABY RAYS to give it some flavor. WHAT??! PREPOSTEROUS. The slaw was the only decent thing, WHICH IS SAD IF YOU'RE FAMILIAR WITH THE DELICIOUSNESS THAT IS JERK. I instantly wanted my $11 back but I live in the burbs and I'm sure that a company that serves tasteless jerk meat doesn't give a damn if you like it or not. Just go on 79th and Halsted and get some real jerk. Preparation will take at least 30 minutes but at least it will be good.

0.description: 5-star review. The flavor of the jerk-grilled chicken. The friendly and efficient staff who are happy to explain the options since this is the kind of menu you might not know.The sweet-savory of the yuca mash.The crisp-fried corn-bread hush-puppy thing that comes with every meal. The just-right bite to the slaw.The trendy up-scale fast casual atmosphere that isn't trying so hard you hate it.The craft beer list that makes me want to come back in the evening.The RUDE GIRL HOT SAUCE which you CRAVE.This River West place is a bit more of a walk, and you're just not gonna regret it.

38.description: If I could give this place no stars I would! This place is ABSOLUTELY disgusting. There is really no other words to put it, and to all Costumers please inspect your meat before you consume it. We just purchased the turkey leg dinner and it was still raw in the middle. The Mac and cheese was very strange, as if they dropped chemicals in it. Not only that we had three orders of Cole slaw which was at room temp and disgusting as well.....PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY HERE. ( Just a forewarning!)

51.description: Definitely a mild "jerk" experience, not very spicy.  The check out process was strange, you had to go over to the bar to purchase alcohol separately from the food. I tried the pork, very moist.

27.description: I live nearby and drive by the place all the time but never have gone in. Also, I see via Instagram that they have half off wings on Mondays...I believe....Still I haven't made it in. So finally I used Door Dash to deliver the food to me. The food was solid! I ordered the chicken with the rude girl sauce (spiciest) with a side of mac. The chicken was plentiful and juicy/tender while seasoned to perfection. The rude girl sauce complimented the chicken and had a slow burning spice that eventually forced me to eat faster and faster cause the spice level continued to kick it up with each and every bite. But for spice lovers...it was amazing. The spice was delicious and not just all heat, a damn good amount of heat but worth every lick. The meal also came with a slice of bread, Jamaican cornbread, and a side of garden salad. The Jamaican cornbread and salad helped cool the tongue off. Oh yeah and the mac and cheese was great! Nice and cheesy and topped with some of their jerk seasoning...mmm..I'm a fan of the place...I will actually stop in some time cause the food is FIRE as in damn good and spicy.

32.description: It was pretty bad. Read the worst reviews and that sums it up.  The chicken and pork was both dry and flavorless. Ye be warned.

54.description: Modern jerk is great, visited the good truck many times prior to the store opening. This was my second time here had the jerk chicken was great. Wife had the salad we where both happy with our meal will definitely  come back next time we are in the area. There are only two  jerk restaurants in Chicago, this place hits the mark the bar is great with a great selection of drinks.

48.description: I've eaten here three times and enjoyed it twice. Get the Jerk chicken entree. It's delicious and it's what I had my first and second visit. My third visit was seriously disappointing after an order of Jerk Chicken wings with yucca. I couldn't finish my meal despite my voracious appetite because the entire dish tasted  like it was powered with sugar, maybe brown sugar. Felt like I was eating dessert or some jerk and sweet & sour Asian fusion. Stay away from this dish. Really good Jamaican jerk wings and authentic yuca fries taste nothing like the heart attack, diabetic, not reflective of how good this place really is, poor quality meal I did not enjoy. Ate some and trashed most, which sucks bc I was really looking forward to this tasting great.

44.description: Their jerk interpretation is awful. Was really excited to come and taste the food, unfortunately you couldn't pay me to come back. Chicken was raw!!!?? they missed the mark completely with this spot. Avoid!

24.description: Great food. Always somewhat of a wait when getting takeout, but well worth the wait. That's the only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars.

7.description: Absolutely love this place!! Everything is perfect. Never had a bad meal or drink! Service is fast and friendly! I would eat there everyday if I could!

49.description: First rule of ethnic restaurants:  Make sure someone of that ethnicity is running the restaurant.  Ever hopeful for Jamaican food in Chicago, I tried this fairly new establishment for lunch last week.  The lack of Jamaicans or any staff of color gave me pause on entry.My friend and I ordered the jerk chicken and jerk pork (no table service here).  The cashier was doing double duty putting meats on the plates and passing them down the line Chipotle-style.  After handling money?  Tsk tsk.  And every order was weighed on a little scale (see photo).  Don't want to give anyone too much.   Then a gaggle of servers handed the plates down the line adding the sides to each plate.  Seems grossly inefficient compared to systems at other restaurants.  The last server then asked "what kind of sauce".  I dunno.  Why not put up a sign?  And anyway, who wants anything but jerk sauce?  But I digress. . .The "Coconut Rice & Beans" was fine, but I couldn't find any coconut.  The slaw and mac 'n cheese?  Meh.  The jerk chicken and pork were barely spicy at all, and the chicken wasn't real whole pieces of chicken but more like jerk chicken mcnuggets.  I can take the chicken off the bone myself, thank you. And a Jamaican restaurant without escovitch fish?  A lot more effort has been made on the bar area, which offers craft beers and other imports by the dozen.  Out of Jamaican Red Stripe, however.  And what about a good ginger beer?  Details count. There was a huge array of hats, t-shirts, and other swag that were plastered liberally with the word "Jerk".  It isn't cutesy, it's just a mockery of the Jamaicans.  A mediocre effort at best.  Get some Jamaicans and save yourself.

40.description: Love!!! Their plantains are so delicious and I've had a tough time finding good ones in the city! The jerk chicken is so good and the staff is very friendly. Good job Jerk!!!

53.description: Well, Allow me to start by saying I'm a Jerk Food Enthusiast. I've tried all the best Jerk Spots throughout the City (Jerk Villa being the best) and even been to Jamaica 6 times for the authentic Jerk Jamaican Food experience. I'm such a fan, that at times I make my own marinade, spark up my own grill, and make own Jerk! :)The other day I was having a Jerk craving. I figured since this new restaurant Jerk Grill was by my place of employment me and a co-worker will give em a try.When I 1st stepped in I saw all hispanics and white people behind the counter working. Mind you this is advertised as "Authentic Jamaican Jerk". For a sec I stepped outside because I thought I entered the wrong restaurant (Chipotle maybe?). But I saw the sign on the window and I guessed I was in right place.But then I thought possibly, maybe they're Jamaican but just don't look it. So then I stepped up to order and said "Wah Gwaan", the guy at the counter looked dumbfounded like I was speaking a foreign language. He didn't comprehend a basic Jamaican Greeting (This is a Jamaican Restaurant right?). We joked it off and proceeded with the order.I ordered a Jerk Chicken entree and my Co-worker ordered some Jerk Wings. Now, I've been eating Jerk for a VERY long time, been to some of the best Jerk spots to some of the worst but this is the 1st time I ever got "slits" of what he said was boneless skinless chicken. The counter guy went as far as to put the few slits of chicken on a scale (which was annoying). He deducted what I thought should be on the platter. Serious red flags are ablazed!Authentic Jerk Chicken is usually a couple quarter chickens chopped with a cleaver. I slid down the counter and got Rice n Beans as a side and was more throwed back when the other hispanic guy gave me a mere scoop of it. At this point I knew that I wasn't in an Authentic Jamaican Food Restaurant. (Looks like Chipotle Mexican Grill employees).I looked at the total for the entree along with Soda and then looked at what I was getting. I couldn't help but to look at my co-worker and laugh as we both shared an unspoken joke.To make a long story short we go to the table and just as I thought the jokes were about to end. They bring my co-worker his 6-wings. Lo and behold, there not whole wings. They're pieces of a wing. Jokes and Laughter continues!The only good thing we spoke about this place is the decor. Clean as a whistle with good jamaican music playing.The sauce "Rudegirl" wasn't bad. I actually tasted the Allspice, Thyme Leaves, and Habaneros. My Co-Worker gave me a drum from his 6-wings and the rub was quite tasty. Makes me wonder if they learned from youtube video's how to make it.I just don't understand why I didn't see any Jamaicans or Black People in a supposedly "Authentic Jamaican Restaurant". The servers and even Cooks were all Non Jamaicans.When I go to Chinese spots, I'm served by Chinese People. When I eat Mexican Food, I'm served by Mexicans, When I eat Greek food I'm served by Greeks. When I eat African Food, well you get the picture...Based off this experience I won't be back. This place is NOT Authentic Jamaican. I predict this place won't last past 3 years.

30.description: I question if these are real reviews.  I can't imagine this place getting anything more than one star. Nothing I ordered was good.  The chicken wasn't good. The rice and beans tasted like pure coconut and was dry.  The plantains were dry.  The beef patty was slimy. The macaroni tasted like hamburger helper. This was not a good experience.  I got served fast.  And there wasn't any sort of confrontation so this isn't personal. But it appears that this is more of a popup restaurant.  If these reviews are here to lure people in, shame on the owners.  I do not recommend this restuarant

46.description: Food was good, staff was friendly. Didn't appreciate the "tip shaming" at the counter. That's why I deducted a star. Why am I tipping again? I get my own drink and bus my own table. Adding the 20% tip makes it a bit expensive for fast food. Just sayin

1.description: Drove 15 minutes to order Brisket sliders and a entre; to my dismay No beef in the building! Nothing worst than a restaurant running out of food!  Authentic Jamican Foodies turn around; this place is not for you. However, Beef patties, were on the menu and to my discovery , the patties were runny and not the  ground Beef texture.  This place is a poor jerk knock off in a loft...

55.description: We tried the jerk chicken and pork entrees with the mac n cheese and coconut rice as our sides.  Everything was really good!  The rude girl sauce was excellent (as suggested by other reviews), but the jerk bbq stole the show for us.  Staff was very friendly, service was quick, and the entree price was very reasonable.  We will definitely be back with friends.

9.description: Brick & Mortar Review!The Jerk truck was once a Thursday lunch staple for the 600 W-esters. As a tag-along one fine Thursday, I was introduced to the sweat-inducing magic of the Rude Girl chicken with seasoned fries. Their Chicago & Halsted shop was hotly anticipated since and thanks to Yelp, the boy and I trekked over on a rainy evening. LINE OUT THE DOOR!I'd liken the dining experience to that of "Green Streets Smoked Meats". There's a fully outfitted bar that's separate from the food counter. You pick a meat and the guy behind the counter slices, dices, then weighs the portions. He'll plop it onto a tray and slide it down the line for choice of sides (island slaw included), a sauce, plus any extras. Their shop has expanded choices of sides such as salted potatoes, coconut black bean rice, and mac-n-cheese. Plus you can enjoy their meats as sliders, on top of salads with other extras like yuca fries and beef/veggie patties. The chicken was just as magical as I remembered. The boy got the Rude Girl, but I decided to give my bowels a rest and try their Jerk BBQ sauce. If you're not willing to sweat it out, their BBQ sauce is a safe bet. There's also an aioli as a third option. After trying the coconut rice and mac-n-cheese, my favorite's always the tried-and-true seasoned fries. Even though it's an extra, this is a must-order!Since Jerk's been open for less than a week, I expected some bumps. The staff was still figuring out their rhythm amongst the dinner rush. When ordering an extra, like fries, they hand you a tiny laminated label that sits on your tray after you pay and sit down. We were confused if we were supposed to check-in and pick it up at the register or if someone was to bring it out to us. Eventually someone did track us down with our fries. Perhaps table number holders for greater visibility? All-in-all, if you're in the 'hood with a carnivorous mood, this is a fine place to get your fix!

26.description: Five out of five hands down BEST Jerk chicken I have had in some years. Will be back again to try the pork. Well worth the drive in my book. Oh and the festival bread yum yum.

25.description: A friend really wanted to try this place.  I checked out the website and wasn't totally sold.  I live in Edgewater so it a bit of a trek to get here.  So with a little convincing, she persuaded me, and I couldn't have been more impressed. The Chicken is surprisingly moist and spicy, the sides were incredible and the rum punch was smooth. Had a wonderful experience here.  The vibe of the place from the dj, to the decor, to the service is spot on.

12.description: Aside from it not being good, my chicken was raw. Ruined my entire appetite. The plantains were tasty. I had the beef patty as well. Luckily I'd eaten that before I looked at this raw chicken. They did give a refund, but of course we had to go pick it up since we ordered on Door Dash. I won't be back.

59.description: Scenario:  Husband and I are super hungry after his jiu jitsu class and my bootcamp class.  Closest options are tacos or Jerk (thanks to Yelp).  Now, we LOVE tacos all day errday...but we figured we should try something different.  Jerk it tis!We got here around 8:30, the place was maybe half full, and there was only one person ahead of us in line.  They have TVs, a bar, and really good music playing.Food:  We both ordered the jerk chicken with the jerk bbq sauce.  I had the corn and beans as a side, and the Mr. got the mac & cheese as his side.  I also ordered the yuca fries because FRIESSSSS.  I am not a jerk expert, but EVERYTHING was good!  Seasoning on the chicken was spicy and sooo good.  The bbq sauce gave it a nice tanginess.  And the yuca fries...so crispy and delicious!  I think it had a jerk seasoning on it as well.  Will definitely be back to try the other meats!  And to drink. :)

21.description: This jerk chicken was so disappointing. If you want real jerk chicken, try Tropical Time or Garifuna Flava. I was craving Tropical Time but chose to go to Jerk because it was much closer. I ordered the jerk chicken entree with the slaw and Mac. The jerk chicken was bland. I'm pretty sure they don't use salt and because their chicken is boneless, it lost a lot of flavor. My girlfriend thought the sauce (which came in a tiny little container, was too garlicky). I definitely agree. The slaw had the smell of nail polish and was too peppery. The Mac was.... Meh. Let's just say I didn't finish the Mac. The fritter was the best thing. I really wanted to like this place. They have great marketing, and it looks like it'll be good, but it just can't compare to real jerk chicken.Okay.... It's been 10 minutes since I wrote this review. I'm still so disappointed. Why did I have to waste a meal on this? My mouth smells of garlic and my stomachs is full. But my wallet is empty and I'm soooooo unsatisfied. I will never go back here. It blows my mind that anyone would like this place.

17.description: First: dry and bland jerkSecond: festival is tastyThird: dry and bland jerkFourth: trendy barFifth: if you don't know what good Jamaican Jerk is then you won't know the difference

10.description: Mac and cheese was highlight. But tiny portions, really? Meat was so dry. Very bland. Not enough sauce given in the delivery. By the time it had reached us (being about 6 blocks away) everything had cooled off. Coleslaw wasn't bad, probably my favorite part.Besides that, not impressed. I'd rather just go for BBQ.

5.description: The chicken is pretty good, but the menu is a little confusing.  For example, I had the chicken thigh, which isn't really a thigh, just meat cut from the thigh.  I would suggest getting that.  Sides were above average, coconut rice is recommended.  Also, they do have an impressive beer list. The one thing I didn't like is the place has a DJ and the guy spins his music really loud which is fine if this place were a bar at midnight, but it's a restaurant at 8 pm.

3.description: I live nearby and drive by the place all the time but never have gone in. Also, I see via Instagram that they have half off wings on Mondays...I believe....Still I haven't made it in. So finally I used Door Dash to deliver the food to me. The food was solid! I ordered the chicken with the rude girl sauce (spiciest) with a side of mac. The chicken was plentiful and juicy/tender while seasoned to perfection. The rude girl sauce complimented the chicken and had a slow burning spice that eventually forced me to eat faster and faster cause the spice level continued to kick it up with each and every bite. But for spice lovers...it was amazing. The spice was delicious and not just all heat, a damn good amount of heat but worth every lick. The meal also came with a slice of bread, Jamaican cornbread, and a side of garden salad. The Jamaican cornbread and salad helped cool the tongue off. Oh yeah and the mac and cheese was great! Nice and cheesy and topped with some of their jerk seasoning...mmm..I'm a fan of the place...I will actually stop in some time cause the food is FIRE as in damn good and spicy.

35.description: So sad that this isn't going to be an amazing review.. I know you all depend on my reviews .. Cool Beer Choices, Love that they have daily specials & lots of parking.. But I really wish the food was better. Under cooked chicken, inconsistent garnish of orders.. They didn't handle the "happy hour" well in my opinion.. Really nice staff, but for me food is key!! ...I really don't care to bash this joint so I won't go any further

19.description: So hot I could cry; so good I couldn't stop eating in spite of this.I went with the go-to item; jerk chicken with Rude Girl sauce; I also picked up a side of yukon gold fries to round it off. Beverages would just have to wait until I got back to the office.The odds are pretty good that you've never had dark chicken like this. It was very moist, and very well marinated with just a little bit of that jerk heat.If you get the Rude Girl sauce, this heat gets cranked up to "maximum". It tastes like habañero and many, many spices, complemented the marinade nicely and nearly made me run into Starbucks for a marshmallow frappucino right then and there. There's a piece of white bread at the bottom of the box in case you cry mercy, and a hush puppy as well that was crispy and corny.The fries were perfectly sized and had an excellent balance of sweet, smoky, rosemary and salty.Jerk is well worth finding, well worth standing in line for and well worth experiencing the pain.

28.description: Awesome options, chicken was amazing. Mac and Cheese phenomenal. Order at counter and sit anywhere. Great for a quick lunch, free parking across street.

45.description: Aside from it not being good, my chicken was raw. Ruined my entire appetite. The plantains were tasty. I had the beef patty as well. Luckily I'd eaten that before I looked at this raw chicken. They did give a refund, but of course we had to go pick it up since we ordered on Door Dash. I won't be back.

33.description: Its ok. It not terrible but its not the best. I had the brisket which was decent and my mom had the wings which she liked. The plantians are really good! Good portion sizes. The staff is friendly and they have a large drink/beer selection which is nice.

43.description: The jerk chicken is outstanding! Tender and juicy and I nicely paired it with a side of sweet plantains. The ambiance and design of Jerk feels very comfortable and I will definitely come back to try the rest of the menu. Give it a shot, you won't regret it.

2.description: Service and operations are a little confusing and chaotic.  Ordered chicken thighs - very good.  Other members of my party ordered chicken salad and thighs. They were out of brisket at 7:30 on a Saturday night.   My brother ordered chicken wings and we were done with all our meals before the wings came out - probably about 20-25 minutes.  We also ordered fries which also took 20-25 minutes after our meal.   We had to go up the front to ask for the fried food -  .  The person taking the order is also serving the chicken- people are all over in line waiting around for things.  Its very unorganized.  Might be advantageous to have some waiters.  The food is good - the default is pretty spicy - I don't mind but people who can only take mild spiciness beware.

18.description: Growing up with parents from the Caribbean and the food that comes along with it...this place is my second home. When I first moved to Chicago, it was extremely difficult to find a place that provided authentic Caribbean/Jamaican food. I saw the signs for months and couldn't wait for this place to open after having the jerk chicken from the food truck.This place nails it! EVERYTHING is on point! From the friendly staff, to the atmosphere, the food and last but not least, the drinks make you feel like you're on the beach in Jamaica or many miles away in a tropical paradise.I've read some reviews that mention that its "not authentic" jerk. Had they taken the time to read the entire name of the restaurant -- they would have noticed the words "Modern Jamaican Grill"! Meanwhile, coming from Caribbean roots, I can authentically say that Jerk is DOING the damn thing and they're doing it right!! No, you won't find ox-tail, brow stew chicken, or "manish wata"-- but what you will find is authentically jerk seasoned boneless, skinless chicken breast, pork, and beef - all grilled and/or smoked to perfection. The sides are just as authentic with options that include: plantains, seasoned mac & cheese, coconut rice/peas and cilantro corn.In addition, other offerings include seasoned Yuca fries which offer crunchier and better health benefits over traditional french fries (which are also fantastic), sliders, probably the best wings Chicago has to offer (Jerk chicken wings). For all you vegetarians out there - I'm pleased to announce that they offer veggie patties, salads and island slaw for you as well!Do not forget to visit the bar and order my favorite - RUM PUNCH! There are so many other options available too. Every bartender is super friendly and very attentive (even when busy).Sauces are on point. Rude girl is a favorite, but, if you are looking for that extra "kick" try the "Rude Boy" sauce. I promise to all those who think the chicken isn't spicy enough, you'd be begging for some rum punch to wash it down with. ;)In a nutshell, Jerk is a modern twist to traditional Jamaican/Caribbean barbecue and offers its customers a 'fast-casual' type of ordering. But if you stay and sit at the bar or at a table, you'll soak up the island vibe and quickly forget you're in the hustle & bustle of the city.Check it out, you have nothing to lose!

41.description: The first time I came here I got the wings. So good, hot and fresh. This time my chicken was cold smh

52.description: Jerk is "FYE" as in fire! The half pound of chicken  is very fresh and the bbq and rude girl sauces compliment the meal very well. The sides of Mac and cheese and rice are very unique. Mac and cheese has a Caribbean seasoning and the rice has a hint of coconut. For dessert u had the plantains that were on the house! Great huge meal for $14 that could easily be shared by two peeps!

50.description: I popped in this afternoon for the first time. Was feeling super hungry and caught a whiff that I couldn't resist. The decor is super cool in a soft loft-type space. I went small and ordered two pork sliders to go, but I love the look of the menu and I'm already planning what I'll get tomorrow. The staff is very polite and friendly. The music alone could keep me there all day.Oh, I just finished the sliders and they were superb. The texture of the pork was perfect and it was spicy without too much mess. Love.

4.description: I've only been once, but I'm sure to return. Wings with cilantro dipping sauce  are perfection & rum punch will put you on your back!  Sides are yummy as well. Staff is also very friendly and welcoming making this my new favorite jerk spot!!!!Super casual environment, with big screens all around. It's NOT a sports bar, but a perfect place to catch a game. Daily happy hour specials and DJ Thurs,Fri,Sat

6.description: I have been waiting and waiting and waiting for this store to open. I was really stalking the restaurant opening for one reason and one reason only - Jamaican Meat Patties!!! After eating a dozen or so meat patties on a vacation to Jamaica I simply could not get them off my mind. A year or two later the Jerk food truck started showing up at my place of employment and to my delight they had meat patties that did not disappoint. Flaky, buttery crust and spicy beef filling just like the ones I had in Jamaica! Fast forward, a year when I'm working at a new place with no access to the Jerk truck and desperately craving a meat patty. Needless to say, I was SUPER excited when Jerk finally opened.I think it would be a fair statement that you probably don't want to eat here if you're not into the spices. Almost everything on the menu packs a pretty solid punch of spice. While dining in with a friend we had the jerk pork and jerk chicken both of which came with a hush puppy (although I don't believe that is their name for it), cole slaw, and a side of your choice. We both chose mac and cheese. And of course, I also got a beef patty on the side. The beef patty was phenomenal (but I knew that already). Both of the meats were excellent, moist and full of flavor. All of the sides were fantastic as well. The mac and cheese is super cheesy and delightful and has that kicked up spice that Jerk Modern Jamaican Grill does so well. Obviously I'll be back to eat ALLLLL the meat patties but after sampling the meats I think it's quite clear to me that I'll be loading up on the jerk proteins too. There are still many more sides and extras to try as well. If they're half as good as my first visit it will be worth it every time.

22.description: It is very good if you are into jerk chicken and dark meat.  If you don't like either of these it will be difficult to have a great meal.  Pricey but that isn't the star drop off I don't punish reviews for price but understand it is pricey for lunch.  Wings were good but overdone, mac and cheese is to die for and the chicken (if you like jerk and dark meat) is great

15.description: This place looks great but they don't have any vegetarian entrees and the cooks are not Jamaican. I don't want these wannabes  cooking Caribbean food unless I get a discount. Also, the vegetarian sides cost $2.45 for a 2 ounce scoop. I know Chicago is expensive but please warn me when you tell a joke so I can laugh too.

57.description: Dumbfounded how this place doesn't have a 5 star rating. Clean, welcoming decor.   Super friendly staff.Most importantly the food.  Jerk chicken was absolutely delicious and the rude girl sauce gave it a SERIOUS kick with an awesome taste. Coconut rice and beans were to die for. Little piece of corn bread was delicious but not nearly enough, I wanted 5 of them haha.  Cole slaw was fresh and crispy.  They have one of those fancy fountain Coke machines with about 200 different flavors; the cherry Coke Zero was ice cold and perfectly carbonated. Overall great lunch experience, I'm legit considering going back for dinner.

20.description: First: dry and bland jerkSecond: festival is tastyThird: dry and bland jerkFourth: trendy barFifth: if you don't know what good Jamaican Jerk is then you won't know the difference

36.description: Went back to Jerk for my 4th or so time for lunch after a long hiatus and have to say I still absolutely love this place. The food is consistently prepared, cooked, seasoned, and served with the same deliciousness and flavor I remember from my 6 times to Jamaica. Love the jerk chicken, chicken wings, festival, mac&cheese, and coconut rice. Also I think customer service is always on point, greeted with a smile and hello every time I've been which I appreciate and feel is seriously missed these days. I think the atmosphere is cool, love the energy of the place and I will continue to go back again and again and gain with my friends and family. To all reading this its Jerk MODERN Jamaican Grill, says it right in the name so anyone upset that it is not 100% authentic Jamaican should take a reading exam. Apart from the food the beer and rum selection is great and they even have rum punch on tap! Haters please go elsewhere, your absence will help keep the line moving faster and allow us who love this place to give our tastebuds what they deserve. Everyone else the high quality shines through on every level, do yourself a favor and go get some Jerk!

14.description: Great Jerk Chicken! Live the rude girl sauce!!!Simple, good price , friendly service. Big, juicy wings. Salads are crisp - super fresh.

58.description: I was very impressed with my experience at Tsukiji.  Awesome ambiance including the lighting, music, decor, and the paint designs on the wall.  The waiter brought out these small dried balls, poured water over them and they expanded into hand towels! Super cool.  The food was delicious, the fish is very fresh and the rolls were tasty.  I will definitely come back again.

56.description: First time ordering grubhub from here. Food came quickly and soup was hot. Quality sushi. I am anxious to actually dine in the restaurant.

29.description: The food: 2/5. We came in on a Thursday night around 7pm and we were the ONLY people at the restaurant. That's rarely a good sign. I got ahi tuna poke,  ikebukuro and two slices of salmon sashimi. Tuna poke wasn't too bad, while the pieces of fish were generous and the spice was about right, the fish just didn't taste fresh and I felt like I was forcing myself to finish it. Frankly, I enjoyed the fresh cucumbers more than the fish. Given the review, my hopes for the  ikebukuro, were pretty high, but again it was very disappointing. While I liked the combo of ingredients in the ikebukuro, the salmon in it along with my salmon sashimi did not taste fresh. The service: 3/5. Average service, while it was fast because we were the only people at the restaurant, it wasn't very attentive and the waitress didn't offer to explain the menu. Overall: 2/5. Mediocre sushi, won't go back.

42.description: Solid place for take out.  Over all its pretty pricey for what they are offering but there are usually coupons available which makes it affordable.Very vast array of cooked foods and sushis.  Sushi is relatively fresh.  Can't really go wrong with any of them.  Nothing is really extraordinary but nothing is bad either.Ramen is nice and heartyHabachi / bentos are good value and fillingAvoid:Yakisoba is very bland and plain (i mean i guess that is what yokisoba is but its way over priced)Agedashi tofu - more of a broth and the tofu lacks texture.  not a fanSummary:Great place for takeout if you have a deal! Otherwise its pretty expensive but it is a solid choice a step above butterfly.  Still this place pales in comparison to other sushi places.

23.description: This is my new top sushi place in Chicago. Very reasonably priced AMAZINGLY bento box lunch. Sushi is unbelievable with top notch quality fish. Great atmosphere and friendly service, Byob. Game over. This is the place.

47.description: I really like Tsukiji, and it has officially replaced Seadog as my go-to sushi spot. Bonus that they offer waaaaaaay more than just sushi! I don't know if I buy the whole "we fly our fish in from Japan" mantra, but regardless the fish is fresh and delicious every time. Their ramen is also really tasty, along with basically everything else I have tried...ranging from the Fresh Tuna Salad to Chicken Yakisoba. But my favorite is always the sushi platter. Also, BYOB! Go get some.

8.description: The gist: excellent service; good, somewhat expensive*, sushi*The prices of the individual rolls aren't bad, but if you compare the size of the roll and the cut of fish on the rolls between this restaurant and say, Yuzu, you'll see why I call this place somewhat expensive.They do a hand towel service at the beginning of your meal. They bring out tablet sized compressed towels and pour war water over them. Watching them expand it pretty fun. I got the rainbow roll and the salmon roll. Not bad, but the rice could have been more flavorful. Fish was sliced pretty thin.

31.description: Great local spot.  I eat here a few times a month.  I have only had their sushi though.

34.description: This was second time here. First time got delivery. Second time, Dined in. First time - Delivery was quick. Was craving udon. Wanted good quality and not chockful of msg. Guessed that this might be a place to try. Ordered Beef Udon. Broth was not soy sauce based as I expected but was light so was okay with it. Noodles were not soggy, but not as thick as I expected udon noodles to be. Dine in - Service greatly lacked. A table that was finishing as we arrived seemed frustrated with the slow service too. Food was okay. Overpriced for what you get. We ordered the Dragon Roll, Ikebukoro, and the Okinomoyaki.Dragon Roll - Fresh ingredients in this roll. Eel was toasty and thick. Ikebukoro - I like ikura and salmon so the combination was perfect for me. Drizzled with sesame oil. Tasted good. No sauce needed. - Okinomoyaki - wasn't on the menu. got it from yelp pics. Was charged as a special kitchen item for $14. Was more worth $10 in my opinion.  Izakaya Mita's does a better job at this dish in my opinion.  Can't comment on the freshness of the fish since the fish I had was either cooked or had sauces on it. Service - Give them a 3. They were not rude, but still dissapointing. Never came to refill hot tea or ask how things are even though we were the only ones in the restaurant.Don't think I'll dine in again. Possibly a take out/delivery option. Pictures of the bento boxes look good. May also try their ramen too.

16.description: Been here a couple of times now.  Ramen is average, but clearly overpriced at $15.  Sushi is slightly better than average, but the uni isn't always the freshest.  Hit or miss.  They charge you a premium for fatty salmon nigiri yet it was pretty much the same as regular salmon.  Toro not afforadable.  They quote MP at $10 a piece.  Staff not the friendliest.

13.description: I really like this place! The workers are all really friendly and the food is pretty good. The sukiyaki and kara miso ramen are among my favorites. Caution though, the kara miso is really, really spicy. Like, they have started warning people when they order it kind of spicy. The sukiyaki, on the other hand, is slightly sweet and delicious. They have this hand towel thing that they give you when you first sit down that is a nice touch. The sushi is also really good, and tastes fresh. The prices are also very reasonable, which is always a plus! Their takeout and delivery isn't as good as the food you get when ordering there, but when is takeout/delivery ever as good as getting food in a restaurant? This place is all about presentation, so you should definitely stop in and eat here. The head chef is awesome and makes amazing looking food!Oh i almost forgot to mention, this place is BYOB and there's a bar that has carry out down the street in case you forget the booze at home!

11.description: If you want true authentic Japanese food, this joint is more like fusion at best. Owner is not Japanese says a lot in its details of materials, the way they are cooked and even presented. Rice is a major part of any Japanese place. This is just so so. I don't mean to speak ill when owner isn't Japanese. However, I want real authentic stuff. Please try harder.

39.description: very good sushi (try the salmon/cucumber marinated appetizer), ramen, and yakisoba.  It's always weirdly empty, but seems reliably good.  a mystery . . .

37.description: I was told by the concierge to check out Butterfly. As I walked past, I noticed that it was packed and decided to look elsewhere. To my surprise, right up the road is a unassuming restaurant that claims to be a fish market. When I walked in I briefly glanced over the menu & asked" How often do you get a fish delivery?" The woman replied "Everyday." What restaurant wouldn't say that? The ambiance was warm, carefully decorated and very intimate. So, I gave it a try. Boy, did I make the right decision. I have been eating sushi for 27 years and sampled the best from all over the globe. If a sushi bar has poor Uni, then most likely, all the fish will be poor. Am, our waitress, was attentive and I never had an empty water glass. You are going to need it when you taste Chef's handmade wasabi. This is priceless. The fish was outstanding..fresh, crisp and sweet. The Uni melted in my mouth and the Sashimi was tender & flavorful.  From the Uni, to the fresh cracked crab legs. The portions were filling and the presentation was too beautiful to eat. Can somebody please call Anthony Bourdain? If you want to eat at Chicago's best kept secret, make this a travel destination. I have to go to confession as the food was that sinful!

0.description: I really don't yelp anymore, but I feel like this place deserves a shout out as it's our go to Japanese restaurant, has solid food, good service and seems to never be that crowded. They cover all the bases with sushi, noodles, katsu and other Japanese standards. I appreciate that they don't also have Thai (like so many sushi places do these days) and just focus on one cuisine..... My 15 month old (and I) highly recommend the okonomiyaki (seafood pancake).Give this place a try!

38.description: I was pretty impressed with this place the first time I came here for dinner. It was pretty busy, but we snagged a seat at the sushi bar. The fish was fresh and the presentation was nice. And the place looks decent and clean. We came here again for dinner on a Saturday night and it was pretty empty. Unfortunately, the service was really poor. They first made a mistake and gave me a sashimi dinner, instead of a nigiri dinner. That's fine as long as it is fixed. But then they forgot about our 2 extra nigiris we ordered. We reminded the waitress and she quickly brought my ama ebi nigiri, but then she forgot our salmon nigiri! At this point, we finished both of our dinners and we were ready to leave. She brought out our check and we noticed they still charged us for the nigiri they never gave us. So we let the waitress know and she said absolutely nothing. They fixed the receipt, but their was no apology or anything. Usually, I don't make a fuss about little things like this. But they messed up my order, forgot about our 2 extra nigiris, forgot 1 of them again, and still charged us for it! C'mon, at least acknowledge the mistakes. It's a shame. Their food is really good, but their customer service is pretty careless and it wasn't even busy. There are plenty of other sushi joints in that neighborhood to go to.

51.description: I don't write reviews very often anymore, but I feel compelled to write a review for this place. It's become my favorite neighborhood restaurant (and maybe one of my favorite in the city), but it's rarely busy.Their menu is huge, so I can't speak for everything. But what I have had... it's amazing. From best to least best.... (1) Any of the ramen (though beware of the kara), (2) karaage chicken, (3) beef soba, (4) katsu don, (5) soft shell crab salad, (6) octopus, (7) seared tuna,  (8) tuna poke, (9) 10-way tie for all the sushi, (11) the Hot Pot. Sushi is second to last not because I don't like it, just because I'd rather eat that other stuff.  The hot pot is last because I didn't like it. While I don't order their sushi often, it's always been delicious and I'm scratching my head at the few people who are complaining that "the fish is not fresh". Every thing I've had here tastes completely fresh (as an aside, the greatest sushi chefs in the world - Japan and elsewhere - use frozen fish; it brings out the "fish" flavor more). The first few times I ate here, there were constantly people walking in and asking where Butterfly Sushi went. (Butterfly is across the street; Tsukiji occupies their former space). They're somewhat hard to compare, (Butterfly is Thai with some Sushi and Tsukiji is mostly Japanese), but I definitely prefer Tsukiji and wanted to tell everyone lining up across the street. My biggest complaint with Butterfly has always been the quality of the ingredients, whereas Tsukiji is pitch perfect nearly every time.Plus, BYOB! Prices are totally reasonable too.  .

27.description: Great addition to the neighborhood! Wayyy better than Butterfly. Excellent ramen and sushi. Fast delivery. I want this place to get more business!

32.description: I've been here quite a few times, and everything has been delicious. I have tried the sushi (my favorite roll is the one with strawberry on top) and the appetizers (seared beef and pork dumplings great), but there is one meal that I actually CRAVE, and that is the Katsu Curry Don. This is the most delicious thing ever. Rich, thick curry gravy with a generous amount of sweet potato and onion throughout. You can get fried pork, chicken, or shrimp on top, but I prefer the shrimp. My husband likes the pork. This is all served on top of moist white rice. It is best when we sit in the restaurant, as their presentation here is just impeccable. Beautiful serving dishes and colors. I love it. Guys. You gotta try this curry deliciousness before I eat it all.

54.description: Third time enjoyed this place.Fish very fresh and cold, melts in your mouth.Nice menu to choose from.Have some authentic udon/soba.Good choice of bento box for those who not consume raw fish.Place worth to try.

48.description: This used to be the space for butterfly.  They moved to a bigger space and I can see why.  This place is very narrow, pray that you dont get seated way in the back especially when theres a big party because it will be so loud and claustrophobic. Luckily we were seated by the window close to the entrance, so we had a little bit of privacy and space.  Not much to say about service, it just ok.  The only reason this had a 4 instead of a 3 rating is because of the food.  The food was very inventive and delicious at the same time.  Dynamite - oh so yummy, one of my favorite dishes of the evening.  This reminded me of a dish in Kai ZanShrimp Yakisoba - a really good noodle dishthe rest of our order were your typical sushi/sashimiMy recommendation is skip those typical menu items and go for the ones that you can only find in this place.  I really love the food here and I feel it is also priced ok.  I recommend and I will be back.

44.description: Amazingly awesome fish served here. Price hit a little higher than we expected, but we ate like kings. The nigiri was second to none, and the oyster shooters were so well crafted that we felt compelled to double up. Fresh wasabi was served without extra charge, quite well done. It just feels like it needs more energy, that was the only shortcoming. Show happiness! Domo arigato gozaimasu!

24.description: Great, consistent food.  BYOB.  Great place to eat out and also order in from.  We live in the West Loop and this is our goto sushi/ramen/soup joint.Keep it up!

7.description: I lived in Japan for a while, it was some time ago so I forgot why I seldom eat Japanese food, ( though I like it) and,  why the Japanese rates of gastric (stomach) cancer per capita are highest in the world - salt/sodium!It's a charming restaurant with lovely, friendly service. I ordered the spicy miso ramen, my bad, as I normally don't eat a lot of salt in my diet.  Maybe it was me that wasn't used to a lot of salt but I found my ramen too salty for my pallet. Everything else,  the sushi,  yakatori etc were fine.

49.description: I'd been wanting to come to Tsu Kiji Market for a while after reading reviews and their website. Perhaps I I was expecting to much?Decor was cool with the Japanese lamps, and koi style art. Service was super slow at first but finally was up to par. The food was average:Spicy Crunchy Tuna Roll: pretty standard of what you'd get at other restaurantsShrimp and Vegetable Tempura: see above commentKaraage Chicken: see above above commentHamachi Jalapeno: a must!Seared Tataki Beef: was served cold and on the bottom is was icy. Couldn't taste the sesame oil.Hibachi Beef: think we got ripped off. there were a lot of tiny morsels of shredded beef treading in sauce. Very hard to pick up with chopsticks since they were so small.Vanilla ice cream: some of the best I've tasted even if it is just vanilla.Green tea ice cream: excellent and I recommend it.I may come back here since it's BYOB and I can get some decent sushi and ice cream.

40.description: Fresh and tasty sushi.  Rainbow roll was excellent.  It wasn't California in the center, but rather tuna and white fish.  Spicy tuna roll was also super spicy, not lots of mayo.  Not a big fan of the shrimp tempura and wish they had a few more creative choices of maki rolls.   Order was accurate and delivery driver was courteous.   I will definitely order again.

53.description: Hidden gem! Excellent service and ambiance. BYOB. Great date spot or perfect for big groups. The sushi is always fresh. Hands down my favorite sushi spot in Chicago. **Must try the Big Buddha roll and Mango Mochi for dessert!

30.description: I had high hopes for Tsukiji--both the website and the storefront seemed extremely promising, and while my experience wasn't terrible, it didn't live up to what its name seemed to promise. I got the Kainan roll which I enjoyed for the most part--the yuzu mayonnaise was an excellent addition to the flavors of the shiitake mushrooms and the flakes; however, I had my suspicions about how fresh the tuna was. The tonkotsu ramen, however, was pretty disappointing--the broth was way too salty, and the noodles were slightly overdone and strangely wide for ramen noodles. Overall, decent service but mediocre food for a rather steep price.

46.description: Tsu Kiji has quickly become my favorite neighborhood sushi spot. I eat here on a weekly basis (dine-in, carry out and, when feeling particularly lazy, delivery). The food is consistent and high quality. I have become somewhat obsessed with the Beef Udon soup. Give this place a shot.

1.description: Tsukiji fish market?  My foot!Well, I used to have breakfast at the real Tsukiji Fish Market in Tokyo while living there, and eat there each year as I travel to Tokyo.  I have no idea how this restaurants claim they bring their fish from Tsukiji fish market; i.e. i do not believe it....maybe packed frozen purchased from a 7/11 at Tsukiji.Low quality raw fish served on poorly done rice, called Nigiri...not even as good (bad?) as those pre-pared ones at Whole Foods Market, and certainly not as palatable as what you get at Mitsuwa for a fraction of the price.Stopped by there as I was driving by and was too hungry to think clearly and go somewhere else.  Lunch at about $58 no alcohol, no quality, and certainly no value.As for the name of the place (assuming it is legal and not copyrighted/trade marked by the real entity), it feels like going to Tokyo and having pizza at a restaurant called Chicago Water Tower Pizza......

55.description: I have a favorite sushi place in the city but Tsukiji Fish Market blew them away.  Everything was extremely fresh and delicious.  We got the gomae, gyoza, miso soup, nigiri (hamachi, maguro and unagi) and dragon roll and everything was excellent.  I'll definitely be back soon!

9.description: Tsukiji is in a nice neighborhood and has a nice quiet feel to it. It is much more of a lunch destination than for a fancy dinner. I can't say the sushi does Tsukiji's namesake justice, but it is very inexpensive, and the lunch deals are great. Drop by for a quick bite, good service, and happy staff.

26.description: First time trying and the fish was fresh and tasty.  We had it delivered and the owner called me to make sure of my order since I ordered off yelp.  The ramen was delicious too.  Flavorful with spice.  I'll definitely be ordering from here again.  Enjoy!

25.description: This review is strictly for the vegetarian ramen I had for take-out last night. Noodles were all stuck together and the broth was pretty boring. I got charged an extra $2 for an egg, which would be fine except this ramen was literally nothing but a couple pieces of seaweed, noodles, some pickled ginger, and three thin pieces of fried tofu (think of inari nigiri). I was really underwhelmed and for $15 plus the extra charge for an egg, tax, and tip, totaling $20, I felt super ripped off.The only upside was that the staff were incredibly nice and chatted with me while I waited. They also offered me water and tea, which was a nice touch.Sadly, I'll be going elsewhere for my ramen fix.

12.description: I think it is kind of pretentious to name your sushi place after the Tsukiji Fish Market, the place where Jiro as in Jiro Dreams of Sushi goes to buy the freshest fish for his restaurant. It was a little snooty to greet us in Japanese, when it appeared that none of the employees were Japanese. ALSO, I would say 80% of their specialty rolls had white tuna/escolar. PLEASE, read about white tuna/escolar consumption. Humans can NOT digest these fish, but of course, as with everything, if you eat sparingly, you'll probably be okay. Anyway...Service-wise... We came here at 10pm on a Friday night for a late dinner. We were the only ones in the restaurant, yet they took their sweet time coming to get our orders or filling our water.I can't remember the names now of what we ordered. The Green Diamond or something similar to that name had calamari in it, which was different, but decent. The portions aren't the biggest. We ordered two skewers - the pork and the chicken liver. Both were good, but definitely not worth $7 for each dish.

59.description: This place is not great & overpriced. $40 for two bowls of ramen & fried chicken appetizer, and the quality of all the meat is questionable. This isn't pork belly in the ramen, but two small slices of pork roast.  Not sure what the cut of fried chicken was, but definitely not breast meat.  The flavor of the ramen was ok, but I've had better, especially at this price point. I won't be going back.

21.description: I loved everything about this place.  We walked in and had the run of the place, which I dont think will last forever.  Go here and enjoy. Its fantastic.  I hadn't had good sushi since I moved to Chicago so i was looking to change that.  Boy did I.  Without question. I ordered the Matsu Sushi Entree which was 9 delicious pieces and miso soup. I tacked on an oshinko roll because they are heaven on earth.  This place delivered everything I ordered with precision.  Very very good sushi.  Also, its BYOB with no corkage fee.  How can you go wrong? You cant.  Its that good.  The service was impeccable too.  Just a well-run joint.  All the way around. Highly recommend this place.  Run, dont walk.  Its worth it.

17.description: Wahhh I was sooo looking forward to eating here because of the reviews! However, our venture here lead us to a disappointing dinner.We ordered a bunch of nigiri (amaebi, albacore, uni, hotate aburi (seared scallop), king crab, wagyu aburi, foie gras, maguro, and salmon volcano aburi). We also ordered the ikebukuro, oyako don, and hamachi jalapeno.The nigiri was whatever, the uni and fish weren't as fresh as I expected. I would not order to foie gras again, despite my love for it, but as a nigiri it was just way too rich and buttery to take down on its own. The amaebi was a bit mushier than what I prefer. And the heads were cold by the time they came out and soggy from the sauce. It probably would have been better if it was delivered fresh out of the fryer. Everything else was just average. I would recommend two things we had: the hotate aburi and the ikebukuro. Those two were pretty good, the best out of our meal.Prices were expensive though, in my opinion. about $3-4 per piece of sashimi/nigiri. I'm used to it being 2 pieces per order. And for that price, I expected something very fresh and high quality.They also only had 3 orders of uni left?! HOW IS THAT POSSIBLE?! So we ended up fighting over the three, but it honestly wasn't worth the fight. It wasn't super fresh and you can tell it was frozen.Service was good. Our server was very quiet and polite. They also had these cool towels that when water is poured on they expand!The ambiance was very trendy. Nice tables, decorations, and plating.But for the price we paid, I could definitely get way better sushi back home in SF.Another downside is that we had to choose between here and Lawrence Fish Market. I now regret our choice to come here and should have gone for the cheaper option which is probably the same quality sushi.

10.description: Tsukiji Fish Market is an actual fish market known in Tokyo for being amazingly fresh & the biggest wholesaler of fish. So either this place has to be fantastic...or is super messed up for using the name....or perhaps both? Personally, I have no strong opinions on them using the name. Their sushi is good and that's what matters in my mind. I actually ordered some maki through GrubHub and the rolls held up just great during transport.I ordered some very basic maki - a Philly Roll, Spicy Tuna, Shiitake, and Sweet Potato Roll. All of these were some of the best I've had in quite awhile. They were rolled well, used very fresh fish and overall tasted delicious. I'd love to go in and try some of their other dishes but based on the name of this restaurant, I'm going to go out on a limb and say sushi is their specialty. Seeing as it's my specialty, too (I'm an expert sushi eater), it will be awfully hard for me to venture on to other dishes.Loved it. Devoured it. Going back soon.

5.description: Overall: Tsujiki fish market is an ok place to dine for it's lower prices but the warm is uncomfortably warm and the sushi tasted like it was frozenFood: Salmon Donburi... the salmon tasted frozen. The quantity is pretty good. The miso soup was good ---You know that uncomfortable feeling when you sit on a warm toilet seat? That's what it felt like when I walked into the Tsujiki Fish Market restaurant in Chicago. I saw sushi lying there that seemed to be unrefrigerated and wondered how it could have been fresh. The waitress was nice and attentive but the food wasn't great. The salmon in the salmon donburi had a weird chewiness to it that made it taste old. I'm guessing it had been frozen for a while. The miso soup and free edamame were solid as well as my girlfriend's eel dish, but my dish was disappointing.

3.description: Ima go ahead and give this place 5 stars just because they were just as good as my favorite Ramen spot that I have been going to for years. I ordered the Kira Miso Ramen and it was actually spicy which I LOVED! The broth is delicious and the portion size is great. Service was friendly and the menu had a lot to choose from. Don't judge by the exterior of the place. Once you go inside it's super cute!

35.description: Hidden place.  Good Sushi.  Love that there is a nice one in the area.  Ramen is also good.  Give it a try... You'll be happy that you did.

19.description: The food: 2/5. We came in on a Thursday night around 7pm and we were the ONLY people at the restaurant. That's rarely a good sign. I got ahi tuna poke,  ikebukuro and two slices of salmon sashimi. Tuna poke wasn't too bad, while the pieces of fish were generous and the spice was about right, the fish just didn't taste fresh and I felt like I was forcing myself to finish it. Frankly, I enjoyed the fresh cucumbers more than the fish. Given the review, my hopes for the  ikebukuro, were pretty high, but again it was very disappointing. While I liked the combo of ingredients in the ikebukuro, the salmon in it along with my salmon sashimi did not taste fresh. The service: 3/5. Average service, while it was fast because we were the only people at the restaurant, it wasn't very attentive and the waitress didn't offer to explain the menu. Overall: 2/5. Mediocre sushi, won't go back.

28.description: Delivery is consistent and awesome! Love the crazy roll!

45.description: Best sushi in the city! I have ordered from this place numerous times but never went to the actual restaurant until last night. I was with two well traveled friends and we all agree it's one of the best if not the best sushi we have ever had. the vibe in the place is very cool - I would have thought it would be more crowded - I'm not sure why it's not. It's a gem!

33.description: I've been here 3 times and each time was great. The sushi chef has over 15 years of experience. Also I don't like mayo which is tough when eating sushi. Everyone wants to add tons of "special" sauce. The cheaper places with less than fresh fish tend to do this a lot. That is not the case here. The price is fair for fresh caught fish. Also the sauces that don't have mayo are great and compliment the fish rather than dominate the dish.I really missed Kai when it moved to the south loop. (Booo Kai, but I understand) So, I was super happy to see a replacement arrive. I don't like Butterfly Sushi. I know everyone goes there but it's just cheap sushi with way too much special sauce.As for the service. It has been consistently good even when they've been busy.BYOB makes it even better.I will say this, if you are someone who expects cheap fish or to be waited on hand and foot, this is not the place for you. Most of the places I like  have a polite  staff  and are reasonably quick, but take enough time to make good fresh food. If those aren't your priorities, most places I review may not be for you. Happy Eating!

43.description: I do liked the food, this is my second time order it from GH, but they came an hour later than the time presented. Also they didn't pack the dessert for me!!

2.description: So when I saw the name of this sushi place, I was like, "wow, they must have HUGE balls to name themselves after Tsukiji! Hopefully the fish is super fresh..."I mean, it wasn't awful, but it wasn't spectacular or worthy of its name by any means. Bland sushi rice had no vinegar. Spicy crunchy roll was alright, I guess.But the real reason that I have to rate them pretty low is because our delivery order took over 90 minutes to arrive. It was snowing, yada yada, so normally I would just give them a pass... but we ordered delivery from 3 other places at the same time (don't judge!), and they all came within an hour. Tsukiji took WAY longer. Plus, the sushi was lackluster. So I think you could do way better than this place if you're looking for sushi delivery.

18.description: I loved everything about this place.  We walked in and had the run of the place, which I dont think will last forever.  Go here and enjoy. Its fantastic.  I hadn't had good sushi since I moved to Chicago so i was looking to change that.  Boy did I.  Without question. I ordered the Matsu Sushi Entree which was 9 delicious pieces and miso soup. I tacked on an oshinko roll because they are heaven on earth.  This place delivered everything I ordered with precision.  Very very good sushi.  Also, its BYOB with no corkage fee.  How can you go wrong? You cant.  Its that good.  The service was impeccable too.  Just a well-run joint.  All the way around. Highly recommend this place.  Run, dont walk.  Its worth it.

41.description: I can't say no to more sushi in the neighborhood. There is one a couple blocks closer, but I do feel that the quality is better here. I came and did carry-out and it was pretty quick paying for my order and getting my sushi. They have plenty of other options if you don't want sushi. I got the Futo, Tornado, and Island maki. All were very good, and I was pretty full. Be on the lookout for your neighborhood coupon booklet for some money off your order. The staff was slightly slow, but attentive enough.

52.description: So many mixed feelings about this place! I went in for lunch with a coworker on Wednesday. Place was very empty. We were the only people in there. I did notice that there seemed to be some take out orders that were being prepped. We sat down and ordered:-Tempura Don-Tonkatsu RamenBoth dishes were actually very very good. The tempura was very crunchy and stayed crisp throughout our meal. I loved the teriyaki sauce that was served with it. The rice was just all right though, not my favorite type of Japanese rice. The ramen was also delicious. I enjoyed it very much. However I felt like there weren't too many noodles? Mainly just a lot of broth.While I enjoyed the food very much I did think that it was pretty overpriced for what you get. They could probably lower the prices a bit for the quantity that you get.The service was interesting. While the lady that served was extremely nice and very welcoming it was very hard to find her and get her attention. Keep in mind, it was just the two of us in there. It should not have been so hard to find her. I had to physically go up to the hostess stand to get the check from. Not good.Overall, a very tasty place that needs to work on its price point and the attentiveness of the servers.

50.description: Tsukiji is fairly close to my apartment, and so that's probably one of the reasons why I've visited multiple times with various friends, and I've ordered for take out as well. Overall, good is the most appropriate adjective to describe it - it's not truly fantastic, and only occasionally great; it has good value, good freshness, good selection, good (and friendly) service, and tastes good. Tsukiji has a unique take on bento boxes (one of my favorite foods ever), they have sweet shrimp amaebi on the menu (my most recent obsession), and a variety of dishes I haven't had the chance to try yet. I usually leave full and satisfied. What can I say, it's just that good.

4.description: Good quality fish. But, I was not thrilled to receive 2 pieces of "krab" and two pieces of Ebi in my 9 piece sashimi order at $23. ¬_¬

6.description: Tsukiji (named after the famed fish market in Tokyo and pronounced similarly to "squeegee" is a solid local Japanese choice.It is not the trendy see and be seen type of place you might find downtown, rather it is a locally run place headed by nice people working hard to make customers happy.The menu is very diverse offering not only sushi but bento boxes, rice bowls, tempura, ramen and udon as well.  Basically it is a tour of classic Japanese fare.It's all solidly prepared and presented. None of it will blow you away but it likely will not disappoint either. The presentation is actually greater than one might expect from such a place and it represents generally a very good value.  Along the lines of value they also allow you to BYOB but now are offering Sake as well so it is the best of both worlds.The portions are also generous and it is generally an easy walk in.  It is great to have such a place in the neighborhood and I urge locals to support them.  Its a great and in some ways better alternative to the other area sushi and Japanese spots.

22.description: I lived in Japan for a while, it was some time ago so I forgot why I seldom eat Japanese food, ( though I like it) and,  why the Japanese rates of gastric (stomach) cancer per capita are highest in the world - salt/sodium!It's a charming restaurant with lovely, friendly service. I ordered the spicy miso ramen, my bad, as I normally don't eat a lot of salt in my diet.  Maybe it was me that wasn't used to a lot of salt but I found my ramen too salty for my pallet. Everything else,  the sushi,  yakatori etc were fine.

15.description: I'm really glad I didn't Tsukiji my shorts as I sat down to eat here. There were some giant spider decorations that scared the bejeses out of me, but thankfully I held it together long enough to enjoy one of the better BYO's I've had in quite sometime. They have a huge menu with sushi, specialty rolls, ramen, yakitori, bento boxes, and a bunch of other noodle options. It's all pretty damn delicious and the price point is really low considering the quality of what you're getting. Definitely do the Tonkatsu ramen, which is about as tasty as it is fun to say, and don't you dare leave without some Green Tea mochi. It's as sweet as the cute little servers, and tops off what's an all around awesome date experience...especially if you're a bachelor on a budget.

57.description: Great neighborhood joint, date spot, and for larger parties.  App highlights were shishito peppers, Giza, trio anari.  Also standouts include ramen (tonkutsu and kara miso).  The menu is extremely large and has everything for whatever mood you are in.

20.description: Tsukiji Fish Market is an actual fish market known in Tokyo for being amazingly fresh & the biggest wholesaler of fish. So either this place has to be fantastic...or is super messed up for using the name....or perhaps both? Personally, I have no strong opinions on them using the name. Their sushi is good and that's what matters in my mind. I actually ordered some maki through GrubHub and the rolls held up just great during transport.I ordered some very basic maki - a Philly Roll, Spicy Tuna, Shiitake, and Sweet Potato Roll. All of these were some of the best I've had in quite awhile. They were rolled well, used very fresh fish and overall tasted delicious. I'd love to go in and try some of their other dishes but based on the name of this restaurant, I'm going to go out on a limb and say sushi is their specialty. Seeing as it's my specialty, too (I'm an expert sushi eater), it will be awfully hard for me to venture on to other dishes.Loved it. Devoured it. Going back soon.

36.description: this is a hidden gem that we found before a bulls game.  it's now our goto place when we are in the area.  i'm a traditional sushi eater, nigiri pieces served how the chef prepares it.  the sake, hamachi, maguro, hotate, shiro maguro, and amaebi were amazing for the price.  i give it 5 stars for the sushi but ... the ramen is what brought down the overall rating.  as for the ramen, the broth was salty and the noodles were okay.  i'd give the ramen 1 2 stars.

14.description: I had high hopes for Tsukiji--both the website and the storefront seemed extremely promising, and while my experience wasn't terrible, it didn't live up to what its name seemed to promise. I got the Kainan roll which I enjoyed for the most part--the yuzu mayonnaise was an excellent addition to the flavors of the shiitake mushrooms and the flakes; however, I had my suspicions about how fresh the tuna was. The tonkotsu ramen, however, was pretty disappointing--the broth was way too salty, and the noodles were slightly overdone and strangely wide for ramen noodles. Overall, decent service but mediocre food for a rather steep price.
