3.description: The guys at Urban Grower have been awesome with assisting me in setting up my balcony garden this year.  I just moved from NC so I was terribly unfamiliar with the concept of small space gardening; however, they held my hand through the entire process and I've had amazing tomatoes this year.  They're the only people I go to for my gardening needs!

1.description: I purchased a gift certificate for this place through a Groupon-style site called dealsmagazine.com for $40 worth of plant nutrients. I had never been to this store before but checked it out online and was pleasantly surprised by what they sold. It's tucked away in the middle of nowhere and I would never have known it was there if not for buying the gift certificate. My girlfriend and I dropped into the store one Saturday afternoon and were excited to check out all of the growing equipment they had. We picked out the plant nutrients we wanted and discussed coming back later in the season to buy grow lights and other equipment to outfit our spare room so that we could continue gardening throughout the winter.I got to the counter and handed over the gift certificate to one of the managers who seemed very surprised by it, saying he had no knowledge of the offer. He told me that anything like that would have had to have been authorized by him first, though he did tell me that the name that was on the gift certificate WAS one of their employees. He went out the back to call Deals Magazine while the other manager assured us not to worry, that they would still honor it. Manager #1 came back and said he couldn't get through to DM on the phone but had left them a message. He took all of my information and said he'd call me back once he had spoken to DM on Monday and they had figured out what had happened.I never heard from anyone at Urban Grower again.I did however hear back from Deals Magazine, they emailed me with this."I want to truly apologize for the problems with Urban Grower over this past weekend. Unfortunately there was some major confusion on their part and they are unwilling to accept the voucher".Before I purchased the deal there were 500 gift certificates available. After I purchased it there were 499. The deal had been live on the DM site for months before I finally decided to buy it and clearly I was the only person to do so, so at the very most, if Urban Grower had done the right thing and honored my gift certificate, they would have been out $40 (though I'm sure there would have been some reimbursement by DM).  A small price to pay for the future business they would have received from me and my large circle of community gardening friends. I'm still planning my indoor garden but it will not be built with any products purchased from Urban Grower

2.description: Definitely found that I strongly prefer it to Brew and Grow on Kedzie. The staff is simply the most knowledgeable and friendly. I went there with my partner and now it's my favorite grow supply store. It covers all the bases and inspired me to check out new ones!

5.description: My wife and I were looking to get an herb garden started inside for the winter, so we decided to go to the Urban Grower and see what they had to offer.  These guys have everything we needed and more, its truly a one stop shop for indoor gardeners. We were a little over whelmed with all the different options but the sales associate took the time and explained everything in great detail. They seemed more concerned with making sure we were going to be successful with our project than up-selling us on a   bunch of additional products ( which we appreciated). They gave us a bunch of free nutrient samples to get us started. These guys truly know what they are talking about and answered all of our questions with out any hesitation. It was nice to know that they are a local independent store rather than a chain or corporation, and it showed with there customer service. Id definitely advise anyone interested in urban gardening to stop in and talk to these gentlemen.

6.description: Very friendly and helpful and had good Black Friday deals on nutrients.  Nice selection of items and more reasonably priced than other larger outfits in town.

0.description: I've reviewed Urban grower before and after having another encounter I feel it deserves a revise.... they are more awesome than I thought!!! I hope this keeps my previous post as well though I'll copy at bottom just so you can see the amount of professionalism and knowledge they presented me with. I went in to merely browse and was pleasantly surprised when Rob sorta remembered me from months ago and asked about my garden. I said "fantastic!" when he mentioned a new product they had that just came in and was even cheaper than the previous stuff! I can't think of any other place that genuinely is more interested in helping rather than an extra $10. I suggest anyone with any interest or desire to learn about growing in general definitely go here! Previous post:5.0 star rating4/30/2012This is the most friendly, helpful place EVER! I recently lost my job and am spending a ton of time at home so I decided to start a garden. It was between that and brewing my own cider. So, to decide between the two I called and asked a million questions and not only was the dude I spoke to (I think his name was Rob) extremely patient, he didn't even try to do any sales pitch. He broke it down and even offered to throw in a sample of some nutrients to try if I came in!!! There are a bazillion grow shops in Chicago and I would recommend Urban Grower to anyone. BTW I'm totally going with the gardening now, forget brewing cider. I'm so excited to start!!! Thanks Urban Grower, you rock! I'm sure I'll be in very soon :)

4.description: WARNING!  They DO NOT Accept returns!I spent over a thousand dollars on equipment from this store to set up an indoor home garden.   Even though the store employee who sold me all the equipment promised to help me set everything up he never did.  Yes, I was not available for our first appointment but after our first appointment date he never made himself available again.   I am growing vegetables in my living room near my entertainment system and I was unhappy that the light that was recommended to me made a loud buzzing noise.  I brought the equipment into the store with the original packaging in mint condition and with the a receipt and I literally had both the store manager and an employee sit there and berate me for wanting to return it in the first place and then try and talk me out of returning it.  Finally they told me they would not take back the light bulb ($30+) because it had been used.  I plugged it in and let it run for 20 minutes before shutting it off and putting it back in the box.  They were considering giving me a trade in for the light fixture ($200+). I asked two to three times to get store credit so that I could purchase an LED light that made no noise.  But they kept telling me that I was making a mistake and should purchase something they have already on their shelves.  They didn't want to order an LED light for me probably because they would make less profit.  I have never seen worse customer service in my life.These guys really need to learn something about how they treat people unless harassing people who are making returns to keep them from returning products is their policy.  I will never step foot in this shop again and I recommend you go to more established growing store.

58.description: This place kicks @ss. Amazing brunch, top notch flavors, great service!  Drinks are excellent.  Looking forward to my next meal here!

56.description: Flo is amazing! Their mimosa flight and black bean burger are excellent!

29.description: Really good food, fantastic cocktails. Our waiter recommended the apple cinnamon mimosa which tasted like a refreshing apple pie in my mouth. Best was the service, which didn't try to rush us out even though the restaurant was busy. Thanks flo!

42.description: This place is so easy to get to on the bus. The service was great and there were too many options on the menu to choose from. I got the huevos verdes, my boyfriends got the tamale hash, and my friends got the steak eggs benedict. All three were delicious and substantial portions but we still managed to eat it all. The sauce on mine was great. I would definitely go here again to try their other options. Side note: we went right around when they opened and were able to get a table right away, but when we were leaving there was a pretty long line.

23.description: Stopped in with co-workers last Sunday for brunch. I was an immediate fan when they offered coffee while we waited for our table. It's such a small gesture, but makes waiting so much more enjoyable. I had the smothered burrito and house potatoes and it was great. I didn't have any, but my co-workers were raving over over their house hot sauces on every table.My only complaint is that the burrito fillings were not "mixed" so depending on which end you were eating, you only got some of filling ingredients. We also shared their french toast special, which was a topped with a lemon cream cheese. Yum!

47.description: Wow. Probably the best brunch I've had in the city. If you like latin-influenced cuisine, this brunch place is for you! I had the ranchero smothered burrito and my friends and I split the fruity pebbles French toast on the side. All of it was amazing - I mean my burrito was topped with guacamole, so of course I'm sold. You know you ordered the right things when people from nearby tables stop talking and stare at your food and ask what you had ordered (I also did the same after I was seated). It tasted as good as it looked. Splitting the sweet dish was definitely the way to go. It's super rich so a few (delicious) bites is all we could do. 4/5 stars for my experience mostly for the long wait (expected) but that morning they definitely accidentally skipped seating my group. So if they say 45 min, just check in after 35-40 to remind them you're still there. They also have coffee for your wait which is a definite plus. Overall, excellent spot though and I will definitely come back!

8.description: Would give this place 10 stars if I could. Local brunch restaurant was told the wait would be 45mins to an hour but we were seated after 15 mins of waiting. The fruity pebbles French toast was amazing. I also had a very good Bellini and a taste of my boyfriend's pork tacos which tasted amazing. Overall this is a great brunch/lunch place.

31.description: Very delicious nopales tacos. Felt a little adventurous to try something unconventional, and opt for the cactus tacos. What a pleasant surprise! The texture of the cactus felt like green peppers. The added pumpkin seeds offered a pleasant crunch to the bite. Recommend to vegetarians.

34.description: This place never disappoints. My bf and I have been here a couple of times now for brunch and both times it's been nothing less than fantastic!Large portions, spicy bloodies and many varieties of mimosas. This place gets crowded, but the wait is never long. Friendly and quick service also.  Highly recommended!

16.description: Yum!  I really enjoy going here for brunch and sometimes dinner.Everything I have had whether it's from their standard menu, or one of their specials, I have always enjoyed it.  The mimosa flight for brunch is a great deal.Only complaint is I have found the service to be a little spotty. Although they are very attentive, I wouldn't say they are the most friendly.  Overall, I would recommend it as a good spot to have a weekend brunch with a smaller group of friends.

13.description: Had the pulled BBQ pork enchiladas...heaven . Went right when it reopen around 4:35 , so barely any people until later on, but decor was pretty cool and service was good. Can't wait to try some more dishes!

11.description: Stopped in with co-workers last Sunday for brunch. I was an immediate fan when they offered coffee while we waited for our table. It's such a small gesture, but makes waiting so much more enjoyable. I had the smothered burrito and house potatoes and it was great. I didn't have any, but my co-workers were raving over over their house hot sauces on every table.My only complaint is that the burrito fillings were not "mixed" so depending on which end you were eating, you only got some of filling ingredients. We also shared their french toast special, which was a topped with a lemon cream cheese. Yum!

39.description: Ordered a standard eggs and bacon dish but was impressed with the portion size and the quality of the ingredients. Will definitely be coming back to try some of the Mexican inspired dishes.

37.description: Been here a couple times for brunch.  It gets crowded if you don't come early, but given location, wait still isn't that bad.  Food here is fantastic.  Today I had the pumpkin pancakes as an appetizer.  Very good pumpkin flavor and just the right amount of sweetness.  Tried my wife's chilaquiles in a red sauce which were awesome.  I had the hatch green chile chicken enchiladas.  One of the best chicken enchilada versions I have ever tried.  I would definitely come back and have any of the dishes again.

0.description: A cousin that used to live in Chicago recommended Flo's as a must for brunch during one of my frequent visits to the city from California. Flo's did not disappoint. I was torn between ordering the skirt steak eggs benedict and the cocoa or fruity pebbles french toast. I ultimately  went with the skirt steak eggs benedict and it was fantastic! The skirt steak and eggs benedict were cooked perfectly and really complimented each other.  My friend order the chorizo scramble and absolutely loved it as well. Portion sizes were definitely hearty so bring your appetite. We topped off the brunch with a mimosa sampler. The hibiscus mimosa was absolutely delicious and so refreshing. Can't wait to go back!Random tip: They do not take reservations so unless you arrive when they open or after 1230 you may be in for a wait. We arrived about 12:30 and were seated immediately.

38.description: Very good food and nice service. We wandered in on a weeknight with our 3 kids and it was pretty quiet. The server greeted us and showed us to a comfortable table. Although it was half-price wine night, we did not oblige. We were told of the kids options and went with grilled cheese and mac and cheese. While the grilled cheese was quite good(using real cheese and nice bread) the winner was the mac and cheese. It was really amazing. They have an adult version that has Chorizo, but the mac and cheese stood on it's own without any meat. The kids loved it so much they are asking to go back. As for the adult food, I had the Mole Chicken which was really delicious as well and I gobbled it up. My wife had the Salad, which she said was decent, but way too many raw onions. Overall it was great and next time we are in that hood we will be going back.

51.description: It was great! I had the fruity pebble french toast, REALLY sweet, but it was good. I had it with their homemade chorizo which was awesome, and what I needed to counteract the sweetness of the french toast. Also had the mimosa flight which was also fantastic! Service was great, everything was great !! My only suggestion is to get their early, because that place becomes packed quick!

27.description: My New Mexico fix in the city! I've come for brunch and drinks. The wait is really long on the weekends (shocking! ;) people love their brunch...myself included). My friend got the green chile bloody mary and I think it was the first time I actually liked a bloody mary (sorry, not a huge fan of the tomato juice thing). I got the chilaquiles and then a breakfast burrito. Both were large portions and delicious. We were kind of shoved into a small table, but the food is so good that it's worth it. I also appreciate the free coffee while you wait, helps keep me a little less grumpy on a sunday morning.

32.description: This is a nice place to hang out after work. Its a bit trendy and pretty small so I come around 4 30 on a Friday to make sure I have a seat.  I like the drink selection and the atmosphere.  Also the baja fish tacos are great!

54.description: It's really a 1.5.Waitress was rude and acted like a dude. She offered the mimosa flight and clearly out of the 3, 2 were the same ones, she literally yelled at me! Took the mimosa like aggressively, said I'll just give you more orange and went into the kitchen and yelled at somebody. She was extremely annoyed by our kid. When he cried she immediately brought the check like f'in flash. This lady is one of the only Hispanic waitresses. Beware she is like a rabid dog!The chilaquiles were a 5 out of 10. The buttermilk pancakes 7 out of 10. The mimosa flight:  bellini yuc, hisbuscus yuc, orange 6/10.Would I come back? He'll NO! $64!!!!!!

48.description: Food was amazing, service was great! Loved that they had coffee for those of us waiting for a table in the entrance. Loved that they had a mimosa flight. The apple mimosa was soooo good. It was a big group of us and everyone was beyond happy with what they ordered so you won't he disappointed! The berry pancakes was fresh and fluffy. Definitely will be back!

44.description: Great Bloody Mary! I did the house bloody & "FLO Style" Breakfast. I was impressed with the wait staffs attentive attitude towards me. I just moved into the neighborhood & heard good things. I'd recommend this place for brunch to anyone who asks!

24.description: Oh brother, I was so sad about my breakfast here. I've never had a omelette so completely devoid of any kind of flavor. I had a mushroom and onion omelette that couldn't possibly have had a single grain of salt on it, or any other kind of seasoning. It was also really overcooked and rubbery. The potatoes on the side were also tasteless. I hear it gets crowded on the weekends...maybe there's a different chef then? I don't know, but I won't be back to figure it out.

7.description: I'm just going to repeat whatever everyone else has said - this place is awesome, the food selections for brunch are the best in this area, the service is attentive, etc. So really I will just leave you with one thing. Mimosa flights for brunch. Enough said. Go here

49.description: For starters, our waitress was on top of it. She saw immediately that we were ready to order. She took our order and our food arrived almost instantly it seemed. Now the food. The huevos verdes is exquisite. Their house made chorizo has a great texture, is spiced well, and came in proportion to the meal. The enchilada were crisp but not tough and the eggs were done to perfection. Great coffee (free while you wait) great drink specials. Worth the moderate wait.

40.description: I had really high expectations walking in and sadly it did not live up to those expectations. The atmosphere was cute and despite being pretty busy they seated us quickly. We got the mimosa flight which was probably the highlight of brunch! I loved all 3 in the flight, although at $12 it was a little pricey. The food came quickly. We got French toast and the steak egg Benedict. The French toast was simple and plain, nothing special. The steak eggs Benedict was good but the bread was soggy and the steak was not the best.The service was slow after we got the food and we were ignored for awhile (took us probably 35 minutes to get a check). Overall it was only average and I don't know if I would return. I will say some of their egg dishes looked interesting so maybe I would go back to try one of those...

53.description: I called them and asked if they take reservations for brunch, which I was told politely they don't. I thought like 90% of brunch places they will have about a 30 min wait. I was surprised that they didn't have a wait at all. We were seated as soon as we walked in. They took our orders (thanks to yelpers I knew what I wanted to try). Why only give it 3 stars? The drinks- I ordered the brunch punch and it was so sweet it tasted like medicine, yuck. We also ordered a michelada and it was just ok, you could taste the chilula.The 3 stars all go to the food. The breakfast burrito was delicious with just the right mix that you wouldn't want to put it down. We also tried the Cocoa Pebbles French toast, which you can order in 1, 2 or 3 slices. It was so good. Reminded me of my childhood and more. A must try. So, I would recommend the food but not the drinks, maybe stick to the coffee

30.description: I was introduced to Flo about a year and a half ago.  It is extraordinary.  The chicken enchiladas with a fried egg on top is a lunch meal that I crave.... a lot.  very casual and low key.  Its character is ideal for its West Chicago Ave location -- an absolute personal favorite.   I hope Flo never changes a thing.

46.description: Neighborhood staple and having a friend move into the neighborhood and wanting to explore brunch we walked over to Flo! Having been there years ago the food was still good and reasonably priced. We went for brunch on a Saturday around 11am, no wait for a table and friendly staff. Kept my order simple with the Flo Combo of scrambled eggs, house potatoes and chicken apple sausage. And coffee of corse!

1.description: Amazing brunch! Arrived at 10:45ish on Saturday and landed a table for 2 with no wait. I got the Huevos Verde and the Mimosa Flight, both excellent (in the case of the verde, eggscellent! haha...) I had seen some reviews complaining about the sauciness of the Huevos Verde, but I couldn't get enough of it! (tip: use the tortilla they give you on the side to sop up the leftover sauce at the end) The house made chorizo was great, and I could taste the freshness of the pico de gallo. The mimosa flight consisted of 1 mimosa, 1 Bellini, and 1 hibiscus Bellini. All were really really good, and I liked having the variety. Service was super fast--our food came out so quickly, and servers were quick to refill our water or my friend's coffee. Atmosphere is relaxed and slightly modern; overall cool vibe. Would definitely come back just to eat the Huevos Verde again!

55.description: I've been here a few times and it's always good! I have had anything from Flo that wasn't delicious.

9.description: Went to Sunday Brunch at Flo this weekend with some friends. Overall, food was decent (little smothered in sauce for my taste) and the service left something to be desired. Got there around noon and were told it would be about an hour wait for our party of 3, seemed pretty standard for a Sunday brunch. After about a half hour we were trying to decide whether to head to a coffee shop nearby while we waited, so asked the hostess how long our wait might be from that point. She refused to tell us any estimate and said she'd already given us a time when we got there. They do offer free coffee while you wait, but the hostess also told us they were out of cups. We eventually took some spots at the bar and placed our order. The bartender was pretty busy while we were there, so didn't get much attention (water was never refilled). We each got a savory item (smothered burrito, huevos verde, and chicken enchiladas). They were all decent, but were swimming in sauce. I got the burrito, and I probably would have gotten it without sauce if I knew that. At times it was hard to tell what I was eating through all the sauce. When we were paying the check, I tried to ask the bartender to split up the check a certain way and he just walked away with our cards instead of answering me. He seemed to be pretty annoyed to be serving us the entire meal. I'd suggest eating at a table, as the servers around us seemed to be more attentive and willing to talk to you about what you wanted.

26.description: Nice twist on breakfast. Delicious tamale, black beans and egg plate. It's not always on the menu - sometimes offered as a special.

25.description: The Cinnamon French Toast drink was as amazing as it sounds - do yourself a favor and order three! I went on a weekday morning so the place was pretty empty but the atmosphere was still just right. The food was great and the service couldn't have been better!

12.description: I can't believe I haven't written a review for this place yet. A southwestern twist on breakfast is such a good idea, and Flo pulls it off well. This is a go-to brunch spot with my guests from out of town to showcase some of my favorite spots for good eating in Chicago. The breakfast cocktails are all great too. Occasionally I won't order one because I am a tightwad but am then trying to push out of my mind how I wish I had one throughout the entirety of my visit.Great stop. Visit if you haven't!

59.description: This was my first time having a Mexican brunch. Everything was SOOOOO good. I couldn't decide between the Green chile chicken enchiladads and the triple berry french toast, so he offered one piece of french toast on the side. Wow was that worth the $3. Both were the best thing I have tasted in a long time. The bloodies and Mimosa flights were really good too!

21.description: Great food, fast service and reasonably priced. I had the Huevos Verdes which I enjoyed a lot being a fan of salsa verde. The 3 of us also shared 2 slices of the fruity pebble French toast...it usual order has 3 slices (Pro tip - you can request a smaller portion of this and they will price it accordingly...so we ordered 2 slices). Since none of us have a big sweet tooth, we still had leftovers of this. Get there early as 10:30am to avoid a long wait.

17.description: This place never disappoints. My bf and I have been here a couple of times now for brunch and both times it's been nothing less than fantastic!Large portions, spicy bloodies and many varieties of mimosas. This place gets crowded, but the wait is never long. Friendly and quick service also.  Highly recommended!

10.description: This is a decent place. Good steak and eggs benedict, decent bloody mary would have liked it with a better flavor, it was spicy but the flavor was a wee bit bland, hard to explain. It was decent though. Standard brunch but good. I will definitely try again and venture into the sweet brunch options as I am a sucker for delicious sweet brunch options. The place gets busy fast on the weekends and can get pretty tight spaced. Get there early, get your grub on and head out and about in the area! :-)

5.description: Great food, fast service and reasonably priced. I had the Huevos Verdes which I enjoyed a lot being a fan of salsa verde. The 3 of us also shared 2 slices of the fruity pebble French toast...it usual order has 3 slices (Pro tip - you can request a smaller portion of this and they will price it accordingly...so we ordered 2 slices). Since none of us have a big sweet tooth, we still had leftovers of this. Get there early as 10:30am to avoid a long wait.

3.description: My review is more of a 3.5 stars. I'll divide up the review based on positives (+) and negatives (-) of my experience here. (+)-Service was awesome! Our waiter was friendly, very prompt, checked in with us appropriately, and was willing to snap a picture of us at the end of the meal, as well.-The menu had lots of different options. Everything looked appealing to me and it was hard to decide on one thing to order. There was a really good mix of healthy and unhealthy options, with plenty of sweet and savory. -Even though I didn't personally try it, my friend ordered the kale smoothie, which she thought was really good. The fact that green smoothies are even on the menu is a DEFINITE plus in my book. If I ever come back here, I'll definitely want to order one.-Good price point. Everything felt fairly priced. My entree was only $10!(-)-You can't sit down until your entire party is there. I dislike this because this place definitely wasn't hopping with people. Luckily, the longest one of the party had to wait was 10 minutes because she had arrived early.-The food itself was generally A-OK, if not a bit underwhelming. My friend wasn't too impressed with her egg white omelette and potatoes. I tried the potatoes and I have to say I can't blame her for leaving those virtually untouched. They were completely flavorless. -My fruity pebble french toast was nothing special. It was much, much too sweet. There had been no indication in the menu that they would be completely drenched in sugary syrup in addition to the sugary cereal. But, then again, maybe that's what I get for ordering them! Overall, it was a fine experience. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here, but we definitely still enjoyed ourselves.

35.description: Flo delivers on atmosphere and trendy cocktails.  The kitchen was fast to bring food out. I thought each item tasted the same, though. Fantastic hot sauces.

19.description: The food looks beautiful but is seriously lacking seasoning; the Flo combo and huevos rancheros were both very bland. The cocoa pebbles French toast got a thumbs up from my daughter. Service was excellent.

28.description: Came here on a Sunday around 11:30am. We waited for around 45 minutes for a table of 3 but one thing I did appreciate was the complimentary coffee they had for you while you wait! Not something I have seen since visiting Portland!Once seated, we ordered a classic mimosa, moonlight moon (grapefruit mimosa) and bloody mary. No complaints other than I thought the mimosas were pretty small for $7.For food we ordered, huevos rancheros, huevos verdes and the skirt steak eggs benedict. I had the skirt steak eggs benedict. I wish I had ordered some fruit or maybe pico de gallo with the skirt steak eggs benedict as it was really heavy meal and could have used some veggies or fruit on the side. But the hollandaise sauce and the poached eggs were perfectly cooked. Great brunch place if you're craving breakfast with a side of Mexican flare! Will definitely be coming back here again.

45.description: Mexican brunch! Extremely good breakfast and lunch food. The coffee is great, the food is great, the atmosphere is very urban, and the waiter was very nice and friendly. Highly recommended!

33.description: Here's the nitty gritty from my experience a couple days ago: decent-good food, short wait time between placing the order and getting food, really solid drink menu. Got some weird vibes from out waitress; she left us feeling excessively rushed. I'm glad I tried it, but I don't imagine it's a place I'll be going back to.

43.description: We had food catered for a pre-wedding brunch and everyone loved the food (they even ate leftovers after the wedding!). We ordered eggs, chicken sausage (huge hit), bacon, seasoned potatoes, French toast and a fruit platter (very fresh). Everything was definitely good. The only reason that I gave four stars (deserve 4.5 :-) ) is because I felt the upfront communication could have been better. I felt like I was playing phone tag, BUT they (mostly the general manager, Leo) was very professional. They were very accommodating and really nice. They were also ON TIME for the event. I didn't have to figure out where they were, as a matter of fact they called me. Again. AWESOME experience. GREAT food. I look forward to visiting the actual restaurant one day. Thank you to the FLO staff and LEO.

2.description: Came here for brunch on a Sunday morning, around 10:00, it was packed, but we got there just in time for one of the last tables. There was a few seats at bar, so that's also an option. I had the french toast with berries and cream. Loved the berry sauce, it was made with fresh fruit and quite good, but wasn't a fan of the actual french toast - it was a bit dry and I felt needed a heavy does of syrup (or to be soaked in egg batter a little longer). Get the mimosa flight - so good and a nice way to try some of their brunch beverages if you can't decide on just one. Portions were just right, not too big, but not small.Service was quick and waitress was very friendly.

18.description: Neighborhood staple and having a friend move into the neighborhood and wanting to explore brunch we walked over to Flo! Having been there years ago the food was still good and reasonably priced. We went for brunch on a Saturday around 11am, no wait for a table and friendly staff. Kept my order simple with the Flo Combo of scrambled eggs, house potatoes and chicken apple sausage. And coffee of corse!

41.description: I've had brunch here a few times, and earlier this week I went for dinner. I had the Flobimbop with tofu and it was delicious. The margarita was lacking, but the food made up for it. They even have a coffee station set up for self-service while you wait for brunch.

52.description: To the person who gave the wait staff a bad review (which so clearly impacted the review of the food) about a week ago ...  Sorry to hear that the staff anticipated a parent's need to get an over-tired youngster out of a stationary position. No good deed goes unpunished, I guess.

50.description: I have been a northsider since moving to Chicago, and have been attempting to check out the under appreciated south for a while now. Flo was recommended by a regular at a favorite coffee shop as a great brunch spot, and my boyfriend, who used to live in the area over 5 years ago, did not realize it was still around so we made are way to the restaurant.Can I just say I love bars/restaurants that primarily play mid-2000s indie rock? Because I do. Everything on their playlist were bands I regularly listen to (because I am stuck in college, apparently) and really set a hip, comfortable vibe. Giant abstract artwork in earth tones with ripped and restitched canvas covered the dining room and added to the hip atmosphere. Everything was very warm and inviting. My boyfriend recognized a few of the servers from 5 years ago - always a good sign.Our server, Omar, was attentive but not overly so and was very friendly and made great recommendations. Brought out chips immediately and got our drink and food orders out fast. Ordered a cholula bloody mary and was pretty excited about it - but it was watery and mostly tasted like weak non-cholula hot sauce and mezcal. Could have been more savory and was ultimately the biggest disappointment. Coffee was great, but I didn't get the chance to ask what they were serving. I got green chile chicken enchiladas with a fried egg and extra hatch chile BECAUSE I WAS SO EXCITED that it was on the menu as a southwesterner who has yet to see it on a menu in the midwest. Chicken was juicy and spicy, green sauce had a great char to it, and the egg on top was the perfect touch. Boyfriend got mole chilaquiles, which was the special on that day. Mole sauce was not overly chocolatey in textrue like it traditionally is, but it worked well with the chips and definitely as chilaquiles. I admit that I may have heavily suggested that he order it, and I wish we had split them down the middle! These dishes were both served with black beans and brown rice, rice was great but I wish the beans had been refried.We arrived a bit later for brunch and while they were obviously setting the dining room for dinner service, we didn't feel rushed or ignored at all. Omar kept our water glasses full and kept checking back in until we left, which is a great way to ensure we'll be back.

4.description: Learn to poach an egg if you're going to serve a 14 dollar steak Benedict. We've come here many times since we live in the neighborhood. Today's visit really soured me on Flo.The steak in my benedict was ruined cause it got covered in the raw egg that spilled out when I cut into it. The server didn't check on us once after taking our order, which just made me more salty because the benedict was so poorly executed. It's going to be a bit before we decide to come back to Flo for brunch.

6.description: Been here a couple times for brunch.  It gets crowded if you don't come early, but given location, wait still isn't that bad.  Food here is fantastic.  Today I had the pumpkin pancakes as an appetizer.  Very good pumpkin flavor and just the right amount of sweetness.  Tried my wife's chilaquiles in a red sauce which were awesome.  I had the hatch green chile chicken enchiladas.  One of the best chicken enchilada versions I have ever tried.  I would definitely come back and have any of the dishes again.

22.description: Great place for breakfast / brunch!

15.description: Went to Flo for the first time with two friends on a Sunday around noon. If you're coming for a weekend brunch, especially with 2+ people, be prepared to wait a little bit. We were quoted 30 mins but it was more like 45 mins. The most important part though is the wait was definitely worth it!!Every plate of food we saw while waiting looked so good! We ended up getting the fruity pebbles french toast, the ranchero smothered burrito and the huevos verdes. Everything was awesome! The french toast was one of the most creative dishes I've ever seen and it tasted almost like it was deep fried. SO GOOD! The burrito was huge and really tasty and the green chile sauce on the third dish was just the right amount of spicy for me. We didn't order any drinks but the breakfast cocktails looked really good as well!I've been to quite a few brunch places in Chicago and this was one of my favorites. They have a unique combination of creative french toast and pancakes with all the traditional Mexican breakfast dishes. I definitely will be back to try more things on the menu!

57.description: If you hate spicy food like I do, you will love Flo.It's the bland-man's-okay-kind of spicyIt's spicy, but not too spicyIt's the-makes-sense-kind of spicyIt's the I-can-taste-my-food spicyThere is spice, but my mouth is not on fire spicyIt's the these-are-interesting-favors-exploding-in-mouth kind of spicyYou will not dart for the toilet or have an upset tummy the rest of the day from this spiceCatch my drift?Come here for a satisfying, filling brunch without making you feel like gross. And the good kind of spice!

20.description: Although my boyfriend and I waited for close to an hour, this place is worthy of the hype. Of course we got the fruity pebbles French toast, along with a burrito and enchiladas. We came out feeling extremely full especially since Latin American food can be greasy to begin with, but we were very pleased. I recommend trying the mimosa flight! Lavender was our favorite. Overall great brunch spot in a fun location.

36.description: Went here for brunch today. The hatch green chile chicken enchiladas with a fried egg on top were delicious! Huge plate, fast service and great atmosphere. Perfect lighting. I will be back.

14.description: Cockroaches.Where there is food, is reasonable to think they will follow. I'm sure all if not most restaurants have varying amounts of infestation problems, Michelin honorees included.However.In most restaurants, the roaches don't climb above the wall separating the kitchen and the main room, hang out by a painting of full view of patrons, and proceed to make it half way to our table before being stomped by an employee.And, in most restaurants, this event prompts more than a round of free shots to the table. Specially considering our small group was the only one dining there at the time. The seared ahi tuna special was also extremely dry and chewy. My first and last time at this restaurant. Hope they clean up some, and/or take much more drastic action to keep customers happy if they don't.

58.description: I am so annoyed - reading the reviews I realize I shouldn't have just chosen a wine by the glass but I should have chosen a wine from their huge selection- I just took the easy route.  Next time I am definitely going to choose a bottle.  We had a blast, the room is great and we thought the service was terrific.  Our bar girl was so delightful and friendly.  A group near us was knocking back a bottle and we chatted with them and had quite a few laughs.Oh- and the food, olives were the best I've had in ages.  We had three or four other dishes and enjoyed them all.  I'm sure there's times where it's hopping but it's also a great spot to chill with a glass and a snack.  I was going to try to reduce my alcohol intake, but not after finding this place!

56.description: Lush has a lot of difficult-to-find wines and liquors.  They are not the cheapest liquor store by any means.  Do not come here looking for Tito's Vodka.  You are much better off buying that at Costco.  Come here if you want limited release and small batch liquors that you can't find elsewhere.

29.description: I absolutely love this place.  On the right side is a nice wine and spirits store.  Thoughtfully chosen bottles of whites, reds ... perhaps a rose instead, craft beers, and small-batch spirits.  There is also a section of "Staff picks under $10," which has about 12 whites, 12 reds, and I've never been disappointed selecting from this rack.  The employees are friendly without being overly obsequious, and have always been helpful if I'm looking for something special or specific.  Then on the left side is a cozy bar with elegant snacks -- cheese plats, DUCK FAT POPCORN, crispy chick peas.  Generally there a couple of "large" things to choose from as well, such as a pasta and a sandwich.  They have wines and beers by the glass, but here's the amazing thing; you can take a $10 bottle from the "shop" area and bring it to the "bar" area, and enjoy it there, no corkage fee.  There is also free WiFi, and I've been known to grab my laptop, settle in to one of their cushy leather chairs, and enjoy part of a bottle and a bite or two while writing or working.  No judgment.  In short, this is a great place whether I'm grabbing a leisurely drink with a friend or date, or sitting solo with my laptop or a book.  Go here.  (The "bar" side is not open on Sundays or Mondays, I believe.)

42.description: All right, I'm gonna say straight up that I'm changing my review because of this. The very gracious owner messaged me, thusly:"If you are not interested in our menu options, you can purchase anything in the shop and take it over to the wine bar.  Of course, there is no corkage fee.  4 people can share a bottle of wine for $10.  We try really hard to offer many budget-friendly options."I did not know this, and probably should have asked.This changes my opinion about this location, definitely. (I have actually always loved their (first?) location on south Halsted 'cos they are a good wine shop. This addition makes them a GREAT wine shop.Well done, LUSH . . . well done. I will be back.

23.description: Tried to go with a group of friends.  They had a lot of arbitrary rules about how they would serve at what times, and where we could sit at what time.  Not worth doing business with someone that doesn't want us there.  We left before we bought because of coming into rudeness was so off-putting.Update:  the manager reached out about our bad experience, and promised a better experience next time.  I'll leave it at the middle until we can confirm its true.

47.description: great drinks and great employees! totally awesome! been here a ton of times and had a wonderful time. wish they were open a tad bit later.

8.description: I came here with some mommy friends for a wine tasting. I was pleasantly suprised when I walked in. It is small on the inside, very intimate. If you want to buy a bottle of wine or some beer, go to the right. If you want to sit down and eat some appetizers while drinking, go to the left. Such a cool concept.Our sommelier was Katie. She was so sweet and helpful and answered our questions so we could understand! We had 4 different Rose tastings, each one very different from the last. We also got a cheese plate to share which was so delicious.The reason for the docked star is the price. It was a bit pricey for my liking. It is a boutique in Chicago, yes, but $35 for 4 wines? However, they do have a $10 wine selection which is right up my alley :)I will definitely be back, and will check out the one in Roscoe Village. Great experience, friendly service and beautiful decor. Pricey, but two thumbs up!

31.description: The staff is pretty knowledgable to fit your palate. I have been here quite a few times and enjoy my glass or bottle here. Whether you are lounging here or longing elsewhere you are on the right track!

34.description: I cannot speak for the food or tastings at Lush.  My issue is simply with wine purchases to-go.  There is this pattern where I go there, buy a wine, like it, and the third time I go back to buy more, they don't carry it anymore.  This has happened in a fairly short span of time with 2 different wines.  It's frustrating.  I understand that they probably want to be cutting-edge and rotate in different wines, but speaking for myself, it's frustrating to find a wine I like, and within a month, it's no longer available.  I prefer not to request that they carry something, because then I feel a sense of obligation to come there all the time and buy it.  One positive is that I found a couple bottles in the $10 rack that are decent, but I expect that next time I go, they'll be gone, too.  I'll probably be back there eventually in large part due to the convenient location, but for the moment, I'm a wee bit pissed off and staying away.  Moral of the story-beware of getting attached to any particular wine there.

16.description: Tried to go with a group of friends.  They had a lot of arbitrary rules about how they would serve at what times, and where we could sit at what time.  Not worth doing business with someone that doesn't want us there.  We left before we bought because of coming into rudeness was so off-putting.Update:  the manager reached out about our bad experience, and promised a better experience next time.  I'll leave it at the middle until we can confirm its true.

13.description: I recently walked in here to get a nice bottle of wine and the gentlemen working (I wish i remember his name) was extremely helpful! The staff is clearly well versed on the product and selections at hand. He also went over and beyond to tell me about the "special" events they put together on week day nights to help drive more business through the doors. I'll definitely be back... great location, good wine & people. Its' a win-win in my book!

11.description: This is my version of heaven on earth. This place looks and has the vibe of a library except with wine bottles on the shelves. My type of place. You can drop in to get a bottle to go or lounge around on the leather couches with your bottle for the entire night. The staff is very approachable, knowledgable, and respectful of any budget. Also, don't miss out on the food! Monday is fried chicken night and it's incredible. Finally, I've heard dogs are allowed inside but haven't brought my girl in yet. This is a great place for reading/studying with a glass of wine, a date night, hanging out with friends, parties...just everything!

39.description: Lush is great place for a date or to meet friends. Love picking out a bottle listening to Sinatra and lounging with my girlfriend under my arm, literally

37.description: Fantastic! Definitely want to go check out their other locations. We went here while waiting for a table at Ruxbin (2 hour wait). We were not disappointed at Lush. One side is a wine shop and the other is a wine bar/bistro. The 'glass' chandeliers are so hipster functional and cute!Don't let the wine prices fool you. The pours are 250ml that come in beakers. Tres chic. You will definitely get enough to drink. Even if wine isn't your thang, they do have several beers on tap as well.We had the French cheese plate (~$20) and it was so tasty. Just the right amount of bread and fig spread. We also got a selection of sausage (hee hee) and it was so good. Get the duck sausage for sure! There were other food options as well, I know they were cooking up some eggs while we were there and whatever it was they were making it smelled good : )Our service was excellent, we will go back!

0.description: Just like a Starbucks for alcoholics. The ambiance here is wonderful and the wine, beer and spirit selection is top notch. All of the employees are helpful and knowledgeable and the chairs encourage taking a quick nap. Highly recommended.

38.description: One of the cooler and less known spots in the city. It's perfect for a first date and even better for any other reason to wander in and expand your knowledge about wine. My go to spot both before and after a nice dinner at Yuzu!

51.description: "Can you make a recommendation for a bottle of champagne around $20 that won't embarrass me?"I have to buy a bunch of work fools wine for the holidays and I really don't want to pay more than $10/bottle.""I need something red and impressive for a date."I've gone in to Lush for all of these situations and I've never come out empty handed or disappointed.Lush isn't a super-mega store.  It's a boutique store with carefully selected bottles to ensure excellent quality and value.  But don't think that means they won't have something to suit your needs.  All price points and flavors are represented.  I really enjoy shopping at this location.

27.description: I wanted to like Lush, since it's in my neighborhood and has a good selection.  Unfortunately, the attitude of the staff turned out to be pretentious and rude.On a Saturday evening, I came in wearing shorts and was looking at the liquor selection when I was approached by one of the staff (a shorter older woman) who asked if she could help.  I told her I was going to a party and I was looking for an interesting, but not too expensive (under $25) bottle of liquor to bring to the party.  She huffed and made some suggestions (vermouth, in fact, which is just rude.)  Fine if they don't have anything, but the problem was when another customer came over whined that "they were having trouble making a decision."  The Lush employee turned tail and walked off.  No words, no "excuse me," no acknowledgment.  I was stunned and stayed for a few minutes to see if she would even come back to say sorry that she had to deal with another customer.  Nothing.  I was, in her eyes, too small a buyer for her.What she didn't know was that, in addition to what I was contributing to the party, I was planning on buying a nice gift bottle of champagne for the hosts (not the party-goers, who just get the moderately priced stuff!) and bottles of wine for a big dinner party the next day.  She judged me based on what I was wearing and that my first request was for a "budget" item at just $25.I left and walked a few doors west to the Noble Grape, where they are friendly, super-knowledgable, have a strong and eclectic selection, and welcoming to everyone -- wearing shorts and asking for whatever.  So, they got my $200 instead of Lush because they weren't scrounging for big fish.Lush is the kind of place that up-and-coming girls ask guys to take them to so they can see how much money he can spend on them.  In my experience, they Lush staff just licked that right up.

32.description: This place is amazing! Not only do they have a great wine AND beer collection, but they have a great sitting area for you to enjoy the drinks you just bough over some delicious food make in-house! BF and I came here before our dinner at Yuzu and enjoyed a few unique, hard to find bottles of beer on a comfortable leather couch, tucked away in a dark, romantic corner.  Along with the beers, we also snacked on some duck fat popcorn, a cheese plate and the beef tartare.  All the edibles were delicious. When they were making our popcorn, the whole room filled with the delicious aroma for salty duck fat, YUM! The portions were huge! I can't wait to come back here, it's a great romantic stop for a date hangout before dinner but also perfect for girlfriends to get together, drink some wine and catch-up.  Love Love Love this place!

54.description: What is this place?  There is so much to talk about but not really worth it.  Look, not sure why there are 2 wine/beer stores within a block of each other, but this is a place striving to figure out it's identity.  The wines were ok, the people there are ok, the place is just ok.  better places to get the wine and beer that you want.  They are over-priced to begin with.

48.description: This place is awesome.  I love the selection, and especially the racks of $10 wine that is carefully selected.  I felt that I could grab just about anything off those racks and come away with something I enjoyed, which is pretty much what I did.  I also love how you can buy the bottle and enjoy in the other half of the room, though we didn't at the time.  I'll definately come back here!

44.description: Fantastic - great wine selection, great menu and great staff. I'd go back in a heartbeat. I did a client event here and the staff at Lush went up and above. A++

24.description: I came here with some mommy friends for a wine tasting. I was pleasantly suprised when I walked in. It is small on the inside, very intimate. If you want to buy a bottle of wine or some beer, go to the right. If you want to sit down and eat some appetizers while drinking, go to the left. Such a cool concept.Our sommelier was Katie. She was so sweet and helpful and answered our questions so we could understand! We had 4 different Rose tastings, each one very different from the last. We also got a cheese plate to share which was so delicious.The reason for the docked star is the price. It was a bit pricey for my liking. It is a boutique in Chicago, yes, but $35 for 4 wines? However, they do have a $10 wine selection which is right up my alley :)I will definitely be back, and will check out the one in Roscoe Village. Great experience, friendly service and beautiful decor. Pricey, but two thumbs up!

7.description: I love this place. You can buy bottles from the store section or get wine by the glass (although I recommend by the bottle $$-wise). The atmosphere is relaxed and fancy at the same time, no idea how they do it but they do. Good for getting work done or for going out for fun.

49.description: This Lush location makes me way happy.One half ultra-stocked wine, spirits and beer shop.One half amazing lounge spot with tasting bar and SNACKS!Did you know Lush had yummy food?Oh yes.So much more than just a big 'ol booze bag.Get crocked and then enjoy a crock.Or some cheese.And charcuterie.How 'bout an amazing Spanish octopus plate with fresh parsley, capers and red onion?That one's my fav!An amazingly knowledgeable staff is on hand to help you with your newest imbibing finds. From the ultra exclusive - hello, Pappy Van Winkle 23 year Bourbon.To the super wallet friendly - yo, abundant racks 'o $10 wines.To the hoppy happy - Brett Saison, anyone?The hits just keep on comin'. Lush. So apropos, no?

40.description: What is there not to love? Wine, beer, spirits: you pick what you want, you pay, you drink. You go back, pick more , drink more. Oh yeah, you can eat, too. This is my third visit to a third Lush location, and I can't say anything bad. We attended an engagement party for dear friends, and it was the absolute perfect location. This location has food and does catering, so all we had to do was pick bottles, drink, laugh, pick more bottles, laugh more, and enjoy the surroundings. The staff are lovely people who offer great suggestions for all palates and price ranges. I wish they'd open an Evanston Lush, I'd never leave.

53.description: Staff is fantastic and selection is great. Their food is great too, get the deviled eggs, it will have you on your knees. Great place and consistently great.

30.description: I was here for a private tasting and not only were the wines that we sampled really fantastic, the food was yummy (charcuterie, duck fat popcorn, olives, crispy chickpeas) and the staff were really friendly and knew their stuff. Great spot for a girls night out or a comfy date -- you can be pretentious if you want, but... ew... be casual! Would love to come back for one of their tastings or for a night out with friends.

46.description: This is a very special place indeed that seems like a well-kept secret, perfect for a relaxing night out- (I didn't know those existed anymore in Chicago!) I spent one of my most pleasant nights in Chicago here. You can actually hear each other talk, and there's just a nice mellow European vibe. Amazing, unusual selection, the big wooden butcher tables perfect for a group of friends, and oh, the BLT....

1.description: Shopping for a beer/wine snob? This place is probably the best in the area to grab hard to find flavors for a dinner party, barbecue, or any other special occasion. There's wall to wall wine labels ranging everywhere from 10 to 70 bucks and for beer they sell them by the single so it's easy to custom make a sixer of suds for the beer geek you know. Great to go, but if you feel like sitting for awhile they have some pretty comfy seating that you can sit, sip for awhile, and enjoy the smells of rich mahogany. They do all sorts of cool tasting events and you can bet that I'm gonna be at their champagne and chicken Tuesday the next time I can make it. Overall it's a great stop in whether you know what you want or just feel like browsing for a little bit.

55.description: This wine bar has over one jillion selections. The structure is classy, elegant, yet casual. The bartenders are very friendly.Be wary of the cheap wine. A date and I once bought two bottles at ten dollars each. Needless to say, we each had the worst hangover of our life. Ask for suggestions from the bartenders. They know their stuff. One of them once chose a very tasty, smooth white wine at a reasonable price for a date and I.Oh, this is a wonderful place to take a date to.

9.description: Anything I write isn't going to do justice to how great of an experience my date and I had here.  The atmosphere is comfortable and cozy, with enough space for everyone to spread out and find their own niche.  Combine that with the excellent service you receive from the waitstaff and bartenders and you have a winner.  The staff here knows their alcohol and loves to share that knowledge with others.  I got the whiskey flight and instead of just grabbing whatever was close by, the bartender came over, sat down, and chatted me up about my tastes so he could hand pick the best flight for me (and give me a detailed history lesson on each).  I'll definitely be back.

26.description: Not a fan.I'm new to the neighborhood and they would have had my regular business if they weren't rude both of the first times I came in. Annoying selection. It would be great if the store actually carried the spirits they have behind the bar (like bonal, etc.). Or had a few sakes and sherries that were reasonably priced. Or carried any other vermouth than like 3 niche brands. Or even, like, a bottle of Campari.  Got a nice bottle of wine, but wasn't a fan of the attitude.  After I asked for a couple things they didn't have, the girl said, "sorry we've really let you down today," in a way that implied I was being a difficult customer. To me, good customer service would have been like, "you live in the neighborhood? What are you looking for? Maybe we can order a bottle or two for you."  Would rather find another place in the neighborhood without the unfounded snottiness.

25.description: $10 wine selection is great and good help to choose the right wine for youHowever! Do not sit down for charcuterie and cheese because you will be ignored if there is someone who "knows someone"Or a large party to be taken care of. I payed the same amount as others but I was snubbed. Slow service, high prices for food and poor service unless you beg for attention. I will come back for a good cheap $10 bottle but never again to sit down and eat.3 stars for wine selection and service1 star for food service and quality

12.description: There is something about a boutique wine store. It is so intimate and personal.We arrived during a day where they were sampling white wines. It was an amazing experience for Chicago. The person serving seemed to know a lot and was happy to tell us about what we were drinking. There were serval other people in the bar as well and she was busy bouncing back and forth and it seemed like no one was left hanging. That goes a lot of the type of customer service they offer.She also informed us that the owners really like Syrah wines which is my favorite. She pointed out the several brands and price differentials between them. The beer selection is also elaborate. For some reason, you can go in here and buy 1 to many bottles of beer. So if you are heading to a near by BYOB place, you can buy a couple of brews to take long.And we are definitely coming back when they serve food. She brought out some deep fried chick peas which were pretty good and she stated that the actual food they serve there is way better.

59.description: I've been here twice and both times in search of something to drink for a BYOB restaurant. The first time was for wine and the second it was for beer. The first time the visit was brief because I deferred to my gf to work her oenophilic magic and didn't need the help of the staff-though they did offer. The second and most recent visit there seemed to be a tasting event going on in the other half so there wasn't a lot of staff available. I was staring at the beer selection they had which was varied and impressive but there was just so much to choose from a little help would have been appreciated, but none came. Fortunately, it was hard to go wrong with their selection. The Nostradamus from Caracole was a winner and the BORIS from Hopping Frog also was a great dark beer."Did you find what you were looking for?" Yes, yes, I did but I did it without any assitance.

21.description: I don't think it was the staff being pretentious that really made me hate my experience... And when I say "hate", I mean it... I felt the staff didn't know what they were selling. The wine the employee suggested didn't have much flavor. She didn't really give us a flavor profile, she just said it was going to be amazing and that it was worth the money. In my opinion, if she would have described the notes and how it tasted I would've known that I wasn't going to enjoy it.The food was not pleasant. I also don't think that's the chef/server's fault. I think there should be a specific menu and there should be details listed on the menu... Like the fact that the devilled eggs are an onion party or that the pasta just isn't good. There should also be a pasta of the day, because the whole "cooking what you feel like" only works if you are cooking for yourself. The chef was nice, nice people should be kept in the FOH. he was over confident and under qualified but because he is so likeable it's hard to tell him that the food just isn't good. Also- I am not sure if he works there or was just hanging out but please have the hipster kid that likes loudly swearing and talking to just stop talking.

17.description: Not a fan.I'm new to the neighborhood and they would have had my regular business if they weren't rude both of the first times I came in. Annoying selection. It would be great if the store actually carried the spirits they have behind the bar (like bonal, etc.). Or had a few sakes and sherries that were reasonably priced. Or carried any other vermouth than like 3 niche brands. Or even, like, a bottle of Campari.  Got a nice bottle of wine, but wasn't a fan of the attitude.  After I asked for a couple things they didn't have, the girl said, "sorry we've really let you down today," in a way that implied I was being a difficult customer. To me, good customer service would have been like, "you live in the neighborhood? What are you looking for? Maybe we can order a bottle or two for you."  Would rather find another place in the neighborhood without the unfounded snottiness.

10.description: This is a great place for a first date or catching up with a girlfriend.  You go and pick a bottle of wine off the wall and drink there right there.  They have some little snacks too.  Overall great concept.  Nice job Lush!

5.description: We just had a big group birthday party at Lush. It was really fun and the atmosphere was great!  The wine flight and whiskey flight we had were great! The staff was friendly.  The serving portions that we ordered for the group were pretty small but everything else was great!

3.description: This place is adorable. I  stopped by today to get a bottle of red wine. Their prices range from $10 to $50 and you can either pick wine to go home with you or open it and drink at the shop with your friends.  I had a very pleasant experience. Parking can be a little crazy but with little patience something always comes along.

35.description: Let me be clear- these five stars are not for Lush West Town. What brought me to this particular location was not even my love for the previous location (in University Village, a mere and too-convenient 15-minute-walk from my apartment). What brought me to all the way West Town Lush, and what had kept me coming back to University Village Lush prior to its closing (on a weekly to bi-weekly basis), was the all-knowing and lovely members of its staff. Namely, and above all, Ms. Anita.The beer selection is great, the homemade salted caramels are awesome, but what truly makes a business is the quality of its people. I could go elsewhere for my favorite craft beer picks, but rarely have I ever gone into a place and met someone so clearly and willingly happy to share their knowledge and passion for their job. She not only knows her beer selection, but she knows her customers.Ms. Anita, you get all five Yelp review stars. Thank you for keeping us coming back.

19.description: $10 wine selection is great and good help to choose the right wine for youHowever! Do not sit down for charcuterie and cheese because you will be ignored if there is someone who "knows someone"Or a large party to be taken care of. I payed the same amount as others but I was snubbed. Slow service, high prices for food and poor service unless you beg for attention. I will come back for a good cheap $10 bottle but never again to sit down and eat.3 stars for wine selection and service1 star for food service and quality

28.description: There is something about a boutique wine store. It is so intimate and personal.We arrived during a day where they were sampling white wines. It was an amazing experience for Chicago. The person serving seemed to know a lot and was happy to tell us about what we were drinking. There were serval other people in the bar as well and she was busy bouncing back and forth and it seemed like no one was left hanging. That goes a lot of the type of customer service they offer.She also informed us that the owners really like Syrah wines which is my favorite. She pointed out the several brands and price differentials between them. The beer selection is also elaborate. For some reason, you can go in here and buy 1 to many bottles of beer. So if you are heading to a near by BYOB place, you can buy a couple of brews to take long.And we are definitely coming back when they serve food. She brought out some deep fried chick peas which were pretty good and she stated that the actual food they serve there is way better.

45.description: This place has an exceptional selection of wine. It also had a pretty interesting selection of appetizers. While I didn't try it, my compatriots raved about the popcorn cooked in duck fat. If I was a wino, and I am, I would come here all time. Then I would be a broke wino, but y'know, there are worse things in life.It was pointed out that the seats at the bar could benefit from a coat/purse hook underneath and a foot step. I totally agree.

33.description: Great place to go for a date night or dinner with the girls. Love that you can buy wine or beer at the store and drink it with dinner, or buy drinks to go. My favorite appetizer is the dukkah - WOW. So spicy, savory, unique, and tasty, and it's only $2-$3!  My mom took leftovers home for my dad who loved it as well. Also enjoy that you watch the food be made in the small kitchen in front of you so you know it's fresh and delicious. Never had a bad plate here!  It's intimate but not pretentious. Great spot, highly recommend.

43.description: Great place, really helpful (without being pushy, you will need to ask if you want help) staff with excellent selection of beer, booze, and wine.  It's not exhaustively stocked liked a Binny's but you basically can't go wrong here for a nice bottle for yourself or a gift.  They can speed chill wine, which is handy.  It is a bit on the pricey side, that's really the only knock on the place.  Very comfortable environment.  Used to be dog-friendly, but not sure now that they're serving more food onsite - still might be, I haven't tried taking the furry one along with recently.  Great selection of cocktail accoutrement.  Limited sweet vermouth options, though.  I know that's an odd thing to pick on, but I find myself out of sweet vermouth a surprising amount of times, so it be nice if they had a couple of options.

2.description: On a recent trip to the Midwest, we stayed in West Town.  Or maybe the Ukrainian Village.  Probably West Town.  We walked into downtown several times.  That might have been a mistake for my inner thighs and the balls of my feet, but I always giggled a little bit when we passed a giant, flickering sign that read LUSH in giant capital letters.  The letters were held up by work ladders and the sun was shining awkwardly on the windows, so I assumed this place was under construction and wouldn't be open during my stay.  I was wrong!We had to go after that.  And so we did.There's a big bar in the middle that splits the spot in two areas.  We opted to sit on the side with lounge furniture.  Had a bottle of wine that they suggested.  Actually, I think we picked it out and they told us it was great.  It was not a great bottle, but it was affordable and not too bad.  A tempranillo that was pleasant, but not quite what I was hoping for.  We didn't eat anything, but there was a small selection of things that I wasn't totally interested in.   Service was friendly and helpful.  They weren't overly attentive as we were drinking, but frankly, we had ordered a bottle and probably didn't need to be attended to.  I can refill my own glass.  They were just there to be helpful when needed, which is good.Random note, the LUSH sign makes a noise as each light bulb flicks on/off.  It was actually cool.  We were sitting right next to it and it was a neat ambient sound that you don't always get to hear.The real deal at Lush may be the $10 section.  We grabbed another on the way out and it was pretty good.  As before, not an amazing wine, but a great buy for a $10 bottle.  If the quality of that section is consistent with what we had, then it's probably worth looking into more often.

18.description: I was invited by a few friends to grab drinks at Lush. I expected it to have a bar-like atmosphere, but I was pleasantly surprised that it didn't! It's a great place to grab a cup of wine with a few friends or for a relaxed date. We were suggested a sweet white wine, Penelope, & loved it. For $11, you can take it home or open it up & have a chilled drink right there!

41.description: The only gripe I have about this place is that every time I walk in here I end up leaving slightly intoxicated.  They always have a tasting going on, or some open bottle I might be interested in trying, and how can I say "No" to that (free booze=happy me)?  And when they pour you a taste, is not like at some places where its just enough to coat the bottom of the glass.  It's usually a healthy portion, and after a few of those I feel a little woozy, often times buying more than I expected.  Good thing their knowledgeable and friendly staff always make great suggestions.  Also good they have a wonderful selection.  Someone really knows how to pick drinks over there.Lush, if I was going to own a liquor store/bar, it would be you.

52.description: I think it's time for the Duchess to finally deign writing a review of her estate...just sayin'....:)I am intoxicated with Lush (oh yes I did!! Don't hate) for many different reasons, some of which most of you won't care about, but that I am going to share anyway because I am in a generous mood. Here you are:- It's close to home; a 15-minute walk/5-minute bike ride to wine happiness? Sign me up.- My beautiful friend Laurel works there, and she's a wizard. And she makes the place glow. But everyone who works there is fantastic and always come up with the best suggestions, whatever your budget is.- $10 WINE SHELF. Make it double; one for reds, one for whites. Always good picks. Kicks Dominick's crappy bottles in the teeth (if they had 'em...let's make it "the neck". That hurts too anyway).- Sunday tastings: every week you can try a selection of amazing stuff. Wines, beers, liquors....I discovered a few great things in the past, including Letherbee gin. Go and discover the world!- Heavy selection of local products; all your distilleries are represented. LOVE.- Food.....do I need to say more? I guess so....dukkah (Egyptian spice blend of toasted nuts and seeds) on bread: addictive and cheap; cheese (try the camembert from Georgia id it's available; it's surprisingly delicious!); charcuterie; canned octopus from Spain, served with parsley, capers, lemon, unctuous olive oil and toasted bread: orgasmic. You'll find what you want, and Norine is a wonderful source of advice.- A lighted sign supported by a ladder?!? You want to see it.Parking is easy, the bus stop is next door; there's no excuse to not stop by.

50.description: I live around the corner from the Roscoe Village location, and frequent it often. Some friends and I decided to meet at a more central location, so we headed here and had a great time.Parking could be a problem at a more peak time, but it wasn't too bad when we went. We found a pay to park spot less than a block away.We got there around 8pm on a Friday and they were doing a free tasting of 4 kinds of champagnes. No pressure to buy, just some great bubbly poured by a very knowledgeable employee. We didn't buy any, but instead opted to buy something from their $10 red wine rack and enjoy it in their Snacks Lounge. This location has beer on tap and offers cocktails and wine by the glass, so I wasn't sure we'd be able to purchase a bottle to enjoy there, so I was pleasantly surprised when I found out we could. There were 2 couples and each purchased a bottle to share. As a small snack, we shared a bowl of popcorn popped in truffle oil. Delicious, and only $3.The employees were very friendly and often checked on us to see how we were doing as we chatted the night away. The place is supposed to close at 10, but the lights came on for us to leave closer to 11:30pm. We quickly took the hint and left.For about $15/couple, we each had about 2 glasses of wine and some popcorn. Totally worth it. I'll be back soon.

4.description: Stumbled on Lush while searching for a place to buy craft beer.  Love the space!  There are a couple of areas with big comfy chairs that look perfect for kicking back.  Love the selection of wine, spirits and beer.  Jay was extremely helpful.  He made some great suggestions and his knowledge was top notch.   There is something for any budget.  I got a bottle of wine to take to a party and it was a great find.  I will be going back to Lush...

6.description: The Monday special: fried chicken, bacon biscuit and cole slaw for 17$ sounds great, but the fried bird was served at room fing temperature (which is how they normally serve).... Added it to it, the draft beer (bells malty ale) was 12$ a pint! Wtf! Overpriced BS! On the whole I was disappointed. It was more pretentious and a rip off for a draft beer n chicken fried in a sauce pan!

22.description: This is one of my favorite places to go get a drink -- err, a bottle.  I'm hesitant to let the secret out, but their beef tartare is one of the best I've had and I crave it constantly.  Just be aware if you sit and have drinks that they probably won't ask you if you want more and they definitely won't ask you about food.  You have to reach out to them.  That's been my experience all 3 times.

15.description: Fantastic! Definitely want to go check out their other locations. We went here while waiting for a table at Ruxbin (2 hour wait). We were not disappointed at Lush. One side is a wine shop and the other is a wine bar/bistro. The 'glass' chandeliers are so hipster functional and cute!Don't let the wine prices fool you. The pours are 250ml that come in beakers. Tres chic. You will definitely get enough to drink. Even if wine isn't your thang, they do have several beers on tap as well.We had the French cheese plate (~$20) and it was so tasty. Just the right amount of bread and fig spread. We also got a selection of sausage (hee hee) and it was so good. Get the duck sausage for sure! There were other food options as well, I know they were cooking up some eggs while we were there and whatever it was they were making it smelled good : )Our service was excellent, we will go back!

57.description: Reserved a table for a birthday gathering-- it was was a smash. The wine tasting was informational--not fussy. The nibbles were great- I was afraid that the guests  would be hungry but the snacks were plenty and delicious.

20.description: I'm a neighbor, and there are lots of things I like about this place. The selection is amazing, and you can't beat a price of ten or fifteen bucks for a bottle you choose from the cooler to the right, that is then poured and served to you while you sip at your leisure at a wide wooden bar. The big negative for me is not any pretentiousness (I haven't noticed any more of that at Lush than I get in the typical wine shop). It's the sssslllllooooooooowwwwwww ssserrrvvviicccccce. Seriously, it takes forever to get someone to notice you, to take your order, for them to come back ... and forget getting anything to eat in less than half an hour. Our cheese plate took months to assemble. It's nice when you want to kill time with a friend, or have a leisurely drink before dinner, but it's just barely an incentive. If all you want is a bottle of something delish without the pretentiousness, head half a block west to The Noble Grape.

36.description: Went here last night for a friend's going away party. This is a hidden gem. Great selection of wines--even bottles for $10 which was great, if you're like me. I'm by no means a wino but had a great time here. The charcuterie and cheese was delicious and the ambiance is very cool. This would be a great spot for a date.

14.description: I often come here to buy wine, or sit and have a bottle in their comfortable space. Staff in general are friendly and knows wine well. Only complaint is that they need proper ventilation. The other day they were frying bacon or ham (not good for a vegetarian) and the place smelled awful... The smell stayed on my clothes also when I left.

1.description: Nothing obviously wrong with Awake. Espresso drinks (even for small size) served in big mugs. The breakfast wrap was tasty. Free (no timeout) wifi. I'd revisit.Note: a weird high-pitched sound can be heard throughout. Maybe it's the fridge, maybe the HVAC, no idea. You may regret not bringing earphones.

9.description: But my Chai tasted like water. The service is warm and friendly but the items are less than satisfactory. Meh.

23.description: I had an americano and it was one of the smoothest and tastiest ones I've had in a while. Very excited to have a coffee shop back on my block.
