12.description: There are a lot of cafes around, but Awake knows what they are doing.  Baristas here have to have skills to make a great drink the old fashioned way, since they have a very nice espresso machine.  (not on an automatic machine, like some chain cafes)Over all, I really like this place.  It's near my work, so its a perfect spot for my morning cup of coffee.  My lattes are always great, the scones are tasty too, and the staff is nice and polite.  I love the bright colors too!

21.description: Awake is definitely a step down from the sandwich place that used to be at this location. It's possible that they're just getting started and will have more to offer once they've been at it for a few years, but right now it's just your run of the mill coffee shop with a few (pretty mediocre) sandwich offerings. Also one of my biggest pet peeves: all the sandwiches come with a little cup of grapes, but the grapes aren't washed, leaving a waxy residue in your mouth.

16.description: I really wanted to like this place because I live two stories above it but I just can't. There's nothing special about the food and it is too over priced. I have tried a few of their coffee options and everything is just okay.

17.description: Awake? From what? The coma you're gonna be in after eating at this boring place. I met my wife and baby here for a quick bite and was pretty disappointed. It was supposedly their grams opening weekend but it had the atmosphere of 'meh,  who cares' going for it. No food morning from the side behind the counter, who just stood there and watched me struggle with the door while carrying and stroller up there non handicap accessible entrance. Ridiculous. I have a seat as my wife grabs a menu for us. We read through the selection of sandwiches I could have made at home and she orders for us. Dude asked to clarify what I wanted like there times. Club sandwich, no lettuce, and a smoothie. What did I get? A club sandwich, with lettuce and the crappiest smoothie ever. The whole time we are sitting there, we watch a small army of employees stroll in one at a time with the look of indifference that is quite fitting for this place.After I'm done choking down a piece of bread with a dab of meat in the middle, I try to tips the trash on the bin. Look, I'm no prude but cut bigger holes for your trash and recycling bins. Had to jam the corpse of my half eaten wich through it. Before leaving, I tried to hit up the bathroom and knocked first. Through the door I got some nice 'tude that shouldnt be a surprise from here, ' I'm in here.'Oh snap. I'm sorry 'I'm'.  I shoulda known better then to knock on a public bathroom door. I know it was an employee also. We were the only folks in this joint. In short, skip it and make your own sandwich at home. It would taste better and at least you would be familiar with the 'tude at home.

10.description: I was looking forward to trying the food from Awake Cafe based on their menu...unfortunately it was a disappointment. The seitan gyro was skimpy and bland (especially for the price) and the vegan spinach wrap just did not taste good. It took over 30 minutes to get these two items (only one other couple in the cafe at that time) and the girl at the register seemed to be having a bad day and inconvenienced by our presence.

5.description: What was on  coast wrap not at all what menu said:  spinach wrap?  No, plain Flour.   Avocados?  Nope.  Nada.  Very dissapointed. For an 8 dollar sandwich.  I could have made this at home.

11.description: This place is a shell of what swim cafe was not long ago. Nothing special.

22.description: Nothing special.  The chicken salad sandwich left a lot to be desired. For 6.50 (decent price) all you get is a sandwich on a plate and thats it. Wheres the garnish? Wheres the presentation? If you are going to be a cafe in this neighborhood you better have something good to offer and not just coffee, theres already enough cafes in a half a mile radius. Step your game up Awake, or else Ill see you replaced by another in a years time. What Swim had is at least innovative tasty food albeit the prices were outrageous.. Do your thing, but keep up with the neighborhood, people don't do average here.

0.description: Really like this place - good neighborhood coffee shop. Has new coffee drinks to try, a diverse menu and the staff is very friendly and kind. Definitely recommend.

20.description: Awake? From what? The coma you're gonna be in after eating at this boring place. I met my wife and baby here for a quick bite and was pretty disappointed. It was supposedly their grams opening weekend but it had the atmosphere of 'meh,  who cares' going for it. No food morning from the side behind the counter, who just stood there and watched me struggle with the door while carrying and stroller up there non handicap accessible entrance. Ridiculous. I have a seat as my wife grabs a menu for us. We read through the selection of sandwiches I could have made at home and she orders for us. Dude asked to clarify what I wanted like there times. Club sandwich, no lettuce, and a smoothie. What did I get? A club sandwich, with lettuce and the crappiest smoothie ever. The whole time we are sitting there, we watch a small army of employees stroll in one at a time with the look of indifference that is quite fitting for this place.After I'm done choking down a piece of bread with a dab of meat in the middle, I try to tips the trash on the bin. Look, I'm no prude but cut bigger holes for your trash and recycling bins. Had to jam the corpse of my half eaten wich through it. Before leaving, I tried to hit up the bathroom and knocked first. Through the door I got some nice 'tude that shouldnt be a surprise from here, ' I'm in here.'Oh snap. I'm sorry 'I'm'.  I shoulda known better then to knock on a public bathroom door. I know it was an employee also. We were the only folks in this joint. In short, skip it and make your own sandwich at home. It would taste better and at least you would be familiar with the 'tude at home.

19.description: Great place to sit down and work on my laptop. The atmosphere is similar to a yoga studio. calm and peaceful. whats the opposite of Bikram yoga  icetea yoga... good place to look like you're doin work maybe idk

2.description: Unlimited free WiFi and good Americanos keep me coming back to Awake Cafe. Nice food with decent portions.

18.description: Stopped in for a morning brew and a bite to eat. The Caspian Bagel with egg white, cheese and spinach with a latte got my started off in a great way. The service is crisp and friendly,  the place is clean and cool. It will be part of my morning routine.

13.description: Awake is definitely a step down from the sandwich place that used to be at this location. It's possible that they're just getting started and will have more to offer once they've been at it for a few years, but right now it's just your run of the mill coffee shop with a few (pretty mediocre) sandwich offerings. Also one of my biggest pet peeves: all the sandwiches come with a little cup of grapes, but the grapes aren't washed, leaving a waxy residue in your mouth.

4.description: It was alright. The atmosphere was fine, and the bagel with cream cheese I had was really good. However, I got a plain latte and it just tasted very milky/watery; the coffee flavor was really weak. My friend got a regular black coffee and said it was really gross :( Apparently it tasted really burnt. She loves coffee and always drinks it black, so she knows what she's talking about. I don't know if it was just an off day for them or whatever, but it was rather unfortunate. Oh well!

24.description: Awake Cafe is the new incarnation of Swim Cafe with a refreshing makeover (feels less like a fishbowl).  Enjoyed a nice cup of coffee and a half-priced smoothie for their opening promotion.

6.description: Today was my second visit and will be my last. I ordered a chai tea latte iced, and got a big ole cup of water. I couldn't taste the chai at all? For a $6 buck drink I expected better. Oh and moms and nannies beware! No one will help you with the door, while it's complicated enough navigating in and out through shops, you would think someone that is standing right at the register would help? My stroller almost flopped to the floor with baby... Very rude awake cafe?!

15.description: Not so great. Latte tasted like a Watered down cup of coffee and the staff didn't seem to happy

7.description: Clean, affordable, reliable, and quick. Everyone who works at Awake is great, especially Nicole! Awake has consistently been working on their branding but they seem to be community-oriented throughout each change. They never burn the coffee or espresso, and make actual cold brew coffee which is top notch. Much more affordable than other small coffee shops.

8.description: I really want to like this place because it is now the nearest cafe since the Ugly Mug (which I loved) closed. I just get drip coffee and it certainly isn't bad here, I do wish though that they had a medium size. I ate here once and that was enough. As others have mentioned it's basically  overpriced and not great.  Those things aside what keeps me from coming here is the place itself. Not sure who puts a register right in front of the door and sugar and cream right next to that and then try to squeeze a table in front of the register!? If u have two people in line it becomes crowded and uncomfortable being there. The uncomfortableness continues throughout this place with way too many chairs and tables that look like they came from Mr. Furley's (Threes Company) apartment! Yep I'm old. All this just makes for a place that is claustrophobic to be in and in-turn not inviting. Really wish something would open in the ugly mugs old spot.

3.description: This place seems to have it together. Convenient and fast! I love the Ugly mug but sometimes there sandwiches can take a while to be ready. My breakfast wrap was fast, warm and ready in less than two minutes. The wrap was light and like that of a rolled up egg, cheese, and bacon mini burrito, which was only $2.99! Glancing at the food menu I also noticed they have great price points on there food. (I hate spending more than $7 on breakfast!)  Not to mention the friendly lady behind the counter had great suggestions. Yay, I'm a fan and will more than likely be back very soon. It's quick and convenient for when you have a few mins on your commute back home or to work.

14.description: This is a good spot for grabbing coffee and a quick breakfast on the way to work. It's the only place I know that I can get coffee and a good breakfast to go for under $5- plus the employees remember my name, which is nice!

58.description: So happy with this salon. Madeline was sweet and helpful. Beth worked wonders on correcting a nearly hopeless case of a bad ombré done by a different salon. I never thought my hair could look this beautiful after one treatment! She was great at explaining the process she was going to use before we began. A true miracle worker! Feel free to post the before and after Beth! Thanks Epoch for a great experience :)

56.description: I got the balayage by Crystal and it's perfect! I haven't gone to get my hair professionally colored in at least six years, but after doing the same thing as the girl in the previous yelp review did (googled best balayage in Chicago) I made an appointment. The atmosphere is very relaxed and Crystal was extremely nice! I will be recommending her to everyone and will definitely be coming back :)

29.description: Epoch studio is "Hands Down" the best hair experience I have ever had. Megan had a major challenge with my hair as I am really starting to Grey. Since I have started to grey, I have had nothing but trouble with people trying to cover it. Megan sat me down for a consult and we went through all my issues...including all my breakage. She advised me on what she thought would be best for my hair, which included an Olaplex conditioning treatment and to brighten me up a bit, so I agreed and the process started. It was like a miracle happened...my grey was covered, the color turned out beautiful, my hair was silky instead of dry and broken, and my cut was awesome. I had an event that weekend and got endless comments on my hair...mostly "Wow, your hair looks great, really healthy, what did you do to it"? or "Your hair looks great, did you go lighter with it"?  I felt like a million bucks! Megan is a VERY TALENTED Stylist and now my go to girl. I referred a friends daughter to Megan for a Balayage which she raved about! If you are looking for someone who really knows her stuff, go see Megan, you will not be disappointed!

42.description: This is a review for Epoch Bridal. Stephanie did a wonderful job doing my wedding day hair and hair for the rest of the wedding party.  She was fun to work with and did exactly what I wanted and even worked with extensions perfectly.  My bridal party had all different types of hair and they all turned out beautifully. My hair stayed all the way through the reception and a windy day of pictures - I didn't think twice about it.  I hope I can get my hair done by Stephanie again!

23.description: I've been going to Epoch for a few years and have a wonderful experience each time. Beth is excellent and the balayage always looks perfect.  I get so many compliments on my color and that's all Beth.  Madelaine who mans the front is the best. Friendly and funny she is really kind if you, like me, need to reschedule. She runs a tight ship and with how busy the stylists are, she really keeps that place a float!They work with you to get your color exactly how you want it and are always friendly and professional.  I recently moved out of state and made sure to make my Christmas time appointment (when I'll be home visiting) because Beth is the best and I'm not ready to branch out if I don't have to!

47.description: I visited Epoch for the first time this week to have a perm done by Beth. I was pretty nervous about getting a perm since all I know about perms is based on bad 80s hairstyles, but I knew I wanted to do something with my fine, limp hair. Epoch was the only salon I could find in Chicago that seemed to have any real experience doing perms, so I figured I would give it a shot.Beth was extremely knowledgeable about the process and really took the time to explain it to me and go through all of my options. I had no idea there were so many ways to do a perm, but together we decided on the best option for my hair. The process itself was easy and only took about 2 hours and the results so far are great - definitely not the bad 80s curls I was picturing from a perm and it's the first time in my life that my hair has any body or texture on its own. My hair turned out semi-curly/wavy, and has way more body than it used to - now I'm just trying to learn how to actually work with curly hair since I've never needed to before. Beth did a great job and I'm sure I will be returning once the perm grows out.The perm was a bit pricier than at other salons, but for a service like this where it could go horribly wrong if the stylist doesn't know what they're doing, I am happy to pay for the extra expertise. Their haircuts and other services though are right in line with other Chicago prices, so it pretty much all evens out anyways.Also, a lot of people seem to have a problem with the information form you have to fill out, which I don't really understand. I thought it was great that the salon wanted to be fully informed before doing any work on my hair, and Beth went through all of the information on the form with me. It also only takes like 3-5 minutes to fill out, so really doesn't put a damper on the visit.Overall a great experience and I would recommend Epoch and Beth to anyone!

8.description: I trusted Beth with my first hair dying experience, and I am so happy I did. I keep going back for balayage and a hair cut. She makes my hair look incredible every time. My boyfriend, however, went in for a hair cut with a new girl at epoch, and I kid you not he looked like Bart Simpson. Definitely recommended for women, not sure about men.

31.description: Annie @ Epoch is amazing! I followed her from the Robert Jeffrey at Wicker Park and I could not be happier that I did. She has done amazing things with my hair over the years--I've gone from shoulder length to pixie cuts and everything in between--never, during the several times that I've grown out my hair did I have an "awkward" hair cut. Annie is amazing at color, too, having taking my natural brunette hair all the way to platinum blonde without using bleach (for that, my tresses remain grateful), then to red, then back to brunette. I used Annie for mine and my bridesmaids updos, and she did my wedding makeup. Plainly, I would follow Annie to the ends of the earth, but thankfully, Epoch has good street parking ;)

34.description: After what seemed like months of researching different salon reviews for balayage, I finally booked an appointment at Epoch and am  so I glad I did!  Leslie did my color and Madelyn did my blow out.  Each were fantastic.  I went in with an idea of what I wanted and along with some photos.  With my VERY curly hair I wasn't sure if what I wanted was even possible but Leslie knew exactly what to do and she nailed it.  To make the hair transformation complete I did a full blow out (instead of just diffusing the curls); that was also fantastic and lasted for three days which is no small feat with my curls.  The studio space is amazing - it's cozy and inviting which is really nice as you spend a couple hours there with all the treatment processes.  I am totally in love with my hair -- I think it looks even better with the curls!  I will go back to Epoch any day!

16.description: I wanted to wait a few weeks before I wrote my review. My friends have died their hair in the past only to have it last a couple weeks before it got dingy and brassy.I'm so happy to say that a month and a half later my hair still looks just as great! I got a balayage ombre combination done on my hair by Beth. I have never EVER died my hair in my life and had just had my wedding a few days before. I wanted something fresh and new and Beth did not disappoint. We walked through several pictures I brought and she warned me about how the color might not be exact because it takes time to lighten up as much as I wanted. Turns out my hair cooperated because it turned out GREAT. The perfect blonde ends to my lightish brown hair. She really made the ombre look natural and the balayage added dimension to the coloring. Also, she gave me a great haircut! I think I have a new bad habit, too bad it's not cheap.

13.description: I agree with all the reviews on here, this place is amazing!! I went to Beth for a balayage and a pretty dramatic haircut. I couldn't be happier with the results!Beth seemed very, very knowledgeable. She happened to be training two girls when I was in there, so I could hear her explaining every step she took on my hair. I completely trusted her and could tell she knew what she was doing. The best part was hearing that I didn't have to come back for another 3 MONTHS for a touch up!! I'm writing this review about two months later, and Beth was right, the balayage still looks good even now. So it's wayy less maintenance, compared with every other time I've gotten my hair done and had to go back in every month to redo my roots.It is definitely on the pricier side, but given that I have to go in less frequently, I feel as if it all equals out. I will definitely be going back and seeing Beth!

11.description: I can't say enough great things about my experience at epoch salon. This place is truly a gem. Megan was absolutely amazing and I have never been so satisfied with my hair before. I cannot wait for my next visit!

39.description: This is my first time coloring my hair so I was super nervous. Beth put away all my anxiety. I walked in with an idea of what I wanted and a couple of pictures and she did wonders! I am so in love with my new hair. Everyone at epoch was also extremely friendly and their loft space is gorgeous. I will not be going anywhere else as long as Epoch is in Chicago!

37.description: This was my first time doing balayage and I absolutely loved it! Leslie colored my hair and I couldn't be happier with the results. I had highlighted my hair twice before (using foils) and it was starting to look a bit processed. Leslie's balayage looked super natural and perfectly blonde. She meticulously painted on the color and made sure that I left the salon happy. Even if you don't get her, I think that this sort of careful consideration is characteristic of the salon as a whole. The space itself was really cute and cozy, and the owner of the collective was very friendly. I have friends who have gotten balayage for twice the price, and I think that my hair turned out better than theirs :)

0.description: I have never had my hair dyed before but caved in when I couldn't hide my greys any longer. I was terrified of changing my hair color and I did my research and settled on going to Epoch after reading all the great reviews from Yelp. I made an appointment with Beth and after a consultation we ended up doing two processes: all over semi permanent color to cover the greys and bayalage to add dimension. Beth did my color while Madeline did my blow dry and style. My hair came out looking amazing! I was beyond happy with the results. Not only was the color great, but the blow dry and style was the best I've ever had done. Better than my normal salon and better than the blow dry bars. My hair is thin and I wanted loose tossels, not curls, and Madeline made it work. Thank you so much to Beth and Madeline again!One negative is the parking is awful. If you can, take public transportation or an Uber/Lyft etc. I came from the suburbs so that wasn't an option for me but I highly recommend it.

38.description: Just got my hair colored for the first time so I was a little nervous. But Evelyn was amazing, totally put me at ease. She explained every detail to me and was a true professional. The results look awesome and I  so happy! Evelyn is the best!

51.description: Thanks for the response. However, I want to make it clear on my concerns. I was 10 mins late, called reception, because I could not find your salon without a sign. When I finally arrived I had to fill out a form which took another 15 mins. I signed the completed form stating I understand there will be NO refunds whatsoever. If there is a problem, Beth will fix it. First salon that I ever had to sign something like that... and I strongly believe, if you have that policy it is best not to close the salon (regardless of the reason) for a long period of time. Or at least check your voicemails and return calls. If someone would have called me back and reassured me my hair can be corrected, I never would have written my review on yelp and I wouldn't have had to pay $$$ to have a different salon fix what I just paid your salon to do in the first place.When Beth finally called me back she said she could not help me and I was suppose to "email" you, the owner for further assistance. Why couldn't you reach out to me via email, phone, mail... You have all my information on the "form" I filled out. Instead you use Yelp to share your excuses and fail to offer any solutions...?

27.description: I got my haircut from Megan and can hands down say it was the best hair cut I've ever gotten. I wanted to transform my Long locks to a short bob and Megan truly studies your face and is honest on what cut will go best with your features. Knowing I was nervous about cutting my hair, she slowly went shorter and shorter making sure I was comfortable. Definitely will be going back to her and to get a baylayage ombré next time! I'm from Seattle, so a trip to Chicago needs to happen so she can get her hands on my hair!

32.description: love Love LOVE this place!!!!! I was looking around for the right place to go from black to grey hair. I had long virgin hair and I wanted it all grey. I called in to a couple places and epoch recommended I set up an appointment for a consultation. naturally I was impatient and wanted to get it done right away but I still set it up. Like a fool I went to another salon to also get an estimate and they said they'd do it on the spot. Apparently this task was beyond their abilities because I came out with patches of dark grey, green, and yellow. So pissed. Went to epoch for a color correcting consultation. Evelyn was AWESOME!!! see did a bleach test to see if my hair could handle it before actually doing anything. The safety of my hair was important and not sell false promises. For 6 straight hours I was Evelyn priority unlike the other salon. She fixed me right up! Can't wait to go back.

54.description: I want to apologize up front for the long review but I seriously cannot say enough good things about Epoch! If you want to stop reading here, then can summarize this review by saying that I 100% recommend Epoch Bridal for weddings and Epoch Salon for anything else! But if you have some time... I booked Epoch to do hair and makeup for myself, my bridesmaids and a few close family members for my wedding in July and I was beyond thrilled with the results! Zee did our hair, Susan did our makeup and Stephanie coordinated the whole process.I am not someone who has my hair and makeup done often, so my main concern going into my wedding was wanting to look like me.  I let Zee (hair) and Susan (makeup) know this, brought along a few photos of what I was looking for, and they delivered EXACTLY what I wanted. I can honestly say that I have never felt as beautiful as I did on my wedding day.From the first time I reached out to Stephanie to set up my Epoch Bridal appointment she was extremely helpful and patient answering all of my (sometimes ridiculous) questions - believe me, there were a lot. When I was hesitant to book trial appointments because of cost (Epoch is pricey but WELL worth it) she asked me to send her some pictures of what I had in mind so she could pass them along to Zee and Susan to get their opinions.  A day or so later Stephanie assured me that, although she always recommends having the trials, if I wanted to forego them to save on cost both Zee and Susan were confident that they could recreate the look I wanted. In the end I ended up skipping the trials and was 100% thrilled with how both my hair and makeup turned out.  I will say that I had a fairly simple vision for both my hair and makeup, so it worked out great for me but if you are wanting something more complicated you should probably go for the trial sessions to be sure everyone is on the same page with what you want.The day of my wedding Zee and Susan showed up to my bridal suite on time and ready to get started.  They were both very nice and very professional, while still managing to be really fun to work with (not something everyone can pull off)! They chatted with everyone and put us all at ease right away.  With all the stress of the wedding day, it was so nice to be able to have some time to relax and get pampered.  Best of all, when they were finished I didn't feel like some overly made-up, cookie cutter bride - I felt like myself (okay, definitely a prettier, more polished version of myself - but you know what I mean!).I completely recommend the team at Epoch Bridal to anyone who is looking for an alternative to a standard 'Bridal' hair and makeup experience. These girls are very talented and they know what they are doing!One more shout out to Crystal at Epoch Salon who did my balayage highlights a few weeks before my wedding.  I have been going to Crystal for just over a year now and she is amazing! If you are looking for someone who can create natural-looking ombre/balayage color Crystal is your girl!

48.description: When I first came to Epoch Salon Crystal was reluctant to do what I requested instead all I got was negative feedback and felt pushed to go a route with my hair that I felt I didn't want at the time. I understand the need to comment and suggest what they consider a better alternative for you, but I felt a little annoyed. After that first appointment I did request for Beth, but for some reason they wouldn't let me book with her so I went back to Crystal and decided to give this salon another shot based on all the good reviews. I did get suggested that I go a little more darker and caramel instead of more blonde. At my last appointment there I went with her suggestion and got balayage for a second time, but when I seen the end result it had looked like I had nothing done to it. I had grown out my hair for about two months after the first balyage, because I was told that you didn't need to touch it up as often. You can imagine my shock when I do that and get a touch up that has a couple blonde strands and that's it. I understand that balayage isn't like highlights but as I seen from the other salon I now go to it is more than a couple thin strands. I had my dark roots that was down to my ears with thin strips of blonde in it and ended up paying what I felt was a ridiculous amount for hair that didn't even look like anything was done to it. After that incident I did end up leaving and never returning. As other reviewers have stated crystal does seem standoffish at times and I did wish she was more engaged at times. I am giving it two stars because the first two appointments of color I did have were great despite the comments it was only the last one that I wasn't too fond of.

44.description: I wanted to wait a few weeks before I wrote my review. My friends have died their hair in the past only to have it last a couple weeks before it got dingy and brassy.I'm so happy to say that a month and a half later my hair still looks just as great! I got a balayage ombre combination done on my hair by Beth. I have never EVER died my hair in my life and had just had my wedding a few days before. I wanted something fresh and new and Beth did not disappoint. We walked through several pictures I brought and she warned me about how the color might not be exact because it takes time to lighten up as much as I wanted. Turns out my hair cooperated because it turned out GREAT. The perfect blonde ends to my lightish brown hair. She really made the ombre look natural and the balayage added dimension to the coloring. Also, she gave me a great haircut! I think I have a new bad habit, too bad it's not cheap.

24.description: A few weeks ago I was finally able to make an appointment with my oh so talented and sweet stylist Annie. I would follow her anywhere but what a surprise to find she had made her new home in such a cute and cozy environment. When first making my appointment on the phone I encountered one of the nicest receptionists ever, Madelaine. What a doll! I truly love everything about my new salon and am so happy that Annie found a place she fits into so well.

7.description: The first time I went here didn't go so well, however I was asked to come back and let another stylist fix it and I did and let me just say I had the best hair experience ever with Leslie. She got me back to the platinum blonde I wanted, and was so sweet and nice and spent literally hours with my hair doing section by section making sure not to over process it. She was so patient especially considering she was fixing a mistake she didn't even make. I didn't lose any length, no split ends and I have absolutely no added damage to my already super bleached hair. If you are blonde (or want to be)  you haveee to go see Leslie!! Shes a miracle worker!!

49.description: Had my hair done yesterday by Beth and the balayage turned our perfect and gorgeous! Couldn't be happier. Great laid back salon in the neighborhood! Thank you!

40.description: I went to Epoch after another salon massacred my hair. Epoch was able to get me in right away for a color consultation. Dillon took a look at my hair, and ended up putting toner on it that day, which was wonderful. (It was the holidays and I was scared of spending even a day more with orange hair).A week later I came back for highlights, and a cut. Dillon did an amazing job, and I'm so pleased with the results. She is a literal miracle worker, and just a very cool person, to boot. I also had a great experience with Madelaine. She is so professional, and proactive. I was incredibly impressed with her.Overall, five stars for both services and customer service. I will DEFINITELY be back.  actually cannot wait to get my hair done again. :) Thanks again Epoch for saving the day!!!

53.description: LOVE this place and LOVE Beth.  This was the 2nd salon I tried when I first moved to Chicago - I was a bit skeptical as the first one had been a huge FAIL and I had an amazing stylist in DC so my expectations were high.  Beth delivered.  In our first appointment, she sat down with me and discussed what I was looking for, what I wanted, and provided some ideas for me.  Her recommendations have been dead on.  In addition to doing a fantastic job at color/cut, i also had her do my hair and make up for an office photo shoot.  I was amazed at what she did - I liked the look so much I decided to go get my drivers license that day - the first time in forever I took a good picture at the DMV.Bottom line - this is not a traditional salon (e.g. no retail) but that is what I like about it - the focus is on you and providing the best color/cut possible.  Everyone has been super friendly and I always walk out feeling great.

30.description: I can't say enough great things about my experience at epoch salon. This place is truly a gem. Megan was absolutely amazing and I have never been so satisfied with my hair before. I cannot wait for my next visit!

46.description: Just moved to Chicago from FL 2 months ago and finally got my hair done yesterday. I must say Beth did an an extraordinary job with my hair. She is probably the most respectful and caring stylist that I have ever met my entire life. Before we started coloring, she sat down and chat with me about what I hate about my hair color and what I wanted to get out of the visit. Beth was very open into saying that she cares about the client's hair and therefore if you have virgin hair, you can't expect to get out looking blonde. She WASN'Tt like any other stylist I met who always told u they can get your hair they way you wanted it and it turned out to be the furthest thing you wanted to happened to your hair. Beth may not talk a lot which I appreciate because that only means that she takes her job seriously. After a good 1 and a half hour I get out with the most gorgeous + sophisticated hair color I have ever gotten in the US!!! Beth may not sells you expectations and promises but she sells u results!!  Thank you for making me the happiest girl a week before my birthday!!!

1.description: Upon strolling into Epoch I was taken a back by it's gorgeous interior. The loft was spacious with exposed brick and swanky furniture. I was even offered a glass of wine... I felt like an elite among the best of the best.Beth, my stylist, was warm and welcoming as I had never been there before. She took great time and care while painting in my balayage highlights. There seemed to be a miscommunication though because instead of receiving a partial, I was given a full balayage (I was now blonde, a former brunette). This was very upsetting. The reason I still gave 4 stars though was this:After calling in to express my frustration, Epoch and Beth immediately fit me in for a new appointment. I was refunded for the mistake and she painted brunette back into my hair, fixing me up nice and good. I was very happy with the final outcome and their willingness to solve the problem with swiftness and kind attitudes.Overall, talented people who mean well. I recommend!

55.description: Googled "best balayage" (like many other yelpers here) and this salon came up first! Made an apt with Crystal. Love her. Did exactly what I asked for ombré/balayage. Posted a before and after. Can't really tell that it's ombré but it is in person. Will be back again! Oh and the salon is so cute!!!!

9.description: I don't even know where to begin. I desperately needed my hair cut and had been putting it off because I didn't want to try a new stylist (I'm very attached to my own back home). But I am so so happy that I found Epoch. I called and they scheduled me with Leslie. She made me feel completely comfortable right away. I also came in a color virgin and not only did she see my vision but she listened to what I wanted and guided me through the process and I am absolutely thrilled with the result. Overall, amazing experience, amazing place. I would recommended anyone to go here.

26.description: Megan was one of my favorite people I've ever had cut my hair- she listens to what you want, advises you on some minor adjustments she thinks would work, and did an AMAZING job coloring my hair. I highly highly recommend her to anyone looking to change up their color, she's fantastic!

25.description: I'm giving two stars for how sweet all the girls and manager was and willing to work with me. (Very accommodating) I'm just really unhappy that I left with my hair looking exactly  how it did before getting it "done". I can't even tell there are balayage highlights in there and when I do see it, it's random and blunt  not blended. It had to be fixed since it wasn't done right the first time and I know blonde is always tricky, everyone makes mistakes but my roots weren't even covered and my hair looked horrible in wedding photos.  The place is gorgeous and the girls are so sweet but I honestly feel like I flushed $250 down the toilet :(.

12.description: Love this studio!! Such a cool space and the staff is mega talented. Beth is a phenomenal stylist and Madeline is so awesome to work with for appointments. Would absolutely recommend this salon for your next cut & color!

59.description: We used leap weddings/epoch studio salon for our May 2014 wedding. We did not use them for video, but used them for bride and bmaid hairdos. Stephanie Ostby was our on site stylist and our experience with her was nothing but fabulous. She came to my home for my trial and then the W Chicago LakeShore Hotel on the morning of the wedding. I can honestly say she was extremely professional and prompt in all of our emails, phone calls, and interactions. Not to mention her talent for hair is amazing. After meeting with her for my trial, I realized she knows what she is doing and would not make me have"country bumpkin wedding hair" or the dreaded "prom hair". On my wedding day, my 9 bridesmaids enjoyed chatting with her and they really liked their dos. I would strongly recommend hiring Stephanie if you are having a Chicago wedding. You won't be sad that you did. Added perk!!! If you go to their salon/business on Ohio Street there is a resident bulldog named Moose to greet you. Thanks EPOCH :)Alison

21.description: Nothing makes me more upset than a hairdresser that gives you false expectations about what he/she can do with your hair. That being said I am so grateful for finding Beth at Epoch Salon. I went in recently with very dark dyed black hair and requested a saturated balayage with golden blonde hair on the bottom. Beth was incredibly honest with me and told me that since my hair was so dark, it would take a few treatments before I achieved the balayage look that I desired. I instantly felt a little disappointment but was happy to hear that she wanted me to be realistic about my expectation with the hair color we would achieve after one balayage. As it turns out the result of my hair color treatment surprised both Beth and I. I ended up with the exact look that I wanted coming into the salon and was shocked that my hair took to the color so well. I will most definitely return to see Beth for any future hair color and cut. A definite win!

17.description: This was my first time visiting Epoch as well as my first haircut in almost a year.  Annie did an amazing job!  She transformed my limp, tangled mess of a mane into a clean and wonderful look, which was exactly what I was looking for.  She was able to salvage my botched self-cut bangs and give me a beautiful fringe that framed my face. I felt like a goddess when I left. In addition, I adored the studio itself!  It has so much character and an amazing upbeat energy!  I can't wait to go back!! (Which is saying a lot for I have avoided haircuts at all costs in the past)

10.description: Okay. So I found this place like many others. I hate to say that I left this place unhappy, especially since I spent over $200. I asked for a bayalage ombre, neither of which I got. I got highlights that were an inch away from my scalp. They were also slightly yellow/orange. I felt like this was something I could've done myself at home. I wound up going somewhere else a few days later just to get it dyed back all to one color. I know I know.. I'm the one that decided to leave without letting them know that I wasn't completely happy. If I were a colorist/stylist, I would ask my client if this is the look they want. I felt like the girl who did my hair wasn't very approachable.

5.description: I went in for a bayalage hair color/hair cut/hair makeover and let me tell you guys that Beth is a hair goddess! I've been changing hair stylist every two months for the past year and finally found my go to girl. I was a little nervous since I have my baby shower in a couple days but after seeing my transformation I couldn't have been happier. She told me exactly what would happen with my hair and what she could and could not do with the picture I showed her (no false hopes given!) Yes, it was a little pricey but I did get a lot done so it was def worth every penny and they gave me 10% off for first time service as well.

3.description: Absolutely love the chic loft set up with the city backdrop out the window. I have been going to the same salon in the suburbs for my entire life and am very picky about how my hair is done. I figured since I have been living downtown for about a year now, I should find a place nearby. I saw the reviews on yelp for Eposh and scheduled an appointment with Beth. They have a million magazines to keep you preoccupied while you wait for your color to set in and Beth is so sweet and incredibly talented. She recommended I get a partial bayalage and a trim and I am more than happy with the results. Beth settles for nothing but perfection with the hair she does and she really takes the time to make you feel special.

35.description: This was my first time visiting Epoch as well as my first haircut in almost a year.  Annie did an amazing job!  She transformed my limp, tangled mess of a mane into a clean and wonderful look, which was exactly what I was looking for.  She was able to salvage my botched self-cut bangs and give me a beautiful fringe that framed my face. I felt like a goddess when I left. In addition, I adored the studio itself!  It has so much character and an amazing upbeat energy!  I can't wait to go back!! (Which is saying a lot for I have avoided haircuts at all costs in the past)

19.description: This is the best salon ever! Beth cuts my hair and does my makeup and hair from time to time. I also get keratin treatments here. Every time I leave I look incredible. Love the space, love everyone that works there.

28.description: Megan was my stylist the first time I came to Epoch a couple months ago.  I had never had my hair colored, so I really didn't even know how to ask for what I wanted.  Megan asked all the right questions to discover what that was and I LOVED the result.  Great color and cut.  I got a lot of compliments.  Megan is awesome, and real wants you to be happy with the outcome.  Not surprisingly I came back to have Megan work her magic again.  Thanks Megan!!!

45.description: After living in Chicago for nearly two years with nothing but bad experiences with hair stylists- i found one! I hadn't colored my hair in over two years and really wanted to lighten it up a bit and found Epoch. Crystal was great and she gave me just what I needed! She sat down with me before hand and explained everything she would be doing and how much to expect it to cost (so you weren't surprised in the end) and was very sweet throughout the whole process. My color was fantastic and the cut was great as well. She fixed a poor cut job from my last bad experience. I will continue to come back here! Thank goodness i found a place!

33.description: Yesterday was my first visit to this salon.  It was a great experience!  I was able to schedule my visit quickly and get in the next day.  Leslie was awesome... love my updated hair cut and color!  The salon was super cute too, and everyone was very friendly.  I would definitely recommend this place!!

43.description: I have had haircuts, keratin treatments, baliage, all over color, up-dos and make-up with Beth. I flew her down for my wedding to do hair and make-up for myself and my bridesmaids. She is the best and most talented stylist I know. I usually ask her opinion for what I need, and I have never left Epoch unsatisfied. Keep up the great work Beth!

2.description: I found Epoch on yelp and was really hoping it was not hyped up to be something better than it really was. Today I learned it is as AMAZING as everyone claims! And I'm really not just saying that. I never post reviews, good or bad. But I felt that I absolutely had to say something because I was so pleased with my haircut and services overall!!I just moved to Chicago from California and did not know who to trust with my hair. I was also experiencing some damage/dryness that words could not explain. I went in today with my hair naturally dried and showed Megan the damage and she provided me with numerous things I could to do prevent further damage and she also recommended an olaplex treatment. I was a bit skeptical because I have been talked into doing different treatments at salons that are supposed to revive your hair and what not...but that was never the case. This time it was exactly what my hair needed!!! It is not like new, which I did not expect, but it looks exponentially better than it did when I walked in there! I am confident Megan will get my hair back to normal, or better!So happy to have found Megan. I will definitely be going back to Megan for all my future hair appointments!

18.description: I went to epoch salon for the first time and got my hair done with Evelyn. She is the sweetest! Love the salon, which is clean and cute :) will be back in the future. Thanks epoch!

41.description: Okay. So I found this place like many others. I hate to say that I left this place unhappy, especially since I spent over $200. I asked for a bayalage ombre, neither of which I got. I got highlights that were an inch away from my scalp. They were also slightly yellow/orange. I felt like this was something I could've done myself at home. I wound up going somewhere else a few days later just to get it dyed back all to one color. I know I know.. I'm the one that decided to leave without letting them know that I wasn't completely happy. If I were a colorist/stylist, I would ask my client if this is the look they want. I felt like the girl who did my hair wasn't very approachable.

52.description: I used to hate getting my hair done and I frequently avoided it -- and now: I love it. I'll gladly travel all the way across Chicago for Epoch and I don't even like going across town. Everyone at Epoch is friendly and easygoing. The salon is airy and relaxing, and there's an adorable dog that moseys around from time to time. I love that they serve tea and various snacks every time I'm in. I always feel pampered. Also, the main attraction: Beth is a wizard and does amazing things to my recovering-tomboy mane. I get balayage and a cut once or twice a year (for me: that's a lot! I might even start going quarterly) and it grows out beautifully. I can't say enough good things!UPDATE: Due to a bonkers schedule, I haven't gone back to Epoch since before I originally wrote this review -- but people are still giving me compliments on my hair! Just today someone stopped me just to tell me that they loved my hair. Seriously: Beth is magic.

50.description: Beth, as usual, nailed it!!!! Just came back from a balayage colour and cut with her and I love it! I was looking for a colour and cut refresher and she knew exactly what I was talking about when I was describing what I was hoping for.  Since moving to the city this year I used Yelp to find her and I'm so glad I did.  She's like the "Balayage Hair Whisperer". Seriously, book her!

4.description: The salon is as cute as can be. The receptionist was friendly upon arrival and they have the most adorable dog hanging around so he helped keep me company while I waited for my appointment! As for my experience, I came in to get my first balayage with Crystal. She was nice, but perhaps not as welcoming and friendly as other hairdressers I've met before. The balayage came out just okay - I neither loved it or hated it. The weird thing is when I called initially...I asked for an appointment with Beth and the person on the phone said no one named Beth worked there. When I arrived, Beth was working on another client so she definitely exists. I've seen her work and it's awesome!

6.description: This is my first time coloring my hair so I was super nervous. Beth put away all my anxiety. I walked in with an idea of what I wanted and a couple of pictures and she did wonders! I am so in love with my new hair. Everyone at epoch was also extremely friendly and their loft space is gorgeous. I will not be going anywhere else as long as Epoch is in Chicago!

22.description: This place rocks!!! I've gone to the same salon almost my whole life and have been sick of it for a while I saw the yelp reviews for epoch and decided to try it out and could not be happier!! Aesthetically the place is beautiful and has a really cool vibe. I had Annie and she made me feel so comfortable and talked me thru everything. I've never colored my hair and she did the most beautiful perfect natural looking job! She made me look and feel so good about myself! I would recommend this place to anyone! GO EPOCH!

15.description: This space is amazing and Annie is such a great stylist! She always listens and helps me talk through exactly what I'm looking for when it comes to my cut and color - and she's just a genuinely sweet, and really interesting, gal overall. The gal that answers the phone and books appointments, Madelaine, is the friendliest, most helpful salon manager ever.

57.description: Well, Beth just did my color a second time and she nailed it again so it wasn't just a fluke the first time ;) She gets it. I still don't know what balayage is or how to pronounce it but who cares, it's clearly communicating what I like to the woman I rely on to do it so I'm going with it. I'm even doing a smoothing treatment on Friday and not because Beth tried to sell it to me, but because I had a few questions about smoothing treatments in general which Beth answered and then suggested a smoothing treatment may be the answer to my lack of motivation to spend time doing my hair in the morning... We shall see.

20.description: I had the absolute best experience at Epoch Salon! Leslie did a FANTASTIC job with my Balayage color and cut! She was so friendly and completely understood what I was aiming for. I can't wait for my next appointment in a few months!

36.description: I agree with all the reviews on here, this place is amazing!! I went to Beth for a balayage and a pretty dramatic haircut. I couldn't be happier with the results!Beth seemed very, very knowledgeable. She happened to be training two girls when I was in there, so I could hear her explaining every step she took on my hair. I completely trusted her and could tell she knew what she was doing. The best part was hearing that I didn't have to come back for another 3 MONTHS for a touch up!! I'm writing this review about two months later, and Beth was right, the balayage still looks good even now. So it's wayy less maintenance, compared with every other time I've gotten my hair done and had to go back in every month to redo my roots.It is definitely on the pricier side, but given that I have to go in less frequently, I feel as if it all equals out. I will definitely be going back and seeing Beth!

14.description: This was the first time coloring my hair so I was a little bit nervous going into it. Beth came highly recommended to me from a good friend, and right after meeting her, I was confident in her abilities. I showed her a picture of exactly what I wanted and she made my hair look even better than I could have ever imagined! I was so impressed with her, the salon and all of the other workers in the studio. I definitely plan to be back soon!

58.description: Oh my, the Hideout Panto gets better every year.  I invited a bunch of friends this year, none of whom could make it on the same day, so instead of having an entourage I showed up for almost every performance with a different person.  It was slightly different each time, everyone I brought loved it, I didn't ever want it to end, and now I have a piece of the stage set standing in my living room that was auctioned off cheaply for charity after the last performance. It's a giant Egyptian sarcophagus beautifully painted by the polymath Jon Langford, who as usual played a strong woman in the leading role.  My cat has risen even higher in my estimation by incorporating it into his play/hunting routine and pouncing on people from behind its cardboard walls.  The music, like the set, was gorgeous, and, as Langford justly observed to the audience in thanking the band, the playing was "tighter than a sphinx's sphincter."  (I'm afraid that visual will stay with me for a while.  Oh well.)  The script was funny and surreal.  The acting was over the top.  The costumes were perfect--especially the insect-thorax look of the romantic lead's armored breastplate, and the camel.  I haven't field-tested the Panto on an actual child yet, but a friend reported that her teenage son loved it, especially the puns.  Damn, now we have to wait till December for another one.

56.description: I'm a big fan of the Hideout. Can't remember when I first came out here, but it was probably with my bandmates. I've even played here once a few years ago.As some people have said, it's not for everyone. And that's just fine by me. The only complaint I've ever had myself is yeah, it's tucked away and not the easiest to get to for those of use without vehicles or bikes. That's why I always as the bartender or doorman to call a cab for me. The North/Clybourn red line stop isn't that far away if I don't feel like taking the cab all the way home.I just like that I can come here, and not have to deal with obnoxious bros & the like, and just have a good time with friends.Great patio facing south towards the city, equally great atmosphere inside. And the tamale guy makes a couple stops here, so that's a bonus too. And FYI The bartenders have always been more than nice to me.I don't always get some of the people who show up after shows just for the dance party, but whatever. To each their own. I've yet to see a bad show here, and can't wait to start hitting soup & bread with some friends.(Oh, and to people who complained about the "varying" price... Pretty much every show in Chicago, not exclusive to the Hideout, has an advanced &  door price with the price at the door being just a few bucks more.)

29.description: An Oasis in the middle of urban desert, the Hideout is a very unique, cozy live-music venue/bar. Worth a trip. Definitely a diamond in the rough.

42.description: Review for musicians who gig:I've played here, I've DJ'd here, and of course I've been to plenty of shows here. The Hideout is just one of those cool venues you wish you and your friends owned. I could spend a lot of time at a place like this.Eclectic booking policy that works for a change. It's part of what makes The Hideout, well, The Hideout. Add to that the oddball location, a fantastic front room bar, and a separate music venue in back and you have all the ingredients for a good night out.If you're on the road and this is your first time here, you might be a bit taken aback. It's located in an industrial area, and to find an old house / bar / venue is a bit puzzling, but no worries. The Hideout has a loyal following, and deservedly so. I've found it to be very performer-focused, so whatever you're doing you'll be treated well by the staff and crowd.Load in through the alley behind the venue to the north. It's just a quick trip from the door to the stage. You'll probably have to stash gear along one of the walls or in front after you check. There's no backstage area. Once that's over, park your car on street and head back in to the bar, grab a seat and order a drink, they'll take care of the rest.It's a small room, and I'd guess sound can be hit or miss, it really depends on how loud you are on stage. I've always been happy with it. DJ booth is in the corner of the room. They have turntables and cds, and I'm sure if you showed up with a laptop they can handle that too. I'm a vinyl guy and never had any problems here. Can't say the same for all venues. I've spun after shows and let me tell ya, the crowd stays and they're ready to get down, so be sure to bring some burners.If you aren't having fun at The Hideout, you need to retire from going out at night.

23.description: You mean to tell me that there is a performance venue housed in an old home, in the middle of a warehouse area, where police cars drive near to get serviced on? And they serve cheap drinks and Old Style? Let's go!I have seen a few stand-up shows here, and I have to say the place packs quite the crowd. It gets crowded, however it is an intimate venue and every time the setting always is warm and friendly. Once you brave the area (if you are THAT uptight), you will immensely enjoy yourself!

47.description: So this place is pretty cool!  I saw a really cool band there a few days ago and the staff are pretty nice.  I kinda really dislike the fact that it really is a hideout!  Its really off the beaten path and not the best feeling walking there alone to an area thats within an industrial area.  I would go again but gotta take a cab next time.

8.description: The Interview Show was great!  Love the dive bar atmosphere, and the location in a deserted industrial zone.

31.description: I can't comment on the music or their block party but they're the BESTEST because of Soup and Bread, which is something I try to come down for on the weekly. I like that this 'season' they're doing themes so it's interesting to see how different people interpret that and with just a suggested donation you can give as much or as little as you want, but with the proceeds going towards local charities it will do your soul some good to give as much as you can. On top of that, I've never had to pay a cover-but then again, I'm there for liquid goodness and you can quickly grab a can of beer and scoot on back to the stage area where you can eat until your hearts content. It can get packed, but I've never left there feeling less than full, and more often than not waddling out with the meat sweats from all the rich, soupy goodness.

34.description: This place is fuuuuuuuuuuuuunnnnnnnn! It's like hanging out in your grandpa's basement, but way cooler. Cheap drinks, clean bathrooms, great shows, awesome dance parties.

16.description: What a great venue. They have cold beer.They have good music.They have been there a long time.Their block party this past year had some great music and interesting displays.It is distinctly urban, behind the city fueling station.It is exactly the same as the first time I was there 15 years ago.It is good. Go.

13.description: The Hideout is super divey bar that has been around since pre-Prohibition.  It is located in an industrial area, and I didn't even know it was there until living in Chicago for almost two years.  They have tons of events every month ranging from concerts to random benefits.  It's a pretty unique place off of the beaten trail.Last night, I met up with some friends to play veggie bingo.  Cards are $3 each or $10 for 4, and it benefits local community gardens.  They have free hot dogs donated by Hot Doug's and grand prize of lots of local veggies!  The hosts were quirky and funny, and I overall had a great time.The bartenders are quick to pour drinks and very friendly.  Keep in mind, this bar is cash only, and if you're taking a cab, you probably need to have the address handy because it's location is so obscure.

11.description: What a great spot,awesome music in a venue that is so quaint and unique. I highly recommend you put it on your bucket list and keep revisiting it. They just opened up a pop up spot on lower Wacker until November 1st check it out it is awesome!!

39.description: One of the best places to see a live show in Chicago. Nestled away down a street that is pretty much all industrial a little house like structure is present and that is the hideout. I do not know how many people the hideout can hold but I would be very surprised if it is north of 200. They have awesome acts that come here and they also have cool food events during the week (I have not been to those). Good selection of beer. And every year they put on an awesome block party. Lots of Chicago artists reguarly play here and this is a venue that has seen many artists before they "got big". I've never had a bad time at the hideout. If you do see stanup comedy here, expect to also be standing (slight inconvience).

37.description: my kinda bar; devil in a woodpile's fun!

0.description: I'm not gonna lie to you, Yelp! readers:  I've done the Hideout more than once as a live performer, at Claire Zulkey's terrific Funny Ha Ha show.  But even if I hadn't, this would still be my favorite bar in Chicago.  Nowhere else even comes close.  The staff is the friendliest around, the atmosphere is just perfect, and there's always something happening worth seeing.  It's got booze and beer -- nothing fancy, but plenty to get you drunk, and the stage room is a perfect music venue.  The way it's tucked away by the city vehicle yard just keeps away the poseurs.  I love the Hideout.  May it last a thousand years.

38.description: This integral part of the Chicago music scene has hosted some of my most memoriable musical moments. Covering from folk to psych, country to noise, poetry to DIY film: they know how to book a good show.The venue is located in an industrial area just off North Avenue near the gas pumps for official City of Chicago vehicles. It reminds me of a something from my small town roots: frame house, wood panelling and vintage beer can display inside.Decent selection of beer and spirits served by hardworking (and musically inclined) bartenders. They do have an ATM onsite. Bathrooms are tolerable, if not fantastic. They host a huge annual block party that benefits several community organizations. A local business with heart. What's not to love?

51.description: A nice bar in Chicago. As usual mostly for the youth and heavy whisker crowd. It has a back band stage area and a small bar in front of an old house. This place is the wrigley Field of Chicago bars. My drunk old suburban friends don't know what they are missing as they drink in their boring Dupage County strip mall bars.

27.description: This place is awesome!  They have Three Floyds Zombie Dust on tap - $5.  The bar area is small and dimly lit, which I love.  This place had a real neighborhood feel even though it's not really in a residential area.  The actual venue space was a nice size.  Not huge, but perfect for an intimate show.  Can't wait to go back here!

32.description: I love The Hideout. Though I've mostly been going there for comedy shows. I always hit up Kind of Blue Comedy every month and Shame That Tune whenever I can catch it.One of these days I'll catch a music show there but I prefer comedy, and this is a great venue for it.

54.description: Great place to see bands. Amazing front bar. And the people here are always friendly. I have had more fun talking to strangers at this place than any other bar in this part of Chicago. There is just something cool about the place. There is nothing else around here. so getting a taxi at closing time can be a pain in the butt, but the patio furniture out front makes it a great place to chill out and talk to friends and make new friends. This place is a favorite hang out of members of top Chicago bands so going on a weekday can often have you sitting next to someone in a band you really like (or so I have heard).When you think you are in a strange section of Chicago surrounded by cop cars and dump trucks and garbage trucks whizzing past you, you have arrived at the Hideout. I heard it was once a bar that was open nearly 24/7 to meet the needs of the city workers at all the nearby garages, but it looks like it was once a ethnic bar with a big banquet hall and stage in the back (there are so many of these that no longer use the back area). The Hideout books some of the best bands in the city, and going on a random night and paying the cover has never disappointed me one bit. I even got to see a band where the woman had antlers on her guitar and made us all ring bells. Yep, that was fun.

48.description: The Hideout, where have you been hiding?! That pun was gross, but seriously, this place is the effing jam. Summer patio - check. Cheap drinks - check. Awesome back area for shows and storytelling - check. I caught the final Funny Ha Ha of the 2012 season and am definitely hooked. I am coming back in the fall for this and for Soup & Bread. It's not suuuuper convensies since the closest red line stop is North & Clybourn but I'm planning on biking my ass over here most of the time anyway so NBD. Also, the hottest new thang Ada Street is right down the block so you can get a rad mix of high brow (go on with your steak tartare) at AS and then pop over the the Hidey for some cheap-ass Hamm's. Life's all about balance, after all...

44.description: Went to the Hideout. Dude with a mustache and some shitty tattoo at the front door told us there was a private party and we couldn't come in. I've heard it's happened to other people too, pretty much every Saturday and Friday night. This place blows. Save the cab fair.

24.description: Went to a show here the other night (5/30/13) to see Caroline Smith and the Goodnight Sleeps.We took a couple buses from Lakeview with no problem - this place is definitely appropriately named.  Getting off the 72 at North and Throop, you walk through an industrial park that is a bit sketchy when the sun is down.  Though, this added to the mystique of the joint and helps give the name its meaning.As you walk up, you are greeted with a nice outdoor patio that is lively with what seemed like regulars - hipster/hippie types.  The front bar area has a dive-y feel, very welcoming.  My eyes went straight for the chalkboard beer menus - on tap they had: Gumballhead, Little Sumpin, Trumer Pils, Cross of Gold, Oberon, Bridgeport IPA maybe a few others.  All draft beer was $5, a totally fair price for Chicago and other cans/bottles hover between $3-$6 depending on quality.  Bar service was a little slow and snotty, but nothing to get up in arms about.  As you order drinks, the double doors to the stage will open and close a few times, giving you a glimpse into whomever is on stage at the time. The separation of bar and stage is done very well and the music is not intrusive to the bar area.  As you walk into the performance room, you are greeted with a wooden basement feel - Christmas lights on the ceiling, big swordfish and other marine life mounted on the walls, and a classy "The Hideout" sign just above the stage.You really can't beat the feel and drink prices here.  I hope I have an excuse to come back!

7.description: Love The Hideout! The difference between The Hideout at 4pm and 8pm is insane. I went this past Wednesday to meet some friends for their Veggie Bingo. Veggie Bingo starts about 6pm during the summer on Wednesday - it's over for this year though. You can find more details on it in the separate listing here: yelp.com/biz/veggie-bing….Being the beastly girl that I am, I got to the bar about an hour before my friends, plopped myself at the bar and started guzzling down cans of PBR. It was a HOT day and I cannot even explain how amazing that first sip of an ice cold beer in a can was. Melted my ice cold stone heart a little bit. As I sat there drinking, messing around on my phone, I looked over their beer menu written on a chalkboard. They had some pretty good selections for cheap prices. Now I got a non-tall can of PBR for $3. I was kinda sad that they didn't tell me any specials and about half hour later they put up a sign with some tallboy cans for $3! Another strange thing was I got my first tallboy for $3 and the second I was charged $5 for the exact same drink. Eh, whatevs.At 4pm, it was just me and the workers hanging out which was cool. Now for Veggie Bingo we went into a big room in the back and when we left at 8pm, the inside and entire patio was jam packed. I'm talking people sitting around everywhere outside - at the tables but also also on the sidewalk, on the grass, on ledges. This place is clearly the hip to be spot and I definitely didn't guess it when I first arrived. The good thing about going when I did was I snagged a parking spot right out front - score! I had a really fun time and plan to go back next year for Bingo. I'm sure I'm going to pop in way before then though because I enjoyed the bar.

49.description: Lakshmi R. and I played a show here this month and I basically have to reiterate everything she said. Hideout is an awesome place to play or see music. The front bar is cute, cozy and welcoming. The music room is super pretty and sounds awesome. Sound guy is an expert; bartenders are sweet; drinks are reasonably priced. Overall, this is a really special, charming venue.

40.description: We all know how great this joint is. Nothing more to say.

53.description: I'm not a huge fan of the pretentious hipster and this place is crawling with them. I can't believe I stood in like for at least 30 minutes and then paid a cover to go into this place.  Also, these sweet mid-westerners are too non-confrontational to throw down when people cut in line at this place-a disapproving glance is not enough!!!  I love places where you can dance and i LOVE to dance, but I felt like I needed to be on ectasy or something to dance in this place. I just can't get down to hipster house/techno with an awkward beat. Thanks, but no thanks.

30.description: super chill. in the middle of nowhere. if you like a bar you can relax at without a bunch of yuppies, this is the place for you. good prices & they also host concerts.

46.description: It was different. Felt like I was in someones basement from 1970's. They charge $5 cover. The drinks are fairly priced, but I don't really understand why they charge cover. The front patio was closed the night I went, and the place was a bit dead. The back room felt like a dingy high school dance.  I would give it another try as I felt it was just an off night or we got there pretty late. I like finding these kind of hidden places. There was a ton of parking as well.

1.description: When we pulled up to The Hideout at the end of Wabansia, I thought it could be mistaken for someone's house with beer signs hanging off of it. It looked delightfully sketchy and I thought, "This is a place I will enjoy being drunk in".I used to work around the corner, so I was used to that part of town where I hoped I wouldn't be found later in an industrial dumpster. But it was kind of a thrill. I came here with some friends to see Tim Heidecker live. A ridiculous man in a ridiculous place with my ridiculous friends, it was a formula for success. So this venue is small and intimate, which makes it feel that much more special and like anything goes. But when it comes to a comedy show like this, it puts most of the audience on an even playing field for the comedian to see you and call you out... which I loved. Tim was insane and the crowd was losing their minds over his antics. It was such a casual atmosphere that Tim hung out at the bar with the crowd the rest of the night. Or maybe he's just usually so chill and cool as hell. I got to talk to him briefly... actually I took a photo with him, blurted out something random and panicked.

55.description: The Hideout  is the place you would go for a unique Chicago music venue that was so unique that it also did not feel like Chicago. What's this place with acres of free parking, and hard to reach by public transit? It might as well be in Wisconsin. It has that feel. The lonely old ballon frame house surrounded by a big empty surreal industrial park. The warm, welcoming neon signs in the window. The few empty picnic tables out front. It's just too inviting. Too "Northern Exposure."Over the years, I've only attended a few shows here, but each time I come, I always like the casual vibe, the low-keyness of it all, and the interesting line-up and events, like bread and soup Wednesdays or the Saturday midnight dances. Last night was a CD release with folk artist Ty Maxson. There were other familiar faces there, too. Three performers. An easy and friendly crowd. And reasonably-priced libations. All in all, a nice little escape any night of the week.

9.description: My favorite music venue in the city and as a music photographer I have been to all several times over. The staff is amazing and friendly.  The sound techs are amongst the best and it is my understanding from local and traveling musicians, they treat them very well.Whenever I have friends touring Chicago, or friends looking for a venue to see local music the Hideout is the first place I recommend.  It is one of the few venues in town where you can easily and reliably seen quality artists.

26.description: Are you kidding me with this place, WOW! A Tanqueray martini and 2 double Stoli sodas set us back $16. SIXTEEN DOLLARS! What a steal! Where am I, at some small town dive bar?! This place was rocking with like 1950s doo-wop music, and did I mention, CHEAP drinks?! They also had this clever chain strung in the bathroom with like 15 rolls of TP to ensure you don't run out, something I think every bar should take note of! Cozy, kitschy, cheap - what more do you need in a bar?

25.description: Well, what the hell? Why haven't I been here in all of my years in Chicago???What a great dive bar to see a show.  It's cozy in here (ahem..small) but it's great for seeing a band.  There is absolutely nothing flashy about this place...NOTHING. which is also why it AWESOME.  It has everything you need:  Booze (a wide selection of beer and hard alcohol), bartenders who are casual and who don't think they are too cool, a small, cozy venue to see bands.The bathrooms are gross with that terrible re-usable towel thing that I thought only gas stations in the south had still but you'll survive using it. I did.It's also off the beaten track which is why I have never seen it before but I will be coming back and I think they have outdoor seating for summer. woohoo!

12.description: This is one of the top 5 bars in Chicago. Period. There is no TV, so you don't ever have to worry about the game being on. The normal over abundance of assholes seems nonexistent here. Robbie Fulks plays every Monday for ten bucks. Why would one go anywhere else?

59.description: The Hideout is just fine. I went here for a comedy show - not their typical kind of show, and it was mostly standing room only with about 10 seats in the entire place. Lame! However, tall-schwaggy-beers were a mere $3!  The location is definitely "Hidden," use one of these photos for reference as to what the outside looks like so when your cab drops you off.. That way you can step out with confidence that you're not being left at some scary creepy industrial townie bar.

21.description: This little gem of a music venue is tucked away in an industrial corridor off of Elston ave.  This is a great place to see a live show, their booking is excellent.  Usually pretty easy to park.  If you are sitting outside sometimes you can see a tow truck hall in a garbage truck or fire truck, as you are right by one of the city motor pools.  Love the hideout.

17.description: This is a place for pretenders. But don't take that the wrong way. It's a place to make believe that, for a Friday or Saturday evening at least, the rest of the world doesn't exist. The Hideout is for 20- and 30- somethings what the backyard treehouse was for 10-year-olds: a place to escape. Yes, it's primarily for brunettes wearing Warby Parker glasses but the bar and the attached venue transport you to a world where only the occasional drink and the music matter.What else should you know? It's in the middle of an industrial park, there's enough beer on tap to keep you interested and the cover runs $8 or so for weekend acts. It can also be tricky to catch a cab home before close, so your best bet's to head to Nelson or North Ave. at the end of your evening. Don't worry too much about the hipster reputation either--so long as you're capable of enjoying music and reasonably priced drinks, you'll find this exactly the escape you've been seeking.

10.description: The Hideout is aptly named. Lucky for me, I  read the yelp reviews beforehand so I was clued in that it was in an industrial area. Seeing the blue sanitation trucks all parked in the city's fleet management fueling station was a trip and I even registered Ada Street restaurant when I was making my way to the Hideout. Now that I know where it is, I will definitely be back.I knew this was a different kind of venue as the first thing I noticed was a group of bikers  (cyclists, not motorcycle riders) outside, clustered around a picnic table. Seeing a bunch of wiry guys wearing spandex was probably the last thing I would have expected in such an off-the-beaten-path setting. I made my way inside, and to the bar. I was still wondering whether I was in the right place up to the point when I spotted a few friends, and the organizer from the Illinois Humanities Council (for that evening's event) standing with a sign-in sheet. Since the performance space was filling up, I made my way to the back of the house to grab seats. The program itself- a panel discussion of education and equality- was thought provoking and it was interesting to hear the owner's backstory. Since the event had to do with education, the owner divulged that he had taught for 20 years and bought the Hideout in 1996. Overall, the space had a feel of a den. I would even go so far to say it functions as a salon, only with alcohol to help lubricate the exchange of ideas.

5.description: Funny strange. Funny ha ha. Dumb Luck.Unbelievably, I'd never been to The Hideout, or to their festival. I'd always meant to go; for some reason it never happened. So when friends wanted to meet at a restaurant near there after work last night, and I happened to be in the area an hour early at 6:30, I said, what the hell. I can sit at the bar for a while. Feel the aura of the place. Funny strange that I was dressed like a square, in a suit (sans tie) because I had just come from a client's office.
