Or, you just grab a housecoat...get home, and drink some wine while sitting on the couch in it. CAREFULLY. Either way, Dovetail is tops.

18.description: This lovely little vintage shop is one of my favorite things about the West Town neighborhood. They have great, unique pieces that are chosen with care by the very knowledgeable and friendly staff. If you're looking for a great present, cute accessory or one-of-a-kind dress, definitely check this place out.

13.description: Dovetail was another stop I made while I was visiting my BFF in Chicago during the Pitchfork Music Festival. It was in the same neighborhood as Very Best Vintage but had a completely different and more upscale vibe that I enjoyed. This cozy shop was decorated very well with gorgeous furniture and adornments. The merchandising is also another high mark with goods displayed lavishly throughout. The prices match the aesthetic, as they should because the designer merchandise is in excellent condition. The inventory is well-edited with pieces from Vivienne Westwood, Yves St. Laurent, Tom Ford, and other couture and premium designer brands. The offerings also included a nice selection of Men's pieces, independent new designers, and gorgeous assortment of jewelry.I walked out with a show-stopping large owl pendant necklace that I receive rave reviews each time it is worn. I was also able to find a snazzy black and white sleeveless sweater dress for a reasonable price as well. I don't believe that I spent over $100 on this visit....or maybe I did...and I am in denial? Doesn't matter. I am smitten.The only reason, I was not able to give Dovetail 5 stars is because the shopgirl (not the owner) was not helpful at all. She was on the phone when we first walked in and didn't even nod in our direction until we specifically asked for a fitting room because our hands were full of items. Even after her phone-call, we had to start and clear out our own  fitting rooms and weren't offered any assistance until we were ready to check out. Again, with my background in owning a women's upscale retail boutique and my prowess in the shopping arena....this is a detriment to this lovely shop. I am not a particularly high maintenance customer because I know my way around the business. However, if a regular customer were to come in and was looking for a little service, this employee would leave a bad impression.I would certainly come back to visit Dovetail again when I am in the Chicago area again around March. I just hope that someone else is working.

4.description: Dovetail is very reasonably priced and they have a great selection of really cool vintage items! The store is organized well, and everything they sell is in great condition and is definitely hand-picked for it's uniqueness. The owner is SUPER friendly and helps you with whatever you need. The store is in a nice location with lots of other cool shops on Chicago ave, which is also an added bonus.

24.description: I'm a good shopper, but not really a vintage shopper.  Every so often I give it a shot, but then end up back at my favorite local boutiques instead. And that's exactly what happened at Dovetail...I took my brother here on Friday to see if I could find any accessories for my dress for the Yelp Retro Spring Fling.  I definitely didn't pick the right shopping companion cause my bro was restless just minutes after admiring their old school record player.If you are a vintage shopper they do have some cool accessories (purses, jewelry, etc) to choose from here.  And even a few racks of clothes. I was a little surprised by the prices...they were higher than I'd expect, but what do I know about vintage shopping.I ended up choosing a yellow flower for my hair, although when I went to pay for it the saleswoman told me that the flower was actually part of her window display. Oops. She was nice enough to let me have the flower for free.Not sure if I'll go back since it's not really my thing, but some of my favorite hardcore vintage shoppers love it so check it out for yourself..

6.description: I've read and seen many great things from dovetail and have been eager to check it out since January. I FINALLY was able to see what was inside the store during my last visit a week or two ago and it was everything I imagined it would be. It's clean, clutter free and the pieces are well curated--definitely worth a look. That is, if you catch the store open. It still amazes me that every review seemed to have no problem getting into the store, whereas I've tried plenty of times to stop by during store hours noted on the store and on the website plenty of times since January. I have no qualms with impromptu days off, but it'd be nice if the website was updated for the day, or if a quick note was placed on the door.

22.description: A stunning store cared for by some really lovely people. I think the clothing (and reasonable price points) speak for itself; there's a reason why they've gotten so much reputable press coverage just in its first year of opening. I'm usually pretty picky and hard on these stores but Dovetail owners really know their stuff. Everything is well-curated with an  ever-evolving collection. But more importantly, these Dovetail girls really understand their consumers and relate to their customers not as "shop girls" but as friends. The advice and friendliness of the in store experience is unique and wonderful, in and of itself. Save yourself time and make this your no. #1 priority when you are looking for vintage wear. It truly is one of a kind and is a testament to the wealth of talent we have in Chicago that enables our neighborhoods to flourish.

15.description: Dovetail has a small yet perfect selection of vintage goodies, including jewelry, handbags, home goods, and other course, clothes.  They have a pretty ample selection of both men's and women's stuff, which is nice, given that a lot of stores offer a t-shirt or two in their men's collection.  The wonderful thing is that I didn't see a single thing that was anywhere near overpriced--the sticker matched the quality of the products.  I went in around Halloween seeking a cigarette holder for my Audrey costume, and although they had just sold their last one, I ended up walking out with the perfect wool winter skirt for like, 36 bucks.  Oh, and there is an adorable kitty hanging out from time to time, who is incredibly friendly.  I'm going back next week to do some holiday shopping, and I'm looking forward to finding some beautiful, unique pieces for some lovely friends and family.  For the not so lovely ones, I'm headed to Target.

7.description: I'm a good shopper, but not really a vintage shopper.  Every so often I give it a shot, but then end up back at my favorite local boutiques instead. And that's exactly what happened at Dovetail...I took my brother here on Friday to see if I could find any accessories for my dress for the Yelp Retro Spring Fling.  I definitely didn't pick the right shopping companion cause my bro was restless just minutes after admiring their old school record player.If you are a vintage shopper they do have some cool accessories (purses, jewelry, etc) to choose from here.  And even a few racks of clothes. I was a little surprised by the prices...they were higher than I'd expect, but what do I know about vintage shopping.I ended up choosing a yellow flower for my hair, although when I went to pay for it the saleswoman told me that the flower was actually part of her window display. Oops. She was nice enough to let me have the flower for free.Not sure if I'll go back since it's not really my thing, but some of my favorite hardcore vintage shoppers love it so check it out for yourself..

8.description: Walked away with a very pretty white cotton sundress for just $30. There were other choice items I had my eye on such as a red and white floral print dress (too small) and a delicate white cotton tank. The Banner Year jewelry is amazing. However, I don't like that the sales associate seemed indifferent to my being there. Typically I don't like fawning attention, but a smile or some kind of acknowledgment is warranted.

3.description: This was a great, little shop. The prices were fairly reasonable for the area, and you can find a lot of quality gems here. Some of the jewelry was homemade, antique or very unique. You know that some of the items you pick up here won't be on every street corner. The clothing selection was pretty eclectic, but there were high quality, heavy coats for sale by a maker in Ohio.

14.description: A stunning store cared for by some really lovely people. I think the clothing (and reasonable price points) speak for itself; there's a reason why they've gotten so much reputable press coverage just in its first year of opening. I'm usually pretty picky and hard on these stores but Dovetail owners really know their stuff. Everything is well-curated with an  ever-evolving collection. But more importantly, these Dovetail girls really understand their consumers and relate to their customers not as "shop girls" but as friends. The advice and friendliness of the in store experience is unique and wonderful, in and of itself. Save yourself time and make this your no. #1 priority when you are looking for vintage wear. It truly is one of a kind and is a testament to the wealth of talent we have in Chicago that enables our neighborhoods to flourish.

3.description: I had an awesome experience here.  I am building my first bike and I came here for a few parts and had a ton of questions.  Corrine (sp?) was really patient with me and got me all the parts I needed, with great care to make sure everything was the right size, and all for $20.  Also, everyone else here was super nice and no one was pretentious or snobby about bikes.  Great place!

1.description: Stopped in today to have my chain checked out. They fixed it for free! Just saying come back in and buy a tube when you need them. It was a really minor fix so I really appreciated it. Everyone seemed really nice and there were a couple of cute dogs hanging out in the store too.

2.description: In the spirit of Working Bikes (on South Western Avenue), this is a small community bike shop that focuses on fixing up and selling used bikes.  It is unlike Working bikes in that Ride typically orders a mixture of new parts to throw on the old bikes instead of cobling them together with all used - and worn out - parts.In my experience, the shop, which by economic necessity runs out of a small space, can get overwhelmed by demand, especially now that everybody's biking to avoid the gas pumps.  They sometimes take a while to get a bike ready, but the end result is pretty good.  The mechanical work is a bit sloppy (no caps on the end of brake cables, for example), but all in all a good economical way to get your hands on transportation.One more slight down side: no fixed hours.  I understand that the mechanics are doing this either as a hobby or for minimal pay, but still, it would pay (literally) to be on a fixed schedule that is either posted on the door  or on a website.But by all means, go, check it out, pick out a bike and let them do it up right for you.  especially in warm weather, Chicago's better by bike.

0.description: If I could give more stars I would!  I did not catch the name of the gentleman who helped me today but THANK YOU.  I had a crash on my way into work this morning (around 8:15) just in front of this shop.  Thankfully there was someone there and he took care of my bike immediately when he saw the situation (mind you they were CLOSED).  What a great way to show the amazing customer service you guys have and genuinely awesome people you have working in that shop.  I ride by here every day, do know I will be stopping in for all of my biking needs and will be sharing this great story and already have been!

4.description: Great bike shop for used & customized rides.  Ron's dedication to outfitting customers with the right bike based on sizing, needs, etc is unmatched.  I bought a used Fuji a couple years back from him which I had to bring back a couple times for maintenance (it was probably a 20 yr old bike, not customized or updated, so I didn't blink at the unforeseen quirks) and he never balked at making sure I was pleased with my purchase.  I even brought in a flat tire one evening before he closed (and looked like he was dressed to head out) and he took the time to fix it right up.  It looks like the store has really taken off - I see a lot of custom bikes in the window now (and on Craigslist), so I can only expect that Ride is doing well and not just another Working Bikes offshoot.  I bet it gets crowded, so it might be better to call ahead to discuss what you are looking for.

3.description: Walk ins r welcome. I got samantha. She gave a relaxing massage for hslf hour and great table shower. Price was right and i left a happy guy. This is very clean and they  take cc.

1.description: I am honestly surprised that this place is a functioning business. BOOKING AN APPOINTMENT:So I wanted to arrange a massage for my husband's birthday before our dinner celebration next door at Mexique. I called and explained that I would like to pre-pay for an hour of Swedish massage and add a 20% gratuity so that my husband wouldn't have to worry about anything. I specifically set it up for 5:30pm so that he could be done by 6:30pm and still have some time for a shower and of course to walk over to dinner at 7pm. Because their staff doesn't speak English, it took me 6 separate phone calls to arrange this! I had to mark my calendar with reminders, as I was told to call back on the day of the appointment when their salon manager would be able to take my payment. When finally I caught their manager on the phone, to make a payment, from our conversation I realized that my appointment wasn't even on their books! After she ran my credit card and we again when over the plan, I finally felt at ease. However 10 min later she called me back. She said that 20% tip comes out to only $14 and it's not enough. She asked if I could raise it to $20! I was shocked, but I didn't want to upset them just hours before his visit so I agreed. It was so important to me that he has a nice massage and all goes smoothly!‼RESULT:My husband received a 35 minute massage, after spending another 10 min in a shower, ended up at dinner way too early. On his way out he was asked for another $2 of gratuity to make up for credit card transaction fees!!!!!

2.description: very very clean. big rooms. be sure to ask for judy aka kiki aka hongjiao---the owner---she works by appointment or outcall. extremely beautiful girl. wonderful massage. fabulous extras. adorable personality. you will leave totally happy.

0.description: Very nice and comfortable place and they have a table shower in a very easy to get to from expressway, l-train,bus

58.description: Ever wonder if a good three quarters of Chicago's restaurant owners ever went to business school? You'll leave a place that's packed when it closes at nine to try to find a new hangout that's generally even more packed. So here's a new late night Mecca for y'all.Arabia just opened a few months ago. Bumped into it when on the way to the better known Iguana Cafe, and I'm glad I stopped, because not only did I collide headlong into a friend I'd known my entire life, but the food is wonderful, generous, and cheap: we're talking $10 hookah, people. Plus the guy who operates the place is actually Moroccan (good sign at ethnic places), warm, friendly and conversational.We were totally okay with leaving at 2 am; you can only smoke hookah for so long, y'know.

56.description: I live just down the street and I love to see this business thrive with all of it's hookah seeking clientele late at night.  Coffee wise (which is why I ever go in there), they seem completely bewildered as how to work their barista machine, hence only 4 stars.  The staff is really nice!

29.description: I'm a fan of hookah.  Though they no longer have belly dancers, if you're looking for a good hookah lounge with a solid flavor selection, good ambiance and pleasant service, Arabia is a good choice.  Some friends joined me here for a smoke on a Sunday night and the place was jumping.  Great for dates and groups.  It is BYO, so if you're looking to booze it up a little, stop by a nearby shop and cart it in some beer or wine.

42.description: I went here for the first time today and had a really relaxing experience.  I have only done the hookah thing 2 times now and I am going to go again.  I enjoyed the grape mint it was yummy and the coffee was yummy too.  I liked the guy joking with me and just the over all atmosphere.

23.description: I am an Arabian person who has been to a lot of hookah places and I did a big mistake by not believing the people who gave a poor rate about this place, this place was the worst hookah place I have ever been at! Too expensive for Very Very bad service, also the coal worker was acting very rude! And the hookah was very horrible comparing to the way it should be made!! As a recommend I would suggest you guys to see other hookah places that has respectful and well trained coal workers, hookah places need well trained coal workers not an asshole one to serve you and make you feel that you are begging them! But the 2 girl waiters were smiling and polite.I think the owner of this place is trying to give a bad reputation about Arabs by employing a horrible coal workers as the worst Syrian guy.DON'T GO TO THIS HORRIBLE PLACE!!!!!

47.description: After a Valentine's Day dinner out with The Boy, we decided to continue our Mediterranean theme and continue our night at a hookah bar. Since we were in the River North area, we decided not to go all the way to House of Hookah since it would probably be crowded anyway and decided to check out this place instead.This place is MUCH LARGER than House of Hookah and better atmosphere. It's nice to be spaced out from other groups and able to curl up on a couch or booth instead of all smushed up. The service was decent although we got a little forgotten about towards the end since we were in the corner of the space (near the register - go figure) as it started to pick up a bit with the after-dinner crowd and with the owner more preoccupied with his own friends and table, the chick had to pick up the slack. The prices seemed descent (I think) and I personally love any place that show Arabic music videos - always a conversation piece. Plus, there was a liquor store down the street with a descent selection that also sells bottles of MSG (almost bought some).Didn't have a bad experience over all and may go again if we're in the area...

8.description: This place is called Arabia, but has no Arab hospitality. The Palestinian guy working there was wonderful, but otherwise the service was quite poor. Our waitress did not have any hospitality skills. There is a $15 minimum which was frustrating for a group of 5 who only wanted to have 2 hookahs ( $40 total). Therefore we ordered water ($2 each, no tap water available) and we were also charged the $3 per person BYOB fee for the bottle of wine that we brought.  The wait staff did not check our hookah or replace the coals at all. We had to flag them down to get our coals changed, and we had to maintain our own hookah. It got harsh several times, but they never checked. What are we paying $20 for if they are just putting this hookah together and leaving it at our table?

31.description: Walked in and the place was completely empty. I thought we would get some pretty good service yet I came out feeling disappointed. There was no one at the counter and waited a few minutes for a girl to appear from the back, she looked a bit upset when we decided to sit next to a window towards the front rather than the back of the place so that it would be closer to the counter. Their selection of hookah flavors is the same as something I could buy for myself at my tobacco store, nothing really interesting and not a very wide selection either. There is no inspiration to the place when it comes to sisha/tobacco. The service was lacking in the sense that the girl took our order and then we never saw her again until we got up and walked to the counter to leave. This was also the first place that i've been to that limits 2 people per hookah. My other friends are not heavy smokers and we could have all happily shared a hookah between all 4 of us and all get a buzz, however they were pretty rude about the situation until we gave in an got a second one.  The man who came out to serve us hookah had a scowl about him the whole time and decided to stare us down as he brought out the hookahs. They didn't have coals on them and had to wait several minutes before he came out with barely-lit coals to start it up. What aggravated me more was the fact that we had to trouble shoot our own hookah as we went on smoking - hoses popped out because they were loose, we had to heat heat up the coals and play with the nozzles in order to get some nice thick smoke going and to taste the flavors (thank goodness we knew what we were doing!). If you want a good experience at a Hookah bar/lounge I would say that you should skip this place. SAMAH would be my recommendation to get great, quality flavors, and a hookah that is brought to you lit, ready, and already producing some good smoke.

34.description: Too Much Hookah!!! Me and my girls had a blast here the setting is very comfortable and classy. We had the cutest blond waitress with curly hair who so nice and helpful and always kept checking in on us! I had no complaints with this place. There is a minimum purchase and we all had to pay $25 and it was 4 of us, but when your having a great time with good people price is the least of your worries!

16.description: This is quite possibly THE worst place in Chicago.  It gets 1 star only because I HAVE to choose something although I wish I could give it negative stars.  From the moment we walked in until the time we left, it was a complete and utter disaster filled with the worst service I have ever seen in my life.  We called to make a reservation for 12 of us and they said sure, although we would only be able to stay for 2 hours.  I didn't really like this, but whatever, they were fitting in 12 of us short notice so fine, we understand.  We get there and they immediately say $20/person and we have to pay NOW.  I thought this was ridiculous because I had been before and knew for a fact that there is a $20 min BUT it goes TOWARDS everything you spend.  So to have to pay $20 in advance is nuts.  The waitress wouldn't even serve us until she collected $20 from us.  She dropped one of my friend's credit cards after he gave it to him and stood there arguing with us for 10 mins of our time we had telling us that we were short before she finally realized the card was on the floor.  When the hookah finally arrived, everything was fine.  That is until what felt like 20 mins after we finally got the hookah, they were telling us we had to get up soon.  WHAT? Absolutely not.  We just spend $240 and most of our time was spent moving our table from the original spot, collecting money, taking orders, and actually bringing it out.  The amount of time we had to hookah was no more than 30 mins.  Unacceptable.  We ask to speak to a manager and the server goes and hands us a iPhone to speak to the manager who told us we had to leave and that was that.  She wasn't even there!Then apparently the manager arrives and the server comes to us to tell us that she is yelling and needs us to leave.  Still she hadn't come to the table herself.  We ask that the server sends out the manager so that we can talk to her ourselves and when she came out, I could not have been more disgusted by her attitude.The manager rolled her eyes as she spoke to us and was completely rude and unprofessional.  There was such a better way to handle that.  I have worked in the restaurant industry for 8 years so I never go to anyone's establishment to be disrespectful or a pain.  I have never in my life had such bad service nor have I experienced such blatant disrespect from someone who is supposed to be a manager.  This place should be shut down until they find someone better to run it.  The manager is really going to be the death of this place.  Looking at previous comments, I see that we were not the only ones.  SAD.  Save your time and your money and do not go here!

13.description: I wouldn't say 2 stars...this place is ok. Nice ambiance, mediocre service , semi buzzed hookah...byob doesn't count-wine/beer only

11.description: Great atmosphere and comfy lounges. Our waitress was very hospitable and we were never ignored. The prices are fair for hookah and the Arabia mocha frapp was good. I enjoyed myself!

39.description: This place blows. The staff is incredibly rude and they gouge you with any charges they can possibly think of. i went with a group of 14 people for a friend's birthday. only 8 of us wanted to smoke, which means we could have done fine with 3 hookas or max 4, but the staff forced us to pay for 6 even though almost half our group didn't touch them. oh, and that was in addition to paying the $5 per person 'corkage' fee. we left before the belly dancer started so they wouldn't get another $5 per person out of us. don't go here.

37.description: Came over to celebrate a friend's birthday this past Saturday and actually had a pretty decent time as I was afraid after reading all the negative reviews here.This joint is BYOB which is cool as my favorite hookah place (Samah) in Lakeview doesn't allow booze at all. The space is pretty wide open which is cool as you can watch others enjoy themselves and even be incorporated in their conversations/fun.They had a belly dancer shaking her thing which was cool. Got introduced to some new hookah flavors which was cool as well.  Our party of 8 were charged $20 per person which I guess isn't too bad as they did not give us a time limit or anything.Good spot to do some hookah, although Samah in Lakeview has a more comfortable atmosphere; seating wise. Would definitely come again if someone mentioned they wanted to go.

0.description: 3/5. Why?Here... Hookahs are okay, but I guess owner don't want to spend extra money to change hoses on time. That's why when you order some mixes you don't really taste what you want. And yes they are pricy.For two people hookah and couple coffees. I paid 53$. Like really? I mean I'm okay but to charge extra for mixes it's ridiculous because you use same quantity of tobacco. And yes place is a little dirty need updates! Tables are burnt!! And you feel a little s***y.So yes 3/5. Thanks.

38.description: The hooka ok The place is greatThe service not good I tell u why, only hooka and soda The guy who bring the hooka and coal is the worset i ever seen :( No smile and irregent

51.description: Arabia Cafe is a great place to go for live music, hookah, dancing, and all around fun! LOVE IT! In response to Theresa B: Anyone that has ever eaten outside a McDonald's knows that there might be a corking fee for any BYOB establishment. A group of 8 people that sit for hours somewhere, and complain about paying $40 a person for live music, belly dancing, and hookah are exactly the kind of people that should stay home. It's that kind of group that takes up space when paying customers, who appreciate what they get for such a small amount of money, can be sitting there instead. As Billie O, points out below, people need to get paid. A live band is not free, nor are any other expenses incurred from running a business. In response to Meredith A: The entertainment was obviously good enough for you and your friends to sit there, drink, and smoke hookah for a few hours. If it was so horrible, why didn't you walk out right away? Were you not able to hear the music until the end of the night, after you finished your drinks and hookahs? Arabia Cafe is a great place. It has a nice atmosphere, with great music and great entertainment. It's decorated nicely and always clean. It's always a blast and great to have such a place to go to in Chicago. Definitely a place to check out!!!

27.description: We tried this place out because it was close to where we had dinner.  It was a Sunday night around 10:30 pm and it was actually fairly busy.  Almost every table was occupied but we (my husband and I) luckily got seated right away.  Our orders were taken immediately.  Hookah is $15 Sunday - Thursday and $20 for Friday and Saturday.  We got the 1001 nights (?) one of their special mixes and it was 5 extra dollars.  We also ordered some baklava and a water and a diet coke.Drinks came out quickly as did the baklava.  Baklava was $7 which I initially thought was overpriced until I saw it.  It was an assortment of 7 or 8 different pieces of baklava which were really pretty good.  We couldn't even finish it so it may be a better choice for a group.  However obviously no one comes to a hookah bar only caring about the snacks.   Just thought I'd mention it for people who were considering ordering it.  Hookah was very much okay.  Wasn't very  strong but I did like the flavor.  My husband and I smoke hookah fairly often and it wasn't bad, it just wasn't anything better than what we could have at home.  Service was good.  One poor girl was the only waitress for the whole place and looked a little overwhelmed but she still was very friendly.  They had another guy who took care of changing the coals and he came around often so that was a plus.  Only strange thing was when a huge party was leaving and they were complaining about their bill.  Now they had a huge bottle of vodka and were very loud and obnoxious (it's an alcohol free establishment but apparently byob?) and were probably very drunk.  But the manager or owner came out and they were all yelling at each other and the drunk people seemed like they were probably just wrong but the argument lasted for 10 minutes in the center of the whole room and was just kinda awkward.  Again, not sure who was in the wrong but it should have been handled better.  It just looks bad to all the other customers.  We tipped the waitress extra cause we felt bad for her.Overall we would not go out of our way for it.

32.description: Pretty sure either the owner is a selfish prick and wants to gouge his customers for as much money as he can, or if he is purposely abusing his customers because he wants the business to fail.  The servers are GREAT!!!  Very kind and helpful.  You can tell that they dislike imposing their evil owner's rules and I bet he probably rips them off, as well.We had a nice time with a hookah, a platter for the table, and tea for everyone.  Should have been enough.  When we asked for our check, they said it was the owner's policy that we couldn't leave until we spent more money.  Our response was, really?  We've had our fill, we're ready to go, and you're owner, who isn't even present or else I would complain to his face, is going to force us to order more items that we don't even need??  It is an abuse of the customers.  When we showed up, there was no one there.  A business should be happy to be getting patronage at all.POOR BUSINESS PRACTICENO CUSTOMER APPRECIATIONSKIP ARABIA CAFE

54.description: Very disappointing. We walked in to a nearly empty room, but as it was 10o'clock, this was not a problem. However everything else that happened next was. I had a reservation, and even though the place was wide open, the waitress was very confused about where we could sit, so left us standing in the middle of the room. The manager seemed equally confused about where to put us, so we sat ourselves in a section near the door. There was a band warming up, but weren't scheduled to start for at least half an hour. Then we got a menu that looked ok, but there is a rule of one hookah per 2 people, each hookah is $20. The manager also came over to tell us there was a cover of $10 for the music, even though the music hadn't started and we had to listen to them doing a sound check.  The waitress came by to tell us they were going to be pretty crowded later and she probably wouldn't be able to wait on us, so we should get all our orders in now. We had 7 people, and $130 for three hookahs, music that hadn't yet started, and the promise of crappy service seemed like a raw deal. We escaped out the front door and went down the street to Sigara.

48.description: I can think of many ways to spend $70 dollars;  a 30 minute massage at a nice spa, or a bottle of  Antinori Tignanello (2006 of course) or a 50 lb kettle bell. Heck, even paying for  two oil changes would have given me more enjoyment than my visit to Arabia Cafe.When Arabia Cafe first opened it was great. The place was low-key and economical. However, on the last visit the boyfriend and I ended up paying $70 for one hookah and a bottle of water. ..oh wait, and yes...on corkage fees. Why does it cost $10 dollars to open and serve $15 dollar bottle of wine?? Hey, I'm a a smart girl. Give me the $%^&  corkscrew and I'll figure it out. Also, why is there a $20 cover charge when we indicated we would not be staying for the dancer?Sorry but we will not be coming back and I WILL buy one of the aforementioned items/services.

44.description: First let me explain this place I'd meant to be more then just a hookah lounge at least on the weekends. With that being said I went Here a few weeks ago with some friends it was a nice place belly dancer was ok she dances a few times bit starts really late about 12 1230 so expect to arrive late hookah was a bit high but i guess if your with a few friends split the price comes out to about 10 dollars a head. Secondly they do not serve alcohol but you may bring some in at charge five dollars a person. My favorite reason that I liked this place has to be the dj ! He played a good mixture of American,  Hip hop with some classic Arabic and some Hispanic sounds plus he had the drums out in the middle banging on them just like your at a wedding doing debke on the dance floor good night with friends will happen here !

24.description: Do not go here! I have never been treated so bad by an establishment in my life. We called ahead to see if they had table available for group of four. They said yes and we told them we would be there in ten minutes. When we got there one waitress came over and when we told them we were the group that just called she said sure we have room and would be about 5 minutes. As soon as she left another waitress came right over and said we cant take your group... we are full. I told her we just called and saw open tables but she again said they were full. When I told her the other waitress said we could be accommodated she huffed and said fine but will be $20 each. The hookah bar was only open for an hour and half til closing. I asked why cant we just pay for the hookah which we planned to get two so it would be $40 not $80. She said no for us its 20 each and that was policy. We decided since we were already there we would just go ahead and overpay. But then as soon as we sat down, before we could even take our coats off. She was like I need the money up front right now. And put her hand out right in my friends face. We decided right then that we didn't deserve to be treated like this and there was no way they were getting our business or money. And left. So please... again, don't go to this hookah bar!

7.description: After coming here a few times, and having experienced much better Hookah lounges in Chicago, I can see why so many people rate Arabia poorly. All and all Arabia's Hookah flavors, environment, and overall service is not worth the high prices they charge.It's a 15 dollar minimum per person on weekend nights and they set you up with whatever you initially order and pretty much disappear from then on. We never had our coal ashes removed nor were we checked on by the server for the remainder of the evening to see if we needed anything else so we could actually USE that 15 dollar per minimum. Final Verdict:I will be finding another local Hookah spot to frequent for my late night fixes. Arabia just isn't worth the cost.

49.description: I was here before 11pm on a Friday night.  We did not bring alcohol or pay a cover charge to stay, so there weren't any surprise charges on our bill.  But yes, $20 seems high for one hookah - especially since their hookah bowls are a little small.  The taste was okay - it was burning a little hot.  The tea and strawberry banana smoothies were delightful.  I didn't feel particularly welcomed here though.  Overall, not an awful place to go but not somewhere I would recommend to all of my friends.

40.description: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE. First we had to pay a cover charge to enter the hookah lounge. Then we got charged five dollars per person to bring in our own wine and beer. The hookah tasted horrible and the owner seemed like he hated his job. Oh and at 1:50 (they close at 2) the owner snatched the pipe out of my hand and said time to go. For seven of us the bill was 180 and all we had was hookah. I would recommend Hubble Hookah over this place any day.

53.description: So apparently this place has turned into just a straight hookah lounge that doesn't open till much later.  Sad.

30.description: My friend and I went to enjoy a hookah but we ended up leaving 15 minutes after we got there as did couple other groups.We walked in, were greeted by a nice girl, we ordered double apple hookah. We received our hookah , after trying it, we both agreed that we were tasting something awful but NOT double apple hookah. We called the hookah guy and double checked that it was double apple and his answer was "I will bring the hookah container and show you ", he had the worst attitude and was very rude. We told the girl( very nice girl), she apologized and offered to change it, she dicided to tell the guy in front of us and he yelled at her and was very rude. Two minutes later he came out with the container and was yelling and showing it to us.We weren't doubting his work , we were not going to smoke an awful hookah, I couldn't believe how rude and poor mannered he was, I've never being anywhere as awful as this place. We left to avoid a fight, we felt bad for the girls who work there and how bad he was treating them, I hope he is not the owner. Do not go there !

46.description: It's been a while since I went out for hookah and I tried this place with some friends from work. It's a little pricey, yes I would agree to that. However the space is large and the ventilation is very good. However there are fees for everything. BYOB can end up costing a lot. So go there with caution.

1.description: Cool hookah place !!! The service is great !!! This hookah place is so nice ! they have great flavors  ! The people that work there are very friendly . it's close to downtown . the hookahs are smooth and last for a while . they are good about changing the coals . it's little on the pricer side . a hookah with a mix of flavors is 25 .

55.description: I went here after a frustrating experience at Samah. I'm a fan. The hookah bar is basically one big room with a mix of tables and couches. When we went on a Thursday night it wasn't very busy, but you can make a reservation for the weekend. Good place for a date. The place has very nice decoration, down to authentic looking lanterns. The hookah selection isn't very big, 8 flavors give or take, but the tobacco is good. I had the Mint and wasn't disappointed. I also recommend getting some tea, we had the Mint and it was delicious as well. I would give the place 5 stars, but $15 still seems a bit steep for a hookah.

9.description: DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE IT SUCKS!!!Quite possibly the worst hookah lounge I have ever been... Ridiculously overpriced and serviced SUCKED!!! They don't even deserve ONE STAR!!!

26.description: We had a party of 7 there on a Friday night.  It was pretty empty when we got there, but it was packed by the time we left.  It cost $20 per person, and two people per hookah.  It's also BYOB.  We tried the rose mint, white grape, peach, and orange mint.  I'd recommend the rose mint and white grape!  Service was really good, but as the night got busier, everything got a little harsh, and it took a while for the "coal guy" to come and fix it.  There was a two hour time limit - and that may have been because it was a Friday.    All in all, a good time :)

25.description: This is quite possibly THE worst place in Chicago.  It gets 1 star only because I HAVE to choose something although I wish I could give it negative stars.  From the moment we walked in until the time we left, it was a complete and utter disaster filled with the worst service I have ever seen in my life.  We called to make a reservation for 12 of us and they said sure, although we would only be able to stay for 2 hours.  I didn't really like this, but whatever, they were fitting in 12 of us short notice so fine, we understand.  We get there and they immediately say $20/person and we have to pay NOW.  I thought this was ridiculous because I had been before and knew for a fact that there is a $20 min BUT it goes TOWARDS everything you spend.  So to have to pay $20 in advance is nuts.  The waitress wouldn't even serve us until she collected $20 from us.  She dropped one of my friend's credit cards after he gave it to him and stood there arguing with us for 10 mins of our time we had telling us that we were short before she finally realized the card was on the floor.  When the hookah finally arrived, everything was fine.  That is until what felt like 20 mins after we finally got the hookah, they were telling us we had to get up soon.  WHAT? Absolutely not.  We just spend $240 and most of our time was spent moving our table from the original spot, collecting money, taking orders, and actually bringing it out.  The amount of time we had to hookah was no more than 30 mins.  Unacceptable.  We ask to speak to a manager and the server goes and hands us a iPhone to speak to the manager who told us we had to leave and that was that.  She wasn't even there!Then apparently the manager arrives and the server comes to us to tell us that she is yelling and needs us to leave.  Still she hadn't come to the table herself.  We ask that the server sends out the manager so that we can talk to her ourselves and when she came out, I could not have been more disgusted by her attitude.The manager rolled her eyes as she spoke to us and was completely rude and unprofessional.  There was such a better way to handle that.  I have worked in the restaurant industry for 8 years so I never go to anyone's establishment to be disrespectful or a pain.  I have never in my life had such bad service nor have I experienced such blatant disrespect from someone who is supposed to be a manager.  This place should be shut down until they find someone better to run it.  The manager is really going to be the death of this place.  Looking at previous comments, I see that we were not the only ones.  SAD.  Save your time and your money and do not go here!

12.description: Nice, lovely and cozy place to chill with your friends. Very nice decorated hookah bar. I love their moroccan tea, it's so so delicious!moroccan sunset flavor is the best here. Their prices are reasonable, $15 per hookah on the weekday and $20 on the weekend. We enjoyed nice atmosphere and great service, they have very friendly and careful staff. The waitresses went above and beyond to accommodate all of our requests. They were always smiling and tending to the customers. Our charcoals were changed in a timely manner. We had such a great time here with my friends! They are also byob so we brought some wine and beer. All in all we loved the place very much!

21.description: Decent price hookah with an alright atmosphere. The minimum charge is kind of high but I expect it as there's only so much you can make with a business like that

17.description: Came over to celebrate a friend's birthday this past Saturday and actually had a pretty decent time as I was afraid after reading all the negative reviews here.This joint is BYOB which is cool as my favorite hookah place (Samah) in Lakeview doesn't allow booze at all. The space is pretty wide open which is cool as you can watch others enjoy themselves and even be incorporated in their conversations/fun.They had a belly dancer shaking her thing which was cool. Got introduced to some new hookah flavors which was cool as well.  Our party of 8 were charged $20 per person which I guess isn't too bad as they did not give us a time limit or anything.Good spot to do some hookah, although Samah in Lakeview has a more comfortable atmosphere; seating wise. Would definitely come again if someone mentioned they wanted to go.

10.description: The service was terrible. We were never told how much anything cost or given any sort of explanation of what our options were. After we were given our hookah and first two coals, we never heard from our server again. We had to borrow tongs from the people next to us to ash our coals. We couldn't even get anyone to give us our bill, so we just left some money on the table and left. Funny thing is, there were a handful of tables around us getting constant service, and then a handful (including ours) getting completely ignored. Way better hookah places in Chicago. This place is literally five feet from my apartment and I will definitely not be returning.

5.description: Pretty chill and intimate. Broad flavor options. The lighting was good, music was decent, and watching the tv's on mute was cool (no clue what was on there) but I would definitely go back if I was in the area and wanted hookah. OH! I almost for got. It's BYOB for beer and wine. $3 bottle fee per person, but worth it.

3.description: I see all the bad reviews and wonder if there's new management. Cleanest hookah bar in Chicago. Aerated, so it's not filled with smoke from the last few months. Service is great. Price is market value. BYOB wine and beer. I love this place.

35.description: Whenever we felt like having some hookah, this was the place we would go visit. First off, there is now cover at the door and a minimum that you must buy in order for you to be allowed in. I don't like that idea. Just because there is a belly-dancer, you have to pay an extra cover to be able to sit and watch during that time when she performs. This wasn't the case a year and half ago. I used to go here with friends and this wasn't how it used to be. Secondly, the hookah is okay. It isn't anything great.Thirdly, the service is nothing special. Whenever we have ordered, the waitress would forget our order or get it wrong. This has happened to us over and over. Fourthly, this a BYOB location. That should be a plus for a lot of people. In the end, because of the cover and minimum that you must spend along with the satisfactory service, I don't go here anymore and ended up buying my own hookah and have hookah parties at my place instead. They lost out on a lot of customers that could have been good for their business.

19.description: WTF, this place is dead. BYOB, wine and beer only. Smoke a hookah here only if your desperate for a decent smoke. Not sure how they stay in business. Service is mediocre at best. Although one of the patrons looks like drake... Not enough to keep this place afloat. They act like they're doing you a favor, and require $15/person minimum spend. But, that's ok, since hookahs are $20/25 each, and they charge 15% service tax! Not worth it brah!

28.description: You can smoke cigars and cigarettes here. I just wanted to smoke and be left alone. It does not appear to be clean to me.

45.description: Well, let's start with the pros: the place is indeed pretty. I liked the decor. It's not a large place, but it wasn't cramped either. Now that I got that out of the way...this place has quite a lot of charges. - Cover - $5. - Corkage fee - $5 (even if you don't drink, you will be charged. So you might as well drink up, buttercup!)- 99 cent bottle of water - $1.50- Hookah - $20 (One hookah is meant to be for 2 people, but as long as you get a mouthpiece, you can beat the system.)- Bellydancer -either $5 or $10, I forget (this was my *record scratch* moment. You already paid to be there, you're already sitting down, you already gave them money to uncork the wine YOU bought and give you some glasses to drink out of, and now you have to pay to watch this lady shimmy around the tables? Word??). If you come here, be prepared to pay to play. As for the service, the ladies seemed nice enough, the guy seemed as if he'd rather stick needles under his fingernails than come to our table. Take that as you will.

33.description: Visited Arabia Cafe on a Sunday with 2 friends.  The hookah itself was packed well, but could have been better attended.  I found the double apple a little off, but my companions did not.The hookah was reasonably priced at $15 - despite what others think, $15-20 is what they cost in every city I've had one.Here's the problem:IT IS NOT BYOB!  Or at least not effectively.  The waitress insisted that the minimum spending for drinking was $15... per person, $45 for 3 of us.  What kind of chain smoking clientele do they expect?  1 hookah per person?  When I noted that the website suggests that drinking is welcome and lists no such minimum, she lied to my face and said it did.  (She declined to actually show me where when I brought it up on my phone)  I tried to come to some sort of agreement but were refused.  (Also not sure why they had CCTV Espaniol's (China Central TV, Spanish version) coverage of a Chinese government meeting on much of the time.)I am fine with hookah without alcohol and would go to a cafe that did not permit it. Usually we order a cup of tea each with a hookah. This place just ruined it for me with senseless rules and dishonesty.We smoked one and then left.  Total cost: just under $20. No cover.Do not go here if you want to BYOB.  I won't be in here again.

43.description: love this place.$3 cork fee per  personhookah lasts forever  $15I like to go during the week.  the weekend is a bit more pricey

2.description: Came here after going out to Frontier. Its pretty low key, you will almost miss it.  The vibe is pretty chill, maybe a little too chill. The place is dark , has good ventilation, but most importantly the hookah is surprisingly good. Ps wish they had plastic hoses.

18.description: Good BYOB Hookah.  I missed the dancers when I was there.

41.description: Dont get me wrong the place is nice but that the only pro...the use the cheapest self lighting coals so you feel like throwing up about 5 minutes after you get there; other places use coconut coals that are all natural so you dont feel like your gonna die lol They put the coals in a position on your hookah so they burn the quickest possible way - and to top it off they automatically charge a 15% tip!! I will just keep going where i usually go!Stay away!

52.description: Ummmm, where do I start?? Don't Go Here! Not worth your money or time. They like to rip people off. Here are my Pros vs. Cons....Cons:- $20 for a Hookah (we don't live in Vegas - way to expensive)- Hidden Fees - They charge you $10/person for their Entertainment fee - Entertainment sucked - the belly dancer didn't even show up while I was there.- BYOB - $5/person to drink the alcohol that we brought.- Uncomfortable seating arrangements - sofas were stiff and the tables were plastic, right off the boat from China.Pros.......Can't think of any.If I were you, I would Yelp somewhere else for Hookah, not this place.

50.description: My bf and I have gone here about 20 time and we always had a good experience but ever since they changed management, things have gone down.   We brought a group of around 10 people on Friday night and it was a disappointment.  They don't have the live music on the weekends now and just a dj.  I know that the cover is for the music and belly dancer but with the belly dancer, she did not show up until 12:30 (when the staff said that it started at 11) and we were tired but when we asked if we still had to pay the cover even though we didn't see the belly dancer, we were informed that we had to so we stayed.  When one of the staff first brought out the hookah, he only brought out one mouthpiece with it.  We checked near the cash register where they have a bowl with extra mouthpieces and it was empty and we had to chase him down.   Why didn't he realize that if there is more than one person, you will need more than one mouthpiece? If you look at my last review, I wrote that he would come around and change the coal very often but it's not the case now.  Not only did we have to chase him down again, it took him a long time to come back to change it for us.  I think it's time for me to start looking around for other hookah lounges because this isn't a place I want to give my business to anymore.

4.description: Very rude waitress and bad service! I didn't have the ID on me, and the waitress said "it's not my problem" flat on my face when I said I didn't have it. For every addition that we wanted on hukka, they charged us 5$ extra. They have weird rules like not more than 2 people can share a hukka. We were a party of 4 out of which one didnt smoke but still we had to get 2 hukkas. Finally, hukkas were served and the waitress came in again after a while. We asked her which hukka is what flavor. She just shrugged, and said "I don't know". The taste/smell of the flavors wasn't evident at all. It just tasted strongly of coal and tobacco. The place was sparsely populated on a Friday evening, and now I know why. The only good thing is music selection, but I assume you won't be visiting a  hukka place just to listen to the music!

6.description: New policy: $3 per person cork fee. Also, they all or the sudden choose to charge 2 people per 1 hookah instead of however many people per hookah. Thee should not be limit to people per hookah. Cost $60 for 4 people, 3 of which smoked. Never coming back. People around us were irritated too.

22.description: DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE IT SUCKS!!!Quite possibly the worst hookah lounge I have ever been... Ridiculously overpriced and serviced SUCKED!!! They don't even deserve ONE STAR!!!

15.description: The staff was very nice and accommodating to us I'm our first visit. They gave us an extra flavor for free being we were the first to visit on a slow Monday evening. Atmosphere is pleasant and not too dark. More flavors would be nice :) byob was fun with champagne too ^-^

57.description: I love this place since I ran into a few months ago. They take their coffees seriously, as evidenced by that impressively shiny espresso machine behind the counter that looks like it was produced by Willy Wonka. Their mint tea with honey experience is only comparable to a hot mojito, maybe less intoxicating, but still the same amount of flavor. The guys who run the place are service friendly, just try snagging one of the couches before others do and you'll have a great time.

20.description: I'm sitting in the hookah bar right now. In fact I have been for the past 30 mins with very little attention being paid to our party. We were seated by the door, told we had to spend a minimum of $15 each even though one of my friends doesn't smoke hookah. Once we agreed to the minimum, we were ignored for 25 mins. We were about to get up and leave but we wanted to tell a manager about our terrible experience but then were offered a complimentary hookah so we stayed. Several other groups came in after us and we're served first. I think it's a pretty disorganized setup. We got a tiny hookah but whatever, it works. I will not be returning here.

36.description: Can't say that I enjoyed myself. Went last night with a group of 8 for a friends 30th birthday. Its BYOB which is a plus and they did not charge a corking fee, but that is where the pros about this place stop. It was a saturday night, so I expect that's a busy night, but it should not take 20 minutes for the waitress to come to your table. Then we had to ask for glasses and ice for our drinks. Did she think we were going to drink out of the bottle?? There is a $20.00 purchase limit per person, however, most of the food on the limited menu was "all sold out". So I guess we were supposed to smoke 8 separate hookas to meet our $20.00 quota? If you are a first timer, they still treat you like you should know what you are doing and give absolutely no info other than "these are the flavors and you need to spend $20.00." After raising the issue with the manager, she says "we don't give group discounts" I didn't ask for a discount, I was just letting you know if you don't have any other items on your menu but $3.00 soft drinks and $4.00 chocolate cake, how do you expect a large group to meet their dollar quota. I guess she didn't have an answer so she said we only needed to spend $15.00 per person. We ordered chocolate cake to go and they wrapped 5 pieces in one big piece of foil, not separately. All in all I just felt like they could care less about customer service and just wanted u to meet your dollar quota and leave. Oh and don't forget about the 10.5% tax and 18% gratuity for crappy service. Definately won't be back.

14.description: I am an Arabian person who has been to a lot of hookah places and I did a big mistake by not believing the people who gave a poor rate about this place, this place was the worst hookah place I have ever been at! Too expensive for Very Very bad service, also the coal worker was acting very rude! And the hookah was very horrible comparing to the way it should be made!! As a recommend I would suggest you guys to see other hookah places that has respectful and well trained coal workers, hookah places need well trained coal workers not an asshole one to serve you and make you feel that you are begging them! But the 2 girl waiters were smiling and polite.I think the owner of this place is trying to give a bad reputation about Arabs by employing a horrible coal workers as the worst Syrian guy.DON'T GO TO THIS HORRIBLE PLACE!!!!!

58.description: I can't even believe that this my first review of Butterfly.  It has been my go to BYOB for years.  The food is absolutely delicious. I love that they have both creative rolls, and Thai entrees, cause sometimes you just can't choose. I've never ordered anything that I didn't like. The ambiance is great for a girls night out, or a date.  You'll also notice a bunch of locals carrying out. Cause it's delicious. It's a little more swanky than the  typical BYOB with orangish red walls, and cozy black leather booths.  I highly recommend Butterfly for any occasion. Oh and if you forget to bring your own bottle, there's a awesome wine store just across the street.

56.description: Best sushi and service! Just dined here for the first time and everything was delicious. Shrimp and veggie tempura, crab ran goon, crunchy tuna roll, and chicken satay. All fresh, yummy and huge portions! My new sushi spot!

29.description: Much easier to get a last minute reservation here than its sister location on Grand. The staff is always nice, and the food is delicious considering the price you pay. The spot is a lot smaller so may be hard for big group dinners. It's also not as rowdy as the Grand location. The Grand one is good too, but just different

42.description: I usually LOVE Butterfly sushi on Grand Avenue. I have been to the Madison location as well but I don't know what was going on tonight when I went to this Butterfly for my friend's birthday.ProsEven before I got there, I heard there were issues with the server not listening to the orders that were being placed.  I usually oder the Crazy spicy noodle without fish and oyster sauce at the other Butterfly locations and this lady specifically said the cooks in the back could not make it without oyster and fish sauce.  Then she server presumed to tell me I should order sushi. Considering there were only one or two rolls (mushroom or sweet potato), I couldn't really make a (satisfying) meal with just those.  Anyway, she ended up talking with the cooks in the back, (after a lot of time) and then said they could do the panang noodles.  So I got that and it was pretty good along with the vegetarian shumai.  What was annoying about the shumai is that when it was brought out, it had sauce and she said the sauce had oyster sauce so don't eat it.  She didn't bring other sauce out so I had to ask her bring some sweet and sour sauce.  The annoying part was that I accidentally kept dipping the damn shumai in the "bad" sauce anyway because it was right there.  Why bring it out if it has an ingredient I specifically said I don't want...?!After we all ate, there were issues paying because even though we specified amounts on credit cards and all that, the server still had trouble following what we were saying. Again, I LOVE Butterfly sushi and I get that when there are big groups (which there usually are at Butterfly Sushi), it can get crazy and hard to follow orders, but after we repeat ourselves and try to make things clear, it just seemed like there were a lot of issues with our service.  I was also disappointed with the fact that I could not get the noodle dish I wanted.

23.description: Have been here with friends and it's always a great. Love their sushi, prices are great and best of all it's BYOBSeating at this site is pretty tiiiight!  =)

47.description: "I felt really sick, so I didn't eat anything. The bathroom was really accommodating, and there was plenty of toilet paper. I give it five stars." - My Brother

8.description: In this order, go to the Grand location, Madison location and if you MUST this Chicago Ave location. I was disappointed that this restaurant didn't seem to be on par with the other two. I went for lunch on Saturday at 12:15 pm and they had just opened at noon and were still mopping the floors and prepping for the day. No worries I thought, so I seated myself and shortly after I was greeted and offered water and a menu. After my friend arrived, I ordered the shrimp rolls... or so I thought. Another table of about 4 had arrived during this time as well and I kept seeing their food delivered but nothing came for me. I was about to ask when I should expect my appetizer when my server attempted to place a shrimp maki roll on my place setting. I did clearly say shrimp rolls which is on the menu as "shrimp rolls" and not a shrimp maki roll. Sigh* She tried to see if I'd still want that maki instead but nah... that's not what I ordered. I'm very familiar with Butterfly's menu (see my 5 star review for the Grand location which is my go-to sushi spot in the city) and I was craving the deep fried, cheese shrimp rolls appetizer. When my order did arrive, I was disappointed again. I don't think I tasted any cheese at all! How sad. I also ordered the salmon maki roll which was fine and a Thai iced tea which was good and served in a cute mason jar mug.Overall, I've had much better food at the Grand and Madison locations and probably won't frequent this one too often. I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt with the 3 stars... there was a grand opening sign outside. I guess they re-grand opened??? I've definitely seen this location before... so maybe they remodeled? Or worse.. they replaced the chefs! Whomp.

31.description: Came here after a workout and wasn't really in the mood for asian food. I was pleasantly surprised by the food. My main course was the teriyaki salmon and it was nice and crispy on the outside just the way that I like it. My girlfriend wasn't in love with her meal so they comped it and brought out a complimentary cheese cake to make up for it. The cheese cake was delicious. Gave sweets up for Lent but couldn't be rude as they brought it out as a make good. Needless to say I ate both her and my piece of cheesecake.

34.description: I'm a biologist and can say with 100% certainty that this place gave me food poisoning based on the symptoms I had and onset time. I've never been so sick in my life after eating here. My friend swears by it and loves it, but I know I won't eat here again.

16.description: They are back! I think they have been opened for about 3 days now.  We went there for dinner last night.  Although the experience was pleasant all the way thorough, I need to state here that the Butterfly restaurants do not have the best sushi if you are a sushi "snob", you'll probably agree with me. But, if you are one to like all the sauces and mayo, this is for sure a great place for dinner.  The entrees other than sushi are delicious too.  Last night I had the golden noodle dish, and it was very tasty. I always enjoy ordering the red dragon maki and their spicy tuna. These are the only special Makis I like. I appreciate the summer maki, it comes with some jalapeño and I love it! I honestly don't know where their fish comes from, but this place is no Kamahachi.  Thus, the price is fair.  Cheap maki rolls. I won't say they are the "freshest" but they are not bad either. This Butterfly is still BYOB as all the other locations.  This location at Chicago avenue is excellent because there are two wine stores right across the street, and a liquor store about two blocks away.  Service here was outstanding last night. I consider this a great place and would be back with friends for dinner at any time.

13.description: Came here two nights ago. The food was delicious! We ordered crab rangoon (the first order we devoured so we ordered a second batch), tempura which was crispy and plentiful, and gyoza (perfectly cooked) for appetizers. All were delicious. For dinner we ordered a chicken curry and 5 rolls of sushi. The sushi was on point. The flavor of the curry was perfect, just wish the sauce was a tad  bit thicker. The ambiance is romantic and modern with purple up lighting. The restaurant is small so make sure you have reservations. We were about 15 minutes late and it was nice they still accommodated us. It's a huge plus that it's BYOB. I knocked off 2 stars because our waiter was very rude and snobby. Service is very important to me and we had to ask him twice to refill our waters. He should also offer an iced wine bucket instead of us having to ask for it. The other servers that delivered our food were very kind, however. I prefer the butterfly sushi by the west loop. The space is bigger and all the servers were attentive and very kind.

11.description: Thank heavens! Sushi is fresh and delicious. I've ordered several more times from this location and I can officially say it tastes just as good as their grand location! Wooooo!!

39.description: Love how close this is to my job and home. I'm in love with the summer maki and spicy salmon maki. I always order some sake and masago nigiri. I love having the option of some Thai food as well. Attentive and friendly service plus nice decor for a great price! $$ :) BYOB makes it extra fun and nice.

37.description: I've been to the other butterfly on Grand and it was fine. But when my girlfriend and I went here we were disappointed. The soft shell crab barely had any meat on it. It was replaced with onions and it tasted very fishy. We decided not to eat anymore to avoid getting sick. We also ordered a few rolls but they were not appetizing. Maybe it was the bad experience with the soft shell crab but nothing tasted right.The staff was kind though and asked what was wrong. They brought out dessert on the house but too bad it was an old brownie that probably came from jewel a week earlier. We will not return since there are plenty of better places out there. Oh and I'm not a fan of the orange lights. All the food looks orange and you have no idea what you're eating.

0.description: I went to Butterfly with a group of 13 and they were very accommodating to us, including splitting our check a million ways! With so many orders going in, meals were coming out at different times. So much so that one person was completely done and others hadn't even eaten yet. Not much can be done to avoid this though at a smaller restaurant like this. Some of the most beautiful sushi plating I've ever seen! All of my friends' makis were displayed wonderfully and even my nigiri had  very cool sauce decoration. I started with the gomae-ae and it was fine but I thought it was smothered a bit too heavily in the peanut sauce. As much as I love nuts (harhar), it was overkill, I also ordered nigiri - tamago (sweet egg), salmon and tuna - all of which was very fresh and just delicious. I gobbled it all down and it wasn't hard on my wallet at all. All in my party were pleased with their meals and their noodle dishes were so large that most had leftovers.Service was great from start to finish, food was tasty start to finish, all in all a great experience at Butterfly Sushi.

38.description: They've been bumped up a star. Butterfly Sushi's servers are awesome and extremely friendly. The food comes out fast. It's tasty and even when they close, they'll let you finish your meal. I'll keep coming back for more. 4 stars Butterfly!

51.description: The spicy tofu noodles were good. I could have used less random chunks of chicken in my tofu noodles, but hey, I'm not a vegetarian. If I was, I probably wouldn't have been so happy though.

27.description: BYOB sushi places are a staple in Chicago and Butterfly is one of my favorites. Large portions and very good quality for the value! Try the summer roll and the cashew chicken for sure. Their sweet potato roll is delicious too if your a veggie lover!

32.description: I decided to go to celebrate a birthday one evening.  Everything went well until I received my plate. I found a PIECE A METAL in my food. GROSS!!!!! The manager wasn't going to be accommodating, either I get a new plate at no charge or 15% off my bill. After arguing with management, I received both. So, be careful want you received on your plate, it might be a SURPRISE!

54.description: I'm kinda conflicted on Butterfly. It's BYOB which is great. The sushi is pretty good, but maybe a bit over priced. The service every time I got is total crap. Last time I brought a 6 pack and had finished a beer before our server made her first appearance at our table.  I keep going just because it's easy and close to home, but I suggest other sushi places if you're looking for really good sushi. I put Butterfly in the same category as Chipolte, it's settlement food. It's satisfying but nothing more nothing less.

48.description: The sushi presentation was very impressive.  I ate the miso soup, fried spicy tuna roll, inari, salmon sashimi, and tamago.  All of these were tasty and I was very satisfied with the quality of the food.  The bathroom was clean and spacious.  My only (minor) negative feedback is the staggered arrival of our entrees.  It would have been optimal if they all arrived at the same time, but one dish came out fifteen minutes later than the first.  Overall, it was a pleasant experience and great value.  I'd eat here again.

44.description: This place is amazing!! Let us begin! I went with my girlfriend a couple of months ago. I've always walked around that area. Definitely a good place to bring someone on a date. Service is great and then sushi just wonderful. One of the best things that I've tried in this place is their rice. All of their deep fry rice is amazingly sweet. The presentation of their plates is also amazing With a plunge of heavenly beauty. I enjoy the atmosphere the lights are dim . Makes everything more romantic. Ps: noble grape is across the street! BYOB

24.description: The sushi here is a bit on the pricey side, but well worth the money. The restaurant has a nice casual atmosphere with outdoor seating when it's nice out. One thing I especially like about this place is that they have a great selection of non-sushi entrees, so if you're going with a group where not everyone likes sushi you're covered. Also, it's BYOB.Last time I was there, they gave us a free dessert! Definitely going back.

7.description: Great Food !!Appetizers were really awesome . Good spicy pasta plus really fresh maki rolls!!!Nice friendly service. You can bring your own battle.

49.description: well priced for what you get.... oh and its BYOB!!!   a great go-to spot for delivery, take out, date night, group outings, etc.

40.description: Excellent delivery, After a long day this place is great on a pinch! It's delicious and inexpensive. The portions are great, however I rarely get napkins. I am a big fan of the Big Pad Thai, It usually takes me two days to eat all of it. The Crab Rangoon is always a must order, They have big ones here! :-D Creamy stuffed pillows of awesomeness that is always great paired with a red wine!

53.description: Great prices on the sushi rolls. In addition, each roll has a lot of fish which is amazing since most places will charge you $7 for a salmon avocado where Butterfly charges $5 and puts in almost twice the fish!BYOB too

30.description: Our go to sushi place when we don't feel like cooking or are dealing with a group. Literally have eaten here 20 times. Easy reservations, amazing portions and quality for the price. Always get a least 1 summer roll per person. delish

46.description: Best sweet potato roll EVER, and really stellar spicy tuna and philly. I'm still a big sushi wimp and therefore didn't try any of the "hard stuff", but the quality of their simpler maki made me ALMOST want to try their signature rolls. Close, but no cigar... yet.Also loved the platting with the swirls of spicy mayo!

1.description: I love Butterfly Sushi. I've been a loyal customer for over 3 years now. My favorite dish is the Samurai Sushi. The sauce that they use is what makes it so good. I really enjoy nigiri too. So I quite often get the Sushi Combo A, which is chef selection and never lets me down. Their fried rice is also one of my favorites. (I usually go for the chicken.)Butterfly Sushi is perfect for dates. It is also BYOB! The staff is very friendly. I am usually able to walk in if I go in the late evening but I do advice to call sometimes to make a reservation especially in the spring and summer or on the weekends.

55.description: The food is great and the presentation is even better, however the portion sizes are small and the restaurant is super dark. The staff is wonderful, and you will always receive cheesecake on the house after every meal.

9.description: I had a great dine-in experience here (5 stars), but this review is for delivery (1 star).  The driver was incredibly rude, and when I tipped her *only* $2, she retorted "that's it?!"  Last time I checked, tipping is voluntary and is a reward for good service...I think I'll stick to carry out.

26.description: Went there on a Tuesday night. I've been to this location quite a few times since I live in the area. The food is usually good but my most recent experience was nothing to brag about. The miso soup tasted stale and the fried gyoza was undercooked. The sushi was good though.

25.description: As far as service goes Butterfly gets 1 star. Food took 1 1/2 hrs to be delivered, food was cold, and the top of the box that the crab ragoons where in had a giant hole in it! After heating it all up in the microwave I will say the food seemed like it would have been really tasty. Good Thai is hard to come by so I may give this place a chance again but only as a dine in customer.

12.description: Ordered delivery. Soups were good. Crab rangoon is too cream cheesey. The wings aren't really wings and they didn't seem to be stuffed with anything as described on the menu.  Seaweed salad was fine. Nothing remarkable going on.  Won'tbe ordering from here again.

59.description: I've never had anything but great food and service from here. For both sushi, maki, and thai entrees, I think they give you above average food for average or below prices. I usually get delivery from here, but the one time we dined in, the staff was very friendly and attentive.

21.description: My favorite sushi in Chicago, really fresh fish and inventive rolls that are beautifully displayed.  Price wise for the quality of the seafood you get more than your money's worth.   I no longer have sushi cravings, I have butterfly sushi cravings!

17.description: Excellent delivery, After a long day this place is great on a pinch! It's delicious and inexpensive. The portions are great, however I rarely get napkins. I am a big fan of the Big Pad Thai, It usually takes me two days to eat all of it. The Crab Rangoon is always a must order, They have big ones here! :-D Creamy stuffed pillows of awesomeness that is always great paired with a red wine!

10.description: This is my go to Thai place in Chicago!Highly recommend the Panang Curry (with pineapple for an added delight)!--FYI: Panang is a flavorful curry with a lil less spicy-kick then green/red curry--But I have not been disappointed by any meal/appetizer I have had here including but not limited to: Cashew Chicken, Pad Thai, Rama (if you love peanut sauce this is the dish for you!), crab rangoon, spring rollsI could go on an on   :)

5.description: Solid, affordable Asian cuisine in a great neighborhood. For two large entrees (my wife went home with leftovers) we only spent $25 including tip. Ordered the Spicy Crazy Noodles and my wife had one of their curries. Our food arrived quickly, piping hot, and was excellent. The veggies in my dish tasted fresh and weren't overcooked. The meat in both of our dishes was tender and tasty. Service was prompt, efficient, and friendly. Only con of the place was the music playing. Their speaker set up sounded very cheap and fuzzy. Music choice was EDM, which sounded even worse than usual on the poor speakers. If the volume was lower, the music selection was less obnoxious, or they had a higher quality system, it would have been far less annoying.

3.description: This is my favorite sushi and thai in Chicago for a reason.  Came back here with my girlfriends for a night out and only wished there was a location close enough to deliver to me.  First off, it's BYOB, so pack your favorite bottle or two.  Second...the sushi is to die for.  They had a new special roll called the 911, and I couldn't get enough of it.  The rolls are huge and like all the best sushi, doesn't require any additional seasoning.  Yes, no soy sauce and no wasabi needed.  Then I had the spicy crazy noodles.  Generally known as drunken noodles or pad kee mao.  The noodles are always perfectly cooked, along with the vegetables and protein.  But the best part is that it's seasoned perfectly as well.  This location is shotgun style, so it's long and narrow, and things can get a little tight when it's packed.  However, the food is so delicious, you won't notice that you're bumping elbows with the table next to you.  Service is good, and the ambiance is nice.  This is a great place to meet up with friends and have some delicious food before going out.  Overall, still one of my favs!

35.description: Went to butterfly sushi with a group of 9 for my birthday. I made a reservation for 7pm on a tuesday and my table was very nicely set up for us when we arrived. The servers were excellent and the food amazing. I recommend the nigiri, so fresh! They even brought out some small cheesecake squares when they found out it was my birthday. The plate they came on had an amazing portrait of me drawn in chocolate!! They even put the design of my shirt on it! Amazing experience.

19.description: Fantastic service. Nice atmosphere. Sushi is fantastic. Prices are about average.
