28.description: Great customer service, great price, great food and great atmosphere!! Butterfly sushi is my Go-to thai place! LOVE IT!!

45.description: On this rainy winter night, I had stepped in one too many puddles and just wanted to stay in with some delivery.  You can order from Butterfly online, and the delivery charge is two dollars.  I ordered the noodles with panang curry with an order of crab rangoons.  The delivery said it would take 45-60 minutes, but it ended up taking an hour and fifteen minutes probably because the weather increased delivery orders.  The delivery guy was really nice though.  The curry is really flavorful, and a nice spice creeps up as you're eating.  The crab rangoons were cold by the time they arrived, but I still enjoyed them.  I've had takeout/delivery from Butterfly, and it is always really, really good.

33.description: The service is abysmal. The food is mediocre at best. The place was not busy at all and it felt like they were throwing the food at our table and running away. At 9pm on a Saturday it was half full. They stared at us until we left. Go to EJ sushi on Grand-- much better service and higher quality fish. Also BYO. Pretty much anywhere is better than this.

43.description: The sushi rice was NOT good at all on this Friday night.  On the nigiri sushi, it had too much vinegar.  In the roll (came with a later order) the rice was dry.  In addition, the seaweed wrapper on the roll was stale.  This was much worse than supermarket sushi.  Only redeeming value was the decent Thai green curry chicken.

2.description: Yes, please. I've been there twice, once ordering tofu pad thai (boring, I know) and once for sushi. I've been pleasantly surprised both times. The presentation and flavor a are excellent. Will be back for more!

18.description: My favorite sushi in Chicago, really fresh fish and inventive rolls that are beautifully displayed.  Price wise for the quality of the seafood you get more than your money's worth.   I no longer have sushi cravings, I have butterfly sushi cravings!

41.description: Cheap and yummy.

52.description: The food is always good and it is a great Thai and Japanese mix.  I can't believe how fast our food arrived tonight.  Our doorbell rang exactly 20 minutes after my online order was places with piping hot amazing food.

50.description: Update 1/2/2014 - Updated to 5 stars. We've ordered twice since my first review and each time the food is delicious, flavors are great and the take-out service is fantastic. --Butterfly is my new go-to for sushi and Thai food. My roommate and I ordered for carry-out and the service was excellent from taking our order to having it ready super quickly. We ordered the red-bean mochi (delicious!) and they kept it in the freezer until we arrived.We ordered the Spicy Crazy Noodles with wide rice noodles and tofu, Cashew Chicken (subbing tofu for the chicken) and 2 maki rolls (avo and kanpyo). The maki rolls were fantastic. Lots of filling, not too much rice, and the avocado was amazingly creamy!! The entrees were delicious- we shared them and there was definitely enough to put us into a food coma. The tofu for the cashew dish was fried and battered but it wasn't horribly greasy and didn't make us feel terrible afterwards. The veg part of the dish was great.The Spicy crazy noodles were seriously spicy! I may be used to places that take the pepper out of the food- we definitely got a few pieces. Besides the resulting annihilation of  our taste buds, we enjoyed the dish immensely and the flavors were still fantastic.

4.description: The sushi here is a bit on the pricey side, but well worth the money. The restaurant has a nice casual atmosphere with outdoor seating when it's nice out. One thing I especially like about this place is that they have a great selection of non-sushi entrees, so if you're going with a group where not everyone likes sushi you're covered. Also, it's BYOB.Last time I was there, they gave us a free dessert! Definitely going back.

6.description: Friendly staff and a higher than average cut of fish brought us down here. If you live in the Wicker/West/Noble area and realize how easy it is to be disappointed by sushi, come here instead.My only gripe is that the Spicy Tuna isn't top notch and they're missing a good ramen. But as far as an Asian mix goes, solid BYOB!

22.description: This is my go to Thai place in Chicago!Highly recommend the Panang Curry (with pineapple for an added delight)!--FYI: Panang is a flavorful curry with a lil less spicy-kick then green/red curry--But I have not been disappointed by any meal/appetizer I have had here including but not limited to: Cashew Chicken, Pad Thai, Rama (if you love peanut sauce this is the dish for you!), crab rangoon, spring rollsI could go on an on   :)

15.description: This place is good. Really good actually. There's another Butterfly that's closer to my apartment though, and that's the only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars.

57.description: I really love Butterfly! Great sushi, huge choice of maki rolls. Hurricane is my fav. I also ordered an iced bubble thai latte with tapioca to drink and it was super good, but if you order it you get something more similar to a caramel smoothie than to a drink. So I had to drink it by the end of the dinner, as a sort of dessert, which is ok anyway. Our server was so sweet and she brought a Thank you! dessert by the end of the dinner, what a lovely thing! I also carry out my sushi sometimes cause I live right by this restaurant and if you do carry out for at least 10$ you get free appetizers! The location is very nice, orangy, black leather seats. Very good choice for a date as for a friends night out! Prices are VERY reasonable. Highly recommended!

20.description: Food is fantastic if you dine in!! The sushi is very disappointing if delivery is ordered. Also, delivery time was well over an hour and a half on a Thursday night which is ridiculous.

36.description: This is my go-to BYOB sushi spot. The fish is fresh/delicious, the rolls are creative, and the atmosphere is very fun. I bring my fun sushi-loving friends here when they're in town.

14.description: Love this place!  Butterfly was a neighborhood fav of mine when I lived in River West.  They have since moved across the street (on Grand) into a bigger space.  Even though I live in a different neighborhood now, I still make the effort to come back - the food's that good!We came there recently with family visiting from out-of-town.  We ordered an assortment of sushi (love the dragon and samurai roles), fish curry, sweet and sour chicken, etc. and everything was delicious!

3.description: I usually only go to the glass shops around Clark/Belmont because I live right around the corner, but this place is soooooo worth the drive to Pilsen. They have some of the sickest one of a kind glass pieces I have seen in Illinois from a variety of local artists. They have pieces of all sizes and prices, and thats not all....they have alot of cool one of a kind shoes, cool shirts, and other art pieces from local artists. I try to make it in here at least once every month or two, I def recommend you check it out if you've never been in or if it's been a while. I know the really colorful, beautiful custom skull they had was stolen during a break in, and I really hope they get that back, there is only one of them I think, so hopefully it will come up...and shame on whoever took it!

1.description: This is one of those businesses in Chicago that you wonder how they stay in business. I live right by Made and I've never once seen anybody in the store. They sell overpriced Jordan's and blown glass. If that's your thing then by all means. If you're the other 99.9% move along

2.description: I peeked in here briefly after having brunch next door. I'm a self-proclaimed sneakerhead so when I saw the wall full of shoes I was intrigued. This place gets new sneakers in often (so I was told). Although it looked like they had a lot of options, there was only 1 size available in each shoe pretty much. At least each display was marked as such so you don't run the risk of getting your hopes up for no reason. To my dismay, the prices are SKY HIGH and they didn't have my size in anything anyway. I can't say that it was a huge let down since I was just browsing, but in any case, this won't become a spot I shop at for real.They also have t-shirts (I love tees too) but they weren't really any on display so I had to sift through one by one to see what the graphics said... who has time for all that!? I lasted maybe 90 seconds. They also have a random variety of artsy stuff for sale... unique pictures, metal pieces, glass work, etc. It was definitely a hodge podge in there.Anyway, it's a 2-star only because I like browsing boutiques, but I wouldn't make a concerted effort to visit this spot, nor would I tell someone to check it out either. IJS... I have seen better.

9.description: Besides their awesome parties they throw for customers, they really do have the best glass, artwork, jewelry and clothing around! Huge selection, you will walk out buying at least two items every time is my guess. And you will want to, everyone who works there is fantabulous!They carry a lot of up and coming companies that you will want to know about that possibly none of your friends do yet. Legit prices with great customer service - I try to stop by everytime I am in town.

10.description: Sad to say my first and final experience with this company was a horrible one! Ive never dealt with an employee who was soo unconcerned with helping me. My initial order (a very important christmas gift) was never shipped. Then when they did finally ship it 17 days later...it was the wrong product.....I was promised a partial refund and have now been ignored for 2 weeks.....the owner makes promises to fix things then doesn't deliver and the employees don't give a shit. Bummer....cause it seems like a cool place.

4.description: Made is the best place in Chicago for awesome glass, jewelry, and unique clothing.Now they carry rare and unusual sneakers, too!I always have a great time at their amazing parties, where you can have a chance to meet the artists and see their work. Definitely stop by and up your game!

6.description: Made is the place to go if you're looking for impressive, artistic work unique to any glass store in Chicago.Also offering hats and clothing, Made truly has it all. And if you're feeling adventurous they also host parties which are exhibitions for both local and visiting glass blowing artists. As true to any place, you get what you pay for and if you're willing to spend the extra money, you will find things that are truly different than any other shop in Chicago.

12.description: I can't help but give this place 5 stars because it totally wowed me. The first time I went there the co-owner offered me a cup cake (which was awesome since I love cupcakes) and he was very helpful with helping me in my selection of christmas gifts. I like how they don't hound you to buy something but they are just chilled and keep it comfortable. I was super exicited when I bought the bleeding hyena posters. I love how they support local artists and have easy parking.

5.description: Mixed feelings about the purchase we made a few days ago and would highly recommend anyone to research specific shoe/price prior to actually buying from this store!!! That being said, we think supporting small local businesses is vital along with paying a reasonable price!!! Basically we purshased a pair of  Nike Dunk Low Pro SB, seize 9.5 in black suede with turquoise for $140 and being it was the last pair, one of the shoes had been sitting on the shelf in the sun and had faded a bit!!! This shoe came out in 2012 and is priced at $65??? Basically, we paid 50% too much for an old pair of shoes, and they were not signed and faded in the sun w/o a discount!!! Boy, do we feel stupid for not researching this prior to actually buying the shoe:(

11.description: I broke my slide this morning while cleaning my tube. Local "entry-level" smoke shop wasn't open so I gave MADE a call. They're working Riot Fest this weekend and are not open but I live just a few blocks away and luckily someone was there when I called. I think his name was Ed.. anyway, cool guy, let me come down and grab a dope slide for a good price. Thanks a lot guys, you've just made a repeat customer. No pun intended.

8.description: This place is AWESOME. tons of parking on the street. I went there on 4/20 and they were handing out food and beers. All the artwork was awesome and the clothes were cool. bring hat money, youll def want a hat

0.description: Not to be confused with that old MTV show where total dorks would try to be MADE into a pick up artist or whatever other stupid ambition they had. This MADE is completely cool through and through. It's a glass shop/sneaker store/awesome art gallery thats one part hip hop and two parts hip-ster. They've got sweet graphic T's, tons of straight bill hats, and all sorts of accessories for your body or your bong. Even if you don't smoke weed or dress this way this place is totally worth stopping in for a look around. Just make sure you bring your wallet...their custom kicks can get up in the couple hundys price wise.

7.description: The straight DOPE. Get yo HEADY STEEZ...T's, hoodies, glass, art, annnnd, of course, pick and choose from the widest selection of Grassroots caps available at any shop in, or even remotely close to, the Chicagoland area. PS...if you read this review and decide to cruise this joint, ask for Luther, CMaz, or Ed...and tell em ya heard the word from Mama Ana :)

28.description: Adorable vintage shoes! They have an excellent selection and prices that will not totally break you. Lots of cute clothes and old comfy shirts. Also, a really nice selection of purses, belts and knick-knacks. It always warms my heart to see an A & W mug...I'm a former teen car-hop. So glad this place is open and is just a short walk from my place. Really friendly people here too.

1.description: I stepped in while I was waiting to be seated for brunch next door. This is an adorable little shop, with lots of random items- from vintage clothes, jewelry, and glassware. I snagged a new pair of aviators, but felt like, at least currently, there best stuff was in the drink ware department. Lots of little glasses for cocktails, mostly sets. Love that stuff. Odd variety, nice staff. Sort of off the beaten path.

9.description: Seek and ye shall find.This cool vintage store has a little bit of everything and it's all in great condition. They have clothes, shoes, purses, games, housewares, jewelry  -- all well organized and neatly displayed, making it easy to peruse.I spied a beautiful teal suede coat in mint condition, but alas it was the wrong size, but I was thisclose to buying a black sequined tube top. Who doesn't need this wardrobe staple?I spent about 45 minutes browsing in here and I was delighted with the quality of their goods and the staff was funny and helpful too.And while I didn't buy anything on this excursion, I will definitely be back on the regular to check out their latest finds. That's part of the "thrill of the hunt" - that elusive little treasure that you only come across every once in a while and everyone asks where you got it. Vintage gold, if you will.And if you see me in that black sequined tube top, you'll know just where I got it.

29.description: "Mooooom...you totally HAD this romper. Terry cloth? One-piece, right?"And this was how my afternoon went at Seek shopping with my mom.I've been walking past this store waiting for it to open for a few months. After a visit to Noble Grape to exhaust my weekly wine budget, I was finally able to pop in. I knew my mom wouldn't mind. She used to drive around trolling for garage sales when I was younger. I swear, she should've had a bumper sticker titled "I brake for yard sales." She's too classy for bumper stickers, but the sentiment stands. She's a woman who is after the steal.I'm a vintage newb, as in, I have bought nothing from a second-hand store. However, I envy my friends who can come out looking smashing for very little money with their vintage finds. In my opinion, Seek is how vintage shopping should be. It's a store owned by two people completely passionate about the "steal." They love finding stuff. Garage sales, estate sales, yard sales...you name it, they go there to find some fantastic finds.  Peeps after my mother's heart, indeed.The best assortment of vintage-y clutches at ridiculously good prices. I scored a darling little leather number for $14. A steal, indeed. I had my eye on a beaded white sparkly number as well...gives me reason to return, right?And dresses galore! I bought one of the owner's gram's dresses. $35. The perfect frock for a summer wedding. And had the buttons not been too tight on a crochet trimmed dress, I'd have snagged that for $18. Too bad for me. But good for bargain-hunting girls smaller than me. Go there and get it. It has pockets and is beautiful.The housing goods assortment is stellar. Glasses, old ash trays, coffee mugs...you name it, you can likely find something to add the perfect vintage sparkle to your kitchen. Clean, well-organized with two fitting rooms, a fabulous edition to my beloved Chicago Avenue. I'm so glad I finally made it in there. Can't wait 'til my return visit.For the record, my mom had multiple terry cloth rompers in the 80s. She rocked 'em too. What can I say, she's a hot piece.

23.description: Mission: Studio 54 outfit + accessories. Timeline: STAT. Like today. Location: Seek Vintage. It's easily the most well-priced, well-sifted vintage selection I've ever been to. I scored a pretty stellar 70's "club" outfit....here's the breakdown: Jewel collared, 70's print dress: $20 (what!?) Gold belt: $12Gold Clutch: $15Brown/white/gold bangles: $10Chris was very helpful in the assemblage, and thank god I won't be rushing around figuring everything out at the 11th hour. One stop vintage shop. Clean, organized, awesome staff, great prices. Serious love up in here.

5.description: Great people and great treasures. I had bought a beautiful purse there that had gotten some water damage at my house. Chris offered to clean it for me and I couldn't have been more thankful. Love Seek!

31.description: I had remembered hearing about a new vintage store opening on Chicago Ave., but I couldn't quite remember where. Last Saturday, while on the way to Lush Wine & Spirits, my friend and I serendipitously found Seek Vintage. There are plenty of vintage shops in Chicago, but this is the best of the best. Though it's a fairly small storefront, they pack the good stuff in without it feeling cramped. The offerings are well organized and prices are very reasonable. Cute tchotchkes, Mad Men worthy dresses, glassware, lamps, a small but surprisingly good men's selection: something for everyone, indeed. I ended up finding a very mod-looking glass ice bowl with tongs for a friend's birthday gift and a tiny something for another friend that just screamed her name. Total spent on both: $18!

25.description: I was in on Sunday with my favorite shopping buddy and we seriously died and went to vintage heaven.  First and foremost the prices here are great.  There vintage is in great condition and the merchandising they have done makes it very easy and exciting to shop (one downfall was the make mannequin plopped in the middle of the store, almost ran into him a couple of times/thought it was a real person).The selection is top notch as well, except everything was too big on me:(.  I am excited to come back and see what new finds they have in store.  The guy working was so nice and really great to talk with.  Plus I love the free matches!

12.description: I am obsessed with vintage shoes, jewelry and bags but I hate digging for them and have very little patience - that's why I fell in love with Seek. Everything is so neatly organized and the store is creatively designed and fun. The owners are SO fun and helpful. They had an incredible selection of jewelry and I didn't have to rummage through bins like most vintage store, but they were neatly hung on hooks and in a display case. Tons of clutches and bags neatly organized by color on tables and in shelving units. The prices are RIGHT. They are totally affordable, everything is in perfect condition and they constantly replenish things and keep it exciting. If you make your way to Chicago and like vintage - this is THE spot. Last time I was there I bought this amazing set of hot/cold glasses for $2 each! I also got a gorgeous charm necklace, shoes and an awesome wallet and I spent next to nothing for great quality stuff.

21.description: The store is very organized and parking is easy.  I didn't find anything.  But, my friend found two pairs of vintage shoes (really cute).  Some of the prices were a bit high, but if they have what you're looking for that might not be a problem.  Some of the pieces for women were a peck on the large side.  But, all in all, its a kool store to check out.

16.description: I very rarely rate things with 5 stars in any capacity.  I've only written several yelp reviews but should you choose to follow me, you'll notice how few places I would rate 5.  I'm not a cynic by any means, I'm just fair.Having said that, Seek deserves 5 stars for so many reasons!I want to start by saying the girl who works there (and does much of the purchasing), Justina, is amazing.  Hands down the most friendly, refreshing, helpful, informed, and entertaining vintage store employee I've ever encountered.  Seriously, she's amazing.  I hope she lets me shop with her some day (and I just met her).Next, all of the items in the store (and for it's size it sure packs a lot in there) are quite accessible when it comes to price.  Every time I saw something I liked, I held my breath just before checking the price.  I always let out a relieved breath thinking, "$12?  That's it?  No.  way."  The variety ranges from super classy stuff, unique tchotchkes, kitschy decorations, and stuff that made you want to weep with happiness because it reminded you of your grandma's weird/cute crap.  There is definitely something for everyone.  And the prices show you just how within your grasp these little pieces of pure happiness are.Now, I previously said they packed a lot in there.  This is true.  But, you can still walk around and everything is in view.  And trust me, you want to stop and look at each last item in there.I'm pretty sure I'll be making weekly treks in.

17.description: This time when I came in the store, I had some good hard-earned money to spend and I left a very happy camper. I found the following:--A glorious pink frock--A hot leather bomber jacket--An A-line polka dot skirt--And adorable tops including a ruffled sleeveless top and a happy yellow one.The only I hate is the messy display!

10.description: Mission: Studio 54 outfit + accessories. Timeline: STAT. Like today. Location: Seek Vintage. It's easily the most well-priced, well-sifted vintage selection I've ever been to. I scored a pretty stellar 70's "club" outfit....here's the breakdown: Jewel collared, 70's print dress: $20 (what!?) Gold belt: $12Gold Clutch: $15Brown/white/gold bangles: $10Chris was very helpful in the assemblage, and thank god I won't be rushing around figuring everything out at the 11th hour. One stop vintage shop. Clean, organized, awesome staff, great prices. Serious love up in here.

11.description: A stretch of W Chicago Avenue, between Milwaukee and Damen in the West Town/Ukrainian Village area, is slowly beginning to rival the vintage corridor in Wicker Park. Last night I attended the opening party of Seek Vintage, a new shop just steps away from Dovetail Vintage and Pistol Bazaar and about six blocks from Very Best Vintage. While affordable, Seek has all the trappings of a fancier boutique-- sleek branding including gold embossed business cards and shopping bags and well organized displays that give customers enough room to browse. My favorite items were the kitschy ceramic planters in the shapes of boots, logs or animals already potted with small household plants for $10-$16. I also liked the huge souvenir keychains that featured retro names like Doris and Marcia for $4. The store stocks plenty of men's and women's clothing and accessories dating from the 1950s through the 1980s in good condition in a range of sizes. Typical prices are $22 for a 1970s cotton sundress, $14 for a 1960s evening bag and t-shirts and blouses are below $20. The merchandising is clever (handbags nestle in an atomic planter) and they are on-trend with their selection of housewares that include cocktail shakers, colorful glassware, industrial chic  toolboxes and a variety of 1970s colorful vinyl flight attendant/carry-on bags. If they had more  pre-1970s items/clothing I'd give the store another star, it's definitely harder to find 1930s-50s items nowadays but other shops in the area have been able to stock them relatively cheaply. I'll also be checking back in a few weeks to see what the turnover rate of merchandise is here and how often they switch out displays. I'm definitely excited, however, to have another quality vintage store to shop at and one only 8 blocks from my apartment. Welcome to the neighborhood Seek Vintage!

26.description: This one is definitely a keeper.  I have been in twice, and they really know their stuff here.  Everything is truly unique and usually older than the 80's.  The prices are very reasonable (real cowboy boots for $35, are you kidding me?!?!)I'm so glad that more awesome business are coming into my fave strip in the city (Chicago and Noble).  If you are looking for something great, flirty, or different you should absolutely stop by.

27.description: So now that I am one of the cool kids and live in up and coming Ukie (um...yeah...excuse me) I am free to roam around and score good deals on Chicago Avenue.Out of the three vintage stores I visited with my friend yesterday, Seek Vintage was definitely the best.Like - Arizona class.Because, man, Arizona is really a gold mine as far as vintage, antique and treasure hunting goes.I pushed the door and was in heaven. Dozens of bags, clutches, pockets, one more beautiful than the other. Belts. Pillows (a great yellow corduroy neck one for a mere $7). Glasses. Board games. Cups. A bike. Dresses. Shirts.Wow.I mean - WOW.I was truly like a kid in a candy store, giving ohhhhs and ahhhhhs in front of every rack and display. Holding every other item with sparkles in my eyes, trying to find a good reason not to give in and go back home with it.I was not bad. I just really fell in love with a red clutch, with the cutest silver opener that looks so-lady like. Total swoon. $14.I paid and told the owner that I would be a regular. She said that she liked hearing that. So did I.

0.description: easily my new favorite thrift store. i believe i looked at EVERY SINGLE ITEM in the place. it was so fun to browse and i didn't want to miss anything! well-organized, clean, cute. it was as if someone with my exact taste scoured the universe for all the best vintage clothing, purses, and knick knacks and put them neatly on display for me. which i suppose is not far from the truth. the owners (super nice, by the way) have really got an eye for this stuff. the prices are of course higher than at salvation army, or even ragstock, but the inventory is every bit worth it.i cannot wait to go back.

20.description: I very rarely rate things with 5 stars in any capacity.  I've only written several yelp reviews but should you choose to follow me, you'll notice how few places I would rate 5.  I'm not a cynic by any means, I'm just fair.Having said that, Seek deserves 5 stars for so many reasons!I want to start by saying the girl who works there (and does much of the purchasing), Justina, is amazing.  Hands down the most friendly, refreshing, helpful, informed, and entertaining vintage store employee I've ever encountered.  Seriously, she's amazing.  I hope she lets me shop with her some day (and I just met her).Next, all of the items in the store (and for it's size it sure packs a lot in there) are quite accessible when it comes to price.  Every time I saw something I liked, I held my breath just before checking the price.  I always let out a relieved breath thinking, "$12?  That's it?  No.  way."  The variety ranges from super classy stuff, unique tchotchkes, kitschy decorations, and stuff that made you want to weep with happiness because it reminded you of your grandma's weird/cute crap.  There is definitely something for everyone.  And the prices show you just how within your grasp these little pieces of pure happiness are.Now, I previously said they packed a lot in there.  This is true.  But, you can still walk around and everything is in view.  And trust me, you want to stop and look at each last item in there.I'm pretty sure I'll be making weekly treks in.

19.description: A friend and I walk at least once a week from East Village to downtown to catch up on gossip and of course exercise... I tend to always bring a CC and ID because I never know what I'll see along the way..So glad I peeped my head into Seek and saw some amazing things so I had to walk in to browse even more.  They have everything from nifty coffee kettles, board games,amazingly priced cutches, handbags, clothing for men and women and my love- Jewelry.  I could not believe the pricing too, so good I could shop weekly!I scored a small gold cutch ($16) I can't wait to rock! And 2 vintage-High quality chucky necklaces ($15 & $18) that are unique and I bet I won't see another Like it! The owners who I found out are great friends were very nice and have a great sense of style to pick out such unique items.Highly suggested, especially if you are "seek"ing something that's one of a kind.

2.description: Standing at front door at 6:53, stated hours are till 8 pm.  Glad we went out of our way to come shop here... Be open when you say you are open.

13.description: So the only reason why Seek is not a five-star is because it's very small and there wasn't a huge selection of clothing.  It's more 50/50 clothing and housewares, which would be great if I wanted a pitcher or a frame, but not if I was interested mainly in 1950s dresses.  But for a vintage store, Seek was beautifully laid out and everything looked amazing.  Best of all, it was very reasonably priced.  I walked out with a perfectly fitted red dress at $32, and that was on the higher end of prices in the store.  Then I headed to Mama Hoosier's, so it was totally worth the trip to Noble Square!

4.description: I live in the West Town neighborhood, and I adore this beautiful shop. Everything is so well-curated, and it's such a delight to browse and find gems. One of my favorite pieces I've purchased there was a super-luxe goatskin pocketbook. I've also purchased some terrific little matching resin trays where I put my jewelry at night. Seek is also right next to some delicious brunch places, so it makes for a fun, lazy Saturday of browsing and brunching.

24.description: I was in a hurry but still found some nice items.  The clothes didn't seem too amazing (mostly 70s and later, as best I could tell), but I did find a Pendleton dress in excellent shape ($30).  No detailed size information on most clothes, but there was a measuring tape up front.  The shoes and housewares were more impressive and also reasonably priced.  The store is neatly organized and nicely art-directed.  Glad to have another place to stop in the area (when also going to Dovetail, Permanent, etc.).

6.description: What a gem in the neighborhood! The staff are helpful and friendly...the pieces in the shop are unique, clean and curated beautifully.  It's like a down to earth boutique that caters just to you...there's something for everyone here...make it a destination! PS - Alfie is the best shop dog ever.

22.description: I am obsessed with vintage shoes, jewelry and bags but I hate digging for them and have very little patience - that's why I fell in love with Seek. Everything is so neatly organized and the store is creatively designed and fun. The owners are SO fun and helpful. They had an incredible selection of jewelry and I didn't have to rummage through bins like most vintage store, but they were neatly hung on hooks and in a display case. Tons of clutches and bags neatly organized by color on tables and in shelving units. The prices are RIGHT. They are totally affordable, everything is in perfect condition and they constantly replenish things and keep it exciting. If you make your way to Chicago and like vintage - this is THE spot. I also got a gorgeous charm necklace, shoes and an awesome wallet and I spent next to nothing for great quality stuff.

She said that she liked hearing that. So did I.

7.description: Good selection of fun clothing, accessories, tchotchkes and  housewares from the  1960s--1980s, attractively displayed. A very pleasant and reasonably priced place to shop for vintage!

8.description: Great little thrift store. Plenty of variety in the antique department, oddities, clothing... etc. Friendly staff and ample parking!Picked me up a nice little Norooz mirror for only $14!

30.description: A friend and I walk at least once a week from East Village to downtown to catch up on gossip and of course exercise... I tend to always bring a CC and ID because I never know what I'll see along the way..So glad I peeped my head into Seek and saw some amazing things so I had to walk in to browse even more.  They have everything from nifty coffee kettles, board games,amazingly priced cutches, handbags, clothing for men and women and my love- Jewelry.  I could not believe the pricing too, so good I could shop weekly!I scored a small gold cutch ($16) I can't wait to rock! 3.description: A cute, well laid out vintage store. I didn't find anything I like but I always love perusing through a vintage store, full of knick knacks.It's about a 10mn walk from the Chicago station (blue line). Side note - it's about a 10mns walk to Hoosier Mama Pie Co so go there before or after for a sweet treat!

14.description: OMG, I loved this store. This was the first store we went to on my vintage store tour of Chicago. The place, kind of small, but filled to the brim with vintage goodness. Home items, clothing, anything and everything you could imagine. The prices, the most reasonable that I have found in Chicago. I got a shirt-$10, some leg warmers-$4, and Christmas ornaments-$3. If I didn't have to walk around Chicago for the next few hours, I would have purchase some home decorating items, but who wants to carry that around all day. Walking through Mexican Town to get there was pretty awesome too...crap, I should have bought some pastries.

28.description: I ordered one chicken taco (I know, who orders one taco?), what I got was a meal. Not even kidding. Four tortillas, like a pound of chicken, toppings galore and 4 containers of salsa. I loved my chicken taco (meal)! No frills, seriously. You are literally eating in the middle of this tiny store surrounded by drink coolers and shelves stocked with everything from potato chips to laundry soap. A true bodega. Spanish television blasting while people eat at what seem like card tables and a few stools looking into the grill area. People come in to grab carnitas and chicken by the bucket full so I imagine that stuff tastes pretty good too. Prices are very cheap, especially for what you get. They take credit cards with a small minimum. They didn't make a fuss about it at all but I must say that I felt kind of silly using my debit card in here for some reason...take cash if you can!

1.description: Amazing! A Family run taco joint nestled away on Huron street. Entirely unassuming storefront, I am so glad I stumbled upon this taqueria! I'm kind of confused about the negative review about the chicken burrito... I was cautious at first to order it as per previous user's recommendation. It was actually quite delicious, and pretty unique!You can tell it has a neighborhood feel, but you wouldn't be judged or made uncomfortable if it's your first time there, they'll make sure to make you feel at home. Delicious food, and it is at an incredibly fair price point.

9.description: Best burritos and tacos in the city. I agree with other reviews. Skip the chicken. Steak and chorizo are excellent. Everything is made to order. Family run. Muchas gracias, Rigo, Alicia and family.

29.description: Great chicken and steak tacos! Too bad I don't work by this place anymore. I miss their tacos! Great family that owns this dive-y taco joint.

23.description: Great mexican food, their tacos are just delish! And you can't beat the price.My new favorite mexican join in Noble Square!

5.description: Al Pastor taco perfection! Will definitely be going back to try the barbacoa and the chile rellano!

31.description: I love El Jardin.  Very nice people, very good food.  I'm"m about the taco's.  and the rice and beans are some of the most flavorful goodness.  It was my corner store until I moved away from the neighborhood.  I still go back for the tacos.

25.description: It is trite to give the 'best kept secret' review, but this place really is the bomb. Family owned, great burritos and tacos, for a decent price. If you are in the neighborhood, you are a lucky person.

12.description: I have been here a couple of times.  Their tacos are pretty good. They also have menudo and carnitas by the pound on the weekends which are great for impromptu gatherings.  Their grocery selection is small but it's nice to have a place near by to pick up basic items like condiments, snacks, dairy, etc.

21.description: Who would have ever thought such yummy quality tacos could exist in a place as such. El Jardin is easy to miss driving down Huron, once you realize this is the place you then begin to question your sanity of eating from a place as such...HOWEVER the steak tacos are AMAZING! Oh and don't forget the Spanish rice. This is my go to lunch spot..$5 special incl/ 2tacos & cup of rice anytime of the day! I dare you say different!

16.description: Hands down the best tamales in the entire city of Chicago, quite possibly the best tamales in the state!!! Tamales only on weekends and the pork tamales are the best! Very nice owners and authentic Mexican food.

17.description: Sticking with 4 stars. Went back for lunch today.  This time no sour cream on my tacos.  The steak tacos are BONGOS good!!! AND the waiter/chef guy in the back is my new best friend in Chicago.  Is it gluttonous if I go back for dinner too?

10.description: Taqueria is located on a small tree lined street near Ogden International School. It looks like a small neighborhood convenience store but inside is some of the best Mexican food I have had in Chicago! Great carne asada that has wonderful flavor. Their food is  never dried out and always tastes outstanding. Small selection of items served, but they make everything on the menu taste fantastic! In addition, Taqueria El Jardin is a great value, and great for children and groups.

11.description: These are the BEST TACOS ever! I stop by about once a week to pick up some steak tacos and horchata. Super nice people and they even know my order.

26.description: Good stuff.  Small selection of staples/grocery, and delicious & inexpensive prepared Mexican food.  Tacos and burritos are tasty, quick service, really friendly employees behind the counter all the time.  It's not going to be on Check Please anytime soon, and rightly so, but if you're in the neighborhood, give the veggie tacos and chicken burritos a try.

27.description: Fried. Chicken. Tacos.

0.description: I moved about 10 doors down and never set foot in the place for over a year. A friend of mine finally insisted we go and wow, I was missing out for a long time. You can get a great al pastor burrito for $5. The tacos are served with onion and cilantro and that's all they need. On the chicken side, it's chopped up fried chicken not traditional cuts. That said, it's pretty tasty. For a nice change of pace, grab the dinner plate or a milanesa torta.

20.description: Muy Bueno! This little taqueria is one of those little hole-in-the-wall places that at first you are weary of but after you eat their food you're a fan for life. I recommend the steak tacos with Spanish rice on the side. The quality of the steak is excellent, the portion is generous and most importantly it's cheap!. Many of my coworkers eat here several times a week because they are close by and you can count on the food being great each time.  The owners also make you feel like family, every time I walk in they greet you like a friend with a smile on their face.Even though there are a myriad of Mexican food joints in the area this one is worth giving a try.

19.description: Muy Bueno! This little taqueria is one of those little hole-in-the-wall places that at first you are weary of but after you eat their food you're a fan for life. I recommend the steak tacos with Spanish rice on the side. The quality of the steak is excellent, the portion is generous and most importantly it's cheap!. Many of my coworkers eat here several times a week because they are close by and you can count on the food being great each time.  The owners also make you feel like family, every time I walk in they greet you like a friend with a smile on their face.Even though there are a myriad of Mexican food joints in the area this one is worth giving a try.

2.description: I laughed at the reviews before I came here and learned from my own mistakes even after reading them...Don't get the chicken burrito unless you want fried chicken on it. It wasn't even terrible... but I just generally don't eat fried chicken for health reasons and the menu doesn't even say "Fried Chicken Burrito". Dohhhh. You've been warned!On the other hand, my barbacoa taco was delicious and whatever my friend ordered was very good as well. They're so close to me I won't be able to resist coming back here. I also noticed that they sell avocados, tomatoes, and a few other convenient foods.

32.description: Oh boy nobody has reviewed El Jardin!We call it the "JARdin", pronouncing the "j" and stressing the first syllable. I still haven't tried their tacos; I had their fried chicken once when REALLY hungover, but it wasn't anything special.We use it as a corner store. They have Gatorade and Tylenol packets for hangovers, a few kinds of cereal, a million kinds of chips (it's next door to a school), toilet paper (there's a stick with a hook hanging nearby to help you drag the rolls from the top shelf), canned goods, ramen noodles, Mexican seasonings (I've bought some as impulse buys, and they've been great!) dog and cat food, toiletries, dairy and eggs... you get the idea.You can get bags of ice in 3 different sizes; I just say "the $2 size" and get a Jewel-type shopping bag full of ice from their machine.Once you learn what they have, it's very convenient, just like any corner bodega...They close at 4 on Mondays, FYI.

18.description: Not sure if it was because it was so late at night and they were probably closing up, but the taco and torta we got weren't 'awesome' as we had hoped. Tacos weren't too bad though and torta doesn't have avocado or beans included so we'll leave it at 3 stars and would return if we have to.

13.description: Great hangover food and friendly service. This place has excellent and tasty tacos! Fast service with lost of random odds and ends.

4.description: We live just down the street and this is my favorite place to get an Al Pastor burrito and their street tacos are also great!

24.description: Best food in Chicago. Hands down.

6.description: This place was BOMB. Wow, I wish I had come here sooner! This restaurant is really small and very authentic. When I came here, I had a carne asada torta. My boyfriend ordered the barbacoa torta and we ordered a red tamale and a green tamale. The tamales were so good that I wanted to order like 20 more. The carne asada was hands down the best that I have ever had. It was a little crispy and just super delicious. I will definitely be back soon!

22.description: I'd read other reviews about the potential for this to be a true hole in the wall. Sadly we were underwhelmed. The staff were friendly and the salsa tasty, but the meat was questionable (and I don't mean the pieces were unidentifiable, I mean it must have been sitting for a while at room temp). Very greasy too. The group of guys who came in flashing gang signs also kinda ruined it for us. Sad, because I've been looking for a bodega to call my own too :(.

15.description: These are my favorite chicken tacos in the city.  To me, they are just perfect.  I haven't met anyone who didn't like them.FYI this joint is a mixture of corner store and taqueria (if you want chips, you've gotta buy a bag of chips from the aisle).  The menu is pretty limited, but if you know what you're getting into, you'll be a happy customer.

7.description: Don't get the chicken burrito.I read great things on Yelp and decided to give this taqueria a try. My friend ordered a steak burrito and I got the chicken. His steak was freshly cooked from a beautiful looking marinade with onions diced in. Mine was fried chicken pulled out from a warmer and scraped off the bone. The cook let it sit on the grill for a few moments before tossing it into the burrito.I picked out several bones and lots of gristle throughout the course of eating half the burrito before finally giving up.My friends steak burrito was "good", but the chicken was without a doubt the worst I've ever had.On the plus side, it was only $5 for about a pound of food.

8.description: Solid tacos and tortas with delicious meats or avocado fillings, though I've especially enjoyed the chorizo. This place isn't going to win any awards, but everything I've had here has been good, cheap, and simple. It's an ideal place to grab food when I want a quick bite that I know will be satisfying. An ideal neighborhood bodega.

30.description: I wandered in here last weekend and ordered two tacos: one with skirt steak, and one with the weekend-only special roasted pork. Both were fantastic. The quality of the meat is unsurpassed. The homemade green sauce was fresh and delicious. They made two special-order veggie tacos for my husband, which he liked. This place is the grungiest taco dive I've ever been to (so far), which is saying a lot since I frequent this kind of establishment. It's the perfect place to grab a casual, hangover-curing weekend lunch.

3.description: Been coming here for years, this place is authentic and friendly and has all around very solid execution on their food. GREAT carnitas, the tortas and tacos always deliver. Very good tamales (weekends only, as well as the carnitas). The rice and beans are almost the best part when your soul needs satisfaction. Mad love for my dudes here.

14.description: No frills Mexican at the party store. I LOVE IT! The burritos here are the bomb! Totally under the radar so there's never a wait. Just get it and go.

3.description: I came in to try a juice and I ended up getting a great tasting carrot juice, an oatmeal and pecan milkshake and a avocado pesto panini on potato bread. They have 4 different smoothies, 6 different milkshakes and 19 different juices. I can't wait to try the boost immune system. I'm going to kick Jamba Juice to the curb. This is my new spot!!!

1.description: Kept forgetting about this place just down the street from my casa. Finally got the chance to go in today.  Love the space - it's so nice and bright.  We got the immunity booster and liver cleanser.  Liver cleanse was ok.  Immunity was fantastic.  My husbo got a tamale and said it was super good.We didn't have anything else but I can't wait to get back to try the pesto sandwich.  So glad it's right down the street from me.  I hope it doesn't get "lost" and continues to serve some good healthy stuff!

2.description: The smoothies are delicious and the owner is genuinely interested in pleasing each and every customer. We had the "anti depressant" and the immunity booster" both hits.

5.description: Great and friendly staff!! So happy they are down the block from my job, looking forward to coming and trying everything on their menu!!

6.description: This place is amazing. It's owned by a family and the husband painted and decorated the whole place himself. It's super spacious so good if you have a stroller. The guac is amazing. So is the hibiscus water and pineapple water. And the sandwiches are great. Also really cheap for the quality!!!

7.description: It's a cute and quaint little juice cafe. The service is impeccable and the food is just as amazing!

0.description: I always walk by this place, but finally got a chance to go in. After a great workout, I stopped by for a pick-me-up. I was craving an apple-ginger-lemon juice and even though it wasn't on the menu, she whipped it up for me and it was GREAT! Super friendly and looking forward to going back.

4.description: Tried the number 27 smoothie, and it was delicious. Not only delicious but nutritious. They juice and make everything in front of you, so you know how clean it is. The staff is friendly, and they are great at helping people live a healthy life.

3.description: cool kids only.I stumbled upon this place while on my way to the Aldo Outlet Shop. Not gon' lie... I was hesitant to walk in to this place.....I walked in and found Diesel, Puma, R&R, urban, fresh, shoes, bags, clothing, watches - like all the reviews say, items that the other retailers are not carrying. I purchased a pair of Diesel flats within seconds of walking through the door. (the lady offered me a deeeeecent price!)

1.description: Horrible customer service.  The MANAGER is extremely RUDE and DISCRIMINATORY.  I came in the store to see if they had a knee brace, and  the manager then came around the counter and told me I am injured because I am too fat.  I guess this place used to be a clothing store, now its a running store and I'm not sure how they are staying in business, maybe its some strange front operation.  if not I'm sure they won't be in business too much longer, the store is always empty and service sucks

2.description: Definitely an awesome place to shop! If you happen to be around you should stop by and check it out. The staff is super helpful and are quick to help you with any questions you have. I just feel this place isn't getting as many costumers as it should, so if you're shopping for clothes and you happen to be around, go in and give the store a shot! :-) Great shoe and clothes selection.

5.description: I'm not sorry, what are these reviewers talking about? In my experience, the total collection of wares is flossy urban wannabe, with spotty finds in between. My dear gay boy friend was looking for a non-pretentious pair of shoes and made the begrudged decision to buy an artful Royal Elastics slip-on. The male bespectacled sales mary made it obvious that we were bothering him (in an empty store), huffing and rolling his eyes and avoiding polite eye contact the whole time he was running out shoes for my friend to try on. One pair of which, he brought out the wrong shoe in the right size. You're allowed to be a dick when your working at Gucci, but this "espace" or "eSpace." No thank yous, no smiles- even, after all his "trouble," we actually bought something. Cheer up Charlie, it's just retail. Welcome to the rest of your life. On the plus, the colored banged woman working there was pleasant enough, but get off your cell phone and take over when your co-worker is clearly "overwhelmed."I say, lose the 'tude before your try-hard store closes just like the other goofy failed enterprises on Division. Go down the street to St. Alfreds for shoes, where the dudes appreciate your business.

6.description: I'm a big fan of family/personally owned businesses, and this is one of the best in Chicago, and I'd say THE best for fashion.  The owners are extremely friendly and helpful.  They hand pick everything the store carries, so you'll always be sure to not only find great brands and items that you won't see elsewhere, but they're always willing to give you all the info on that brand that they know.  I bought a pair of shoes here after receiving a 5 minute briefing on the brand history, the wonderful design of the shoe, and tried on 5 pairs of that brand.   All this info came from a male, even, so if you do go there, be sure to talk up the people working - don't assume that they won't be helpful.  They also have good sales at the change of every season.  I also got a coupon a couple times for $10 off next visit.  Great way to keep me coming back! :)

7.description: yesss!!! finally a cool new retail store in this neck of the woods on the corner of Milwaukee and Ashland Ave.  fun, stupid fresh kicks for dudes and ladies that you won't see on everyone and their mother. a plethora of denim, tees, and other stylish urban shoes that are priced either fairly or reasonable.i left with 2 pairs of pumas and a cool track jacket and am very happy with my purchases.  owner drew, is a nice guy too and will give you a thank you discount coupon if he sees that you are a loyal customer.

8.description: Great space and very artistic displays. You can tell that they put a lot of time and thought into every single piece they carry. You'll find a lot of hand-selected and hard to find labels. Definitely one of the better Wicker Park/Bucktown boutiques.

0.description: My new favorite athletic shoe store, I will only buy my shoes here! So much variety, the best prices, and very friendly customer service. It's open 11-6 but the owner will come open it with an hours notice!

4.description: I bought a nice pair of Red Wing shoes and a pair of jeans. Watch for the sales here.. you can get some good stuff. Use cash and you might get a better deal!!"Oh Espace, how you..."Did I ever tell you how I hate reviews that try to be funny starting out that way.

58.description: Their PoBoy sandwich was excellent,I say was because they are using different bread which isn't as good as before,their fries were skimpy. I ordered a salad and it was just lettuce and a couple of tomatoes with a tomato vinaigrette dressing that was very spicy and for 8 dollars it wasn't very impressive.

56.description: I've been going to this place since it opened because I have lived in the area for most of of those years so I recall it being a great place for a drink (especially a bloody mary) and a meal (meatloaf Mondays!).  Today, we went to the roof and they were playing tunes from a streaming music service with COMMERCIALS (unnecessary and obnoxious), a hungover waiter (which was actually fine cuz he admitted it) and meh food. Overall it's going down and I don't think I'll be back unless I'm forced to meet a friend there. Management might try to get the vibe back that it originally had because it's gone now.

29.description: Horrible service. Have a great selection of whiskey but bar tender couldn't help me with a selection shad to wait 10 minutes for someone else who knew what they where doing. Got seated on roof where they serve food and smoking is allowed. Have been waiting a little over 20 minute for server to great us. She had time to take a shot with another table but not even meet us yet. Awful place do not come here!

42.description: Drinks were poured heavy and the po'boys are delicious! Alex the bartender was super cool. He gave my boyfriend a complementary shot of his favorite whiskey. The only thing I didn't like was the menu was so limited.

23.description: Wow. I would get food from here multiple timesPer month when I used to work nearby. Me and my fiancé came and I was excited to get a buffalo chicken sandwich! Oh.my.god. This was probably the worst food experience I have had in an extremely long time. I got my sandwich, it looked burnt and maybe just used the sauce to cover it up. The waitress recommended the fries which turned out to be cold spongy things. Didn't even swallow one.. The cheese curds were pretty cool, not enough quantity for the price and man was it strange biting into that glorious huge curd that was cold on the inside. I'm so sad. :-(

47.description: Chila-killas (w/ home fries instead of rice and beans) were great and the bloodies were pretty good. However, the service was terribly slow.

8.description: I've been in here a few times for a drink and this past weekend my boyfriend and I were driving by and decided to try out some lunch. The food was surprisingly delicious! Pork tacos were flavorful with a good hint of spice, and the chicken sandwich was inhaled by my other half. I would definitely come back and try some more of their food, the biscuits and gravy looked delicious as well, and like something I would like to try - I'm a sucker for biscuits and gravy and very few places make a good plate. The only thing I have to say, which didn't necessarily affect my experience here, is that the bartender was a little bit strange. She took our order with an omelette in her hand that she was chowing down on, and at some point in the hour we were there she put on sunglasses. She also had no qualms about answering her cell phone while bar tending. But, twisted spoke is airing towards the side of divey, so I try just to think of it as added character to the place.

31.description: Headline - It has so much promise; it should be great. It's not.Have driven by Twisted Spoke on many occasions. But, never stopped in. Tonight, the wife and I came in for dinner. Let me start with the good:1. Great location2. The bar is well-stocked, with a great assortment of beers on tap. 3. The rooftop is really nice. Lots of seating. Good views.4. The BBQ Nachos were killer. Definitely a must have. Now, let's talk about the bad:1. The burger was greasy. I mean really greasy. As in greasy enough to turn a toasted bun into something soggy. 2. The po boy was not fresh. A basic rule of "fish" is, it shouldn't smell fishy. My po boy did. Not good. Also, similar to the burger, a toasted roll was rendered soggy. In this case, it wasn't because of grease, but because the slaw was so plentiful.3. The bathroom was disgusting. It's a health hazard waiting to happen. I get that it's a "biker bar", but cmon, the bathroom can't be a toxic war zone. 4. Service was meh. I'd put it on the slow side, not the worst, but worth mentioning. This might be a good place for a great cocktail, but I can't recommend the conditions or the food. A real disappointment.

34.description: Average, ok, decent. Etc. is what I can describe this place as. No big Cons. But no significant Pro's either.  Not sure the biker bar title is accurate- a few pieces of Junk motorcycle parts strewn around is all.

16.description: There is an option to eat at the bar or there is a back room that is more of a restaurant feel. Anything with the pulled pork is a must try! I had the nachos. Meat was so tend and seasoned so well. I heard the pulled pork sandwich is just as delicious. Went on a Thursday night and it was pretty empty so service was great!

13.description: "Broken Spoke"After coming here almost weekly for years, I was surprised on a recent visit to find a drastically cut down menu.  The staff explained that the kitchen was abruptly closed for three days last month and upon reopening that this is what they are now serving.  Gone are most of the signature Mexican dishes that held up one side of the old menu - no more tacos or burritos - sadly, even the remaining standards have been thoroughly mangled.My typical order used to be chicken tacos or a burrito, but left to the limited options, I went back to an old favorite - the BBQ chicken sandwich.  The breast itself was dry and about a half the size of the prior offering and inexplicably they have abandoned their delicious brioche bun for an oversized dry, almost stale style of bread - maybe to compensate for the smaller chicken breast.  Either way, it was terrible.This was all heartbreaking and I left wondering if this was just a bad day, a change in owner, manager, chef or all of the above. With a sunny spring day at hand, my wife wanted to go for lunch outside the following week and suggested the Spoke for some fish tacos.  I explained that they were no longer on the menu and tried to describe my experience from earlier this week and she scoffed at the possibility it could really be that bad.  So we gave it another try...Shockingly, the second experience was even worse. We tried a burger and against hope it showed up on that same inedible bun the chicken sandwich arrived on during my prior visit.  Instead of a regular sliced tomato it came with a pile of grape tomatoes that spilled off the patty like a fistful of marbles. The salad which used to be a generous portion of crisp greens was an undersized and wilted mess.  At $8 it is the certainly the worst value in salads in the city.I took notice at the tables around us and the amount of uneaten food on peoples plates is notable, typically sandwiches and burgers picked apart, to eat around the dry, oversized buns.   Read other recent reviews - post May 1 - and they are all on this same theme. The staff are polite and apologetic about the changes and customer disappointment.  I know most of them from my literally hundreds of visits to the Spoke.  They reported that there has been no change of ownership or chef, just a willful act of abuse on a very loyal customer base.  As we were leaving, there was a table full of police officers eating lunch and it was all I could do to not stop and report a crime. I caught myself, because at heart I am a capitalist and respect a business owner's right to change the product as they see fit - whether to cut quality, reduce portions or raise prices.  I do however also believe in freedom of choice, and like many other regulars will be choosing to not return to this shell of a once great establishment.

11.description: I went to Twisted spoke as part of my chicago burger club monthly event.  I had been before but considered it unremarkable. For a large group (16) they were able to accommodate us on either the roof or in the back room seating are which was nice.  We picked indoors which was good because a monsoon opened up before we were done eating. Our table ordered a few appetizers including the bbq nachos, chili and the guacamole.  The chili comes out in a 9 inch skillet and is a huge portion that includes 2 cornbread muffins. The chili was delicious. I'm not a take leftovers home kind of person but i definitely took the extra chili home and had it for lunch the next day which was even better the second day. We all got the fat boy which comes with free add-ons of cheese, onions, grape tomatoes and lettuce but also offers $1 add-ons of bleu cheese, chorizo, avocado, bacon, and fried egg.Some rock and roll style burger places blast loud music which is tough to have conversations over but Twisted spoke did not on this Tuesday which I appreciated. Overall, a great memorable experience my second time at twisted spoke.

39.description: Love this place!  Drinks are excellent, food is great and very reasonably priced.  Love the rooftop!!!    Always a favorite.

37.description: Fun outdoor terrace seating with a biker theme. I had the chili-killas which were just OK, I've had better. The corn beef hash was pretty good. The bloody Marys  looked good at the table over. Overall the food is forgettable the place has potential.

0.description: I came here with some friends for brunch this weekend and overall had a great time. We ordered the biscuits and gravy, chilaquiles with chorizo, and corned beef hash. The hash was just Ok, but everything else was great. The chilaquiles definitely took the win. We also tried 3 different bloody Mary's and all were great. I like a place with a creative bloody! Mine was made with gin and had 2 shrimps as a garnish- delicious!  They also get brownie points from me for the amount of beer options they have. Tons and tons of good beer on tap to choose from, so you're sure to find something you'll like! The atmosphere is cool, laid-back with a biker vibe. I look forward to returning for the upstairs patio come spring!

38.description: DANGER DRINK HERE AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!! Careful what beer you drink.  I had their porter and had a massive migraine the next day

51.description: Pretty regular/ bland food to me but my hubby loved the burgers the drinks where different I'm not a big bourbon fan so that was an experience in itself we went after hours and the porn was the hairiest porn I've ever seen in all my years .... I gave it 3 stars based on my hubby love of the burgers and the fact they play porn

27.description: Came here for a lunch date today, our sever was a female brunette bartender, very attentive and service was good. I really liked the theme of the place and thought it was pretty cool, def hoping to see it at night. I got the Chilakillas (yes, that's how they spell them), I didn't want and meat on it so the bartender offered avocado which was very kind and a perfect addition. My date got the wings, which were flambéed but that sever seemed less than thrilled to be doing it. My drink was delicious, downside is the cherry that was tossed into it looked a gross shade of brown, and honestly, could do without that. My Chillakillas were delicious, although barely had any eggs on them.

32.description: Where to start?1. We didn't see a server for about 20 minutes and another 20 minutes to get our drinks. 2. One side of the rooftop got service regularly and promptly while our side didn't. 3. Here's the kicker, IT WASNT BUSY. Whenever we did see our server, he kept mentioning that "their system was down." Still doesn't explain the lack of service to one side of the room. There are better bars in the area. Don't waste your time.

54.description: "Broken Spoke"After coming here almost weekly for years, I was surprised on a recent visit to find a drastically cut down menu.  The staff explained that the kitchen was abruptly closed for three days last month and upon reopening that this is what they are now serving.  Gone are most of the signature Mexican dishes that held up one side of the old menu - no more tacos or burritos - sadly, even the remaining standards have been thoroughly mangled.My typical order used to be chicken tacos or a burrito, but left to the limited options, I went back to an old favorite - the BBQ chicken sandwich.  The breast itself was dry and about a half the size of the prior offering and inexplicably they have abandoned their delicious brioche bun for an oversized dry, almost stale style of bread - maybe to compensate for the smaller chicken breast.  Either way, it was terrible.This was all heartbreaking and I left wondering if this was just a bad day, a change in owner, manager, chef or all of the above. With a sunny spring day at hand, my wife wanted to go for lunch outside the following week and suggested the Spoke for some fish tacos.  I explained that they were no longer on the menu and tried to describe my experience from earlier this week and she scoffed at the possibility it could really be that bad.  So we gave it another try...Shockingly, the second experience was even worse. We tried a burger and against hope it showed up on that same inedible bun the chicken sandwich arrived on during my prior visit.  Instead of a regular sliced tomato it came with a pile of grape tomatoes that spilled off the patty like a fistful of marbles. The salad which used to be a generous portion of crisp greens was an undersized and wilted mess.  At $8 it is the certainly the worst value in salads in the city.I took notice at the tables around us and the amount of uneaten food on peoples plates is notable, typically sandwiches and burgers picked apart, to eat around the dry, oversized buns.   Read other recent reviews - post May 1 - and they are all on this same theme. The staff are polite and apologetic about the changes and customer disappointment.  I know most of them from my literally hundreds of visits to the Spoke.  They reported that there has been no change of ownership or chef, just a willful act of abuse on a very loyal customer base.  As we were leaving, there was a table full of police officers eating lunch and it was all I could do to not stop and report a crime. I caught myself, because at heart I am a capitalist and respect a business owner's right to change the product as they see fit - whether to cut quality, reduce portions or raise prices.  I do however also believe in freedom of choice, and like many other regulars will be choosing to not return to this shell of a once great establishment.

48.description: The food has changed...  Menu is half the size and more expensive. The quality is gone and mixed. Service. What happened?

44.description: The menu has been completely overhauled. Our waitress confirmed that the regulars are not thrilled. Unfortunately, this is now off my go to list for bar food.

24.description: 5 stars for the service and vibe. Eduardo said it would be a 15 - 20 minute wait for upstairs, and he was spot on. He handled everything with class and good vibes. All you could ask for. Similar experience with our server upstairs. 4 stars for the solid beer selection. 3 (maybe 3.5 stars) for the guacamole. Want to go back for a burger. And to enjoy the rooftop and quality service again.

7.description: So... I was pretty much a fan of Twisted Spoke at first sight. Who could possibly diss this place after seeing the rad motorcycle skeleton hanging about the entrance?! It's just got that magnetic character and charm.Overall, things about Twisted Spoke that stands the test of time:1) Great outdoor rooftop bar and seating.2) Whiskey Wednesday!3) Can accommodate large groups, especially on week nights.4) Above average food for a biker bar!This is definitely one of those... "I want to be a regular" type establishments. Heck, let's make a weekly Wednesday night of it, eh?

49.description: I used to be a regular visitor....It's bad now. I won't be back. Fired. It's pretty much what it always was, a pretend biker bar. The food was pretty good, but the new menu is terrible. The music is dumb loud. I'm a musician. My job is loud, but if you have to yell when you talk at a bar it's silly. Not hip. There is nothing cool about twisted spoke- it's just bad.

40.description: The Bloody Marys are pretty good, but if you want a decent burger don't go here. We sent our burgers back because they were so overdone and they brought out replacements that were just as bad. For $12 I expect more. The fries were terrible too.

53.description: Service seems to have improved over the past 6 months. Still a good drink selection, with good bloody marys and ciders available. Food is consistently good, but nothing to go out of your way for. Last time I was there, they had a tomato salad dressed available that was AMAAAAAAZING. Think slightly chunky bloody mary mix with a bit of a kick to it, but not so spicy it was out-of-place on a salad.

30.description: The first time I went to Twisted Spoke was last summer for brunch and had an awesome experience. They had an awesome po' boy, amazing Bloody Mary's and great rooftop seating. I never got around to reviewing it then, but if I had, my review would be much, much better. We headed to Twisted Spoke after Pitchfork to grab a drinks and bite to eat with some friends we met up with after the show. It was around 11pm, and there was an insane wait. We were attempting to order drinks at the bar while waiting, but the bartender ignoring us and cleaning glasses that she didn't need at the moment instead. They somehow were able to seat us right away, which we were relieved about. The server warned us that the bar was a bit backed up when we sat down. We had just come from the bar and didn't think it should be that bad. We ended up waiting about forty-five minutes for four beers and one neat pour of whiskey. We placed an order for cheese curds, guacamole and BBQ nachos, which took just as long as the drinks. I don't know if they were slammed from Pitchfork or what, but the amount of time it took to get drinks was ridiculous.I really liked Twisted Spoke before this visit, but they really need to get it together. When we left there were even more people than when we arrived waiting for tables. Like I said, I don't know if it is typically like that, but man, it was insane.

46.description: I should stop going here, except when I'm really really hungover. The food and mood are damn heavy. Or if there's room on the patio in a sunny day. Then I'll go. Because, patios and 2.50$ mystery beers are my jam. The mystery beer is usually Blatz! which is also good. But still, heavy.

1.description: I think I might have a love / hate relationship with the twisted spoke! This particular visit was my first time and everything was just ok. The place is pretty cool everything else just kindof fell a little short. I came in for dinner by recommendation with my BF and two of his buddies. One of the guys and my BF have eaten here on numerous occasions and vouched for the place. Needless to say I was expecting to be blown away.The moment we were handed our menus I thought to myself "wow there is a ton to choose from". I was a little ahead of myself, it was only the drink menu. Great for the guys but I'm more interested in the food and specifically what I was going to order! I should mention that I do have certain food restrictions being a strict vegetarian. That said, the menu is pretty limited. I honestly thought my menu was missing a page or two. Not much to choose from, everything looked great but there wasn't much for me to eat... The guys decided on a Burger, Chicken sandwich, and the Buffalo Chicken tenders. They loved their dishes and overall they were pretty satisfied! I on the other hand got shafted and ordered an Egg Sandwich (it was all I could actually eat) -- not exactly something I would order myself for dinner but when in Rome, right? The sandwich was ok, I'll give them that, but I was hoping for something more than just a Grilled Cheese (so boring!). It was good but I was not impressed, I wanted the experience the guys were having with their meals. oh well. One thing I have to commend the Twisted Spoke for is how fast our food came out. I'm not entirely sure if it was do to the fact that it wasn't as busy or these cooks really know what they're doing! As far as the service is concerned I found it to be somewhat awkward and a little cold. Our waiter was very quiet, I honestly did not understand or hear a single word he said the entire time. I can't really say that he was attentive to our table or any other within our vicinity. Overall I'd come back only if my boyfriend wanted to go, I personally wouldn't come back on my own unless they expanded their menu... The website was down at the time and is still down today. Usually I do my research before dinner, unfortunately on this occasion I came in a little blind.

55.description: Just had one of the worst experiences ever at a restaurant.My wife and I ordered a chicken sandwich with onion rings and a burger with a side salad.  The chicken was a mystery piece that was mostly fat and grizzle.  The onion rings were weren't really onion rings, they were shoestring onions-not as described on the menu (which were filthy and disgusting to even hold).  The burger was served on a giant stale bun with a side salad that had absolutely no flavor.  My wife's warm beer with extra head arrived after the food.  The pickle was very good, but that's about it.  I have never written a review on the internet, but I felt compelled after this experience.  All of this was brought to our servers attention very politely, and she said our bill would be adjusted.  After another 15 minutes of waiting, the chicken was removed off of the bill ($14), and so was the side salad ($2).  The complaints about the burger however were not timed properly according to our server so it could not be removed from our bill. So....$30 for 2 beers and a few bites of barely edible food....bad deal.

9.description: My boyfriend talked Twisted Spoke up for months before we went to visit Chicago. He wasn't lying. I can't speak for the food - we weren't exactly headed here for a meal. But their alcohol...now, that, I can speak for. Their ridiculously long metal bar and awesome bartenders was a great way to spend a few hours getting drunk before 2pm. Started out sweetly with a Road Rash Mary each and beer backs. That quickly turned into a whiskey adventure seeing as they have well over 400 whiskeys sitting behind the bar. Great atmosphere, great selection, awesome time.

26.description: I went to Twisted spoke as part of my chicago burger club monthly event.  I had been before but considered it unremarkable. For a large group (16) they were able to accommodate us on either the roof or in the back room seating are which was nice.  We picked indoors which was good because a monsoon opened up before we were done eating. Our table ordered a few appetizers including the bbq nachos, chili and the guacamole.  The chili comes out in a 9 inch skillet and is a huge portion that includes 2 cornbread muffins. The chili was delicious. I'm not a take leftovers home kind of person but i definitely took the extra chili home and had it for lunch the next day which was even better the second day. We all got the fat boy which comes with free add-ons of cheese, onions, grape tomatoes and lettuce but also offers $1 add-ons of bleu cheese, chorizo, avocado, bacon, and fried egg.Some rock and roll style burger places blast loud music which is tough to have conversations over but Twisted spoke did not on this Tuesday which I appreciated. Overall, a great memorable experience my second time at twisted spoke.

25.description: A different twisted spoke then it use to be. Different crowd, different employees and just higher prices. Motorcycle theme throughout but don't think any bikers come here anymore. Kind of miss the clark location now.

12.description: Incredible Bloody Mary's on a Sunday morning. Eggs, bacon toast?  You can get that anywhere.  But the TS Sunday breakfast choices will take care of any Sunday morning craving...or hangover

59.description: Wait, regulars! They changed the menu and axed the weekday lunch special! Too bad I didn't find this out until I was almost finished with my (now, $20+!) burger! The rolls are now bigger and dry, no more cut tomato slices, some kind of grape tomato mix, and, at least on mine, two tiny bacon strips that didn't even cover the burger. I did get to talk to the manager, who was cool and explained things are in flux, the cost of beef, and listened to my love of my regular meal. But then, he didn't even bring up a small discount or comping my drink. Oh well... Big things: grilled cheese is gone, fish and chips are gone. Bottom line -- this won't be on the lunch playlist any more. Big bummer. Yes, change happens, but for regulars, this doesn't necessarily mean for the good.

21.description: Completely decent. Not something I'd go out of my way to try again but they have decent service, food, and drinks.

17.description: As awlays, excellent service, and excellent food. I love to come here late afternoon for the best stomach filling brunch menu ever.

10.description: I've passed by Twisted Spoke on almost a daily basis for nine years. Perhaps I was intimidated by the biker feel the exterior of the restaurant exudes?
