Food was ready in less than 5 minutes.My main gripe is the portion size - you can get a LOT more food for roughly the same price and slightly better quality at New China. Plus, they include a can of pop in their lunch special. China Court's eggrolls, while tasty, were dinky. The fried rice was also dry and extremely bland. If I'd known, I would have saved myself the calories and opted for plain white rice. And to top it off, my fortune cookie was devoid of a fortune! Where's the love??

14.description: No complaints. The lunch special is the beez kneez. It comes with a large entree and crab Rangoon or egg roll) for under $8. I always get the kung pao combo and I love that I can taste and readily identify the veggies and meat and the shrimps are huge. Plus, the kung pao has a perfect amount of kick. When I'm craving Chinese takeout, I crave China Courts kung pao combo.

12.description: I love this tiny little coffee shop. Kind of hard to find the entrance from the street, but the espresso drinks are really well prepared and the staff is incredibly friendly. I'd give it five stars if they had other flavored syrups besides vanilla!

3.description: Any cafe that uses half wit beans is a win. Tried a cup of drip coffee, an Ethiopian blend, and it was pretty great. I prefer coffee with more complexity, so I enjoyed this spot. Friendly people. I'll have to come back to try the restaurant.

1.description: I work in the building and only go here if I am running late and can't stop somewhere else because it is not the best..... Staff is nice and its a cute shop, but coffee is way too over priced (although I have heard rumors they lowered their prices).Salted Caramel Mocha is awesome but DO NOT GET THE PSL!! The PSL tastes like old lunch meat and leaves a gross taste in your mouth, if they could change the PSL I would go back.

2.description: I work in an office right next door to Cafe Blue. It could not be a better location for an office full of snobbish 20-somethings to indulge in some good coffee during their breaks. Here's the thing that should be scaring Cafe Blue. NONE OF US GO THERE. Look, the coffee is pretty good. I'd even say it's better than average, but it's so outrageously expensive that even a bunch of hip kids can't get behind it. I've been on a iced coffee/cold brew kick the last several weeks and for my $2.50, Dunkin' Donuts has a decent, large cup of iced coffee that I'm more than happy to make a walk down Chicago Ave for. But today, I figured I'd stick close to the office and get a cup from Cafe Blue. Here's what I learned: if you want cold brew from Cafe Blue, you're going to pay over $4 for 16 ounces. Now, Dunkin's coffee isn't as high-quality and they probably don't actually cold-brew the coffee, so let's throw that example out. If you wanted a 16 oz cup of cold brew here in Chicago, you could go to Intelligentsia (nectar of the Gods) and get one for $3.75. Okay, comparable price. How about Starbucks? $3.25 for their new cold brew. And again, the coffee is pretty damn good! I have no qualms with the quality of the product here, just the price of it. I thought it was just my small-town mentality, but speaking with the natives in my office, nobody thinks this brew is worth the price-tag. I know that a proper cold-brew isn't cheap, but I think in this case, Cafe Blue is missing out on a lot of business. The story here is that quality comes at a price, and it comes over quantity. The same could be said for its counterpart restaurant next door, "Jerk." It's good, but is it worth it? No. No it isn't.UPDATE: I've been in touch with the owner of Cafe Blue and Jerk, and he's informed me that they've reviewed their menu prices and have made significant changes across the board. Including lowering the price of cold brew coffee to $3.25, which I consider a fair price. This is a huge step in the right direction for the gang at Cafe Blue and Jerk!

9.description: Great cafe! Coffee is on point and the staff is super friendly. I'm here almost every day. It's not a place I would really sit and hang out at but it is a place I will grab a good coffee from! Cold brew can be purchased in a bottle. Vanilla is made in house. They have an amazing machine that lets you froth almond milk (as I can't have dairy). I love this place! It's a hidden GEM on Halsted.

10.description: 2.5-3 stars.I work in the building that Cafe Blue is in and we were SUPER excited to finally get a coffee place in the building since the nearest coffee is Dunkin Donuts about 10 mins away.. Here are the cons:1. Ridiculous prices- Small Iced Coffee is around $4.15 compared to $2 at Starbucks and $.99 at DD from 3-6PM2. The coffee is pretty bitter and nothing special for the price. That being said, the coffee has a TON of caffeine that gets us through the 2PM afternoon slump. 3. They have very few food options: 2 croissants, a cookie, donuts, and muffins. If you ask them to heat up the croissant they can't because none of the food is made there. It's just delivered and put in the case. Their pros are the convenience of location for people who work in the area along with the customer service. Everyone that works there is very friendly. Cafe Blue has some great potential but really needs to step up their game on their pricing and menu offerings!

13.description: Being a huge fan of Jerk's food, I tried out their cafe next door. Their coffee is amazing, the staff is really friendly, and the pastries are to die for! The island vibes are also an awesome perk, the esthetics are on point. There's an area to work right by the cafe as well that's sectioned off from the Jerk restaurant, they have free wi-fi so it's a great spot to work from. There's plenty of space and it's right by huge windows so lots of natural sunlight. It's now one of my go-to spots to eat and/or work - awesome lunch at Jerk followed by a perfect cup of coffee.

16.description: This coffee BLOWWWS MONKEY ASS. These must all be employees underneath me, because there is no way anyone  would say this about the place. First, prices are outrageous. 5 dollars for a DONUT!!! What is wrong with you people. When did that become reasonable.  I could travel out to Indiana, gather up a couple wheat stacks, drive all the way back to chicago and create my own donut for less than 5 dollars. HA HA! Barista my ass. This coffee is terrible. So bitter. Second, why in the world is an iced coffee 2 dollars more than a regular coffee. Are they magical ice cubes? I think not. If they were I'd have a girlfriend by now. This place is terrible. Dunkin Donuts please run this cafe out of business for everyone that works in the buildings sake.

6.description: This coffee shop is my spot!Do I work in the building? Yes.Have I come here on my day off? Yes.Do you need at least two dollars and some change for a cup of coffee? Yes....welcome to the world of quality beverages. Since they have opened I feel a personal connection with every member of the staff here.They ask me about my day and I ask them about theirs.Their espresso is on point and the iced coffee is great.The pastry selection is small, but the items are always quality.I recently tried the new guava butter on toast and have already gone back twice for it.

15.description: This cafe is everything! Three things I highly expect when looking for a coffee shop:1. Friendly Staff2. Quality of Product3. Atmosphere/ Experience Cafe Blue provided me with a world class experience in all three of these categories. To start, after coming in just once, the staff remembered my name and seemed so happy to see me. When I came in, Abby and Victoria were working. They were incredibly sweet, served me well, and seemed to be a great team. I ordered a red-eye (which is a coffee with a shot of espresso in it). It was amazing! I've been drinking coffee for 13 years and used to be a barista myself, so I know a good coffee or a crap coffee when I taste it, and this coffee was amazing. The price is super reasonable as well. Lastly, the atmosphere of this place is awesome. If you want a comfortable cafe with island vibes and amazing food option (Jerk Chicken) attached to it, this place is FOR YOU! Also, parking is always a dealbreaker for me, but I was so happy to discover that there is plenty of parking around the cafe, and they even have space in the parking lot across the street. FIVE STARS FOR CAFE BLUE. You must try it out, you will not be disappointed!!!

0.description: I'm staying with a friend that lives in the area and needed to get some work done so I headed over to Cafe Blue.It's attached to Jerk, Jamaican style food, which also looks great, I'll have to try them! Back on point, the staff is very friendly and this is the perfect spot to bring your laptop and have an amazing Carmel latte, seriously the best latte I've ever had in Chicago.I also order a chocolate scone, but it was sugar overkill and I couldn't finish it. But still delicious.I'll definitely come back and totally recommend if you're in the area.

5.description: It's finally open!!! This cafe inside of Jerk's brand new storefront has been a long time coming. The sign has been on the front of the building for literally almost 9 months, and although I was a little underwhelmed at it's offerings, the coffee and croissant were very spot on. They only have java and a few pastries, but it's a nice little add on after a plate of Caribbean food for lunch. If you work in the building you're gonna be stoked at a new option at your doorstep.

11.description: I work in right next door to Cafe Blue. It is a great place for an afternoon pick-me-up. Their coffee selection is pretty limited, but good overall (a bit bitter, but not bad at all). I usually go in the afternoons, so there really is no wait. I haven't tried their iced beverages, but it is on my to-do list.

8.description: Average coffee in a surprisingly inconvenient location.Now that Cafe Blue has finally opened after a year long build out, I was excited for a new morning coffee option on the drive to work. The regular coffee comes in one size small/medium for $2.50, and though it is done by local roaster Halfwit it was pretty generic. I guess I had hoped for something more exotic or island-y or... Jamaican? I would expect that any Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee would be tastier and more thematic. To round out the order I got an English Breakfast tea and a pastry. For the tea I was given a cup of warm water and a point to the boxes of tea bags on the counter. As for the pastry, when I asked where they were from I was told "the La Boulange." I wasn't sure if the fellow meant "the the bakery," "the the starbucks," or if he really meant "the La Boulangerie," but wherever they come from it was a tasty (albeit $4) chocolate croissant. Unfortunately as there is no parking on Chicago or Halsted, and no space (or even loading zones) on Green or Superior, I imagine this will end up serving mostly people who already live in the handful of residential buildings at that corner. According to their website there is parking available...somewhere, however as of this morning it wasn't marked nor posted in the store.

4.description: Last time at Jerk, I'd managed to polish off my entire platter of Jerk meats and sides, plus extras. Instead of the usual feelings of dread, shamefulness or disgust after consuming said large quantities of food, I took my accomplished self down the hall to Cafe Blue. Gotta rest and jumpstart the digest[ion]!It's a small, cozy alcove framed with distressed blue shutters featuring Halfwit coffees and an assortment of pastries. My cappuccino was smooth, well-made and STRONG. Just what I desperately needed. I only wish this place had longer hours on weekends because I'd totally walk over for some caffeination and some light work.

14.description: I work in the building, and usually bring my own coffee or stop in route to Starbucks because the prices and size of the coffee is beyond a RIP OFF! They only offer 1 size coffee.... a tiny coffee cup. I decided to give them a second chance after the owner made an effort to reach out to individuals in the building saying he reviewed complaints and made adjustments to the price. The small (only size cup) coffee is still more expensive than a Starbucks venti coffee AND the kicker, I brought my own tervis cup, not creating more trash for the planet and saving them the cost of using a cup. At Starbucks, if you bring your own cup it is cheaper- promoting reducing our carbon footprint. However, at Cafe Blue they will charge you the exact same amount AND refuse to fill your coffee higher than what their cups fill, despite not wasting or using the cost of a cup they wouldn't give a little more coffee or comp the price for bringing my own cup. In asking about this, the woman at the register told me their coffee beans are much more expensive than Starbucks and the cups are basically of no cost. These magic beans do not taste too magical. I still prefer Starbucks any day of the week! Nice to see that Cafe Blue is not environmentally conscious and do not value their neighbors in the  building.... When Love's cafe was here, everyone in the building ate breakfast, got their coffee, and had lunch there. Value your customers, don't rip them off. PS- Today is National Coffee day too, you think you could be generous to fill up my Tervis cup a bit more for a paying customer!!!

7.description: The cafe is consistently quality stuff. I'm more of a fan of the hot bevarages over the iced - the iced ones seem to lose the impact of the bean even with their filtron coffee press. It's filmy and leaves an odd aftertaste. But their espresso and americanos? Fantastic.The staff generally is nice, not the fastest but earnest. If I see 2-3 people in line, I tend to skip it in the morning as they never staff more than one person it seems, even for the AM rush. My only 2 real critiques - they charge for simple syrup - I don't any other that does that. $.30 of sugar placed in hot water and you have to charge so much for it? Your sugar packets left on the counter cost more than that per serving. And lastly, they've made mistakes with my order, and when told there was a misstep, they like to make sure you messed up the order not them. Again, not bad qualms, just something to keep in mind.

58.description: I purchased a drill from this store about a year ago. When I went to use the drill this past weekend I noticed the battery wouldn't hold a charge in fact the charger was telling me the battery was defective.I went to the store in hopes of having them replace the battery.  Upon arriving at the store I spoke with 3 people all who asked me if the drill was registered, if so I could get a battery, if not, no dice.As a last ditch I asked to speak with the manager.  Some person came up to me, and I quote, "You talked to 3 people what do you want from me".  No hi, No my name is, No how can I help you.  Just "what do you want from me".Well here is what I want:1) To be treated with some respect2) To explain your policy on defective goods

56.description: Customer service is pretty hit or miss...basically 75% of the staff could give a fu*k. I've been given misinformation so many times I don't bother asking anymore. However, it might take me forever to find what I need (this place is ginormous) but I always end up finding it! If you can make the trip, I suggest the Home Depot in the South Loop, the staff is way more helpful and so are the customers (cute construction dudes offering to help find stuff...you can't beat that).

29.description: Every Home Depot seems to be out of moving boxes. We called ahead and they assured us they had every size and they did!This Home Depot location is better than most customer service wise. When we arrived we were looking for a cart and the sales girl notice and said wait right here and got one for us. Besides that there was always someone there offering there assistance without being overbearing. Just like it should be we were in and out with no problem.

42.description: 40 minutes to get some paint. Slowest checkout in the world. Service at the South Loop store seems to be much better. They must pay the employees in nuts and bolts, because no one seems happy to be there...

23.description: Dear Home Depot CEO,Please "undercover boss" this Home Depot location.  WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!!  I am talking both in the store and over the phone.  You CAN NOT get a question answered to save your soul!  I had a totally suck experience while I was in the store....couldn't get anyone to help me, finally found someone who told me it wasn't his department.  He went to find someone for me....never returned.  Long story short left after two hours.  For the last 2 days I have called to ask a question....was told the same thing, not my department then would be transferred to a department where you were asked to leave a message.  Was not returned.  I was on hold over 10 minutes tonight to speak to the manger.  Finally hung up.  So Mr. CEO, I want you to know not only did this location loose my business, Home Depot in general lost out on a $50,000 remodel project.

47.description: They make everything so easy. Always earner to help. Great customer service for returns. I like doing business w/HD

8.description: Came in here to get some bathroom tile cut on a few occasions. Curtis assisted us each time and did a PHENOMENAL job. He was meticulous and sharp (no pun intended) and patient. I live closer to another Home Depot but make it a point to come to this one instead. Curtis is awesome.

31.description: At the beginning of 2014, I had a very pleasant experience at this Home Depot location in purchasing materials for the buildout of my new business location.  Even in a chaotic and busy environment it did not require much effort on my part to find assistance.Last week in an effort to reinvigorate my home I set out on a mission to build a new patio for my backyard and replace the aging entry door to the house.  I was helped by a wide variety of associates throughout multiple visits and I can't express enough how happy I was with the store's associates.They've earned the 5 stars.

34.description: I mostly receive great advice & services at various Home Depot stores and have written positive reviews to recognize those stores, but this recent experience at store #1912 inspires a different kind of review as we wasted 2 hours of our time here when we had so much work to do for our project.The store manager here is just plain lazy and incompetent. I can forgive incompetency to a certain degree, but when you are too lazy to make an effort to solve an issue, it is unforgiveable.The issue on hand is relating to a warranty exchange of a broken water heater. The manufacturer has already approved the warranty exchange because the warranty is still in effect. We were told to just swing by Home Depot to get a new replacement. When we arrived, the store manager told us that there is nothing he could do as he needs a RGA number in order to process the return, but they are closed until Monday. We were not the only ones with similar warranty exchange requests at the store. There were several people behind us with the same request for different products. Not getting anywhere with this store manager, we proceeded to just call Home Depot's corporate line directly. Diana at the call center was able to patch in the manufacturer and got an authorization under the water heater's serial number. Once approved, the store manager just had to enter the serial number into the computer system to process the warranty exchange. We passed this information to the store manager and he reluctantly processed the exchange. He didn't seem too happy about doing it either, though we can't understand why. In summary, the store manager was either too lazy to make that phone call, or he was too incompetent to realize that's all he had to do. Either way, wasting 2 hours of a customer's time and finally having the customer solve an issue that should have been owned by the store is completely unacceptable. What a horrible experience.

16.description: Not a fan of big box stores, but almost every time I come in this place I find what I need and get the assistance I need from people who want to make sure that is the case.. And on a couple of occasions I have gotten customer service that has been WAY beyond what you would expect. I would like to give a special shout out to the rental department which helped me out enormously when i stupidly thought I could handle a DIY project that turned out to be more than I was ready for. And  in Flooring the 'big moustachioed  expert' who's name starts with A went way way out of his way to hook me up.. And for both of those events I am eternally grateful and forever a fan of this particular big box store,

13.description: They had the slowest customer service I have ever seen. Also the employees don't want to work. They are always on their phones and aren't paying attention. They never want to help and feel annoyed when you ask something. When you do ask something they rarely know the answer. They're not smart at all and I don't say that lightly.

11.description: Every Home Depot seems to be out of moving boxes. We called ahead and they assured us they had every size and they did!This Home Depot location is better than most customer service wise. When we arrived we were looking for a cart and the sales girl notice and said wait right here and got one for us. Besides that there was always someone there offering there assistance without being overbearing. Just like it should be we were in and out with no problem.

39.description: These 5 stars are for Edgar! He rocked in the plumbing department helping to quickly fix what could have been a disaster. He was friendly, knowledgeable and all at 9:45p on a Sunday. THANK YOU!!!

37.description: I have been going to Home Depot on North Avenue since it opened. I have remodeled my house several times, and I have spent a lot of time and money there. The products, service, and prices are excellent. The management team is especially helpful, especially Troy. I very much appreciate the time they take to make sure I get what I need. We are lucky to have Home Depot in our neighborhood.

0.description: I already stated in review of the Home Depot on North, that i'd reserve the almighty Hot Dog at Home Depot a stage all its own, so here it is.If you've lived in Chicago for at least a decade or more and *haven't* purchased a HD Hot Dog, then you need to return your Chicago card and just go back from whence you came. And then hang your head.  Like putting ketchup on a Hot Dog, it is damn near criminal. Chicago style only, paired with a coke/sprite and Jay's Chips, it makes the HD trip complete.  It might just be that due to all the work you're doing that brought you to HD that makes it so damn good but whatever it is, you gotta love it.

38.description: We've always used this Home Depot for picking up stuff that we order online. M orders things and I pick them up. Easy peasy. No need to have an anxiety attack in a maze of overwhelming aisles.But then Black Friday rolled around... I was planning on calling Abt to buy a whole kitchen of Samsung appliances but then the building maintenance man recommended Home Depot. He said that they always have the best deals. He also recommended going in person because then a sales person could give me a deal for buying a bundle (or something like that).I went around 6:45/7:00 AM and had my appliance measurements in hand. I also knew the exact models and prices for my desired Samsung appliances at Abt.Home Depot had a decorated table with hot coffee and two employees smiling and handing out cups. I was cheerfully greeted and directed to the appropriate section for my purchase. Getting there was a straight shot.The woman who helped me was sweet as pie and seemed out of place in a hardware store except that she had an astounding warehouse of knowledge about her department. She quickly researched my Samsung appliances and determined that Home Depot's prices for the same models were a dollar cheaper. THEN, she had the Whirlpool guy work his magic. I saved $100 overall by buying a Whirlpool dishwasher, microwave, and stove. Next, I got a Samsung fridge and saved another $100! Everything I bought was over 30% off and I got free delivery of the new stuff and hauling of the old stuff. I didn't have to pay sales tax on two of the appliances because they're being installed. OH! And I got 50% off of installation.What was super about the whole experience was that it was SO easy. The sales people worked hard to figure out how to get me the best buy. They compared specs, discounts, and bundle prices. I just stood there. That's MY kind of shopping!

51.description: Worst home center I've ever visited.  This place is so poorly managed that I would rather go 10 miles out of my way than shop here.  I made the mistake of getting a 12 ft Christmas tree this weekend.  They had no stands that could support such a large tree so I had to drive all the way to a place on Foster and Clark to get one and come back.  As of this morning the tree is not drinking much water and I'm very worried about its ability to stay green until Christmas.  I've been here many times.  First, if you need help, good luck finding someone.  Second, if you do find someone, they rarely know how to help you or where the item is you are looking for.  GREAT location but needs real management to turn it around.

27.description: The best I build my restaurant from home depot the best ever anything you need they help you with it to fix thing or build thing I been going there for the last three years

32.description: They usually have everything in stock but the staff is horrendous.  Forget it if you want to return something since you'll wait in line for 30 minutes (no rush to help anyone) and no greeting or personality. Very unwelcoming. It's also annoying that there's people that stand by the front door in small groups asking if you need help as soon as you walk in.....no, I just walked in but you can check back in about 10 minutes once I've had a chance to look around since that would make more sense.

54.description: HEY, ASSHOLES WORKING OUTSIDE IN THE PARKING LOT--- next time you cat call me I will kick down the ladder you are standing on.I don't know what they were setting up outside (I think the Christmas tree tent?) but I walked through the parking lot twice and both times I was cat called and harassed by the guys working. All of them. You've got to be kidding me. It is one thing for your average pervert on the street to do it, but Home Depot employees who are on the job? Are you serious?This is my local Home Depot and I am an avid DIYer so I am here a lot. Like most home improvement places I am spoken to condescendingly, presumably because I am a woman. Since I actually know what I am talking about I generally disregard that. This is one of those places where, as a female, you will be spoken to like a child but treated like a piece of meat. I know some women are into that sort of thing, so enjoy. I had to rent a drill and I brought the drill to the power tools section and asked the guy working which drill bit I would need. He handed me perhaps the only drill bit that isn't compatible with the drill I showed him. I unfortunately did not figure that out until I walked all the way home. All in all this place is fine, but recently I've had some bad experiences. This location is within walking distance from where I live, but after my last few experiences with Home Depot I think the drive to Menard's or Lowes might be worth it.

48.description: This particular location has some very good customer service much like the rest. One thing I was impressed with is the selection at this particular store. They seem to have a couple 10000 more square feet in here and you can definitely find whatever it is your looking for. Also, the parking lot is easy to get into and out of so you won't be waiting forever for cross traffic to clear to get around.

44.description: This review is for Alicia in millwork.  This evening we were ordering a custom window and door. Alicia helped us through the process and was very knowledgeable. She was also the kindest and most pleasant sales associate I have come across in a long time! I will be back to this store because of her.

24.description: Went in to buy a bunch of plants for a new home.  I approached Marlo Brown in the garden center to ask for some advice.  He not only answered my questions, but helped me out with everything from getting delivery set up to picking out my plants to purchase and keep separate in the back of the store until delivery was made.  Great customer service from this guy- if you need help, find him!

7.description: I was pleasantly surprised at Home Depot today! An employee approached me and my sister-in-law while we were browsing for ideas for the guest bathroom. It turns out, he was one of the managers and he really went above and beyond to help us find what we needed. Remodeling a home can be very stressful but he made the experience a pleasant one. Thank you Nick! That's what management customer service should be all about. Thank you!

49.description: I love this Home Depot, it's like my happy place.  Every time I go in there, there are employees everywhere smiling, saying "Good Morning", and offering help.  I'm not a contractor, or even really into building stuff, but they always have what I'm looking for and someone to help me find it.  Today, I was helped by four different people (by my own choice, they all offered to walk me to another area) and my shopping trip was a breeze.  I was in and out in a matter of minutes.  I kind of want to work there sometimes.

40.description: I am no Fix-it-Felix or Bob-the-Builder, but when one decided to take on the status of Garish Gardener I decided to hit up the emporium for all things veggie gardening. While through my trials and tribulations, I've found almost everything needed: containers for varying stages of growth, stakes, coco liners, fertilizer, and soil (although I go to Old Town Gardens now for the nice organic stuff). Every time I've been there, I always get asked by a multitude of staff if I need help finding anything. Friendly and efficient. Just how this girl likes her hardware stores.

53.description: We ordered some Pergo flooring from Home Depot. It turned out to be one of the worst customer experiences of our lives. The flooring arrived mostly damaged - as if some disgruntled employee scratched them coming off the line. Home Depot said it would take several weeks to replace them so I said pick it up and give us our money back. Six phone calls and  ten days later, they finally picked it up. That was three weeks ago. To date, I still have not been refunded - although I have been assured at the end of each of the seven phone calls since they picked it up that it has been taken care of. I will NEVER do business with Home Depot again.

30.description: Just went here yesterday w a friend of mine. I wanted to do a little gardening on my balcony and knew next to nothing about it. When we got there we were pretty overwhelmed by all the options and the people. Enter Omar. He was so helpful! He told us everything we needed to know about potting plants and vegetables. He walked w us throughout the entire area until we were satisfied w everything that we had. He even helped us figure out which flowers would look best together! He was a great customer service representative from start to finish. I'm so glad we found him because he truly made our experience a positive one when it could have easily been extremely difficult and stressful. Next time I need anything at the Home Depot I will ask for Omar!

46.description: Let me be frank- Home Depot doesn't interest me. As a self-admittedly not very independent woman, I don't know what to do with more than half the stuff in here and honestly I don't care to learn. That being said, this Home Depot location is great. It's spacious, clean, well organized, and the staff is always so friendly and helpful. I have even managed to come here alone and find what I need. I always get flowers here, and the cleaning supplies and paper products are a great alternative to buying at an overpriced grocery store. Also, and maybe most importantly to me, Home Depot is dog friendly. My little kiddos love to come here with me and they get a hotdog on the way out from the stand by the cash register. Makes the whole shopping experience that much more enjoyable for everyone!

1.description: My wife and I bought a new house and thought we would measure our windows and go into Home Depot to buy window treatments. We met with a sales associate and they helped us pick out some window treatments and they informed us that we should pay to have them measure. This will alleviate our responsibility of the treatments were measured incorrectly. It made sense. They came out and measured and we bought the window treatments. When they installed our window treatment, we were informed that they weren't going to look the way we wanted and that they weren't measured properly (horizontal instead of verticals) which didn't make sense to us. They knew what we were buying. In any case they look like crap. There is a gap in the middle and the sides.  The window treatment in our living room cost us $1600 before installation and tax. When we called it took 2 hours to get through. They kept hanging up on us and transferring us. Then I spoke to Ella Louis a manager that called me back. She would only talk in circles and said they needed to come out to re-measure and fix the blinds. I didn't know why but I agreed. Once they came and re-measured I called Ella Louis and asked why, since they couldn't fix the blind, they didn't take the blinds back. She kept talking in circles and blaming me for the mis-measurement. I know have damage to the window frame from the drilling of the blinds and I can't get a straight answer from anyone at Home Depot. I just want to be refunded my money and these blinds out. Do not go to Home Depot! This experience has been terrible. I would give no stars if it was possible.

55.description: Two words. Vienna Beef. Our Home Depots have homegrown hot dogs and they don't serve em with ketchup. Ample, non-skimp celery salt, whenver I am hungover and told I need to fix something I groggily stagger over to Home Depot, buy overpriced screws/fixtures/etc, and get a hot dog, and my day is better.

9.description: This store may be sufficient for a quick stop to pick up any project materials but it falls short when it comes to installation.  DO NOT use them for door installation.  Not only do they charge an arm and leg but they leave you hanging for weeks.  Scheduling the measurement appointment was a breeze.  Guy came out a few days later.  Store calls to finalize the details and is unable to provide the doors I SPECIFICALLY requested when talking to the measurement guy.  He told me to call him back if I don't hear from him in 24 hours.  Call him back...?!  That is his job.  I've since tried to call 30 times.  Not a single answer.  Only voicemail.   I had to call to speak to someone in flooring, so that they could relay my message to a manager since the door department is never working.  It shouldn't have to be this difficult.

26.description: CARPET/ FLOORING DEPT REVIEW:My husband and I picked up carpet samples in the North Ave store and brought them home. I went to the Home Depot website to estimate the cost of the carpet purchase. I then tried calling the N Ave store to discuss purchase/ schedule required in home measurement I order to have product warranty. I was routed and re-routed over the phone for more than 30 minutes so I gave up that angle.Knowing there was a $37 installation special promoted online and in store, the next day I went back into the North Ave Home Depot store to schedule the carpet install measurement / move forward with my carpet purchase after deciding on a carpet and color. No one was working in the flooring department the morning I went to do this (9:15 AM week day arrival).I waited for 20+ minutes in the department without assistance along with other customers and called the store on the phone while sitting in the store to try and get someone's attention. My call was routed and re-rerouted continuously while I sat there. Employees not qualified to assist in the department walked through the department and called for an MOD to come to the department. No one qualified bothered to show so I left. In my car I tried calling the store again to talk to a manager. I finally did. He apologized and said multiple people in that department had called off today. He said due to my trouble he would have the "required" $35 in home measurement done at no cost to me and someone would call to schedule shortly. I need the in home measurement in order to maintain the warranty.7 hours later I received a phone call from someone who went through every detail of my install to provide me a quote. This was after I told him exactly which carpet I wanted and the SF of the room.  I asked him simply for a date/ time for a measurement in home and reminded him of the $37 installation special and comp'd in-home measurement due to issues in store. All was new news to him. After a 20+ minute phone call and reminding him the in home measurement was supposed to be at no cost, he provided me with a carpet quote I didn't ask for that was over $200 than what I had estimated on the Home Depot website. He told he was supposed to provide an inflated quote over the phone but that the actual quote with measurement should be lower. (WHAT??) We ended the call with him committing someone would call me on the day of my measurement between 7-9 AM to provide me with a time window. I received an email welcoming me to their install system with a contact number and email address.Today, the day of appointment no one called as promised (am I surprised?). I proceeded to inquire about my time window. I called the store and was routed and re-routed through the lines again, no luck. I sent an email to the contact email from the "welcome" notice and I called the phone number in the welcome notice. On the call and later via email I was notified that I actually wasn't scheduled for an appointment today because the man I spent 20+ minutes with who "scheduled" the appt never completed it or processed the fee payment (really?). I have scheduled a next day appt with Empire Carpets for an in home measurement tomorrow.

25.description: Excellent service.  Usually have desired merchandise in stock. Plants are well cared for.  Free parking lot

12.description: I signed up with two friends for the woodwork workshop. We were supposed to do a hanging flower plant stand.We got there 10:10 for our 10:00 workshop. Our mistake. They thought no one was coming, so never bothered preparing it. So after some back and forth, we finally start the workshop at 11:00.The first guy was really nice, but didn't really know what he was doing. After building the first stand, another guy came up. He really knew what he was doing, and showed us how to properly use most tools. We left with 3 great plant stands - and they were free! We just paid for the paint to finnish them latter.We'll be back for more workshops!

59.description: This Home Depot is fine.  I don't find the staff to be as friendly or accessible here as the Roosevelt Road location, but this is still a fine Home Depot.  This store is one of the larger Home Depots in the city, and they seem to have more high end options than the other Home Depots.  (So if you want high end appliances, this is a good place to come).

21.description: The service desk here is absolutely awful... I felt like I was talking to the DMV.  I was just trying to find the smoker I ordered that they states online that they have 2 available.  They cancelled the order and did not help any further from there.  I called just to find out where one might be available and when, and the guy said "Wellll... we're not Amazoooon".  Way to brighten everyone's day, customer service.  You suck.

17.description: We've always used this Home Depot for picking up stuff that we order online. M orders things and I pick them up. Easy peasy. No need to have an anxiety attack in a maze of overwhelming aisles.But then Black Friday rolled around... I was planning on calling Abt to buy a whole kitchen of Samsung appliances but then the building maintenance man recommended Home Depot. He said that they always have the best deals. He also recommended going in person because then a sales person could give me a deal for buying a bundle (or something like that).I went around 6:45/7:00 AM and had my appliance measurements in hand. I also knew the exact models and prices for my desired Samsung appliances at Abt.Home Depot had a decorated table with hot coffee and two employees smiling and handing out cups. I was cheerfully greeted and directed to the appropriate section for my purchase. Getting there was a straight shot.The woman who helped me was sweet as pie and seemed out of place in a hardware store except that she had an astounding warehouse of knowledge about her department. She quickly researched my Samsung appliances and determined that Home Depot's prices for the same models were a dollar cheaper. THEN, she had the Whirlpool guy work his magic. I saved $100 overall by buying a Whirlpool dishwasher, microwave, and stove. Next, I got a Samsung fridge and saved another $100! Everything I bought was over 30% off and I got free delivery of the new stuff and hauling of the old stuff. I didn't have to pay sales tax on two of the appliances because they're being installed. OH! And I got 50% off of installation.What was super about the whole experience was that it was SO easy. The sales people worked hard to figure out how to get me the best buy. They compared specs, discounts, and bundle prices. I just stood there. That's MY kind of shopping!

10.description: Came in on a busy Saturday for a list of items needed for a home project. Que helped me find everything on my list and was super helpful and friendly. Home Depot customer service has come a long way!!

5.description: Was stranded, phone was on 8%, and was put on hold for 12 mins without anyone answering the phone to answer a simple question. Took a cab there, and was told they didn't carry what they just told me they did. Worst customer service in over three departments. Not reliable or trustworthy.

3.description: I definitely feel something different going on here.  The service Level has improved dramatically. I've been in a few times recently and noticed friendly,attentive, personal people proactively offering to assist me.

35.description: Truly the most understaffed and surly (perhaps because of point 1) staff of any HD I have been to in any city, any where. The one on Elston is infinitely better.... or the True Value on Milwaukee.  Having just moved into Bucktown less than a mile away, we will drive farther than needed just to avoid this service hell hole

19.description: Excellent service.  Usually have desired merchandise in stock. Plants are well cared for.  Free parking lot

28.description: I've called this place three times today. And every time I've actually been hung up on. So I've never been able to actually speak with anyone. Disappointing. Poor customer service.

45.description: If you know what you need, the store isn't bad, but the employees are pretty terrible.  It took them over 30 minutes to realize that their stock room was too messy to find items from an online order.  I've never seen employees "give up" at their job before.It also took over 20 minutes for a manager to come by, and ultimately I got tired of waiting and just left.

33.description: I love this Home Depot! I live in the South Loop but come to this location (yes six miles further) as the staff here are much friendlier and helpful. It's such a different vibe when you walk in this store. It feels like the staff genuinely want to help you. I do a lot of DIY and usually love it, but whenever I go to the South Loop I genuinely feel deflated and leave. Today Tevan helped me in the wood department and he was great!!!

43.description: This Home Depot always has what we need, they have long hours, and they are nice enough.  Is it my dream to have to frequent HD?  No... but it's not half bad.  That being said, I'll only come here when the one 2 blocks from my house is out of something.

2.description: I've had variable experiences at Home Depot. Sometimes, however, an employee makes such a difference, that it pretty much makes up for any sub par assistance previously received. This was my experience.Tony, who works (manages maybe?) in the garden center is probably the most helpful Home Depot employee I have ever encountered. He was incredibly knowledgable about everything you can think of, from paint, to furniture refinishing, to mold elimination. He probably saved me from contracting a terrible upper respiratory infection and convinced me that I needed to move out of my new apartment that had a terrible mold problem (that I thought I could fix) instead of trying to sell me a bunch of products. He also helped me understand the psychology of my slumlord. They should just put him in charge of the whole Home Depot.

18.description: The service desk here is absolutely awful... I felt like I was talking to the DMV.  I was just trying to find the smoker I ordered that they states online that they have 2 available.  They cancelled the order and did not help any further from there.  I called just to find out where one might be available and when, and the guy said "Wellll... we're not Amazoooon".  Way to brighten everyone's day, customer service.  You suck.

41.description: I ordered carpet from Home Depot and it was installed yesterday.  There were definite ups and downs of the experience, but overall the one aspect that stayed consistent was their customer service.  They did everything to help me bring the price down and find discounts.  Vrenly specifically, was awesome.  She followed up with me and helped me out with everything.  The installation was easy stuff, in and out in 2 hours and the carpet is fantastic!

52.description: DO NOT GET KEYS MADE HERE (or any Home Depot for that matter)!After finding two Ace Hardware stores closed today, I finally gave in and visited this Home Depot. Mind you, I have had terrible experiences with the key counter in the past, but I was desperate. After waiting ten minutes while the key counter employee stood playing with a remote control helicopter as his friend watched, I finally spotted another employee and asked if anyone could help me. They shouted over to the helicopter-flying employee who took a couple more minutes to land the helicopter before taking my key. He couldn't wait an additional 3 minutes for my keys to be finished before he started flying the helicopter again. He handed me the keys, did not say a word, and walked away to continue his adolescent escapades. I opted for self checkout so I could leave the store as fast as possible. I immediately tested the keys when I returned home to find that one of them was entirely useless. It did not work a single lock of the four locks it should fit. Thankfully the other key worked with a little bit of finesse. Overall, this was definitely not my best experience at Home Depot. I would also not recommend visiting the key counter at the Home Depot on Elston near Logan Blvd.

50.description: This is only regarding the plant department of the store.  I purchased a Mother-in-laws tongue from them late in the summer 2012.  3 months later I had fungus gnats all over my apt.  All my other plants had been with me for 4+ years, so I know it came from that one.  2 exterminators and a re-potting of all my plants did nothing.  I had to throw the plant out.  Totally dissappointed.  Will NEVER purchase a plant from their store again.

4.description: Home Depot....where I go to day dream about all the projects I want to do. They always have everything I need, and everything I don't need, ha! Great store, clean and professional.

6.description: Let me count the ways I love this home depot. Every single staff member I meet is more than helpful. This morning I returned a drill without a receipt. I brought in the two credit cards I would have used to buy the drill and all I had to do was swipe the right card, and bingo! The returns prison was happy to help. No anger, no agitation that I didn't have the receipt in hand.

22.description: This place is usually a nightmare to find things in and it's usually hard to find someone to help.  However, the last time I went in there I had a real snafu with signing up for the Home Depot credit card, and the manager (Roger?) took the time to help me out and addressed my concerns.  He even gave me a discount!  Thanks, Roger!

15.description: Absolutely horrible store. This is the third time I called to check stock and they told me the product was in and it wasn't. When I complained they told me that's how their inventory system works

57.description: The Same.

20.description: Needed help with 4 bags of dirt.  I've bought all my spring plants at this Home Depot for years, and until now I didn't need any help.  Different this year.  I have cancer and just had surgery so can't life very much.  Spent over $200.00 and then waited several minutes for someone to help with the dirt.  Asked the clerk.  Her response...I'm working on it right now lady.  She was helping someone else, however Home Depot doesn't have many clerks around, so not sure if she wanted me to just wait endlessly. As I walked away, she said "bitch" loud enough for everyone around to hear.  I have never before run into a clerk who was so rude and insulting.  There are lots of places in this city where one can buy anything you can get in Home Depot.  I will never go back into that store.

36.description: I never post on here but I would be remiss if I did not.......I was looking for a very expensive Moen kitchen faucet, shower head, and a new bathroom sink. Let's just say the service was pretty piss poor and pathetic.  I even tried to speak to a manager ( I won't say his name) and got no solution on certain issues.  I have been here before and the employees just don't  give a Fu!k.

14.description: To keep it short, it's Home Depot. You're not going to get the best service, if at all. I somewhat dreaded having to call to ask if an item was in stock/stores or just online. The customer service rep was abrupt and slightly rude, she put me on hold without telling me, or telling me why. Which, unfortunately, is what I expected. After calling the South Loop HD I was told that item was not found in stores, only online. Fortunately, this customer service rep wasn't rude and gave me an answer. She also had a hint of friendliness to her voice.

12.description: I would think of something positive to say about this place, but lying would probably give me bad karma or something. Its small, its dingy, and the staff I dealt with was pretty laughable. There's no sense wasting time here when you could buy books from Amazon at a much lower price and without the ordeal of incompetent salespeople.

7.description: This is the oldest occult book store in the world, having been around in Chicago longer than any other store, even in England.  The staff is very knowledgeable, the selection of books is pretty good (and, if they don't have it they can order it).  There are also rare books behind the counter, if you are looking for really scarce items.  Rounding things out are such things as candles that are specially decorated and "worked" for particular goals.  This is the store that was the template for the Jim Butcher's Harry Dresden series and has the classic look of an occult bookstore.  Highly recommended.

19.description: This place is the real deal.  I bought a pendulum here.  The clerk was informative and helpful, and he knew a lot about occult stuff.  Also, there were spooky noises coming from the basement.

1.description: I often frequent bookstores and other venues seeking rare, esoteric books. Maybe I caught them on a bad day but the book selection was rather pedestrian: used psychology books, some history books, but nothing especially useful or interesting. They have a small selection of candles and jewelry, and some herbs in jars behind the counter, such that you cannot easily browse, but must know what you are looking for so they can access it. I had hoped this store would be a better resource, and I may check back there again sometime, but it doesn't seem to vibe that well with me, nor have the things I am usually looking for.

2.description: The name of the Occult Bookstore is a bit misleading.  I was expecting the Powell's of the occult world, something you'd find on Diagon Alley sandwiched between Olivander's Wand Shop and the Leakey Cauldron.  Or at least stacks of books with Old Norse lettering emblazoned on the spine. Unfortunately, the book selection was disappointing.  I was looking for something pretty basic--an encyclopedia or dictionary or overview of East Asian mythology--and the place was dry.  I'm pretty sure the tiny public library in my oppressively Catholic suburban hometown has a better selection of occult books than this place.Rather, this particular Occult Bookstore seems like more of a meeting place and supply shop for local occult practitioners.  There's a curtained-off area in the back, probably designated for card readings and such.  The people who work there are really social and we wound up having an hour-long conversation about the Haitian Voudou exhibit currently at the Field Museum at the time.  I plan to go back simply to chat them up. The hours posted to the website are incorrect--we arrived around noon only to find a handwritten note scribbled on the door saying they'd open at 2pm, so we wound up trekking back to the Loop to return at 7pm.

9.description: I find their book selection a little too heavy on the fluffy stuff, such as banal self-improvement books disguised as spiritualist and aimed at the vague new age type person, or astrology/tarot reductionism, but I have been able to find a few gems hidden here from time to time, such as John Michells CIty of Revelation and an Aryeh Kaplan book. But I have yet to see any Henry Corbin, Jocelyn Godwin, Rene Guenon, Julius Evola, Phillip Sherrard, David Fideler, Paul Foster Case or Leonora Leet to name a few.I guess I should state what is probably already obvious, and that is that I am a definite bookworm and have little to no interest in all of the "practical" stuff they sell, so if you are interested in that, you'll probably get a lot more out of the store. My main problem with the place is that it is called a bookstore, but books seem to be less than half of their business. It's not a bad place, and I probably wouldn't have found the John Michell book anywhere else in Chicago, but I don't feel compelled to check their stock very often.

6.description: This is definitely a solid place, mostly for their rare finds. Their basic selection is decent- nothing really outstanding, but behind the counter they've definitely go some dusty old tomes that beg to be devoured. The pricing is steep, but probably because they don't move enough volume to bring prices down.They've got some very cool stuff here, and it seems to be a gathering place of sorts for various groups in the Chicago area. It's worth checking out, especially in this day and age of Kindles and defunct Borders stores. Support your local bookstores, kids!!!

18.description: I had a weird experience here. I went in to look at some books ( which were way overpriced). There was a man telling a woman how to cast spells to get the man she wanted. I left paying around $30 for books I should've ordered online. I did get a great yoga book  though. I bought some nag champa and left. I don't think I will return.

10.description: This is not a store that I will ever visit again.   Their book selection leaves much to be desired and there was not much else there.  I wonder if the owner or employees cleanse the used book they get and put up for sale or if they allow the energies from the previous owners to linger.  As a practicing Witch I was picking up on some extremely negative energies and feel the need to do some cleansing of my own when I get home to rid myself of it.  Not a shop that I would recommend to anyone.

13.description: This is an eccentric store with an eccentric owner. Takes some getting used to.I give it 4 stars based on the variety of workshops and speakers they offer - for example Otter (Oberon) Zell, one of the greatest hippie shamans of our age and founder of the Church of All Worlds, did some workshops there this weekend.There aren't too many New Age bookstores left, so I hope this one does well. The Occult Bookstore has quite a history, in its different locations.

16.description: I visited the Occult Bookstore with a couple friends Fri night (for a witches Meetup) and was pleasantly surprised! I remember when they were in the Flat Iron building and boy did the store seem crowded and dark This new space is nice and spacious, with high ceilings and great atmosphere. Friendly customer service and big selection of books, amulets and gifts made this a nice experience.If you are looking for some magickal goods, check them out!!

17.description: This place was awesome! My husband and I went there to experience the place, and it was full of charm and information! There are books there on almost every religion, and they also have a wide array of different incense I would assume things for spells? I don't know anything about that kind of stuff, but I do know that it was a very interesting shop, and the staff there was SO nice! I picked up a book on "Santeria" and another on "Soul Upkeep." If you're looking to go and explore a new place, or are looking for a good read, go here! And the pricing was AWESOME!!!!!! For 2 humungous books I only paid $20.

15.description: The book selection is off the chain, but the prices are wack, over priced. What would make this place a five is if they knocked a few bucks off these books. If money ain't an issue and you are interested in the occult or any type of fringe or metaphysical stuff this is the place for you.

0.description: I'm a big fan of Occult bookstores.  I've enjoyed perusing them since I was a teenager and still do.  You never know what you're going to find!  My first visit to this store was roughly two years ago.  I made a special trip out there and was warmly welcome by a man in a brown hooded robe like one you'd see the Franciscan Friars wearing.  The book selection touches upon all sorts of subjects from Crowley to LaVey, Freemasonry to OTO, Wicca to ADF.  Various ritual items are for sale or people that practice these varied faiths as well as jewelry and pendants.  I ended up buying a beautiful silver and moonstone pendant for my mother for her birthday.  Friendly staff, varied selection, and an awesome experience if you're a fan of Occult bookstores or a practitioner of one of the many disciplines represented in this store.  It's worth the trip!

5.description: The staff is friendly and informative, grat custom blended incenses but a little short on the newer books...

11.description: The owners could totally drum up business if they'd start stealing chicken and rabbit carcasses from a gross Indian deli and then leave the bloody remains all around the neighborhood. This would scare people into thinking that a "dangerous cult" was operating out of the store, which would increase foot traffic from curious onlookers.This might also spur the police to begin wiretapping the store, and it might also result in a few oddball PETA vigilante types throwing bricks  through the display window.So maybe they should just focus on excellent customer service.

8.description: I must be honest here when I write this review and it's from my heart mind you.  My fondest memories of this place was when an elderly gentleman originally owned the Occult Bookstore and that still sticks.  I guess we can not help but remember what this lovely store used to be to so many Chicagoans that remembered the original owner and how playful and eccentric and grumpy but witty he could be.  I remember when this store was in the flat iron building which was more cozy and back then that store has some intense psychic readers I cherished.  I also remember the old store having a rare collection of antique glass eyes pre world war II and other wonderful oddities as well as some wonderful books by Aleister Crowley.  I can only give this new store three stars because I enjoy my visits if Biobe is there as I find him to be a very kind man who truly does care about the spirit of magic and faery beings.  I was upset during my last visit because I just moved back to Chicago and wanted to walk with my dog from the W. loop to this location.  I purchased what I wanted and the weather became even colder but I was NOT dressed correctly for the weather.  I needed to wait at the store so I had to use my cell phone and attempt to find a cab company that would accept me and my large dog to go back home.  One of the managers a young lady was quite curt with me and acted all put out about me and my dog needing to wait at the store for a cab as if we were criminals.  Everyone at the store but this young lady really loved my dog and she received a lot of loving attention but I guess the new store owner has a policy against cell phone use and dogs in the store.  I by no means wanted to create any issues so I left promptly and I have no real need to go back there at this time because I thought she was truly out of line since the weather was sub zero and I had just moved back from the city of Atlanta to Chicago and did not even know where most of my winter clothes had been packed.  I had an emergency and this female manager (don't know her name) acted upset when clearly everyone else really loved the fact that my dog was there.  I wanted to get a cab...it was freezing so I just left and have not returned to the store since because this manager ruined our shopping experience and made a scene in front of everyone so I was too embarrassed to even want to go back.  If they get rid of her I think the store would do so much better to be honest with you but regardless this place is just not as artistic or cozy as it used to be.  The original owner was a true bohemian and he had oddities a great tarot card selection and even cozy seats for you to sit down on in the store as you browse.  This is not the case with this store it's not the same it's a pity.

3.description: Finally a bookstore that can satisfy my hunger for spells and such. I am a practicing Wiccan of of course, and I love the realness of books. Not newer in the least, but used and really seasoned. I like that in a book, for it gives you a glimpse of being cared for by someone and that is a plus. The place has an old school feel and if you really pay attention you can find some rare books not currently in market. Love the high ceilings and the feel altogether. I remember that they use to be located some were else near here, but I could be wrong.

14.description: The books were a little old (which adds charm for most; I guess for me personally it reminds  me of my gradnpa's endless library, which was full of archaic and out-dated books), BUT they had a marvelous selection, and beyond that, the people working there were SO nice and So helpful and SO interested in helping me find something perfectly customized to my needs and interests, I will definitely go back. They have classes coming up sometime soon, and as knowledgable as the staff seemed, I'd love to attend one.They had a lot of interesting items; personally I would have like to see more of that, but they are a BOOKstore, so BOOKS are the main focus here, as they should be.

4.description: I was in Chicago recently on business. When I travel I try to make a habit of visiting occult shops to get a feel for the witchy vibe of the city. Apparently this is the oldest occult store in North America (or so they claim? I can't be sure, I thought that label went to Laurie Cabot's in Salem, but I guess now that she's closed/closing it maybe these folks take the title?) which I suppose is alright. Since I'm not a local I can't speak to the culture that this place has floating around it, or to their array of workshops/guest speakers. I didn't see anything advertised when I was there.The second I entered, I was told I wasn't allowed to be on my phone (I was talking on my cell phone at the time; what can I say, I love to multitask). I raised my eyebrows and finished my conversation outside - if this wasn't my only hour long free time slot and my only plan after missioning to the opposite area of the city, I probs would have peaced out due to the not-chill-ness of the dude who told me to STFU. Anyway. Lucky for them I went in I guess? I feel like most places that would have been a deal-breaker for me. For some reason photos of the interior of this place are also not allowed, which pissed me off. Anyway - I was not super impressed with the overall selection at this place. Their stock was seriously diminished to the point of almost entire shelves being empty. There were some cute displays of devotional statuary (I am assuming someone at this shop works with the lwa?) and nice decorations on the walls. I did like the layout of the place, and they had a decent selection of jewelry and herbal shit for sale. Book selection - mostly used and in poor condition, but still somehow selling for full price? Very dusty, and not the best selection of titles. Lot of stuff from the 80s. Also they had books on non-occult topics, like computers and other random shit that I was like whaaa? But I did find a book that I'd been meaning to buy - a bit of an obscure rarity, something written by one of the founders of Blue Star Wicca. It was a pleasant surprise to find that here, and wish the other stuff on the shelves were as pleasant to encounter.The reason I would go back to this store (probably) and why I'm giving it three stars instead of two is because of their nonchalant rare book collection. To a discerning eye there are some very interesting things that they have for sale (and this is fetching in the thousands of dollars) - rare stuff that it is almost impossible to find in person, let alone sitting on a shelf at what is more or less a used bookstore. The clerk didn't know exactly what it was that they had, but they did know that it was worth something. The trip to this store was worth it to see that book in person alone. That this is the kind of place that encounters that kind of book and displays it nonchalantly behind the cash - not even in a glass box or anything, which probably would have been a better idea) makes me think this is an interesting spot to keep an eye on.

58.description: I don't usually "YELP" about places or things unless they are above extraordinary so this place has definitely made my list! I love going to Dynamics, they treat me like I've been going there my entire life. My hairdresser, Jojo or Joanna is simply the best! She gave me a Karatin treatment a couple months back after some nudging about how wonderful it would be for my thick mane, and I must admit it really is nice. It cut down on my blow-dry time and I have way less frizzes. So since then I give her freedom to do what she wants when I come in and lately she added some color to my hair, which everyone loves, so now I LOVE IT! :) There's also Michelle (one of the owners) who will wax my eyes and other areas whenever I'm there and Melissa the receptionist/owner/manager of the studio who is the busiest, nicest person I've ever met. I must recommend the nail technicians as well, the items for sale and the location where although it's only street parking, I've never had a problem finding a spot.

56.description: Great place, great service. First time Joann did a wonderful cut, color and style. The price was affordable as I was a Michael Anthony client, yet the service at Dynamic has been superb. My second time my hair was styled by Tony and it was beautiful. Also lasted for four days. I've had manicures and no chip done by Hillary and the service has been comparable to Pinky Nails. All in all, Dynamic is my new 'hair therapy haven' and I will be sure to recommend it to friends.

29.description: Joanne is great. I have thick, curly, long hair.  I used to have a hard time finding a hair stylist who could handle my hair.  I've been going to Joanne for a few years. I love her!!! She does a great job with color and her blowouts are fantastic!!!

42.description: Had a groupon for two no chip manicures. No where on the groupon did I see it stated that only one person could use this and assumed when I brought a girlfriend with so we could both get no chip manicures on her birthday would this be an issue. But it was... So instead of having our manicures covered, I got to shell out an extra $30 for my friends no-chip and now have a single no chip manicure left over. Oh, and I really don't want to use it since my no chip started chipping on day 4.   On day 8 of no chip my entire thumb has peeled off and half of another finger. That's the first time ever that I've had a no chip anywhere not still look decent at the 10 day mark. No idea what is wrong with this product to not have it last at least 10 full days. On the upside though, the ladies who did our manicures were super nice and we had a great time while we were there. Nice to be offered coffee, tea, water or wine while we waited for our manicures. However, it was freezing in the salon... Wish more ladies had been getting blow outs to warm us up.  When temps are freezing outside, perhaps turning heat up would be nice?

23.description: Another groupon disappointment, but I guess you get what you pay for. I booked an appointment for a no chip mani and regular pedi. I told the girl over the phone I was interested in a French no chip, which had an up charge of $7. That's fine with me, as long as the work is quality. The girl who did my pedicure was brand new, fresh out of school. I'm all for training and letting people learn, but when you go to a high end salon, you expect high end results. The pedicure chairs are lined against a wall with zero lighting, so as she was doing my toenails, her hair kept dipping into the polish on the other side (gross!). She first buffed my nails, then cut them, then filed them (not the right order but I didn't say anything). Then she started applying the base coat, and proceeded to start cutting my cuticles. WHAT? I asked her and she just shrugged. After they dried-- I noticed that the top coat covers literally HALF of each toenail. It's especially noticeable on the big toes...come on. They're completely uneven. I could have done a better job on my own toenails, I'm sorry....If that wasn't bad enough, we went to start my no chip French. She admitted she's only done this twice, but feels confident. She used a base coat that was clearly old, lumpy and sticky. It wouldn't dry, bubbled over instantly, and then her French line was way too thick. At this point, I got pretty upset. She got up, interrupted another manicurist mid-manicure for another client, and asked her to switch. This manicurist looked at my nails in disgust, and completely restarted from scratch. My nails are way too short now, but this had to be done because even she said it was done totally improperly. I had to go pay the meter again since I was there for an extra 40 minutes beyond what I expected (annoying). Thankfully I only paid $35 (plus 7 for the French) for this mess..I can't imagine being a new customer and paying the regular pricing for these services. I just moved to the area and was looking for a new salon to go to instead of having to drive back to the suburbs to get my nails done, but I've learned my lesson. I definitely won't be back.

47.description: Bought the Groupon for two no chip manicures. My first experience was okay, nothing spectacular and my manicure chipped within the week. The person who did my nails was not into it and acted like she didn't want to be there. The second time I went was not any better. The receptionist who greeted me seemed annoyed. The person who did my nails kept looking around and not seeming to want to work.Worst part is one of my nails completely peeled off today And I got my manicure two days ago. I would not recommend this place based  on the quality of work I have received on two separate occasions her. There  are better Groupons for manicures.

8.description: I got a Groupon for 2 body wraps and a facial. I thought it was perfect since I was getting married in a few weeks. It said that the facial should be scheduled during one of the body wraps--no problem. I scheduled it with my first one since the second one was the day before my wedding. I thought it was great that I received a confirmation text for my appointment. However, when I got there, I was told that I cannot get my facial the same day. I explained to her why I didn't want it scheduled with my second body wrap. Her reply: "It's not gonna happen." I understand things happen, but phone call would have been nice so that I could've rescheduled the entire thing. We settled on scheduling the facial on a completely different day so I just had a body wrap on the first day.Now this was my first body wrap so I didn't know exactly what to expect, but I have heard about them from friends, and it was nothing like I expected. I thought it would involve putting some kind of vitamin enriched lotion/cream/oil on my body then wrapping me up. The body wrap here was the complete opposite of feeling pampered. I received no service. I stripped down, got into this body sized plastic covering, then laid in a sleeping bag sized heating pad... For an hour. All I did was lay there in my sweat. After the hour, I got out, dried myself off, then left. Someone came to check on me a few times, but that was pretty much it. When I came in the second time for my facial, I guess it was ok, which is why I gave 2 stars instead of 1, but I thought I was going to get a full facial. She only worked on me for about 30 minutes and didn't include any neck and shoulder treatments. It seemed like more of an express facial, but the Groupon didn't say anything about that. She didn't ask my about what products I used on my face, nor did she recommend anything.I dreaded my second body wrap, but I had the Groupon so I went. Same thing, but no one even checked up on my. I at least knew to bring a bottle of water with me and keep it near the bed this time. No one even saw me out. It sucked. I'm not going back, at least not for these services. If I wanted to sweat, I would've rather gone for a run or sat in a sauna.

31.description: I have mixed feelings about Dynamic. I've had both great and mediocre experiences. The thing it seems to lack for me is consistency, it's a bit of a gamble going in because I'm not sure how it's going to be that day.It's a little bit casual/not super professional. Also I've been there over 5 times and every single time I book, they can't find me in the system. Then when I come in, everybody treats me as though they've never seen me before, including the stylist whom I have gone to every single time. Not a very personal experience. I often feel like she is distracted or in a rush, one time she did another person's entire haircut while she was waiting for my foils. I spent the whole time hoping she hadn't forgotten about me!Overall I always leave satisfied with my hair, but never raving about the experience as a whole. And they charge for blow-drying at the end:(

34.description: One of my girlfriends recommended coming here for a manicure, so I did. I called for an after-work appointment.I really enjoyed the service and I walked out feeling super pretty with my new manicure! They have such cool colors ;)OMG and they have all sorts of services like hair styling too! They have cute jewelry for sale too! Thanks Dynamic! I'll be back!

16.description: Purchased a Groupon for no chip manicure with a regular pedicure and while I was there I got a haircut with Joanne. Absolutely loved it! Very clean, and chic, spa/boutique. I loved the atmosphere, my mani and pedi was perfect, my haircut was fabulous. This will definitely be my go to salon from now on. Thank You!

13.description: One foot in the door and I'm immediately greeted with a warm welcome full of smiley faces! One stop salon for all your needs. Exceptional, friendly, sweet, accommodating staff. I always leave feeling beautiful as the staff!

11.description: Bought the Groupon for two no chip manicures. My first experience was okay, nothing spectacular and my manicure chipped within the week. The person who did my nails was not into it and acted like she didn't want to be there. The second time I went was not any better. The receptionist who greeted me seemed annoyed. The person who did my nails kept looking around and not seeming to want to work.Worst part is one of my nails completely peeled off today And I got my manicure two days ago. I would not recommend this place based  on the quality of work I have received on two separate occasions her. There  are better Groupons for manicures.

39.description: The perfect atmosphere for a girls spa getaway.. I always leave there feeling and looking amazing thank you guys!

37.description: I look forward to all of my appts at Dynamic Salon each and every time... Not only do they have the sweetest staff, but they have the talent to make you look and feel like a movie star every time you walk out their door. I highly recommend Dynamic Salon...always. To everyone :) Keep doin' it ladies (&Tony!)!

0.description: The salon offers an array of services. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. I enjoy going to the salon because it offers a very relaxing atmosphere while remaining upbeat. I love that they offer the very latest in services, from hair color to the newest techniques in manicures.One of the things I truly appreciate is the effort they make in trying to accommodate your appointment request. I believe every time I've called they were able to accommodate the day and/or time I could make it there. I will continue to go to this salon and hopefully take advantage of the many services they offer, highly recommended.

38.description: I have been struggling with severe acne & scarring for about 5 years & eventually just gave up on everything. I been going to several different dermatologists, been put on different medications, been using different products & NOTHING was working. A friend recommended that I work with Michelle Gomez from Dynamic Salon on getting my face back to normal and I decided to give them a try...Both Michelle & Melissa have been working closely with me for about a year now. They helped me find an acne treatment product that literally stopped all my acne & now I been coming in on the weekly basis to get Microdermabrasion done to reduce my acne scars, which is working!!!I honestly didn't think that anyone could help me with my acne problem. I'm already 23 and I just figured that this was something that I had to live with... if dermatologists couldn't help me then who could? The first day I walked in there I straight up told them to do whatever they wanted, as long as my acne & scarring went away.
