It did take a few months to get my acne under control, but they did everything they could to figure out the right treatment & products that I should use & I will forever be thankful to them.They also have the BEST JEWELRY & hair products there!!! There isn't a week that I walk empty handed out of there.... But anywho, these ladies are the best & the vibe of the place is awesome. If you haven't been there, check Dynamic Salon out.... you won't regret it!

51.description: I went in to use my groupon for a haircut and Moroccan oil treatment with Joanne. She did a great job! I highly recommend her. I will definitely be coming back.J

27.description: I just got a pedicure and a no chip manicure here today and I'm really please. The girl doing my nails, Jessie was very nice and did a great job. The salons look is also very nice.

32.description: I absolutely love this Salon,  Michelle & Melissa are so accomodating to whatever I need, last minute hair, makeup, nails.   Thier Ace in the Hole is Antonio, he is the BEST, I have been getting a blow-out of my thick, coarse hair for years, and he is definitely the tamer of the WILD:)  I cannot say enough amazing things about this salon.

54.description: A friend & i came in, bought a groupon for a no chip mani n regular pedi. Staff is nice, product is horrible. My friends nails chipped the next day, mine chipped 3 days later. Never had a no chip last me less than 2 weeks. Most of my no chips last sometimes up to a month. We dont have physically demanding jobs so i have no clue why they chipped.

48.description: I tried. They tried. But they could not give me a no-chip manicure that would last more than 4 days. After my first appointment with a nail tech (in which I was cut twice and after 3 days ALL my nails peeled off like rubber cement), I called to talk about getting a redo. I figured I just got a bad tech and I would give them a second chance. They were more than helpful in accommodating, but even after an appointment with the owner, half my manicure peeled off in 4 days. I'm not sure if it's the product being old or what, but I am sporting the weirdest franken-manicure situation until I can get in with another salon. I've had many a no chip in my day and I am usually needing to get them removed by the pros, so this is very strange to me. I would not waste time or money on no chip services here.

44.description: I really like Dynamic. I went there the first time because of Groupon...such a fantastic deal. And its so convenient for me since I work across the street and they have no problem squeezing me in on my lunch break. There is a good selection of no chip colors, added bonus they set it up so you can find the matching color for a pedi right next to the no chip colors. The chairs are great for a nice massage while getting a pedi. I've got terrible toes and they manage to get them decent for me lol. My no chip tends to last at least 2 weeks. I did have a bad chip the next day when I got to Mexico, and when I got back 4 days later she gladly fixed it and touched up my nails free! I only had one issue there and that was when they switched my mani & pedi to a new day, and when I got there I was only down for a mani and the nail tech there was pretty rude and told me there was nothing she could do. I was leaving for vacation and desperately needed help. But I haven't had any issues since, and I go back about every 2-3 weeks.

24.description: I been coming to Dynamic Salon for a couple months very clean, very professional and great service. While you wait your turn you can relax and the lounge area and enjoy a glass of wine. I'm very happy that I found Tony hair stylish who has done wonders to my hair. His highly recommended ladies.

7.description: I been coming to Dynamic Salon for a couple months very clean, very professional and great service. While you wait your turn you can relax and the lounge area and enjoy a glass of wine. I'm very happy that I found Tony hair stylish who has done wonders to my hair. His highly recommended ladies.

49.description: I purchased a groupon for two no chip manicures. I cheated on Chocolate For Your Body (love that place), but I wanted to take advantage of the groupon since I work right down the block of this salon. BIG NO NO! My no chip manicure was over within 30 minutes or so... it felt so rushed, and she didn't pay attention to any detail. To make matters worse, my nails began to chip 2 days later!! Normally, they last me 2-3 weeks without chipping at all!!! I was very upset, I called to see if they can fix it, but I never got an answer. I prefer to spend a little extra (or the same amount) and get better, quality service somewhere else or back at my original spot! Not returning here again!

40.description: This place is truly a gem! The salon is run by 2 sweet sisters, Michele and Melissa, who take pride in making others look fabulous. This salon does it all, one stop shop for real! My hair is always fabulous,  they sell tons of morrocan oil products, manis, pedis, makeup, facials, eye brows, waxing, jewelry and so much more!   Ladies...be sure to check out there margaritas and manicure events!!! You won't regret it!

53.description: Tony is a great stylist! I had impulsively "fixed" my bad haircut at a Walmart a few months back and it was in desperate need of some cleanup. Tony has a great eye for detail and did a great job of understanding my needs. I will say they could do a better job of making this a more welcoming environment. It's sort of open and chaotic, there were kids running around. In terms of the quality of the cut and stylist, though, I give 5 stars.

30.description: I don't have a lot of time available for a salon- and I also don't want the chipless mani (too much chemical exposure and UV is NOT a good thing for my hands).That's why I LOVE Selena at Dynamic Salon! When she does my nails they last for almost 2 weeks- with conventional polish!

46.description: I had an amazing experience here! Arti is a magician with thick hair! I got a keratin treatment and a haircut, and will definitely be coming back!

1.description: Love this place! I keep forgetting to leave a review. but I first found out about dynamic through groupon and it was quite a pleasant experience. My stylist was and still is and will always be Tony! He always leave me feeling %100 with my cuts. I trust him with my hair, he knows what looks good and what doesn't, and he will tell you how it is. I have pretty long and thicke hair and the first time he cut a little off and gave me layers and volume it was perfect. And this last month I really wanted to go drastic and cut about I'd say almost 6 inches off.. And boom he nailed it! Told me how to style it, what short cut was the best. I trust him, that's all I've got to say.They take cards but you have to leave tips in cash, but they also have an ATM machine. The parking isn't too bad around there especially if you score a spot in front or a spot on a side street.  they serve you beverages not that it would make a big difference lol but it's a nice perk!  They also do mani and pedis, the atmosphere is comfortable the staff is very nice and cheery, they always return a smile. I always feel so welcomed.

55.description: I live nearby and was looking for somewhere close as I was in a rush. I was a bit skeptical new place, new stylist, new environment. However, I was warmly greeted by the receptionist any my appointment was right on time. (not like other salons that make you wait) I was then Greeted by Joanne, who did my first blow out in years, I normally get curls or go straight, but I was amazed at how beautiful and voluminous  She left my hair. She asked how what I was looking for and made it happen. Nobody was pushy in selling me anything or ripping me off. Prices were reasonable, environment was clean, and oh! Did I mention I always get a complimentary glass of wine when I go. I've been there twice so far and every time the service has been good, consistent, inviting, and most importantly trust worthy. Great Service for a great price! I love Joanne and will definitely by back to see her! I recommend her as she is also very knowledgeable and down to earth. Also I mentioned to Joanne, that I normally go to someone else and that I cheat every now and then because the salon is close to me and she wasn't pushy at all. On the contrary she was very understanding. This is a respectable quality as most beauticians/stylists are pushy. ( Admirable quality) I recommend at least try it if you haven't yet!

9.description: I've been getting my nails done for over two years and love their attentive services. Melissa and Michelle, the owners, are always around so it's nice to know they care about their business. I would recommend it to all!!!

26.description: Motivated to try a new salon/spa in the neighborhood I found this place on Groupon and went in for a no-chip mani and pedi. I had a great service and experience with Jessie. She made me feel instantly relaxed and offered a variety of beverages and help selecting the perfect color! She even mentioned deals on future services, so I will definitely return.

25.description: I have been a loyal customer of this salon for many years. It's hard to find a hairstylist that gives you great results. Tony has been that person for me until recently. The other day I made an appointment after work to get my fringe bangs cut (he has done them before). He seemed rushed to get me out of his chair as quickly as possible and his actions showed. He cut my bangs at first way too long. I told him that i wanted fringe, i even showed him a picture of when he cut my bangs the last time. I have a cow lick but he worked with it in the past by cutting the other side a little shorter to compensate. He acted as though he didn't know my hair! He cut them way too short. They weren't even either. THANK GOD HAIR GROWS BACK! He wanted to send me out of the salon with my hair not done. I asked that he blow dry my hair and he gave an attitude... that might've been because a walk-in came in and he wanted to do it but now that i asked that he blow dry my hair it was going to consume his time. His lack of undivided attention was very off putting. I've been a loyal customer of his for years and a GREAT tipper, I did not deserve to get treated in such a unprofessional manner. He charged me $40 for the less than desirable results (which i thought was complete b.s.). I left hating my hair and extremely upset. I will not be coming back, that one bad experience was enough to make me never want to.

12.description: Obsessed with this salon for my hands and toes. They are my go to for no chip on my hands and the perfect pedicure. They are the best deal in town and who doesn't want to support women entrepreneurs.

59.description: Cant' wait for my touch up and no chip.  I appreciate you guys squeezing me in as my schedule is ridiculous.  Coming to see you Joanne and Loretta :-)

21.description: I bought a groupon for Dynamic over a year ago for 2 no chip manicures. The services were fine when I went a year ago, not great, but totally adequate. I live right by there, so it's very convenient. I saw they still had a groupon up, and that you could use a groupon if you'd been there a year or more ago, so I purchased it and called to book an appointment. The receptionist told me I could not use a groupon unless I was a new customer, and when I read the exact fine print from the groupon to her, she went to ask her manager. She returned saying that the fine print is a mistake on the part of groupon, and they would honor the amount I spent on the groupon ($35), but would not honor the deal. She was entirely unapologetic throughout the exchange. I feel like this is a frequent issue with businesses not wanting to honor or deal with groupons, but then I don't understand why they agree to the deals. I also feel that what the manager said was untrue, due to the fact that I checked the groupon I had purchased over a year ago, and the fine print stated exactly the same exclusions. It seems unlikely that the business would not have resolved this issue with groupon in the space of 14 months. I chose to cancel the groupon, and I will not be returning to this salon.

17.description: Another groupon disappointment, but I guess you get what you pay for. I booked an appointment for a no chip mani and regular pedi. I told the girl over the phone I was interested in a French no chip, which had an up charge of $7. That's fine with me, as long as the work is quality. The girl who did my pedicure was brand new, fresh out of school. I'm all for training and letting people learn, but when you go to a high end salon, you expect high end results. The pedicure chairs are lined against a wall with zero lighting, so as she was doing my toenails, her hair kept dipping into the polish on the other side (gross!). She first buffed my nails, then cut them, then filed them (not the right order but I didn't say anything). Then she started applying the base coat, and proceeded to start cutting my cuticles. WHAT? I asked her and she just shrugged. After they dried-- I noticed that the top coat covers literally HALF of each toenail. It's especially noticeable on the big toes...come on. They're completely uneven. I could have done a better job on my own toenails, I'm sorry....If that wasn't bad enough, we went to start my no chip French. She admitted she's only done this twice, but feels confident. She used a base coat that was clearly old, lumpy and sticky. It wouldn't dry, bubbled over instantly, and then her French line was way too thick. At this point, I got pretty upset. She got up, interrupted another manicurist mid-manicure for another client, and asked her to switch. This manicurist looked at my nails in disgust, and completely restarted from scratch. My nails are way too short now, but this had to be done because even she said it was done totally improperly. I had to go pay the meter again since I was there for an extra 40 minutes beyond what I expected (annoying). Thankfully I only paid $35 (plus 7 for the French) for this mess..I can't imagine being a new customer and paying the regular pricing for these services. I just moved to the area and was looking for a new salon to go to instead of having to drive back to the suburbs to get my nails done, but I've learned my lesson. I definitely won't be back.

10.description: I love going to Dynamic!  Michelle and Melissa make you feel so welcomed.  My hair stylist is Antonio "Tony" and he is AWESOME!  I'll come in with a picture from Pinterest and he always makes my hair look better than my vision.  I always get compliments and people ask me "where do you get your hair done?" :)  Michelle is a magician with my eyebrows and when I need to get extra help, their make-up and nail artist are the best.  Don't pay attention to the negative reviews, you just have to try Dynamic for yourself.

5.description: This salon has a great atmosphere.  They create a great hair experience.  Very affordable and top notch stylist.

3.description: Love this place! I am usually one who thinks about getting my hair blow dried for an event at the last minute, it's horrible, I know!  Dynamic Salon never disappoints!  I call in and they do their best to squeeze me in with any of the hair stylists available and my hair always looks amazing!  The two sisters who run the spot are super friendly and know the industry very well.  If you need hair, nails, make-up, hair removal - this is definitely a place to check out!

35.description: I love this salon. I always get the best treatment from the time I walk in the door until I leave. The staff is great. Tony always does a fabulous job on my hair. Melissa is always accommodating when I need an appointment. I will continue to recommend this salon to all my family and friends.

19.description: This was my second time here and at my previous appointment I appreciated the in-and-out experience. However, my experience last week was bizarre and very rude. I arrived at 5:30 at the same time as another woman. We both picked out our nail colors and she was seated with a nail tech. I picked out my colors and was ushered to the a massage chair with a  foot bath. Then I waited. After 15 minutes I tried unsuccessfully to get the attention of the receptionist and had a flag down someone else since my feet were wet. She came over and told me that the other nail tech was on her way. She hoped she would be there soon, but her phone had died. I was frustrated she didn't mention this when I checked in because I would have left and came back. no big deal. When the nail tech finally arrived at 6, a half hour late she didn't even apologize for her lateness.  This is an example of terrible management.

28.description: Not a good experience.I bought a Groupon for haircut + deep conditioning treatment. When I made the appointment I let them know I had the Groupon for those 2 services.I get to the salon at 11:55 a.m. for my 12:00 appointment on a Saturday. Even though there are 3 hair stylists walking around, fixing each other's hair, eating lunch, curling heir hair, chatting with each other, no one is able to take my appointment as I wait for 25 minutes.I don't understand if one hair stylist is running late with a current appointment, why they didn't just give my appointment to one of the other 3 people doing nothing? Anyways 30 minutes later the lady is finally ready and she says "I'm so sorry for running late I'm going to give you this awesome deep conditioning treatment for free since you had to wait".It really really really bothers me that I made an appointment with the Groupon for the deep conditioning treatment and the receptionist never transfers that piece of information over to the hair stylist.So I said "oh I'm already paying for that with the Groupon I bought". Awesome.Anyways she rushes me over to the place where they wash your hair. She dunks my head in the water without ever glancing at what my hair is like. Right away I'm nervous, most salons will look at your hair when it's dry to understand the texture, if it's naturally straight or curly, etc. Not here, just right to the hair wash with no questions asked. Then she put the conditioner in my hair and left me for 20 minutes while she finished up her other client. My friend brought this Groupon and said she received a head massage while waiting. I was left waiting in the dust, while they have their main door open and a draft coming in, I'm freezing with my head wet for 20 minutes. Literally at 1:00 she started to cut my hair when my original appointment was at 12:00. She asks very few questions then starts chopping and chopping and chopping and more layers and more texturizing and this and that. I start to get nervous because my hair is wavy and wavy doesn't do good with many layers and much texture because it turns into frizz. After she's done blow drying my hair she goes "oh I thought your hair was naturally straight....but this haircut should still be okay."That's what happens when you don't ask questions or even LOOK at the persons hair before you start cutting it.Anyways my haircut sucks and the deep conditioning treatment is useless because after 2 washes my hair was back to its normal self.

45.description: It was very challenging to get an appointment with dynamic for for a mani pedi. I tried walking in my first time, which they say is okay on their website, only to be turned away without apology. When I finally got my appointment I waited for over 35 minutes to begin my nails. My nail stylist, Deja, was a sweetheart but didn't seem very experienced. And now one week later my nails are chipping! With the 'no chip'! Luckily I had the groupon and didn't pay full price. I will not be going back.

33.description: Went and did my hair at another salon a few days before coming in to Dynamic. They completely fixed my color problem. The first salon had my hair lighter on some parts and darker on others. Dynamic was able to go in and correct my color flawlessly. Very satisfied!

43.description: Went to this salon for a groupon deal- two no chips for $35. The first and only time I went, just like many other reviewers, I was treated more like a station at a factory- "pick color. Sit here. Wash your hands. Move your finger." Etc. just rude, impersonable and choppy. People go to a salon to relax and be pampered and this place doesn't get that. Skip this place, there ARE better groupons out there (and closer to the city). The only thing was that my nails DIDNT chip until 10 days later hence why they earned two stars.

2.description: There's something about this place that I just can't figure out.I bought the Groupon and decided to get two no-chip manicures. My first one lasted a full 3 weeks (except for my nails growing out, it seriously looked stunning on week 3 the same way it did day 1). The reason for 2 stars is because the service just isn't there. You don't feel pampered at all; more like an in-and-out sort of ordeal which is fine but just not what I expected. During my first no-chip the manicurist actually stopped my manicure to answer her phone - it was just really, really weird.I really didn't want to go back but I already bought the Groupon. My second no-chip was alright, but you could tell the polish color I'd chosen was old - the manicurist kept tipping it upside-down to get the polish on the brush. The weirdest part about this one is that she took off my original no-chip, clipped and filed my nails - but didn't buff them. So they were still rough when she started painting them. I've had my fair share of no-chips and that's never been the way I've seen it done. Then, instead of using lotion on my hands, she used oil - the hand massage was 10 stars for sure - but driving home I had to wipe off my steering wheel because it was all oiled up. Again - what? Just so weird.Maybe my experience was different because they knew I was a Groupon customer - which really isn't the point of going somewhere new with a Groupon. Not the way I like to feel when I indulge; probably won't be back.

18.description: If you care about good, long lasting results, avoid Dynamic Salon. I typically go to Revive on Milwaukee (love!) but a friend gave me a voucher from one of the deal sites for a no chip so I gave it a shot. The setup of the salon is odd, it's more of a hair salon with a few nail stations thrown in. I wasn't greeted, not even by the stylists, for quite some time after walking in the door. I knew within minutes I'd be regretting my decision. The salon didn't feel very clean and the girl that did my mani was not your typical salon employee, not nice at all.Long story short, I couldn't get out of there fast enough and I had 5 chipped nails within the first 3 days. (See photo of one hand, the other looks the same!) I'm typically good for 2-3 weeks with my Revive no chip before I have them remove it on my next appt. When I left, I had to wait for the girl at the front desk to stop texting long enough to ring me up. There are too many great salons in the area to give Dynamic a try.

41.description: 1st and for most i LOVE going here! I decided to treat my 7yr old to get her nails and toes done and a haircut!!! She loves it and everyone made her smile. They asked her if she was ok or needed anything and made sure she was happy. I got a pedicure along with her and my friend got a manicure & of course we love it. Melissa and Michelle are such great women. My daighter is definitely  asking to go back!!!

52.description: If I could give 3.5 I would. Went in for a mani-pedi, they were super sweet but understaffed and busy. There's a lot going on between the salon services on one wall and the nail services on the other, and it's not a very relaxing atmosphere. I would go back, as the women were great and the price was right, but just know that if you're looking for a luxurious experience, you should try elsewhere.

50.description: I came here because I purchased a Groupon for the $35 no chip mani and pedicure. They didn't have that many color options compared to other nail salons that I typically go to. The nail technician did not cut my cuticles and did not my paint my nails all the way in, making it look like they've been grown out for a week. This is the same with my pedicure. She also did not paint enough layers on my nails making it look like an ombré effect and not opaque. I felt like everything was half-hearted.Overall, the staffs were nice and the price was fair but I would rather pay a little more for better results.

4.description: Do NOT let some of the other reviews detour you from this place. I was in a bit of a rush to get a No Chip Mani and regular pedi; I was able to call in and set up a same day appointment with ease. I under estimated traffic and was about 10 minutes late for my appointment and was worried I'd get the "stink eye" upon my arrival... I didn't! :) After apologizing the lovely woman at the front desk pointed out the nail colors (which are already paired up no chip/reg. polish for you!!!). I was pampered by DEJA, which is ABSOLUTELY phenomenal and just fell in love! I work with my hands so I'm always weary about paying so much for a No Chip because it NEVER seems to last... Let me tell you.. Today is day 7 and if it wasn't for the out growth it would look like I had got the work done yesterday!! Deja is soooooo detailed and precise I have no lifts, chips, or even dullness! I live 45 minutes away and I'll still be seeing her soon!!P.S. She also picked my awesome color!

6.description: I bought a Groupon for a no chip mani and pedicure.  I tried calling starting on Jan 8th for two days trying to make an appointment for my birthday on Jan. 15th.  There was no answer or answering machine stating they would be closed for a few days.  I assumed they had closed down, but I drove past and appeared open, but closed.  I understand it was after the holiday's and business is slower, but this was a weekend. You should at least have an outgoing message when customer's are calling.  When I finally got through to someone I mentioned that I had been calling-she said they had been closed.  I mentioned they should probably have something stating they would be closed, whoever didn't seem to think it was a big deal. No problem, moving on....the girl who did my nails and toes was not rude, but she didn't say one word either really.  I went in on Jan. 15th, today is the 20th and my thumb nail (that she had to re do once while I was there because it had a bubble) still had a bubble and chipped/peeled off last night.  Now my middle finger and well as pointer finger are starting to get that peel that no chips start to get.  I understand no chip's don't always last the full two weeks, but I've never had one last under 10 days let alone 5 days.  It's a cute place in the neighborhood too, but def much better nail techs around.

22.description: I bought a groupon for $32 for 2 no chip manicures. Got my first one and its chipping four days later. Probably the worst "no chip" I've had. I doubt I'll be going back for the second

15.description: Motivated to try a new salon/spa in the neighborhood I found this place on Groupon and went in for a no-chip mani and pedi. I had a great service and experience with Jessie. She made me feel instantly relaxed and offered a variety of beverages and help selecting the perfect color! She even mentioned deals on future services, so I will definitely return.

57.description: If you care about good, long lasting results, avoid Dynamic Salon. I typically go to Revive on Milwaukee (love!) but a friend gave me a voucher from one of the deal sites for a no chip so I gave it a shot. The setup of the salon is odd, it's more of a hair salon with a few nail stations thrown in. I wasn't greeted, not even by the stylists, for quite some time after walking in the door. I knew within minutes I'd be regretting my decision. The salon didn't feel very clean and the girl that did my mani was not your typical salon employee, not nice at all.Long story short, I couldn't get out of there fast enough and I had 5 chipped nails within the first 3 days. (See photo of one hand, the other looks the same!) I'm typically good for 2-3 weeks with my Revive no chip before I have them remove it on my next appt. When I left, I had to wait for the girl at the front desk to stop texting long enough to ring me up. There are too many great salons in the area to give Dynamic a try.

20.description: I have been a client of Sarah's for years.   She is an absolute skilled  professional who has never sent me home in tears, wearing a hoodie and a look of dejection.   I trust her sense of style!

36.description: I absolutely love Dynamic!! The owners, Melissa and Michelle, are complete sweethearts.  Every time I go in, the staff is attentive and they always take care of me. Joanne and Sara, hairstylists, are very talented and the manicurists are amazing.  Sure, I've waited for my appointment, but its not a big deal...I enjoy catching up with the staff, who have become friends!

14.description: Had a groupon for two no chip manicures. No where on the groupon did I see it stated that only one person could use this and assumed when I brought a girlfriend with so we could both get no chip manicures on her birthday would this be an issue. But it was... So instead of having our manicures covered, I got to shell out an extra $30 for my friends no-chip and now have a single no chip manicure left over. Oh, and I really don't want to use it since my no chip started chipping on day 4.   On day 8 of no chip my entire thumb has peeled off and half of another finger. That's the first time ever that I've had a no chip anywhere not still look decent at the 10 day mark. No idea what is wrong with this product to not have it last at least 10 full days. On the upside though, the ladies who did our manicures were super nice and we had a great time while we were there. Nice to be offered coffee, tea, water or wine while we waited for our manicures. However, it was freezing in the salon... Wish more ladies had been getting blow outs to warm us up.  When temps are freezing outside, perhaps turning heat up would be nice?

1.description: I went in here to find  new pair of jogging shoes. The people that work here are so rude. This big chick working there was totally rude to me, just for asking if I could get a certain shoe in my size. Then proceeded to watch my every move as if I was going to steal something.  I was being polite and saying, please and thank you, but she just gave me a "um-hm"... I will never go here again and make sure no one I know ever goes in as well. Like I know you make minimum wage, but damn, watch the attitude.. especially to paying customers. I almost want to return my shoes because I don't believe in supporting businesses that don't give a shit about their customers.

2.description: I had to stop at City Sports to get me a ball cap.  Thats like the number one thing for me to do when I go out of town.  I found a real cool Chicago Cubs New Era cap with a red bill.  The store owner was really  cool and gave me a little discount since a brotha was from out of town.  I wish the Chi town drivers were a little more accomodating but hay.lol

0.description: A surprisingly nice shoe & sporting goods store at the intersection of Milwaukee & Division.  On the outside, the awnings are faded and the store looks like a sure-bet for musty, overpriced, disorganized, and out-of-date merchandise. But, on the inside, it's actually a clean, two-story store with a wide selection of men's, women's, and kid's shoes and apparel. If you are lucky (which is very very possible), you might get an awesome deal on a pair of shoes--I saw several cute pairs for $30-$60.  It's got quite a bit more for men, and the shoes are organized almost purely by brand, so women have to scan carefully to identify the women's shoes. So, if you are looking for a pair of trendy tennis shoes, don't overlook this place. You might be surprised by what you find. (BTW: the interior of store is also very architecturally interesting).

58.description: Nice draft beer list for a local Italian-American dive.  Calamari is still the star for those who knew the old name, Cafe Fresco.  Cesar salad pizza is really good.  Beer patio is now done and its great!

56.description: The new Grandview Tavern is a great place. They did a great job once the name changed in regards to staff, atmosphere, back patio and food. Been a few times here in 2013 and each time the experience has been superb. Look forward to making this a great summer hang out! Keep up the great work!

29.description: This bar has above par food and decently priced drinks. It also hosts a diverse crowd from hipsters to I've-had-my-hip-replaced-ers. The outdoor patio facilitates fantastic conversations in the summer, and it's truly my favorite place in the neighborhood to visit during the warmer seasons. I can't end without mentioning that the grilled cheese is yummy and that their Moscow mules, though stubborn, pack a kick.

42.description: My fiancée and I just moved into a new place right down the street from here, so we thought we'd try it out tonight for dinner and the Blackhawks game. I got a bad first impression the instant we walked in and were greeted my that bar smell of smoke, grease and fart-the kind of smell that stays in your clothes all night. When we got our food, the disappointment continued. I ordered the porkbelly Cuban and sweet potato fries (which were an astonishing THREE DOLLARS to substitute for regular fries). The pork was charred, dry and salty, and along with the over-toasted focaccia made for some difficult biting and chewing. The sandwich, clocking in at $12 before the added sweet potato fries, was tiny; about the size of half a normal sandwich. And the aforementioned $3 sweet potato fries? They were even saltier than the pork, almost unbearably so, and left my lips chapped like they were movie theatre popcorn. Ok, so it's a bar where the food sucks, that's ok as long as the atmosphere, drinks and TVs are good, right? Well, their satellite feed cut out several times during the Blackhawks game, and all the TVs had annoying closed captioning (completely unnecessary whilst watching sports) so it was not exactly a stellar watching experience either. As for the drinks, our Guinness were $6 each, again extremely high for a bar of this size/caliber. All in all, I will definitely never eat at this place again, and won't be in a hurry to hang out there either. I may check out the patio in the summer, but if you're looking for decent food or a good vibe to drink in, you can do a whole lot better.

23.description: Great spot!  Authentic neighborhood atmosphere. Food is definitely above bar food really great!   Staff and owners are friendly and welcoming.  Jessica rocks!

47.description: Holy Fabulous Craft Beer Selection!!!  Grandview seems to be on top of their craft beer selections..always changing always something new.!! Love that they support the local breweries in Chicago and surrounding areas! I am OBSESSED with the Black bean Burger...the trick is order it on the focaccia and add swiss cheese...Scrumptious!!!!!!!!!!

8.description: The daily specials are a great, $5 wine on Thursdays are my personal fave! But once you try the grilled calamari it's a must every single time. The staff is very attentive and friendly and we've had great service from multiple servers. Love the beergarden, a hidden little gem!

31.description: bravo!thank you restaurant.com for introducing us to this amazing gem.friendly staff, cozy atmosphere and delicious food and drinks.we shared the goat cheese quesada, (6 dollars on special on thursday's) a chicken caesar wrap, and the homemade burger with sweet potato fries.everything was delicious, and FRESH. (no greasy stale bar food here)we didn't get a chance to check out the beer garden patio in the back, yet we saw a lot of other fans heading back there.the moscow mule and long island cocktails were delicious, although I wish the long island was a little bit more boozy (yes judge me) we also enjoyed the colorado oskar blues g'night beer cans. The owner Dave visited our table and made sure everything was up to par, which is always much appreciated.This place was just the bomb dot com.What are you waiting for? Get the restaurant.com, stop reading this review, and make this place your next stop of the day.stay classy grandview tavern and beer garden, we will see you next time!:)

34.description: Great food, great beer, great music, great patio! Perfect place for neighborhood locals.

16.description: What a great little spot!  It's the dead of winter right now, so I can't speak to the patio, but the kitchen serves up great bar fare (and at a good price).  They also have daily specials that include $5 for their flatbread and $5 for brisket burgers.Open for lunch, too!

13.description: I went there today in the afternoon. There was just one waitress working and she was complaining all the tine that it is her first day. The service was the worst I ever seen in Chicago. We waited an hour just to order and there werent so many people in the bar. I gave two stars just because the food was fine and I liked the atmosfer in the padio, but I will not go back there, thou I live one minute from this place.

11.description: Bad food, worse service, dirty bathroom flytrap!I was greeted with no hello, just.... If you want some water, its over there in the corner. really?I was duped into coming for lunch based on false advertising on their website.The website claims the signature burger, the grandview burger to have "kobe style" beef. Not even close, I got a frozen overcooked chunk of meat. It also claims to have jalepeno bacon, not the case. Just regular bacon. Beef grilled to perfection??? Are you kidding me???. The other must try Philly Steak was not even edible. Both pickles were dehydrated for some reason. Wasn't offered water and when the food came i got a ketchup bottle, thanks.I will never ever go back. I would have sent it back or complained but the service there cannot even afford basic accommodations and courtesy.With so many other great places in the neighborhood for food and drinks, I can't imagine they will be around much longer.

39.description: My friends and I go here pretty often for drinks and to watch soccer. Jodi and the crew are super awesome. The service drinks and food is fantastic. Will keeping going here while Jodi and the crew are serving!!!

37.description: This place was a great find! Beautiful little patio and great food. It's not your average tavern, it's much better than that.

0.description: If you're fortunate enough to get Ryan the bartender, you'll particularly love this little west-town gem.  Good beer selection and secluded back patio, this place is a great place to meet friends for a few drinks any time of year.

38.description: Love this place. The food is really good, staff is super friendly, and the beer garden is awesome.

51.description: Awesome neighborhood bar, lovely beer garden, good beer selection, friendly helpful serivce and the bolognaise fries were delicious! And pet friendly as a bonus - we'll be back for sure...

27.description: This place had to be the worst service I ever received! The server/bartender was extremely rude. She did not check on our table at all. We had to hunt her down every time we wanted to order drinks and the place wasn't busy for that to be an excuse. As she would bring our drinks, she would slam them on the table and just walk away failing to give eye contact or even a smile. In addition, she did not check if we wanted or needed anything else and was overall very rude. It was such poor service it ruined my entire night and it is safe to say I will never go again and I don't think you should either. If I could I would give it 0 stars or even a negative rating I would!!!! If you want to have a good night with great customer service your best bet is going across the street to G&O!

32.description: If not for restaurant.com, I never would have thought to come here but so glad we did. Staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. Place was clean (including the bathrooms), and the food was great. I did not check out the patio. We had the Roy Rogers burger (BBQ with deep-fried onion rings) and the Grandview burger (jalapeno-cured bacon)...both were excellent (and on pretzel buns) and cooked exactly as ordered. While skeptical to pay $2 more for sweet potato fries, OH MY, they were totally worth it! Seriously the best sweet potato fries I've had anywhere in the city. So much better than their regular fries, in my opinion. They did mix up the order (put my regular fries with my wife's burger, and my wife's sweet potato fries with my burger) but not a big deal. Also tried the grilled calamari and it was goooood. Nice char taste and decent amount of calamari, spinach and goat cheese...only knock is that the vinaigrette was a bit salty. Keep in mind that this 5-star review is b/c restaurant.com certs helps offset the pricey burgers. Fantastic burgers but I also get fantastic burgers at BopNGrill  for around $8, whereas burgers here average $12. Without restaurant.com, I'd give this place 4-stars.

54.description: Live this place.  Great dive-ish bar with good food and great drinks.  Love that colleen bartender

48.description: Irish mule. Try it.Any "mule" on a menu, I'll try it. Normally I'm a Moscow Mule fan but Grandview introduced me to this twist. And Yum!We were there back in September when it was still nice enough so sit on the back patio without heaters or sweatshirts. Love the back garden area. Just so quaint and chill. At the time, maybe a little too chill. We were out celebrating our "engagement" - not really, had been engaged for a year but just got my ring so it was like an engagement night. We got a few sideways glances when I stepped in in a dress and heels and my fiancé in a suit and tie, no worries, just classing it up. :-) We told the server about our engagement and she just brushed it off, "so what can I get you?" Was a little disappointed we didn't even get a congrats but it is what it is. And to her defense, when we went in to pay we realized she was the only one working - both the front bar and the back patio area so seems a little more she was just in a rush than trying to brush off our excitement. Checked out the menu but didn't order. Seemed typical bar food. Bar menu was sufficient and the Irish Mule fantastic. It is served in a copper mug but you do have to leave an id or credit card as a deposit...apparently they "walk out" of there enough that you get the heads up you'll be charged $30 if the mug isn't returned. Be warned...DON'T STEAL - duh!

44.description: I locked myself out of my place, and came here until I could get keys to my place. What a pleasant surprise to find that this was a Michigan State bar. There were a few people inside, and they were all sitting at the bar watching the football game. I went with a beer on draft, and the bartender happily gave me tasters of the ones I wanted to try. I got the chicken sandwich but it was missing the tomatoes, which I had to ask about and got after I finished the first half of it. Despite the little mishap, I am sure that this will become my little neighborhood bar spot that I will be coming to.

24.description: I really enjoyed this place. I was there in the dead of winter early saturday afternoon,so there were maybe 4 ppl in the joint. Including me and my friend. I had half a turkey burger and half a chicken burger, they were both delish! I would totally go back.

7.description: Decided to check out Grandview Tavern and Beer Garden with a friend Friday night for drinks. Neighborhood place with an outdoor patio and nightly food and drink specials. The service wasn't great but could have been because there were only two people working inside the bar and out on the patio. Ordered drinks and had to find someone to ask when we want to order food. Ordered the hot spinach and artichoke dip topped with bread crumbs and came with tons of hot pita, which was very good. Ok place for a drink but definitely the service has to be worked on.

49.description: Best service, garden and food in the neighborhood. The only downside is that weird Greg guy from next door who is always there. What is his deal anyway??

40.description: Just moved into the neighborhood a few days ago and me and a roommate went stopped in for dinner and to watch the Blackhawks game. There's about 6 or 7 large flatscreens above and behind the bar that can be seen from any spot in the place. I asked the waitress for recommendations on which sandwich to get and you could tell she knew the menu well enough to give a good recommendation, unlike some servers who just look at the menu and blindly pick something. We had the grilled calamari that was excellent. Fresh and cooked perfecly with feta cheese, spinach, roasted red peppers. The pizza was great and the ancho chicken sandwich was awesome,on a tomato basil foccaci roll that you dont find at many places.  We asked the waitress to surprise us with any IPA they had. Cant remember which one it was but the owner walked past and stuck up a conversation and said he was going to stop ordering the IPA we had but offered to keep it if it was what we liked drinking. We told him we were just trying it out and he recommended a diffeeent one to us and bought us a round. Everyone was friendly and the cook even walked past us and asked us how everything was. Needless to say we'll probably end up making this our spot.

53.description: I love the Grandview. I go there for the outside patio, but beyond that, the customer service is great. The beer is great. The grilled cheese is to die for.This is a place where it's easy to hang with your buddies but also make friends. The staff becomes your friend very quickly as well and they always keep an ear open for what a customer wants to say.No complaints, but just an all-around great time!

30.description: The owner knows his beers and is super nice. He'll let you try different beers and takes the time to try to find something you'll like. Even if you're not a beer "snob" he'll explain/teach you and not in a condescending way....he just likes to share his passion with others. I haven't tried the food yet.

46.description: When this place was Fresco it was a gem. They had a very quiet and warm patio where you could enjoy your dinner over good conversation. Now as Grandview they have added an outdoor bar, big screen TVs an allow smoking!? Not only have they lost the menu items we so enjoyed with this transition. They have turned the fantastic patio into a sports patio that is barely tolerable with the loud groups, smoking and terrible service. The food is average at best. This place has lost our business. It really unfortunate as there's Mahoney's less than a block away which was our local sports bar. We didn't need another.

1.description: My boyfriend and I ordered dinner and our appetizer at the same time. His meal came out first and half way through the bartender told me mine would come out shortly. About 5 minutes after my boyfriend finished his entire meal, I asked the bartender the eta. The bartender said they wrote my meal on a separate ticket and it must have got lost.I got my dinner 20 minutes after my boyfriend finished his entire dish.This was annoying to say the least. Not sure I'll be back.

55.description: Great back patio....too bad this place still allows smoking....umm pretty sure that's against the law in Chicago....even on patios.  I would have enjoyed my beer a lot more if the table next to us wouldn't have kept firing up cigs.

9.description: Wonderful outdoor beer garden with great seating.  Two televisions outside perfect for watching the Stanley Cup Playoffs.  Friendly waitstaff and good food and drink specials.  Parking in this area is a problem, but the inconvenience is well worth a trip to this lovely spot.  On your way out the door, pick up wine and beer to go.  Very cool and very convenient!

26.description: Great outdoor space. Decent beer list, the food is totally...fine.I'd definitely come back here to enjoy the outdoor patio after this year's polar vortex has passed. Hopefully I will survive.The patio is totally enclosed with large shady trees above the space. I can imagine how amazing it would be during the summer. We went during a warm fall day.

25.description: Very chill bar - can't comment on the food or the patio as we just stopped in for a drink before heading to a friend's party down the street.  The bar staff was super friendly and attentive, and the beer and whiskey selections were great.  Crowd seemed like a lively local bunch.  Seems like a great neighborhood watering hole that is friendly to "outsiders" passing through.

12.description: bravo!thank you restaurant.com for introducing us to this amazing gem.friendly staff, cozy atmosphere and delicious food and drinks.we shared the goat cheese quesada, (6 dollars on special on thursday's) a chicken caesar wrap, and the homemade burger with sweet potato fries.everything was delicious, and FRESH. (no greasy stale bar food here)we didn't get a chance to check out the beer garden patio in the back, yet we saw a lot of other fans heading back there.the moscow mule and long island cocktails were delicious, although I wish the long island was a little bit more boozy (yes judge me) we also enjoyed the colorado oskar blues g'night beer cans. The owner Dave visited our table and made sure everything was up to par, which is always much appreciated.This place was just the bomb dot com.What are you waiting for? Get the restaurant.com, stop reading this review, and make this place your next stop of the day.stay classy grandview tavern and beer garden, we will see you next time!:)

59.description: I moved into the neighbourhood back in October, and although I'd heard of the area, I had never really hung out save for one random night at Funky Buddha. So I began exploring and found several wonderful places, including Grandview.In the past month, I've been there three times. Dave, who runs the place, is a super nice and accommodating guy who just wants you to enjoy yourself and have a  good time at his establishment. My second time there, my friend and I went to pick up our food and Dave sat us down, handed us a couple of beers, and started chatting with us. He showed us the gorgeous beer garden area (available for parties/events, folks!) with newly installed flat screens for us sports fans. "Midwest hospitality" indeed.The food is really good--from the burgers to the appetizers to the salads--as is the friendly neighbourhood vibe. One of the few places around that has mozzarella sticks--I can't believe how hard it is to find these yummy fried snacks sometimes. The service I've had has also been great; the servers are attentive and make sure you get your food exactly the way you want it.I'll definitely be back many more times this summer.

21.description: Hard to believe I've forgotten to put a review up for Grandview since it's the place in my neighborhood that I've frequented the most in my 10 years in West Town, going back to the Fresco days.Great beer garden, tons of TVs for sports, excellent eclectic beer selections on draft and also a myriad of great unique stuff in tall boy cans, solid food and an outstanding group of bartenders who are super friendly and awesome.  Really fun relaxing environment, great for a weekend night out, or just a beer or three after work during the week.

17.description: Great smaller place with nice outdoor seating. Service was great, although we were there when there were only a few people at the bar. Drinks were generous liquor-wise and pricing was really decent. Food was good as well, a good selection, had a hard time picking. Had a great time, definitely will be back!

10.description: I was excited to go based on the reviews and decided to watch some of the March Madness tournament here. Unfortunately our food was disgusting. We ordered the fresh mozzarella to start but it wasn't hot and came out with the rest of our food. I had the salmon BLT which sounded delicious but actually tasted like rotten vegetables. It was inedible. The fries are worse than a fast food place. My fiancé ordered the mix and match sliders that he said were 'ok'. Our drinks were fine but they have a pretty limited beer list for a 'beer garden'. On top of that, we ordered multiple beers that our waitress would then inform us they didn't actually have. Overall it was a bad experience, the service wasn't great, drinks were mediocre and food was poor.

5.description: When a friend suggested Grandview Tavern as a place to go and watch the game, I couldn't place it until I saw that it was the old Cafe Fresco.  Well good for us as it was just as fun as I remembered to be.This is a great neighborhood bar with good food and drinks, plenty of TV's, a jukebox and a pretty nice patio out back.  A patio you say?  Why yes.  More of a hidden garden, if you will, with vines covering the walls and tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the street.  Few seem to know that this is even here as it is one of the great places to sit outside and drink without a huge wait.We had a burger and one of their grilled cheese sandwiches.  Very tasty and the sandwich was big enough for a second meal!  And for this moscow mule loving gal, they have those copper mugs which just seem to make everything taste better.  They also have a great beer list so be sure to check that out as well.Next time you are looking for a great neighborhood place, check out the Grandview Tavern.  The food will bring you in and the patio will keep you coming back!

3.description: 1 shot of Malort1 "The Radler" cocktail (Steigl grapefruit radler beer with gin)1 Grandview Tea (tea with vodka, St. Germain, and lemonade)When I say I didn't feel a thing, I don't mean that the alcohol numbed me.  Drinks were disappointingly weak, but at least we had a spot to hang out while we waited for another bar to open.  Meanwhile, I encouraged Courtney C. to try her first shot of Malort.  They have Malort here, so there's that.Thursday's special is half price flatbreads.  The Chilaquiles flatbread was a tad spicy but delicious and definitely worth the $5.  We ordered this after I realized I had only eaten a protein bar and a few samples of toffee at Terry's Toffee down the street.Grandview has an OK atmosphere, it's another other bar or tavern.  The service was great too, she was attentive and didn't seem bothered that we lingered for awhile.  It's a decent neighborhood bar, but I don't have a reason to come back again.

35.description: Great Jeppson's Malort cocktail. The bartender was super awesome running back and fourth a lot. One of my drinks took a while but she was super sweet about it and apologized. Great hang out spot most def coming back!

19.description: I was here in July for a few drinks on a hot night.  The bar inside was basically empty but the beer garden out back was a nice place to kick back, take it easy, and enjoy some beer.  They had a nice selection to choose from.

28.description: Great little bar. Beer garden out back very nice. Service by Amy very personable and nice. Just stopped in for a couple of beers before getting on train but the food that people ordered looked and smelled very good.

45.description: Although we were visiting Chicago only briefly, my friend and I managed to stop into Grandview Tavern twice, and we agreed this would be our neighborhood spot if we lived nearby. Grandview is a friendly, casual neighborhood pub with an awesome beer list, very decent pub fare and most importantly, attentive bartenders who make it worth a stop.We managed to while away the better part of a Sunday night here watching a game on the TVs behind the bar, chatting with the bartender and sampling a variety of their great beers on draft. You can do a tasting of four beers (four four ounce pours) which is a nice way to try a few if you're not sure what to order. The food menu has some nice choices and we thought their sweet potato fries were awesome. Everything here is reasonably priced and the welcoming atmosphere make it a place you want to linger. Overall, a great neighborhood spot and one I look forward to visiting when I'm back in Chicago.

33.description: DON'T GO HERE...  because I want the patio all to myself!What an amazing hidden gem. This patio rules. It's for sure my new go to outdoor bar in the neighborhood.  Just loved everything about it.  Food was tasty, great beer selection, amazing seating, perfect television situation to watch the World Cup, friendly service, clean, awesome.STAY AWAY.  It's mine!

43.description: I'm actually sitting inside Grandview Tavern right now trying to think of a good way to describe this place.  The best I can think of is:  OK.  The beer selection is good in theory except that they don't seem to be very good at keeping things in stock, as witnessed by the awkward two-time, "So, we don't actually have that one right now."  Once I did order an in-stock beer, the drunk owner turned to me and asked if I was drinking a Guinness because it didn't look like any of HIS other taps (said in his best "Hey, look at me! I own a bar, this is my bar!" voice).The menu looked pretty good, which was part if my reason for coming, only the ownership has unfortunately not trained its staff on the menu. A pork belly cuban with ham should come with both pork belly and ham... not just the least tender pork belly I have consumed sans-ham.  Cuban sandwich = ham just about... everywhere.But the chef... err... cook did come out and apologize for his mistake, which is commendable.Overall:  Meh.  There are two or three better places around the corner with consistently good food and service.  I don't plan to come back.

2.description: Grandview has many things going for it: an extensive list of beers at reasonable prices, an absolutely stunningly beautiful garden, clean bathrooms, and friendly service. The one thing I wish I could say is that I loved the food, but I just can't. First of all, they were completely out of their famous wings, which was the dinner special of the day. This was disappointing. Then, when I ordered a philly cheese steak sandwich the waitress highly recommended, she came back 5 minutes later to let me know they "didn't have that item today." Ok. Finally, now starving at this point, I ordered an ancho chili chicken sandwich. The food was ok. The French fries are the thin kind, similar to McDonald's fries, but crispier. I wasn't a fan of them at all. Furthermore, my sandwich was pretty mediocre. The chicken breast was grilled well but it had no seasoning. It was severed on a focaccia bun with a slathering of "chili" mayo. The mayo tasted more like tomato paste, and it was very bland. The focaccia role was good but didn't seem to fit the sandwich well. My boyfriend's burger was also just ok, nothing special. And he had to ask twice for the jalapeños he had ordered to come on the burger.Our waitress was very sweet but she was literally the only one on staff, causing our meal to take over 2 hours because of the extreme wait time for our drinks, food, order corrections, etc.The beer selection was great and the beer garden is GORGEOUS. I wish I could have loved Grandview, I really do. I'm hoping maybe we just caught them on an off night, I'm not sure. Overall, this would be a great date night spot to just have a few beers, but I would skip the food!

18.description: Solid service. Food late. Welcoming crowd. Beats the pants off Twisted Spoke! (where we sat for several minutes with menus).

41.description: This bar is excellent. Wednesday night trivia is top-notch. The bartenders are awesome, service is awesome, and the crowd rocks.  One bad thing, however, is that the bar tenders cannot take shots with the patrons!! Bad management decision- myopic and counterintuitive. It's fun to order the great bartenders and staff shots. On top of that, the bartenders make more money if they can take a shot with their customers! Anyway, the grilled cheese is awesome, and the fried pickles are fun. This is definitely my partner's and my new favorite neighborhood jam. We live a few blocks away and visit at least twice a week. It's nice to have a neighborhood bar we like just a few blocks from our house. I do encourage the managerial team to reconsider their decision- especially on Wednesdays- we like to buy your excellent staff a shot or drink here and there! Anyway, five stars- great bar, fun people, awesome atmosphere. Irrefragably the best bar on Grand! See you soon, Grandview. When we originally bought our condo here, we were not sure about whether our transition from the north side to here would be smooth- but Grandview had played an instrumental part in us adjusting to our new neighborhood. The lenitive effect of a great bar a couple blocks away from your new house in a new hood is indisputable. Great times, casual crowd, and wonderful overall experience. Thanks so much!

52.description: Had dined here in the garden when this location was called Fresco so I was looking forward to visiting the new and improved Grandview.  My friend was in from California the weather was beautiful I live in the hood we walked over.  To my embarrassment and disappointment what used to be a beautiful intimate patio has turned into an al fresco sports bar.  Televisions mounted on the bar were blaring and WORST of all they have allowed smoking on the patio.  As we left an employee explained that smoking is allowed 15 feet from the door.  I will never go back nor would I recommend the patio unless you are a smoker.

50.description: Great place!! Food is good and the staff is amazing!!

4.description: Cool little bar and they have take out beer! They also have this boozy tea and oh my goodness, it is perfect for hot summer days. This is a fun bar to go to for any major sports games (especially Hawks games!), as they have large TVs, but it never gets overly packed, even though it isn't a huge bar.As for the take out beer, there's a lot of BYOB restaurants in the area, so this is a great place to stop by if you're headed to dinner and forgot to bring some drinks with you.

6.description: Amy Lynn was not our server but we asked if she would turn on the tvs in the patio area. I'm not certain what the technical issue was, but the was no way she could get a signal. After trying every option (unplugging and plugging back in, changing the input,changing the channels, etc...), I finally conceded that it was ok and I will enjoy my meal without the tv. But she wouldn't give up. She was bent on making sure I was able to watch the game and she spent over 45 minutes, between her taking care of customers, trying. She called the owner and had kitchen staff out to try. She even had a customer who is tech savvy give it a go. The end result was no tv and missing the end of the game yet the takeaway is the exemplary customer service, going above and beyond reasonable expectations to make customers experience amazing. I applaud the effort and pride and passion that Grandview instills in their employees and the fact that the meal was great doesn't hurt. Thank you Grandview and Amy Lynn. Excellent work!

22.description: What a great little spot!  It's the dead of winter right now, so I can't speak to the patio, but the kitchen serves up great bar fare (and at a good price).  They also have daily specials that include $5 for their flatbread and $5 for brisket burgers.Open for lunch, too!

15.description: Hard to believe I've forgotten to put a review up for Grandview since it's the place in my neighborhood that I've frequented the most in my 10 years in West Town, going back to the Fresco days.Great beer garden, tons of TVs for sports, excellent eclectic beer selections on draft and also a myriad of great unique stuff in tall boy cans, solid food and an outstanding group of bartenders who are super friendly and awesome.  Really fun relaxing environment, great for a weekend night out, or just a beer or three after work during the week.

57.description: I've been coming to this spot for a couple years and it's now better than ever! The  beer garden in the back has been upgraded to include a long wooden bar complete with flat screens so that you can watch your favorite game while enjoying the outdoors. I recently stopped in after a Blackhawks playoff game and the place had such a fun inviting atmosphere. They always have a great tap beer selection that changes frequently. I haven't been to the Thursday night trivia but I've heard it's a good time. My favorites on the menu include the grilled calamari, chicken caesar pizza and any of the sandwiches with the sweet potato fries.I wish I lived a little bit closer and this place would be my neighborhood go to spot. I've had a great experience with all the staff and there always seem to be fun friendly people hanging out here. I've been here for Bears games and the owners make it fun by passing out orange and blue jello shots when our team scores! Also had the pleasure of spending NYE here and it was equally nice when they had the champagne toast at midnight.Overall a great spot to hang with friends, watch a sports game, and enjoy the rare nice Chicago weather in the beer garden.

20.description: I was excited to go based on the reviews and decided to watch some of the March Madness tournament here. Unfortunately our food was disgusting. We ordered the fresh mozzarella to start but it wasn't hot and came out with the rest of our food. I had the salmon BLT which sounded delicious but actually tasted like rotten vegetables. It was inedible. The fries are worse than a fast food place. My fiancé ordered the mix and match sliders that he said were 'ok'. Our drinks were fine but they have a pretty limited beer list for a 'beer garden'. On top of that, we ordered multiple beers that our waitress would then inform us they didn't actually have. Overall it was a bad experience, the service wasn't great, drinks were mediocre and food was poor.

36.description: This joint is a "Partiers HAVEN" !! Great Beer List/ Awesome Beer Garden and great "Pub Grub".. what more can you ask for? Ask for Amy! get dat did

14.description: Pros:  Great drinks, nice beer garden, and patient server.Cons:  The food was HORRIFIC! Everything tastes like freezer burn, stale chips, the blue cheese looked like semen, I don't want to talk about the taste.  The steak was so chewy, I wouldn't give it to my dog.  If you're hungry, don't bother coming here when then twisted spoke is right next door, otherwise the beer garden is great for drinks.

28.description: Tasty food with nice staff and quick service, sure they have greasy options but they also have great Chicken and salads as well as a decent breakfast.

1.description: Just paid $6.50 for a hotdog and fries. So i either got ripped off or they charged me for 2. Which is what i asked for. Either way Home Depot across the street is fresher and cheaper.Food was ok and I actually like the naturally grungy but not too grungy atmosphere.  Gyro on the spigot is always key. Regardless they screwed the order up so I wont go back.  Big city with many restaurants that don't make mistakes like that.

9.description: OH MY GOD!!! This place has the BEST chicken I've ever had! The food is super fresh and after sampling almost the entire menu, I'm addicted!! And...now they deliver to my work! Thanks to me and my big mouth my whole office is also now addicted! You are welcome everyone!!! PS...the cheese fries and Greek salad are amazing too!!! Super Clean and I think it's family run! LOVE!!!!!!

29.description: Stanley, I love the produce market. But, the cafe? Lacking a bit. Lots of greasy stuff...I thought you were concerned with our health? You serve such nice lucious things at the store across the street...The food is so/so. Good enough for the lunch crowd, I suppose. But, I like hearty breads, I think you should offer something besides white. Oh, and processed deli meat for the sandwiches...ick. And for the love of God Stan, serve up some Diet Coke. Pepsi sucks. However, I will continue to shop across the street...maybe if you get a DC machine, I'll be back for a lunch stop. Best,Colleen

23.description: you know what?  i'm sad to see a bunch of crappy reviews for stanley's.  i've only been here once but the chicken is pretty damn good.  granted, i'm a sucker for anything grilled.

5.description: This is a hidden gem. The food her is always hot, fresh and delicious. This has been a go to for years. The chicken is excellent. Inside is clean and the staff is nice. They have a daily veggie. Parking in rear. Fresh made salsa is great. Garlic bread spot on. BBQ sauce is served hot and is spot on

25.description: Stanley's is one of the few places to dine within the industrial sector between North/Clybourn shopping and the Wicker Park hip.  It's either Stanley's (or their fruit/produce market), Burger King, or Mr. Pollo.  I figured Stanley's would be the best option with a group of 15 who all had different tastes and were on a schedule.  They are quick so I give 'em that.  As for the food itself, everyone's food was just average in taste...even the burgers and chicken which they're known for.  I thought the 1/4 chicken meal with blah vegetables, rice and a pita was worth the $6.  The chicken was a bit bland and dry but I dealt with it by filling myself up with the accompanied carbs.  Simply average.

12.description: Fabulous broiled chicken...Is what the menu and sign outside said.  I would agree that the flavor was fabulous.  Texture/presentation-wise, the chicken was a bit on the greasy side, however.  Ditto for the white rice that came in the chicken entree.  The steamed broccoli was good, gyro pita was an odd inclusion but no compliants, and the red tomato-based hot sauce didn't really do anything for me.  I love it's proximity to my new office, and also that the amazeballs Stanley's fresh produce is right across the street.  Still, not quite 4-star territory yet. I'll be back though. I'm sure I can find that sweet spot in the lunchtime menu.... ohhhh yeeeeeeeeee

21.description: The chicken meals they have here are delicious, very fresh, and a great taste. I'm not giving them 5 stars because they only give a small amount of food. The cake slices they have for dessert are great, I recommend those.

16.description: The men's room stunk so bad, that I couldn't go in there.

17.description: I've had lunch here at least once a week for two years, which tells you two things about me:1. I am pretty lazy.2. Stanley's has enough variety in their menu that I've yet to get bored.Hot Dogs? Half a chicken? Gyros? Steamed veggies or rice instead of fries with your cajun chicken sandwich? All that and a full breakfast menu.The atmosphere isn't the most exciting out there, but if you want food that is a step up from fast food for the same prices, then Stanley's is hard to beat.

10.description: I was brought here by a friend about a year ago. and have been coming at least once a week since. they are known for their chicken , whether you get the half Grecian or kabob or breast plates. I recommend the skirt steak.

11.description: I love this place... We frequent this spot every Saturday....  The cashiers  are always pleasant. And my fav cashier is Liz... when I call she always know our order.....

26.description: This place is Lame and the employees, especially the girl that works the counter, are extremely unfriendly . Mediocre greasy fast food, especially when you consider that it is associated with a produce market. I recently ordered the chicken dinner, and it came with frozen peas and carrots?!?!!! recently, a co-worker went there and was asked to pay $.50 for 2 extra katchup packets with his take out! I wanted to like this place due to its close vicinity to my work, but I will never go there again.

27.description: Big portions, hit or miss on taste...several greasy menu options, slow  to receive the fast food you ordered, and yes I agree with one reviewer, the staff is humorless and totally epitomize an "I hate my job" attitude.   This is a fill your belly up type of place for the working class so if you are hungry and ready to stuff yourself, head to Stanley's Grill.

0.description: Their white rice with veggies is absolutely delicious.  Ordered a side of it and it was probably 2-3 cups for under $2. Not salty.  Not mushy.  Not dry.  Give it a try...you wont be disappointed Also had the half chicken meal... Delicious.  That is basically the only thing I can say about it lol.  Try it.  You wont be disappointed.  And the price is good too... Under $10 for half a chicken, rice, vegetables and a pita bread

20.description: I've had lunch here at least once a week for two years, which tells you two things about me:1. I am pretty lazy.2. Stanley's has enough variety in their menu that I've yet to get bored.Hot Dogs? Half a chicken? Gyros? Steamed veggies or rice instead of fries with your cajun chicken sandwich? All that and a full breakfast menu.The atmosphere isn't the most exciting out there, but if you want food that is a step up from fast food for the same prices, then Stanley's is hard to beat.

19.description: Stanley, I love the produce market. But, the cafe? Lacking a bit. Lots of greasy stuff...I thought you were concerned with our health? You serve such nice lucious things at the store across the street...The food is so/so. Good enough for the lunch crowd, I suppose. But, I like hearty breads, I think you should offer something besides white. Oh, and processed deli meat for the sandwiches...ick. And for the love of God Stan, serve up some Diet Coke. Pepsi sucks. However, I will continue to shop across the street...maybe if you get a DC machine, I'll be back for a lunch stop. Best,Colleen

2.description: This also ran by the same family as the produce store across the street. Been here 3 times...twice for breakfast and today for lunch. The young ladies that work here are always smiling and cordial. It's usually slow and mellow during breakfast time but t was surely popping during lunch time. Breakfast is not the best I've had but can't be beat for the quality and quantity you receive with such a great price! Denver omelette w/potatoes and toast for $5.65...Wow! Service is quick as well...even when busy. For lunch, I just had two things I was craving for...Gyro Meat and French fries together...Grub...Grub! I also like their nice seating arrangement for a medium sized restaurant along with two flat screen tv's! Good place for some grub for breakfast and lunch...NOT open for dinner!

18.description: Good and cheap. Chicken is definitely the go-to here. I actually like there breakfast too.

13.description: Only got a few minutes for lunch?Want fast service?What a hardy meal?Well you're looking at the right review. Let's keep in mind that this little café is the evil little brother from the Stanley's produce market. Their luscious and delicious meals are geared for the lunch crowded... This is not fine dining... simply order and go! I had the strip steak (please reference the picture) and had a hard time finishing it. Their portions are king!Their décor is a seamless modern America dinner/café... something small but cleanTheir service could use some improvement... I really don't have much to say about this please... a great place for lunch, but I will never take a date here.

4.description: The burger was good, I was in a happy place eating it and was almost finished before noticing the entire place was crawling with ants and some other type of bug. I got a few pictures too of the ants.Kind of scares me thinking of what is in their kitchen

24.description: Only got a few minutes for lunch?Want fast service?What a hardy meal?Well you're looking at the right review. Let's keep in mind that this little café is the evil little brother from the Stanley's produce market. Their luscious and delicious meals are geared for the lunch crowded... This is not fine dining... simply order and go! I had the strip steak (please reference the picture) and had a hard time finishing it. Their portions are king!Their décor is a seamless modern America dinner/café... something small but cleanTheir service could use some improvement... I really don't have much to say about this please... a great place for lunch, but I will never take a date here.

6.description: three stars--A-OK exactly right.  Place is cheap and clean--decent counter service food.  A lot of cab drivers and city workers--2 unambitious groups who can be relied upon for decent lunch values.  I think the place has some connection to the real Stanley s across the street--veg of the day was broccoli which they served by the ton.  When i went to buy veg across the street--they had a ton for sale. 1/4 chicken dinner with broc and rice--$7.  Quite decent.  Breakfast looks cheap and nice.  Parking lot and wifi.  One of the best values on the northside.

22.description: Let's point out that we're not comparing Stanley's to Four Seasons.  I have to rate a place relative to what it's supposed to be.  For this reason I really wish there was a 3.5 rating.  When it comes down to it though 4 stars is 'I'm a fan' according to yelp, so 4 it is.  Here is the thing, its not fancy, the décor is mildly cheesy, but..and a big but...their food is good, wicked cheap, and the folks are friendly.  They are as good at cranking out quick cheap food for you as I am at writing run on sentences.  If my girlfriend reads this review she'll be cringing at my grammar.Seriously though, you can call an order in and 10 minutes later you're packed up and ready to go.  An egg and cheese sandwich is like 3 bucks!  One reviewer made the good point that it isn't a place for a date.  I'd agree unless your both hung over and already intimate; then....it's perfect;)All in all I like this place.  It's close to home, really fast, really cheap, and good fare for the money.  I can already taste my grilled cheese with ham hangover Saturday.Prost, Cheers, Salud, Bon Appetit, and all those great wishes!

15.description: Just ate the beef and cheese......terrible...dry and disgusting.  I ate there once before but don't remember what I had, but it must not have been too bad since I went back.  But this time, I will remember.  I won't be going back.  The beef looked like gyro meat or something...it was gross and I didn't feel too well an hour after I ate.  My friends did not like their chicken or stake sandwich either, but at least theirs look a bit better than the beef.

7.description: I work in the area and Stanley's is the perfect lunch place to run to for a fast meal.  They have an extensive menu that's priced a little on the high-side.  They say they are famous for their chicken- 100% the truth.  I usually go with the tenders, but all their chicken is super tender inside with that nice crisp skin on the outside.  Their salads are overpriced but it hasn't stopped me from ordering them.  I always get their Cesar salad with chicken.  It comes with garlic bread that is seriously addicting.  It is the main reason i keep going back.  Other favorites- Cajun chicken sandwich-not over spicy and super tender.
