Gyro Sandwich (huge amount of meat that is much cheaper than the gyro plate).  Cheeseburger-thin burgers, but super juicy.  And Every single breakfast sandwich.I always go at lunch time so it is busy, but the longest I've waited for a to-go order was about 10 min.  When ordering the salads it's about 3 minutes.  Everything is made to order so I have never thought I was waiting too long.  The daily people in Stanley's are locals who work in the area.  It's nice to see a place that has regulars, but if you're in the area it's a great diner to check out!

8.description: Awesome gyros plate a very good portion and the taste is over the top I love this place great neighborhood joint with lots of choices

3.description: Grilled chicen salad is HUGE and fresh and the chicken is great! No weird grey or "funky pieces" that look lille fake meat here! It's great! The staff are super friendly and they offer free wifi!The little table for two on the right by the window gets all the sun at noon so it;s pleasant to sit there and be warm. :)

14.description: I liked ordering here because it is close to my work and yes their fast and if you are hungry it's good enough but giving customers frozen salad dressing? Really???? What makes you think I can use a dressing that is frozen? Any person knows that! They make their own Italian dressing (I'm guessing) and it's in plastic containers so I guess when they put it in the refrigerator it freezes (shows how much fat is on it). If you know you use this dressing a lot, why not thaw them first when you give it to me so it's usable? How about that? I told the cashier and I ask for another one but she gave me another frozen one. I said, "do you have one that' s not frozen?", she said "yes", and handed me a frozen one. Happened in 3 occasions, I kept trying to give them a chance.  It's not a language barrier either because they speak/understand well. Their other food is plain, nothing special but even if it was good, I wouldn't come back due to lack of common sense and customer service.

58.description: Decent price, delicious food, and average service.

56.description: I am Thai from Thailand and I can say this place has a good Thai food with real Thai taste!! We had "Poh Tak", beef salad, and stirred vermicelli with chicken. Service was great too.

29.description: An out-of-town friend and I stopped by here for lunch. It was also my first time exploring the city. We were looking for sushi on a Sunday, which is apparently hard to come by before 4 or 5 pm. Props for being open earlier than the other places! We were on to plan B after the first place was closed for renovation and we barely saw this spot. Tummies rumbling, we decided to stop. The food was very satisfying. The Thai spring rolls were terrific! As was the Spider roll. They've got an extensive menu with creative choices (Chicago dog sushi...what?) I was disappointed with some of the produce (avocado and jalapeños were a bit dry, not freshly cut) and from someone who doesn't complain about water -- mine tasted funky. Also, the bathroom was clean -- always a plus.

42.description: Online orders beware. I have ordered via phone from here several times with no issue. Tonight, I ordered using GrubHub. I received the confirmation my order was received, a second update with a delivery window and a third update saying my food was on its way. After my delivery window came and went by 25 minutes, I called. Took them 5 minutes to try and find my order only to tell me there was a problem with the online service (and something I couldn't make out about a fax) and they never printed the ticket and my food was never made. I asked how I was able to receive an update that the food was en route...? She blamed the online ordering for updating that for them (impossible) and just kept asking if I wanted to place a new order. So after an hour and a half, three confirmations and updates, they never "got" my order, said "sorry" and then asked if I wanted to place a new order. They never offered to make up for their mistake and blamed GrubHub. They have now lost a customer. On a positive note, I informed GrubHub of the situation and they were beyond apologetic on behalf of the restaurant AND issued me a $5 GrubHub credit for the hassle. Now that is a great company.

23.description: Food was okay. Small portions.Delivery experience was terrible. Instead of actually coming to my door, the delivery guy called me from his van down the street and asked me to come out (and not bc he was lost or confused as to where my place was). I had to go downstairs, out the door and down the sidewalk in my pajamas and bare feet, and out towards where he was parked. Luckily, he at least got out of his van to hand me the food.Ridiculous.

47.description: I am still in the search for the nice Thai food in Downtown Chicago. Manee Thai has the good portion, nice flavor dishes but they could do better with the chicken and broccoli. I tried the Pad Sea Wee which came with a very generous portion. The only veggie were big chunks of hardly cooked broccoli. The Chicken was big piece and tough which were pretty much left untouched. I did like the noodles which was not over loaded with salt. Maybe I should have tried the Tofu dish.I did like the young coco iced juice which were really refreshing. That was my highlight of the lunch.

8.description: Ordered delivery and am disgusted and amazed by how bad it all is.Apple salad- crispy apple in the description but came with mealy apples.Basil chicken, no basil and very small amount. I can't believe the cook had the nerve to put so little in the container. Won't order or dine here ever again.

31.description: I live very close to Manee Thai and have been there often since they first opened (before the fire).  It's decent Thai food in a clean, decent atmosphere.  I've had the sushi, several noodle dishes, the the curries.  They menu is HUGE, which I love.  The good is pretty good, but not great, although the ingredients are usually pretty fresh.  I live very close and I'm glad we have it as a local option.    A great thing about Manee Thai is that they have a private room for parties, and (at least in the past), they will do Karaoke for your party.  Awesome.  The problem is that there are so many other Thai restaurants in the area that have better food, are more authentic, and are BYOB.  I think Thai Aree and Thai Thai have better Thai food, at lower prices.  (Similar prices, but you get more food.)  Admittedly, they are both "hole-in-the-wall" places, where you'd probably prefer to take-out,.  But, for me, the quality of the food is more important than the atmosphere or service. If I am willing to do the drive, I also like Sticky Rice on Western.  (Also BYOB with a huge menu.) Personally, the only reason I would choose Manee Thai over the others is: (1) to use the party room; or (2) if I want to dine-in with someone who needs a huge menu, does not like "hole-in-the-wall" restaurants, and/or prefers non-BYOB.

34.description: Ordered green curry with chive dumpling appetizer. The dumplings were fine if uninspired. Green curry had the consistency of a thin soup. Very thin, like a gruel, with limited flavor. Spice level was fine, a little burn without being overbearing. Curry should be a homogenous sauce, this was like a soup with separated curry bits.

16.description: An out-of-town friend and I stopped by here for lunch. It was also my first time exploring the city. We were looking for sushi on a Sunday, which is apparently hard to come by before 4 or 5 pm. Props for being open earlier than the other places! We were on to plan B after the first place was closed for renovation and we barely saw this spot. Tummies rumbling, we decided to stop. The food was very satisfying. The Thai spring rolls were terrific! As was the Spider roll. They've got an extensive menu with creative choices (Chicago dog sushi...what?) I was disappointed with some of the produce (avocado and jalapeños were a bit dry, not freshly cut) and from someone who doesn't complain about water -- mine tasted funky. Also, the bathroom was clean -- always a plus.

13.description: Was looking for a quick bite and this place didnt disappoint. Got the delivery and the food came fairly quickly. The portion sizes were huge. I've definitely had better thai food but  it was definitely a decent eat. Prices aren't too cheap but decent hence overall just okay...

11.description: It's BYOB so it has that going for it. There is even a liquor store near by. If I stopped here, I would have given this place at least 4 stars. But I won't.We arrived and sat in a pretty empty place, the wait staff greeted us promptly but then we sat there for about 10 minutes before ordering. We split a crab rangoon, spicy tuna roll (both of these recommended by a yelper), and a pad thai. There was way too much cucumber in the crab rangoon, but at least you have to think it was either house made or at least from a different distributor from other restaurants. The spicy tuna was ok, nothing to boast about, but I've been on a "I don't enjoy sushi" kick lately. The pad thai, however, was the reason I bumped this down to 2 stars. It was way too eggy and we both thought that the egg "smelled" bad. Trying to avoid it was near impossible. The actual noodles were ok, but that was it.

39.description: Manee Thai #2 is my go-to delivery spot. I love their Thai noodle dishes of course, but they also have some of my favorite sushi rolls I've had in the city. Appetizers are solid as well.

37.description: The food was pretty okay, but our meal ended with having to knock cockroach off of the chair. Won't be back

0.description: This was my first time at Manee Thai but I plan to come back many times!  White crisp table clothes and tasteful art set a lovely atmosphere.  The lunch menu had 28 options for $7.75. The meal came with a soup, appetizer, and entree. Plating was fabulous and the service extremely attentive. The food was delicious and freshly made. I was extremely impressed and plan to take my employees there next week!

38.description: Nothing special here. Got the pan curry and it was not the worst I've had, but also not the best I've had either. My friend got the duck and it wasn't very good. I give it just average rating.

51.description: I waited 2.5 hours for my food to be delivered on a Monday night. The wait wasn't worth it - the food was cold, they forgot a portion of ingredients in the rice dish, and it's apparent that the veggies in the rice dish were frozen, not fresh. Blah. Not going to try here again. The only good that came of it was Grubhub credited the meal for my next order, and the delivery driver was nice to look at ; ) Both have nothing to say about the food, though.

27.description: Horrible, Horrible service.  Very rude!  Placed an order for delivery and was told the order would be here in an hour.  After 1.5 hours, called restaurant and was told order was never printed out for them to make and that they were just canceling the order and wouldn't be delivering.  They weren't apologetic, and were in fact rude.  I would have excepted an apology for the order being 1.5+ hours late and them to put a rush once the issue was brought to their attention.

32.description: Manee Thai #2 is my #1 go to delivery spot for sushi and delicious apps. I have yet to be let down by their food. I order from them usually every Sunday. Sushi Sundays are the highlight of my week. There may have been a time or two that something was forgotten or cold (a warm app) but after calling, they were more than happy to make it right with my next order and that's really what counts. The Gyoza, the crab Rangoon and the crunchy spicy tuna rolls are what keep me coming back. Their pad thai is killer too!

54.description: I love Thai food. I was happy to see Manees selection of food. They have some things that other Thai places close to me don't have. I always play it safe the first time I order from new paces, I figure if they can't get the basics right, then I'm not risking the not so basic menu items. So I got the Sweet and Sour with brown rice and a Thai coffee. Both were perfect. The Chicken they use is really soft and doesn't taste very bland like other places. The sauce wasn't thick and gross like other Thai places I have eaten at, and the rice was fine. Food came fast and the people were friendly. I can't really ask for much more. I should have taken a menu so I could have it delivered sometime... I will definitely be coming back, and would certainly recommend to any one.

48.description: Some friends and I stopped in for dinner on a recommendation, and I'm sooo glad we did!  We shared  the Thai Spring Roll appetizer, which I found pretty mediocre and flavorless, but my friends loved.  They each had the Pad Thai (him spicy, hers regular), and I had the Spicy Basil Noodle with tofu.  My entree was pretty good - the tofu was cooked well, and there was a fair amount of spice and sauce.  The portions were very generous, but they were so good that we cleaned our plates! Water was refilled regularly, and our server was attentive yet not overbearing.  I'd definitely go back to try some of their other offerings.

44.description: Very bland. We ordered in and were very disappointed. Shrimp was fishy. Won't order it again.

24.description: I have been pretty loyal to this place since finding it several years back. Typically I have LOVED their food.  So much so that when I moved to Lincoln Park I still ordered and drove to pick up. I am sad though more recently. They have changed their noodles. They are soggy lately and even more disappointing is that I feel like the last 3 times I ordered I got MAYBE 3 pieces of chicken in my pad Thai. Mostly egg. Just not so in love anymore. Suddenly seeking a new Thai place.

7.description: Just had dinner w/the familyStaff is OKFood is good but huge portionsPrices are OKHope this place get more coustomers Let's souport this  neighborhood restaurants if you pay cash you had a 10 % off in your checkAwesome

49.description: Bland (even if you ask for it spicy). Could they at least cut the vegetables properly so they cook evenly? No? Ok. At least service is quick if you dine in. The dining area is pleasant. Now if only they could execute food well! Call Bella's Pizza down the street. Order the stuffed spinach & garlic pizza. You're welcome.

40.description: Favorite pad thai in chicago!! Amazing appetizers too. Crab in a bag is yummy and so are the spring rolls. I have yet to get something from here that I didn't like.

53.description: When it's prime time for dinner and there are only 3 tables occupied, it's not a good sign.If you absolutely need food to survive, then I guess this would suffice.  However, it's not tasty Thai.Luc Thang, almost a mile up Ashland is better.  Or if you're heading to Wicker Park, Pot Pan Thai is always good.

30.description: It's BYOB so it has that going for it. There is even a liquor store near by. If I stopped here, I would have given this place at least 4 stars. But I won't.We arrived and sat in a pretty empty place, the wait staff greeted us promptly but then we sat there for about 10 minutes before ordering. We split a crab rangoon, spicy tuna roll (both of these recommended by a yelper), and a pad thai. There was way too much cucumber in the crab rangoon, but at least you have to think it was either house made or at least from a different distributor from other restaurants. The spicy tuna was ok, nothing to boast about, but I've been on a "I don't enjoy sushi" kick lately. The pad thai, however, was the reason I bumped this down to 2 stars. It was way too eggy and we both thought that the egg "smelled" bad. Trying to avoid it was near impossible. The actual noodles were ok, but that was it.

46.description: I don't know why it's the case in this city, but I can seldom find a Thai place that is just Thai and isn't adding some other Asian fare to the menu.  And that's the case with Manee Thai and their sushi bar, too. I can't review that side of the restaurant though, because I have been pretty obsessed  with the dishes that I ordered the first time and am struggling to switch it up.My boyfriend and I love this place and it is our go-to for take out or for a quick meal out.  For some reason it's always empty.  Why aren't there more people in there?!  They are friendly and fast, the space is clean and comfortable, and the flavors here are much better than other Thai places in the area. Where is everybody?We get the chive dumplings to start.  The sweet brown sauce and chewy/sticky dumplings feel like the best junk food, but they're green -- so they've got to be healthy, right?! My boyfriend gets the chicken red curry and is always happy.  He is a little bit of a snob when it comes to curry, so I'm happy to have found one that he likes. He also has a nut allergy and every waitress we've had here has been accommodating and made us feel like he'll get an uncontaminated meal -- somewhat of a feat at a Thai place.I am boring and get the Pad Thai with tofu.  It is perfect.

1.description: Manee T is standard resty Thai fodder which will satisfy that need just fine in comfy and clean environs.  Menu is fairly massive making you tedious if you can't find anything to your liking.  Highlights are the Gong Bao and the silky smooth Green Curry, stick w the Thai and skip the sushi i'd say.Oh and BYO obvi.

55.description: Okay Thai food. Ordered the Pad See Ew, but found it rather bland in comparison with other Thai restaurants. Especially for the price.

9.description: My experience at this joint was offensively BAD. I cannot tell whether one should get Chinese takeout or opt for eating Thai-ish food from Manee Thai. Granted the two times I ordered from this place it seemed to taste ok, the pad Thai and pad see ew I ordered at the restaurant had no spice or flavor. Both were too sweet. The pad Thai came out pink, lukewarm and seemed to be cooked with honey. Really no chillies or peanuts in there.Tom yum soup did not taste the least bit like it should taste-it is usually hot, sour and spicy. Their soup tasted like chicken broth with a squeeze of lime-- and it had chunks of raw tomato in it! Yuck. Just... Don't bother.

26.description: This is my favorite Thai joint in the entire area. Service is always great and when I do delivery it is pretty fast too. I love the rolls, fried rice and chicken with added pineapple in addition to the pad thai. Everything I have ever eaten here has been consistently on point.

25.description: My experience at this joint was offensively BAD. I cannot tell whether one should get Chinese takeout or opt for eating Thai-ish food from Manee Thai. Granted the two times I ordered from this place it seemed to taste ok, the pad Thai and pad see ew I ordered at the restaurant had no spice or flavor. Both were too sweet. The pad Thai came out pink, lukewarm and seemed to be cooked with honey. Really no chillies or peanuts in there.Tom yum soup did not taste the least bit like it should taste-it is usually hot, sour and spicy. Their soup tasted like chicken broth with a squeeze of lime-- and it had chunks of raw tomato in it! Yuck. Just... Don't bother.

12.description: This place was really good! Though I wasn't incredibly impressed with the Pad Thai, the Crab in a Bag and Orange Chicken were SO good! The staff was really nice and they were jamming out to 90's music lol

59.description: This place has awesome Thai food. It isn't greasy like other places in town and I think they steam their meat instead of frying it.  Their tofu isn't crumbly and is cut in firm pieces.  They also have the option of brown rice if you are trying to be healthy.We always order from Manee Thai through GrubHub.  We only had one minor delivery error and they refunded the whole dish to make up for it.  They are our favorite Thai spot in town.  Check them out!!

21.description: Just had dinner w/the familyStaff is OKFood is good but huge portionsPrices are OKHope this place get more coustomers Let's souport this  neighborhood restaurants if you pay cash you had a 10 % off in your checkAwesome

17.description: Ok. Sushi isn't that good. Good byob alternative when butterfly is too busy

10.description: I've been coming to Manee Thai now for at least 2 years.  Sometimes dine-in, but mostly just pick-up.  Can I just tell you that every time I order Pad See Eiw either with tofu or shrimp - it comes out just perfect?  I love the way Manee Thai char-broils their protein just right in any of their dishes!  I had Pad See Eiw w/shrimp the other day from Joy's Noodles on Broadway and can I tell you that I was EXTREMELY disappointed???  I thought for sure that it was going to taste exactly like my Manee Thai Pad See Eiw and of course it wasn't.  I feel like I was completely let down!So I just wanted to write this review and tell Manee Thai that I'm sorry that I took so long for me to write a review.  And that I took you for granted.  My apologies and I hope you keep doing what you do best - which is cook GREAT Thai food!Also, wanted to say that I love Manee Thai's Crab Rangoon appetizer as well!  They always make sure to poke holes in my container so that by Rangoon's stay crispy!  They also do a great job of delivering food as well!Thanks, Manee Thai!  I love you!ps. Your Thai Iced Coffee rocks as well!  ;)

5.description: I ordered three Icys (Guava, Pineapple, and Lychee) for delivery. It took 70 minutes and the delivery bag reeked of cigarette. Not to mention the car could not come to the right address though I left very specific instructions. The icys were ok, they were quite watery.

3.description: Placed a takeout order on 11/5 (a Thursday) and it took an hour and fifteen minutes for it to be delivered. My sister and I ordered online under my name and used her debit card...didn't think that would be a problem. The delivery guy (who reeked of cigarettes) repeatedly asked my last name and the name on the debit card before giving me the food. It was so weird and rude. The worst part, however, was finding a hair on my sushi. Never again will I order from this place. Yuzu is down the street and a little pricier but well worth it.

35.description: Tasty and wide variety of sushi rolls in a casual, BYOB, no-frills atmosphere. Friendly staff.

19.description: Food was okay. Small portions.Delivery experience was terrible. Instead of actually coming to my door, the delivery guy called me from his van down the street and asked me to come out (and not bc he was lost or confused as to where my place was). I had to go downstairs, out the door and down the sidewalk in my pajamas and bare feet, and out towards where he was parked. Luckily, he at least got out of his van to hand me the food.Ridiculous.

28.description: Bye Bye Manee Thai. I ordered some pretty easy and standard items, nothing that was too elaborate or should have taken too long - a curry dish, pad thai, spring rolls and crab rangoon. They told me it would be about 45 minutes to one hour. Understandable. Like the last time I ordered, I waited, and waited and waited. After 90 minutes, I called them to get an update; obviously, they said it was "on it's way." I asked them since it's been 90 minutes, 30 minutes over what they said it would be, and that I'm just a few blocks away, could they at least take off the crab rangoon as most likely they would be cold and soggy, or just to take the delivery fee off. I was transferred to someone who I assume was a manager who informed me that: "[We] are not a fast-food restaurant, and if you wanted fast-food, you should have gone to McDonalds"! EXCUSE ME?!?!? That's the way they treat customers? I told them to just cancel my order. And then, how ironic, about 10  minutes after calling them, one hour and 40 minutes after placing my order, my doorbell rang and my food was here.   When I felt the containers, they were stone cold; when I looked at the bill, nothing was discounted. Obviously I told them they could keep it. This will be the last time EVER being a customer there (dine-in or delivery.) There are so many better places in the area that I'll be supporting from now on. The only reason I gave them one star is because having them there is better than a vacant store front.

45.description: I love this place! The service and food was excellent even though there was a full house and the mango ceviche is truly the best thing ever! We had a very enjoyable dinner and I will continue to go back.

33.description: If you don't mind being sold a small or medium portions being sold as large, great. Side dish vegetables are undercooked and they use frozen chicken tenders passed off as breast meat that are dry and tough.  If your not happy with the small portions for the price point or anything else, their attitude is,"That's how were do things." I guess they know that there are many Hipsters and people with money too spend in the Wicker Park area that don't realize they're being squeezed financially.

43.description: I wish I could give this place 0 stars. The driver was late and appeared disgruntled and disheveled. He made me regret that I tipped in advance on Grub Hub.The food was absolutely disgusting. I almost threw up. I ordered the basil noodles and the vegetables were boiled but blackened and the noodles were a mushy paste consistency. The whole thing was cold by the time it arrived AN HOUR LATER and looked like it had been thrown on the floor and packaged up for my delivery.I just wanted a decent meal, so much for that. I should've heeded the reviews but I thought---well maybe it was just that one person who had an issue since the other reviews were great. Clearly I was mistaken.Luckily Grub Hub read my mind and before I could even call to ask WTH happened, they had already issued a full refund and I ordered from somewhere else.Had I ordered directly from this place I would have....well, let's say it would not have been a good night.This place should be shutdown.

2.description: This is the type of place that would be more at home on Broadway Street in Lakeview. It is similar to Thai Village in that it is bland and inauthentic. I was somewhat expecting that but was still highly disappointed. The Thai soup does indeed have unmanageable chunks of raw tomatoes like other reviewers said. I asked for it to be extra spicy and it is not spicy at all. The sweet potato tempura roll was different than most I've had (not in a good way), but it was good enough because I was home sick and hungry. As a side note, I do enjoy Zoku's sweet potato tempura roll (a similar but better Thai/sushi joint in the West Town area).The only plus was that it was low in cost and came on time - hence the two stars. It is true that the delivery driver reeks of cigarettes though. I wonder how this place has stayed in business so long. Do they read their Yelp reviews? They should really listen to the few consistent, negative things people are saying about their business.

18.description: This is my favorite Thai joint in the entire area. Service is always great and when I do delivery it is pretty fast too. I love the rolls, fried rice and chicken with added pineapple in addition to the pad thai. Everything I have ever eaten here has been consistently on point.

41.description: LOVE!!!!!!!!!!! the stir friend rice, I do not eat asian food, ever! but I had a craving for plain stir fried rice, even had them put the sauce on the side.  OMG I am in love!!

52.description: I really liked this place. Ordered delivery last night for a nominal $2 fee.  They came fast and the food was really good.  I had the basil chicken which was big fresh pieces of chicken, the vietnamese spring rolls with peanut sauce which were great and fresh, and the tom yum chicken soup which was also very good.  If you live in the Noble, Wicker, Ukrainian areas this is a great spot for Thai delivery.  Much better than Butterfly which I was not impressed with at all.

50.description: I really, really dislike this restaurant. Without exaggeration, in the dozen or so times that we have ordered, there has not been a single time, not once, that our order was 100% as placed. The common fault is that the kitchen doesn't read the tickets that the people ordering write. There is a severe Bell Pepper allergy in our household, and many times i have to drive, after delivery, to switch out our food for a dish that won't cause a severe allergic reaction. Each time they get the ticket that they wrote to "show me that i didn't say that", yet each time it is written exactly as i ordered it. "NO BELL PEPPER, SEVERE ALLERGY". The latest mess that we ordered involved the "7 buddies" that is clearly described as "all together wrapped in green leaves", yet we got a do-it-yourself kit with ginger chopped as large as playing dice and tiny diced lime with the peel. If i wanted to put a meal together, i wouldn't have ordered out.They say insanity is doing the same thing over and over again and expecting a different result; we must be the nuttiest household in the city, but that stops tonight. Do yourself a favor and avoid the inevitable headache. DO NOT EAT HERE.

4.description: Ordered off of grub hub and they delivered which was convenient. Pad thai was standard nothing special. Sushi was ok. Decent takeout.

6.description: Their pad thai is pretty good and comes with fresh veggies... sprouts, cabbage, carrots, etc.  Their tom yum soup is tasteless.  I would much rather have the tom yum at Pot Pan on Milwaukee.

22.description: I have ordered delivery from Manee Thai 3 times now and have never been disappointed.I am a big fan of curries so I have sampled the red and panang curries so far and also the pad thai which were all delicious. I get the spring rolls, Tom Kha soup and Thai iced tea always with each order and everything always arrives warm and double bagged individually to prevent spillage which I appreciate. Delivery was average usually here between 45mins to an hour, no biggie as I am willing to wait for delicious food! Delivery guys are always friendly and I'll definitely continue ordering from here regularly!

15.description: Solid Thai offerings. I enjoyed the Rama Chicken and Crab Rangoon a great deal.  The Pad Thai was above average, but not spectacular. It is a reasonably priced neighborhood kind of place that I will likely come back to.  I wouldn't travel far and wide for it though.

57.description: I am Thai from Thailand and I can say this place has a good Thai food with real Thai taste!! We had "Poh Tak", beef salad, and stirred vermicelli with chicken. Service was great too.

20.description: Thanks GrubHub, I placed an order through GrubHub and ordered the chicken Pad Thai with extra peanuts and Vietnamese Spring Rolls. Everything was great, hot and delicious and the staff is super friendly. I will definitely be returning.

36.description: I've loved I've ever tried there.  Appetizers, Thai, Sushi.  It's all good!The people are so friendly.  Manee Thai #2

14.description: I have ordered delivery from Manee Thai 3 times now and have never been disappointed.I am a big fan of curries so I have sampled the red and panang curries so far and also the pad thai which were all delicious. I get the spring rolls, Tom Kha soup and Thai iced tea always with each order and everything always arrives warm and double bagged individually to prevent spillage which I appreciate. Delivery was average usually here between 45mins to an hour, no biggie as I am willing to wait for delicious food! Delivery guys are always friendly and I'll definitely continue ordering from here regularly!

1.description: Absolutely the best salon experience I have had in years, I'd give more stars if I could! My initial call with Amie was very pleasant and I was able to schedule an appointment within a few weeks. First impression is her salon is so cute, inviting and very clean. Amie was also a delight from the moment I walked through the door. We first sat and chatted about my hair concerns and what I am looking to achieve. I have naturally blonde hair with blonde balayage highlights... at least that's what I've been wanting. The salon/stylist I visited the previous three times I had my hair colored ended in results that I did not like. I have been trying to achieve a very cool, creamy blonde color but ended up with awful yellow balayage highlights. On top of that my roots were colored to be very warm, which is exactly the opposite of what I wanted/asked for. I was told by the previous stylist that my hair could not get to the color I wanted and that my hair is "stubborn". I knew this wasn't true as my hair has been highlighted cool blonde most of my hair coloring life. Anyway, that made me search for a new stylist and I am so grateful I found Amie! She listened to every single concern I had, explained the best way to get my color where I wanted then did her magic. She is a true hair artist. The color turned out way better than I expected, she transformed my yellow blonde hair to the beautiful cool, beige blonde exactly like I had envisioned and almost given up hope I could achieve. She also managed to tone down the brassiness of the base color so now the colors blend beautifully. I have not felt this great about my hair in so long and it's all thanks to Amie. Also, she is extremely friendly and easy to talk to. I've already recommended her to multiple people looking for a new stylist, they see the amazing transformation of my hair so her work actually speaks for itself. Her pricing is also extremely reasonable. Thank you Amie! The search is over... after 8 years of salon hopping in Chicago I finally found an amazing, talented stylist :)

9.description: After asking around Facebook for hairdresser recommendations, a friend led me to Amie! She took her time assessing my hair and what was going on with it and how to make it better, which definitely put me at ease. I trust a stylist who takes her time before anything is cut or colored! She also made sure we were on the same page with what I wanted. I had some super bright highlights that I wanted calmed down a little bit, and when the toner didn't fix it one time through, she added more toner-- no one has done that for me before even when I voiced my concerns about too light of highlights. She knew exactly what I wanted!Also, I have to mention what a positive light of a human being Amie is! It was a delight to chat with her during my appointment. She did an excellent job on the decor of the salon! Everything was bright, shiny, modern, and clean. I definitely will continue to go to Amie and her salon- my experience was wonderful and it was perfectly in my price range, which in Chicago is hard to come by!

23.description: Amie has been doing my hair for years, and I've followed her wherever she has worked. I always tell her what I am thinking and she suggests how that look will work for me, the result is always perfection. She's done cuts, color, highlights and extensions for me. I couldn't give her enough praise. I always trust her hair advise and her prices are more than reasonable. Her new salon space is beautiful! I highly recommend Amie to anyone looking for a new stylist!

25.description: Amie is great! She's done my hair in the past & I LOVE the new space! Super girly & modern. She really listens to your ideas about your hair & magically makes it happen even better than what you could have imagined! I'd recommend this place to anyone. I'll definitely be back! :)

12.description: I always love coming in to see Amie, my fellow Aries lady Came in to get my Balayage done, told Amie a general look that I was going for and that I wanted to switch it up a bit, the color came out amazing, beyond my expectations and so natural!This lady knows color and it comes to her with such ease. Needless to say I won't be going anywhere else for my hair needs besides Amarie's!

21.description: I was referred to Amarie's by a co-worker who had great hair and great things to say about Amie.  I had an evening appointment on a Monday, which I was impressed by because its so hard to get an evening appointment.  The location is great, plenty of street parking and easy to get to.  The salon itself is beautiful, very comfortable and extremely clean.  Amie was friendly from the moment I walked in.  She gave me the best hair consult I've ever had.  I've never had anyone take the time to discuss what I wanted, what could be achieved and how they would go about doing it, in such great detail.  It gave me great confidence that she would do a great job, and she really did.  I have long and very thick hair.  She did a sombre, color correction and a cut.  It looks beautiful and I couldn't be happier.  Amie really knows her stuff!  She's up on trends, product and new techniques.  We were there until midnight and it was worth it!

16.description: I'm not one to write reviews but just had to say a few things about the magic that Amie does on my hair. I've been going to Amie for about over 6 years now. EVERY time I've come in to see her and either need a cut, highlights, style it is complete perfection. She did my hair for my wedding and my bridesmaids hair as well and each girl was different, classic and on point. I moved to LA but when I travel back to Chicago I still see Amie as my stylist because No One has colored my hair or changed it up for something new and fresh like she has. If you live in the Chicago area, she is by far the BEST hairstylist in the city.

17.description: I've been meaning to write a review about Amie for sometime now, she's been doing my hair for almost 6 years! Not only does she give a beautiful cut, but she's a genius at color. I change my hair a lot and she's always been super excited with each change. She's creative, and loves to give suggestions along side your own ideas of the look you're going for. I saw a review on here complaining that Amie's clients must all be her friends. Amie started out being my hairstylist and several years later I worked at a Salon with her. When I decided to go out on my own with Esthetics she was one of my biggest cheerleaders and mentor. Always being supportive and giving advice when needed. A friend indeed. Women helping women. Amie has worked for herself for several years and does everything on her own. She's one of the busiest people I know in the Industry! I've sent several of my own clients to her without hesitation because I know they'll be happy with the results they receive. Amie loves what she does. She is not just a five star, Amie is a Ten!

10.description: Amie is fantastic! She has been cutting my hair for several years and always does an amazing job. Last year my grays came in (ugh) but I didn't want to do a major color job so I started getting a gloss from her and it's the best!! She always gets the color just exactly right - never too dark, and it's full of shine and bounce for weeks!Amie also did my hair for a wedding and gave me the most gorgeous, soft updo. It was so pretty that I was sad to have to take it down! One other thing that really sets her apart is her amazingly positive and sunny attitude! Even after 8-10 hours on her feet, she is so incredibly pleasant and clearly loves what she does for a living! She's so much fun to chat with when I'm in the chair - I always leave the salon with a smile on my face and pep in my step!I just wish there was an Amie in NYC since I recently moved!!

5.description: Amie is amazing. I've been seeing her since 2008 and wouldn't dream of trusting my hair with anyone else. I have thick, curly hair and she knows exactly how to cut, color and style it so that it looks good straight or curly. She helps me to change things up and is open and honest about when I come to her with a bad idea. ;) We have great conversation and, when necessary, I can use her WiFi to get a little work done - although I never want to because I'd rather catch up! I've recommended three or four co-workers to her - all of whom have become lifelong fans as well. It's also great to be able to book by text which saves me time and is my preferred form of communication. Always respectful, always professional, always a great color and cut - she's the best!

11.description: I LOVE Amie! I'm super picky and indecisive especially when it comes to my hair. She listens to what I like and don't like, gives me her honest opinion about how a cut or color may look on me. She's professional and always up to date on trends with color and cuts. Not only that, but Amie remembers so many details about me. I only see her a few times per year, but she always remembers what we talked about the last time I was in (which is especially impressive given how many other clients she has). I have gotten cut, color, and formal styles with Amie and have absolutely loved everything. Also her salon is just the cutest! I can't say enough good things about Amie as both a professional and a person. She's truly one of the good ones.

22.description: After asking around Facebook for hairdresser recommendations, a friend led me to Amie! She took her time assessing my hair and what was going on with it and how to make it better, which definitely put me at ease. I trust a stylist who takes her time before anything is cut or colored! She also made sure we were on the same page with what I wanted. I had some super bright highlights that I wanted calmed down a little bit, and when the toner didn't fix it one time through, she added more toner-- no one has done that for me before even when I voiced my concerns about too light of highlights. She knew exactly what I wanted!Also, I have to mention what a positive light of a human being Amie is! It was a delight to chat with her during my appointment. She did an excellent job on the decor of the salon! Everything was bright, shiny, modern, and clean. I definitely will continue to go to Amie and her salon- my experience was wonderful and it was perfectly in my price range, which in Chicago is hard to come by!

0.description: I moved to Chicago 6 years ago and spent a lot of time reading reviews to find a new stylist (I'd been burned before by too many too expensive and terrible haircuts).  I found Amie when she was at a salon in Lincoln Park and she had RAVE reviews.  I became an instant fan.  Amie does great hair.  No question.  Color is always impeccable and style is always well-executed while still fitting my needs, time allowance, and skill level.  Amie also gives the best scalp massage ever.  I've now followed her to three different salons and travel 45 minutes via CTA to get to my appointments.  So worth it!What's equally important though is that Amie is just plain cool.  She puts off a really comfortable and approachable vibe.  She's honest about what would and won't work in styling decisions and doesn't make you feel bad for asking silly questions.  Amie is lot of fun to chat with through the process.  Last shout out -- my husband has been going to Amie for the better part of four years and has never looked better.  He has thin hair and a receding hairline.  He used to get a cut at the neighborhood barber who just never did anything but exacerbate the situation.  Enter Amie.  She has worked wonders and he enjoys going to see her.  Everybody wins!

20.description: I positively LOVED my experience at Amarie's Hair Studio. From my initial emailing with Amie through the entire service, Amie was so sweet, knowledgable and professional. She has cultivated an amazing space that feels very welcoming and relaxed. Apart from the customer service, my end result is what really blew me away. I'm pretty adventurous with my hair and started the process of going platinum blonde a few months ago and was always so frustrated with how brassy and yellow my hair was turning after only a few washes. Amie was reassuring and really understood what my hair needed. She also used this new product Olaplex on me which I don't exactly understand but essentially my hair feels and looks Better than it has in years after having bleach on it so I'm sold. Anyhow my end result was exactly the "pearly", cool, silver white that I've always wanted and her prices were extremely reasonable. She really put in work and I was so impressed by my entire experience. I can't wait to go back, I seriously feel like I've found my girl!!

19.description: I have been following Amie for 10 years as my only hair stylist and she is amazing! I've been with her through 4 salons and I'm so happy she's opened her own. It's absolutely adorable in there and is a perfect intimate setting for her to focus during my service. I get both cuts and colors from Amie and I always leave 100% excited, no matter if we do a touch up or drastic change. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS SALON!!!

2.description: Cute shop.  Great location.  Not stuffy.

18.description: I have been a loyal client of Amie's for about 5-7 years now.  Not only is she great at cutting/coloring hair, but she is very accommodating as well.  I have a "trouble" area right in the middle of my hairline, and of course my grays like to pop up, right there in the middle.   Often times I start to see gray in the hairline before other parts of my hair, so I will text Amie for a hairline touch-up and she always finds a way to squeeze me in as she knows it's only a quick touch up. I travel frequently for trade shows, so my schedule is not accommodating yet she always finds a way to make it work.   She is affordable especially in the city of Chicago, and does not "nickel & dime" you with separate washers, expensive toners, etc... Her salon is very cozy and she has a great personality.  I would definitely recommend her!

13.description: Amie is truly gifted when it comes to hair--I have been going to her for 5+ years for color & cuts and she always makes my hair look beautiful. I get compliments all the time. She is so easy to talk to, her salon is clean, beautiful and not stuffy, and her prices are super reasonable...I would not dream of going anywhere else!

4.description: I love amie. Prior to her opening her salon I used amy for an In home beauty party and it was one of the best girls nights out (at home) I ever had the pleasure of hosted. She was professional, efficient and reasonably priced. I am thrilled she now has a salon that I can visit and will be for sure visiting her for future hair needs. I also enjoy following her on Instagram and Facebook to see firsthand the amazing work she does on her clients.  Highly recommend.

24.description: I have gotten my hair done twice by Amie (cut and highlights), and I love it every time. I always bring in pictures and she tells me what will and will not look good. She makes sure you're pampered and pleased the whole entire time. I also like how she explains which products she's using for your hair and gives you tips on upkeep. The salon space is fabulous and easy to get to. All in all - the experience with Amie is fabulous!

6.description: If you are looking for someone who knows hair and does a great job (and who isn't?) Amie is it!  I have been going to Amie since I moved to Chicago about 4 years ago, and have never looked back.  First, she actually talks to you about your hair, and explains the type and texture and how what you want will (or won't) work!  Amie also explains everything as she goes so you feel a part of the process, and not just waiting to she how it turns out.  I love that!  Finally, she's fun and great to chat with if you want to.  I have been to many hairstylists over the years, and have never had such a great overall experience as I do with Amie.  And I can not speak highly enough of the work she does, I mean she took me from dark, dark brown to a fun blonde that acutally looks cute and natural!  I've never left not feeling awesome about my hair.  Highly recommend!

15.description: I have been going to Amie for about 2 years now and I can honestly say she is the best! I have gone from super blonde ombre to dark for winter and she nails it every time. She really takes the time to understand what you are looking for and sets proper expectations about what will work and what won't. I usually don't trust anyone with my hair, but anything she says I'll go with. All my coworkers ask where I go and I get so many compliments. It's no wonder why she is completely booked months out, but she's so worth it!

7.description: I moved to Chicago about 7 years ago. An old co-worker recommended Amie. I haven't gone to anyone else since! I have pretty thick hair, and a lot of it. Amie knows how to make it manageable! And I am very lazy when it comes to styling my hair, Amie makes it so I can let it air dry and it still looks great! Whenever anyone is looking for a new stylist I always recommend Amie! She's definitely hard to get an appointment with though, so book early!

8.description: BEST salon and BEST hairdresser there is!!! I have worked with Amie for many years and refer her to all my brides and friends!! she is amazing at what she does and is responsive and responsible !! Can't say enough good things about her!!!! LOVE her and her services she provides!!

3.description: Best hair salon ever! Amie is magical and gifted when it comes to making anyone look beautiful! Whether it's keeping my long hair, going short, adding highlights, or introducing me to a new style; her professionalism is refreshing and her energy is contagious! I would recommend her to anyone because she gives every client her best and we always walk out feeling gorgeous!!

14.description: I started seeing Amie in 2011 for my wedding and we have been together ever since. I have followed her to three salons and happy that she has one now with her name on the front!  Together, I have been brown, blond, red, short and long and have always come back because of the expert service and talented workmanship. Amie is the best. She is good at what she does and she is fair. 5 Stars...great if you are looking for a change, to stay the same or for amazing wedding hair too!

12.description: Excellent service--knowledgeable and helpful. Went in to pick up some brass screens and came out with a free sample of glass stem screens and a reusable glass cleaner solution. Be back soon!

3.description: I've been to many different Vape shops and this one is by far my favorite!  The staff is incredibly helpful, their house brand juice is fantastic, great prices, unbelievable variety, overall I give this vape shop an A++.  This is their second location, the other is in Lakeview.  Great place for people who have just started vaping or are looking to quit smoking cigarettes, as well as experienced vapors who are looking for a great vape shop! #Roots #BestVapeShop

1.description: Finally they opened their Logan Square spot! I have shopped at their Lakeview store on Sheridan. That place was cool but this place is beautiful. It looks like a goddamn art gallery! Same guys working here so there was no sales pressure and I was able to chill and look up the pen i was interested in online and make sure the reviews were good on it. The guy working there said it was reputable but wanted to make sure. I ended up buying the pax even though the guy informed me that a new model was coming out. I'm not worried about having the latest thing. plus the price went down so I was happy.

2.description: My favorite smoke shop!I moved to this areas a couple of weeks ago and was low on juices. I used to buy them from another shop in wicker park before. Was surprised how friendly the staff is and with a nice range of the flavors available for tasting.The only place I buy my juices now.

9.description: Just walked in on their soft open today. They were VERY friendly & answered all my questions regardless of not being completely set up. They still had a really great & huge variety of organic juices too. Can't wait to see all that they have at full open. I've been to their other store in the Lakeview area. This place is MUCH nicer. I love the decor & displays. They even have a cool vape juice bar to sit and sample flavors. Tons of options at a reasonable price for mods. This shop fits right in with the neighborhood including the douchy tatt'ed up skinny-jeans-wearing hipster behind the counter.

10.description: Great vape shop! Just picked up my Vapium Summit vaporizer and couldn't be happier. The staff at both locations are very helpful and friendly so when I couldn't find what I was looking for at their Lakeview location they helped me track down the vaporizer I wanted and held it for me at their Loan Square location, they were also awesome enough to throw in some goodies with my new vape.

4.description: Great atmosphere. We love the rustic feel in the store. Chi Fabs had the opportunity to build their cash bar and a few other furniture pieces. The owners are great too. I recommend their wide variety of smoking products to any smoke friendly  people out there!

6.description: Haven't hit up many shops yet.  Definitely was a solid shop but nothing special.  The equipment for tasting flavors wasn't working half the time and I couldn't find a good enough flavor.  I did end up buying something cause I ran out.  It was ok.

15.description: I love the new location, I had to travel far ways to their other location because of such fair prices they had. Every other smoke shop that I have been to seem to over price their products.  Now I only have to drive a few blocks to stock up on my juices!! And might I add that they did a great job with the Decore, very beautiful place!!

0.description: Got back into the country and found myself at the airport, out of juice.  I called up Roots smoke and vapor and Syed explained how to get there and was very helpful.Once I found Roots he welcomed me, remembered my name and the Roots vape experience began.  They have a huge selection of juice that you can sample through their atomizers, or (which I was most impressed about) they allow you to sample all their flavors on your drip tank.Solid place, solid people, solid selection.  Also it's a 30 second walk from the Blue line train stop at Logan Square.

5.description: Just bought my first electronic cigarette from here and couldn't be more pleased. It was empty when I walked in and busy when I walked out and I still got the help I needed in a timely fashion. Evan was really helpful and showed me the juices and setups and helped me figure out what was best for me. The other customers who were seasoned vapers were getting the stuff they needed as well. Great shop and customer service.

13.description: Went by the Milwaukee Ave store today. The staff (just one dude) was exceptional. Very helpful and extremely knowledgeable (especially about juice). I got to try all the juices before I bought (you get a disposable tip and battery pack and you can just screw on tanks at their vaping bar). Totally didn't feel rushed or under pressure to buy anything. I got a Roots brand Orange Slices (awesome! like Orange Crush) and Velvet Cloud Vapor Strawb-Gwab (tastes like Hi-Chew). Great selection and liked the space, inside kinda looks like a boutique that sells eyeglasses or something (mean this in a good way). Recommended.

11.description: Love this place! Great selection and helpful staff! Definitely worth checking out. I believe they have another location as well

8.description: These guys did it again! This new shop is great, and Evan and Syed will help you with anything you need!

14.description: This place has it all! Beautifully decorated, with friendly staff who were willing to answer any question I had regarding the wide array of smoke and vapor products that they carry at very reasonable prices. I will DEFINITELY be going back soon!

7.description: They have a poor selection and they are very standoffish a employee filledy tank for me and didn't know what he was doing

58.description: I never write yelp reviews but relied so heavily on others reviews of this salon before I went there so I thought I'd add to their praises! If you're on the fence about finding a new hair place, Kelly Cardenas will not let you down!I have lived in Chicago for almost a year and still haven't found a new hair place.. I thought I could make it another month until I go home for a cut and color with my long-time stylist, but I couldn't take it anymore so I yelped a bit and found Kelly Cardenas and I couldn't be happier with my results! I called yesterday and they were able to get me in on a cancellation today, which was so great. I did a brief phone consultation before I arrived then when I got there my stylist (Bethany-- who was fantastic!) and Travis, another employee, were so welcoming. Actually every person there was so friendly and so helpful, it was great. There is definitely a good vibe and working relationship amongst staff which is always nice. After chatting with Bethany we settled on color and she was very upfront and open about the cost of the appointment. Of all things, this was one thing I was very grateful for because it's pretty nerve wracking going to a new salon and being blind sided by cost. It ended up being cheaper than I was expecting and for a transitional color appointment from dark brown/blonde ombré to a lighter summer color, I couldn't be happier with my results. I love the location--right in the heart of WP-- and will definitely be going back.

56.description: I had a great experience at this salon!  Amber was awesome, she gave me a masterful "Sombre" (subtle ombre) color and cut!  Excellent service as well, you definitely feel pampered from start to finish.  I will definitely going back to Amber for my next cut/color and highly recommend this salon if you are willing to throw down a few extra bucks for a sophisticated on-point style.  These guys know what they're doing!

29.description: I had a GREAT experience! I had Travis and he went above and beyond. He listened to what I wanted and gave me exactly that, and more. I couldn't be happier! He is great with color! I would highly recommend him and the salon. I'll be back for sure!

42.description: I have been going here for a few months and love it! Diana is absolutely the best! My color and cut have been phenomenal. My hair looks healthier than ever. It is expensive but worth every penny!

23.description: This review is sooooo long overdue. I've been going to KCS for almost 3 years now and Taya an absolutely godsend! Besides being the sweetest girl ever, she always understands exactly what I'm looking for and sends me off with an amazing cut. I always get compliments on my hair and have easily referred half a dozen friends to her/KCS. I've gone to some of the most upscale (not to mention, stuffy) salons in the city and none of them compare or deliver the quality product and experience KC give clients time and time again. They're super professional, but always friendly/cool/laid back. Just call and book your appointment already - you will not be disappointed ;)

47.description: had a GREAT experience at KC! I went in yesterday and (unfortunately) was not 100% in love with the color I got, but went in today and they fixed it and i am TOTALLY in love with my cut and color! Eli was AMAAAAZING. The entire staff was fun, professional, and great at what they do. I felt like a super model walking out of there. Definitely worth every penny and will absolutely go back again!

8.description: Amazing. After seeing that my hair needed a huge "pick me up"after almost a year of negligence, I turned to yelp. Recently moving to Wicker- KCS was at the top of the list and I immediately booked. I walked in as a (almost) color virgin and with no idea of what I wanted. Bethany was absolutely fabulous! She talked me through the process and asked detailed questions to narrow down what my indecisive mind was looking for. After the consultation, color bar, amazing wash/massage- my hair came out beautifully. I never thought I'd enjoy the color & highlights (as I apprehensively agreed to prior) Long story short- Bethany, along with the team @ Kelly Cardenas Salon was a perfect decision. They deliver nothing but the best, flawlessly appealing to every client that walks in. I highly recommend to anyone who wants nothing but perfection in their style -oxox

31.description: I just got back from my first haircut and deep conditioning treatment appointment at Kelly Cardenas with Cristian as my stylist. I have never been so happy with the service and end result that I immediately decided to write a review. I had no wait time at all and was warmly greeted by the receptionist. They offer an array of beverages from simply water to tea to hot chocolate... of course I opted for the hot chocolate ;)Next Cristian met me and gave me a quick tour of the salon and explained how they operate which was actually great because I knew what to expect. He then sat me down and asked me what I was hoping out of this haircut and any issues I have with my hair. I liked that HE wanted to know what I wanted and didn't pressure me in what HE thought I should have (which i've experienced at many other salons.) As other reviews have mentioned the massage is amazing. The washing station is blocked off from the rest of the salon and has a spa feel to it as it's dim, they lay a blanket on you, and calming music is playing. Cristian took his time to properly massage my hair as well as gave me an arm and neck massage. Literally at this point I was thinking "can this get any better?!"During the haircut Cristian was genuine and we had great conversation. The environment is open, friendly, not snobby at all. The way the salon is set up allows customers to interact with one another too, which is different but cool. He didn't push any products on me excessively, just told me a bit about the hair spray he was using and pretty much let the product speak for itself when he worked it into my hair. I left with healthy, beautiful, wavy hair and a big smile on my face. Having lived and travelled in over 30 countries I have to say hands down this salon has been the best I've ever visited. I promise you will be pleased if you go to Kelly Cardenas Salon!

34.description: I finally found 'my salon' (and stylist) and couldn't be happier! They really have the whole customer experience thing figured out here. Everyone is SO friendly and nice... I feel so welcomed and comfortable as soon as I walk in the door. Travis, in particular, is wonderful and so incredibly talented! I always leave with exactly what I want. :)

16.description: Travis is awesome. Although KCS is on the pricey side, you definitely get what you pay for.

13.description: I've been going here for at least 3 years or more. I've seen multiple stylist and have been happy with them all but within the last year I've shifted my loyalty to Cristian!  He always gives me the cut and color I want, he doesn't over cut or color and my highlights look natural which means I can go less often and my hair still looks great! Recently, I had him cut my seven year olds straight as a board hair and it's the best hair cut I've ever had for him-seriously! (It's been a long painful adventure finding someone to finally give him a great cut) now I have!

11.description: My regular stylist is on maternity leave and I am overdue for a hair cut. I scheduled an appointment with Travis based on yelps reviews.  Very very satisfied with the result!! My hair looks exactly like the picture I showed him but a shorter version as I requested.  Will return for color soon!!

39.description: I did a ombré hair with Bethany and I couldn't be happier with the results , she is super friendly and she knows what she is doing , I highly recommend Bethany for whomever want a perfectionist hairstylist .

37.description: Love love love this salon - Travis is the best and bobby at the desk couldn't be more helpful!!

0.description: Yay for KCS and everyone who works there!!!! My new salon in Chicago as I just moved here from NYC; you truly can't find this kind of quality + kind and wonderful service in Manhattan--the kind of service where you get to know and love all the employees and become like family to them.Diana is easily one of the most talented on staff here and the kindest heart. She's incredible at both cut and color. I would refer her to anyone!

38.description: My stylist was the lovely, talented, and friendly Diana. She gave me a tour of the salon and explained the layout. Then she led me to the bathroom where I could put on a robe to protect my clothing. (Not necessary since I was only getting it styled, not colored or cut, but I appreciated the gesture.)Diana then sat down and asked what I was looking for in my style that day, even looking at a picture of my dress for the event to get a feel for what was appropriate. Then she went to work! We chatted because I love to talk to people, and she was very energetic. She let me have total authority over what I liked and didn't like, even showing me with her own hair what the crimper would do. In the end, I was totally pleased and would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for great service with a smile. (And it won't totally break the bank, either...my styling took about an hour and cost $65 before tip.)

51.description: Beth, knows!!! I'll start by saying I was pretty scared with booking with anyone. I've never been able to trust anyone with my hair. I'm mixed with Black and Puerto rican. I have long, THICK, wavy, curly and coarse hair. It's hard for me to do my own hair and especially someone else who doesn't do "my type" often. It took me yearrrsss to find the place I've been looking for. Beth was amazing. She listened. She asked questions. Told me what she could and what she couldn't. I walked out with more than the results I expected. I have found my hair stylist. Not going anywhere else. Oh to name other stylist that were sooooo helpful and talented.... Jessica. (She's amazing with her curling wand) and also Selina at the front. If you have curly/wavy natural hair. PLEASE take her advice. Other than that... book with BETH. that red head knows her hair and work.

27.description: JESSICA! I went to this salon for the first time today and Jessica did such an amazing job on my dark brown dye and short hair cut. My hair was super long and lighter before and I was nervous on what I wanted but she did amazing. This salon is so great! Will definitely go back! Choose Jess!

32.description: For a decade, I had my hair done near where I work in the 'burbs. That stylist left and I looked for a place closer to home.Enter...Yelp. Kelly Cardenas had great reviews, so I made an appointment with cautious optimism. That was two years ago. Today, I can't imagine going elsewhere. I'm certainly no hipster, even though I live in a hipster neighborhood - I think I have a more classic personal style. A lot of hipsters work here, but not once have I ever felt out of place or uncomfortable. In fact , this is my respite of calm every eight weeks. The people here are so polite and friendly, with you and with each other. It seems like a very genuine and not forced environment. That's important to me, as my PR career makes me skeptical of people's motives.If you're looking for perspective on pricing - it's reasonable. It's not cheap, but by no means is it out of line for customer that is single and in middle management.

54.description: I love getting my hair done thanks to this salon.  I used to be SO nervous about getting haircuts because it never came out the same or the way I wanted it. I've been there multiple times. Each time Matt cuts my hair it looks amazing. I get complimented multiple times a week. I went for highlights and they are perfect! The prices are a little on the high side, but for me- it is worth it. The head/neck massage makes my day every time I go to the salon. The salon is also timely, I've never had to wait for more than 5-8 min. They do a really great job of making the experience as relaxing as possible, and then you leave looking beautiful. What more could you ask for ?

48.description: This is actually my first Yelp review, as I felt the need to write about my horrendous experience at Kelly Cardenas. I am extremely picky about my hair, and have gone to enough salons and hair transformations to know what a good cut and color looks like. I had not dyed my dark brown hair for about 7 years, but had been thinking about having the ombre look done to my hair for a couple of years now. Last week I went into Kelly Cardenas to have the ombre done to my hair, where I met Taya, my stylist. I showed her a picture of exactly how I wanted the ombre to look, expressed and reiterated to her how I wanted it to be SUBTLE, how I hadn't dyed my hair in about 7 years so I was nervous, and told her I would like the color to be more on the ends and underneath my hair. Taya basically did the exact opposite of everything that I wanted. When she washed out the color and blow dried my hair, the color was not subtle. The bottom half of my hair had various shades of blonde highlights, and she kept telling me, "You'll like it when it's all done." Needless to say, I did NOT like it when she was finished. I told her it was way too light, and she proceeded to tell me to go home and feel it out for a couple of days, and to come back if I still didn't like it. Knowing right then I didn't like it, I asked her if she could darken the blonde highlights. She ended up putting a gloss toner on my hair to darken everything. My hair ended up looking better than what it first looked like, but I went home still unsatisfied. It was not an ombre, but more like highlights that started from the bottom half of my hair, it wasn't subtle, and it was not the color I asked for. While she did my ombre, she was doing the weaving technique to highlight my hair, I should have known right then it was not going to end well. A couple days later I called back because I disliked everything about the color Taya did, where I was told to come back in and she would fix it. The next week I came in, explained what I wanted again, and showed more pictures of the color I wanted. To my surprise, the ombre turned out WORSE. The top half of my hair was colored black, and the bottom half had more various shades of blonde, nothing was blended, and I just thought I completely ruined my natural hair that I had for so long. I would have been better off never going in to have the ombre done to begin with. Being really upset with my experience, I called back and asked to speak with a manager. The manager told me come back in for a third time to get my hair done by someone with a little more experience. I decided I absolutely did not want to go back to this place again, so I asked for a full refund. This is where the two stars comes in, the manager did not give me a hard time about the refund, gave me all my money back, and had it ready for me to pick up that day. Fortunately, I went somewhere else where they did an amazing job fixing up the botched ombre from Kelly Cardenas. They knew exactly what I wanted, could see exactly what went wrong with the ombre, and used the balayage technique to create my desired ombre.

44.description: Quite possibly the best haircut/style I've had, ever. Dani went through a thorough process understanding what kind of cut and style I wanted. The shampoo and conditioning before the haircut was great. Dani was extremely detailed and meticulous with my haircut. When I saw the finished product, I couldn't be more happy. My only regret is that I didn't come here sooner. This place is the only salon you need to go to in the City of Chicago.

24.description: I am a total control freak when it comes to my hair or makeup. The last haircut I got was about a year ago, and it was traumatic - I asked for a couple of inches off, ended up leaving with 8 or 9 inches off and about to cry. It's not easy for me to find a good hair stylist, and once I find one, I stick to the same person. I moved to Chicago in August, and this was my first time getting my hair done here. I did extensive research online, and narrowed it down between a few. One looked promising but the pricing was absolutely ridiculous! High prices on their site, but when I called to book an appt, they said "Oh yeah actually the prices are $100 more than listed and we've been meaning to get that fixed on our site"It would have cost me at least $500 to get my hair cut and balayage done. So I decided to come to Kelly Cardenas. Taya is amazing. She is friendly, very skilled, and works quickly. I have had all kinds of things done to my hair in the past.. from perms to dyeing to ombre, but it was my first time getting balayage. I absolutely love how it came out, and she exceeded my expectations.The entire salon was full of friendly and courteous staff. I will definitely be returning when I need something else done :)Thanks Taya!

7.description: I went to Kelly Cardenas Salon for almost 3 years and was never once disappointed! The overall experience from start to finish was fantastic! Taya always took great care of me, and the rest of the team truly enjoyed the work they did. They even went out and fed the parking meter for me when my time ran out. Taya did phenomenal coloring and cuts over and over. I always got compliments on my hair and she knew how to change it up with a fresh new look without going outside of the client's comfort zone. They also make you feel like what you want is the priority. Sadly I recently relocated to another city, but next time I'm in Chicago I may make another appointment to catch up with Taya and get a new style. I highly recommend Taya for a stylist, among many others! Get a glass of wine and enjoy the massages while you are there.

49.description: I just adore this place. I made my usual very late "6 week appt" staying with my usual short cut but bringing pictures for something a little different. Once again Taya performed a perfect cut. This time she suggested adding highlights to roughen up my hair texture (virgin hair for about 10 yrs) so I do remember color making my hair less prone to flatness. It turned out beautifully. I'm so happy she talked me into it. Also a benefit of having color done as well as haircut I did two shampoo room visits today. It was heaven. Honestly the young lady who shampooed and massaged today was outstanding. I love that room and gladly make the half hour drive to experience it. I also need to add: Somehow I ended up confusing my appointment time and showed up 2 hrs early. They graciously fitted me in. It was totally my fault but they never made me feel like I was putting them out. And I was personally mortified about my mistake.

40.description: I'll start with the positive first. I can see why some people like this place. It's energetic and the people are quite friendly. The service is also very good. They will run and refill your meter for you if time is running short. The shampoo area is in a separate room with dimmed lights and soft music, and the massage is lovely. But this is about it for what good I experienced here. I originally called asking to see a senior stylist that same day, explaining that I have dealt with beginner stylists before with disastrous results. They had none available that day - fair enough - and offered to have me see one of their junior stylists who was very experienced and skilled with long hair. I expressed my concern and they were very reassuring so I thought I would take a chance. Bad idea. When I arrived, I was sitting and waiting for at least 30 minutes past my appointment time. They also don't have assigned stations for their stylists, so if all the seats are full when your shampoo is done, you are basically just waiting in the colouring area with your wet towel until one opens up. This isn't something I would not come back for, but it would have been nice to know ahead so I could factor in the extra time into my schedule. After a long wait, I had a stylist come to greet me and take over ... not who my appointment was supposed to be with. At first I thought he was just shampooing my hair, and I eventually asked about the mix up. He said he was assigned to me and didn't know why the confusion. This was the first major aggravation. I have no idea why I didn't see who I was scheduled to see. I found this extremely unprofessional, especially considering no one addressed it with me prior to the appointment starting. I very specifically explained what I was looking for and the problems I have had in the past and the way my hair works. I wanted thicker layers, chunkier face framing layered bangs no shorter than below my eyebrows, and a slight trim. To avoid confusion, I provided pictures. Long story short, I came home with a haircut that brought me to tears. It was nothing like what I asked for, and in fact my hair looked in worse condition than when I arrived. It now looks like dry straw, with layers that looked frayed and sheared. And the "bangs" were a nightmare: wispy, shorter than what I asked for (which I pointed out to him and received no response or apology) and looking like a 5 year old attached my hair in my sleep. I can see why some people like this place. The service apart from the haircut is good, but the actual haircut itself was a nightmare. The stylist I saw clearly had limited experience and was just spewing out information he obviously just learned in school. I haven't walked away from a haircut this upset for 10 years. All I can say is thank goodness hair grows back. I will definitely not be back or recommend this salon.

53.description: This review is long overdue! In a nutshell, I tried to find the perfect colorist and stylist for years. Nine years to be exact. My search is over (and has been over for almost 2 years). Matt is consistent, sincere and all around wonderful. I am so glad I found him. I leave happy every time! Matt is fantastic and the entire staff is welcoming and friendly!

30.description: As a full-time student who doesn't live that close to the Wicker Park area, booking was super convenient and quick through their online appointment system. Multiple stylists came up to me to introduce themselves and compliment me on my hair throughout my time there. The entire salon seems to be filled with very welcoming and friendly staff!Taya was my stylist and she did an amazing job! I was a little apprehensive as I have never dyed my hair before and was going for balayage highlights. I showed her a few pictures and she immediately came up with an idea and color scheme she was hoping to achieve. She's incredibly sweet, easy to talk to, and knows what she's doing with hair! After the addition of highlights, I got my hair washed by Matt-- who was also extremely nice-- and the massage was awesome (I even fell asleep, oops). Taya trimmed and curled my hair afterwards, and I am in love with my new hair! I have gotten so many compliments already. Definitely book with Taya!

46.description: Got a same day appointment. I had colored my own hair and made it WAY too dark. Jessica helped me out with highlights, and added a gloss treatment. Now my hair is shiny, long, and a color that I absolutely adore. She made me feel so important and paid attention to every detail, including wash and styling that was far more attentive than I've  experienced in the past at other high end salons. Wonderful!

1.description: Absolutely love this salon!! First off, everyone is so nice and welcoming. The room where they wash your hair is amazing. It's so calm and relaxing and to top it off, I got a neck and shoulder massage. I could have fallen asleep. I was able to work with Travis who was amazing!
