It's so nice when you find someone who listens to what you want and can help with suggestions to make managing you hair easier.  Love the cut and style and can't wait to try the suggestions given so I can stop throwing my hair in a ponytail all the time. I can not say enough good things about the salon and Travis. Thank you so much!! Can't wait to go back.

55.description: I'm not a fan of trying new hair salons in fear that the stylist will mess my hair up but Taya relived all my haircut fears! A friend recommended the salon to me and I decided to try it since it's located near my house. Everything from making my appointment (you can book everything online!) check in, wash/head massage to my finished haircut was seamless. Taya was super friendly and actually understood what I wanted her to do with my hair. I thought it was so cool how they have an open setting where anyone can help one another with cutting hair, coloring or blow-drying. I'd never seen that before but it seems to work. At one point I had two people blow-drying my hair!I've left both times feeling really great about my haircut and wanting to tell the world where I got it cut from. I've been to the salon twice and for the first time in my life; I actually look forward to booking my next hair appointment! Hidden Gem in Wicker Park! Go now!

9.description: I have mixed feelings about this place. I didn't get the light brown hair I was looking for but I did get nice highlights everyone compliments me on. Done by Bethany. I didn't like it at first I have to admit. I had to go in the next day to get them fixed but they're pretty nice now; kind of looks like ombré.

26.description: The best salon in the city. Not only do they know good hair, they are the coolest people you will ever meet. They are humble, kind, talented and there is no salon out there to match their customer service. I love going to KCS because I get to come out looking amazing and hang out with my friends at the same time.

25.description: I've been coming here for almost a year now! I always get my hair done by Jessica! She's so amazingly talented!!!! Whatever you ask for you get! I always bring her a million Pinterest photos of what I like and she talks to me about what works, what doesn't and helps me get to the perfect choice. I've never NEVER been disappointed with their services. When they wash your hair your enter this extremely relaxing "wash house" which is very Xen. Calm music puts you in the most relaxing state ever while they wash your hair AND give neck/back massages. If your ever having a bad day/week I would suggest just coming in for a wash and blow dry! Even if you don't get a cut or color, the experience alone is worth every dime! Best salon in Chicago hands down & Jessica is the best stylist!

12.description: I am a total control freak when it comes to my hair or makeup. The last haircut I got was about a year ago, and it was traumatic - I asked for a couple of inches off, ended up leaving with 8 or 9 inches off and about to cry. It's not easy for me to find a good hair stylist, and once I find one, I stick to the same person. I moved to Chicago in August, and this was my first time getting my hair done here. I did extensive research online, and narrowed it down between a few. One looked promising but the pricing was absolutely ridiculous! High prices on their site, but when I called to book an appt, they said "Oh yeah actually the prices are $100 more than listed and we've been meaning to get that fixed on our site"It would have cost me at least $500 to get my hair cut and balayage done. So I decided to come to Kelly Cardenas. Taya is amazing. She is friendly, very skilled, and works quickly. I have had all kinds of things done to my hair in the past.. from perms to dyeing to ombre, but it was my first time getting balayage. I absolutely love how it came out, and she exceeded my expectations.The entire salon was full of friendly and courteous staff. I will definitely be returning when I need something else done :)Thanks Taya!

59.description: I had a great experience here last summer with Nicole, gave me the most beautiful ahmering blonde highlights ive ever had! So naturally I returned this upcoming summer to turn my dark brown hair a lighter shade, hopefully blonde.  I have gone from black to blonde in the past as well and knew what I was in for. I sat in the chair knowing full well I would be going through bleaching, toning the whole shebang.  O received a platinum card for my dark hair which lifted immediately.  The products they use here are great, but I didn't appreciate the trim I recieved. It left my hair looking slightly uneven and she cut off more than I wanted to see on my already-short hair. Basically-color yes, cut-definitely not. Other than the bad trim everything else was fine but i am disappointed that my hair looks so odd now.

21.description: This is by far my favorite hair salon in Chicago and in life. Here's my Top 10 Reasons I Love Kelly Cardenas Salon:1. They brought me back to being blonde and I just feel like "me" again.2. The stylists have the edgiest clothes and are all best friends which I think is really cool and speaks to the cohesiveness of the company.3. All of the stylists genuinely LOVE Kelly. They speak about him like he's their God which leads me to believe he's a truly inspiring and awesome person, especially as their boss.4. They have a unique system for doing highlights that makes it easier for them to pick up when they re-highlight you.5. As Christian was massaging my shoulders after shampooing me, I thought about writing this Yelp review. They massage you. Umm yeah. Amazing.6. They have a very competitive price.7. I love the way they wrap the towel on my head. I need to learn that technique.8. They've always been able to accommodate my schedule or squeeze me in when need be.9. They have complimentary wine and coffee - try the Bon Affair.10. Just drink the Kelly Koolaid! You will not be disappointed!

17.description: Matt does my cut and color and I am always VERY happy when I leave! By far the best in Chicago! I have referred all my friends to him and will continue to do so.

10.description: I've come here once before to get an ombré & I left happy. Second time around I called and they booked me with Travis for my color. He did an amazing job getting the multidimensional brunette I was going for but it turned my ends way too dark Anyway, I'm not one to complain but I had to go back a few days later. This time not only did it take under an hour to fix I left feeling SUPER happy! My hair is freaking hot. Not even 4 hours out of the salon and got compliments! Thankfully the salon did not have a stank attitude and now I'll keep coming back! (See my picture)

5.description: As a full-time student who doesn't live that close to the Wicker Park area, booking was super convenient and quick through their online appointment system. Multiple stylists came up to me to introduce themselves and compliment me on my hair throughout my time there. The entire salon seems to be filled with very welcoming and friendly staff!Taya was my stylist and she did an amazing job! I was a little apprehensive as I have never dyed my hair before and was going for balayage highlights. I showed her a few pictures and she immediately came up with an idea and color scheme she was hoping to achieve. She's incredibly sweet, easy to talk to, and knows what she's doing with hair! After the addition of highlights, I got my hair washed by Matt-- who was also extremely nice-- and the massage was awesome (I even fell asleep, oops). Taya trimmed and curled my hair afterwards, and I am in love with my new hair! I have gotten so many compliments already. Definitely book with Taya!

3.description: I'm so glad that I met the Kelly Cardenas crew at an event 5 years ago, after which I scheduled an appointment with Taya, who I've been going to ever since. The salon is great and the stylists freely move between chairs across the salon, and retractable hair dryers are suspended from the ceiling! I revel in each visit, from the consultation to the amazing shoulder and scalp massage with the shampoo experience. Taya is the best stylist I've ever known, she understands what I'm trying to get out of my hair when I can when I can hardly verbalize it myself! I always love the way my hair looks and feels when I walk out the door.

35.description: I've been going here for at least 3 years or more. I've seen multiple stylist and have been happy with them all but within the last year I've shifted my loyalty to Cristian!  He always gives me the cut and color I want, he doesn't over cut or color and my highlights look natural which means I can go less often and my hair still looks great! Recently, I had him cut my seven year olds straight as a board hair and it's the best hair cut I've ever had for him-seriously! (It's been a long painful adventure finding someone to finally give him a great cut) now I have!

19.description: If you like to be pampered and want a good haircut, you found the place. Eli did a fantastic job!

28.description: Travis is awesome. Although KCS is on the pricey side, you definitely get what you pay for.

45.description: Really nice people working there, that's basically what the two stars go towards. I would maybe suggest booking an appointment with one of the more sought-after stylists. My girl didn't seem to have too much experience and the look I was hoping for didn't completely pan out. There was also some kind of confusion of doing a blowout with a round brush...very odd. For $300+, I would never walk in there again. I was extremely disappointed after being so sure this seemed like a great place for color.

33.description: LOVE this salon! Won't go anywhere else! Styling and coloring on point and the shampoo room is the best! Taya's my girl. Go to her.

43.description: Loved my haircut...AGAIN!!  Very accommodating! I called on a Friday to see when was Matt's next opening and they told me he had a cancellation for the day and they could fit me in. In & out on a Friday, what more can you ask for! Everyone was very attentive & personable! & Matt left me feeling beautiful!

2.description: I've never been that girl with "good hair." I've always had that frizzy, kinky hair that did its own thing no matter how I tried styling it. My saving grace in college was learning how to braid. After years and years of frustrated acceptance and hair envy, I was referred to Matt S. at Kelly's. For starters, Matt is just an incredible person - the kind of person you feel at home with. As soon as you sit in his chair, you just know good things are about to happen. He is a focused listener and will make sure you are on the same page before any styling begins. He is an expert at aligning your cut/color with your style and preferences. Matt is light years ahead of the fashion industry but also an accomplished stylist when it come to the classics. His attention to detail during the highlighting and trimming process really makes hair look so flawless.I've been coming to Matt S. for going on four years now and I'm having the best hair years of my life. He has transformed my hair into beautiful locks that get compliments from friends and strangers alike (I've actually had complete strangers ask about my hair). Last week I told Matt I wanted a change. I pulled up a few photos of short cuts and we discussed my options. An hour later, I had short hair and bangs that looked EXACTLY like the photos but somehow better? I have no idea how he did it, but it was amazing. He even showed me a few ways of styling it. If you want to find your forever stylist, go see Matt S. and get that good hair

18.description: I forget who did my color, but the experience was TERRIBLE.  I don't have particularly processed hair, but whatever they put on my hair burned my scalp, and the stylist insisted their products were so gentle that it must be "normal," so I went with it.  The end result was color - and I just dyed my brown hair a richer brown - that leeched out in weeks and left my hair a weird fake orangey color.  My hair now, even after being re-dyed, is damaged and snarls terribly.  I'll end up having to cut off about 4" to save it.  I don't know what the heck happened, but I can't say enough bad things about this experience.

41.description: ELI did my hair recently and  I have to say she is really good! She did everything I asked for, and she made sure I was happy! What I really like about her is she is very detailed orientated and a perfectionist so it worked awesome for me. Once again I love this place & it's staff!

52.description: Let's begin with that as soon as I walked in I was greeted immediately & asked for a beverage. Now, ladies...I have for the past 3 years, had my hair washed once a week to a week 1/2 bc of my color maintenance & I have never, NEVER, had a shampoo experience like here. They escort you to a private room & have all these wonderful head & neck holders to position you on comfortably for your hair to be washed while in a spa like setting with soothing music & dim lights. Your head is kneaded in a massage like scenario & a full shoulder rub after while you are escaping to a relaxing set within your head. Then, your stylist professional will talk with you through all the products & if you're like me, who likes none, they make you feel safe & secure with the few they might choose. Finally, when it's all said, done & dry, you look epic! I walked out looking like a damn Paul Mitchell commercial with my hair flowing from side to side. I can't thank Bobby Bosch enough for recommending this place to me since I moved here & to Eric for being so well educated & amazing throughout the entire process! Honestly, fuckin epic.

50.description: Was a regular for awhile but then just wasn't completely satisfied anymore so I left. Hair did always look good but just not quite what I asked for. Still the head massage was very addicting. And getting there and parking was a hassle since I don't live in Bucktown. I would say I would give 3.5 stars if I could.

4.description: Sadly I received the worst color ever . . . and from the salon director. See pic. Taya did my color and it was insanely awful. It looked nothing like what we talked about (darker base, bright, vibrant blonde balayage type highlights). I started with very blonde hair so she really just needed to darken the base and tone. When she first finished, my hair was greyish almost green. Shockingly I had to explain this wasn't what I wanted and it looked bad (wish I took a pic of that to share). She was blow drying and commenting on how good it looked. Yes she was super nice but she needed me to explain why I didn't like this gross dull grey color. Kind of awkward. Why do I need to explain to a salon director why ugly color is bad?So she "fixed" it and I left with reddish pink hair (see pic). Again nothing like I wanted. I was hoping I could deal with it for a bit but ended up calling the next day begging for someone to fix it ASAP. I was put with Jessica. Unfortunately she needed to consult Taya, the salon director, the one that screwed up my hair in the first place (no idea how she was appointed director - it's concerning). I like Jessica and I actually think she is talented. She wasn't able to do much since damage was done but she tried her best to fix it. If you go here see her. Yes the staff is super nice but that cannot make up for a complete lack of talent and I'm basing that on the "top colorist."

6.description: Let me start off by saying that this was by far the best experience that I have had at a salon. I am from the Schaumburg area, and I would drive through traffic and everything to head back to the salon!I was immediately greeted at the door with a lemon water and given a tour of the salon. Everyone was so friendly and the environment was very collaborative and fosters the social element some salons seem to miss out on. There are multiple chairs at the coloring station to facilitate conversation between patrons and the artists themselves. Coming from the Schaumburg area, I was unfamiliar with city parking and accidentally parked in a no-park area. Travis gladly moved my car to a more appropriate area and made sure the meter would not run out, but not before providing me a delicious glass of wine while my foils were under the dryer.Travis and I had a hair consultation right before I started. He explained the process and let me know suggestions to correct the color crisis I tend to have with going lighter (my hair pulls red). The area where they rinse out your hair is so relaxing and smells amazing... the neck/shoulder massage I got after I was all rinsed out was fantastic - much needed after a long day at work.Overall, I could not recommend a better salon period. Best salon I've been to... ever. Friendly environment and excellent customer service. I felt like VIP walking in and definitely a rockstar walking out.Book your appointment today and go see Travis. It will have been the best decision you've made!

22.description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this salon!! I've lived in the city for 6+ years and until now, I've yet to find a salon that I love and can stay loyal to.  I actually met the owner of the salon on a flight (who was AWESOME by the way) and he told me I had to check it out.  The salon itself is really cool and modern, and the staff is so friendly!  One of the best parts is the hair washing room...they put you in a dark room, play music, give you a blanket AND give you a scalp, neck and shoulder massage!! AMAZEBALLS!!! Taya was the one who did my hair (color and cut) and she was the best!  She is super cute, outgoing and sweet...and I LOVE the way my hair turned out!!  Shawna washed my hair and she gave the best massage (she is a cute, little petite thing and I told her if I didn't know better, I would have thought a big, strong man was giving me a massage, lol!) Overall, the whole experience was amazing and unlike any other salon I've been to.  The culture and atmosphere is so fun and the staff is extremely friendly, professional and knowledgeable.  I highly recommend this salon to anyone and everyone!!

15.description: My stylist was the lovely, talented, and friendly Diana. She gave me a tour of the salon and explained the layout. Then she led me to the bathroom where I could put on a robe to protect my clothing. (Not necessary since I was only getting it styled, not colored or cut, but I appreciated the gesture.)Diana then sat down and asked what I was looking for in my style that day, even looking at a picture of my dress for the event to get a feel for what was appropriate. Then she went to work! We chatted because I love to talk to people, and she was very energetic. She let me have total authority over what I liked and didn't like, even showing me with her own hair what the crimper would do. In the end, I was totally pleased and would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for great service with a smile. (And it won't totally break the bank, either...my styling took about an hour and cost $65 before tip.)

57.description: I've had 3 stylists here and each has been awesome! Taya is so good at making my boring hair fun and fresh. Prices are comparable to everywhere else in the city. And really, just the washing experience is worth it.

20.description: Let me start off by saying that this was by far the best experience that I have had at a salon. I am from the Schaumburg area, and I would drive through traffic and everything to head back to the salon!I was immediately greeted at the door with a lemon water and given a tour of the salon. Everyone was so friendly and the environment was very collaborative and fosters the social element some salons seem to miss out on. There are multiple chairs at the coloring station to facilitate conversation between patrons and the artists themselves. Coming from the Schaumburg area, I was unfamiliar with city parking and accidentally parked in a no-park area. Travis gladly moved my car to a more appropriate area and made sure the meter would not run out, but not before providing me a delicious glass of wine while my foils were under the dryer.Travis and I had a hair consultation right before I started. He explained the process and let me know suggestions to correct the color crisis I tend to have with going lighter (my hair pulls red). The area where they rinse out your hair is so relaxing and smells amazing... the neck/shoulder massage I got after I was all rinsed out was fantastic - much needed after a long day at work.Overall, I could not recommend a better salon period. Best salon I've been to... ever. Friendly environment and excellent customer service. I felt like VIP walking in and definitely a rockstar walking out.Book your appointment today and go see Travis. It will have been the best decision you've made!

36.description: I've come here once before to get an ombré & I left happy. Second time around I called and they booked me with Travis for my color. He did an amazing job getting the multidimensional brunette I was going for but it turned my ends way too dark Anyway, I'm not one to complain but I had to go back a few days later. This time not only did it take under an hour to fix I left feeling SUPER happy! My hair is freaking hot. Not even 4 hours out of the salon and got compliments! Thankfully the salon did not have a stank attitude and now I'll keep coming back! (See my picture)

14.description: Thanks to the receptionist Jeannette, I got to be a hair model for Travis who was simply amazing. I was greeted and got a tour of the salon. I told travis how I was looking to go a little darker for fall and he did exactly what I wanted and kept the conversation going. The wash area was so tranquil and I got a neck massage. Normally, the service I received today would have been $210, but since I was a hair model, I only spent $25. A total steal for someone on a budget and I'm glad I went. Thanks Kelly kardenas salon!!!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Extensions, Coloring

58.description: We dined with another couple at Shaman last night and had a great experience. The margarita mix was fantastic, much better than I'd expect when you can BYOB. All the dishes we tried (brussels sprouts salad, sweet potato tamal, pork ribs, flank steak, wild mushroom flautas) were all delicious and each had their own unique flavor.  You would be doing yourself a disservice not trying the mexican hot chocolate, it is a rich dessert in a glass...which is probably why I was so full after having some of the amazing peanut butter empanadas too.

56.description: I liked it a lot - food was delicious and nice atmosphere and staff. Overpriced, but I'd definite go back and definitely recommend !

29.description: The food was great. Really enjoyed everything we ordered and loved the tapas style because we like to try a little bit of everything. Bring a bottle of tequilia or wine. They have margarita and sangria mix there for you. Be warned it is extremely loud in there. My voice was gone the next day from yelling to talk to the person across the table from me.

42.description: They accommodated a large group of 12, including 2 who were gluten-free AND vegan, effortlessly. We opted to have the wait staff choose the small plates, and everything was wonderful: flautas, sopes, ceviche, salad, tamales, ribs.... they knew the exact amount to fill us up. Service was attentive and friendly, making sure our vegan friend had her options known. They opened our (many) beer bottles and wine bottles to mix for sangria efficiently to keep the party going.The dinner was really tasty, inexpensive, and they made a 12-person dinner fun and easy.Note: They take 2 credit cards per table, so bring cash if you're in a group!

23.description: This was my first time at Shaman and hopefully not my last. The food is delicious. Their BYOB rules are tough but that's okay because the food is GOOD and they know it. We will start with atmosphere: it's dark, cozy and nice. No complaints. Drinks:  bring some tequila. Get the margarita mix. You will not be disappointed. Food: we had a large group of seven and probably ordered 3/4 of the menu. Now I should note that Shaman changes their menu every 30 days? Now don't quote me on this but it's something like that.  Our party of 7 started off with the guacamole, the spinach salad, and the mahi ceviche. All awesome. I was not looking forward to the spinach salad with all the other delciousness going around but that salad was AWESOME! Simple, tasty, and satisfying. It was a great surprise and truly a treat.  We also got the fried calamari (awesomeness that doesn't even need the sauce) beef brisket cazuela, grilled flank steak, pork ribs, and enchiladas. All very delicious. Shaman has very complex, unique flavors but somehow has a simple perfect presentation. They don't try to do too much and let the flavors do the work. Now I felt the need to write this review for the chiles en nogada, which had pork picadillo, walnut cream sauce, goat cheese, nectarines, and almonds. I truly enjoyed the history the waitress gave us. Apparently this is a 32 ingredient dish, which is a Mexican delicacy/favorite that represents the Mexican flag, and only comes around once a year.  Im not going to lie.. I felt a little lucky. I'm not from Chicago and happened to be in town, in this little restaurant, enjoying this treat. The flavor is phenomenal and you may get a spicy bite or a sweet bite depending what portion of the chile you get. Nevertheless, it's all good. The flavors blend in your mouth and for that moment you understand why this dish is so celebrated in Mexico.Last but not least, dessert: we had the tres leches, peanut butter empanadas, and coconut cream pie. My fav: coconut cream pie. But try them all as -let's be honest- they are all good and you only live once. Enjoy.

47.description: With all the cold and snow lately, I've been in a massive funk. This included a food funk. Shaman luckily stepped in and broke the streak. The decor is super casual and almost odd but relaxing. We were greeted by an extremely enthusiastic and well versed server. In previous reviews Yelpers indicated that the wait staff was aggressive in mandating the BYOB policy of a bottle per two people. We were not hassled and were made to feel really comfortable.  He was helpful when we have questions about the menu and everything he suggested, was fabulous. The fare is all small plates and much lighter than typical Mexican food. Favorites of the night included the trout (which was AMAZING) and the magi magi cevichi. We will be going back.

8.description: Very pleasantly surprised based on the reviews! I went with a group of girlfriends on a Saturday night and we all loved it! Restaurant was not too crowded, service was great and the food was tasty. We tried a pretty wide selection of the menu, my personal favorites were the pork belly tacos and chips and guacamole. The lamb chops and desserts (flan, empanadas, and tres leches) were also a big hit with the table. Server was really helpful, I informed him of my food allergies and he made sure to educate me about every dish and check with me about the preparation. We were not rushed at all and actually hung out talking for about an hour after we finished eating.Their byob policy is one bottle of wine per two people, my only complaint!

31.description: I was there this past Saturday with my significant other and we generally thought the good was good albeit a bit overpriced for tapas. On the plus side, we took a bottle of Sangria and our server was very accommodating and brought us wine glasses with ice and fruit. I thought it was a nice touch. On to the food- we started out with the mahi mahi ceviche which was fresh and flavorful. Then we went for the chorizo molotes- we were informed this was a seasonal dish and the server sold us on it...there were two molotes and they were small and slightly salty but with a good spicy kick.The third dish we had were the chicken picadillo sopes. Three small sopes were served on a plate and while they were small, the sopes were very flavorful. Overall, a good dining experience. I would recommend making reservations as the place is small and fills up quickly on a Saturday evening.

34.description: If this were a "food only" review, I would give this place FIVE stars without hesitation.  Unfortunately, on every visit, and I've had three, I've been bombarded with rules and treated like a criminal from the start.  I will not be back.Shaman is close to my house, has wonderful food, and is a BYOB- triple win!  It seemed like the perfect spot for my husband and me to take two other couples.  If you glance at the menu before the visit, you're bound to notice the "1 bottle of wine/1 six pack of beer per two people" policy.  I assume they've been wronged in the past by some "late-stayers".  Whatever, no big deal.  I didn't think they'd be counting bottles as long as we were deep into our meal and still ordering.Upon arrival, we were short two members of our party (we were 15 min early).  They said they couldn't seat us until the full party arrived- a common practice.  Even though the restaurant was completely empty, we were fine with it, as they told us we could grab seats at the bar.  The four of us sat at the bar and asked for glasses as we waited.  The manager asked if we were eating at the bar.  We explained the situation, that we were waiting to be seated, and she said you have to order food to open the wine.  We all agreed we were starved, so we asked if we could start with some appetizers at the bar.  She said, "If you're not eating dinner at the bar, you can't order appetizers at the bar.  We need to save these seats for people who want to eat dinner."  Again, completely empty restaurant.  So now we are stuck sitting awkwardly at the bar, unable to eat or drink or be seated in an empty restaurant.  Luckily, our other members arrived shortly after the exchange.  We were shown to a tight corner table, and we pulled out a bottle of wine.  Our waiter approached and the first thing he said was "Is that your only bottle- do you have another bottle- where is it- because I have to tell you you're only allowed one bottle per two people".  Wow.  What a way to welcome guests to your restaurant.  We ordered a TON of food.  About $50 per person in the end, which is steep for such a reasonably priced BYOB spot.  Yet throughout the meal we were constantly being watched, bottles being eyed and counted, very bizarre.  At the end we received the check and told the waiter to please split it three ways.  He immediately said, "Sorry, we only take two cards per table" to which I responded, "Yes, I read your rule on the menu, and that's why there are only two cards and the remainder is in cash."  The only rule the waiter didn't mention or follow- he was supposed to add 18% gratuity to a party of 6+.  I guess that is the only rule that's based on the server's discretion?  So at this point our bellies are filled with good food, but our minds are filled with rules, rules, RULES.  It made for a truly awful evening.My advice to management?  I don't go out to eat to be constantly reprimanded.  Unless it's an actual problem, and a table is abusing your rules, don't mention your rules.  If a table is ordering food, and racking up a huge tab, do you really care if they open another bottle?  Get your priorities straight.  Unfortunately, you've lost this customer, and you've missed an opportunity to gain my friends as repeat customers.

16.description: Last night I had a reservation for 11 people for my sister's birthday. Most of the table had wine or beer to drink but my sister had Rum and I had vodka to share with one other person. Immediately after sitting down we were informed it was beer, wine and tequila only by the "owner" of the restaurant and that she needed to hold on to everything else. We tried to tell her that one of the people at the table called earlier and was told there were no restrictions. She was very rude to the entire party and was arguing with a customer over what she was told and if it was posted on the website. Even still, we have not been able to find this information posted on the website. From this point it took the waitress another 15 minutes at least to come check on us at which point we were also told now that we couldn't open all of the drinks at one time due to a one bottle per night for every two people rule. Not everyone was drinking the same things so this added another layer of complication to our already horrible start. It was complicated enough organizing the evening with 11 people and this was the icing on the cake. You would think they would be more willing to work with a larger party to accommodate especially since we would be spending so much at their restaurant. 35 minutes after sitting down (having the waitress only come over once during that time) we were ready to just order some food and put the issues behind us. When we asked for two orders of guacamole the owners response was "we sell food here you can't just sit here all night and eat guacamole and drink". This comment was offensive and unwarranted because while we were frustrated we were never rude to anyone. All we were trying to do was put in something to order while we figured out the rest of the dishes we wanted to order. At this point she also decided to tell us our whole order had to come in at once. Basically it was as if she was making up more and more rules specifically for our table that just complicated things to the next level. Especially since throughout the night glancing at other tables it was clear the same rules didn't apply to them. Overall, the whole experience was ridiculous and it ruined what was supposed to be a fun celebration for my sister. I will NEVER be back to this restaurant.

13.description: What a great BYOB spot in the neighborhood. We came here for a friend's birthday dinner. The menu is very creative flavorful. I love the idea of Mexican tapas. We agreed to the group decision of allowing the server to choose our items kind of like a Chef's menu, and I feel like this was a good and bad decision. For me I love to try many things so this was great, but then I overate and it was pricey. I'm not sure how this ended up being $51 a person...The owner came by to check on us, and the server brought out a lot of great choices and was pretty attentive and making sure my boyfriend got his own steak since he's quite a picky eater. We had the pork ribs, flank steak, pork belly tacos, enchiladas, guacamole, ceviche, kale and butternut salad, flautas, tres leches cake, pastel de queso, and peanut butter and jelly empanadas. I really enjoyed everything, but probably would have switched out the flautas for something else. I would actually love to come back and bring my family and friends, but pick out the menu items myself.

11.description: Had high hopes for this place but was sadly disappointed... Service and atmosphere were fine but the best thing I had was the guacamole (which was just regular guac)... So we had:- mahi mahi ceviche - strangely dry for fish prepped in citrus juice and didn't taste very fresh- fried calamari- super fried but came with a salad of red cabbage and purple onion which was a nice bright accent to the dish- mushroom flautas - didn't really taste much mushroom, flavors just blended into each other and not in a good way- chicken sopes - another "just fine" dish - lacked fresh or distinct flavors, but chicken was cooked well at least- tres leches - may have been the most upset by this, the flavor of the cream soda ice cream and coconut with the cake just didn't workNothing we had was bad, just nothing really stood out.  BYOB policy was nice...

39.description: An amazing experience, I recommend the Trout and Pescadillas Crab UNREAL!.BYOB took it over the Top.

37.description: Fun place to go in the summer and sit outside! BYOB is always a plus! This place is small so make reservations and I wouldn't suggest trying to big a large group here. They have a really cool atmosphere and the food is good! Have your server suggest the food for you - everything is great and worth a try!

0.description: The food was a 5 but the service was more of a 3. We'd go back.All of the food was excellent and especially the dessert, the peanut butter filled empanadas! I would go back just for those. We had a 7:30 reservation on a Saturday and the service was great when we were seated and placed our order. But as it got busier and filled up, we saw our waiter less and less. It easily took 45 minutes for us to get our dessert and then the check, after the rest of the meal had only lasted around an hour. Fix the service issues, as a lot of people note, and you'll be all set.

38.description: The literal definition of a Shaman is a person with access to good and evil spirits - if the owner of the restaurant Shaman is one, be assured they have access to those GOOD spirits.Hands down this one of the best meals I've had in a long time, and I base that comment specifically around the food.  The service and atmosphere are pretty good, too, but the food steals the show.  Did I mention the food?  Holy culinary goodness!  The concept is Mexican small plates - a double whammy for me because I love Mexican (no explanation needed, I hope) and small plates as we get to share dishes and sample many.  We started with the chips/guac and panuchos.  The chips were ok, but the guac was creamy yet slightly chunky but smooth and tasty.  The panuchos were like a tostada topped with potato, black beans and goat cheese then an arugula salad lightly dressed on top of that.  Supurb!  For the next round we went with flank steak, goat cheese enchiladas, fish/crab tacos, a shortbread short rib tamale (special of the day) and I personally had the sweet potato coconut soup.  You know how when you order small plates some are good but some steal the show and you wish you had more of this, less of that?  Not here!  Everything was to die for so I don't know which of the above to recommend - just try them all.  And while you may think hey piggy how could you eat all that at a table of three, yeah we still had desert...the peanut butter empanadas.  So good, but so very sweet.  But, don't get your hopes up too high on the items mentioned above as the menu does change monthly.  As any Yelp Elite would do (yeah see that badge there to the left?  I'm elite, Yelp says so!) I did check the reviews prior and was slightly turned off by all the 'rules' mentioned.  They are true, our table of three got a 'one bottle of wine per two guests' from our server the moment we sat down and a judging look, but when we mentioned there are three of us she gave a confused look then quickly stood down.  There is also a sign on the wall mentioning said rules.  Annoying, yes but maybe this is where the evil spirits come in....and did I mention the food???

51.description: This restaurant is a five star quality establishment. The food is exquisite, one thing is better than the next. Don't forget to save room for dessert. The waitstaff and the owners a charming and warm and welcoming. You must check out both locations. They have a BYOB policy.

27.description: The owner, Soraya Rendon, is a class act.  I have been a regular customer for the past year and I can say that honestly I leave more satisfied every time I eat here.  She and chef Natalie reinvent the menu every month and I'm always surprised by their range.  My favorites were the bacon skewers, mushroom flautas, swordfish, oh and the corn chowder!!  The guacamole has sun dried tomatoes and its the best guacamole I've ever tasted.  By all means save room for dessert!  The peanut butter empanadas are my standby favorite and are a constant on the menu, but the tres leches cake is equally amazing and not to be missed.  My honest opinion is you should try one of each because the newest addition to the menu - the creme brûlée with strawberry mousse???  INCREDIBLE.  To speak to the negative reviews posted by a group of people who have no consideration for what it takes to run a byob restaurant:  go somewhere else to socialize if you don't expect to eat (it's called a bar and at least they make money on the liquor they serve you).  I was dining outside on the patio and was there the night you decided to bring your birthday party of 15 in to celebrate.  You're going to have to be diligent in your search for a restaurant that welcomes a party of any size to sit down and drink in a byob venue without eating a single thing.  Shaman is not your living room.  You and your party created quite a scene that night and the atmosphere immediately improved upon your exit.Soraya,  cheers to you and your continued success!!!  The neighborhood is anchored by establishments like yours that set a high standard for quality ingredients, executed by an extraordinary chef and hosted by a loyal and well trained staff.

32.description: Excellent food, excellent service, my only suggestion would be to get bigger pitchers to fit a whole bottle of wine in. Great food and patio

54.description: The benefit of the doubt that a belly full of beer gives to food couldn't save the food here.  Combined that with an overly aggressive waiter and a bathroom reachable by walking through the kitchen, and you have a food establishment to avoid.  The food:The guacamole had way too much acid;The baby octopus was clearly made with older octopus and was very fishy;The mushroom flautas and duck chorizo molotes tasted the same;The lamb in the lamb barbacoa gorditas was cooked to death;The chile relleno was without flavor;The pork belly tacos couldn't have been more sweet, yet at the same time dry;The service:Our waiter was extremely pushy with drinks, and at multiple suggesting we purchase tequila for margaritas or wine for sangria.  He also asked if we felt 'adventurous' offering to pick our food for us.The rest:Bathrooms were only reachable after walking past the kitchen and people cleaning dishes.  Prices are elevated for the quality of the food.I am not sure how this place will survive much longer.Grade: D+

48.description: The food was very good. Loved every bite. It's BYOB so we brought a bottle of top self tequila from next door and ordered the limeade pitcher. There were several open tables despite feeling like the waiter (and hostess) was trying to get us out the door the minute we sat down. Understanding that working in a restaurant can be stressful, I didn't take it personally. Unfortunately despite me loving the food, I will not be going back. Once we finished our meal (and please note we were not THAT table who sat there wasting time taking up a table, not ordering anything). I asked if we could each get one additional glass of limeade (an item that is on the menu) and we were told that he could not serve us just a glass of limeade. The excuse the waiter told us was that it was because they needed our table. Even though this is completely unacceptable no matter the circumstances, NOBODY WAS WAITING FOR A TABLE. I was in shock. Never in my life have I been refused service. Was the 5min it took for us to finish our after dinner drinks really worth us NEVER coming back??? The answer is NO.

44.description: I cannot say enough good things about Shaman!  I've been here multiple times and am never disappointed.  The staff is so friendly and accommodating.  Everyone knows the menu inside and out every time it changes (which is approx. monthly), and the food is tops.Full disclosure: I have not tried everything on the menu.  My main purpose in writing this review is to praise the kitchen and serving staff of this restaurant.  My husband is vegan and every time we've dined there they have been so very accommodating, which does not always happen at non-vegan restaurants.  But everyone at Shaman is just so wonderful about recommending dishes he can eat and the cook will even go out of their way to adapt certain dishes to make them vegan (switching out a cream based sauce on a vegetarian dish, for example).  Because the menu changes and they work with fresh locally-sourced ingredients I guess they are in a better position than a lot of places to adapt their menu, and they are so very gracious about it.  Every dish we've ever eaten here has been fresh and delicious, and I love the sangria!  It's great even if you don't add your own wine to it.  I have also been a few times with my family (not vegan) and heard only positive things about the non-vegan menu items.The atmosphere is eclectic and inviting.  It's always a pleasure to spend some time enjoying a meal here.  Highly recommend.

24.description: I could not be more appalled by this restaurant. I wish I could review the food, but unfortunately my group was not able to get as far as an entree. The owner of this restaurant is a horrendous, miserable, unhappy and horrifically rude human being. After extremely looking forward to Shaman and organizing a large birthday dinner with several out of town friends, I was beyond mortified and offended by the way we were treated. As a 6 year Chicago local, I can easily say this is the most unprofessional, rude and inexplicable restaurant owner and situation I have ever been put in. False advertising does not begin to describe what we experienced, especially in regards to BYOB. I cannot articulate on yelp how horrible this experience was, but plan to take my complaints far beyond the yelp database.

7.description: I am a huge fan of Chilam Balam, so I was really pumped to come by Shaman with a party of 7 a few weekends ago. The only downside to Chilam is that they 1) don't take weekend reservations and 2) don't accept big parties. Fortunately, Shaman solves both of these issues! We had no trouble making a reservation on Friday night for Saturday night. Upon arriving, we were seated immediately. Many comment on the alcohol rules at Shaman, but I have a solution for you. Tequila! Shaman has great margarita mix and you can bring one bottle per two people. Easy. Our waitress came over right away with the mix and to explain the menu.Same as Chilam Balam, we loved the ceviche. This is a menu item that stays, even as the rest rotates, and I think I order it every time I'm there.  As I mentioned, half of the menu at Shaman rotates monthly which is pretty amazing. The fall menu was absolutely on-point and we loved every dish. If you're going in the near future, don't miss the chile en nogada which apparently has over 30 ingredients?! My personal favorite was the brisket casuela which you could make little tacos with. The complex flavors were hearty and rich. We also enjoyed the calamari (which is far from your normal calamari), grilled flank steak, goat cheese empanadas, and the RIBS. These are always on the menu and, in my opinion, a must order. I have no idea what's in that sauce, but it rocks.We also shared a few desserts, even though we were so full! The coconut cream pie was my absolute favorite and everyone loved the sweet empanadas, these were a little rich for me. I truly enjoyed visiting Shaman with a big group because we were easily able to share tons of menu items. Considering the quality of the ingredients and complexity of the dishes, Shaman is very affordable. The BYOB seriously helps as well! Highly recommend a visit to Shaman, whether it's date night or with a big group!

49.description: Horrible, horrible, horrible experience!!!!!!! Manager wanted to force $30 per person minimum, even though we weren't hungry anymore. Plates average about $13, that's means I have to eat almost 2.5 plates. Ridiculous. Manager was extremely rude. Called out the birthday girl about the minimum in front of the entire party. Will never come back. Food was ok.

40.description: It's been 2 days and I still can't stop talking about the great experience we had at Shaman.  We had a party of 8 for a 40th birthday party.  Our waiter suggested that instead of ordering ourselves that the kitchen prepare several dishes with portions for everybody to share.  We loved the idea that we would be getting a sampling of their best dishes and they did not disappoint.  We had 8 dishes (apps to dessert) and every dish was amazing.  The ribs, tostada and pork belly taco were the groups favorites, but the ceviche, crab empanadas and desserts were also fantastic.  Their service is great and we put them to the test staying 3 hours.  It's BYOB and they provide sangria mix.  Our group was one of 3 having birthdays, so it's a great spot for groups.  There were also some smaller tables.  I did feel it was loud and hard to hear everyone, but that is expected.  Can't wait to return.

53.description: I had the pleasure of eating here two nights in a row with my fiancé and some friends. I live in the area and finally got the chance to see what this place was all about. Simply stated, the food is delicious. We were privileged to dine while executive chef, Natalie Oswald was working her magic in the kitchen. The tapas style plates were full of flavor. You can tell that a lot of thought goes into each dish. To top it off, they are byob, which is always a huge plus.Our server, Luis was very knowledgeable about the menu, despite it changing on a monthly basis. I'll definitely be back here again!

30.description: I tend to agree with the negative reviews of this place. The service here is atrocious, at best. I only received a small taste of the "rules" here before my large group promptly walked out. We came here for a friend's birthday. I was leaving within 30 minutes or so to go to bed as I had to wake up at 4 the following morning. I just wanted to enjoy everyone's company, and I wasn't planning on eating, and evidently this was a major issue. The waitress was giving the table an unreasonably large amount of grief for this, literally saying, "why would you come to a restaurant if you aren't going to eat?" I'm sorry, that's the rudest thing anyone has ever said to me in a restaurant.  She was making a gigantic issue with me sitting there, so I simply left. A note - the restaurant was empty. Completely empty. It's not like me sitting there was stopping business from coming in. Not more than five minutes after I left, the rest of my fifteen person party vacated. I guess they neglected to mention the 30 dollar minimum when making the reservation. The minimum is fine but the fact it wasn't communicated out is a major draw down. Advice to management:Your place will go out of business if you continue to allow these kind of practices. A table of fifteen potential customers left when your restaurant was empty. Your lack of communication to your customers regarding reservation parameters will do nothing except upset people, as evidenced by Friday night. Your wait staff is the rudest staff i have ever experienced - even worse than the atrocious service at Jack's/Drew's on halsted.  Actually asking a customer "why they're even there" is 100% unacceptable.You might want to chill out on your rules. Seems like this has the potential to be a nice place. This isn't Alinea...you can loosen your restrictions. It's dinner, not boot camp. I will actively tell people to avoid this place. Long story short - rudest service experienced in a Chicago restaurant. Go somewhere...Anywhere else.

46.description: Susan and I strolled in on a busy Saturday evening, unaware that Shaman takes reservations.  No matter, there were open spots at the bar in the back and we were more than happy to be promptly seated there.  We knew enough to bring a bottle of wine, but on my next visit, I'll be packing tequila!A very friendly Luis greeted us, opened our wine and asked if we needed help with the menu.  To keep things simple, we turned all our ordering over to him, a practice we almost never regret at better restaurants  Luis did us justice, starting us with mahi-mahi ceviche followed by crispy crab-filled pescadillas.  At this point, we realized that we were in for something special! and encouraged Luis to "bring it on!" Next up was a beet salad with a crispy jack cheese chicharron followed by grilled lamb chops with a blood orange sweet potato mash (the chops were a bit too medium for my taste), and finally, pork belly tacos with kiwi pico de gallo.  Our equivalent of "one thin wafer" were the sweet empanadas with peanut butter and two remarkable dipping sauces.  Muy delicioso!in addition to Luis's attentive service and that of various busboys, owner Soraya Rendon and chef Natalie Oswald checked on us at several points during our feast.

1.description: I was really excited to try this place. It wasn't terrible, but for some reason a lot of the dishes didn't seem fresh and were definitely under-seasoned (no salt on tables). Almost like they were maybe they were precooked and microwaved prior to serving. Ambiance is ok. Sort of cafeteria-like. Also, the acoustics in the room were unbearable. We were seated at a 4 top by the door and literally screaming to speak to the people who we dined with and they were just 2-3 feet away across the table. My throat hurts the day after from literally yelling for an hour. Guacamole: just ok, needed seasoningMahi mahi ceviche: the fish was unevenly cut, some big, some small, and a couple of pieces were fishy Crab pescadilla: this was probably my favorite of the night. The crab was stuffed into the tortilla and the tomatillo salsa that topped it was delicious.Grilled flank steak: ordered it medium, came medium rare. Fine we still ate it, but the meat was tough and chewy. Literally had to yank the meat away from my teeth cause I couldn't chew through to break off a bite. That happened with 2 of the 4 pieces that were served. Pork belly tacos: I didn't try the dish cause it was ordered by other friends at the table. They said it was good.Mushroom flautas: bland, muddled flavorsChicken sopes: probably the worst dish of the night. Chicken thigh meat only. Seemed microwaved. Could hardly chew through the masa. It was hard as a rock. Flavor lacked seasoning and was just one note.We also had the sangria mixer, which was good. Overall, wouldn't go back though. For the 7 dishes and 2 mixers, the lackluster meal came to $120. So with tip cost $35/pp. I could've gone to the local Mexican joint and had amazing food for $10. There was nothing that could justify the pricing of some of the dishes. Keep in mind, the top 3 dishes were very small.

55.description: I really like Chilam Balam but unfortunately this place does not match up. We had the chicken sopes, lamb, and ceviche. Sadly none of them were good and we did not even bother to finish them. Best dish was the enchilada. Guac was solid. Desserts were average. Service was just okay. We won't we going back.

9.description: The food is excellent, but the place is always empty. This doesn't make for the best atmosphere. I haven't experienced any of the crazy issues other diners have mentioned, but will certainly update if I do. I plan on enjoying their delicious food again.

26.description: Excellent service! Nicest people and wonderful food! Pork belly tacos, guac, mahi-mahi were our favorites! Byob. Amazing food. You have to check this place out!

25.description: Had high hopes for this place but was sadly disappointed... Service and atmosphere were fine but the best thing I had was the guacamole (which was just regular guac)... So we had:- mahi mahi ceviche - strangely dry for fish prepped in citrus juice and didn't taste very fresh- fried calamari- super fried but came with a salad of red cabbage and purple onion which was a nice bright accent to the dish- mushroom flautas - didn't really taste much mushroom, flavors just blended into each other and not in a good way- chicken sopes - another "just fine" dish - lacked fresh or distinct flavors, but chicken was cooked well at least- tres leches - may have been the most upset by this, the flavor of the cream soda ice cream and coconut with the cake just didn't workNothing we had was bad, just nothing really stood out.  BYOB policy was nice...

12.description: I tend to agree with the negative reviews of this place. The service here is atrocious, at best. I only received a small taste of the "rules" here before my large group promptly walked out. We came here for a friend's birthday. I was leaving within 30 minutes or so to go to bed as I had to wake up at 4 the following morning. I just wanted to enjoy everyone's company, and I wasn't planning on eating, and evidently this was a major issue. The waitress was giving the table an unreasonably large amount of grief for this, literally saying, "why would you come to a restaurant if you aren't going to eat?" I'm sorry, that's the rudest thing anyone has ever said to me in a restaurant.  She was making a gigantic issue with me sitting there, so I simply left. A note - the restaurant was empty. Completely empty. It's not like me sitting there was stopping business from coming in. Not more than five minutes after I left, the rest of my fifteen person party vacated. I guess they neglected to mention the 30 dollar minimum when making the reservation. The minimum is fine but the fact it wasn't communicated out is a major draw down. Advice to management:Your place will go out of business if you continue to allow these kind of practices. A table of fifteen potential customers left when your restaurant was empty. Your lack of communication to your customers regarding reservation parameters will do nothing except upset people, as evidenced by Friday night. Your wait staff is the rudest staff i have ever experienced - even worse than the atrocious service at Jack's/Drew's on halsted.  Actually asking a customer "why they're even there" is 100% unacceptable.You might want to chill out on your rules. Seems like this has the potential to be a nice place. This isn't Alinea...you can loosen your restrictions. It's dinner, not boot camp. I will actively tell people to avoid this place. Long story short - rudest service experienced in a Chicago restaurant. Go somewhere...Anywhere else.

59.description: Ordered 10 dishes to share with our group of 4. Proteins were all cooked well, but it seemed like most of the dishes relied heavily on the sauces. This wasn't necessarily a bad thing to start, but as we progressed everything started to taste similar.  When sharing plates between 4, each person only got 1 small taste.  BYOB is a big plus and the peanut butter empanadas were a nice end to the meal.

21.description: Food was amazing!  Service was incredible!  Just don't like the bathroom situation which is thru the kitchen and 1 bottle of wine per couple rule.  Seriously if I'm going to eat too much, I want to drink an equal amount

17.description: The literal definition of a Shaman is a person with access to good and evil spirits - if the owner of the restaurant Shaman is one, be assured they have access to those GOOD spirits.Hands down this one of the best meals I've had in a long time, and I base that comment specifically around the food.  The service and atmosphere are pretty good, too, but the food steals the show.  Did I mention the food?  Holy culinary goodness!  The concept is Mexican small plates - a double whammy for me because I love Mexican (no explanation needed, I hope) and small plates as we get to share dishes and sample many.  We started with the chips/guac and panuchos.  The chips were ok, but the guac was creamy yet slightly chunky but smooth and tasty.  The panuchos were like a tostada topped with potato, black beans and goat cheese then an arugula salad lightly dressed on top of that.  Supurb!  For the next round we went with flank steak, goat cheese enchiladas, fish/crab tacos, a shortbread short rib tamale (special of the day) and I personally had the sweet potato coconut soup.  You know how when you order small plates some are good but some steal the show and you wish you had more of this, less of that?  Not here!  Everything was to die for so I don't know which of the above to recommend - just try them all.  And while you may think hey piggy how could you eat all that at a table of three, yeah we still had desert...the peanut butter empanadas.  So good, but so very sweet.  But, don't get your hopes up too high on the items mentioned above as the menu does change monthly.  As any Yelp Elite would do (yeah see that badge there to the left?  I'm elite, Yelp says so!) I did check the reviews prior and was slightly turned off by all the 'rules' mentioned.  They are true, our table of three got a 'one bottle of wine per two guests' from our server the moment we sat down and a judging look, but when we mentioned there are three of us she gave a confused look then quickly stood down.  There is also a sign on the wall mentioning said rules.  Annoying, yes but maybe this is where the evil spirits come in....and did I mention the food???

10.description: This is my second time dining here. And my second time having dreams about my meal after visiting. We ordered 4 items off the menu. Theenchiladas potosinas was first delivered and holy amazing party in my mouth. We also had the pork carnitas, the grilled flank steak and the fried ballenas. All outstanding in flavor and great presentation. Byob makes this place a STEAL!! Adding it to my list of favorites.

5.description: It was eh. I live nearby and have been wanting to try this place. I'm glad I waited. I came here with a date around 9 pm and there were only 2 other tables there which was expected as it was a Tuesday I believe. We brought a nice bottle of wine and got started. The waiter was nice enough at first. We ordered the Mahi Mahi cevice to start. It was very tasty but it was a very small portion and the onion was a little overwhelming. Our waiter recommended we each get 2 to 3 of the small dishes. At first it seemed like a good idea but then we saw the prices. They average out to about 13-16 dollars a small plate. that meant we would each be spending about close to $50 each including the ceviche we shared. It's not totally unreasonable but for a Tuesday night, I just wasn't ready to dish out what I would normally spend on a weekend dinner. We ended up sharing the steak and the lamb dish. They were both tasty but of course we were still left a bit unsatisfied. The food is isn't really my biggest complaint as was our waiter. Since we were the last table that sat down, we ended up being the last table out. By the time we finished our meal we each still had almost a glass of wine left. We sat there drinking our wine all the while getting looks from our waiter and other staff. It was 9:50. They close at 10. We were out of there by 10:05. When we apologized for staying 5 minutes after closing time and thanked him for everything he just looked at us as we were leaving, didn't say a word, and went back to counting his tips. We had already left him over 20% for staying 5 minutes later than we should of and after leaving I immediately regretted it. in conclusion, food is good but not great. Service is good, if you get out of there by exactly closing time.

3.description: -Owner is rude and service is terrible. Never been treated worse at a restaurant. -prepared to be treated as a child-BYOB rules are ridiculous, don't plan on bringing a variety of wines, you won't be "allowed" to drink them -WORST OF ALL: a birthday gift was left behind upon departure and before we got in the cab we already went back to retrieve it and it was already unwrapped and the owner was putting the necklace on the chef? Can't make this stuff up, folks. STAY AWAY

35.description: Shaman has a special place in my heart.  A very tasty and unique take on Mexican tapas.  The owner is energetic and charismatic, treating each customer like royalty.  I recommend this place to anyone looking for a good date night or small party.  Not to mention it's BYOB!

19.description: No surprises here based on the prior reviews, a quick summary --guacamole was somewhat flavorless, needed some citrus-mushroom flautas...where was the mushroom?-the flank steak was chewy and lacked a lot of flavor in my book, no way you could eat this on tacos as intended-chicken sopes...the sopes were a bit doughy, again flavorless chicken-pork was again lacking in the flavor department and was extremely greasyOverall many of the dishes were interchangeable, with the flavors resonating the exact same from dish to dish.  Everything felt and tasted the same for the most part, which is probably the most damning element.  Also, pretty high for what you are getting. So, overall already a 2 star experience for the food.  But the service...THE ATTITUDE.  As others have said, treated like a criminal from the get go.  This is the truth.  Not only did they get an order wrong, but blamed US for getting it wrong.  Absurd.  Won't leave a bottle opener at your table, good luck to you getting your beers opened.  The liquor policy is absurd...we ordered a lot of stuff but it didn't stop us from getting a dressing down from the server related to the liquor policy (I asked clarifying questions as I've never heard of such a policy and was insulted and treated with absolute disdain in the process...I let it go).  Pretty unreal.  And really strange.  Overall a poor experience, look elsewhere.

28.description: The food and ambiance is amazing. Great, family run BYOB restaurant with five-star tastes. Takes gourmet Mexican food to another level. That service, "rules," and attitude of the staff/owners is something to be desired. I had less rules at my mother's dinner table...6-pack/wine per couple maximum, no outside liquor except tequila, minimum $30 spend per customer for parties of 10 or more, reservations can't be seated without a complete party (there's like 30 seats total), two credit cards per check maximum, parties in advance must pay cash/check. Should I go on? Holy cow. The amazing food is overshadowed by the constant rule reminders and overall rude stuffiness of the staff. Shame, I'm I neighborhood local and love the cuisine. I'll take my business somewhere else where their head isn't up their ass.

45.description: Amazing. Cochinilla pibil, do it. Mahi mahi ceviche, also delicious. The service is particularly good. There's an apartment above the restaurant I'd like to rent.

33.description: My friend Berenice recommended this place on a very wintery night in January 2015. We did not have a reservation so we had a drink at the bar. Our table came up just as our party arrived. The place can be a squeeze but it is totally worth it. The tacos were good, flavorable and a little expensive. But as everyone else has said, the BYOB on tequila and beer makes this experience even better! Between our party of 6, we tried just about every dish and had the house margaritas. They were delicious and went perfectly with our own tequila. We pretty much closed the place down and the waiter was happy to see us drinking and enjoying ourselves. Overall, a great spot to get a little rowdy with friends.

43.description: Went here last weekend with a party of 17!! They handled yes with no problem.. The food and service is amazing.

2.description: I have gone to Chilam Balam and loved their food and service. Unfortunately, Shaman does not even come close to the original and simply made for a terrible dinner experience.  The food was decent, but nothing to rave about. Our table for 5 barely could fit 4, and they did nothing except add a seat to try and squeeze us all in. The service, as others have pointed out, is the absolute worst and ruined our meal. The female server started off the night scolding us and reciting very confusing rules about their BYOB policy. After a 2 minute "rules" rundown and what appeared to be her own disapproval regarding our table of 5 having a bottle of tequila to share (which is encouraged, as the restaurant provides Margarita mix for purchase!), she finally allowed us to open the tequila and brought us margarita mix.  The kitchen brought out the wrong order and when we let them know that was not our order, the waitress glared at us and scolded "that's yours," to which we politely replied we had not ordered it.  Later in the night and 7 small plates later, a friend who does not drink tequila asked to open the bottle of wine she brought, to which the server rudely replied no and went on to explain that unless we ordered more food, we were not allowed another open bottle. We verified that what she was saying was that the byob policy was directly tied to the amount we spend and she said yes. Unbelievable. The waitresses tone, demeanor and lack of service left us all feeling like we were school kids on time out. Thanks for the great birthday dinner, Shaman...Also, fyi, they only allow 2 cards per table, so just keep that in mind if you decide to try this place (though I encourage you to try anything else instead). The amount of "rules" this restaurant has is rediculous.

18.description: Susan and I strolled in on a busy Saturday evening, unaware that Shaman takes reservations.  No matter, there were open spots at the bar in the back and we were more than happy to be promptly seated there.  We knew enough to bring a bottle of wine, but on my next visit, I'll be packing tequila!A very friendly Luis greeted us, opened our wine and asked if we needed help with the menu.  To keep things simple, we turned all our ordering over to him, a practice we almost never regret at better restaurants  Luis did us justice, starting us with mahi-mahi ceviche followed by crispy crab-filled pescadillas.  At this point, we realized that we were in for something special! and encouraged Luis to "bring it on!" Next up was a beet salad with a crispy jack cheese chicharron followed by grilled lamb chops with a blood orange sweet potato mash (the chops were a bit too medium for my taste), and finally, pork belly tacos with kiwi pico de gallo.  Our equivalent of "one thin wafer" were the sweet empanadas with peanut butter and two remarkable dipping sauces.  Muy delicioso!in addition to Luis's attentive service and that of various busboys, owner Soraya Rendon and chef Natalie Oswald checked on us at several points during our feast.

41.description: They let you bring beer to this place!

52.description: Really great food that spans all types of Mexican cuisine. I highly recommend it.

50.description: HORRIBLE experience! Literally sitting at the restaurant now and can't believe the "manager" came over to our party of 10 to speak to my cousin who was celebrating her birthday here to say "we had an agreement and you're supposed to order $30 per person." Unbelievable! Disgusted to say the least. If that's a rule for larger parties, complete to understandable but no need to deliver that information in such a condescending fashion. Will never come back here EVER.

4.description: I hate to be so mean, but this place is just plain ugly. They painted the exposed light bulbs orange and it isn't a flattering look. Also the long wood bench and cafeteria style chairs are not very comfortable. They are charging $14 for tapas plates and the place looks like maybe $500 was invested in the design. The server although very polite and knowledgeable seems very awkward and sort of uncomfortable. The food is decent but since I feel like a lab animal I want out of the ugly maze ASAP.

6.description: Another win for these owned except this time in Noble Square. We ventured over from our lake view locale since Chilam Balam is one of our neighborhood favorites. The food is fantastic, and very similar to the location in our neighborhood. The setting is a street level restaurant with simple decor that keeps the focus on the flavors. I continue to love the honest and authentic service and unique play on traditional Mexican dishes. Overall, it brings the fantastic flavors and owner operated love that made Chilam Balam a star, however it's not differentiated enough from the original restaurant to make it a destination - but a great addition if you live in noble square.

22.description: I had tried Chilam Balam and left there very dissapointed. I gave Shaman a shot thinking they would redeem themselves. I left this place insulted. One: it's overpriced and two: the food is terrible. If you want Mexican food, I would recommend Los Comales a thousand times before this place.

15.description: This was my first time at Shaman and hopefully not my last. The food is delicious. Their BYOB rules are tough but that's okay because the food is GOOD and they know it. We will start with atmosphere: it's dark, cozy and nice. No complaints. Drinks:  bring some tequila. Get the margarita mix. You will not be disappointed. Food: we had a large group of seven and probably ordered 3/4 of the menu. Now I should note that Shaman changes their menu every 30 days? Now don't quote me on this but it's something like that.  Our party of 7 started off with the guacamole, the spinach salad, and the mahi ceviche. All awesome. I was not looking forward to the spinach salad with all the other delciousness going around but that salad was AWESOME! Simple, tasty, and satisfying. It was a great surprise and truly a treat.  We also got the fried calamari (awesomeness that doesn't even need the sauce) beef brisket cazuela, grilled flank steak, pork ribs, and enchiladas. All very delicious. Shaman has very complex, unique flavors but somehow has a simple perfect presentation. They don't try to do too much and let the flavors do the work. Now I felt the need to write this review for the chiles en nogada, which had pork picadillo, walnut cream sauce, goat cheese, nectarines, and almonds. I truly enjoyed the history the waitress gave us. Apparently this is a 32 ingredient dish, which is a Mexican delicacy/favorite that represents the Mexican flag, and only comes around once a year.  Im not going to lie.. I felt a little lucky. I'm not from Chicago and happened to be in town, in this little restaurant, enjoying this treat. The flavor is phenomenal and you may get a spicy bite or a sweet bite depending what portion of the chile you get. Nevertheless, it's all good. The flavors blend in your mouth and for that moment you understand why this dish is so celebrated in Mexico.Last but not least, dessert: we had the tres leches, peanut butter empanadas, and coconut cream pie. My fav: coconut cream pie. But try them all as -let's be honest- they are all good and you only live once. Enjoy.

57.description: I went with a group of 7 friends.  All of the dishes were delicious, super flavorful, and well executed.  We loved all of the dishes we had.  A few favorites:Goat Cheese EnchiladasPork Belly Tacos (I personally didn't try them, but everyone else at the table loved them)RibsWe got 2 desserts that were phenomenal -- the chocolate flan had sea salt on top, and the peanut butter empanadas were also amazing.The food definitely gets 5 starts, but I give service a 3.  We were seated on time, our server was knowledgable and made good recommendations, but the service wasn't particularly friendly.  They are also very strict about their BYOB policy, so if you (nicely) ask for another bottle of wine to be opened, be prepared for some attitude.

20.description: I am a huge fan of Chilam Balam, so I was really pumped to come by Shaman with a party of 7 a few weekends ago. The only downside to Chilam is that they 1) don't take weekend reservations and 2) don't accept big parties. Fortunately, Shaman solves both of these issues! We had no trouble making a reservation on Friday night for Saturday night. Upon arriving, we were seated immediately. Many comment on the alcohol rules at Shaman, but I have a solution for you. Tequila! Shaman has great margarita mix and you can bring one bottle per two people. Easy. Our waitress came over right away with the mix and to explain the menu.Same as Chilam Balam, we loved the ceviche. This is a menu item that stays, even as the rest rotates, and I think I order it every time I'm there.  As I mentioned, half of the menu at Shaman rotates monthly which is pretty amazing. The fall menu was absolutely on-point and we loved every dish. If you're going in the near future, don't miss the chile en nogada which apparently has over 30 ingredients?! My personal favorite was the brisket casuela which you could make little tacos with. The complex flavors were hearty and rich. We also enjoyed the calamari (which is far from your normal calamari), grilled flank steak, goat cheese empanadas, and the RIBS. These are always on the menu and, in my opinion, a must order. I have no idea what's in that sauce, but it rocks.We also shared a few desserts, even though we were so full! The coconut cream pie was my absolute favorite and everyone loved the sweet empanadas, these were a little rich for me. I truly enjoyed visiting Shaman with a big group because we were easily able to share tons of menu items. Considering the quality of the ingredients and complexity of the dishes, Shaman is very affordable. The BYOB seriously helps as well! Highly recommend a visit to Shaman, whether it's date night or with a big group!

36.description: The food is very good!  Actually delicious!  However ,as others have stated, it is unfortunate that the other aspects of the dining experience are not so fantastic, namely: 1) The rules; 2) The pushiness of service/bad attitudes; 3) The atmosphere.Throughout our meal I felt like they were trying to rack up our bill / speed us out the door, which is funny because only a quarter of the tables were full on a Saturday night.  As for the atmosphere...well are you a hidden gem of a restaurant at which to enjoy a relaxed mean or a party spot?  The music was loud; the lighting was awful; the tables are slanted; and the patrons are all pretty wasted.  One group was playing Heads Up on their phone nearby us screaming at the top of their lungs.  Doesn't make for a super classy meal.  I guess I can understand why they seem to resent their customers.  Management seemed to have a lot of rules and was not very customer service oriented.So much potential if only a few changes could be made.  I would be pretty pissed at the front of the house if my amazing food was overshadowed by the not-so-stellar policies.

14.description: Really really good food (pork belly tacos, flank steak tacos, brussels sprout salad etc)! I would suggest re-tiling the floors, putting some recessed can lighting in (versus the panted fluorescent tubes) and upgrading the cafeteria chairs. I was just slightly embarrassed bringing an out of town guest here without trialling it first. Thankfully the food redeemed it!

58.description: Overcharged me $31 for a $15 dollar order due to some glitch in their online ordering system. They never rectified the situation after admitting it was their mistake. Have to call and let my bank deal with it since Ameer Kabob refuses to.Had to wait an additional 25 minutes after scheduling a pickup and having ordered/paid online because they "didn't receive it". However my card was charged and I was sent a confirmation email from them. After being double charged and waiting 25 minutes on site for my food, I get home to discover they gave me fries instead of rice! Wtf!? I call them about the fries-rice mix up, the girl hands the phone off to Ameer and doesn't even have the common sense to mute the phone " I think it's the black lady". Smh. Ameer agrees to send the rice via delivery (I live about 7 minutes away). Over an hour later some surly, frowning guy shows up with cold rice. Service is so bad that it's bordering on the ridiculous. The food here doesn't justify the b.s., it's not even that great.
