56.description: This place was surprisingly great. I had the chicken kabob dinner. Cook perfect and very delicious!! Even the side salad was very good. The staff was very friendly!

29.description: Talk about an all in one place.  I don't normally post reviews but i felt obliged to write for Ameer Kabob.  The food is great it is very cheap for the amount that you get.  The beef is delicious, the chicken is actual chicken and not fake meat.  Also the owner is the cherry on top, extremely friendly! I would honestly pay more here if it was priced higher!  Let it show good food good service and a friendly staff WILL take you a long way!  I go to a lot of mediterranean restaurants but this one is definitely the top of my list now!

42.description: I was there this afternoon and had the Lentil soup and Chicken Shawarma entrée. Both were excellent, with just enough spice to give them an interesting kick without being overpowering. Even the rice was delicious. I wish there was one of these where  I live.

23.description: This is some of the BEST Middle Eastern food in Chicago! The Shawarma Combo with a large order of Hummus and an order of Grape Leaves is absolutely phenomenal. Healthy portions, along with extremely reasonable prices and a  friendly staff make Ameer Kabob my favorite local restaurant---pick-up, or delivery! These folks are super-busy in the early-evening hours, so please keep that in mind when placing your order. Regardless, I definitely recommend Ameer Kabob!

47.description: This place is great. I've had delivery several times, and carry out once as well. Every time I am impressed. The portions are huge, the prices are reasonable, and the staff is friendly.Get the shish kabob. You won't be disappointed.

8.description: Food fuels my motivation when I work out and seeing as this place is at the end of my running route it's often been the reason I've burned a bunch of calories. Even though I end up putting them back in eating here it's all relatively healthy stuff and definitely doesn't break the bank. The entrees are all about 10 bucks and come with a good sized side salad, creamy hummus, rice and pita bread. With pretty quality portions of tasty marinated meats It's definitely a steal for something that you can potentially eat for two meals. There's not much to the interior or the signage, but don't let that fool ya...it's a pretty solid spot for pickup or delivery. Overall a great spot for folks the who dine on their own more often than not.

31.description: This restaurant was just OK a few years back, but it changed leadership and i noticed that the food quality as well as portion size have increased. I have only been there a few times but i order for delivery quite often, so far I am very pleased with the quality and the consistency.Having a sensitive stomach, I usually know immediately if the food is not fresh or if it was prepared in less than adequately clean conditions, but I never had any bad incident with Ameer's food.

34.description: Ordered in at a friend's place and was surprised by the authenticity and quality of the appetizers and food. Excellent Hummus and FANTASTIC meats .... Pleasant surprise.

16.description: Really good chicken shawarma sandwich! Flavors are on point and portions are generous. Plus, if you eat there, everyone's super nice.All around awesome choice!

13.description: This is on a delivery order, but even if the food were fresh I think I'd feel the same. Delivery service: Ordered from Eat24, took about and hour and a half, and the order they brought was totally wrong and missing an entire entree...but with lots of extra dolmas! Cause I really wanted a dinner of 12 dolmas and hummus with about 15 pitas, but no chicken shawarma, rice, or salad...What they did manage to bring was not great.hummus--super bland, very dense mostly chickpea flavor, little tahinitabouli--the worst I've ever had. I have to think they forgot to dress it or something because its literally just chopped parsley. falafel had good flavor and was the most edible itemSuper disappointing. Because they are closed now I wasn't able to get in touch with them regarding the order, but Eat24 refunded me for the missing item so that was good service at least.

11.description: Drove past this place in search for a good/quick lunch to enjoy with my mother and made a u-turn to find parking bc it caught my eye. Food wait was not long, too bad all of the tables were dirty and we had to wipe one down ourselves. Then we ordered some pop and who restocks the fridge and moves the cold ones to the back, all of the bottles were sticky. Then we get our food (which was absolutely delicious) expect for when half way through my food  not 1 but 2 baby roaches crawled up the wall. We no longer could eat and when my mother told the young girl at the desk she acted as if she had no clue what we were talking about and did not offer a refund or to even look at what we killed. Never Again!

39.description: This place is amazing!! The Kafta kabob is so tender and flavorful. My husband loves the chicken shawarma and we usually get the dinner because the rice is also delicious. Combine that with a yogurt salad and you've got an amazing meal. The falafel and stuffed grape leaves are also very good but the meat and chicken is really what is outstanding here. The inside is a bit gross to be honest and gets smokey from the grill but we usually order delivery and it arrives hot. 5 stars for food but only gave it 4 because of the inside of the restaurant. Very affordable.

37.description: Yea yea...I think this place is where my love for Arab food started.  Pretty much everything on their menu is very good.  The shawarma plates can be kind of pricey compared to other places but you pay for quality.  Again, this place is delicious.  Delivery takes about 45m but I guess every place is like that.  If you get their food you will want more. Trust me.

0.description: I've had the chicken shawerma sandwich and the vegetarian platter, and have come away both (1) extremely satisfied and (2) excited to try other things on the menu. This is a no frills kind of place. You don't come here for the experience. You come here for the food. And on most nights, that's just fine. So don't come expecting to be served like a king amongst some mesmerizing decor, but do come to eat some good food.

38.description: We order take out from here all the time and have never been disappointed. The beef kefta is amazing and so is the hummus.

51.description: Ameer Kebab is hand's down one of my favorite hole-in-the-wall joints in Chicago. This place should get way more business than it does due to it's bizarre location and weird vibe. Make no mistake though, this surpasses nearby Sultan's and every other Mediterranean place I've been introduced to.The food, particularly the entree chicken shawarma and kefta kebab are outstanding. Ameer serves you plenty of food whether you order delivery or eat-in, but it's the amazing home-cooked quality of the meal that really elevates this place. Their food tastes like an expertly cooked dinner made by your friend's Mom, it's clean and just right in terms of grease vs. flavor.One of the things that also really makes this a favorite is the fresh vegetables and seemingly great quality meat they use in their salads. You would think at a divey place like this they'd have to make up for low quality material with great sauce, but everything I've eaten there is remarkably fresh.The vibe in the dining room can definitely get a little weird due to the randomness of the location, but it' comfortable and the staff is very friendly and attentive. Expect great service and warm from the servers.Long and short, this place is HIGHLY recommended if you're looking for dynamite middle eastern cuisine at a bargain price!

27.description: Stopped for a chicken shwarma to eat while I walked around on a spring day. The sandwich was decent and pretty cheap but left me feeling like I could have made it myself. The chicken was clearly just sauted, rather than being cut off a delicious fatty cone. I know wanting a sandwich to walk around with was a little demanding but there was soooo much sauce that the bottom soaked through immediately; which made it really hard for me but I think it would have bothered anyone eating in or take out as well. In the end it was pretty cheap, so I might give the rice entrees a try some day but my mediocre experience means its not on the top of my list.

32.description: Good price, good food!I usually order for pickup and all the staff is always very nice and friendly!

54.description: Dry, hard as stone, possibly a few days old or factory made pita bread. Burnt veggies and meat not cooked/grilled perfectly. Q salad is watery, more like yogurt w bit of cucumber, i should say. Sorry but based on the reviews my expectation was high. Only thing i liked is lentil soup.

48.description: We have had delivery several times but I suggest coming in and eating. It's much better when it's fresh.

44.description: I've never eaten inside, but their delivery is on point. Their food is very good--the rice is seasoned well and the meat is tender and also seasoned well. The portions are generous and the prices are great.

24.description: good chicken shawarma, order ahead of time took 30 minutes.

7.description: I've ordered from this place a couple times and both times it was excellent! I got the beef and chicken shawarma combo this time. It was well seasoned and fresh. They give you a good amount too for your money. Excellent pitas as well.

49.description: Walked into a smoke screen. Like a family diner, fries are an option. Was tasty and I had food on my face after. V good prices = $0.55 for a falaalf. No paper towels in the bathroom. Get the stuffed grape leaves. Why isn't BYOB? No window nor air flow. I don't give 5 star ratings. The candy was good. What candy? Leftovers are still in the fridge, says something, but I'm about to go get them. Would go again

40.description: The food is amazing however their delivery man was incredibly rude. He basically yelled at me for not giving him a tip and when I told him I had added it to my credit card he said I couldn't. I then had to show him the 'tip' line item. Don't get delivery.

53.description: My friend and I have ordered pick up from here a couple times. Not once have we been disappointed or dissatisfied with the food. The prices are extremely reasonable and portions are plentiful. Generally my friend and I will come here when we are low on funds because we can split a meal and both be left stuffed in the end. Last time we ordered here we went with the combination feast. Everything tasted amazing. I took a bit of everything and shoved it into the falafel that comes with the meal and devoured it. Can't wait to get the urge again for some yummy middle eastern dining.

30.description: Wasnt even that hungry, but couldnt stop eating. Had the chicken salad and it was so fresh and light while the chicken was so flavorful and went really nicely with the light dressing. Overall, the food looked less greasy than other similar places. The owner was super nice and friendly. Loved it!

46.description: The food was really good and the service was excellent.  The food was nice and fresh and you get a lot of food for the price you pay.

1.description: I love this place. We've mostly ordered takeout/delivery but eat-in is fine, too. No frills, lots of cab drivers (great sign, in my opinion) and an extremely friendly counter service. The baba ghanouj has a perfectly roasted eggplant flavor with a great texture and the hummus is creamy with out being over blended- neither are too salty. We usually share the Ameer Platter with beef shawarma and chicken kabob and the Chicken shawarma salad. I feel this is some of the best Mediterranean I've had and am so happy to have found it not on this funny stretch of Milwaukee Ave!  Oh yes--Their lentil soup is great, too!!

55.description: I was told this place has a great chicken shawarma sandwich.   So I went.   They were right!   My chicken shawarma sandwich was full of seasoned moist chicken with a great sauce.   The fries that came with it were hot but not great.   Can't wait to go back and explore the menu. The staff was very friendly as well.

9.description: Huge portions for a pretty cheap price. The food was delivered quickly, was hot and pretty delicious. Definitely will order delivery again from these guys!

26.description: Good shwerma and falafel. The hummus was surprisingly just so so, but everything else I've had here was excellent.

25.description: My favorite Mediterranean place in the city.  Their hummus is amazing and goes great with the hot pita bread.  I get a large order of that hummus to go with the chicken schwarma dinner for delivery at least twice a month, and one order is good for about 2.5 meals.  The combination platter is also fantastic.  I highly recommend.

12.description: This is the first restaurant I visited in Chicago and it didn't throw up any surprises. The food was great and the owner was very nice.Other than that - the utensils were not clean, the place was smoky, the place can need a lot of TLC!I think it'll be great for to-go and deliveries as the food is great.

59.description: This place is a couple blocks from my house but easy to miss as you cruise down Milwaukee. Just north of Augusta on the west side of the street. Absolutely nothing to look at and maybe looks sketchy, but don't be fooled.Once inside, again nothing to look at. Ordered the chicken kabobs and were told it would be 15 minutes. Downside - that's a long time; upside - its fresh. The result: a really good chicken kabob that was fresh and very tasty. The rice and pita were standard but this is a good place with fresh meat so I'll be back!

21.description: Their chicken shwarma and chicken kebob are my favorites. Solid customer service if there is a problem - only encountered one issue of all the times I've ordered - and always quick delivery.

17.description: A bit dry, but that could be me.

10.description: Pretty good middle eastern place.  Looked like a cheap knock off of pita inn for those who know that place as the menu is almost identical.  The shawarma was very good.  Not a fan of the falafel at all and the tahini sauce shouldn't be that thick.  Only complaints about the place.  Other than that, a definite go to place

5.description: I've ordered from this place twice now, and really like it.  The first time I had a chicken shawarma sandwich, hummus and baklava.  The sandwich was good, although I've had better.  No complaints about the baklava.  I really enjoyed the hummus and the warm pita.  There was a lot, to where I had more than enough for breakfast the next morning.  The second time I ordered, I got a vegetarian plate, and I can't recommend this enough.  I couldn't decide between the vegetarian plate from here or from Old Jerusalem, but went with Ameer Kabob's since it was almost $4 cheaper and included more items.  It came with baba ghanouj (nice and smoky), hummus (so smooth), falafel (crispy), dolma (addicting), tabbouleh, and garlic tahini.  So yummy and filling.  Everything was full of flavor, color and freshness.  I also love how I order from River North, and the pitas are still nice and warm when they arrive.

3.description: Came here recently with a group of friends.  Middle eastern food is one of my favorite cuisines.  When we showed up the place was pretty empty, and we all placed an order.  I got the shawarma combo.  Then waited and waited and waited for about 45 minutes for our food.  For a small fast food place like this, this was unacceptable.  Besides it did not seem like this place was super busy.   I thought the chicken shawarma was decent, not the best I have had but the beef was super dry.  I am used to eating my shawarma with hummus/tahini, but it did not come with either. The portions were large and the rice was delicious.  Overall food was 3 stars but one gets taken away due to it taking forever to cook.   I would not recommend this place if you are in a hurry.

35.description: TERRIBLE!  I ordered delivery food via Eat24 and they brought us an order that was cold, looked old, and missing half of our items.  The food was subpar - the rice tasted like it was Lipton or Knorr broth rice.  They said they would deliver the rest of our order and never did.  Shame on them - I called the restaurant from the delivery guy's phone and they just blamed their delivery guy instead of trying to make up for it.

19.description: Not trying to be a total hater but I've ordered from this spot twice now.  They're a mile and a half from my place. The first time they were an hour and a half late and the original wait time was an hour. The guy told me traffic was bad. Nonsense. Food was good and it was also actually hot so they clearly just didn't bother to send it out on time. The owner promised me a free meal for my next order. He's now totally flabbergasted that I'm asking for my free meal. Delivery was super late again. Same deal - good food terrible delivery and incompetent staff. Sorry Ameer, I want to praise the schawerma but you're service is awful. It can't be this hard and you clearly don't care. See ya never, BYYYYEEEEEE

28.description: Really good chicken shawarma sandwich! Flavors are on point and portions are generous. Plus, if you eat there, everyone's super nice.All around awesome choice!

45.description: One of my favorite spots! I would put it up against any other med establishment. even though local cretin chris d. writes "It's definitely not a place I'd eat inside of - pretty "hole-in-the-wall-ey" and had some creepy people when I was there." its obvious he is a pussy and doesn't deserve good food.  GO BACK TO LINCOLN PARK CHRIS.

33.description: Ordered via Grubhub. Decent food, nothing exceptional. There are better alternatives but worth a try.

43.description: Food fuels my motivation when I work out and seeing as this place is at the end of my running route it's often been the reason I've burned a bunch of calories. Even though I end up putting them back in eating here it's all relatively healthy stuff and definitely doesn't break the bank. The entrees are all about 10 bucks and come with a good sized side salad, creamy hummus, rice and pita bread. With pretty quality portions of tasty marinated meats It's definitely a steal for something that you can potentially eat for two meals. There's not much to the interior or the signage, but don't let that fool ya...it's a pretty solid spot for pickup or delivery. Overall a great spot for folks the who dine on their own more often than not.

2.description: Soooo frickin' good! I stopped by last week to see that this place was closed and I panicked. Fortunately I stopped by today for lunch and I see that the inside has been completely remodeled. Its good to see that my favorite mediterranean place hasnt closed down for good.  I got a beef kabob on a large salad and the meat was cooked to perfection. Same great flavors and service.

18.description: The food is good, not terrible, but good. The best review i have read on Yelp about this place :While not bad, this place is not nearly as good as other reviewers would lead you to believe.Couldn't put it any better. I must admit that I am rather surprised at the comments over the service, especially delivery. I have eaten here about 4 times and have always been treated nicely. If I was the proprietor, I would investigate all the complaints about delivery.

41.description: Holy moly. When you think about chicken schwarma, it's that meat on a big stick and they shave it off and throw it on the grill to heat it up. That's not the case here. This schwarma is legit schwarma. Real schwarma. Like I'm takin real good schwarma. Just look at that pic of mine. Great source of protein after a good work out!!

52.description: Contrasts of chicken and beef shawarma = delicious! Good service. Atmosphere, however...

50.description: I came here a few times before with my husband and the food was really good. So we went there again today really hungry and desperate to eat that delicious food again but it wasn't how we expected. The hummus was SPOIL!! we order a carry out order and when we got home to eat it we had the surprise that the hummus was spoil and it tasted really bad. I called them to let them know and even though they gave us a credit it still ruined our dinner. My husband really loves hummus so he got really upset. The food tasted different it doesn't have the same flavor as usual, so sad because i won't go back there it's just not the same flavour. So this is why i only give a one star because they don't have a lower rating. Won't go back there again!!

4.description: Excellent, cheap delivery or pick up that is close to me.They have a million options.  Their hummus is fantastic, baba delicious, gyros great, kababs...YES.  Pitas galore...yummy carbs in my tummy and my thighs...the NY resolution will start soon enough.Dont judge...this girl can eat.

6.description: Great deliciousness! This place is right around the corner from my house and I can't believe I've never ordered from here before. As far as I can tell, it seems pretty healthy too. I had the Combination Feast with Rice and an order of Hummus. I'm tempted to eat it all in one sitting, but this is enough for two meals. Thanks for the friendly service, as well!

22.description: Some of the best chicken shawarma I've ever had. I picked the order up to go and was salivating from the smell of the food in my car. Every bit of it was savory. Price was very reasonable and the service was very fast. The pita bread was a little tasteless but a minor complaint.

15.description: Holy moly. When you think about chicken schwarma, it's that meat on a big stick and they shave it off and throw it on the grill to heat it up. That's not the case here. This schwarma is legit schwarma. Real schwarma. Like I'm takin real good schwarma. Just look at that pic of mine. Great source of protein after a good work out!!

57.description: So, get this. 7:30 on a Saturday night, I get a craving for middle eastern food. I'd never been to Ameer Kabob, only heard of it. I figured I'd try it out for delivery. The food arrived 30 minutes after ordering, hot, very filling, and the delivery driver took extra care to make sure nothing was spilled/mixed inside any of the containers (Including the soup). That alone was wonderful to see.I got the platter with 3 meats. I chose 2 kabobs and chicken shawarma. On top of that I got an additional pita order and lentil soup. I couldn't have finished all this food if my life depended on it. It was fantastic though. The meats were all very flavorful, cooked to perfection, and had some grilled veggies with them as well. It seemed like it was all cooked in a sort of hobo-pack prep style which sealed in a healthy amount of flavor. The platter also came with hummus which was extremely generous in portion size and was about on par with Sabra brand you'd get at the store.The soup was nothing to call home about and actually was semi-bland. I would personally stay away from soups here in the future after trying it.All-in-all I highly recommend Ameer Kabob and I know for sure I'll be ordering again in the future.

20.description: Stopped into Ameer Kabob for a chicken shawarma plate ... OMG - it was sooooo delish.  So delish, I am actually thinking about contracting with them to cater my eventual wedding - it was so delicious!

36.description: The food is good, not terrible, but good. The best review i have read on Yelp about this place :While not bad, this place is not nearly as good as other reviewers would lead you to believe.Couldn't put it any better. I must admit that I am rather surprised at the comments over the service, especially delivery. I have eaten here about 4 times and have always been treated nicely. If I was the proprietor, I would investigate all the complaints about delivery.

14.description: good stuff

58.description: I've been to beauty bar on several occasions to see my friend DJ. What I like about the location is parking can be somewhat decent. Although I have never had my nails done here I heard it's reasonably priced. I like the concept of getting your club on and nails done at the same time...lol. The décor is also cute. Seats with hooded air dryers line the wall and the dance floor is pretty big. Right next to the main dance floor is a room with a disco ball and another dance floor. (It makes me too dizzy so I normally don't go in that room though). Drink prices are reasonable and it's a generally good time. One huge thing I don't like though is the temperature (at least for the events I attend here). It is soooo hot!!! Even in the dead of winter I still have to wear booty shorts and a tank top. LOL. Besides that though it's a nice spot to kick it.

56.description: If you're a hipster or from the suburbs you'll love this place. It sucked in Vegas, it sucked in LA and it sucks here.

29.description: Cleanest daym bathrooms I have ever seen.

42.description: The legend that is Beauty Bar had been mentioned to me a couple of times before I finally gave it a go--and at the perfect time: it was the "Another 90's Party," which meant my night was filled with drinks, a manicure, Brittney, TLC, and Spice Girls. What more could a girl ask for?The manicure deal is pretty solid--for $15 dollars you get a martini and mani. I got the "Bed Head" (tequila with pineapple and lime juice--which was strong enough, but not overwhelming) and just a basic manicure. Two gals were manning the manicure table, and churning them out pretty quickly. It's a bit no frills, but for what you pay, it's decent: just a quick file and buffer, with a couple coats and quick dry top coat. I was back on the floor dancing to Savage Garden in no time.Winter tips: They have a coat check for $4, but whether your turning your coat in or heading back to fetch it, expect a bit of a wait. Also, don't let the frigid temps outside trick you. If you go on a night where you plan to dance, you're better off dressing for the warmer days we all long for. I was wearing jeans and a long-sleeved shirt and wasn't even in the back dancing room but it was still sweltering. I'm just going to go ahead and choose to believe this just means I sweated off the calories from that "Bed Head" drink.

23.description: I never have a bad time here. From 50-60's nights to Top 40 I always enjoy the music. This place is like a hidden treasure on Chicago's near west side. The only thing is that I wish that the dance floor was a bit larger!

47.description: Description: If you like dancing you will love this place. They have a great pink room with a disco ball in it where they play R&B, funk, 90's, 2000's and everything in between. Be sure to check the calendar and go at a time they are playing music you will like. Even if you don't like dancing the place is pretty cool.Pros: My favorite place to dance in Chicago. Cool people, small egos, love to get down.Cons: The place does get kind of crowded some nights, so show up early!

8.description: I did not get a manicure here so my review is in regards to the bar on a Friday night during the Y2K night (where the DJ played music only from the early 2000s, which was amazing!)I am definitely coming back here again in the futureThe music was ON POINT ( and I don't say that very often), drinks were good, service was great! I loved this place and had such a good time, I definitely recommend it if you love to dance!

31.description: The bartender charged my card for someone else's bill then they kicked me out for not paying mine. I came back the next day they apologized. Then came to the bar at night. Door guy said we can't let you in, you ran out on your bill. Fucking idiots run the place but the music is great

34.description: It's always such a blast here! 90's night is the best. It gets pretty hot/humid. Draft beer is like 6 bucks, not too bad. I've never tried the $15 manicure + martini special but I just might try that next time.(I like how Yelp asked this question: Is this place hipster? I pressed yes. Then it said: I bet you went here before it was cool) lmao

16.description: It's always such a blast here! 90's night is the best. It gets pretty hot/humid. Draft beer is like 6 bucks, not too bad. I've never tried the $15 manicure + martini special but I just might try that next time.(I like how Yelp asked this question: Is this place hipster? I pressed yes. Then it said: I bet you went here before it was cool) lmao

13.description: I love their 80s and 90s theme parties!  Get there early on those nights because a line forms down the block!  I wish that the dance floor area took up more of the bar.  I look forward to going back for the Daft Punk party!

11.description: Ahhhh...the old Sonotheque...how I miss thee!I came by recently as I was invited by someone for a Friday nite party. I walked in and saw dudes and chicks getting manicures (nothing wrong with that...I get em myself). As i walked beyond the entrance area I noticed the layout is pretty much the same as the old place used to be. I also noticed drinks are more expensive as I ordered a ciroc vodka and pineapple and it ran me about $12...the fuck??? There is still the wide open space in the middle where you can dance your ass off to the awesome joints the dj was spinning/tabbing on the computer. I noticed on the back wall opposite of the bar there is some comfy looking/feminine-esque seating which goes along with the name/theme of the place. There was also another area in the back of the club where peeps seemed to congregating/dancing and it looked like a good time. I had a good time while I was there I have to say and would definitely come back on a Friday night if the vibe is that way it was when I was there.

39.description: I'm honestly contemplating coming here once every two weeks to keep getting my nails done! They do a really good job, especially for a BAR! Not only do they do a good job with your nails, you also get a martini with it for $10 on a weekday and $15 on a weekend! If you don't think that's a good deal, I don't know what to tell you. I came here two times already within the past three weeks and I don't plan on stopping! My first time, the manicure lasted about a week, but just let me tell you, I work with first graders and I'm constantly digging through papers, toys, etc. I just went this past Friday, and my nails are still looking amazing. The bartenders are also super cool people and the drinks are fabulous! I especially enjoy the Deep Condition. If you feel like pampering yourself while sipping on a delicious martini, you should definitely come here. Or even if you don't want your nails done, you should still come! It's super fun on weekends and pretty chill on weeknights!

37.description: Got there at 920 on sat night. 5$ cover after 9. Not real busy. Free pbr 9-10p if you RSVP.90s night. Mostly girls belting out every song! I loved it!But did get packed quickly. Too packed and very hot. Drinks all over the floor- a mess but so is any dance bar.Coats sitting all over even tho there's a coat check. 20$ minimum for credit cards:(

0.description: I like their indie dance nights.  Always had fun when i went on those.  Drinks are cheap...and people are very fun and nice and friendly there.Expect to wait in line on weekend nights.

38.description: A group of us came here early for a quick girls outing. It's kind of a shabby chic look (emphasis on shabby) but cute. We had made reservations for our spots and waited in the entry area for about 10 minutes without anyone checking in with us. In the end, we just walked in and no one questioned us/helped us. The bartender was nice, but the nail techs seemed pretty impersonal and cold (literally and figuratively--they had coats on and heaters going). I'm pretty particular about where I get my manicures and decided this wasn't really for me, so I can't comment on the quality.It's a unique spot, so I'd probably come back, but I don't think it's making it into my regular rotation.

51.description: Shame, I used to love this place and recommend it to lots of friends, but one terrible night can really make a person do a 180. Extremely rude bouncers, a long and bureaucratic ID process (why??), no explanations for any policies, and then when we tried to call in and speak to a manager, we instead got this woman who gave me so much attitude I had to scrape it off my shoes later."Uh, hello, it's a Saturday night, we're like, really busy? Can you call back tomorrow or something?""No, I'd like to speak to your manager please, tonight.""Well like, he's at the bar right now, so..."Sorry Beauty Bar, I will never set foot in you again. Shame, because a lot of my friends perform at Salonathon here, which I'm now unable to attend because I don't want to support you. Terrible!

27.description: I went here on a Thursday night for DTRT (Do The Right Thing) 90's hip-hop & R&B night. The first thing is obvious on a night like that, the music was on point. The spot itself is not that big, but not too small that you would feel claustrophobic.  The bartenders were on their A game as they were friendly and attentive. The spot apparently offers manicures and such, and also has a photo booth in the corner.  I opted to not get my nails painted, but feel free to get that done when it's available. I need to come check out this spot on other nights, but this spot is definitely a dope spot in West Town.

32.description: Ahhhh...the old Sonotheque...how I miss thee!I came by recently as I was invited by someone for a Friday nite party. I walked in and saw dudes and chicks getting manicures (nothing wrong with that...I get em myself). As i walked beyond the entrance area I noticed the layout is pretty much the same as the old place used to be. I also noticed drinks are more expensive as I ordered a ciroc vodka and pineapple and it ran me about $12...the fuck??? There is still the wide open space in the middle where you can dance your ass off to the awesome joints the dj was spinning/tabbing on the computer. I noticed on the back wall opposite of the bar there is some comfy looking/feminine-esque seating which goes along with the name/theme of the place. There was also another area in the back of the club where peeps seemed to congregating/dancing and it looked like a good time. I had a good time while I was there I have to say and would definitely come back on a Friday night if the vibe is that way it was when I was there.

54.description: Would have given it four stars if it were not for the semi-incompetent doorman who basically coerced us into paying five dollars despite the fact that I had followed directions to get in for free...but it is what it is.The service here was really great and attentive and the prices are totally fair given the proximity to Wicker Park and Downtown. The vibe is mainly hip but you get the sprinkled in Midwestern yuppie crowd as well. This location is much bigger than its Manhattan counterpart and the music here was actually much better as well. Beer selection is above average (shoutout Akari Shogun from Half Acre) and the martini & manicure deal is sure to win some folks over.I would definitely consider coming here again but probably not when there's a weird cover charge. The band that played last night was great though.

48.description: Strong drinks and the ability to get your nails done all at the same time at night? Yup, Beauty Bar I gotta tip my hat to you and say that is one of the most unique bar/nightclub designs I have seen yet! This place is pretty big inside too, although I was told by pretty much everyone I know that this place ALWAYS gets full so if there is a DJ or someone you want to see her, you should probably get here early before the masses arrive. There is a small DJ booth and they do all kinds of special indie DJ nights and some nights even featuring LCD Soundsystem and groups like that which is pretty great. The dance floor area is in the back and I think could have been better--not enough awesome dance moves there, and it was so crowded by one point in the night I don't think anyone could show off any dance moves if they had any to show off in the first place! But a fun night all around here, but be sure you know your drink order when you get to the bar, because they take making drinks seriously here!

44.description: I love beauty bar!!! I mean hello there is glitter on the walls! Any time I need to go out and let loose on the weekends I choose beauty bar!  The music is always fun and I dance the night away. The staff is great too. Zach, one of the bartenders is my favorite.  Hes always funny and charming and remembers my drink(and super nice!)  By far my fave spot in chicago!

24.description: Most of the time they have great music, fun atmosphere. I especially love their Bump and Grind Nights because they're usually more R&B which I personally prefer. Been there on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. I'd say Friday is best if it's Bump and Grind, otherwise Saturday's for sure. Some drinks are a bit pricey but pretty good for the most part. Aaaaallways an excellent time!

7.description: I loved the design concept of the place. Lots of glitter with some antique beauty salon accoutrements. The music was phenomenal. Giving me high school flashbacks. I had a double don Julio on the rocks and it was $22 bucks which I thought was steep but I could equally be miss remembering my levels of good tequila. Regardless we had a wonderful time and I enjoyed the mixed crowd of people. I definitely suggest earlier than later. We got there at 10pm and it was pretty busy, but when we started heading out at 12:45 it was beginning to get a bit crowded. I also always appreciate a good photo booth, which they had.

49.description: I went here for a friend's birthday, and I had a lot of fun! Admittedly, I was a little moderate in my fun, as I was driving AND had work the next morning, but I still had fun. The bar itself is very easy to find. It's right on Chicago Ave. and it's very straightforward. Parking was easy to find; I found a spot about two blocks away on the same street. When you first walk in, it's very cold, as the lobby is where they check IDs and get the cover charge. It was a very simple system, my friends and I were there early (at nine), so there was no wait. The cover charge of $5 was super reasonable, and the coat check was $3. I have a personal fear of coat checks, so I did not take advantage of theirs. I have to write about their decor. The Beauty Bar is definitely a themed bar. As soon as you walk in, there is a spot for their mani/martini deals, but there's also old school beauty shop appliances artfully placed. I loved the fact that they had hair dryers as chairs, plus it was made for a nice photo opp. The bar portion was very clean, and since it was early, their bartenders weren't too busy. The music was good, not great. We attended the Freedom Party, and I was expecting hip hop the entire night, but they played somewhat lame motown-esque club remix hits for the first hour we were there. Lame. Then they played dancehall, which was AWESOME. And after that, it was 90s hip hop, which I loved. Overall, I'd go back if I was invited.

40.description: As for da decor, I think Katy Perry lived here. Music was hip hop night ...was ok...good sound system. This place most likely enjoyed by women. Good lighting system. Men's restroom had soap. And bathroom stall had a door.

53.description: Logged onto my Chase account and discovered Beauty Bar decided to round up the $28.80 I wanted charged to my card (bar tab + tip) to $29. If I hadn't thrown away my copy of the receipt, I'd go over there and call 'em on it since I live in the area.Way to stay classy, Beauty Bar - just like the skeezy bottom feeders from outside neighborhoods and sh*tty suburbs who come to hump each other on your icky dance floor. It's kinda like the John Barleycorn of West Town.No coat check and $5 cover charge for a subpar crowd, music and atmosphere. Just sayin'.

30.description: Cute place, but the DJ was an asshole and wouldn't even look at us to say happy birthday to our friend. The music was awful and the $5 cover is not worth it.

46.description: First of all, I'm shocked this place (that I used to frequent), has hired such horrific staff in the past year. The bartender in particular Zach was the absolute worst! Spent the entire night at the bar and had accumulated a pretty hefty tab. As I was getting my belongings & about to leave a generous tip IN CASH (because I'm also a bartender & not an asshole), this guy out of nowhere starts on a rage filled tangent. Apparently he was butt hurt because he thought I wasn't going to leave a tip, so he then proceeded to get in my face and yell disgusting derogatory terms that literally brought me to tears. I've never felt so violated/disrespected in my life, by a man no less! After this incident not only will I never spend my money here again but have since warned friends/colleagues to steer clear of beauty bar Chicago & if they ever come across the classless jerk with hand tats, to leave him the kind of tip in which he deserves... which is pennies.

1.description: OK, I came here years ago for a martini and manicure.  Sure, it's $10... because the manicure is terrible and the martini isn't very strong.Fast forward to a recent experience at Beauty Bar for one of their "dance nights" on Saturdays.  They typically have Facebook events advertising these themed dance parties and - surprise - they had one for the one we went to.  The event page said that if you RSVPd to the party via their website, you could skip the $5 cover at the door.  So, we all fill out this stupid form online and (I'm sure) sign ourselves up for mailing lists galore and we're ready to go.Once we're in line to get in, we hear people ahead of us complaining that they're being asked to pay the $5 cover even though they RSVPd ahead of time.  It's kind of a lot of people complaining.  Of course, my friends and I are prepared to complain because that's not how the event page explained this would work!  Once we give our names and get our stamps, we're asked to pay the $5 cover.  We argue and the hostess or whatever says "That's not what the Facebook page said."  Oh yes it did, honey.  So we stood there, two of us, attempting to pull up the event on our phone to show her... and guess what?  THE EVENT PAGE WAS GONE.  Erased.  Like it never existed.  That is shady as hell.  Welp, I guess you're right... that's not what the event page said because it no longer exists.  Shady.  As.  Hell.  So we paid the $5 cover for the music and got a free PBR ticket for it (so we paid $5 for a $3 beer?).  The bar wasn't too crowded at 9 but by 11 the whole place was like a sardine can.  The line at the bar was three people deep and it was impossible to get a drink (or close a tab).  Needless to say, this place got gross pretty quickly.I'll definitely never come back here, even if they advertise some kind of super awesome theme night.  It's not worth it at all, especially since the place turns into a douche-haven with a line three storefronts long outside.  This place is not that great!  Why are so many people waiting to get in?  You'll get one drink in like 3 hours and not even have enough room to dance because people are shoulder-to-shoulder.  Yuck.

55.description: Cool place. Very retro. I got my nails done there before and it was ok. The music is great and the staff is friendly and fun. I will be going back!

9.description: Stopped by on a Saturday night around eleven. There was not a line yet so we walked right in to.. dancers galore and ass-dropping to 90s music. I was immediately transported back to my junior high gymnasium at homecoming. So fun, so..awkward. Thank gosh we had started drinking heavily earlier in the night, no pesky inhibitions to stop us from taking control of the dance floor! I heartily recommend this spot to anyone who feels ready to break out their dancing shoes, but please just don't stand there along the wall watching. Service is fast, music is loud, and bouncers are ready to throw out any creepy wallflowers.

26.description: I went to this place, as I've had some really great experiences here before, for my birthday and danced until 1:45 am when the employees pushed me out (literally) 15 minutes before they even closed. Then, when I told the employee I was waiting on a friend who was in the bathroom, he psychically put his hands on me and then called me a bitch when I reminded him that they didn't close for another 15 minutes. I will not be returning to this establishment and I will make sure no one I know does either. Worst place, worst workers.

25.description: Good times

12.description: Seemed cool til they kicked me out for using the "wrong" bathroom. White bouncer with beard is a lil bitch. I threatened his authority and he couldn't handle it and kicked me out. I wasn't super drunk or anything still left when I got ready. I'm not a fan of racist or sexist establishments. Told me I couldn't use whatever bathroom I wanted. Line at the ladies was 10 girls long and I really needed to go. The men's room door was propped open and nobody was in there. I gave him the finger and went in the men's so he told me I had to leave I told him I wanted to see the manager he said there wasn't one. I said that's fine I make more $ than ur manager. Eff u and him, paid my tab, no tip, and left. Needless to say won't be back.

59.description: I don't know what the magic number of e-mail and voicemail messages is required before one can actually book a party here, because after a few weeks of leaving multiples of both, I decided they didn't exactly deserve our business.  If you have a contact form on your website, Beauty Bar, you should respond to said contacts. So unprofessional.

21.description: I used to go to the Dallas Beauty Bar with my sister all the time so I was very excited to hear there's one in Chicago when I moved here. The lines are usually pretty long and I can never seem to make the 9-10 no cover charge. The disco ball on the dance floor always seems to make me feel way more drunk than I probably am. The dance floor is small but it's never too crowded. There aren't people pushing through to use the bathroom constantly like most dance bars I've been to in Chicago. The DJ plays some good old school music but sometimes it gets too top 40 and I have to roll my eyes a little while pretending to like the song to keep up the jive. It's hard to get a drink at the bar, the bar is always packed with layers of people but I guess what bars not? You can get a manicure and martini for 10 dollars and the manicurist has some pretty cool nail stickers:) It's a fun place but it's not what I crave

17.description: I used to go to the Dallas Beauty Bar with my sister all the time so I was very excited to hear there's one in Chicago when I moved here. The lines are usually pretty long and I can never seem to make the 9-10 no cover charge. The disco ball on the dance floor always seems to make me feel way more drunk than I probably am. The dance floor is small but it's never too crowded. There aren't people pushing through to use the bathroom constantly like most dance bars I've been to in Chicago. The DJ plays some good old school music but sometimes it gets too top 40 and I have to roll my eyes a little while pretending to like the song to keep up the jive. It's hard to get a drink at the bar, the bar is always packed with layers of people but I guess what bars not? You can get a manicure and martini for 10 dollars and the manicurist has some pretty cool nail stickers:) It's a fun place but it's not what I crave

10.description: I LOVE TimbuckTuesdays!!! They have yet to let me down with the music(been twice)! They play everything from early 90's to current, hit after hit. I have to say, this time I notice a few, how can I put this nicely... Uhmmmm.. REAL urban token individuals in the place. I say REAL urban because, as if the ankle pants wasn't ridiculous enough, they decided to put on the pharmaceutical cologne and pushing around while dancing!!! Then they had their girlfriend with them (they didn't literally know the girls but they were REAL urban, too). Coming in at like 1a.m. upset because there's no seats, trying to ease in your seat AND trying to fight if you didn't let their group of 10 use your seat for their coats?! Uhmmmm don't drive out the hood for fun to come acting like the hood you left, REAL Urban-ers!!! But over all, my go-to dance place.

5.description: Pretty pumping place. Went on a Friday for 90's dance music. The DJ was good and the environment very energetic. The drinks are expensive and expect tons of ice, but that's what you get from frequenting an establishment like this.

3.description: I came to Beauty Bar on a Tuesday, but not just any Tuesday. I specifically came to honor and pay my respect to Dj Timbuck 2, who was a resident Dj for the past 5 years. Due to this tribute night for Timbuck2 I was able to experience Beauty Bar packed to capacity!The following is a list of things I learned that night.- Depending on what day/event they host don't expect for there to be ample room to move around in. You will definitely be bumped into and shoved. I hear that Tuesday's normally don't get busy and Saturday is when it gets packed, but again this can change depending on what event is happening.-There are two dance floors, the main area where the bar is, and a smaller room with a cool disco ball that gets opened when the place starts to really fill up.- Wear comfortable shoes because the few seats they do have will be taken, like all night long. - They do have coat check for a small fee, it might have been $2 not sure.- If you pay for the martini/manicure ($10 on Tuesday) combo your drink will be strong :) but your manicure will be basic even borderline bad. While the manicurist was sweet she applied way to many layers of polish and top coat. My nails started off as cute then quickly began to wrinkle before my eyes. BUT hey it was $10 and the drink was truly strong. - There are only 3 stalls in the ladies restroom so there will be a line. ALSO it's located all the way in the back, so If it's packed and you just so happen to be closer to the entrance you will have to push your way through a crowd. Fun!-There was a photo booth that unfortunately wasn't working, but I'm sure is nice when it is. Overall I totally see myself coming back to Beauty Bar, I really dig the vintage dećor, hair dryers as seats and all :)

35.description: Such a fun time at this place!  Very eclectic and great price on drinks.  A nice change of pace from the usual places I go to.  We met up with some friends and stayed until the place closed.  I will be back for sure.

19.description: The legend that is Beauty Bar had been mentioned to me a couple of times before I finally gave it a go--and at the perfect time: it was the "Another 90's Party," which meant my night was filled with drinks, a manicure, Brittney, TLC, and Spice Girls. What more could a girl ask for?The manicure deal is pretty solid--for $15 dollars you get a martini and mani. I got the "Bed Head" (tequila with pineapple and lime juice--which was strong enough, but not overwhelming) and just a basic manicure. Two gals were manning the manicure table, and churning them out pretty quickly. It's a bit no frills, but for what you pay, it's decent: just a quick file and buffer, with a couple coats and quick dry top coat. I was back on the floor dancing to Savage Garden in no time.Winter tips: They have a coat check for $4, but whether your turning your coat in or heading back to fetch it, expect a bit of a wait. Also, don't let the frigid temps outside trick you. If you go on a night where you plan to dance, you're better off dressing for the warmer days we all long for. I was wearing jeans and a long-sleeved shirt and wasn't even in the back dancing room but it was still sweltering. I'm just going to go ahead and choose to believe this just means I sweated off the calories from that "Bed Head" drink.

28.description: I always have a good time here.  Every time I go, it's different music selection, which makes it more fun.  Sometimes it's cold when you get in early before the crowds, that's my only real complaint.  The servers are efficient.  It's gotten slightly more expensive ($15 for mani & drink instead of $10) but not bad.  I always get the mani special because I always come with my best friend and we always want to chat and catch up before we get down to the dancing.  Plus it's not bad waking up the next morning with a new fun polish!

45.description: This spot is my usual Sunday night hangout. 50¢ Schlitz and free pizza is a hard deal to beat. After becoming a regular, i felt like I was truly welcomed by the staff. They remember who I am, and go out of their way to catch up with me. Zach has always been a great bartender, very attentive and legitimately cares about the well being of the patrons of Beauty Bar. I know that it's not in the Bartenders job description to get to know patrons, but he does and it means a lot to someone who works in customer service.

33.description: I had so much fun at Beauty Bar on 90's night! Drinks were reasonably priced and the jams were awesome. The crowd was cool -- a good mix of people -- I didn't encounter anyone who was disrespectful or sloppy, which is always good! Its not like a ritzy night club, which I appreciate, but it is still classy.We had to wait in line for quite some time, so I would suggest getting there before 11 if you don't want to wait.

43.description: Beauty Bar is hands down one of my favorite, if not my favorite, bars in Chicago. Good music, fun theme nights, reasonable prices, and awesome service. The entire bar is covered in glitter, dryer chairs, and vintage hair product ads. It's like being inside an awesome drunken estrogen blast. I usually go on Sundays when Zach is the bartender, who is always friendly and courteous. Wednesdays are also a fun night to come in. Nicole and Gigi are both amazing nail artists too if you get the martini and a mani special. Gigi does great 3d nail art and Nicole had a huge binder full of custom nail decals she's made.

2.description: This was my second visit to beauty bar and this place does not disappoint .. As long as you know what you are going for. Beauty Bar is first and foremost a bar/dance club with manicurists. If you go expecting a polished and trendy salon that serves drinks you may not be pleased. Manicurists are ready to go from 7-12pm everyday. They have a martini and manicure special $10 Mon-Fri and $15 Sat/Sun. This deal cannot be beat, especially in Chicago! They have a nice selection of trendy nail colors. You may have to wait a bit but who doesn't mind sipping a martini and listing to music while waiting for a cheap manicure? My boyfriend was surprisingly happy with the beer selection and prices. If you want to drink and get your dance in, stop by even if your not in the mood strobe lights and glittered walls help get you going.

18.description: Best night of my life!!!! I danced 6 hours straight. Drinks were flowing heavy. If you haven't been to this spot you missing out

41.description: I loved this place! Went this past weekend for 90s night and had such a good time. The drinks were very affordable compared to other bars, and they were good (& I'm a drink snob). People were getting manicures done, while others danced on the huge dance floor. Loved it, I'm going back in a few weeks for my birthday.

52.description: I love this bar! $10 for a manicure and martini Sunday-Thursday and $15 on Saturdays and Sundays. The bartenders are very nice, too!!

50.description: So admittedly, I'm past my clubbing prime, but there's something about beauty bar that get's it done.  The event I love is the Freedom Party which is held on the third Friday of every month.  They play old-school, hip hop, R&B, Dancehall.  Whatever they're spinning, it's generally sure to keep the dance floor packed. Typically on an old school night you wouldn't expect the crowd to be very diverse, but to my surprise (a happy one) it was a very mixed group.  Overall good atmosphere.  They're over charging on the liquor a bit, but after you've had a few you stop noticing.  $5 cover was reasonable.

4.description: I literally only come here for Freedom Party and I'd give that party 5 stars all day! The door and bar staff are always friendly enough and the prices are reasonable. There are usually a few drink specials posted on the mirror behind the bar (although there weren't any last week).However, I don't know anything about the venue outside of that night that's hosted by my friend. The manicure stations are available some of the time... I don't know how quality it is though. The photo booth is hit or miss but a fun feature during a night out with friends.

6.description: Fucking shithole of a club. Waited for 2 hrs in line. Music bad. Drinks horrible. Waitress unfriendly AF. Don't go there. Waste of time and money.

22.description: the production company i work for throws shows here and we love it. the space allows for enough room for the crowd it brings it, and even on different nights the music and events here are amazing.come here if you're looking for a good dance party with decently priced drinks. the crowd here is great and you're bound to have a fun time.looking forward to trying the martini and manicures.

15.description: Beauty salon meets bar.This lounge setup is very funky, and lively. Every weekend there are themed parties, which adds interesting entertainment. Went for a bday on an Indie's night, and they offered up $10 manicures (Loved the neat work, but more color selection would be better) with the purchase of any Martini. The bar was long and sleek, with the bartenders being quick, and efficient. The drinks were all great:'57 Chevy: 4.5Velvet (something... I can't remember): 4.5Pomadour (martini): 5Crowd: 3 (very funky/edgy, Wicker-Park and San Fran-types). Fun, just not my preferred setting.Ambiance/decor: 3.5Would find myself back here strictly for friends' parties...

57.description: Weird. Place. Not fun. Music sucks. 90s music you say? I love the 90s... Did not love this place. $5 cover. Will not be back. Smells in here. And all the people in here smell. It's like a weird version of Big City (Big Shitty) tap.

20.description: This is a really cool place to go with your girlfriends. The dj is great and they have reasonably priced drinks. There are two dancing areas. One near the bar and another in the back. I just found out that there is seating in the back room with fans. You have to check it out.

36.description: When my friend told me about Beauty Bar - a bar/club that is also a nail salon - I had the biggest bewildered look on my face. Now, whenever someone mentions Beauty Bar, my eyes light up w/ excitement. A bunch of us went on 90's Night, and we all had an awesome time. None of the girls in our group got their nails done, so I can't comment on that aspect of it, but the music and atmosphere at Beauty Bar is amazing. If you're a fan of 90's music (honestly, who isn't?), you're going to LOVE 90's Night. Mariah Carey. Biggie. Ace of Base. The Backstreet Boys. No Doubt. NSYNC. The DJ was on point - every 90's classic jam was played and the crowd definitely loved it. Drink prices are fair. It's a fun crowd and everyone else seemed to be having a grand time as well. Yelp should really consider labeling Beauty Bar under "Karaoke" as well since everyone is basically singing along to their favorite childhood songs! I'll definitely be coming back for the next 90's Night.-Tip: RSVP for 90's Night online and you get free PBR's from 9-10 pm-Tip: Get there early - it gets crowded quick-Tip: $20 minimum credit card charge

14.description: When my friend told me about Beauty Bar - a bar/club that is also a nail salon - I had the biggest bewildered look on my face. Now, whenever someone mentions Beauty Bar, my eyes light up w/ excitement. A bunch of us went on 90's Night, and we all had an awesome time. None of the girls in our group got their nails done, so I can't comment on that aspect of it, but the music and atmosphere at Beauty Bar is amazing. If you're a fan of 90's music (honestly, who isn't?), you're going to LOVE 90's Night. Mariah Carey. Biggie. Ace of Base. The Backstreet Boys. No Doubt. NSYNC. The DJ was on point - every 90's classic jam was played and the crowd definitely loved it. Drink prices are fair. It's a fun crowd and everyone else seemed to be having a grand time as well. Yelp should really consider labeling Beauty Bar under "Karaoke" as well since everyone is basically singing along to their favorite childhood songs! I'll definitely be coming back for the next 90's Night.-Tip: RSVP for 90's Night online and you get free PBR's from 9-10 pm-Tip: Get there early - it gets crowded quick-Tip: $20 minimum credit card charge

0.description: The Burkhart Underground is a Chicago institution. Burkhart is an ancient hippie who claims to have met many of the iconic figures of the sixties, and has the photos to prove it. He brags that he has not held down a paying job in over forty years. Instead, he subsists off an art gallery and coffee house, and has been the de facto patron of many a young artist over the years. Burkhart also has a purple and turquoise bus he drives around town as a mobile art gallery, parking (when he can) at various big chicago events.Burkart is the real hippie deal.

58.description: I am obsessed with this place.  Easily the most underrated restaurant in the neighborhood.  Really amazing traditional Italian cooking.  I've been steering clear of meat and cheese lately and always get the chopped salad (no shrimp or cheese) and the vesuvio potatoes.   My husband is always raving about his pasta and the hot bread basket doesn't hurt either.  The staff is always gracious and the prices are great. Make sure to pay them a visit!

56.description: This place was playing an opera version of "Wicked Game" when we arrived, and we sat next to a giant painting of a cigar in a high-heeled shoe. As if that weren't amazing enough, I then received a giant bowl of pasta covered in cheese (baked cavatelli). Worst espresso of my life - like a tiny cup of yesterday's sludgy folgers from the Waffle House of Christmas Past. Bonus points for the campy atmosphere and traditional Italian service style (check comes when you ask and not before.) I'd go back.

29.description: Food was great, but the baked clams were a bit small. Nice place to enjoy lunch or dinner.

42.description: My favorite Italian restaurant in city. I recommend any pasta dish with their vodka sauce. Their tiramasu is phenomenal!!!! Cocktails are always spot on! Management (Vic and Ramon) always take good care of their customers. Their second floor can be used as a private party room and has access to another full bar. We have had a couple family parties here and always receive the best treatment. If your looking for authentic Italian food and terrific service give this establishment a try.

23.description: My favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago. The food is incredible and so is the service. They are always friendly and accommodating. If you like seafood, the seafood salad is by far one of the best seafood dishes you'll have anywhere; and I mean anywhere. Always fresh and the combination of flavors are amazing. Ask them to add avocado and jalapeños to kick the flavors up a bit, you won't be disappointed (if you enjoy some spice of course). Everything we've ordered has been great. Our favorite pasta dish is the Green Noodles Alforno, ordered it the first time we went some years ago, and continued to order the same dish the first couple of times we went, it was that good. We've also had the NY Steak and lamb chops, all amazing dishes. The vibe of the place is great, the food is amazing and the staff is awesome.

47.description: Great service, excellent food. I had the special dish of the day (grilled halibut) and was not "grilled" by the price.

8.description: This place is consistently good. Keep in mind that their half-portion size is big enough to feed a family of four for three days. Full-size portions are just ridiculous. Martinis are nice and strong, service is friendly and efficient, meatballs are gigantic and delicious. You really can't go wrong.

31.description: It's a small, cozy intimate restaurant. We just had our holiday luncheon here. They were able to accommodate 15 of us.Most of the coworkers have been here and raved about the food. If you like fish, they have a white fish that was fabulous. Half the table ordered it. I had a chicken with peppers and mushrooms. The chicken was so flavorful and juicy. The bruschetta was delicious with the chopped tomatoes, garlic and basil. They do something with the tomatoes because it's warm and juicy. I don't think you could go wrong with anything you order. I'll be back.

34.description: We ordered delivery from here a few nights ago. The food was pretty great- I imagine if we had eaten in, the pasta may have been more al dente and I would happily give them five stars. We ordered a half order of  fettuccine alfredo with a side of chicken, a half order of the farfalle with sausage and onions and peppers, and a whole order of the zuppa di pesce. Initially, I was a bit upset with the total of around  $70 with delivery charge and tax... then the food came (a half hour earlier than Grubhub estimated). The half orders were easily enough for three meals each, and the full order, I kid you not, arrived in a quarter sheet pan filed to the brim with fresh seafood and (albeit slightly overcooked) pasta. Considering this was delivery, as I said, I expect their dine-in meals to be even better. Definitely our new go-to Italian delivery spot.

16.description: Dined with Bella Notte with friends visiting from out of town.  The atmosphere is really cool with Greek/Roman columns and interesting art work combined with a cozy feel.  The service was good but the best part (of course) was the food.  The portions were huge and lots of food to take home for my next meal.  I had the Lobster Fradiavolo with incredible spicy tomato sauce.  Overall great Italian restaurant!  I will definitely be back and recommend to others.

13.description: It's a small, cozy intimate restaurant. We just had our holiday luncheon here. They were able to accommodate 15 of us.Most of the coworkers have been here and raved about the food. If you like fish, they have a white fish that was fabulous. Half the table ordered it. I had a chicken with peppers and mushrooms. The chicken was so flavorful and juicy. The bruschetta was delicious with the chopped tomatoes, garlic and basil. They do something with the tomatoes because it's warm and juicy. I don't think you could go wrong with anything you order. I'll be back.

11.description: We ordered Bella Notte from GrubHub this evening and GrubHub delivered us the wrong order. We called the restaurant and they were incredibly helpful. They offered to refund us completely or re-send a new order (even though the fuck up wasn't on their end). We asked for a re-send and one of the restaurant employees hand delivered our food. We could tell it was prepared and sent over immediately since everything was still really hot. We enjoyed the food but the customer service was truly fantastic!

39.description: The food is good enough, but not amazing. This is a decent neighborhood place and they serve very basic Italian American fare. Based on  the high number of 4 and 5 star rating for this place on Yelp  (which really surprised me), clearly there's a big market for that here. It did strike me as very old school Chicago in that regard, so I guess that's what they're going for. However, I was very unimpressed with the service and didn't think any of the food really stood out. If you're looking for a really good Italian restaurant in Chicago, check out A Tavola or Antico, two examples of neighborhood Italian restaurants in Chicago that I enjoyed much more than Bella Notte.

37.description: I've never had a bad meal here.  No matter what I get, what time I go, who I go with, etc., it's always always good.  You know you're getting great Italian food when ever you come here.  It's nice to be able to rely on a restaurant.  I think consistency is key to success when it comes to food.  Staff is attentive, friendly, respectful, and very helpful.

0.description: This is a great neighborhood restaurant that takes you on a little tour of Italy. I have always been a huge fan of family-owned Italian restaurants. I started of with the grilled octopus appetizer, and the sauce was amazing!! Bread was warm and delicious. Martinis were on point and our server was a sweet heart!! I had the veal picante and it was very tender and the lemon-wine sauce was great too!! If you're ever in the West Town area this is a must for traditional Italian. I'm looking forward to my next visit!!

38.description: My friends and I would go to bella notte all the time and food was on point. However, last few times lacked horribly. I ordered my usual dish to go and the man who answered the phone was extremely rude. He had no customer service/ phone etiquitte whats so ever. He was acting like he was doing me a favor  by taking my order! This is not the first time hes been rude. Next the food was just awful. Took 2 forceful bites and threw it away. Food and service went down a lot. Will never return again.

51.description: Really nice atmosphere, food, and service. We'll be back.

27.description: We had our work Holiday Party at Bella Notte and it was amazing.  The manager was accommodating to meet our needs and we had a great space for the party.  The service was excellent and the food was delicious!  It's a great place to host parties or go for dinner.

32.description: Meh. I'll probably give them another chance, but I was not impressed the first time. The ravioli was generous, but I'm allergic to tomatoes, and substituting alfredo sauce didn't really come out that well. And their menu is hard to navigate for those of us with nightshade allergies. I know it's Italian, but other Italian places have more non-tomato options.The grilled calamari was quite bad. Rubbery, badly overcooked, and not fresh--fish-stinky. I ate one bite and threw the rest in the garbage.The tiramisu was a standout. Yummy, and a generous portion. I tried Bella Notte partly because I was tired of paying for Leona's shrinking tiramisu. On that front it was a good choice.Delivery was prompt and courteous, and they came to my unmarked door with no confusion, which is unusual.

54.description: This is my default Italian restaurant, and not just because it's close to my house. The food is consistently excellent, and the portions are HUGE. Most dishes come with the option of full and half orders, and I've never been able to finish a half order in one sitting. Eating in, the atmosphere is lovely, and the service is great. If you do takeout, you get a massive portion of bread and also a fruit plate with whatever you order. I've eaten here more times than I can count, and I've never been disappointed. Highly recommend.

48.description: I was here the other day and it felt like a trip down memory lane like a time when peoplehad conversations with each other instead of texting each other or bringing their laptops, i phones, smart phones, dumbphones, i pads, microwaves or whatever people are bringing these days to places where they are supposed to be eating.So ends the rant portion of the review.My friend who shall remain nameless has been going here for years and so he arranged for a group of 10 guys to go hereand eat and have a quasi replica of thanksgiving...a mini thanksgiving if you will. He bought a turkey, gave it to them, they cooked itand served it to us, charged us whatever and also allowed us to order appetizers and drinks off the menu. Oh yea and they also served stuffing and sweet potato's. It was awesome and ended up costing $35 a person with the tip which I thought was very reasonable.I liked the artwork although I felt like it deserved more lighting...Old Style Italian Restaurant with a cool vibe. You could not ask for anything more.Will I be back? heck yea

44.description: Wonderful in all aspects!We were headed to one of our favorite Italian places when we found our destination was closed. Googled other options nearby and were directed to Bella Notte; We were excited to try somewhere new but honestly a bit apprehensive because we had to drive back out of the loop. Upon arriving greeted by a great atmosphere, amazing smell emanating from  kitchen and an extremely professional and friendly host. Seated at a great table, nice amount of space and had our coats removed. Water filled immediately and drink recommendations. We didn't feel rushed but had full attention; seriously awesome service that continued throughout the entire night.Large menu, lots of options. Ordered the calamari, house wine and martini; the order was done quickly, very fresh and tasty. Calamari is some of the best we have had, not too greasy or overdone.I had the homemade cheese ravioli and my partner had the special of the day- his order was HUGE and the price was so reasonable! We were there about 2 hours talking our time eating and talking and did not feel rushed at all. Forgot the name of our server, high recommended. Both were great and we left full and with leftovers.Not to over sell this place but it is definitely our new favorite Italian place! Thank you Bella Notte we will definitely be back!

24.description: This was the absolute WORST Italian restaurant I have ever been to. My husband and I made reservations for 8:30 p.m. on Valentine's Day. We got there 10 minutes before our reservation time to find the front lobby filled with waiting customers. I thought these people did not have reservations. WRONG! The restaurant overbooked themselves, at least 3 other people came in and announced they had reservations for the same time as us. People who had 8 pm reservations were being seated at 8:30. Why over book yourselves on a holiday?? We couldn't go anywhere else since it was Valentine's Day. We were seated at 9:00 p.m. and the waiter completely ignored us and the only time he came by was to take our order and we had to flag him down to get our check so we could leave. The food was terrible!! We had the Shrimp Francaise and Green Noodles Alforno. Both were so bland, especially the green noodles.Green noodles and spinach were just boiled, thrown on a plate with some of the pasta water in the plate and that was it. I am also pretty sure "alforno" means baked, but this pasta was not baked. I took no more than one bite, I could have easily done that for myself at home. All they did was cook the food, no seasonings or anything. We will never be back here and I do not understand why anyone would even come here. If you want bland food and terrible service, come here. It was also so dark in this restaurant you couldn't see the person in front of you or read the menu.The couple behind our table took out their cellphone flashlight to read their menu which was not a bad idea. Otherwise go to Olive Garden, they have better food than this place. I use yelp all the time but never signed up. I signed up today JUST to leave this review.

7.description: This place has great food, HUGE portions and awesome staff. I would recommend to anyone looking for a great Italian feast for either dine in or take out.

49.description: Let me get out of the way before I jump right into the juicy details - the food was great. HOWEVER......HOWEVER...It doesn't matter how good your food is if you place zero emphasis on service and taking care of your customers. Let me set the stage for you: Sunday night, early dinner, upcoming Blackhawks game. Bella Notte seemed like the perfect place to grab a quick (and delicious) bite to eat and then head to the Madhouse.Our party arrives and is seated promptly. That's great. The restaurant was more or less empty but there was some commotion upstairs (which we later discovered was a private party). Drinks and appetizers are ordered and we are on our way. Our dinner rez was early (4:30 PM) because the puck drops at 6:00. We inform the waiter that we are going to the Hawks game and that we need to be fed and out of there in a reasonable amount of time.After a while, we realize that there's no food coming out of the kitchen. For anybody. And then all of a sudden, there's a rush of waiters and waitresses and staff coming from the kitchen and they scurry upstairs. We are now approaching 5:15 PM. Our group asks our waiter when we can expect the food and we are informed that it is coming out soon.But then nothing happened.Someone else came up to the table and explained that due to the party upstairs and a large amount of delivery orders they were running behind. There was no apology, no real concern - it was like they were going through the motions. Around 5:30 PM, the food arrived. We were left with realistically 15 minutes to eat as much as we could and then jet over to the United Center for the game. There's nothing quite like eating a family sized portion of piping hot pasta in 5 minutes. During this entire time, the waitstaff went about their business as if this is something that happens regularly throughout the week.And after all this, their valet charged extra for us to leave a car at the restaurant while we drove to the game. Even though the only reason why we left the car was because their staff couldn't admit that they forgot to put in our food order and continued to defend themselves (and simultaneously blame others) rather than take ownership of the situation.Bravo!PROS: Great foodCONS: Everything else

40.description: Definitely one of the best Italian restaurants I've been to, in my life. Ambiance depends on the night, mostly rustic and warm, attracting typical loud Italian families, that's kind of a treat to watch while still being able to enjoy your meal privately. The wine selections are great too. Sure have to try their white sauce pastas, extremely cheesy and wonderful. Makes you contemplative with every bite, hahaha! Surely recommend.

53.description: This is out most favorite restaurant for over a decade. It is to-go for special occasions or just family dinner.

30.description: Our family has been eating at Bella Notte for years, but have no plans to return.  Last night we ordered Veal Siciliano - 2 orders- and it was tasteless and full of fatty tissue.  2 hours later both of us are sick!  The staff is as great as ever, bread and cappucino tops, but the food has definitely slipped several notches.
