46.description: I came here with 3 other families with kids.  We had reservations and some of us were a bit late, but they didn't have an issue with it.  The servers were friendly and attentive to not only the adults, but the kids as well.  We started out with an Antipasto and a caesar salad for the table, as well as grilled seafood and fried seafood appetizer platters.   They were basically calamari, shrimp, and octopus grilled or batter fried.  I had the day's special which was a linguini in a creamy vodka sauce with 3 lobster tails.   My husband ordered the Grouper filet on a bed of spinach.  Everything was delicious.  The servings were huge and we had plenty to bring home as leftovers.  I suggest if you're not a big eater, order the half size portions.  The kids ordered basic pasta with meat sauce and raviolis.  It must have been good because they ate well.  I will definitely be back!

1.description: I booked reservations for this restaurant because the food looked delicious online and the environment seemed very inviting. Loved the food and the ambiance inside was very relaxing. However, our server made us feel as if we were the last table of the night and he couldn't wait to get off work. After being sat, we waited 20 mins for him to come by and when he did, he didn't greet us or tell us his name. He just said, "Are you ready?" I was unsure if he meant ready for drink orders or meal orders because we weren't given wine menus which surprised me because the wine selection was the reason we chose the restaurant to begin with. After giving us the wine menu we chose a wine and he seemed like was trying to be polite but when we ordered he wasn't even looking at us. He seemed very pre-occupied with something else. After receiving our food pretty quickly, he didn't come back to the table until he noticed our plates were finished. We wanted to order another bottle of wine, but when he didn't come back for a while we decided it was too late and we didn't want it anymore. The only time our server was attentive was when he came to pick up the book that I just finished signing. I'm a server myself, I understand that we came into a restaurant rather late at 8pm on a very busy restaurant holiday. However the service should not have reflected this.

55.description: This one of the few places where the wait is worth it . The place was 30 minutes late in seating our party . The food was delicious and portions generous.  This is a real winner and we will return, but space the seating s more liberally.

9.description: If you are looking for great Italian food at resonable prices you need to go to Bella Notte.A staple and one of the best in Chicago.Whether dining in or picking up Bella Notte is consistently one of the best.A small family owned beautiful, romantic restaurant where the owner (Ramon) is always there and who genuinely cares about your dining experience not like your chain want to be's.Great food, great service at great prices.Great place to go before Bulls and Hawks games as well as date night, business meetings or just for a boys night out.Well worth it......

26.description: In my opinion, this is the best Italian restaurant in Chicago. I've been coming here for years and have yet to have a disappointing experience. Last time I came here I had the Chicken Oreganato and Sausage and Peppers for an appetizer. Everything was outstanding to say the least; environment was nice and relaxing as well. I wish they had a location that was closer to me.

25.description: Fabulous wine and Dinner last Night.  Grilled octopus, chopped salad and pork chops are the best!

12.description: It was pretty meh to be quite honest. The food isn't that great. Server was ok, good was ordinary..really nothing that good. Two stars to me is reasonable considering I will not bother going there again as there are far too many better restaurants in Chicago and there's a ton I haven't even tried

59.description: I went to this restaurant with a large group of people.  When we arrived, the general manager, Ramon Aguirre, refused to seat us because our entire party had not yet arrived.  The next day I noticed an extra $400.00 charge on my card.  When I called the Ramon, he attempted to tell me it was not the restaurants fault because my group and I asked to split the bill, which is not something they normally allow.  At this point, I was very frustrated.  Since Ramon was refusing to help with the issue, I asked to speak to the owner about the issue.  Again, Ramon refused to cooperate.  Overall, I found the general manager to be extremely disrespectful.  I highly recommend not going to this restaurant due to the

21.description: We ordered through GrubHub and the order was over 40 minutes late! When the food arrived it was inedible. We couldn't even fork the noodles because they just fell apart. When we called to complain we were told they were only willing to give us "store credit" for our almost $50.00 order. We refused it because we would never want to eat there again. We were very disappointed - we should have gotten a refund just based on the order being late not even considering how awful the food was.

17.description: I have been coming here for years AND WILL NOT RETURN AGAIN. ZenaldoWas a server who treated us like patrons from "Denny's.@ He forgot to,Bring my spouse his  Cocktail, and before we knew it appetizers were being served. the serviced was rushed, sloppy and impersonal, and I found the quality of the food to,be quite deteriorated. the food was piled on the tables I,had to,return the us pulp because it was cold, the escarole salad was floating in vinegar, salty and disgusting! the waiter had no,personality andA complete lack of concern for any type of customer service.I,agree with the prior review, whereby there are MANY BETTER ItalianRestaurants in the city to choose from. I am very saddened that this placeHas slipped. Something is definitely going south with this establishment! you will be quite disappointed! I am a true foodie!

10.description: My friends and I went here while we were in town over Memorial Day Weekend.  As a native New Yorker with Italian blood, I can tell you that this place is truly magnificent.  Not only did we receive top notch service (and the treatment one gets only from dining at a small family-owned establishment), but the food was simply off the charts.  We started with martinis (which were wonderful and strong) and I had the 1/2 veal parm.  Honestly, the melted cheese on top was more difficult to cut than the meat.  The sauce was perfectly done as well.  It was sublime; I cannot say enough good things about the dish.The atmosphere itself was wonderful and reminded me of being back home at a family dinner in Brooklyn.  If you don't try this place, you're seriously missing out!

5.description: I love Bella Notte. The grilled calamari and octopus was great, as was the broccoli salad, meatballs, and my dining partner liked the veal marsala. The service is good, and Jan is the best server! The desserts are good, with a flourless chocolate cake and cheesecake being the best. Good spot for Italian style food and plenty of selection on the menu.

3.description: I have nothing but amazing and great things to say about this place. The food was excellent, fresh and plentiful!The service was extraordinary and the waiter Z was the sweetest man ever!!We happened upon this resturant after being disgusted by the service at M Vie!!I will definitely visited Bella Notte again.$300 well spent!!!Five stars!!!!

35.description: I come here about once every quarter with my former supervisor/friend and we catch up with each other at the table next to the window and in front of the bar in the corner. We sit here because we have been told this is a very important table in the restaurant's history. We typically order the 8-finger cavatelli which is very good but this week we ordered the chopped salad because we were both on a diet. I was pleasantly surprised by how big and good the salad was! Of course, coupled with a glass of red wine and their bread, I left feeling satiated and pleased. Plan to return next quarter per usual...

19.description: Nice food but terrible spot for a pre-marathon dinner. We were seated a half hour late. Food took an hr to come out. Very nerve wracking service.

28.description: If you are looking for great Italian food at resonable prices you need to go to Bella Notte.A staple and one of the best in Chicago.Whether dining in or picking up Bella Notte is consistently one of the best.A small family owned beautiful, romantic restaurant where the owner (Ramon) is always there and who genuinely cares about your dining experience not like your chain want to be's.Great food, great service at great prices.Great place to go before Bulls and Hawks games as well as date night, business meetings or just for a boys night out.Well worth it......

45.description: Expensive but the portions are epic so it's worth it. Love that they give you bread and fruit with the order. I always get their rigatoni al vodka sauce. Perfect taste and just the right amount of creaminess. I'd give it five stars but I haven't tried anything else there and while my portion was big, I still think it was over priced considering it didn't even have meat in it.

33.description: I attended a catered dinner here last night in the upstairs section, and this morning am wishing I hadn't been so polite in refusing to take leftovers. To start, baskets of a warm focaccia and loaf of Italian bread and butter were passed around, followed by a mixed greens salad topped with Italian dressing. Our starter was the sausage and peppers; I personally do not like sausage, but it smelled good, looked cooked well, and the server even made sure to pour some of white wine sauce it was all cooked in onto the plates for everyone, and the group as a whole enjoyed them very much. The sausage was followed by the Chicken Vesuvio, cooked in a white wine, garlic, and oil sauce, which was very moist and flavorful, served with peas and Vesuvio potatoes, which were warm, soft, and fluffy. The chicken and potatoes were also accompanied by the rigatoni in vodka sauce, which was my favorite, surprisingly, a very simple dish, but classic and excellent when executed well like this. The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente, and the tomato cream sauce was thick and delicious and really stuck to the noodles. This restaurant definitely is up to snuff on the pasta! Finally, the meal ended with a small dish of lemon ice, cold and creamy and citrusy, a great light ending to a very filling meal. My group had a great meal at Bella Notte, and I would definitely come back on my own to try some other things on the menu.

43.description: We came from Dallas to try this place out since it came highly recommended. Best Italian food I've ever had by far! Try the chicken Siciliana and seafood salad!!

2.description: Very impressive meal! This was my first visit and it was a tip from a regular customer who always mentions how great the food here is. It was a work lunch and they were quick, friendly and delicious! Very accommodating. Sometimes it's good to go to places that aren't the newest or the trendiest and instead you get classic, home style service and food. We tried the shells and broccoli, cheese ravioli, the house salad, a chicken dish and calamari. All was spot on, flavorful Italian fare, better than most Italian places I've been to. I'm not normally a pasta lover either, and here I truly enjoyed it. The prices are so reasonable and the food so plentiful that you have leftovers to spare. I would drive out of my way to come back for this food. You should, too. Salute.

18.description: THIS PLACE IS GREAT! We came in after 7:00 on a Friday night with a party of eight. We were celebrating a good friend's birthday and had been turned away from another place (even though we had a reservation). We were welcomed with a smile and they accommodated us within 20 minutes! Our server, Z, was a DOLL! He made sure we had everything we needed and the food was FABULOUS!! They even put the candles on the birthday cake and helped us sing to our friend. And we were shocked at how affordable everything was! LOVE THIS PLACE!!

41.description: We very much enjoyed our meal and experience at Bella Notte. Its have a very cute rustic, clean Italian decor. Our server was very friendly and helpful with great recommendations. I ordered the 8 Finger Cavatelli with Rapini while my friends also ordered the Veal Marsala and  Ravioli. All of us loved our meals. I loved the rapini on top of my pasta. I am still dreaming of it. It was that good. Full of garlic and white wine pungency that was a palette pleasing star. It was also well priced for portion sized... we all had plenty for lunch the next day.

52.description: I like the food at Bella Notte. Some of my favorite things there are the appetizers, pasta dishes and meat dishes. It's a good restaurant to go to for lunch or dinner.

50.description: Took a few ladies out last minute on a cold and rainy Friday night. One was not doing the gluten thing and the other anti-carb so we never got to try the pastas.  I kind of knew what I was dealing with so my strategy was to go small-plate by ordering a variety of appetizers and sides. They have a decent selection of classic southern Italian fare and shell fish pastas, good side dishes and a very nice selection of classic soups.  Lots of regulars of multiple generations who look like they have been going there for years. I felt like like the owners have gone to great lengths to carry on family recipes and traditions and take pride in welcoming guests to share those traditions. It seemed like there were two brothers who took making sure you were taken care of right very seriously.  We got there at 8:30 pm Friday and the place was packed. We ate upstairs, quite a hike.  It had less of a buzz than downstairs, but was still full, had a comfortable buzz yet we could still hear each other talk.  (well I could hear them talk since I couldn't get a word in once the two of them started yapping :-D)Anyway, they nailed it.  The Octopus...WHOA, top 5 I've ever eaten.  Nuff said!  It was delicious, char grilled, cut like butter and had just the right balance of texture and chew. Rapini, fresh, perfect. Mushrooms, roasted peppers, ditto, ditto.  Even my carb and gluten resistant ladies broke down when it came to dunking up the delicious shrimp scampi sauce with hot, nicely crusted bread.  And how did it work out with the ladies you may ask...well...I am a gentleman..;-D!

4.description: This is the perfect restaurant for a pre-game meal for events at the United Center. They get you in and out. The service and Italian food can't be beat. We ordered the chopped salad, house Chianti, grilled calamari appetizer, veal  parmesan and were absolutely thrilled with our menu choices. The wait staff is fast, efficient and very helpful in menu selections. We were quite pleased with our dining experience!

6.description: We ordered delivery from here a few nights ago. The food was pretty great- I imagine if we had eaten in, the pasta may have been more al dente and I would happily give them five stars. We ordered a half order of  fettuccine alfredo with a side of chicken, a half order of the farfalle with sausage and onions and peppers, and a whole order of the zuppa di pesce. Initially, I was a bit upset with the total of around  $70 with delivery charge and tax... then the food came (a half hour earlier than Grubhub estimated). The half orders were easily enough for three meals each, and the full order, I kid you not, arrived in a quarter sheet pan filed to the brim with fresh seafood and (albeit slightly overcooked) pasta. Considering this was delivery, as I said, I expect their dine-in meals to be even better. Definitely our new go-to Italian delivery spot.

22.description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago! My husband and I both have our favorite dishes but nothing is ever bad. We love to start with the fish salad or the sausage and peppers! The fish salad is amazing! Always fresh. As for pasta our favorite is the fusilli arrabiata! They also have a wonderful vodka sauce! They are very accommodating if you want to change something they are always willing to see if they can! It's a neighborhood gem.

15.description: Meh. I'll probably give them another chance, but I was not impressed the first time. The ravioli was generous, but I'm allergic to tomatoes, and substituting alfredo sauce didn't really come out that well. And their menu is hard to navigate for those of us with nightshade allergies. I know it's Italian, but other Italian places have more non-tomato options.The grilled calamari was quite bad. Rubbery, badly overcooked, and not fresh--fish-stinky. I ate one bite and threw the rest in the garbage.The tiramisu was a standout. Yummy, and a generous portion. I tried Bella Notte partly because I was tired of paying for Leona's shrinking tiramisu. On that front it was a good choice.Delivery was prompt and courteous, and they came to my unmarked door with no confusion, which is unusual.

57.description: Great restaurant to use when going to Artistic Home Productions right next door.  Real Italian feel with some nice selections.  Portions are big, so the half orders will do most people just fine.  Might be a little pricey form some people, but you can work around that with appetizers or half orders.

20.description: AMAZING take out and delivery. They give you so much food!! Have eaten in a couple times and it is always good, high quality, consistent food. Highly recommended.

36.description: Nice food but terrible spot for a pre-marathon dinner. We were seated a half hour late. Food took an hr to come out. Very nerve wracking service.

14.description: Have never been here, but ordered from Postmates for delivery and the food was delicious, and a TON of food at that. The Chicken Marsala was absolutely fantastic and will be ordering again soon.

28.description: So excited that they're finally open even though it's currently just carryout and delivery. The food was all really good. I look forward to the dining room opening so I can eat everything fresh!Omg peanut sauce lover. Soooo delicious! I know it's listed under hot and spicy but I could request mild on their online ordering and it was super delicious. I do want to try it again as medium next time because I'm sure it's also super delicious.I also really like the moo ping appetizer! Can't wait to try more!

1.description: We are in delivery range for this new location of Opart. I've never been here but have ordered delivery about half a dozen times.I love the green curry, pad see ewe, Penang curry, all with chicken. I didn't love the curry with shrimp so I'll stick to chicken. They also have brown rice ... Yay!Wish they delivered via eat24 or grubhub. They use some random special website.Best Thai so far in Chicago. With a few locations it's easily accessible in different parts of the city so that's nice! Will continue to be my Thai delivery go-to.

9.description: We'd been keeping our eyes on Opart, waiting for any indication of its grand opening. Then one day there it was, a sign saying they were serving takeout and delivery! Approx two days later we picked up our first order and it was delicious. Maybe I should also mention Opart Thai holds a special place in my heart bc it was one of my first dates (north side location) with my now husband. We are excited to have Opart in the hood and it'll make a great addition to Chicago Ave. Will definitely be back!

23.description: Quality, prices, atmosphere, and service all get 5 stars. The restaurant has an upscale feeling with a dimmed light ambiance. Prices for dishes are just below $10, and they are delicious and made with good quality ingredients. Sometimes I feel like Thai dishes lack veggies or use veggies of poor quality, and that was not the case with Opart Thai. The spicy grading scale is true to the claim. Normal spiciness is a 3, I ordered a 4 and it was a little too much for me. Usually I order a little higher because the kitchen under spices the hotness, but you don't need to do that here.The waitress was wonderful. Very friendly, helpful, and knew the menu well. It was truly a wonderful experience. I will certainly be coming back.

5.description: Finally a Thai restaurant in my neighborhood that is great!I grew up in a town with a large percentage of Thai people and multiple very good Thai restaurants.  They were flavorful and would make your food to a spice level of your liking.  When I moved here 3 years ago, I thought it would be easy to locate my new go to for Thai in such a large city.  Well I hadn't had much luck, and almost given up on Thai food in Chicago ever replicating my hometown.  Then I found Opart!The first thing, I noticed about Opart was they had 5 spice levels.  A staple in my hometown restaurants that I'd found in very few restaurants up here. Spicy is very important too me and the other Thai spots in the city just couldn't satisfy me there.  Then I noticed multiple authentic Thai dishes on the menu, which some others and the fusion Asian places lack. I ordered the  Pad Chou-Chi, which was spectacular. The Shrimp Spring rolls were great as well.  The service was quick and great, so I knew I'd be returning.  It was in running to be my new Thai place, although I knew I couldn't leave this review after 1 meal.The next time I had it, I got delivery and ordered the chicken pad thai.  I've had a lot of pad thai in my life and it was good not great.  Still better than most I've had around the city, and it possibly would have been even better if it wasn't delivery. Something about eating at the restaurant makes the food taste better I think!I went back to the restaurant this week and ordered the Tiger Cry and Chicken Pad Prik King both as spicy as you can get.  My head was sweating and went through multiple glasses of water!  I was blown away by the flavor and taste again!  Both were every bit as good as what I used to get back home.The consistent quality of the dishes and spiciness of Opart's dishes set it apart from the rest.  I will continue trying their new dishes, and they've picked up a weekly customer.

25.description: Ordered in from here and the food was amazing!!! Best pad see iwe I've had yet. Wish they'd have hot sauce like noodles in the pot but I was impressed without it. Highly recommend the food here!!

12.description: Consistent, fresh and authentic.  It's clean and has a good atmosphere.  The prices are reasonable and the service is good.  The best Thai food around and they have a good delivery service.

21.description: So excited to have a location nearby! We ordered delivery last night; they arrived exactly when they said they would. We had the peanut sauce lover, pork fried rice, and kuay tiew kee mao. While everything was good, the peanut sauce lover was amazing. Highly recommend!

16.description: I've been here a few times and found that their food is not consistent.  I always order green curry tofu, but have had different versions each time.  We did really enjoy the pad thai but still needed more flavor.  The panang curry was good though, as well as the garlic fried rice.

17.description: They've been open for a week so I cut them some slack on not having any alcohol available yet. I ordered the jasmine tea and it was great. The mugs are thick and heavy. I ordered the sweet and sour chicken and it came with white rice. It was very flavorful and it was the right portion size for one and at the best price. The waiters were attentive and kind. In total my bill was like $11 ! They have a good size selection on desserts which I will have to come back and check out because I'm so stuffed right now seriously. Lol

10.description: Was hoping to get the first review!  So far I have ordered three times for take out and have, obviously, been very pleased.  I have yet to experience table service so can't review service itself.Only minor complaint is I asked for a mild papaya salad and got 3 alarm fire version. Must have been a mix up. Couldn't eat the salad but all else was really excellent.

11.description: What a disappointment two times in a row.  I live not too far away and was hoping for a good staple Thai restaurant in the neighborhood, but this is a flop.  I ordered from here last weekend and they screwed up my take-out order. I figured it was a one-time thing, so I gave them another chance this weekend and once again they got it wrong.  I could almost live with that, except when we call them to tell them the guy on the phone was not even apologetic, instead he told me that he had a full restaurant....so what?  Why should that be your excuse?Then he did not even prioritize fixing our order, he told us he had many orders ahead of us. The food was decent, but nothing amazing.....there are better Thai options where they know how to run a restaurant.

26.description: Was hoping to get the first review!  So far I have ordered three times for take out and have, obviously, been very pleased.  I have yet to experience table service so can't review service itself.Only minor complaint is I asked for a mild papaya salad and got 3 alarm fire version. Must have been a mix up. Couldn't eat the salad but all else was really excellent.

27.description: They've been open for a week so I cut them some slack on not having any alcohol available yet. I ordered the jasmine tea and it was great. The mugs are thick and heavy. I ordered the sweet and sour chicken and it came with white rice. It was very flavorful and it was the right portion size for one and at the best price. The waiters were attentive and kind. In total my bill was like $11 ! They have a good size selection on desserts which I will have to come back and check out because I'm so stuffed right now seriously. Lol

0.description: We were excited to see that an already established Thai place was taking over Bow & Stern. The neighborhood could use it! I am not familiar with the other Opart Thai locations but they have great reviews and a solid reputation. This location is no exception. We haven't eaten in the restaurant yet. We're wondering if they're still remodeling as it looks sort of sparse. However, we have used them for pick-up. I'm embarrassed to say many times in the last few weeks. We can't stop!So far the only ding is on the first order my boyfriend tried something that ended up being too spicy to eat. I believe you can pick the spice level and their mild is his 5 alarm fire.I'm a whimp when it comes to heat so I haven't ventured far from their standard noodle dishes with tofu. All have been so flavorful! We also enjoy the spring rolls with peanut sauce, and, of course, the crab rangoons.I don't know if we'll ever eat in the restaurant, but for now this is our go-to Thai take-out place.

20.description: We'd been keeping our eyes on Opart, waiting for any indication of its grand opening. Then one day there it was, a sign saying they were serving takeout and delivery! Approx two days later we picked up our first order and it was delicious. Maybe I should also mention Opart Thai holds a special place in my heart bc it was one of my first dates (north side location) with my now husband. We are excited to have Opart in the hood and it'll make a great addition to Chicago Ave. Will definitely be back!

19.description: I moved to Ukrainian Village three years ago from Lincoln Park and was disappointed with the Thai food in the new neighborhood then along came Opart Thai my old friend from Lincoln Square. I got delivery tonight and yes the food could have been warmer but damn was it good. I ordered the peanut lovers sauce which is just like I remember and my boyfriend had the Tiger Cry. Thank you Opart Thai for coming to Ukrainian Village. There will be many orders in my future.

2.description: After all the excitement about htis place opening I wanted to give it a try and compared to others I have to give this a ......eh meh.  Wasn't impressed.  I ordered the Panang Curry and Tiger Cry based on other recommendations in the reviews.  I'm not sure what the fuss about the Tiger Cry is all about it was on the dry/burnt end. And the homemade sauce seems to be just soy sauce.  The curry was a small portion of curry sauce and tender chicken with a few slivers of green peppers no other veggies very disappointed there were not other vegetables included.  From other reviews it sounded like Opart was big on fresh vegetables.....??? The flavor/spiciness was good. 5 stars for the quick delivery though!

18.description: I am so exited that they opened a location in my neighborhood.  My friend's mom is from Thailand and she has always said that Opart Thai was the best Thai food she's had in the U.S.  I've only tried the Thai red curry so far, but I must say that other than the super high end Arun's it's definitely the best Thai food I've had outside of Thailand - and we have some other very good Thai restaurants in our neighborhood too.  They also asked me my heat profile (it turned out to be a little hotter than the hot, but not the "crazy hot") and they completely nailed it.  I did carry out as they are not "fully open" yet. They have carry out and delivery right now, and it sounds like you can come and do BYOB until their official opening and liquor license.  The restaurant itself has a very nice atmosphere and they did a good job remodeling it. This is a great addition to the neighborhood!

13.description: I blame myself. Maybe my order was not setting this meal up for success. That said if you have "thai" in the name you should be able to make pad thai. Also, I got delivery. Always dicey I should have gone in for my first meal. The dish was so dry I literally used a butter knife to cut the noodles out of the dish. Flavor was apparently extra. And they didn't offer anything spicy on the side to deal with it ... found some chili spice to wake it up but not my 1st choice. The chicken was bountiful ... but still dry chicken + dry noodles. I did however like the crab rangoon though that is not a dish I would return to get just a naughty treat to hit my delivery minimum.  I'm deeply annoyed.

4.description: So excited that they're finally open even though it's currently just carryout and delivery. The food was all really good. I look forward to the dining room opening so I can eat everything fresh!Omg peanut sauce lover. Soooo delicious! I know it's listed under hot and spicy but I could request mild on their online ordering and it was super delicious. I do want to try it again as medium next time because I'm sure it's also super delicious.I also really like the moo ping appetizer! Can't wait to try more!

24.description: Best Thai food I've had in Chicago.  That Tiger Cry left me crying for joy. They have carry out and delivery, but their dining room is now open too.

6.description: Terrible. SLOW DELIVERY WITH INCORRECT ORDERS. Please do not order from here. We ordered 4 dishes on a Sunday night and had to wait an hour and a half for the food to arrive and once it did, what we received was completely incorrect. They left out dishes and charged us fully. We called to complain and Carl from the restaurant was very unhelpful. I understand this is a newer branch of the original location but they should get their delivery services in order. The food that did arrive was bland and tasteless. I will be sticking with butterfly sushi down the road.

22.description: I moved to Ukrainian Village three years ago from Lincoln Park and was disappointed with the Thai food in the new neighborhood then along came Opart Thai my old friend from Lincoln Square. I got delivery tonight and yes the food could have been warmer but damn was it good. I ordered the peanut lovers sauce which is just like I remember and my boyfriend had the Tiger Cry. Thank you Opart Thai for coming to Ukrainian Village. There will be many orders in my future.

15.description: Great service, delicious food!! Crab rangoons are on point. Perfect location in the neighborhood - it was much needed.

7.description: Best Thai food in the city.  Tiger cry being my fave.  It's better than Kbbq.  For being such a nice restaurant the prices are more than reasonable.  Most of all the dishes are under $10.  Everything is cooked fresh and it tastes and shows.   I'll be going back for sure.

8.description: Quality, prices, atmosphere, and service all get 5 stars. The restaurant has an upscale feeling with a dimmed light ambiance. Prices for dishes are just below $10, and they are delicious and made with good quality ingredients. Sometimes I feel like Thai dishes lack veggies or use veggies of poor quality, and that was not the case with Opart Thai. The spicy grading scale is true to the claim. Normal spiciness is a 3, I ordered a 4 and it was a little too much for me. Usually I order a little higher because the kitchen under spices the hotness, but you don't need to do that here.The waitress was wonderful. Very friendly, helpful, and knew the menu well. It was truly a wonderful experience. I will certainly be coming back.

3.description: The flavors were all there but the presentation was lacking. I ordered the duck curry but it wasn't presented in a very appealing way and there wasn't much to the dish - a few slices of duck sitting in coconut milk curry. My friend got a seafood dish - some sort of shrimp stir fry but it also didn't look too tasty and the flavors were just okay.

14.description: Best Thai food I've had in Chicago.  That Tiger Cry left me crying for joy. They have carry out and delivery, but their dining room is now open too.

58.description: I tried Kin for the first time last night and I was extremely disappointed with the food and service. I came in to pick up a to-go order and not only did the hostess forget to give us our food when it was ready but the hot dishes were cold and the meat (Steak Teriyaki and BBQ Pork) was terrible and in sort supply. After the meal my friend and I were still hungry. That's a terrible feeling after spending over $30 on the order and knowing that Wendys is right across the street. All in all, I'm never going back and I highly DO NOT recommend Kin.

56.description: This place has become a regular spot, the Thai food is always fresh and delicious. I love that it's BYOB too. The servers are always very nice.

29.description: Order was a half hour late via Grub Hug. No communication or update from the restaurant. Food was still warm, but the noodles were WAY overdone. Buyer beware. Never ordering from them again.

42.description: I would have given it a five start if were not crammed on a smaller table.

23.description: I bought a groupon for this place, using the groupon booking situation, and after having my groupon reservation declined 6 times, I finally called to make a reservation and indicated that I wanted to use the groupon. This was still a problem once I got the the restaurant and provided lots of confusion with the server who didn't speak very good english, but it somehow worked out and the deal went through. This is more a groupon issue than a restaurant issue, but both need to work together to be able to honor the deals smoothly after offering them.The service otherwise was ok, though the server rarely checked on us and we had to flag her down to both order and get our check. I like being left alone to chat with my dinner partner, but we would have liked to have the fish in front of us wrapped up and out of the way at some point.The food was good though, and pretty much made up for all the other issues. The roll selection is a little lacking, not for variety of rolls, but for variety in the rolls- they all kind of have the same ingredients with only slight modifications here and there. We had the crab rangoon, which looks like a deep fried dumpling here, and tried three rolls: the Crispy Kin, which was enormous, and my favorite, the Number 10, which was a little too fishy for me in terms of texture, but had a nice flavor, and the Sexy Summer, which was a little too sweet for my taste and I chewed more on shrimp than shrimp tempura. I definitely enjoyed the crab rangoon and the crispy kin the best. I probably won't be back though with other sushi places located closer to me, and with better roll variety and service.

47.description: Great local spot for me. I'm a huge fan of red curry, but this place hooked me with their Pad Se Ew (or however you spell it). Their curries are thicker than most of the curries I've tried. The red curry has a higher cinnamon content. What I liked even more than their Thai food, was the sushi. Again, I state, I am not a huge sushi fan, so if I say it's good, it's good. My favorites so far are the California, Crispy Kin, and Rock & Roll. The only thing I will say is that their sushi items can get a little repetitive. The restaurant itself is pretty small, but I have never seen a wait. I only said it was not good for groups or children, because I can see a group of 10 people going there and the staff having to section off have the dining room. Also if kids are not well behaved they will be heard at every table and have no place to run but into others. Enjoy!

8.description: This place is probably one of our favorite take-out "Asian" places...it's more than the self-proclaimed sushi and thai...they have an amazing selection of stir-fry's, appetizers (some dim sum-esque), salads, and noodles in addition to sushi and thai.  The prices are extremely reasonable and everything we've had has been well-executed.  If you are feeling like dining out instead of staying in, the BYOB option is well worth taking advantage of.Great selection, great food, great location...and the ambiance isn't too bad either.  Definitely a go to for us!

31.description: Service was deplorable.  Customer service and small talk were two languages hardly spoken.  Who was our waiter? (to be PC and linguistic correct, men and women are waiters).  I've been to tons of Asian restaurants where service blows (where their primary source of business is Asian consumers that deal with bad service) but when your a restaurant trying to compete in a more... what's the word American area, come'on! give us some good service, locally source your service and hire all kinds of people.  If not, then invest in your business by training your waiters.  Companies send their salespeople to sales training.  Waiters can be sent to hospitality training.When you think about what it takes to make a great evening or a great dinner there are some factors to think about.  We as consumers have to earn a living and we hope to spend that hard earned money somewhere that appreciates our business..yes?I appreciate stellar wait service, I appreciate a wait staff member that can talk to me, socialize a bit, suggest entrees or in this case sushi, a waiter that foresees what I ( the diner) may need, suggest a drink refill, try to see my dining experience and help it get to great.All of which didn't happen for us.  We didn't make any connection with our waiter.  She was cold, forgetful and hardly spoke a word.  Some of the time, I could swear she was talking about us with her co-worker.  Condiments, plates, extra plates which would seem an obvious suggestion for the table weren't thought of or rather took great pains to enlist her service of.Sushi was a-okay.  There were a few plates that garnered the "oh boy" smile and others that were nice.  Some of the appetizers were stellar, specifically Takoyaki.  (See Instragram photos to see best of, dishes, sushi and entrees.)  Crab Rangoon = decent, but there wasn't any signature to their place that you could remember them by.The lack of service, suggestion and ability by waitstaff killed our hopes for a great Saturday night.  Can you believe no one suggested dessert! The only time I saw a glimmer was when they announced the kitchen closing!  WTF! Six dined and our table cost was roughly $30 per person including tip which they robo charged.  I would have felt better giving 10%.  Last thing, it was the end of the night and very very cold outside.  We left the ladies behind to go grab the car, can you believe they asked them to leave!  The obvious response to that is to say "what a fucking place!"  Or rather, drop the g and add an apostrophe three letters from the right.  I'm sure you get my meaning.

34.description: Delicious sushi! Double nigiri, where most only give you one piece... They give you 2! Great service, atmosphere, and yummy food! Never tried the Thai, no need, the sushi is so great!

16.description: My first visit to Kin was to celebrate a birthday for a very special friend.  The space is really small but intimate, making it a great date night spot or  even for ladies night, as it was in our case.  Kin is BYOB, which greatly cuts down the cost of a meal.  I had arrived much earlier than my party and the server was nice enough to make me comfortable at the bar and repeatedly came around to fill my glass of water.  I truly appreciated their hospitality.We ordered:edamamecrab rangoon - more cream cheese and wanton than any crab, and the filling a little on the stingy side.ROLLS:White Christmas : Tuna, avocado, mango, topped with super white tuna, jalapeno, drops of spicy sauce.  I loved this roll.  It was fresh, and delicious.Crispy Kin: Spicy shrimp, avocado, cucumber, unagi, jalapeno, mixed greens, tempura crunch, unagi sauce, wasabi mayo. I liked  this roll a lot.  The crunch was a nice contrast in texture.Sexy Summer: Shrimp tempura, kanikama, sweet mayo, avocado, topped with fresh salmon, mango, and ginger sauce.   I thought this one was also good.  Typically, I don't like salmon since it can be on the fishy side unless it is uber fresh, I went out on a limb and tried this roll, and was not disappointed. Milwaukee: shrimp tempura, avocado, lettuce, topped with seared tuna, ginger, ponzu sauce.  I really like this roll.  the seared tuna was delicious!Spicy Tuna: tuna, avocado, masago, chili oil & spicy sauce.  I think this was the only roll that left me wanting for more.  The pieces were on the small size and there was absolutely no heat in the roll. Don't call it spicy tuna unless it's spicy!There is some street parking on Milwaukee, but it's hard to come by because most of the side streets are zoned.  Therefore, be prepared to drive around for a bit looking for parking and once you find it, be prepared to walk.All in all, I had a great time at Kin, which also turned out to be a very affordable night out.  We split the bill 5 ways and it was just shy of $25 a person.  Not bad! I will probably go back to make sure that I loved the rolls because they were so delicious and not because I was enjoying the company of the friends I was with so much.

13.description: My bf i ordered pork chashu ramen and pork bbq. EVERYTHING was overcooked and bland. The ramen is supposed to have half cooked egg, with the yolk little bit runny. The egg was fully cooked as it is, noodles were overcooked, and the pork bbq was too dry. Service was alright, but food was pretty bad. I will not be coming back.

11.description: We ordered spicy tuna and eel sushi and both were amazing! Miso soup was a great treat for such a chilly evening. Chicken Pad Thai was our choice for an entrée and that was so delicious. We brought a 6 pack of beer and had a very nice experience. I would highly recommend this place!

39.description: This is my favorite restaurant in wicker park! I love the pineapple fried rice and the sushi is always superb. The Thai Ice tea and coffee are a must try. Also, the crunchy salmon is great for starters. They always play good music and it never seems to be too crowded. I'm so lucky to have kin close by. The presentation of the food is very well done. I personally like the pad thai and don't understand why others didn't.

37.description: Good, quick, reasonably priced, and a cool ambience. Very nice. I haven't utilized BYOB yet, but they allow it. So that's pretty sweet too. Second best Pad Thai to Star of Siam, and I eat a lot of Pad Thai.

0.description: I came here because  of the Groupon  and I have to say it was  a great experience. My partner doesn't like sushi so it is hard to find a place where we are both happy with the meal. Normally I stay away from mixed menus that have sushi as I expect one of the types of food to be less than ideal. But my partner loved his Goyozas as they were golden and perfectly fried and his basil noodles were full of yummy basil flavor and thick noodles.I got the rocky road and the ten rolls. The ten had two types of fresh fish that was a good serving size and then other flavors that made my mouth sing.  The rocky road had crab inside and eel on top. Both rolls were different  from each other and I enjoyed the variety. And they were big!!! I hate leaving sushi places hungry. But just two rolls filled me up! So I left very happy

38.description: SO GOOD, SO YUMMY, SO AMAZING, CONSISTANTLY!!!!!!This is our favorite place to go with friends. I was introduced about 2 years ago when my boyfriend and I started dating. We have gone back at least 20 times sine then and ordered take out another 10! BYOB awesomeness, great service and great sushi at a very reasonable price!

51.description: Kin has that special blend of quality food, service and fair pricing that will keep you coming back. To begin with this place is special to me because they have the best pad see u I have ever tasted for only 7.95. The dish comes out quickly and is always served hot with a nice peppery taste.No I don't eat sushi because I'm strange. But my dinner guest rave about their sushi and how you don't even need soy sauce because the flavors are so well pronounced. I have enjoyed many a dinner sitting at their small sushi bar watching the chef roll my boyfriend's food dreams into rice. This place is BYOB but more importantly it is BYOB done right. The open your drinks throw away empty bottles, bring you frosted glasses and understand that you are staying until the 6 pack is gone.Just writing this has made me hungry.

27.description: Best BYOB sushi place in town!

32.description: Our waitress admitted that she was "new". Still however, our service was horrendous. I guess it is kind of cliché too to point out that service was bad at an Asian restaurant but seriously this was really bad.The people sitting next to us got all of their food at once. I think they then understood what the service was about because they quickly asked for their bill. We prior to see this however. We ordered miso, edamame, a cucumber salad, and some rolls. I got my miso in like 2 minutes, then we proceeded to wait about 20 minutes before getting the edamame, another 5 for the salad, then about 20 more for the rolls.The rolls were pretty much substandard for rolls, the price was actually pretty good and it is BYOB so that is a plus. However, I seriously doubt we will go back or even suggest this place to anyone else.

54.description: We came here for my birthday. It was a Saturday evening and we were surprised that it's not crowded. I had a group of 14-15 people and they were able to accomodate all of us for a sushi restaurant.All the sushi rolls we ordered tasted yummy! The sushi pieces were good, too. This place is BYOB, so perfect for those who want to bring in their own booze to dine with. I had a good time here..Good food, good company. Location is pretty good, too. Since it doesn't seem to be much of a popular area, we all got parking very close to the restaurant. Our parking was right in front! It is a small, cute sushi place and I would definitely give it a try if I were in town.

48.description: I am Thai and may be a bit more particular on how Thai food should be prepared, but this is the worst Thai food I have had in all of Chicago. Their beef salad (Nam Tok) was greasy, bland and boring, chicken larb was dry, one dimensional with no texture, green chicken curry was oily and sweet. Thai food is supposed be made with FRESH ingredients and to have complexity of flavors -savory of fish sauce, acidity of "fresh lime" balanced wIith heat of Thai chili (not red pepper flakes you out on pizza) -aromatics and textures. Salads (no onions, cilantro, mint, lettuce) served with no greens, curries served with minimal veggies (bamboo, green beans) and all of it did not taste fresh.

44.description: BYOB! Excellent, friendly, service and a cute spot for a date, group hangout, or just solo (I would do it!) Came in on a Friday night before heading to Bedford. We had reservations here for 8 girls to celebrate a birthday and we all brought a glass of wine. We ordered lots of sushi and all of them were delicious. We had attentive service the entire time and the restaurant was pretty busy. Lots of people were here for an hour dinner and left. It seemed like a great quick dinner and chat spot. What surprised us was our bill around 15 dollars per person. Will definately go back again!

24.description: I come here after I get my nails done down the street. Their lunch is fast and affordable. The food is never disappointing. I would highly recommend this to any of my friends. The last time I was here I left my wallet behind (oops!) and the hostess called me to let me know, going above and beyond. This is a great spot.

7.description: Food wasn't bad. Wasn't amazing. I was hungry and ordered delivery. I was satisfied. I'm a starving college student. I got some miso soup, gyoza, egg rolls, and ramen. I ain't complaining. You get what you expect. You want gourmet, go somewhere else.

49.description: I've lived just around the corner from Kin for about two years, but have only recently discovered how tasty - and affordable - this restaurant is. I've definitely been missing out on some great food that's served with an upscale presentation that's sure to impress a date. And the restaurant is beautifully decorated with a modern design.I am now a regular customer.Highly recommended.

40.description: We came on the Jan 1, 2013 around 2pm before my flight back home. My cousin, who is from the south side, has his usual location but they were closed due to the Holiday. So I looked on Yelp for a location on the way to O'hare, and came across this joint while on the freeway. I was a little hesitant of Chicago's sushi being that I'm from America's land of Sushi - SF Bay area. Standards are HIGH. Its on N Milwaukee, the street is packed and its in a busy area, which makes me like it already. When you walk in, the first thing you notice is the high ceiling and the decor. The walls had an Asian theme with dragons, lions, dangling lights, and walls with gold mirrors. Not a big place, but def a little trendy one. We get to the front, greeted by a hot Asian chick and she asked, "Do you have a reservation?" All 3 of us looked around, realized that were we the only ones there. We LAUGHED so hard one of us even snorted! LOL! Kudos for her - big points for the personality!! We then proceeded to the Sushi Bar area. Anyways, the sushi was actually pretty damn great. I was impressed with their specialty rolls. I had the new Tokyo: asparagus tempura, mango, cream cheese, topped with seard smoke salmon, honey mayo. That mango in the sushi really set it off. And who knew cream cheese went well with it? The moment I saw both the ingredients, I had to get it! And the other one that caught my eye was the Rock and Roll: salmon, unagi, crab mix, cucumber, avocado, cream cheese,lightly batterd fried. It was an excellent choice. All in all, the food was good, the prices were reasonable, and because everyone was at home hung over from NYE, we got seated ASAP.

53.description: Reasonably priced sushi and salads, that were all really good.  There wasn't much ambiance in there and both of the waitresses I spoke to didn't really speak english well and couldn't understand my questions, so i give it a 4 star

30.description: A-OK indeed! I wouldn't say this is my favorite sit-down Thai restaurant, BUT it is an excellent choice for taking Thai or Sushi to go. After having a terrible, failed delivery and customer service experience with China Court, I was left with pangs of resentment and a longing for some kind of Asian food the next day. Ordered my food online, specified a pick-up time, and WHAM BAM BOOM! I had my Egg Rolls and Pad Kee Mao right on time, good to go home with me. Kin was prompt, the woman ringing up my order was friendly, and my Asian food craving was satisfied. What more could I ask for on a below 0 degree day in Chicago? The egg rolls hit the spot and the pad kee mao was exactly what I was hoping for. My only gripes were the price---it was $5 for 3 egg rolls which is steeper than usual for Asian take-out, and my overall order was about $15. Also, the size of my pad kee mao serving was smaller than I expected for $8. However, it was good for portion control! All in all, I recommend this place for reliable take-out. Cheers!

46.description: I met a friend for dinner upon her recommendation for great food and BYOB. I had seen Kin multiple times from driving past it, and I was very excited to try it! The restaurant itself  is very modern, sleek, and on the less traveled part of Milwaukee Ave in Noble Square. The service was fantastic. Right when we walked in and placed our bottle of wine on the table, the waitress immediately chilled it without asking any questions, and provided glasses. Great service! Although, it was surprisingly slow for a Thursday evening. I did see quite a number of takeout orders though. The food itself was great. They serve both Thai and sushi, and tonight we decided on sushi. We got three rolls - Crunchy Spicy Tuna, Dragon Roll, & New Tokyo. AMAZING. The New Tokyo was my favorite by far. The rolls were so big that we couldn't finish them all, and got to take some back for leftovers. I will certainly be coming back for BYOB or ordering some great takeout in the very near future!

1.description: I don't know why anyone would order thai food here when their SUSHI is the way to go. We were invited to this restaurant by one of my fiance's co-residents for his birthday. Their sushi was surprisingly really good! We usually never get full when we go out to eat sushi, but their sushi rolls are BIG. Also, they don't skimp out on the fish portions in their sushi. I highly recommend the Number Ten Roll, Emerald Dragon Roll, Kin Maki, and Q salmon Roll. You won't regret it! Order a side of seaweed salad. SKIP the cucumber salad.  Don't forget to BYOB - there's no corking fee. There's a liquor store 2-3 stores down. The service is subpar, but their food comes out fast. If you're in the area, Kin is perfect for a date night.

55.description: We came for sushi, and maybe should have had Thai.  We also should have brought wine, it's a BYOB!  Oops.The edamame to start was excellent.  It was warm, perfectly salted, and really hit the spot.  The sushi selection was good.  We had a few different rolls to try including the Aloha, Spicy Scallop, Dynamite, and Tang-Kwa Maki.  None of the rolls were bad...but none of them really wow-ed us either.  The bill for all of it was just about $30.  Compared to other sushi places in the city that seemed like chump change.Next time, I may try Thai food.  The location and pricing (SO reasonable!) of this place makes it hard to give up on.

9.description: We ordered delivery from this restaurant on  Sunday evening. The MAIN reason for my 3 stars versus 4 is that they ignored my "special instruction" in the "special instruction" portion of the online order form. And so I wonder, what's the point of giving customers an opportunity to add a "special instruction" if you are gonna ignore it anyway?So- I ordered 2 sushi rolls- The Summer roll and the Sexy Summer roll- apparently I'm over winter and channelling the warm summer weather!  ANYWAY, in my "special instructions" I wrote that I DO NOT want the seaweed on the outside of my rolls and to make sure the outside layer of each roll is rice. Of COURSE one of my rolls had the stupid gross tasteless sticky seaweed as the outer most layer. I mean, it wasn't a tricky request- every other sushi restaurant manages to get it right. Some even call it "inside out." So I was dismayed.  The rolls themselves were good and I'd like to actually dine at the restaurant itself at some point to experience the ambiance and perhaps more rolls (with rice on the outside!)My hubs got Chicken Green Curry and Shrimp Tom Yum Soup. He really liked everything he ordered. I do believe we would dine with them in the future- but next time I'd like to dine in!

26.description: My first visit to Kin was to celebrate a birthday for a very special friend.  The space is really small but intimate, making it a great date night spot or  even for ladies night, as it was in our case.  Kin is BYOB, which greatly cuts down the cost of a meal.  I had arrived much earlier than my party and the server was nice enough to make me comfortable at the bar and repeatedly came around to fill my glass of water.  I truly appreciated their hospitality.We ordered:edamamecrab rangoon - more cream cheese and wanton than any crab, and the filling a little on the stingy side.ROLLS:White Christmas : Tuna, avocado, mango, topped with super white tuna, jalapeno, drops of spicy sauce.  I loved this roll.  It was fresh, and delicious.Crispy Kin: Spicy shrimp, avocado, cucumber, unagi, jalapeno, mixed greens, tempura crunch, unagi sauce, wasabi mayo. I liked  this roll a lot.  The crunch was a nice contrast in texture.Sexy Summer: Shrimp tempura, kanikama, sweet mayo, avocado, topped with fresh salmon, mango, and ginger sauce.   I thought this one was also good.  Typically, I don't like salmon since it can be on the fishy side unless it is uber fresh, I went out on a limb and tried this roll, and was not disappointed. Milwaukee: shrimp tempura, avocado, lettuce, topped with seared tuna, ginger, ponzu sauce.  I really like this roll.  the seared tuna was delicious!Spicy Tuna: tuna, avocado, masago, chili oil & spicy sauce.  I think this was the only roll that left me wanting for more.  The pieces were on the small size and there was absolutely no heat in the roll. Don't call it spicy tuna unless it's spicy!There is some street parking on Milwaukee, but it's hard to come by because most of the side streets are zoned.  Therefore, be prepared to drive around for a bit looking for parking and once you find it, be prepared to walk.All in all, I had a great time at Kin, which also turned out to be a very affordable night out.  We split the bill 5 ways and it was just shy of $25 a person.  Not bad! I will probably go back to make sure that I loved the rolls because they were so delicious and not because I was enjoying the company of the friends I was with so much.

25.description: Stopped here for lunch. Nice atmosphere, good service, and great portion size on the lunch special. Loved the cucumber salad--very light and refreshing, the pork pad Thai was delicious, and the sake don was very fresh.

12.description: One of the BEST sushi places I've ever been in the city. amazing rolls and great Thai side dishes as well. I'd definitely recommend trying this place out. Also - it's byob which is nice with NO corkage fee. :)

59.description: I have ordered take out from this place about three times already and BOY DO I LOVE THEM! They deliver to me in less than 45 min and the food is piping hot. So far, I've ordered their Beef Pad See Ew, Chicken Pad Thai, Chicken and Pineapple fried rice, Beef  fried rice, crab rangoons and also their Chicken skewers with peanut sauce. They have yet to fail me! Everything was delicious and bursting with flavor. The portion size is quite generous--I had leftovers for about 3 days! I would definitely recommend them to anyone. Their service is on point. If I could, I would probably eat their pineapple and chicken fried rice everyday for the rest of my life---That's just how good the food is. 5 stars for Awesomeness!

21.description: The food is alright but the service is poor. I do take out from them pretty regularly and they usually get my order right but when they don't, they do nothing to fix it. They delivered food tonight but were missing crab rangoon. When I called to tell them and ask them to have someone bring it, they told me they'd give me a credit for next time instead. Next time? Are you kidding? With a response like that, what makes them think there will be a next time? There are plenty of other places to get takeout like this and I'm going to take my business elsewhere.

17.description: How can you beat Thai, Sushi and BYOB?!...you can't!I was here for my birthday with some of my most special friends to celebrate another year survived!  We ordered edemame and crab rangoon for the table and both were great starters.The crab rangoon was not greasy but have to admit just like any other Chicago location that serves crab rangoon there was more cream cheese than crab.  For dinner we all dug into the sushi.  Bare with me if I can remember everything we ordered! White Christmas : Tuna, avocado, mango, topped with super white tuna, jalapeno, drops of spicy sauceyCrispy Kin: Spicy shrimp, avocado, cucumber, unagi, jalapeno, mixed greens, tempura crunch, unagi sauce, wasabi mayo. Sexy Summer: Shrimp tempura, kanikama, sweet mayo, avocado, topped with fresh salmon, mango, and ginger sauce. We had a few others but the slip my memory at this moment.  The three that I mentioned were by far my favorite but everything was definitely great.  Now I know that it was a birthday dinner and I was not allowed to pay but I sneaked a peak at the bill that was split 5 ways with just a few bottles of wine and enough sushi and appetizers to fill up all the girls and it was only around $25 dollars a person!If that isn't a deal I don't know what is?!!I love everything about this hidden gem and will be back...hopefully parking won't be a struggle since street parking is hard to come by.

10.description: I bought a groupon for this place, using the groupon booking situation, and after having my groupon reservation declined 6 times, I finally called to make a reservation and indicated that I wanted to use the groupon. This was still a problem once I got the the restaurant and provided lots of confusion with the server who didn't speak very good english, but it somehow worked out and the deal went through. This is more a groupon issue than a restaurant issue, but both need to work together to be able to honor the deals smoothly after offering them.The service otherwise was ok, though the server rarely checked on us and we had to flag her down to both order and get our check. I like being left alone to chat with my dinner partner, but we would have liked to have the fish in front of us wrapped up and out of the way at some point.The food was good though, and pretty much made up for all the other issues. The roll selection is a little lacking, not for variety of rolls, but for variety in the rolls- they all kind of have the same ingredients with only slight modifications here and there. We had the crab rangoon, which looks like a deep fried dumpling here, and tried three rolls: the Crispy Kin, which was enormous, and my favorite, the Number 10, which was a little too fishy for me in terms of texture, but had a nice flavor, and the Sexy Summer, which was a little too sweet for my taste and I chewed more on shrimp than shrimp tempura. I definitely enjoyed the crab rangoon and the crispy kin the best. I probably won't be back though with other sushi places located closer to me, and with better roll variety and service.

5.description: We go to this place for sushi more often than any other place.  Mostly because of convenience, but also because of their price point and consistency.  Highly recommend for anybody looking to try sushi for the first time.

3.description: Bought a Groupon to try this place out. Groupon requires a reservation prior to use. I have attempted several reservations on different days and at different times, each of which was canceled by the business. Not only am I no longer interested but I asked for my money back from Groupon.

35.description: One of my favorite places to go for quick Sushi in the city! Although my favorite sushi chef went to the Ashland location I believe :(.  Good. Fast. Prices are fair and its clean.  Good deal if you ask me!

19.description: I first discovered this place a few months ago.  I was up North and felt like some Thai food.  I looked up the closest restaurant and KIN came up.  I ordered the Pad Thai to go and when I got home I was pleasantly surprised.  The portion size was enough for two meals and it was delicious.  I have been coming back to this place since then for more take out and also to dine in.  The ambience is cozy and inviting.  I'm so glad I stumbled upon this place.  It's one of my new favorites!!

28.description: How can you beat Thai, Sushi and BYOB?!...you can't!I was here for my birthday with some of my most special friends to celebrate another year survived!  We ordered edemame and crab rangoon for the table and both were great starters.The crab rangoon was not greasy but have to admit just like any other Chicago location that serves crab rangoon there was more cream cheese than crab.  For dinner we all dug into the sushi.  Bare with me if I can remember everything we ordered! White Christmas : Tuna, avocado, mango, topped with super white tuna, jalapeno, drops of spicy sauceyCrispy Kin: Spicy shrimp, avocado, cucumber, unagi, jalapeno, mixed greens, tempura crunch, unagi sauce, wasabi mayo. Sexy Summer: Shrimp tempura, kanikama, sweet mayo, avocado, topped with fresh salmon, mango, and ginger sauce. We had a few others but the slip my memory at this moment.  The three that I mentioned were by far my favorite but everything was definitely great.  Now I know that it was a birthday dinner and I was not allowed to pay but I sneaked a peak at the bill that was split 5 ways with just a few bottles of wine and enough sushi and appetizers to fill up all the girls and it was only around $25 dollars a person!If that isn't a deal I don't know what is?!!I love everything about this hidden gem and will be back...hopefully parking won't be a struggle since street parking is hard to come by.

45.description: This place is the best for BYOB in Wicker Park/Bucktown area. It is located 2-3 blocks from The Bedford, so it's really nice to do a sit down dinner, get a little tipsy, and then head over to party at The Bedford.We came here for a birthday dinner, ordered 2 appetizers and a boatload of Sushi (really. check out my pictures for a pic of the sushi). It was super delicious, fresh, and CHEAP. I believe we paid $20 each for the 5 of us (including paying for the birthday girl). At the end, we ordered a Mochi dessert platter (also see pic) and they put a candle in it and made it look awesome. All in all, I would definitely come back here to celebrate another birthday.Only cons: it's really tiny, so make reservations early!

33.description: My new favorite Thai delivery joint in the hood! Food is delicious. Only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is that the spice level can be hit or miss with this place. I've ordered a few times now and it seems to vary regardless of my instructions. Wish they had a better way to indicate spice level when ordering online. In all fairness, I'm sure this is not a problem when visiting them in person. Also, I was a little nervous to order delivery sushi but this place rocks that too. I've lived on the west coast for the past 13 years so ordering delivery sushi in Chicago made me a little nervous but I had to try it. They did not disappoint. Well done Kin.

43.description: I am torn, I want to like this place for multiple reasons:1. They serve two of my favorite cuisines, sushi and thai. 2. Cute atmosphere and ambiance3. Crab rangoon - yum!4. It is next door to one of my most favorite places, Frontier.I went here Friday night for a girlfriend's 40th birthday to which she had invited 14 girls, 2 more than the original reservation was for. The restaurant took a long time to seat us (acceptable because it was busy and I get it) then literally forever to ask if we needed water or wine opened (unacceptable.) The waitress seemed nice but very timid and almost afraid to ask us anything. I asked her finally if we could order because she never brought it up after bringing the waters. I ordered the crunchy shrimp and the crunchy kin roles. She brought me a california and a crunchy kin instead. She apologized and offered to take back the california and switch out for the proper roll but as other's rolls had been doubled up on my plate and we were all starving I was just like forget it, I'll take the california, just leave the food here! I then proceeded to eat a ton (liked the wasabi roll.) All the rolls were literally doused in mayo, which was kinda gross.  I also tried a piece of crab rangoon which didn't taste as good as I remembered it. My stomach was not happy with me about 3 hours later. Maybe it was the combo of the things, maybe it was the mayo (eww.) I didn't get sick but was kind of quesy until the next morning. Which wasn't fun. Anyhow reading through some of the other reviews of people saying they got food poisoning I will not be back. Filed under "Not worth the risk."

2.description: Good stuff! We chose to stop in because my girlfriend who is vegan orders delivery from this place regularly and is a fan of their sweet potato rolls. Sweet potato aside, I was admittedly a little skeptical about eating sushi place at a restaurant offering both Thai and Japanese cuisine upon seeing their menu. Having eaten both Thai and Japanese items during our visit, I can truly say it was a welcomed and pleasant surprise. It was very, very good. And having eaten sushi the day before, I could fully appreciate the offerings here were without a doubt of a better quality. Kin's Sushi Combo - 5 starsChicken See U - 5 stars Veggie Gyoza - 5 stars Thai Iced Tea - 4 stars Corn Korokke - 5 stars Price - 5 stars Location - 3 stars (parking is challenging but this place delivers)

18.description: Service was deplorable.  Customer service and small talk were two languages hardly spoken.  Who was our waiter? (to be PC and linguistic correct, men and women are waiters).  I've been to tons of Asian restaurants where service blows (where their primary source of business is Asian consumers that deal with bad service) but when your a restaurant trying to compete in a more... what's the word American area, come'on! give us some good service, locally source your service and hire all kinds of people.  If not, then invest in your business by training your waiters.  Companies send their salespeople to sales training.  Waiters can be sent to hospitality training.When you think about what it takes to make a great evening or a great dinner there are some factors to think about.  We as consumers have to earn a living and we hope to spend that hard earned money somewhere that appreciates our business..yes?I appreciate stellar wait service, I appreciate a wait staff member that can talk to me, socialize a bit, suggest entrees or in this case sushi, a waiter that foresees what I ( the diner) may need, suggest a drink refill, try to see my dining experience and help it get to great.All of which didn't happen for us.  We didn't make any connection with our waiter.  She was cold, forgetful and hardly spoke a word.  Some of the time, I could swear she was talking about us with her co-worker.  Condiments, plates, extra plates which would seem an obvious suggestion for the table weren't thought of or rather took great pains to enlist her service of.Sushi was a-okay.  There were a few plates that garnered the "oh boy" smile and others that were nice.  Some of the appetizers were stellar, specifically Takoyaki.  (See Instragram photos to see best of, dishes, sushi and entrees.)  Crab Rangoon = decent, but there wasn't any signature to their place that you could remember them by.The lack of service, suggestion and ability by waitstaff killed our hopes for a great Saturday night.  Can you believe no one suggested dessert! The only time I saw a glimmer was when they announced the kitchen closing!  WTF! Six dined and our table cost was roughly $30 per person including tip which they robo charged.  I would have felt better giving 10%.  Last thing, it was the end of the night and very very cold outside.  We left the ladies behind to go grab the car, can you believe they asked them to leave!  The obvious response to that is to say "what a fucking place!"  Or rather, drop the g and add an apostrophe three letters from the right.  I'm sure you get my meaning.

41.description: Dined at Kin Sushi and Thai with some friend the other week. Service was great, restaurant decor attractive, and BYOB is a major plus. We ordered several appetizers that were all delicious, then our party ordered a mixture of the sushi and thai. The sushi was really great, everyone had lots of compliments. The thai on the other hand was quite disappointing. It wasn't bad per se, but was also less good than one would expect from a thai restaurant. The pad thai was particularly disappointing - too much sauce, not enough spice, a bit tangy overall. I like this restaurant and will probably go back, however will stick to sushi and other items next time.

52.description: I was delighted by Kin Sushi when I went here with a friend for dinner last weekend. First of all, it's BYOB, which a concept I love because I do not get to do this at my local restaurants (it's illegal) and it feels very risque.  Sushi, with a hint of danger.  OK, I know that's just me.Anyway, the sushi I had was delicious.  Sushi is probably my most favorite best food, so it's not exactly hard to convince me that a sushi joint is really good.  That having been said, I have had enough of it over the course of my life to know the difference between bland, store bought junk and fresh, tasty sushi goodness.  This tasted like goodness.Service was prompt and courteous and the place was not overly busy but the staff let us linger after our meal, even though I knew they wanted to close.  The decor is nothing to get excited about because the whole restaurant is pretty much an empty black box.  When I got the bill, I was absolutely shocked.  Kin was literally the cheapest sushi restaurant I've ever been to.  When bf later questioned how much it cost, I happily told him, "It was practically free!"

50.description: I always come for the New Tokyo. I always stay for the great BYOB service.Kin is one of my favorite places for sushi in the city. This restaurant can easily be overlooked because it's located at the crap end of Milwaukee Ave. Regardless of its location this is a place that tis meant to be visited (multiple times). The sushi has always tasted very fresh and delicious. I strongly suggest trying the New Tokyo and Rock & Roll rolls. You won't regret it. I never use soy sauce here because the chefs are amazing. The service is really good especially in the BYOB department. If you walk in with booze they have a bucket of ice on your table and half the speed of light. The food comes out pretty fast as well. That might because of how this place is never crowded and the chefs work diligently. Also, try their peanut sauce.

4.description: The sushi and Thai food here is very affordable.  The sushi is fresh but the rolls not the most amazing or impressive. However, the Thai food here is very tasty. I have had their pad Thai, pad seeyou, and curry dish.  My favorite appetizer there is shrimp in a blanket, it's a must try.  Overall,  the service is friendly and it's an average doe sushi, but great for Thai food.

6.description: Kin is a culturally confused attempt at pan-Asian. The pad thai ($8.95) was so greasy that the noodles stuck together. For the amount of sauce it was soaked in, it tasted somewhat fishy and overly sweet. In effect, it didn't taste anything like pad Thai even though I squeezed my hunk of lime all over it. The tofu it came with was cooked on the outside but flavorless inside. The fried calamari ($6) was over battered and slightly rubbery, and came with a revolting sweet and sour sauce. Charging an extra dollar for sriracha and mayo is pretty offputting. I got a stomach ache for 15 minutes after dinner and couldn't finish my noodle dish. As we were waiting for our food my artsy fartsy friends and I analyzed the pretentiously artsy decor. We first noticed the sides of the room were covered in magic mirror which promptly reminded me that I was always body dysphoric. Mirrors are usually placed in restaurants to give the illusion of an expansive interior but I couldn't decide if the hanging quilts installed in a square formation above us served to elongate or shorten the space between the ceiling and the floor. In the dim tungsten lighting, the interior appeared claustrophobic.I don't know what to do with my fishy leftovers to make my meal worth it. Douse it with sriracha? Refry with soy sauce? Give it more lemon juice?! Still burping and farting tons after the dreadful visit.

22.description: I was really happy with this place. We came with a group of 8 girls for a bachelorette party and they gave us a great table. The servers provided us with wine glasses and everything we needed. Most importantly the sushi was delicious! You could tell it was fresh ingredients and well made. I am most certainly coming back.

15.description: My boyfriend and I stumbled upon kin when we were on delivery.com. I think I have experienced delivery heaven. First, it only took 40 minutes from the time I placed the order for the food to get to me!!!! Totally awesome! Everything was still hot like we were at the restaurant and it came right out of the kitchen. Anyway, for starters we had the samurai roll- it was delicious and had the perfect amount of crunch. The flavors exploded in my mouth and it was so fresh!We were hungry so we ordered the Panang curry, pineapple fried rice, and yakisoba noodles as well. Panang curry- the spice definitely builds. The veggies were so fresh and it was all so flavorful, we ordered it with beef. Pineapple fried rice- we added pork and it was made to perfection. Among the best fried rice that I ever had! It tasted very clean the cucumber added the perfect touch. Yakisoba noodles- the noodles were soooooo amazing. They had awesome flavor and I only ate two since I was full from everything else. We will have plenty of leftovers to say the least and I will be ordering from here quite often in the near future.

57.description: We have been looking for a good Thai place in the neighborhood and have been dissapointed with several others we have tried. This was not the case with Kin.  Our food was delivered in just 20 minutes, and the it was delicious.  I opted to do Thai (instead of sushi) and got the Tofu Pad Thai. It was so flavorful, fresh and interesting.  The sauce was not spicy, but it was almost savory (had hints of garlic, too).  I will definitley be back to try more dishes!

20.description: I can't speak for the sushi because I'm vegetarian but the veggie dishes are wonderful. The food is always so fresh and satisfying.

36.description: Amazing! Really great lunch specials with a lot of food for a fair price. I got the "big lunch" with chicken fried rice, crab Rangoon, and a California roll. The portions were smaller than dinner sizes but still reasonable. Everything was fantastic! The fried rice was flavorful and the crab Rangoon wasn't too heavy. The best cucumber salad I've ever had.
