Very fresh vegetables and amazing dressing that was light and not over powering. Highly recommended place to go for lunch or dinner!!

14.description: 1) NO A/C2) Overpriced sushi for quality I ordered St. Patrick maki for 13$ it supposed to be: Unagi, tempura crunch, topped with shrimp, avocado, wasabi mayo, wasabi tobiko. There was almost 0% unagi, and 80% roll filled with tempura crunch and 20% avocado. Super dry maki with no flavor.Shrimp tempura rolls didn't have much shrimp either. .Tom Kha soup was pretty good and it was BYOB.Im giving 2 stars for BYOB and possibly good thai dishes. I will never go there again

29.description: I've walked in a couple times here. Showed Ruben a picture of what I wanted from my phone, and he nailed it. He definitely takes his time (I think my cut was about 45 minutes), but it's worth it. He does mind going slowly to make sure he's doing what you want. Feels great to support a local business like this as well.

42.description: Awesome. Just got back from a Sunday morning cut (they're open 7 days a week, 10a to 3p on Sundays) and I am very pleased. The owner is very nice, very professional. They have 2 other barbers that work there also. For about $18, my cut only took about 15 min. tops and I had a ton of hair to get lopped off (I procrastinated too long and looked like Wolverine - just not as cool). The owner tells me they are open to feedback, so if you don't like your cut, tell them - they will be happy to fix it, and have a genuine interest in attracting and retaining customers. I will definitely return.

23.description: All I can say is WOW. I usually get my haircut at Floyd's. However, they've never left my hair looking as awesome as Ruben's Unisex did. I already had a reference picture to show the man that cut my hair (not Ruben, but a man with a ponytail), and he cut it EXACTLY the way I wanted it. Also, these men are as professional as they get. I walked in at 6:40pm (they close at 7pm), and there were 5 other men waiting to get their haircut. They gave each and every single one of us a great haircut. I walked out of the place at around 8:30pm, since I was the last in line, feeling like a million dollars.UPDATE: I've been here over 10 times. Every haircut that I've received has been great. Exceptional haircuts and service!

47.description: How did I ever miss this place?  This guy is the king of fade!  He takes his time and did my outline with a razor.  Can't remember when I had such a great cut.  The guy takes his time.  Awesome!

8.description: DO NOT GO TO THE WOMAN...i'm not being sexist, this lady is just TERRIBLE.  This was hands down THE worst haircut I've ever had, and the fact that all the haircuts I've had prior were either free of $11 haircuts says a lot.My normal guy was all booked so I decided to take a chance on a $20 cut at Ruben's because it's close to my new place and the reviews on here are stellar. I showed the lady two pictures and asked if she could give me a cut in between the two styles. She briefly looked at them and said yeah, and laughed it off as if saying "yeah no problem!".  Well, she went HAM on my hair and was not careful or taking her time like the other reviews mention. My glasses had to be off most of the time so I couldn't see what she was doing. When she got to the top of my hair though, I knew she was cutting way too short 'cause she was Edward Scissorhands-ing the hell out of it and stopped her. I wanted short faded sides and a trim on the top and basically got a 1 all the way up the sides and half of the top cut off. Parts of it weren't even even, and now I look like a wack Macklemore.  What's even worse is when I called her out she was not apologetic and tried to brush it off. She kept saying it was "just a little trim" and kept trying to style what was left as if it made it better. I coughed up the $20 and left pissed as hell, but you better believe I didn't leave a tip. I've could've screwed up my own hair at home for free, and ended up going home to try to fix it anyhow.  Never again Ruben's.......

31.description: good price.  did a great, detailed job on my haircut.  happy to have found a good barber by my new apartment.

34.description: Another great review. I walked in on a Wednesday afternoon, and there were three guys working. An older gentleman, a man in his 40s or 50s (Ruben, I'm guessing), and a guy who was probably in his 20s. The older gentleman was the one who cut my hair. I had a picture on my phone of roughly what kind of haircut I wanted. He took a look, asked a few questions, and began. As others have said, this was not a quick in-and-out job, and it's not the kind of place where they try to force a conversation.He took his time, asking questions along the way. At one point he asked if I wanted it a bit shorter, then nodded and smiled when I said yes, as though that was exactly what he hoped I'd say. It has been awhile since I had a haircut from someone who gave the impression that getting it exactly right was all he really cared about.Great cut. Great experience. I will definitely be back.

16.description: All I can say is WOW. I usually get my haircut at Floyd's. However, they've never left my hair looking as awesome as Ruben's Unisex did. I already had a reference picture to show the man that cut my hair (not Ruben, but a man with a ponytail), and he cut it EXACTLY the way I wanted it. Also, these men are as professional as they get. I walked in at 6:40pm (they close at 7pm), and there were 5 other men waiting to get their haircut. They gave each and every single one of us a great haircut. I walked out of the place at around 8:30pm, since I was the last in line, feeling like a million dollars.UPDATE: I've been here over 10 times. Every haircut that I've received has been great. Exceptional haircuts and service!

13.description: Just going to reiterate how great this place is! I walked in to Ruben's for the first time at 10:30am last Wednesday and there were two barbers there, one just finishing up. They sat me immediately and I showed the barber a couple pictures on my phone of the style I wanted. He started out by not just using the clippers to trim the sides, but to shape them, going over the areas several times. After each step he would check with me and allow me to provide feedback before progressing. Towards the end when I thought he was all done he then busted out the shaving cream, lined it around the edges of my neckline and ears and took a straight razor to shave a nice natural hairline without any strays. This was by far the smoothest and most detailed haircut I ever had and the one I've been most pleased with. I've payed over $40 for haircuts before and never been so satisfied. It's a disgrace to call this a bargain because of the attention and skill they use but it is undoubtedly the best cut you can get and at a price you can't beat. Just don't forget to tip if you are pleased with what they do!Oh, and at the end I introduced myself and asked the name of my barber.. turns out it was THE Ruben! How lucky I was to find this place and get such great service!

11.description: First time here. I walked in and was greeted by one of the barbers. On a Thursday at 11am I was seated in 5min. Romero cut my hair and modeled it after a few pictures I showed him. He did a great job! My only knock is that he didn't explain how short he was going on the sides and back of my hair before tapering it. I would've preferred less of a taper, but I'm happy with how everything looks. For $20, I'll def go back.

39.description: I moved to Chicago several months ago for grad school and I was definitely feeling some anxiety about finding a new barber. I'm very particular about my barbers and I usually get cut every 7-10 days because my hair grows incredibly fast. Not sure how to begin my search, I simply Googled "best fade haircut in Chicago" and this was the first place to come up. I've received nothing but incredible cuts from both Ruben and his nephew. I take two trains to get here, but it's totally worth it. I've always hit my line up with a straight razor after I get home from the barber shop, but at Ruben's it's part of the haircut without even asking for it and no extra charge. Sometimes I have them trim and line my beard and they have never charged extra for that either, but I make sure to give an extra generous tip. While I get a fade, I've seen guys get all kinds of different cuts and they always look great. Ruben's is a no frills, traditional style barber shop. If you want a pretentious, high-end salon go somewhere else, Nancy. At Ruben's you always get a great cut at a more than fair price. If you come to Ruben's you won't have to endure any awkward small talk or listen to the guy in the chair next to you bitch about his wife. The environment is very quiet and relaxed, with the only sound consisting of soft classical music playing over the radio. My only tip is to remember to bring cash because I've seen quite a few guys forget to bring cash and have to go find an ATM. I find this ridiculous because I have never heard of a barber that accepts anything other than cash, but apparently it's more common than I think. I highly recommend this shop. Go there, and leave looking great.

37.description: Just finished getting a haircut,seriously the other reviews are spot on,this is the best haircut i got in a loooooong time,check them out!!

0.description: After receiving haircuts my entire life from the popular chain hair cutters, I decided to check out this place when I moved right by (Noble Square). The crew is highly trained and cut hair better than any of the other places I've been too. They are perfectionists and take their time. You can expect even sideburns, no loose hairs and the style you desire. I would say it takes at least 40 minutes for a hair cut because they do the little things like shave your sideburns and neck and style your hair (I've even had my eyebrows trimmed there).Ramiro is excellent. I don't remember the other names of the staff but all of them are excellent barbers.

38.description: Asian man in the house. I am usually very picky about my haircut so when I can, I usually go to a Korean Place. But since Reuben's was in my neighborhood, I gave it a shot. They did a great job! I'm very happy with the result. Well worth the $18. I'll probably be back again!

51.description: Fade Inn, I'm very happy for you and I'm gonna let you finish but Ruben gave me the best cut of all time, OF ALL TIME!  Honestly, this is the best hair cut I've ever had.  Don't let the exterior fool you, you won't get a shoddy haircut here.  And do not come here if you are in a rush.  When I went inside Ruben was already cutting another customer and he didn't let my entrance change how meticulous he was at cutting that person's hair.  In fact, he didn't even shift his attention to acknowledge me or say hi.  So I went outside, took a five minute smoke break, went back inside and waited about twenty more minutes until he was finished.  Not a problem, I think I'm pretty patient.  Finally it was my turn.  Ruben asked what I wanted and went to work.  He isn't a conversationalist and neither am I.  He didn't force small talk about work or girlfriends or make me uncomfortable.  Thirty minutes later, I was surprised when he touched up my fade with a straight razor.  He did a fine job.It cost $17 and I left a $3 dollar tip he was appreciative of.  Not too bad for the best haircut of the world.

27.description: There aren't a lot of reviews on here from women, so I wanted to say that Ruben's does a great job on women's hair, too! I walked into Ruben's on a Monday after work and was able to get a chair within 15 minutes. I have to say, I got one of the best haircuts ever...simply because it was done right! The man who cut my hair also spent a lot of time drying and styling it, and it looked amazingI would've never thought to style my hair the way he did it, but I will from now on. For $25, this haircut was an incredible deal. I'll be back for sure.One thing to note: CASH ONLY!!!

32.description: Very happy with my haircut. I was a walk in after work and Robert cut my hair. I can be very particular about my haircuts and was definitely a little apprehensive about getting a cut here. Robert took his time, was friendly and asked me several questions along the way on length etc. Great haircut and at 18 bucks makes it an incredible cut. This will be my go to.

48.description: I just got the best haircut I've had in America. Romero (must be Ruben's apprentice) not only gave me a great cut, but the follow through was unequaled: thinning sheers for stray tips after the cut, a brush and blow-dry to remove all stray hairs, and a straight-edge razor finish. 18 bucks.I had been looking for a good barber in West Town, and now I've found it.

44.description: Couldn't agree more with the previous reviews. I moved to River North from Los Angeles a couple months ago and luckily found this place after a couple bad haircuts at other places nearby. Quality low-fade, straight razor lineup was nice, after every other place I called said they don't do straight razor. Strongly recommend this place. They've got a customer for however long I'm living in Chicago.

24.description: Much like everyone else I love this place.  I've been in Chicago for almost two years and I spent the first year overpaying at salons and places like State Street for mediocre cuts.  I tried Ruben's based on these reviews and was not disappointed.  Ruben was the barber who cut my hair the first time and I haven't used anyone else since.  Told him what I wanted and got it. I've seen the other barbers give great cuts, but Ruben is my guy.  For $20 and a good tip it can't be beat.  Give this small local business a chance, you won't regret it.

7.description: Been going here for a couple years. Top notch barber shop. Ramiro (younger guy) and Ruben (older with a ponytail) are great guys and always give a great haircut. They also have 2 other barbers (don't know their names) there as well and they do great work. It's walk-in only. I've never waited more than 30 min to get in a chair. I usually just show them a picture of what I want and they get right to it with no problem.

49.description: Just had Ruben cut my hair for the first time and it was a wonderful experience. Extremely kind man, relaxed setting and he gave me an incredible fade. I'd come back any time.

40.description: Well, I had another 'Ruben's Experience', and Im back with even more info.I walked into Rubens today, and Ruben himself was busy with another customer. Crap. This 18-year-old-looking guy said "Haircut?". I reluctantly said yes.The first time I was in Ruben's, I was so impressed with the haircut that I actually took a picture of myself in the mirror, just for reference. I showed the picture to the guy and told him that's what I want to look like.He definitely took his time with my cut, even longer than Ruben usually takes (expect around a half hour of your time) - except he did use a trimmer instead of a scissors - Which worked out in the end.I was basically worried that I would get a sub-standard cut, since I have never seen this kid in the shop - But this may actually be the best haircut that I've gotten in this place. The only thing that I do miss (as far as not actually getting my cut with Ruben) is that this young guy did not use the straight-edge on me.100% happy, well worth the $18. Give these guys some decent tips, by the way, I'd hate to see them go out of business.

30.description: This place is phenomenal. My barber was one of the most professional, hilarious people I've ever met and he gave me the best haircut of my life. I couldn't hold back a smile at how fast he clipped with the scissors, it was unreal. But overall he took his time, didn't force conversation and his attention to detail was impeccable.

46.description: This place is good. Part of the reason I awarded five stars was that my heart was quivering five minutes into my haircut. I was nervous I had made a huge mistake, but it turned out great. Some of the methods here are unconventional, but the result is what matters. I've never seen such extensive use of the thinning shears on all parts of my head.I got a fade with a 4 and a 5. Very thorough haircut, which was better than messing up because you're going too fast. Probably took twenty minutes total They also used a straight razor on my neck, sideburns, and behind my ears. $18 total.I wonder about the finances of this place. The decor is late 70's or early 80's. Red and white checkered tile floor. There was a another older barber with a long pony tail. Kinda looked like an older version of The Dude. However, haircuts haven't changed that much and aren't that complicated. If you live nearby and need a simple haircut, this is a safe option.

1.description: Ramiro is the Go-to barber! Got tired of listening to my sister complain about her kids haircuts,. I took it upon myself to get them a good cut,. Kid friendly and very talented, my sister had nothing to complain about! My 7 yr old nephew wanted a "wave" whatever that is. Apparently him and Ramiro speak the same language because he is always satisfied and blushing after getting his fresh cuts here! Its hilarious.I've since, taken my 2 yr old and 17 yr old nephews, and now i'm always getting called all because they need a haircut!So,. not sure how to word it? Ask the Barber Ramiro, I'm sure he'll understand!

9.description: Ruben is a genuinely talented guy who takes his time to give you what you want. Best haircut around for $20 hands down!

26.description: Nice group of barbers in a relaxed place with a short wait. Watch  the fades, the older guys might go a  bit too high for your liking, Romero the young one is probably  the best, very attentive.

25.description: Seriously writing this review bring tears to my eyes. No joke been coming to Rubins 4 haircuts since 1999 and unfortunately no longer live in the city or would continue to come back every week as usual. I'm just going to make it simple "BEST HAIRCUT EVER" !!! Side note actually lived  above Rubins when first moved to Chicago and that's how lucky I was.

12.description: Best haircut place ever. I just started going here and Romiro is amazing at cutting hair. I highly recommend going here. Staff is amazing and nice. Always greeting everyone nicely.

21.description: Just going to reiterate how great this place is! I walked in to Ruben's for the first time at 10:30am last Wednesday and there were two barbers there, one just finishing up. They sat me immediately and I showed the barber a couple pictures on my phone of the style I wanted. He started out by not just using the clippers to trim the sides, but to shape them, going over the areas several times. After each step he would check with me and allow me to provide feedback before progressing. Towards the end when I thought he was all done he then busted out the shaving cream, lined it around the edges of my neckline and ears and took a straight razor to shave a nice natural hairline without any strays. This was by far the smoothest and most detailed haircut I ever had and the one I've been most pleased with. I've payed over $40 for haircuts before and never been so satisfied. It's a disgrace to call this a bargain because of the attention and skill they use but it is undoubtedly the best cut you can get and at a price you can't beat. Just don't forget to tip if you are pleased with what they do!Oh, and at the end I introduced myself and asked the name of my barber.. turns out it was THE Ruben! How lucky I was to find this place and get such great service!

17.description: Super chilled out. Walk in time isn't so bad, all barbers are laid back and cut great hair!

10.description: Moved to West Town recently and picked Ruben's because it was close. They are pros, very detail oriented. Typical haircut takes 20-30 min as they do a top notch job. I recommend Ruben's to anyone looking for a good cut.

5.description: The best. Literally everyone does a great job here. But ... please don't go when I go? I don't want it to be too busy.

3.description: Thankfully, found a normal barber shop. No screaming music, not fashionable or chic, they just cut your hair and do a great job, quietly and for a good price. Also like that they do the neck shave with a proper straight razor, held with a deft touch. Ruben's is my new go-to barbershop.

35.description: Came in just before closing on a Sunday and Rivera was accommodating. He took his time and I got a great cut. I will be changing barbers now to this shop.

19.description: Just moved to Noble Square and was  nervous about finding a place for a good (but affordable) haircut.  I went to Ruben's because of their help reviews and was not disappointed.  A great cut for $20.00.

28.description: Great haircut! Took his time, didn't force conversation, used scissors, straight razor finish. Everything I want in a barber shop. In this hood where places are catering to men but pricing for women this place is a local gem.

45.description: Ruben is the best. I was a first-timer after trusting the yelp reviews and he totally delivered. He's incredibly meticulous and couldn't be nicer. Best $18 haircut I've had.

33.description: I've never figured out how to cut my hair. When I was a teenager, I kept it long and went to stylists trying to figure out some way to make my beiber sweep look cool. I failed. When I got older, I gave up on looks and started buzzing it at whatever sports clips was in the area. It wasn't the greatest, but at least I looked professional. Fast forward to now. I moved to this area of Chicago and needed someone to keep me presentable for work. Saw Ruben on yelp and figured I'd give it a shot. Best haircut of my life. He probably spent a good 40 minutes on my hair, a true professional. Do yourself a favor and see this man, you won't regret it.

43.description: Not to sound like a broken record, but yup it's the best place I've found for a fade! I just moved from California and it's been a tough trial and error period until I found a good place, until I found this place. It's nothing fancy and don't expect conversation, but you do leave looking good :)

2.description: Hands down, consistently some of the best fades I've ever received. I'm so grateful to have found Ruben's on Yelp, not to mention it's really close to my River North condo and they're open all weekend. I've gotten cuts from both gentlemen and they're both consistently good, taking their time (about 30 minutes for a fade), scissors to blend even further, and finishing off with a razor to line you up. They check all angles which I like, and ensure to even out all blemishes. $20 for a cut, and the best $20 you'll spend in Chicago for quality service. Ramiro is certainly my go-to, but as mentioned, both are great.Best,Charlie

18.description: Never have I ever been so pleased w a haircut. I went in and was quickly greeted by Ellie. She assured me she could give me the fade I wanted. I sat back and watched her do her magic. Abt 30 minutes later I was looking fresh! She is a perfectionist and really takes her time w your hair. Something I will tip well for. Next time I'm in the Chicago area, I will be coming through Ruebens to see Ellie! Thanks again. Oh did I mention I highly recommend this place?

41.description: Literally the best haircut i've ever gotten. No exaggeration. These guys take their time, making sure you get a clean, even cut. Ruben (owner) wasnt there- but his nephew is apparently equally skilled. I've paid double @ other places for less. Old school type shop. No frills, even do the straight edge razor on neck/ touching up lines. HIGHly recommended. You won't regret it.

52.description: So I just got another awesome haircut from this place.  I may be biased (I live in the building), but you can't get better treatment.  Don't look for a lot of conversation...even if you speak Spanish.  They'll do the cut, and do it right.  Hook it up.  I think they even do waxing, if that's your thing.

50.description: the way all service industries should operate:  do one thing AND DO IT WELL!!!

4.description: I've sent my boyfriend to one of the best high end salons in the city, iMale Salon, with disappointing results and a super heavy $$$ price tag. I tried again, but this time decided to go with modest cost and somewhere that focused more on talent/skill and less on posh aesthetics. The results were phenomenal! Ramiro did an excellent job. He was fast, needed little direction, and the result was gorgeous! Thanks for turning my lumberjack into a hot male model!!

6.description: Rubens is awesome. I have gotten my haircut by all three of the men that work here and they've all done AMAZING work. However they all do move at different paces so if you're in a rush definitely get your hair cut by the youngest guy-- I forgot his name, but his work is just as precise as the other two barbers and is twice as fast. This place is 20 bucks a cut and I always like to tip 5 because it's well worth it. It's within walking distance from me so parking is never an issue, but I know there is street parking right in front.

22.description: I have regularly visited Reuben's for almost a year now. For some $20 for a haircut may be average or not much. For me I am still getting used to it but I do realize that even great clips is at that here. BUT every time I walk out there is no mistake, you feel like you just had the best haircut in your life. The time and detail... I think they cut your hair at least twice just to make sure it's perfect!

15.description: I went in and asked for a trim and I got a mullet instead. I got to pay $20 plus tip for the privilege. I decided to just leave it and pay somebody else to fix it instead of letting them butcher it further. I've had a bad experience here before but I chalked it up to an isolated incident. I've had a couple of good haircuts here before, but it's a real gamble. Not a gamble I'm willing to take again.

20.description: Go to Romero at Rubens unisex for the best fade haircut in Chicago. I'm always happy with my haircut.

36.description: Excellent Excellent .. Thank you

14.description: Recently Moved From LA, been to few places trying to get a good skin fade, no great luck then I decided to yelp it and came across Romero at Rubens. Gave it a try and love my results. Perfect Fade. Definitely coming back!

58.description: i guess its safe to say that this is my go-to neighborhood bar. considering its literally right behind my apt, its easy to go in and enjoy beer specials and catch a game on their giant screens (seriously, you can sit in any corner of the bar/tables and you will be able to get a good view of the tv's). i love love love their lil brother burger (merkts cheddar, onions, jalapenos, yum) and i always get the sweet potato tater tots with jalapeno aoli on the side. some people argue with me that they have a better burger down the street but i think theyre terribly mistaken. the buffalo chicken wrap is pretty darn awesome too.

56.description: This place has become a go-to.- Never overcrowded, you can always get a seat- Awesome service all around- Megatouch, jukebox, pool table, darts- Deeee-licious tortilla chips- Douche-free enviornment- Welcoming and comfortable ambience

29.description: If we are talking about bar-food, which this is: The food and staff get fives across the board.What can I say?  The salads are some of the best in the area. and to be honest, everything here has been fantastic - it does have a gritty ambiance, but the food has always been great, as well as the service.They have a deal every day, and on game-days, you get the 'real' fans

42.description: I really liked this place.  Sunday afternoon bartender had a great personality and recommended great beers.  Patrons were lots of fun too and everyone had a good time.

23.description: So our favorite bar-food spot changed their menu and it was time to explore the neighborhood for a replacement spot and here I am loving Delux!  Their menu is quite large for a bar and they offer somewhat healthier sides if you don't want fries with your burger or sandwich.  On the other side of healthy -- they deep fry their tater tots (you just can't get that at home).  We've gone on weeknights and weekend nights but around dinner time and always had prompt helpful service.   If you're in the neighborhood and in the mood for a burger or wrap -- you will be happy you went here.

47.description: Doesn't get any better than a great bar with really good food being right next door to your apartment! I've had breakfast , lunch and dinner here and all the food is definitely well above your standard bar food! Even friends who visit always say how lucky we are to have this place right next door! Also, just found out they have amazing desserts, too! This place just gets better and better. Love it!

8.description: Came here for brunch. The breeze be the windows is awesome and bathrooms were really clean. Ordered chilaquiles with chorizo and they were actually pretty tasty. I like mine crunchy not too soggy so these were on point. Also large order of tots, a bit too greasy but otherwise crispy. Good brunch spot

31.description: Wow just moved a few blocks closer to Delux yesterday and decided to give it a try for delivery.  We got wraps, sandwiches, salads, wings and nachos.  Everything was really good except for the side of soup that I got.  (It's July so I'll give them a pass.). It was nothing fancy, just solid good food.  Will definitely be ordering again/go to the restaurant next time.

34.description: Well, I read the Yelp reviews, but I had to try for myself. Someone said the reviews are fake, and I agree. The service and staff are friendly, but the food here is terrible. The coffee is even awful. I had the American Skillet and it had more ham and cheese than eggs. And by too much cheese (I read that in a review as well), even if you're a cheese lover its too much. They ARE generous with their portions, but it's not the cheapest place to grab bar food either. If they could get things straight in the kitchen I'd be all over this place. It's in a great neighborhood and a great place to watch the game.

16.description: This place never disappoints.  great service, great food and always the right amount of people in the bar. The Duke burger and the shrimp po boy are my favs.

13.description: Couldn't be more happy with a bar that I can basically trip out of my front door and land inside. It's the ultimate neighborhood spot. So chill both staff and customer wise, amazing bar food, and very affordable drinks. Do: Eat the buffalo chicken wrap, Lumberjack burger, Asian chicken salad and of course tots. Do: Play darts, jam music on MyTouchtunes, sit in the comfy lounge chairs, and drink one of their awesome Zing Zang made bloodys. Don't: Tell your friends cause this is my new spot. Just kidding...they can come too.

11.description: This is a go to bar for lunches and after work drinks. Its a couple blocks from my office and super convenient. Atmosphere....Clean & Friendly. Pool table and Internet Jukebox. Not to loud that you can't hold a conversation with your friends. Food...95% of the food I've ordered has been very good. My favorites are the burger special and the buffalo chicken sliders. When we head there after work, tater totes are usually the favorite. Drinks...Good drink selection, I would love it even more if they could put Smithwick's on the menu. Negatives?....They usually only have one server on lunch. Sometimes when the place fills up, you may have to wait for your bill. Definitely not a deal breaker though.

39.description: Fantastic bar food! Everything is made in house and has great flavor. Prices are good and the staff is usually friendly and helpful. Living down the street is dangerous because we've never had a bad meal here. Chicken wings and minis on pretzel roll.

37.description: This bar is always mostly empty. I find the staff is always rude when ever I go and if you use the juke box to play something fun the bar tender uses the remote to skip your songs! Waste of my money! The food isn't that great. The breakfast was not good, since the eggs where pretty gross. My boyfriend likes tater tots. But I'm like, who needs a pound of tater tots? Not me. This place is a waste of location.

0.description: We were around the corner for an event, and we found this place as the closest and best option for food. We got takeout and it was relatively quick service . All I gotta say is GET THE SMOTHERED TOTS. Just do it. I still think about those dang things. So glad we stumbled across this restaurant that day.

38.description: Amazing tots. My moscow mule was pretty strong. Restaurant is a corner bar on Milwaukee, kind of hard to notice. Burgers were ok. Our waitress was super friendly.

51.description: This place is great, we live around the corner and its safe to say we're regulars.  The food is great quality, the service is awesome and the beer selection make this cozy little neighborhood spot a staple.  And a brunch that is a well kept secret of river west!

27.description: Great bar food (best fries in the city). I live in the neighborhood and go there all the time. I usually go for the wraps or shrimp po boy. Definitely recommend if you're in the area.

32.description: Food was great. The Little Mo was Great, the beef and cheddar sliders also great. Nice neighborhood atmosphere. Will return.

54.description: Easy going , good food and service.  Nothing else to say but you will be satisfied.

48.description: Not usually a fan of bar food, but as bar food goes, this place is the best. Everything is scratch made. Not much is pre-made or precut from a food distributor and you can really tell. The soup broth, pizza dough, and thee house made tortilla chips are  bursting with freshness. If you are ready to treat yourself, you can't leave without trying their amazing nachos (with steak.) Everything from the cheese sauce, to the meat and chips are all homemade and oozing with flavor! They also have great big salads for all the days you can't each nachos for dinner. Always affordable and comfortable relaxed atmosphere.

44.description: My husband and I love Delux so much, we had our rehearsal dinner here before our wedding. Delux has been loved by our family since we moved nearby in 2009. So I don't know why I'm only now getting around to writing a review ... guess I've been too busy eating Delux ...Seriously, we basically do our grocery shopping here. And the fact that they recently started delivering (even though we live only three blocks away ...) only enables our Delux addiction further.Delux has the best tots, french fries and sweet potato tots in Chicago. Just the right amount of crispiness that makes you eat an entire plateful before you know it. But it's not just their potato products. Everything on the menu is amazing. Even their pizza is impressive!THESE ARE A FEW OF MY FAVORITE THINGS:* Pulled Pork Quesadillas* Turkey Reuben * Southwestern Wrap* Delux Salad* Nachos* ChiliWhatever you order, you cannot go wrong. Chef Matt, we love you. LONG LIVE DELUX!

24.description: Chorizo Taco Plate.  'nuff said.Bartender's pretty cool too.

7.description: Shrimp Po Boy and Tortilla Soup were great paired with Revolution Brewery AntiHero.  Also had a thin crust bacon pizza which was great.  Sometimes a thin crust can be too thin but this was a perfect medium between traditional hand tossed and thin crust.  Service was great, we were there early for lunch service and there was almost nobody else there.

49.description: Couldn't be more happy with a bar that I can basically trip out of my front door and land inside. It's the ultimate neighborhood spot. So chill both staff and customer wise, amazing bar food, and very affordable drinks. Do: Eat the buffalo chicken wrap, Lumberjack burger, Asian chicken salad and of course tots. Do: Play darts, jam music on MyTouchtunes, sit in the comfy lounge chairs, and drink one of their awesome Zing Zang made bloodys. Don't: Tell your friends cause this is my new spot. Just kidding...they can come too.

40.description: Delux, Delux, Delux... Well, I used to be a "regular" at Delux. For my birthday, earlier in the year, I brought my parents, wife and my son and daughter. At the end of the meal, my dad insisted on paying for the meal, our waitress, ran his card, and came back, with it already run, and my dad added the tip. About four months later, my wife and I happened to be in Delux, when that same waitress, whose name is Ashley, waited on us that night. She asked if we'd been in a few months earlier with an older man, it took me a bit, but put it together as my dad, plus everyone else in the family, so I asked if that was when she was talking about, and she said yes. Keep in mind, we went to Delux at least once a week, and would order take out at least one to two times per week, as well, typically on week nights, which apparently Ashley doesn't work, or we just never crossed paths with her. Ashley then proceeded to tell us that something was wrong with my dad's credit card, and the charge didn't go through. Number one, remember that she had already authorized it, and brought it back to the table for him to add the tip-if there was a problem with the card, she'd known it then. Number two, my dad uses his Disney credit card for every single thing to earn Disney points, and never, ever had a "problem" with it. So, anyways, I told her that I'd check with him to see if the charge went through, to which she protested and said that we would have to pay that night, and I could ask him later, or I could call him right then. I told her my dad isn't up that late at night, well, that didn't matter to Ashley, she added the previous bill from four months prior, to our bill from that night. She related that a manager did this, we've checked and this is ILLEGAL! Furthermore, during that night, Ashley was doing squats against the wall, with some patrons, and gave us some of the worst service, we've ever had. So, I did check with my dad, whom called his credit card company, to which they informed him, that Delux, did in fact run his card for authorization that day, but, drum roll please, they never put an actual charge through. So ASHLEY messed up and didn't put the charge through, she only authorized the card. I have zero problem with paying for the meals, where my problem lies, is, when we come in all the time, and I say I'll call my dad the next day, to check, to make sure his card didn't get charged, that's what you let us do. It'd already been four months since the bill had been improperly handled by Ashley, the business couldn't wait one more day, for regulars, to make sure there wasn't a mistake somewhere? Not to mention, again, that them adding a bill, that someone else had tried to pay, onto our bill, is ILLEGAL! Ashley, and/or the manager that was on duty that night, should know better, than to do what they did, it's a shame that Ashley's mistake on not putting the charge through, properly, resulted in this. No apology has been given to us, which is even a worse sign of how business is conducted here. Too bad, because they were just around the corner from us, now we have taken them off of our places to eat.

53.description: In a way, nothing to write home about - but I'm going to recommend it.  Never too packed, not too pricey, and great variety on the menu.  Their breakfast items have tater tots baked into them, and their lunch/dinner stuff is decent, too.They totally won me over one morning when I was in for brunch, it was slow - and I asked them to go off menu for me.  My server was Allie, and the chef in the kitchen was Matt - and I had some of the best breakfast tacos EVER.  I really appreciated their willingness to get experimental on a slow day - made my morning.

30.description: Every single time we go here we love it. Not only is the good waayyyyy better than your average bar and grill, we love the service. Ashley auggie and Jen are all fantastic and make everyone feel very special. The drinks are great, the food is great and the peoe are excellent. what more could you ask for? Glad I found this gem!

46.description: I find it fascinating that a place that has been reviewed twice in an entire summer received two amazing reviews the same day following my negative review, including one mentioning the house made broth, because "guests" really mention/know that a broth is house made, convenient, but that's fine. (Perhaps THAT is actually the reason for your positive reviews Matt F. not the so-so food and crappy service) What IS 100% ridiculous is that management responded to a terrible review regarding their delivery service after my review was posted, but Not my review where a waitress ILLEGALLY came after us for a tab that wasn't ours and acted like a rude bully!  They clearly follow their reviews, as they should. Yes delux, I see that your "business and guest relationships" are truly important to you.  I have mentioned our experience now to EVERYONE I can, and will continue to do so, because no one should be subjected to such bad business practice all for food that is mediocre on a good day... one person stated they would have called the police!  What could have been rectified by professional management has now become an epic failure in business and become far more offensive.

1.description: I hate to leave this review because this is such a neighborhood gem - delish food, chill vibe, tv's, great go-to. I usually dine in or take out about 2-3 times a week from here, I'd say I'm a regular. But after my last visit I'm going to take a break. I recently brought some friends in for pizza and beers to watch the bulls game. We ordered a large THIN crust za, pretty standard - it took over. an. hour. By the time it came out the game was over. Naturally I inquired about the status of our (thin crust) pizza a couple times during the stupidly long wait - was just told that "it takes a while" and then that "they had to remake it". No apologies were made, nor was anything taken off our bill (like maybe one of the extra rounds of beers we ordered during the 75 minute wait for our food??). Oh and the pizza was kinda burnt. Don't come here expecting five star service I guess. Or mediocre service.

55.description: I went here because of their solid beer selection (I was looking to get Left Hand Milk Stout). I was a little disappointed that most of their beers were in the bottle and not on draft. The food was solid and the atmosphere is pretty cool too. Good neighborhood spot to hang with a group of friends.

9.description: Came here for brunch the other day. Superb brunch. Service and atmosphere were good as well, though the location is pretty inconvenient for most everyone I think.Had the corned beef hash skillet. Massive amount of food, delicious hash with a hefty portion of corned beef. I would definitely get it again. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the other filling ingredients were very tasty.I'd definitely return for brunch and would probably be willing to try it some night as well....though I'd be sure to order the food when I go at night.

26.description: Went to Delux with some buddies a few weekends ago to watch some playoff baseball and shoot pool. Not too many people in there, which isn't a big deal to me. They had a decent beer deal going on and their pizza was awesome. We had a great time and would go back again.

25.description: I'm pregnant and needed nachos at 7:30 on a Sunday night. This place came up on GrubHub. My nachos arrived super fast along with my partner's delicious looking Asian salad. Our delivery guy was very nice and really fast. Will definitely order again!

12.description: Everything I've had to eat here is really good but I have to say the chicken nachos are amazing just be sure to tell them skip the lettuce (yuck). The staff is super friendly and I usually don't have a lot of trouble getting a table unless the Bears are on. Good Bar. Great Food!!

59.description: Great service, food, and fun place to enjoy a game.

21.description: Place is growing on me, but still 4/5 stars. First time I went there I got majorly screwed on two shots of Jameson that cost me $24. The good news is I haven't experienced that sort of rip off since. Pros:-The food is really good all around. -Bartenders are friendly-Pool table is a plusCons:-The beers are priced ok. They could probably stand to be a dollar less each. Maybe its just my pet peeve, but a $5 bud light should only be reserved for river north and trendy bars...not the divey/casual ones.

17.description: Some if the best mozzarella sticks in the city!!!My friend was defeated by the huge portions of nachos, but she said they were good! The staff was able to change the channels to the games that we wanted to watch which was great.

10.description: Great place to watch your favorite sports team and enjoy drinks and bar food! I highly recommend the buffalo chicken egg rolls appetizer!

5.description: Looking for a good brunch to help relieve that hangover? Then this is the place to go! Both the food and service are pretty amazing. The people that work there are not only super nice, but have a good sense of humor too.In terms of food, I have now been here on 2 occasions with 2 groups and was able to try several dishes.Like another yelper, I highly recommend the loaded tot appetizer. How can you go wrong with tots smothered in cheese sauce and bacon? Drooling just thinking about it! We also had the mozzarella sticks, and those were pretty standard.The Mexican scramble was delicious, especially if you like a little heat. Also delicious was the breakfast quesadilla. My husband ordered the buffalo chicken wrap due to one review saying it was the best. It was good, but definitely not the best. The sauce was a little watery and didn't adhere to the chicken that well. Also, the chilaquiles were not quite what I'm used to. I prefer mine drenched in a nice red or green sauce and they used salsa vs sauce. Also, another plus if you are a tot fan is that the breakfast potatoes are actually smashed tots!! Overall I'm super happy we found this place and this will definitely be part of our usual brunch rotation!

3.description: The hot wings are pretty good and so are the nachos.  The burger is a bit too salty and the fries suck.  Cool place to watch Sunday football though.  Lots of tvs.

35.description: My close proximity to Delux makes it my go to bar when I am looking for a chill place to grab a drink.  The bartenders are friendly and they have a good beer selection.  I have had a few of their dinner options and I love everything they have with buffalo chicken.  I just wish they had more healthy dining options; I would definitely come here much more often if that were the case.

19.description: Moved a couple blocks down from here, and after 2 weeks, I've already been here 3 times. I've gone on weekday nights, sometime around 8/9 pm and its usually been me and maybe 8-10 people in there, so pretty slow. They have great drink specials, including $3 Goose Island on Tuesdays and $3 Stellas, so great place to grab a beer after a day of work.While the menu has most of the typical items you'd see at a bar (wings/burgers/nachos), They tend to take them all up a nothc. I've had the Buffalo chicken egg rolls, the southwest chicken wrap and nachos with pull prok, and they have all been excellent. So glad to be living near a place that is a short walk, and will provide great service and some great food.Can't wait until Hockey/Football Season when I can see this place getting pretty full.

28.description: Moved a couple blocks down from here, and after 2 weeks, I've already been here 3 times. I've gone on weekday nights, sometime around 8/9 pm and its usually been me and maybe 8-10 people in there, so pretty slow. They have great drink specials, including $3 Goose Island on Tuesdays and $3 Stellas, so great place to grab a beer after a day of work.While the menu has most of the typical items you'd see at a bar (wings/burgers/nachos), They tend to take them all up a nothc. I've had the Buffalo chicken egg rolls, the southwest chicken wrap and nachos with pull prok, and they have all been excellent. So glad to be living near a place that is a short walk, and will provide great service and some great food.Can't wait until Hockey/Football Season when I can see this place getting pretty full.

45.description: Ahhhh...Delux.  I've spent numerous nights/days/afternoons here throughout the years.  As a lot of my friends live(d) nearby, we would make this our destination when we needed to slam shots (multiple ones), vent about life fails (mostly guy related) or indulge in some yummy food (hello tater tots!).  Oh, and darts and multiple tv's.  I have to mention those!  It's been a great destination every single time.  Because of this, I suggested having a combined birthday brunch here.  We were lucky enough to have the high top tables reserved for us as about 30 of our friends celebrated with us!  Service was AMAZING.  Not only did the waitress let us start our own separate tabs, but she KNEW our names!  Perfect. Best experience in a big group, let me tell you!(The only one missing was Krys B.  as she introduced me to this place.  Miss ya!)

33.description: I stopped here for lunch. WHY?!?! Because my co-workers said that they have great specials and great fries (i live for fries with mayo). First of all it was COLD in here. The weather was cold and i did not understand why they had alllllll the windows open. I took a seat at the bar and my server/bartender was just rude. I mean i haven't even placed an order yet and she gave me a nasty attitude! I am aware that i have a very slight accent but she kept saying "HUH and  WHAT" its not liken i was speaking in a foreign language. I mean seriously her "huh and what" really pissed me off.I ordered the burger special for $ 6.00 plus fries. I asked for a medium well burger and my burger was literally burned, super greasy and I did not have what i wanted on it which was; cheese, lettuce, tomato, raw onions and ketchup. How do you get this wrong? Honestly if she would have gotten my food correct and the burger less greasy; it could have been good. I took maybe two bites of it and asked for my check.Now in my experiences if you see a customer barely touching their food, YOU AS THE SERVER, YOU ARE SUPPOSED TO ASK WHATS WRONG. Well this server/bartender just looked at me and took my food.BTW its the very very tall blond behind the bar that was serving meWont be coming back!

43.description: A nic e looking neighborhood bar that is far superior to neighborhood bars in the suburbs. It is in the midst of condo rehabbed buildings and it has a very young crowd in the bar and the neighborhood. The televisions are placed in all the right places and beer selction decent along with the service. Good quality windows and chairs.

2.description: I've only been here for lunch and the food has always been good.The chicken tortilla soup smells delicious. And the taste is amazing down to the last spoon. I decided to try a different salad today. I had the Asian chicken salad. The fried won ton strips made it nice and crunchy. They fry them per order is great. But it makes the salad very oily. Next time I'll ask if they could dab the oil a bit more. Great place for lunch...at a bar.

18.description: Chorizo Taco Plate.  'nuff said.Bartender's pretty cool too.

41.description: Stopped here for lunch earlier today with some coworkers. We split the tots appetizer, and it was absolutely delicious - in the guiltiest way possible. I ordered the buffalo rap for my entree, as opposed to the sliders which would have been my second choice. The rap was very good, I'd say top 3 that i've had in Chicago. We didnt have any drinks, and it was relatively empty, but I would imagine it would be a decent spot to grab drinks after work. Definitely reccomend the food.

52.description: I love this place.  Eat here all the time.  Their salads are excellent, and the sliders are very unique and all quite good.  The atmosphere is very laid back.  Gets a little busy around brunch on the weekends, but otherwise you can always get a seat and the staff is great.  A great neighborhood bar.  Highly recommended!

50.description: I'm from St. Louis, and I stopped in here because it was between the train station and where I walked to pick up my rental truck.  The BEST burger I have ever had.  Ever.  [*edit - I was just reading some of my previous reviews, and I believe that actually, the burger I had at The Chuckbox in Tempe Arizona may have been better...]The place was not very crowded, but looked like it was the type of place that gets super packed on Friday nights.  I liked the decor, and the bartender was friendly without being intrusive.  Thanks, Delux, for making my brief trip to Chicago a super awesome trip!

4.description: This place has the most underrated bar food around.  From their burgers, to their wraps, their pizza, everything is good here.  Great place to watch a game and have a beer.  The service isn't the best, but they keep up most of the time.

6.description: My favorite River West bar, and a great bar all-around.  Cheap drinks, quick service, plenty of space, a full menu, and some TVs are actually tuned to the news!  If you're in the area (and even if you're not and just looking for something new), come on over!

22.description: Some if the best mozzarella sticks in the city!!!My friend was defeated by the huge portions of nachos, but she said they were good! The staff was able to change the channels to the games that we wanted to watch which was great.

15.description: Nice so far, I'm ordering a take out even that it's nice inside. 4/5 they have no pineapple so no Hawaiian pizza choice.

57.description: I love that this place is never too busy. They have a pool table, dart board, and my fave - trivia game at the bar. Always have fun here. Service is good too. Still need to try the food.

20.description: Came here for brunch the other day. Superb brunch. Service and atmosphere were good as well, though the location is pretty inconvenient for most everyone I think.Had the corned beef hash skillet. Massive amount of food, delicious hash with a hefty portion of corned beef. I would definitely get it again. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the other filling ingredients were very tasty.I'd definitely return for brunch and would probably be willing to try it some night as well....though I'd be sure to order the food when I go at night.

36.description: Bad idea. One of the yuckiest meals I've received in quite sometime. Maybe go for a drink, but steer clear of the food. Bad, bad idea. Scouts honor.

14.description: I stopped here for lunch. WHY?!?! Because my co-workers said that they have great specials and great fries (i live for fries with mayo). First of all it was COLD in here. The weather was cold and i did not understand why they had alllllll the windows open. I took a seat at the bar and my server/bartender was just rude. I mean i haven't even placed an order yet and she gave me a nasty attitude! I am aware that i have a very slight accent but she kept saying "HUH and  WHAT" its not liken i was speaking in a foreign language. I mean seriously her "huh and what" really pissed me off.I ordered the burger special for $ 6.00 plus fries. I asked for a medium well burger and my burger was literally burned, super greasy and I did not have what i wanted on it which was; cheese, lettuce, tomato, raw onions and ketchup. How do you get this wrong? Honestly if she would have gotten my food correct and the burger less greasy; it could have been good. I took maybe two bites of it and asked for my check.Now in my experiences if you see a customer barely touching their food, YOU AS THE SERVER, YOU ARE SUPPOSED TO ASK WHATS WRONG. Well this server/bartender just looked at me and took my food.BTW its the very very tall blond behind the bar that was serving meWont be coming back!

1.description: People need to relax, it's a diner, not a 5 star restaurant,  and for what it is, it's pretty dam good and yes the thing to get is the skirt stake. Super friendly people, fast service, and great prices.

9.description: Been coming here for 10 years for breakfast and lunch. Everything I've had has been really good. My favorite is the skirt steak breakfast with eggs. For lunch I always get the Art's burger and if I go healthy I go with their salads.

23.description: A conveniently located simple grill that hits the spot with a couple of egg sanwiches for breakfast! Just off the Kennedy at North Avenue. If I'm going on a road trip, this is where I fuel up beforehand. A little salt, a little grease, heaven.

12.description: The best. Fast, courteous delivery. The food is super cheap and delicious. So far I've tried the cheese fries, fish sandwich, chicken kabob plate, egg and cheese sandwich and garden salad. All were so good, especially the egg and cheese sandwich - which is quite a feat given that it's just eggs, american cheese and a french roll - and the cheese fries. Everything is really, really flavorful and tastes like good quality food, which is super impressive considering the prices. Btw - they do healthy food well too. I got the garden salad for $2.95 expecting crappy brown lettuce and some pale tomatoes, and got a huge, beautiful salad with ripe tomatoes, cucumbers, onions and hardboiled eggs. Highly recommend Art's for really good food at ridiculously cheap prices.

21.description: Fast quality food.  Great daily specials.  Breakfast or lunch here is great, omelettes, hash browns, skirt steak & eggs.  Power home made soups.  Try the Art's Burger for lunch.  A classic Chicago fast food restaurant which delivers quality food day in & day out.

16.description: Tasty, cheap, reliable, and a very decent place (although there will be a lot of grease). The shrimp dinner is my favorite (comes with garlic bread and fries); but the tuna melt on pita is also very nice. Not much seating, but you don't expect that in a diner anyway. My colleagues and I drive here all the time for lunch; it's that good.

17.description: Nice, clean and open for breakfast. I always get the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich with lettuce and tomato and mayo.....amazingly delicious.

10.description: I order off of Eat24 from these guys, and the delivery charge indicated $0.  I decided to order from them and give the delivery guy a good tip.  Food came, and I was handed a different bill with a $5 delivery charge.  Eat 24 still charged me, gave me $5 coupon, and told me the manager of Art's added the charge.  I called him and ask to explain, and when I told him this was unacceptable, he didn't apologize and then cursed at me.  I guess when you order $#%T food, you get $#%T service.  Food was okay.

5.description: I wouldn't recommend going here if you're on a diet, but if you're in the mood for some old school greasy-spoon hedonism, this is a good spot to scarf down some calories!Oddly enough, this place does not have, and never had, a drive in - something I confirmed with the manager.  I always assumed it did, just driving by, so imagine my surprise when I pulled up and there was no entry.  Luckily I have legs, so I got out, went inside, and got myself lunch.I had the patty melt and fries. The prices were affordable and the food was fast.  The fries were very good, perfectly fried and not greasy.  The patty melt was good too; the burger was obviously not recently grilled, but what do you expect for $6 bucks?  All in all, it was fresher and tastier than fast food, and they were also super friendly and nice.

11.description: I had never been to this place but I stopped to pick up an offer for a friend.  The grease smell hit me coming through the door. Older dude behind the counter was rude, he mistakenly took the order to be "five" instead of "fried"- and actually expected me to pay for his own mistake and wanted to argue with me, smh this was my FIRST & LAST visit!

22.description: This place has a nice variety of food.  However it's a little to small to handle the lunch rush hour. Not my number one choice for a quick bite.

0.description: This is one of my boyfriend's favorite restaurants in the city. He always gets the steak here. I have had a few items and they are really tasty and hearty. Most recently, I had the vegetable soup and the turkey and bacon club. Both were flavorful and delicious. I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't as greasy as I thought it would be. The staff is really nice. The prices are reasonable as well. I can imagine how busy they could be if it had a lot of seating but mostly standing room and 2 tables.

20.description: It probably helps that this is one of 2 restaurants in a food desert on the corner of North and Elston. Probably also helps that this is 2 blocks from my office. Regardless, I really enjoy Arts. Really quenches that grease craving I get every once in a while. Of course they pretty much have everything on the menu. My personal favorite is the Maxwell Polish. AMAZING!! Not sure why....maybe because they grill AND deep fry....that's right! Deep fry the sausage. It is cardiac arrest heaven on a bun!! I do eat other thing as well, but keep going back to that damn Polish!! Johnny, the owner is awesome as well. He knows every ones name, their "usual" order and has it ready in minutes! There is parking but I always feel better walking those two blocks back and forth knowing that I'm not a complete slob!

19.description: It probably helps that this is one of 2 restaurants in a food desert on the corner of North and Elston. Probably also helps that this is 2 blocks from my office. Regardless, I really enjoy Arts. Really quenches that grease craving I get every once in a while. Of course they pretty much have everything on the menu. My personal favorite is the Maxwell Polish. AMAZING!! Not sure why....maybe because they grill AND deep fry....that's right! Deep fry the sausage. It is cardiac arrest heaven on a bun!! I do eat other thing as well, but keep going back to that damn Polish!! Johnny, the owner is awesome as well. He knows every ones name, their "usual" order and has it ready in minutes! There is parking but I always feel better walking those two blocks back and forth knowing that I'm not a complete slob!

2.description: Maybe  it was a bad day. Maybe it was the wrong menu choice. I was doing business on the northside and was craving grease. I saw the sign and pulled right in. The menu was expansive, but almost to the point of being busy and too much to visually handle. I saw an 8oz patty melt was on special, so I went for it. Now I must say, the crinkle cut fries were perfect. Perfectly golden  with just the right amount of salt and on the well-done side of crispy. Outstanding The patty melt was not good. The burger was maybe 6oz when pre-cooked. It had the consistency and size of a McD's quarter pounder without any of the taste.  However, the rye was pretty good. I now understand that the skirt steak is the thing to get here. And if I come here again,I'll give it a whirl. But in my experience, the burger quality here is little more than dog food

18.description: great breakfast joint ask for the chorizo ( mexican sauage ) and egg,cheese,peppers sandwich its the best.

13.description: Good Dog, but $4.35 for a dog, no fries, and a small coke at a hotdog "dive" is a too much. Go 2 blocks down the Home Depot and get as good a dog for 1/2 the cost.

4.description: Been a loooooooong time since I been here, and I only stopped because i didn't frequent the area as much....this place has been here 14 years, and the food is awesome.  Skirt Steak, Italian Beef (in my own opinion) The Art Burger, and the Rib-eye steak.  Good stuff man.Shakes are good, and the owners are friendly.  This place does do delivery (it out sources it) and they have a lot, but it is small, and on the corner.  SO careful coming in or out of it.  But otherwise it is pretty awesome.  Try the frappe shakes.Also mind the hours....my friend had breakfast here and he loved it, but he is open pretty early, so I think he closes by 6 pm.

6.description: Awesome place! Plenty of room and large windows to sit down and chow down the amazing grub and Not feel trapped. Tried the cheeseburger, it was great , came back today and tried the art'a burger, pretzel bun with a special cheese, and a huge party, simply destroyed this thing :) great place, fast food, and great service.Will be back!

15.description: Check out the Daily Special meal for something delicious.I love this place. I'm addicted to the gyros. The pita is always soft and fluffy, the meat isn't dry and the sauce is tasty. I love that I can get a slice of American cheese and giardiniera peppers on it without strange stares.For breakfast 2+2+2+2 (The four deuces) is my favorite. Two pancakes, two eggs, two sausage and two bacon. YummyI've tried to eat my way around the menu, skirt steak, hot dogs, kabobs and chicken. But, do yourself a favor and ask John to build you a double fish sandwich with cheese and onion. Yes, I said onion. It's not on the menu, but the flavors are so yummy. But be ready to take a nap afterwards.

7.description: Solid, average diner food.  Did the Art's 2x2x2 this morning (pancakes, bacon, eggs), and for $5, this was plenty of food.  The pancakes were rich, buttery, and the store-bought syrup worked very well for me.  Eggs were cooked just right and the bacon was way too crispy.  The decor is as divey as a place like this should be, but with Choppers or Hollywood closer to my Bucktown home, it's hard to imagine a repeat visit.

8.description: I ordered a large Catering Order from Art's Drive in for a business meeting.  The traveling meeting participants said they travel for work all year round and all throughout the country and this Catered meal from Art's Drive In was Excellent and by far one of the best meal they have had in years.  I have been catering work events from Art's Drive In for years and have NEVER had a bad review.  They always want to re-order and take home leftovers!  Orders are always ready at the time of pick up or if delivered they are always on time, pleasant and include everything needed for serving food.

3.description: Delicious place! They have the best breakfast and coffee. My favorite lunch sandwich is the chicken sandwich on pita bread! The best,, John is super cool and down to earth! Always has a smile on his face and his dad as well!

14.description: Yup!  Just waht my belly wanted.  Some classic dogs meant for a real appetite.  No frills just great food

36.description: I came here to get my first tattoo on the recommendation of a friend  and was not disappointed. The space is very nice and clean, all the staff was super friendly and helpful. The process was very efficient as I was in and out in about an hour and a half. My artist was Frank, his work was excellent and he was great at walking me through everything and letting me know where he was in the process at it was happening. After we were done he was also great at walking me through the process for taking care of the tattoo over the next few days. If I get more I will definitely be going back to him!

29.description: Don't bother going anywhere else in Chicago.  The artists always deliver, customer service is great, and the atmosphere is welcoming.  I've brought my family and friends to the shop for tattoo's and every artist has been amazing.

42.description: Just started my Half Sleeve today by Nick.  What a great guy.  He took me in last minute, drew up some amazing pieces and did the outline today.  This guy is lightning fast with a steady hand.  Straight lines, awesome artwork, couldnt of asked for anyone better.  I have found the guy who will be doing all my work for years to come.  Not to mention I already referred 2 buddies and my wife to use him as well.  You cant go wrong with anyone at Great Lakes, it was just a great atmosphere there.  All the work I saw, was top notch.  Thanks again Nick if you are reading this and cant wait for the next 3-4 weeks to go by to get started on the color.

23.description: Professional, clean, amazing artists and guest artists. Great tattoo from Nick, and will be going back for more. I've recommended them several times, especially to out-of-towners looking for quality work! They're the best!

31.description: Best tattoo shop around, period. * Awesome, professional tattooers and friendly folks* Great flash from the artists covering the walls* Photos from Chicago's tattoo history* Comfortable, unique spaceIf you want a great tattoo at a fair price, this is the place to go. Pick from the wall or have them draw something up for you, you will not be disappointed.

34.description: I've had the pleasure of getting tattooed by most of the Great Lakes Tattoo staff. Great Lakes has created an amazing and unique space and has set the bar high for all tattoo shops to follow. This is the best place to get your first tattoo or your 100th. Clean space, knowledgable staff, and a welcoming environment will make any patron feel comfortable and excited to be there.

16.description: Absolutely wonderful!Got my first tattoo here on a vacation from Australia and it was great. Nick was very friendly and even though I had an easy design they didn't turn me away. Was in and out fast and very affordable. Will definitely go again if I'm ever in Chicago :)

11.description: I have probably sat for close to 100 hours of tattooing. That being said, this is the absolute NICEST looking and CLEANEST shop I have ever been in. The staff here is super talented and helpful. While they do mainly American traditional work, this is by no means all they are capable of. Traditional has an emphasis on clean lines, good dimension, and proper shading. Since the guys here are experts at that, they can do anything. I've seen everything from tribal, script, new school, to japanese done here and not once have I seen a sub-par tattoo. Just go!

39.description: I just had work done today by Matthew "Beatdown" Ziolko. Not only did he do an awesome job on the tattoo, he made sure it was EXACTLY how I wanted it. He re-positioned it 4 times to make sure it looked good to me. He also touched up little things that I wanted done with the finished product, THEN he fixed a tattoo I got from a shitty artist a few months back. The whole time he was really friendly, asked me questions regarding artistic decisions with the design, etc. I'm definitely going back to get my next two planned out tattoos done here, by him. A friend of mine that was with  me is also now planning to get his work done there too. OH, I was referred to him through another friend who only gets his work done by Beatdown. Definitely check this guy/place out!

37.description: I came in here with some friends to get my first tattoo bc their usual place was closed for some unfortunate reason. I knew about what I wanted and when we were going back and forth I had to converse with the front desk manager and not directly with the artist. By the time I revised the design to be what I wanted I think they were being nice about it but? They quoted me $2-300 for a simple arm band. Ok great so we made it smaller, only 1/2 band and reduced the size a bit. It took 20 minutes, the artist was very nice, but after all is said and done my tattoo cost $200 and my friend got an inside forearm tattoo with full color that took twice as long that cost $280. I kept asking the manager questions about their pricing and am feeling gypped. I want to go back for the rest of the arm band but most likely I will go somewhere else. I don't understand the tattoo attitude and wish my first experience would have been a little better. Maybe Mario just charges more than the other guys....**I got 1/2 of an arm band in the end and it still cost $200. Do the math here. If you want to pay for this shop's overhead then go here. If not, go somewhere else.

0.description: I had a tattoo done by Mario Desa on Saturday, on a whim. I had decided I wanted to visit this place after being repeatedly recommended by Rob Benavides from Flying Panther in San Diego, and Travis Antoni. Two tattooers I respect and admire very much. The tattoo process was quick, I came just at the right time. Front desk help was courteous and considerate - not at all rude as I read in a previous review. Mario was unreal. He was very polite and of course extremely talented. I really enjoyed my time at Great Lakes, and Mario will definitely be my go-to-guy from now on. Thanks guys.

38.description: Friendly, knowledgeable and professional. I recently got a piece of work done on my shoulder from Matt at the shop. I came in with a picture of sort of what I wanted and talked about what I actually wanted with Matt for a few minutes. He took a drawing of the area and told me his opinions on what he thought would look good and where. When I came in to see the picture it was amazing, and just what I had pictured in my  head, I loved it instantly. Getting the work done everyone in the shop was very friendly and made me feel very comfortable. Mid way through my session I started feeling a little faint and everyone was very attentive immediately. Candy and water was brought over while Matt didn't make me feel rushed to finish. Its defiantly my favorite tattoo and will be going back.

27.description: I loved this place so much that I actually got a Yelp profile just to rate them!I got my first-ever tattoo by Erik on a Saturday night, without appointment (but called in advance). The light paperwork and consultation was quick and enthusiastic. I got a quote right away and it was in the range I was anticipating. He was patient and explained everything to me and put me immediately at ease. For my first time tattoo, he was a great artist because he had a steady hand, was fun to talk to, but was still very professional. Within minutes, it was done! It looks great, is perfectly centered, and is exactly what I said I wanted. He went over the care routine for the tattoo thoroughly and said that if there were any issues after it healed to come back and he would fix it up, no charge. I very highly recommend!PS: My boyfriend also got a tat the same night but from Frank, and it was spot-on, including the hand-lettering he designed to accompany the image. Great place!

32.description: Their motto doesn't misrepresent: "Cleanliness & Civility" and then some. If you want to ensure a great tattoo experience in the Midwest (or anywhere), this is the shop to visit. Can't go wrong with anybody working here. Love this shop.

13.description: Can't say enough good things about this shop. Whether you're getting something custom or from flash, all the guys at the shop do incredible work. And they have the best selection of guest artists, too! It's not difficult to get an appointment, but you also get great pieces done when just walking in. There is such a great vibe in the shop that you wish you could stay and hang out.  I've been tattooed here countless times. All around awesome place.

24.description: Great service from Mario and the Great Lakes tattoo team.

7.description: I'm by no means an expert ( I only have 4 tatts) but Nick and his staff made this my best experience ever!

40.description: The finest tattoo parlor in the country.I have well over 80 hours of tattooing on my, and a significant chunk of it was done by artists from this shop.  They know exactly what they are doing.  Talent, skill, passion, and inspiration have combined to give this place a special niche in the tattoo world.  It says all that needs be said that professional tattooers come from all over the world to work guest spot here.In addition to the finest tattooing around, Nick and company have created a virtual museum of the history of tattooing here.  They didn't simply rent a storefront and set-up a few chairs, they designed this space to showcase the art and craft of tattooing, and it certainly does.If you want a tattoo that you can be proud of for the rest of your life, or you want to immerse yourself in the history of tattooing, or you simply want to spend an hour taking in the art and ephemera displayed on the walls, this is the place to go.

30.description: No need to go anywhere else in the city. I have gotten tattoos from most of the people in the shop and have never been disappointed. They have great original flash from some of my favorite tattoo artists. Great guest spots too.Plus they have a gallery downstairs where they showcase artists every couple months, and pop up events.  Always worth checking out. Thanks Great Lakes Tattoo! See you soon

1.description: World class service! #GLT #chicagosfinestFast. And so accommodating. My mom and I got matching tattoos to celebrate our birthdays. Nick & company made sure the drawing was ideal and the placement was spot on! For her first and only tattoo, mom enjoyed the experience. Thanks guys!

9.description: Great experience! My friends and I walked in on a Sunday afternoon. They were able to see us within 15 minutes, and they were very friendly and helpful! Reasonably priced and great quality work. We were all pleased with the experience! Thank you!!!

26.description: I have multiple tattoos and my only regret is that I didn't have Nick do all of them - I may have him fix some of them though - that's for sure.  I learned of GLT because I had a client speak highly of them, so I went there to see about a forearm tattoo - complex black and white with some small elements of color.  It was perfectly executed - PERFECTLY.  The details were great, the shading was perfect and there is not a single thing I would change.  It was fairly priced and Nick seriously knows his stuff.  His touch is light, his lines are exceptional but more importantly, the ambiance of this tattoo shop is wonderful.  Some places feel like the artists are renting space and there is no connection between them (as a collective group) or any great loyalty to the place in which they are working.  With GLT, one feels like it is a group of professionals, all with their specialties, all familiar with each other and each other's personalities - I love this shop and Nick is the only one I will go to when I get my next tattoo.  I can not recommend them highly enough.  Also, unlike the horrible experience I had with another well known tattoo shop in the center of Bucktown - who is also about to get reviewed by me - Nick and his whole operation NEVER ever made me feel like they were doing me a favor by doing the tattoo - the whole experience was pleasant in every way possible.  Again, can not recommend Nick and Great Lakes highly enough.  Do NOT get a tattoo before at the very least consulting with this wonderful addition to the Chicago tattoo world.

25.description: This place is the essence of tattoo parlor! The ambiance is so Chicago. Artists are highly skilled and deliver high quality work. I got a foot tattoo by Frank in August. I walked in & was told to come back in about 1 hour. Not bad for a summer day.  The prices are higher than what I've paid @ other spots in the country but so be it- it's totally worth the experience! Thanks GLT!

12.description: This is a shop to check out whether you're from the area or from anywhere in the world. This shop promotes high quality tattooing and plays a huge role in preserving tattoo history and providing an authentic shop atmosphere. I've been to a lot of shops and have been tattooed by so many people and I regret that I've only been here once.
