I am counting down the days until I can stop by again and get tattooed or just hang out because their art is so awesome. I love their celebrity sausage thing and it was the reason I finally came by and checked them out since they had one of my favorite tattooer's as a guest. I am seriously blown away by how clean and spacious the shop is. It could almost pass off as a mini museum or something with how clean and fancy it looks. With such old school tattooer's in the shop and such a high reputation you kind of expect them to be snobby or assholes. Definitely not the case. Everyone is very nice and professional along with holding some impressive years of experience under their belt. If you get the chance to stop by this shop, don't let it pass you by.

21.description: GLT is on point to say the least.  I was blessed with a breathtaking portrait of my deceased pops by Miles.  This man is LEGIT and a true wizard with the gun.  I was very hesitant getting a portrait until I saw Miles work.  His ability to capture life like images on skin is second to none.  Not to mention, he's an extremely humble and chill dude that genuinely cares about the finish product and leaving his clients jaw droppin.  The shop is impeccably clean and well decorated.  Plenty of tattoo relics to check out while you wait which was a really nice touch.  Feels like the Field museum of ink.  Not sure if there are many other shops that can step to the ambiance of this unique space.  The receptionist is super nice and helpful as well.  None of that agro tattoo shop vibe in this establishment.  Thanks Miles, you really killed it!!

17.description: Today was my first time in the shop. I was wanting to fill a spot I had left on my leg. I called ahead to make sure they had availability to do walk ins. They said someone will be available. So I head up there. Told the front desk worker what I wanted. She asked where at and then went and got a book for me to choose from. She sized it and had me fill out some paperwork when the artist set up. Once it started it was over in a little over an hour. Turned out great and was placed perfectly between my other tattoos. Everyone I talked to were nice and I would recommend this place to my friends.

10.description: Absolutely great experience. Tattoo Artist, Miles:Just started working with Miles (check out his instagram at @milesmaniaci) and couldn't be happier. From the beginning he has been great to work with and understood immediately what I wanted. His portrait skills are amazing - very much looking forward continuing with my tattoo.The Shop & Staff:Very professional and nice. Had to make some changes to an appointment and had no problem. The shop is extremely clean and always busy (a very good sign).

5.description: Best tattoo shop in Chicago. The space is beautifully filled with talented artwork and flash. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The artists are amazingly skilled at their craft, Beatdown is super cool. Check it out, you won't be disappointed!

35.description: Three of my friends and I were walk in appointments. We all had ideas of what we wanted and where. All of our artists were very professional. They made sure we were calm and relaxed. The place is clean and nice. Love the atmosphere.

19.description: Professional, clean, amazing artists and guest artists. Great tattoo from Nick, and will be going back for more. I've recommended them several times, especially to out-of-towners looking for quality work! They're the best!

28.description: Stopped by the shop for the first time last weekend. Great experience. Staff was knowledgable and talented. Eric banged out three killer pieces fore and two friends. Quality was excellent pricing was fair and staff were a lot of fun.

3.description: Holy cow these guys are fast! This was only my second tattoo (both small), but Matt did a better job in less time, for a tattoo about twice the size as my first. Granted, I got my first tattoo from a young guy in a back alley place in Vietnam (not advisable, but at least everything turned out ok...). I walked into Great Lakes on a Friday at around 3:30pm (no appointment), and by 4:10 I was done! My tattoo is Hebrew script about 2.5x3.5"-ish and he made it look even cleaner and nicer than my original print! I knew I wanted the tattoo on my shoulder blade, but I wasn't sure where, especially since I have these crazy "winged" shoulder blades. Matt was super nice and advised me on where he thought would look best, and I'm really happy with it! Everyone was incredibly friendly and the salon is impeccably clean and well kept up. Obviously, I'm not well-versed in tattoo pricing, but they charged $150, which I thought that was pretty reasonable!I will definitely be back for any future tattoos I get! Thanks again, Matt!

33.description: GLT is the best tattoo shop I've been to - not only is everyone friendly but the shop is beautiful. I've been tattooed by Frank and Nick, both who were incredibly professional and willing to listen to my ideas. I've never been disappointed. Not only is it fun to get tattooed there, the atmosphere makes you feel apart of their family. Definitely recommend to anyone in the Chicago area looking to get tattooed from some of the best artists out there.

43.description: THE BEST!!!  The minute we walked in we knew this place was something special. We were warmly greeted by Brandon at the desk (I know his name because he was so damn nice I actually wanted to know it and shake his hand) who acted as a liaison between us and the tattoo artists. Matt "Beatdown"  kindly took us as walk-ins. The whole session for both me and my boyfriend went completely great. There are no weird "too cool for school" egos that you often find in shops around town. Not to mention, the space is so clean and gorgeous. Really thoughtful design and great attention to detail went into this shop which makes it feel extra pleasant to be there. We are super happy to have FINALLY found our shop and can't wait to get so much more work done there. Thanks Great Lakes!

2.description: I had a 3 year old outline of a tattoo that I had gotten elsewhere and decided to go to GLT yesterday to get it fixed up and filled in.  Kevin Leary gave me a beautiful brand new tattoo, his rose work is awesome.  I probably won't go anywhere else for a tattoo after visiting GLT.

18.description: No need to go anywhere else in the city. I have gotten tattoos from most of the people in the shop and have never been disappointed. They have great original flash from some of my favorite tattoo artists. Great guest spots too.Plus they have a gallery downstairs where they showcase artists every couple months, and pop up events.  Always worth checking out. Thanks Great Lakes Tattoo! See you soon

41.description: Awesome place..good prices great artists. .and no egos. Came in to get my navy tattoos and Frank W did my tattoo. Never meet a cooler dude and the whole staff was like that. The shop is awesome I am definitely coming back to get more. Would recommend 100%

4.description: This shop really is the best in Chicago. The space is absolutely beautiful, incredibly clean, and full of great art! I've been tattooed here twice and both times have been fantastic! I would recommend any of the artist here because they are all super talented!

6.description: Excellent work, great staff and a nice shop. Ted took care of me as a walk-in and Mike delivered two great tattoos exactly what I wanted. I highly recommend and will be back.A+

22.description: Absolutely wonderful!Got my first tattoo here on a vacation from Australia and it was great. Nick was very friendly and even though I had an easy design they didn't turn me away. Was in and out fast and very affordable. Will definitely go again if I'm ever in Chicago :)

15.description: I came here with my husband to get tattoos to celebrate his birthday.  I have never gotten a tattoo before & thought I knew exactly what I wanted, but the detail was too much for the size I was looking for.  I asked the chick up front a ton of questions - everything from what looks good on ghost white skin to how the process works.  She was totally cool and didn't seem phased by my pathetic woes. Mike did my tattoo and was amazing.  I told him I was very nervous & again, all my questions were answered & he made me feel really comfortable.  I got a small tattoo below my right ankle and love it!  I plan on coming back for my next one.....they deserve my business for being so helpful while I was so nervous.

20.description: I came here based in a referral from a friend, and I was not disappointed. I sat down with Mario for my first session yesterday and was impressed by his professionalism and the shops cleanliness. I am having a tattoo covered and reworked, and he has offered helpful suggestions to make sure I end up with something that looks good. I feel that he respected my initial idea, and offered his opinion tactfully.  After my first session, I have a better idea of where this is going to go and I'm pretty excited about it. Overall, I would recommend Mario and this shop to anyone.

8.description: Best shop in Chicago/ Midwest/ America/ The World. Let me break it down for you. IF YOU want a naked girl, (illustrated of corse) inside of a martini glass, (definitely illustrated cause martini glasses are small) then this is the place where you and you're tattoo fantasies come true. We'll mine did. IF YOU want luxuriously hand crafted cursive text this is a place where not only you would find that, but an employee will inevitably say "her/his name can always get covered up with a very black panther."IF YOU have any idea, what so ever, this is the place for you.And on top of all that!!! The shop has a very pleasant atmosphere. It's very spacious and clean and not to mention - they have impeccably framed art on the walls.Great Lakes Tattoo is an A+ #1.

14.description: I can't recommend this place enough, and I do. I came here for my first tattoo and I was NERVOUS. We walked in and the guy at the front desk was welcoming, helpful and super knowledgeable from the beginning. He fit us right in and we were out in almost thirty minutes.These guys are all super experienced tattoo artists who could have laughed at my nervousness. But instead, they did a great job helping me relax. Matt was super fast and nice to me the whole time. He complimented my design - which was a small and somewhat simple design from a piece of my grandma's jewelry. I was just so impressed with how efficient, professional and kind everyone was. He gave a lot of great input about the placement, and because it's kind of a challenging place, I could tell a less experienced artist probably wouldn't have done it as perfectly in this spot. My friend got a tattoo at the same time, and her artist joked with me while I waited. They all made me feel like a valued customer and made me feel great about my tattoo.This is definitely a great place to go for experienced, professional tattoo artists. But don't be afraid to come here for smaller or first tattoos, either, because it's a great first experience. I've never not received a compliment on my tattoo, and I'll continue recommending Great Lakes to everyone.

58.description: So maybe I had high expectations for a "Punk Bar" that has been around since the early 80's, but this place was anything but punk. The bartender felt she deserved a massive tip just because she was in a bikini and was showing off her super-original angel wing tattoos (ha!). I think not. We had beers, all she had to was hand them to us and we could do the rest. We decided to see what was going on upstairs and some guy in mesh sleeves and guyliner was playing some industrial crap way too loud. Then some dude who called himself "Steve-O" (you can tell these people are creative) was spinning fire. Indoors. On a wood floor. Following Steve-O was the president of the high-school-angst trench-coat mafia club. Just the stupidest bar I have ever been to.

56.description: You know how you might have a couple of places that you're embarrassed you frequent? Well this is one of mine.  I met Ron Jeremy there of all people, that should speak for itself.They have a late license and are open till 4am on Friday, 5am on Saturday.  The music on Saturdays (2nd floor) alternates from good to decent electro, alternative, industrial, to ghetto old school depending on the guest djs.  The crowd is very eclectic.....sometimes.The first floor is your basic bar and plays a nice variety of industrial, metal, punk rock off somebody's iPod.  When the music sucks upstairs, I'll usually head downstairs to give my ears a break.Drink prices are pretty high, $4 for PBR and they don't have a good selection of craft beer.About the best thing here is the Tamale Guy who shows up around 3am with delicious cheese or chicken tamales which he sells by the half dozen.  Sometimes I go here just because I'll know I can get some tamales to take home.

29.description: I thought I'd give this place another chance, but of course, no good deed goes unpunished: Sit down and order my usual, a Guinness and a shot of Jameson, the latter of which I was appalled to see placed before me in a phthalate-laden plastic thimble (see pic).  On the hierarchy of glassware, this is a few rungs below the plastic measuring cups that come with a bottle Vicks, and in the hierarchy of drinking establishments, it's something you'd expect to see at a post-frat douche bar on Rush Street --maybe that's what Exit is aspiring to be now.  I'd never seen a shot served up that way here before, and I'd like to say that I never will again because that's the last chance I'll be giving this once quasi-sacred place, but sadly that's probably not true (see below).  All the criticisms in the previous review remain in effect, though I guess some old staff members still work here. Seriously, this is now officially the most un-punk spectacle in town, and makes The Alley look like Ian MacKaye.  It's now basically Tais Til 4 for people with sightly better taste in music and more interesting pasts. The exact same criteria (4 a.m. license, inebriated judgment, etc.) are the only reasons that would ever lead someone to darken the door of either shithole.

42.description: I've been to the Exit several times with no problems. I even played a couple of shows there with my old band. But my latest and possibly last experience left a sour taste in my mouth. I decided that I would meet up with my buddy for a night of firespinning, absinthe and debauchery. After 2 rounds of absinthe at $9 a pop and a can of pbr at 3$ (thanks Donnie!) my bill came out to $58. WTF?!? I politely informed the bartender that my bill was incorrect. She looked it over, apologized and knocked the total down to $46. I looked at her and said "I'm sorry but this isn't correct." To which she responded "I haven't been drinking" I told her that no one said she was and asked to speak to the manager. 10 minutes later the bouncer shows up. I explained the situation to him and he had enough sense to get the actual manager. Meanwhile Donnie is sitting in quite possibly the most awkward situation of his life. Torn between his loyalty to his friend and his desire to "get more drunker" he exudes discomfort. A small amount is visible on his brow. 25 minutes after being astronomically overcharged the manager finally shows up. I explain to him the situation and after several re-tellings of the story to check for sobriety and an explanation of how my bill was mathematically impossible based on the number of drinks my bartender charger me for he agrees to charge me for $18. Like I said, I haven't had any problems with the Exit prior to this. My only warning is to beware of the bitch with black hair at the upstairs bar. She will charge you for drinks you didn't drink and she hasn't even been drinking.

23.description: 1 of 2 things can happen at Exit. You will either get laid or get stabbed. If neither one of those things happen by the end of your night, you did not try hard enough.

47.description: The Exit Chicago, why am I giving this shithole 5 stars? Well, cuz I'm just that type a gal. I, after all, after this review, have become the Duchess of Exit. Now, let me tell you about my filthy dukedom..."I hate Exit." My friend says. We frequent the spot after 2am on Wednesdays, even though I've been on other nights as well. "Why?""Cuz it's nasty and full of drug addicts and prostitutes and it's just a total meat market." "Ahhhh. I call that character." Step into this supposedly haunted Chicago nightlife spot and probably the first thing you will notice is the filth. Filthy ages old bras and panties hang over some like 10 foot diameter medieval looking chandelier things, but I don't think they are meant for lighting. I think these contraptions are meant for the bras and panties. The next thing you'd notice is probably the punk rock black and red interior. More filth and grime up ahead, a stripper pole. And if you've been to this joint as many times as I and seen as many things as I, you probably wouldn't touch it. I highly doubt they ever clean it. The upstairs carries the same grime/creepy interior style but with blacklights, yeah! And if you really want to freak yourself out, use the upstairs bathroom. I once tried to buy a drink at Exit. I asked the super wasted bartender for a vodka soda water (I'm on an anti-preservative kick.) She handed me a huge glass of tequila and stumbled back to her friends who she was feeding shots, never to look at me again. I stood for a moment with my $20 wondering if she would charge me, she continued to cackle with her friends and not give a fuck. This was the moment I fell in love with Exit. They just don't give a fuck. There is no pretension at this spot, no one really cares. Do what you like, be yourself. You don't have to be goth or punk or hipster, dubstepped out, or on X, or a hoe, or a dj, or a anything at all. Grime welcomes all. Dance on the floor, climb on the bar, take your clothes off. And for this, I give it 5 stars.

8.description: Best punk rock bar ever! I've been coming to Exit for years and its my favorite place to grab a cocktail and listen to some rad punk rock. Dark and dingy perhaps resembling a castles dungeon.  Behind the bar on Fridays is the lovely and wise cracking Ms Donna who has been my friend  via Exit for 13 years now and I specifically go on Fridays when Im in town to see her. Tell her Big John sent you !

31.description: I love the Exit.Honestly considering its proximity to my home I should really get over here more often.The Exit is a bar for degenerates or anyone who wants to play one for an evening.Downstrairs is usually rock upstairs I've witnessed bondage, live music, and dance parties of all types.This is why the Exit steals my heart. Its like a crazy clubhouse for all of Chicago's different counter cultures.I've never had a bad time at the Exit and best part is they're open till 4!Come here, drop you inhibitions, leave happy.

34.description: I enjoy Exit but at times I get aggravated there. I love the music they play downstairs, upstairs the music is too much like a club. But downstairs it's a cool fun place. I feel like they dont have a lot of top shelf alcohol. And the beer selection is okay. Downstairs is where I prefer to stay. If you are there for a while a conversation will usually strike up with some stranger who may or may not know what they are talking about depending on the time of the night.At times there is bondage stuff, Burlesque or bands (maybe) upstairs. Gets crowded on weekends, especially after 2, because they have a late night license.  Wanted to go to metal sundays but never have yet.I enjoy going there whenever I wander in.

16.description: "So say good night to the bad guy!...The last time you gonna see a bad guy like this again, let me tell you."Every great evening needs a strong finish and 'Exit' is one hell of a nightcap when you've wound yourself up elsewhere and just aren't ready to call it quits.  The female bartenders are sexy and fun...the crowd seems diverse and there's this come-as-you-are feel..a welcome freeness about the place that I had honestly forgotten since I'd last darkened this dive's doorway; I say that with the utmost affection.I often joke that the thick heels on my boots are for kicking hillbilly heads in, but the truth is, I'm rather fond of hillbillies and some of my closest friends wear that badge proudly (and loudly); the 2nd story dance floor here has made it painfully clear that those heels are intended for Hipsters.  I kid...I kid. Ladies shouldn't fight. *deep breath*  The bummer for me was the unsavory sea of feel-ya-up Frat boys and drunk chicks that drifted in as the wee hours approached. You know the type: completely clueless while bumping into you,.repeatedly, sloshing beverage in your hair... then fawning over you while waiting for the bathroom as if you were some sort of novelty. Serenity now! The DJ played some choice tunes (Depeche Mode, The Clash, Nitzer Ebb), but wouldn't drop any Ministry for me...so while it was suggested by a patron that I pop out my breasts to get a request met, I'd much rather just pop in my own tunes on the ride home. I've always got a Little River Band loaded up here!  As others have pointed out, the odor that envelopes the 2nd floor over time is nasty. No doubt I made some small contribution in that regard, because despite I'm mad fresh,  I had my share of fun....and part of that was losing myself in rhythm. In summation, she certainly ain't what she used to be and that's a damn shame, but I still enjoyed the time I spent here so a solid three stars it is. Bonus points for their extended hours, some whiskey on the house, having Rogue's Dead Guy Ale on tap and Ultraman vs Godzilla on the tube! Wat?! I came with *great* company (a nod to Maria C.) and met some cool peeps in the mix that made my night at Exit worthwhile. I dug just chillin' at the bar on the first floor and exchanging conversation to dat sweet sound of old school metal. On your way out, if your heart so desires, you can snag a bite from the quirky, but endearing street vendor or gather round their cart to chat a spell. Will I be back? Hmmm...."Me? I always tell the truth...even when I lie."

13.description: First time in this place and the bartender Shavron was amazing. Although my friend was being a total D-bag since he was obliterated she understood. We ended up getting kicked out, but that was on us. I highly recommend to go here. You won't be disappointed.

11.description: I have never written a one star review before but this place deserves it! Well, at least my bartender and whoever hired her deserves it. I came here last weekend with a friend of mine for a couple of drinks and to have a good time, he wanted to cheer me up after a recent break up. It was my first time there, he is a regular. Since I was driving both him and I for the night I decided to not drink too much and started out with a water. He ordered his beer next to me, I ordered the water and she said "Honey, this is a bar, we don't serve water", I gave her a puzzled look and told her I was the designated driver for the night. After she stared me down awkwardly she finally poured me a cup of water. This was awkward for everyone around us, awkward enough for everyone to go outside and want a smoke.I join everyone outside where there's a large group of people and we smoke and talk out there for maybe 20 minutes. We get back inside and continue our night. Maybe an hour into the night I reached for my water and remembered that I had left it unattended while we were outside and decided to play it safe and order another water, I also ordered a beer. Same bartender, this time she got up halfway on the actual bar and said "Honey, you can't just keep ordering water, this is a bar, we don't serve water" and then pushed my old water back to me. When I explained that I had left it unattended and didn't feel comfortable drinking it she dumped it out, gave me a water bottle and charged me $2. Then she served me my beer. I watched her do shots all night. Climb up on the bar with her dirty knock off Doc Martens to whisper in customers ears all night and just plain be a terrible employee. Later through the night we discovered that the reason she was so rude to me was because she wanted to bang the guy I came with and was upset that he had come with a female friend. WTF are we 18 year olds? The entire night I felt like I was in some weird teenage drama with some weird bartender giving me death stares over a crush on my friend. FRIEND. It was awkward for everyone around, not just me. While my friend was interested in her large fake tits she kept jiggling around, her craziness eventually drove us all away. She was telling other customers to ask him if he was single, and ask me if I was okay with them talking and...it was all just very juvenile and strange. My friend is 29 and I am 24, we're both military veterans and I guess we just expect our bartender to act like at least a semi young adult.At one point throughout the night one of friends ordered shots for everyone, she forgot my shot glass and maybe 10 minutes later I was able to get her attention and ask her for one.OH, at the other end of the bar, with the other normal bartenders we joined some friends who had come in a group. One girl was the DD and she ordered water, she was given a large red solo cup of water FREE OF CHARGE and when I asked her to go ask for another one, she got another one FOR FREE. When I needed to pay my tab she just scribbled on a piece of paper in font of me and told me my total was $20. At this point I just wanted to leave. Overall terrible experience. The place was nice, the people were awesome, the music was awesome, didn't go upstairs. Doubt I'll go back.

39.description: Too much testosterone...every guy there wants to look and act like a bad ass like they are in some movie. A city bar that attractives a suburban type of patron.

37.description: Your typical 4am bar.  Interesting crowd runs here.  Music is so freakin' loud...It's neat to visit, but does seam tacky and "tries too hard."  It's the kinda place you look for table scraps at 330am...

0.description: I've been a fan of this place for a year or two.  It's fun.  Good music for alternative without being metal heads.  One bit of warning, parking across the street has had a few car break-ins.  My car was broken into last weekend.  I also saw glass on the pavement from another break in in the next parking space.

38.description: Exit isn't perfect, but it's a freakish mix of nonsense that 99.9% of the time mixes into something enjoyable. Cheap booze, interesting people, music that isn't downtown club (and all I listen to is what most people would call "dance music"). Punk, industrial, techno, metal, house.. I dunno, it's all there. Go on one night, get this.. go on another night and get that. Not too many f**ks given and that's a good thing, in my opinion. Complaining about how it isn't the Wells Exit from the 80's or how it's changed since the 90's is tripping too hard on nostalgia. Yes, it isn't the 80's/90's. Bars have to make money and run promos / change things up now and then. It's also a business. Womp womp.Exit's like a second home. Not for everyone, but at least give it an open-minded shot.

51.description: Exit can suck my dick.

27.description: This place is classic. You can go there anyday&anytime and it's still gonna be fun. I wish I lived closer so I could visit more often.

32.description: I came here on a date, yeah a date, for bondage night a few years ago; no, the date who brought me here did not get lucky that night.  Actually, he never did. When I walked in wearing usual date attire I was stared at by everyone and felt more than awkward.  I was 19 at the time and was by far the youngest person there, maybe by ten years. I actually enjoyed it.  The blue haired mohawk people did not appreciate my type being there but I did not judge them so they got over me.  More recently I was here over the winter and boy has this place changed for the worse.  Now, the people who go here are just in their 'be different' phase and all wanna-bes.  Coming from the person who said she didn't judge, I know. Yet, in my defense the people who go there now are just fake people and that is one thing in life I wish did not exist. I had a friend in town from Florida and I did not even waste our time parking to take her here. I wish it was the same as before!

54.description: I'm a little embarrassed to write this review because people will know I went here.  It was a friend's birthday party and although he enjoyed it, I just didn't find this to be a fun place to go.  They had $3 Newcastle on tap and it was about 55F.  I had some other beers and then tried the Newcastle again 2 hours later. Still warm.  They had a "DJ" playing house music with long pauses between songs (first day on the job?) and about 8 people on the dance floor standing with their feet planted and somewhat moving their bodies with their hands in their pockets. I think they thought they were dancing.I you like warm beer, 35 year old men who wear halloween costumes all year and chubby girls with mohawks, this is the place to be.

48.description: I'd go back to exit if like Pantera was hanging out there or something.

44.description: First went here in the mid 1990s. At the time and up until about 2007 it was a really unique, sometimes outta control place to interact with people and just listen to loud good music. It's gotten really annoying and tacky since then in that it seems very much saturated with advertising and promos for some stupid new type of vodka, rum, etc. And the music is different, the staff changes too frequently, and there are a lotta customers who are either there as sort of a joke or are drunken frat dbags that should never have left there dorm that evening to venture out.That being said, my positive experienced with Exit outweigh how poorly they've tanked in both popularity and image in the past 5 years. But in the end I wish this place would either revert back to what it was or shut its doors for good.This is not the same place it once was, now its just a big waste of time.

24.description: What can one say about the Exit?  Bittersweet would be the word I would use if I only had one to describe it.  No one ever says let's go to the Exit at 8pm.  Due to it's 4am closing time the suggestion always comes around 1am.  When it's brought up everyone knows the better option would be to go and get some tacos and pass out somewhere.  But that never happens, not intentionally anyways.  Everyone will rally and shuffle on over to the Exit.  Once there, there is a 95% chance that one or more of your party will be exiting the Exit within 15 min, usually not by their own volition.  Word of caution: you cannot play with the DJs records no matter how badly you believe he is doing his job.  After that a couple of the weaker members of the herd will jump on that escape route and offer to take them home since they can't wait outside without getting arrested.  After that you will continue to drink the moderately priced drinks and get to a new level of inebriation that you swear every time won't happen again. Because there is some sort of space time flux capacitor thing going on here and it's impossible to have just one beer and you won't realize it until you close your tab that you have had 12 beers and a shot of something.  Inevitably you will end up hating yourself in the morning and realize that it's never actually a good idea to come here....until the next time you start drinking.

7.description: I loved coming here back in the day...when people appreciated good music. Came here for New Years Eve and the heavyset losercrowd were unforgiving and unkind assholes to someone who has actually made beautiful and important music and has sold hundreds of thousands of records. I live in L.A. now and miss the acceptance and warmth of the Midwest. You are loser assholes who made me thankful that I now live in a beautiful place where people are not nearly as entitled and snobby as they are at this place.

49.description: I've been going to Exit for over 10 years now, and it is one of the more unique establishments in the city. As a club that caters to the "alternative crowd", you can expect to hear Punk, Metal, Industrial, Thrash, and other kinds of loud music on a regular basis. There used to be Bondage Thursdays in the upstairs lounge, but I haven't been there since Halloween's "Blood Wrestling" match to see if it is still going on...This place packs in a pretty good crowd on weekends, so be prepared to be jostled and shoved when things get moving. Mostly DJ's spin music of the above-mentioned type until 4 or 5am when they close.You will see a lot of biker-esque folks here, a few goths who decided to stop here before going to Neo, and a lot of people in between. The music is good, and if you go to the second bar by the stairs, the bartender usually has a porno playing on the VCR to get people in the mood for drinking or whatever...I have lots of good memories here. On a busy weekend evening, expect to pay 5-10 bucks to get in if something is going on, otherwise it's free. There is usually an old motorcycle parked where the bouncer is, which is neat to look at. Drinks are not too expensive, but when they allowed smoking, a pack would run you around 10 dollars...I am not sure if they still sell cigarettes there to be smoked outside, but if they do, you can do much better by buying them in DuPage or Lake County in Indiana...Overall, a very enjoyable, loud experience every time that is not to be forgotten- two thumbs up!

40.description: Felt right at home here.  Drinks were reasonably priced.  Music was awesome.  Met a lot of cool people.  The only reason I docked a star- music was so loud I was screaming to have a conversation.  Raspy throat at the end of the night.

53.description: if you can read and have any kind of self respect you will never come to exit.But luckily some pretty cool locals do find their way here, late at night, without care or caution and rage.sometimes you will hear some new wave, some metal, some punk, some girl puking in the alley, or strippers legs sliding down the pole.Exit is small. it does have 1+1 floors, but its not meant to hold the world in its boosoms.its a place where you can get a smiley boobie bar wench serving up some whiskey and beers with just as much attitude as you desire.you can meet a friend or 2+1 and dance like nobody is watching because they are too busy watching themselves.fuck.it wouldn't be a proper Exit review without some 4 letters in a word action.

30.description: "So say good night to the bad guy!...The last time you gonna see a bad guy like this again, let me tell you."Every great evening needs a strong finish and 'Exit' is one hell of a nightcap when you've wound yourself up elsewhere and just aren't ready to call it quits.  The female bartenders are sexy and fun...the crowd seems diverse and there's this come-as-you-are feel..a welcome freeness about the place that I had honestly forgotten since I'd last darkened this dive's doorway; I say that with the utmost affection.I often joke that the thick heels on my boots are for kicking hillbilly heads in, but the truth is, I'm rather fond of hillbillies and some of my closest friends wear that badge proudly (and loudly); the 2nd story dance floor here has made it painfully clear that those heels are intended for Hipsters.  I kid...I kid. Ladies shouldn't fight. *deep breath*  The bummer for me was the unsavory sea of feel-ya-up Frat boys and drunk chicks that drifted in as the wee hours approached. You know the type: completely clueless while bumping into you,.repeatedly, sloshing beverage in your hair... then fawning over you while waiting for the bathroom as if you were some sort of novelty. Serenity now! The DJ played some choice tunes (Depeche Mode, The Clash, Nitzer Ebb), but wouldn't drop any Ministry for me...so while it was suggested by a patron that I pop out my breasts to get a request met, I'd much rather just pop in my own tunes on the ride home. I've always got a Little River Band loaded up here!  As others have pointed out, the odor that envelopes the 2nd floor over time is nasty. No doubt I made some small contribution in that regard, because despite I'm mad fresh,  I had my share of fun....and part of that was losing myself in rhythm. In summation, she certainly ain't what she used to be and that's a damn shame, but I still enjoyed the time I spent here so a solid three stars it is. Bonus points for their extended hours, some whiskey on the house, having Rogue's Dead Guy Ale on tap and Ultraman vs Godzilla on the tube! Wat?! I came with *great* company (a nod to Maria C.) and met some cool peeps in the mix that made my night at Exit worthwhile. I dug just chillin' at the bar on the first floor and exchanging conversation to dat sweet sound of old school metal. On your way out, if your heart so desires, you can snag a bite from the quirky, but endearing street vendor or gather round their cart to chat a spell. Will I be back? Hmmm...."Me? I always tell the truth...even when I lie."

46.description: Be prepared for grungy music, bras hanging from gothic chandeliers, whips, & girls chained to a fence. That basically sums up the experience I had at Exit. Not at all the kind of bar I normally go to, but my friend convinced me and I am one to try new things. I had been warned prior to going about the bondage experience. Upstairs, there was a girl tied to a large chain fence wearing just a corset, fishnet stockings, g-string, & heels, who was being whipped by another girl wearing a teeny tiny skirt, revealing her butt. Pretty kinky if you ask me. Not really my thing, but I must say my eyes were fixated because I had never really seen anything like this in person. People were just standing around watching the charade. One thing I won't forget was the odd scent of the bar; basically ruined it for me. Not sure what it was, but it grossed me out. Don't think I'll be returning to Exit.

1.description: I love love love this bar. It's grungy, but fun. Friday's & Saturday's upstairs are generally great for dancing, Tuesday & Thursday nights might be out of some people's comfort zone, but nevertheless, a unique experience! I'd recommend checking the schedule firsthand. The security guard, Jesus, is probably one of the nicest guys you'll ever meet. The crowd is super friendly as well - literally, the nicest people I've met in Chicago.

55.description: I love, love love this place, however I do not like the smell of b.o upstairs, that is the reason i gave it a 4 instead of 5.  Everyone is super friendly, and does whatever they want.  The first floor is still old school grunge, motorcycle type of people, but upstairs they have electro, alternative etc.  You have a mixture of people here as well.  Glad this place has been open for this long.

9.description: Went back here for a friend's CD release party and was dreading another experience like the one I had last time (cunty bartender, watered-down drinks)...but I was pleasantly surprised. The bartender who served me last time was nowhere to be seen; instead it was a friendly (!) girl named Ashley (hope I spelled it right). She apologized for being slow, but at least it wasn't because she was taking her time flirting with customers, taking shots with male patrons, doing a clumsy look-at-me dance on top of the bar...nope, she actually did her job, poured some decently strong drinks, and even checked on us when she saw our cups were getting close to empty. TLDR: the bartender can make or break your experience here; my only good experience has been with a badass chick named Ashley, and I appreciate the hell out of her for it.

26.description: The Exit is a different place from when you first come here to the time you come here after years of visiting. Always good tunes. The vibe is a little hit or miss. The service is fair. Its just another pit stop for the wicked in the wee hours of the night. My band was fortunate enough to perform here. Its a punk rock bar. Dingy, Dark, Scuzzy, not the kinda place you would want take a sleeping bag to and stay for nights on end. I am glad it exists but its not particularly my go to late night bar experience.

25.description: New management is helping correct some of the chaos that caused customers troubles

12.description: Ahh it was the best of times and the worst of times and the times you just couldnt remember if it was the best or worst. After coming here for about 8+ years What can you say about this place other than it's an iconic piece of chicago history and what used to be primarily leaning towards punk patrons now has subsided into the more annoying hipsters taking over certain times.. BUT It's still a completely awesome place to go and I love it and Ill probably always end up here in the end! Oh and Blacklight Blackout is always a hoot, The Annihilist is the best!

59.description: Exit wasn't nearly as scandalous as my friends made it out to be. I easily found parking on a Saturday night, dancing upstairs to a great new wave mix and left shortly later. I'd love to return by cab or bus.

21.description: Great dive-y punk bar open late in the city. There's a unique atmosphere here where all the punks, goths, wiccans, and weirdos come to hang out and if you come in with an open mind you'll love it. Downstairs is the bar and upstairs is the dance floor. Every time I come here I always have fun and meet great people. Last time was the Halloween party and costume contest. Lots of originality and cheap drinks.

17.description: I always make a point to stop here when I'm in town, but it can be so hit or miss. One night it was just crazy and packed. The downstairs focuses on punk, oi and rock music. The wait staff is all very beautiful regardless of gender. Upstairs they had electronic and industrial music playing with a small dance floor and a smaller bar. The entire thing has a great vibe of a post-apolcolyrpic punk rock cult classic extravaganza. It can be corny if it's not as hoppin' as it could be. The bouncer was really friendly and talkative and so were the rest of the people in the bar.

10.description: This bar is unique. I had never been to a place like this before. I didn't like it because it's not.my style of music nor scene, but I can say that the people there were having fun. I don't think I would go back but if your into electronic, hard rock, ect. Then YOU might Want to.come here. Something to experience. 4/5 stars for its uniqueness

5.description: Interesting place. In fact I'm really pretty sure you won't find another quite like this one. There is nearly always something obscene going on in this place and it's often mind-blowing loud. If you are a get-so-drunk you can't remember it kinda person you'll fit right in with the sh*tty drunks and obnoxious perverts. Perverts you ask? Well it's open til... crap does this place ever even close? And there is usually something pornographic going on behind the bar- right next to the vintage gas masks.... and half dressed drunk bartenders... and other weird stuff. So yeah perverts.The bathrooms- well that's just one gross mess. Staff- mostly drunk slamming shots all night and whoring themselves all over the customers... enough so that it can be difficult to get a drink if you aren't in their site for the night. I literally had the bartender walk past me about a dozen times and get drinks for her "regulars" or "friends" and then proceed to chat up some dude while groping her boobs for about 20 minutes before she finally decided to begrudgingly take my order.  When I say take my order I mean I wouldn't dare order anything but beer because I can only imagine how annoyed she'd look for having to do any real type of work. The quirkiness is refreshing but sometimes a bit over-the-top...

3.description: First trip to EXIT in a while.  What happened?  It used to be hot chicks and bikers; now it's duck dynasty with jewelry.  Love the scene, but they need to ditch the beards.

35.description: Cool, they decorated everything for Halloween!  Huh? Oh really? Ahh, I see...

19.description: decent rocker bar, especially if you are looking for 4am.to be honest tho, everyone tries a little too hard here. the bar, the staff, the customers. metal and punk aren't about all the bullshit, guys, lol. you'll hear better music here than most other bars though, and it's overall chill.

28.description: One of the few authentic Goth bars left in Chicago. People watching is highly encouraged. I love this place. I've been coming here for years.

45.description: Took my staff out for drinks after work, had a GREAT time- Ashley was our bartender- she took care of us! What a fun night, thank you!

33.description: So fun! I was there last month and there was an awesome burlesque show upstairs..I had a great time and can't wait to go back. The only problem I had was with the waitress at the upstairs bar.. She was texting the entire time.. Other than that it was a great experience

43.description: I had heard rad things about the exit from back in the day but apparently it's fallen from grace. The main gripe I have with this place is that a few weeks ago my band and Hotlips Messiah played there, prior to the show both bands were told they would be paid for the set however after both bands played the bar basically said "HA HA JOKE'S ON YOU, WE'RE NOT PAYING YOU AT ALL!". Now I don't play music for money and we have always played shows for free (sans on tour) but it's more or less the principal of telling somebody that you're going to pay them for a service and then backing out of it. Beyond that any liquor drink you buy will be watered down to hell and then be packed with more ice than most places, so stick with the beer which is decently priced. As far as the patrons go there's a good amount of cool people but there's also a lot of the arrogant type of punk, who gives you the "punker than thou" attitude which is just laughable. The one star I'm giving this place is for the decent price of the drinks and the cool people who hang out there, other than that places like this kill the scene. The bar would rather have a person playing music off a computer than cough up the money for the live bands (And based on the amount of people there that night the made a killing off admission and drinks). A word of advice, if you want a real "punk bar" go to the mutiny. The Exit has become nothing more than a name, aside from that it's a shitty place that rides on the coat tails of its former glory which is really unfortunate because if the owners stopped being assclows is could be a really amazing place.

2.description: By far my #1 favorite bar in the Chicagoland area.While it may appear dark and sinister, you won't find a more welcoming crowd.Different nights have different themes, but there's usually something to dance to upstairs, and something to drink/ headbang to downstairs.It's definitely a little grimy and grungy LOOKING, but that's by design. It's part of the charm! The bartenders (I've met Ashley, Donna, Kelly, Frenchie, Lacey, and several more) are all fun, friendly, and goregous (even Billy and Jerome haha), but I always park myself by the charismatic, sassy, and beautiful Shavon ("The Daymaker"). She's always rocking out, chatting people up, slinging drinks in every direction, and just making sure everyone is having a good time. I wish she worked there more.If you're looking for a great dive with great music, people, and atmosphere, look no further.Exit to the EXIT.

18.description: Went to this place for the first time with a couple friends on a Saturday night.My first impression of the place was Filthy.It has been open since 1981 and it sure LOOKS like it has been not seen a remodeling since then! There are bras and panties hanging from the ceiling downstairs in the main bar. There are also many stickers behind the bar, as well as an Elvis statue. Pretty cool. The music they play here is my kind of music so I really liked it :)My friend told me there was an 'upstairs' so we decided to check it out. I have to admit the music was pretty awesome. The dance floor was dead and there was probably no more than 15 people.... bummer.We went ahead and decided to sit at the smaller bar. As I was pulling the bar stool out to take a seat, to my disgust, I felt something sticky at the bottom of the stool.... it was gross and I needed to find the nearest bathroom ASAP!  I didn't end up getting anything, but one of my friends decided to get a beer that cost him $5.After being disappointed with the lack of ambience upstairs, we decided to go back downstairs. We talked about trying some Irish carbombs and asked for a few... to my discontent, the bartender handed out napkins to place our drinks and gave my friend a dirty napkin! Yuck...Overall, I didn't experience anything bad with the service at this place... the bartenders seemed cool and so was the bouncer. I am giving this place 3 stars for the music that it plays! Awesome :) Exit just needs to clean!!!!

41.description: Exit is the ultimate end of the night destination.  It attracts a mix of tattooed hipsters, punks, goths and fun loving social degenerates.  Plus it's open late, really late.  After work I may drag myself outta the burbs to have some fun.  The bottom floor has two bars and the decor includes chandeliers with bras, motorcycles and a stripper pole.  This makes for great photo ops.  Depending on the night you go the entertainment may include bands, D.J.'s, or Dominatrices.  Plus the TV's always have something entertaining.  I realize this bar is not for everyone.  I once brought a friend that was on the more dance club side and she left traumatized.  I say, suck it up, do a shot, and enjoy the phenomenal people watching!

52.description: 10pm: Jesus, is that place still open? fuck..who even goes there anymore?2am: FUCK! hey Exit is still open! This place rules! I am drunk and they are playing Iron Maiden and Fugazi till 5am! sweeeeeeeet!

50.description: Cheap booze, colorful crowd, easy parking and plenty of character make this a great alt bar. Punk rock downstairs, idustrial/goth upstairs. Go on a weekend as the week night crowd is too thin.

4.description: Wanna get away from every stereotypical Chicago nightlife scene? Go to Exit. It's one of the only places in town that isn't a Big 10 sports bar, bro lounge, or hipster cocktail spot. Sure, they play ear bleeding metal music, but even if that isn't your thing this place is a pretty awesome time. They've got a surprisingly super nice staff from the door guy to the bartenders, its some of the best people watching you'll witness anywhere, and the crowd that comes through is unexpectedly friendly considering the tunes sound like something you'd sacrifice a goat to. Overall a pretty damn cool experience. Especially if you're sick of the same old stupid bars that you always end up going to.

6.description: First time a was ever chained and whipped. First time I ever drank Malort. First time I ever heard "head hunter" while dry fucking my ex chained against the wall. First One night stand with a goth stripper. Exit you are the lust in my heart and the fire behind my eyes...

22.description: That place used to be cool but now it's a wannabe strip club with douche bags. Not a punk scene anymore. Sell outs. Go to neo instead.

15.description: I thought I'd give this place another chance, but of course, no good deed goes unpunished: Sit down and order my usual, a Guinness and a shot of Jameson, the latter of which I was appalled to see placed before me in a phthalate-laden plastic thimble (see pic).  On the hierarchy of glassware, this is a few rungs below the plastic measuring cups that come with a bottle Vicks, and in the hierarchy of drinking establishments, it's something you'd expect to see at a post-frat douche bar on Rush Street --maybe that's what Exit is aspiring to be now.  I'd never seen a shot served up that way here before, and I'd like to say that I never will again because that's the last chance I'll be giving this once quasi-sacred place, but sadly that's probably not true (see below).  All the criticisms in the previous review remain in effect, though I guess some old staff members still work here. Seriously, this is now officially the most un-punk spectacle in town, and makes The Alley look like Ian MacKaye.  It's now basically Tais Til 4 for people with sightly better taste in music and more interesting pasts. The exact same criteria (4 a.m. license, inebriated judgment, etc.) are the only reasons that would ever lead someone to darken the door of either shithole.

57.description: PUNK!

20.description: The first bar I've ever been to turning 21, it was the shit at first, then it started loosing it's touch, the drinks are ridiculously watered down and over priced, it's more of a nostalgia thing going there now.

36.description: Jen is the most awesome bartender and we are having a great time. She has great recommendations for those times when you have no idea what to drink. Definitely worth checking out!!

14.description: This is one of the last hold out, true Punk Clubs. The dark metal S&M feel is the charm. If you like :Dark" vibes, then this is the place. I have been coming here for years. When I was 18 I had a movie show here (at the old location on Wells), and it showed every Sunday. So I came here a lot. this was (and maybe still is ) a great place for a dancing date.If you like a decent into the darker reaches of the Music/Club World, then come here.

58.description: Bari is an Italian grocery where you can find a wide range of products, but when I hear about this place all I can think about it's their sandwiches. They're a combination of traditional ingredients that charms you from the first bite. Every time my mother sends me here to buy sauces and fresh pastas I end up leaving the store with a huge prosciutto and mozzarella sandwich that's totally worth the effort. Sandwiches are affordable so everyone can try one every now and then. Proof that Bari's sandwiches are so famous is the line, but I don't mind waiting 15 minutes for my sandwich because I know that no other place can make it better. The grocery also features imported cookies, dried pastas and a butcher where you can find a wide range of home-made products such as sausages, rabbit or veal. If you happen to be in Chicago, you should take your time and enjoy the best sandwich you've ever eaten at Bari.

56.description: Bari's Deli has been a Chicago staple for over 35 years. Great sandwiches can be delicate, gut-busting, humble or flashy. What they have in common is that they're built with love and care and great quality ingredients. This is exactly what Bari's Deli has created for several decades. If you landed here, it means you are searching for a fantastic sub sandwich in Chicago. Yeah, yeah, bada-bing bada-boom-boom, you found it so look no further, because this joint is number one when it comes to subs. We love the made-to-order deli sandwiches. Picking just one of their masterpieces at this deli shop is no easy task, since every massive mound of bread, meat, and cheese here is nothing short of a Chicago treasure. Years ago, I tried the prosciutto, sopressata comprised of fresh mozzarella, sweet roasted peppers and olive oil -- simply memorable -- fresh, chewy bread melds perfectly with the cold cuts and cheese. The savory olive spread adds an extra kick to the whole she-bang. We were astounded by the carniv-orgasmic offerings at this place when we first  came here over 10 years ago!You can try ham, salami, turkey, roast beef, mortadella with American, Swiss or provolone cheese, lettuce, tomato, onions, hot peppers, mustard, mayo, oil and vinegar, all packed on a fresh, fluffy Italian bread. The bread is simply ethereal. There are lots of solid options to choose from at this joint, which prides itself on creating sandwiches to satisfy every palette. Thick Italian bread envelops plump pieces of their meatballs, all elegantly smothered in delectable fresh mozzarella, Romano cheese and piping hot tomato sauce. Afterward, you can nap for weeks, awake refreshed (and five pounds heavier). My favorite sandwich here is their Italian sub (or Italian hero). If you want to have the gastronomical experience of a sub sandwich life time hit this place up for lunch.There is only one thing you need to know about this joint. What dat? What dat? The Italian sub is the one you want. Don't think twice! Just order it and step back. Let the man work his magic, while you marvel at the quick dance of sandwich seduction happening before your eyes. First, a long loaf of Italian bread is sliced open and fresh cured meat after cured meat thinly shaved goes directly into the sandwich. At this point, your mouth is watering as cheeses, peppers, dressing, everything, added so deftly that if you blink you might miss a step. Second, hold your wrapped sandwich tightly in your hands and try not to quiver with excitement at first bite!This mom and pop operation has been serving fantastic Italian sausage, Sub sandwiches and Italian beef for decades. I wouldn't say they have "the best" Italian beef in the city, but it is definitely worth trying (even if it is only once). This is carry-out only, so get your sandwich and get the hell out.  Bada-Bing, Bada-Boom. You're done! ;DStreet parking = 3 stars (not super difficult to find a legal spot)Sandwiches   = 5 starsService = 4 starsBreads and Circuses = 4 stars

29.description: What a coincidence that another yelper mentioned that the folks at Bari always call him "Chuck Norris". Every time I waltz into Bari the guys by the meat slicing station refer to me as "The Octopus That Was in the Sky", so fitting! That's just the thing about the soldiers of the Bari good taste armada, they have an eye for detail. They call it like it is, they know you want a mean sandwich and they hand you a raging scorpion of flavor, wiggling in a paper wrapping that will be transparent by the time you make it home, you just can't contain the flavor juices infiltrating the polluted Chicago air. Id like to move away from this place just to get rid of my asthma. That reminds me, I actually have a bumper sticker on my car that says "I came to Chicago for the Bari, stayed for the Asthma!"

42.description: In my opinion, Bari unequivocally makes the best "Italian" sub in the city.  I've been coming here for years, and even though they may not know my real name, they call me "Chuck Norris" ( guess they think I look like the old boy ! ! ) Although making a sub sandwich isn't rocket science, a noteworthy version can only be the sum of the freshest and best quality ingredients.  My checklist would include the following.  The bread should have a thin, crispy crust and soft crumb.  The meats & cheeses , lettuce & tomato must be both flavorful and freshly sliced.  And last, but not least, the giardiniera needs just the right amount of crunchy & soft veggies, herbs, and olive oil.  Bari meets all these standards. ( In addition, Bari makes its own giardiniera, and sells it in jars too)   Its no wonder the small place is always packed with customers.  Service is always prompt, but at prime time, you might need to wait a few minutes.  Its a small  price to pay for a terrific sub.  From Chicago cops and office workers to Italians from Harlem/Belmont, Brideport, or Elmwood Park, Bari is what the Italian-American sub is all about. If you happen to be looking for Italian groceries, they carry an ample selection of oils, canned tomato products,pasta, canned fish, and homemade condiments.  They also have fresh meats , homemade sausages, cheeses , and a wide selection of deli meats/salads.  If you don't enjoy cooking, checkout their prepared pastas and sauces.  (Currently, there are a few parking spaces just 2-3 doors South which are for customers shopping at Bari)

23.description: Best Italian subs in town!! I've been going there since I was a little kid and the old neighberhood feeling never goes away.

47.description: The Italian subs here are really, really good. And, a super value. Very nice and friendly staff too. Can't wait to try their other subs.

8.description: This place is not a pretender. It's the real thing. The bread is excellent, meat slices thick, and the other toppings are fresh + the prices are decent.

31.description: I'm an Italian beef fanatic.   And a combo enthusiast to say the least.   So obviously I google the best Italian beef sandwiches in town and Bari pops up #1.  I had tried Mr.  Beef,  Boston,  Al's, and some damn place on south Pulaski that I don't remember the name.   So I says,  ok,  this is gonna be the love of my life, right?  As you can tell by my rating...WRONG.   the meat doesn't even look or taste like Italian beef.   Plus it's dry and has no bite, just pulls apart but not in a good way.   They put a crap load so that's good.   I say to myself, I must be wrong,  maybe it was a bad day or something so I go again.   Same thing,   at least they have consistency.   To be honest,  it's the second to last on my list.  The last is that south Pulaski place that tastes like plastic,  (rated #1 on WTTW Tony's Italian beef it's called)  I actually threw that one in the garbage after one bite.   And these placed come up highly rated,  I don't get it.   Want a damn good italian beef sandwich or combo.   Go to Portillo's. Your taste buds will literally explode.   It's a chain, I know,  but it is what it is,  the best Italian I've tasted till now.   Oh yeah,  Gene & Judes are not the best hot dogs around,  not by any means.   Don't trust the ratings!

34.description: We placed an order online today for a grand total of 13 subs. The instructions on the order were specific and very detailed. When I arrived back at my job, one sandwich was missing. The person whom it belonged to made a special trip to visit and her lunch was not there. Additionally, the gardiniera was missing. The instructions were that they were to be on the side for the all of the sandwiches. Instead, they were all missing. The French bread was also on the hard side so it kind of scrapped my mouth whenever I took a bite of the sandwich. Please fix this!

16.description: You just have to go here and check it out. Words can't do Bari justice. It's like being teleported back to a 1930s grocery store. The deli is amazing, get an Italian sandwich. It's huge and delicious!

13.description: Again in awe of their Italian beef and Italian sub - amazing house made  hot giardiniera - they just enough to meld with the flavors.  The market has everything I'm looking for in an Italian grocer.  The bread is from Damato's next door, the best canvas for a masterpiece.  I've tried other beef in good faith, but in the end I find myself racing to Bari to get a few bites (or more) to replace the taste lingering in my mouth.

11.description: Bari you broke my heart, you broke my heart! If this was the Godfather Bari would have to go. An utter dissapointment. After reading a columnist from Serious Eats claim that Bari's might be the best beef he ever had and Thrillist list it as its #6 beef, I just had to try it...I couldnt wait, even if it wasnt the best beef Ive ever had it would be damn close.My first bite chomp chomp, swallow a bit, roll the flavors around. What the.... Roast beefy...A step above Arby's but "possibly the best beef ive ever had" really guy from Serious Eats? Is he from California or something?! No flavors were popping in my mouth, nothing dancing...Mr. Beef, those flavors are like a sassy, hot Latina taking over the dance floor in my mouth. Bari's, a middle aged white man trying to jusr stay on his feet...Where is the Oregeno? The bread was pretty darn good...But what good is it if the beef sucks...Its like a cool take home box but if you put dog turds in their I really dont want the box now...Get my point!To be honest they seem to crank out sandwiches left and right and Ive heard great things about their cold cut subs so I probably will meander back in someday. Its an old school joint that seems to have good quality meat. Therefore I know they can do better, thats why two stars.... Just stay away from their Italian Beef!

39.description: I don't know how I'm going to get through the summer without eating Bari every weekend. Best neighborhood sub spot. Friendly atmosphere. Ridiculous prices.

37.description: I was taken here by my sous chef last Friday.  I have never had a sandwich as delicious as the footlong I had.  Ridiculously delicious, perfect bread, perfect ratio of oil and vinegar, mayo and dijon, absolutely delicious housemade giardinara, and the feel of the place was very old school Chicago so I felt very at ease.  My sous was telling me they do a very good business and I was not surprised at all - they also have a nice butcher shop but I was really there for that sub.  I will go back again and again.  Magnificent!

0.description: Love, love, love Bari's sandwiches!! It's in a small market where you can pick up the sandwiches at the deli. What's even better is the price! The sandwiches are such great quality and fresh ingredients with a low price. We got the Italian sub and prosciutto with mozzarella. I couldn't decide which sandwich I liked more and kept taking bites of both. The Italian had a good amount of meat and I loved the spicy peppers. The prosciutto with mozzarella was also delicious, although I wished it had as much filling as the Italian. Either way, yum.... Verdict: I want to go back and try all the sandwiches that are available. Grab a bag of chips and a drink in the market on your way out! You can also get one of their great sides.

38.description: This place has always had the best sub's in Chicago. My only fear is that the Major gentrification of this neighborhood will jack up the prices, or worse yet sell out to  developers. Yuppies ruin everything.

51.description: For $8 you can get a massive, tasty, Italian sub on tomato focaccia! One of the best deals around. This is a small Italian grocer with a deli counter in the back where you can get awesome made-to-order sandwiches. No area for eating in but no big deal. They accept credit cards which is convenient. If you do happen to have a few bucks on you though, stop in D'Amatos next door for some fantastic square pizza slices (they can warm them up if you're eating in) and arancini! Anywho, I highly recommend this sandwich at Bari!

27.description: I cannot stay away...they know me by name.  I fall more in love with the 12" turkey with extra hot giardeniera every day.  I don't care that they increased prices a bit.  Best sandwich in the city.  And really nice long-time employees make it even better.

32.description: A Grrreat sandwich. When your in the mood for a good sandwich you have to go to Bari, Cold and hot sandwiches and they are all great. Fresh Mozzarella taste great with the beef its awesome !!!!!!!!! Hats off to them all.

54.description: What is a better lunch than a REAL Italian sandwich? Seriously, I can't think of anything else. Bari has really great quality food for an unbelievable value. I have only been to the actual store a handful of times, and usually order for delivery. Delivery can take a while, but it is always worth the wait!

48.description: The Italian sub was a perfect blend of flavors with the hot giardiniera. My daughter was choking on her sandwich trying to eat it and say amazing at the same time!

44.description: One of the all-time great sandwich spots in the city.  The meatball sub with atomic giardiniera alone secures Bari's permanent perch in the top five best sandwiches of Chicago. This place gets wicked busy for lunch, with a line from the deli counter to the door. Or so I've heard: my experiences are always at off hours when I can peruse the fancy imported groceries and spend my well earned money.In particular, I like their selection of soda and sparkling water, their many kinds of angel wings and ornate Italian cookies, and the homemade pasta and olive salads. Delivery to my apartment in the neighborhood is always hot and fresh!

24.description: Found this through a blog and made the trip over to try it out. Great atmosphere and quick customer service. The meat was fresh and the Italian beef was served to perfection topped off with the homemade Giardiniera. Love this place and will be stopping by again.

7.description: I'll keep this nice and simple... Bari subs are a gem in Chicago and despite some recent price increases still an absolute bargain.You can get a delicious and authentic sub made from truly quality ingredients on freshly baked bread for the same general price as a junky chain like Jimmy John's... why would you even debate this choice?Walk to the back of the store to the butcher counter. There you will be greeted by a platoon of guys working diligently to make subs for what is often a sizeable line at lunchtime. Go for the traditional Italian first but also try to mix it up with a custom order using the Italian meats they have or try a house made sausage. Don't bother with generic stuff like turkey; Bari shines with the authentic Italian meats.When you are done stop by D'Amato's next door and grab some cookies... this is among the best lunches you can have in the city and it will cost you well under 10 bucks all in. you really can't beat it.

49.description: Mom and Pop shop, running at the speed of light. If you arrive at lunch/dinner, expect a line (it forms on the left aisle).This place makes & cans their own giardiniera. Just a warning, the hot really is hot. Best Italian Beef in Chicago? Check. Cops eat here? Check. The unapologetic staff corrects my attempt at Italian? Check.This is a great, local, neighborhood place, a true gem in the area.

40.description: Ordered food from Bari this afternoon for delivery through yelp.  After confirming my order and after an hour waiting, I got an email stating that they cancelled the order because they decided to close early.  Now how many yelp stars would you give a place that did this??  I've stopped in many times and while their subs are really good and affordable, the Sunday management team has a lot to learn about customer service....

53.description: Best Spicy Italian sub in Chicago.The extra spicy giardiniera is really spicy and really good.The pepper jack cheese actually has a pepper jack taste.You taste every part of the sandwich in every bite.So good.

30.description: They jacked up their prices last week when they got a new sign. They incorrectly charged me for a sub. It says on the menu- roast beef and cheese-$6.75. They proceeded to charge me an extra $.75 for cheese even though it's supposed to be included. I've been going here for 7 years, and I always thought it was good for the price. Now it's not worth the price at all! Try a much better sub place on Taylor St.- Conte di Savoia. Better quality meat, much better bread, and an overall better experience in regards to interacting with the workers. Bari has rude workers with a bad attitude. Also, there's now real order to the place, lunchtime is chaos, and frustratingly stupid. Avoid this place at all costs.

46.description: We come back to Chicago every year. Whenever we are in town we visit Ralph and Frankie and get our spicy italian w/ imported provalone. No where else have we found a better sandwich. Who needs mayo when the flavors of the meats and cheese and crusty breadWe also grab a couple of jars of their homemade giardinera. We have given some to friends all over the western United States to try and have received many compliments and testimonies of goodness. From mild to Extra Hot the labels speaks the truth.  The mild can be fed to your children and the Extra hot has habanero in it, need i say more?

1.description: I used to live in Hoboken and became rather spoiled by the Italian delis. I'm a sucker for fresh mutz and good bread. After reading the reviews on Bari, I had to give it a try to see how it stacked up compared to the East Coast competition. I got the Prosciutto and Fresh Mozzarella. On the whole, it was good, but not outstanding: the bread was crusty, but the fillings were limited (really kind of light on the mutz and the prosciutto). Although there was Italian seasoning and oil, I found the taste somewhat bland. I think balsamic would make for a nice addition here.Delivery is quick though there is a $3 charge.

55.description: Deli place that sells good sandwiches, but where you can also get anchovies, Italian sausage, etc.

9.description: With a killer combination of capocollo, genoa salami, mortadella, provolone, lettuce, tomato, and spicy giardiniera, Bari Foods in Chicago's West Town has perfected the sandwich, any sandwich. Go!

26.description: I'll keep this nice and simple... Bari subs are a gem in Chicago and despite some recent price increases still an absolute bargain.You can get a delicious and authentic sub made from truly quality ingredients on freshly baked bread for the same general price as a junky chain like Jimmy John's... why would you even debate this choice?Walk to the back of the store to the butcher counter. There you will be greeted by a platoon of guys working diligently to make subs for what is often a sizeable line at lunchtime. Go for the traditional Italian first but also try to mix it up with a custom order using the Italian meats they have or try a house made sausage. Don't bother with generic stuff like turkey; Bari shines with the authentic Italian meats.When you are done stop by D'Amato's next door and grab some cookies... this is among the best lunches you can have in the city and it will cost you well under 10 bucks all in. you really can't beat it.

25.description: We've been ordering subs from them for years! Tried all their subs, but the Italian is my favorite. Call ahead to order, street parking is hard to find especially around lunch time. Service is good! One of Chicago's hidden gems!

12.description: A native Chicagoan told me this place had the best Italian sub sandwich in town. She wasn't kidding. This quaint, authentic Italian grocer and sandwich shop resides in the heart of Chicago's Italian neighborhood. Here you can find every type of pasta, sauce, and deli item you could possibly crave. From fresh mozzarella and Sicilian olives to veal chops, this place has it all. They pack a lot of items into a space that's not much bigger than your kitchen and dining room so I could see it getting a bit snug in there during peak hours. However, it's worth it. When you step up to the counter, treat yourself to an order of the Italian sub. The 9-inch is priced to sell. You'll be hard-pressed to find a better sub for about $5. For a $1.50 more you can get the 12-inch and have an extra meal. It comes in mild, medium, and hot. Get the mild if you're not keen on spicy sandwiches. This place is a must try for anyone wanting a quality sandwich that will leave you full without breaking the bank.

59.description: I really can't say enough good things about this place. Their sandwiches and soups are fantastic every time, as is their deli meats. The people working are helpful and kind and the grocery store has everything I need! Is you haven't been here do yourself a favor and try it out!

21.description: What a disappointment. My partner and I have been on a mission to try every notable Italian Beef sandwich in Chicago. We were very excited when we heard about the delicious meats and sandwiches at Bari followed up with rave reviews on Yelp!  Sounded like the Italian Beef cannot be beat! We ordered both the Italian sub, which was mentioned in several reviews, and the Italian beef.... I couldn't believe it. While eating at the counter, I was starting to think we went to the wrong Bari. The Italian Sub--meat to lettuce proportion was unfair, couldn't even taste the meat, there was so much lettuce. The bread was stale, tasteless and crumbling, which was a shame because there are Italian bakeries next door and across the street. The Italian Beef-- Bland. Nothing was going on. I didn't taste the flavors, seasoning and meat juices that make Italian beefs so amazing. We were so unhappy when we left, with nothing to speak of on our palates. We think we might've gone on an off day since we're a minority in the reviews. We will try it again on another day and definitely take some sausages home from the meat counter. That looked great!

17.description: What a great place in a great location. Bari has a wide selection of fantastic deli foods, canned goods, Italian cookies, and my favorite giardiniera ever. They have a deli counter with a great selection of sandwiches and subs, with different specials every day. We had the Italian beef with giardiniera sauce, and it was a real bargain, at $9 for a gigantic foot long sandwich. It was served up on a wheat roll with a gigantic pile of tender, juicy, thin sliced Italian beef. BTW, you have to be sure to request the giardiniera when ordering. Maybe we just caught them on an off day, but I would have liked a little more (ok, a lot more) giardiniera on the sandwich than the 5-6 pieces of veggies we got. Overall, the sandwich was delicious, but I hope to get more giardiniera next time. Bring it on!

10.description: One of the all-time great sandwich spots in the city.  The meatball sub with atomic giardiniera alone secures Bari's permanent perch in the top five best sandwiches of Chicago. This place gets wicked busy for lunch, with a line from the deli counter to the door. Or so I've heard: my experiences are always at off hours when I can peruse the fancy imported groceries and spend my well earned money.In particular, I like their selection of soda and sparkling water, their many kinds of angel wings and ornate Italian cookies, and the homemade pasta and olive salads. Delivery to my apartment in the neighborhood is always hot and fresh!

5.description: Bari is a pretty good although I expected to be a bit more impressed with all the rave reviews. I ordered the Italian sub because that is what you should do.  First, it is a huge sandwich and just over $5. The meat on it was very good and fresh.  The bread I found was just okay and was too much for the sandwich and the sandwich was a bit over dressed.The staff was very friendly and helpful. We also took some deli home and a few things from the Italian market.  For a small store they have a decent selection. The deli was very, very good.  It was also pretty cheap for everything we got.

3.description: The best sandwiches in the city!! My husband and daughter stumbled upon this place by accident last year, and I'm so glad they did! They got me a sandwich, and I just had to know where it came from. Bari is a small Italian grocer that carries a lot of specialty items and has a meat counter in the back. There they take orders for any cuts you like, how you like, and they custom make sandwiches, in three sizes The Italian, which my daughter loves, is said to be the best in the city. I love their tuna! The sandwiches come on french bread with lettuce, tomato, onion, and/or any other toppings you'd like. They have a variety of cheeses and if you like spicy, their Gardinera is delicious. They seem to always be busy, but they get you in and out fairly quickly, and everyone is super nice. We are definitely fans!!
