After 12 months I put Baby R's very last picture into my beloved frame...and was so excited to have a frame documenting her entire first year. A few days later it fell off the bookcase and shattered into a bunch of pieces. Ahhhh! My first thought was to reorder it from RedEnvelope and was devastated to see it had been discontinued. Apparently I was the only one buying it for myself and gifts.  I tried to find a similar frame, but couldn't find anything I liked nearly as much. And sooo I turned to Yelp to find a frame store to help me.I came across April 7s Custom Framing and took my shattered frame over to Marty. He was very sympathetic and promised to help me fix it.  I can't remember how much paid, but believed it was around $50...and said he would charge me the rest later (he thought it would be another $50-75, but said it would depend on if he had to build it again from scratch). And he said it would be ready in a few weeks. Three months later I was still waiting for the finished product and hadn't heard from April 7s because a voicemail after 3 weeks saying they'd need a bit more time.  I called Marty and asked what the deal was. He was extremely apologetic, promised to have it ready by that weekend and said he wouldn't charge me anymore than my initial payment.Marty was true to his word this time and did have it ready by the weekend. And when I picked it up I was excited to see that it looked even better than it initially looked. I'm pretty sure it would now withstand a fall off a bookcase, but then again I don't plan on trying it. And he also didn't charge me more than my initial payment even though he did end up having to completely rebuild it.Three months of waiting for something would usually result in a negative Yelp review, but Marty was such a pleasure to deal with that I actually still had a good experience. And I would actually even consider going back to him for other framing needs...he assured me that regular projects typically go much faster.

43.description: I nearly peed myself when I saw that they'd relocated so close to my apartment! I took my most favorite thing ever to be framed at their previous location. -- a huge print of this photo images.wisconsinhistory.… that I got for participating in a study. It had been rolled up in a tube for 3 or 4 years before I finally took it to be framed.It was a busy morning when I showed up, but they had cute dogs to keep my company, and a big frame selection to browse while I waited. I liked that even though a lot of people were waiting, I didn't feel rushed to make my choices. I described the decor of the room it was going into (erm, non-descript?) and a few weeks later I hung my beautifully framed historic photo print over the bar in my dining room. I thought the price was reasonable, I got good advice on my selections, and the owner is easy on the eyes, which really didn't hurt (is that inappropriate to mention?).I have 2 other pieces waiting for framing but they won't be waiting too long with the shop so much closer to home.

2.description: Great experience at April 7s Custom Framing! I had two old and fragile pictures that were family heirlooms - one charcoal drawing of relatives from generations past, one landscape in pastels. All kinds of problems with them - chipped and destroyed moulding, broken frames with loose nails and no structural integrity, dirty old glass that had absorbed the images, wires on the backs that I can't believe held them up for half a century in my grandparents' house, and plenty more.I took them to April 7s and Alex, a manager there, knew exactly what to do with them right away. He examined them closely and pointed out details that I hadn't even noticed before, and laid out clear plans to fix and refresh every issue they had. He also was able to give me a little more background about how they were made, which I found fascinating. Also, the price he quoted me was amazing - I almost couldn't believe it. Huge bargain.They were done in a couple short weeks, and when we went to pick them up I almost couldn't believe my eyes. Wow! First, the backs were all totally new and redone, and as secure and sturdy as I could hope for. Nice new wires and good hooks for the walls. The glass was new too, and good preservation quality with buffers to keep the panes away from the art. The landscape was brighter, more vivid than I'd ever seen it. The frames themselves were still the same material, but strengthened and reinforced, and all the cracks and fractures in the intricate woodwork and claywork were touched up, corrected, and painted to match. They look incredible on my walls.I'd highly recommend April 7s, great experience, great price, great product, great employees too. Thanks for making my family heirlooms last many more generations!

18.description: Amazing service and frames! Not cheap but you do get what you pay for. Very high quality! Now I can finally hang my artwork that was hidden away for years.

41.description: OH MY SWEET GHERKINS! So these guys are friends of friends and I had heard about their shop several years ago. The stack of things I intended to frame kept growing and I finally went in to see them. AMAZING. They are so helpful and nice. Martin and Julie took their time with me and went through all my pieces, picking out unique options for each. I picked them up today and they are AWESOME. I have to decide where to hang everything! THANKS APRIL 7s!

52.description: I need to have my certificate framed, searched Yelp, and went to April 7s. I had searched around Lincoln Park, Wicker Park and found that April 7s was simply the best. They did a great job on my framing my CPA certificate and it looks perfect.  I enjoyed working with the owners to implement my vision and deliver spot on.

50.description: Late last year I was looking to get an expensive Eric Clapton Crossroads Festival poster framed and I wanted to go to a new place. After researching Yelp I noticed that April 7s was not only close to me, but amongst the highest rated frame shops on the website.When I first arrived at the store, the door was locked. If this happens to you, it probably means that the staff are in back working. Just knock on the door and they'll get you. After being let in, they guy who worked there (I forget his name, sorry) came up with several different framing options. Although I came in with a specific idea, he showed me a few really cool frame designs that proved to be better than what I had come up with. Long story short, they did an excellent job putting a frame on my  poster that complemented it's color scheme. On top of that, the guy was unsure if a particular deal that they had been running on Yelp was still valid or not, so he just decided to give it to me. I wasn't even aware there was a Yelp related deal. The impression I got was that they not only really loved coming up with new and creative ways to frame artwork, but that the people at April 7s wanted to be good to their customers. I'll be going back.

4.description: After waiting over a decade to get a special artifact from our travels framed, we finally wandered into April 7s. We knew the item deserved special treatment, but didn't have a clear idea in mind. The staff member we worked with had an art background, and used it to give us some good direction. When our vision was bigger than our budget, he helped us find cost savings. We picked up the item late last week, and it was gorgeous. The piece was almost four feet long, and to make hanging it easy April 7s created a cardboard template, with drill holes. It was an extra bit of service we didn't expect, but made it easy to get this large piece up on the wall. We've definitely found our Chicago frame shop.

6.description: If there was one word to describe how you feel every time you walk out of here with your personalized picture it would have to be euphoric. I have been working with Martin for several years now. He has done everything from a sports photo, to a Thailand souvenir to a WWII keepsake. Every single time I wonder how he could possibly get better and he exceeds any expectations. He truly is a genius and it is so wonderful to have a partnership with someone that is not only talented as he is just a nice person. These items hang in your house and you would think they only mean something to you, but the pride, skill and time he puts into it shows how much those items mean to him, too!  Such a fantastic shop filled with wonderful people!  I cannot say thank you enough!

22.description: Best frame shop in Chicago hands down. I have had over 10 pieces custom framed here and have been nothing short of ecstatic with the turn out. Martin and company are wonderful at helping you to find the perfect combinations of designs to fit your work. They're very affordable and very efficient in getting your order done on time.

15.description: I am so happy with the work that April 7s had done for my custom framing project.  I had bought some artwork from Etsy that was unique and important to me-- We worked with Alex who was awesome and very flexible.  We had changed our idea a few times and he worked with us.  The price was a lot higher than I had expected, but his work was very much worth it.  I hated putting a time pressure on them, but they were able to complete this complicated project in a weeks time.  I hope to have these pieces forever! I will be back for our next project.

57.description: Ok, after the previous review, I had a lot more framing done.  My spouse and I have accumulated a lot of wall decoration, and not much in frames.  So we got some Ikea frames and went here to get matteing.  We had about 35 things that needed mattes.  I stopped by in mid-December.Martin said it would normally be about 2-3 weeks, but with the holidays, it would be a week longer.  It ended up being about 3 times that.  But this is a small operation, and the biggest job they had, probably.  Sometimes it was tough getting updates on the progress, but eventually we got everything back and it all looks amazing.  We even recommended my brother-in-law go here.

20.description: What do you mean it normally takes more than 24 hours to custom frame a picture?I'm sorry I forgot the guys name, but he could not have been more helpful. Knowing he had to turn it around quickly using stuff they have in the shop already, he spent a full hour with me digging up different options for mattes and frames. He gave great suggestions and assisted while I putzed around taking my time deciding which frame to use.  Could not have been a better customer service experience.I was tempted to give one less star just because the price seemed high, but you know what, I have no idea what custom framing costs. I think it costs more than I want it to cost. Maybe if I had framing done frequently, I might be wise to shop around for a good deal.  But since I have something framed about once every ten years or so, this was a pretty wise choice.

36.description: My husband has had many pieces framed at April 7's. I think it's been about 7 or 8, now, including a Banksy. They do an amazing job, every time! They also offer discounts if you have multiple things framed at the same time. I highly recommend using April 7's for any of your framing needs! They are friendly & really easy to work with.

14.description: We worked with Martin and got amazing service. He picked out several frames for us after hearing what we were looking for. He also gave us a variety of options with those frames to find the best price for us.This is the first frame store I've been to, but after visiting, we will not go anywhere else. It's great to be able to support local businesses and also get great customer service.

58.description: Sushi X is always delicious. I love that they have BYOB and half off rolls every month. I have never been disappointed with their food. However, about 50% of the time the service is unbearably slow, even when there's not a lot of people in the joint. The servers seem rushed and stressed most of the time. Several times we have had about an hour wait to get our food. Lately we have been ordering takeout rather than opting to stay in.Still - they have great sushi and half of the time the service is good! :)

56.description: Sushi x is my absolute favorite sushi restaurant in Chicago. I have tried a ton of different spots for sushi but this is my absolute favorite. Others barely come close to the food here. I have dined in and had delivery and both are always great. Great job sushi x! :)

29.description: We had been at "sushi X" multiple times, brought friends and referred the place. All feedbacks were positive. Casual, laid-back atmosphere, good service and the best sushi. You cannot get wrong, whatever you order. Excellent deal for lunch. It's called "lunch X box" for $10. Easy access and always street parking available.

42.description: Fun tasty rolls! But most of them have cilantro which I cant stand!!! I don't know if I didn't say clearly that i needed all of them without cilantro or our server didn't hear me (cause music is pretty loud) and didn't double check.... but 3 out of 4 rolls came out WITH cilantro. When we told her that all rolls are supposed to be with no cilantro she had a very bitchy attitude about it and she completely forgot to place an order for one more roll and told us that we didn't order it.... she had this attitude the whole time we stayed there and in the end she didn't even say "thank you, good night". She just dropped off our check and left. Seriously?? Sorry but we had to leave her just 12%... I think her name was Rachel... Overall I really enjoyed the food. Wish the service was better

23.description: I came here for lunch one day because I did not feel like waiting for the 66 bus after getting off the blue line. The outside is mysterious and if the name did not say "sushi x" I would have guessed it was some porn shop. The sushi was awesome. I tried salmon, octopus and tuna. They were decent sized too for rolls. The lunch special came with Perrier. I will come back for dinner sometime.

47.description: Food is good. Atmosphere and service not so much. Was there for lunch - both water glasses had lipstick still on them, the other glass that was brought out for another drink was cracked down the side. I dropped something and while picking it up saw the scariness of the floors - looked like it had not been swept or mopped in some time.  Drinks - they are bottled.  I was expecting a glass of fresh tea with honey and instead  got a bottle of tea that's primarily sweetened by cane sugar and was super disappointed.   I could have gotten the bottled crap at CVS across the street and it would have been cheaper.I really like the food but will probably only order take out from this point on.

8.description: Rolls are pretty solid, but nigiri is weak.  I like the oyster shooter. I would give 3.5 stars, but I can't so, it has to get 3 cuz it doesn't rise to 4 stars.  Been here plenty of times out of convenience.

31.description: This is by far the best sushi place in town! It never disappoints and has something for everyone, even for people who don't love sushi! They have a nice mix of raw and cooked foods which make it the perfect place to take friends. Plus, you can't go wrong with BYOB! The rolls are unique and delicious, definitely some out of the box flavors that are amazing! The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is very fun. It's a small place but worth the wait. It's a West Town staple!

34.description: Ordered to-go from here as a first timer a month ago because I live very close! I was hoping this would be a new go-to for sushi take out but I'm really hesitant to give it another try. Pros: some of the rolls were quite good. Cons: one of the rolls came with mango in, and on top of it. I know I would never order a roll with mango as I am very allergic, but thought I probably read the menu wrong or something. Mango wasn't listed on the menu but was put on the roll. Not really a fun surprise, when I called to let them know my order was not only incorrect, but that I was allergic to the ingredient they added, the employee on the phone asked what I wanted in return for the mistake. While I asked for a refund for the roll, I just thought it was a little insensitive due to the error being a food allergy issue...and now I had less food! The other thing that really irritated me was the portion of the tuna tartare. I am not sure if they give a smaller portion with to-go orders or if this is their norm, but it was SUCH a sad portion size for $14. It was tiny and there was NO tuna in comparison to all the accompaniments. Really a shame. Ordered a ROK bowl that also lacked flavor, maybe this is better in the restaurant? Not a good experience in general and for that, it makes it difficult to try out again, especially for around $15 a roll.

16.description: From the outside, it looks like a night club. When you walk in, it looks like a former nightclub....but very small. It has a large screen playing old Anime movies which is pretty cool .Our waitress was really sweet. The food is good but it pretty much has your standard sushi restaurant menu with the gyoza, seaweed salad etc. apps and then the usual sushi rolls. They do have a nice selection of more complex sushi rolls and I got the megatron roll - good but just had too much stuff in it so the flavors of all the different items' seemed to cancel each other out.I would recommend Sushi X because it's inexpensive and it BYOB!

13.description: I have had the pleasure of dining here twice and had wonderful experiences both times! The highlights you ask?- Amazing customer service - Amazing sushi rolls and apps!- Amazing ambiance - BYOB... soooo... also awesome. Check it out!

11.description: Best Sushi spot in Chicago. I tried em all & this place is by far #1. Godzilla roll is amazing!

39.description: Went for dinner recently and it was delish!! Still craving the tuna tartar which is not only yummy but the portion is nicely generous. Service was spot on, with our servers checking in and ensuring we had everything we needed. We absolutely loved it and will be back soon.

37.description: This place is awesome. It has parking, a unique vibe, and some of the most original rolls/combos. The employees are always helpful and spunky, the prices aren't ridiculous like some 'hip' sushi places, and their monthly specials are always worth it.Eaten here a bunch of times-- both take-out and dine-in with some BYOB. The Black Widow roll is phenomenal, the scallops are CRAZY GOOD, and even the simpler rolls are wonderful.Overall, great place. Love dealing with them.

0.description: The first time we came we celebrated my fiance's birthday with a very large group of friends. The restaurant was very accommodating and allowed us to book half of the restaurant, the area behind the curtain. The level of service stayed great, the food was absolutely delicious and everyone had a blast, even though there were a LOT of us there.We also came tonight for dinner and ordered the dragonfly and the double stack rolls. Both rolls were delicious and HUGE. We ordered 2 rolls to share, 2 misos, 4 pieces of salmon sashimi, and chocolate peanut butter cup dessert and it was more than enough food for the 2 of us.The sashimi was very tiny pieces, a lot smaller than what I am used to, and I get salmon sashimi at every sushi place. But the fish was very fresh and deliciously fatty.They are BYOB so bring a bottle of your favorite libation.They do not take reservations for small groups, but we were able to come in and get a table on a Friday. I assume with a small wait you ca do a walk in.We have done take out before as well and the quality of the sushi was still great.I highly recommend Sushi X for a regular dinner or for a celebration in the reserved private area.

38.description: Sushi x helped host a bridal shower for us recently.  The prices were reasonable and they went above and beyond making sure we had everything we needed.  The food was really good and even put the left overs in little goody bags for people to take home!  I can't wait to go back to sushi x for lunch or dinner.  Thank you again teresa and sushi x crew for your work!

51.description: Awesome sushi! Great atmosphere. Kinda small so go in a small group. But the food is amaaazzinnggg. Not to mention byob what whhaaatt.

27.description: Excellent choice.   If your looking for a large selection with good quality, you have to try this place. The rolls are large, fresh and tasty. Delivery is fast and there was no fee. I like their specials.  The have some pretty creative options. If you want sushi and you'd like to eat in you own home, this is a great option!We've never dined in at this place but we have picked up our food. Looks nice inside.

32.description: Love this place!  Been here a few times.  Byob, friendly staff and cool music and vibe.  The coconut shrimp was really good and all their rolls are great! The giant larger ones will really fill you up so if you're hungry would recommend that. Every month they also have a roll on special but you have to ask! Got the crab Rangoon roll, the mango, the jalapeño roll and some other ones.. All super freaken amazing!  It's super small tho so you might be waiting if you come during a busy time and I don't think they take reservations.  Def recommend this place for a cute date night!

54.description: For sure get the Godzilla! Byob , bring some Prosecco. Can't find any? Head to Lush or noble grape!!!! (Or cvs if you want a standard selection) no excuse to not have booze!

48.description: I've ordered a few times from Sushi X and I must say that it's exterior is somewhat off-putting (a building painted black without windows), but this is in no way indicative of the great food inside.  Yesterday, I tried some of their wasabi ceviche that was a great twist on a classic peruvian dish; I found it to be very refreshing.  The red chicken was absolutely delicious! The dish included grilled chicken served curry style with a red pepper marinade and other vegetables; I requested it spicy and it turned out incredible.

44.description: I expected this place to suck about as bad as a binky at a warehouse rave. Don't get me wrong I love a good innuendo as much as the next guy, but party drug references on a website (rollingatsushix.com) doesn't exactly give me confidence in the Caterpillar roll. I was totally wrong though. Went in expecting a bunch of kids sake bombing and being obnoxious and actually found a pretty decent BYOB. The rolls are affordable and tasty but I recommend doing one of their bowls. There's a couple of different options, but they're basically deconstructed makis served with either sashimi or stuff from the hot menu.  It's small and has some trippy artwork on the wall so unless you're dining with a Mormon or Jehovah's Witness who'd be horrified at the insinuations I'd say it's a pretty decent place to take a date.

24.description: Delicious sushi, decent sized rolls (you actually get what you pay for), and byob. What more could you ask for... maybe bring back the bento lunch boxes?

7.description: Normally I would not write a bad review. This time around, I am compelled to do so because the service was so bad, we left before ordering food. We walked in, we were seated, but a couple was getting up from a table further from the door than ours, so we politely asked if we could switch to the table they were vacating. The hostess said this was no problem. After the table was cleaned, a server finally arrived at our table and asked if we had ordered food yet. We had not even been given menus. Then, our server brought one menu, telling us they couldn't give us two because "there is a big party taking them all". Then we asked if we could switch to the table we were told we could switch to. The server said, "oh wait, the hostess said you could do that? Hold on." She proceeded to consult the hostess, and after they decided not to let us sit at the other table, the hostess shouted from across the restaurant, "Oh sorry!"We brought with a bottle of wine to drink, since it's a BYOB.  We asked for a bottle opener, and they brought one.  But they really just dropped it on our table nonchalantly and walked away. There was no offer to provide ice to keep our bottle chilled, nor was there any real concern for anything regarding our experience. I am not one to nitpick with service people, but our experience was so subpar, we just left before ordering. Maybe the food is good, but I can't recommend this place based on service alone.

49.description: As far as BYOB sushi places go, I'd say Sushi X would be slightly above average if you're looking for a pre-bar dining option. The black walls, high ceiling, and cheap artistic marilyn monroe prints make you feel like you're in a staging area for a club.  However, once you get past that, the service is good and the sushi is as fresh as you'll find in the Midwest.

40.description: Just ok, I've heard people raving about this place and I wasn't that impressed. Any place that uses lettuce in their sushi rolls always has me a bit suspicious. Rolls were all a bit forgettable. The space was also pretty jam packed, and they were playing anime vids, blasting music, and servers were running around like mad- so it just made me pretty anxious. Not the typical soothing sushi restaurant vibe I prefer. The punny sushi roll names and fun design of the menu did help a bit to distract me from the chaotic vibe of the place. I felt like everyone around us was on an awkward tinder date, which I guess I could have expected from the exterior of the building, which is completely black with no windows. Can't say I'm rushing back here.

53.description: WORST service ever! Food was good.Came here with a friend for a lunch meeting on a Tuesday. I ordered a lunch box and the Godzilla. My friend ordered a sashimi combo and soup. The waitress forgot to bring out the soup, and we had to go up and tell her. My lunch box came with a water bottle which she also forgot and I had to ask for at the end of my meal. I finally got my water bottle with my TO-GO box!In the end, we felt rushed to leave. She completely disappeared (they close at 2pm..we had NO clue! would have been nice to let us know rather than disappearing on us!!)  and our water was never refilled. While we sat there thirsty, she tells us that they are closed. Wtf?! Okkkk... Guess it's time to hurry up and leave in the middle of our meal!! At least give us some water! Or a heads up!WORST service ever.

30.description: The service is TERRIBLE. My fiancé and I waiting for 25 minutes at our table just to order our appetizer. When we finally ordered,they forgot our seaweed salad and the sashimi was thin and tough. When we received our sushi, the rolls were very sloppy. Everything was thrown together in a messy fashion and the taste was subpar. When we received our bill, the prices were worse than the actual sushi. $9 for spicy tuna..are you kidding?! To conclude, don't waste your money. Sushi is an expensive habit so at least be satisfied when you leave.

46.description: If you like Anime, House music, and sushi then this is your place!  The rolls are Godzilla size (huge)!  In fact you can get the Godzilla roll.  I had the white tiger and the Megatron, both very good. The tuna tacos are excellent.  The servers were fun and welcoming. Very trendy spot, looked closed from outside but once your in its totally chill spot!!  Find the ninja and get a free desert!!Cool spot!

1.description: Meh. Meh. Two mehs; one for each star.  I'll begin with saying the atmosphere is pretty nice, but there may be too many tables, which made navigation to the bathroom somewhat difficult.  Once I got there, I realized it was being used.  No biggie, except I was literally five inches from someone eating dinner.  I went with two friends and the BYOB aspect, as many heave mentioned, was nice.We got the tempura green beans, but had to order two since the first order was cold.  The gentleman who served us rushed another round over.  We also had edamame, which was standard, and the veggie potstickers.  The potstickers were my favorite thing of the night.  We each ordered a plain roll and one p the fancier options.  All three "fancies" we're meh.  I ended up picking the maguro and super white tuna out since the rice was a bit hard and the roll as a whole had too much cilantro and was just meh. Sorry for all the mehs again, but it's the best word I can use to describe the bland tasteless dinner.Again, the staff was awesome but $90 for two mehs, especially when there are so many much better sushi places, was a bit of a bummer.This place has loads of high reviews, but I won't be back to see what I missed.

55.description: Hands down our favorite sushi spot in Chicago. We get Sushi X takeout almost every week. Thai Stick, Godzilla, Stingray, and Honey roll are staples that we can never get enough of.

9.description: Loved Sushi X! Myself and two other friends went on a Friday night, without reservations, and we were seated in less than 10 minutes. Next time, I'd make a reservation, because I think it was just pure luck that that happened. I think the fact that it's BYOB makes this place even cooler, and it kind of sets a different mood in the restaurant. The staff seems chill and relaxed, lending bottle openers should you need them (one of my friends with was 21+, so she brought herself a couple beers to enjoy). This place reminded me of a club, but the music wasn't obnoxiously loud that you couldn't carry on a conversation. Anyway, even though the ambiance was chill and the staff did their jobs, the true highlight is the sushi. Although it's a little more pricey, it was definitely worth every splurging dime. We ordered a variety of sushi between our little group, and venturing outside of my typical sushi order seemed more accessible and not as scary as it usually seems (in my case). Next time I have a sushi craving and a few extra dollars together, I definitely plan to go back.

26.description: Great service, good sushi that is inexpensive yet has the quality of a more expensive restaurant.

25.description: We have all had those days when it's too chilly to go out, but you're craving sushi sooo bad! I can say I've been let down with delivered sushi even from my favorite places before. This was not the case with Sushi-X though. They REALLY put the extra few minutes into packaging your to go order, so that when it arrives it still looks nice and tastes great! I've now had them deliver to me twice, and my only complaint is that I didn't care for the bacon in the Maui Waui roll. That's just a personal opinion though, and I'm sure they would have no problem substituting with extra pineapple or something. Definitely my favorite close, quick sushi joint!

12.description: Oh my goodness, where to start?! This place is great! The sushi tastes fresh. Innovative sushi ideas, general sushi staples all present.Do yourself a favor, get the Chocolate Reeses cup for desert. You will not be sorry.

59.description: Sushi X has been on my bookmarked list for quite some time and finally a Saturday night came around where we were craving sushi and didn't have reservations anywhere else so we decided to try this place hoping we wouldn't have to wait too long since they don't take reservations. Got in around 6:30pm and snatched one of the last 4 top tables there so that was a positive since I hate waiting, especially during winter weather in Chicago. The atmosphere is a little too funky for me with a big screen monitor playing Japanese cartoons and such. There's music as well, which got a little too loud at one point, but despite those things, we still had a great time and definitely enjoyed our sushi.So onto the goodies, we started with a spicy tuna salad for $9 which was a decent portion of tons of spicy tuna with spicy mayo and siracha, some avocado pieces on top a bed of lettuce, definitely recommend it. We also got an edamame which was a large portion as well while we waited for our creative and super size make rolls to be made and let me tell you that these rolls were huge. Some of them barely made it in my mouth, they were big so although on the pricier side, they were worth it. -Honey roll for $8 had white tuna, tempura flakes, cucumber, honey sesame mayo. One of the smaller rolls but definitely worth it.-Godzilla roll for $14 which happened to be my favorite one and is definitely worth the hype here had tempura shrimp, siracha, scallions, roe, cream cheese, tempura flakes, avocado, mayo, topped w/ eel sauce and wasabi mayo. Seriously, get it now!-Double Stack for $16 (this one was what my hubby really wanted since it had plenty of raw fish for him to eat, but I have to say I didn't love it, maybe I'm just not a fan of cilantro in my sushi but it was made of tuna, albacore, salmon, cilantro, jalapeno, avocado, mayo, roe, citrus chili ponzu. Definitely an adventure item.So the sushi was awesome overall and definitely filling because the rolls were huge in size and pieces. So the best part was when our super sweet server saw me take a pic of the gorgeousness she said "hey, if you upload your picture at sushi X on instagram, I'll get you a free dessert." Now that gets a star in itself. I love that kind of service, since I would have probably done it anyway. We ended up trying the mango mousse cake with some mochi ice cream, which was light and a great way to end the meal. So Sushi X is definitely worth trying if you're in the area for some good sushi and great service. But I wouldn't come in the winter since the door keeps opening and it gets a little chilly inside since the place isn't huge.

21.description: Consistently amazing fast friendly service!  Favorite sushi place in Chicago!! I've been coming here for 10 yrs.  I hope it's open forever!!

17.description: The sushi was sooo good and not expensive. First thing to review is of course the food!  We had the creamy ginger salad which was light and delicious. I'm not a salad person but that was really good.  The miso soup was about the only item we ordered that was just ok.  Our party of 4 had the white tiger roll, dragonfly roll, megatron roll, caterpillar roll, honey inside out roll, bombshell zero roll and waters all around for a little over $100. The place itself was nicely decorated and not loud which was nice because we didn't have to shout to have a conversation.  It had a huge screen in the middle playing animae from that was a little different.  There was actually some dance music playing like you're in a club so that was really different...not in a bad way because it wasn't loud.  It's not that big so I could imagine having to wait for a table but luckily when we went on a Saturday night around 9 pm we got a table right away.  The waitress was super nice and she had us look for a ninja figurine she hid somewhere around the restaurant for a free dessert.  We closed the place out so we weren't bothering anyone but that was cool.  The other 4/5 star reviews are spot on.  You should definitely visit if you like sushi!

10.description: I expected this place to suck about as bad as a binky at a warehouse rave. Don't get me wrong I love a good innuendo as much as the next guy, but party drug references on a website (rollingatsushix.com) doesn't exactly give me confidence in the Caterpillar roll. I was totally wrong though. Went in expecting a bunch of kids sake bombing and being obnoxious and actually found a pretty decent BYOB. The rolls are affordable and tasty but I recommend doing one of their bowls. There's a couple of different options, but they're basically deconstructed makis served with either sashimi or stuff from the hot menu.  It's small and has some trippy artwork on the wall so unless you're dining with a Mormon or Jehovah's Witness who'd be horrified at the insinuations I'd say it's a pretty decent place to take a date.

5.description: Great place for sushi, if you like an intimate hole-in-the- wall. It was busy and our table was a bit neglected when it came to ordering, but an apology and complimentary salad made up for it. I never have a problem when there's an apology. Steven was great, love that it's BYOB, the rolls were fantastic. We will definitely be back!

3.description: This is my go-to place for sushi. This place allows for BYOB.  The sushi is amazing, the service is fantastic, and I always leave satisfied.  I start with the edamame with the hot sauce (they should bottle this stuff and sell it).  Then we get a few rolls such as the Godzilla, rainbow and double stack. Check this place out.

35.description: HOLY CRAP ITS LOUD IN HERE!!Seriously though.... If youre able to get passed that, the sush was just ok. I dont quite understand all the raving of this place.

19.description: I came here for lunch one day because I did not feel like waiting for the 66 bus after getting off the blue line. The outside is mysterious and if the name did not say "sushi x" I would have guessed it was some porn shop. The sushi was awesome. I tried salmon, octopus and tuna. They were decent sized too for rolls. The lunch special came with Perrier. I will come back for dinner sometime.

28.description: we order sushi x quite often, and the food is always great. the double stack is the go-to roll, no question, but I gotta switch it up once in a while with a silver haze bowl. Both are packed with great fresh fish. I love this spot because the food is consistently fantastic, the rolls and other dishes are huge!, and the service is always great... dine in, carry out or delivery. I definitely recommend sushi x.

45.description: I ordered a lunchbox - couldn't believe the value! I got the miso soup, salad, drink and 6 rolls of spicy tuna, $15 dollars with change including delivery and tip! The sushi was spicy and delicious, soup pipping hot, salad a little tired but still fresh, and soda...well, as good as Sprite gets :)I looked up their website and it looks that if I was to order it separately, I'd pay $18 without delivery & tip, so the $10 lunchbox is definitively a steal! Will get it again for sure!

33.description: I really wanted to like this place. I really did. I wanted to try a new sushi spot but was disappointed.Went to this place on a Tuesday around 6pm with my partner. I thought it was a cute place because my partner is into anime and they have it playing on a wall with a projector with no sound, only music. The place is fairly small but roomy. The place was dark and lit with candles and some light. I liked it. The place is not as loud as I thought either. There was a boy and his mom sitting 3 feet from us and he was crawling on the floor and looking around looking for a toy in the place and I guess he one something, like a game. It was distracting and the place looked unprofessional. Immediately after picking our table we received paper menus and glasses of water.We started of with the Godzilla roll since I read on here a lot of people enjoy/recommend it. It was my favorite from this place sadly out of 4 rolls. This sushi roll took about 10 min to get to our table. Wasn't even a lot of people. I though they took forever.We got 3 rolls after that and that was it. We got the omega, spider and black widow.Tasted like they out panko in all the rolls.The presentation wasn't worth taking a picture.They all sounded pretty amazing except I wasn't impressed. The tempura tuna in the Omega wasn't as good. The sushi rolls weren't rolled tight. They were falling apart as I tried picking up some pieces. My partner called them amateurs under her breath. I don't wanna  disrespect anyone's hard work in this place but I called this cheap sushi. Not the best I've had. The service was okay. We certainly didn't get as much attention as the other tables. At the end I paid $63 for all 4 rolls which is decent for the sushi I usually eat. But I felt ripped off because the rolls were disappointing.I don't wanna give them one star because it wasn't the worst place but 2 stars because the sushi was sad.I will not be back here.

43.description: One of my favorite Sushi spots in Chicago The staff are all top notch, and the sushi is great. The sushi is seriously outstanding, hands down.

2.description: BYOB! This cute little sushi place is pretty good! There isn't took much around this location, but we took the Blue Line and grabbed a drink at the MatchBox before wandering over to try the sushi.. we obviously stopped by the CVS to grab a bottle of wineThe ambience was really nice, dark with some interesting art on the wall. The rolls are very inventive. For example, I had the Five-O, which is a roll made with prosciutto and bacon. It was really different and while I would probably rather stick to more traditional sushi, it was nice to step outside of the box on that one. We also ordered a Nigiri Platter, which was good quality and another MegaRoll

18.description: Sushi X has been on my bookmarked list for quite some time and finally a Saturday night came around where we were craving sushi and didn't have reservations anywhere else so we decided to try this place hoping we wouldn't have to wait too long since they don't take reservations. Got in around 6:30pm and snatched one of the last 4 top tables there so that was a positive since I hate waiting, especially during winter weather in Chicago. The atmosphere is a little too funky for me with a big screen monitor playing Japanese cartoons and such. There's music as well, which got a little too loud at one point, but despite those things, we still had a great time and definitely enjoyed our sushi.So onto the goodies, we started with a spicy tuna salad for $9 which was a decent portion of tons of spicy tuna with spicy mayo and siracha, some avocado pieces on top a bed of lettuce, definitely recommend it. We also got an edamame which was a large portion as well while we waited for our creative and super size make rolls to be made and let me tell you that these rolls were huge. Some of them barely made it in my mouth, they were big so although on the pricier side, they were worth it. -Honey roll for $8 had white tuna, tempura flakes, cucumber, honey sesame mayo. One of the smaller rolls but definitely worth it.-Godzilla roll for $14 which happened to be my favorite one and is definitely worth the hype here had tempura shrimp, siracha, scallions, roe, cream cheese, tempura flakes, avocado, mayo, topped w/ eel sauce and wasabi mayo. Seriously, get it now!-Double Stack for $16 (this one was what my hubby really wanted since it had plenty of raw fish for him to eat, but I have to say I didn't love it, maybe I'm just not a fan of cilantro in my sushi but it was made of tuna, albacore, salmon, cilantro, jalapeno, avocado, mayo, roe, citrus chili ponzu. Definitely an adventure item.So the sushi was awesome overall and definitely filling because the rolls were huge in size and pieces. So the best part was when our super sweet server saw me take a pic of the gorgeousness she said "hey, if you upload your picture at sushi X on instagram, I'll get you a free dessert." Now that gets a star in itself. I love that kind of service, since I would have probably done it anyway. We ended up trying the mango mousse cake with some mochi ice cream, which was light and a great way to end the meal. So Sushi X is definitely worth trying if you're in the area for some good sushi and great service. But I wouldn't come in the winter since the door keeps opening and it gets a little chilly inside since the place isn't huge.

41.description: Ordered Sushi X the other day via Seamless, and had a terrible experience. Shortly after placing the online order, a Seamless employee called me to say that Sushi X called them to say that one of the items we ordered (veggie gyoza) was "too heavy" and they couldn't make it. (??) A few minutes later, a Sushi X employee called me and spent five minutes complaining about how terrible Seamless is, how their customer service is awful, it's a horrible organization, etc., and that next time I should order through GrubHub or the restaurant directly. Okay...fine. She clarifies the gyoza thing (which still didn't make sense), and says the delivery guy is walking out the door with my order. Forty-five minutes later, nothing. I call Sushi X back and talk to a very hyper and defensive guy who says the delivery guy "left his cell phone at the restaurant" so he can't call him to check on our food. He says I need to wait a full 60 minutes before he can "make it up to me." Not encouraging. Needless to say, the delivery guy never showed up so I called back and the same hyper guy answered and was even more defensive and rude. I said we wanted to cancel the order, and he seemed pleasantly surprised... like he was glad that is all I wanted to rectify the situation. Sounded like this wasn't the first time customers were unhappy with their delivery service. Anyways, I asked him to confirm it would be cancelled and we wouldn't be charged. Yes, yes of course, he assured me and hung up. My husband checked his online cc statement and what do you know... Sushi X charged us for the full order. Can't wait to call back and deal with that. Never again.

52.description: Great spot, cool atmosphere and a trendy vibe to it.  We try to come to Sushi X at least 2 or 3 times per month.  It's BYOB which is fabulous, the staff is super friendly.  The sushi is great, can choose between extra large rolls or the regular size rolls.  Appetizers are great and the portions are huge - highly recommend the asparagus beef roll, the hibachi scallops and the spicy tuna tacos.  All the rolls and sushi/sashima are awesome, and each month they have a special roll that is 1/2 off.

50.description: Get the sushi fruit, and you will not be disappointed.  This is my new favorite sushi spot in Chicago.  You may pass this place everyday and never know the restaurant exits.  But, it does, I promise you.  The exterior is very unwelcoming, but that is not indicative of the service.  The waitress was very friendly and the sushi was remarkable.Also, find the hidden ninja, and get some free mochi.  Who doesn't love ninjas and free dessert?

4.description: Haven't been here in months. the place is getting a big cramped, especially last friday. that said, the rolls are awesome - great taste, texture, presentation. music still is too loud for my aging ears but i love the energy of this place.

6.description: Sushi is my absolute favorite. If I had to choose a last meal on earth, it would be Sushi. Anytime I can't think of what to eat, I default to Sushi. In other words, I love Sushi.Sushi X, on the other hand, I don't love as much. I ordered delivery from Sushi X and while quick and prompt with their service, I couldn't eat half of my order due to the quality of the fish.I got a SPICY SALAD with spicy tuna that came with avocado and spicy mayo dressing. I asked for little (or no) mayo and the restaurant definitely honored that request by omitting the mayo from the dressing. That said, perhaps it's because I altered the dressing but the fish, itself, tasted RANCID. It smelled fishy, it tasted fishy... it made me gag. I could not stomach the salad and ended up throwing it away, much to my great dismay.I also got a SILVER HAZE BOWL with sashimi, lettuce, cucumber, scallions, masago, shiso leaf, carrots, daikon and soybean sprouts, sesame oil, nori flakes, and silver haze sauce (spicy red pepper vinegar sauce). This is basically your Korean "hwe dup bap" but better. I loved the julienned daikon and carrots but felt like the raw soybean sprouts were too potent and detracted from the other flavors. The silver haze sauce is essentially Korean "cho-gochujang" and was very welcome because IT IS SURPRISINGLY IMPOSSIBLE TO FIND IT IN CHICAGO /end rant. Again, some of the fish tasted rancid so I had to pick them out but, overall, after picking out the soybean sprouts and rancid fish, this was an excellent entree and I would order again.Maybe it was an off day, maybe the fish was off. I would reorder because I loved the Silver Haze Bowl and am hoping the rancid fish was a fluke.

22.description: From the outside, it looks like a night club. When you walk in, it looks like a former nightclub....but very small. It has a large screen playing old Anime movies which is pretty cool .Our waitress was really sweet. The food is good but it pretty much has your standard sushi restaurant menu with the gyoza, seaweed salad etc. apps and then the usual sushi rolls. They do have a nice selection of more complex sushi rolls and I got the megatron roll - good but just had too much stuff in it so the flavors of all the different items' seemed to cancel each other out.I would recommend Sushi X because it's inexpensive and it BYOB!

15.description: Love this place!  Been here a few times.  Byob, friendly staff and cool music and vibe.  The coconut shrimp was really good and all their rolls are great! The giant larger ones will really fill you up so if you're hungry would recommend that. Every month they also have a roll on special but you have to ask! Got the crab Rangoon roll, the mango, the jalapeño roll and some other ones.. All super freaken amazing!  It's super small tho so you might be waiting if you come during a busy time and I don't think they take reservations.  Def recommend this place for a cute date night!

57.description: My go-to sushi place. The dinning room is cute but small. I live near by and get take out from here a lot. Best sushi in the neighborhood if you ask me. The rolls are fresh and you can taste all the various favors. Everything there is good but a few of my favorites are: the white tiger, the Buddha roll, double stack, omega roll,  Godzilla roll and sweet potato roll is warm & sweet. The spicy tuna tacos are the spicy tuna roll mix in a taco: really good sushi alternative.  Buddha roll is great for vegans and they even have a roll with spicy chicken if you want. There is a lot of sushi around here and sushi-X is a winner.

20.description: Food was really good, huge rolls and huge menu!  Miso Soup and Oyster shots really good!  Yellow jacket, Black widow and Maui Waui were all really good!  The decor was cool, Just think the place is really dark.

36.description: I have been to Sushi X twice now and held out writing a review. The first time a friend and I arrived we bailed after waiting 20 minutes with no end in sight. The place doesn't have a waiting area which is inconvenient to say the least. If I have to wait for a table at least give me somewhere to stand and maybe enjoy a glass of wine or beer while I am waiting. On a side note, the place is BYOB, which everyone loves. Attempt #2: Same friend and I met again and decided to pop in early in hopes of getting a table. Mission accomplished! The whole place is somewhat small and can get loud but I feel that is to be expected in most trendy places nowadays.We started out with the usual edamame and gyoza. They were pretty typical with what is served at other sushi places. We ordered from the Mega side of the menu. The dragon fly was great, the sushi fruit was different (not to my liking) and another staple, the spider. There is a reason these are on the "mega" side of the menu. The portions are exactly what they say - mega. Attempt #1: My friend and I met at Sushi X again dinner. Again we were seated right away. We got there around 6:30 pm on a Saturday this time. This time we thought we would venture out of our normal appetizers, so we tried the sashimi carpaccio. There were nice cuts and variety of sashimi and I enjoyed the lightly balsamic touch. We ventured out on the menu you a little more this time. We ordered from the Zero section - bombshell, which I was pleasantly surprised. We also ordered the Red Dragon from the Inside Out section of the menu, The various ideas Sushi X has are cool. Both times I was happy with the quality of the fish, however, when a sushi requires two or three bites I get a little annoyed. I want to be able to enjoy the roll in its entirety. The atmosphere is very upbeat, however, the place is somewhat cramped and can get very noisy. Each time we were here street parking was relatively easy; however, I have a feeling that is not always the case.

14.description: Solid!!! Cool atmosphere (Japanese anime meets Crate and Barrel)...prices are remarkably low...byob which is not uncommon. Combine excellent service, no crowds, excellent quality sushi, extensive menu selection, and great prices = new go to place!!! It's going into our regular rotation. You won't be disappointed!!!!

12.description: The City of Chicago requires licensed pedicabs to get inspected so I took it to Ancien Cycles because of it's close proximity to my garage. It was my first time at the shop and I must say it is very impressive. They have a ton of products as well as a ton of space. More importantly the service they provided was top-notch. I've heard of other shops charging a ridiculous amount of money to perform this two minute pedicab inspection. The guys at Ancien Cycles was kind enough not to charge me. I'd recommend everyone to go to Ancien Cycles for all of their bicycle (and pedicab) needs!

7.description: A great team and a fantastic bike shop. Mike and Scott helped me update my aging single speed with a great looking and comfortable brooks saddle, bar tape and nitto bars.They let me borrow a great book on Paris-Brest-Paris, a ride they introduced to me and got me excited to do through their own enthusiasm. Look forward to having a new bike kitted out by a very experienced bunch!Can't wait til the bar and restaurant are open. I will probably end up spending even more time there than I do now.

3.description: Awesome shop, super friendly staff, great movie night with the Rapha crew! The bike shop has some necessary items for riders and some cool apparel and bikes that are unique and out of the box.

1.description: If you are looking for coffee without the craziness of Starbucks, take a seat at Ancien. I thought it was a Bike Shop, but I saw the tables and decided to try it out. Good coffee and according to the other reviews, much more. Don't be deterred by the Metra. I barely noticed it.

2.description: One of my best friends held her 30th birthday party here. This is a really great event space! They had their own kitchen where they made panninis and other hot food for a party of about 40-50 people. They moved their bicycles and some of the other items in their store to accommodate for the party, plus they let us decorate with our own stuff, like photos, a big banner, even some small candles. My friend had purchased the liquor for the party and we made a punch that they allowed people to pour for themselves but they also had their own staff bartending. They were courteous, professional, and genuinely interested in making the party planners and the guests happy. It's pretty easy to find parking around here and also very easy to find. Not sure how much cost is or how far in advance you have to reserve but it seemed like they were pretty flexible and reasonably priced.

9.description: Quite the bike place. Friendly staff (and even friendly customers have helped me here). I can't wait until their restaurant opens up - And....its right on Milwaukee, on the most heavily trafficked part of the city. Get some tunes on the inside & outside of the building guys!

10.description: Welcome to the neighborhood, Ancien! With the arrival of the warm weather, I brought my bicycle outside the depths of my garage where it had been all winter and realized that I must have left my helmet back at home in Miami.  Now I am no professional cyclicst, nor have I ever splurged on bike equipment, but I was interested in a good quality helmet at a decent price.  I walked in and was immediately greeted and welcomed into the shop. The guy who helped me out really took the time to explain to me the options they offered and properly fitted me for the helmet.  I ended up spending around $50 for the helmet, which is definitely more than I'm used to, but is to be expected from a specialty bike shop.  Really excellent customer service!!

13.description: This is my new go-to bike store. I went in for some basic service on a bike. I thought the pricing was very reasonable. All 3 employees I interacted with were very pleasant. One guy even offered me a cup of coffee. (I don't think that was usual. More of a "it's early on a Sunday, so here ya go".)  Normally I think of good shops as stocked to ceiling with bikes and massive walls of disorganized tools for the mechanics. Ancien was much more polished and I actually liked it. Lots of open space, a smaller selection of mostly higher end bikes and accessories. It had a really amazing setup for sizing riders for custom builds. There's a small cafe that offers some basic snacks and drinks. There were couches and wraparound bars with stools along the walls. I just moved from Bucktown where I was a big Rapid Transit fan. It's nice to know I have a quality shop just a couple minutes from my house now. I would certainly recommend stopping in.

16.description: I am very impressed with this bike shop.  I own two Storck racing bikes and I've been looking for a reliable place to have them serviced.  I decided to give Ancien a try because they are located close to where I live and because their mechanics have experience working with Campagnolo systems.  Over the last month they have rebuilt two of my Campy shifters, replaced the shifting and brake cables on both bikes, replaced a bottom bracket, and replaced a chain.  My bikes are now shifting better than they have ever shifted.  The mechanics are obviously skilled and their service rates were very reasonable.  I have been into the shop around five times now and they have provided exceptional customer service during every visit.  I will be coming to them for all of my service needs in the future.  I should also note that one of the best things about this shop is that they are targeting a broad range of clientele from bike novices to bike experts.  In my experience most shops that carry high-end bicycles also carry some introductory models, but when a novice enters one of these shops he is often ignored or treated condescendingly.  If what I have witnessed so far is any indication, this will not happen at Ancien.  I have seen one of the owners talking to people with little cycling experience (one was someone who had just moved to Chicago and was looking for information on riding a bike in the city and equipment options).  His manner was friendly and welcoming and he spent a lot of time explaining the equipment options.  He made an effort to find out what sort of riding the individual would be doing without trying to steer him towards the more expensive racing-oriented options.

17.description: I rarely write reviews here but I was compelled to do so in this case, on my 3 visits here the service has been above and beyond what I've received at other shops, on my last visit I went for what I thought was a simple front derailleur adjustment on my Cannondale and the gentleman who took care of me proceeded to also adjust the rear and discovered that I needed the rear derailleur re-tapped, he searched around for the tool did the work and also explained everything that was going on with my components which in turned helped me uncover another issue which most likely would have caused further damage. He did all of this with a level of cool, patience, and sophistication that indicates that it's either his way of being or he truly likes what he's doing! good sense of humor too! I honestly won't be buying any bikes here as I like to build my own but for parts, service and experienced advise and tips this is your place! second to none!

15.description: so so glad that this shop exists right across the street from me. my darling ricky needed a new tire and some tlc and the folks at ancien did a great job! the space is pretty awesome and the staff is amazing!

0.description: What a great venue!Introduced as a  "Lifestyle" organization, when I saw the Julie Wood (Jazz) Quartet (great!) there on Wednesday.Mixing two of my favorite things: (bicycling & Jazz), as well as some wine, sandwiches all for $10Definitely going back there just to check-out some of the quality & creatively designed cycles.Worth checking out!

5.description: Great place!!! I was told by another shop that I needed several parts to fix my bike. Luckily for me, this place opened right across the street from me. I went in told them my problem and they where able to fix it for way cheaper and great service. I highly recommend this place!!!

11.description: Another great bike shop opens in Chicago.  Dropped in at the start of a ride up Milwaukee to window shop.  These guys are very friendly and informative.  They have unique quality products and can recommend whatever you may need.  The associate installed a new seat post on my wife's bike within 15 minutes and adjusted it so that she could had the perfect fit.  These guys are knowledgeable and helpful.  Prices are very reasonable, especially considering the quality of the components.  They actually intend to build a relationship and not simply sell you something.  Good job.

8.description: Very clean bike shop. Mechanic was very knowledgable and had my tire fixed within 20 minutes with no appointment on a Saturday. Glad they replaced Upgrade Cycle Works as my nearest bike shop cause this place is literally an upgrade from Upgrade. If I were to have one complaint, it's due to lack of accessories. But with the internet, that's not really a problem. Looking forward to the bar side being finished and perhaps buying a new bicycle from here.

4.description: Best location for a bike shop in Chicago? Quite possibly...and I'm not just saying that cause it's spitting distance from my pad. Milwaukee Ave is the cyclist equivalent to the Kennedy Expressway so if you're on your way to or from The Loop from Wicker Park or Logan Square Ancien is a great place to stop for a tune up, some air in your tires, or accessories. They're also going to be opening a bar and cafe next door which will be even more of a reason to stop on your commute during the summer. The owners are awesome and super experienced in food and beverage as well as bikes so stay tuned for some great stuff from them in River West.

14.description: Very impressive bike store right on Milwaukee Ave south of Chicago Ave in West Town. I went during their grand opening for a yoga and wine event. Yes, they had a yoga class going on and free wine afterwards. Really great staff and terrific selection of brands like Opus, Moots, Ritte. The repair guys are total  gear heads who have been building and repairing bikes for years. It's a very passionate staff who are informed not just about bikes but about the whole cycling scene and the vibe of the place makes you just want to hang out, which I suppose is good because apparently they are building a restaurant and bar next door. It's a very unique cycling store unlike any I've been to.

6.description: Took my bike in for a tune-up into this nice looking shop/store, and picked it back up a few days later.  The staff is knowledgable yet  surprisingly unfriendly.A smile & greeting typically persuade customers that your business is happy to get new business....Tried to pick up the bike on a Friday just after 6pm but the place was "closed" although many people were watching TV inside... For a bike shop on presumably one of the busiest bike streets in America, I was very surprised that they close so early on a weeknight.An accidental overcharge would be no issue - if the cashier had the password to credit it back... This had to be done hours later over the phone

28.description: Most unhelpful pharmacy, one time I needed to have my script transferred to another store because I wasn't going to make it there by 10 p.m to pick it up, the answer was no. Hmm Walgreens does it. Another time I was shorted 20 bucks in change at the drive through.Tonight, I guess the pharmacy closes at 6 or 8, I'm not sure but it seems early for a Saturday night. I will be moving my scripts for sure.Then since I was there I decided why waste the trip, better pickup milk, a line of about twenty people deep. Are you kidding me? So I put the milk back and leave.A note to CVS corp, this is the first of two reviews that will be both one star. Staff your stores with good hires, people hate lines and other weirdness.

1.description: This place is an embarrassment.They force customers to work there a la self checkout. Anytime checkout requires a coupon, or if checkout is going smoothly, the whole thing stops,  blinks and requires an associate to type in some numbers to move it along. There are 5 checkout stations yet 15-20 people generally waiting to checkout and every station is blinking that it requires assistance. No one actually works at the register. In an economy such as this, people need jobs, so wtf happened here? Everything is done by computer; yet even those are incompetent!!!Product placement is beyond misleading.Parking lot is tiny.Pharmacist handled a syringe with her bare hands and when I asked for a sealed one she said that was the only one I could get. Gross.

9.description: huge homeless problem here.you're pretty much guaranteed to be harassed by 1 or more shady looking characters lurking outside the front entrance begging for money (and yelling at you if you don't give any).I've brought it up to the manager, who says there's nothing they can do.I called CVS corporate, they say it's the store's problem.end result, I now go somewhere else.

29.description: Very nice pharmacy staff, but incompetent. Unfortunately, being nice doesn't cover everything when you are dealing with medications that can cause very severe problems if mishandled. I will never go to another CVS again, particularly this one, for prescriptions. Problems: In February I received someone else's medication and had to bring it back. In May I set up the auto-fill option. Twice now I have gotten calls saying they are ready and when I go in, they are not ready. Fine, but what's the point of the auto-fill calls? Also, despite asking multiple times to change my contact information, they are still calling my parents in Ohio (I haven't lived there in 5 years). This week (July 7), I was charged for 3 months of pills and received 1, so had to go back. Also this week, I asked for both of my prescriptions, but they said one needed an authorization, even though my bottle said there was one more. I called my doctor and she called CVS to refill it. I went back and she said it had been ready all along, but she thought there was a change. Why would she think that if neither me nor my doctor said there would be a change? Excuse for incompetency I guess. I am now behind on my medication by 2 days, which is ok for me, but for more serious medication, this could be a real issue.They say you should choose your pharmacist as closely as you would your physician, advice I will now heed. I highly recommend moving your prescriptions away from CVS. Even if they are nice, a medication error can be very, very serious. Please don't support a company that has as many issues as this one (look up CVS complaints online and you'll see they have nation-wide issues), especially on something as important as medication.

23.description: Ha! The negative reviews for this place pretty funny. I mean, the store is filled with some crazy ppl at times, don't get me wrong, but I agree with Kelsey M.  It's a CVS! LOL!I am giving this a 4 based on the pharmacist alone. Went in asking for a recc for OTC cold medicine....she asked me my symptoms, we talked about boogers/snot/mucus, what the color and consistency of mine were like, what that meant, and how I should proceed.I think I felt so gross I was pretty sure I said, "my boogers are green and kind of thick?"  I bet if she rated me, she'd probably give me a 1....For the record, I'm no longer a snot filled person and am on the road to recovery.

5.description: This place is THE WORST place to go to, staff are I competent and rude, machines don't work...I advise to NEVER come to this location.

31.description: The store itself may be your classic convenience store hole, but the pharmacy is wonderful.  The good folks who work behind the florescent-lit counter are friendly, on-the-ball, and will take the brain-space needed to remember you next time.If you would like a regular pharmacy to get your Rx from, go here.  If you need some advice, go ask them.  If you need to grab your prescription and a pack of toilet paper and a candy bar, they'll ring you up and smile doing it.

25.description: Maybe it's because it's like a second home to me by now, but I have few problems with this CVS. I guess the ones I do have should warrant a lower star rating, but I just can't do it to them! The people who work there are insanely nice, at least to me, and anyone else who seems to engage them. I saw the first loud customer situation in 3 years today, where a girl was trying to return a phone and they wouldn't let her... She swore up and down and called the lady several nice names, and we later found out it was the third phone she tried to return...Anywho, The lines can be long, but usually move fast. It annoys me when people don't line up along the cassette tapes and photo area, and instead spread all out into the impulse-buy-table area; I mean, are you new or something?They should start putting Vitamin Water on sale a lot more, but they often have good deals on vodka and cold medicine...

12.description: The friendliest CVS ever and the cashier Anne was very helpful. My cvs card doesn't work sometimes. And she was the only who explained me what to do. Oh and there's wide choice of cosmetics which is great.

21.description: Great location, clean, with easy parking. Also a US bank in the parking lot... this place works for me!

16.description: Ha! The negative reviews for this place pretty funny. I mean, the store is filled with some crazy ppl at times, don't get me wrong, but I agree with Kelsey M.  It's a CVS! LOL!I am giving this a 4 based on the pharmacist alone. Went in asking for a recc for OTC cold medicine....she asked me my symptoms, we talked about boogers/snot/mucus, what the color and consistency of mine were like, what that meant, and how I should proceed.I think I felt so gross I was pretty sure I said, "my boogers are green and kind of thick?"  I bet if she rated me, she'd probably give me a 1....For the record, I'm no longer a snot filled person and am on the road to recovery.

17.description: No complaints,they have pretty much everything that you need,it's clean,and plenty of parking ^^

10.description: I have been coming here since this was an Osco.  An OSCO!  Since I first moved to the city and lived across the street.  Its a CVS now. And has been for quite some time.   I mean, I think we all wish it was still a stand alone Osco, but its a CVS - with carpet, weird signs to locate their items, a horrible self-checkout system and generally long lines.Why do I give it 4 stars?  The Pharmacy is great!  Drive-thru is fast and the pharmacists are SO friendly and helpful!Go easy folks.

11.description: I am an East Coast girl, so I am very CVS indoctrinated. I agree Walgreens looks shinier and newer, but you don't get to be East Coast without being a little rough. I really like this CVS because the staff is uber friendly and helpful. I hate the self-checkout stations, but I haven't been here once without a friendly greeting. Still, the food selection leaves much to be desired, and since I feel like this area is a food desert, it would be nice to have a better selection of groceries i.e. produce (not prepackaged 8-day old oranges), healthy prepared foods (not ugly old sandwiches) and decent cheese and pasta sauce (not Kraft singles and Ragu).

26.description: My experiences with CVS have not been the best as I try to patronize home grown Walgreen's as my first choice.However, what I really, really hate about CVS is the carpeting.  When shopping in a drug/convenient store I want to get in and out.Their wall to wall carpeting does nothing but hopefully slow down their customers in hopes they will make more unnecessary purchases.  Screw the carpeting, I'm not shopping in a Dept. Store.

27.description: Sweet baby Jeebus, this place is busy...at all hours of the day and night.  Might it have something to do with those super nice, super-approachable pharmacists?  I think it might.Last week, I probably would have written a scathing review.  Then, I dropped off a prescription to be filled.  I was swiftly informed it would take the pharmacy 20-30 minutes to fill it.  Ok, that's fine.  After all, there was a crowd of about 20 people hanging out in front of the pick-up counter and cars were busily streaming through the drive-through.  You're busy.  I get it.That, however, does not explain why it took me 1.5 hours to get my antibiotics.  I'm perplexed.  All one had to do was put 5 - count them, one, two, three, four, five - antibiotic pills in a little orange bottle, affix a label and hand over my gosh darned drugs into my greedy, grasping, and shaking hands.  Yup, 1.5 hours.Today, I run in to pick up more antibiotics, some bionic woman strength cough syrup, and steroids.  I'm in and out in under 5 minutes, with a smile on my face.  Oh, and the cutest, tiniest pharmacist man explained to me how to take my steroids and gave me a short but sweet lecture about absolutely, positively not chugging my cough syrup out of the bottle.  Instead, he gave me a beaker slash spoon to measure that shit out.  I need to come up with a name for that dealio.  It's sort of....kind of....like a spork....but a beaker that terminates in a spoon resemling a miniaturized sugar scoop.Oh, sorry, I got off track.  Yes, back with the program.  Pharmacists = caring, friendly, and patient.  Lines = sometimes long as the River Kwai.  (Note to self:  Bad analogy.  Replace with something better once brain is functioning at optimal speed). Will be back to fill more prescriptions if death rattle does not abate.

35.description: Why is this my favorite CVS?+ They are open 24-hours.+ They have a huge beauty/bath section.+ They have a large liquor section.+ They have all my necessary cleaning products.  Even Murphy's Oil Soap!  + Super friendly staff.+ Large magazine section if you're waiting to fill a prescription.+ Large parking lot for drivers.

0.description: This CVS is located on the corner of Milwaukee and Chicago.  A very convenient location with the bus and CTA Blue line only steps away.I don't think there was a card minimum here which is a bonus.  They also had "fresh produce", a few bananas.  Again, this isn't that major but it is a nice option to have fresh fruit if you want it.  I got a couple Gatorades here and a banana after one of my runs.  The service was friendly and actually helped me swipe my card as I was clearly incapable.  They also have self checkout at this location.I prefer someone else check me out.

20.description: The pharmacy's manager is the worst!! she always has bad attitude and even when there is no customers waiting in line....she wont acknowledge  that you are there standing for 15 minutes like a moron!! The when I say hello!!! I'm here.....she gets an attitude. You need to lead by example in front of you co-workers  ....if you can't no longer do that and be nice to the consumers like myself and everyone else....go HOME!!

19.description: I really hate to give a one star review but in the case of CVS I have to. I have been there 3 times counting today and it will be my last. I don't mind that a store has self check out for those who want to self check out but I work to hard and then spend my hard earned money at CVS only to have to check my self out and bag my purchases. The line is very long and there is ALWAYS a problem with at least one of the self check out lanes. I usually go to the Jewel on Des Plaines and Kinzie and they could not be nicer. I will stay closer to home from now on.

33.description: My review is mostly for the pharmacists.  I don't know where CVS finds them, but this store has the nicest, most helpful pharmacists I've seen at a major chain drugstore.  I've gone in several times with various ailments, and in an attempt to avoid going to the doctor, inquired with the pharmacists about which OTC drugs would help me. There are 2 in particular ( I wish I knew their names!) who are very friendly and sympathetic, and do seem to know which drugs work for which problems.  Unfortunately the rest of the staff is just so-so. Everyone's friendly but the lines are always sooooo long.  I guess you really wouldn't go out of your way for any CVS, but if you live in the area, this is much better than any of the Walgreen's around.

2.description: Compared to my last CVS on Kinzie and LaSalle this one is as awesome as a four day weekend. It's open 24 hours, there's a drive through, the staff is nice, there's a Coinstar machine, and they actually open the non self out check lane. Even though I actually did see a car drive through their front window (see pic) it's not that bad of a drug store that you'd want to do something like that.

34.description: CVS in River West: you get one star for selling booze, and the other for staying open 24/7.  But boo for the long, horrendous lines that occur more often than not in the evening.  And an even bigger boo for your unruly patrons.  Yes, it sucks waiting in line. But screaming and borderline abusing the staff isn't going to make much of a difference. Earmuffs for the kids-- unofficial warning to all families.  CVS, you've got a nifty "Extra Buck Rewards" program. Basically, you carry most everything I could need in a pinch.  But I've switched locations, because I moved, and I couldn't be happier.  I can now fill my prescriptions and read that "Us" magazine, er, rag (shhhh) in peace.

32.description: One Star for BeerOne Star for other BoozeNegative for the traffic which isn't their fault however getting a couple more cashier's out on the registers during after work core hours is too simple to NOT be their fault.

18.description: Ever since I moved down the street from this CVS I have despised having to use this CVS for my pharmacy. These people are awful!!! I even called them once asking if I could take two medications together and one of the pharmacists said yes, you sure can. 5 or 6 days later after I was waking up seeing blurry and dizzy in the middle of the night, I called my doctor very concerned and she said stop taking those two immediately, they are known for people hallucinating when mixing. On top of this, it always takes 20 minutes minimum (even in the drive thru!) to get an Rx. Moving in a week and couldn't be happier to not use them anymore!!
