13.description: I really, really don't like this CVS.  The first time I came here, I had a small child with me.  Since this was going to be a quick trip for baby wipes, I decided to nix the stroller as I could just grab a cart if necessary.  Well, turns out they only had about 3 carts for customers to use while the rest sat full of products throughout the store.  My next problem came when I needed help with reaching something.  An employee completely ignored me even though I said "excuse me" twice.  When it came time to check out, there was a long line waiting to use the self-checkout with no employee around to help those having trouble with the machines.  Having only self-checkouts and no one around to monitor them created a long wait with an anxious toddler who didn't want to be held and didn't want to hold my hand.  It's often convenient, but I still don't like it.

4.description: Wrost customer service I've encountered in a very long time, literally waited 10mins to be greeted and acknowledge. I understand it's a busy day in the drive in for people to pick up an Rx. A simple "Hello, I'll be with you in a moment" goes a long way. The lady behind the counter made me feel like me being sick was an unconvinance. The cashiers in the front of the store however are  always awesome and usually friendly, which makes the whole thing really disconnected.

24.description: Dudes...it's CVS I'm not sure what is to be expected?  Sure there's a ton of strange folk milling around this place, but come on, watching those characters is what makes the wait in line fly by.  I mean where else will you see a dude pick up a sixer of Bartles and Jaymes and a box of Magnums?  And sure they run out of stuff, but it's located at a very busy intersection in a residential area next to an El stop.  It's bound to happen. Over all I'm pretty happy with my CVS.  The people that work there are always friendly and they usually have everything I need in a pinch.

6.description: This may be the friendliest CVS ever.  They have a door greater.  This is also a large CVS.  The parking here is not easy but it was manageable.  Its one of those corners where 5 or 6 streets "cross" so its a busy area.  Interesting to me, they also sell alcohol here, but I was there early in the am, so that was not relevant for me at the moment.  They also carry pretty much everything else you find in CVS stores, and have a large pharmacy.  The checkout was easy as well.  Overall, this is a fine drugstore.

22.description: Ugh. This place is frustrating. It's a typical CVS, so I have no complains about the products. However, the staff is pretty terrible. They have self-check outs and the employees basically ignore every customer. I've waited in a HUGE line at the self check out while three employees standing behind the checkout counter chatted and laughed the entire time. Really? Really?!

15.description: Low score just to even out my score distribution. I was delighted to find they sell Tullamore Dew here, which is a very smooth yet underrated whiskey. Not to mention at the same price as Johnny Red, you'd be almost outta ur mind to get Red over the Dew. I know I know, no product reviews, got it Yelp police. Staff here nice but maybe that's everyone in Chicago.

7.description: The nice thing about this location is that it has a drive-thru.  It makes it easy to drop off your prescription and then to come and pick it up later when it is ready.  The only thing I hate is when you hit the call button and voice over starts talking to you.  It says, "that someone will be with you as soon as possible."  I am fine with that but the people working behind the window never look over and they will pretend like you are not even there.  I guess it just feels non-personal but they eventually will come over and talk to you.  The drive-thru will save you time...you can avoid the homeless person asking for money by the front door, the security guard profiling you and the long walk to the back of the store where you will always find someone waiting in front of you.As I continue to write this review am I wondering why I am giving them 4 stars because my comments seem a little negative.  I am giving them the 5 stars based off of them always filling my prescription in a timely manner, always filling the prescription correctly and being able to drive in and out quickly.If you do go in...this place has a blood pressure machine, so you can check if you are still alive or about to die.  You can also ask the pharmacist a few questions about certain over the counter drugs and if they will have any negative interactions with current medications you are taking.

8.description: The employees at this CVS are incredibly lazy. This location has self-checkout stations, so they never have a cashier station open. They honestly are taking complete advantage of self-checkout machines and force all customers to go to self check-out. Even though I always see employees in the front of the store standing around and talking about nothing, none of them are rarely courteous enough to open up a cash station for me and personally ring up my items. The so-called "door greeter" actually just stands there to direct you to the self-check out station, because none of them are actually going to do their jobs, go behind the station and actually HELP you get out of the store faster. I guess they think because they have self-check out machines, employees no longer have to do their jobs.

30.description: For whatever reason, this one pharmacy in this huge chain of pharmacies has the most wonderful, sweetest ladies that work here. I recently switched here from Walgreens because of a brand of a drug that they carry and I'm not sure that I've ever been treated nicer at any pharmacy ever. For some reason, pharmacists always have this "I'm too busy for you" air about them, but they are so sweet and helpful here that I simply had to yelp about it.Bonus points for a drive-thru pharmacy. Although I see the irony of it if you're picking up diabetes medicine or something. Being that I don't have any serious health issues, it was really nice not having to get out of my car during a snow storm.

3.description: The staff and the selection are great, however the pharmacy is another story.  The pharmacy is constantly out of stock, and the staff is rude and patronizing. I highly recommend this cvs except for there pharmacy.

14.description: The cash register Bany was too busy talking to her coworker about tatoo she forgot to say: hello, thank you and goodbye. Your customer service is horrible!

58.description: Giant-sized Jenga in a bar? Why yes, I will! I apologize for anyone who got my Jenga blocks spilled on them. I've only visited here once, but had a great time. Of course, it always helps when you're surrounded by good friends, good music, and beer. Can't wait to return!

56.description: I came here soon after a disappointing expeerience at another restaurant. The staff was friendly (people, don't forget to bring your driver's license or state ID). I like how they had a stage, television sets, games, tall tables and romantic ambience. The tables were also clothed. I thought I was eating a candlelight dinner.The staff helped with the orders. Since we came with a groupon deal, and basicall everything was up to us. We ordered what we liked. We each had a burger, a beer ,and two appetizers. The food was delicioius. I loved their hot barbecue wings. I forgot what burgers we ordered but it is definitely worth the price. Though they don't have a wide variety of burgers, they are distinctly Mahoney's. They have a full bar, which is awesome. It was a quiet Friday evening when I came. Only three tables were occupied.

29.description: Came here for my first time last Saturday. Music was great, big space for dancing and life sized jenga. Friendly bar staff and drinks were not crazy expensive. I'll definitely be back!

42.description: This is definitely not my type of place but I would say if you are looking for a fun place to feel like a kid playing traditional boad games this is the spot.With the DJ playing oldies but goodies in teh background that you can belt out while playing Jenga it is a lot of fun.Great for groups but word to the wise don't stay here sober because you will be the only one!  If you can't beat them join them is how your attitude should be when you come here!  And just have a great time!

23.description: Went in on 10/5/14. Waitress said they didn't have any dessert to order.  Then the first 3 bottled beers I ordered they were out of. Ordered fried artichoke hearts and those were decent. Had the vanilla porter but they ran out after 4 bottles. Over all, get your shit together and order the proper invantory on your menu or don't put it down at all. Server it as a "special" if you can't keep up with demand but don't disappoint  customers because that's all I was at Maloneys, disappointed.

47.description: Good times.One of my coworkers after work specials is coming down to Mahoney's. Not the best drinks or decor, but the atmosphere is refreshingly scene-free. I also like the games and the bartenders are friendly. I pretty much have a good time whenever I'm at this spot.

8.description: Mahoney's used to be OK about 6 months ago -- friendly staff, pretty good food, fun trivia that myself and friends used to frequently go to, and Blackhawks hockey (an official Blackhawks bar).With this in mind, I decided to meet up with some people for tonight's Hawks game. What ensued was the quickest decline of a bar due to new management that I have ever witnessed.1) A new, smaller menu without the two best things on the old menu -- Irish Poutine and Texas Potatoes. Now, everything is much more generic, run-of-the-mill bar food.2) The Jameson bottles lining the interior of the bar? Gone. So much for personality...3) When the Hawks game came on, it was only on about 4 of the 10 or so TVs. Fine, there was one close enough for me to watch. However, there was music still playing, which would normally be fine, but as an "Official" Blackhawks bar, this was not OK. So I politely asked our server if they were going to turn on the sound. She told me she would check .... but alas, I never received an update and the music kept playing... Needless to say, it was time to find a new destination.I don't know what the hell the new management is thinking, but they better get their crap together and fast -- there were maybe only 10 people in the entire bar, where as Twisted Spoke and Aberdeen Tap (where we later ended up) were all crowded.Congratulations Mahoney's -- you have officially lost a bunch of formerly loyal customers due to being worse now than six months ago in pretty much every single way... isn't the idea to improve?

31.description: Decent bar in an odd location. I guess in a city like Chicago, you can find a sports bar on just about every corner and Mahoney's is that spot for this stretch of Ogden. Returned recently for a friend's thirtieth this past Saturday and was surprised to walk into an empty bar around six o'clock which was then completely packed by eight. Owned by the same group that runs Mother's et al. Mahoney's offered cheap beer specials and expensive shots (perfect for a birthday.) We also decided to eat here before the festivities started in earnest, and everyone's food was pretty good for bar fare so that was a pleasant surprise.  I wouldn't go out of my way to return, but if i ever find myself aimlessly wandering around Ogden looking for a place to watch a game I would stop in.

34.description: Mules. Moscow. Mahoney. Any flavor. Delicious. Bartenders very nice and super friendly.Husband and I were looking for a "low-key" place where he, as a Redbirds fan living in Cubby land, could watch the NLCS that wasn't going to get us taunted yet wasn't as lonely as watching on the couch. We walked by a few other bars on the Ogden strip and settled on Mahoney's. The FREE (water) (great) BEER (on tap) sign outside the front door was what originally caught our interest - love a sense of humor.Got there about 7:30 on a Friday night. Few bar patrons and maybe 5-6 tables full of people watching the Bulls game. Sort of ideal for a newly married who doesn't want to be a lameo on the couch on a Friday night but also isn't looking for the crazed bar scene of single-dome. (Word is the place gets a little more busy around 11 but that seems reasonable). Bartenders were super accommodating when we asked for one TV to change to baseball - Bonus, not one person had a negative thing to say about a couple cheering for the Cards. We ordered a burger. Delicious. French onion soup. Average. Cheese curds. Unless you're craving mozzarella sticks, save the calories or head down to Twisted Spoke. Just wasn't up to par. But the drinks were spot on. I'm a huge Moscow Mule fan. So much so, they were the signature drink at my wedding. So, I think I know what I'm talking about. In my quest for the best in the West Town/Noble Square area, hands down these were the best. We had both the Moscow and the Mahoney's (made with Jamison) Mule; both delicious. Probably too delicious as too many went down way too fast! Appreciate they were served in a copper mug and we didn't have to leave an id or credit card in order to drink from it. Overall, fun, friendly place. Great drinks, decent food, nice vibe. We'll be back!

16.description: Mahoney's is a solid bar. Good space. Great TV setup. The waffle fries are awesome. The drinks do what is intended.

13.description: Nice decor, terrible bar.  Tried ordering several different craft beers off their menu and they didn't have any of them.  The fried chicken sliders were tiny and dry.  Really poor experience, not recommended.

11.description: This is definitely not my type of place but I would say if you are looking for a fun place to feel like a kid playing traditional boad games this is the spot.With the DJ playing oldies but goodies in teh background that you can belt out while playing Jenga it is a lot of fun.Great for groups but word to the wise don't stay here sober because you will be the only one!  If you can't beat them join them is how your attitude should be when you come here!  And just have a great time!

39.description: I can't believe this place is still open.  Drinks are watered down, the food is horrible!  I know its bar food, but an attempt to make it taste good would be nice. i had a pulled pork sandwich, not fresh at all, appeared to be reheated several times.  The place reeks of old alcohol, wet carpet.  The staff does what it could with what they have to work with, meh.   Skip it.   Go somewhere else.

37.description: I came here on a Saturday and this bar kind of had a suburban kind of feel to it.  It wasn't very busy, I was here before midnight, and the people that were here seemed to be the misfits.  There were only a few girls and a handful of gangly guys and old men trying to court these ladies.  The DJ was a playlist changer at the most but I wouldn't even give him that much credit as he struggled through mix transitions and intermingling genres of music.  They have an elevated dance floor and novelty chandeliers made out of liquor bottles.  There was a guy and girl who were clearly pass their limit that were sleeping/passed out at the bar.  I should have taken a picture now that I think about it.  This place was alright but it is nothing I would write home about.

0.description: Had such a great experience here! Danny was our server on Monday and I brought my 2 kids with me, which I wasn't sure if they were allowed, but he made my kids feel both welcome and comfortable, he said he was one of the managers there, and it was nice to see that somebody in this place finally has some GREAT customer service! We've come to Mahoney's for parties occasionally as well as when we just need a night out just me and the hubby over the past 2yrs we've lived in the neighborhood, but we didn't always have the greatest experience, we actually stopped coming for a while because of our last experience with an extremely rude manager a few months back, but we passed and the kids were hungry so I figured lets try it again, couldn't have made a better choice, and the food was great! Apparently they do half off all sandwiches and wraps on Mondays now, I had the new Buffalo chicken sandwich as Danny recommended it and it was GREAT! My son ordered a corned beef sandwich and my daughter ordered a Veggie wrap, they both loved their food. Danny didn't hover over us while we ate, yet he made sure to check on us constantly to make sure everything was good and that we had everything we needed. I highly recommend Mahoneys as a great lunch/dinner spot for the family. He did tell me that kids are only allowed until 9pm, but that doesn't bother me because my kids are usually getting ready by 9pm as most kids in school are. 2 thumbs up Mahoney's food great, prices AWESOME, service, STELLAR, and killer job on the management!

38.description: What's with the bad reviews? Really good bar food, my burger was Amazing... Great drink specials, nice people working... And lots of TVS to watch football

51.description: Yeah, sorry, nope, don't think so.  Maybe I shouldn't give it one star since in this case, it's just a matter of a.) being too old, b.) not being into the college bar scene, and c.) being too old.  A long time ago this used to be the barbecue place by the Twisted Spoke people.  I've been trying to remember that name and it's bugging me.  Anyway....We opted to stop here for dinner the other night.  Walked in, smelled the rank stale beer smell, which yeah, you can smell from the street too, took a look around at the college-bar-esque scene before us, no one greeted us, there was some kind of roped off dance floor area, a big group of people wearing matching t-shirts, no one eating.....hmm.  We looked at each other and walked out.It's too bad too.  Their menu sounded pretty decent and their beer list for my sweetheart looked good.  Yick, stale beer smell -- who can eat with that going on?

27.description: Well. well.. well... last bar during a Bar Crawl and it totally made the night.This place is HUGE, bar area, sitting area, flippy cup/beer pong area, band area, etc.  When we arrived it was pretty slow, due to the snow, so it as pretty nice having the place almost to ourselves.  It did get busier throughout the night.Beer and mixed drinks were pretty cheap for the city.  The DJ was awesome, playing us old stuff and new stuff, we were pretty much annoying to everybody else I am sure, but we did have a good time dancing all over that band area.We even got a shout-out on the banner :)

32.description: Could not get food. Ordered food, waited, was repeatedly brought wrong food (not even close, we're not that picky). Left hungry.Worst ever.

54.description: After moving to Noble Square, my boyfriend and I were eager to find a decent bar to walk to from our place. In the time that we moved here, we've probably given Mahoney's 3 or 4 chances. The first night there was actually an escape from The Twisted Spoke, and though it was crowded, it was an alright experience.At some point Groupon released a deal for Mahoney's, and I bought one since it was so close-by. But there were many nights when we'd approach the place, see college kids playing bags on the patio, and turn around. We did finally use the Groupon, to a satisfactory experience. However, we just ate there again today, and we decided that'll be the last time. Everything about the visit was awful. First, there was the table of bro-skis (I thought they stayed in Wrigleyville!). They were the worst loud-talkers. Four sales guys off of work gossiping like pigs and guzzling beer- they were the epitome of obnoxious. But, we were hungry so we tried to tune them out.The server was nice enough, but was very awkward and often lingered after a decision was made on food or drinks. I got cheeseburger sliders. Or so I thought. They looked more like burgers they accidentally put cheese on. Pretty pathetic-looking sliders. After this, we'd had it and just wanted to leave, so we offered up our credit card. The server disappeared for about 10 minutes and finally came back saying their system was currently down. She continued to inform us they were re-booting the system, and they'd try swiping the card again in a few minutes. Or we could use their ATM to get cash (for a fee, of course). Though our table neighbors were getting rowdier, we decided to wait a little longer. But another 5 minutes was all we could take. We started our way over to the ATM, when the server stopped us with the receipt- it finally went through. And just in time. Our frustration level with Mahoney's was just about at its breaking point.On our way out we noticed a sign we had never seen before- a courtesy sign asking patrons to:-please leave quietly- respect the neighborsAND.... - don't pee in the alley. (not kidding).I think if we had seen that sign before our first visit to Mahoney's, we would have been saved a lot of trouble.

48.description: The one and only star is for the bouncer working the door who was the only nice person we encountered at Mahoney's. I went to Mahoney's with my boyfriend and two friends on Friday night around 9:40pm for what we hoped would be a quick, decent meal. I mean, I wasn't expecting much from a bar. But instead of a decent experience we ended up with a terrible one...We waited at least 25 minutes for a waitress to even acknowledge us once we sat down. Oh wait, I'm sorry, this was after the bartender shouted at us from across the room that we'd need to come up to the bar to order from her. By the time we were finally acknowledged by a waitress and received our food it was around 11pm - ridiculous! I think the waitress maybe checked on us once while we were eating - the second time she came over was to literally drop the condiments on the table - as in, she threw them down on the table, said nothing and then walked away. Then there was the 25-30 minute wait to get our check, which may I add: involved me having to track the waitress down across the bar to give her our credit cards because she was so inattentive.By the time the whole ordeal was over it was around 11:45pm - two hours after we arrived. I asked to speak with the manager and explained our frustrations with the extremely slow service and the unapologetic waitress who rarely checked on us in our 2-hour stay. The "manager," who was by no means an actual manager, was also completely unapologetic and said, "OK I'll be right back" in his unapologetic Australian accent. He then went over to the DJ who I'm assuming was the real manager (what?!?!) and spoke with him for awhile before coming back and offering to adjust our checks. There was no explanation or apology involved. Sure, I appreciate the $20 taken off of the check but an apology might have gotten me to come back in the future.Instead, I will never be back. Not only was the service bad but the bar itself is disgusting and smells terrible. I work in the hospitality industry so I know it can be a tough job - but this was ridiculous. Don't waste your time.

44.description: Nachos were good, chicken needed a minute

24.description: One of my favorite places to go have a few drinks and relax. So many fun activities to help pass the time with our favorite friends. Celebrated My husband's bday here & the waitress went above & beyond to make sure we were taken care of!  She even bought him a birthday tequila shot! Will definitely be visiting again!

7.description: Alright, mahoneys is a weird place. I am not totally sure what they are going for with the decor, but as a neighbor of the bar I always feel welcome here and the staff ( especially Andrea) make sure that I'm having a good time. I started coming here at the beginning of football season and Andrea did not give up until both my girlfriends Game and my game were on. I appreciated that she worked so hard for us, and it's kept us coming back, even after football season has passed.With that being said mahoneys is not a place to go for an exceptional craft cocktail, but they have cold beer, a lot of TVs and the staff ( especially Andrea) treat you like you actually matter.

49.description: Today I made a post and accidentally posted it on the site for Twisted Spoke. The post should have been for Mahoneys on Odgen.  The service was completely unacceptable. However, Alexander, the waiter was great. The bartender and manager was non accomodating on every level. We had to go get the initial waiter ever time we wanted something.

40.description: Horrible service. Friends and myself got double charged and wrongly charged several times on our credit cards then when we called to rectify it, we were accused of trying to "pull" something or they blamed Comcast. Management completely rude and unprofessional. I was told to "bring it" when I said I'd have the credit fraud investigated.  Also never received concert tickets I won in a raffle, not that I would even use them at this point anyway. Will never go there again. After having many parties there and frequenting it a lot, I will now never go again and I strongly urge others to refrain from it as well. There are plenty of other bars in the city that know how to add and know how to swipe a credit card. Never have I felt more insulted in my life.

53.description: It is so hot today. I think I am going to go get some italian ice or something a drink, a bite to eat after the Randolph street fest, which I worked at feverishly. On the blacktop.Walked into Mahoney's Pub & Grill from the Ogden side, where they had a large open patio space. "Front door," said the server cryptically and scurried away. Worst service ever, very rude & not helpful. Went to the front. Everything was bad. Shitty nightclub scene in 90' heat. Walked on off the street & the waitress said,"Why can't you walk in the front like real people?"Repeat in caps for dramatic effect:"WHY CAN'T YOU WALK IN THE FRONT LIKE REAL PEOPLE?"Wow. We were on the verge of dying of thirst on the sidewalk. I worked at a bar before so I know it sucks to work when its the hottest day of the year, so i was willing to let that slide. We walked in the front door like real people. "See your ID's guys." Said door guy 1. Me: We just wanna eat something and we are waiting for someone else, we don't want to drink or anything, can we just eat?"door guy 1 & 2: "blalwahawlabalblwbawlbawlbawlalbwlawblwablbwlbalw­b ID's"Hey you know what? I realized, I am not going to try to convince someone to let me spend money on them anymore. So I left.  But I wanted to go back and talk to the two smoking hot chicks who were standing in the front wearing matching Old Navy shirts, one had a boob job, but I don't care. I am from the streets.

30.description: Bottom Line Up Front: Sandwiched between two MUCH better bars, the only reason to come here is for the Sunday Ticket.Mahoney's main problem is that it is located between two significantly better bars. The Twisted Spoke is directly south on Ogden, and Matchbox is less than 1/4 mile north on Ogden. Both of those places have better service, a better selection of craft beer and spirits, and the Spoke has far superior food. The only reason that I found myself at Mahoney's is because I don't have cable and I wanted to watch an out of market NFL game. Mahoney's has the NFL Sunday Ticket.Mahoney's is totally Vanilla. It's an unoffensive Irish Pub with a whole bunch of finished Jamison bottles adorning all of the open shelf space in their main room. The food is below average, but safe. I had a humus/veggie plate and a some Buffalo Chicken tenders. I ordered the humus because I was on a date and wanted to show that I'm worldly and into weird foods from other countries, the Buffalo Chicken was ordered to show that I'm from the street and like to keep things hot. Neither mattered because my Dawgs, the Cleveland Browns were on and my total lack of attention to my date really piqued her interest.The service was below average. I'm convinced that the open-mouth breather that was waiting on us was a zombie. She was confused by the simplest changes ("no lemon in the water, please") and didn't realize that there was a difference between Lagunitas IPA and Lagunitas Little Sumpin' Sumpin'. The restrooms are pretty clean, but I'm a guy who hangs out at Liar's Club on the regular, so take my "cleanliness" ratings with a grain of salt.The beer selection was ok, but nothing fantastic. I was impressed that they carried a microbrew... I was sort of counting on almost exclusively light beer offerings.I suppose if you're a Lakeview ex-pat and you're new to the neighborhood, it would be a good place to get your bearings, but other than that, I struggle to find a reason to recommend this place.

46.description: Their bloody mary bar literally saved my arse on a very, very, very hungover Sunday. I had my friend make them for me and they were bomb. So bomb I might have had three with my lunch. They had all sorts of things to put in them. My favorite is of course the classic choice: olives. But they also had pickles, carrots, celery, ham and cheddar cheese cubes. NICE!As for the food: I enjoyed an incredibly tasty and greasy (the good, delicious kind) grilled cheese sandwich that came with yummy, creamy tomato soup for dipping (I'm drooling thinking about it right now) and to aid my gluttony, I went nuts and ordered a  large plate of fries as well. Everything was tasty. And I'm pretty sure it wasn't because I was ravenous and did I mention VERY hungover? I really like the space. First of all, it was huge on the inside, lots of TVs and the best part was the crap ton of empty Jameson bottles all over - even on the chandeliers! They also had a stage and I believe they have music/DJs and dancing going on at night. It was a bit loud with the music and distracting with all the TVs showing some unimportant sporting event (college basketball??? hahaha, don't be mad, I like DA BULLS) because the Hawks weren't on yet. But other than that, I can see myself going back. If the grilled cheese and fries and bloody marys were that good, I'm curious to see what else will titillate my taste buds. A secondhand tip: the breakfast buffet might not have been the greatest, but the alcohol was cheaper if you went the buffet route. I declined because I'm a veggie monster.

1.description: What the heck has happened to what used to be one of my favorite places to catch a game and grab a bite to eat?I took a large group with me to watch the Hawks the other night, and I swear they only had 4 people working in the entire place that was packed to the gills.Our server didn't stand a chance as she had every table in the place.  And when our food finally came up (we ordered at 7pm and the food arrived at 9) the food was cold, there were no salad dressings for the entree salads and the tater tots had clearly been sitting out for awhile.Trying to help and go to the bar to get a drink ourselves was no better as there were only 2 people behind the bar and they couldn't keep up either.  There seemed to be an abundance of bussers but not wait staff . . . crazy bad!It wasn't like they didn't know the playoffs were happening and the place was going to be packed.  C'mon Mahoney's!  You can do better than this . . .I've seen it!Still plenty of free street parking which is always a plus in my book.  But you won't find me here during any of the playoff games . . .plenty of other places that can get it right.

55.description: Eek! is exactly the "word" I'd use.I was just served VERY undercooked chicken at Mahoney's.  The waitress was apologetic and removed my dish from the bill, but I'm still really uncomfortable.  How does an undercooked chicken finger leave the kitchen?  And not just one, but several?  Seriously, they were ALL under.  They were served in a wrap, and I ate a few bites before noticing.I'm hoping the stomachache is just psychosomatic.

9.description: I held my husband's 30th birthday party here in their back room.  From start to finish, Kelly, the events planner, and her team were incredibly helpful at organizing the party with me.  We chose appetizers (which were set up prior to my guests arriving) and a wristband special (free wristbands, $1 of all drinks).  When I got there, my parents and my husband's parents were running late getting to Mahoney's from the suburbs.  Kelly and another girl working there did not hesitate to help me set up the entire room--putting up banners, decorations, etc.  They were so nice.  I brought my own custom cups, and the bartender was great about using them to serve the guests.  When it came time for the cake, Kelly brought the cake and cupcakes out with a cake cutter.  She put the cupcakes on the cutest little footed platter.  The only reason I'm giving four stars is because the room temperature was out of control.  It was freeeeeeezing without the heat on and then nine million degrees with the heat on.  :(Thanks, Mahoney's, for a great 30th birthday party experience!

26.description: Went there with a group of 7 for lunch on a Sunday. So disappointed. Food was terrible. Three people waited an extra 10 minutes for their food to arrive. One was told that he had to order another dish because they couldn't find one of the ingredients (?!?!). Another got her burger which was totally raw in the middle, so she sent back to be cooked further. The person who had to reorder his dish decided on a veggie burger. That took almost 20 minutes to arrive. Most of us were done by the time he got his food. To top that off, the "burger" was still frozen in the middle. The gal got her burger back and it was still raw. I ordered the BBQ pork sliders. They had an off taste so I didn't finish them.We complained and the waiter said the cook was new. Seriously? He can't even cook a hamburger and was serving food that was undercooked or possibly spoiled? When we asked to talk to a manager, the waiter said HE was the manager!! Really? A manager is supposed to be the face of the business and cater to his customers. All he said was that the cook was new and that he would not charge us for the bad food. Wow. We could have called the Board of Health and had his place shut down and all he could do is give us an "Oh Well, too bad" attitude? So bad. So sad.Mahoney's used to have half-way decent food (Twisted Spoke is much better), but not anymore. We're taking our business down the block instead. I'm sure they'll still get their usual cadre of drunk college students on game days, but real diners will know better.

25.description: This place is awesome!!! Stumbled in last weekend and loved every second.  They have $5 Coors Light pitchers and $2 dafts.  (Trying to get rid of Green Beer from St. Pats Day- they died too many

12.description: The bar/restaurant is okay! Was not impressed at all with the service I received went here during a Blackhawks game, there wasn't a hostess to greet us then we decided to seat ourselves. We waited for approximately 20 minutes and no waitress came to our table. So decided to go to the bar and order drinks. Then had to go back up to the bar to ask to see menus the person near the bar (waitress) seemed to have an attitude(which is completely uncalled for). We had to order food at the bar! I had to wait for awhile at least 30 min (shouldn't take that long to make wings and fries)!till I asked the bartender where was the food, cause I was going to cancel the order... I will never come back to place ever again!!!! Kinda felt like this bar wanted to shaft me from my money, if I didn't ask where the food was!!

59.description: I live in the 'hood but will only go to Mahoney's on 'off' hours. It is my favorite Saturday afternoon bar. At night it's just a bunch of slutty chicks jumping on their bro counterparts like pink, sticky spider monkeys.

21.description: The worst. The bar was filthy, the nachos had "ballpark cheese", and I am positive the stoli was 75 percent water. Oh, and the background music was Coldplay. The absolute worst.

17.description: They blast incredibly loud terrible top 40s music all night.  You can hear the music several blocks away.  I don't know how they haven't gotten in trouble yet.  The type of people that work and frequent the place are just as obnoxious.  Enough said.. don't go here!!

10.description: What a horrible experience.Just FYI, a can of miller lite will cost you $4.50 a piece... If you can finally get your order at the severely understaffed bar.  After waiting patiently for 15 mins to get my drink order in at the bar, the bartender brings my shot of whiskey in a tumbler glass, and it was clearly short of a shot.  Knowing that 1 shot of JD costs $7, I told him it was a light pour, and instead of apologizing for his error, he challenges me the customer by saying: "it is a shot.  I'll pour it into a shot glass and if it's not, you have to buy the whole bar a round."  Taken aback by this, I say of course not.  He still proceeds to pour the whiskey from the tumbler into a shot glass, filling it half way.  Then, what upset me the most was the arrogance of his next statement: "See look!  It's a shot!"I told him to send it back and I would not pay for it.  I paid my $29 for 4 cans of miller lite and 1 previous shot of jack (that another bartender poured appropriately), left a normal tip, and decided to never come to this poorly run & managed establishment again

5.description: Servers are awesome...shout out to Alex, Andrea and Brandon. Our rugby team drinks and is sponsored by these guys and they have been nothing but great to us.         Karaoke Thursdays are L E G I T!!! Strip beer pong? No problem. Burlesque shows? Forget about it. Bible studies? Sure...this place is great.

3.description: Good service, decent food. Tots are very good.Sometimes they have worthwhile specials.Giant Jenga is fun. Lots of tvs.

35.description: I've actually have been to Mahoney's a couple times now.  The first few were with a group of people late night for a quick shot and drink so I couldn't really write an accurate review.   Well good thing I was drunk those times because when I came in with a clear mind the place is terrible.   It pretty much has do with service and pricing.   As a frequent bar patron, I have never seen pure disregard for pricing on a Thursday night since I was in Vegas (which is warranted).  I had purchased two domestic bottles of beer and two bombs in a pretty empty bar (one hour after the bears game ended).  The Total  $30.  Then to top it off I was charged Sales tax.  I can understand if there was food purchased, but sales tax on drinks at a bar was a first.  Of course I asked the bartender if there was mistake, but she just smiled and tried to sympathize saying "I know. Its just what we charge."  I just don't understand how places get away with these types of pricing strategies when they are purely set up to be a college type bar.  The place is a dump with a stage.  You could throw this bar in Tijuana and it would be considered bottom tier.  P.S. The people that were singing Karaoke were awful.

19.description: We recently held an annual fundraising event at Mahoney's and had an amazing experience working with all of the staff. The events coordinator Kelly was incredible to work with and could not have been more accommodating. She met with us prior to the event to ensure that we had everything we needed. They even brought in help from their other bars to help with our event. Everyone was a pleasure to work with and they even got involved in the activities. We can't wait to have another event with Mahoney's!

28.description: Good little neighbourhood bar. Staff (Bryan, Sam etc) are cool.

45.description: Don't eat here. Food took forever. Two of our three orders were wrong. My friend's burger came out when I was already done eating. Food was OK.  Took an hour to get our check and there were only a few other tables. May be a fun spot to drink but not eat. Waitress was nice but she was terrible.

33.description: At first I was surprised that I don't go here very often. I mean it is right down the street and it is an irish sports bar, a lot of things that I like.The bar is aligned with empty Jamo bottles that patrons have drawn on after the bottle is finished. 3 years worth of a collection (even on the chandeliers) and for that this place deserves a visit. The plethora of TVs makes this place worthy of going to see which ever game you want. I was there on a Friday and instead of the sounds of the game, they did have a DJ spinning (yeah!) 80s dance with modern top 40.The bar started filling with a younger crowd as the night grew longer, but it also had its fair share of older, seemingly regular patrons. This place didn't scream cheeseball. I didn't feel under or over dressed. The music was good and the Mahoney Mule will bring me back (these things go down like water). The food was decent at best, I mean standard for your bar food. The cheese curds (and I've been finding cheese curds lately) were more like mini-mozzarella sticks. The french onion soup wasn't strong enough (you know, I want that pungent taste in my french onion). My wife's waffle fries were ok as was her burger.Bottom line, they have food and that alone should make you happy. Go here for the atmosphere, this is a local bar. Go here for the drinks, they offer a Keep Calm and Chive On beer (meh) and hit the Moscow Mule. Go here for the music. But really go here for the sports bar, lots of tvs, lots of methods to watch your favorite game.

43.description: Overwhelmingly meh and generic. This is the type of place that people in lots of sports regalia tend to inhabit, as all their specials are giant pitchers of beer or cocktails. If you're a team after your game, totally come here!That said, I do have love for this place, as they hosted the Pup Crawl. They opened their patio to the four-leggeds, and had about a half dozen dogs the day I was there and it was a great time. I had the wings. Apparently the Chicago Tribune called these one of the 10 best places for wings in the city? I'm not sure about that, but they were tasty, indeed.I probably wouldn't go here on my own. I would go back for another dog event. That said, for what it is - they do it well. Bartenders are VERY friendly, attentive and nice.

2.description: Just a good bar to drink some beers with friends, listen to some good music, play a little jenga, and just have a good time.  During Hawks and Bulls the place is packed, but not when we were there.  Place was empty and I really enjoyed that.  I am a fan of this place, I hate where there are reviews about an empty bar and it's get a 1 star rating.  Maybe you were just not there on their good night.  This is your average Chicago Dive bar and I enjoy my random visits here.  If you ever are looking for a specific reason to come here, come when they do the HogFight in the summer. Great time and not very crowded, sense a theme here?

18.description: Well. well.. well... last bar during a Bar Crawl and it totally made the night.This place is HUGE, bar area, sitting area, flippy cup/beer pong area, band area, etc.  When we arrived it was pretty slow, due to the snow, so it as pretty nice having the place almost to ourselves.  It did get busier throughout the night.Beer and mixed drinks were pretty cheap for the city.  The DJ was awesome, playing us old stuff and new stuff, we were pretty much annoying to everybody else I am sure, but we did have a good time dancing all over that band area.We even got a shout-out on the banner :)

41.description: There is nothing to complain about here.  It's a fine bar, food is above decent, prices are fine, and service, both table and bar is very good.  It's huge, nice outdoor spot, and a hundredy billion televisions, include a projection screen the size of Rhode Island.  The crowd on Friday and Saturday night isn't my bag, but a great place to watch a game.  Especially a B1G football game, unless you are a UM fan.  Things may have changed, but they definitely seemed to swing to the green side of the Spartan/Wolverine spectrum last time I watched a MSU/UM game there.  The guy who lives across Ogden is a tool who will come outside and scream at you and threaten you if your dog pees in his yard, but his general failings in life and attempts at being a decent human being are in no way the fault of Mahoney's.  But he is a jerk and he lives nearby.

52.description: My favorite neighborhood bar. There are lots of different taps to choose from and they have a fantastic bar food menu. The bartenders and wait-staff are cool people who also live in the area, so they're good company. My only reservations:  Sometimes service can be a little lax and it's rarely busy. It baffles me why this bar isn't more busy regularly, because it has a lot to offer.Also, the bar has fun games like life-size Jenga (think Jenga blocks the size of bricks). Every Sunday they have a brunch buffet for ~$12 and a bloody mary bar for ~$4.Recommended if you live in the area.

50.description: Oh, Mahoney's. Get on their mailing list to get free happy hours. This is seriously the reason my friends and I frequent this place. They play the greatest/strangest mix of music from WhiteSnake to Whitney Houston to that Cupid Shuffle song (did I just age myself?)...it's pretty hilarious, terrible and awesome all in one. Seriously, you kind of have to be a fan of the ridiculous to enjoy this place. Don't expect to meet the man or lady of your dreams here (unless it's the super cute DJ, hey boy heeeey), but it's a good spot to hang out with a good group of friends. Mahoney's, I like your style.

4.description: What a bizarro bar. Like, what does it even want to be? There's a REDICK Hawaiian cantina in the back that is just so niggardly placed. The manager is a lousy waffle, the kind that just sorta walks around with his head up high and his eyes on the tits.They call this an Irish bar? HA! Charles Stewart Parnell would roll in his grave. The orgy of Jameson bottles on the ceiling by the main bar area is A SIN against the state. How dare they even try, just kill yourself Mahoneys. Instantly kill yourself.I hope a fleet of gremlins riggs this place with explosives and damns it to hell, actually, to the Oort Cloud and back.

6.description: Gets better every year. Now that Andrea is our go to bartender it makes it all worth while.

22.description: Mahoney's used to be OK about 6 months ago -- friendly staff, pretty good food, fun trivia that myself and friends used to frequently go to, and Blackhawks hockey (an official Blackhawks bar).With this in mind, I decided to meet up with some people for tonight's Hawks game. What ensued was the quickest decline of a bar due to new management that I have ever witnessed.1) A new, smaller menu without the two best things on the old menu -- Irish Poutine and Texas Potatoes. Now, everything is much more generic, run-of-the-mill bar food.2) The Jameson bottles lining the interior of the bar? Gone. So much for personality...3) When the Hawks game came on, it was only on about 4 of the 10 or so TVs. Fine, there was one close enough for me to watch. However, there was music still playing, which would normally be fine, but as an "Official" Blackhawks bar, this was not OK. So I politely asked our server if they were going to turn on the sound. She told me she would check .... but alas, I never received an update and the music kept playing... Needless to say, it was time to find a new destination.I don't know what the hell the new management is thinking, but they better get their crap together and fast -- there were maybe only 10 people in the entire bar, where as Twisted Spoke and Aberdeen Tap (where we later ended up) were all crowded.Congratulations Mahoney's -- you have officially lost a bunch of formerly loyal customers due to being worse now than six months ago in pretty much every single way... isn't the idea to improve?

15.description: We had a great sunday funday here on the patio with Dan who was an awesome bartender/server. Will definitely be back!

57.description: I've come here on many occasions...but I'm still not completely sold on it (and I honestly have NO clue why)The good about Mahoney's:TV's galore! Every time you turn your head, you'll be watching a new game. They have a shuffle board table!!! Ummm, AWESOME! They have bags outside during the warmer months. Yay! Huge indoor/outdoor seating section. When I say indoor, I mean with the big doors open so it's the next best thing to being outside. It's nice to sit there in the warm months when it's raining outside :)HUGE bar! This place is ginormous! The bottles of empty (signed when finished) Jameson that line the walls. The food is pretty good...when the server remembers to put your order in.The staff is pretty friendly. The bar/bathrooms are super clean The bad:Why isn't the huge bar packed? Is it too big that it always seems empty(ish)That one time that I was starving and the server forgot to put my order in. Ehhh, I won't hold that against you guys too much. Even though my softball team was the only people in there at the time. I'm gonna keep coming back because I know that I will eventually love this place...somethings just gonna click for me one day!  Honestly though, it could just be me coming here on the wrong nights. BTW, they have some REALLY good specials rushanddivision.com/maho…

20.description: No. No. No. No. The worst. Everything about it. No.

36.description: Ok, so Mahoney's hosts some *great* events and I love them for it.  They'd be a 3 star bar if not for the awesome events that they host.So let's talk about Mahoney's.  It's a large place with a stage.  This bar can hold a LOT of people and they seem to have a love for Jameson here.  That's great and I, too, love the Jame-O but the crowd can get a bit young outside of the events (later into the evening on weekend nights).  I'm not young and that's sad but if I had to choose a bar to go to late on a Friday night, it wouldn't be Mahoney's.  If it were Friday afternoon and I wanted to kick back on a warm summer afternoon, count me in.

14.description: I was a loyal customer.I even joined their loyalty card program.I never use coupons and rarely joined those kind of programs. However, when I joined theirs they refused to make good on their offer.  Really crappy unprofessional way to do business.Food is average at best.  Drinks are nothing special.  Staff provides adequate to moderate service.Never going back.Bad business practices and average everything else!!!

58.description: This is quite possibly the best coffee in the city, in my opinion. On top of that, it's organic and they roast it right there in front of your face!! Huzzah! They have some great unique drink options. They also make their own chai tea blend and allow you to sweeten it to your liking which is really really delicious and obviously awesome of them. The staff here are not only some of the best baristas around, but probably some of the best people around. I actually feel more like I'm visiting friends when I'm there instead of getting coffee and working.A nice extra touch, is the large TV screen that has updated weather and blue line train times. Genius.PS - who dared give this place less than 5 stars!? Poppycock!

56.description: Big Shoulders will satisfy the seventh-wave coffee snob and the wayward vagrant alike, with its warm interior, $2.00 bottomless coffees, and all manner of pourovers ("slow drip") and special milky drink options. Baked goods are a little pricey, but what else is new.It is not a place to go for complete quiet, because they actually roast the beans right in there, which creates a decent amount of noise (and heat), but I think that adds to the authenticity, especially amid a stenciled wall with the text from the 1916 Carl Sandburg (back when things were actually made in the city and before everyone was working for tech startups and... coffee shops). Definitely recommend!

29.description: The Cardamom spice latte was very sweet and not especially spicy (I find this is often the case with tea and coffee lattes -- maybe I need to try to modify my ordering...or just stick to plain old lattes, which is sort of boring). The coffee was good, but I wish I'd gone with a basic, unflavored, unsweetened latte instead. It's in a great location right at Chicago and Milwaukee. There's a bike rack right outside. The staff was very obliging, making my latte in my travel mug so that I could take it with me on my bike without disaster. It's also a nice space with big windows, and since it's right on a busy corner I imagine there's some fun people-watching to be done.

42.description: What a great cup of coffee. As their website says "no-nonsense brew delivered fast and hot"  and that's right on the money. And speaking of money it's reasonably priced. But the coffee - well balanced and flavorful- bold but not over the top; fresh roasted beans and perfect brewing does the trick. Very good customer service from the two baristas too.The shop is clean and, in my experiences, not overly crowded. Makes me want to get out the door a bit early to stop in and enjoy my cup before transferring to the blue line. I'm not so much a specialty coffee guy but they have a nice variety on the menu - the marshmallow late looks delicious. Other in house made syrups/infusions. I need to bring my wife here... she loves that kind of thing :).Doing coffee right over there, no doubt about it.

23.description: Nice airy, bright coffee shop.  Right around the corner from the Intuit Museum.I'm still thinking about the spiced hibiscus iced tea.

47.description: Simple!  Good coffee and pastries in a well ventilated, clean comfortable setting with knowledgeable and informative staff.  Now, I have a new list of lattes to taste in house made syrups/infusions.

8.description: Again, just a food truck review, so I can't say much about the physical location on the west side.What can I say about my coffee? I like my coffee like I like my Death Stars. Big, dark, and strong enough to destroy a planet. And while this may be me on the cusp of coffee snobbery, I think weak coffee is the equivalent of pissing into a Keurig.I was dragging myself across Wacker on my way to the office. I hadn't had my morning cup yet, so homicidal thoughts were running pretty high. Just when I thought 20 years in Cook County correctional didn't seem so bad, bam their coffee truck was right there. Literally, I wasn't paying attention to where is was walking and I actually bumped into their coffee truck.Some lady was in front of me taking her sweet ass time completely unaware that she was standing at scene of the July 17th Chicago coffee massacre. (The date this review was written) And just when I had all I could stands and I can't stands no more... she left, a nice young man within the truck provided coffee for $2 (not a bad price) and a disaster was averted.  Seriously, I wash with powdered soap, I totally can't go to prison!  Thank you Big Shoulders Coffee! Oh yeah, the actual coffee... Duh. It wasn't the strongest cup of joe I've ever had, meaning I didn't have to chew it. But it was a nice blend of fragrance and acidity. Overall a good choice. They also have some dessert items on their menu. I can never know if Jenny Craig is reading my reviews, so just to be safe I didn't partake, but you should probably try them. When was the last time you and a brownie didn't get along?

31.description: So I went to sleep at midnight and got up at 4:30 to join a friend for a bicycle ride to Chicago's new "606" 2.7 mile jogging and bike path. I know...what was I thinking?!? This actually very enjoyable trip culminated in heading back to our respective homes, hers in River West and mine in Streeterville, but not before a stop at Big Shoulders Coffee so I'd have an extra hard time getting that second half of a proper 8 hour sleep.While I like lattes, macchiatos, cappuccinos, and other Italian named coffee fare that I don't necessarily understand, I'm kind of a purist who just likes ol' drip coffee. Big Shoulders' "fast drip" was mighty nice. It really puts the V in smooth. No burnt taste here, just rich coffee flavor with no bitterness with a smooth taste that makes me wonder why Starbucks is so damn popular. Oh yeah, well McDonalds and Miller Lite are too.They have a good selection of teas and coffee beans and a few pastries too. Apparently no hot breakfast-y type food to the lament of another reviewer. My pal says their marshmallow latte is excellent while perhaps not appreciating the irony of drinking her coffee black to save calories for "something else."Friendly service and a funkdafied atmosphere. Oh, and free wifi!

34.description: Big Shoulders is another pit stop on my Indie Coffee Passport. If I lived along the blue line, I would make this place my go-to for a cup of coffee.BSC roasts the coffee beans in-house, in-your-face. The roasting machine is located near the entrance, and it's like heaven when you're sitting at the cafe and the smell of freshly roasted beans are wafting to your corner of the cafe. Just like BK, BS will brew your coffee "your way": chemex, pour-over, catila. They have specialty lattes and will allow you to smell the syrup if you're hesitant. Had to choose between cardamom spice and toasted marshmallow today, and as big of a chai tea snob as I am, I went with toasted marshmallow. In-house lattes come in glass cups like chai tea does in India. Thick foam that makes you think you're sipping a melted marshmallow. Unimaginable and incomparable sensation unless you try it for yourself. Service was par-excellence. In-house lattes are brought to you at your table. On Twitter? Tweet about your experience and get any drink for $1. No need to hit up BK for "your way" on the dollar menu. Only thing a-miss? Didn't get a toasted marshmallow on my latte. Kinda sorta came here just for that.

16.description: Yum.  Great after-Mass treat (I was at St. John Cantius just up the street).  I strongly suggest the Marshmallow Latte and the Sonny B- they're both DELICIOUS!

13.description: Pretty cool spot, free WiFi which is great and the staff is awesome! I had a rhubarb scone (delicious) and a chai lattee. The lattee tasted pretty watered down, so I'll be giving their other beverages a try next time.

11.description: Experiencing many different independent coffee shops in Chicago, I have to say the "Colombian", a low acidic, medium roast with notes of praline from Big Shoulders was the most delightful cup of coffee I've had in a while. #bigshoulderscoffee

39.description: It's taken me awhile to write this review, partly because I hold it to such high esteem so I feel the need to make the review commensurate. But screw it, it's time I write this review.Big Shoulders is great. My go-to coffeeshop for great espresso, roasted right inside the shop. The drip is barely too acidic for my taste, but nothing beats Big Shoulders' espresso drinks. Nice baristas that are always approachable.There's about 20 spots to sit, which isn't a lot, but there's always an open space. Ample amount of plugs around the nifty, triangular table that conforms to the shape of the place. If you're lucky, you'll leave with aromatic white flakes on you, coming down from the ventilation once the roasting machine gets roastin'. It's basically free caffeine sitting atop your big shoulders.

37.description: I love this coffee shop so much! The marshmallow latte is my fav! Only 4 stars due to the lack of a bathroom.

0.description: I cannot get enough of this place. Whether you're getting a drip coffee or a specialty latte, everything Big Shoulders touches is fantastic. Great service and delicious brews makes this a no-brainer for any West Towners. Even better, we just recently started bringing their beans home with us to brew on the weekdays.

38.description: I look forward to stopping in (almost) every morning on my way to work.  The staff is friendly and welcoming, the pastries are delicious and the coffee is affordable and is one of my favorites in the city. And while that is all great, what I love most is that you never know what kind of surprise is waiting for you when you walk thru the door...is it a DJ? Free cup of coffee? $1 cup of joe when you ride the cta? They even have a bus tracker so you can enjoy your morning in the stylish space while you wait for the bus/train.

51.description: This place has delicious and strong coffee. I love the different variety of drinks you can get. The Almond Latte w/almond milk is excellent. The atmosphere is very chill and inviting, too. The workers are very, very kind. I feel like they value you as a customer whether they've never seen you before, or see you every day. They make great conversation, are very considerate and kind, and take great care of you. Awesome cafe!

27.description: Best coffee roasters in Chicago. Their light and medium roasts really stand out (especially the unwashed mexico beans when they have them)

32.description: I love this place. It's not on my way to work, in fact it's the opposite way for me. But I often find myself going out of my to go grab coffee in the morning. The space is simple, but really nice. Not too modern, but looks new. The staff has always been as nice as can be. The prices are good, the coffee is amazing. I like to sit by the window and wait as long as I can before catching my train which is located steps from the door. They even have screens with the train and bus trackers! It's a great place for commuters to stop in before work. They have bar seating and a communal table. Since they roast their own coffee, I like to grab a bag and take it to work so I can press my own.

54.description: Served in a "one-size fits all" cup, the coffee is simple in its delivery yet complex in flavor - the kind of cup that represents the nature of the city of Big Shoulders. Depending on what's brewing, you might get a cup that's fruity and bright or rich and chocolate-y; either way, it will taste fresh. If you crave milk and sugar, you'll find your yearning for coffee fused with your childhood love of hot chocolate in the form of a marshmallow latte. A giant marshmallow is roasted, skewered and set over the cup for a drink that is perfectly sweet, not cloying. It's lighter than a traditional cup of marshmallow-studded cocoa, but cozy enough for a Chicago winter's day.

48.description: Great coffee shop.Stopped in to grab some beans, since this place is right on the blue line. Walked in and the first thing you see is someone roasting coffee, which is a good indicator. They have a good selection of whole bean coffee from various locations. When you buy a bag of coffee they give you a complimentary cup to go, which is a nice touch. Also, the barista was super friendly and took the time to describe the different options they had available for my to go coffee. They serve drip, press, clever and chemex to order. And most important, the coffee was really good. They have a coffee bar and some tables. If I wasn't on my way somewhere I would have enjoyed hanging out here for a bit.

44.description: Best coffee....and coffee shop...in Chicago.  Tim Coonan and his team serve up great Joe and make you feel most welcome.

24.description: Again, just a food truck review, so I can't say much about the physical location on the west side.What can I say about my coffee? I like my coffee like I like my Death Stars. Big, dark, and strong enough to destroy a planet. And while this may be me on the cusp of coffee snobbery, I think weak coffee is the equivalent of pissing into a Keurig.I was dragging myself across Wacker on my way to the office. I hadn't had my morning cup yet, so homicidal thoughts were running pretty high. Just when I thought 20 years in Cook County correctional didn't seem so bad, bam their coffee truck was right there. Literally, I wasn't paying attention to where is was walking and I actually bumped into their coffee truck.Some lady was in front of me taking her sweet ass time completely unaware that she was standing at scene of the July 17th Chicago coffee massacre. (The date this review was written) And just when I had all I could stands and I can't stands no more... she left, a nice young man within the truck provided coffee for $2 (not a bad price) and a disaster was averted.  Seriously, I wash with powdered soap, I totally can't go to prison!  Thank you Big Shoulders Coffee! Oh yeah, the actual coffee... Duh. It wasn't the strongest cup of joe I've ever had, meaning I didn't have to chew it. But it was a nice blend of fragrance and acidity. Overall a good choice. They also have some dessert items on their menu. I can never know if Jenny Craig is reading my reviews, so just to be safe I didn't partake, but you should probably try them. When was the last time you and a brownie didn't get along?

7.description: Big Shoulders is another pit stop on my Indie Coffee Passport. If I lived along the blue line, I would make this place my go-to for a cup of coffee.BSC roasts the coffee beans in-house, in-your-face. The roasting machine is located near the entrance, and it's like heaven when you're sitting at the cafe and the smell of freshly roasted beans are wafting to your corner of the cafe. Just like BK, BS will brew your coffee "your way": chemex, pour-over, catila. They have specialty lattes and will allow you to smell the syrup if you're hesitant. Had to choose between cardamom spice and toasted marshmallow today, and as big of a chai tea snob as I am, I went with toasted marshmallow. In-house lattes come in glass cups like chai tea does in India. Thick foam that makes you think you're sipping a melted marshmallow. Unimaginable and incomparable sensation unless you try it for yourself. Service was par-excellence. In-house lattes are brought to you at your table. On Twitter? Tweet about your experience and get any drink for $1. No need to hit up BK for "your way" on the dollar menu. Only thing a-miss? Didn't get a toasted marshmallow on my latte. Kinda sorta came here just for that.

49.description: Finally a cup of coffee in the Windy City that was yummy ! I had the marshmallow latte and it was great. My husband had the Horchata and he enjoyed it too. The staff was super friendly. Great place to warm up especially during a blizzard!

40.description: Great place to get a solid coffee without the pretentiousness in the city.  You can get a regular cup of coffee sure.  Or you can get something with a little extra like the horchata latte.  Drinks are made quick and you can even see them roasting their own beans.  At least I'm pretty sure that's what's going on. Wouldn't hesitate to come here again.  Also it's literally steps from the Chicago blue line stop.  What else could you want?

53.description: I love Big Shoulders coffee and have been frequenting for months now. I can't stay away from the cool crafty drinks and fun environment! The staff is amazing and the quality of the drinks are always consistent, and always on point. You can tell they care about coffee and yeah, I'll still cross the street for donuts some time, but I always get my coffee at Big Shoulders first. Try the almond latte...it's pretty amazing.

30.description: Big Shoulders Coffee is one of my go to spots for coffee! The space is bright even on the gloomiest days with their floor to ceiling windows. There is space to work at the coffee bar, community table, or right by the windows. Summer drinks are here and I'm loving both the Painted Lady and Cafe Bombon.

46.description: Being the coffee snob that I am, this place is worth being a constant stop for coffee fans! My wife was able to get an almond milk latte. Offering a healthier alternative to milk or soy, she was ecstatic. I chose one of their dark roasts served to me in a french press. What could be better than that? Love this place! Great atmosphere and knowledgeable/friendly staff. We will be going back over and over.

1.description: I just popped in here for a quick cup of coffee since I work in the area. Inside, it's a nice little cafe. It has a very soothing atmosphere, it would be an ideal place to come get some work done during a less busy time (mid to late afternoon, for example).The menu is small, which is nice for making a quick choice. I opted for a hot marshmallow latte with skim milk.For $3.90, I got a small latte. Emphasis on the SMALL. This latte was about the size of a double shot of expresso at Starbucks. It was, maybe, five or six sips of coffee, which is kind of a joke for $3.90.That being said, the coffee itself was ok. Not sure what all the hype is about. I found the flavor to be average. Not too sweet, which was nice (I hate overly sweet lattes).The best part is that the latte came with a toasted marshmallow on top! This was a nice touch and tasted great.Also, the barista was really nice and service was fast.Overall, nothing to write home about. I'll probably be back to try the horchata latte.

55.description: As you can tell from the reviews, this place is pretty great. Excellent coffee, excellent space to drink it in, helpful and friendly staff. The food quality/selection is a little lacking, but this is a coffee shop not a breakfast spot. Just keep that in mind if you want more than just coffee. Otherwise, stop in and get great beverages then buy some fresh roasted coffee to make at home.

9.description: So I went to sleep at midnight and got up at 4:30 to join a friend for a bicycle ride to Chicago's new "606" 2.7 mile jogging and bike path. I know...what was I thinking?!? This actually very enjoyable trip culminated in heading back to our respective homes, hers in River West and mine in Streeterville, but not before a stop at Big Shoulders Coffee so I'd have an extra hard time getting that second half of a proper 8 hour sleep.While I like lattes, macchiatos, cappuccinos, and other Italian named coffee fare that I don't necessarily understand, I'm kind of a purist who just likes ol' drip coffee. Big Shoulders' "fast drip" was mighty nice. It really puts the V in smooth. No burnt taste here, just rich coffee flavor with no bitterness with a smooth taste that makes me wonder why Starbucks is so damn popular. Oh yeah, well McDonalds and Miller Lite are too.They have a good selection of teas and coffee beans and a few pastries too. Apparently no hot breakfast-y type food to the lament of another reviewer. My pal says their marshmallow latte is excellent while perhaps not appreciating the irony of drinking her coffee black to save calories for "something else."Friendly service and a funkdafied atmosphere. Oh, and free wifi!

26.description: So I visited Big Shoulders, and before I placed an order, I asked the barista if I could get the key to the restroom so that I could wash my hands. She told me one customer just left the shop and took the key with him, so they were locked out and had no restroom available.No big deal. I just order a drink and forgo washing my hands (by the way, the painted lady sounds a little odd with lemonade and mint and coffee, but it's very tasty). I sat down and worked on my laptop, and throughout my stay, I noticed the other customers were freely using the restroom.Before I left, I asked the barista if the restroom was now available. She then tells me it's just past the side door, no mention of requiring a key. I question her about the key, and she suddenly remembered what she told me earlier, and quickly mentions that the customer just came back and returned the key.So if no key is required, then where did that story about the customer walking off with it come from? And if a key is required, then why wasn't it given to me the second time I asked about the restroom?I totally understand if the restroom is reserved for paying customers only. But if that's truly the case, then just say so. Don't lie to your customers! If they were up front about it, I would have ordered my drink and then gone to the restroom. And honestly, I would have ordered something to eat, but I didn't because my hands were dirty.

25.description: Excellent fast drip at a fair price. Smooth and balanced. No caffeine spike nor crash, and I don't get the coffee-cough like I do with SB's.. I'm in town for four days, and will stop in four times. No need to experiment elsewhere. They should try serving giant toast, like "The Mill" in SF. Friendly service by all. Check this place out.

12.description: Highly recommend Big Shoulders over any Starbucks.  The Marshmellow Latte was awesome. Make the effort to stop in.

59.description: I stopped by after 9am to grab a cup of joe and also grabbed a apple muffin. The space is small, but cozy with a few tables and higher seats against the windows. I can imagine this place being super packed during the morning rush.As for the coffee it was really good. It was the house coffee and was not too strong. The muffin however was dry and did not taste like apple at all. Both items set me back almost $7.If you want to grab a good cup of joe ONLY and a cozy spot to do work or look out the window AFTER rush hour than come here other than that there is a DD across the street for muffins.

21.description: Ah, the independent coffee shop remains strong here in Chicago, and Big Shoulders fits the mold.  Sitting right at Chicago, Milwaukee and Ogden,  Big Shoulders is easy to find and easier to enjoy.  Very simple no frills interior with amazing (and strong) brews.  There's really nothing not to like about this location.  Internet can def be a little spotty, so leave the laptop and home and plan on reading a book.  Generally a quiet spot, save for the occasional artist who thinks the world is interested in overhearing his/her conversations about their writing style.  Big Shoulders is worth the stop if you're in the neighborhood and worth making a hike over to even if you're not.

17.description: Simple!  Good coffee and pastries in a well ventilated, clean comfortable setting with knowledgeable and informative staff.  Now, I have a new list of lattes to taste in house made syrups/infusions.

10.description: Ah, the independent coffee shop remains strong here in Chicago, and Big Shoulders fits the mold.  Sitting right at Chicago, Milwaukee and Ogden,  Big Shoulders is easy to find and easier to enjoy.  Very simple no frills interior with amazing (and strong) brews.  There's really nothing not to like about this location.  Internet can def be a little spotty, so leave the laptop and home and plan on reading a book.  Generally a quiet spot, save for the occasional artist who thinks the world is interested in overhearing his/her conversations about their writing style.  Big Shoulders is worth the stop if you're in the neighborhood and worth making a hike over to even if you're not.

5.description: Big Shoulders Coffee is the epitome of coffee done right and it's a place that makes me so glad (ecstatic, in fact) that coffee culture exists. They have high quality beans, a straightforward menu and the friendliest, most hard-working baristas who care as much about preparing the coffee as ensuring that you're enjoying it.  Wonderful.If you have the Indie Coffee Passport, they don't have a separate drink menu to choose from; you can have any drink already listed on their menu. Even more wonderful.  The moment I walked in, I was greeted with a "Hi, how are you?"  For every person who leaves, the staff wishes them well with a "thanks for coming by" or "have a good one."  Even the call-and-answer way the baristas communicated with each other behind the counter displayed the fluidity of their teamwork.When I was seated at the counter, I was kind of fascinated. They would constantly give each other tips or experiment making different kinds of coffee.  I realize now that they're relentlessly perfecting their trade.  I ordered a Uganda dark roast in a press which is timed to 4:00 minutes.  I absolutely love how they talk each other like scientists geeked out in a lab... along the lines of: "Is your timer set?" "You bet, it's to 4 minutes."  I did have a front row seat to witness their craftsmanship.Words from Carl Sandburg's "Chicago" poem were painted on their walls:"Hog Butcher for the World,   Tool Maker, Stacker of Wheat,   Player with Railroads and the Nation's Freight Handler;   Stormy, husky, brawling,   City of the Big Shoulders:"Their space is open and inviting, and somehow they capture some of Chicago's history and embody its hardworking spirit. There are bar stools at all the windows and their counters even have purse/jacket hooks underneath!  You will see shelves of pour over contraptions with names like kalita wave, stacked alongside beakers, kettles, scales and timers.To go with my coffee, I also ordered a Basque pastry (like a petit madeleine in the shape of a tart, dusted with powdered sugar) and those run about $4.00.  It was exceptionally good.  If I hadn't gotten a dark roast coffee, I would have ordered their Cardamom Latte.  A friend (also with the Indie Coffee Passport) had raved about the Marshmallow Latte that comes with a toasted marshmallow.It has been awhile since I've given five stars to a cafe, but both their coffee/staff top the list in the coffee world and are nothing short of wonderful.

3.description: Big windows, 1 big table, but also counter seating. Music chill, not too loud.Staff wonderful. Right by the Blue line entrance.

35.description: If I ever want to introduce the local places to my out-of-town friends, Big Shoulders Coffee is certainly on my bucket list.  That was my first time this late morning.  The location is just as prime as it can be; take the "southbound Chicago ave." exit of the CTA Chicago Blue Line station, you will see BSC and can't possibly miss it!  It's a small place, but they utilize windows and simple, clean-looking decors to visually enlarge the entire venue.  Without any hesitation, I ordered the marshmallow latte, while hubby had the cappuccino.  I've been browsing through pictures on Yelp and curious about what and how the marshmallow latte tasted like.  Let me be as descriptive as possible with this human ingenuity.  The latte was pretty "honey-strong" with a mild tone of marshmallow to draw a correlation between the "toasted-marshmallow stick" on top of the latte.  I anticipated that some might not like the sweetness, yet some would go bananas with it since it definitely added playfulness and innovation to a regular latte.  So what did I think about the marshmallow latte?  I'm a fan of this, especially when I want to have a lazy day in the city.  They do have restrooms available; they share the facilities with the playwright theater next door.  Please ask for a key at the service counter.  They have bus trackers on the big monitor (56 Milwaukee and 66 Chicago).  If you're catching a train, you can track the progress on the monitor attached to the entry/exit of the Chicago Blue Line station.  In the meantime, you can enjoy people-watching, the free show of the day.

19.description: As silly as it feels ordering a marshmallow latte and having the workers fire up the torch just for you, it was damn delicious!

28.description: Happened to be nearby and wanted to give this place a try due to having a lot of positive reviews. It took a bit to find parking which may explain why it seems popular among commuters not worried about where to put their wheels. Found a spot after two loops and headed in. The guy at the counter was helpful with making a drink selection. I originally wanted the Horchata Latte, but he advised that it's made with sweetened condensed milk so it wouldn't work as a nondairy option.
