I went with the Cardamom Spice Latte instead (with almond milk) and it was delicious! I'm a big fan of baking spices anyway and the combination with their house roasted espresso was a great balance. I don't find myself over here often, but I'd definitely go back if I were, and would highly recommend it.

45.description: You have forever ruined other coffee for us! We get big shoulders beans and LOVE them! We are all turning into coffee snobs thanks to your amazing coffee! Guests love it when we make it for them and we usually end up stopping in and buying a bag for them when they are in town!

33.description: Pretty solid coffee

43.description: Big Shoulders Coffee is the epitome of coffee done right and it's a place that makes me so glad (ecstatic, in fact) that coffee culture exists. They have high quality beans, a straightforward menu and the friendliest, most hard-working baristas who care as much about preparing the coffee as ensuring that you're enjoying it.  Wonderful.If you have the Indie Coffee Passport, they don't have a separate drink menu to choose from; you can have any drink already listed on their menu. Even more wonderful.  The moment I walked in, I was greeted with a "Hi, how are you?"  For every person who leaves, the staff wishes them well with a "thanks for coming by" or "have a good one."  Even the call-and-answer way the baristas communicated with each other behind the counter displayed the fluidity of their teamwork.When I was seated at the counter, I was kind of fascinated. They would constantly give each other tips or experiment making different kinds of coffee.  I realize now that they're relentlessly perfecting their trade.  I ordered a Uganda dark roast in a press which is timed to 4:00 minutes.  I absolutely love how they talk each other like scientists geeked out in a lab... along the lines of: "Is your timer set?" "You bet, it's to 4 minutes."  I did have a front row seat to witness their craftsmanship.Words from Carl Sandburg's "Chicago" poem were painted on their walls:"Hog Butcher for the World,   Tool Maker, Stacker of Wheat,   Player with Railroads and the Nation's Freight Handler;   Stormy, husky, brawling,   City of the Big Shoulders:"Their space is open and inviting, and somehow they capture some of Chicago's history and embody its hardworking spirit. There are bar stools at all the windows and their counters even have purse/jacket hooks underneath!  You will see shelves of pour over contraptions with names like kalita wave, stacked alongside beakers, kettles, scales and timers.To go with my coffee, I also ordered a Basque pastry (like a petit madeleine in the shape of a tart, dusted with powdered sugar) and those run about $4.00.  It was exceptionally good.  If I hadn't gotten a dark roast coffee, I would have ordered their Cardamom Latte.  A friend (also with the Indie Coffee Passport) had raved about the Marshmallow Latte that comes with a toasted marshmallow.It has been awhile since I've given five stars to a cafe, but both their coffee/staff top the list in the coffee world and are nothing short of wonderful.

2.description: My friend and I decided to stop in Big Shoulders Coffee before dinner one night.  This place is not your fancy coffee shop and doesn't offer many options, but everyone is friendly and their options are truly unique.  My friend tried the marshmallow latte and I opted for the horchata latte.  For my lactose intolerant friends, they do offer other choices of milk: soy or almond.  The flavor of my latte was delicious.  It truly embraced the flavors of a horchata while still having the rich aromas of coffee.  It was a tad sweet for my liking, but nothing asking for less sugar (or even no sugar) won't help with.  Overall, this is a great place to sit and enjoy your cup of coffee or on the go in a hurry.  It's conveniently located steps away from the blue line.  Definitely go grab yourself a cup.

18.description: Every once in a while the coffee truck parks in front of the Deloitte building on Monroe and Wacker. I look forward to this rare event. Simple, Fresh, hot, robust coffee. One of the best! looking forward to my next cup!

41.description: Good Vibes & Great Coffee. I will never forget my first time going to Big Shoulders and getting a coffee to go. I totally underestimated the strength of their coffee, but man was i in for a surprise! The staff is super friendly, a quick place to get away or kill time to get a coffee while waiting for the blue line or 66 bus. They really blew my mind when i ordered the toasted marshmallow latte- everyone needs to try it!

52.description: Went there to do some work on my computer one afternoon. Service and the marshmallow latte was great!  Seating was somewhat limited as the place was kind of small and not too many tables, but definitely worth going to I think if you want to try a different coffee shop that isn't so generic like Starbucks.

50.description: While I'm not a huge coffee drinker, I do love this place.  The coffee is really strong  (for me anyway), but I love their tea and hot chocolate with soy and vanilla. They also have this carrot cake that will blow ya mind. The staff is super nice and approachable, and the vibe is very laid back. It may not be the best kick it spot (no comfy chairs to be found) but it's a great cafe overall.

4.description: If I ever want to introduce the local places to my out-of-town friends, Big Shoulders Coffee is certainly on my bucket list.  That was my first time this late morning.  The location is just as prime as it can be; take the "southbound Chicago ave." exit of the CTA Chicago Blue Line station, you will see BSC and can't possibly miss it!  It's a small place, but they utilize windows and simple, clean-looking decors to visually enlarge the entire venue.  Without any hesitation, I ordered the marshmallow latte, while hubby had the cappuccino.  I've been browsing through pictures on Yelp and curious about what and how the marshmallow latte tasted like.  Let me be as descriptive as possible with this human ingenuity.  The latte was pretty "honey-strong" with a mild tone of marshmallow to draw a correlation between the "toasted-marshmallow stick" on top of the latte.  I anticipated that some might not like the sweetness, yet some would go bananas with it since it definitely added playfulness and innovation to a regular latte.  So what did I think about the marshmallow latte?  I'm a fan of this, especially when I want to have a lazy day in the city.  They do have restrooms available; they share the facilities with the playwright theater next door.  Please ask for a key at the service counter.  They have bus trackers on the big monitor (56 Milwaukee and 66 Chicago).  If you're catching a train, you can track the progress on the monitor attached to the entry/exit of the Chicago Blue Line station.  In the meantime, you can enjoy people-watching, the free show of the day.

6.description: finally got a chance to try the much hyped big shoulders coffee experience. it did not disappoint. even the drip coffee (bottomless for customers who hang) was rich and delicious. they also have the chemex method of brewing for those with deeper pockets. its a small space so i cannot complain about hard chairs and limited seating. the employees were mellow and provided musical ambiance that was chill and perfect for a greyish sunday. chicago, you have many great roasters and big shoulders is one of them.

22.description: Great coffee. Good environment. Air conditioning was on full blast and was freezing which kinda sucked, and the wifi connection was pretty shorty as wel

15.description: It's taken me awhile to write this review, partly because I hold it to such high esteem so I feel the need to make the review commensurate. But screw it, it's time I write this review.Big Shoulders is great. My go-to coffeeshop for great espresso, roasted right inside the shop. The drip is barely too acidic for my taste, but nothing beats Big Shoulders' espresso drinks. Nice baristas that are always approachable.There's about 20 spots to sit, which isn't a lot, but there's always an open space. Ample amount of plugs around the nifty, triangular table that conforms to the shape of the place. If you're lucky, you'll leave with aromatic white flakes on you, coming down from the ventilation once the roasting machine gets roastin'. It's basically free caffeine sitting atop your big shoulders.

57.description: Fantastic coffee shop right off the Blue Line at Chicago.  All of their coffee is great, in particular the Kraakamandel which has a lot of almond taste and is truly fantastic.I also love how they provide bus and train estimated schedules.  Perfect for those headed into work in the morning.323/365

20.description: Every once in a while the coffee truck parks in front of the Deloitte building on Monroe and Wacker. I look forward to this rare event. Simple, Fresh, hot, robust coffee. One of the best! looking forward to my next cup!

36.description: Tim the owner insisted I try the slow drip...changed my coffee game forever.  I stop in for some beans and a brew whenever I'm in the area.

14.description: I love this place. It's not on my way to work, in fact it's the opposite way for me. But I often find myself going out of my to go grab coffee in the morning. The space is simple, but really nice. Not too modern, but looks new. The staff has always been as nice as can be. The prices are good, the coffee is amazing. I like to sit by the window and wait as long as I can before catching my train which is located steps from the door. They even have screens with the train and bus trackers! It's a great place for commuters to stop in before work. They have bar seating and a communal table. Since they roast their own coffee, I like to grab a bag and take it to work so I can press my own.

58.description: I'm a huge fan of the mix of old-timers and neighborhood folk, and of cheap beer.  Pool is $0.75, which isn't bad, and the bartender was nice. It was a cool mixed crowd, I love how its tucked away - I will be back when I'm in the hood.

56.description: One of the best dives in Wicker Park. Friendly bar staff, great jukebox and great drink prices. You can't beat it!

29.description: Chipp Inn is a small neighborhood bar with a good selection of beer and a friendly atmosphere.  It is a great place to relax and enjoy good conversation with friends.

42.description: The Chipp Inn is a divey gem off Chicago Avenue located almost in an alley.  The beer selection ranges from extremely cheap schwag beer to better tasting and still reasonably priced "better" beer. While I'm not a regular, the bartenders have always been nice and welcoming. (and the regulars are quite friendly as well)  In sum, a great neighborhood bar and worth checking out if you're in the area.

23.description: This place is good because: it has a jukebox that most of the crowd seems to neglect (so we can take it over), the drinks really are cheap, the bartender is efficient and runs his one man show pretty admirably, and they have 50 cent bags of chips, which we all sometimes need.Cash only, don't expect too much, and accept that the crowd is hit or miss.

47.description: Awesome bar!  Only thing is, I think I left my wallet here and their phone doesn't seem to work...If anyone knows of anyway to get in touch with them, I would be SO thankful!

8.description: My buddy and I like to sit at the Chipp Inn bar drinking Blatz' and doing Malort shots until we can't remember each others' names. I love this place, and you will too. It's THE PERFECT Chicago neighborhood bar. Tell Mark I said hi.

31.description: I don't live too far from here, but only just stopped in last Saturday evening and was reminded just how different Noble Square is from nearby Ukranian Village.The prices weren't THAT cheap, the place wasn't THAT divey and the bartender wasn't THAT nice.  The crowd was light on the old drunk men and hipsters and heavy on the yuppies and their girlfriends.  It got pretty loud in there just from conversation by about 9 p.m.It doesn't feel like a neighborhood bar to me, it feels like a place people mention to make people think they went to a neighborhood bar.

34.description: The Chip Inn is great!  Here you will find an old school atmosphere, good music, and friendly patrons.I like this place because it's unpretentious and has cheap beers.

16.description: Really, why did I only give the Chipp Inn four stars?This place is incredible.Cheap pool, too.P.S. That infamous grab bag is only Thursday nights.  Just thought I should clarify.  Last time I was there, beers include Tecate, Hamm's, Old Style, Strohs, Old Milwaukee, some kind of green can that says "Special Export" and some others I can't quite remember.  Honestly... ridiculous.  I love that this is basically in my alley.

13.description: Dive bar- great beer, great vibe, friendly bartenders. True "neighborhood" dive bar- nothing better!

11.description: Great neighborhood dive bar. Cash only!!!. Pool table in the back room is pretty sweet. It was open the whole time we were there on a Friday night, so we were able to play a few games. Up front, there is seating at the bar along with high top tables. Even though it was cold outside, this bar felt very warm and cozy. Great jukebox too!

39.description: Great neighborhood bar with decent bottle selection, rotating crafts on draft, fair prices, and solid service. The pool table is always open, and the awesome looking, hand carved wood bar is pretty great. This place used to be a speak-easy- come check out a piece of local Chicago history.A great place to catch the game, election results, state of the union, or whatever is going on that day. The perfect neighborhood bar.

37.description: Really, why did I only give the Chipp Inn four stars?This place is incredible.Cheap pool, too.P.S. That infamous grab bag is only Thursday nights.  Just thought I should clarify.  Last time I was there, beers include Tecate, Hamm's, Old Style, Strohs, Old Milwaukee, some kind of green can that says "Special Export" and some others I can't quite remember.  Honestly... ridiculous.  I love that this is basically in my alley.

0.description: I'm quite a fan of this place.Very cheap drinks and great service. I was there on a Wednesday afternoon and being a recent new resident to the city, was made very welcome by the bartender and crowd. My wife had mentioned how she always enjoyed the place.I enjoyed seeing all the retro beer advertisements and paraphenalia around the bar. They had the Hawks game on and people were quietly going about their business playing pool.Can't fault anything in the place - it was a great escape from the cold.

38.description: This is a tiny, basic neighborhood dive with a jukebox, pool table and strong drinks. It reminds me of being in a small town, which is a welcome relief from all the fancy shmancy places popping up on Chicago Avenue. If you're planning on a beer-fueled meltdown, you may want to add Chipp Inn to your itinerary.

51.description: Nice, bright, cozy, and social little corner bar.  Good enough beer selection with a couple of Oktoberfest beers on draft right now... or plenty of cheap swill in a can, too.  I really liked this place for what it is..just a no-frills neighborhood watering hole.

27.description: Unfortunately, Was too crowded when I went. But IS a rather classic bar with ALL that memorobilia. One of the next times, I may give it another try.

32.description: Chipp Inn is one of those local dive bars that you can belly up to the bar, sit there for hours and just chill. Chipp Inn is one of my favorite bars for three reasons:1 - I love a bar where it's not just hip to order PBR, but seems appropriate. 2 - The local clientele are always entertaining.3 - It's always great to have a bartender who you can actually chat with than one who simply wants to serve you a beer and move on to the next customer.Did I mention they even have $2 Hamm's on Saturdays? Chipp Inn is a tiny neighborhood bar with a loyal local crowd and cheap drinks. Combine that with a bit of Chicago history and this place is a winner. Sounds like I need to head back there soon.

54.description: Noble Square dive bar with super cheap drinks and surprisingly friendly service. There is a beer special that's something ridiculous like $1.75 a can. Seems like an awesome place to hang out on a hot summer night. Although I'm guessing shit gets rowdy as the night progresses, given that you can get wasted for $10.

48.description: Really good bar if you are in the Noble Square area but since many of us do not it can be quite the pain to get there. The reason this is getting four stars is pretty much based on price alone.  There are few places that I can think of in the city where you can have a pretty awesome time for $10 or less. You may be drinking Hamms and other "low beers" but really, are miller lite or bud light that much better? The atmosphere is nicer/cleaner than most "dive bars". I would say it is pretty standard neighborhood bar but with just super low prices. The jukebox seems to play some good tunes as well. I went here with a fellow yelper and that may have also helped get it a four star rating :) . So if your'e in the area and want a very relaxed bar to go to this is your place.

44.description: Chipp Inn.  Husbo wanted to go for a walk/drink so he searched his loving android and found the Chipp Inn.  I had been here before for the....$1.50 PBR tall boy special...he hadn't so we went again.  I like this place.  It's just an average, neat, historical neighborhood bar.  Kind of like Cheers, except waaaaaaay cooler and less ridiculous.  Next time - I'm getting a shirt.

24.description: This is one of the best neighborhood bars period. Go here for cheap beer and good times. They grill out for Bears games and you can toss bags out front. There's a reason its been here for over 100 years.

7.description: I've lived in WestTown all my life even before it got somewhat gentrified. This local watering hole is one of the best bars in Chicago. If you don't want the pretentiousness of wicker park or buck town come to The Chipp Inn. Cash only, no food and a pool table, the bare essential that people forget about. It's a mixed crowd of locals, hipsters and yuppies... And everyone seems to get along great. The bar tenders are good and efficient. If your looking for a blonde with big tits you can flirt with and over Tip, this ain't the place. This bar is a blue collar, $2 Schlitz, PBR and Hamm kinda joint. You can bring in food from the outside and not get any shit for it, come have a beer... You won't be disappointed.

49.description: I  love the Chipp!  The City is seriously lacking in the good ole neighborhood bars.  I am so delighted to have found one in my new hood!  Cheap beer and  friendly bartenders who don't mind getting you drunk!

40.description: I'm in a total love affair with the Chipp.  And honestly I don't know why they keep letting my friends and I back in when we make a ruckus almost every time we're here.Cheap Drinks.  Pool Table.  Friendly Atmosphere.  Bad Ass Bartenders.  Chill Clientele.  Secluded Location (but close to other bars if you want to change it up some).A Dive Bar Done Right!

53.description: so awesome. so awesome. old school old chicago.

30.description: This is a place I want to like simply because it is so old but I recently had a rum and coke here that was so bad it will go down in my own history books. Flat soda and a lime that had to be off made for a god awful combo that haunted me all evening even though I only had a few sips of it. It actually made my stomach turn.

46.description: The Chipp is for real.  Cozy, historical (it used to be a bike shop, and then later turned into a bar around the time of the Chicago Fire), tucked away off major streets.  The wooden bar itself is awesome, and the tin ceilings lend real character to this small watering hole.  Prices are cheap, and one of my favorite things about this place is the "grab bag" where the bartender throws a bunch of cheap beers in a cooler filled with ice, for $1.75 per.  Kind of fun!  Will you get a Hamm's?  Will you get a Tecate?  Will you get a Blatz? (Which is extra fun when you say it with gusto - BLATZ!!)Not too crowded, and everyone seemed friendly and easily approachable.  The Chipp Inn just skyrocketed to the top of my list.

1.description: This is a great "LET'S GET HAMMERED" neighborhood bar.You won't find anything fancy and, if you're like me (which you should be, dammit), you'll be super happy that there isn't a Chad/Trixie to be found in the place. Just go here with $20 and lose some brain cells, ya dingus.

55.description: my friend chuck calls this a dive.  he is wrong.

9.description: Great place filled with great people.  Been going here over a year and it's always a positive atmosphere.  The staff treats you like your family and prices are more than fair!  Highly recommended to good people!

26.description: Check out the Thursday grab bag special!

25.description: a perfect neighborhoody dive bar.  and a great name, to boot?  love it.

12.description: I'm the buddy Braydon T is referring to.  Everything he said about this bar is true.  It's a true joy coming here.

59.description: Quick, easy, pool table, juke box, nice bartender and cheap bottled imports.  Loud grownup dudebros arguing about Jews and Romans and playing Shania Twain and/or Jewel all night, but still a very pleasant place to pass an hour or two.

21.description: Fridge full of fairly priced bottled beer, one bartender and cash only because all that's there is an old school register. This is absolutely a dive bar, sticky floors and unpleasant odors included.

17.description: Chipp Inn is one of those local dive bars that you can belly up to the bar, sit there for hours and just chill. Chipp Inn is one of my favorite bars for three reasons:1 - I love a bar where it's not just hip to order PBR, but seems appropriate. 2 - The local clientele are always entertaining.3 - It's always great to have a bartender who you can actually chat with than one who simply wants to serve you a beer and move on to the next customer.Did I mention they even have $2 Hamm's on Saturdays? Chipp Inn is a tiny neighborhood bar with a loyal local crowd and cheap drinks. Combine that with a bit of Chicago history and this place is a winner. Sounds like I need to head back there soon.

10.description: A new Tuesday night, due to a changing work/life situation.  When left to my own devices and without a host (or quasi room mate) to "entertain" me, I will do one of two things:  seek out a completely decadent and over indulgent place, spend quite a bit of cash money and either feel edified by that expenditure or let down.  The alternative, completely diametric, and more entertaining thing to do - is to look for where the locals drink, preferably slashie style (both bar and liquor store in the same place).  While not a slashie - the Chipp certainly didn't let me down from a "let's just take it easy" perspective.  Location: 5 out of 5Literally down the street (half a street) from my new Tuesday night digs.  Walking is easy, street parking is available, and if you must take public transportation, the blue line and/or the Chicago bus are not so far away.Decor: 4 out of 5Exactly what I was looking for in a neighborhood joint.  Unpretentiously and unironically divey with a pool table as others have mentioned (which wasn't being used), a simple and somewhat sticky bar, old timey cash register where you have to punch physical tactile keys to get it to work, and old posters, signs, remnants, and memories of bygone times and now hard to find beer manufacturers adorn the somewhat dark and just a little pungent interior.  In full transparency, I happened to go on a day when it was in the 90s with high humidity, so perhaps this contributed to what I perceived to be just a little bit of stickiness and dampness.  Quality of Drink Available: 1 to 5 out of 5, so we'll split it and call it 3, depending on how you want to approach things.This one is an odd one for the following reasons.  I've been hard pressed to find a place that has Hamm's on tap, but Chipp Inn does.  But wait...look to the left and to the right, and you see a beerscape that's as varied as the clientele.  5 Rabbits makes sense because we're in Chicago.  Lagunitas has a Chicago connection now but we're getting a little bit more "upscale."  Founders?  Whoa...crossing all sorts of sociobeerconomic (see what I did there?) boundaries here.  This was evident by the other patrons when I went:  a younger "hip" couple consuming sandwiches they had brought in and a few blue collar regulars. The same range goes for the liquor collection, and while you won't find any haut couture, i.e., boutique flavored vodkas, you'll see an eclectic mix of whisk(e)y, bourbon, and vodkas.  And how could I forget that on Tuesday evenings, you can get the poor man's boilermaker for 4$ featuring Beam and the BEAST?!  I should also mention that they have Blatz in cans, which is rare(r) now in Chicago.  Price: 4 out of 5As someone has mentioned already, it's cheap but not THAT cheap.  2.50 for a Hamm's draft, 2 bucks for a can of Blatz.  Not breaking the bank by any means, but not quite liquor store singles cheap.  I'm not in tune to what the specials are each evening yet, but 4 $ for a Beam and Beast seems reasonable, and I imagine that much entertainment can arise from watching the over consumption of such options.  Remember that this place is cash only, though an ATM is available.Customer Service: 4 out of 5Friendly guy behind the bar who made small talk well.  Didn't get into any deep conversations about life, love lost, dogs, politics, corruption, etc. but it doesn't mean that we won't get there one day.  For my first visit - talking about Hamm's, the beer refreshing! and Blatz was a good introduction to this bar.Overall: 4 out of 5Worth a visit if you're in the area, and I'll gladly go back to drink old school beers in peace, make small talk with the barkeeps, and hopefully watch and observe the shenaniganry that inevitably accompanies 4$ shots and beer combos.  Keep it classy, keep it safe, and remember that you can bring in your own food (or have it delivered).

5.description: I like my dive bars like I like my police drawings...sketchy. The Chipp Inn technically iiiis a dive bar...I guess. It's kinda grimey, it's cash only, and it's about the size of a shoebox, but the ratio of normal folks to total degenerates is very much in favor of the less entertaining. I didn't see one person that I was scared of what they might potentially do...Call me crazy, but I'd categorize it as more of a local watering hole what with the fancy jukebox and all. Dives don't let you play tunes from your iPhone. Still any place that beer prices have a 1 on the left side of the decimal point deserve at least 4 stars.

3.description: This place is a tiny dive bar in the middle of a neighborhood. The bartender is really nice. Drinks are really straightforward and cheap.The pool table is TINY, sadly. And the room that it is in is small, so you can't really get good aim from certain angles. But any bar with a pool table gets extra points in my book. It's definitely a place to hit up. I love dive bars. With that said, it's a dive bar.

35.description: Kooky place. Good for basics. A couple times there's been a funky sewer smell. So maybe it's good there's no 'wet bar'.

19.description: Cheap beer (Hamms on tap), great bartender, and right of Chicago Ave. and Ashland if you decide to go somewhere else. It's perfect.

28.description: came here for ah drink while waiting for a table at ruxbin.  daily specials.  CASH only.  don't think it's one of them places where a lady goes for a cocktail.  this here is real.  if i lived down the street, and was a fat man with 3 kids, married to a wife with blue hair, the chipp inn would be my Moe's.

45.description: Came, saw, bought the t-shirt off the wall. Literally.That's about all I remember.

33.description: I'm glad to see someone else is speaking up about the owner. Like Jessica B I was there when the owner felt free to pontificate on how awful gays and Jews are. Like most places, the crowd varies night to night but the owner stays the same. Avoid if you don't want to give your money to a bigot. And if you're the owner please don't contact me about my review, I'm gay and there are enough homophobic jerks in the world to deal with.

43.description: I love this place. It's a totally relaxed, cozy, dive bar. It feels like you're walking into someone's house because of the out-of-the way location. There's a pool table and tv's and a great place to hang out to watch a Bears or Sox game. Sometimes they have free food for the big games. There is also a cheap beer special. Only $1.75!

2.description: Annual Spelling Bee. Cheap Schlitz. Mike Janus. Place is amazing. Best neighborhood bar you could ask for.

18.description: One of the best dives ever! If you are looking for a spot to get away from the yuppie crowds Chip Inn is the place. Cash only and very affordable. The bartenders are great too and easy to strike up a conversation with. Bring singles for the juke box!!

41.description: This is basically everything you could ask for in a neighborhood bar. It's super close to where I live. It's relaxed and laid back. It's been around for EVER. The prices are reasonable. More than anything, it has a comfortable feel to it. I can't describe it very well, but I can say this... I picture this as a place the guys from The League would visit (and the show is based in Chicago, so who knows).They also have a pool table in the back room and a good jukebox. If this place had a dartboard, it would be a 5-star, easy.

52.description: Great little bar. Service was amazing, friendly atmosphere, and they opened a bit early for my buddy and I!

50.description: This is classic a neighborhood bar, on 2 side streets, cash only, large selection of cheap beer, hamms and blatz are available, cheap prices, friendly people, i love this place

4.description: Tactfully hidden on the corner of a side street and an alley, Chipp Inn has certainly rewarded those who happen to stumble upon it over the past century! Although I'm not sure if it was called Chipp Inn back then... Unlike other "dive" bars in the area, this one has craft beer on tap. Enjoyed sampling offerings from Arcade Brewery with Joe the bartender - a neighborhood bloke who doesn't take no flack from mischievous upstarts,  but is happy to strike up a friendly conversation with friendly passerbys at the bar. They also have Hamm's on tap, which is always a plus. They allow individuals to bring in their own food, too! Excellent vintage, seemingly hidden option in Noble Squre/West Town/East Ukie Village.

6.description: I love this little dive bar!The Chipp Inn has just one bartender and honestly that's just plenty for their Saturday night crowd. The crowd is a mix of people but everyone is quite friendly. They have a jukebox so the music ranges from wanting to blow your brains out top 40 stuff to awesome GnR songs! They have cans of Blatz & Hamm's for $1.75 - score! Apparently these specials change daily based on what's scribbled on their chalk board. They also had Little Sumthin Wild on tap, as well as some other good brews.Pool table in the back is .75 per play - bring quarters. The decor is divey with beer signs all over the walls and the florescent beer signs all around the windows. It's a true neighborhood bar without having the feeling of unwelcoming you'll sometimes catch at those types of spots. My friends and I had never been there before last weekend and we felt right at home. A friend even tipped over my glass of Little Sumthin and the bartender gave me a new one gratis. Now that's service!  Cash only!

22.description: Great neighborhood bar, a little divey but its awesome. Cheap drinks, they don't serve food but you can order food to be delivered there. The bartender is nice, people are friendly. Great place.

15.description: Excellent little local dive.  Friendly bartenders, great prices.  Most folks are drinking Hamms or other cheap domestic beer, but they have a few premium taps if you want to class it up.A funny recollection I have was one time after we ordered our second round of drinks, the bartender tossed a bag of potato chips our way and said, "Free buffet tonight."Another time I specifically stopped by to catch Jeopardy because I knew a contestant that was going to be on that day.  I asked the bartender if we could put Jeopardy on in 5 minutes. "We always watch Jeopardy" he said.  Nice!

57.description: How many places can one walk in and get appropriately drunk on $20?  Not many these days unless you're a cheap date, lightweight, or little person.  Chipp Inn fit the bill for a quality evening of chatting, bitching, and drinking.  The bartender even bought us a round.  I think it's because we are drunkity drunkards.  This place is a lovely old man bar, fitting of the old men that myself and my drunken partner in crime are.  We are crotchety old bastards only to be competed against by Tom Waits and Neil Young.  I'm Tom Waits.  My pal can be Neil.  Or we can switch.  Seriously though, Chipp Inn.  Good place to get down on the weeknights when you can't handle life anymore.  Cash only.

20.description: A new Tuesday night, due to a changing work/life situation.  When left to my own devices and without a host (or quasi room mate) to "entertain" me, I will do one of two things:  seek out a completely decadent and over indulgent place, spend quite a bit of cash money and either feel edified by that expenditure or let down.  The alternative, completely diametric, and more entertaining thing to do - is to look for where the locals drink, preferably slashie style (both bar and liquor store in the same place).  While not a slashie - the Chipp certainly didn't let me down from a "let's just take it easy" perspective.  Location: 5 out of 5Literally down the street (half a street) from my new Tuesday night digs.  Walking is easy, street parking is available, and if you must take public transportation, the blue line and/or the Chicago bus are not so far away.Decor: 4 out of 5Exactly what I was looking for in a neighborhood joint.  Unpretentiously and unironically divey with a pool table as others have mentioned (which wasn't being used), a simple and somewhat sticky bar, old timey cash register where you have to punch physical tactile keys to get it to work, and old posters, signs, remnants, and memories of bygone times and now hard to find beer manufacturers adorn the somewhat dark and just a little pungent interior.  In full transparency, I happened to go on a day when it was in the 90s with high humidity, so perhaps this contributed to what I perceived to be just a little bit of stickiness and dampness.  Quality of Drink Available: 1 to 5 out of 5, so we'll split it and call it 3, depending on how you want to approach things.This one is an odd one for the following reasons.  I've been hard pressed to find a place that has Hamm's on tap, but Chipp Inn does.  But wait...look to the left and to the right, and you see a beerscape that's as varied as the clientele.  5 Rabbits makes sense because we're in Chicago.  Lagunitas has a Chicago connection now but we're getting a little bit more "upscale."  Founders?  Whoa...crossing all sorts of sociobeerconomic (see what I did there?) boundaries here.  This was evident by the other patrons when I went:  a younger "hip" couple consuming sandwiches they had brought in and a few blue collar regulars. The same range goes for the liquor collection, and while you won't find any haut couture, i.e., boutique flavored vodkas, you'll see an eclectic mix of whisk(e)y, bourbon, and vodkas.  And how could I forget that on Tuesday evenings, you can get the poor man's boilermaker for 4$ featuring Beam and the BEAST?!  I should also mention that they have Blatz in cans, which is rare(r) now in Chicago.  Price: 4 out of 5As someone has mentioned already, it's cheap but not THAT cheap.  2.50 for a Hamm's draft, 2 bucks for a can of Blatz.  Not breaking the bank by any means, but not quite liquor store singles cheap.  I'm not in tune to what the specials are each evening yet, but 4 $ for a Beam and Beast seems reasonable, and I imagine that much entertainment can arise from watching the over consumption of such options.  Remember that this place is cash only, though an ATM is available.Customer Service: 4 out of 5Friendly guy behind the bar who made small talk well.  Didn't get into any deep conversations about life, love lost, dogs, politics, corruption, etc. but it doesn't mean that we won't get there one day.  For my first visit - talking about Hamm's, the beer refreshing! and Blatz was a good introduction to this bar.Overall: 4 out of 5Worth a visit if you're in the area, and I'll gladly go back to drink old school beers in peace, make small talk with the barkeeps, and hopefully watch and observe the shenaniganry that inevitably accompanies 4$ shots and beer combos.  Keep it classy, keep it safe, and remember that you can bring in your own food (or have it delivered).

36.description: its a great iconic bar...no bullshit.its kind of small so it is better if you don't go there...we will make it a regular spot.

14.description: Solid low key spot to grab a beer with friends.

58.description: Great Pizza. It folds and tastes as close to  New York slices as I have had in Chicago. The cheese covers the slice perfectly and with enough cheese to make the slice a pizza instead of a bread stick with cheese on it. The salad is fresh, but they put anchovies on it. This was not for me and they should have asked if I wanted anchovies in the salad so I did not give five stars. To me, this is a service issue and they should know that anchovies are a special preference item. They could make a better Cesar salad that just lettuce and croutons. The pizza was ready on time and was perfectly made. Excellent customer service.

56.description: I just tried Paula and Monica's this past weekend and only experienced their pizza, but I know I will be back for more (and possibly upping them a star). While I do enjoy deep dish, it is not a pre-drink dinner. It is a pre-nap dinner which on a Weekend night I must avoid.Thin crust is not often discussed in Chicago but this one is worthy of discussion! We ordered a sausage and small veggie and they did not disappoint. Most people scoff at a veggie pizza but this one was more of a meal then the sausage! They load on the spinach, olives, onion, green peppers and whole slices of flavorful and fresh tomato to fill you up but not leave you in a coma.I can't wait to try it again and perhaps build my own.

29.description: Best pizza in Chicago hands down. In the past week I've ordered pizza from here 3 times. If it were up to me I would eat their pizza all day everyday. Paula and Monica's pizza is simplicity at it's finest. Their crust is thin, the sauce is flavorful, and the portions are generous. I've tried many different pizza places in the surrounding area and NOTHING compares to Paula and Monica's. It's my new favorite pizza place.

42.description: This place has the best pan pizza in Chicago. The jumbo slice special is priced very low and they offer a bunch of other items instead of just pizza. If you are in the area definitely check this place out!

23.description: It's bizarre that this is my first 5 star review, but shit, man, this pizza hit the spot. Walked in to grab carryout and it just smelled like a really solid pizzeria, a little nostalgic for some reason. Got home and was so ultra pleased to bite into this gooey, cheesy, saucy, deliciousness. Sausage was perfectly sausage-y and the garlic had perfectly saturated the sauce. Compelling, really. A reminder of why pizza is America's pastime.

47.description: Decent little spot which was a stone's throw away from my old apartment.  Since I'm not a fan of the signature Chicago deep dish pizza, I frequented this place.  Good service, friendly owners and a decent salad too.  Pizza was always cooked long enough and wasn't greasy.  That's usually my main complaint about pizza.  If you live in Noble Square or West Town, check this place out.

8.description: Love this place.  My favorite in Chicago for what I would describe as classic style pizza.  They are not really artisan and definitely not deep dish which I think are almost 2 different things completely, but just classic thin crust with standard toppings.

31.description: The worst pizza I ever had.  We ordered a thin crust half pepperoni/half veggie.  Both sides were extremely bland and flavorless.  The crust was chewy and rubbery, and the cheese was congealed like wax.  Disgusting. Yelp is usually accurate, but way off the mark with this place.

34.description: Popped into this small pizza spot for a quick bite with a friend. The pizza is NY style and there are a lot of different sizes to choose from, including by the slice. They also have appetizers, salads, and sandwiches. I got the medium pepperoni slice for $3 (see picture for idea of size). The pizza was pretty good, the crust nice and crisp. My friend got garlic bread and I tried some but didn't like it. One drawback was they didn't have a soda fountain, so if you want water you have to buy a bottle. But the owner is really friendly, and location is convenient right on Chicago ave.

16.description: Pizza was fantastic. And as a ny style , you won't feel like you've swallowed a loaf of bread and wheel of cheese for days. Do not deliver. Took 90 mins. Worth the trip to pick up though. Had a veggie. Phenomenal.

13.description: 1/22/14 Upgreeeyyyyyed:Quality/Taste metric updated to 4 out of 5 because of their specialty pizzas.  They don't skimp on the bacon on the meat lovers, and the margarita while not truly "authentic" was tasty and well rounded. Price bumped up to 4 out of 5 as well.  With the Eat24 online site, the coupon deals are reeeeediculously good.  Overall, gets bumped up to a 4.

11.description: I love me some pizza and this place has some of the best in Chicago.  After years of trying to find one, Paula and Monica's has become my go-to pizza joint.

39.description: This pizza is great! I used to live right behind them and ordered for the convenience when I first moved in. To this day it's my favorite thin crust in the city. No bells and whistles, just great food.

37.description: Awesome pizza. Super friendly staff. Owner is usually there when I go in for lunch and is always a super pleasant guy.

0.description: You know what's better then good pizza? Living a block away from an amazing pizza place.My first experience with this place was ordering a pizza for my roommate and I. It was affordable, VERY delicious and made in good time.  My second experience, when I had gotten out of a rough relationship and was "dating myself".  On that second visit is when I learned to love them, for the self-dates.  They have a cheap meal for one, type of thing, or a cute little date at a hole in the wall. $6 for 2-3 HUGE slices of pizza + a can of pop.  It's simple, very effective, especially if you're gonna sit in the restaurant which is never busy, and read a book while enjoying "me" time. :)I highly recommend this place.  If anything, take yourself on a date and bring a good book.PS.  The canoli's are to-die-for!

38.description: This place is great. Not only do they have great tasting pizzas, the owner is great too.

51.description: I ordered a jumbo thin slice of pizza sausage on a Friday night at around 10:30 pm. The person behind the counter wasn't friendly at all. The pizza was super thin, the sauce was very plain, the topping of sausage was scarce. I got a pop, and when i filled it up the soda spilled all over me, a girl ordering there told me that machine spill all the time =p. Overall didn't like it.

27.description: So yes it was a little odd when we first walked into the place. My wife, who has a much keener sense of smell than myself, identified the small as a bit moldy. I just thought it smelled off.Regardless, we didn't eat there, we took it to go. I ordered the large pizza slice $6 with a can of soda and she a medium pizza slice at $4. I am pretty sure the pizza slices were actually the same size, just cut differently.But I felt they were really tasty slices! I will definitely come back for more slices especially since the pickings in the area for slices are thin (just like the crust!).Oh yes, it was thin sliced which is my preferred slice. Nice and toasty with cornbread bottom. There were plenty of pepperoni, not drowning in it but also not short of a cheese. I read the cheese is the best there so I need to check that out.BYOB too yo! And internet! So bring a six pack and your tablet and hang out I guess.

32.description: Paula and Monica's pizza is damn good pizza!! I eat pizza about 5 times a month and would put their thin crust cheese in my top 5 Chicago pizzas. Their sauce and cheese go together great, and their crust is always cooked just enough.  I would recommend carry out or delivery and I can't wait to try their pan pizza!!

54.description: Not even worth 1 star. I made them come back and get their food. 2 chicken ceasar salads and there was barely any chicken. Not even a small handful. 90% lettuce. I am not paying $9+ per salad on top of tax and delivery for this crap. And then the driver can't come to my door and ring the bell like a normal person but stands out in the street and yells my name loudly. What a joke!!!

48.description: Meh.  I must have eaten at a different Paula and Monica's because my experience was nothing like what the other reviewers described.  I'll give them a star for the friendly service but the pizza itself was terrible.  The jumbo slice (actually 4 slices after they cut it up) was so greasy and tasteless it reminded me of high school cafeteria pizza.  This is definitely not NY style thin crust...it may look like it but that's where the similarities end.  The crust was hard and crunchy and had neither the taste nor texture of NY street slices do.  $5 for a huge slice and drink would be a great deal if their pizza weren't so crappy.

44.description: Best thin crust. BEST.

24.description: Very good pizza like the cheese n the crust the jumbo slice was just perfect for me happy to find this place

7.description: Never ever ever order from these people!  Worst experience I ve ever had with delivery in my life.

49.description: by far one of the best pizza places, and i am so lucky that it happens to be in my neighborhood. we have been ordering it for the last few years and it is has never disappointed.  regardless of the number of people, you need to order the jumbo pizza, it really has the right ratio of dough:cheese: sauce.  we have been to most of the high end pizza places in town, and paula and monica always outshine  them.

40.description: For pizza by the slice, there are few better values in Chicago. Great prices and a good option for delivery, too.

53.description: Sometimes when the Pizza Monster calls, you have to answer.  I experienced a fierce pizza craving no Lean Pocket could tame, so I decided to bypass my old standby D'Ags and try something new.  I was in the mood for thin crust and decided to give Paul and Monica's a try.I'm not going to sit here and wax intellectual about real NY slices.  I'm a Chicagoan.  If it's thin, folds in half and doesn't require a knife and fork to eat it, it's a NY slice.This is what's happening at P&M's.The crust was soft and chewy and delicious.  The cheese wasn't overbearing.  It was pretty tasty.The only problem is the sauce.  I don't really know what's going on there, but it tastes kind of off.  Maybe too bland?  Kind of like ketchup?  I figured it was a good thing P&M's doesn't go overboard on the sauce.  It certainly wasn't offensive enough to not eat the 'za, but it definitely required an extra dose of red pepper flakes to spice things up a bit.Delivery was fast and easy via Grub Hub.  Work on that sauce, yo, and you'll be UP THERE with my go-to delivery spots.

30.description: Love this place! Happened upon while my mom was in town, such a find! The thin crust and the pan pizzas are both amazing!The owner is the sweetest and the annual membership is a pretty good deal. My mouth is watering just typing this out!

46.description: Nice little hole in the wall. Good pizza and friendly staff. Clean and a good deal. Great for carry out. Their member club is petty cool.

1.description: One of the best Mom and Pop pizza parlors in town and that says something. Huge fan of the Meat Lovers pizza with the pan crust. They use real bacon.... not that crappy Canadian stuff we are so used to seeing on pizza's. Can't tell you much else in terms on non-pizza items here but the pies are solid. Plus they partner through Yelp24 for online ordering and delivery. Never used that though.

55.description: Paula and Monica's has one of the better thin crust pizzas in Chi-town (a rarity in here), very generous portions for their 'slice'- 3 slices and a pop for $5, a great deal. Agree with other reviews, their crust is tasty. Paula and Monica's also has a nice selection of other options- including Italian Beef, some salads and other sandwiches (with are merely average).

9.description: Ordered here 3x, and got COLD pizza every time.  Sorry, 3 strikes you're out.

26.description: My family and I just had the most delicious pizza! Freshly made, nice and hot. The sauce was just right and the crust delectable. They were curteous and provided excellent service. Looking foward to visiting  again!

25.description: Really good pizza. I love there veggie, and their pizza and sausage. They also serve slices that are really good.  I have gotten take out and delivery.

12.description: There are few pizzas in Chicago where the ingredients are so fresh and delicious that you can taste each one individually, Paul and Monica's Pizza is one of them. The pizza makes my mouth water just thinking about my delivery to arrive, which they say "45 min" but usually takes 20. Very pleased with the pizza and great service.

59.description: i got a Groupon deal to pick up a large pizza and salad from here and I'm so glad.  I never noticed the place driving by and now I'm glad to be familiar with it.  The pizza was great and at a good price.  I love the large NY triangular cut.  Do not park illegally outside thinking you will only be in there for five minutes.  Those parking guys over there are swift. :(

21.description: The gold standard thin crust but not too thin crust pizza in Chicago right now.  Delicious and economical.

17.description: If I could give 0 stars I would. Ordered pizza and was charged. Over 1 hour and 45 minutes later, no pizza and the restaurant doesn't know where the delivery driver is. Avoid.

10.description: Best deep dish I've had in Chicago so far. Meat lovers was awesome! The crust is what makes it. It's perfect. Friendly staff and is great for ordering out. Seats if you can't wait until you get home.

5.description: I ordered a pizza and the delivery man couldn't get through. I was waiting downstairs and get horrible reception in my house. When I opened the door after getting a voicemail the delivery man yelled at and scolded me saying that he had tried to call me 7 times. On top of that, he dropped my pizza on the ground and had to go back to bring me another one.  I felt very disrespected for something that wasn't my fault. I will not be returning but will be requesting a full refund.

3.description: Terrible experience ordering delivery from here- so bad that I held off a month to settle down so I didn't unfairly blast this business in anger. After cooling off, I still think this place deserves a 1-star review, so here goes.I order a half cheese, half Italian beef and giardiniera pizza- the cheese part being for my vegetarian friend. My first complaint was the delivery took forever- not sure why because we didn't order during peak hours or anything. Second complaint was the pizza upon arrival- as you can tell from the pic I posted, it was not a half-and-half pizza like we ordered; the entire thing was covered in ingredients, making it "inedible" for my vegetarian friend. Also, the Italian beef was not Italian beef- it was like brisket or something and really, really dry. To top it off, the pizza was soggy and clearly undercooked. I ate half a piece and we threw the rest away- it was that disgusting (I should mention I grew up poor and do NOT throw away food, so this was a drastic measure).I called to complain and no answer, so I submitted a complaint via email through their website, requesting a refund and for a manager to call. No one ever did.With a pizza place in every block, there are much better options- avoid this place at all costs.

35.description: I came in ordered a slice that was lukewarm and the crust was not crispy at all.  Pretty tasty pizza, but improper reheating is a big no-no.  This is definitely a carry out place - there's limited seating and the dining area is chilly.

19.description: Popped into this small pizza spot for a quick bite with a friend. The pizza is NY style and there are a lot of different sizes to choose from, including by the slice. They also have appetizers, salads, and sandwiches. I got the medium pepperoni slice for $3 (see picture for idea of size). The pizza was pretty good, the crust nice and crisp. My friend got garlic bread and I tried some but didn't like it. One drawback was they didn't have a soda fountain, so if you want water you have to buy a bottle. But the owner is really friendly, and location is convenient right on Chicago ave.

28.description: It's not quite Chicago Style but it's good! The Pizza was made to order and took twenty minutes to cook. By the time we walked it home it was the perfect temperature not to hot and not cold. I really enjoyed every piece of it. :-D

45.description: I remember 2 years ago when I lived in the area and this pizza was awesome. The tastiest sauce, perfectly hot. I just got it for delivery tonight and I have to say I was really disappointed. The pizza was definitely on par with Little Caesar's, like another reviewer goes on to say. The cheese was thick, hard to digest, the pepperoni was undercooked, half of the pizza was overcooked and half of it was undercooked. The delivery guy was very nice but called multiple times to find my address with many corrections given with clear direction. I really only recommend getting a slice here. Your money is better spent on tastier pizza in Chicago.

33.description: 1/22/14 Upgreeeyyyyyed:Quality/Taste metric updated to 4 out of 5 because of their specialty pizzas.  They don't skimp on the bacon on the meat lovers, and the margarita while not truly "authentic" was tasty and well rounded. Price bumped up to 4 out of 5 as well.  With the Eat24 online site, the coupon deals are reeeeediculously good.  Overall, gets bumped up to a 4.

43.description: ordered their pizza for a team lunch party - 4 large pizzas, liters of pop, salads.  the pizza was DELICIOUS, the owners/managers kind and helpful, and arrived right on time.  was an awesome experience for us, and we've ordered many (many) more times since.  we now order it about 1-2 times per week, and it never disappoints.  our whole team loves paula and monica's!!!  (george, the owner, is so very helpful and clearly puts his heart into his food.)

2.description: Paula and Monica's is crazy good! If we have friends over, they are our go-to take out pizza place. When talking about pizza my mom will bring up "that delicious pizza in your neighborhood! Man that was so good"! Definitely recommend doing Canadian bacon, pineapple and jalapeños. Mmmmmmmm

18.description: Hands-down best thin crust pizza in Chicago. It will blow your mind.

41.description: This place is in decline. I love that they make thin crust pizza, but they got rid of their soda fountain so now you have to buy cans. The most recent pizza I had was simply awful. I could taste the cheapness of the ingredients. Paula & Monica need to stop cutting corners and step up their game!

52.description: Great pizza! I love the thin crust here. This is a consistant take out pizza place for me. They have fixed up the inside and did a nice job.

50.description: the pizza here is fine, lets get that out of the way.we were there last night grabbing a couple of slices and the delivery driver was parked out front knocking back a modelo negro in his delivery car, I don't know of a better place to have a beer than at work where your primary responsibility is to drive. There was also a guy inside with his like 8 year old son who went out to the delivery car to have a beer with the driver while the kid sat inside and watched them. the real kicker was when the homeless man with rickets that lives under the old natalinos outdoor dining awning ran inside with a filthy cup and used the fountain drink machine and ran back out. We just looked down at our drinks like wtf. won't be back paula and monicas, can't stomach sharing your drink machine with someone who uses a cup that looks like it doubles as a urinal and your drunk driving delivery man.

4.description: Since moving to Chicago 2 years ago this is without a doubt my Go To delivery pizza place. Is is the best pizza in the city, no, definitely not but when you consider price, taste, delivery, service, timeliness and everything else you could want with pizza, you really can't go wrong. If you are giving P & M a bad review on here, I'd really love to get some suggestions from you. No arguments needed. I just like pizza. Cheers!

6.description: Great food, nice people and I feel proud to not support a chain. It's nice to have a place to go to that has quality pizza that's non wood fired. BBQ pizza and meat lovers are ones not to miss.

22.description: I reserve five stars for outstanding places. That said, the meat lovers pizza never disappoints and is loaded with strips of thick cut bacon. This place is also really good for slices. You can get a jumbo slice and drink for 6 bucks and considering the slice is good for 1.5 or two meals it's a pretty good deal too. Their crust is really thin so it doesn't dry out like a lot of places that serve slices that sit out, theirs are almost like a freshly made pizza. If your in the area I wouldn't hesitate to stop by. The staff is always really nice too.

15.description: It's not quite Chicago Style but it's good! The Pizza was made to order and took twenty minutes to cook. By the time we walked it home it was the perfect temperature not to hot and not cold. I really enjoyed every piece of it. :-D

57.description: Haven't been in a few months but was back the other night with a friend and my sister. Got two "slices" (aka their usual 3 in 1 jumbo "slice") and we had enough to share a snack among 5 people. Tasted as great as last time....... just thinking about it now makes me want to go back!!!! Seriously skip the Bacci or whatever else... This pizza is THE Best on the Block. yummmmm!!!!!

20.description: Pizza is just ok for the price, but good none the less.

36.description: Good pizza... Problem is for that price point we won't ever order again unless we get a half off coupon.  It was $22 and some change for a thin crust 14" pizza that can't feed 3 people.  Good pizza but way over priced.

14.description: So yes it was a little odd when we first walked into the place. My wife, who has a much keener sense of smell than myself, identified the small as a bit moldy. I just thought it smelled off.Regardless, we didn't eat there, we took it to go. I ordered the large pizza slice $6 with a can of soda and she a medium pizza slice at $4. I am pretty sure the pizza slices were actually the same size, just cut differently.But I felt they were really tasty slices! I will definitely come back for more slices especially since the pickings in the area for slices are thin (just like the crust!).Oh yes, it was thin sliced which is my preferred slice. Nice and toasty with cornbread bottom. There were plenty of pepperoni, not drowning in it but also not short of a cheese. I read the cheese is the best there so I need to check that out.BYOB too yo! And internet! So bring a six pack and your tablet and hang out I guess.

29.description: This place is BYOB and a great small spot west of the loop. Great service and excellent food.I recommend the lobster roll yummy! Also try there ice cream for dessert because you will be glad that you spend the extra $4. Also I had the ocean roll glad I tried it because that was delicious! Great place for a great price.

42.description: This place is an awesome addition to the neighborhood!! The service is great and the food is fresh and delicious. I have a dietary restriction and can't have rice and they catered to my needs and were so nice about it; suggesting new sushi options! I highly reconnect this place to anyone who loves fresh sushi and great atmosphere.

23.description: This is our #1 neighborhood sushi restaurant. The owner is amazing and the food is fantastic. My favorite rolls are the Volcano and Sweet Potato and my husband's favorite rolls are the Ocean and the Alaskan. We both highly recommend EJ Sushi and feel very lucky to have it in the neighborhood :)

47.description: The renovation is great...but the sushi has gone downhill since this place was Kai Sushi. Sadly. I went in around 3:45 pm for a late lunch - I was the only one in the restaurant, I ordered the lunch special - two rolls an a miso soup - and two pieces of inari sushi. It took FOREVER for my food to come out. I was there literally for an hour. For lunch. I was the only person there. Sigh.Although the ambiance of the restaurant is a lot nicer, it was still awkwardly silent with no music playing or anything. The owner was very nice and came over to check on me a few times and we chatted, but the no music thing was just weird.The avocado roll was fine, the inari was good, the miso soup was fine (could've used more tofu), but the sweet potato roll was a disaster. If you are going to serve a sweet potato roll in which the sweet potato is not tempura, you need to disclose this fact. Because I've literally never encountered a single sushi restaurant in my 27 years of eating sushi that served a non-tempura sweet potato roll. So... I'm pretty sure they cooked my sweet potato in the toaster oven, and it was still quite raw (yuck!), and still had a bunch of the really tough skin on it. It was barely edible...and only because I was ***starving***.In all, including tip, my bill came to $19, including a $2 charge for green tea (huh?). For lunch. For one. For mediocre sushi. Ridiculous.

8.description: This place opens at 2 on Sundays, and that means exactly at 2. Not 1:55, not 1:58, 2. And because it opens right at 2, and is completely dark until 2, if you get here at 2, you'll have to wait a very long time for your food as it only has two people working, a server, and a chef. And before the server gets there, the chef has to be a server too, although we seated and served ourselves in the beginning. Do yourself a favor and get here at 3 or 4 instead.Once we finally got our food, the rolls were flavorful and I enjoyed them, but I've had a better -and bigger- Dragon, especially for the price. The Sunshine was quite unique- warm and almost with a BBQ sauce on top? If not for the groupon, I wouldn't have come here, and I will likely not return with so many sushi options around town.

31.description: I like their sushi, but they did not have a ton of variety. I liked the atmosphere, very modern and they played current hip hop music. We were 1 or 2 couples there, and the service was still a bit slow. I probably would not go back since I live further away, but if you live in the area it is worth going. It's BYOB and there is a store that sells liquor next door. If you have a lot to drink.. the service may not seem as slow.

34.description: Fresh sushi and very friendly service.  Their signature roles were delicious!!  Definitely added this place to my rotation.

16.description: It was just us in there when we went.  Restaurant was clean.  The sushi was fresh and tasty.  We also tried the Yaki Soba which too was really good.For dessert we had the banana tempura.  Also good --- It's not too sweet.

13.description: I was pretty shocked that this place was really good! The prices were really decent and the food was delicious. It might not look super fancy, especially from the outside, but I care more about food than ambiance and it's nice enough to cover both categories.

11.description: Worst delivery ever. So bad. Don't do it. Trust me. I moved from nyc, have patience and this place is not good. Order elsewhere. Called and drive was "lost". Manager needs to get "lost". Owner should be ashamed. Your product defines you. You...lose.

39.description: Really great ambience, great service, great sushi! The staff was extremely kind and approachable. Outdoor seating available and bathroom really clean (I know that's weird but it's important to me as I feel it's a reflection of a business). The owner, Sarah is extremely personable and she made my friends and I feel very welcome. Will definitely come back!

37.description: I had read a lot of positive reviews online comparing this place to Butterfly Sushi, also located on Grand Avenue, and people said they liked this better, so my husband and I decided to give it a try. We ordered 3 signature rolls, a spicy tuna roll, salmon sashimi and the veggie egg rolls(which we did not understand why they were drenched in sauce, that was tasty, bit WAY too much). All of our signature rolls involved spiciness(which the only thing we found "spicy" was the wasabi, which they do not make)and either tuna or salmon. Our usual types of fish that we order when we get sushi. I have to say I am not understanding how anyone could rate this place higher than Butterfly Sushi. We always preferred Coast on Damen, which we still consider good quality and flavor, but Butterfly is by far the best all around in our opinion. I am basing this off our experience at the Butterfly location on Grand... I cannot speak, as of yet for their other locations. We are very disappointed in the food from EJ, as well as how long it took for our order to arrive. We will never be eating here or ordering from here again. Butterfly is SO much better...don't make the same mistake we did.

0.description: LOVE IT! My girlfriends came for girls night out. BYOB no corkage fee!!!Quick and attentive service, amazing fresh sushi and sashimi !!! LOVED the rolls too.Specially, Green turtle yum!!!Really reasonable too!!! It was awesome : )))

38.description: Came here on an early dinner on a Tuesday night with the boyfriend. We were the only ones there at the time. Sushi took awhile to come out. We were starving! The dynamite roll was absolutely delicious, I'm still craving it. Unagi rolls had little eel and a lot of cucumber. Service was slow. The spicy shrimp roll was good, but had onions in it which I hate and wasn't listed. Boyfriend had the dragon and caterpillar roll, the rolls were small compared to what we've had [we love sushi!], they were fresh though. Free banana desert for check in! Probably wouldn't come back unless in the area.

51.description: I have visited EJ's a few times since they opened after taking over the space from a previous sushi restaurant and I am a huge fan. The fish is always fresh and delicious and the rolls are good sized. They have a good variety of speciality rolls along with the regular selection of other rolls. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.Inside the restaurant has been completely renovated with a new style that is welcoming and cozy. Perfect spot to come and have a few bottles of sake (don't sell it yet but they are applying for a liquor license), and some very tasty sushi. They lost one star just because the times I have been there they have been out of Ponzu sauce (I prefer it over soy sauce for my rolls).Give them a try and you will soon find yourself a new neighborhood sushi spot.

27.description: Very good, fresh and reasonably priced with lots of variety. Lots of smiling faces when you walk in the door.

32.description: I went for lunch here a few weeks ago with a friend and I have to say this is hands down the BEST sushi place I've been to in the city. We started off our lunch with a couple appetizers, we had the gyoza and the shumai which were both delicious. Oh and we had the squid salad, my absolute fave! We got a ton of sushi rolls as well. We did the lunch special and had the shrimp tempura roll, tuna avocado roll and the snow crab roll. I especially liked the snow crab roll. We also had a couple of the signature rolls. The firecracker was recommended to us and it was amazing! But just be careful because it lives up to its name and packs a punch with spice. We also got the Sakura Blossom, this one was killer! I loved it so much! The fact that the whole roll is tempura fried is what really makes it! Sooo good! We ended the meal with Mochi which was given to us so generously. Everything was just soooo good. I can't say enough about the food.The wait staff was also something to rave about. The server was quick and sooo nice. We also met the owner and she is an absolutely outstanding lady. The restaurant's atmosphere is also very charming.All in all, its just a great place to go and relax and enjoy some good food.

48.description: Was a previous regular at Kai, so I was nervous about the new opening. EJ's didn't disappoint! The sushi was fresh and tasty, I had the Spicy Shrimp, Philadelphia, and California rolls. Pretty surface level, but I wanted to make sure they were legit. It's also a nice atmosphere since the Reno- you feel like you're in San Francisco or something lol. Check it out!

44.description: Such good food! I am surprised more people aren't in here on a regular basis. It does take a while for the food but it is definitely worth it. The staff is really nice and they are BYOB.

24.description: Place is delicious. Goes up against yuzu but is more of hidden gem. Will come back often

7.description: Just had lunch at this hidden gem and I am so glad we tried it. I found the restaurant on Groupon and decided to give it a try. The food is fresh and made to order. Nothing tasted like it sat around to be served. Awesome and friendly service!We'll be back very soon for dinner and bring own bottle of wine. This place is BYOB!

49.description: I used to go to Kai Sushi all the time. After going to EJ's, I'm infinitely sadder that Kai Sushi is gone. I ordered the Sake Don. The description says it comes with seasoned rice. The rice in sake don was not seasoned at all. A few sesame seeds sprinkled but no distinct vinegar taste. I also waited over 30 minutes for my takeout to be ready and it was pretty much empty when I was there. With the long wait with the disappointing food, I won't be coming back here.

40.description: I was pretty shocked that this place was really good! The prices were really decent and the food was delicious. It might not look super fancy, especially from the outside, but I care more about food than ambiance and it's nice enough to cover both categories.

30.description: Very good! My BF and I went here last night with another couple, and had a lovely meal. The restaurant is super cute. The decorations and artwork are basically adorable and beautiful. Service was friendly and unobtrusive, which I like. It's BYOB, which is always a good thing. We ordered miso (good, but I've had better; it lacked a depth of flavor) and 6 specialty rolls between the 4 of us. All delicious, and I highly recommend the Green Turtle and Super Crunchy. Definitely will be back. Wasn't very crowded, but hope this place sticks around. I say try it. Cute date night spot. A bit pricey, but not bad.

46.description: While the staff is friendly and the food is decent they are totally incapable of preparing a a pick up order in a timely manner.  I will not be ordering pick up ever again.They are constantly at least 20 mins. longer than quoted.  It almost as if they don't start making it till you show up and pay.  I've mentioned it multiple times, only to be told 'we had a big order, so sorry, it will never happen again.'Now it will not because I'm not ordering anymore.If you live in area and are looking for a decent BYOB sushi spot it does the trick, for dine in only.  If you are picking up be prepared to wait a while or give them a 30 min cushion to get your stuff ready.  Nothing like letting your sushi warm up a little on the box while you wait.

1.description: I did Mongolian food take out. Food did not taste as much as I was expecting, please try to use fresh meat and no cheap meat.I am just disappointed for wasting my 10$ like this.

9.description: Ordered a couple rolls to pick-up. Fresh and tasty.We ordered the caterpillar and the dynamite rolls.The caterpillar had the right amount of crunch with the cucumber and smooth creaminess of the avocado.The dynamite has a kick -- too spicy for my bf -- but perfect for me. The shrimp tempura in the roll was still crunchy when we ate it.My bf said he hasn't seen too many people inside whenever he's passed by, so I thought it was unexpectedly good given that info. I figured either the freshness or taste would be compromised, but neither were lacking. Yummy neighborhood restaurant. Since it's BYOB, I think I'll stop by again and more often.

26.description: Just had lunch at this hidden gem and I am so glad we tried it. I found the restaurant on Groupon and decided to give it a try. The food is fresh and made to order. Nothing tasted like it sat around to be served. Awesome and friendly service!We'll be back very soon for dinner and bring own bottle of wine. This place is BYOB!

25.description: We came to this place  by a Groupon and I am glad we did!  Dinner was delightful and the decor is cute. We had the Mexican roll, extra crispy roll and sunshine roll. All were delish. Prices reasonable. Highly recommended. BYOB is an added bonus. Next time we order sushi it will be from here.

12.description: We came here for lunch during the work week and it was empty. There is a reason for that. We ordered bento boxes and they were no bueno. It was probably the worst tempura I've ever had. The batter was thick and very heavy and it was served room temperature. My boyfriend couldn't even eat it. The terriyaki sauce was watered down and mediocre. To top it off, service was extremely slow (serving no one?) and we were late getting back to work. Never going here again.

21.description: I loved the food but was disappointed with the customer service. My boyfriend and I bought a groupon for this restaurant two weeks ago with the hope to use it on Valentine's Day. When we arrived there was no one to greet us so the chef came forward and sat us at a table. We asked him if paying  with the groupon would be ok and he said yes. I checked in on yelp and noticed that we had access to a free dessert so I ordered it. At the end of our meal I told the waitress that we were paying with a groupon and said that she couldn't combine the yelp deal and the groupon.. She then went on to say that she wasn't accepting the groupon because it was Valentine's Day. I explained to her that the chef had approved it beforehand. After lots of negotiating she decided to accept the groupon and charge me for the dessert... Super lame. Anyways, I hope this helps anyone deciding whether or not to go tonight. Lol :/

17.description: I eat here because it's the closest place that serves Ramen close to my apartment. It's good, not great. If it's not in walking distance, it's not worth getting.

10.description: My new fave chi sushi spot. Fresh, byob, not a lot of rice on their maki, and great value.  Get the firecracker (seared salmon on top, seared anything ... yum) and the mexican roll.  Basic maki ~$6, special maki ~$11.  Yummmmm.

5.description: This place is amazing! Great prices, amazing quality food and a phenomenal waitress. I can't remember her name right now, but she was fantastic. The ambiance is relaxing and intimate. This restaurant is BYOB with an excellent liquor store right next store. Try this place out, you won't be sorry.

3.description: Neighborhood place.  No trek necessary.  Ordinary menu.  Lunch specials and Bento Box are better value.Dine-in customers get cucumber salad and orange for dessert.WHITE SWAN ROLL ($12.95) -- a tad heavy on sauce.  I thought it was good value due to ingredients Soft shell crab, cucumber, topped escolar, and jalapeno mayo sauce.SASHIMI (2 pcs per order) -- decent thickness, quality and portion.SERVICE and VENUE -- clean and decent.

35.description: I had a groupon here, and I ordered 3 rolls for the lunch special(salmon roll, eel roll, and Philadelphia roll), and my signature rolls were; caterpillar roll, dragon roll, and some other roll I can't remember. It was a weekday so they only has 1 chef, 1 server at the restaurant. The food is good, and the price is decent with the groupon. The presentation is also very nice and the restaurant itself is beautiful. I also got a free mochi ice cream desert with an orange, but the mochi tasted like it went bad, or that it melted and then refroze.There is free street parking available, and the service was good, but very unprofessional. If I needed something I would have to get her attention, which is fine by me, as I know servers can't read my mind, but My server was literally on her tablet watching some kind of show or something, but I don't blame her as I was te only customer there and did not see anyone else come in except for 1 take out order the whole 1.5 hours I was there for. I have still yet to find a sushi restaurant that can satisfy me in taste and curb my hunger for about 20$ that is not AYCE.

19.description: My boyfriend and I have been in here twice already and we definitely will be back for more! He loves sushi and i'm new to it so I've been slowly introducing myself to it. I always get the bento box and it never dissapoints. The rolls are delicious too! I suggest the firecracker rolls, philadelphia rolls and the jalapeno bombs.

28.description: This place opens at 2 on Sundays, and that means exactly at 2. Not 1:55, not 1:58, 2. And because it opens right at 2, and is completely dark until 2, if you get here at 2, you'll have to wait a very long time for your food as it only has two people working, a server, and a chef. And before the server gets there, the chef has to be a server too, although we seated and served ourselves in the beginning. Do yourself a favor and get here at 3 or 4 instead.Once we finally got our food, the rolls were flavorful and I enjoyed them, but I've had a better -and bigger- Dragon, especially for the price. The Sunshine was quite unique- warm and almost with a BBQ sauce on top? If not for the groupon, I wouldn't have come here, and I will likely not return with so many sushi options around town.

45.description: Our visit to Ej's was wonderful! We had a large party, about 25, who all left full and happy. The staff was very accommodating and fast. Out apetizers and drinks came out as soon as people seated, followed by soup and salad. As for sushi, we got a variaty of rolls and sushi nigiri style  for each table. My favorite has to be the dragon roll and fire cracker roll(can't go wrong with any roll with spicy tune!!)
