For the kids, they had japanese fun drinks, which they went crazy for and udon noodle soups! Overall, everything went very smooth, and everyone in our party left with plans to come back very soon.

33.description: Our new favorite sushi place, great food and very welcoming staff made our visit one to go back for again. Very nice, comfortable decor. Parking was easy. They also have some outdoor seating and are BYOB. You can't go wrong at this place. We will be regulars at EJ on Grand.

43.description: This place is BYOB with no corkage fee! I love the renovation, it's super trendy! Definitely my go-to place for good sushi.Their fish is fresh and love the West Town roll, spicy tuna (actually spicy), and chirashi bowl is out of this town good! This is a hidden gem in the West Loop!

2.description: Great food and service! Our waiter was Zoro and he was very attentive and friendly. We had the Firecracker, Texas and the Super Crunchy rolls and they were all delicious! We topped it off with a very tasty Banana Tempura dessert. Will definitely be back soon!!

18.description: I love this place! Food was delicious and cheap. The firecracker roll is great if you like spicy. The dynamite roll is good too. Definitely coming back. And I also like the decors and the Ikea light

41.description: The food here is fantastic. Reasonably priced and delicious sushi. My friend and I had a lunch special and two other rolls and left this place stuffed! Everything is fresh and beautifully presented. The staff are very skilled and super friendly. Laughs galore with the owner. Definitely stop in if you're in the area. They also have a small spot in the Chicago French Market on Clinton Ave, which is just as good (if not a bit more crowded).

52.description: When EJ's first opened in the beginning of 2014 we were hesitant of trying it out as the sushi place that was there prior just suddenly closed down. We soon found out that there was nothing to be hesitant about. Upon walking in the decoration make the place very welcoming. We were greeted by who we now know is the owner Sarah. She was extremely friendly and recommend some rolls to us. The menu is basically the same as the old sushi place with some additional rolls added. I'm from San Diego where you will find some of the best sushi on every corner so when I moved to Chicago I had a hard time finding decent sushi. I will have to say by far, EJ's is one of my favorite places to go after a long hard day of working at OTG Boot Camp. The price is very good for the quality of sushi you are getting. I would recommend to everyone in the neighbor to go try out EJ's. Once the weather warms up they will have outside seating as well. (I can't wait) BYOB as well!

50.description: Hey! You should check this place out, we did and it was very tasty! Started out with the cucumber salad, which had a great soy dressing and it was a large enough portion to share, was expecting a dinky bowl with cucumbers but they do this up right. Edamamae on the side were great too, spurring a conversation that yes, it is possible to ruin Edamame. We split three rolls between the two of us and can only say that they were very tasty, the fish was absolutely fresh and good presentation. We visited on a Friday night, expecting there to be more folks (we were the only ones!) and I hope to see business pick-up because it's good sushi for a reasonable price, and gotta love that BYOB! Definitely been added to the list of delivery for sure.

4.description: Excellent sushi, low-key place, AMAZING banana dessert. Highly recommend  :)

6.description: Good place for lunch and dinner friendly staff.

22.description: Waited over an hour for delivery at 2pm for only 2 people. Seriously?  Made it so we couldn't eat before leaving the city for the airport. I would have had Yuzu but they were closed for 2 days to move.

15.description: My shumai and sashimi to go left me sad and hungry. For $30.26 I would have expected at least average fare...

20.description: some of the best sushi I've tasted. will definitely return. nice place, friendly owner. great presentation. I went for lunch, and can't wait to return for dinner.... Not today, though

36.description: Your typical sushi place...only one other table eating while we stopped by during a weekday. The sushi was good. Probably won't be back, as I was just passing by and needed lunch.

14.description: I had an amazing scallop, crab, tempura shrimp roll! I would just come back for that! Cute place and it's  byob!

58.description: The staff was quite rude, from the moment we got there til the time we left. I heard such great things about the place from friends, and it was true as far as the food is concerned. However our interactions with staff lessened the experience. For example, when trying to get a table, the hostess said "I need you to be gone by xyz time because I need the table." For another example, the waitress was very rude in her interactions with our table. We asked her for 3 of a certain item and they only brought 2, she said we only asked for 2. From that point on she was even more rude. Not sure if I will ever go back to this place.

56.description: Went out for a friends engagement party and although the inside is gorgeous trying to find Parkin is like finding a needle in a haystack. Service was average (got what I need after I got her attention) I think the buss boy was more attentive than the server.  Ordered the  crab dip and a burger. The crab dip was delicious although it came out separate and got dropped off at the wrong table. The burger was pretty descent and I would order it again plus it was cooked correctly which is always a plus. Only problem with that is that it wasn't cut in half which wouldn't have been a problem if I wasn't sharing it and if it didn't already say all sandwiches were cut in half on the menu. Ooo yea and that they didnt have mustard?!?!? All in all I would recommend this place for a casual gathering with friends. Ps. What Chicago bar doesn't carry mustard? This one...

29.description: This is one of my favorite places to go for drinks (picklebacks!) and food.  It's one of our favorite places to meet for drink and I don't know why I never left a review until now.We were there this past weekend and our bartender recommended we try a different drink, tequila shot and chase it with one of their chasers.  It was made of pineapple juice, jalapeno, cilantro I think lime.  It was so good!  They have amazing cocktails and varieties of interesting meat in their menu.I'll probably be there again this weekend.

42.description: I made reservations at 11:30pm and came a tad bit late at 11:32pm and was told the kitchen was closed even with being informed the kitchen closes at 11:45pm. Suggestion: maybe not take reservations at 11:30pm and make me drive there only to be turned down. Your last reservation should be at 11:15. Thanks Frontier for ruining my night.

23.description: This was our second visit & I can say I wasn't as blown away this time around. Our first visit consisted of deviled eggs & duck tacos. Both were amazing & full of flavor! This time around we had the lollipop wings and lobster mac and cheese. The wings were good but the breading was sooooo crispy. Almost "break a tooth" crispy if you know what I mean. The flavor was pretty good though, so I'd probably order them again. The lobster mac and cheese was okay.. Nothing really to write home about. Service is friendly & the atmosphere is cool. Maybe we'll come back for a whole pig...

47.description: I did not eat at Frontier, but only went for drinks at the bar with some friends. The ambiance is nice (they have a great patio), the food looks really good, and drinks are ok. So why 2 stars? As pointed out by several other reviewers, the staff is impolite and aggressive beyond imagination.  Despite the place wasn't particularly crowded, asking for drinks was as frustrating as asking for information at the worst DMV. Bartenders serve you as if they are making you a huge personal favor, and interact with customers as if they were home intruders. Make no mistake,I am not lighthearted: I understand that some gruffness is to be expected in popular bars, but what we experienced at Frontier was a whole new level. As a final treat, when we asked for the check one of the bartenders charged me twice, once for the whole bill, well above $100, and once for my part. Mistakes happen, no big deal, but the bartender handled the situation with a derisive attitude, and as if it was cheap for me to pay attention to the bill(s). As of today, both transactions are still displaying on my bank account. I am intrigued by the food, but I will definitely order to go.

8.description: My Ahi Tuna sandwich, with a side of rosemary fries, is pissed at me for giving Frontier 2 stars right now. My sandwich and fries know they are good. They know they filled me up. My sandwich knows that the crispy bread, wasabi mayo, and perfectly seared tuna is an amazing brunch option. My fries know they can stand up to any other fries and defeat them in a taste test competition. The entire menu - which apparently appears to offer whole animal servicing for parties as well as offers individual meals focused around omnivore tastes - knows they have something unique to offer customers who like their meals on the savory side. Actually the entire inside of the restaurant, with it's rugged, rustic, refurbished, look of an old saloon is mad that that they are getting 2 stars. They are all mad at the music. Stupid music. It's always on so loud. No one can hear each other. The music itself is fine. Bob Marley at brunch on a Sunday - yeah, that sounds great, actually! But Frontier takes it one step further- Bob Marley over brunch at the decimal level set for a club on Saturday night? Do you like yelling over to the person across from you while you are trying to conversate? How about just sitting there on your phone because you gave up trying to talk to the person you came with because no one can hear each other. Saldy that's what happened to me at brunch on Sunday. So that's why my Ahi Tuna sandwich and the rustic decor are mad at the music right now. The loud music turned off another person who would have otherwise, loved their experience.

31.description: The wait staff was phenomenal! Our waitress Stephanie was really awesome!!!! She was fun and energetic, and even took a picture of our group. The alligator was delicious, and the beer menu was on point! I recommend the not your fathers root beer!The only thing keeping me from giving a 5 star is the bartender. there is this Asian woman who was bartending who felt that her she could be a complete bitch to everyone. I asked for change for a $50 to be able to tip my waitress, and the bartender gave me a rude look (rolled her eyes) and slammed the money on the counter, with no smile or anything. Had she actually been nice about my asking for change, I may have ordered a drink. So I recommend this place as long as you avoid the Asian woman bartender with standing bitch face (unless you are looking to give no tip, then by all means....)

34.description: We arrived here around 4:45 on a Friday afternoon after hearing about their $1 oyster happy hour from 4-6 and we had heard about some beer specials as well. Unfortunately they weren't serving any draft beers for some reason--our waitress was trying to explain it but said it had something to do with the heat? We were pretty bummed but I tried the frozen cocktail "Rodeo Sweetheart" instead, which was surprisingly strong and tasty and perfect for the 90 degree July weather. We started with 6 raw oysters, which were HUGE, fresh and ice cold. They're served with horseradish, cocktail sauce, and Tabasco, but strangely NO crackers? Sure if they're good oysters you don't need crackers, but sometimes when you're hungry they're good to have! We were treated to a rude "no" when we asked for them so we shrugged our shoulders and slurped them down alone. We also ordered the roasted cauliflower which was colorful and amazing. It was hot but so good I didn't mind burning my lips and tongue to taste the sauce it was roasted in. My boyfriend got the pulled boar sandwich which was enormous and served with lots of sauce on a pretzel bun. Super delicious. His fries were good too. I ordered the beef cheek tacos which I loved but they were soooo small. I mean like half the size of street tacos. Still good but don't expect them to fill you up. Kinda underwhelmed by this place honestly but I'd probably come back for the oysters!

16.description: Oh Frontier. Once a year when I've forgotten about you past mistakes, you sound like a good idea, but then you end up being a pain in the ass. You have some of the most uncomfortable tables and seating I've ever encountered in a sit-down restaurant/cocktail bar. And yes, like it or not, you are a cocktail bar- a whole menu of $12 specialty cocktails, $10 "classics", and a $7 specialty shot? But you've got two bartenders for the whole place on a Saturday and the one didn't know how to make a hot toddy (a special on the menu, by the way). You make tea.Shepherd's pie was amazing, french fries so crispy, burger sad and overcooked. You're a meat place for god's sake! Slow indifferent service at the bar killed the night though. The restaurant wasn't even full. We were one of the first groups at the bar. Other reviews are right- nobody cares.

13.description: Wow I can't believe I've been living in Chicago for close to 20 years and this is the first time I discovered this place it's amazing very amazing set up I especially love the Crocodile meat as well as the whole cooked pig that we ordered for our party this is the second time in my life that I've seen a whole pig gets roasting in front of me very delicious  I even are the  eyeBall yummy

11.description: I think I'll have to return with a larger group to better enjoy Frontier.Came here on a slow Monday night and found that for a group of 4, this was not going to cut it. We decided to cut our losses and go elsewhere.There was plenty on the menu that we would have ordered even with the high price to portion ratio, but they were either sold out (7pm on a Monday, ya'll) or waiting on a shipment. Fine. The crispy rabbit livers were probably the only thing we could rave about. The alligator legs seemed to be more of a novelty than a real dish, and although we enjoyed the brisket (+those sweetbreads!) it was just such a small dish. The veggie dishes are, well, simply that.The real problem may have been the advice of our waitress - "Just get 4-5 dishes to share, it will be enough." Wrong. Expectations make everything, and here, it ruined our dinner; it took some time for each dish to come out, so had we known earlier, we would have ordered more.For a slow night, our waitress made way too many awkward glances at our table, not to ask if we wanted to order more, or to suggest something else... But to give us the check as quickly as possible.I still really want to love Frontier - the concept is great - but maybe with a larger group (who doesn't want to split a whole animal?) and a different waitress.

39.description: Tapa family style dishes did not disappoint ; an a la wicker park's version of avec - anything with duck and bacon did not disappoint. Alligator thatDuck taco this Crispy Wings Duck bacon sausagePecadew Peppers My new favorite

37.description: First, and most important for many - this is a bar. You show your ID and it's very loud (obviously, on busy nights).Service was very attentive - a solid A. Maybe my expectations were too high, but the food was okay, but inconsistent. Bourbon Chicken (meh - didn't even finish it)Lamb chorizo; okay but not special. tasted like sausage. Alligator sausage; sorry, but don't understand the fuss about alligator - rather blandCrab-dip; forgettable and chips were so salty they were inedible by some at my tablePulled Boar; what you'd expectDuck tacos; okayMac and cheese - best thing on the table.Fried Chicken sandwich; stole the show!That said, I'm glad i went. It wasn't a bad experience. And while I'm not the full-animal service person, I think that would add HUGELY to the experience for those that are.

0.description: My husband and I heard about this restaurant on Check Please and really wanted to try it out so we went with some friends on a double date last night. Our waitress was friendly and quick. The tables were all pretty close together and if the people behind you weren't sitting as close to their table as possible then you'd have a hard time getting into your seat.Our waitress suggested that because we were first timers, we should all pick 1-2 dishes and split them as they came out. We decided to go with that and I was surprised that the dishes weren't larger to accommodate four people. Some of the things that came out had less than four items on the plate so we all had to kind of cut everything in half and get a bite here and there. It wasn't the worst experience and in the end I was able to get enough to eat. I just feel that if they are going to suggest sharing, it should be served for sharing. I like this restaurant because I was able to try a lot of new things that aren't as common at other places like elk sausage and alligator. I have to say that the duck tacos and elk sausage were my absolute favorites. Very flavorful and definitely something to come back for. I would also like to try ordering a whole pig sometime if we ever have a large party. The women's bathroom is terrible though. The stall doors are very high off the ground and very, very close to the toilet. My knees were almost touching the door when I closed it and the bottom of the door was almost up to my lap. It was a very uncomfortable situation and I don't recommend using the bathroom. The valet was also not that great. We arrived at 6pm on a Saturday night and there was absolutely no street parking around the whole block. There was only one person working the valet so we had to wait almost 25 minutes for our car to leave.

38.description: Food is ridiculously delicious. Oysters and lamb chorizo were fantastic. Service and atmosphere are great.

51.description: I live around the corner and no matter what every single time I am ignored and service is non existent. I am walking out right now because I came for the happy hour special and my order was not even started to avoid having to honor it. It's so great they have positive reviews but I am tired of being treated like a third class citizen. If it's appearance then shame on you if it's more than that figure it out and fix it.

27.description: One of my first bad reviews! Walking around with a friend who had just gotten take out Thai food we decided we wanted a drink before heading home. We asked the host, who was very nice, if we could bring her takeout inside. She said yes otherwise we would have headed home. We were seated and waiting about 10 minutes before being greeted which feels like an eternity.  We watched as the busser told the flock of servers we had been waiting, and to my surprise no one rushed over. We order food and drinks and later my friend is approached saying she can't eat her food that she brought in. We told the server that we were told it was okay. If the host hadn't told us yes, they wouldn't have had our business in the first place. The server or manager I can't tell, was very short with us and spent a lot of time with the other tables. Food was tasty but expensive and portion size incredibly underwhelming. After being a server for 8 years I feel I know how to dine out, tip and behave, but my expectations were not even close to being met.

32.description: Duck tacos were delicious and decent beer. Went back for dollar oysters and the waitress never told us that the oysters on the menu didn't qualify. The $140 bill (we ordered drinks) was quite the surprise. I actually like the place but will probably never go back

54.description: We went there for a friends graduation party last Saturday. My friend had planned for the whole pig service with the sides and such.It was a lovely experience; the waitress was attentive, even with the Blackhawks game on and all of the commotion that comes with it. We even had some little people with us and they were super accommodating with that! Food was great, drinks were cold, company was awesome and our Blackhawks won. All in all, it was a successful night!

48.description: Decided to check out Frontier since I love meat and the menu features a vast array of gamey meats (boar, alligator, venison...), however, I opted for the ahi-tuna sandwhich instead of the boar sandwhich! Simply put, yum, yum, yum! The ahi-tuna coupled with the wasabi mayo and the toasted shallots on sourdough make for a very scrumptious experience! The rosemary fries were a bit salty and barely had any hint of rosemary. Had the deviled eggs as an app and those were very tasty. My drink was very delightful as well- can't remember the name of it but gin, ginger beer, lime juice and rose liquor blended together very well. I'll def. be returning to check out other menu items. Waitress was great along with other staff minus the hostess whom wasn't too friendly and had a slight arrogant attitude. They need to get a new hostess, as the first impression of the restaurant, bad idea to have someone with an unpleasant demeanor be the initial representation of your establishment.

44.description: I was really excited to try this place because of all their cool menu options, so we headed there one night. The restaurant itself was a great space, they had an outdoor eating area and an enclosed outdoor patio with a fireplace. The outdoor area looked like picnic benches. We ordered the peppadew peppers as an appetizer which I loved. The duck bacon was delicious. For dinner, we got the alligator sausage, the turtle bolognese, and the bourbon chicken. The sausage was cooked perfectly and had a great taste to it. We weren't too fond of the turtle bolognese - turtle doesn't have too much flavor and it turned out the dish was more like a small salad with just the tiniest bits of meat. The highlight of the meal for me was the chicken. While the chicken itself was a little dry (but overall pretty good) the sauce was amazing. The bourbon chicken also is served in bigger portions than a lot of the rest of the entrees. Price wise, it's not super cheap but if you're feeling a little more adventurous, it may be worth it.

24.description: Craft beers aplenty, cocktails with an assortment of adult liqueur, and some flawlessly constructed meat-inspired medleys with original takes on classic dishes. Lollipop chicken wings arrived to the table hot and crispy, perfectly paired with a savory drizzle of Bleu cheese and buffalo sauce. Lobster mac n' cheese didn't quite rise to the occasion, but a respectable effort nonetheless. Not nearly enough lobster or cheese (IMO) to qualify for the namesake, but the creamy shells and burnt cheese crust satisfied. Char-grilled parmesan oysters and deviled eggs are, dare I say, an absolute must.  Aside from lumberjack portions and flannel fleecewear, the Frontier undoubtedly fulfills its Western motif. Dimly lit, practically adorned exclusively in wood, taxidermied range stock every few feet, and the option to order whole animals with advanced notice are just a few of the seemingly effortless effects that prompted our return visit. A low key hangout boasting locally brewed libations and creative fare...what more could one ask for? (Maybe a break on the bill at the end of service?) - It can get pricey...almost overpricey...

7.description: Well THAT was entertaining.We happened to find ourselves here during a Saints football game and this place was rockin'. If you haven't read from other people's reviews, this place is a nice slice of NOLA. While hitting the beignets and hurricanes, we got some first-rate entertainment from a brass band. And the brass band was only half the entertainment. Just watching the Saints fans was nearly enough to pay the price of admission. They were having a great time.The servers were also attentive, quick, and friendly and the food was good. For the full experience I would definitely check this place out for a Saints' game, but the food and service that we had made it a place that I'd come back to.

49.description: My Ahi Tuna sandwich, with a side of rosemary fries, is pissed at me for giving Frontier 2 stars right now. My sandwich and fries know they are good. They know they filled me up. My sandwich knows that the crispy bread, wasabi mayo, and perfectly seared tuna is an amazing brunch option. My fries know they can stand up to any other fries and defeat them in a taste test competition. The entire menu - which apparently appears to offer whole animal servicing for parties as well as offers individual meals focused around omnivore tastes - knows they have something unique to offer customers who like their meals on the savory side. Actually the entire inside of the restaurant, with it's rugged, rustic, refurbished, look of an old saloon is mad that that they are getting 2 stars. They are all mad at the music. Stupid music. It's always on so loud. No one can hear each other. The music itself is fine. Bob Marley at brunch on a Sunday - yeah, that sounds great, actually! But Frontier takes it one step further- Bob Marley over brunch at the decimal level set for a club on Saturday night? Do you like yelling over to the person across from you while you are trying to conversate? How about just sitting there on your phone because you gave up trying to talk to the person you came with because no one can hear each other. Saldy that's what happened to me at brunch on Sunday. So that's why my Ahi Tuna sandwich and the rustic decor are mad at the music right now. The loud music turned off another person who would have otherwise, loved their experience.

40.description: Went here last night (Monday night) for $1 oysters. That was definitely the best part of our experience. After taking our drink order (myself & my friend both ordered a glass of wine), we did not see our waitress for a good 15 minutes. This was okay at first since we were enjoying catching up, however our drinks did not come at all during this time. Two glasses of wine for two guests in an empty restaurant.We put in our orders for the oysters and received these in a timely fashion. However, after completing the oysters we decided we were still hungry and wanted to order more off the menu. So there we waited, empty wine glasses empty plates, for our waitress to come over and acknowledge we may want more food. The worst part was getting our check. Our table was cleaned and cleared for a substantial amount of time before our waitress came over to see if we wanted our check. Once receiving the bill, we placed our credit cards inside and both had time to separately use the restroom and drink an entire glass of water before she returned to pick up the cards to run. We actually had to physically get her attention to come over to our table.The $1 oysters do not make up for the subpar service and while the other food was enjoyable (mac & cheese and the crab dip) it was not worth the wait.I will not be dining here again.

53.description: Like I said in my past review i'd be back for the food.  Well I came back with an appetite because we ended up doing a whole lamb that feeds 16!  Get 16 of your friends and do this.  It was worth every penny.  The service was excellent, the food was perfect and we got our own upstairs area all to ourselves!The guy with the knife also cut up the awesome parts for us.  IE  heart, liver, eye, tongue, brain!  Was delicious!  The lamb itself was so juicy and not as gamy as I thought it would be!A must for all lamb lovers.  They also have goat, alligator, and pig!  Gotta go back for those....

30.description: Came in on Sunday around 1:30. Lovely day, but all the doors were propped open and the a/c was on full-blast inside. Why? My friend and I moved tables because the tiny bar table where we were sat was directly in line with the full-blast a/c.  The wait person was friendly and pleasant. The food, though... I ordered the $12 Ham and cheese sandwich, and everything on my plate was super salty. Salty ham and cheese? Ok, that's understandable. But otherwise, the sandwich, which looked tasty, had almost no other flavor. Very bland. The rosemary fries were not just a little over salted, but ridiculously so. The red eye gravy, which is really a meaty soup on the side, was also super salty. My friend had a burger. We both agreed that the meat itself was good, but everything else was really tasteless. His fries were also ridiculously over salted.There are hundreds of other places in Chicago where I can have a mediocre-to-poor burger or ham and cheese that don't over salt and don't charge $12 (and don't have wide open-door with full-blast a/c when it's 78 degrees outside. I won't be back.

46.description: I've been here twice now. The menu has a lot of unique options, and it inspired me to try alligator for the first time. Both times, the waitress emphasized that the plates are shareable, but I think they're a little high in price for a two-person party to try more than 3. The fella (who wasn't terribly hungry) and I got a few oysters, the deviled eggs ($4 for an order of 3, definitely worth it), and then we each picked our own main dish. It was a little awkward, because his pulled boar sandwich & fries came out well before my alligator scallopini (the waitress explained that items would come out whenever they were ready, so it was expected). I tried a bite of his sandwich, which was delicious, but I don't know that a super messy BBQ sandwich is actually "shareable." Also, the two-top tables are tiny if they really want to make shareable happen. The cocktails are awesome.The outdoor space looks great, but we haven't been able to sit outside yet.Unfortunately, the air conditioning was out of control. It wasn't that hot outside at all, but the air was cranked and I spent the entire meal shivering, even though I had a sweater. By the end, I just wanted to go outside and warm up. If it wasn't so uncomfortable, we would have stayed for another cocktail, but we decided to go elsewhere.

1.description: Wondering where to take your obnoxious group of 35 hungry friends? Frontier is the place to go. We ordered an XL pig and loved everything about the event.The staff was helpful and responsive in the days leading up to the event in answering all our questions.Arriving to the location they had everything ready for us and our large group was comfortably set up and seated.They placed the pig in from and gave us time to take pictures.The staff was courteous and allowed us to open tabs for each person for all the drinks.The pig itself was amazing! Juicy, flavorful, a little fatty (but our guy was a porker). Sides were great, especially the Mac and cheese. I actually loved the salad oddly enough.This was great time over all, a unique experience to get over the mundane repetitive nature of other restaurants.

55.description: Would not visit again. The bartenders were very slow is taking our order at the bar and didn't come back to check on us after we were done with our drinks. The female bartender completely ignored us but happily helped the white guy next to us. When we tried to get her attention she said just a minute and then purposely didn't come back to us even though she was right in front of us and not that busy. It took over 15 minutes for us to pay our bill. We could have walked out and they would not have noticed. Horrible service. Will not be returning.

9.description: We went here for a Saints game and had an absolute blast.  Even if you are not a saints fan, you should come to watch a game and enjoy the crowd.  They had a great jazz band playing that interacts with the crowd.  Their outdoor patio was great even on a cool fall day.  The outdoor fireplace was a great added touch.  It was fun being outside, listening to the band, while also watching the bad.The prices are so reasonable and it was great New Orleans style food.  For as busy as they were service was great.  It is first come first serve for most the bar but we were able to get a table.  I suggest getting there early if you have a group.We had the deviled eggs and shrimp po boy.  Both were very good.  We saw several other dishes go out to other tables that looked good too.  If you are a Saints fan then this place is a must--everyone else it is a great place to try something new!

26.description: I had a reunion party at this venue with approx 40 people, and it was an excellent experience from start to finish. The space was perfect (the beer garden) and the service was great. I want to give a special thanks to Emily, the event coordinator, for her friendly demeanor, professionalism and responsiveness. I would definitely have an event here again.  Frontier, Emily is a gem! Thanks again for helping making our event a success!

25.description: My boyfriend and I went to Frontier for a date night recently and had a wonderful experience!  Since where we were going was a surprise, I had no idea what to expect and came to Frontier never having heard of the restaurant or looking at the menu.  Pulling up to Frontier we were greeted with a large sign surrounded by bright lights which made the restaurant extremely easy to spot and made me excited to get inside! Once we entered, the atmosphere at Frontier was bumping! We went on a Saturday night and there were several large parties and lots of people at the bar, which did make the noise level a little loud (not exactly the quiet date atmosphere we were looking for) BUT we still had a fabulous time.  Frontier's ambiance is fun, hip and has an earthy feel with an attached beer garden with trees, candles on the tables and there were even antler chandeliers! I felt as if I was dinning in Montana or Alaska, but trendier than something you would typically find out west, plus the exposed brick and swanky bar still gave Frontier a city feel.  The food at Frontier is definitely more wild and gamey than most other restaurants in Chicago, which made it interesting to study the menu and glance at all sorts of large animal entrees as they passed by our table.  I'm not one to step too far outside of my comfort zone but I figured "when in Rome..." We started off with the Turtle Bolognese then ordered the Cauliflower side and the Lobster Mac n Cheese. Frontier's entrees are meant for sharing and come out as they are made, so we ordered each dish throughout our meal as we sipped on our cocktails which were delicious! The Turtle Bolognese was far better than I had nervously anticipated, it didn't taste too wild (was similar to ground beef) and we got lots of turtle meat!  In fact there wasn't any noodles served with our dish, like it said there would be on the menu; however we still were pleasantly surprised by the meal.  The cauliflower side was delicious and served with almonds and had a citrus taste, it was the perfect side to share with 2 people in-between courses.  The lobster mac and cheese was phenomenal!  We loved the crispy cheesy top and the fact that they added generous portions of bacon in the pasta.  However, there wasn't much actual lobster in the mac and cheese but the bacon helped make up for the lack of lobster.  Sharing two entrees and one side was the perfect amount of food for the two of us, while sipping cocktails.  Finally, the service at Frontier was great. Our waitress was friendly and helped me pronounce my French drink without sounding condescending!  Most of the servers at Frontier had the the hipster, exposed tattoo, piercings and chill vibe which I don't mind.  In fact, it's nice because no one there was checking in too much or pushing us to order more.  They clean up quickly and run food out as it's ready, no sitting and waiting under heat lamps.  Ultimately, I had a fantastic time dinning at Frontier and will be back with friends.  Definitely a good place for a couples night or group dinner! Plus, there are still traditional sides and vegetarian options, if you're not one to try unique meats!

12.description: Yummy...Yummy...Yum O!  Sat out on their covered patio on a pouring rain Sunday for brunch and had the delicious Ostrich Juicy Lucy.  So here's my one compliant.... it's not a juicy lucy.  Minnesotans will know what I'm talking about here and since lived there for a few years I now also consider myself a juicy lucy expert.  Anyhow...the burger is fantastic.  The ostrich burgers of which there are two were fantastic and melted between them was the Gouda which is where I'm guessing they think they can call it a juicy lucy.  still no... but I degrees.  Add in some leeks and a nice mayo with a some nice kick to it and you have yourself a winning burger.  Get it. All three of us got it and loved it.  And one of them only eats meats a few times a year so that's saying something!

59.description: We had a large party (15 people) for the whole pig dinner and reserved half of the upstairs party room.  The room is nice for groups because the downstairs restaurant is seriously LOUD!  The room was set up for us with a small sitting area and two tables.  We had only one waitress for our group and though she was very helpful, there were some service issues.The whole pig dinner is the reason we came here.  This is a small pig that is smoked and then roasted.  It's presented table-side steaming hot and is carved for all to behold.  It's an impressive thing to see.  The meat was super tender and juicy, with just a hint of smoke.  Truly delicious.  It's served with a mild horseradish mayonnaise and a sweet BBQ sauce.  The only downside of this method of cooking is the skin is not edible - it becomes hard as leather.  They advise against eating it.  As a bonus, they boxed up all the bones and leftovers! After the pig is carved and served, they make a platter of pig head parts for the adventurous to eat.  This included the ears, snout, brain, eyeballs, cheek, jowl and tongue.  Actually the ears and snout are inedible for the same reason that the skin cannot be eaten.  However, the other pig head parts are really tasty especially the cheek and jowls.  The platter is served with two shots of Jameson's whiskey - those are for the brave souls who eat the eyeballs.When you order the pig you get some sides - mac & cheese, succotash, Caesar salad and cornbread.  The mac & cheese is impressive, served in a cast-iron cauldron-like pot, bubbling hot and caramelized on the top.  Very tasty.  The succotash is pretty and pretty good too.  The Caesar salad is definitely polarizing - the dressing has horseradish in it and the croutons are huge fried corn bread things - I thought the salad was very good but others were put off by the horseradish and some did not like the croutons.  The cornbread was just ok.We ordered some additional items as well.  They have this stuffed pepper appetizer that is awesome.  These are small red peppers that are stuffed with dates and cheese and then wrapped in bacon.  OMG these were tasty little bites!  The chargrilled oysters were also delicious but some of them were quite small.For dessert we tried the pineapple upside-down cake which was perfectly gooey and caramelized.  The turtle s'mores dessert was also delicious - how did they get that marshmallow layer so light?There's a really nice cocktail list and an impressive list of whiskeys, tequilas and craft beers.  The wine selection is very limited but at least it's inexpensive.This is a great place for a group party and the whole animal service is definitely a "WOW" thing.

21.description: Bumping it up to 5 stars because I love everything about this place. I attended their Shrimp Boil and Oktoberfest party and it was wonderful, excellent food and environment. There are no restrictions to the culinary magnificence that is Frontier Chicago. And while I haven't tasted everything on the menu yet, I have full faith in the abilities and creativity of chef Brian Jupiter. I look forward to attending many more events and classes at Frontier and I will be back for some many more brunches, devouring ever biscuit sandwich.  Everyone searches high and low for a restaurant that they can call "My place," and I have found that in Frontier.

17.description: My review for Frontier is long overdue for good reason. I had previously only visited the establishment after reserving the top floor bar for large parties/events. From this perspective, I really liked Frontier as an option as they generally offered decent drink packages for a nice space.I finally was able to eat at Frontier last Monday after hearing pretty decent things. I am not sure if they were having an off night, but it was disappointing. The first thing we ordered was wings because of how much people raved about them. When they arrived, they looked pretty appetizing. Too bad the looks were deceiving. They were dry and relatively flavorless. My husband and I split the burger. We asked for it to be cooked medium but it ended up more on the medium rare side. The flavor was ok. We did add the wagyu bacon, and although it was good, I am not sure what sets it apart from other bacon. The dessert was sadly the most disappointing choice of all. I was super excited to finally try the smores. It was cold! It should have been this warm melty ooey gooey chocolate marshmallow deliciousness, but instead the marshmallow was cold and tasted like they attempted to warm it but stopped midway through (in other words, a slight smokey flavor)Overall, it wouldn't be my first choice for food, but I do like the atmosphere and cocktails, so likely will return.

10.description: We arrived here around 4:45 on a Friday afternoon after hearing about their $1 oyster happy hour from 4-6 and we had heard about some beer specials as well. Unfortunately they weren't serving any draft beers for some reason--our waitress was trying to explain it but said it had something to do with the heat? We were pretty bummed but I tried the frozen cocktail "Rodeo Sweetheart" instead, which was surprisingly strong and tasty and perfect for the 90 degree July weather. We started with 6 raw oysters, which were HUGE, fresh and ice cold. They're served with horseradish, cocktail sauce, and Tabasco, but strangely NO crackers? Sure if they're good oysters you don't need crackers, but sometimes when you're hungry they're good to have! We were treated to a rude "no" when we asked for them so we shrugged our shoulders and slurped them down alone. We also ordered the roasted cauliflower which was colorful and amazing. It was hot but so good I didn't mind burning my lips and tongue to taste the sauce it was roasted in. My boyfriend got the pulled boar sandwich which was enormous and served with lots of sauce on a pretzel bun. Super delicious. His fries were good too. I ordered the beef cheek tacos which I loved but they were soooo small. I mean like half the size of street tacos. Still good but don't expect them to fill you up. Kinda underwhelmed by this place honestly but I'd probably come back for the oysters!

5.description: Summary: subpar food, beware of overcharging credit card Went to brunch with a group of friends Service: overall, the food took incredibly long to come out. We were there for 1.5 hrs but didn't get our order taken and get the food for almost an hour. Taste: I got shrimp and grits which came out cold and I found pieces of shell that did not belong in there. It came out in a stone pot that felt unclean and had a weird smell, so did not make for a pleasant experience. That being said, the others seemed satisfied - the two who got duck and waffle liked it, and one who had ostrich burger liked it, though none of them finished the food. Billing: MAKE SURE TO CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD BILLING. Because I had such a subpar experience, it caught my eye when the charge on my credit card came out higher than the bill + tip I left, and I had kept the customer copy to check that my eyes weren't deceiving me. I called and left messages but they didn't even bother responding or fixing this. Unacceptable.

3.description: This place is a nice place in concept.. execution is not as good as expected.It was pretty warm inside but we opted for this instead of the outdoor seating because it was too loud.  Service was actually pretty good.  Neighborhood I was told is a little sketchy.Tried many many things... - Duck tacos:  Comes in 3.. probably one of the better things.  Very tender.. now if you ask me if it's mind blowing.. no.  It's good though.- Lollipop wings:  It's crispy.. but nothing out of this world.  I did not like the carrots at all.- Charred oysters:  Dissapointing.  It's just oysters with cheese on it.  I have had much better charred oysters in New Orleans.  I would have opted for fresh oysters but I am sure they won't beat the ones on the east coast.- Elk:  It was an interesting game meat.  I like the cheese balls.. it's pretty small.  I didn't mind it.. but it was prepared almost identical as the Wagyu- Wagyu:  Meh.. tasted tender but too uninventive as it was the same as the elk.- Pumpkin:  Meh.. it's sweet and a bit salty.. not my fav- Mac and Cheese:  It's okay but they really need to add onions or bacon or pancetta or chorizo or somethingI don't know if I would come again as there are so many places in Chicago and I am not in town very often anymore.

35.description: get the burger, other dinner options are kinda small portions

19.description: Worst hostess ever. Best drink ever. We walked in on a stupid hot day on our way to the Wicker Park fest and were told by the hostess several times that there was no food service but that we could sit at the bar. Right, thanks, but can we get a table, we don't want food, but there are three of us and it would be easier to chat at a table. After rolling her eyes at us, she seated us. Our server was super sweet and accommodating although she also reminded us several times that there was no food service and that she would get our first drink, but for anything else, we'd have to ask the bartender. Not an issue. We just wanted a drink and a table and required no special treatment. I ordered the pampelmouse, which should have been spelled pampelmousse unless you wanted to make a play on the rodent, except that the cocktail  had grapefruit in it so I don't think that was the point.  The drink also had lemon and elder flower in it. I was skeptical, but on that stupid hot day, it was the best thing I've ever had. So refreshing and delicious. The atmosphere is bizarre and I'd be hesitant to try the food, but if it came with that drink, then yes I'd come back!

28.description: Great atmosphere and good food.  Unique beer selection.  Had the shredded boar sandwich - very good.  Manager was good- checked up on us.

45.description: We went there for my nieces bday, we arrived 25 mins early and we had to sit at the bar because our table wasn't ready yet. I ordered the cheapest wine by the glass and it was $11 ! To be honest, I thought that was expensive, but then I was surprised by the quality of the wine, it was a very good one (paso Creek California 2012), the waitress were very nice and the place was full considering it was on a Thursday, we got seated in the middle of a loud and crowded room,  full of tvs, the stools were tall considering my 76 yrs old aunt condition, the room was a little chilly but the waitress turn off the fan on top of us and made it happen. My niece ordered the whole goat. $575.00 and it was amazing! We got full just with the side dishes, we became friends with the tables next to us, we all sang the Happy bdays for each table and let them take pics with our huge meal. It was awesome! They don't have valet parking on weekdays but we all found parking within a block or two. In overall we had an excellent time, we like the restaurant very much. We are definitely coming back

33.description: Held a party for my husband's 40th birthday and it was fabulous!  Jen, the event manager, was  very helpful in planning our event.  The upstairs area was perfect for our party of 30.  Rachael and Shannon (I hope those are the right names!) were great at tending to our party.  We had such a great time that we didn't want to leave so we move our party to the bar area.  The Hostesses were great at finding an area for our remaining guest to drink and enjoy the evening outside on the patio.   BTW the food was delicious! Overall, our guests had an awesome time!

43.description: Came here for my boyfriend's friend's birthday dinner. I wasn't a fan. He catfish dish was pretty good, but a little heavy on the sodium. The pheasant dish we ordered somehow got mixed up in the kitchen, so we ended up waiting for that dish when our party was already ready to pay the bill. Our server comped that dish but we wasted some time just sitting there. She wasn't to be found when we eventually were ready to pay. My boyfriend had to hunt her down...a bit annoying. Also for a party of 14 gratuity should have been added am I right?

2.description: For a place that touts communal eating, they don't give you very much to share.  The food comes out in the order the chef deems appropriate, which means in no particular order.  The Brussel sprouts happen to arrive first to our table of four.  We all stared at this dish wondering how to share it since there were only 3 brussel sprouts cut up.  Really?  You couldn't throw a few more in there?  The food overall was good, but I wasn't impressed by much.  I rarely say this, but I thought the portion could have been bigger.Duck Tacos $12Mac and Cheese $8Gator Legs $14Rabbit liver $14Brussel Sprout $8Beet Salad $11Paid street parking was easy to find nearby.

18.description: Went here last night (Monday night) for $1 oysters. That was definitely the best part of our experience. After taking our drink order (myself & my friend both ordered a glass of wine), we did not see our waitress for a good 15 minutes. This was okay at first since we were enjoying catching up, however our drinks did not come at all during this time. Two glasses of wine for two guests in an empty restaurant.We put in our orders for the oysters and received these in a timely fashion. However, after completing the oysters we decided we were still hungry and wanted to order more off the menu. So there we waited, empty wine glasses empty plates, for our waitress to come over and acknowledge we may want more food. The worst part was getting our check. Our table was cleaned and cleared for a substantial amount of time before our waitress came over to see if we wanted our check. Once receiving the bill, we placed our credit cards inside and both had time to separately use the restroom and drink an entire glass of water before she returned to pick up the cards to run. We actually had to physically get her attention to come over to our table.The $1 oysters do not make up for the subpar service and while the other food was enjoyable (mac & cheese and the crab dip) it was not worth the wait.I will not be dining here again.

41.description: Everything was great except that they had no reservation for us.   I had made reservations through gdine.com and have never had a problem anywhere else.They did seat us right away but I wonder what would have happened if they were super busy....When I told the waitress we had GDine, she had no idea what I was talking about.   It did make it a little unnerving but the manager ended up coming out after the 2nd or 3rd time talking to the waitress about what we were entitled to.Manager made it all good and we enjoyed a very nice meal.  It was our anniversary though and I really would have rather NOT had to deal with "issues".

52.description: My parents sat down for their dinner reservations at 5:00 p.m., ordered and received their food an hour later.  The prime rib special was tough and my parents who are not picky eaters said the portions were plentiful, but the prime rib was tough.  Very horrified that my parents had to scarf their food down in order to get to the theater when they allotted plenty of time for a good dining experience that they didn't get.

50.description: The good.The food is decent and different. Rosemary fries were good, but too salty. Cauliflower was a hit as well as the lamb chorizo. It's the only place ive seen aligator on the menu, if thats important to you. Its kitsch is game meat. Drinks are good tooThe Less-goodIt's a sports bar with optional dining room tables. If you are expecting a quiet meal, then no. But it's a good bar. No excuse for the God aweful teen grunge music that was blaring. Not a teen in sight, just normal ppl after work. The UglyService. The service is ugly. The service is why im writting this review. Order a drink at the bar and you're fine. Another story for food. Ordered oysters at 5. Place was half empty. Left at 5:50 with no oysters. It's a shame, as Ive heard they are good. I live around the corner and constantly give this place more chances, but each time the service disappoints unless I'm ordering a drink at the bar. Wait staff is fine. The kitchen is slow I guess. Something is broken. Check it out if you want a drink. Or if you want whole pigs, aligator legs, alpaca necks and snake hips. If not, maybe try someplace else.

4.description: This spots down the street from the heart of wicker park on Milwaukee. From the outside it doesn't look like much, but you will be pleasantly surprised once inside. This place has everything, great big bar, beer garden, a "elixir" room' which is loungey, looks like somewhere i would want to grab a cigar and chill. It even got a "Chefs table" where you can watch the magic of the kitchen, including whole animal service, which includes boars, gators, pigs and lamb. The menu is clearly a little different, it has alot of "game options. And the not so unique options are great as well. The drinks were solid, just wish they had a larger craft beer selection. Very chill, strong drinks, and different kinds of meat this spot is my kinda place!

6.description: This was our second visit & I can say I wasn't as blown away this time around. Our first visit consisted of deviled eggs & duck tacos. Both were amazing & full of flavor! This time around we had the lollipop wings and lobster mac and cheese. The wings were good but the breading was sooooo crispy. Almost "break a tooth" crispy if you know what I mean. The flavor was pretty good though, so I'd probably order them again. The lobster mac and cheese was okay.. Nothing really to write home about. Service is friendly & the atmosphere is cool. Maybe we'll come back for a whole pig...

22.description: Great space and awesome patio. Food was unique and tasty--we had the chicken wings, mac and cheese, green beans (they're a MUST), duck tacos (also very good), and 1-2 other shared plates that I can't recall at the moment. Everything was prepared very well and of very good quality, and I like that there were different options than your typical tapas-style restaurant. Good beer and cocktail menu as well.

15.description: Such a waste. Really wanted it to be great. In all fairness, we did not order off of the normal menu. We ordered off of the whole animal menu. Mistake.The restaurant itself is very cool. We sat in the outdoor beer garden by the fireplace. Comfortable and lovely. The staff is basically fine but cold.We ordered the pig. It was flavorless. They ordered a pig. They stuck it in the oven and took it out 6 hours later. Zero seasoning. Zero smoke. Zero love. Most of the meat was uneaten.The sides that came with the pig were fine. But really . . . fine at best.The strangest part to me is that nobody follow up with me. When you order the whole animal you work with an event manager. We never heard from the restaurant manager or the event manager the day of the event. And we did not hear anything from them after the event. Isn't it strange that a manager would not poke their head in and ask how everything was going? Or an email from the event manager to make sure we had a nice time. We spent a small fortune between the pig and the drinks. There are piles of leftover food getting cold in front of us. And nothing. I believe this is at the heart of the issue with Frontier. Nobody cares.

57.description: Yummy...Yummy...Yum O!  Sat out on their covered patio on a pouring rain Sunday for brunch and had the delicious Ostrich Juicy Lucy.  So here's my one compliant.... it's not a juicy lucy.  Minnesotans will know what I'm talking about here and since lived there for a few years I now also consider myself a juicy lucy expert.  Anyhow...the burger is fantastic.  The ostrich burgers of which there are two were fantastic and melted between them was the Gouda which is where I'm guessing they think they can call it a juicy lucy.  still no... but I degrees.  Add in some leeks and a nice mayo with a some nice kick to it and you have yourself a winning burger.  Get it. All three of us got it and loved it.  And one of them only eats meats a few times a year so that's saying something!

20.description: I've been to this restaurant twice in the last month specifically for their ahi tuna sandwich. It's amazing and well worth the trip. The amount of tuna given on the sandwich impressed me as it was overflowing from the bread. The tuna is fresh and crusted with pepper. They add some panko chips and sprouts for crunch. Then they spread on some wasabi mayo for spice. The bread is toasted perfectly to compliment the other ingredients but not overshadow them. The sandwich also comes with homemade fries. All in all a fabulous dish for only $14. I recommend this dish and restaurant to all of my friends. It's very unexpected for a place that looks like it's concentrating on the drinks versus the food. And the wait staff has been exceptional every time I've visited. Definitely add this to your list to try!

36.description: Worst hostess ever. Best drink ever. We walked in on a stupid hot day on our way to the Wicker Park fest and were told by the hostess several times that there was no food service but that we could sit at the bar. Right, thanks, but can we get a table, we don't want food, but there are three of us and it would be easier to chat at a table. After rolling her eyes at us, she seated us. Our server was super sweet and accommodating although she also reminded us several times that there was no food service and that she would get our first drink, but for anything else, we'd have to ask the bartender. Not an issue. We just wanted a drink and a table and required no special treatment. I ordered the pampelmouse, which should have been spelled pampelmousse unless you wanted to make a play on the rodent, except that the cocktail  had grapefruit in it so I don't think that was the point.  The drink also had lemon and elder flower in it. I was skeptical, but on that stupid hot day, it was the best thing I've ever had. So refreshing and delicious. The atmosphere is bizarre and I'd be hesitant to try the food, but if it came with that drink, then yes I'd come back!

14.description: Hosted a large party (65 people) here in October of 2015. The Frontier did an outstanding job! Everything we had discussed was followed to a T! Working with Jen was great! They did everything they could to make all of the guests happy, and checked in with me often to make sure everything was going as planned! The food was great! - We did the large format menu (whole pigs) with all the sides - which were delicious. If you need to host a large party, I would highly suggest this! The upstairs was perfect and we had the whole area to ourselves! A little more seating would be helpful, but the food and service was well worth it!

58.description: The staff was great and the food is delicious! We started off with the chicken empanadas with guava salsa. It came to the table piping hot and was devoured in 1 minute. The sandwich called media noche was served on crusty bread with turkey,pickles,mustard Swiss cheese and sweet plantains. Beware it is a serving that could actually feed two!  The churros were soft inside and melted in my mouth.  I will be back..but I will take a sandwich and empanada to go.

56.description: They've cut down their menu dramatically. I would always get the Cuban steak sandwich or the steak, egg and cheese and those are off the menu now. I tried the media noche and except for the plantains, it was very bland. The turkey they use seems bottom of the barrel. Also, every cuban sandwich that I've had is pressed, hot and has melted cheese. This didn't have either.For those that are interested in going, they still have the apps, drinks & deserts which are good. The only sandwiches are the media noche, El Cubanito & Cuban PBJ.

29.description: When you have a Brittney Payton blessing, you really are one of Chicago's Best!Nini's Deli features an eclectic menu of incredible flavors and great bites to satisfy all lovers of Latin cuisine. Not only is the food top-notch, the look and feel of the restaurant evokes an "at-home" style of comfort that is no better illustrated than its phenomenal staff that run Nini's. You'll be treated like family from the minute you walk in with the charm of Juany (the awesome bearded dude at the front) and his whole family that all lend a hand in bringing Chicago together to taste and experience their amazing creations.Of their creations, I was able to have their empanadas, their Cubanito sandwich, and their churros. Their empanadas are by far the best I've ever experienced. They're large, flavorful, and pair well with the Verde sauce. You must have these! I would classify their Cubanito as a "classic". I could have it everyday and I honestly wish I could. Do it and don't think twice!The churros were a great finish to the meal as they were perfect and fresh. Juany also hooked me and my friends up with their amazing hibiscus lemonade. Literally the coolest concoction around, it was too pretty to drink!Every Chicagoan should dine at Nini's Deli, period. YouTube their feature on Chicago's Best if you need further proof. I honestly can't wait to get back!

42.description: Disappointing their menu had changed so they offer not so much anymore.  I'm not sure about the hype surrounding that lemonade hibiscus drink,  I got a complimentary one and it had very lil flavor.  The empanada was good.  I did not care for the twist they put on their Cuban. I drove over an hr out of my way cuz of the reviews *tears*. They did give me a free empanada so that was cool.

23.description: I've been meaning to stop in but hadn't gotten around to it so I finally made it a point to get here before the early closing time. The menu is limited to three sandwiches but don't let that fool you, they are delicious!  I feel that they are a bit pricey at $8 each.  The menu selection overall is quite small but the items I tried were good.  The place itself is clean, updated and while I was there eating, it had a constant flow of customers.   The staff is very efficient and friendly.

47.description: After a long day of work. I stopped by this little spot on the corner. I ordered a media noche, cubanito, a churro and a chicken empanada. I haven't eaten there before and I wanted to get a feel for the place. And also I am a hungry monster after work so there is my defense! The inside had such a great feel to it. The staff is super friendly, and the guy (Juan) went through the whole menu with me! Which is much appreciated. The place is very personable, and it really adds to a great food experience. Got home and everything was SO GOOD! It was like how I always ate the food at my grandmothers. They put Beans in the sandwich, sweet plantains in the middle. Everything was really delicious. Large sandwiches (lunch for tomorrow :) ) , I was incredibly full. Too Full to move. (mission accomplished) The coffee was spot on also. Great coffee, which is ALWAYS REALLY important.  Over all  I am really happy I decided to come in. Will be back again and again!

8.description: Coming from a Cuban and Colombian background I take my Empanadas very seriously. When it comes to Empanadas Ninis has the game on lock. They're big, juicy, and full of flavor. I've had every Empanada on the menu including the very r4re Ropa Veija Empanada (available on steak days!) and they're all delectable. Make sure you grab a coffee or a Hibiscus Lemonade as well. This place is much more than just food, its an experience.

31.description: Excellent food and a super friendly staff that make great suggestions and offer all kinds of customer service. Juan is the best of what the business should be, and he frothed the milk for my hot cocoa a bit which made it more filling and delicious.Their take on a Cuban sand which is just delicious and non heavy, while still being very unique. Everything is made to order and you can taste the freshness in every bite. I can't wait to go back and have some churros

34.description: Nini's is a gem in noble square, as a west town native I love seeing the blossoming of home grown native spots! Nini's not only reminds me of home but the foods amazing too ;) by no means am I a foodie but hey I am from Chicago.... Nini's is a natural twist on cultural favorite sprinkled with Chicago... Everything is super fresh and always warm! The very first time I visited Nini's the sandwich shop, I was given a complimentary dessert I think they had just re opened and Juan wanted to butter me up... Well it worked... Our favorites are the empanadas and of course the cafe con leche iced. The sandwiches are really good, never a miss... LOVE NINI'S

16.description: Affordable, family-run, funky cuban joint? I'm there. From their hibiscus lemonade and cuban iced coffee, to their mouthwatering churros, to any one of their sandwiches, Nini's is drowning in amazing food. Oh, and the family that owns it? Delightful, welcoming people - you feel at home. My sweet tooth just raves about the Cuban PB&J: peanut butter, guava jelly, and sweet plantains. Elvis would be shaking his hips all day long if he ate here.

13.description: After a long day of work. I stopped by this little spot on the corner. I ordered a media noche, cubanito, a churro and a chicken empanada. I haven't eaten there before and I wanted to get a feel for the place. And also I am a hungry monster after work so there is my defense! The inside had such a great feel to it. The staff is super friendly, and the guy (Juan) went through the whole menu with me! Which is much appreciated. The place is very personable, and it really adds to a great food experience. Got home and everything was SO GOOD! It was like how I always ate the food at my grandmothers. They put Beans in the sandwich, sweet plantains in the middle. Everything was really delicious. Large sandwiches (lunch for tomorrow :) ) , I was incredibly full. Too Full to move. (mission accomplished) The coffee was spot on also. Great coffee, which is ALWAYS REALLY important.  Over all  I am really happy I decided to come in. Will be back again and again!

11.description: Nini's is the best place ever. The food is the best Cuban food I have ever had. And, the owners are friendly and passionate!

39.description: You are TRPPPEEEN if you give this anything less than a 4.5/5. I give this a 5/5. First of all, WOW-- I love their spin on cuban sandwiches!! What my big foodie self ordered:- Media Noche sandwich: turkey (grilled to order), pickles, mustard, swiss cheese & fried plantains ... I also added an egg.. best decision EVER!! 5/5 stars- Hibiscus lemondage... o m g!!! so delicious! not sweet, not too sour. the right mix, and it comes out so colorful and beautiful 5/5- Coffee, it was strong and took you straight to the moon and back with just a shot size amount. I was awake and ready to take on the day. 4.5/5Also I got to try the cuban PB&J.. thought it was a bit sweet, I can totally see why its a hit. I dont know if its possible to finish the PB&J sandwich alone because the sandwiches are pretty big. I do however, can see myself eating 1/2 and saving the other 1/2 for later. 4.5/5

37.description: Popped into Nini's after catching them on Chicago's Best and they really are! The best! Everyone is so friendly! And when we shared that we'd seen them on the show, they made us a complimentary "willie" on the house - cinnamon, whipped cream, espresso, and other delicious secrets! So we ordered sweet plantains and the peanut butter and apple empanadas! Noms! Seriously visit here soon!

0.description: The vibe in here is great & the food is made with passion. I had their take on the Traditional Cuban, which is made with turkey instead of pork. That is awesome for me because I don't eat pork. The sandwich was great, the way they layer the plantains is the key. Also had a veggie empanada & their lemonade drink provided much needed refreshment to some of my crew battling hangovers. Then they brought out the tortilla chip desert specialty... Damn.Great spot. Def want to go back to try more of the menu.

38.description: If I could give this place six stars I would! Finding a gluten free sandwich this good is rare.  Don't miss this spot if you are gf!

51.description: Nini's Deli is beyond amazing. From the colorful, vibrant design of the interior to the food and drinks that they serve to the wonderful and friendly service that they have, Nini's definitely knows how to make you feel right at home and welcomed along with giving you the best food possible. The Hibiscus lemonade was just the perfect amount of sweet and the plantains in their sandwiches are a unique and perfect touch with extremely fresh ingredients. I got to try the empanadas and churros as well which were just as perfect. Overall, Nini's will make sure that you leave happy at heart and full in your stomach!

27.description: Great Twist on Cuban food. Came here with my hubby and absolutely loved the food and environment. Will definitely be back!

32.description: Where do I begin! Not only are you always greeted by name and a friendly smile but the food is amazing. Hence why I am known by name cause I can't stop coming back! From the amazing sandwiches to the hibiscus lemonade. You can never go wrong. The sweet empanadas are to die for with the perfect combo of apple and peanut butter. So amazing! And those sliders!! My mouth just got watery! Love this place and you will too as soon as you walk in. Such a neighborhood gem!

54.description: Great spot. The owners are super nice people, very food is great, fresh, and reasonably priced. Cafe con leche and hibiscus lemonade were standouts, and the house salsa with the empanadas is delicious. Highly recommended!

48.description: Awesome service and really great food. We tested 2 of their 3 sandwiches.The Cuban egg, beans, and plantains combo was off the hook. Such an inventive flavor profile that had the perfect balance of sweet and savory. The bread on both these sandwiches was perfect: french style with a crisp crust and chewy/doughy crumb. The eggs were nice and fluffy and just played so nicely with the cheese. The other sandwich, turkey, ham, and plantains was also very good. Though I preferred the first sandwich. The flavors in this one blended quite well.The guy at the front offered us complimentary hibiscus lemonade. It was really good, like a Caribbean Arnold Palmer. You guys have to check this place out.

44.description: We stopped in for a light lunch / snack last weekend and were very happy that we did! We shared the spinach empanada (YUM) and their take on the cubano sandwich with ham, pickles, plantains, and avocado. They were both excellent, especially the sauce that came with the empanada. I also tried their house made iced tea, which was excellent. Nini's is such a cute spot and the staff is SO friendly. Go!

24.description: I have tried this spot a few times. For a small business they keep it very personal. After a few visits they remembered my name a quality that is lost in the food industry. I love the empanadas they are not small at all a meal within itself. I also love the media noche for a sandwich. They are not open on Mondays however. Sometimes because they are so good they may run out of food late in the evening. So my advice would be to get in early. All in all great to have Cuban food with great service.

7.description: Don't remember the guy's name but never met someone so excited about Cuban sandwiches and his family owned deli. Real friendly guy! Also the food was great.. Have to get the coffee along with your Cuban sandwich! He also brought us their signature hibiscus lemonade and it blew our minds!

49.description: This review is for coffee only and while the taste was fine it was not "cafe con leche".  I mean, it physically was coffee w/milk but it was pre-made and came out of a warmer.

40.description: tasty sandwich hit the spot! service was superb! maybe we came to the place late into the day, there were only 3 sandwiches selection left on the menu. Nevertheless, less is more. The El Cubano the owner rec'd was sooo good! Perfect texture and flavor. Will go back again to try the others (hopefully a sandwich with meat :) )

53.description: I'm lucky nini's is half a block away from the office. I come over at least once a week to get my fix. The empanadas remind me of the ones my mom used to make me for lunch when I was a kid. Pollo or carne both are amazing! You will receive a small cup of magic sauce to go with them, sweet and a bit vinagery, it is he perfect compliment to each crunchy bite of crispy empanada. The stars of the menu are definetly the cubanito and the steak sandwhich. The first being a cool innovative take on what has been on the plates of many latin americans. Sweet plantains fried to perfection, creamy black beans and the perfect omelette with melted chedda. throw in some ham and avocado it will make you reach lunch valhalla. The steak sandwhich, Theone! A sandwhich on another level! Once removed from the menu, it has made an elusive come  back! The rumor is it will be coming around more often and I couldnt be happier. Try it once, youll be hooked for life. Believe me, you want it. Be sure to ask when it will be served next and save the date. Come early too, as it will sell out! The staff is down to earth and friendly. Nini's is a true testament that hard consistent work pays off.

30.description: I have actually been trying to eat here for a while.  I came over a year ago,  last week and finally today.  The last two times they were closed due to holiday hours, ect I finally got to eat there today and boy was it worth a trip back.  Even when they were closed last week, I went to the door and saw someone in there thinking it was opened, and the owner apologized for being closed and offered us soda.  It really was a nice gesture, nice enough to get us to come back this week.  I had the chicken empanada which was freshly made and delicious, especially accompanied with the hot sauce that it came out with. For sandwiches, I had the Media Noche and the el cubanito(added turkey and avocado per their recs) and both were phenomenal.   Price was appropriate and I will 100% be coming back.  I think I liked the Cubanito better(as long as you add turkey and avocado) but next time I might try the Media Noche but add egg and avocado.  I think that also might be a winner.

46.description: I got a great sandwich! ...Always add avocado too. The staff was super nice, too.

1.description: Looking for amazing Cuban food in Chicago, well look no farther. Some may say it is your typical family owned neighborhood cafe but I say, it will quickly become your go to destination for empanadas! However, the food is not the only component of this place that is great. The customer service is phenomenal! (Thanks,Juan). From the time you step into the cafe, they treat you like a member of their family. I went in about 30 mins before they closed and they were slammed. None the less, they were happy, helpful, and patient enough to allow me to take my time. Now back to the empanadas. They were ahhhhh-mazzzzing! The empanadas are not small (like some other places, ahem) and are definitely Seasoned very well. I tried the veggie (spinach & cheese) and the chicken ( pulled chicken seasoned well ). I also tried the rice and beans & the hibiscus tea. Mind you this is a cafe, so they keep their menu concise and filled with their take on Cuban staples. Next time, I'm going for the Media Noche!I just wish they stayed open later than 6pm!  If they did, this would be my dinner once a week.LOL  oh and I stumbled upon this gem, thanks to my #Giftie app!

55.description: Atmosphere- amazing, casual, hipService- fast, friendly, family-owned & its shows!!Food- fresh ingredients & unique Cuban cuisineDrinks- refreshing, sweet but not too sweetCan't say enough how much I love this neighborhood sandwich shop!

9.description: This place serves only three sandwiches: 1) Media Noche (turkey sandwich)2) El Cubanito 3) Cuban PB&JI had them all and I liked them all. However, the Media Noche with its turkey meat was probably my favorite one. El Cubanito is savory while the Cuban PB&J is sweet but overly sticky. The Media Noche is just zesty and good. Apparently, every 2nd Wednesday of the month, there is a special sandwich that they sell. I didn't get to have that, but the owner (who was a really cool, chill guy) highly recommended it. So perhaps, next time.

26.description: So since my last review, I have unfortunately moved out of the neighborhood and they have downsized their menu, so my Kitchen Sink sandwich recommendation is no longer valid. My other favorite sandwich, El Cubanito, is still there. You should get it, because every time I go on their Instagram I am reminded of how much I miss this place. I SHALL BE BACK, JUAN!

25.description: 5 stars for the delicious food- we got media noche, chicken empañadas, pb&j sandwich, and the hibiscus lemonade- all of which were delicious.  5 stars also for the really warm and welcoming host.  His enthusiasm for the food was contagious and very much needed, especially on an otherwise cold and rainy day. Will definitely come back again.

12.description: anyone who has lived or spent time in miami should know about the beauty of cuban coffee and the ways it completes life. their cuban coffee is a sweet remedy to thursday night's before a dreadful night class right down the road. their empanadas are on point. spinach is definetely my favorite (it counts as my spinach intake for the week). but even better than the empanadas, is the chile sauce they are served with.but what puts this place above all the rest is the people. i come at the same time every week along with 30-40 others and my name and order are for the week. quality of food is good, making the customer feel good is better.-borland out.

59.description: Ninis deli is amazing! The interior, in my opinion, is so chic in a very earth friendly type of way! It makes for a great instagram picture ;). (Plus good music). I'm a big fan of the el cubanito w/ avocado. They also offers it in a wrap for us bread intake conscious people! Of course, you cannot leave without trying their signature hibiscus lemonade. Not only is the food great but the service really makes you feel like you've been knowing the family for a long time. Juany and Mel, who are there literally everyday, always greet people with a smile and a heart warming " hi, hello! Welcome to Ninis! Whats going on?" If you're an avid coffee drinker stop by the shop at 8am for you cup of café con leche. You'll get a great tasting coffee and a compliment from Juan- it's practically impossible to have a bad day after a visit to Ninis!
