21.description: Awesome cubanito sandwich (ask for avocado) it's a gem! Cuban sandwiches with a modern twist.

17.description: The first thing I noticed about Nini's was that it is tucked away in a neighborhood rather than some strip mall. Its really got a local, family feel. Juan greets you when you get to the register and he was made for this, he is charismatic, friendly, and you can really tell he loves what he does. That love translates into the food because, its lit. I started off with the hibiscus lemonade and a chicken empanada. The empanada is filled with cheese and chicken and is a really tasty take on a cuban staple. The hibiscus lemonade is sweet and perfect for the winter or summer. I also had the Cubanito with turkey. Nini's version of this cuban sandwich is refreshing as it is sweet and savory. I ended my visit with a cafe con leche and it was the perfect amount of sweet and a great mid afternoon pick me up to get me through the rest of my day. I was too stuffed to try everything I wanted and I am going to have to comeback to try the rest of the menu!

10.description: Don't sleep on Nini's. Best place to start your day. You can walk in very sad and depressed but once you taste that sandwich it gives you hope and happiness, you walk out feeling very positive and ready to start your day. Wow. Thank you nini's!

5.description: I have actually been trying to eat here for a while.  I came over a year ago,  last week and finally today.  The last two times they were closed due to holiday hours, ect I finally got to eat there today and boy was it worth a trip back.  Even when they were closed last week, I went to the door and saw someone in there thinking it was opened, and the owner apologized for being closed and offered us soda.  It really was a nice gesture, nice enough to get us to come back this week.  I had the chicken empanada which was freshly made and delicious, especially accompanied with the hot sauce that it came out with. For sandwiches, I had the Media Noche and the el cubanito(added turkey and avocado per their recs) and both were phenomenal.   Price was appropriate and I will 100% be coming back.  I think I liked the Cubanito better(as long as you add turkey and avocado) but next time I might try the Media Noche but add egg and avocado.  I think that also might be a winner.

3.description: For all the Muslims out there yes their meat options are halal. Upon arriving at the front door of Nini's Deli we were greeted by a few skaters enjoying a warm sunny day in the midst of February in The Chi. The restaurant itself carries a hipster-esque vibe to it. Juan, the owner, provided us a jovial reception and recommended getting the 'El Cubanito'($8) and adding turkey for optimum meat consumption. We also ordered the habiscus lemonade($3) just so we could remain true to the hipster mandate of drinking using mason jars. As an added bonus the homemade lemonade was phenomenal. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit there and hope to visit when they have their steak day-which is once a month. Call ahead and find out the particular dates since it's not offered on regular days.

35.description: Solid 3.5 stars!Came here on a weekday and this place was bustling with people. Greeted promptly and I sincerely wish everyone who works in customer service was like Juan. The man is cheery friendly and cool. Hubs and I ordered a Ropa Vieja, a Cubanito and some empanadas along with Hibiscus lemonades. The drink alone was delicious! Very Refreshing, savory and Instagram worthy. The empanadas were okay I wasn't a fan of the spinach one but the chicken was a bit better. Hubs on the other hand thought they were amazing.What really stood out to me was the crust. It was thee perfect crust. The sandwiches were good. Again the standout for me was the bread. It was soft warm and not too flaky. I think the Cubanito was better and definitely the plantain added wonderful flavor. I found the combination of mustard and pickles not to my taste but I like that they use grilled turkey in the Ropa Vieja sandwich.It was my first time trying Cuban sandwiches so perhaps I am not used to these flavors together. Tldr; Cool urban atmosphere, friendly owner and solid sandwiches. Great lemonade hibiscus drink and decent empanadas.

19.description: Awesome service and really great food. We tested 2 of their 3 sandwiches.The Cuban egg, beans, and plantains combo was off the hook. Such an inventive flavor profile that had the perfect balance of sweet and savory. The bread on both these sandwiches was perfect: french style with a crisp crust and chewy/doughy crumb. The eggs were nice and fluffy and just played so nicely with the cheese. The other sandwich, turkey, ham, and plantains was also very good. Though I preferred the first sandwich. The flavors in this one blended quite well.The guy at the front offered us complimentary hibiscus lemonade. It was really good, like a Caribbean Arnold Palmer. You guys have to check this place out.

28.description: Affordable, family-run, funky cuban joint? I'm there. From their hibiscus lemonade and cuban iced coffee, to their mouthwatering churros, to any one of their sandwiches, Nini's is drowning in amazing food. Oh, and the family that owns it? Delightful, welcoming people - you feel at home. My sweet tooth just raves about the Cuban PB&J: peanut butter, guava jelly, and sweet plantains. Elvis would be shaking his hips all day long if he ate here.

45.description: Been here 2 times and the food is great. Love the halal sandwiches. The only thing I don't like is that it is all the way in the city. Would like it if they were in the suburbs but still give it 5 stars.

33.description: This is my first Yelp review. I would like to say that Nini's has been a long time favorite, and that I visit this fine establishment whenever I am in the neighborhood. I find that it is one of my favorite restaurants in the Noble Square area. The service is quite superior, often very speedy and quite friendly. On my last visit, I ate a delightful El Cubanito sandwich along with a plantain. All in all, I would say Nini's Deli is quite highly recommended.

43.description: This place is awesome! Had a Cuban sandwich, plantains, churro, and hibiscus drink. Everything was delicious, left very satisfied and way too full. The owners' son even came to our table to check on us, which was great and spoke a little about his family. Of course, I'll be back again very soon.

2.description: It took way too long for me to pay a visit to Nini's & I'm mad at myself for not having it sooner. Take my advice:Put the phone down, stop what you're doing, and make your way to Nini's! I was immediately greeted by their enthusiastic owner, Juan. The establishment is hip, cozy, and vibrant. Their food...Geez.. Their food was outstanding! I had their shredded chicken and cheese empanada with a sweet and spicy sauce on the side (they could sell that sauce by the gallon and I'd be first in line). I had their hibiscus lemonade that was perfectly sweet and tart. To follow, I had their "cubanito" sandwich with grilled turkey. I basically inhaled that. For a sweet treat, I had their hot chocolate. It was perfect on such a cold day. I can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu. This place is a true hidden gem!

18.description: Nini's Deli is my #1 go-to place in chicago. The owner and his family give off the nothing but the most friendly atmosphere that'll make you feel at-home from your first visit to every visit after.

41.description: This is not your typical deli. They put care into all their ingredients and prepare it to perfection. The cuban influenced sandwiches and sides are delicious. Definitely worth a quick visit!

52.description: I wasn't impressed at all.  The menu is very limited, even for a deli...3 sandwiches, 1 of which...PB&J empanadas??  I even asked to see a menu so I could sit down while trying to decide what to eat, I was told "we don't have menu's...everything is on the board."  Which brings me to my next issue...customer service!  The woman at the counter wasn't very pleasant, so my guest & I left.I was waiting to try the tea and a little more; it appears from the 5 star comments that the 3 sandwiches must be delicious.  However, I don't think I'll be coming back.Glad everyone else was throughly satisfied...

50.description: Nini's Deli is a special place. When you walk in, you already feel welcomed and at home. Everyone there is so friendly, it's just a great atmosphere to be at. Now for the food, oh man it's delicious! Make sure you try el Cubanito tho! and also grab yourself a hot cup of café con leche because it will warm you up, especially on cold days that are coming up. Overall it's a great place and a must go if you're visiting Chicago! So check it! You won't regret it.

4.description: From day one, Juan and his family have made me feel at home with their hospitality and their amazing take on Cuban cuisine. Perfect in the morning after a night of heavy drinking, perfect place to take a first date, perfect place to go if you're hungry in the west loop and won't settle for anything less than quality. Much love to you guys, keep doin what you're doin!

6.description: Excellent food and a super friendly staff that make great suggestions and offer all kinds of customer service. Juan is the best of what the business should be, and he frothed the milk for my hot cocoa a bit which made it more filling and delicious.Their take on a Cuban sand which is just delicious and non heavy, while still being very unique. Everything is made to order and you can taste the freshness in every bite. I can't wait to go back and have some churros

22.description: Great service from the waiter/cashier. He was super helpful and energetic. The dining area was a little drafty...granted, it was only about 9 degrees out when I visited. Good sandwich, wish I could've tried the special steak Cuban...maybe next time

15.description: When you have a Brittney Payton blessing, you really are one of Chicago's Best!Nini's Deli features an eclectic menu of incredible flavors and great bites to satisfy all lovers of Latin cuisine. Not only is the food top-notch, the look and feel of the restaurant evokes an "at-home" style of comfort that is no better illustrated than its phenomenal staff that run Nini's. You'll be treated like family from the minute you walk in with the charm of Juany (the awesome bearded dude at the front) and his whole family that all lend a hand in bringing Chicago together to taste and experience their amazing creations.Of their creations, I was able to have their empanadas, their Cubanito sandwich, and their churros. Their empanadas are by far the best I've ever experienced. They're large, flavorful, and pair well with the Verde sauce. You must have these! I would classify their Cubanito as a "classic". I could have it everyday and I honestly wish I could. Do it and don't think twice!The churros were a great finish to the meal as they were perfect and fresh. Juany also hooked me and my friends up with their amazing hibiscus lemonade. Literally the coolest concoction around, it was too pretty to drink!Every Chicagoan should dine at Nini's Deli, period. YouTube their feature on Chicago's Best if you need further proof. I honestly can't wait to get back!

57.description: The service is the absolute best I've ever seen! The owner is as friendly as they come! Highly suggest for a great experience!

20.description: The first thing I noticed about Nini's was that it is tucked away in a neighborhood rather than some strip mall. Its really got a local, family feel. Juan greets you when you get to the register and he was made for this, he is charismatic, friendly, and you can really tell he loves what he does. That love translates into the food because, its lit. I started off with the hibiscus lemonade and a chicken empanada. The empanada is filled with cheese and chicken and is a really tasty take on a cuban staple. The hibiscus lemonade is sweet and perfect for the winter or summer. I also had the Cubanito with turkey. Nini's version of this cuban sandwich is refreshing as it is sweet and savory. I ended my visit with a cafe con leche and it was the perfect amount of sweet and a great mid afternoon pick me up to get me through the rest of my day. I was too stuffed to try everything I wanted and I am going to have to comeback to try the rest of the menu!

36.description: Alright.  Updated review.  Juan is amazing.  This place has tried hard to be great.  They have streamlined the menu and the ordering process and come out ahead.  (The owner has been reading the Yelp reviews and listening to peoples complaints/advice!!!)My complaints about order time before have been shot down.  Last trip there, I was in and out in under 5 minutes.  The sandwiches are tasty!Noble Square needs more places like Nini's Deli.Give them a shot!

14.description: Great service from the waiter/cashier. He was super helpful and energetic. The dining area was a little drafty...granted, it was only about 9 degrees out when I visited. Good sandwich, wish I could've tried the special steak Cuban...maybe next time

58.description: Decent at best. The sushi was very mediocre. Seaweed salad was decent, same with the spicy tuna. The tuna takaki special roll tasted literally like burnt plastic. Not worth $16 at all. Had a 25% off groupon, but I am in no hurry to return when so many other great sushi places exist in the city.

56.description: Not a good experience.  I didn't like anything I ordered.  Pot of tea for 5 was enough for one person.  Fried rice was overloaded with vegetables.  My noodle dish was okay .  I would not do this place again.

29.description: This review is for 5 years ago~Came here with a coupon. I thought the food was quite good. I was a little wary that when I came (Sat evening). I was with my friends who are of Hispanic origin. Apparently they didn't know they were allergic to seafood and/or shellfish, so they had a reaction soon afterwards. But that didn't detract from the experience. Because it was relatively empty on what should have been a busy time, I suggest caution. Sushi nor tempura was outstanding, but relatively inexpensive (standard price). Best for people who are in the area without going out if their way.

42.description: It was your typical sushi joint... The rolls were pretty good and I also had the shrimp and mango dish which was tasty as well.

23.description: After a Saturday evening concert, came here with friends.  Stylish décor with a solid lineup of sushi and Asian fare.The highlight of the evening was the dirty saketini.  Looked good.  Tasted great.  A fellow diner put in her order after seeing mine and finishing something else.I ordered the Sushi Display B (I'm possibly not up on sushi to know why it's called that) and enjoyed.  The entrée came with a spicy tuna roll.   The roll was fresh, tasty, distinctive--yes, I know!  How is that?  Distinctive?--but it was!My partner wound her way through avoiding gluten issues, eventually ordering steak teriyaki.  It got an 'okay'.  The server asked if she wanted it 'well done', causing me to blanch.   Got it medium rare--it came that way, but did not overly impress.While not taking a taste, the mango shrimp looked like a winner.8 guests at the table.  Our server was efficient and friendly.  A good late night stop.

47.description: Free parking!The fish on the snowball maki is incredible, but too much rice in my opinion.Fireball sounds like it has lots of goodies but they all meld together in one mass of a maki.I really enjoyed the booth near the window and fast service.

8.description: Got a groupon for my birthday. When we got there, the place was empty...it was a Thursday night at 6pm. My friend and I had the place all to ourselves. We ordered a spicy salmon with cucumber roll and a red dragon roll. The rolls are skimpy...more than usual. The tuna had no flavor and was close to being dry. The wasabi wasn't spicy...I had to use a whole pea sized amount for each piece to taste the spice. We also ordered the honey something shrimp. That was decent. The seaweed salad was also a good portion, but you can't go wrong with seaweed salad anywhere. Overall, this place isn't worth your time.  But the waitress was great. She gave us enough privacy and only came to check on us when we actually needed her.

31.description: A friend and I came here for the first time, and our experience was okay, but nothing worth screaming over. Atmosphere is very relaxed and chill and the service was good, but I felt like there was nothing unique or anything that stood out from the hundreds of other sushi/asian places here in Chicago. In others words, if you dined at one, you pretty much dined at a majority of them.And it's not that the food tasted terrible or anything, but it didn't leave enough of an impression on me to warrant another visit back here. It's also a bit overpriced for the quality you're getting, as I expected more tastebud tantalization for the cost. Most likely won't be going back. I'd rather prefer UMI at East Irving Park Road, as they have fresher and better sushi.

34.description: Party of 3 sushi/ramen lovers including one 11 yo budding gourmand. We had an Amazon Local coupon so we thought we'd give it a go.  Pretty empty on a Friday at dinner time but more folks came in as we left.  We were seated at the very back table by the kitchen door.  I usually don't mind this but... I faced the door way and there was ugly kitchen detritus to accompany my meal.  Mayhap a curtain would make things disappear.We ordered an assortment of dishes including a ramen, sushi, a spider roll and pork buns.  And PICKLES - get the pickles! The best thing we ate!   Sushi was odd, certainly fresh but cut wide and thin with LOTS of the radish.  Tasty but seemed like a lot of filler.  Odd sized globs of "wasabi" on each dish seemed wasteful.  Generally not the best presentation and could be improved.  Sushi seemed cut for economy.  Roll was OK. needed more spider.  Ramen tasty and OK. Nice broth, could use more stuff in the both.  Added pickles.  Pork Buns  - odd - bbq pork tucked in to bun wraps garnished with ice burg lettuce and spicy sauce.  Tip to diners and resto - ditch the lettuce and put in pickles!  More pickles - order the pickles.  Pickles!  GREAT with pork in buns with spicy sauce!Obligatory oranges that came with the check were Very Cold and well cut (11 year old ate them all) but were sort of tasteless and did not seem worth the bother.  I did learn from observing the knife work how to cut oranges so the 11 year old will make them.Service was very good - nice lady was friendly and efficient. In sum, if I had another coupon, I might come back.  I did not get poisoned but there were no WOWS or OMG this makes it all worth it. The pickles cannot stand alone. There are many other Asian spots in WPB that I have yet to try.  Usagi -Ya (means rabbit in Japanese) has a cute logo but needs to tighten up their game; flavors and presentation need work.

16.description: Party of 3 sushi/ramen lovers including one 11 yo budding gourmand. We had an Amazon Local coupon so we thought we'd give it a go.  Pretty empty on a Friday at dinner time but more folks came in as we left.  We were seated at the very back table by the kitchen door.  I usually don't mind this but... I faced the door way and there was ugly kitchen detritus to accompany my meal.  Mayhap a curtain would make things disappear.We ordered an assortment of dishes including a ramen, sushi, a spider roll and pork buns.  And PICKLES - get the pickles! Nice broth, could use more stuff in the both.  Added pickles.  Pork Buns  - odd - bbq pork tucked in to bun wraps garnished with ice burg lettuce and spicy sauce.  Tip to diners and resto - ditch the lettuce and put in pickles!  More pickles - order the pickles.  Pickles!  GREAT with pork in buns with spicy sauce!Obligatory oranges that came with the check were Very Cold and well cut (11 year old ate them all) but were sort of tasteless and did not seem worth the bother.  I did learn from observing the knife work how to cut oranges so the 11 year old will make them.Service was very good - nice lady was friendly and efficient. In sum, if I had another coupon, I might come back.  I did not get poisoned but there were no WOWS or OMG this makes it all worth it. The pickles cannot stand alone. There are many other Asian spots in WPB that I have yet to try.  Usagi -Ya (means rabbit in Japanese) has a cute logo but needs to tighten up their game; flavors and presentation need work.

13.description: Grabbed a $25 for $50 amazon local deal and made the most of it at Usagi Ya. The place was pretty dead on a Fri night so I understood their need to promote on a daily deal site. Being across the street from another really good sushi place must be tough. It's like being assigned to sit next to the most popular girl in class. No one's gonna pay attention to you even if you have a great personality. We had the Miami roll (seemed appropriate), crunchy and the truffle roll. Most rolls came with only 6 pieces and were around $14. What? This ain't River North, girl. Anyway, I liked the truffle roll best (no surprise) and the crunch least. It just felt so ordinary. The server was nice, especially since she handled all patrons by herself but I felt for being empty, the chefs were painfuly slow. I almost missed my post-dinner plans that night because they either forgot my order or had something more important to do. With the countless sushi spots in chicago, this one is decent but not my fav. Sorry, overlooked kid in class, I like your friend across the way better!

11.description: I came here because of a Living Social offer. There are two good qualities about this place: the ambience and the service was exceptional. The waitstaff was attentive, listened, and were very kind. The waitstaff, however, cannot help what is being made in the kitchen. This is where trouble came:When you have a Japanese restaurant that specializes in sushi and the sushi is at best a C- there is nothing special about the establishment. The spicy mayo resembled nacho cheese (was just unappetizing to look at) and it wasn't all that spicy which basically meant it was nacho-colored mayo. We had the spring rolls, takitori octopus, agadashi tofu, spicy scallop roll, salmon, Miami, and the spicy tuna. Here are my thoughts on each item:-spring rolls, nothing special and has a weird liquid smoke flavor in the sauce and in the roll. Didn't work, unappetizing. -taketori octopus was decent except the octopus was tough which means it was slightly under cooler. -agedashi tofu was overall decent. Soft, nice tempura batter. Just a bit heavy on the fish sauce. -spicy scallop roll I could barley taste scallops. It was odd.-salmon roll: standard. Hard to mess up-the Miami roll has the weird nacho cheese looking mayo and the tuna roll both had a very odd oil taste. I couldn't put my finger on it, but it tasted as though they maybe needed to change the oils in the fryer or they used some sesame oil or something in both of these rolls that just did not work.Overall, it's a shame because the staff is great and the ambience is good. But they need to step up their game since it was a Friday night and not busy and there are better sushi places in the surrounding area. I wish this place the best but I won't be back.

39.description: Walked in here alone on a Tuesday night with a groupon, and I sat at the sushi bar in a nearly empty restaurant. There was one couple when I came in and a different couple when I walked out. It was super clean and nicely decorated and I was well taken care of, but the servers were almost too attentive. It's awkward being stared at while stuffing giant rolls into your mouth.I had a beer and was presented with a complimentary salmon amuse bouche- it was hard to eat with the chopsticks and I couldn't get all the flavors in one bite, but it was tasty in a deconstructed way as well. I had ordered the soft shell crab appetizer to start. The crab had a really creative presentation with tempura legs coming out all over the place in a little fried wonton bowl. It was tasty as any deep-fried shellfish would be, but I didn't die and go to heaven. For my rolls I tried the Godzilla and the Turtle and both were enormous and flavorful, but again, no heaven on earth moments there. At the end you get half an orange- how refreshing!

37.description: Used an Amazon Local deal for three sushi makis: turtle maki, snowball maki, and crunchy maki. My fave was the snowball.  There's nothing wrong with the food and the atmosphere is great, but I think the price is high for average sushi.  I probably wouldn't come back without another discount.

0.description: Since my heart attack in May 2015 I've eliminated salt from my diet. The staff here have been wonderful in teaching me which things I can and cannot have.We enjoy the food and hospitality so much (plus the late closing) that we schedule post-concert dinners here with our friends. Tonight there will be 18 of us!

38.description: I'm quite disappointed with the sushi and ramen. The sushi was decent.  The wasabi seemed watered down. Everything just seemed very soggy.

51.description: This stylish sushi bar offers so excellent cooked and raw items.  The Tuna Tower and Hamachi Jalapeno were our favorites. Service (by presumably the owner) was friendly and attentive. You can sit in a cozy booth in the front windows, or have a more private space in the rear.

27.description: my homie and i came here for dinner on a wed evenin & the place was dead. only 2 other people eatin but that didnt deter us from tryin it. decor ad ambiance was great! we both loved the paintings on the walls. we also liked the waves lookin wall! pretty cool! service was great but it better have been since they werent busy at all. the food was really good too! we were both satisfied with all the rolls we ordered. it was a tad bit pricey for what u get but nothin too outrageous. would definitely come back!

32.description: I came here because of a Living Social offer. There are two good qualities about this place: the ambience and the service was exceptional. The waitstaff was attentive, listened, and were very kind. The waitstaff, however, cannot help what is being made in the kitchen. This is where trouble came:When you have a Japanese restaurant that specializes in sushi and the sushi is at best a C- there is nothing special about the establishment. The spicy mayo resembled nacho cheese (was just unappetizing to look at) and it wasn't all that spicy which basically meant it was nacho-colored mayo. We had the spring rolls, takitori octopus, agadashi tofu, spicy scallop roll, salmon, Miami, and the spicy tuna. Here are my thoughts on each item:-spring rolls, nothing special and has a weird liquid smoke flavor in the sauce and in the roll. Didn't work, unappetizing. -taketori octopus was decent except the octopus was tough which means it was slightly under cooler. -agedashi tofu was overall decent. Soft, nice tempura batter. Just a bit heavy on the fish sauce. -spicy scallop roll I could barley taste scallops. It was odd.-salmon roll: standard. Hard to mess up-the Miami roll has the weird nacho cheese looking mayo and the tuna roll both had a very odd oil taste. I couldn't put my finger on it, but it tasted as though they maybe needed to change the oils in the fryer or they used some sesame oil or something in both of these rolls that just did not work.Overall, it's a shame because the staff is great and the ambience is good. But they need to step up their game since it was a Friday night and not busy and there are better sushi places in the surrounding area. I wish this place the best but I won't be back.

54.description: Usagi-Ya-hot-usagi-youUsagi for me, usagi for youReally nice space and atmosphere and not too difficult to have a quiet evening meal on non-weekends. Great place to have an awkward conversation about breaking up, coming out of the closet, or going back into the closet after breaking up.Hot towels upon entrance. Very classy and effective if you don't know where your date's hands have been (perhaps more so if you do!). In this weather I wish they had a full body version.Super attentive service. The waitstaff are friendly and helpful with menu item choices. The drink service is superb! The dirty and regular 'sake-tini' pack more punch than a Bruce Lee movie (or Bruce Leroy if you catch the above reference). Honestly you'd have to go to boystown to find a cock-tail pairing this good (sake, cucumber and kettle one vodka - the dirty version uses unfiltered sake).  [Also, if you don't mind radiating fellow humans and killing tens of thousands of civilians - you can request the nagasaki-tini version - I hear Truman loved it.] But we're talking about food! Sushi Must Tries include:Summer RollTuna Kamikaze MakiSpider RollNoodle Must Tries include:Thai Ocean Noodle (have never seen anywhere else)Nabeyaki UdonLastly - though not exactly 'cheap' the sushi chef combos aren't too expensive and when I've ordered have never disappointed. Considering that half the reviews include disclaimers involving Groupon, TravelZoo, or some other deal site - you can't go wrong going this route especially when you're getting it for less than retail.

48.description: Getting deals or certificates is the best way to enjoy Usagi Ya.  Good food quality.  Same pricing as others.  The tasting menu deal is comparable to others, but you get more food -- plenty of brown bag.  I appreciate that most dishes are available for the deal.Hot Hand Towels -- Yay!Dirtytini -- strong, boozy woozy.  Great value.Honey Moon Shrimp -- plenty of shrimps.  Decent sauce.Orange Mouse Cake ($8) -- very orangey.  Good portion.  Cold.  Seems outsourced by the circle :-).Other good dishes:Goma AeRainbowSpiderService -- Consistent and appropriate check-up.  Knowledgable.  Informative.Venue -- Romantic.  Quiet.

44.description: They will not honor deals from the Community Appreciation Program coupon package.  I had a "Four Course Dinner for Two for $35" but they charged me $76 and took off $35 which is NOT what the coupon states.  The owner continues to tell me that the coupons are wrong and they're not even supposed to give me anything off.  I should have read the reviews before I purchased the coupon package.  It looks like even in 2013 they were doing the same scam.  If they don't honor the coupons, then why are they still for sale?  This was the most frustrating dining experience I have ever had.  The food was mediocre and doesn't even total $76 if you were to order a la carte.  The four course menu was printed on marked up crinkled paper.  The whole deal seemed shady.

24.description: Service : 5+Our waitress was attentive, informative and easy to talk to.  Food: 3.5 We had a 4 course dinner deal from Groupon. Although  there is value, as another yelper mentioned, there's a different menu with limited options with no substitutions. You may end up having to get an appetizer which you would not normally order because of the way it's structured. I would suggest you go with other deal options so you can try more items off the regular menu. Foodwise, the rolls were all fresh and tasty. We had the summer roll and the spider roll. The steak teriyaki was ok ...a bit chewy. Cold spinach appetizer with peanut sauce was something new we tried. It was a healthier option though I won't have ordered this at all if I had the chance to pick from the regular menu. It's worth a try so go see for your self

7.description: After a Saturday evening concert, came here with friends.  Stylish décor with a solid lineup of sushi and Asian fare.The highlight of the evening was the dirty saketini.  Looked good.  Tasted great.  A fellow diner put in her order after seeing mine and finishing something else.I ordered the Sushi Display B (I'm possibly not up on sushi to know why it's called that) and enjoyed.  The entrée came with a spicy tuna roll.   The roll was fresh, tasty, distinctive--yes, I know!  How is that?  Distinctive?--but it was!My partner wound her way through avoiding gluten issues, eventually ordering steak teriyaki.  It got an 'okay'.  The server asked if she wanted it 'well done', causing me to blanch.   Got it medium rare--it came that way, but did not overly impress.While not taking a taste, the mango shrimp looked like a winner.8 guests at the table.  Our server was efficient and friendly.  A good late night stop.

49.description: We really enjoyed this sushi restaurant.  Unfortunately it was under attended.  Sadly there was only one other table of customers while we dined there on a Saturday night.  The service was great.  The sushi was fresh and delicious.  I'm a fan of the tuna, white tuna and unagi.  Our chef selected platter was a beautiful assortment of nigiri, a spicy tuna roll and a California roll.  The vegetable fried rice was also very tasty.  This is a classic sushi restaurant.  No gimmicks, traditional sushi.

40.description: Fresh fish is the most important thing about sushi, and they have that. They chef is very creative with their sushi concoctions, so this isn't a "starter" sushi place. They have fried sushi, mushroom sushi, all sorts of good stuff. Nothing is really hot on the menu- including the fireball. But it is very good. Also new on the menu was their pork belly starter- which was the best tasting thing all night. Make sure you get the port belly if you go! The decor is lively and the service was very friendly. Only downside to this is I felt it was a little pricey for what it was.

53.description: Just another mediocre sushi spot. I believe it was a Tuesday or Wednesday when I stopped in, it was the last day to use my living social voucher and I didn't want it to go to waste.  We ordered the edamame and chicken yakitori as appetizers.  The edamame was perfectly salted and the chicken skewers were delicious.  The sushi however, did not live up to same standards.  We had three rolls and nothing was really outstanding.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good enough to make me want to go back.  I also tried their dessert, which was pretty good and a great way to end the meal. Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to dine there, but if they offer another deal I might perhaps stop in again and give them another chance.

30.description: I really thought going to this restaurant was going to be a great experience but it was the worst experience ever.  When we arrived we were the only customers in there and  I guess that was our first red flag.  The guy who took our orders wasn't very friendly and the lady who was also there helping him was even worst.  They did act like they didn't want to be bothered. And when our food came out it wasn't what we ordered and when I told the guy that we didn't order that. The lady snatch the food, stomped on the floor and said something.  At that moment I told her to bring one of the orders back because I didn't want to piss off the person handling our food.  So I ended up eating a very bland order of tempura Shrimp.  Once our entree's arrived I was hoping that the lady had calmed down and there wouldn't be any issue with our food.  So we ate and everything was ok.  We ended up paying about $20 more than expected and just really was disappointed in the whole experience.  When I tell you that by the time we made it home, our stomachs were hurting so bad, We all threw up several times and had other issues all night.  And when I tell you we had serious issue for 3 days, I swear to you that the lady had to have put something in our food.  She was so mean and pissed about having to take back one of the orders that I think this was her way of getting back at us. I have never been so sick, I don't know if they gave us old food or just added something that gave us food poison.  BUT NOW I UNDERSTAND WHY NO ONE WAS IN THERE.. BAD SERVICE, BAD ATTITUDES & BAD FOOD.

46.description: If it was possible to give this establishment negative amount of stars, I would. My review is mainly about the management of this place and partially about the quality of the food. ***WARNING! If you have a "community appreciation program" voucher, they will not honor it in its entirety.*** We came here hoping to use our "community appreciation program" voucher to redeem the "dinner spectacular" (we will attach pictures for clarification) where it says on the voucher that we will save UP TO $100. But when we confirmed with the owner/manager, he said it was only good for up to $50 off. So fine, we will choose another option. We chose the "two four course dinners package for $35" and the waitress proceeded to confirm with the owner what this was and came back and gave us the details. We proceeded to order as we assumed this offer is still valid. (According to the waitress and the owner, you can't combine two of these options in one sitting although it never specified this in the terms and conditions.) So, we ordered the gyoza, spider roll, summer roll, ton katsu for entree and two saketinis. After finishing the whole meal, my boyfriend and I were both still not stuffed but that's not the point. We asked for our bill and looks like they charged us $76 for the whole meal plus 20% gratuity and only deducted $35 as the "discount". We were confused as this voucher clearly states that this whole meal was FOR $35, NOT a $35 savings... We then asked to speak to the owner who proceeded to tell us that this voucher was not even honored to begin with and said that the waitress had informed us of this which was not the case. He proceeded to tell us that he "did us a favor" and "deducted $35 from our bill even though they didn't honor the voucher". The owner kept cutting us off when we tried to explain that this was not told to us. Because had we known this, we would have not ordered and ate at this establishment. The owner was very rude and and insisted that we get our money back from the company who sold us this voucher (which we will) which is probably why he felt he was doing us a "favor". Bottom line is we will NEVER return to this restaurant ever again solely due to the attitude of management. They didn't seem to want to please their customers anyways.

1.description: Usagi Ya sushi & Pan-Asian was disappointing. It's mainly a Japanese menu with some Chinese items on it. They have sushi rolls as well on a  separate ordering sheet. They have a really nice decor the place is sleek with a modern artistic flare. When we arrived there at around 5:00ish p.m. the  hostess seated us immediately to a private seating area that seem to be made for either a party of a romantic dinner for two. It was a nice set up with bench seating with pillow cushions and a bench table. Only you have to climb into the the seating to get seated and get out. Which was new thing for me and my husband. This type of seating would only work for people who are young and active, because I can't see older people climbing into a room to get seated LOL! It's just funny thinking about it right? Anyhoo, let get to the food! So we sat down in our private boxed room with a nice big window to look out at. We had a groupon it was like $20 for $40 value. We ordered two sushi roll, tonkotsu ramen and teriyaki dinner.Okay let's break it downWe had spicy scallop and tuna roll it was good. We liked it. But it wasn't outstanding sushi or anything. Tonkotsu Ramen was okay it wasn't that tasty in my opinion. I the pork belly in it tasted good. I felt it was more of a Chinese take on ramen.The Teriyaki plate dinner was a negative on so many levels. First the person who took our order didn't even ask how we wanted the steak to be cooked. She just asked the chef to make it medium. For us that is a total negative because we always like our steak medium rare bc we don't like hard steak. The steak looked to me like it was boiled it didn't look like it had any kind of searing done to it. It was on a plate with two or three pieces of broccoli some kind of carrot garnish and teriyaki sauce. Oh, and a bowl of rice on the side. The plate came with one bowl of miso soup which was just okay.We couldn't enjoy the steak it was so sad! Also If we go to other Japanese restaurant for a $20 N.Y stripe steak it should be really good am I right? I would prefer teriyaki beef over un-edible steak. For $20 they should've added more flare to the plate, perhaps some tempura and instead of rice mebbe a bento box with some sushi too. Make up for terrible steak.We will not be returning to this establishment I'm so sorry to say. Even though the service was fast and attentive. We hope they can improve somehow. Please get a better quality of steak! A New York strip steak is suppose be a beautiful cut and this cut didn't seem like a N.Y. strip steak.

55.description: Always check out their daily special maki.  the snowball rolls are great and they have a good seaweed salad.  there is never anyone in this place, but as I live around the corner and eat there regularly, I am guessing most of their business comes from carry out.  I do like sitting in the front windows in the warmer months though...

9.description: The best thing on the menu is the Dynamite Mussels! Baked with chilli spice these were very good. Also had the Godzilla roll and summer roll, which were great. The Dirtytini was a bit strong, vodka and sake mixed together is a lot of alcohol with not a lot a flavor. They don't have a very creative menu, good for a sushi novice. Service was on point, she was very thorough and explained everything clearly.

26.description: I previously posted a bad review of this restaurant, only to find that somehow it was removed. The fact is that we had very bad service (5/17/2015)  (slow and inattentive), and I did not think that the quality of the food was good either. To be specific, I ordered a Ramen soup, which Lacked flavor until I added a lot of soy sauce.  I should have sent it back.  Typically I like authentic Ramen, and I have had my fair share of very good quality Ramen. I am not sure if this recipe truly it's from scratch at the restaurant (the server claimed it was when asked), but it was very disappointing. More than that, I had ordered an uni shooter and was served an oyster shooter instead, but not told. I only realized this after I did the shot. I have an allergy to oysters so imagine my dismay. I told the server of the problem at the end of our visit and was told the reason was that they were out of uni.  I was offered no apology with this information.  I asked for the item to be removed from the check.  After I told her I had an allergy to oysters, I still received no apology.  Instead she got annoyed and told me that since I ate it, I should pay for it. I insisted on getting the refund.  She definitely was unhappy with me as she took the check away without another word, but ultimately did remove it from the bill.  I will not go back to this restaurant.  If my review is removed again I will repost it.  Please contact me, yelp, if you have any issues with this review.

25.description: We came on a Monday night at about 8pm. There was only one other table when we walked in but as the dinner progressed a few more tables were seated. Obviously on a Monday I wouldn't expect it to be busy, but I was a bit surprised because the restaurant itself is so beautiful. So my friend and I came with the 4-course Groupon for $35 which included: 2 Martinis, 1 appetizer, 1 regular maki, 1 special maki, and one shared entree. We had ordered a saketini and dirty saketini (unfiltered sake) to drink and both were very delicious. We also had the gyoza to start, spider and summer rolls, and steak teriyaki as the shared entree. Everything tasted great and the service was great too. The only reason I gave it 4/5 stars is because the Groupon description was a little misleading as to what you could order. We knew that there were "up to" value limits but we thought it was for the entire menu. When we told the server we had the Groupon, he brought us a menu of limited items to pick from just for Groupon guests. It wasn't a huge set back as we still were able to order most of what we wanted anyways but I guess just having a larger selection would have been nicer?Again it's a shame the place isn't as busy as shittier sushi places like Sushi Para but hey, some people don't know good sushi from bad. I'd definitely come back again!

12.description: Getting deals or certificates is the best way to enjoy Usagi Ya.  Good food quality.  Same pricing as others.  The tasting menu deal is comparable to others, but you get more food -- plenty of brown bag.  I appreciate that most dishes are available for the deal.Hot Hand Towels -- Yay!Dirtytini -- strong, boozy woozy.  Great value.Honey Moon Shrimp -- plenty of shrimps.  Decent sauce.Orange Mouse Cake ($8) -- very orangey.  Good portion.  Cold.  Seems outsourced by the circle :-).Other good dishes:Goma AeRainbowSpiderService -- Consistent and appropriate check-up.  Knowledgable.  Informative.Venue -- Romantic.  Quiet.

59.description: WARNING: Usagi Ya will not honor restaurant.com coupons. I presented one last weekend that I purchased on 12/2/13 and they would not take it or any other restaurant.com coupons.

21.description: I have been here 3 times in as many days and the service and food has been excellent. Had Tuna tartare which was a great appetizer, very tasty and a great start to our meal. All service personnel and the manager have been excellent and very attentive. I am not from Chicago but will make a point to visit again on my return.

17.description: I was visiting Chicago with a friend and found a groupon for 2. We had the edamame, the red dragon roll, spicy tuna roll, and the honeymoon chicken (similar to orange chicken with a kick). The meal also included miso soup,  rice,  and sake.  Everything was so delicious, the portions were generous (probably enough for 3 people), and the service was great. Definitely worth the price.

10.description: Came for a late lunch and only 1 other table was there. Clean and nice ambience, but a bit creepy eating next to a painting and you look up and their private part is there. Weird.Unagi-Jalapeno Tempura - I've always wanted to try this and it was good, but wished the Unagi taste was a bit stronger. Also, $12 for it is too much.Turtle Maki - I liked this.Honey Moon Chicken - My guy liked this. Nice and tender with a bit of spiciness to it.Thai Ocean Noodle - This had a spicy taste and then the lemongrass comes through. Not bad, but wasn't much noodles in it.Overall, the food was good, but pricey for what you get.

5.description: First time here. Saw it on groupon and thought to give it a chance. I have to say what a great chance I took. The food is so good and the maki. The drinks are delicious and strong. So so good and so much food for how much you pay. Stop by grab a drink and eat yummy food. Great to hang out with friends.

3.description: I keep coming back, and Usagi Ya keeps growing on me.  The wall paintings are very unusual, but you don't have to look at them.  And for some reason the air temp is always just slightly uncomfortable, either too hot or too cold, and it changes day to day.  But the food is good.Of course we started off with the beef tataki, very nice cuts of meat in a slightly spicy sauce, and on top of black mushrooms.  Always tasty, although sometimes you can see some fat on the pieces (and eat around it).  Another staple is the Tonkatsu ramen.  This hasn't been quite consistent, sometimes it is more creamy and sometimes not as much.  And we finish with the Dragon roll, which has consistently been good, and I say this as someone who is not a big fan of eel.

35.description: A couple of years ago I played hooky from school and stopped by Usagi Ya. It was one of the better meals I had had in Chicago. I had some great Wasabi Dumplings and a Spicy Tuna roll. Both were top notch. Flash forward to a couple of days ago. We wanted sushi and some entree dishes. We had eaten at Usagi Ya a couple times over the years . . . I ordered some sushi and a curry. It just was blah. Even the presentation of our delivery blah. The curry came in a three reservoir styrofoam container. It has spilled and splashed all over. The sushi rolls  were alright but nothing to write home about (just yelp). It was okay. I think price wise and in the area we can do better than okay.

19.description: Came here over the weekend for lunch. It was great! Service was wonderful. Their ramen was SO good! And the sashimi platter had good sized pieces of fish that tasted very fresh. It's reasonably priced and some of the best sushi in wicker park for sure. I'll definitely dine here again, and recommend to friends.

28.description: I'm sad to write a bad review but I really wouldn't come back. We were the only ones in the restaurant on a Friday at 7:30/8. I hoped it was just because it was march madness and they didn't have a TV but guessed it probably had more to do with the recent yelp reviews I read. We had a gilt city voucher and were the only ones in the place so perhaps that had some effect on our food.  The gyoza was good but we only got 4 instead of the menu description of 6 (we didn't pay for anything individually but the menu price on the gyoza was $6). Then we got a spicy scallop role that was 3/4 filled with cucumber & 1/4 scallop. Don't know the menu price.The red dragon roll was tasty but had such a thin strip of tempura shrimp that my dining partner questioned whether it had shrimp anywhere in the roll other than the ends where you could see it sticking out.  It wasn't very large in diameter/portion for the $13 menu price.Lastly we had the steak teriyaki.  The taste was pretty good but if I had paid $20 for that steak portion and single ice cream scooper of rice, I would have been very disappointed.The service was fine but there is just really no reason to patronize this restaurant vs others in the area. There are so many better sushi restaurants (sushi x, butterfly, nori, kin) nearby that this pales in comparison and I really can't recommend that anyone dine here.

45.description: My girlfriend and I came here on a Tuesday to use our expiring Amazon local deal. The place had a nice ambiance, but it was pretty empty for dinner time. Maybe 1-2 other tables were full while we were there. We order the avocado, cucumber, asparagus for an appetizer, which was good. I got the veggie yakisoba and my girlfriend got the seafood udon. We both enjoyed our entrees, but we agree that this isn't a place we'd come out of our way to come back to. I'd probably go back if I was in the area and somebody I was with wanted to come here, but I'd probably be more interested in trying something new nearby. I feel like sushi places are a dime a dozen in Chicago, so it's hard to really stand out.

33.description: Came here with a Gilt City deal ($30 for $50). Read beforehand that the place was never quite busy. Came Friday around 9pm and there were just a few other occupied tables.It was nice that we were given warm hand towels upon seating.Bf and I get the miso ramen, beef fried rice, summer roll, rainbow roll, and one piece of uni.The rolls were not made with too much rice. The summer roll was very good in particular, but this is my favorite roll anywhere. The rainbow roll tasted fine, although the fish definitely wasn't as fresh as it could be. My piece of uni was pretty good.The miso ramen was fine. Wasn't expecting to compete with the top ramen places around, but it sufficed my craving. The noodles were on the soft side and was reminiscent of instant ramen noodles from the packet. The pork belly was very good, but there was only one piece of it. Egg was overcooked. Broth was decent. The real drawback was the piece of wood ear was not washed and was very gritty. Bf enjoyed the beef fried rice. Beef was a little overcooked, but the flavors and rice were good.Service was very good. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. I liked that she didn't make it awkward, when I busted out my Gilt deal. Instead, she took it in the beginning, so she didn't have to bother me about it later.Overall, food was quite mediocre and is just another place to add on to the numerous Japanese spots in the city.

43.description: Came for a late lunch and only 1 other table was there. Clean and nice ambience, but a bit creepy eating next to a painting and you look up and their private part is there. Weird.Unagi-Jalapeno Tempura - I've always wanted to try this and it was good, but wished the Unagi taste was a bit stronger. Also, $12 for it is too much.Turtle Maki - I liked this.Honey Moon Chicken - My guy liked this. Nice and tender with a bit of spiciness to it.Thai Ocean Noodle - This had a spicy taste and then the lemongrass comes through. Not bad, but wasn't much noodles in it.Overall, the food was good, but pricey for what you get.

2.description: Saw Usagi Groupon deal for a while and finally bit on the deal. Went on a Saturday evening with my wife for date night and liked the romantic atmosphere. We even got a window table! On the other hand, the half-naked paintings killed that vibe pretty quickly. The hot towels were a nice touch, but still... those paintings!!Service was quick and responsive, and food came rather quickly after ordering. We ordered two rolls, a bowl of ramen, and a NY strip teriyaki plate.The sushi was pretty good, but the sushi was too sticky (gelatinous) making it hard to appreciate the nice cut of tuna inside the roll. The spicy scallop roll was better and felt like the rice on that roll was from a different batch of rice. We much preferred the taste of the scallop roll.Next up, we got the New York strip teriyaki plate and a bowl of  tonkatsu ramen. Don't order the teriyaki plate. The steak was dry, overcooked, and tasted like an inferior cut. New York strip is supposed to be great. This was not! Told the waitress about this, and her response was that she told the kitchen to cook it medium and if I wanted to order anything else. No thanks. :/The tonkatsu ramen was so much better. It wasn't your traditional style even though it has the same ingredients. The broth was pleasantly less salty than other ramen joints. It tasted more Chinese in its soup mildness. There was plenty of pork, bamboo, bean sprouts, etc. Filling for sure!So would I come here again? Probably not, but if you score a Groupon, it's worth a shot and you skip the steak teriyaki plate. Temper your expectations, and you'll have a fine time.

18.description: My review is on the service as we never got the chance to eat the food.  My GF and I bought a Groupon for a four course meal for two. Another couple who are friends of ours also bought the same coupon, so we decided to go together. We showed up around 7:30pm on a Saturday, no wait, the restaurant was pretty much a graveyard, and we were seated immediately. We let the waitress know that we had the Groupon, she said that we could only use one per table.  We asked if she would reconsider losing our business (which was the only business she had at that time) , and letting us sit at separate tables then, and she gave us a very hard no. Look you can look at it from the standpoint that rules are rules, but what does it matter to them? We brought two coupons to feed four people and just so happens we knew each other, we even offered to sit separately, and they said no--so instead of getting money from your Groupon and a tip, you get nothing.

41.description: Wow.  So the husbo and I came in here on Monday for some seaweed salad to go (We had amazing steel-head fillets at home and thought it would be a good accompaniment) and while we were there it dawned me that we had been visiting Usagi-Ya since it's opening in 2004!!!  This place is great.  The sushi is always wonderful, the owner is always helpful and the prices are sushi expected.  I'm so happy this place has weathered the years and stuck around.  I've never left disappointed and have always been stuffed.  Such a good sushi place that knows their fish.Highly highly recommend. And, sometimes, if you go and sit at the bar on a lonely Tuesday afternoon, the sushi chef may make you a creation all his own to try.

52.description: I've been to 30 different sushi restaurants in Chicago.   This is by far the best Sushi I've had.  Everything was perfectly prepared, the staff was the most attentive, and the atmosphere was perfect.   It was really as if there was someone cooking a private dinner for me in my house, instead of being out at a restaurant.

50.description: Grabbed a $25 for $50 amazon local deal and made the most of it at Usagi Ya. The place was pretty dead on a Fri night so I understood their need to promote on a daily deal site. Being across the street from another really good sushi place must be tough. It's like being assigned to sit next to the most popular girl in class. No one's gonna pay attention to you even if you have a great personality. We had the Miami roll (seemed appropriate), crunchy and the truffle roll. Most rolls came with only 6 pieces and were around $14. What? This ain't River North, girl. Anyway, I liked the truffle roll best (no surprise) and the crunch least. It just felt so ordinary. The server was nice, especially since she handled all patrons by herself but I felt for being empty, the chefs were painfuly slow. I almost missed my post-dinner plans that night because they either forgot my order or had something more important to do. With the countless sushi spots in chicago, this one is decent but not my fav. Sorry, overlooked kid in class, I like your friend across the way better!

4.description: Service : 5+Our waitress was attentive, informative and easy to talk to.  Food: 3.5 We had a 4 course dinner deal from Groupon. Although  there is value, as another yelper mentioned, there's a different menu with limited options with no substitutions. You may end up having to get an appetizer which you would not normally order because of the way it's structured. I would suggest you go with other deal options so you can try more items off the regular menu. Foodwise, the rolls were all fresh and tasty. We had the summer roll and the spider roll. The steak teriyaki was ok ...a bit chewy. Cold spinach appetizer with peanut sauce was something new we tried. It was a healthier option though I won't have ordered this at all if I had the chance to pick from the regular menu. It's worth a try so go see for your self

6.description: I got a groupon for this place for a four course meal. It didn't have amazing reviews, but I was willing to try for that price. When we got there, it was completely dead, no one else eating there. The seating is alright, but the decor and paintings are real weird, definitely not something I thought I would see at a sushi place. I told them that I had the groupon for the four course meal and he came back with a separate sheet of paper. He would only let us order off of the set list, even after I showed him that the groupon said otherwise. I was very frustrated that the groupon was not correct and I had very little variety. My girlfriend asked if he had any hot sauce, so he brought a little bit, which he charged me for later. The food was okay, nothing special at all. Would have been better to make my own. We got the gyoza/dumplings(4), summer roll, another maki roll that I forgot, honey moon shrimp (not very much food), sake, and a dirtitini. We didn't like either of the drinks, but we just aren't big sake fans. The server was very kind through everything, but I was still frustrated. I will not ever be going back.

22.description: First, the good: Our waitress was friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. She was the only positive part of the experience.Second, BEWARE if you buy a Groupon for this place. They let you select from only a small subset of the menu if you are using one, and nothing in the Groupon description tells you this. We had the four-course dinner for $35 deal (one appetizer, one maki, one special maki, one appetizer, two sake drinks), and when we arrived we discovered that although the deal says you can have an appetizer up to $10 and maki up to $10 and $14, respectively, they limit your appetizer choices to essentially salads and gyoza, even though there are plenty of others on the menu for under $10, and they let you choose between just 5 of the special maki, even though there are others listed for the same prices. They clearly selected options that give them the highest profit margins.So, with that griping aside: the sushi was very mediocre. The special rolls have cheap, low quality fillings and the used too much mayonnaise. We ordered some sashimi to supplement the meal deal and it did not taste fresh at all. The teriyaki chicken entree was decent although the meat was a bit dry. We will definitely never go back here.

15.description: Went here with a coupon, and it was a great experience. The selections available with this coupon were more than adequate, and everything was great. Wasn't very crowded on a Friday night, but that's okay, it made for a quiet dinner in an area that can get pretty loud.

57.description: Introduced to this place because of a Living Social coupon. Very nice atmosphere. Easy to get a table. Very pleasant wait staff.I have to agree with others that the sushi is good - not great - and swings a bit high on the price. However, what I really enjoyed about this restaurant - and what will have me come back - is that the full menu is very complete and offers more than just sushi. Many of my favorite sushi restaurants offer a limited selection of other menu items. Usagi Ya has a nice variety - we enjoyed the tuna tower and a delicious sliced beef appetizer.  So when dining with friends who are looking for something beyond sushi - I would definitely come back here.

20.description: Went here with a coupon, and it was a great experience. The selections available with this coupon were more than adequate, and everything was great. Wasn't very crowded on a Friday night, but that's okay, it made for a quiet dinner in an area that can get pretty loud.

36.description: Another expiring Groupon deal meant that we made a visit to Usagi Ya last Friday for lunch.  Besides a salmon maki roll we had as part of a specials menu, the other sushi here was just okay and the veggie tempura was fine, but not as good as others we have had in the neighborhood.  Given the location of Seadog and Yuzu, it's hard to imagine coming back here, since the food is average and the prices are a tad bit high.  But my wife and I both thought the two people who seated us and served our meal were friendly and quick, and I liked the space, very peaceful.

14.description: Came here with a Gilt City deal ($30 for $50). Read beforehand that the place was never quite busy. Came Friday around 9pm and there were just a few other occupied tables.It was nice that we were given warm hand towels upon seating.Bf and I get the miso ramen, beef fried rice, summer roll, rainbow roll, and one piece of uni.The rolls were not made with too much rice. The summer roll was very good in particular, but this is my favorite roll anywhere. The rainbow roll tasted fine, although the fish definitely wasn't as fresh as it could be. My piece of uni was pretty good.The miso ramen was fine. Wasn't expecting to compete with the top ramen places around, but it sufficed my craving. The noodles were on the soft side and was reminiscent of instant ramen noodles from the packet. The pork belly was very good, but there was only one piece of it. Egg was overcooked. Broth was decent. The real drawback was the piece of wood ear was not washed and was very gritty. Bf enjoyed the beef fried rice. Beef was a little overcooked, but the flavors and rice were good.Service was very good. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. I liked that she didn't make it awkward, when I busted out my Gilt deal. Instead, she took it in the beginning, so she didn't have to bother me about it later.Overall, food was quite mediocre and is just another place to add on to the numerous Japanese spots in the city.

58.description: Annie's a no bullsh*t kinda gal. I like that. Edit is a cute lil' salon, although busy and a little louder than I'd like. But that just depends on your taste; I'd prefer to be more relaxed, personally (am I getting old?). Edit is easier to get to for me than Epoch (also excellent), where I normally would have gone, which is why I tried it...I'd say Epoch offers a more quiet, relaxing atmosphere. However, I watched other stylists as well while I got my hair done and everyone seems very skilled. Seems like you'd be safe in any of their hands.  Thanks for fixing my hair! :)

56.description: Just had maybe the best haircut of my life with Patrick. He's the first person who's really known what to do with my thick, wavy mop.  I walked in hating my hair and left *loving* it. The guy really knows what he's doing. So glad to finally find an awesome stylist!

29.description: This place is super cute and friendly... but the reason I'll be back is that I had a fantastic cut by Crisby.  He did an incredible job!  I have lots of thick, wavy hair - it's not easy to style.  But Crisby listened, asked the right questions and I walked out with amazing hair - exactly what I wanted, even after I styled it myself (which is the true test).  I don't think I've ever received this many compliments on it.  Coming from someone who has a very specific look in mind and is rarely happy with my hair, I can say that I am literally thrilled that I found Crisby & Edit Salon.

42.description: I absolutely love this salon! Allison is amazing at color. I love that the salon has "colorists" who just specialize in color and I was very satisfied with the results. I came back and had a cut/style with Johnny and he is just the best! Let's just say my hair is really long and had not been cut in quite a while... he never made me feel bad about it, but instead made me feel excited about what he was going to do to fix it! I also appreciate the education the stylists give to their clients. They were not pushy on products, but after seeing the difference in my hair in a couple of days I purchased the bumble and bumble and my hair is healthier than ever! And there is wine. Which to me was just icing on the cake.

23.description: I'm a pretty low maintenance person so this was my first time at an actual salon making an actual hair appointment (basically my rating is skewed because I had no expectations). I needed to cut off 9 inches because the amount of shampoo and time to wash it was just too much. Also, I decided to spend the extra money so that I could properly donate it to Pantene Beautiful Lengths (do some research about the organization before you donate). Johnny did a great job; he was meticulous and relaxed, kind of like a chill perfectionist. He welcomed all my suggestions and Google images. I didn't feel unwanted at all even though I was the last appointment of the day. Watching Herby (sp?) the bulldog wrestle with someone through the mirror was entertaining too. Lots of compliments on my hair and though I probably wouldn't spend $60+ on my hair in the near future, it was worth it! I'll be back in a couple of years when I'm sick of my length again.

47.description: Allison Elmore is a fabulous colorist and Edit is such a cute salon! I am constantly switching up my hair and I am so fortunate to have found such great talent in Chicago. I have been Allison's client for a few months and I have left extremely happy every time. Recently I had her put pastel purple  on my hair and it turned out exactly how I had pictured it! I have never gotten so many compliments on my hair. Allison is true talent that you can definitely trust.

8.description: I hate what was done to my hair. The stylist was a total sweetheart and I did what I never do: relax and just let the person ply their trade without my anxious commentary. I have a terrible layering job that I didn't ask for. I always say to please preserve my length, that I wanted only to cut the dry parts off my very long hair. I cannot even believe how short the outer layers are and how absurd it all looks now that I've washed and dried it. He even said, "you won't need to blow/brush it out like this" taking care to respond to the comments I was making about needing to remain super low maintenance, wash and wear. To fix this cut I am going to need someone to cut my hair short short. I'm pissed, really. What did I just drop $75 on? I know this guy must know what he's doing, but not with my hair. I just look awful. It's blunt and all one length underneath and over this he cut off up to three inches. If you Google "bad layered haircut" it comes up with chop jobs like the one I have. I want my money back, honestly. I really, really, hate my hair right now and I'm pissed off that I will be living with this for a long, long time. Two stars because he was nice, because there is a salon dog, because it's a decent location, because I was given water, and because the place was clean. I really like the stylist as a person, but why in the hell he did this to my hair I cannot know, unless he was secretly trying to be mean.

31.description: I've been trying to grow my hair for the longest time, with no success. It becomes brittle, dry, damaged, and everything else you can imagine. I tried micro-loop hair extensions but they only made matters worse - I ended up with thin, lifeless hair. So after some research here in Yelp I decided to go with Edit salon because I read many good reviews from my fellow yelpers, and also had a friend who's a regular this place.  I didn't pick a stylist, as I wanted (NEEDED) an appointment today.  They placed me with Johnny, this extremely friendly Lebanese stylist. And he did a PERFECT job! I am so happy with my result! Johnny is extremely skilled.  He explained to me how he would ideally "fix" my hair, step by step.  Oh, and you haven't lived until you experience his scalp massage. I was in heaven! And on top of it all he is the nicest and sweetest person! In love with him!I feel so pretty right now.  This was an incredible salon experience ( relatively quick too! As I hate spending hours in a salon). Best of all they are located in my hood, which will most definitely contribute to make me a regular! I'm almost holding my compliments because I don't want everyone going to book with Johnny, just because I don't want him to be all around busy and with no time for me! Lmao! But seriously, the guy is an artist! Thank you Johnny!!!!The salon itself is everything you need! Clean, friendly, modern, an experience!  These guys are rocking out!

34.description: Patrick for cuts and Amy for color are the best.  You won't find better in this city.  Just make sure to schedule your appointments well in advance -- they book up super fast!

16.description: I don't have words to describe how great this place is! Johnny has been cutting my hair for about a year, and I've tried some crazy colors with Allison (blue and purple!!!). Great service all around.

13.description: My mom and I came here while in town. I looked up salons in the Chicago area and went with this one based off the good reviews. I had a cut with Johnny and my mom was with Mila. We were offered wine as soon we we checked in. Johnny was super sweet and talkative. Made you feel real comfortable. And my mom said she really liked her haircut with Mila. I liked that they aren't a pushy salon with the products. That's one thing i hate when going to new salons, but i didn't have to deal with that here. I'd definitely return next time I'm in the area.

11.description: I can't understand all the great reviews about this salon. I decided to try it because of the good yelp ratings and was very disappointed by all three visits.The first time, a saw a stylist who is no longer there. She was very professional and the cut was ok, though not really what I asked for. It was difficult to style and did nothing for me.I came back and saw the owner. I have a lot of hair and specifically asked him to remove a lot of the weight. He refused to do that and instead gave me lots of awkward layers that just accentuated the thickness of my hair in all the wrong places. I came back once more, and this time his attempt at removing weight left me with a poofy shelf halfway up my hair that I spent months growing out and having another stylist fix. It seems there is just a lack of technique and understanding of how to manipulate different hair types.On top of this, both haircuts with the owner left a chunk or two longer than the rest of the hair that I had to fix when I got home. I understand that mistakes happen, but at this price point I expect at least the basics to be done right.The experience left something to be desired as the owner kept gossiping about former employees. Again, at this price point I expect better.

39.description: This review is for Crisby, an amazing addition to Edit. I have fine, thin hair, very hard to get a cute cut and easy to get a bad one. Crisby has given me 2 different modern and fresh cuts. Last week, prior to the Golden Globes, he gave me a cut similar to the hottest bob on the red carpet, Rosamund Pike's look of a bob slightly longer on one side. He's extremely talented and great to talk to. He cut my friends hair too, she has long thick curls and she was ecstatic, said it was her best cut in years. Go to him you won't be disappointed!! Also, the salon has a very calm, clean, professional, modern vibe :)

37.description: So happy with this salon. Color by Amy. She is amazing, my hair is blonde and I'm fairly particular about color. Always happy. Cut by Jonny.  Great shape and movement. The best cut I have had in Chicago.

0.description: I normally despise going to the salon, because I have long, thick hair and it takes FOREVER to style. The thought of having to chit chat for three hours sends shivers down my spine. After reading the reviews on Yelp, I thought I'd give Edit a shot. I called to schedule a cut/color and the receptionist was extremely accommodating. She couldn't find one time for both services, so she helped me set up two separate appointments. It's definitely a good sign that this place is booked up a few weeks in advance!I got my hair cut by Crisby, who was incredibly friendly and attentive. I showed him one picture of what I was thinking, and he immediately articulated what was in my head. The haircut was almost exactly what I wanted. He even took the time to add the perfect wave to my cut! At the last minute I asked for some bangs, which weren't exactly what I wanted...but they still look great.I think I may have found my salon in Chicago! I will definitely be back!

38.description: Moving to another city, as big as Chicago, and finding a new hairdresser can be a very stressful experience. After so much research on Price/quality I found Edit. I was assigned to Johnny, recently arrived from London (as well as me). I felt I hit Jackpot!! And I was not wrong!! Johnny knows what's trendy what's old. Freshly arrived from the fashion city of London he started styling my hair! And oh WOW! Hands down!! An extraordinarily HAIR STYLIST. I LOVED LOVED my new hair! If I could I would give Johnny the 6*. Not pricey (as some 300 dollars prices I saw, crazy) and done to perfection! I highly recommend JOHNNY & Edit Salon with the great staff!

51.description: Dana left :.( BUT I just had a haircut with Ash, I wanted my hair cut into a super short pixie cut, it came out looking AWESOME! Also, Ash is really adorable and fun to talk to. I wasn't exactly sure what length I wanted but she really analyzed my hair texture and helped me decide what was best. Make an appointment with her, you won't regret it.

27.description: Got a cut and blowout with Johnny. Oh he is the sweetest man and the best hairdresser. I got it cut over two months ago and it still looks good and grew out well. Thank you so much Johnny.

32.description: I have gone here a number of times and they are top notch. I also love the bull dog. Yvette is a fantastic colorist and Patrick is fabulous at cutting hair. The salon itself is great and they don't push products on you. Make sure to book in advance because they are busy busy! The only thing semi-negative I have to say pertains to one of the women that washes and blows my hair dry. She is quite sweet, but she doesn't do much for the blow drying. I usually walk out with crazy looking bangs and my hair flipped out in all the wrong places (I have thin, straight hair). I manage to get her every time and am not sure how to remedy her odd blow outs. I understand that she isn't there to style it, but she could use a lesson on how to effectively blow dry different types of hair. All in all the holistic experience of amazing color/cuts outweighs the weird blow dry each time.

54.description: LOVE THIS PLACE. If you're like me and tired of paying ridiculous prices at snobby chain salons and walking away with an empty wallet and just OKAY hair, GO TO EDIT. You will have yourself your new salon to call home.I have been eyeballing an asymmetrical haircut on pinterest now for over a year and decided to google salons that could handle this transformation and landed on Edit's awesome yelp reviews. PS.. I had over-processed fine shoulder length bleach blonde hair that needed major rescuing..What I loved: -Stylist Melissa  - SO friendly & she gets it... I want a change here, not too safe, not too crazy. She gets it.-First phone call was very personable and scheduling was a breeze (I even got in same day with an 11am call for a 6pm appt ...lucky I assume because the place was buzzing when I arrived.-Great ambiance/energy/super friendly/everyone was smiling when I walked in (zero snobbiness)-They fed me wine. Um, hello.. wine is thee single most wonderful thing when you're chopping all your hair off.-Waited 5 minutes and Melissa grabbed me and gave me a solid 10 min consult about my chosen style.-I'm going back for my color on Tuesday and am very excited!

48.description: I have been going to Patrick for over a decade now and he's simply the best at cutting hair. I mean, the.best. Read the other reviews bc they are all correct. But this review is for Allison, the genius who colored my hair. I had always been a salon-hopper when it came to color because I have NEVER found anyone that can get it right. My husband calls me the blonde nazi. Every time I came home from a salon I would be so unhappy bc the colorist just didnt listen to what I wanted. Allison did just the opposite......she listened to every little concern I had about my hair and she fricken nailed it. I can't tell you how long it has been since I have been so truly happy with my blonde hair. My best friend (also a blonde nazi) saw my hair and immediately said she is going to see Allison.  My blonde hair finally has luster, radiance and is HEALTHY. Other colorists over processed and my hair would literally fall out.  Do yourself a favor- go see her! And she's a sweetheart to boot.

44.description: Alison rocks my world!I've been going to Alison for color for close to ten years.  I followed her from Art and Science to Edit Salon.  She always does a fantastic job.  I've asked her to go darker, lighter and highlights.  She always nails it.  I highly recommend her - she is great at what she does and also just awesome to talk to in general.Also- props to Edit Salon for serving 2 buck chuck at 9A on Saturday morning.  :)
