24.description: Patrick really help me out when it came to options with my hair & i received many complements from my friends & family & coworkers after my visit about how great my hair came out I definitely would go back and recommend him to anyone

7.description: I'll start off by saying that I usually hate salons because my hair always turns out terrible after. Since my last horror experience, I hadn't done anything to my hair for two years. A few days ago, I decided I wanted to try highlights and based on the yelp reviews, requested an appointment through their website. They responded very promptly (2 business hours) and I came in the next day. As soon as I arrived, I was seated instantly and began consulting with Allison about what kind of highlights I wanted. I came in with the vague idea of ash-toned highlights but I had no examples (not even any pictures), and I wasn't even sure whether that's what I actually wanted. Basically, I was the difficult customer who is picky but doesn't know what she wants. Allison recommended warmer, dark caramel highlights (I'm a brunette) because it didn't require bleaching and was less of a hassle for first-time highlights. I didn't want my hair to look too brassy, but she sounded like she knew what she was talking about so I let her do her thing. On a side note, she's pretty attuned to people. I was exhausted so, while I had a few questions, I was quiet almost the entire time and it didn't feel awkward. She seems like the type to happily talk to you the entire time if you'd like or just leave you to your thoughts. Two hours later, I was handed off to Mila who was very friendly and talkative. (Bonus: She speaks Russian!) I told her that I was trying to grow my hair out and to please PLEASE for the love of god not to cut off more than, like, half an inch. Even though she would have preferred to take off an inch because of the split ends, this girl is the first person in years who LISTENED and did exactly as I asked! And she's not the type to insist because she actually suggested I get layers at first (I agreed as long as she kept the longest layer actually long) but then changed her mind because my hair was a bit too thin on the ends. It's nice to know my hairdresser doesn't have itchy fingers to cut cut cut. She also gave me tips on how to keep my hair more hydrated. Final thoughts: The highlights look really nice and natural like I wanted. I should have gone with the ash-toned ones though because that's what I came in wanting. However, for my first time, I'm glad I listened to Allison and went with the warmer tones. It would have taken even longer with the bleach and I wasn't ready for that. Besides, I've gotten multiple compliments since I left. Mila listened to me and didn't cut off more than I wanted which puts her at the top automatically, hands down.They're definitely pricey but what's great is that on their website, they have full highlights listed as $150+ so I assumed they'd charge me more since I have long hair but no, it was $150 on the dot. My trim and blow-dry/straightening was $55 (which reflects what their website says). In all, I was expecting to spend way more than $205 pre-tip so I was pleasantly surprised. I'll be back!

49.description: Best haircut of my life w Pat. I have kinky fine curls and he gave me a long bob, w longer pieces in the front. I feel like this haircut was made for my hair type- or rather he gave me the best haircut for my hair type. Realistically gave me what my hair had potential to do. Very easy to maintain now- easier than having long curly hair. Would recommend this stylist to anyone and I intend to return.

40.description: I was looking for a new hair salon and a friend recommended Edit. She told me to see Johnny, but since it was a last minute appointment before New Years, I was willing to try anyone... as long as they knew what they were doing.I was going from long hair, to a shorter 'lob' do' so I was skeptical of just trusting "anyone."The girl scheduling my appointment was super helpful, asking what my hair was like and what style I was going for.After I told her I'd be making a change from long to short, she put me with Crisby.There weren't many reviews about him... but it isn't because he's no good. It's because he's new in town and has only been working here for about 3-months. And he's EXCELLENT! He knew exactly what I meant by lob and texture. He took his time cutting my hair and even curled it in the end. I felt like I was a celebrity getting my hair done. Overall, I had a very good experience and I'll definitely be coming back.I feel like I finally found a stylist that I can depend on and trust! I would recommend Crisby, and Edit Salon to others!And the cost isn't even bad compared to the other mediocre salons I've been too!What a gem!

53.description: Edit is a great Salon too! I saw the good reviews and visited for my first hair cut back in July. Super friendly and great environment. Unfortunately I wont be back due to location being rather far off from where I live compared other good salons close to me ( Solo). But again, definitely recommend people to get haircut there.

30.description: Edit is by far the best salon I've ever gone to.  Amy is the best.  She listens to what you want, is happy to give her opinion on different color options if you ask for it, and (as a bonus) is a fun person to talk to while you get your hair colored.  The salon overall has a laid-back vibe, which I love.  Did I mention they serve wine?

46.description: I love coming to Edit!! Amy is amazing at color and does an unbelievable job on my ombré every time I go! I have super thick curly hair and she knows exactly how to color it for both curly and straight looks. Also, the blowouts are incredible! Each time I go my color appointment includes a blowout, which is rare, and I walk out with amazing finished hair. I can't speak highly enough of Edit!!!

1.description: This is the only place to get your hair cut and colored. EDIT. it's what they do. They customize your experience tailored to your specific needs. I can't imagine going anywhere other than Patrick to get my haircut. I've known him for many years and he is a true master of his craft. Spike Lee said it best, " Do the right thing."

55.description: Edit is a great Salon! I'm an active duty service member and I just happened to pass by this salon after surprising a dear Friend of mine.  Well, I am flying back to my duty station in Germany in one day and needed an awesome fade. Well, let me tell you. If you are in the military and need a GREAT fade or if you like fades then Pat is your guy! He took his time, he fixed some of the unevenness from the previous haircut and got me looking sharp. Again, if you are in the market for a great fade then Pat is the guy for you. It doesn't get any better than this. Thank you Pat! SFC Rick Serrano

9.description: I have been going to Edit for over a year and I can't believe I haven't written a review yet. After living in the city for a few years, I still hadn't found my "groove" as far as a colorist. Low and behold I met Yvette, an angel in disguise. Every time I go, I tell her what I want and she always nails it to a tee, which is so hard to find. It is so typical to tell a stylist what you have in mind and they try to sway you in another direction but she take what I want and makes it look even better than I imagined. I have been doing Ombre with her and the bleached part lasts so long and looks fresh even after a few months. Also she is so sweet and gives THE BEST head massages when she washes your hair!The salon itself is beautiful and very clean. Definitely has more of a "hip" yet comfortable layout. I have only used the color services but I am planning to start getting cuts there too.10 stars if I could :)

26.description: Got a haircut here for the first time last week because the yelp reviews were too good to not try it. Johnny was wonderful--I said I didn't know what I wanted or what would work with my hair, so he just explained to me what he was going to do, and I love it.  It was a relaxing experience with just the result that I wanted (but didn't know I wanted), and I'll definitely be coming back. Thank you!

25.description: I've been living in Chicago for the past 7 years and hadn't been able to find someone who understands my hair. Always ended up with a bad haircut until the day I ended up with Patrick at Edit Salon. He cut and styled my thick curly hair like he's been doing it for years. I was more than pleased with his work. Everyone complimented me on my hair and how great it looked. I waited to write this review because I wanted to see how my hair would look when I washed it and my natural curls dried. My curls hadn't looked this great in a very long time.

12.description: I goofed up on the time of my appointment, despite them having sent me an email reminder and called when I was late (just coincidentally I didn't look at the email or get the phone call).  It was TOTALLY my mistake, so I arrived an hour late for my appointment.  They still fit me in, and everyone was so gracious about it, they didn't make me feel like an idiot, even though I was.  Johnny was great; so kind and accommodating, and my haircut looks great.  I hate pretension, and thank god there was none of that, just a great salon with very professional and friendly people!!

59.description: I've been coming to Edit Salon since they opened & thought it time to write a review. this is a very talented shop with most of the staff having a specialty. I started with Patrick & he is really into cut & serious blowouts, loves his products. The shop is very comfortable. The stylists are all usually busy but the venue still seems comfy & relaxing with simple contemporary feel & great location with easy street parking.I've been getting my hair colored for years & Amy is probably the most talented colorist I've ever seen. She uses minimal product when doing touch up but more importantly, she has a vision for what your hair could look like over the course of her taking care of your color for you. My hair has actually gotten healthier since coming to Edit.Annie is amazing at cut and style. She just like an artist at work every time I see her working with one of her clients. She's done a few blowouts to my hair and always great. I can't wait to have her give me a good cut this week.Dana is great as well...lovely personality as she is the assistant to the owner, Patrick. She's ready for her own chair and is great for a wash & blowout.The only difficulty with the shop is you  have to make your appointments in advance. They aren't very good at last minute requests. Especially if you have a favorite stylist it's impossible to get her on the phone to "fit you in." Their phone system is a bit outdated so frequently you'll get voicemail & they are at about a 50% callback rate. For this they lose the 5th star. If you're a frequent traveler, you better plan your visits to EDIT in advance between travels as they simply cannot accommodate last minute requests

21.description: When I moved to Chicago last year I was extremely nervous about finding a new salon, so much so that I waited a LONG time and my what had been vibrant pink/purple hair looked like a sad mess of worn out violet by the time I found Edit. I made an appointment for a cut by Johnny and color by Alison. It was the best choice I could have made! Johnny took all the gross dead ends off and made sure I actually had some shape to my hair again. Alison took the great challenge of being my colorist lol, I get extremely bored with my hair and by the time I got to her decided I wanted to take my hair bleach blonde. She made it happen and now we've been through a few colors together! I'm at the salon just about once a month because I hate having any type of roots growing out and recently Alison had me come in to try a new treatment they got called Olaplex. I'll be honest, I have NO idea what it actually is. What I do know is that my hair is like silk now for the first time in ages because of how much I put it through (curling irons, blow drying, flat irons, coloring once a month, long days in the sun, you name it and I've probably damaged my hair from it). I was skeptical of my hair actually staying nice and silky after it went through a few washes but it's still great. My hair was knotted and dry from product and sleeping on it, got in the shower and as soon as the water hit it it smoothed out and was tangle free and silky again. All in all I can't say enough good things about the salon and everyone in it, from Patrick, LaRae, Alison and Johnny, they all are fantastic and will do pretty much anything to make sure you're happy when you leave. It is worth noting that there IS a dog there from time to time, Herb, who is a sweetie pie and will come up to your chair to get pet while you're being worked on haha I'm dreading the day I move from Chicago and have already forewarned my fiancé that I will be traveling back to Chi JUST to get my hair done because I trust these guys so much. Go here, you won't regret it!

17.description: I went in to try a new hair style and Mila guided me through the process like the pro she is! I will definitely be back.

10.description: Nice short hair cut, thanks Crispy!Their lemon herb tea is great! Try that if you are a tea lover. The store is bright and clear, bad wifi and phone signal. So prepare for a very focused haircut experience haha. My hair cut last an hour long.

5.description: I really like this place in the West Town. Easy walk from CTA blue line stop and a cozy place. They work late hours so its easy to come after work, though you still need to book early. I choose Mila for hair cuts and Amy for color and they both do a really good job.

3.description: So I promised myself that I would try out several salons before settling since my last break up...HOLLA  Lucky #3!I made an apptmt online which is basically a request.  What I liked was that they emailed me about my preferred apptmt.  YES!  Thank you, if I am trying to book online either I am antisocial and dont want to talk to you OR I am unable to realistically talk on the phone during work hours (these jobs do exist).I loved the salon!  Beautiful decor.  The staff was super nice.  Unpretentious but an upscale, relaxed vibe.Yvette did my color.  It was PERFECT.  EXACTLY what I wanted...no joke.  I have gotten so used to mediocre hair salons, but this is it!  Perfect blond tone that I asked for.  Plus, she has a fantastic personality.  I havent tried any cutting people yet.  That will be on my next visit.  I am not crazy about the compartmentalized departments, but it makes sense.  I hope its as seamless as the color.Only other thing is...dont expect to get caught up on smut people or OK magazine...only nice magazines here :)  And selfishly, its convenient for me to get to.  Easy to make an apptmt and easy street parking if you must drive

35.description: Edit Salon is BEST SALON IN CHICAGO hands down!!!! If you haven't been here yet, then you probably have never had the best treatment of your life. The Ladies here are amazingly sweet, honest and truly tell you what your hair really needs. They are not there to try and break into your wallet, their main goal is to meet your expectations and have you leave as the most satisfied customer they have ever had. After coming in I can say they have gained a permanent customer with me! :) They are the BEST of THE BEST!!!

19.description: So, I very rarely write reviews, just because I never have experiences that are overly wonderful or horrible. Last night, I got a haircut and blowout by Johnny, and I was just completely thrilled. It is one of the best cuts I've had in years, and after trying tons of new stylists, I've finally found one who I will come back to every time. He is sweet, and talented, and funny, and knows what he's doing. I've never understood people who pay for blowouts without a cut, but after Johnny's blowout, I totally get it. So talented, so worth it. Thanks Johnny!

28.description: After much research, I booked an appointment with Patrick to cut off my too-long hair (donated to Locks of Love). His reputation of terrific styling for curly/wavy hair is well-deserved. He had a pretty specific idea of what to do with my hair, and I let him go with it; best decision ever. I love my new 'do, and am getting tons of compliments. Great location, great service. A shout out to front desk staff, LaRea, who could not have been more welcoming and accommodating. Thanks!

45.description: Allison is the BEST!I decided I wanted to do something to freshen up my look. As a dark brunette I was a little apprehensive sitting in the chair as I never color my hair. I was wanting a noticeable change but was nervous to hear how light that actually meant. Allison was the best. She assured me I would love the color, and with the technique it required little to no upkeep. The second she started I knew I was in good hands. Allison was very warm and professional. She took her time and made sure every strand looked great. I have never felt more confident in a stylist's chair. The end product is fantastic. I receive comments all the time and have recommended her to all of my friends. One of my friends even said "this is how your hair should look all the time". If you are looking for a colorist who you can trust completely go with Allison. I'm definitely going again. Thanks so much Allison for killing it! You are the best!

33.description: So, I very rarely write reviews, just because I never have experiences that are overly wonderful or horrible. Last night, I got a haircut and blowout by Johnny, and I was just completely thrilled. It is one of the best cuts I've had in years, and after trying tons of new stylists, I've finally found one who I will come back to every time. He is sweet, and talented, and funny, and knows what he's doing. I've never understood people who pay for blowouts without a cut, but after Johnny's blowout, I totally get it. So talented, so worth it. Thanks Johnny!

43.description: I was blown away by Johnny. Seriously, one of the best blowouts I've had EVER.  I love this place, I loved my stylist and I will not trust anyone else with my hair again. Thanks Johnny, you are fantastic!

2.description: One word: GIL. No matter what kind of hair you have, trust that Gil will cut it beautifully. I have been seeing Gil for over 4 years, including at a previous salon. He is not only an amazing stylist but an amazing person. I love the fact that I really don't have to say much and can simply trust that he will make my hair work. It is also easy to make and reschedule appointments via email, which I appreciate. LaRae is very helpful to this end. As an aside, edit has also been very supportive of my philanthropic endeavors over the past two years in donating a cut or color for fundraisers I've hosted. It means a lot that a salon supports its customers in that way for a good cause.  Bottom line: if you are not 100% satisfied with your current stylist, Go.See.Gil. He is a wizard!

18.description: I went to Edit my first time yesterday and I can't say it was an experience I would recommend to anyone. Amy did ombre on my hair and she wonderful and nice, but the results was not really what I expected. I took a picture of my hair before and after I did my hair and I was trying to go lighter but I honestly did not see much a difference. All I think was done to my hair was bleach and it was not worth the 200$ that I paid. On a side note, the receptionist was not very friendly to me. She looked very disinterested and when I told my friend she said she noticed that she was friendly to her but not to me. I was told that I wouldn't the color I wanted so I did understand that but I felt like 200$ just to bleach my hair was too much. I didn't achieve ombre.

41.description: Johnny is a FANTASTIC stylist.  I have long-layered fine hair, and he gave me the perfect face-shaping layers for growing out bangs and easing my hair back from the brink of a bad cut.  Two weeks after my first cut with him, I went back to Johnny for a blow-out.  This was AMAZING!  I found my new go-to stylist.

52.description: I got my haircut by Melissa a couple of weeks ago. I was a little nervous because I am pretty new to Chicago and was trusting a new (to me anyway) stylist to give me a drastic change. I was going from hair past my shoulders to an asymmetrical pixie. Melissa really listened to what I was looking for and by the end, my hair looked AWESOME! Not only is she skilled, but she makes it seem like you've known her forever. Great conversation, No awkwardness at all. I will definitely be back.

50.description: When I sat down in Patrick's chair for the first time and he asked me, "Is that your natural curl?" with a touch of glee in his voice, I dared to hope that maybe I had finally found The One. For years I've sought a stylist who could cut my wavy hair so that I could wear it straight or curly without a ton of fuss. When my mother declared this the best haircut I've had IN MY ENTIRE LIFE that sealed the deal. (If your mother is as opinionated about your hair as mine is, you understand) Pat, I'm yours for life. After spending a solid 10 minutes chatting with me about the history of my hairstyling woes, Patrick assured me that he could help me look like I actually styled my hair to be curly instead of looking like I just didn't feel like fixing my hair, which was the look I'd been sporting all summer. He explained that it may not be as smooth when I wore it straight, but I was willing to take that risk. And a couple days later, when I tried it straight, it was perfect. Swoon...It's true that you get what you pay for, so Patrick is not cheap, but if I could credit the number of compliments I've received on my hair since I saw him against the cost, it's a bargain. Worth every penny.

4.description: Friendly staff and quality care. After so many run-ins with bad experiences at hair salons, Edit has become a savior. LaRae, who is in charge of booking, is always very prompt and helpful. For color, I see Yvette. She is AMAZING. She gets it right every time! For cut, I see Mila. She's delightful to work with and guides you in the right direction! Everyone deserves to leave their hair appointments feeling fresh and confident. If you're looking for that, Edit is the place to go!

6.description: OMG! All of the reviews are right! The stylists and colorists here ROCK! All you see are happy faces leaving the salon! I totally recommend this place if you want to look fabulous!!!

22.description: I can't understand all the great reviews about this salon. I decided to try it because of the good yelp ratings and was very disappointed by all three visits.The first time, a saw a stylist who is no longer there. She was very professional and the cut was ok, though not really what I asked for. It was difficult to style and did nothing for me.I came back and saw the owner. I have a lot of hair and specifically asked him to remove a lot of the weight. He refused to do that and instead gave me lots of awkward layers that just accentuated the thickness of my hair in all the wrong places. I came back once more, and this time his attempt at removing weight left me with a poofy shelf halfway up my hair that I spent months growing out and having another stylist fix. It seems there is just a lack of technique and understanding of how to manipulate different hair types.On top of this, both haircuts with the owner left a chunk or two longer than the rest of the hair that I had to fix when I got home. I understand that mistakes happen, but at this price point I expect at least the basics to be done right.The experience left something to be desired as the owner kept gossiping about former employees. Again, at this price point I expect better.

15.description: Let me tell you about Mila :) I hadn't had a hair cut in what felt like years, but she brought it back to life with some layers and was still able to keep the length. I LOVE my haircut and will definitely be going back. Great stylist and a sweetheart!

57.description: I love this salon. Dana cut my hair the other day and it was exactly what I wanted. Plus, she's a great conversationalist and is very detail-oriented. Also, I'd never walked into a salon that offered beer before which helped me to relax (they also have wine and liquor). Overall, I give this salon a 10/10 for professionalism and making me feel comfortable while getting my hair done. Definitely recommend to everyone I know.

20.description: I found my new hair stylist...Pat!! This is a very professional and fun salon. The staff is kind and accommodating. I got the keratin treatment which I love love love! Thank you Edit salon for making me look (more) beautiful ;-)

36.description: Really great service, from booking my appointment to getting my haircut. Johnny was super friendly, listened to what I was thinking and made the perfect suggestion.  I'll be back for sure!

14.description: I found my new hair stylist...Pat!! This is a very professional and fun salon. The staff is kind and accommodating. I got the keratin treatment which I love love love! Thank you Edit salon for making me look (more) beautiful ;-)

58.description: Great deals that are sometimes hit or miss

56.description: great prices! love this place. the parking lot gets a little crazy at times, but I save a lot of money here and it is worth it!

29.description: One of the best places I've found for produce in Chicago. Way cheaper than jewel, trader joes, whole foods, even Aldi. And a much better selection. Place can get pretty busy during peak hours so I suggest you go at an "off" time.

42.description: Stanley, you have my heart to the core! Cherries: 98 cents a lb ?!  Apples: 89 cents a lb?! 3 onions for a dollar?Yes, yes, and yes! These are just some examples of the great sales they have at Stanley's! They vary from week to week but the produce is consistently in decent shape, lasts at least four days from date of purchase (obviously some more than others - their sweet potatoes last FOREVER), and their staff is quick and friendly. The only downfall I can think about is that it's pretty hard to get to via public transit but I always make it a priority to get there, somehow, at least once a week. Go!

23.description: Fresh produce mostly organic at super affordable prices.. I highly recommend this place..

47.description: The Best! - compared to Jewel, Mariano's, Whole Foods, Aldi's - Stanley's takes the cake. This produce is by far the cheapest on the block. There is a solid organic section as well as a deli with endless options. My favorite days are when the deli promo guy is there giving out samples. He cracks me up. Note - wash your produce no matter where you buy it. :)

8.description: This is my most favorite place next to Chicago Diner since I have moved from Atlanta. I get a great amount of fresh produce and even a kale juice for a total of  $20 or less. I can certainly understand some of the reviews regarding fruit of vegetables that are not as hard or as crisp as you may find at the larger chain grocery store, there is a difference in the products sold at Stanley's and its freshness. if your eyes can't tell the difference your stomach and gut will certainly thank you for eating this good food as nature intended it to be. I also prefer most of my fruits and vegetables cooked due to my diet restrictions so softer works well for me. There is parking one thing to mention, People, there are two ways into the parking lot, but only one way out please look for the arrows, it makes things so much less difficult. Love YA, happy shopping

31.description: When it comes to fresh produce in Chicago you can't do any better than Stanley's (as far as I know!)Private parking lot with plenty of free parking, ample carts and baskets, friendly staff, fresh produce, tons of organic options, and unbeatable prices. I could really stop my review here because lets face it that's all you really need to know.You wouldn't guess this place was such a serious gem from the outside as it's nothing fancy or flashy from the exterior but that all changes when you walk in the door. No frills- just plain great produce at extraordinary prices. An efficient layout allows maximum produce within the walls of this market. I have yet to see aging products and everything is fresh and well maintained. TIP: The store is SUPER CLEAN! (and AWESOME!)Along one side you'll find exclusively organic options, there's also a great deli towards the back of the store. A case against the back wall has generous portions of prepackaged fresh herbs for the cheapest prices you'll find anywhere, and who doesn't love cooking with FRESH HERBS?! I believe I last paid about $1 for a giant bunch of fresh rosemary as an example.Jump on the kale train-- they carry several varieties including organic and red (purple) kale and WAY cheaper than Whole Foods and most of the healthful food stores (about $1 a bunch)The staff here genuinely seems like the like their jobs and have always been friendly and helpful. Despite the sometimes longer-ish lines here because it's a poplar spot- there is never really much of a wait and this market truely runs like a well oiled machine everyday.

34.description: As the other posters note, it's a great place for cheap produce.   Amazing bargains!  I always end up buying WAY more than I planned.  Despite all I've bought, I don't thing I've cracked the $20.00 limit during any shopping trip.  I wish I still canned, as you can get CASES of stuff for dirt - cheap:  tomatoes @ $1.49, cherries, asparagus, and on and on and ON...!!!

16.description: If you want fresh organic foods with out paying the astronomical high prices as some pay at WF, then this is the place for you to shop! Friendly staff and owner! Met Stanley and he was very helpful with answering all of my questions about the store and where they receive most of the organic produce...can really appreciate that in an owner! Vegetables are at least half the price but not half the quality of any other grocer. Deli is magnificent! Boars Head Meats...need I say more? Great prices for fresh sandwiches! The store also has a fresh juice bar as well with shots of wheat grass for only 99 cents! Must try this place!

13.description: This is my number one place to go to for fresh fruits and vegetables! The are always fresh and your can't best the price. For sure one of the cheapest places for fruits and vegetables in Chicago!  You will not be disappointed! Went in there and  came out of a cart full of fruits and vegetables for $18.37! My fiance and I go through fruits and vegetables so fast and  allows is to enjoy!

11.description: The best friut store in Chicagoland! And the vegetables are huge and fresh! This place has convient parking and a great restaurant across the street. Love getting fresh fruit already cut up ready to eat in the cooler fresh daily. You will never go anywhere else after going here to shop!

39.description: Best produce market in Chicago, hands down!Inexpensive for extremely high quality products!!!I really cannot say enough great things about Stanley's- convenient private parking lot, (although the place is certainly not a best kept secret so it's usually bustling) the store is clean, the produce is fresh, I've yet to find anyone to beat these prices for the incredible quality and value. Awesome friendly (and very helpful staff) who always seem to be in a good mood and genuinely want to help. With as busy as this place can get, it's never uncomfortable like waiting in line at most of the bigger stores surprisingly they move people through pretty quick and efficiently.LOVE STANLEY'S!

37.description: I like to call Stanley's "produce heaven." It has all of the produce you could ever imagine at great prices. Organic too! The only thing to watch out for is that sometimes, it goes bad fast. But during the summer, keep an eye out for their GOOD sales. I usually get a large box of strawberries for a dollar at least once during the summer. Stanely's cant be beat.

0.description: decided it was time to check out Stanley's after passing by here for the past year on the North Ave. bus and seeing all of their advertised deals. i was pretty impressed by their selection of fruits and vegetables, even those fruits that are not in season currently (strawberries, nectarines, blueberries...). all very reasonably priced, didn't see anything over ripe/rotten. though, my chief complaint would be that some advertised "ripe" fruits were not anywhere near being ready to eat (this is not an issue only at Stanley's, it's nationwide...farmers pick too early). i was very pleased to see organic asparagus for $1.99/lb. at F4L or WM their regular price is about $5/lb. and very rarely goes on sale. blueberries were 99 cents as compared to $1.50-$2.50, as were Driscoll's strawberries. they also had Italian parsley which i have found hard to find in most markets, and at .69 a bundle! i paid 60% less for celery as well. ripe kiwi were 7 for $1, awesome price. the only price that i didn't see a difference in as compared to other markets was Granny Smith apples ($1.49/lb.)i walked out of here with two bags full of fresh produce for $14.50. i tead many reviews who say that some stuff spoils after a few days, but FYI: most produce isn't meant to last for weeks on end! (unless it's a root vegetable, like an onion or potato.) the store was clean, in fact there was an employee going through the store cleaning the aisles and two employees weeding through the produce. the cashier was very nice. yes, the aisles are narrow. but in this fast paced life: get over it. this is a great store with an awesome variety and they carry many specialty items (pasta, Amish sweet cream butter, juice, olives, olive oils, on and on..)definitely a gem.

38.description: I love this place. This is the cheapest produce you'll find in the area. You have to be sure to check everything carefully because sometimes the produce is a little older, but still good.

51.description: I've passed by here dozens of times and always wonder how the heck their advertised prices are so low. This time I decided to drop in and see for myself. I still don't have the answer why... but they had a good variety of produce for a fraction of the cost of the any one of the major grocers in the city. I assumed the quality would be noticeable inferior, but in general, that wasn't the case. In some instances, however, I passed on their selection... like avocados for example... I bought one small one for 50 cents I believe. It didn't look particularly great, and well, it didn't taste too good or last long enough as is typical of other avocados I've purchased. But for 50 cents, I am happy to have tried it for myself. For other items - tomatoes, apples, bananas, onions, peppers - I've had no issue. I spent $10 on what normally would have been at least $15, so I'm not complaining.I appreciate the one-stop shop atmosphere of most grocers but in the event I'm driving by, not in a rush, and in need of my week's bundle of produce, I'll certainly pop in Stanley's.

27.description: I love love love Stanley's. Great selection of produce and amazing prices. I just left with a cart full of fruits and veggies and spent $36!

32.description: Great deals need I say more. This way I dont feel bad if somehting goes bad becuase I didnt pay much for it. God bless Stanley's... Be honest some times you just cant get to everything you buy...

54.description: I go to Stanley's every week.  The produce can't be beat; especially for the price.  A few tips:- Be flexible on your grocery list; availability varies quiet a bit.  Plus, the specials are great and should be taken advantage of.- If the parking lot is crazy, drive south a little on Elston; there is always parking- If you get something for a crazy low price (a pallet of strawberries for $1 or tomatoes for .20 a pound), be sure to process/use them immediately.  I buy the strawberries and freeze them, puree, and make jam.- Definitely check out the fresh herbs and sun dried tomatoes in the back by the milk; great value!Hope you enjoy Stanley's as much as I do!

48.description: This place is difficult to put into words! I mean who sells apples 5 for $1, homemade chips and guac and some of the best lunchmeat at ridiculous prices? I still think this place is a figment of my imagination!I have, on more than one occasion, walked a little faster to my vehicle so as not to get arrested for shoplifting. The deals are stupid!

44.description: As a relatively new transplant to Chicago, it takes awhile to figure out where to get all your groceries from. We now get all of our fruits and veggies from Stanley's.The only thing is, BE CAREFUL with some of the produce as some of it is currently molding, or basically just about to go bad. In general, everything is pretty good, but for example a couple days ago, the green lettuce was seriously wilted, there were moldy strawberries that were on sale. So just make sure you look at your produce well.However, I feel like this is a great place for very affordable fruit and veggies. Good amount of parking. Try to stay away from here on the weekends, can get super crazy in there! And I don't like being crowded when buying food...Can't say anything about the deli section as we only buy the fruits and veggies.

24.description: I'm not really sure what the hype is about this place. I typically drive to Petes fresh market for produce. But, after a coworker raved about this place so much, I decided to venture out and check it out. The produce is mediocre at best. Prices are decent. But the quality is just not there. I give 2 stars due to the wide variety to choose from. However, lots of the produce here looked like it was at its last limb.

7.description: Excellent choice of organics in the city.  Great selection of other as well.  All produce is fresh and the staff is pleasant.  We will be back.

49.description: I love you Stanley's. Wonderful produce, wonderful prices, wonderful staff. That's all. You guys rule.

40.description: This place is da bomb. Beautiful fruits and veggies at prices that may make you feel like you walked away with MORE money. You can pretty much find any fresh ingredient here and feel confident in the quality as long as you use it up within a couple of days. I feel healthier just walking in here!

53.description: This place is my everything! Now...if you are the type of person that likes to buy every fruit and vegetable all year round, this is not the place for you. Most of the items will vary based on seasonality. BEST PLACE TO BUY ORGANIC. 90% of the time, you can buy organic kale, spinach, beets, bread, dairy, strawberries, etc here for a fraction of the cost that you are used to paying. Yes, you will likely need to go more than once a week as some of the items will not stay "fresh" for two weeks, but so what?!?!I usually walk out with 3-4 bags of delicious produce for $38ish dollars!

30.description: Stanley's is perfect to stock up on fruits and vegetables. Their prices are cheap, their produce is fresh, and they have a wide selection of fruits, vegetables, and herbs. While most of their produce is conventuals grown, they do have some limited organic options. They have limited selections of other items such as dairy, breads, and canned beans. Theoretically, you could do all your grocery shopping here if you were a great cook, but I usually have to supplement the Stanley's fruits and vegetables with a trip to another grocery store for other staples and dry goods.

46.description: Why in the WORLD are you paying 4/lb for apples at whole foods, and just organic produce in general?  Is it pride? Is it because it's nice to be seen at whole foods and because it feels nice? If so, I get it.  But this place is so cheap and just as good quality.  They are limited in terms of they only carry produce (fruits , veggies) and cold cuts.  And they don't carry spices.Best place ever if you're ready to lose your hot shot Lincoln park living, Audi driving ego.Support cheap organic produce that's a million times better than Mariano's and jewel and just as good as whole foods.  I know as I shop at all of them.

1.description: I don't think I can sum up into words how much I love Stanley's. I'm routinely able to get all of my weekly produce for $25-30. It is fresh and lasts! The deli area is also very good and they have a dairy/egg/packaged goods section that makes it a one stop shop! The pico is very tasty and tastes homemade. I order my meat online, so I don't need anything other than Stanley's! Even at crummy Jewel, my produce is $50+ and is usually rotten by the time I get home!The parking can be cray...so don't go on Sunday afternoon. Otherwise, it's extremely accessible and even has a generous parking lot. Favorite grocery story ever with an amazing selection!

55.description: Before you just walk into Stanley's and start buying up every last fruit and vegetable, all while telling yourself "I saved so much money!" It might help to pay attention to the price. I also think many shoppers make this mistake at larger corporations which require membership fees to even make a purchase. Right there, the $30/$50 you spend can be divided and added to the items you purchase over the year, and pretty much you come out even going anywhere else. I definitely have a limited income, and I secretly laugh at my friends who take me to these membership corporations, thinking they are doing me a favor. I watch them purchase items which are well over priced, or the same as anywhere else. My visits to Stanley's (I have been here more than what my 2 check-ins reflect) are always hit or miss. Stanley's has had the best sale on asparagus I have ever seen at a produce market. Of course, this was last summer, and I am pretty sure it was during the asparagus season. Yes, for those shoppers who are not familiar with when produce is seasonal, you're really doing yourself a disservice and you need to do some research. When produce is in season, this means the pricing will come down. I hate cooking with a passion. If I am going to spend money on food, it better be a good deal. Typically I go with friends. I am usually aghast with what deals my culinary arts friends pass over. How can you be in the industry and not know a good deal when you see it? My last visit, I was alone, thank goodness, and decided to give this market a thorough investigation. Really, I was not impressed. Apples, like Danny W. had brought up, were priced much like a major chain would price out theirs. One of my health tricks is making sure I have apples. First, it takes more calories to burn off an apple, than the calories found in an apple. Second, I always eat an apple with a fatty meal because it slows down absorption of the fat into your system. Bottom line, I am always watching prices on apples. What I did notice was that Stanley's had a deli. Not even advertised as a sale, their lunchmeat was reasonably priced, even the roast beef! I also noticed their hummus was a decent price, if not typical, but I had never come across some of the flavors I found here. I can't wait to try the horseradish hummus! I got the last container so it must be a hot seller. You may not find prices that seduce you, however, I am always impressed with the quality of their produce. Far beyond that of a major chain or any grocery store in Chicago (what is it with grocery stores in the city? Gross! Even the ones closest to the Gold Coast), Stanley's will always have produce which doesn't look like it has been bathed in pesticides... even if it has; or even if some of the produce has started to go bad. It still looks fresh and like a healthy decay. Like I have said, my beef with Stanley's would be their lack of consistently offering good deals on all of their produce. If you don't know your way around fruits and vegetables, then you're not going to come out ahead shopping here. I'm probably not doing myself much of a favor by driving all the way out to Skokie to shop, but I think it's worth the cost in gas just to encourage the Euro Markets to keep delivering fresh produce at an affordable price. Yes, I would much rather hand them my money.

9.description: Jeesh, I was a real downer in 2014. Bad year I guess! But in 2016, Stanley's is definitely a five star spot!Some things I've learned over the years about Stanley's...- Wash everythinggg. I've seen things...like a kid grabbing random handfuls from the spinach (at least he's eating spinach?!)... And all kinds of produce go rolling off the pile and down the aisle, then put right back. (I do it too, guilty! But still... Clean yo stuff!)- If there's a Crazy good deal on something outside, like 12 containers of blueberries for $3...look at the 12 you choose closely, and use them how you want right away. Also prepare for some inevitable mold picking.- The employees are usually very nice and knowledgable, especially the girls who work at the juice bar! So sweet! But if you see someone out on the floor, feel free to ask how to know if a certain item is ripe or not, ask what something is, or if they have more/better ones in the back.- With that, if the leaves pull easily from a pineapple it's ready to eat Then, stay away from papaya...it's basically dirty feet fruit (bleh) and if there's only 2 picked over containers of bluebs left, ask, they probably have more in the back that just hasn't been restocked. - Finally, get the sweet potato chips. Just do it. The saying I noticed on the back of the bag alone makes it worth the cost -- Chicago hipsters become Stanley's chipsters! Ahhahaha Keep rockin, Stanley's! See you soon ;)

26.description: Love that store.I am going there mostly for the organic section. It keeps getting bigger and bigger and is affordable . Thank you for that.

25.description: My go to place for fresh fruit, veggies and sandwich meat!! I go to this place faithfully! Amazing prices!

12.description: I love this place! There is no other place to go do fresh produce at reasonable prices. You can literally get two weeks of produce for 30 or less. Bring your own bags to not be bogged down with their plastic bags. I'd also recommend getting the guacamole because it's great for the price! Some people complain and say that the fruit goes bad quickly but you just have to be better about picking it out. The cashiers are always friendly. Side note: avoid going after work on Mondays or mid day on Sunday's!

59.description: Just yes. I love everything about this place! Fresh fruit and veggies, great deli selection, and just awesome prices overall. The store is always clean and the staff friendly, although after work this place can get hellatiously busy. Sure the fruit/veggies tend to last for a lot less as long as getting stuff from Jewel - but I feel like that's probably because Jewel produce is sprayed with nasty chemicals and preservatives. I can get a damn bag of spinach or arugula as big as the upper part of my whole body for 2 - 4 bucks and it lasts me all week! Win!All and all I'm all about supporting locally grow crops and run businesses without the middle man that makes them overcharge the heck out of us!Some things here are a bit more pricey then if you go to Jewel but honestly i save so much in so many ways I don't mind at all.Final Verdict:Go here. Today. I wish I had started many moons ago as it would have saved me a TON of money!

21.description: This is my number one place to go to for fresh fruits and vegetables! The are always fresh and your can't best the price. For sure one of the cheapest places for fruits and vegetables in Chicago!  You will not be disappointed! Went in there and  came out of a cart full of fruits and vegetables for $18.37! My fiance and I go through fruits and vegetables so fast and  allows is to enjoy!

17.description: Stanley, you have my heart to the core! Cherries: 98 cents a lb ?!  Apples: 89 cents a lb?! 3 onions for a dollar?Yes, yes, and yes! These are just some examples of the great sales they have at Stanley's! They vary from week to week but the produce is consistently in decent shape, lasts at least four days from date of purchase (obviously some more than others - their sweet potatoes last FOREVER), and their staff is quick and friendly. The only downfall I can think about is that it's pretty hard to get to via public transit but I always make it a priority to get there, somehow, at least once a week. Go!

10.description: As many of you know, I'm a true Chicagoan foodie.  But when it comes to cooking at home, I consume almost no meat but veggies and fruit only.  Hubby is also a vegetarian, so shopping at Stanley's is just no brainer, isn't it?  It's too many positive things to say about Stanley's.  Let me use bullet points to tell you why Stanley's is awesome.  1) it's super cheap: it's the BEST deal you can find in the city of Chicago limit, period.  Can you find a 2.5-lb bag of fresh baby spinach for under $5 anywhere else?  I personally have not.  If the spinach doesn't impress you much, how about five (5) garlic cloves for 98 cents?  You gotta check it out on your own.  2) empty your car to have all the room you can to stock up the fresh produce, because you need it.  Borrow a truck, a school bus, or a limousine if you have to.  You won't regret it!  3) they have a private parking lot, but it's busy no matter what time of the day.  Just keep that in mind.  4) they do have a small deli section, but I never bother to visit there.  I want to eat my veggies and fruit till my heart's content.  5) they have the widest elections of apples, from honey crisp, red delicious, to Granny Smith.  The most expensive kind is in average $1.49/lb.  Today I saw the Granny Smith was on sale for $0.49/lb.  You can bathe in apples everyday without breaking your bank.  6) today I purchased: a giant bag of spinach ($4.98); 5 oz. garlic pack ($0.98); two (2) cucumbers ($0.98/lb. for $1.51); two (2) green peppers ($0.59/lb. for $0.56), one (1) pack of mushrooms ($1.49); four (4) bundles of green onions (4 for $1.00); two (2) avocados (2 for $0.98); J. Gold apples ($1.49/lb. for $2.44); loose carrots ($0.98/lb. for $0.48).  The total after tax came to $15.92.  7) the nearest public transportation is the CTA 72 bus (North Ave.), since there's no busses running on Elston because of the bike lanes.  A short bus ride east will get you to the CTA North/Clybourn Red line station; a short bus ride west will get you to the CTA Damen Blue line station.  Now, you have no excuses to have your daily veggie and fruit intakes, children!

5.description: This place is amazing!! A friend recommended it since I am starting  a fruit and veggie fast tomorrow. I believe he was the manager who took me around the store to select out all the veggies that I can eat raw. The prices are so ridiculously low! I bought enough food for at least 5 days of my fast (maybe more) which was at least 8 bags of groceries and it only cost $40!!

3.description: When you go to a fruit market in the city and get strawberries, blueberries and Cedar Hummus for $0.98 a pack it's a deal! I got some wonderful produce including blood oranges too. I love the variety and the low prices for veggies and fruit it makes healthy affordable. I wish we didn't live so far from it. It has busy lot busy store it's always packed full of shoppers. They are a good deal I'm glad to go there once in awhile when I can convince my husband to help me drive out there,

35.description: If I could give Stanley's 6 stars, I would.  Absolutely LOVE this place.  Phenomenal concept, very good execution, and just AMAZING prices if you know how to shop it.My standard Stanley's run consists of a 5-10 item list, combined with 47.5 impulse buys, and yet I still leave every time spending less than $20. It's almost as if the registers can't count higher than that.  Simply amazing.  Things I accept:- this produce will go bad...very quickly.  I'm assuming that's how they get it so cheapThings I like:- Very good pita in the back near the deli- Deli is CHEAP and decent meats (not Boar's Head but hey, decent)- Carry organic eggs & essentials in case you don't want to do a grocery run- intelligentsia coffee!- good dried fruit selectionThings I love:- the wall of deals when you first walk in- how ridiculously cheap carrots are - love carrots.- how ridiculously cheap (almost) everything is.  - Again, something about cheap-ness- Did I mention it's cheap?

19.description: Quality. CheckInexpensive Prices. CheckNon-assuming, user-friendly environment. CheckDreams of cooking things I have no idea how to make. CheckThis place is stupendous. Come to browse, come to buy, come to explore. My only complaint is that I wish I lived closer so I could come more often.

28.description: Best place to buy veggies in the city, other than farmers markets. Great value, large selection, and organic selection has increased but still needs improvements. Parking lot can be chaotic on Sundays.

45.description: My landlady swears by this place. The produce is always so good and so cheap. The berries are a good deal, too. Sometimes I can get Driscoll Strawberries for $1 a box and raspberries for $0.33 a box. Insane.

33.description: We all are crazy about Stanley and his low prices for organic fruits and vegetables and low priced Intelligentsia coffee beans, but, I had the most amazing experience with the Staff. Things get really busy on the weekends and the efficiency of the Staff is most notable as well as  their care should one lose their wallet! I was in an absolute panic late Sunday night and after emptying every bag and pocket,turning the car inside out, the house upside down and even going through the garbage, we could only think that I must have dropped it at Stanley's. After a sleepless night in Chicago, I put a call into Stanley's at 6:00 AM--that's when they open! They said to call back at 9:30 when the woman who would have that information would be in. I called at that time, and voila! Even when they aren't rescuing unconscious shoppers, the ladies are sweet tempered and polite, but, I had to sing their praises especially in light of my recent experience. I will always remember to be courteous to them and next time, I go in,I will take them some flowers or chocolates  because they wouldn't even take a reward!

43.description: BEST PRODUCE MARKET!!I have shopped at Jewel, Whole Foods, and Mariano's looking for fresh produce, and even with their higher prices, I sometimes come up empty handed because the avocados are hard as rocks or total mush.  Stanley's is AWESOME!  It's spacious, and the multitude of produce available is just simply impressive.  For $21 I bought a bunch of kale, cilantro, 2 yellow onions, 2 jalapenos, a container of olive tapenade hummus, a package of pita bread, 2 deliciously ripe mangos, yellow, red, and green bell peppers, fennel, fresh thyme, limes, perfectly ripe avocados, carrots, potatoes,  and a big bag of tomatillos.  I will here on always do my produce shopping at Stanley's!! The best.

2.description: Cheapest produce in the city. Best selection of fruits and veggies at amazing prices. I get everything I need with all the obstacles of people and carts in the way. Hard to not run into customers. The juice bar is surprisingly awesome. Very tasty. I had the Smooth ___ something.. I am blanking.Cashiers are always friendly. Prepare to wait in a line that moves rather quickly!Nice prices, great produce! Always happy to shop here!

18.description: I love Stanley's when I want to have more than enough fruit to share and my hubby and I are on a total veggie kick. For a measly $20-$30, I will walk out of with a boatload of produce that lasts anywhere from 3 days to 1 week and keeps us in a fresh food cloud, too! Supplemented by the slightly more pricey organic (which Stanley's also has a lot of these days) produce, if it weren't for the crowds, I could see shopping at Stanley's for produce, exclusively.

41.description: As many of you know, I'm a true Chicagoan foodie.  But when it comes to cooking at home, I consume almost no meat but veggies and fruit only.  Hubby is also a vegetarian, so shopping at Stanley's is just no brainer, isn't it?  It's too many positive things to say about Stanley's.  Let me use bullet points to tell you why Stanley's is awesome.  1) it's super cheap: it's the BEST deal you can find in the city of Chicago limit, period.  Can you find a 2.5-lb bag of fresh baby spinach for under $5 anywhere else?  I personally have not.  If the spinach doesn't impress you much, how about five (5) garlic cloves for 98 cents?  You gotta check it out on your own.  2) empty your car to have all the room you can to stock up the fresh produce, because you need it.  Borrow a truck, a school bus, or a limousine if you have to.  You won't regret it!  3) they have a private parking lot, but it's busy no matter what time of the day.  Just keep that in mind.  4) they do have a small deli section, but I never bother to visit there.  I want to eat my veggies and fruit till my heart's content.  5) they have the widest elections of apples, from honey crisp, red delicious, to Granny Smith.  The most expensive kind is in average $1.49/lb.  Today I saw the Granny Smith was on sale for $0.49/lb.  You can bathe in apples everyday without breaking your bank.  6) today I purchased: a giant bag of spinach ($4.98); 5 oz. garlic pack ($0.98); two (2) cucumbers ($0.98/lb. for $1.51); two (2) green peppers ($0.59/lb. for $0.56), one (1) pack of mushrooms ($1.49); four (4) bundles of green onions (4 for $1.00); two (2) avocados (2 for $0.98); J. Gold apples ($1.49/lb. for $2.44); loose carrots ($0.98/lb. for $0.48).  The total after tax came to $15.92.  7) the nearest public transportation is the CTA 72 bus (North Ave.), since there's no busses running on Elston because of the bike lanes.  A short bus ride east will get you to the CTA North/Clybourn Red line station; a short bus ride west will get you to the CTA Damen Blue line station.  Now, you have no excuses to have your daily veggie and fruit intakes, children!

52.description: We love Stanley's. There is no better place to get cheap produce in the city. They even have a decent sized organic section!We have been fans of Stanley's for many years (who doesn't love an entire case of strawberries for 98 cents??) but I felt compelled to post after shopping here while preparing for a juice cleanse.Juicing takes a LOT of produce and people think it gets really expensive. But if you can pick up the bulk of your produce at Stanley's it's very reasonable.Last week for less than $45 I picked up:6 bunches of organic kale1 head of organic romaine8 organic cucumbers20 green apples4 pears2 bunches of fresh ginger1 pack of fresh sage1 bunch of parsley1 bunch of cilantro5-6 yellow onions4 roma tomatoes1 pack cherry tomatoes1 fresh coconut10 limes8 lemons4 packs of organic celery2 zucchini2 acorn squash6 red peppers2 packs of blueberries2 portabello mushroom caps8 small avocados1 head of broccoliONE avocado is usually $2 at any other grocery store!The key to Stanley's is to make it your first trip when grocery shopping. It's small and the cashiers are quick. Get in with your list and get what you can, then go to another store to get the rest of your items. What they have available changes frequently, they won't always have everything you want.They do have awesome seasonal deals. In the summer its common to see flats of strawberries outside for $1/case (8 packs) or sweet corn for 10/$1. Right now they have pumpkins, squashes, gourds, and bales of hay out front for cheap for everyone who's doing their fall decorating.

50.description: I've been going to Stanley's for years, and until today, I was happy with their products and service.  Today they demonstrated what poor ethical standards they have.  They had a "special" on avocados today -- 10 for $1.  Great deal right? Well, I bought 10 assuming at least 4-5 might be subpar.  I came home, cut them 4 hours after purchasing them, and found all 10 were completely black and rotten on the inside and some with mold.  Stanley's should be ashamed of themselves.  It's not about the $2 I lost.  It's about the fact that they knowingly sold rotten produce to make a buck.  Basically lesson learned -- if the deal sounds too good to be true at Stanley's you should probably skip it.

4.description: Interesting place. Stanley's is pretty small, relatively speaking. They mainly have produce (at great prices). And, their produce selection is very wide and the quality looks good. They do have a small deli counter, a and a limited selection of breads, imported canned and bottled goods.With the small size and good prices, it was quite crowded. Good for them. But, the checkout lines moved very quickly. Once we made our selections, and made it through the crowds, checkout was easy. Price-wise, we came in well below what we had budgeted for the trip.

6.description: Most bang for your buck? You'll find it at Stanley's when it comes to veggies & fruits - I even spied fresh pico de gallo that was super affordable & some good lookin' guac! I mostly come here for the veggies & fruits because honestly the quality AND quantity you get is amazing... It's hard to believe their prices are so low. I also tried a sandwich at their deli today & that too, was delicious. Even more so for just $4.99? Don't be scared of the lines, they move quickly & cashiers are polite. Worth the trip over!

22.description: I love Stanley's. The fruit and vegetables are cheap and there's a huge variety. The staff is always friendly, and everyone's in such a good mood that the patrons are always nice and polite, too. They actually have a parking lot, which is great because you can't walk home with a case of strawberries when they go on sale for 98 cents, which happens on a pretty frequent basis. You DO have to be careful and look through the insane berry sales because sometimes they'll have mold on them, but it's generally still a great value. Some of the negative reviews have mentioned the fruit and vegetables expire quickly once you get them home, but I haven't noticed it going bad any faster than produce purchased at any other store.Today I got a case of blueberries for $1.49. What more could a person want?

15.description: Well if you want to bring down your groceries budget by 400 dollars a month this is your place. I absolutely love it!!!! 20 apples for 2 dollars?!? Are you kidding me?!? Huge selection on Fruits and Vegetables for an amazing price. You probably get that price because things are not washed or look perfect but let me tell you they taste perfect! Also their cheese and ham section is sooo good! Super tasty Provolone and turkey ham, for a 1/3 of the price you get at whole foods or jewel. My only problem is not having one close, so I need to plan my trip for once a week or once every two weeks.

57.description: Great produce selection-- deli meat and cheese case is also fantastic.No frills, but great selections overall. We go there weekly and enjoy it each time.

20.description: the deals here are unreal. a pound of spinach is $1.50. a crate of blue berries was $1, thats right, a case! that is 8 containers for $1.Only rule of thumb is that typically you should be eating this food within a week of purchase. Other than that, this might be the greatest store of all time for produce.

36.description: My husband loves Stanley's but sice I'm writing this review its going to be my opinion.  Personally I am not that happy with Stanley's-  I know most people love the place but I find the store very dirty and the selection is hit or miss.  Know what you are buying because some of the prices are good but some are no different than other stores.  I have also noticed some items go bad and have to be thrown away a day or two after I buy them.  The fruit at wf or jewel seems to last longer.  Not impressed.

14.description: The possible deals found at Stanley's are mind blowing, but pay attention. We paid about $2 for a case (12 boxes) of blueberries. This is unbelievable. We did take the time to look at the boxes so that we chose a good case. We also washed them when we got home and froze the blueberries that we were not going to use quickly. It was a great deal! This location can get very busy, and the parking lot can become overfilled during busy times of the day.

58.description: DILAN IS AMAZING!! I was in a rush to get to class and he did my acrylics in literally 30 minutes and they look amazing. He listens to what you want and he kills it! He was also really funny and fun to talk to while I was getting them done. A+ for sure. :)!

56.description: I love Revive! The salon is clean and does not smell like chemicals. Polish always lasts at least 10 days and you can have a glass of wine during your service!

29.description: I love revive!  It's a great, clean salon where everyone is polite and does a great job.  I've co tinier coming here because of the location and the service.  They offer wine, tea and water to every customer which is appreciated.  They do get busy, so call ahead to make an appointment!

42.description: I've been here three times now and have never left disappointed. I usually do a basic pedi and a no-chip manicure. My no-chips have always lasted the full 2 weeks with the only chipping being my own fault (I'm rough on my hands). I love the online booking feature, and even when I have arrived early they've been able to seat me within a few minutes. Like any place, it's easier to get an appointment during off-peak hours. I've been to places all around the city and this is one of my favorites. I'll be back in time for the holidays!

23.description: I went to Revive with a friend and they were very accommodating as we booked through services and arrived separately.  We booked no-chip mani/pedis and they ensured we received our services together, which was great! Very clean salon and cute interior. If you want to save $20 - book through Prettyquick with this link prettyquick.com/redeem/e…Great color selection - the only disappointment part for me was they do not carry OPI no chip polish and I'm a loyal OPI person.  I came in with my color choice (in the OPI brand), but then found out they don't have that in no-chip.  However, they were very helpful in finding a color similar to that in a different brand. I do not live in the Wicker Park/Bucktown area, but I would come back here if I did.  Super friendly and welcoming and my mani/pedi looked good.

47.description: Love this place! Hours are great. Staff is always super nice. My nail tech Vanessa is awesome!

8.description: I've been a few more times after my last experience.  Overall, they are pretty decent.  The one thing I hate is it's totally dependent on your technician.  I've had some really great ones and then some really not great ones.  One time, it took 1.5 hours for a no chip mani...the next time it was 1.5 hrs for no chip mani & pedi.  It's very unpredictable, which can be frustrating.They are the closest nail salon to me now so I'm kind of stuck because even if they take awhile, it's still less time than me running to find a different salon.Lots of colors and the no chips usually last awhile.

31.description: This place is great. They take their time and always want you to leave happy. They frequently have deals and always have "early bird" specials. Lots of options for polishes. Tip - always call for an appointment. They aren't great at accommodating walk-ins, which may be hurting business a bit. BUT, as a repeat customer, I appreciate this model, knowing that I won't get stuck waiting behind others like at so many other salons. The one time they ran late on my appointment time, they gave me 10% off my service to make up for the (minor) inconvenience. That's customer service!!

34.description: Last no-chip lasted seven weeks before I took it off. This place is the best. Their standard is perfection- especially An. They send me email coupons all the time and it's too easy to make an appointment. Only complaint is they need more no-chip colors

16.description: Friendly staff, clean facility, and my No-chips always last! One of my favorite places to go.

13.description: I went to Revive with a friend and they were very accommodating as we booked through services and arrived separately.  We booked no-chip mani/pedis and they ensured we received our services together, which was great! Very clean salon and cute interior. If you want to save $20 - book through Prettyquick with this link prettyquick.com/redeem/e…Great color selection - the only disappointment part for me was they do not carry OPI no chip polish and I'm a loyal OPI person.  I came in with my color choice (in the OPI brand), but then found out they don't have that in no-chip.  However, they were very helpful in finding a color similar to that in a different brand. I do not live in the Wicker Park/Bucktown area, but I would come back here if I did.  Super friendly and welcoming and my mani/pedi looked good.

11.description: I've been going to Revive regularly since last December when I wanted to get my nails done for NYE. Before I went, I did some researching online for places in Chicago that used more natural products. Since I'm health-conscious and I know that typical nail salons are full of chemicals and fumes, I was really excited to give them a try. I'm glad I did! The staff is super friendly, the atmosphere is very spa-like with NO fumes, it's very clean, reasonably priced, and most importantly, they do great work. The technicians I've worked with were also very accommodating to my requests - just ask and they'll do what you want. My favorite so far is the organic mani-pedi early-bird special. I can't believe I lived in Wicker Park for 2 years and didn't go there then. I'm in a different neighborhood now but the added distance is totally worth it! I love this place.

39.description: One of the best in the city! An does my nails and she is amazing.  Love their pedicures!  Very clean, modern salon with wonderful staff.  GO HERE!

37.description: Lovely nail salon. Lein was great and a wonderful person. I walked in but was treated like I come here regularly. And they have wine.

0.description: Revive has a combination of skilled technicians and business owners who know what they're doing. The customer experience has been crafted attention to detail and the folks who I've encountered at the front desk are extremely helpful with answering questions about services. They also sterilize their manicure instruments and have a dizzying number of no chip colors.I've had many conventional manicures and no chip manicures over the years. Revive has introduced me to my all time favorite in terms of beauty and durability: No Chip Gel Lacquer manicures. They're flexible and last without chipping or peeling for almost 3 weeks, even with as hard as I am on my hands (I can't break the bad habit of using my nails like tools)!My tips for folks thinking about getting the No Chip Gel Lacquer:-be ready to pay $45 plus tip for the service (worth every penny)-The lightest colors can sometimes get stained by clothing dyes (think if your nails rub against your dark blue jeans) and start to look dingy.-I wouldn't recommend attempting to remove them on your own; it's worth paying for Revive to do a "soak off" before your next manicure-Nail art can be done with the gel lacquer. I've had French tips and half moons.-Gel Lacquer works well on long or short nails and especially pointy stiletto nails.Similar to what Cara Y. wrote below, I live no where near Revive but it's well worth the trip.

38.description: Revive Nails is the best nail salon in the city! If you're looking a for a great no-chip, Look no further! Lasts 3+ weeks, and great color selection. They also have a great early bird special - no chip-organic pedi combo for less than $60!

51.description: Great love this place great love it everyone is great

27.description: Vanessa is my go to girl. Her technical skills are on point and she's a doll, she's so sweet to talk to. The staff is great and so welcoming as well. Very clean and they run on time every time I have an appointment.

32.description: There are 3 nail salons within walking distance of my home and I opt to travel over to Revive every other week to get my manicures. I work for myself, and at a bar, meaning my hands are constantly abused between 14 hour days at a computer and nights in harsh cleaning solutions and Revive's no-chip lasts just as long as they promise AND they manage to reset my hands to their original glory every time I go in. Their prices are insanely reasonable, their staff is incredibly talented and kind.I love you, Revive, you got me for life.

54.description: I am crazy picky about having stuff done to my nails...have always left them plain because I am never happy with how they get polished or how long the polish lasts.  However, now that I have Vanessa, I LOVE having my nails done!  The polish lasts for weeks - no chipping for normally three weeks, and have gone four without a crack or peel in sight!  Vanessa is amazing!revive has no "nail salon" smell, the people are friendly and my nails always look fabulous and don't lose the shine or polish before my next visit!

48.description: I have been to Revive twice now in the past month and both times the service as been wonderful. The staff are friendly, capable, and prompt. I appreciate the flexibility of online appointment scheduling too and will definitely continue to go to this nail salon.

44.description: I love that you can make appointments online. Everyone is pretty friendly and does good work, so far. The salon is relaxing and hospitable, and they will bring you a beverage of your choice. I like that it is convenient for me, and I will be returning again and again.

24.description: I've been a customer for years and have never had a bad experience with my pedis or no chip manis. Booking appointments online is a breeze, the salon is always spotless and clean (which is a must), and the free glass of wine is always a nice touch as well. Highly recommend.

7.description: I called them to see how much they charged for acrylics. Said they're not doing any acrylic services because they don't have the technician for it She was nice. But get it together guys, you're a nail salon.

49.description: This is one of my favorite neighborhood nail salons. They have always done an excellent job with my nails, but more importantly, the service is unmatched. Highly recommended!

40.description: I come here every 3 weeks consistently to get my no chip gel manicure and they do a great job every time . For someone who travels weekly, the no chip gel manicure is perfect and their manicure packages are great for those that get mani/pedis on a regular basis. The place is clean, they're eco conscious and have organic polishes, they serve wine/tea/water every visit, and an added incentive is really their loyalty points. The loyalty points are tangible and you can actually redeem them for something worthwhile (exfoliating scrubs, clay masks, 2 finger nail art, eyebrow waxes, etc). After moving to Chicago in Aug 2014 I was looking for a consistent nail salon. Pinky's and other nail salons along Division, really just weren't doing it for me. I highly recommend Revive and they will have my business as long as I am in the neighborhood.

53.description: Wanted so badly to love this place as it's literally right next door to me. Left feeling frustrated and not relaxed at all. Pros:Ileana did a great job on my no chip mani. The quality of both my nails and toes was very good, which is the only reason I am giving 3 stars. Cons:Entire service took 2 hours and 15 min. Longest nail service of my life to date. This wouldn't be such a con if the rest of the experience was enjoyable. Soak-off of my old no-chip polish took 55 minutes for both fingers and toes, at my usual spot it takes 10, max. No exaggeration. They also charged $6 for the soak off service, which I have never experienced before. It's always been complimentary when you are getting another main/pedi to replace it, both of which I got.The guy doing it (didn't introduce himself) seemed frustrated that he had to do the soak off. Suggested that I shouldn't get no-chips on my toes because the regular polish lasts just as long. My no-chip was 7 weeks old, so I nicely said that wasn't the case for me, and explained that I danced was on my feet all the time. Thought it was strange that he was talking-down a more expensive service. The same guy also kept asking the tech next to him to do both my manicure and pedicure, (under his breath like I wouldn't hear him) and I felt so awkward sitting there, as he kept trying to pass me off. I should mention that I DID make an appointment, but I felt shuffled around like an annoying walk in. The salon wasn't even busy - there were only 3 techs working when I arrived - but the woman on the phone said appointments were preferred, that there's almost always a long wait for walk-ins etc.The guy did end up doing my toes and did good work, but didn't want to put my silver sparkle straight on my toes. He insisted on a silver base polish, to which I said fine, but he just put one coat of the sparkle...so really my nails just look silver, with a very faint sparkle, not the glittery look I was going for.The tech didn't talk to me much at all (this is okay, but at least ask me how I am, how my day is going, etc. or notice that I am a new client, ask me if I live in the area, etc. - these quick interactions make your clients feel at home and WANTED/WELCOME.) He did however discus other salons and pay rates elsewhere with a fellow nail tech, who tips well, etc. Felt awkward having them discuss other places in front of me - as if they were both unhappy with the jobs they were currently at/doing.The woman next to me was offered something to drink right away. My guy offered me nothing, and left me sitting for what he said would be 5 minutes and was definitely 15. (Ileana did offer me a drink when I sat down with her for the mani - thank you. The tea was really good. Just would have liked the same from the other tech who did my toes.)SO MUCH confusion over what service I wanted. Went in for an early-bird special - $58 for a no chip mani and regular (standard) pedi. I said this on the phone, but when I arrived they thought I wanted an organic pedicure/manicure. After we sorted out the confusion (caught some eye-rolling from the woman at the front desk), I still had to clarify with the techs. I think this was the start of the one male tech trying to pass me off to Ileana.I tipped in cash and went up to settle my balance and the front desk woman was again confused about my service. She seemed confused about the special I went in for, and I had to pull it up on the website to confirm. She was then charging me $9 for the soak off when it should have been $6 ($3 for fingers $3 for toes). She was nice about it, and we settled on the correct amount, but it was all too much. Should have been a simple transaction. I too am in customer service, and feel the atmosphere and overall experience here was just really lacking. The decor is so warm and inviting but the staff seems lackluster at best. Again, props to Ileana, she was the nicest one I encountered, but even she seemed less than thrilled to be there. Over 2 hours, I had nowhere to be and I just couldn't relax. I may try them again, but not before trying other shops in the area first. If I do go back, I'll ask for Ileana specifically, and maybe call a day or two ahead of time.
