30.description: I have been going to Vanessa for almost a year and won't go anywhere else. My nails and toes receive the best attention and I never feel rushed. I have to pass several salons to go here but it's totally worth it. The salon overall is nice and clean, no complaints. Vanessa makes it great for me. If it wasn't for her I could take it or leave it. She does great work and sometimes I get the occasional design for fun. My only complaint is the salon charges for the removal of a no chip even if you are getting a new service. I find that a bit ridiculous considering I come on adverse every 12-14 days. Other than that the pricing is fair.

46.description: I've been going to Revive since it opened, and have always been a satisfied customer.  I'm convinced they have the longest lasting no-chip manicures in the city--I can usually get a full three weeks out of mine!!! Sometimes the manicure takes an hour or so, but I'm happy to deal with the nail techs' perfectionist tendencies when my nails look this good!

1.description: A lot was left to be desired. A modest collection. 3 racks of  opi, Essie, and cnd/China glaze mix. While i appreciate the minimalist, health-conscious, Eco-friendly vibe, here were my misses. I came for a mani-pedi. The massage chair had a buttocks option, and this portion did not work. It seemed like a lot of the buttons on the remote were unresponsive. I saw a water dispenser... Wasn't offered water. Pedi-tub water was hardly even lukewarm. Nicki was my tech... Appropriate in skill, for the most part. No problems with polish application... But she cut my nails too short. I had two broken nails on my R index and R middle.. And I just wanted the rest shortened slightly so it would blend. All my nails ended up quite short, with my fingertip pads visible beneath the tip of the nail. Hate that. She set me at the drying station and didn't turn any of the driers on before leaving. Asked the receptionist for help. She had placed my phone away in my purse, and the drying station faces outside. No magazines, music, or TV to distract, risking polish injury.  After the pedi, she should have asked me to pull my leggings down to my ankles. I didn't realize this was missed until after I was done at the drying station, so  I risked polish smudging again, trying to pull my leggings down over my calves. Small things... But these all added up. I've got a hefty collection of polish at home, so spending on a spa treatment with little hospitality just didn't sit well with me. This is a spot I wouldn't revisit... And I'd only go if I lived in the area.Nothing was wrong, but nothing was great either.

55.description: Revive nails is great. I stopped in bc they were around the corner from my new place and I was pleasantly surprised. They are clean (a must for me), reasonably priced and have great nail techs. Not to mentionall the incentives to get $$ off your next visit, with Yelp check-ins, friend referrals for $10 off and if you review them on Yelp 5% off then too! I will definitely keep going back to revive.

9.description: There are 3 nail salons within walking distance of my home and I opt to travel over to Revive every other week to get my manicures. I work for myself, and at a bar, meaning my hands are constantly abused between 14 hour days at a computer and nights in harsh cleaning solutions and Revive's no-chip lasts just as long as they promise AND they manage to reset my hands to their original glory every time I go in. Their prices are insanely reasonable, their staff is incredibly talented and kind.I love you, Revive, you got me for life.

26.description: This is by far my favorite nail place in Chicago. They have exceptional customer service, everything is very clean and my nails always look amazing! I love it here and highly recommend it!

25.description: I made an appointment for a no chip mani, and regular pedi fifteen days ago. My no chip has been awesome -  best no chip I have ever had. I also enjoy that they offer complimentary wine and tea. What a great idea! The women that work there are very friendly and accommodating.  If you refer someone to Revive, they give you $10 off and who you've recommended! Prices are reasonable anyway! I will definitely be returning.

12.description: the service is always great! I usually get a no chip mani and it lasts a very long time!

59.description: Dylan is so great...he did an amazing job on the no-chip. Very detail oriented and had a great personality! Highly recommend this place!

21.description: I'd like to say since the new owners have taken over here; it's been a delight !  I enjoy going a little out way to come here because of the service here. The moment you walk through the door you are appreciated. I've had many sessions; pedi/manis here with different technicians and they have done a great work. I'd like to thank Trina and Tuan for always dong here best to accommodate my hectic schedule.... Thank you all seen you soon

17.description: I come here every 3 weeks consistently to get my no chip gel manicure and they do a great job every time . For someone who travels weekly, the no chip gel manicure is perfect and their manicure packages are great for those that get mani/pedis on a regular basis. The place is clean, they're eco conscious and have organic polishes, they serve wine/tea/water every visit, and an added incentive is really their loyalty points. The loyalty points are tangible and you can actually redeem them for something worthwhile (exfoliating scrubs, clay masks, 2 finger nail art, eyebrow waxes, etc). After moving to Chicago in Aug 2014 I was looking for a consistent nail salon. Pinky's and other nail salons along Division, really just weren't doing it for me. I highly recommend Revive and they will have my business as long as I am in the neighborhood.

10.description: I've lived in the area for a over a year and Revive has been my go-to location for no-chip manicures and standard pedicures. The staff is extremely friendly and courteous. (Added bonus: they offer beverages whenever I am there.)They are good at coordinating weekend services for groups of 3-5 (I haven't had to schedule appointments for more people, so I can only speak for 3-5); however, we had initially tried to schedule an evening appointment on a weeknight for 3 people, but were advised only two nail technicians would be available. This wasn't a big deal as we were able to align our schedules to go on the weekend, but just a note.Overall, my pedicures and no chip manicures have typically stayed on for the minimum time stated and they are always completed timely and cleanly.Last note: Not that this is unique to Revive, but if you want to tip, remember to bring cash. :)

5.description: Revive is my favorite nail salon that is walking distance from my home. The staff is super friendly and professional.  They always offer tea, wine and water when I arrive.I have had several manicures, no chip manicures, and pedicures.  I have had no problem booking the manicures through PrettyQuick or by calling the salon directly. Overall, my pedicures and no chip manicures have been great.  There is one lady that I love and try to request her all of the time.My only critique is that I do wish they had a better magazine selection!

3.description: What a fantastic facility. It can be a little challenging getting a last minute appointment here, but it's because of how great their services are and because of how reasonably priced they are as well. I have been here twice and while it's no where near where I live, I will only return here for my nail services. The staff is friendly. The facility is clean. I actually watched my tech open the sealed tools to do my nails. No fuss here!! Thank you for providing great services at really fantastic prices!!

35.description: Very nice people and basically a spa pedi for a regular pedi price

19.description: Love this place! Hours are great. Staff is always super nice. My nail tech Vanessa is awesome!

28.description: I called them to see how much they charged for acrylics. Said they're not doing any acrylic services because they don't have the technician for it She was nice. But get it together guys, you're a nail salon.

45.description: I have been going to Revive for 2 years now and I have tried every single nail place. They are the CLEANEST! This is big because it is rare that you actually see nail techs take out NEW tools every single time. That is huge for me. Secondly, the receptionists are really friendly and accommodating. What could I say, Vanessa is the best! She is passionate about nails and so warm and friendly! Her nail art is so amazing and she is so creative! I am out of there quickly and I love their late hours. Trust me, I have tried every single nail place good and bad. Revive is the best there is in Chicago!

33.description: I have moved out of the neighborhood, but still come back to this salon.  The quality is consistent, the salon is always clean, and everyone is super friendly.  I get a standard mani/pedi and am always pleasantly surprised at how long the manicure lasts (other salons are about 24 hours for me and the one I have currently has been almost a week).  I highly recommend Revive and will be returning soon!

43.description: I love this place! The staff are very friendly, and the place is super comfortable! Last time I was in, I had the organic mani & pedi from Lis. She is great - took her time and made all of my nails look fantastic! Free wine and tea is a plus. I've never had a bad experience here.

2.description: Revive is absolutely amazing! Offering traditional, no chip, and organic manicures and pedicures. Stopped in for a walk in around two hours before closing on a Friday night and the staff was absolutely fantastic. Accommodating doesn't begin to cover it. Wonderful color options, lovely massage chairs, and taking the time to check in with us, the staff is wonderful!  Can't wait to come back and get another treatment!

18.description: Revive Nails is simply the best nail salon by far. With everything being environmentally friendly and the service oh mygosh!  Will recommend  this place any day

41.description: Great service, clean facility, reasonably priced.  Its the only place I go now because the no-chips last longer!  I'm just sad the secret is out and now I always have to book an appointment in advance!

52.description: I started coming here because I downloaded the PrettyQuick app and they are one of the best spots in the Wicker Park/West Town area. No matter who does my no-chip manicure, they always look fabulous and last for at least 2 weeks. One time it lasted well over 3 weeks without chipping. They fill up quickly with appointments, so make sure you book in advance!

50.description: Great service, friendly staff.  Always SO pleased with the results.  I typically head to Revive for pedicures, but I also had a no-polish manicure done there and it was perfect.  Nice option to book online, too.  Would recommend them to anyone.

4.description: Final update: Three strikes is my limit. I think the people at Revive (especially the owner) are very nice, but they lack quality and consistency workmanship. I went in to have two acrylic with no chip nails repaired to tide me over until my fill next week. Vanessa wasn't available, but the receptionist said they now had an "acrylic specialist" who could do it. He was very friendly and did the repairs, but when it came time to apply the polish to the repaired nails, he said "I'll do you a favor and put a new coat on the old." I didn't ask for it, but I assumed that he was going to put no chip on the existing acrylic.Instead, he applied no chip to both the acrylic and the raw cuticle where my nails had grown out. The result, as you can see from the pictures, is embarrassing. The no chip is peeling from the raw cuticle and you can clearly see where the acrylic ends. They look so much worse than they did before I came in today! Some of the polish had worn off, sure, but it didn't look like my cuticles were bleeding. I really wanted it to work out at Revive because I like the atmosphere and the people, but the quality of work is just not there. The first time, the nails came off easily. The second time, the nails were stronger, but the nail length varied drastically. Now, the third time, I have no chip peeling off of my raw cuticle because the so-called "acrylic expert" didn't think about what would happen if you applied no chip to the space where the acrylic nail had grown out. I've reached my limit.

6.description: Always great. Very relaxed atmosphere and their supply of options for an all natural nail day is on point! I've brought my sister, best friend and mom here. They all enjoyed their experience as well! You won't be disappointed.

22.description: Wonderful service. Nails always come out looking great! Appreciate that they have eco-friendly products and vegan nail polish (for us mamas). Only wish is that they did shoulder massages.

15.description: DILAN IS AMAZING!! I was in a rush to get to class and he did my acrylics in literally 30 minutes and they look amazing. He listens to what you want and he kills it! He was also really funny and fun to talk to while I was getting them done. A+ for sure. :)!

57.description: Awesome no chip. Specialist took her time and really made sure my nails were evenly filed before she put any polish on. Salon was very clean and had a really mellow vibe to it.  I'll definitely be coming back.

20.description: I went in 3 weeks ago for a no chip and they lasted the whole 3 weeks with no chipping just out growth. I will be going back for sure.

36.description: Good quality polish, nice technicians who do a thorough job and take their time rather than rushing through services. I would recommend them. They also offer natural and organic products.

14.description: Everyone at Revive is always so welcoming. Stephanie, in particular, takes such good care to ensure my nails are PERFECT every time. She is a perfectionist and I benefit from that. The salon is clean and a peaceful place to be. To top off the experience, they offer water, tea or wine at each visit. I love this place!

3.description: Honestly as good as it gets Staff:Staff is super helpful and caters to all customers - beginner to advanced users everyone is welcomeFacility: You can tell these guys put a lot of effort into making this a nice relaxing place open to all. I suggest you skip the coffee shop and bring your laptop here if you need to get work done - they have ample seating , free wifi and even a pool table free for everyone to use. Bathrooms were clean.Product line:They carry all major juice brands as well as a couple local juice producers lines. They have everything from basic setups to really advanced regulated mods. OverallI have nothing bad to say, I really enjoy going here since they have opened. I live near this shop and am glad to have them in my neighborhood.

1.description: Stopped in for the first time today to reup on Juul pods (addicting) and was very impressed with the look of the shop. Very friendly people and good vibes. Recommended.

2.description: Awesome place and great service! Wide open area and a great selection of starter, mid range, and high end Vape gear. The owner Jason has a great mind for the business and his service is some of the best in the industry. Plus this makes you feel like you're at any Vape312 store, so you know it's all quality products and services.

0.description: Hands down the BEST Vape Shop I've been to. Location is super accessible. I've visited more than a handful of times and I always find free and close parking! The shop has tons of space inside. You'll never be without a seat or table. They have nice large high top tables with stools if you want to get some work done (FREE WIFI) or they have a huge comfy couch if you just want to kick it. They also have a pool table that anyone and everyone can use for FREE! Staff is super welcoming. They definitely care more about the customer than they do the sale! They give their honest opinions and share their knowledge based off of your personal needs. They go above and beyond to help get you the juice/build/product/set up you need! Also, Bring Your Own Booze!!! Need I say more? Overall this place, and the owners, have really out done themselves! Amazing location, excellent customer service and super chill ambiance!

4.description: Great shop!! Awesome deals on eliquid and vaporizers. They have a great selection of beginner devices all the way up to highend mods. They have a huge eliquid bar, plenty of tables, comfy couches, and a free to use pool table. The owners and workers are very knowledgeable and friendly. Definitely a one stop shop for all your vaping needs.

58.description: I went here for lunch and had the two hotdog, fries and a drink for $5.25 special.  It was great.  The ingredients on the dog were fresh and ample.

56.description: What looks like an unassuming little pizza joint from the outside houses the driest, most tasteless pizza that I've probably ever eaten. The slices are large, sure, and they are also mediocre. In a city known for great pizza, you can safely pass this one by.

29.description: I love this place! I am not a deep dish kind of girl so the thin slices here are perfect! They have great food and amazing service. The guy who is normally working the register is always very nice. The prices are affordable and they have a lot of options. This is right off the Chicago blue line. The only down fall is there is no parking, so I have to risk a ticket every time I want to swing by and grab food.

42.description: This place is awesome, I eat here constantly for lunch. Love the pizza and the prices are really good too. Highly recommended!

23.description: Considering I only eat the pizza slices when I'm drunk, my rating may be a bit generous...  But the slices are huge and tasty!

47.description: Come for the pizza. Stay for the delicious pizza sauce.I walked in and stopped for a slice of sausage and cheese. I thought it was just alright. Last week I had their pizza at Beauty Bar and thought it was great. So great that we ordered two pizzas last week. Both times we got only pepperoni for a topping. If I wasn't so fat I would get their pizza all the time. If you decide to try this place, I highly suggest that you get extra sauce on your pizza. It's definitely a must. They have have some of the best sauce around. In the future I want to try more toppings and  appetizers. The also seem to have some solid special throughout the week. Just writing this is making hungry for more Pie-Eyed.

8.description: Pizza is meh. My issue is with their sauce... too watery and bland.Their salads are decent, but it's not like you go to a pizzeria for the salad.

31.description: Hands down best thin crust pizza in the area. Open till 4am on the weekends, so they get drunken orders from me all of the time. Their top competition is D'Agostinos and I personally favor Pie Eyed's sauce over theirs. I've never had anything besides their pizza.

34.description: I really like the pizza here. I'll start off by saying that I prefer my pizza crust to be thin and crispy. Deep dish just doesn't do it for me. The crust here is just a little too thick for my taste, but the toppings make up for it. I do wish they'd put more seasoning into their sauce, but other than that I'd say the pizza is a good deal for the price, and the topping selection is large enough to allow for a lot of variety.

16.description: I absolutely love their Buffalo shrimp. Their pizza is not bad. Their delivery is pretty fast.

13.description: Good pizza, clean restaurant.  The owner works behind the counter and is friendly and helpful.  From what I hear it is a great place to grab a slice for lunch or late after a night out.

11.description: It doesn't take much genius and creativity to bake good pizzas. And even a good pizza would have been acceptable, dough, sauce and cheese, temperature and time. But when you can mess up something so basic, you may wanna fire your kitchen staff and start all over again.$24 for a 18" flatbread with ketchup sauce (???) and cheese = killed my appetite and never coming back!

39.description: Great slice,good crust and fresh toppings. If out late and in the area pie eyed is the spot.

37.description: Delicious pizza by the slice and a meatball sandwich delivered from heaven with cheese and hot peppers for 5 bucks yes, yes, yes!

0.description: Hey do u know of better thin crust? I don't know of a more perfect pizzeria. the Cheese pizza is incredible and they don't have to hide behind toppings but the toppings are also really awesomeAnd the hours are the shit!! I used to come here pretty much every day in high school and now we order from them 2 miles away!

38.description: Great for late night pizza by the slice. Best pizza by the slice I ever had. Right by Chicago ave blue line stop. I recommend a slice of tomato basil. Open till 5am Friday and Saturday. Very little seating. Full of drunks late night and the staff is always friendly. Grab your pizza and eat it on the curb, or on your way home. We've even order a whole pie for delivery. It was pretty good. Support your local pizza!

51.description: Pretty decent pizza. I love that you can buy thin and deep dish by the slice. It's a biiiiig slice too. We got this new york style "cookie" which was like a dough with chocolate and vanilla on it. Just get it dude. It was delish. Nice twist on a traditional cookie.

27.description: I gave this place 3 chances. First time: Fried Ravioli and Garlic bread special. The grease was bad, I ate two raviolis and for the rest of the day I had an epic stomach ache. No bueno. Garlic bread was an odd combo of soggy and chewy and tasted like straight butter. Gross.Second time: Tomato Pizza with fresh Basil: Well my pizza was only reheated halfway  so the first half of the pizza was warm and decent. The second half was cold. It was just Ok. Third time: Garden Salad: Sooo much rotten lettuce that it was inedible. I want my money back but I already used my lunch break and can't get take any more time out of my day to deal with this rotten little salad. needless to say I am pissed. Bottom Line: I feel like this place only cares about their late night customers who are too wasted to know whether they are eating cardboard or pizza. Save your time and money.

32.description: I've been here a few times (lunch and late night) Food was fast and good. Good service (especially when emergency dictated the use of the top secret restroom). Make it a combo with fries and a drink.

54.description: I love this pizza it just like New York style big and thin and the fried mozzerella sticks to die for.  This is good whether you been out drinking all night and need to soak up the toxic waste or if you just want a good slice of pizza.  We always get the tomato w Fresh basil with a sprinkle of parm and red pepper flake.  The cheese is melted nice into the tomatoes and fresh yes fresh basil chopped up and tossed on top PERFECT!!! The staff is always welcoming.  My favorite side is the fried mozzerella sticks yes its not healthy but every once in awhile you just have too! And these are worth it they are not really greasy lightly fried and served with yummy marinara sauce.

48.description: All hail Pie-Eyed.I was introduced tot his place via Beauty Bar and have been obessed ever since. Now lets be honest: their walk up slices leave much to be desired, but if you haven't ordered a pie then you haven't experienced pie-eyed.Their made to order pizza is fresh and oozing with flavor.Their sauce taste as though it has a hint of sugar and like so many other sweet things it kind of taste that makes you go back for more after you're al ready full.besides that hint of sweet in their well balanced sauce they also have 2 buck off cupon on their website for large pizzas and their take out is pretty quick. Ask for extra sauce and be preapred to meet your new pizza obession.

44.description: Simple slice of pizza here folks, nothing more nothing less.They are open till 5am on Friday and Saturdays.

24.description: I went in with the kids the other day and realize this group really cares about their customers.

7.description: It'll get the job done for sure.   Good late night or when you need to pop in for a slice.

49.description: Pretty good- awesome- creative- open late! All words that come to mind with this place.   It is good either midday or late nite.  Not overpriced like so many "chicago pizza" establishments.  Totally check it out. Oh and the guys behind the counter are totally down to earth and listen to some killer music.  Just one thing that sucks, im a cash only kinda girl. They dont do cash for delivery late night.  I understand why, they have their reasons.   However, they would have had so much more biz from me if they would accept cash.

40.description: great place for a quick bite right off the Chicago blue line! Oddly enough they have excellent spinach salads! The dudes working at the counter are usually extra helpful and nice. The heart shaped Pizza is a sweet deal!

53.description: Great pizza....amazing thin crust and savory sauce. Generous on the toppings. Quick delivery. Love this place. Also, every time I call in or go in, the customer service is great. Very friendly staff!

30.description: New York thin crust pizza drunk while stumbling home from the bars.

46.description: Great Small Pizza joint. Good for lunch, dinner & late night grub. The pizza is solid & so are the sandwiches. Best bacon in town for the pizza. Also has fresh slices available. The owners are great. Overall a good spot.

1.description: I've been a Pie Eyed customer for a few years. Consistently good deep dish (mmm so heavy, so much bread and cheese and sauce) and really great thin slices. I appreciate that they are open late on weekends. I know where to get my pizza fix if I want pizza at 1am.Rather recently, I called in an order before leaving work to pick up on my way home. By the time I got there, I didn't have a wallet - unfortunately, I'd been pick-pocketed on the train on my way home - and I stopped in to tell them I wouldn't be getting the pizza after all. Dude said, "Sounds like you're having a sh***y day, take it anyway." It was so kind when I was feeling so frustrated, it made me cry. Thank you, Pie Eyed, you are the pizza of my eye. :D

55.description: There are better pizza places in Chicago. That being said, there are definitely worse pizza places in Chicago too. if you're in the area and interested in pizza, I wouldn't hesitate to go in.   I've ordered from here a few times and have never been really disappointed. It's just that I've never been blown away either. Pizza is a pretty personal thing. It's an art really. The artists at Pie-Eyed aren't really big on sauce or toppings. It's definitely a minimalists dream.  I'll order from there again, I'll just order from a few other places first.

9.description: Okay, let me just start by saying that the people we talked to from Pie Eyed were super nice, so this not so stellar review has nothing to do with the service we received. Also, we ordered from here on New Years Eve, so I'm pretty sure they were slammed, but nevertheless, our order was over an hour late and came cold. We also had to call the restaurant several times, only to find the delivery driver said he had come to deliver but we didn't pick up his call so he went back to the restaurant. I'm not sure what happened here, since neither I or my fiancé had a voicemail or a missed call, but stranger things have happened. They did end up delivering, but it was a total ordeal and the pizza (along with being late and cold) was more saice than anything else. I don't think we will be ordering from here again.

26.description: I'm in the neighborhood a lot and eat here a couple times a week. Pizza should be the obvious route (their to-go slices are the best in the neighborhood), but then they also have these weekly specials -meatball sandwich and chicken parmesan- that particularly strike my tastebuds.

25.description: This place sucks.  Anyone who thinks this is good pizza doesn't know what good pizza is.  The cheese is as fake as it can get.  Tried the Italian beef and there's more bread than beef.  Asked to have it dipped and they didn't do it.  They don't listen to what customers want.  Gave this place 3 chances for lunch and failed everytime.  I would not recommend this place to anyone.  Garbage food

12.description: I love pie-eyed! I'm usually pretty lucky to be one of the first customers of the day. For most that means getting the biggest slice of pie. The problem is their slices are HUGE! Don't get me wrong I like to eat, but I always have to talk the lady into giving me the smallest slice. Add a blood orange San Pellegrino and my stomach is happy.Thanks for the pie!

59.description: This is my favorite pizza joint in Chicago, due to its proximity to my home and the quality of the thin crust pizza.The sauce is sweet, the toppings are quite generous, and the crust is crunchy. It's a little thicker than most thin crust, but still great.All of these lambasting reviews about how terrible the pizza is are garbage. Everyone is entitled to their opinions, but those gratuitous comments are simply sensationalized. I've had their Chicago-style pizza as well. Though I'm generally not a fan of that type of pizza, it beats Giordano's handedly.Why 4 Stars and not 5?Sometimes their selection isn't all that great. I've walked in on more than one occasion, just to see one type of pie on the warming plate. I am easy to please: pepperoni, sausage, cheese, or any combination of the three. Sometimes those aren't available.

21.description: Maybe something other than pizza would be better, but the pizza was only okay imo. Got a sausage slice and the sausage was a bit skimpy and the slice was way undercooked, not at all crispy. It also was just really lacking in flavor, i like tomatoes and seasoning, and this was just doughy, cheesy thin bread with a bit of sausage--not a terrible thing, but not a treat for my taste buds, which is what I look for when I eat out. I only saw NY style, no Chicago or Sicilian. It also wasn't piping hot. The slices are large, but not $4.25-worth. The staff is friendly, and the location is excellent--right behind the east-bound 66 bus on Chicago, and across the street from the blue line Chicago stop. I could see going again based on convenience, given the location and late night hours, it would be a good place to sit and wait for the bus, but I wouldn't actually recommend the pizza. Oh, and there's a bike rack right outside.

17.description: All hail Pie-Eyed.I was introduced tot his place via Beauty Bar and have been obessed ever since. Now lets be honest: their walk up slices leave much to be desired, but if you haven't ordered a pie then you haven't experienced pie-eyed.Their made to order pizza is fresh and oozing with flavor.Their sauce taste as though it has a hint of sugar and like so many other sweet things it kind of taste that makes you go back for more after you're al ready full.besides that hint of sweet in their well balanced sauce they also have 2 buck off cupon on their website for large pizzas and their take out is pretty quick. Ask for extra sauce and be preapred to meet your new pizza obession.

10.description: I can be quite the selective eater. Their wings are crisp (you know, not soggy), meat on the bones, and a buffalo sauce that has some kick to it. Their wings are great! Other things I recommend are the toasted ravioli, any of their salads, the pizza (duh), the italian beef is toasted and done to perfection. Their pizza is also the right amount of everything. Highly recommend.

5.description: I don't go to many pizza places that offer pizza by the slice but this one is awesome. Their sausage and pepperoni slices are amazing. Great convenient location right off the Chicago Ave blue line stop. Walk up the stairs from the train and into the place. Can't get anymore convenient then that. Also my mom liked their spinach and mushroom slice.

3.description: This is a fantastic little find!It's reasonably priced in fact, it's inexpensive, it's open really late, it's got a great menu, and the food ain't bad.  I recommend checking the daily specials.  The Monday Meatball Sub is fantastic.  They give you large meatballs with a lot of cheese and the sauce pretty decent.  It's not fresh, but let's keep expectations realistic here, it's a great little dive with good prices and completely convenient.  The pizza is good, I like their crust and is sold by the slice. The chicken parm is ok too.  I had their wings.... Well....ummm.....errrrr....ehhhh....let's just say don't get the wings...it's not a wing joint, ok?If you live nearby, you're crazy not making this a regular standby/go-to.Oh, watch out for the bakery. Best way to put this, make sure you have dental insurance first, just sayin'....

35.description: This is my new deep dish pizza destination plus they deliver. Their pizza is great.

19.description: There are very few options for late night food in this area so the pizza was decent, but undercooked and not an option under normal business hours.

28.description: There are very few options for late night food in this area so the pizza was decent, but undercooked and not an option under normal business hours.

45.description: Love this place. They are always on the money, always on time with delivery! I've ordered from them at the office at least a 10 times now, each time - fresh toppings, delicious sauce, deep dish is good, thin is awesome! Never had a bad experience with this pie place. Came upon them on a whim, seemed to be the only place with reasonable prices and good reviews, in addition to cheap same day delivery. Been with them ever since!

33.description: Ordered the gluten free pizza for the first time the other day and it was absolutely delicious. My boyfriend has been gluten free for a couple years now and we honestly have the hardest time finding a good tasting gluten free pizza. We found our new pizza home. Loves it!!!! Can't wait to be a fat a$$ and order one a week.

43.description: Our favorite place for pie delivery!  If you are craving delicious pizza with fresh toppings, this is the spot! Classic thin crust, sweet sauce, and spot-on delivery. We make sure to always add on an order of buffalo shrimp, which you can order increments of five (which is great, in case you only want a little something extra to complement your pizza). The shrimps come lightly breaded and sauced in their fantastic buffalo sauce -- which also works well on the buffalo chicken pizza! Highly recommend. Your order typically comes with coupons too for future discounts. Awesome perk for loyal customers :) FYI, for pizza-and-wing fans, their wings are breaded as well ... I only mention this because we ordered them once and forgot to ask, so we were caught off guard.

2.description: I came with the fam and had a pizza with fries combo. The fries thing was a little off but let me tell you... The fries are the only thing worth coming back for. The pizza was bland and more on the average side. The service was ok and there were no customers so finding a seat was a breeze.. Although, not offering high chairs to its customers is not only a let down but not family friend at all. Would I come back? Um, highly doubtful

18.description: I gave this place 3 chances. First time: Fried Ravioli and Garlic bread special. The grease was bad, I ate two raviolis and for the rest of the day I had an epic stomach ache. No bueno. Garlic bread was an odd combo of soggy and chewy and tasted like straight butter. Gross.Second time: Tomato Pizza with fresh Basil: Well my pizza was only reheated halfway  so the first half of the pizza was warm and decent. The second half was cold. It was just Ok. Third time: Garden Salad: Sooo much rotten lettuce that it was inedible. I want my money back but I already used my lunch break and can't get take any more time out of my day to deal with this rotten little salad. needless to say I am pissed. Bottom Line: I feel like this place only cares about their late night customers who are too wasted to know whether they are eating cardboard or pizza. Save your time and money.

41.description: Ordered for delivery through Grubhub.  PRO - There is only one.  The delivery was incredibly fast, like under 30 minutes.  CONS - The food order was messed up, the toasted ravioli was overbreaded and very greasy, and I've had better Italian Beefs at a place that looks like it should be shut down by the Health Department any minute.  I did not try the pizza so maybe I am missing out, but I'm probably not going to try again when there are so many other places that do the stuff beyond pizza so much better.

52.description: 12/10/13Please open your restrooms to your customers.  Pie Eyed pizza is still great, restroom policies are stil not great.No customer restrooms.The pizza is great and gets 3 stars for Chicago pizza and 5 for late night pizza.  But Pie-Eyed should be ashamed for locking off employee restrooms and turning away customers.  If you want to report them to the city you can Google "chicago consumer retail complaint", the first result will take you to the correct form.

50.description: this is my neighborhood pizza joint. can't say that its my favorite pie in the city but it definitely satiates my pizza fix when needed. i think i can confidently say that i like their cheese fries over their pizza. this says a lot considering i'm a bit of a frites snob. and as for the cheese, it's so fake and so good. love that stuff!

4.description: Really good offbeat local pizza joint right at the Chicago blue line stop. Don't expect anything fancy just good thin-crust pizza, huge slices and range of fried food options. Open late. The #1 with a slice, drink and fries is a good deal. I recommend heading across to the street to the Matchbox after, some of the best cocktails in the city in a really unique space.

6.description: Good pizza. Good hours. I would recommend to my friends for sure :)

22.description: I would really give it 2.75.  It's solid pizza, the people are nice and the menu has a lot of diversity to it, but I just didn't feel like it wowed me or left me with any overwhelmingly favorable impression. Also ordered some of the appetizers which were diverse but I didn't feel like had any real value or wowing taste/appearance.Solid and reliable but not can't miss.

15.description: First, I've ordered from here a couple of times now.Below Average Pizza - lacks the minimally required flavor and texture.And the surprising uncalled for cherry on top - Extremely rude customer service. It's almost like they're trying not to have sober loyal customers. Need I say more?

57.description: For being a quick grab-a-slice-on-the-go, this place is awesome!  Their pizza is pretty good.  Although you shouldn't expect a gourmet slice, you should expect a good, hot, gooey slice of pizza that is very generous in size.

20.description: First, I've ordered from here a couple of times now.Below Average Pizza - lacks the minimally required flavor and texture.And the surprising uncalled for cherry on top - Extremely rude customer service. It's almost like they're trying not to have sober loyal customers. Need I say more?

36.description: Pretty solid late night choice. Open til 5am on the weekends and they also have delivery. Huge slices of pizza too.

14.description: I went in with the kids the other day and realize this group really cares about their customers.

58.description: Horrible.  Called and asked if we needed to make reservations and the woman said no.  Waited for 45 minutes before being seated.  Service was horrible because they only had 2 waitresses and the place was packed.  It was so loud that I couldn't even here the person I was eating with.  Food took forever to come out and it was cold, not even warm.  We sent it back and they obviously just microwaved it and returned it and it was horrible-and extremely bland.  Maybe this place was good at one time but I will never step foot in there again.  I hate to say it but I think they have outgrown themselves somehow and can not handle it.

56.description: Simply the best Cuban food and yes it is authentic! Better than Cuban food we have had in both South Beach and north Miami beach. It's BYOB, but Noble grape is just a 1-3 min walk away!

29.description: Very kitschy Cuban Restaurant. I ordered surf-n-turf... garlic shrimp and steak w rice, beans and fried plantains. Very delicious!!! I put hot sauce on the steak and it was perfect. Great music and loved the ambiance. Can't wait to try more dishes on the menu!!

42.description: I spent an afternoon walking through Wicker Park with my cousin while visiting Chicago. We decided to drive a few minutes out of the way to try Habana Libre. This was a great change of pace. The roasted pork and ropa vieja were outstanding. The black beans and plantains were great accompaniments to the meals. Our server was sweet and I hope to someday come back to dine at Habana Libre for some great Cuban cuisine.

23.description: Very nice staff, very tasty sandwiches!I enjoyed my cubano, and would come back for seconds. Portions were generous and super-filling. As others have mentioned, it's BYOB. If you forget to bring something to drink, there are numerous liquor stores nearby.There are plenty of menu choices for chicken, beef, pork, or seafood lovers with a few good vegetarian options as well.

47.description: Habana Libre is a cozy cute place with outdoor seating, BYOB and a warm vibe that will bring me back frequently.  Especially on a frigid winter night (like we haven't had any of those-ha!) when I just want to close my eyes and pretend I'm someplace with an umbrella in my drink and sand between my toes. Service is great, very efficient even when slammed. And best of all they make you feel like you're family.   And after all of that there HAS to be something naughty in those rice and beans....seriously.  There is no way anything so simple can taste so good.  I loved my red snapper with capers, don't get me wrong, but why oh why did I want to lick the bowl that held the beans that accompanied my meal.  First ground rule, I like beans, not love them and especially not like this.

8.description: I have been here several times and each time I come here, we (husband and I) get the Masas de Puerco which are outstanding!  I decided to switch it up and try chicken breast (pollo encebollado) and my husband had the half chicken.  It was seriously the worst chicken I have ever had anywhere!  I have been to D'Cuba on Fullerton avenue and had the same chicken and it was phenomenal.  Both chicken Plates were gamy and dry.  The breast is $16.95 and is half the size of a typical breast.  The half broiled chicken was sopping in oil - it was gross.  Never again. Stick to the typical sandwiches and Masas - don't deviate.

31.description: I have only ever been to 2 Cuban restaurants in my life and both have been great experiencesThe food here was great and the service was even better. Very helpful and welcoming serviceIf you don't know what to get, just get pork. Cubans kick ass at porkIf you want variety, ask them about their sampler platter; it's great and is way more food than you think. It will easily feed two hungry people and leave them both a bit happier about the idea of opening up diplomatic and trade relations with this tiny county of happy people, beautiful women, gorgeous beaches, and FANTASTIC FOOD

34.description: Finding good Cuban food outside of Dade County is close to impossible, but I must admit that I was happily surprised by Habana Libre.  It's a cozy little place right on Chicago Avenue that serves up tasty dishes at a reasonable price.  The ropa vieja was very tender and the picadillo I tried was super flavorful and tasty.  I had no difficulties finding street parking and along with the solid service, I will be stopping by more often to get my Cuban fix-dale!

16.description: Like Scarface from Half Baked this place is Cuban B youtube.com/watch?v=CtM6… ...YOB. Between that and the super cute interior alone it makes for a great first or second meetup spot. Super affordable, good food, and most likely different than what your date is used to dining at. There's an outdoor patio for the summer months, and when the winter hits inside has a warm tropical vibe as if you ignored the embargo and hopped a flight to Havana. Excellent ceviche and empanadas to start and the entrees we're equally delicious. If you're in the mood for something casual, good for conversation, and different from most of the other options in town Habana Libre is likely going to make you a happy camper.

13.description: I tried this place because of the reviews. Makes me question peoples taste for authentic Cuban food. Staff was friendly, yes. However, I've lived in Miami where Cuban food is abundant, fresh and plentiful.This was so disappointing. Small portions, didn't taste that fresh. The fried yucca was ok, but that is pretty simple. Not sure what other people's experience with Cuban food is that rate this place so high, but if you want real Cuban food, don't waste your time here.

11.description: Came here on the search for empanadas authentic Cuban style. We found that & more. Cut to the chase....we order chicken, beef & spinach empanadas. My 10 year old daughter had these, she enjoyed the spinach the best & even order 2 more! I thoroughly enjoyed a small tasting of the beef. Season well, light crunchy & flaky crust. My hubby & I shared an order of ceviche served with saltines. Authentic. Great fresh flavors with a nice slice of avocado.We both order the fried red snapper, mines in garlic oil and peppers, his smother in Cajun juices. Both snappers were very tasty, seasoned , portion size perfect served with rice, savory black beans & a plantain.  Now everyone can't cook red snapper, this was some goooood red snapper. I'll be back for sure! Beware.... You may have to wait 25 minutes for your red snapper but it's sooooo worth it!! Trust meOur waitress was a doll & very hospitable. She did a great job welcoming us on our first visit. Quaint cute jem...stop sleeping on this amazing place

39.description: Loved this place and challenge anyone to show me a more authentic Cuban joint in Chicago. My dad was born in Coral Gables and spent his first 17 years eating Cuban straight from his the kitchens of las abuelas de his friends. He and I have tried a bunch of the other spots and haven't found one better. Compared to Cuban home cooking or half the restaurants in Miami, this place is probably average, but for a place 1500 miles north of Cuba, I don't think you'll find much better. As a bonus, you will find some awesome little Puerto Rican touches like mayo-ketchup.P.S. The masa de puerco is as good as any fried pork I've had, anywhere. The congri is legit, but ask for a little of the homemade hot sauce and toss some on there. Then proceed to finish it off and lick your plate.

37.description: Solid Cuba food outside of Miami?  Yes!  Habana Libre offers really good Cuban food in a clean and welcoming environment with wonderful customer service.  In fact, the customer service is so spot on that I actually told my phone that I felt like the hostess had given me a verbal hug after making a reservation for dinner with her on the phone.   Even while we were there, there was a slight miscommunication about the side that was to accompany our entree.  We wanted the green plantain but our server thought we had ordered the tostones.  She was kind enough to give the tostones to us and not charge for them because it was her mistake.  Most places would have just tossed the tostones.  My friend and I chose the surf and turf option: Mentira Mary Tierra the famous liar plate which included grilled skirt steak and shrimp in garlic sauce.  Our entree came with a side of white rice, black beans and the green plantain.  The food was EXCELLENT!  We enjoyed every last bite of my meal.  It felt homemade, and prepared with love.  The food was fresh and flavorful.  It hit every mark I look for in a quality meal.It's a neighborhood gem and brings the flavors of Cuba a lot closer to home :).

0.description: The appetizer Tostones Rellenos de ropa vieja were somewhat disappointing. If you're looking for a plate to share (there are 6 mini tostonitos), I suggest ordering but trying a different meat. The ropa vieja just didn't have the correct balance of tomato and plantain. HOWEVER, that lechón...oh boy you better make sure you have enough to take home for leftovers.

38.description: The food was amazing, i had the chicken stew special which was amazing, and my friend had fried cow which was also really, really good. Also it is byo, there is a beer/wine store 4 doors down to the right, try the daisy cutter beer.

51.description: Every aspect was really good.  Street parking available, attentive service, good recommendations from the server and above all, every dish was great.

27.description: Nothing fancy, but great cuban food with great service. Def recommend the pechuga de pollo and palomilla dinner entrees. It's also byob- with NO corkage fee!

32.description: I was so happy I found this great little Cuban spot. Great lunch specials- get the steak sandwich !!!! Can't wait to go back for dinner...

54.description: This is the spot!! If you are looking for authentic cuban food you don't need to look any further!!For starters you can find plenty of parking on the street and when you walk in the restaurant has a comfy, homey feel.We started with the fried plantains with a garlic sauce and they were perfectly crisped and tasted right on spot!For my entree I had the enchilado de camarones.  This was a shrimp cooked in a cuban creole sauce that the waitress was kind enough to ask me if I'd like made spicy.  Of course I didn't argue a little extra heat!The dish came with a side of black beans and rice as traditionally all plates come and this was a hefty helping for someone as small as me!The shrimp were no joke and not stingy either.  The creole sauce was so flavorful you could lick it up with the bread at the table easily.  I would definitely come back if I wanted something made with heart and soul.To end the meal I had a cuban coffee and let me tell you, if you need a coffee with a punch you will find a few extra punches in this brew! Delicious and the perfect way to end my meal!

48.description: Slow service. I mean very slow. Ok my average review is based on the mediocre service at this place.  The food is good, but nothing to brag about. I went on a Thursday evening. They had plenty of tables, the place wasn't really that busy so we got seated right away (party of 2). It took them about 20 minutes to come and take our order. Check this out, an appetizer of croquetas came out about 50 minutes later. Really? A tiny little thing like this took that long? After about 1.5 hours of waiting we told the waitress to bring out the check because we wanted to leave. And sure after five minutes of telling her that she brings our food. The worst part is that it was cold. It was just horrible. To tell you how bad the staff is, one of the waitresses is walking around texting on her phone, she bumps into a customer that is coming out of the bathroom. The customer says "sorry", but she totally ignores her and keeps walking while texting on her phone. How unprofessional is that?

44.description: Habana Libre is a weekly ritual for my husband and me.  Their food is consistently great.  Appetizers we've tried and liked are the empanadas, tostones, maduros, ceviche.  My favorite entree is the enchilado de camarones (shrimp cooked in cuban creole sauce.  My hubby loves the masa de puerco (fried pork topped with garlic and fresh onions).   Both dishes are served with a side of beans, rice and sweet plantains.The service may be a little slow if they are busy.  However, the servers are always pleasant.  There is one server who noticed that I never eat the beans that come with the entree.  She asked me why and I told her that I just don't like beans.  Her response was that she wished she knew that because she could substitute plantains instead of beans for me.  Music to my ear!  I never say no to plantains!BYOB!!!  If you happen to forget to bring a bottle, there is a wine shop, Nobel Grapes, a few doors down.Lastly, parking is only street parking.  However, it's not that difficult to find a spot on Chicago Ave.

24.description: This place is *****FIRE EMOJI*FIRE EMOJI*FIRE EMOJI*****No but seriously.  The empanadas were juicy as heck and they came with this super delicious sauce to dip them in I'm pretty sure it was tomato aioli.  I had a cafe con leche to drink and it was terrific too.  I'm definitely coming back to this spot.  It's places like this that make me happy to live in Noble Square!

7.description: This place is *****FIRE EMOJI*FIRE EMOJI*FIRE EMOJI*****No but seriously.  The empanadas were juicy as heck and they came with this super delicious sauce to dip them in I'm pretty sure it was tomato aioli.  I had a cafe con leche to drink and it was terrific too.  I'm definitely coming back to this spot.  It's places like this that make me happy to live in Noble Square!

49.description: The service here is amazing. We got in a little late last Tuesday for a byob dinner with a Wilderness Brewing growler I was recently gifted. The waitstaff and kitchen were extraordinarily accommodating, provided detailed recommendations from the menu, and immediately offered to put our growler on ice while we waited for our food. Cuban food means pork to me, and after hearing our waitress' recommendations, I ordered the fried pork dinner. It had a delicious, fried, crispy exterior, and a juicy, flavorful interior.  It also pairs up really well with a hoppy, chewy IPA.If you're looking for a solid byob restaurant close to the loop (which, unsurprisingly, is a byob desert) this place has you covered.

40.description: Good food and decent service. The seafood was pretty good and they were very friendly. My boyfriend  and I go here regularly as it is right around the corner from his place.

53.description: Unfortunately, I really don't know why I went back here.  Food is not good, service wants to be good but it is as slow as it could be,  waiting time for 2 dishes on a very slow Monday night: ~20 minutes. Lots of people I know like this place but not my taste buds, sadly.

30.description: The plaintains were sooo good!  I had the carne asada which was quite good, but wish I had more considering the price I paid for it.  My friend got the chicken which was very moist and tender!  I wasn't too big a fan of their empanadas and have definitely had better at other places around the city.

46.description: Picked up some carry out yesterday and it was fantastic! The waitress helped me pick out her favorites and they are now mine. The fried pork and slow cooked chicken we full of favor and seasoned to perfection.  I will be back!!!

1.description: The food is flavorful and reasonably priced.  I have eaten here a few times, but most recently with a few coworkers.  We bought a bottle of rum next door and used it make some mojitos.  The portions were pretty large and filing, and the service was great.  The atmosphere is very laid back, casual and inviting.  I will definitely be back the next time I am craving some Cuban food!

55.description: Tasty and unique.  The food is really great, a happy marriage of Caribbean and  Mexican flavors, done perfectly.  The pork and chicken were really tender and flavorful.  The portions were pretty big.  They play Cuban jazz on the speakers and it really creates a nice relaxing but fun ambiance.  The only small detraction was that service was a bit slow, it looked like there was only one waitress, but she was still  extremely friendly and pleasant  and happy to answer all of our questions.  About 8 minutes walking from the Blue line, so very easy to get to.  Highly recommended.

9.description: I love this place! I've been here 3 times now and it's consistently good. The cafe con leche is exactly what I want from coffee. Full disclaimer: I may be biased, since I'm of Latin decent, toward this menu. The tostones are perfect, the black beans are fabulous and the lunch special sandwiches hit the spot.

26.description: Great food worth 5 stars...But needs work on hospitality....ordered a sandwich came out wrong.  After telling the waitress it was wrong can I get it fixed, she told me I had to pay for a new sandwich.  Ridiculous!!  In the end they gave me the correct sandwich without having to pay for it.

25.description: We've been here a number of times looking for good Cuban food and never have been disappointed.  Great selection of authentic Cuban dishes. It is BYOB.....

12.description: I have only ever been to 2 Cuban restaurants in my life and both have been great experiencesThe food here was great and the service was even better. Very helpful and welcoming serviceIf you don't know what to get, just get pork. Cubans kick ass at porkIf you want variety, ask them about their sampler platter; it's great and is way more food than you think. It will easily feed two hungry people and leave them both a bit happier about the idea of opening up diplomatic and trade relations with this tiny county of happy people, beautiful women, gorgeous beaches, and FANTASTIC FOOD

59.description: I came here for the first time with a group of 20+ people. Their food was bland yet pricey. Also, they only had two waitresses on that Saturday night so the service ended at our table after we all received our entrees. I pretty much left the restaurant dying for water. I will give Cuban food another try someplace else.

21.description: This is one of the more consistently good places around. I like anything they make with eggs in it. Sides of rice and beans help round out the generous portions nicely. Good appetizer options. Pair an entree with any of their coffee drinks and you're in for a good meal! Waitstaff are consistently nice too.

17.description: We went here this last weekend and were pleasantly surprised by the food here. We ordered the ceviche app, combination for 2, and 2 corditos with a coconut flan for desert. Everything was delicious. Will be back

10.description: Funny decor but good Cuban I think although I'm not well versed in Cuban food! We split a sandwich and and steak. It's byob so we brought our own bottle of wine.Prices are super affordable. Nice waitress, good food. I'd love to come back and try more!

5.description: This place was O.k at best. The food was decent but portions were small. The place is a dive and the prices are high. Service was okay not many people there. Let's just say, I'm still on the hunt for that perfect Cuban joint. If your a dirty hipster with a trust fund you'll love it.

3.description: My parents wanted "Mexican BYOB" so they got Cuban BYOB.  The space was cute inside.  It was a little stuffy when we were there because it was humid outside.  They also have a nice little outdoor patio area.The service was very mediocre.  Server was forgetful.The food was kind of meh and pricey for what you got.  We got the appetizer platter for 6...it was like $25 but it really didn't have much on it.  3 empanadas, 3 sticks with ham and cheese, 2 large meat balls, 6 fried plantain circles...kind of ridiculous.  I had the Cubano.  It was good but I've definitely had better.Fajitas were ok.  Small and not tons of meat for the price.  $14-17.Overall it was just ok.  I wouldn't go back.

35.description: Just call to place an order for delivery.  First I was kept on hold for over 3 minutes, second..It's a $25.00 minimum order for delivery plus a $5.00 delivery charge. When all you want is 2 lunch specials at $8.25 each..that is way too much.  I love the food at this place but this isn't the only Cuban place in town!

19.description: My family and I we're enjoying our food and everything was going pretty good. Then after our meal, my dad decided to order some coffee. A couple sips into it, he noticed something in his coffee so he pulled it out with a fork only to find out it was s small dead roach. Yuck! Ruined the experience.

28.description: Great authentic Cuban food!  I had the fried pork and my husband had the oxtail.  Two awesome dishes!  We had a large 22pp party and service was good, not great.  I think it was due to the large group.  Coconut flan was amazing

45.description: Like Scarface from Half Baked this place is Cuban B youtube.com/watch?v=CtM6… ...YOB. Between that and the super cute interior alone it makes for a great first or second meetup spot. Super affordable, good food, and most likely different than what your date is used to dining at. There's an outdoor patio for the summer months, and when the winter hits inside has a warm tropical vibe as if you ignored the embargo and hopped a flight to Havana. Excellent ceviche and empanadas to start and the entrees we're equally delicious. If you're in the mood for something casual, good for conversation, and different from most of the other options in town Habana Libre is likely going to make you a happy camper.

33.description: Funny decor but good Cuban I think although I'm not well versed in Cuban food! We split a sandwich and and steak. It's byob so we brought our own bottle of wine.Prices are super affordable. Nice waitress, good food. I'd love to come back and try more!

43.description: I finally returned for a full meal. The appetizers were hit and miss. The plantains were a big miss.....more like plain-tains.  The enchilada with shrimp was tasty. Nothing else stood out as overly good or bad.

2.description: Too expensive for such a small amount of food;  I ordered a chicken sandwich cafe con leche and croquettes. Also order my wife oxtail and soup to go and honestly the prices aren't honored on the menu. The waitress said the owners are on the process of changing prices on their menu. If the menu states a price honor it don't verbally steal. The $62.00 would of been best invested in any other Cuban restaurant in Chicago. The to go order is the size of any left overs taken from any restaurant. Way too expensive for such a little amount of food definitely think twice before spending your money. I am originally from Miami I know the ridiculous amount of food Miami serves however I have been to a few places in Chicago to have Cuban food in Edgewater, Logan and Bucktown and def. their portions are way better. This place is not at all impressive! Service wasn't all on point. I had to ask for a refill to get water. Never bothered brining extra napkins. She was more concerned about the party reservations at3pm than the four tables that were actually sitting  before 1:30. Overall the kitchen should serve bigger portions and the waitress shouldn't be changing prices. I practically paid 2.00 over every item ordered. I can see why this place isn't busy compared to other Cuban cuisines. Too bad it is a small little cute place with crappy portions. Never again will I think of going again to this place. The sandwich taste great and the croquettes were aight the sauce made up for it.

18.description: Very nice staff, very tasty sandwiches!I enjoyed my cubano, and would come back for seconds. Portions were generous and super-filling. As others have mentioned, it's BYOB. If you forget to bring something to drink, there are numerous liquor stores nearby.There are plenty of menu choices for chicken, beef, pork, or seafood lovers with a few good vegetarian options as well.

41.description: Byob. Great food. Great for carry out. Ceviche is fresh & delicious...my husband lovesss the Cuban sandwich and Cuban marriage!

52.description: Went here for dinner and the food was good, on par with some other Cuban places in the area. We had the shrimp ceviche as a starter, it was just ok. I wouldn't order it again, ok flavor, consisted of small diced shrimp that seemed pre-boiled, onion and tomato and cilantro. Came with saltines which was a bit odd, would have preferred tortilla chips or plantain chips. The entrees were very tasty, we had ropa veija and vaca frita. Both came with rice and beans. I would order both again. Service was very friendly although a bit slow.

50.description: Outstanding food, fast service and left stuffed to the gills! The staff was super friendly, they checked on us often. Will go back in a heart beat!!

4.description: I crave their jibaritos. I've had several and this one is the best in the city!!! Although it's small I have seen it packed for dinner.

6.description: You know, I really love this place. They have one of the best cuban sandwiches. Plus, it is really the only place to get a "sandwich" in the hood. The cuban is probably the best type of sandwich to get, so if it makes it that much better.The plantains are served in all three styles, maduro, tostones, and platanitos but you have to ask for the third, sometimes they will not give them to you like that. The garlic sauce that comes with tostones is incredible, I wish I could bottle it up and use it on other things.The fact that it is BYOB and the staff is always super friendly, makes this place well worth the trip from any hood, but happy it is in mine. Oh and they have outdoor seating and the Noble Grape is down the street.

22.description: A really great neighborhood BYOB joint.  Their empanadas are delicious across the board- the guava cheese one is a sleeper hit.  I am mildly obsessed with their masa de puerco frita (chunks of fried pork).  It also may sound basic but their black beans are great comfort food- rich and soupy. I usually wake up with a garlic hangover after a trip here but it is worth it.  If yelp allowed 4.5 stars this place would get it.

15.description: Solid Cuba food outside of Miami?  Yes!  Habana Libre offers really good Cuban food in a clean and welcoming environment with wonderful customer service.  In fact, the customer service is so spot on that I actually told my phone that I felt like the hostess had given me a verbal hug after making a reservation for dinner with her on the phone.   Even while we were there, there was a slight miscommunication about the side that was to accompany our entree.  We wanted the green plantain but our server thought we had ordered the tostones.  She was kind enough to give the tostones to us and not charge for them because it was her mistake.  Most places would have just tossed the tostones.  My friend and I chose the surf and turf option: Mentira Mary Tierra the famous liar plate which included grilled skirt steak and shrimp in garlic sauce.  Our entree came with a side of white rice, black beans and the green plantain.  The food was EXCELLENT!  We enjoyed every last bite of my meal.  It felt homemade, and prepared with love.  The food was fresh and flavorful.  It hit every mark I look for in a quality meal.It's a neighborhood gem and brings the flavors of Cuba a lot closer to home :).

57.description: Just had lunch there today. It was pretty good. Everything is in Spanish so I can't totally remember what I got, it was vaca something (which means cow). Super yummy. The vanilla flan was excellent as well

20.description: I tried this place because of the reviews. Makes me question peoples taste for authentic Cuban food. Staff was friendly, yes. However, I've lived in Miami where Cuban food is abundant, fresh and plentiful.This was so disappointing. Small portions, didn't taste that fresh. The fried yucca was ok, but that is pretty simple. Not sure what other people's experience with Cuban food is that rate this place so high, but if you want real Cuban food, don't waste your time here.

36.description: Since I've been back they raised the prices of the food with a sharpie on the menu, also raised the card limit to $15.. which is kind of dumb because of you come in for a special whether it's lunch or dinner their all $7-$10 so you have to get way more food.Also, they raised the prices but not the quality... now it's just not worth it anymore.

14.description: Since I've been back they raised the prices of the food with a sharpie on the menu, also raised the card limit to $15.. which is kind of dumb because of you come in for a special whether it's lunch or dinner their all $7-$10 so you have to get way more food.Also, they raised the prices but not the quality... now it's just not worth it anymore.

58.description: I hadn't been to their place in a couple of years, but today, I was jonesing for a mani/pedi. My nails were tore up. I didn't want to catch a train, and I wanted to use an OPI polish. So, I pulled on my flip flops and headed back.I opted for the plain mani/pedi combination instead of the spa. Good choice! No more really hot towels! The women who attended me were pleasant, there was a funny show on TV, and I felt myself relax so much I almost fell asleep. Really enjoyed all the massages, and my nails are adorable. Even though the shop was busy, everyone was efficient, friendly, and capable. They've won my allegiance. :)

56.description: Really great. My nails lasted about two weeks and they give you a really wonderful massage while you wait for them to dry. Will definitely come back.

29.description: This place is fine if you want to go in mid-day, but if you're going to try to stop in within 2 hours of their "closing" time at 8pm, forget about it. I've seen them lie to potential customers stating that they're full with appointments for the evening, and then mysteriously no appointments come in. Simply because of location, I use to frequent this place about once per week. I came in last night a full hour and 40 minutes before closing time, and my favorite nail tech (Heidi) greeted me with a smile and started to motion for me to sit down. However, the woman behind the counter refused me saying they were full (again, nail tech was just standing around with no customer). After picking up some food, I drove by 20 minutes later and the place was empty. I guess they don't want my money any more. I do have to say that some individual employees here are very friendly, and I have had good service on occasion. The people that run this place are extremely rude and apparently don't like to make money.

42.description: This place is eerily quiet, so don't think you are going to chat on your phone or have a long conversation with the nail technician. Also don't think about just walking in during peak times. Though they are well staffed they are also well patroned. Unlike other places, they don't have a price list when you walk in but they do have an extensive color wall of OPI and Essie polish.The salon is clean and well organized, so if you looking for a spa like experience visit, but this was just too much pampering for me and my in and out ways.

23.description: As I sit here getting a pedicure I think to myself, I am never coming here again! This place has gone downhill. The chairs are ripped, their polishes look like they are old and have separated in a way that no one has ticked them in ages. There is absolutely no customer service here!

47.description: I just came back from getting a manicure and pedicure at Pinky Nail and I am BLOWN away!! They did such a great job. I have been living in the west loop for 2 years and I had not found a good, quality nail salon that I would want to go back  to routinely until today!I was a first time client and usually at nail salons, if your not one of their "regulars," the are kind of snippy. It was the total opposite at Pinky! As soon as I walked in, they were so hospitable and genuinely friendly that I was almost weirded out because that's not what I'm used to at a nail salon like this. I had Anna and she gave me one of the best mani's and pedi's I have ever had. She took her time and perfected each nail. And she gives a killer back massage that lasted like 15 minutes long. This place is a little more expensive than the average nail bar, but only by a little, and it is totally worth it. All in all, an awesome place so go, go, go!!

8.description: Excellent for last minute walk in appointments. They took me at the last min and I had my manicure quick and fast! Good service and great back rub at the end of the appointment.

31.description: Very rude service without quality manicures to redeem themselves. Asked for a no-chip and told them I currently had a no-chip on. As she was removing the no-chip polish (which I got at a local competitors) shop, she told me "this isn't normal, this no chip won't last as long." Well, she was right. My $35 no-chip lasted maybe 3 days and brittles all my nails, unlike the other salon down the street. Never again!

34.description: This nail salon is now officially terrible.  I used to go here consistently for the past 3 years, but over this past year: service started slacking, my favorite nail technician-Sarah, left the salon, their attitudes started getting more and more rude, and finally...yesterday I walked in at 7PM for my pedicure appointment and the woman at the counter said that they are closing and refused to take me.  So why did you take my appointment in the first place?  And why "claim" to be open till 8PM? Service has become increasingly awful. Pedicures used to last 3 weeks, now I'm lucky if they last 3 days. The nail techs are not very gentle, to the point of me saying, "Please stop hurting me," at least 3 times during the appointment. You can barely breathe in there because the fumes are so overwhelming. No more neck massages after the appointment. Piles of garbage and dust mites in the corners & on the seats. The technicians are rude, service is awful, prices are higher. As previously stated - the place has now officially gone to shit.  Save yourself the misery and go somewhere else - anywhere else.

16.description: I went to Pinky's multiple times, and it usually turned out okay.  However, each time I felt rushed, never feeling pampered.  The last time I went though will be my last time there.  I got a no-chip manicure with pedicure.  After just 1.5 days, the manicure started to lift.  I have never had a manicure lift off my nail.  I would have gone back to complain, but we went on vacation the day after I got my mani/pedi.  Before 2 weeks, the normal timeframe for a no-chip, one entire nail lifted off.  I had 3 others about ready to completely fall off, so I decided I needed to go get my nails done before the 2 weeks were even up.  This is very frustrating considering you pay a lot more for a no-chip than just a regular manicure.  I won't be returning even though this location is just down the road from me.

13.description: I would avoid this place at all costs. I went in for a quick manicure because my agency had called and notified me that I had a casting and my hands needed to be in good shape. I arrived and the front desk lady went to the back to get a worker... Out strolls a woman who looked disgusted that I interrupted her. The whole time during my manicure the woman seemed as if she hated her job. I was in a hurry to make it to the casting so I really didn't look over my nails. I paid the $15 and left a $5 tip... BIG MISTAKE! As I hop into a cab I look at my nails and notice they are uneven and unsightly! After arriving to the casting the photographer looks at my hands and just starts shaking his head NOOOOOOOOO! I was screwed by Pinkys! Luckily the shoot wasn't for a week and I had time to regrow my nails. I ended up going to Polish and Pour (401 E Ontario St) the day of the shoot and the lady did an awesome job! Seriously don't go to Pinky's unless you have no other choice... And even then you might be better off going to a blind panhandler and paying him the $15 dollars.  I'll post pictures of the hack job.

11.description: I've been to this Pinky Nails location many times. It's close to my house and convenient. Sometimes I have good experiences, sometimes I do not. Today I was rushed into my seat as soon as I walked in the door which is normally great, but when getting a gel manicure removal I have tinfoil on my hands making it almost impossible to navigate the sample color wheel. I like to choose a color maybe try a few on, I enjoy that process seeing as I have to live with it for 10 days or so. I felt very rushed and the woman doing my manicure didn't say two words to me. She put the tinfoil squares (for removal of my polish) so loosely that they fell off right away and instead of putting them back on tighter she scraped the polish off my dry nail, ouch! That can't be healthy for my nails. I had to ask the gentleman seated next to me (without clients) to grab me a few pink colors he suggested so I was able to choose a color!!! The manicurist helping me today must be knew I haven't seen her there before, but she did not even try to be polite or welcoming. It mostly seemed like I was annoying her, especially when I accidentally smudged my first coat and apologized profusely, she didn't say one word! Not happy with my service today.

39.description: I used to go to Pinky Nail Chicago.  My favorite nail tech, Sara was wonderful. She always remembered what I did the last visit.  Now she is gone.  The service is not as good.  I have followed Sara and her daughter to their new place, Pin Curls.

37.description: Not the best place to get a manicure. I've been to Pinky about a half a dozen times because it's close to where I live but I always feel rushed here. The manicures are so hit or miss here. The quality really depends on the manicurist but when they're not done well, they're REALLY not done well. My most recent, and final, visit to Pinky resulted in my nails being cut so short that they were sore. She honestly seemed disturbed to be giving manicures. Next time, I'll go out of my neighborhood to get my nails done.

0.description: Just got a GREAT No Chip manicure from Heidi. Highly recommend her. She aslo gave an awesome shoulder massage :)

38.description: always a great experience! a little more expensive than most salons in the area, but the final results are worth it! keep up the fab work, pinky!

51.description: Even though this place is walking distance from my place i prefer to drive to the other Pinky on Damen (with the other owner). They are cleaner, nicer and the manicures last 5-7 days longer than this location/owner....and they are less expensive! No contest in my book. If you need a quick mani/pedi it's good but if you're like me and like them to be really good and last 10-14 days go elsewhere.

27.description: it was my first and last time to get my nails done there!!! my mani was chipping after one day. very unfriendly. sooo bad!!!

32.description: I'll probably go back because it's right in my neighborhood but overall I was disappointed. My feet were still rough when I left, the paint job was mediocre at best, and they give you a terrible shoulder massage (you can decline) while you're drying.

54.description: I am in love with Pinky Nails on Grand. After driving past a few times down Grand Ave on my home from work, I decided to stop in and was randomly placed with Jenny for my first time at the salon. THANK GOD! I refuse to go anywhere else because the experience just isn't the same. If she is unavailable, I wait until I can get an appointment with her. Jenny is a nail goddess. She is super sweet and extremely professional. She always takes great care of me, does a fantastic job on my nails, and hooks it up with the massage.
