Even if you don't have the chance to have Jenny do your nails, everyone else in the salon is very friendly and does a good job (Jenny just does THE BEST).I recently moved to the south suburbs and make the drive to the city just to have her do my mani-pedi. It is worth the drive for a relaxing and quality experience!!

48.description: ok, yes.  pinky is more expensive than your run of the mill nail place.  i know.  but i keep going back regardless.  its close to my house and i get great service every time.  whenever i get a pedicure, i seriously consider replacing my living room furniture with their pedicure chairs.  top quality, massaging that actually feels good, heated seats, mm mm mm.  i typically get the mani/pedi and seriously, one time, i had a mani that didnt chip for 9 days.  NINE DAYS.  it was the end of days of something.  but anyways, theyre good.  good color selection too.  but heres the kicker.  the hot towel shoulder massage.  they kind of have you lean over the manicure station and they rub down your neck and shoulders and upper back, pretty much exactly where i store all my stressies.  ask for tom.  hes the best.also, if youre on the cheap and short on time, just go in for a polish change rather than a mani.  all the other good stuff for like 10 bucks.  worth it.

44.description: Perfect from beginning to end! Packed but I didn't wait long. it was nice and quiet. at most mail salons, you are subjected to the foreign conversions b/t  the nail techs. However @ pinkys, they remained professional and only chatted w/ their clients. I was in and out in less than one hour, and my mani is flawless! I had a gift certificate and soko,my nail tech, still performed as if I were paying cash, including two massages (hands & shoulders). I am VERY pleased and will make pinkys my permanent nail salon.

24.description: Myself and a friend went to this nail salon because it's in the neighborhood. This is my first time writing a review on Yelp but I felt compelled to let others know. The service was awful. We each had a mani/pedi totaling almost $100 w/a tip (gave 15% just to be decent). It was so rushed and the staff was genuinely unfriendly. Laughing at customers and performing a less than mediocre service. If we wanted to wash our feet and hands and polish our nails ourselves, we could have saved $92.00. I am sure that most of the workers are not licensed professionals. I'm so disappointed in their service. I wish I read the reviews prior to going. We will not return.

7.description: Again they treat African  Americans different or should I say of a certain age. I went several times with my daughter my services seem to be lacking every time no foot massage no hand massage no shoulder massage at end complained got free service wont go back all the ladies act like they dont want to service me the lone young  man volunteered  to take me. Now third time I a m in an asian place and they dont want to service me properlyI stopped going

49.description: went with a friend for a walk in. the girl who seated us was pleasant, but both of us got mediocre pedicures from two surly ladies. the technicians were not friendly, the massage lasted maybe a minute, and both of us had dry skin on our feet! felt very rushed the whole time.the WORST part of it all was the PRICE! i'm happy to pay a higher price for an above-average treatment, but for a sub-par one? no way! $35 plus tip came out to a $41 pedicure. my regular place charges $25 and does an excellent job. will not return!

40.description: My go-to nail salon in Chicago, with which I have a love-and-sometimes-hate relationship with (mostly love though). Love the mini massages, the no fuss touch ups and their never ending patience with me always changing my mind about which polish to use. They're pretty good with taking care of you, although you'll feel rushed every once in a while. Thankfully, that doesn't happen often, so I'm able to over look that--everyone's got a bad day, right?

53.description: Given how often I pop into Pinky, I should have the hands of a hand model. Alas, I have the hands of George Costanza as a hand model... which is better than it'd be otherwise. Shudder, I know.The pedicure is sound, about the same as anywhere else. But it's really all about the manicure. Not one, but TWO massages... one that beats your arms, shoulders and back into submission right before you pay (smart!), and a shorter one as your nails dry. Maybe it's because my tips have gotten bigger and bigger, but their massages have gotten longer and longer. For just 15 bucks, it's the best relaxation money can buy. The polish lasts at least a week on my writin' & typin' fingers, and four on my tucked-away toes.The other locations are good, but not great. So no matter where I move in the city, it'll be this Pinky or bust.

30.description: Love this place! Inexpensive, fast, clean and they are really nice. Only place I'll go for Mani/pedis.

46.description: After trying many nail salons in the area, I've now been going to this Pinky for almost two years. Solid mani/pedis every time and great no-chips as well. Great color selection, great massages ( you're not there for a massage, you're there to get your nails done) and they're quick without sacrificing quality.

1.description: Bummertown USA. I took my Mom here this past Sunday for a regular mani-pedi for both of us, I dropped about $120 (including tip), and by Tuesday my paint has chipped on 5 fingers.Maybe the polish is really old?Also I didn't get my punch card stamped, but last time I remember they didn't use them anymore at this location.Bummed because its a couple blocks from my house, and I am an avid mani pedi girl.Onto the next I guess.

55.description: Staff was warm and inviting from the moment you walk into the door. The entire salon is neat, CLEAN, and extremly orderly. My favorite part was that there was NO talking loudly over customers heads to other technicians. I simply detest when I go into a nail salon and the technicians and shouting back and forth to each other the entire time customers are present, I find it incredidly rude.Now onto the nails......the pedicure was nice and long and it included a a healthy calf massage which I was pleasantly suprised. My only gripe is that the bottoms of my feet could have been buffed for a bit longer. As for the manicure.....the tools were clean and they were gentle with them. I am always a bit leery that the techinician is trying to draw blood with the cuticle tools, which was NOT THE CASE here. YAY!! The manicure was precise with smooth filing and an even paint job. The hot tools were hot, but very tolerable....they did not burn my skin. In addition to the manicure, they give you a sholder and neck massage and put hot towels on your neck and shoulders.....I found this to be impressive. My technician also gave me an additional brief shoulder massage when I moved over to the drying station.All that being said, I will be coming back to this salon based on the cleanliness, friendliness, and decent work.

9.description: This has been my spot for years. I rarely stray from this location. Heidi and Boyo are just two examples of their outstanding technicians. It is no more pricey then down the street or even the suburbs for that matter. You are paying for a clean comfortable environment.  This is without a question my favorite nail salon for a no chip & pedicure in the city.

26.description: I'm writing this review as my nails are drying. Since this nail salon is right in my neighborhood, I tend to come. But I'm officially never coming back. The no chips I've gotten here are rushed and destroy my nails (I've gotten no chips at other places, even back to back up to six months and my nails stayed healthy).  Just now, the salon is empty and I still received subpar, aloof service.

25.description: I started to frequent this place because it was located close to where I live. The atmosphere is boring but I honestly was just looking to just be in and out w/ a good no chip mani. However as of today I will NEVER be back to this place! My nails are constantly chipping and the service is next to none. My best friend had a HORRIBLE experience as the technician told her he "no longer wanted to do her nails" and stormed out of the store in front of every one. He was upset because she wanted her nails filed and not cut and wanted oval (he was doing square). The terrible part, was that the owner and other employees did NOTHING. My friend sat there and had to say out loud "sooo, what's the protocol for your technician storming out while in mid session?"  I was so embarrassed at their terrible customer service! Save yourself the disappointment. Go to another place.

12.description: I started to frequent this place because it was located close to where I live. The atmosphere is boring but I honestly was just looking to just be in and out w/ a good no chip mani. However as of today I will NEVER be back to this place! My nails are constantly chipping and the service is next to none. My best friend had a HORRIBLE experience as the technician told her he "no longer wanted to do her nails" and stormed out of the store in front of every one. He was upset because she wanted her nails filed and not cut and wanted oval (he was doing square). The terrible part, was that the owner and other employees did NOTHING. My friend sat there and had to say out loud "sooo, what's the protocol for your technician storming out while in mid session?"  I was so embarrassed at their terrible customer service! Save yourself the disappointment. Go to another place.

59.description: I love their location in the Jewel shopping plaza and I love that they have a parking lot.  Their pedicures were ok - not great, not bad, just run of the mill.  Did an average job and spent an average amount of time working on me.  I give them three stars because I find it to be pretty expensive at $35.  Plus, the workers are awkward when they ask you to pay by saying, "you pay now?" while you're still busy drying off.

21.description: Excellent for last minute walk in appointments. They took me at the last min and I had my manicure quick and fast! Good service and great back rub at the end of the appointment.

17.description: This nail salon is now officially terrible.  I used to go here consistently for the past 3 years, but over this past year: service started slacking, my favorite nail technician-Sarah, left the salon, their attitudes started getting more and more rude, and finally...yesterday I walked in at 7PM for my pedicure appointment and the woman at the counter said that they are closing and refused to take me.  So why did you take my appointment in the first place?  And why "claim" to be open till 8PM? Service has become increasingly awful. Pedicures used to last 3 weeks, now I'm lucky if they last 3 days. The nail techs are not very gentle, to the point of me saying, "Please stop hurting me," at least 3 times during the appointment. You can barely breathe in there because the fumes are so overwhelming. No more neck massages after the appointment. Piles of garbage and dust mites in the corners & on the seats. The technicians are rude, service is awful, prices are higher. As previously stated - the place has now officially gone to shit.  Save yourself the misery and go somewhere else - anywhere else.

10.description: Decent no chip mani on the front end, but won't last a full 2-wks because of sloppy and rushed technique. Maria is rude and dismissive which makes what should be a nice little indulgence, less than enjoyable. Danny is sweet and more detail oriented. Manager seems pleasant. Generally easy to get in without an appointment. There are better places, but in a pinch, not bad.

5.description: Horrible service!! Will NEVER go back again! I went in with a friend for mani & pedi. Took her there for the 1st time as part of the birthday gift. Not only that they didn't properly clean my cuticles but both our nail's started chipping the next day. It looked so bad that I had to clean and paint my own nails a day after my visit. Disappointed. Fast and awful quality work, terrible customer service skills as well. Definitely waste of my money.

3.description: I got a no chip mani and regular pedi here And my no chip chipped 2 hours later!! I would say you get what you pay for since this place is pretty small and kind of run down but it was 60$ total (for no chip and pedi) which I feel is pretty standard prices for a nice place! I was very disappointed but went back the next day and they fixed it no problem but didn't even say sorry or anything.The hand, foot, and back massages are the best I've had at any nail place which is why I'm giving this place 2 stars!

35.description: I really enjoy Pinky Nail for their care with manicures and their massages!  I really like this location because the people are so nice.  Grace is the best manicurist I've had by far.  I'm a huge fan of the no-chip manicure.  Almost every no-chip I've had here has been great, but I have  had a couple duds.  I've found it really matters who is doing it--some of the girls allow more time between polish applications than others.  I've also had my eyebrows waxed at this location and they've done a great job.  Pedicures are always great and last for weeks.  I highly recommend this location.

19.description: I love that this place is around the corner from me, but when I walked in and asked for a "fill for my no-chip" the woman working  rudely told me that they do not do those "here." When I then explained I wanted a new no chip she said, "you should've said that." I then mentioned that they were almost the same thing to me. With hostility the woman replied "no they aren't"Then explained that they couldn't take me for an hour despite the fact that noone was waiting. The Division location is much friendlier.

28.description: I have been meaning to stop in for a while since I've only lived in the neighborhood for the past 3 years. I had a wedding that I was going to, and this place helped me out in my jam to get my nails done. The water temperature for my hands and feet were perfect. My aesthetician was an older lady that didn't seem to speak a lot of English, but that was fine. I was quite exhausted and really appreciated the shoulder rub she gave during the manicure process. It made me realize how desperately I needed a massage. I think she could have done more with trimming and pushing down my cuticles. I also have a lot of excess dry skin that was peeling that could also use some extra TLC. I like that the dryer/UV fans are on timer so that you know when you can leave. In any case, I know I should be using more lotion to help take care of the problem myself. Prices were a little more than average that I would spend $40 for both mani-pedi, but they also have specials on certain days of the week.

45.description: I was in the area looking for an apartment and had some extra time. I called them from Chicago Ave and they took my name and were ready for my pedicure by the time I walked south to Grand. Great nail selection, and the staff were really friendly.My pedicure was great. There was lotion, a massage, hot towels, rather than just one or two of those services. I thought the $35 price was really reasonable for what was provided. I'll definitely be back - especially if I could ever find an apartment!

33.description: Never ever ever again.  I have been a committed customer of Pinky's/Nail Party for the last four years and it takes something pretty awful to force me to "vow off" a business for life.  It literally just happened.  I showed up today at Pinky's completely prepared to wait as long as 45 minutes to get in for a mani/pedi.  When I walked in, as expected, I was told that it would be around 30 minutes.  I said "no problem".  About 5 minutes later an employee walks in and asks me if someone had helped me and I told her that they had and said it would be 30 min.  So, I sat down and was waiting when after 20 minutes the same employee asked me in a loud voice "You have an appointment with Sarah, right?".  I said no.  She said that that was what she asked me when she came in.  I explained that I must have misunderstood.  So - get this - now she's pissed at me!!! What the what?  And to make it even more awkward, she is the one that will be doing my nails.  Awesome.  As  I approached the chair for the pedicure she gave me an icy look and for some reason I felt compelled to say I was sorry for the misunderstanding.  Why I did this, I don't know.  She told me that if I didn't understand her that I should have asked her again.  But wait, I thought I did understand what she said.  Really?  So at this point I am in the chair with my feet in the but and was about to yank my feet out of the water and bolt but instead decided to ask "Is this was going to be a problem?  Should  I leave and find another place to get my nails done today?"  She said no, it was fine...but gave the impression that it was still my fault.  About half way through the pedicure, she said she wasn't "mad" at me but was angry with someone else there.  Come on, people get their nails done to relax and not feel stressed.  I don't need this and won't give my business to either Pinky or Nail Part on Madison again.  There are less convenient options for me but in the end it will be worth it.  I have never written a straight up negative review but this experience was that BAD.

43.description: My roommate and I were super impressed by this nail salon. Reservations were easy, staff is friendly, and they give you TWO shoulder massages before and after your manicure. I don't know any other salon that does this.My second visit, after being so impressed by the first, was even better. After leaving my pedicure, I messed up both of my big toes. I called and came back in and the lady redid them - FREE of charge! I will continue to come here even if it might be a bit more expensive than your average. It is well worth the money.

2.description: Went in for a quick no chip removal and manicure. Sara was my tech and did a great job and also gave me a couple of back massages. I would definitely recommend this place to my friends.

18.description: I just received a mani pedi at Pinky's on Grand and I have to admit it was amazing! The place is quiet, clean and cutely decorated. The chairs were comfortable and clean. My nails are so pretty and well done and the hot towel treatment was to die for.

41.description: Walked in and got technician who spoke to me twice. Nothing really relaxing about this place. Nails chipped two days later.

52.description: Simply the best mani/pedi I've had in the city. It's a little more expensive than most places, but all of the massaging made it totally every penny. The place is spotless and the nail techs really took pride in their work. I'll be back Pinky!

50.description: Visiting a friend in Chicago, we went to try this salon as she had heard it was great. We walked in and they were nice enough, had a great color selection and their pedicure chairs looked new and clean.Despite being gouged a few times by my attendant (to the point of uttering ouch!), the pedicure looked good. However, when we got our bills, we were both surprised it was a $35 pedicure ($25 is more average).The "massage" expected with a pedicure was merely lotion application. My attendant was rather snippy and very rude when the service was complete. She literally stood over me waiting for her tip (which frankly was not deserved at all, especially since the service was $10 more than other salons and not as good).Oh well!I wish we'd had the 5 star experience others seem to have had here!

4.description: This is the first no chip manicure I've had that's chipped during the first week. Three different people worked on my nails, and each one seemed to adjust the work done by the person before, strange. I think i was supposed to be asked if I wanted a neck massage, but wasn't. The person I went with received a very short neck massage (maybe 30 seconds) while the lady next to her seemed to have one that lasted about two minutes. Not sure if I'll give them another try or not. I had Maria for part of the service, she seemed miserable.The place was clean, and we were able to make an appointment, always a good thing, but not thrilled about quality of the finish.

6.description: I don't understand why this has 3 stars!! I've been coming here for the last couple yrs. Always great service.!! I tell and bring my family and friends when I can and they love it. Esp hot towels and shoulder massage! !

22.description: I love that this place is around the corner from me, but when I walked in and asked for a "fill for my no-chip" the woman working  rudely told me that they do not do those "here." When I then explained I wanted a new no chip she said, "you should've said that." I then mentioned that they were almost the same thing to me. With hostility the woman replied "no they aren't"Then explained that they couldn't take me for an hour despite the fact that noone was waiting. The Division location is much friendlier.

15.description: I wanted my nails to be blue. Austin-tacious blue, to be exact. I have no idea what prompted this extreme desire to paint my nails a light, sparkly blue...but it was hatched earlier in the day, and foiled...and thus, I finally reached this petty goal at Pinky Nail! After a fumble at Amy's Nail Gallery in Bucktown (totally swamped, 1 hour wait for a manicure at 3pm on a Saturday, bah!), I made my way over to Pinky Nail. Was taken right away...they have all the great OPI and essie colors, including my sought after punk-a-licious blue color.$15 manicure, however it includes: -long hand massage-neck/shoulder rub before polish-very friendly tech-nechk/shoulder rub while drying. YES! 2 neck/shoulder rubs. NICE! My tech did a great job, the color was put on thin in 2 coats...and it's shiny, blue and now I can lead my life a happy, confident woman. SUPER easy street parking (no meters on Noble, and surrounding side streets). Easy via 65 Grand Bus, or blue line at Grand as well...They take credit cards, and accept tips on credit. Score. (though, of course I'm sure they prefer cash if you've got it). This is my favorite Pinky Nail location thus far...

57.description: I've been a frequent customer to this place since it opened. I live near it so I've only been to this grand location, but this is my favorite nail salon out of every single one I've ever been to. They have tendency to be ridiculously busy on weekends but they still do a fantastic job. It's best if you can get them early in the mornings, especially during weekdays. I've never had an issue though, they're always very nice, my mani/pedi comes w/ a relaxing mini massage & hot towel (which I still find very refreshing even though it's hot!) If others find it hard to relax during busy days, if possible- try to get there on a weekday, or if you have a day off, go in the morning! :)

20.description: I would avoid this place at all costs. I went in for a quick manicure because my agency had called and notified me that I had a casting and my hands needed to be in good shape. I arrived and the front desk lady went to the back to get a worker... Out strolls a woman who looked disgusted that I interrupted her. The whole time during my manicure the woman seemed as if she hated her job. I was in a hurry to make it to the casting so I really didn't look over my nails. I paid the $15 and left a $5 tip... BIG MISTAKE! As I hop into a cab I look at my nails and notice they are uneven and unsightly! After arriving to the casting the photographer looks at my hands and just starts shaking his head NOOOOOOOOO! I was screwed by Pinkys! Luckily the shoot wasn't for a week and I had time to regrow my nails. I ended up going to Polish and Pour (401 E Ontario St) the day of the shoot and the lady did an awesome job! Seriously don't go to Pinky's unless you have no other choice... And even then you might be better off going to a blind panhandler and paying him the $15 dollars.  I'll post pictures of the hack job.

36.description: I only come here occasionally because the mani/pedi is just ok. It's cheaper than a downtown spa but like most nail only salons they are about quantity.I run and they have never gotten my feet smooth or nicely clipped my cuticles.The techs are nice and its convenient, but I don't mind paying a little more for a complete service. This place is good if you are in a pinch.

14.description: Not friendly at all. The girl I had seemed annoyed to be doing nails. Otherwise the place was clean. Good in a pinch.

12.description: We are remodeling our bathroom and supplying all the fixtures and fittings to our contractor. I found this place on Yelp and thought I have nothing to lose after going to a few places and not finding what we wanted. I wish I had gone here first and saved myself the hassle and stress! The week before we had come across it and bought a toilet and medicine cabinet that were in stock and just what we were looking for.The customer service, range of products, and prices were superb. If you are looking for contemporary and modern fixtures within a short amount of time, this is the place to go. We were quoted a lower price than Home Depot for a Kohler bathtub with delivery next day to the store, compared to 7-10 days with Home Depot. Salesman Joe not only spent a couple of hours with me as I decided on a bathtub(which we needed immediately), but also gave me a good deal on a shower door, phoned at least 5 places when a drain for the faucets we wanted was out of stock and then proceeded to follow up with phone calls to his supplier once he had faxed the order to ensure it took place, then he called me the next day to confirm the part had arrived and was ready for pick up.This is definetely the first place we will go to for any future remodelling needs.Parking is easy outside and the guys who bring your order and load it in your car are super helpful as well.It was wonderful to receive such great service.

7.description: I was looking for an adapter for my faucet and had tried a couple of local hardware stores... Finally after much frustration someone suggested Consumers Supply Company.  I walk in and I see an older gentleman with an unlit cigar hanging out of his mouth... I immediately liked him!  I think to myself "this is my kinda guy" anyway i walk up to him and tell him what I need and show him the parts I have.  He takes a look at it for maybe ten seconds and then says "I think I have what you need".  He walks over to the this wall and looks it over for a second and grabs a part... He continues to open it up and BOOM right piece first try!  I tell him that's awesome he got it on the first try.  He says "When you got it you got it".  He was awesome and from now on I will only go there when I need parts for anything plumbing related.

3.description: I had a hard to find faucet dispenser, went to these guys and they assist like there's no tomorrow. The times I've gone in, the staff is very helpful, smiling and laughing and you'll get one of the owners that'll come from the offices and do some counter work with us patrons.. Don't screw around with the bathroom supply amateurs. Go to these guys, they'll steer u right!!!

1.description: Walked in on Saturday, Feb 27th around 12:33p looking for bathroom and kitchen fixtures for 7 of my properties. No one offered any help on the kitchen and bath side. As I walked through the store looking no offered any help. However, several other individuals walked in and of course they couldn't even get through the door good enough before they offered their assistances. The only person that was willing to help was the gentleman that helped answered my questions about tank less hot water heaters that was when I first walked in before you go up to the steps on the other side.The staff dealing with kitchens and baths looked at a me as though I couldn't afford anything in their store. Mind you I am an owner of 27 properties total and very good career.  I guess it was the color of my skin..hmmm!Well its their lost as well any referrals they would have gotten. I hope they stay in business because in today's times most business don't last long. Open today and close tomorrow.Remember how you treat people as they walked through your doors.

2.description: Very helpful. No pressure to buy. Could use more parking. The store had an enormous inventory.

9.description: I am an online customer.  I ordered my whole house worth of faucets and bath fixtures and had them shipped to California.Not only does this store offer the absolute best prices on Grohe fixtures that I could find, the customer service is great!  One item was a bit delayed due to a change from the manufacturer, but they let me know right away and kept me updated on when it was shipping.I returned a few items because I didn't like the style after I got them, and got fast, personal email responses.  I exchanged them and got a credit back for the difference with zero fuss.

10.description: Found the store information online and we decided to check out the store for our bathroom remodel project. We talked with Joe for about 30 minutes about all the Grohe gear we were interested in. He was knowledgeable and helpful. We picked up what they had in stock and ordered the rest.

13.description: Thank you Consumers Supply, especially Joe M., for all of your assistance with our kitchen and bath remodeling. Great selection, service and value.

16.description: I went into Consumers one day looking for a shower head. They have an entire wall filled with all kinds of options. The selection was not only good, but the pricing was even better. I'll be back soon to re-do my bathroom, as their showroom has everything!

17.description: I just ordered a fairly large amount of plumbing fixtures from Consumers Plumbing, and I couldn't be happier!  The great service started when I placed my order.  I asked to speak to a Grohe hardware expert and was connected with Kenny, and he truly is an expert.  He helped me to select all the right items (many of which I didn't know about) and was extremely helpful in every way.  They had all the items in stock, and they all showed up exactly on time--and the order was 100% correct.  Kenny also followed up after the order was placed via a personal email with the tracking number.  The prices were very reasonable.  Again, I couldn't be happier with the excellent service.

15.description: Good selection.  Much cheaper than your big retail stores like Home Depot!  The staff there was friendly and nice enough to let me ask stupid questions.

0.description: Our contact is with a very knowledgeable and extremely patient gentleman named Joe. He is priceless!!!

5.description: I was looking for an adapter for my faucet and had tried a couple of local hardware stores... Finally after much frustration someone suggested Consumers Supply Company.  I walk in and I see an older gentleman with an unlit cigar hanging out of his mouth... I immediately liked him!  I think to myself "this is my kinda guy" anyway i walk up to him and tell him what I need and show him the parts I have.  He takes a look at it for maybe ten seconds and then says "I think I have what you need".  He walks over to the this wall and looks it over for a second and grabs a part... He continues to open it up and BOOM right piece first try!  I tell him that's awesome he got it on the first try.  He says "When you got it you got it".  He was awesome and from now on I will only go there when I need parts for anything plumbing related.

11.description: A great place and it's nice it is family owned. I went in looking for a part for a dripping grohe shower and they were very helpful in finding the correct replacement part. The price was reasonable (slightly higher than online places) from the prices I found online at other sites. What I didn't care for was that the replacement piece was not a genuine grohe part but a generic part that fits multiple brands. It still seems high quality and has fixed the dripping problem. Though for an authorized Grohe dealer, I would have expected to receive a genuine replacement part. I am glad to support a small, family-owned business though. They also seem to have really good sales on very high-end toilets and sinks.

8.description: I came here to find a rubber hose for a repair on my air conditioner condensate line.  At Home Depot, they didn't have the right diameter hose, and they only sold other hoses in 10' lengths.  The guy at HD recommended that I come here, and in about 10 seconds, I had exactly what I needed, no more, no less!

4.description: The man that was helping us was rude and condescending. The name of the business is CONSUMER Supply Company. Had it been CONTRACTOR Supply Company and I had over-stepped my bounds and gone to purchase something at a store where professional plumbers shop, I would understand. However, I called and was assured they have a showroom and consumers are welcome. Not only would he not offer any helpful advice, but he also attested to the fact that their 'showroom' wasn't an accurate portrayal of the products, as there is no way to tell from one showerhead to the next if what you see is the efficiency/effectiveness of the showerhead or perhaps, the plumbing pipes vary from one to the next. When asked 'how can one compare apples to apples' , his answer was 'sorry but you can't'. When asked about product comparison, we kept hearing 'they are all the same. I have no idea'. When shown a picture of our shower and asked what size attachment we should use- the 6 or 8 inch- we were told- ' I have no idea. Whatever you want.' He clearly hated his job and could care less. We were in a bind and bought the showerhead anyway- but were not happy to find it less expensive at another local place that we wished we had visited- The Chicago Faucet Shoppe. They were extremely nice on the phone and I am upset that I gave Consumer Supply Company my business as the salesman was beyond the worst I have ever encountered. Note to store: the name we saw on the store receipt was 'H". We came in at 4:00 on a Monday. If you know who your employee is, I strongly suggest a crash course in customer service at the very least. If it was me- I would fire the rude man.

14.description: We remodeled our home (kitchen, 3 bathrooms, bar area) last year.  I did a lot of research online for various suppliers and designers.  Spent time visiting several places but ended up back at Consumers Supply - right price, good variety, customer focued.  Everyone at the store was willing to help and answer questions.  But we strongly recommend Joe Milianta.  Joe spent several hours over several Saturdays working with us; he took the time to understand our project and our style and our timeline and our budget.   He offered ideas on style...and ideas on various products and various price points on products.  His mission was to make sure the customer was happy with the product and service.  He delivered on this mission.  He is a man of his word.  If we had a problem with the product or delivery of the product, he took care of it....no questions asked.  Overall, we are very pleased with the product, service, and price that CS offers.  We will definitely go back.  Thanks Joe for helping turn our house into a beautiful home!!

6.description: This is a wonderful business with super knowledgeable staff and discount prices. I have worked with Joe and have been very pleased with his recommendations. I have done some large remodels and most recently a basement bathroom remodel. Joe will help you find what you need in any price range.

0.description: It is tucked away in the same building as Moksha yoga and hosts a few awesome artists.  The entrance is off of Huron.  It was cool to see the artists in their work space and browse the variety of pieces.  The easiest time to check it out is during an opening so I'd suggest keeping your eyes open for the next opening.

28.description: La Scarola's one of my favorite restaurants and since I'm not extremely fond of the second hand smoke one's subjected to at Richards, Clover is usually where I go to drink my dessert. It's a chill spot spot that you just can't help but like. Nothing outrageously noteworthy about it, but the staff is always friendly, the prices are fair and they've got a MyTouchTunes jukebox. I've never seen it extremely packed which is what I love about it. Great place for post dinner date drinks. If the name has anything to do with it you might even get lucky...

1.description: Bartender was so friendly and service was quick, although it wasn't very busy last night, so that may have helped. Beer selection was OK. Beers on tap were limited, but that was fine. This is a fun local neighborhood bar for a relaxed night, love it. We ordered appetizers, which I found out were from Emmit's across the street - best bar food! I recommend the Irish Potato Boxty. Divine.

9.description: Jess and Anna are friendly, fast and make you feel apart of the hood. They remember your name, and treat you like an old friend. Quaint neighborhood bar, great for sports, and reasonable priced drinks in a rather pricey area. Thankful for bars like the Clover.

29.description: Started out as a real believer. Great place for Sunday football, tons of TV's, very accomodating. and was there 5 out of the past 6 sundays. Got to know the whole crew, great folks. Until last weekend. Once the Bears game was done and all the late games started, the sound was turned off and an awful mix of country and Madonna music was started, and loud!Several requests to get any of the game sounds (which happened with no issues in the past 5 times I was there), were completely refuted by the owner. Despite a couple dozen people there, staring at the TV's trying to watch the games, the owner insisted that folks want to listen to music and don't care about the games. Note that the music was so damn loud you couldn't even have a conversation. My group then promptly asked for the bill and we walked out. I hope the owner reads this and realizes how absurd his argument was and how easy it is to lose good customers. You go to the trouble of putting a dozen TV's in the place, play all the games and advertize it, and then put on Madonna? Then you argue it's what people want? Seriously?

23.description: Great pub!  Great beers!  Rob the owner talked to us all night....place "gets" it !

5.description: I had a great time here watching the iowa football game, they had good drink specials-$4 20z bud lites and $9 pitchers, plus free walking tacos! I also won an iowa hoodie from the free raffle you can enter just by walking in, it didnt get too packed but still had a good crowd, also free popcorn, and after iowa won we got free fireball shots, it's now my favorite place to watch iowa games in chicago

31.description: I became an instant fan of Clover after one visit. It took me longer than it should have to stop in, partly because their storefront is a bit unassuming relative to the Funky Buddha next door and also because I prefer American / Belgian craft beer. First, the beer selection. Their taps include too many mass-produced beers for my liking, though they do have a respectable bottled craft selection (e.g., Three Floyds, Brooklyn, Delirium Tremens). While I wouldn't grade them 5 stars on their beer selection alone, the service and charm at Clover is unbelievable. Our first visit felt like walking into Cheers. The manager greeted us, the bartender introduced himself, the wait / bus staff were friendly and attentive, and everyone said goodbye and thanked us for coming when we left. It seemed that all of the staff were on the same page about creating as warm and welcoming of an atmosphere in a neighborhood pub as you could ask for. Another point: I like to support local businesses, and value businesses that do the same. As best I know, Clover doesn't have a kitchen, though they've partnered with neighboring stores La Scarola and Toni's pizza to offer great food at reasonable prices. I've tried a lot of food from Toni's and La Scarola, and they're consistently excellent, but the dishes not to be missed are: bruschetta, pasta & fagiole (best I've ever had), chicken vesuvio, and Toni's spinach pizza.

25.description: Love this place, the place is hip and friendly.The place has a lot of tv's to watch whatever sporting event you are looking for.The drinks are great and the bartender is so friendly.Love this BAR!

12.description: I moved across the street a few months ago and this has become my favorite spot to either start or finish the night. The prices are good, there is a neighborhood feel, the staff is extremely friendly and Sasha, my precious pup, is always welcome as are other well behaved and reasonable four legged companions. It's is a Hawkeyes bar, but hey, no one is perfect.

21.description: Great specials, lots of TVs, free popcorn and great service.  The downfall?  They order food from across the street so theres not a lot of options.  The nachos we ordered came in cold and soggy before we really got to enjoy them.  Otherwise the staff here is a lot of fun, especially during hawks games!

16.description: The owner Rob left one of my favorite drinking neighborhood joints (River Shannon with the Rush and Division Group) to open this place with a partner.They certainly do a great job of making the customer feel at home. Too bad it's sorta distance from my place. Else I'd be there all the time!

17.description: Clover Sports & Leisure is an old-fashioned drinking joint, taking a page from the days when it wasn't frowned upon to have a smoke and a drink, and when sports icons played for the love of the game, not for fame or money.  Located in the definitive six-corner intersection that is also home to Chicago institutions as La Scarola, Richard's Bar and Emmit's Irish Pub, near Grand and Halsted, Clover Sports & Leisure will be in good company.The concept is simple, and it was formed by two veterans in the bar business who became drinking buddies upon meeting at The Lodge Tavern in Chicago years ago.  Dana Ronk, who has over 20 years in the business managing establishments, most recently Mahoney's Pub & Grille, along with Rob Dalton, with over 14 years behind the bar, up till now managing River Shannon, know what it takes to make patrons feel welcome in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere.  Ronk and Dalton have created a warm and inviting tavern, referencing a time of the good-old-days with a focus on the leisure of life, encouraging customers to relax-well in their aptly named Clover Sports & Leisure.  They credit The Lodge Tavern's Jimmy Borchers with schooling them on how to be 'proper barkeeps'.  Clover Sports & Leisure featrures lots of flat-screen, plasma televisions nestled in and around the large oak bar with plenty of barstools and some comfy cushioned chairs.  Every seat is a great seat to kick back, relax, and take in a televised sporting event while enjoying a preferred adult beverage.  Clover Sports & Leisure offers over forty beers, seven on tap, and a full bar of premium liquors, including a nice variety of scotches and whiskeys, as any respectable watering hole would.  While imbibing, patrons may feel the urge to snack, and for that reason Clover Sports & Leisure will offer hot pizzas and fresh popcorn, as it is all about simplicity and going back to a time when less meant more.

10.description: I love Clover.I moved nearby around June, and this place has become my go to place to grab a quick beer or get a night started with Friends. They have specials all the time (get a PB&J!) and a pretty diverse selection of beers, usually with plenty of chicago local brews. Come Friday/Saturday nights, it is usually pretty full, but very laid back. Giant Jenga is hilarious to play with a group of friends, as each block has a dare for you to do. There is also free darts and all you can eat popcorn. They also have lots of TVs, and is an ideal place to catch a Bulls/Bears/Blackhawks game.If you want food, they can order from emmitts next door and deliver, but no in house options.

11.description: I love walking into Clover after a long day at work. The staff is friendly and very pleasing to talk to and the great beer selection doesn't hurt. Good place to watch sports as they have plenty of TVs! They always have the sound on for Blackhawks games but never too loud so that you can't hear your friend sitting next to you. I wish I could give this place more stars!!

26.description: Clover Sports & Leisure is an old-fashioned drinking joint, taking a page from the days when it wasn't frowned upon to have a smoke and a drink, and when sports icons played for the love of the game, not for fame or money.  Located in the definitive six-corner intersection that is also home to Chicago institutions as La Scarola, Richard's Bar and Emmit's Irish Pub, near Grand and Halsted, Clover Sports & Leisure will be in good company.The concept is simple, and it was formed by two veterans in the bar business who became drinking buddies upon meeting at The Lodge Tavern in Chicago years ago.  Dana Ronk, who has over 20 years in the business managing establishments, most recently Mahoney's Pub & Grille, along with Rob Dalton, with over 14 years behind the bar, up till now managing River Shannon, know what it takes to make patrons feel welcome in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere.  Ronk and Dalton have created a warm and inviting tavern, referencing a time of the good-old-days with a focus on the leisure of life, encouraging customers to relax-well in their aptly named Clover Sports & Leisure.  They credit The Lodge Tavern's Jimmy Borchers with schooling them on how to be 'proper barkeeps'.  Clover Sports & Leisure featrures lots of flat-screen, plasma televisions nestled in and around the large oak bar with plenty of barstools and some comfy cushioned chairs.  Every seat is a great seat to kick back, relax, and take in a televised sporting event while enjoying a preferred adult beverage.  Clover Sports & Leisure offers over forty beers, seven on tap, and a full bar of premium liquors, including a nice variety of scotches and whiskeys, as any respectable watering hole would.  While imbibing, patrons may feel the urge to snack, and for that reason Clover Sports & Leisure will offer hot pizzas and fresh popcorn, as it is all about simplicity and going back to a time when less meant more.

27.description: Nice intimate and friendly place.  Our plan was to do a bar crawl on Super Bowl Sunday, this was our first stop and we never left.  The owners were having a semi private party and they welcomed our group of 4 like we were regulars.   They had a buffet that included pizza, italian sausages, pasta, hummus, and a whole lot of chips and salsa.   Would reccomend and would definitly go back when we're in Chicago again!

35.description: Love this new kid on the block. We  stopped in tonight with friends after work  for a few drinks and got a nice table in the back. Meet both of the owners Rob and Dana while they were hard at work. Nice crowd, nice atmosphere and good drinks. Everyone was having a good time watching the game , playing giant Jenga and / or dancing. We will be back....

8.description: Clover is one of the most fun and lively bars I've been to in Chicago. It attracts a pub crowd that is generally made up of staff and patrons that want to drink and mingle, with a  strong distaste for solitudinous sobriety. Great place to start or top off a night with friends.  But if you go, promise me you'll keep it light and friendly!  Btw- Jessica, Jamie, Hana and Luis fucking rock.  Also the bartender, I think his name is Devin, who coined me as the "sleepy surgeon."  For yelp's peace of mind, I'll let you all know that I'm not actually a surgeon, clover just happens to brew aspiring comedians.

0.description: My favorite little neighborhood bar! Great staff, wonderful drink specials and steel tip darts...what more can you ask for. Recently they expanded and offer pool and shuffleboard. This bar is mine and my boyfriends "go to" spot for fun and friends!!

20.description: i have been here several times.  the first few times I enjoyed the experience, mainly because it wasn't crowded or too loud, and the drinks were good.  however, the music was basically the owner playing his personal music off of his laptop behind the bar. the sound was awful, the taste in music was a mix of billy joel and bob seger, and forget about him taking any type of request.  and since the bar was empty, it should really have been a no-brainer to be a little accommodating.and therein lies the problem.  Rob, who introduced himself as the owner, swings from friendly to aggressive in a heartbeat.  it took a couple of visits to recognize this.  Rob seems to have opened a bar so that he has a place to hangout with his buds.  from what I could tell, we may have been the only paying customers in the place.  and when his friends lit up their cigarettes it was the final straw. apparently the fact that I complained about the second-hand smoke, not to mention a law against smoking, meant that I was the problem and had overstayed my welcome.which I guess explains why the place isn't crowded when the other bars on this corner are hopping.  if you go, I would definitely not challenge Rob in any way or you may be given the same treatment as I was.   I recommend emmitt's

19.description: Love this bar. Its pretty chill and laid back. Great staff and good drinks. They also have free popcorn and a jukebox. Its a really friendly bar seems mostly locals attend. Its never a big crowd. They also have the jenga!

33.description: I really love this bar.  It's not too crowded and there's fairly good deals.  The staff is friendly and I always have a good time when I hang out here!Free pop corn and a over-sized Jenga game what's not to like! :-)

2.description: What a sad excuse for a bar. My party of 6 sat at a table for 10 minutes before we were given menus. Another 10 minutes pass and our sad excuse for a bartender finally comes back to take our order. What was she doing in the mean time? Talking to other customers. Probably because we look like "hoodlums" in our hoodies. Who knows. 10 more minutes pass and she isn't even pouring our beers. To top it off, she comes back and forgets my drink order. What a terrible excuse for a bar and bartender. We asked about their nacho bar and they said they had to "restart" it. What does that even mean? Also, they need to stick to their soundtrack and stop switching the song mid track. I can officially say I despise this bar. They don't serve food. You can order food from the bar next door. Our solution? We're going there instead.

34.description: Love love love! So many good things to say I just don't know where to start!So first of all both the owners are awesome... because they are the one's making your yummy drinks! Second, how could you go wrong with free popcorn or ordering  food from two amazing restaurants right next door. Third, the atmosphere is exactly what I want as my watering hole. It's crisp and clean with plenty of TVs for sports game but still comfy like a locals pub. I must say I am very excited this place has come into our Chicago bar scene and will be back often!Maybe I'll see you there... have a RumChata shot waiting for me!

32.description: Stopped in on Friday after work and had a great time.  Great staff, great drinks and a very friendly atmosphere.  Great addition to the neighborhood!

18.description: Went here Saturday night with a group of friends. The two bartenders were absolutely amazing! They were so fun & engaging. I wish I could remember both of these ladies names because they really did make our evening such a fun experience!!!  The jenga & popcorn kept us entertained for hours. :-)

13.description: La Scarola's one of my favorite restaurants and since I'm not extremely fond of the second hand smoke one's subjected to at Richards, Clover is usually where I go to drink my dessert. It's a chill spot spot that you just can't help but like. Nothing outrageously noteworthy about it, but the staff is always friendly, the prices are fair and they've got a MyTouchTunes jukebox. I've never seen it extremely packed which is what I love about it. Great place for post dinner date drinks. If the name has anything to do with it you might even get lucky...

4.description: We came here Thanksgiving night. We were orginally set for Richard's Bar, across the street, but I walked in, took one breath, and walked out, after taking a few puffs of my inhaler. It's a total smoke fest in there. Anyways, I asked someone outside, "where can I get a beer without having to burn my clothes in the morning?" Yo.I walked across to Clover and went inside. It was warm, not too crowded, and someone had a dog there. The beer menu was decent, with some solid IPAs and craft beers, and the bartender was responsive. If you like Jenga, they have a few gigantic versions set up for your amusement. Apparently, this is an Iowa bar. I'm not sure if it's Iowa State or Iowa Univerity nor if there is more than one.Overall, not a bad place. I had a few decent, tandom conversations. The dude with the dog was letting him walk around aimlessly and then would get ticked if someone pet him. Beers are $6-8. They have a jukebox and TVs.

24.description: Great spot. Bartender was great.  Turned out to be owner. Definitely recommend.   Rob seems to be in touch with his clientele. And, the music is great. #jacksonbrownerulesa

6.description: The Clover is everything you could ask for out of a neighborhood bar! good specials and beer selections, free popcorn, a lengthy bar with plenty of seating, and plenty of TVs to watch sports. (Not to mention a complimentary nacho bar for Blackhawks games). Oh, and Giant Jenga or darts anyone? There's always an upbeat friendly vibe in this place. What REALLY sets Clover apart is the staff- Jessica and Anna are absolutely fantastic. Friendly, accommodating, quick service- they're awesome. My husband and I have lived nearby for a year now and it is hands-down our favorite neighborhood bar.

22.description: An impressive looking bar in Chicago. I think it is fairly new and is a great place to watch a sporting event. The bartender was really friendly and this is a much better alternative in the neighborhood than Richards bar or that Irish bar right next door to it.

15.description: FYI, no food here BUT they get food from Emmit's across the street! Yes they have an Emmit's menu, the staff will take your order, and voila...it's delivered to your table at Clover - and added to your bill.Or I think you can bring your own food or order delivery.We came here on Sunday to watch football. The bartender-waitress was was very nice and accommodating at first. We had a table and she came to the table taking our orders and delivering them but as the hours went by we had to keep going to the bar to get anything.This is a pub but it's not all ratty and run-down like most I've seen. They have nice TV"s and furnishings (including the bar) that doesn't look deteriorated. The bathrooms are nice too and you get your own "fortress of solitude".

7.description: Megan is  the best bartender I've encountered so far.   Great service. Very fantastic  at her craft.  It was nice meeting  her.

36.description: The bartenders and staff are so wonderful!  I went during the week and they had amazing beer and liquor specials.  I am so glad this place opened and its been a needed addition to the West Loop area of Grand/Halsted/Milwaukee. I will definitely be returning!!!

30.description: Great place to have a few beers, hang out with your peeps and watch sports.  It's not an enormous bar but there is a television on every inch of every wall in the place.  The service is friendly and prompt and even when crowded I never had a hard time getting a fresh beverage.Important note regarding the food situation:  Don't go here looking for dinner and drinks, but if you need to eat there are two VERY different options.  Option 1 is ordering one of their frozen pizzas (i.e. Tombstone).  Option 2 is ordering delivery from the restaurant across the street, which happens to be some of the best Italian food in the city.Also: This is an Iowa Hawkeye bar.

3.description: Iowa Bar!!! Gamedays are real fun with a raffle at halftime where you can win some pretty sweet prizes. Service is great and staff is friendly. Free self-serve walking taco bar brings me back to IC... Wide selection of beers and they serve food from the adjacent restaurant. LET'S GO HAWKS!!

14.description: I took a date to this bar so we could see the blackhawks game. The atmosphere is nice however they refused to play the blackhawks game since a group of customers previously requested to watch a college basketball game. That's fine, but judging how they had more than four TVs. I am not quite sure why they couldn't put the game on one of their TVs. The crowd was obnoxious and loud. I get it's a bar, but when you have people falling out of their seats and hitting on your date that's a bit extreme. I find it naive to even call this place a Blackhawks bar when they don't even play the game for you live.

3.description: The only thing smiling in this place is the lucky person who was fortunate enough to walk away with a $5 footlong (and that is probably still rare)...or maybe a smiley face written on a table with a Sharpie.  Someone needs to give these workers some "happy pills" because I swear you feel like you are pulling teeth and nails when ordering.  (Yes, I actually want to put some toppings on my sandwich and even some sauce!)  The previous reviews about great service must have been from previous owners or workers because I can assure you that the service is far from great here.  Avoid this location if you can...unfortunately I have had to come here more often than I want because of limited time!!!

1.description: The worst customer service experienceI've ever had in Chicago. The staff literally started talking to Each other every time we opened Our mouths to place an order. Looking at me right in the eye and talking to Someone else so Loudly I couldn't hear myself speak. Never told us when we were done with the transaction. No receipt, just walked away. With hundreds of subways in the city why go to one where they could Care less what your experience is like. What does it say about other standards? I would have fired someone on the spot if this were my place. As soon as we sat down their conversation stopped. Wonder what they talk about when no customers are here. Two of the most obnoxious women  ready to ignore you in exchange for your money. Go somewhere else!

2.description: Rarely post on yelp, but this place is kind of bad. Been to a lot of subways in my time and i have to say this is quite possibly the worst.  They shrink portion sizes, allow perished toppings to sit, and i suspect they lie about offering wifi. The staff, however, are very friendly (provided that the indian banter and laughter ia not actually about the customers).  But as so many people have pointed out.. its a subway.. eat shet.

5.description: It's a Subway, so it's pretty much what you'd expect.  I've been there a few times and the service has been very good.  I've also had no problem finding a place to sit.  The tables are clean and it's close to the Blue Line.

6.description: Like another reviewer has mentioned, it's Subway, so you know what to expect.  However, the service here is fantastic.  Even on crowded days, you're in and out within a few minutes.  The employees are EXTREMELY kind, always greet you with a smile and tell you to have a nice day, and if you go there enough, remember your order.

0.description: For some reason, I love Subway. This one is especially nice because it's never packed and when it is, they don't herd you through like a bunch of cattle. The people there are really nice to boot.

4.description: They are really friendly in here and I appreciate their fast, friendly service.

3.description: My daughter is 11 months old, and she is enrolled in her second round of music classes at the Suzuki-Orff school. It is such a gift having this school be just down the street. My neighbors and I walk here once a week and enjoy playing with our babies in this musical and friendly environment. The class sizes are small. The teachers are talented and extremely comfortable and thoughtful around babies. We spend our 45 minutes learning new songs, playing with fun instruments, and watching our children be exposed to the concepts of rhythm, singing, playing instruments, sharing, and working alongside other kids. We purchased an instrument bag for $30 so we can play and sing at home, which we do all the time. My daughter is a rockstar on the triangle now. I couldn't be happier with this class, the instructors, the other babies, or the cost. It's a perfect package for me, and we will keep going!

1.description: We could not be happier with the experience we have had at ChiMe. We have our two boys enrolled in their guitar program, one for 3 years and one for two years, and the musical education they have received is top notch. They have a great teacher who has gotten them excited about music and kept them motivated to improve each week. The broader support/administrative staff at the school is also excellent and is able to create a very welcoming and warm environment, especially to parents like myself with no musical education or training. I would highly recommend this program to any parent who is interested in starting their child down the path of learning about music and playing an instrument.

2.description: Love love love the classes here.  My baby is now 10-months old and he is in his second session.  The baby-steps program is great.  The teacher ( Kristin) Is wonderful- really good with the babies ( oh and bonus points for singing pretty).  It's amazing to see the little one's get the hang of the songs and improve their development from week to week.  I have noticed a difference in what my son can do after starting classes- I have heard similar things from some other parents in the class.  Example- The babies are given different instruments for different songs- before the song each baby picks up an instrument from a basket then after they put them away to a song- at first my boy through a fit- wouldn't get the toy , wouldn't put away the toy, lots of tears. Fast forward a few weeks later- He is completing these tasks often and even sometimes at home- he will put his toys away to the song from class. ( HE IS 10 months! ) Another bonus-the other parents are nice and everyone is pretty friendly.

5.description: In an effort to discover where my little one's talents lie, I took her to the Suzuki-Orff School of Music for a trial class in the Baby Steps program. She LOVED it! Unlike the fiasco at the Little Gym, she jumped right into the group and was singing, xylophoning, rhythm sticking and tambourining her little heart out. The instructor works extremely well with young children, she's patient yet firm, encouraging and makes sure she includes everyone in the activities. This is a happy place. You can tell once you walk in that everyone is happy to be there, staff and students. We signed her up on the spot.

6.description: This school is a hidden gem in Chicago. The teachers are top notch and the programming is stellar. I'v tried several music classes with my children throughout the chicagoland area  and this school hands down is the best for really learning music. Children are active participants and actually learn (my son is starting to read notes at 4).  The suzuki instructors are wonderful and so are most of the orff ones (take a Ms. Courtney class-you won't be disappointed).  The suzuki students have frequent opportunities to perform at great venues (e.g. museums, theaters, millennium park etc). This occurs on a regular basis so that performing has become so natural to my pre-schooler at a young age. The facility is old and run town-don't let that deter you. I used to complain about the administration but this has changed in a very positive way over the last few months.

7.description: Our daughter and son love music classes and both teachers they have had for Twinkle Tots and Learning Explorers (different Baby Steps groups based on age and readiness).  They sing the songs, clap to the beat, and talk about their teachers outside of class. Classes aren't exactly cheap, BUT  I have a feeling they will work with you.  I know they are worth every penny I set aside for it.I would like to respond to the parents who see it as a negative that a teacher asked a parent to take a time out for her child. It is part of the teacher's job to ensure that EVERYONE is benefiting from the class.  When a child is throwing around toys (which are not allowed to be brought into the class by families for obvious reasons) or a tantrum in the middle of a class, the child is distracting other children from focusing on the music and learning experience.  This is not to say that this is the child's fault.  S/he is, of course, only 2 (or 1 or whatever). One simple thing is to take a child out of the room, calm them down, and then bring them back.  I have had to do it myself because I know it is not fair for the other kids to watch my child throw a tantrum for a class that their parents are paying for.  I have seen other parents do the same out of consideration and respect for the teacher, the children, and their parents.  I find it hard to believe that a teacher would ask a parent to give a time out for just throwing a toy once.  Based on my experience as an educator, there is usually a lot more to the story.  Was it the first time?  Was it excessively hard? Did it hit another child?Also, these classes are boring?  Anything but boring.  There is singing, dancing, movement, reading, playing, etc.  Are there times when we have to teach our children to be patient waiting for a song that s/he likes or wait their turn?  Yes, but that's not being boring.  That's what we're SUPPOSED to be teaching our kids - in and out of a music class.  It's a shame not everyone sees it that way.Nobody expects the children to be perfect, but maintaining a little discipline does not mean that the teacher is being immature or unkind.  Of course they'll run around once in awhile or do a little exploring in the room. However, now is the perfect time to teach children that throwing instruments is unacceptable as is throwing a vase in your house.  Once again, discipline does not equal being unreasonable or mean.These teachers are the exact opposite of mean and unkind and to imply otherwise offends me for them.  That said, these classes are a lot of fun for my kids. They are learning about a lot more than music.

8.description: My son has been going to Suzuki Orff for almost a year now.  He is a very spirited 2 year old and like another reviewer had stated - it's been challenging for him to sit for some of the songs (especially the ones he doesn't like) and I considered pulling him out because of this energetic personality trait he inherited :-).  I, also, agree with that same reviewer when they said that the teachers expect the children not to throw instruments or  run around (unless it's part of a song). (Although, to be fair, none of the teachers have asked me to time out my son... but, I do that on my own  in a quiet and calm way so that it's not drawing negative attention to the behavior or taking away from the other students' experience.)  However, all of that aside,  I couldn't be happier that I decided to keep my son enrolled and have seen steady improvement in his ability to attend and participate throughout the entire class.  There are still times where I have to pick him up and let him observe because he gets a little rambunctious - but even during those moments he's absorbing everything that is happening.   Some of his favorite songs are the songs we learned at Suzuki-Orff.  And personally, I am very happy that he is learning to be respectful to musical instruments and is lengthening his attention span.   Oh, and he's also gotten a lot better about turn-taking and sharing!To give an idea of how my son's class is structured :* The first 15 minutes the students get to play with toys and is a great way to transition into the actual 'music' portion of the class.*The teacher then leads the children into several different songs that teach them how to use instruments such as, a drum,  rhythm sticks, jingle bells, sand blocks and shaker eggs.  They are usually the same songs each week, although they do have some songs that change depending on the weather or holiday.  MANY of the songs incorporate movement (those are my son's favorites).   *There are also other props used to assist in enhancing the song and the student's understanding of the songs.  For example, the other day his teacher, Clara,  showed the students a real nest before singing a song about a nest.  Oh, and there is also a rocking horse named, Old Joe, that the kids LOVE to ride while learning about beat.*The last 5-10 minutes, the lights are dimmed and the students transition into leaving.  They get to play the triangle with the teacher, sing their ABC's and say goodbye to each other.Last, but certainly not least, I have to acknowledge the two AMAZING and PATIENT teachers he has had:  Clara and Toni.  They are both stellar (and I wish I had their voices!!!).

9.description: The Baby Steps program is great for little kids. We've tried a lot of music classes. This is our top pick. The instructors are patient and fun but firm. There's a lot of emphasis on teaching kids the beat and the rhythm. The songs are unique and very catchy, plus the kids get to use xylophones, sticks, drums etc. Highly recommend this.

0.description: Best music classes for young kids in Chicago ( and we have tried a lot). Ignore the old building and focus on the wonderful , engaging, enthusiastic dynamic baby -steps music teachers ( Ms. Allie does a fantastic job creating an interactive and exciting atmosphere for very young  children). Excellent violin teaching staff ( for the most part). Stick with Cecelia for the young child who needs a lot of nurturing or Lauren if your child is a more serious musician. Lots of great performance opportunities. Administration has really gotten their act together for a smooth consumer experience ( this used to be my only complaint when we started 5 years ago). We are so lucky to have found this music school.

4.description: We had a very good experience here.  In the end we could not continue because the commute was too war, but the teachers are very well trained, enthusiastic ,and get even shy kids to participate.  My daughter loved the rhythms, songs and games.

28.description: A great place to get gifts.  My wife and I were in the neighborhood and we found Abbey Brown just walking by.  With five or more teachers to buy presents at my son's school, ABSA was the perfect place to get them a little something.  It's a bit expensive, but considering what you are paying for its totally worth it.  They make all their own soap and other items.  The store is a fun place to shop and smells amazing!!! It's great to see a locally owned retailer making it.

1.description: Fancy soaps and bath products for the fanciest of ladies.  I had to stop and smell every Chicago-themed candle.  There's a candle for every CTA line.  I don't know that the red line really smells like that, but Abbey Brown's soaps have me convinced.  It was impossible for me to choose a favorite.I almost bought a vat of chamomile butter, but my arsenal of body products is full right now.  My friend bought rose and patchouli-scented bath salts.  I don't like patchouli at all, but the scent was a little more delicate in this product.  Everything in this shop smells lovely.Walking in here, I automatically felt a little relaxed compared to the hustle and bustle of Grand Avenue.  I'm not big on taking baths, but I would recommend this shop to ladies who love baths or just simply appreciate soaps with all natural ingredients.Of course this place is a bit more spendy than a Bath & Body Works, but the two don't even compare.  The products here are still very affordable, most in the less than $20 range.

9.description: I received some gifts (rose scented olive bar and bath salts) from here and was about to to run out from using them so much. I came by to stock up on more items and see what else the store had.  First off, the store smells heavenly. It wasn't very overwhelming like most spa/skin speciality/aromatherapy type stores can be. In fact, it made the store seem so warm and cozy, and I probably lingered around longer than I should have been. If that makes any sense...As much as I loved rose scented anything, I picked up a couple other scented olive oil soap and shea balm items: pear up and peppermint.  I don't like to admit this, but the winter season is brutal to my poor dry feet. I'm quite excited to try out this shea balm for my feet and other dry patches caused by bitter winters. Damn you winter! In addition to the all the great bath and candle stuff, the store also carries a lot of artwork, clothing, jewelry, greeting cards, and bags all made by local artists, which is awesome. Prices are reasonable (about $6-10 for most). I'm going to keep this store in mind for future gift giving and of course, retail therapy for me. I have my eye on a messenger bag displayed up front. Oh, and it's easily accessible by the Grand bus and walking distance from the blue line.

29.description: Like previous posts have mentioned, this place is great because they make all their soap ON the premises.  They have a very wide selection of scents and herb combinations and will cut you whatever size you are looking for.Also some cute gifts and jewelry, also by local artists.  Stop on by!

23.description: I absolutely adore this shop!  The soaps, soaks, and lip balms are amazing!  I bought a few soaps and soaks for friends this Christmas and they all loved it.  It is a bit pricey but they use high quality and natural ingredients and they make everything in the store.  Just knowing that makes me forget about the prices.  I can't wait to take one of their soap making classes.  Every time I try to sign up it is already booked.  Hopefully next month I will be able to finally take one class.The staff is also extremely friendly and I love to support local businesses!

5.description: I found Abbey Brown online when I was looking for Chicago-themed wedding favors. When I perused the site, I found wonderful ideas. Since we had a very small wedding, I spent more on each favor. I also didn't want to give favors that had no purpose. I ordered matching soap/candle pairs ($15) for each couple and put them in a decorative mesh bag. I also reused the brown paper shreds from the box. It is difficult to get the scent you want when ordering online, but none of the frangrances were bad! I did visit the beautiful store to purchase more, and the employee was very nice. If you are looking for Chicago-themed gifts, check out Abbey Brown-you will not be disappointed! She makes lots of other fragrant items also. I just enjoyed the wrapping with names and pictures of iconic Chicago locations. When I recieved my order in the mail (in a very timely and well-packed manner) the woman who packed the box wrote a lovely message wishing me well on my wedding. I didn't notice immediately, but the card was a picture of the storefront. What great idea!Thank you staff at Abbey Brown! And FYI, Abbey Brown is the name of a color-not the name of the store owner!

31.description: Best bar of soap $5.00 can buy, once you get some you will be hooked. Mostly a gifty type of place with a lot of variety from aromatherapy to crafts and books. Seriously the place made me reconsider what I was doing to my skin all these years.

25.description: This really is a cute place to go for soap gifts and with christmas coming up I will probably be back soon. For $6 each they have an awesome selection of soaps packaged in little brown bags that are adorable - tons of different kinds like mango, lemongrass, poppy and basil. They also have cards and baby gifts and a lot of other things that would make nice presents. It's nice to buy local products and these are high quality soaps.

12.description: What a cute little shop! Everything smells great and a helpful staff will answer questions for you, since, after all, they make the soap there!! There are great little gifts for anyone from friends to really cute local things like soaps named after our CTA lines! I liked the citrus line including a great salt soak! I'm definitely heading here for my Mothers Day gifts this year!!

21.description: Cute place, I would expect this homemade soap and bath salts shop to be on Division or Roscoe, but it resides right here on a stretch of Grand Ave., among the Italian Deli's and restaurants. They make all their soaps and salts in-house, with all natural ingredients and the quality shows.The Orange Blossom and clove soap was my first choice, but I'm really curious about their higher-priced line, where I espied a soap made with clay soil. The salts can get expensive, but you can buy a one-bath sample for $6.50. Large sizes are ~$21.Also offering soap-making classes, I do expect to take a class soon so I can make some of my own unique gifting favorites. Abbey Brown also has cards, journals, and the like, and the store help is friendly as can be!

16.description: These are the ONLY soaps I use, mainly because I know they use pure ingredients. I took a soap-making class there and they use TONS of olive oil, which is not cheap, and zero sulfates. These soaps clean without drying my skin, so sometimes I can skip a moisturizer. I've also tried their body butters, which are also great, very few ingredients.I took off one star because I felt that $60 was very steep for the soap-making class. Yes, we got ONE free bar of soap, but it was basically watching the owner make huge batches of soap. Not worth such a high price.

17.description: I'm reviewing the French Market location. After seeing their gift sets on the web site, I decided to get my Christmas gifts for colleagues there. However, when I asked the sales girl about them, she had no clue what I was talking about. I asked her for recommendations to put a few items together to re-create the gift box, she still had very little idea of how to help me (she started with lip balm when I was holding the bath salts and staring at the bath items). The only thing she was able to tell me was about the smells (since they are open for me to smell, that part didn't really help). The interaction ended with her not having bags for me (and my 4 boxes). She offered an old ikea bag, but ended up asking a neighbor for some plastic bags. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't poor service, I think she really did want to help - she just didn't know the product or how to sell. I recommend you do your own homework before going.

10.description: I love the Citus Shea Butter. It is the perfect travel size for carry on luggage and a little goes a long way.

11.description: Pricey soaps, but they clean well and smell great! I love the herbal scents and am using In The Woods in my bathroom now. Not girly or cleaning-product-smelly at all, but still fresh and mature smelling.I found them at the Logan Square farmer's market.
