26.description: FABULOUS soaps!local and luxurious! what more could you ask for?58% olive oil in the soapsone for a gift...two for me...two for gifts...four for me..you smell great and your skin's soft...you've got to try her products! they're all over the city/burbs, so hurry and visit!i particularly like the french market location.also, deborah, the sweet shop owner, has a fantastic memory!

27.description: Two words: COFFEE SOAP.

35.description: for years i'd bemoaned the fact that the guy who owned our building never leased out to girlie tenants.  i mean, this neighborhood is so lacking in the 'pretty', it's ridiculous.  (but i still love it.)so what a great relief when abbey brown arrived.  pretty, handmade, artisanal soaps.  yes, the vibe is a little...crafty.  but the stuff ain't bad!  i had the shea butter lip balm and it's so soft and nice - and all natural!  i've also used the lavender scented room deoderizer (you know, the one with the wicker sticks that dispense the fragrance...) and i have it next to my bed and it relaxes me when i sleep.(not to mention it makes the room smell very good.)she also carries stationery, art, bags, jewelry and some crafty things from local artists.  support our locals!  i'd much rather shop here for work/friend/family gifts then schlepping all the way over to some other 'hood.Note:  i think she's going to start teaching classes.

8.description: Cute place, I would expect this homemade soap and bath salts shop to be on Division or Roscoe, but it resides right here on a stretch of Grand Ave., among the Italian Deli's and restaurants. They make all their soaps and salts in-house, with all natural ingredients and the quality shows.The Orange Blossom and clove soap was my first choice, but I'm really curious about their higher-priced line, where I espied a soap made with clay soil. The salts can get expensive, but you can buy a one-bath sample for $6.50. Large sizes are ~$21.Also offering soap-making classes, I do expect to take a class soon so I can make some of my own unique gifting favorites. Abbey Brown also has cards, journals, and the like, and the store help is friendly as can be!

0.description: Great even though a little pricey, but not really. They have samples for almost everything and you're more than welcomed to try all. Friendly lady, and they don't rush you. Wander as long as it want. Quite wide range of products and smell. Really good shop in general. Just quite hard to find a place to park, but no big deal. Highly recommended!

20.description: Who do you think you are giving me super soft skin and having me smell uber-delish with your Honey and Oatmeal soaps? Making my skin next to perfect and exfoiliating and moisturizing like no one's business? Just who do you think you are being super convenient having a location near my home and in Navy Pier? Shame on you for being awesome, you make all the other soaps sad. :-)But really, I had a chemical peel for my face and alternated between the mud purifying soap at night and the honey oatmeal soap in the morning and my esthetician said my skin recovered better than almost anyone she had ever seen. I also use the honey oatmeal soap all over my body and the scent makes my hubby swoon. I will never use another soap and I am VERY picky. Love at first lather, trust me.

19.description: I absolutely adore this shop!  The soaps, soaks, and lip balms are amazing!  I bought a few soaps and soaks for friends this Christmas and they all loved it.  It is a bit pricey but they use high quality and natural ingredients and they make everything in the store.  Just knowing that makes me forget about the prices.  I can't wait to take one of their soap making classes.  Every time I try to sign up it is already booked.  Hopefully next month I will be able to finally take one class.The staff is also extremely friendly and I love to support local businesses!

33.description: I absolutely love the soap from this store!  It's made of pure olive oil and it so luxuriously silky.  I also love the lip gloss sold here and the body butter.  Actually, I love everything here.  The shop also sells at the Lincoln Park farmer's market every saturday, even in the winter!  That way you have choices on where to go.

2.description: I love supporting independent shops or boutiques! This one was no different. Abbey Brown carries a plethora of scented goodness and it took me quite awhile to decide on what to buy. Had it been a little closer to Christmas, I would have picked up some of the Chicago themed soaps and candles. I was thinking they'd make a cute basket item for a Chicago-themed basket.I ended up leaving with just some bath salts since my bath collection is already way overstocked. If in the area, I highly recommend coming in and saying hello.The ladies working the shop were friendly as well.

34.description: This is a nice independent store carrying handmade soap, essential oils, tea, candles and a small selection of cards. The main attraction here is the soap. It all smelled very good, but I didn't walk away with anything other than some of their All that Jazz black tea for a friend. It's definitely good that places like this are still popping up in my neck of the woods. Personally though, for soap, I have been buying my favorite soap (cranberry pomegranate) for the last couple of years from Luv a Dub Dub Soap Co. so this place just doesn't do it for me, but for other people. I'm sure it hits the hippie meets yuppie spot!

32.description: Really nice gift and soap shop.  I haven't tried the soaps yet (which are all made at the store), but I have purchased numerous other gifts.  She carries a good assortment of items from various artists - selection changes as she gets new inventory.  I am looking forward to seeing what she gets in the future.

18.description: Who do you think you are giving me super soft skin and having me smell uber-delish with your Honey and Oatmeal soaps? Making my skin next to perfect and exfoiliating and moisturizing like no one's business? Just who do you think you are being super convenient having a location near my home and in Navy Pier? Shame on you for being awesome, you make all the other soaps sad. :-)But really, I had a chemical peel for my face and alternated between the mud purifying soap at night and the honey oatmeal soap in the morning and my esthetician said my skin recovered better than almost anyone she had ever seen. I also use the honey oatmeal soap all over my body and the scent makes my hubby swoon. I will never use another soap and I am VERY picky. Love at first lather, trust me.

13.description: I expected better service from a boutique shop such as this.  We were basically ignored until we wanted to pay as the manager/owner was too busy ordering her interns around.  It was our first time in the shop and we came to purchase Mother's Day gifts so a greeting, offer to help, or asking if we had questions would have really improved the experience.  Instead we were left to wander around on our own wondering what our mom's would like and what exactly was in this stuff.  You might have upsold me, Abbey Brown, had you simply asked if I needed help.  I like that the products are all natural, made on-site and I love supporting local businesses, but my mom really like's Terry's Toffee and the employees there talk to me AND there's free samples!  I'll update the review if there are rave reviews from mom...

4.description: pretty good soap but a little pricey but I prefer the candles. I like to try different soaps. My favorite is from a pharmacist who makes soap from Pharmasoap.

24.description: I received some gifts (rose scented olive bar and bath salts) from here and was about to to run out from using them so much. I came by to stock up on more items and see what else the store had.  First off, the store smells heavenly. It wasn't very overwhelming like most spa/skin speciality/aromatherapy type stores can be. In fact, it made the store seem so warm and cozy, and I probably lingered around longer than I should have been. If that makes any sense...As much as I loved rose scented anything, I picked up a couple other scented olive oil soap and shea balm items: pear up and peppermint.  I don't like to admit this, but the winter season is brutal to my poor dry feet. I'm quite excited to try out this shea balm for my feet and other dry patches caused by bitter winters. Damn you winter! In addition to the all the great bath and candle stuff, the store also carries a lot of artwork, clothing, jewelry, greeting cards, and bags all made by local artists, which is awesome. Prices are reasonable (about $6-10 for most). I'm going to keep this store in mind for future gift giving and of course, retail therapy for me. I have my eye on a messenger bag displayed up front. Oh, and it's easily accessible by the Grand bus and walking distance from the blue line.

6.description: I visited the shop located in the French Market and was highly impressed with the quality of the products.  The products are made using natural ingredients and smell delicious.  There are several options at all price points.  I can see these products as great gifts for the holidays.  I also enjoyed how they had soaps creatively named after local things like a soap for the Chicago French Market.  They also have soaps named after the train lines. I ended up buying a citrus shea lip balm for $4, which I love.  I'm thinking of getting the body butter since I love the smell so much.The woman working at the shop on Saturday afternoon was super friendly and helpful.  I definitely will come back here again!

22.description: Not only are their people soaps divine as other reviews mention. But now they have dog shampoo!! Comes in bar form; which is easier to apply then normal liquid; just scrub dog with the bar. Suds up well for good cleaning, but also rinses super easy and with no residue. Conditions fur and skin without artificial moisturizers. And I am bathing a German Shepherd and a Pit Bull here, so we are talking serious fur and lots of it!! If you bathe your own dog, you must try this shampoo!! Or bring some to your groomer as a present!! Also, a perfect place to go if you need a gift for someone and have no idea what to get them. I have bought my Mom's Xmas presents 2 years running and both have been a hit!! (Seatbelt buckle purse and handmade bird house)

15.description: I have never actually been to the store so this review is just for the product.  I was at the one of a kind show three years ago and picked some soap up for my mom for Christmas.  She could not stop talking about it so now I have to make the hike every year to stock her up every Christmas.  Soaps all smell good and are made from pure fresh ingredients.  I wanted to take a soap making class at the store but they are a bit pricey at $60 a person.

7.description: I needed a 'thank you for hosting us' gift to send to some friends in Miami.  I was excited to check out the store and buy something not only Chicago local, but neighborhood local as a gift (I only live one block from the store).  I walked into the store and was BARELY greeted by a girl in the back with an unexciting hello.  I looked around at the goods for several minutes and the girl did not even come over and say 'how are you' or 'what can i help you find'.  She even came to the front of the store to put some items on a shelf and didn't even converse with me.  Customer service is everything to me!  I simply won't support a store, a neighborhood SOAP store nonetheless, that doesn't have friendly service.  I walked out empty handed.  There were actually a few items I would have liked to purchase.  Visited 8/19.

36.description: This is a great addition to the neighborhood. Really cute shop with friendly owners. They have tons of different handmade soaps and little cutsey things. I will be checking them out for Mother's day for sure.

30.description: I live pretty much right next to this place, and it gives me a thrill to be buying TRULY LOCALLY: the soap is made on location, and all their gifty things are created by local artists and crafty folk. I wish the art that they sell was better, a little less cutesy would be good....  and some of the handicrafts are startlingly expensive, but all in all it's a great place to buy gifts, and it smells nice to boot. There need to be more places like this in the area -- and in saying this I'm aware I'm probably sounding all gung-ho for gentrification, but honestly, if your manufacturing is done locally, and you're employing local artists, it can't be that detrimental, can it?The lemongrass soap is top notch. I smell good now.

3.description: One of the best looking stores I've ever been to!! I want to own a store like this one day!!!

14.description: This place is amazing.  Both my son and I have incredibly sensitive skin and I try not to switch or try new products for a fear of a reaction and never use anything  that does not pass the sniff test. Everything is handmade and amazing. It should be a must go to whenever someone comes to the city!

3.description: We use alot of ultrasound gel and I was always having to run to Northlake to get it and boy, was it priced ridiculously.  I found Howard medical and they have been my new go to for supplies to do my job.  Close to where I work and easy to order from. They even were nice enought to deliver my first order.  I usually just drop by and pick it up bec its that easy.  Great prices, easy to order - why go anywhere else. They seem to have a vast catalog of medical supplies so I'm sure they have what you need at a unbeatable price.

1.description: Don't trust themI should have realized that I couldn't trust them when they didn't leave a receipt with my new batteries.  I bought new scooter batteries in the summer.  This is the first time I've bought replacement batteries.  When I purchased them, they didn't tell me that I would need to purchase a new battery case as well as new batteries if I purchased a different size so I purchased the larger batteries.  When they came with the new batteries and realized that I needed a different size case, they did come back with new batteries and case.  However, they didn't leave a receipt.The batteries didn't work right from the start, but my father broke his hip and so I didn't have time to deal with it for a while.When I called about the batteries, Howard Medical said they would replace them since the batteries were still under warranty.  They came out and said that the case was wet but the batteries were fine.  They put new batteries and case into the scooter.  Later, they said that they didn't have any paperwork that they had left the original battery case and so didn't believe me that the case could have been wet from the start.Now Howard Medical says that the batteries weren't fine and charged me for both batteries and case.  I will be looking at alternative medical suppliers in the future.  If you decide to use them, get paperwork

2.description: Have never rented a wheelchair in the past but will only use Howard going forward. The only downside is that they are closed on the weekends. Otherwise, phenomenal service and prices!!

9.description: My brother in law came to town from Delaware and I needed to rent a wheelchair.  Howard Medical was so easy to deal with and they just took care of everything.  When I went to pick up the chair it was waiting for me up front with all of the paperwork attached.  I wanted to return it on Saturday but they are closed on the weekends.  Because of that they did not charge me any extra.  Who does business like that anymore?  If you need a wheelchair in Chicago Howard Medical is the only place to look.

10.description: I've worked with this company for 9 years and they are always consistent and deliver right on time. They make ordering a breeze.

4.description: I injured my leg two days before I was supposed to fly into Chicago. I was so happy to find this place through my fellow Yelpers. The people who work here are kind and efficient. I was able to order my chair ahead of time and getting it into the car was relatively easy. Prices were much cheaper than I was expecting which is obviously a plus. Definitely recommend.

6.description: I needed a wheelchair for my 84 year old father who was visiting for the week.  He has bad knees, and we wanted to do some sightseeing so we knew a wheelchair would be helpful!   Howard could not have been more fabulous.  They have a variety of wheelchair sizes and are very willing to help you find the one you need.  I was able to rent a 20 inch wheelchair (slightly larger than standard) for $65 for the entire week.  It was a lifesaver and I will not hesitate to use Howard Medical in the future.

12.description: Scenario:  your 74-yr-old small-town living, farm-dweller MI mother had her knee replaced 10 weeks ago.  She is doing well, still needs a cane but she cannot walk more than a couple of blocks.  But, by god, nothing's going to stop her. "I am getting on Amtrak and coming to Chicago!" she tells you.  My mother is nothing if not ballsy - or should I say "ovariesy?"I fret, "what are we going to DO with her? She can't keep up with us."This is where Howard Medical Company comes in. This place is the bomb! $15 per day gets you a 18" transport wheelchair (250 lb. weight capacity) - SO easy to fold up, has handles to carry it - fits into your Honda Civic tiny ass trunk.I talked to a woman named Bernie by phone - nice as hell - who says "we have plenty - no need to worry."  They open at 8 am - I am there at 8:05 am - assisted by yet another wonderfully nice employee named Jim. He shows me how to fold it, adjust it, etc. This is too easy -pinch me, I am dreaming.I race home to our apt, Metropolis coffee in hand, and say, "Duretta Jean, get in the car - we are Chubby Girl walking at the lake!"  Then to Target, then neighborhood strolling, then...oh the possibilities are now endless!A week I was once dreading has now become so much easier. Check them out!

5.description: Quick, friendly service. I've never rented a wheelchair before, but I'll only ever rent from them when I'm in Chicago from now on!

11.description: Rented a wheelchair from here to wheel my mom (bad knees) all around Chicago over the weekend for some sightseeing.No hassle. Great customer service. Cheap rates. I have zero complaints.

8.description: I have rented wheelchairs here on two occasions over the past seven months. The service is great, the prices are unbeatable! When you call you speak to a live person who will actually take care of your needs! I hope not to have to return, but if I do need medical supplies they are the first ones I will turn to! Thanks Howard!

0.description: I had back surgery in December, and while I'm easily able to walk, I really can't go too far (or too long) without sitting down.  So, the only way I can do big stuff is renting a wheelchair.  I went to Comic Con last weekend, and I was planning to rent a wheelchair through the convention center.  When they finally called back with pricing (the day before the con started) I was floored at the price - $250 for 3 days.  You can BUY a wheelchair cheaper than that, given a little notice.  So I googled "wheelchair rental chicago", and Howard Medical was the only result that looked promising.  I called and I couldn't believe how nice and helpful they were, and they had 5 chairs in stock for me to choose from to pick up the same day!  They were also really helpful when we were picking up, and it was only $15 a day (and they didn't charge extra for dropping off on Monday morning instead of Sunday night).  The chair itself had trouble with normal walking speed, we had to go slower than we wanted to, but that seemed to be the style of wheel - the chair itself looked like new.I couldn't be happier with their service, I'll definitely use them for my next convention!

7.description: I have had to just start using a scooter and the people at Howard Medical  company are so kind and so helpful and so great about pricing.Great company with a big heart

58.description: I absolutely love Kala Salon and Asif. I'm relatively new to Kala and have been so happy I made the switch. This is the first time I've had complete faith in someone to take care of the look and overall health of my hair. Even the blowouts are gorgeous. The salon itself is fresh, modern and the staff is friendly and helpful. Highly recommend!

56.description: Asif is a truly talented colorist -- I haven't left a salon as satisfied as I left Kala yesterday. My hair looks healthy, beautiful,  and so sexy. I love it!

29.description: I had my first appointment at Kala with Victor today and man, does my hair look great. I'm excited to be adding ANOTHER five star review to the board! I'm in the process of going from a dark auburn to a light blonde and came in with roots up the wazoo. I walked out with a head of hair Sienna Miller would die for. Highlight job was amazing and the cut was also perfect. I really hate giving the "I'm trying to grow it out" speech and have someone weed-whack my head, but Victor cleaned up my ends perfectly without sacrificing my hard-earned length. I booked my next appointment right away - I think I've found a salon forever home. Thanks, Victor!

42.description: 5 stars for Brittany. I called about 15 minutes before I was a walk-in last night in a minor hair crisis and Brittany luckily could take me! I walked out with a super cute modern bob. She not only listened to what I want but delivered on it (!) and would periodically pause and tell me what she was  doing and to ask me what I thought. I'm pretty low maintenance but I do know what I like. The small salon was buzzing with energy mixed with men and women.Products=Devines (the best)Tips=Cash only (there's an ATM in the bar on the corner)Try them. Trust me!

23.description: Erica is great.  I have been going to her for a little over a year and she always gets my hair color on point.  She's so patient with my 15+ inches of hair every time!  So happy I found Kala Salon!!

47.description: I've been going to see Jay Choi for a few years now.  She is still the only person in the city that does digital perms and she's the only stylist I've had that truly understands how to cut Asian hair.  I've never been loyal to one stylist until I met her.  I love going to her because I don't need to give her much direction and she just does what will look good.  I literally just show her how short I want to go and if I want layers or bangs and that's it.  She's fun and personable and doesn't rush through anything.  It was a relaxing experience and really affordable!  I highly recommend her to anyone with Asian or just thick hair.  I plan on getting another digital perm this summer.  If you want a low maintenance hair style and are tired of stick straight hair, I completely recommend getting a digital perm with Jay.  I've had it done three times by her and I've always left feeling like I had super model hair.

8.description: I was recommended to Erica at Kala Salon by a good friend of mine. She explained how wonderful the salon was, not bougie like some salons can be, and also mentioned how much she adored her stylist Erica. I decided to make an appointment with Erica right away. I can happily say...my friend was right! The salon itself has a cool Chicago loft style, and the staff makes you feel extremely comfortable! Erica took the time to really listen to what I wanted during our consultation and gave me her expert opinion on what our options were as far as my difficult color change. My hair was a deep auburn red and I wanted to go back to my natural medium brown color before my wedding (which was only 2 months away)!! Erica was amazing! She's friendly and very knowledgable when it comes to hair. She's easy to talk to and takes her time when making sure the end result is not only up to the clients standards but hers as well. I had to book several appointments with Erica to ensure my hair came out the desired color before my big day. She did not disappoint! I'm so pleased I found such a wonderful stylist!

31.description: Best bob I've had. Erica is awesome and very relaxing to be around! I'm new to the city and neighborhood so it's nice to find such a great salon. Totally worth the money!! I'll be back!

34.description: Alyssa is phenomenal. Highly recommend her. I'm here on business from New York and very picky about getting my haircut. She has a high attention to detail and she did exactly what I asked. Good conversation too! If I lived in Chicago, I now know exactly who my stylist would be. Thanks again!

16.description: Always the best haircut, keep going back

13.description: Been going to Alyssa for a while now; she's the best at cut & color...and I've been happy with the outcome every time I leave her chair!She's also done amazing airbrush makeup for me in the past as well. A total sweetheart who's awesome at what she does-ask for Alyssa!

11.description: My experience with Kala salon was fantastic! Alyssa was so warm and friendly, I felt she really listened to what I wanted and went above and beyond to make sure I got that!I went there for my first ever balayage try. I told Alyssa I wanted something natural and she did a wonderful job! She also did a wet and dry cut, evened everything out. And--she didn't take too much off as many stylists do! I haven't been this happy with a haircut in a few years. Would definitely recommend.

39.description: This place is modern and everyone here is so nice!  I came for a trial for my wedding hairdo, and Erica was absolutely amazing!  She experimented with my hair, and came up with the most beautiful braided crown that fell in soft curls.  On the wedding day, she came to me to do my hair and my mom's hair.  She did an absolutely superb job, and I will certainly go to her again when I need to get my hair done!

37.description: As the legendary Joan Crawford once said, "I think that the most important thing a woman can have -- next to talent, of course -- is her hairdresser."  Ladies and gentlemen, you will find that important thing at Kala Salon.Extraordinary, magical, gifted...these are a few words that describe the incredibly talented Asif Rajan.  Asif has worked with celebrity hair and has studied the art of hair in many cities across the globe in order to master his craft.  I genuinely look forward to an appointment with him every single time, even if it's after a dreadful 11 months without getting a haircut, but Asif is cool and never makes you feel bad about your hair choices (more like mistakes).  Naturally, I was super excited to hear about Asif's new venture, Kala Salon, and couldn't wait to book my appointment!I first saw Asif more than 4 years ago while he was at Fuga, and was so amazed by not just the haircut, but the entire experience. Asif looked at my hair, addressed all issues I had, and asked me what I wanted. I've never met a hairstylist who listens and actually does what you want with your hair, without ever pushing you into doing what's out of your comfort zone. He knows exactly what length, cut, and color will work for you and your lifestyle, and will recommend quick and easy ways to keep your hair looking fabulous well after your appointment.  Your hair will be cut so brilliantly that it continues to look amazing even as it grows, even for months after the cut. I have never left Kala Salon without feeling like a million bucks!Over the past 4 years, I've received several compliments on my hair, and I couldn't be happier to recommend Asif and Kala Salon. Trust me, go to Kala and you will not be disappointed. Asif is a top-notch, world-class stylist who genuinely cares about your vision and surprises you with a beautiful cut/color every time!  HE IS TRULY THE BEST!

0.description: This was my second appointment with Erica and she was absolutely wonderful! She's easy to talk to and very patient with my long hair. My hair is so beautifully layered now. All the support staff in Kala are super nice as well. Highly recommend this place!

38.description: This is the place to be...Asif and everyone working there are super friendly and do an amazing job.

51.description: After moving from San Diego, CA where I had the same stylist for about 10 years, the anxiety settled in about finding a new stylist when I moved to Chicago.  All of my friends know how important my hair is to me.  The first thing they said was..."what are you going to do about your hair in CHI?!" Luckily I happened to get introduced to my stylist Brittany Autery while having dinner in the city with my family.  I actually asked the waitress where she got her hair done (noticing she had really nice light highlights on a dark base) and she told me her friend that works at the restaurant does hair.  I asked for the intro to Brittany and so happy that I did.  I followed Brittany from a previous salon and I would follow her wherever she goes.  I travel from Schaumburg to Kala Salon just to see her which is about an hour drive when the traffic is bad (which is all the time...lol).  I LOVE³ her work and I would not trust anyone else with my hair.  I have major OCD when it comes to anyone working on my hair and I am very picky with my stylists.  I have natural black thick Asian hair (stubborn of course) that has been bleached blonde for as long as I can remember.  I go as blonde as I can go all year round which is not easy with super black roots like I have.  Brittany is such an amazing and talented stylist.  She does beautiful highlights and cuts, not to mention her flawless styling.  Just by the particular way she laid the foils in my hair, I knew I was in good hands.  Brittany also cuts my Mom's hair and my daughter's hair as well.   She brought my daughter's hair back to its normal state (less layering) since my daughter didn't need a high maintenance cut which she got from a previous stylist.  If you are looking for a stylist that really caters to your OCD needs (like mine), takes the time to really listen to your hair issues you may have, or if you simply have no idea on what you want to do....Brittany Autery is your stylist!  I will be so sad when I have to move back to SD in a few years after my Hubby retires from the Navy.  My mom said.."you better ask Brittany to come with you!!"  (in her Filipina Mom voice) LOL!  =D

27.description: Yesterday I got a perm and an impromptu haircut with Britney. A perm? Yes. I didn't really know what to expect once we took the rollers out, but once we did, I suddenly wanted a bob, and Britney worked it right out. She is very intuitive and flexible. I mean, she made that haircut happen fast, and it's a good haircut. Also, she was very non-judgemental about all of my bad kitchen beautician tendencies. I will definitely be going back to her, and over-tipping because I think I may have under tipped this time. (Too hungry to do math). Everyone else there was very friendly as well, so the atmosphere is very pleasant.

32.description: Over the past year, I have been to the salon numerous times and I have never been disappointed. The salon has a chic yet cozy atmosphere. The Davines' products are amazing and I've converted all of my hair products over because they are that good. Lindsey V is a total pro and my hair always turns out great, whether I go in for a color, cut or blowout. She's the first hairstylist I've ever had that I completely trust to do whatever she wants with my hair. I will definitely be back. :)

54.description: Went back again...was about that time.  Called to make an appointment and got right in.  The receptionist was really nice, she even called the day before to remind me of my appointment.Lindsey did my color which turned out exactly the way I wanted it (AGAIN!).  She is a doll.Erica did my toner and gave me the BEST shampoo.  Everyone is that place is just so nice.  A pleasure going there.  Ill be back!

48.description: I've been seeing Asif for nearly 3 years now, and I couldn't be happier. Number one, he is just amazingly talented. Cut, color, style and all kinds of trreatments - he has done wonders for my hair. I get compliments on my hair pretty frequently, and the credit goes to Asif. I do cuts and colors most frequently, with keratin treatments here and there. I love what the keratin does for my ends and how fast it grows, but I didn't love how flat and difficult to style it became after my first treatment. It was soft, silky and shiny, but I still wanted some body. Asif worked with me to cusomize a keratin treatment, leaving some room between my roots and where the treatment was applied, to achieve the same silky and smooth texture but with more stylability. The whole staff at Kala is wonderful and always considerate, offering whatever you need - coffee, water, cappuccino or champs. What's not to love about this place?I've recommended to several friends, and my boyfriend has now become a regular too. Highly recommend the salon to anyone looking for anything from basic cut or blow out to color, treatment and style.

44.description: What a great experience. I made an appointment with Lindsey to do the big chop on my hair and fix my color. Not only did she make sure to really get a feel for the style I was going for, but she made it happen. She knew exactly what my hair needed and where to take excess hair out and where to fix my ombre, what fit my face shape, etc. Everyone at the salon was super friendly and you could tell they all knew what they were doing. The salon's ambiance is great, too. Super happy with the outcome. I'll definitely be coming back. Thanks Linz, I should have came to you years ago!

24.description: I had an appointment with Brittany for a digital perm, and let me tell you, that girl is THE best. I'm from NYC and have lived in Chicago for a year and a half now and would schedule appointments with my regular salon every time I flew home. I'm incredibly particular about who cuts my hair, what I want, and what I'm looking for in a stylist. I have an insane amount of hair - take whatever you have on your head, and times it by ten - my ponytail is like a horse's tail, so when it comes to cutting my hair, it's a serious workout for a stylist and really time consuming, so I like getting to know who's cutting my hair, getting to know them, and letting them know my concerns before we get started, because I've had some nightmare haircuts before from stylists who didn't know what they were doing. Brittany not only brought it, but was so knowledgable in her field (she is the perm/keratin QUEEN), kind, and made me feel SO comfortable (which most stylists do not do). She listened to my entire shpiel, asked me questions, and then laid it out for me - what kind of hair digital perms are for (they're actually for people with straight hair), what another perm would do for me, and how a keratin treatment would improve my hair health, shine, and frizz (especially since the warm weather is approaching). This was ALL before we even got started. Brittany took her time on EVERYTHING, stayed late after closing hours to make sure my haircut was perfect after the keratin was done, and was an amazing stylist. I was looking to cut my hair primping time in half - since I have a lot of hair, it can take me over an hour to do my hair everyday before work. So Brittany suggested the keratin treatment, because it takes all the time I spend blow drying, out of the equation, and I can still curl and style my hair when the keratin loosens up. It hasn't been 24 hours yet and my entire office has told me how amazing my hair looks. Kala salon was recommended to me by another salon, after I had a consultation with them and scheduled an appointment, they called me a week later to tell me they didn't feel comfortable performing my perm, but told me to call Kala, because they are the best. And to be honest, they 100% are. I trust Brittany 100% and am SOOO happy I found her. Kala is a little pricey, but if you're like me, and don't skimp on your hair, then you'll find the money for this. And bring extra cash for a tip if you're booking with Brittany. Because after you meet her, and once you see your hair when she's done, you're going to want to give her SOO much more than what you brought. I couldn't be happier with my hair.

7.description: I've lived in Chicago for 4 years and Alyssa Hronec is the only hair stylist that I've felt comfortable and confident going to more than twice. My hair has issues and Alyssa is the only person capable of not only taming the wacky beast, but ensuring that it looks more than respectable between cuts. As long as I am in the city, she has my business!

49.description: I am in town from Detroit for a wine tasting and wanted a blow out. I looked up places close to the Swissotel and Kala popped up. The staff was professional and to the point. Victor was very pleasant and fun to talk to as well as an awesome stylist. Would absolutely return when I'm back in Chicago and need my hair done.

40.description: Since moving into the area I've been looking around for a new salon/stylist to go to for regular cuts. After some research and yelp reviewing, I went to Kala. Saw Erica and she's my new girl! I'm very picky when it comes to a good/bad cut and she did a great job! I'm very happy!Plus, they serve champaign while you are getting pampered. Sweet!

53.description: Asif is an amazing artist!  My hair looks absolutely perfect every time I go in for a cut, and lasts for months afterwards... Honestly, I have a short edgy cut, and I get stopped multiple times a day with people complimenting me on my hair!!!  It's been over 2 months since my last cut/color, and I was stopped 2x by friends asking if I just got it cut.If you are looking for someone who will do an amazing job on short hair - this is it.  SO happy I was referred here....

30.description: I am thrilled to have found this place!! Asif, was wonderful.After having a crappy job done a few months ago. I was extremely nervous to go to a new stylist. I sat down and went over my concerns with Asif. He listened and made some great suggestions. My layers are beautiful. I finally have that wavy layered cut I've been dying to have.

46.description: I had a great experience at Kala Salon. I had seen it near my building and decided to give it a try. I called at 3:30 to make an appointment, and they were able to get me in that day, which was fantastic. When I arrived, the receptionist, I don't know her name, was really friendly and took my coat and offered me a glass of water. Then I met my stylist, Victor who consulted with me and listened to all my requests. Then he gave me an amazing hair wash! I have a sensitive scalp and tend to be very uncomfortable  when I have my hair washed, but Victor was great! After a long day of work, I almost fell asleep in the chair! He was an expert blow out stylist at well; very skilled with a round brush and blow dryer. In the end, I left with a great cut and completely satisfied with the experience. I will definitely be back!

1.description: My hair was very damaged walking into the salon. Asif immediately assessed what needed to be done today and moving forward. He kindly taught me exactly how I should be treating my hair (in most salons I typically feel berated with information, but Asif was very genuine and helpful).I came in for a simple color and cut, but what I got was much more than that. Asif walked me through all of my color options and consulted me on what would look best. He was very knowledgable, which was great since this was my first time coloring my hair. After coloring and cutting my hair, he took the time to blow dry and flat iron. To top it off, it was a lovely space and very cool atmosphere. My hair now is a complete 360. It looks amazing and I am so excited to take Asif's tips moving forward.I will recommend this salon to all of my family and friends.

55.description: I have to admit that my hair is not the easiest to cut and that I am quite picky about my hair. I have the thick and stiff Asian hair that likes to rebel against stylists. I couldn't find a place that "got" my hair and what I wanted.And then I met Lindsey at Kala. After a brief conversation and showing her a few pictures of what I had in mind, she just "got" what I wanted and what would work for me. I finally was able to get a haircut that was easy to manage and style, without looking like a bowl or Elvis.Lindsey is very easy to get along and she is a pleasure to work with. She is very genuine and friendly, definitely not the fake annoying type which I hate (there are a few out there). I would strongly recommend her.

9.description: As the legendary Joan Crawford once said, "I think that the most important thing a woman can have -- next to talent, of course -- is her hairdresser."  Ladies and gentlemen, you will find that important thing at Kala Salon.Extraordinary, magical, gifted...these are a few words that describe the incredibly talented Asif Rajan.  Asif has worked with celebrity hair and has studied the art of hair in many cities across the globe in order to master his craft.  I genuinely look forward to an appointment with him every single time, even if it's after a dreadful 11 months without getting a haircut, but Asif is cool and never makes you feel bad about your hair choices (more like mistakes).  Naturally, I was super excited to hear about Asif's new venture, Kala Salon, and couldn't wait to book my appointment!I first saw Asif more than 4 years ago while he was at Fuga, and was so amazed by not just the haircut, but the entire experience. Asif looked at my hair, addressed all issues I had, and asked me what I wanted. I've never met a hairstylist who listens and actually does what you want with your hair, without ever pushing you into doing what's out of your comfort zone. He knows exactly what length, cut, and color will work for you and your lifestyle, and will recommend quick and easy ways to keep your hair looking fabulous well after your appointment.  Your hair will be cut so brilliantly that it continues to look amazing even as it grows, even for months after the cut. I have never left Kala Salon without feeling like a million bucks!Over the past 4 years, I've received several compliments on my hair, and I couldn't be happier to recommend Asif and Kala Salon. Trust me, go to Kala and you will not be disappointed. Asif is a top-notch, world-class stylist who genuinely cares about your vision and surprises you with a beautiful cut/color every time!  HE IS TRULY THE BEST!

26.description: My first time coming to kala salon, very comfortable & very friendly people, needless to say I wasn't disappointed. I'm very careful in whole I let touch my hair. I didn't want to end up having my hair burned (have heard a few stories) any who, Alyssa (hairdresser), first off I'd like to say, she has an awesome personality..she did just wonderful! I don't have enough fingers to count how many compliments I got in just one day. Victor (super adorable) & I believe her name was Erica (she has awesome hair)? Also helped for a bit they were awesome, felt like I was getting the royal treatment; it was great. I will definitely be coming back next time I need something done..they also do waxing now so perhaps I'll give that a try as well. I highly recommend Alyssa & of course victor & Erica as well.

25.description: I just left my haircut and I can't wait to go back. The entire staff is terrific, professional and friendly. Asif is incredibly talented and extremely knowledgeable about the products and technology needed to achieve the look you're going for. Hands down the best cut and color I have ever had, and their hair products are top of the line. After one appointment I can already say I won't be going anywhere else!

12.description: I missed an appointment because I was stuck in traffic. Next attempt to get a haircut, I had a terrible day at work that ended in me crying. I debated canceling again, but thought that was a jerk move to cancel yet another appointment with little notice. So, I decided to just go through with an awkward appointment, while I looked like a puffy, red mess. I have to say that Victor and the receptionist that day (didn't catch her name) were two of the nicest people. Victor does great work on my wavy hair every time. In our small talk, he went with me being tired that day.. and I'm thankful.

59.description: I followed Jaime from his previous salon. He always gives me a great cut and knows how to work with my hair. I love the location of Kala, and the staff are very friendly. After your hair appointment make sure to have plans for a night out on the town because you will want to take advantage how beautiful your hair will look.

21.description: This salon is very fresh and clean with a great vibe and atmosphere.  I made a same day appointment with Victor for a hair cut.  It's always hard to trust someone new with my hair, but he did a fantastic job.  I have long hair and he updated my layers and  gave my hair life again.  Definitely recommend.

17.description: I had an appointment with Brittany for a digital perm, and let me tell you, that girl is THE best. I'm from NYC and have lived in Chicago for a year and a half now and would schedule appointments with my regular salon every time I flew home. I'm incredibly particular about who cuts my hair, what I want, and what I'm looking for in a stylist. I have an insane amount of hair - take whatever you have on your head, and times it by ten - my ponytail is like a horse's tail, so when it comes to cutting my hair, it's a serious workout for a stylist and really time consuming, so I like getting to know who's cutting my hair, getting to know them, and letting them know my concerns before we get started, because I've had some nightmare haircuts before from stylists who didn't know what they were doing. Brittany not only brought it, but was so knowledgable in her field (she is the perm/keratin QUEEN), kind, and made me feel SO comfortable (which most stylists do not do). She listened to my entire shpiel, asked me questions, and then laid it out for me - what kind of hair digital perms are for (they're actually for people with straight hair), what another perm would do for me, and how a keratin treatment would improve my hair health, shine, and frizz (especially since the warm weather is approaching). This was ALL before we even got started. Brittany took her time on EVERYTHING, stayed late after closing hours to make sure my haircut was perfect after the keratin was done, and was an amazing stylist. I was looking to cut my hair primping time in half - since I have a lot of hair, it can take me over an hour to do my hair everyday before work. So Brittany suggested the keratin treatment, because it takes all the time I spend blow drying, out of the equation, and I can still curl and style my hair when the keratin loosens up. It hasn't been 24 hours yet and my entire office has told me how amazing my hair looks. Kala salon was recommended to me by another salon, after I had a consultation with them and scheduled an appointment, they called me a week later to tell me they didn't feel comfortable performing my perm, but told me to call Kala, because they are the best. And to be honest, they 100% are. I trust Brittany 100% and am SOOO happy I found her. Kala is a little pricey, but if you're like me, and don't skimp on your hair, then you'll find the money for this. And bring extra cash for a tip if you're booking with Brittany. Because after you meet her, and once you see your hair when she's done, you're going to want to give her SOO much more than what you brought. I couldn't be happier with my hair.

10.description: YES. Everything yes. I could not recommend this salon higher. Best salon experience I've ever had. Met with Victor for cut and color - he is both incredibly talented and incredibly effective with people. IF GETTING YOUR HAIR DONE STRESSES YOU OUT, BOOK VICTOR. First: Beautiful color! I booked highlights but when Victor saw that I wait a while between visits (see below), he recommended balayage because it grows out prettier. And then he did an absolutely beautiful job. (I've had balayage before; Victor puts an utterly unfathomable amount of attention and TLC into his.) He cares for and really takes care of you. Second: "chairside manner." Not everyone has the same idea of "relaxation" and for some of us, going to the salon isn't enjoyable because it's usually an extroverted experience - hours of small talk even though there's nothing about the service that necessitates it. For us, getting our hair done is usually something we dread, and paying that much money to feel like we're "working" or even stressed out isn't enjoyable. Victor is incredibly refreshing in this regard - we chatted a bit, but then he immediately recognized that my idea of "relaxation" included some silence, too, and I was free to really unwind and let my mind wander. 10/10 would Victor againAlso? Sparkling wine, guys.

5.description: LOVED my haircut, loved the ambiance of this place. I booked an appointment with Victor after seeing a few Yelpers recommend him and I couldn't have been happier. I usually have no idea what I want done with my hair, but I always tell my stylist that I am a low-maintenance kinda girl (aka I can't blow dry, curl or even brush it for sh*t) and I give them a ballpark length to go by. Victor explained everything to me and assured me my new style would be easy to deal with. The process was quick and fun! I do think it's funny these days that you are handed off to multiple people during the haircut - one person washes, then the stylist cuts, and most times another person dries and styles your hair. I'm not sure that I particularly like that, but I understand why it has to happen to keep things moving in the salon.All in all, love Kala Salon, love Victor, love everyone that works there that I came in contact with. The rest of Chi-town seems to agree. I'll be back!

3.description: I really don't like to rate hair salons/stylists but this was just awful. I booked a full highlight with a stylist to remain anonymous. I showed her the picture on the left and she said "well that's balayage." I said if you have time let's do it. She said not a problem and proceeded to show me a picture of a recent client. I said great, as long as I'm lighter & brighter/less yellowy and most importantly I want a lot of dimension throughout. I'm not sure if I just didn't hear her or if she did not tell me everything, but I did not get balayage and I did not get highlights. Instead she made my roots MUCH darker and basically extended my roots by 3-4 inches and then toned the bottom. I was horrified and when I checked out she said "Since we didn't balayage today, it's only $X." WHY DID WE NOT BALAYAGE?! I came out with much darker hair, absolutely no dimension, and definitely no highlights. I was able to get into another salon almost immediately to semi-fix it, but will have to go in again in 3 weeks. Had to spend $200 at the other salon, so let's just say this was the worst expensive color I've ever gotten. So very disappointed.

35.description: I had to write a review for this salon specifically for Erika, a senior stylist there. Let me first state that I have TURBO Curly and Thick hair, I have been to many salons before, and I simply accepted the fact that because I have curly hair any hair cut will do, because my curls will hide the imperfections. I NEVER let the stylist blow dry my hair, because I would literally come out with a giant poof....until Erika came into my life. The angles came down and the light finally shined down on me. Erika can color, cut, and blow dry ANY TYPE of hair. She is truly a wizard, and a master in her profession. I grew up in Africa and Europe so I am accustomed to a European way of blow drying hair (Le Brushing) and Erika executes that marvelously. Whenever I go to the salon I always get a balayage, and let me tell you that Erika does wonders with color she is a true artist. I cannot speak highly enough of her, she is kind, enthusiastic, and she truly loves her job, which means she will give her everything, every time you go see her. If you are like me and feel like getting your hair done is just like brushing your teeth, go to Kala Salon and book an appointment with Erika, I promise you will feel like a movie star after she is done. Thank you Erika for all that you do!PS: I give you 7 stars Erika

19.description: I had a great experience at Kala Salon. I had seen it near my building and decided to give it a try. I called at 3:30 to make an appointment, and they were able to get me in that day, which was fantastic. When I arrived, the receptionist, I don't know her name, was really friendly and took my coat and offered me a glass of water. Then I met my stylist, Victor who consulted with me and listened to all my requests. Then he gave me an amazing hair wash! I have a sensitive scalp and tend to be very uncomfortable  when I have my hair washed, but Victor was great! After a long day of work, I almost fell asleep in the chair! He was an expert blow out stylist at well; very skilled with a round brush and blow dryer. In the end, I left with a great cut and completely satisfied with the experience. I will definitely be back!

28.description: I missed an appointment because I was stuck in traffic. Next attempt to get a haircut, I had a terrible day at work that ended in me crying. I debated canceling again, but thought that was a jerk move to cancel yet another appointment with little notice. So, I decided to just go through with an awkward appointment, while I looked like a puffy, red mess. I have to say that Victor and the receptionist that day (didn't catch her name) were two of the nicest people. Victor does great work on my wavy hair every time. In our small talk, he went with me being tired that day.. and I'm thankful.

45.description: It's now 4 months later and my perm looks amazing still. It even survived a trip through SEAsia. I'm still as lazy as ever - all I do is wash it, put some spray gel in and twirl it around my fingers. It makes big bouncy curls. I still get all these comments about it. My husband and I both agree - best money spent on a salon service EVER.

33.description: I went to Kala salon with 2 of my friends, we all walked out of the salon extremely happy. Erica, Victor and Britney were all awesome hair stylists. Please go there, you won't regret it!

43.description: I went to Kala for the 1st time today. The friendly and uber cool vibe of the salon was a treat. Brittany was my stylist.  She was fantastic and immediately put me at ease. From the time I sat down to the time I left she was 100% focused on my hair and it definitely showed in the end result. I was a bit apprehensive to have highlights, lowlights and a cut done somewhere I've never been but will now be a happy repeat client. Thanks Brittany GREAT JOB!

2.description: I could not rate Kala or Brittany more highly. I found the salon on Yelp after my preferred stylist left my old salon. Brittany is absolutely brilliant at what she does - I have had several cuts, plus a balayage and a regular color with her and have loved everything she has done with my hair. Brittany always listens to what I want, but I also feel like she wouldn't do anything that wouldn't suit me. I completely trust her with my hair.The salon itself has a really good atmosphere and it's a relaxing environment. I'm so happy that I found this place and someone as professional and friendly as Brittany is.

18.description: Just had my first cut with Asif, amazing! I've found my place.  He is so knowledgeable and really listened to what I wanted. He turned my jumbled description into a beautiful and stylish cut.  I have really thick long hair but he made it feel so flowy and light. Gem of a salon!

41.description: Erica is absolutely the BEST! I moved to Milwaukee, WI a year and a half ago and have had one disappointing stylist after another. I came to Chicago on business and had some time to kill and found Kala Salon on Yelp. I called and as luck would have it, Erica could see me. I have thick hair, that has somewhat of a wave. She gave me the most amazing haircut I've had. Now, I will commute to Chicago just to see Erica. She is extremely talented and definitely knows what she is doing!! Kala is a great salon, always playing good tunes and offers awesome products ie Davines "All In One Milk"

52.description: I had an AMAZING experience! Out of the 3 years living in Chicago and trial and error at various salons I have finally found THE ONE! Erica was amazing, she was very nice and completely understood what I wanted. I originally scheduled a color application only but she was also able to fit me in for a haircut that same day! I loved my hair color, hair cut and blow dry. They have great products and the salon has a nice vibe to it. I will definitely be returning to fulfill my hair needs!

50.description: I am INCREDIBLY picky when it comes to someone touching my hair - coloring, styling and especially cutting. My hair grows really slow so getting a "bad haircut" gives me tons of anxiety! I was visiting the Chicago area for the long weekend and looked on Yelp for good salons. I decided on Kala Salon and I am so happy that I did!Brittany gave me an amazing cut! My hair is semi-damaged from extensions, straightening and coloring. However, I left Brittany's chair with my hair feeling healthy, looking shiny and feeling great! I hate when hair dressers do what they want with your hair, despite you telling them what you want. I showed Brittany some pictures of the style I wanted and she gave me exactly that!!! Brittany was friendly and personable - but not overly intrusive like hair dressers have the image of being. She also is very knowledgable and tells you, as her client, little tips and products she would recommend that won't break your budget. The salon is cute, comfortable and in a good location - very modern feel. Everyone there was friendly and professional. I would recommend Brittany to ANYONE! In fact, I'm wondering how I can travel from Michigan to Chicago every 8 weeks to see Brittany for a trim!

4.description: Hala for Kala!Found this place via yelp while I'm on the hunt for a new person to style my hair.LIKES1. I love the space.  It's underground.  It has a nice vibe between homey and upscale.2.  I love online booking...yes please!3.  I absolutely love Davines products!  I did not know they had them.4.  Britney did a pretty good job on my hair.  I absolutely loved the color.  She was easy to talk to and initially I thought...sweet!...I found my girl...alas below is a couple of things I can't get over.5.  For my first time, she had the assistant give me a free blow dry.6.  They offer coffee, tea, water, & champs.DISLIKES1.  A blow dry does not come with color???  HUH???  Whhaaa???  They'll give a 'rough' blow dry....but not a full one.  I find this very obnoxious.  If you want your head fully dry, you'll have to pay an extra $35...unless you get a cut...then it's included???  And I did have the assistant blow dry, but it wasn't some fantastic blow dry....2.  full highlight.  It ended up costing me $160.  Yes, I have long hair that is fine and I love it bright blond....but that still seems high for basically a no name salon in River West and not to mention if I wanted a blow out it would be $195.  Who knows how much it would be with a cut.  Eeeeek!I still am totally shocked that a blow dry doesn't come with color at the prices they are charging...it's almost more expensive than my last high end salon in Gold Coast!  I cannot get over it.  I am going to explore other salons in the hood and see if I can find something that I absolutely love.  Don't get me wrong, kala was good...I just don't think it's for me.

6.description: Picked this Salon for my first ever keratin straightening treatment because I heard phenomenal things about Brittany. I was apprehensive about it before the appointment but I loved it! Everyone is extremely nice and accommodating. Brittany made the whole experience relaxing and walked me through each step. And obviously, the results were amazing. I got it done back in October and just now getting curls again in January (and hair isn't frizzy). I've never had a consistent salon or stylist before and hadn't touched my hair 'professionally' in years due to bad experiences with salons, but I'm now getting my regular cuts here with Brittany. I'm actually overdue and waiting because it's on the pricier side but I'm starting to really invest in my hair! Also, a quick FIY: tips here are cash only!

22.description: I went to Kala Salon for the first time a few days ago and I LOVE my haircut. Alyssa did such a great job. It had been while since my last cut and I wasn't exactly sure what I wanted to do, but she offered great suggestions and talked me through what she was doing and I am so happy with how it turned out. Highly recommended!! Also, everyone was really friendly and there was a lot of free street parking available when I went at 7:00.

15.description: My first time coming to kala salon, very comfortable & very friendly people, needless to say I wasn't disappointed. I'm very careful in whole I let touch my hair. I didn't want to end up having my hair burned (have heard a few stories) any who, Alyssa (hairdresser), first off I'd like to say, she has an awesome personality..she did just wonderful! I don't have enough fingers to count how many compliments I got in just one day. Victor (super adorable) & I believe her name was Erica (she has awesome hair)? Also helped for a bit they were awesome, felt like I was getting the royal treatment; it was great. I will definitely be coming back next time I need something done..they also do waxing now so perhaps I'll give that a try as well. I highly recommend Alyssa & of course victor & Erica as well.

57.description: Walked in here after having never been to another salon/stylist EVER since I've had my very first cut as a kid, and felt comfortable the second I sat in Lindsey's chair. She's a colorist master!

20.description: I LOVE Kala Salon! I had an appointment today with Victor for a balayage/ombre color and haircut and he did the most amazing job. He listened to what I wanted and looked through so many pictures of hair colors I liked... Such a sweetheart.  He truly is an artist. I've also gotten my hair done with Asif and he is wonderful as well. Very talented and experienced, I trust him to do anything he thinks would look good. This place is definitely worth every penny and I'll never get my hair done anywhere else.

36.description: In dire need of a haircut while traveling on my business, I was fortunate enough to find this little hair salon in Chicago. There are many things I like about this place and it definitely lives up to its reviews on Yelp, with almost every customer giving it 5 stars. My hairdresser was Erica and I was thoroughly impressed by her haircutting skills. It's not always easy for me to find a hairdresser who is knowledgeable with Asian hair and how to properly cut it. I've had enough bad experiences walking out of the hair salon to know. However, Erica was very experienced and knowledgeable as to what she should do about my hair, how to cut it so that it fits well with the shape of my face. The entire experience was wonderful and she listens very attentively to your requests while giving you her expertise. I booked this place via their website and you can basically book your appointment and see which stylist is available during that time so you could pre-select the hair stylist of your preference.

14.description: I got a perm from Brittany about four months ago and I'm still LOVING it!  She did a wonderful job and I get compliments on my hair now all the time, people are surprised when I tell them it's a perm and that my hair used to be straight.  My hair smelled bad for about four weeks after the initial perm, that was the only downside, but totally worth it for how easy it is to style now and I don't think my hair was damaged at all from what I can tell.  Would highly recommend.  Thanks again Brittany!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Coloring, Kids' Hair

1.description: I stopped in here for a cold drink while exploring the neighborhood. They were out of the main ingredient for my drink, but assured it would taste the same. A lot of items were blacked out on the menu as well. I wasn't eating there, but good to know I could get a roll of dirty quarters from the bakery case! Service was fast, but so fast that the cashier didn't give me correct change. I paid cash and she started taking another order in the middle of the transaction. She put my money back in the drawer because she was distracted! Good thing the register shows how much change is due. I had to wait for her to ring up a few more people so she could redo my transaction which was annoying. I wasn't asking for anything out of the ordinary, just my money she never gave me!

9.description: Really want to drop a star since I tried the red velvet cupcake. It is beautiful but tastes super bland. Very disappointing.

23.description: I know it's lame to review a massive chain like Starbucks, but I, like G.R., think the employees of this particular Starbucks deserve a shout-out.  This Starbucks is practically right next door to my building, and while I try to not spend money on coffee at all (or support my local roasters like Metropolis) I do find myself with an excess of SB cards after holidays. The staff here is quick, cheerful, and always friendly.  One time last year I went back in after somehow dumping my $4 frappuccino on the ground, and they gave me a free replacement without even seeing the evidence (which was actually on the floor outside of my elevator). I've worked this kind of job before, and the kind of friendly service they give me is rare.  You know, Starbucks is Starbucks- but the people really make a difference.

12.description: Allow me to set the scene and you will understand my gripe:6:30pm on a Friday night.  Chairs are up on the tables and lights seem low.  The employees inside can be seen as they are removing all the food from the display cases and washing the floor surrounding the counter.  Seems closed.  But... it's not.   The sign said it closed at 10pm.  I was beyond confused but seeing as a friend and I were meeting there and it was freezing outside, I pulled on the door and sure enough, it was open.  Upon getting inside, nobody greeted me, despite having turned around to watch me walk in the door.  I felt like I was interrupting their quick getaway.  Like they were thinking "Shit!  Someone came in and now we can't close early" Ultimately, I got my order and found a seat in one of the cozy armchairs near the windows.  Tucked in a few corners, I noted some other patrons on their laptops.  As I sipped my drink and waited for my friend, I watched the crew continue to prepare for closing... over three hours early.

21.description: I don't really drink a lot of coffee and I'm certainly not partial to any type of coffee or coffee chain. However, I love my chai/iced chai and this place makes the best of both I've ever had. It's great every time! Makes me wonder what other places are doing to screw it up. The employees are super nice. I think I've only actually waited in line once - there may be a line but they will keep taking orders and next thing you know you're out the door!

16.description: What can one say about a store that is part of an international chain? No big surprises or disappointments here. The partners here are fine; no one that makes me go to see my favorite barista, but no one off-putting either. The parking is atrocious (in Chicago?!? Nooooo way!) and this location is usually extremely busy in the morning. While a bit impersonal, they will,get you in and out fast. So really, nothing substantially amazing or horrible about another corporate drone store. If you want more of a cozy, quiet, chill atmosphere with a great couch and reading selection, go across the street to Sip.

17.description: Spacious!  Plenty of outlets and parking lot.  Proximity to bars like Twisted Spoke are a bonus!  Sunday's people traffic is mild.  Great for students.

10.description: The STAFF are pretty awesome people, they are very friendly. Parking lot is small but after bank business hours you can park on their side. They have a pretty patio, overall great location.

5.description: I go to this Starbucks sometimes to do work  and haven't had a negative experience until today.  New guy working the register was very sweet but the blonde girl with glasses was very negative and rude for no reason, dissatisfied with Starbucks' customer service today.

11.description: Love this one.  The employees are great and  that make a difference!

22.description: Lots of corporate tools in here at rush hour that should be taken out and beaten, and the parking lot is the apotheosis of self important buttnobblers, but the staff can knock out a 20 person line like that, and there is a nice outdoor space for enjoying the industrial traffic on Ogden.

0.description: I know it's lame to review a massive chain like Starbucks, but I, like G.R., think the employees of this particular Starbucks deserve a shout-out.  This Starbucks is practically right next door to my building, and while I try to not spend money on coffee at all (or support my local roasters like Metropolis) I do find myself with an excess of SB cards after holidays. The staff here is quick, cheerful, and always friendly.  One time last year I went back in after somehow dumping my $4 frappuccino on the ground, and they gave me a free replacement without even seeing the evidence (which was actually on the floor outside of my elevator). I've worked this kind of job before, and the kind of friendly service they give me is rare.  You know, Starbucks is Starbucks- but the people really make a difference.

20.description: I've always been happy to make a stop here for an evening beverage.  Some of my favorite baristas, including a lawyer and a gal that lived in Asia, have moved on, but there are still a number of talented conversationalists that serve up a dependable beverage.  It is directly across the street from the Twisted Spoke, so I am not sure that Mario R. ever actually went to this location. (Grand and Ogden...in Chicago)Parking is a bonus, but isn't quite so prevalent during the morning and lunchtime rush.

19.description: Love, love, love this Starbucks location! The baristas always remember my order, they are super nice and fast.

2.description: The Grand and Ogden location is one of the best. The parking lot does get tight at times since its shared parking with other store fronts and a bank. The service has always been friendly and they are always willing to please on any drink or food order. The location is not far from some great neighborhood restaurants and bars along Grand Ave . It's my go to weekend coffee location! They also have a nice outside patio off to the side which is a bonus!

18.description: Great location, the staff really does a good job of keeping the line moving.  I go about once a week.  The only downside is PARKING.......I usually have to do it illegally. But in this neighborhood, not any other good coffee options.

13.description: One of the best Starbucks in the city! Employees are super friendly (and cute!) and they make the drinks fast, even when it's busy.

4.description: The "baristas"/employees were horrible: lacked knowledge of the register; had to triple check orders in the midst of pouring drinks for numerous customers; stated lowering music without doing so; asked customers to move while they swept during operating hours; after asking several times to lower music, turned music down, and began grinding beans for tomorrow...The drink was norm but slightly cooler than sanitary temperature according to corporate's standard. Something I look for when the "baristas" seem to have less than average work ethic.

24.description: Okay, I know a lot of people aren't  Starbucks fans. However, I'm a fan of the people here. A friendly group that will remember your name and what you drink if you're a regular.Most people here have worked at this location for a while, so you don't have that big cooperate feeling.  The coffee and food items, are definitely Starbucks, same here as the other stores.It's the people at this location that make it what it is. Just outstanding.Thanks guys!

6.description: Had two drinks here last night.  No line, no wait, but for some reason the barista rushed through it and drinks were horrible.

15.description: I've always been happy to make a stop here for an evening beverage.  Some of my favorite baristas, including a lawyer and a gal that lived in Asia, have moved on, but there are still a number of talented conversationalists that serve up a dependable beverage.  It is directly across the street from the Twisted Spoke, so I am not sure that Mario R. ever actually went to this location. (Grand and Ogden...in Chicago)Parking is a bonus, but isn't quite so prevalent during the morning and lunchtime rush.

7.description: I don't like this location. The parking is terrible and if you order a drink they don't put a sleeve on it for you. I have to do it myself! I guess my normal location in Hyde Park spoils me!

8.description: Parking is tight & usually full. The staff is friendly & the wi-fi is great. I love their passion teas in the summer & chai lattes in the fall/winter!

3.description: I have never been so disappointed at a Starbucks in my life. The employee acted as if I was trying to steal a tumbler off the shelf. I was simply informing her that there was no price on the bottom, and was trying to purchase it. The lackluster enthusiasm with which she tried to find the price made me never want to come here again.

14.description: Such a great location -- great staff, nice ambiance (somehow feels more homely than a traditional Starbucks), speedy service.  PARKING IS SUCH A PAIN THOUGH! I would probably frequent this Starbucks if I lived closer, but even driving by, I think twice about whether or not my coffee is worth the parking hassle.  Regardless, I've enjoyed the times I have stopped by.

3.description: Today I had a massage from Amy. All I can say is Fantastic! My shoulder had been bothering me, but after my time with her, it's 100% better. This is what I'm after when it comes to bodywork. I'll be back back for sure.

1.description: Amy was my masseuse and she was amazing. She really worked on all the knots in my arms and back but also knew when it was getting to be too much. This will be my go-to massage place from now on. I definitely recommend.

2.description: Today I got a Thai aroma session on the mat with Amy. OMG!!! I'm on the verge of becoming a  massage addict. It's funny that I've tried massage everwhere but this little place is the best!!! I completely understand the meaning of real Thai bodywork! I recommend that you try Amy.

9.description: Just got my first Thai massage with Nida. So pleasantly surprised! I didn't know what expect and it's definitely not your traditional massage at the spa but I went in with a migraine and came out feeling great! They work and stretch every muscle. It was amazing and I will definitely be back. Nida was great so recommend her as well. The prices are also very reasonable so that's an added bonus. I'll definitely be back!

10.description: Authentic Thai technique that the masseuse was happy to explain to me.Best massage I ever had, and the current prices are hard to beat.Will definitely be back.

4.description: Had a Thai massage w Nida - best massage of my life.... And I've had lots of them. I was a little hesitant about the traditional Thai massage with stretching involved but sooo glad I did it. My whole body feels amazing. She's very sweet and was very considerate asking me about weather pressure was enough or too much and I really liked that too. I didn't even have to tell he's where I was tight - she immediately found all the right places. I will definitely be back on a regular basis - such an amazing experience.

6.description: My wife and I were in Chicago for a couple of months performing with a touring production. We came in and saw Melody and Amy basically once a week to "reset" the muscles. So glad we found this place! Will return whenever we are in the city.

12.description: A very, very good thai massage.  The place is spotless and a nice atmosphere with good prices. Melody did a great job at getting all of the knots in the my shoulders out too.  I actually had to tell her to lighten up on the pressure (which almost never happens). I'll be back.

5.description: My boyfriend and I each had a great Thai Bodywork session here last Saturday. My only complaint is that I made an appointment for 2 people at the same time, but was told upon arrival that they only have one bodywork room and so we would have to have back-to-back sessions. Luckily we live close by and this didn't cause too much of a hassle for us, but others in the same situation would be stuck spending an hour waiting for the other person in their party to have their bodywork session.That being said, the session itself was excellent. I will definitely come back for another session, because we both felt like a million bucks afterward!

11.description: Excellent massage and super clean place. Shower before and after massage included. Super nice staff.

8.description: I just got a massage from Nida and it was great! I'm Thai so I know what is good or not. Try her

0.description: A great massage. Table or mat. I've never been disappointed in the year I've been going. Neda, Melody, both great. Take the shower and steam. You'll leave transformed.

7.description: Best Thai Massage ever. My wife & I are Thai massage enthusiasts. We have had Thai massages in San Francisco, NYC etc... Princess Spa was by far the best for both of us. The massage was amazing and you can't beat the price.

12.description: Dear B&L... I love you.

7.description: Just checked this place out today and it does not live up to the hype. Don't get me wrong,  some of their meats looked good, but quite pricey, and the steaks looked they had an excessive amount of fat left on for $23/lb. There is a decent amount of cheese to choose from and they had some ice cream that looked tasty, but as far as grocery items that were eye catching, that's about it.This place looks rather barren actually, and I saw several people looking at the empty rooms beyond the shopping area searching for more.  I am guessing most people come here strictly for the butcher and the cafe counter, so if that's what you're looking for,  it may be worth a visit. But if you're hoping for something in the vein of a farmers market or an abundance of local goods, you will probably be disappointed. Maybe they will continue to expand their offerings?  Hopefully.

20.description: Amazing! Everything caught my eye. Knowledgable employees, foods displayed with great care, and the beautiful cafe seems to pull it all together. A must see!

19.description: Amazing! Everything caught my eye. Knowledgable employees, foods displayed with great care, and the beautiful cafe seems to pull it all together. A must see!
