Perhaps it would have tasted better had we eaten there as regular customers, but the deep dish pizza they served us was cold and the crust was really hard. Sarah's was ok. Heaven on Seven was gross... I had two bites and didn't eat the rest. The cheezeborger at Billy Goat Tavern Grill was beyond awful. Patty was paper thin and tasteless. The only sampling I enjoyed was the Chicago dog at Downtown Dogs. It's nice to learn about the history behind these establishments, but what good is a food tour if the food isn't going to be good, or at least decent? This is a really hard review for me to write because the tour itself is great and obviously Tastebud Tours can't control what is served at the establishments it visits, but I really don't know how else to rate it otherwise. I was looking more forward to the food than anything else, and in that regard it was disappointing.

24.description: Went on the tour summer of 2012.  Great guide. Group of 12.  We hit  all the must sees and it is exactly as described. Entertaining with plenty to eat.  I fully recommend it. Not giving it the 5th star cause i wish we had gone a little bit more off the beaten path- ya know hidden gems & all.

7.description: So fun!!! Local Chicagoan, Keith, did a great job entertaining us with personal stories, historical information and awesome food. As this was our first visit to the city, we were most anxious to try some regional cuisine and we were not disappointed. The tour began with deep dish pizza at Pizanos and included a Chicago style hot dog, gumbo from Heaven on Seven, a cheeseburger from The BillyGoat Tavern and more. Even a surprise torrential downpour was taken in stride. Keith procured 2 cabs, bought some umbrellas "just in case",  and we arrived at our next stop dry. (I so appreciated this thoughtfulness--hope he's reimbursed!!)Definitely a fun way to explore a new place!!

49.description: FOODIES BEWARE!If you like bad "comfort" food, you'll LOVE this tour. Hot dogs, bad pizza, horrible gumbo, sausage, popcorn, etc.  If you like anything even remotely good, modern, innovative, healthy, tasty, avoid this at all costs.  Even worse, they drag out the tour to 3.5 hours by stopping at other landmarks to kill time, but they don't really do them justice... so you feel like you are wasting time.  The tour also moves at a snail's pace to accommodate out-of-shape tourists and the elderly.  That's very kind of them, but not necessarily how you want to spend 3.5 hours in Chicago.All the food is pre-ordered and comes ONE way.  You walk into a cupcake shop and you get the one cupcake the tour pre-purchased... not the one you want.  You walk into a hotdog place (that shares the space with a Pop-Eyes), and what they hand you... some painfully artificial green relish that bleeds into and colors the bread around it.  The gumbo?  That was NOT gumbo!  It was pureed black beans and some fake andouille sausage.  The owner of the tour company (nice guy, but loud) even accompanied our tour into the popcorn shop and exclaimed the virtues of the world's greatest popcorn.  Really? It's stupid popcorn with cheese dusted onto it and cracker jacks!  Get me out of here.Until the final stop, they ONLY serve water.  The final stop has a mug of root beer.  And you just paid $50 each.The ONLY reason this tour doesn't get one star is that you know going into it, from their website, that you're eating bad food.  But there are better places in Chicago for everything they served to us and much better places to eat for better food in general.  After figuring out their profit margin, you and friends could do your own, better food tour for a fraction of the cost.

40.description: Really nice food tour. Covered a lot of great food in the downtown area and we walked it off while the tour guide told us about local history. Our tour guide was a student of journalism who wrote for some sort of publication about food. It is great that the tour hires people who are passionate and knowledgeable.

53.description: This tour is great if you want to see Chicago ( The Loop) and learn some history while you are at it !The gentlemen , Lynn , knows alot about history in Chicago and does a good job telling you about it !We went to several places ( some which are obvious , others not so much) and each of them has some history to it in relation to the city of Chicago .I happened to be the only one on a tour one day (buddies bailed out) so it was like a personal tour of Chicago ! It was GREAT !He allows to buy stuff along the way if you want to - and also offers some coupons should you want to come afterwards while in the city. If your new to Chicago and want to spend a cool 3 hours .... this is a MUST !!

30.description: This was a good tour for the money. We sampled several restaurants. The food at the restaurants were pretty good and we had a variety of food famous in Chicago. tour guides were knowledgeable and friendly. I think some of the stops could be reconsidered, but overall I was very satisfied. I will do it again next time.

46.description: I think I've become a food tour addict! I live in the Chicago suburbs, but  I had previously gone on two other food tours in the city, and I was a little weary about going on one with a company I was not familiar with. My cousin and her family were in town from California, so I thought this would be a really fun activity for her family, me and my husband.We started our tour at Pizzanos with AnnaLyn and Lynn (the owner), and from the beginning they made the tour awesome! I was a little skeptical when Lynn made a point saying that they treated all their tours "like family"....we could take bathroom breaks when we wanted, we could shop when we wanted....all these things were restricted in the other food tours I've taken. Well....AnnaLyn and Lynn really stuck to their word! They both got to know all of us on the tour, and really did treat us like family! I think the reason they were able to do this is because they were still starting out as a company and had a great relationship with all the owners of the establishments we went to.I was also very hesitant about the amount of food that we got to eat....there were some HEAVY things and I thought we'd be rolling around the city by the time we were done, but the pace and the distance between the locations helped a LOT! We definitely didn't walk away hungry! I'm SO happy that we decided to take a tour with Tasebud Tours! They were great hosts and showed my family a great time in the city! We can't wait to go on their upcoming Sweets tour!!!

1.description: First, my friends and I were only supposed to go to the 1 and a 1/2 hour tour, but when the guide came down with the flu, they upgraded us for free to the 3 hour tour for the same price!What a great way to experience traditional Chicago food and learn about the history of the city! Be sure to have your walking shoes on, as you will be walking for almost the entire 3 hours! Our tour guide was an expert in all things food and Chicago history. She was so friendly and down to earth. She really made the trip worthwhile. We started with a deep dish and traditional pizza at Pizzanos then went to The Drake hotel - Cape cod restaurant. Marilyn Monroe and joe dimaggio carved their initials into the bar... just some interesting things we learned while visiting the Christmas hotel. These celebrities also stayed there: Vince Vaughn, princess Diana, Diane Keaton. Off to La appetito for a chocolate fudge brownie, invented in Chicago. Pippins and downtown dogs for a Chicago style dog- 314 light beer.Billy goat tavern- lucky goat that fell off the truck- lucky goat. Tried to get into the Cubs stadium. They haven't won the  since 1945 curse of the Billy goat. The burger was similar to McDonald's... flat and brown. But the draw was the SNL skit filmed there. The owner was so friendly! He came out and gave a tee shirt to my friend's little boy who joined us on the tour. Last we went to a chocolate  shop. Over all, a great tour I'd recommend to any tourist or local!

55.description: I LOVE Food, so when I found information on Tastebud Tours I had to give it a try.  I also LOVE Chicago, so it was a win win right off the bat.  Lynn, the owner, was our tour guide.  A real, genuinely, nice guy.  You can tell he loves what he does, and loves the City.  He gave us many unique facts about Chicago, and some amazing history of some of the restaurants we ate at.  We went on the tour on a fridgidly cold, windy day in February, and still enjoyed it.  The walking was worth it to get to the next stop of great food.I would suggest eating a very light breakfast before the tour.  You don't eat a ton at any one stop, but you are full by the end.  We evenended up buying some cupcakes, brownies and already have plans to go back to two of the restaurants on the tour.  I would recommend the tour, and we are actually hosting a meeting in Chicago and plan to take some of our attendees on the tour this summer.

9.description: My friends and I went on the tour yesterday with Johnson as the guide. We had an amazing time! Not only did we have great Chicago food, but we learned a lot about the city! This is highly recommended!!

26.description: The combination of sightseeing and food made this tour worth the cost. If the tour had only consisted of food, I would not recommend it, but everything combined made this purchase and experience a worthwhile one.

25.description: We were on a layover in Chicago and would recommend this tour.  It was 3 hours of walking, tasting, and visiting.  Annalyn was a great tour guide, and Lynn the owner met us at the last stop.  It was my first visit to Chicago, buy my husband has been on business.  We visited big name and historic places, and got to see lots of downtown sights.  I would recommend this tour.

12.description: AWESOME! Neither my boyfriend nor I had ever been to Chicago, so we really didn't know where to go in the city. When I saw reviews for the Tastebud Tours I figured we'd give it a try.  Going on a Tastebud Tour was the BEST decision ever. We were able to get a tour of the city, learn about Chicago's history, meet the other guests in our group and find out what they recommended visiting, and we got to experience all of the signature Chicago foods in a short period of time.  It was nice getting to have a deep dish pizza and Chicago style hot dog without having to dedicate an entire meal to each dish.  Anna Lynn was our tour guide and she ROCKED.  She was so sweet and friendly, and super knowledgeable.  She kept the tour running smoothly without making anyone feel rushed. She was just a really cool, fun tour guide.  Thanks to Tastebud Tours having a tour in New Orleans, we will be traveling to NOLA for our next big vacation.  Tastebud Tours are the BEST way to get introduced to a new city!

59.description: For my mom's 60th birthday, I wanted to find something to do that didn't require planning, catering, or cleaning our house to host a bunch of guests.  When I learned about the TasteBud Tours and had read several of the online reviews, I knew that this was the perfect choice.  My family lives in Arlington Heights and rarely ventures into the city for anything.  We chose to do the Chicago Loop tour since it had a little less walking than the Magnificent Mile tour.  Our tour guide, Lynn, was absolutely fantastic!  He was knowledgeable about all food-related facts from all the places we passed on our Loop tour.  The pizza at Pizano's was definitely the best pizza I have tried in years...something about that tomato sauce was so unique and tasty, but none of us could figure out what made it so different.  We managed to stuff ourselves over a 3-4 hour period trying pizza, popcorn, hot dogs, gourmet cupcakes, killer gumbo, and bratwurst.  Everyone loved the tour!  Most of all, my mom was thrilled with spending her birthday with family doing something so different and unique.  She has said that her friends still mention what a great time they had on the tour periodically and we went back in early June.  So, it was a total success.  For $44 per person, the price cannot be beat -- food from 5 or 6 places, entertainment, and a tour wrapped up in one.As a side note, the gumbo at Heaven on Seven was so unbelievably good (and I will say that I am NOT a gumbo fan) that both myself and my sister-in-law went home and bought the cookbook from the restaurant online so that we could make it at home.  We have both tried the recipe and loved it a second time!!If you are considering doing this tour for a special occasion, like a birthday, anniversary, or just wanting to get a Taste of Chicago, TasteBud Tours was the PERFECT solution.  And, I was able to drag my mom into downtown and get her out of the burbs!!

21.description: This was a great experience. Received really good food and some rich history about Chicago. I highly recommend it!!

17.description: I think I've become a food tour addict! I live in the Chicago suburbs, but  I had previously gone on two other food tours in the city, and I was a little weary about going on one with a company I was not familiar with. My cousin and her family were in town from California, so I thought this would be a really fun activity for her family, me and my husband.We started our tour at Pizzanos with AnnaLyn and Lynn (the owner), and from the beginning they made the tour awesome! I was a little skeptical when Lynn made a point saying that they treated all their tours "like family"....we could take bathroom breaks when we wanted, we could shop when we wanted....all these things were restricted in the other food tours I've taken. Well....AnnaLyn and Lynn really stuck to their word! They both got to know all of us on the tour, and really did treat us like family! I think the reason they were able to do this is because they were still starting out as a company and had a great relationship with all the owners of the establishments we went to.I was also very hesitant about the amount of food that we got to eat....there were some HEAVY things and I thought we'd be rolling around the city by the time we were done, but the pace and the distance between the locations helped a LOT! We definitely didn't walk away hungry! I'm SO happy that we decided to take a tour with Tasebud Tours! They were great hosts and showed my family a great time in the city! We can't wait to go on their upcoming Sweets tour!!!

10.description: I made a reservation with Tastebud Tours back in February because I was taking a train trip from DC to Denver with a day-long layover in Chicago.  Unfortunately, I realized immediately after booking that my train left two hours early and I wouldn't be able to make the entire tour.  I was hesitant because of their no-refunds policy, but quickly emailed the President, Lynn, who said she would refund my money.However, despite countless emails, I never got a refund, or even a response after that initial one.  Which sucks, because if I had known that I would have at least tried to make part of the tour to get some of my money's worth.  Definitely sketchy, and I obviously won't be trying the tour anytime soon.

5.description: SO DISAPPOINTING! $40 is way overpriced to be walked in a small circle around the city eating food you could basically buy off a food cart! The pizza to start off was very average, and everything else on the tour tasted like something out of a food truck on the side of the road... Our tour guide was completely unenthusiastic and barely spoke to our group except to push us into buying alcohol at each stop or asking if we wanted to take anymore pictures...The portions are fair but none of the food is good enough to be worth filling up on... Save your money and enjoy a nice lunch in the city it's much more worth the money.

3.description: We recently did the Chicago Taste Tour. Our tour guide (Johnson) was excellent.  You could definitely tell he enjoyed leading the tours, and went out of his way to make sure everyone was having a good time.  In between the stops he along the way he shared a lot of history and interesting trivia about the city.The food on the stops was excellent as well, from the Deep Dish pizza at Pizzano's to the Fannie May chocolates, and everywhere in between.  They give you small portions at each stop, but there is plenty of food by the end of the tour, you will not go hungry.  I would highly recommend Tastebud Tours to anyone looking for an interesting and fun walking tour of the city.

35.description: I just visited Chicago for a convention and for the first time decided to actually check out the city. This tour was perfect. They gave us a lot of food and a lot of history. I went with three other friends and we had a great time. Take your walking shoes, a camera, maybe a small back pack and dress for the weather. At the final stop order (extra money) the beer flights! A great end to a great day.

19.description: Like Megan G, I was also one of the "guinea pigs" who was on one of the free Tastebud Tours for Yelpers on August 1. I had to kill time because I followed the (erroneous) note to show up an hour early instead of only fifteen minutes early, but it was nice to chat with Yelpers old and new with the down time. Our tour guide was Lynn, who is also the owner of TTC. The goal is for participants to enjoy a walking buffet of "Chicago" foods while also getting a taste of not only the foods but the history and behind-the-scenes anecdotes supporting the dishes. While we stopped mostly at dining establishments, we also walked by and through significant historical places and landmarks (Drake Hotel, Water Tower Pumping Station, John Hancock Center). Yes - this is a WALKING tour so be ready to do a healthy amount of walking, rain or shine. Besides, you can walk off the calories that you will consume on the tour.  The first stop of the Magnificent Mile tour is at Pizano's Pizza on State (there is also another parallel tour that covers the Loop and Millennium Park areas). While Pizano's may not be as famous as some of the other Chicago-style pizza establishments, it has a rich family history that gives it "cred" in the deep-dish game. We all tried some thin-crust and deep-dish pizza, and its crackling crust does the trick for me. We spent some quality time at Pizano's, also in part because this is the first stop so there was time needed to set the ground rules and expectations (water provided at most stops! bathroom breaks along the way! pay attention when walking outside!). Next was Sarah's, a chic pastry shop on Oak Street. This was the shortest stop, barely longer than the time needed to inhale the fudgy brownie sample bite provided to us. Next was Downtown Dogs, where most of us ate the "typical" Chicago-style dog with all the standard trimmings. This was a regulation-size hot dog, so it certainly brought my stomach to the point of satisfaction at halftime. This ain't Hot Doug's, but it certainly does well as your typical Chicago dog.  Next we went to Heaven on Seven, which in this case is on the second floor (unlike the original location on Wabash, which is actually on the seventh floor). They still have the wall of hot sauce bottles here at this location, along with a see-through kitchen. We enjoyed our beans and rice and jambalaya samples (yes you get shrimp here even in the little samples, no skimping here). A couple of our braver participants tried Da Bomb hot sauce (supposedly the hottest topper amongst their zillions of bottles), and therefore provided a bit of comic relief after a teeny bit of the sauce was consumed. The tour then goes underground to the Billy Goat, a tourist dive if there ever was one. While the half-burger and "gruff service" sideshow may actually put off some people, I actually liked my burger sample. The final stop is at the Purple Pig, a surprising entry when compared with the more typical and touristy places on the list. The Pig may be more trendy than touristy, but it is a hit with our group thanks to the pleasing interiors and the tasty samples of soft gelato (cappuccino) and assorted cookies. If we had not eaten so much already, this would be a great place to linger and eat more food!    It was interesting to run into other "rival" tours along the way (pizza, chocolates etc), so one can see Tastebud Tours becoming a long-run success. It's not just an eating tour but also a spirited 3+ hour walking tour featuring history and architecture, so once can justify the $44 cost of the tour when you factor everything into the mix (there are currently online discounts available). Funny thing - after all the food and ice water I consumed I was still not "full", but that's probably due to all of the walking (my exercise for the day!) and the fact that I can seemingly eat food continuously.

28.description: I had a marvelous experience on our tour. Our guide, Andrew, made our tour informative and interesting.  It's is a great way to experience " Chicago style " food and learn about it's evolution.

45.description: My boyfriend and I took the tour on August 4th.  We're both big time foodies from NY, and I thought this would be a perfect way to experience the food and culture in Chicago while we were visiting.  Well, I was wrong.  Going into the tour I was excited, especially after all of the 5 star reviews I had been reading.We started out with Pizza, which was actually acceptable.  But it all went down hill from there.  We stopped for our Chicago dog at a fast food joint that also served Popeye's, and had MUCH BETTER Chicago dogs at the White Sox game the night before.  Out of all the places to serve a Chicago dog, why here? FAIL!  After the Chicago dog we stopped to get mini cupcakes from a cupcake shop which once again was acceptable. They had so many delicious flavors on display and gave us the chocolate cupcake with chocolate frosting.  They probably do this so that you're tempted enough to purchase a pumpkin, key lime pie, coconut, or red velvet on your own (which I did, the pumpkin was yummy).  We then walked across town to an old/unimpressive German bar/restaurant where we were served root beer and bratwurst which were both terrible. Our last and final stop was Heaven on 7th (something along those lines) for 'the best southern food...blah blah blah," we were served a small cup of (once again) unimpressive gumbo.The only reason why I'm giving 2 stars is because it was nice to get a tour around the city, and Mimi our tour guide was very nice.People who enjoy REAL food, don't waste your money!

33.description: Love this tour! Great combination of history and food. Doesn't get any better than that! And Annalynn, our guide, and Lynn, the owner, were clearly passionate about what they were doing, and were totally knowledgable and willing to share their stories.As for the food, my husband liked the gumbo at Heaven on 7 the best, but my favorite was the rice pudding at the Allerton Hotel. It was out of this world good.... Loved this tour, but make sure you starve yourself beforehand. I was stuffed for the rest of the day!

43.description: The positive of this tour is the tour guide was very knowledgeable and tried his best to ensure everyone was comfortable. This really should not be called a food tour but rather a history tour with some food stops. My close friend and I visited Chicago for the first time this past weekend and I thought a food tour would be great way to experience the diverse Chicago fare. We are huge foodies from NY and my friend has her own food blog. At the end of the tour my friend said to me, "this was a waste of my time and money". I felt terrible because I made the recommendation. The first stop of the tour was Pizano's Pizza for dip dish pizza. The pizza itself was OK. Several people on the tour were from Chicago and mentioned they had better pizza. There was a terrible smell outside the establishment. It reeked of dirty gutters and pee. I know this is not the fault of the tour but this environment is definitely not conducive for eating pizza. Several people commented on the stench. Thankfully we ate inside.  For the next two hours of the tour (I kid you not) we visited notable places in Chicago, such as the Millenium park, Cultural Center, and famous hotels. At this point we had taken a walking tour of Chicago and were really looking to sample the food. This was not useful for us. At this point I was starving because I did not eat breakfast. We finally had a hot dog at a place attached to a Popeyes, and headed to "Sugar Bliss" for a cupcake. The cupcake was delicious and I would recommend this bakery. However, we should be able to select the type of cupcake, instead of just chocolate. What if someone does not like chocolate or prefer vanilla/red velvet? We then went to a New Orleans themed restaurant in an office building called "Heaven on Seven". The food was OK but the restaurant was not my cup of tea. We then toured the city some more and ended at a subpar German restaurant.  Overall I would not do this tour again or recommend it. The food is subpar, the tour is extremely long but most of the time is spent on the history of Chicago. We were limited to one each of everything and didn't have a choice on what flavors to sample. I love good food and we tried some of the Chicago restaurants on our own. We were wowed by the flavors and creativity of the food we tried on our own. This tour was not an accurate portrayal of the great flavors available in Chicago.

2.description: One of the best decisions I've ever made traveling & traveling to Chicago is the Tastebud Food Tour!!! We booked our tour a few days before we left LA to go to Chicago. You can only book online & it costs about $50/person. This gets you a tour guide from Tastebud who is fully equipped to tell you about each food location, the food, history & culture. But this tour is not just food! There are so many historical facts built in. Our tour guide was Johnson, yes, that's his first name & not his last. He was AWESOME! The tour is 3hrs long & you get a taste of each food location (for us that includes: Deep dish pizza from Pizano's Pizza, a double fudge brownie from Palmer's Hotel, Italian Beef sandwich from AL's Italian Beef, Red velvet cupcakes from Sugar Bliss, Pixies from Fannie May & Brauts from Berghoff's) & tons of cultural & art references. We went to Millenium Park to see the sculptures & installations & the Chicago Public Library, which we found out is lovingly nicknamed, the People's Palace.There is plenty of time to take in sounds & smells from each site, take pics, ask questions & have an enjoyable time. Be sure to wear layers to add or peel off, depending on the weather. Wear comfortable shoes, because you do walk the whole time. Take cash to buy extras at locations you like (we bought a dozen mini cupcakes at Sugar Bliss & tons of chocolates at Fanny May to take home) & to tip your tour guide. $5-10 is recommended, but my bf tipped him a generous $40 because he was excellent & deserved it!!!If you go to Chicago, you need to do the Tastebud Tours! These tours are also available in New Orleans & San Francisco, I can't wait to do those tours as well!

18.description: Looking for a fun way to explore Chicago, and experience some of its unique cuisines and history? Try Tastebud Tours.  On our tour, I sampled Oprah's favorite pizza while sitting at Vince Vaughn's favorite table. I saw remnants of the great fire and learned how Mrs. O'Leary's cow had gotten a bum wrap. I met one of the Chicago's hottest new chefs and tasted one of his unique dessert creations.  What I didn't get to do was use one of America's top ranked restrooms; that treat was reserved for only the female members of our tour group.All the restaurants on the tour are unique to Chicago.  Some boast a wealth of history while others are the latest trend in the Chicago culinary scene.  We tasted a variety of quite diverse foods.  You will definitely get enough to eat.  In hindsight I wish I had passed on the second helping of pizza and the burger.Rain or shine, the tour goes on.  Ominous skies at the beginning of our tour had me worried.  However, even when Chicago started demonstrating why it's called the Windy City, with umbrellas flying and rain slanting down at angles, the tour didn't stop.  Our guide Lynn picked out some strategic locations to shelter us from the weather while he regaled us with interesting facts about Chicago.  Throughout the tour he also shared some useful money saving tips such as where to get a cheap boat ride on the Chicago River and where to find inexpensive but quality coffee.  Out-of-towners, you might want to consider taking this tour at the beginning of your visit so that you can fully utilize some of Lynn's tips.I was the lucky recipient of a complimentary tour through Yelp but I believe it is well worth $44.  Check their website for special offers.  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Tastebud Tours to all visitors and Chicago residents.

41.description: The first time I ever heard of and/or went on a "food tour", was November 2010, in Chicago!! Ever since that AMAZING food tour experience, I was hooked with searching for food tours everywhere I traveled with family and/or friends. This is was due to my first food tour with TASTEBUD Food Tour, that was GREAT TASTING AND A BUNCH OF FILLING YUMMY FOOD!!! I say first food tour with Tastebud's because since November 2011, I've been on 3 food tours through their company and have LOVED each one! I went in November 2010 to Flavors of Chicago, we went with three adults and two teenagers (one vegetarian), and all of us LOVED it and couldnt move after the tour due to so much yummy food! The second best part of the food tour, other then the BEST food, is the tour guide's energetic and educated history of the city/area your touring! You cant beat $44 for a three hour tour that you get not only the history of the beautiful city but all the yummy food from the city too! That's a deal that keeps me coming back for more, and searching for other food tours as Tastebud, when I travel now! I traveled recently to the east coast, New York, Philly, Washington DC, and Miami...no Tastebuds:( but I was able to find a food tour in NYC (August 2011), and although it was good, it def didnt meet the standards of Tastebud's...which made me realize that Tastebuds had set the food tour standards HIGH, with their prices, coverage of tour area, food they offered on tour, and tour guide history and energy!! I also went on a food tour in Los Angeles (June 2011), where we actually live, it was a lot of food...but not all yummy!! Again standards too HIGH!!! Now I return to Chicago (October 2011), and my husband demands we go on a Tastebud's food tour...I was a little scared because I thought I'd been on the best one, the year prior, but decided to try a different food tour with Tastebud, so him and I could share a new experience.  We went on the Taste of Chicago with Tastebud's, and was not disappointed, this tour was in the loop area, so different food, but still yummy and great tour guide with different history for me!! I def recommended these tours to others when traveling to Chicago! Both tours are hard to choose from...Billy Goats was very cool...and the Loop area was cool too...try both!Now three weeks later, I'm looking online for a food tour for New Orleans, because that's where I'd be traveling next and I found with excitement Tastebud Food Tours had just started up in New Orleans!! Now New Orleans is ALL about the BEST FOOD, MUSIC, AND DRINKS!! So the bar was set HIGH for the first real food tour for the amazing city! There's culinary classes...but seriously I want to eat, not cook!!! lol I viewed with excitement the places we'd eat and the food we'd try...I was impressed, although I had been to New Orleans before and tried a lot of food, I was excited to hear the history and try the food again!  And the prices for New Orleans and Chicago were the same, and I can't beat that deal!!  Just so happens my father and I attended the FIRST kickoff Food Tour for Tastebud in New Orleans on 11/12/11.  We even had the pleasure of meeting the genuis who created Tastebud's, and I got to share that I LOVED his tours, tour guides, food picks for tour, and the history that was given at all three tours I had been on.  I also expressed a thank you for opening me up to food tours as a must do when I travel!  And although I had been to New Orleans before and ate like crazy, this tour took me to places I'd hadn't been and gave us of COURSE an abundant amount of YUMMY food and history of the tour area!! I can't recommend enough a TASTEBUD Food Tour, whether its in Chicago or New Orleans, as well as other cities when traveling...BUT you will not find the nicest price, fullest tummy of the yummiest food, and best tour guides with the most knowledge of the city's history and the food your eating on the tour!!!  I'm glad to have been apart of the kick off and be able to tell the owner himself what a fantastic idea and company he created.  If your a food LOVER go on this TOUR!!!

52.description: My girlfriends and I went on the Tastebud Tour during our first visit to Chicago and were pretty impressed with the mix of city and food attractions. Our tour guide had an extensive knowledge of Chicago's history and took us to a variety of food places to sample different items (deep dish pizza, chicago style hot dog, mini cupcakes, bratwurst and homemade root beer). We were supposed to stop by another food venue that was packed with the lunchtime rush so the Tastebud Tour owner credited us $5; very nice of him.I'd definitely recommend Tastebud Tour to anyone visiting Chicago for the first time.Make sure you wear comfy shoes because you will do a decent amount of walking.

50.description: We did their Gold Coast tour yesterday. Best food tour I've ever been on. They take you to the best spots with the best food. You also learn so much about the city. It is worth every penny. Cant wait to try their other tours!!!

4.description: My friends and I were in town for a girls weekend and did the taste of Chicago tour. It was one of our highlights of our trip!! Amazing food tried at all locations! We learned a lot of Chicago history too!Our guide was Johnson and he did a great job!! He was very attentive to the group, entertaining, and made the tour fun!

6.description: Incredible tour today with Tastebuds. Great food, informative, and not rushed or restricted from exploring more menu items, taking pictures or even shopping. Johnson was a great tour guide. Lynn, that's a bonus for him, right? Instead of Cheezborger Cheezborger Cheezborger perhaps it should be Johnson Johnson Johnson. Trouble bonus. :)

22.description: After locating the tour online through both yelp and other sites, I confidently purchased tickets for the Flavors of Chicago tour.With an excellent tour guide, Anna Lynn, whom by the way I HIGHLY recommend, we walked around to some of the best food places the town has to offer.We met at Pizano's Pizza, for a slice of deep dish and thin crust. We were told this is home to the world famous deep dish pizzas - boy that was true! The pizza was so good, we went BACK for dinner that evening. Then we made a stop to The Drake Hotel for some historic background and to visit the powder room. After we visited a former place for Sarah's Pastries for a traditional brownie. Then it was to Downtown Dogs, where I first encountered a Chicago Dog. I have to say, that I would have never gone out of my way to eat such a trashcan food item..... However, I was very mistaken once that treasure hit my taste buds. A perfect combination and I must admit, I'm a fan!!! Heaven on Seven, it was a nice Louisiana style restaurant with a wall full of hot sauces (over 2,000) my dish tasted better with the hot sauces I added, it really made the meal pop! When I visited the Billy Goat Tavern, I was not impressed. Great history behind the foundation of the tavern but we went for a cheeseburger and it was just that..... A cheeseburger. Nothing special about it. Finally the last leg of the tour brought us 23 floors up to the Tip Top Tap Allerton Hotel. We had some decent chocolate chip cheesecake, but the dining setting was beautiful and the history tour was great.All in all, the tour lasted roughly 3 hours and we had a blast! It's an awesome experience whether you're a Chicago native, or visiting. I definitely recommend you give it a try because it takes you for a tour outside your comfort zone! They really do take you to great "hidden" places that you normally might not have found. The price was good for having a guide escort you around town and take you straight to all your destinations.The walking made it easier to fit more food in too!

15.description: I am so happy to have had the opportunity to try this tour with some other Yelpers. Let me just say that I have tried A LOT of food tours (both Chicago Food Planet neighborhood tours and TWO chocolate neighborhood tours) and this one ranks up there in the top!  Out of all the tours I've done, I learned the most of Chicago history here. We not only stopped off at food locations but also at historic landmarks (i.e. The Drake hotel).It was a rainy AND windy Chicago Sunday, but despite the weather I had an awesome time! Lynn did a really great job with our tour and handled the weather situation without difficulty. What a great easy going guy!We visited:--Pizano's Pizza (I may have found my new favorite pizza spot. The deep dish and thin crust pizza were delicious! I am still trying to figure out how they get that crust so crispy!)--Sarah's (The brownie was definitely good...I've never met a bad brownie, but it was not the best I've had)--Downtown Dog's (Good Chicago hot dog--stay away from those peppers!)--Heaven on Seven (The gumbo was really delicious! I may have to come back to try more food!)--Billy Goat Tavern & Grill (I've lived in Chicago for over 4 years and FINALLY made it to this place! Sadly, the cheeseburger was not good. But I enjoyed learning about the history of the Original Tavern and the Billy Goat. Definitely a Chicago tourist spot to visit, if not eat at)--The Purple Pig (I've been wanting to check this place out too!!! That strawberry ice cream IS DELICIOUS!!!!! It tasted like something from my childhood!!! Very nostalgic for me! The outdoor seating was very nice!I enjoyed visiting ALL the locations on our tour, but my favorite EATERIES were Pizano's, Heaven on Seven, and The Purple Pig.For $44 you definitely get your money's worth if not more. The tour guarantees enough for lunch, but I can tell you that you'll be filled up for dinner too!! LOTS OF FOOD to keep you full. I started cramping towards the end from eating so much!!Just a note for those that decide to come, I recommend NOT driving. Your parking meter will expire. The tour is longer than 2 hours and the tour does not end where it begins. Also, the tour is designed for sit down dining so that you will always have a nice comfortable seat and a nice ICE cold drink (so you're not drinking the warm water you've been carrying around).  The tour is NOT rushed at all which I enjoyed A LOT. You can also shop during the tour stops too, which many food tours don't allow. The duration of my tour was from 11am to 2:45pm. I recommend keeping your schedule for the entire day open so that you don't feel rushed to get somewhere else. I would definitely recommend this tour to my friends!

57.description: What an awesome tour!  As a foodie from the bay area (CA) and as a Yelper, I thought this kind of tour would be perfect during our short stay in Chicago to sample all the local cuisines while listening to some history.  My husband and our 9.5 month old went on the 12 PM Goldcoast tour.  We used the online coupon to save $4 off of the $44 ticket.  Our baby was free (and very good during the tour).I was a little apprehensive that we may get rained out, but we had a perfect day in October.  Our tour guide John led us on a wonderful historical walking tour that included plenty of food for lunch that pretty much allowed me to skip dinner (should've skimped out on my hotel breakfast).  Pizano's - Who knew that Uno's Pizza is truly from Chicago with such history?  I took it for granted in CA.  I LOVED the Pizano's deep dish crust.  I wasn't a fan of the amount of cheese on there, but there's something in the crust that's very unique compared to the Chicago deep dish pizzas in CA.  The crust is drier with more of a crunch.  They gave us a slice of cheese and one of sausage.  I should've skipped out on the cheese pizza to pace myself as I've ran out of space in my stomach later.Sarah's Pastries - Very cute bakery.  I thought the brownie wasn't that small as some Yelpers complained.  Do we really need a huge piece when we have how many more food stops?  The sample wedding cakes look beautiful.  The French macaroons looked delicious, but I didn't buy anything as I know of so many great bakeries back home.Downtown Dogs - one Chicago hotdog, which we ate at the Pipian's Tavern next door.  Since I didn't stop by any of the hotdog stands, I appreciated the hotdog.  I didn't get to eat much of my hotdog, which was fine since I had a nice snack later on.  I loved how the hotdog was a bit sweet and spicy.  I know it's not the healthiest food, but what a treat!Heaven on Seven - gumbo and jambalaya.  I love the presentation of the gumbo in demi-tasse and jambalya on a small plate.  They even gave us free dessert coupon.  The hot sauce bottles along the walls were amazing!  We tried different hot sauces on the table, which was very nice touch.Billy Goat Tavern - very interesting burger joint with a "basement feeling."  It was very well hidden with a great history.  This tavern made Chicago pretty famous.  The cheeseburger was alright as John warned us.  I'm glad we only ate 1/2 since we had so much food already at this point.Purple Pig - beautiful, modern wine bar/charcuterie.  They gave us a soft serve ice cream with olive oil drizzled on top.  Who knew such combination would taste SO good?  The soft serve brought the nuttiness of the olive oil out.  Absolutely delicious and what a way to end the tour!Few keynotes:  Along the way, John showed us different historical sites such as buildings that survived the big fire and historical hotels (Drake Hotel) and neighborhoods (Streeterville).  John used humor to keep us entertained and interested in learning about the Chicago history.  And I'm thankful that the tour was small and person at only 6 adults since we had our baby in the stroller.  Our baby did great on the tour, but I was very thankful to everyone for being patient with us and accomodating to our needs.We had a nice surprise towards the end of the tour.  Lynn, the founder, joined us at the Billy Goat Tavern.  At the end of the tour, we had an opportunity to give him some feedbacks.  He actually took my feedback about his website and I noticed that he's already changed it today!  (We toured yesterday.)  He's efficient!  And he was genuinely nice and down to earth.  I'm glad Tastebud tour is doing really well on TripAdvisor.  Congrats!I'm going to recommend this tour to anyone visiting Chicago.  They're expanding to other cities, so we'll see I can repeat such experience in another city.

20.description: My teenage daughter and I had a fantastic time on Tastebud Tours. The perfect mix of great food, interesting Chicago history, and a bit of exercise. We tasted deep dish pizza, Chicago hotdogs, burgers from the Billy Goat Tavern, brownies, handcrafted chocolates and some delicious gumbo, of all things. We ate so much that we actually skipped dinner that night!Jaime Lyn was our tour guide, and she was a font of knowledge about Chicago. She was personable and gracious, and seemed to enjoy her job. We also got to spend time with the owner, Lynn, who seems like a terrific guy. He has a real passion for Chicago and for food, so this is the perfect business for him. He also mentioned being involved in charitable work that helps feed kids in poverty, so as you are enjoying the tour, you are also helping to do some good in the world. What could be better than that?Good times; highly recommend!

36.description: Great tour... useful if you dont have enough time to do all by your own.

14.description: Went on different food tours and never ever have I found one so poorly run.Sadly, our guide was sweet enough,obviously the company is lacking a plan.For example,we simply walked between food places with no commentary on the areas we were walking through or the restaurants we were in.At the restaurants we sampled foods again with no discussion at all.

12.description: Spent over $12k on Ultracraft Cabinets which I've realized are "UltraCrap"  received the cabinets damaged and with chips and paint missing in multiple areas, as well as door and drawer panels not cut square.  During install two boxes actually came apart and had to be put back together with glue and screws.  The overall quality of the paint used on the cabinets is disappointing with a huge lack of attention to detail during the finishing process.  Crawford and Ultracraft paid for a refinisher to come out and and address the paint issues at which point their genius solution was to spray the affected areas with a spray can, which later began peeling. Multiple boxes had excess glue on the inside that had to be taken off by me with razor blades, and don't expect a refund from anyone as I've been going back and forth for almost a year and both sides just try to play up "what they've done" to try and fix the problems.  I paid $12k for cabinets, there shouldn't have been any problems in the first place!  I've dealt with phone calls,emails, multiple deliveries of replacement products of which some still came damaged..  Overall not happy with the experience and can not believe for what we paid the lack of quality that we received in our Ultracraft cabinets.. NEVER AGAIN!

3.description: I have to say THANKS! to Crawford Supply.My parents have been very stressed out about a kitchen remodel as they are really short on time to complete and they have to manage a lot of other conflicting priorities.When they decided to buy a sink and faucet, they didn't know where to go to see a large variety of options (and things that aren't really out on display at the typical spots).  My mom visited the Lincoln location of Crawford and she was able to see lots of items, and was helped by a really great and friendly (and patient) staff.  They have a good selection of high quality items and really really really friendly staff.  Thanks Crawford!

1.description: AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE. We purchased a toilet from here when it was still Community Home Supply. A few MONTHS ago, a part went bad and we returned for a replacement. It wasn't until we visited that we learned Community had been acquired by Crawford Supply. To keep a long story short, it has been a nightmare trying to get a simple replacement valve...nothing but unreturned phone calls & emails, empty promises and poor to zero communication. Months later, when the part had arrived and was available to be picked up, we had to call to find out that it was there. Apparently, no one at Crawford Supply knows how to use a phone or send an email. Customer service is obviously not a priority with these folks.I will NEVER return to Crawford Supply and advise others to steer clear.

2.description: Crawford Supply has a great inventory of toilets, faucets and lots of other supplies.  The personal service is what helps the most.  They know their products and work with you to get you what will work best for you.I had a great experience.

9.description: We are renovating our bathroom, and needed help learning about all the the different shower options out there.  We are putting in 2 separate rain showers in the same shower, and had a lot of questions about the right way to do it.  Enter Jamie.  Jamie was fun, not intimidating, and really wanted to help us find what we needed - not just sell us the most expensive system - to get for our shower.  She showed us all the different options, and on top of it, made a really intimidating process FUN!  We got all our questions answered AND MORE.  We will absolutely be back for other plumbing needs.  The whole staff was friendly, and willing to answer questions.  Unlike other showrooms where you can't talk to anyone without an appointment are are forced to wait 2 hours and then are treated poorly, Crawford was THE EXACT OPPOSITE.  If you are in the market for any plumbing needs, go to Crawford, and say hi to Jamie for me!

10.description: Working with Crawford Supply for the purchase of a bathroom vanity and faucets was one bad service experience after another: lack of response and lack of follow through followed by lack of response and lack of follow through, then defensiveness when I called them on the poor customer service. My recommendation is to steer clear of this business.

4.description: I called to make an appointment to visit the showroom for a bathroom remodel and was transferred to voicemail.  That was over a week ago and I never received a call back.

6.description: This place is a joke.   Old school tool bags that think they are doing you a favor by letting you buy things from them.  If you're looking for a lesson in bad customer service, the Crawford Supply Experience is the place for you.

0.description: I had been a long time customer of Community Home and a bit reluctant to try out Crawford... I had an issue with an old faucet I had bought at community with no receipt  and they helped me reorder new faucet at no charge...staff couldn't have been more helpful!.. Will definitely be buying all of my plumbing supplies from here in the future...Good luck on your transition!!!!!

5.description: I use to go here when I lived in the hood but have since moved but still go back when I need explanation for installs. Last two times I talked to Mark who explained to me in detail on he to install Groehe bathroom faucet and toto toilet. This guy knows how to do installs based on past experience. He not only explains he takes time to make sure his customer understands. He does relationship building very well. I hope his manager realizes how good he is.

13.description: Love this store Jared has been soo helpful with getting replacements and updating. Feeling grateful that we bought through them. Customer service is amazing!!!!!

11.description: Jordyn was great! She found the perfect sink for our powder room, and she followed the shipping very carefully until it arrived safely to our home and kept me in the loop throughout the process.I would highly recommend Jordyn to anyone in need of bathroom or kitchen products.Rob

8.description: Although my order with Crawford didn't work out, I wanted to write a note about my customer service experience.  I worked with Jordyn Bomberg who helped ne track down and order a very specific type of tub that I wanted. She gave me a heads up that it took a while to come in so we ordered well in advance of my project and they accomodated me by holding the tub in their warehouse until i was ready for delivery.  Upon receiving the tub, my contractor found it to be cracked.  Since it was special order it would have taken too long to replace as my bathroom was already under construction.  They ordered a pick up of the broken tub right away and promised to credit me the full amount as soon as received.  Wonderful customer service that certainly helped an unfortunate situation.  For that I would certainly work with them again.

14.description: Renovated a kitchen and Jordyn and her colleague were able to find me a very reasonably priced kitchen with a lot of style.  Jordyn is easy to work with and responsive.  Also bought some plumbing supplies through Jordyn at Crawford for another project and in some cases she was able to beat the internet companies prices.  Thank you Crawford!

7.description: I'm not sure if this is the same place as Community Home Supply but we visited this location on 3/28/15 and the service was awful. We have been here before and have had similar experiences. It was not crowded and even so, there apparently weren't enough salespeople. Today we found THE perfect stainless steel farm-style sink that was displayed in the middle for the store. There was a little sticky note inside that said "discontinued". So we waited for someone (never approached - had to just ask and wait) and the gentleman said yes it's discontinued Got it. We asked the price for the "floor model" and he said they won't sell it. It's just there in the middle of their showroom. Um... Ok. There was no effort to even say "hey let me show what we DO have that's similar". We said thank you and he sat down at a desk. We just walked out. It's a shame - it looks like they have some nice stuff.

28.description: My husband and I visited Green Home Chicago after hearing about it from our architect. Our architect thought we should look at another green building/design business other than the one we were working with at the time. We were in the midst of beginning a kitchen expansion and redo. We were very taken with the warm atmosphere at GHC, and found many items we liked. My husband and I were already committed to purchasing our kitchen cabinets from another source, but if we had known about Karen and GHC previously, we would have purchased from her. We decided to purchase 2 countertops from GHC, and carpeting for one of our new rooms. Karen and her staff were great to work with, and very responsive to any questions we had, investigating all options. After our construction project was finished, we purchased furniture from Karen for one of our new rooms! I would definitely work with Karen again - in fact, I need to get downtown to see her!Kim and Joe Decker

1.description: I tried to remodel my kitchen on my own.  It didn't work.  I was so tired of bringing home samples and looking at slabs I thought my brain would explode.So I changed the drill.  I went to Green Home Chicago with photos of my cabinets, back-splash, and counter-top. I told Karen I'd given up on trying to find something to go with my old, tiled back-splash, and she calmly and quickly, like a magician, pulled a few pieces together that she thought would work. They did!  She sent the BEST workers to my condo to install the new pieces. They did beautiful work.My new kitchen looks grand!I recommend Green Home Chicago without reservation.

9.description: I rarely do anything impulsive, but only a little more than a week before a big party in our home we decided to have new carpeting installed. Karen was terrific and brought it all together just in time, even with some last minute changes! She worked with our budget and helped us choose a product and padding that wouldn't exacerbate our allergies and her advice regarding the color pallete was spot on. In addition, she was friendly, accomodating and fun to work with. The installer, Randy, and his assistant did a flawless job - they were timely and efficient, the carpeting was laid beautifully, and they left everything the way they found it. The only unforseen issue was that the new carpet had a lower pile than the old which unfortunately necessitated a last minute touch-up to the paint just hours before 70 people arrived. It was a great party, by the way, and our neighbors will be giving Karen a call!

29.description: Green Home Chicago is now my destination for all home renovation projects.  Karen was my saving grace in completing my kitchen renovation.  Cabinets were already purchased but I was not certain of the countertop.  Granite was a great choice considering cost only.  My visit to GHC and Karen's patience found my perfect match in ECO by Cosentino. The process was absolutely without any grief, an exception to all that came before.  It took less than 2 weeks from order to installation.Can't wait to come in and consult GHC and Karen for my bathroom overhaul.

23.description: Love this place. Karen and her designers are wonderful to work with, and the products they carry are top-notch and thoughtfully selected. On top of that the space is just really cool to be in. We have gone to GHC for upholstery fabrics for refurbishing several vintage chairs, and also sourced a number of materials for a kitchen remodel, including amazing recycled glass composite countertops. Simply put, they carry materials and colors that I've never found anywhere else, and Karen has a great eye and creative imagination for putting things together in compelling ways. None of this is cheap, but I feel the pricetag is well worth it for excellent materials and wonderful, personable service.

5.description: What a terrible experience!  Karen provided pricing then DOUBLED it right before I was to sign a contract.  When I asked why, she refused to share an explanation and was extraordinarily rude in the process.  I was more than shocked. I would not recommend her.

25.description: GHC is outstanding. They offered me great design advice, got everything ordered, made sure it arrived safely and went above and beyond what they charged me. Can't say enough good things about Karen and her business.

12.description: Karen at Green Home is fantastic. We didn't end up using her business for our kitchen renovation project because we decided to DIY, but she was a pleasure to communicate with and their prices are very fair for the quality of work. Definitely worth checking them out as an option... you will have gained another resource for the future. Karen was super responsive and had a wealth of great ideas for our project. If we end up doing anything else in our kitchen that requires nice products, installation (or, if our self-installed breakfast bar falls apart...haha), I will be back at Green Home in a second! ps. Their store is beautiful, stop by just to browse if you're in the market for any sort of earth friendly products. Gorgeous!

21.description: I absolutely love this store! I have purchased several pieces of furniture and they are my favorites. I am rehabbing my kitchen soon and I'm definitely going to use GHC's designers and awesome eco products. Super friendly staff, I highly recommend them for any home projects.

16.description: Green Home Chicago was Everything I hoped for and more. As an environmentally conscience Interior Decorator, the show room was a dream come true. It is My one stop shop for everything, rather than hiking all over the city collecting samples and still not finding what I need, they have it all right there. From cork and bamboo flooring to recycled glass countertops, if you need it they'll most likely have it! Their library is extensive and they are more than happy to help you locate any sustainable material you might need for you or your client's project. Most of all it is a very relaxed atmosphere. Karen and Stefani are fun and friendly, and very knowledgable about the products as well as interior design. They are an invaluable resource to have for both materials and design advice. I look forward to doing much more business with them in the future!

17.description: Karen Kalmek and Green Home Chicago are great resources for anyone interested in exploring a home or apartment remodeling or redecorating project....large or small.I found Karen by googling "cork floors" as I was very interested in finding a non-toxic, green alternative to replace my master bedroom carpeting. She was initially very responsive to my phone calls and I found her to be a wealth of information regarding my flooring options, as well as interior paints. She knows her stuff, most certainly. Don't be fooled by the many well-known brands of paint purporting to be "no-VOC." The toxins are in the pigment, so be cautious if you are truly concerned about introducing toxins into your home.Karen's store is delightful, full of all sorts of tempting furnishings. In the course of my project, I visited twice and am now sitting in a great chair I bought off her showroom floor. Do yourself a favor and visit Karen's place. You will find her completely professional, knowledgeable, and very responsive as you navigate the inevitable challenges of a remodeling project. Ultimately, my project was completed on time and exactly as I expected, with the aid of two incredible contractors recommended by Karen.Highly recommend Green Home Chicago!

10.description: After spending weeks trying to find and agree to the right tile for our bathroom reno & kitchen backsplash with no luck, my husband and I decided we needed an expert's help and creative direction. That's when we found ourselves at Green Home Chicago and we were incredibly pleased with the ideas and advice Karen provided. We brought in samples of our wall colors and granite counter tops, and she then helped us sort through various options. Karen is great at helping you think outside of the box and add some color - to which I can easily be wary of - but I really appreciated her approach. She and her team are a pleasure to work with and we are incredibly happy with all of our decisions! Thank you, Karen!

11.description: Excellent service and very fair pricing.  They have a great selection of products and just stopping in will get your creative juices going.  In my case, I stopped by looking for a small bathroom counter top piece.  I actually thought that my request was going to be too small to be worth their time and effort but Karen never batted an eye. She made a bunch of great suggestions and was ultimately able to get me what I needed.   Sometimes when you go into places that are design oriented and you don't have the budget to afford a lot, the sales/service people figure that out quickly and basically ignore you.  That was definitely not the case with Karen!  Stop in and check this place out.  You will be glad you did.

26.description: I used Green Home Chicago to help me source a few items for a recent home remodel. Their selection is great, their enthusiasm for their business is amazing, they were on top of communication, and both Amanda and Karen couldn't be nicer or easier to work with. Next time I need something they will be the first place to stop.

27.description: Karen is just delightful to chat and work with.  She always keeps a fantastic (but small) selection of home decor products and she is constantly bringing in new, trendy items to consider.  Great deals on designer items...and they are Green!

0.description: Karen recently helped my wife and I with the purchase of a new dining room set. Based on our prior experiences in working with Karen, we knew she would have some options. What we didn't realize is how easy it would be. After talking with Karen for a bit, she came up with a combination of pieces that we couldn't resist.  We continue to get compliments from friends and family on how the pieces work together. I would highly recommend Karen and her team for any interior design efforts.

20.description: Green Home Chicago was Everything I hoped for and more. As an environmentally conscience Interior Decorator, the show room was a dream come true. It is My one stop shop for everything, rather than hiking all over the city collecting samples and still not finding what I need, they have it all right there. From cork and bamboo flooring to recycled glass countertops, if you need it they'll most likely have it! Their library is extensive and they are more than happy to help you locate any sustainable material you might need for you or your client's project. Most of all it is a very relaxed atmosphere. Karen and Stefani are fun and friendly, and very knowledgable about the products as well as interior design. They are an invaluable resource to have for both materials and design advice. I look forward to doing much more business with them in the future!

19.description: I highly recommend Green Home Chicago as a terrific resource for their service in kitchen and bath design and sustainable finishes.  They offer high style in a sustainable package.  Great furnishings and finishes, excellent service.  Thanks Karen and team for helping me achieve my clients design goals.  - Asparagus Interiors Inc./ Elizabeth Marusin ASID - Interior Designer

2.description: My husband and I are so in love with our kitchen designed by Stefani at GHC! We had talked with other designers who constantly pushed us in the direction of a beige kitchen, even when we explicitly stated many times that we love bright colors. When we sat down with Stefani, she was a breath of fresh air; we finally felt like someone was listening to us. On top of the great design work, GHC has amazing eco-friendly products and connections with the best contractors around. It was a true pleasure working with GHC!

18.description: Proprietor, Karen Kalmek is as good as any store owner can get.  Karen spent at least 1-1/2 hours helping us choose the perfect counter top to compliment the tile back splash & Blanco sink samples we showed to her.  With so many styles/colors to choose from, Karen presented the perfect Cambria sample perfectly describing the back splash tile & counter top match as "sophisticated".  Done deal.With a couple of mishaps by Cambria (not Green Home Chicago), Karen worked tirelessly on our behalf to make things right.  Also, Karen displayed numerous beautiful porcelain tile for our radiant-heated floors and helped us choose the perfect product for the back porch area.Karen Kalmek is a knowledgeable and extremely resourceful person.  She  also saved us several hundred dollars by ordering our beautiful Blanco faucet. Throughout our initial visit to Green Home Chicago I found so many beautiful items.  We will definitely be back to the store - perhaps Karen can help us find a 25 ft runner!Thank you for your time and expertise, Karen.  The wine and beer are chilled, and we look forward to your visit so you could see first-hand how beautiful the Green Home Chicago products look in our new kitchen.  We are pleased beyond expectation!

13.description: When we found out we were pregnant in January we knew we had to complete the renovation of our kitchen and two bathrooms before the baby was born. It was also more important than ever that we use sustainable products. Green Home Chicago was the perfect solution for us. Aislinn and Stefani, the designers, came to our home to see the space first hand and take measurements. They were friendly, listened to what we wanted, and came up with creative designs for our space. We were able to stay in regular contact to bounce around ideas and tweak the designs. The showroom is amazing and it was fun to be able to see the products in person and play with different colors, textures and combinations to see what works best. Karen, the owner, was extremely helpful and took the time to really listen to what we wanted. She was able to recommend a contractor who was a perfect fit and could complete the project within our tight timeframe. I would recommend Green Home Chicago to all of my friends and family.

4.description: Sadly my old leather couch had been peeling for some time and it wasn't possible to fix it.  After a lengthy online search I found it was really hard to find an eco-conscious couch, particularly in the Chicagoland area.  Finally I found Green Home Chicago and it's in my neighborhood!Karen and her associate were friendly and welcoming.  She gave us information about the 2 companies she works with and helped narrowed down the style and materials we liked, making sure we knew all options since they're made-to-order.  We browsed through a couple of catalogs and many fabric and wood samples.  Karen was helpful without being at all pushy, and she really went out of her way to make us comfortable.  I also appreciated that she informed us about an upcoming promotion that the manufacturer was running a week later.  We returned to the store at the start of the sale to take a second look and place our order.Our couch was ready a little earlier than promised and Karen was great at communicating with us on the day of delivery (by the way the couch was delivered at the beginning of the 2 hr widow so no waiting around all day!).  She really went out of her way to make sure the couch met our expectations and the delivery went smoothly.  We've had the couch for a few weeks and we're really happy with the appearance and comfort.Overall my husband and I enjoyed working with Karen and we love our couch.  It's great to have a company so close that shares our concern about the environment and fair labor.  We'll definitely use Green Home Chicago again in the future!

24.description: I highly recommend Green Home Chicago as a terrific resource for their service in kitchen and bath design and sustainable finishes.  They offer high style in a sustainable package.  Great furnishings and finishes, excellent service.  Thanks Karen and team for helping me achieve my clients design goals.  - Asparagus Interiors Inc./ Elizabeth Marusin ASID - Interior Designer

6.description: Karen was very knowledgeable. She spent a long time talking with us when we first came in and told her about our project. We were clueless, so it was much appreciated. We ordered Gilasi countertops for our kitchen and get complements on them. We also got a great tip on ordering remnents which saved us money. I wasn't satisfied with the install of the counters and Karen made sure that everything got fixed.

22.description: We first went to see Karen at Green Home Chicago to see what our options were regarding "green" materials for a bathroom remodel.  Karen was so nice to work with and spent time with us and also managed our 2 year old while we looked at materials and discussed options.  The materials we selected were absolutely fabulous and Karen was so helpful through the entire process.  Thanks Karen!Yes I would refer GHC to all of my friends and family!

15.description: I can't recommend Green Home Chicago enough for countertops. They have tons of awesome types of countertops you won't find anywhere else. Most importantly Karen spent a lot of time helping me find the exact countertops for my kitchen space. Couldn't have done it without her help!! Also Walter installed them wonderfully. My kitchen looks 100% better!!

7.description: Karen and team are outstanding. What started with, "we think we might want a single-slab, raw edge table," turned into a trusted partnership as we worked to design the main space of our new home.I appreciate Karen's ability to understand client needs while also inputting her expertise. She partners with quality artisans to custom-build pieces, focusing on local product and local talent. What started as the table turned into a custom-built, locally sourced table, custom chairs, and a gut-renovation and custom stone work/shelving for our fireplace. Our room went from standard to gorgeous in a matter of weeks. It was awesome to see the vision come together -- and I loved having Karen by my side throughout the whole process.   Overall the team provides excellent service at a reasonable rate and only partners with the best to get the job done. I highly recommend.

8.description: My husband and I loved our experience at Green Home Chicago. Karen collaborates with a talented group of artists and contractors who create and install unique functional pieces. We found an amazing custom made counter top there for our new kitchen. Since we were hosting Thanksgiving, we gave Karen an impossible challenge to finish within a very tight timeframe. She kept her word. Everything was completed beautifully and on time.  We're so happy we found Green Home Chicago.

30.description: I have wanted to make a trip to GHC for a while and I did this weekend.  I wanted to buy their eco friendly paint.  I am tackling a big house project so I mentioned a few things on the 'things to purchase' list to Karen, the owner.  She was great at suggesting items and trying to take into account my budget.  She had amazing ideas and pointed out items I didn't even know about.  The show room is great, not huge, but that's to be expected, it's a niche industry, right now.  I haven't painted yet, so hopefully more later.  I was impressed with the wide selection of colors this paint line has, everyone should be able to find a shade they like.  I can't wait to come back!

3.description: I want to say that this company did fantastic job on  renovating our bathrooms . My husband and I are both ecstatic with the workmanship and detail put in and have received lots of positive comments. We love love our contemporary Miami stile bathroom and basement bathroom and floor. Norma and Karen did amazing job.  We will definately recommend this company to family and friends.M & N.

14.description: Superb Service, Sustainable Choices and Competitive Prices!  I am thrilled with the Counter-top and recycled glass back-splash tiles I purchased from Green Home Chicago.  It was a pleasure to conduct research in the beautiful Fulton Market area store that features an extensive selection of sustainable finishes and genuinely friendly people.  I fell in love with the Gilasi product, made in Chicago's Ravenswood neighborhood of  resin and broken oven door glass from Chicago's south side.  How great is that story?!   Walter's expert and timely installation kept our kitchen project right on schedule. Karen was also helpful in finding the specific glass tiles I had seen elsewhere and recommending (but never pushing) complimentary products like flooring and cabinets.  I highly recommend Green Home Chicago for home and office projects.

58.description: Lost my stylist about 6 months ago and was sent art+sciences way by my wife.  Kept my fingers crossed that this Katie id been scheduled with was the real deal.  She is.  I got lucky being paired with such a professional, friendly and talented stylist.  My last cut was the best haircut I've gotten in my life. Easy choice for you gentleman that are searching for a serious professional and a really solid value.  Get on the books with Katie. J

56.description: Here's the thing. I'm typically a freeloader on Yelp. I use it religiously for finding new places but very rarely take the time to write reviews. Scandalous. I've always liked this salon. Hip but friendly. Trendy but accessible. And I always like popping into Levi's next door when I'm done. I recently had my hair colored only to arrive home and realize it was way too dark and that little accent piece I asked for was on steroids. I absolutely hate the inevitable phone call that follows. I feel terrible complaining and hate being one of those clients. BUT! The front desk was super helpful and fit me right back in (with no attitude). I saw Stephanie and she turned the darkness into a hair color I've always lusted after on magazine covers. She was fast and accommodating and even called to ask if I was happy after the appointment. Better yet, they fixed it for free!I've finally found a colorist AND a stylist in Chicago I can count on (because I forgot to mention Hannah works wonders with a pair of scissors)!

29.description: I have been going to Rob for almost 5 years now, and it is a totally shame that I have not written a review of him and the salon yet.  Rob is amazing - a total hair genius.  He is intuitive about your hair needs, and always gives you good recommendations if you are worried about how a style will work with your face/hair type etc.  He is such a great people person and he makes you feel totally special by remembering things about your life even if you haven't seen him in a long while (oops!).  I love Rob and Art & Science!!!

42.description: I walked 8 blocks only to find out that they had messed up my appointment. Did not offer any compensation, was just asked to come back later.

23.description: After many bad cuts and colors, I stumbled upon this place on Yelp. I decided to call and ask for a senior stylist because I was in desperate need for someone to fix my terrible, uneven cut. I was matched with Seven and boy, am I glad. I'm officially done looking for salons/stylist. Seven is my new girl!

47.description: I think three stars are generous but my hair looks good. Great space and nice people but terrible philosophy. I came in for a partial highlights and a hair cut. Normally the partial highlights takes an hour and hair cut takes about 45. Here the partial highlight takes an hour and 45 min and then you wait for an unnecessary amount of time til your haircut which takes at least an hour. The last salon I went to I had one person do everything which really cut down time. Here I dealt with three people- so coordinating three stylists is obviously more challenging than one. Instead of hair dryers to speed up the highlights you wait. Then you get a wash and wait. And wait some more. Then a haircut. I waited an extra 45 min. This could have been eliminated if they did build so many buffers in. So now I type this as I have cold wet hair waiting for my cut. Finished product looks good and you get free wine but make sure you have 3-4 hours!!

8.description: I would also highly recommend Ivan for color. Achieved Victoria's Secret level beachy bayalage both times I've seen him. Listened intently to what I wanted and he went above and beyond. He's an artist!

31.description: Typically, I absolutely dread hair cuts.   After passing Art+Science and then seeing it make the Chicagoist "The 8 Best Hair Salons In Chicago" list, I thought I would give it a go. I am so happy and relieved to have found such a fantastic salon! From the front desk to the shampoo girl, everyone was friendly and welcoming. There was great music and they offered tea, coffee, etc. Good vibes from start to finish. I had my hair colored by Susan. I cannot say enough wonderful things about her. She is fabulous! It is clear from the moment you meet her she is truly passionate about her career. I wasn't exactly sure of what to do with my hair, so she took a lot time to consult me about my options, what i wanted from my color and what she thought would be best.. My resulted hair color has far exceeded my expectations. It is very complimentary to my complexion and eye color. I have received compliments from all my co-workers, friends and family.  I love my new color and have already scheduled my next appointment with Susan. My color was followed by a cut with Seven. She also exceeded my expectations. She gave me a great cut that I have been able to manage well on my own. I love it!Thanks A+S for a great experience, I look forward to my next visit!

34.description: Bridget does such a nice job with color.  And she's very sweet and personable.  I recommend!

16.description: I tried so many salons while living in Chicago looking for an awesome cut and color that didn't make me look like a soccer mom....I wear my hair short and just because I'm 50+ doesn't mean I do not want an edgy look. I finally found Rob & Bridget at Art + Science! They are amazing! I now live out of state but drive back as often as possible to see my kids, who still live in Chicago and squeeze in a cut and color! My husband, who travels with me LOVES Katie! I can see why Art + Science was rated the best Chicago Salon! The staff is super skilled and the front desk could not be sweeter! Best part, No pretentious people here!

13.description: Ivan works wonders! I came in with a blonde that I absolutely hated and he transformed my hair into a beautiful platinum/silver. Everyone in the salon was extremely helpful and knowledgable! I've never found a salon that I want to go back to until now! Thank you and I will see you in 6 weeks!

11.description: Mitra gave me the best haircut I've ever had. We talked through what I want and what she thought would look best.
