She walked me slowly through the whole thing and made me feel great about my look! She also gave me lots of tips and was great to talk to. I will definitely be coming back and will recommend to my friends!

39.description: Rob is amazing. I just received what is the best cut of my life.  Besides being amazingly talented, he's super sweet and does an awesome consultation.  Then he actually does what you agreed upon! The salon is beautiful, modern, and friendly.  They served me a delicious cup of jasmine tea as well. Everyone that works here is super friendly also.Go. You will love this place!

37.description: I recently went in for some color and a cut.IVAN is the person to see if you need some color accents added. He is extremely personable and has such great style. JESSICA did my cut. Again, seriously a sweetheart and listens to what you're looking for. I asked for input and she gave me honesty, which is a whole lot better than walking around like a fool. My experience here was excellent. I'll definitely be back in soon!

0.description: This review is for hair color.  Art + Science is the second salon I tried after moving to Chicago in 2015.  I have found my spot.  It's everything a quality salon should be.  After scouring Yelp reviews and checking out websites, I decided to give Art + Science a try.  It is evident from their thoughtfully designed website, hip and trendy photos and Yelp reviews that a high level of service and professionalism could be expected.  I was not disappointed!I booked an appointment with Susan, the color director, and for a first time appointment, no prior relationship, the chemistry was great.  She is an extremely talented and competent colorist. Jamie who is apprenticing also was very polite and professional and did a great job on my rinse and style.The salon offers a variety of high-quality professional products.  The reception/scheduling staff is extremely attentive and friendly.  Overall my experience was outstanding.  I highly recommend Art + Science color service.

38.description: I love Art and Science.  Great customer service from the receptionists on the phone to everyone at the salon.  I will tell you I am super picky about my hair and have tried multiple stylists but there is absolutely no one that compares to Becca!  The hardest thing to find in a stylist is consistency but with Becca every cut is perfect (I have been a client for 2 years.) She is always engaging and listens to your ideas and makes her own recommendations, the sign of someone who knows what they are doing.  This review is two years too late but just had to give her a shout out!!

51.description: I just went here yesterday after being referred by a friend. I'm beyond happy that I went. I usually hi-light my hair and decided to do a bleach and tone instead. Ivan is an absolute genius with color. He nailed the color I wanted perfectly. I'm so glad I found this salon.  Super friendly staff, great atmosphere. Love it!!!

27.description: This was my first visit to Art and Science, and was definitely my last. The haircut I had was unfortunately the worst of my life. I saw a stylist (who I won't name here) that left the bottom line of my long hair completely crooked, and cut incredibly uneven layers. I am going to have to visit another salon to have it fixed. I feel as though the time and care that should have gone into my appointment was not afforded to me by the stylist -- she left in the middle of my cut to wash her next client's hair because she was behind schedule. I can only assume that this is the reason why she made such glaring mistakes while cutting my hair. While she was blow drying she twisted my stick straight hair with product so that the errors in the cut were not so apparent and made the comment that she "liked the choppiness." It wasn't until I went home and washed my hair that I saw the 'holes' in the layers and the crooked lines. I can't wait to have someone fix this - this haircut was a complete waste of $65.

32.description: The receptionist (I believe her name was Anna) was so entitled and unprofessional, she completely discouraged me from wanting to come try out the salon! Potential first time customers should not be scolded when trying to make an appointment.

54.description: I got my hair cut here around the end of April/beginning of May and realized I never wrote a review!I had a great experience here. When I called, they were able to fit me in same day which was really nice. Coco cut my hair and she did a great job. I hadn't gotten my hair cut in 2 & 1/2 years (Horrible I know), but I had been a broke college student for most of that time. Nonetheless, I loved my haircut. I told Coco that I wear clip in hair extensions normally and have been for about 4 years and she cut my hair so it would still be easy to blend my extensions in or still look good without them. Super please with my final cut and need to go back soon to try out their colorists!

48.description: First time to one of Wicker Park's haircut places. First impression I got when I went in was friendly service who offered me water. Place was really nicely decorated and had a vibrant feeling.I went in with my groupon. Katie was the only barber that accepted groupon.  I can say for sure that this is the place to get a men's haircut despite the price being quite hefty (especially without a Groupon). Katie is a great barber and I would recommend. Only downside to her is that she's quiet throughout the haircut.

44.description: Groupon requires specific barbers. Unable to book special barbers. Hence, unable to use services. The haircut I did get was rushed and felt that would have been better off using some of the other salons in the Wicker park area. I would suggest those who go here to try somewhere else first.

24.description: I recently tried Art + Science after getting a not-so-great cut from my former stylist. I LOVE ART + SCIENCE. The attention to detail my stylist had when fixing my cut as well as the professionalism and care I saw other clients receiving was top notch. I can't wait until my hair grows out and I can get a full cut (not just a fix) from someone there and see what they can do!

7.description: Wow! Lexie did amazing things with my hair, I'm traveling from Australia and have had the same hairdresser for 10 years there, and I normally don't trust anyone else with the blonde, took a chance and it was amazing! My color looks fabulous and it was exactly what I wanted!! Definitely a place to go!!!! I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Chicago!!!!

49.description: I had a great experience here. I would assume that my hair is pretty easy to cut. It's long and straight and I usually just get a trim. However, I thought Coco did a great job. She got rid of all my dead ends and suggested adding in some long layers. My hair looks healthy and I can tell she did a much better job than the last haircut I received. I gave this salon 4 stars instead of 5 because my old salon gave head massages and this one doesn't. I'll definitely be back. Also, getting an appointment was super easy.

40.description: Jessica was my hair stylist here and was really great! Very knowledgable and terrific personality!

53.description: After having a pretty miserable experience at another neighborhood salon that I had been going to for years, I looked to Yelp for direction. I called A & S and was scheduled with Bridget. She was fabulous; she understood what I was looking for, took time reviewing the photos that I had brought, and asked questions to fill in any gaps (because I know I'm not very salon-vocab savvy). I'll definitely be seeing her again, and I highly recommend her!

30.description: I've been coming to this salon for about 4 years, my person was Guy. When he left I bounced around different stylist and then I came across Yana. I love her! She understands what a light dust off the ends means (I'm trying to let my hair grow). My hair was slightly brittle due to cold weather, and I walked out with soft luscious hair. Thanks Yana!

46.description: I have been going to Art + Science for about a year now and I have never been disappointed. I go to Bridget for my color and she is absolutely amazing. I went in not knowing what to do and she gave me the most beautiful ombre. I get comments on how pretty my hair is weekly with people wanting to know my secret for such a great color. I like to think I am a walking billboard for her dye jobs! Bridget will never settle until you are happy with your color. She is also super personable and genuinely cares about you and your opinions. I have never met such an amazing colorist and I will never let anyone besides her dye my hair again!

1.description: I came in today Saturday around 2:00 pm to see if I could get a haircut, the lady in the front desk (the one with short hair and an earring in her nose) welcomed me with a very upsetting face and rude attitude. I simple asked if walk ins were welcome and with a very despicable tone of voice she answered me with a "YES BUT WE ARE ALL BUSY"  then I asked her if maybe I should wait or come back later and she looked at me from head to toe badly and again very rude tone of voice she said they were all busy by the rest of the day and I just come another day or call for an appointment !!" She didn't even say thank you for coming , good bye or we are sorry no body is available. Poor costumer service!!! What a rude welcoming , that makes me have a bad feeling about the salon in general. I'm afraid the stylists might be the same.  I will definitely never go there again! Sometimes the owners forget that the ladies helping in the front desk are the face of the salon too!

55.description: Love my new haircut! This is my first time visiting and I couldn't be happier. My stylist, Jo was amazing. I was hesitant at first because of how much I was cutting off but Jo walked me through every step and was cool with answering my (many) questions. I will definitely be back again. Thanks Jo!

9.description: I. LOVE. This salon. I came in to refresh my color (I'm currently rocking a grey bang) and Ivan was able to take care of me, no drama, and the color came out not only gorgeous but EXACTLY the way I wanted. He really listened to me, which I appreciated. I was blown out by Andy who was WONDERFUL, asked me how I blew my hair out, what products I wanted, and gave one of the best blowouts I've ever received. She also seemed to have a real understanding of my texture (her hair is naturally straight) and listened to all of my instructions. I left the salon with big, fluffy, beautifully colored hair and happy as a lark. Lol

26.description: I have been going to Art and Science in Wicker Park for about a year and a half now. I at first saw Vanessa, but upon her leaving the salon I was transferred/recommended to see Jana. I just saw Jana for the first time last week for a cut and there is no way I would see anyone else!  The best part of a cut with Jana is she takes the time to listen to what you want, your hesitations about cuts (if you've ever had a bad cut im sure you come in with some worries), and talks honestly about what she thinks will look best. In addition, as she's cutting she asks for your opinion to be sure that the cut is spot on. FINALLY- I told her that I am awful at styling my own hair, and she offered to make another appointment with her and I could come in and she could teach me a bunch of different ways to style my hair. She's so friendly and great. I have continued to get my hair colored with Susan. I cant say enough good things about her. She's amazing!

25.description: Art + Science was the second salon I tried after moving to Chicago in 2014. The fashion-forward Logan-Square-esque vibe of the place appealed to me, so I decided to try it out.Seven is my hairstylist.  Ready to make a change, I requested a lob that would emphasize the semi-wavy texture of my hair.  I also wanted bangs back. She asked me a few follow-up questions, and ended up giving me one of the best haircuts I've ever received.  Seven was great at helping me to figure out what I wanted and at working with my round-ish face shape, hair texture, and concerns about maintenance [I like low-maintenance hair]. She also offered free bang trims between cuts, which is great.  The price is good for Chicago as well.  I've been coming to her for several months now, and I'll continue to do so.

12.description: Mitra is the best! She gave me an amazing bang, and I thought a bang would never look good on me, but she proved it wrong. It came out excellent and gave me some amazing layers. Highly recommended!

59.description: I have tried all the usual Men's haircut outfits around Chicago, paid anywhere from $15 to $75 in search of a guaranteed great cut every time I sat down in the chair.  Needless to say, that was a challenge.  Several years ago I was lucky enough one day to stumble upon Katie who now works in Art + Science's barbershop division.  I followed her from a less expensive men's only haircut place to Art + Science and happily pay the small up charge as the venue itself is super clean, fun and friendly.  When you find something (or someone) this good where you know exactly what you're going to get every time, exactly how you want it, you don't let that go.  Ladies, send your men to see Katie.  Dudes, go see Katie if you have been on the hunt for awhile.  You won't be disappointed.

21.description: Seven at Art + Science is amazing. She's been cutting my hair for several years, which means she's given layers & texture to my very long hair, chopped that into a mid-length bob, and, most recently, given me an asymmetrical pixie. In short, she can do anything! I appreciate how she really listens to my nonsensical descriptions and then runs it back to ensure we're on the same page before she goes to work. She's forthright and helpful about what can work with my hair and what can't, which I find invaluable. I think that's why I leave loving each haircut more than the last. Seven will rock your hair's world!

17.description: Typically, I absolutely dread hair cuts.   After passing Art+Science and then seeing it make the Chicagoist "The 8 Best Hair Salons In Chicago" list, I thought I would give it a go. I am so happy and relieved to have found such a fantastic salon! From the front desk to the shampoo girl, everyone was friendly and welcoming. There was great music and they offered tea, coffee, etc. Good vibes from start to finish. I had my hair colored by Susan. I cannot say enough wonderful things about her. She is fabulous! It is clear from the moment you meet her she is truly passionate about her career. I wasn't exactly sure of what to do with my hair, so she took a lot time to consult me about my options, what i wanted from my color and what she thought would be best.. My resulted hair color has far exceeded my expectations. It is very complimentary to my complexion and eye color. I have received compliments from all my co-workers, friends and family.  I love my new color and have already scheduled my next appointment with Susan. My color was followed by a cut with Seven. She also exceeded my expectations. She gave me a great cut that I have been able to manage well on my own. I love it!Thanks A+S for a great experience, I look forward to my next visit!

10.description: I have gotten my color and cuts done at Art + Science for some time now. I started going because I knew Jo who works at the Evanston location from a previous job. She does an awesome job cutting! I am pretty picky about my cut and she gets what I want every time. She is always professional and meticulous. I don't think I could ever have someone else cut my hair! I would highly recommend her for for detailed hair cuts and mens cuts. I was recommended to see Elvis for color. I had been going to another salon for color and they were not getting what I wanted at all. On the first visit to see Elvis, he totally got what I wanted and I was really happy with the color. I have since seen him a few more times and every time it turns out great! I have worked in a couple salons before in reception and have worked alongside a lot of stylist, Elvis totally has natural talent and has an understanding of color that not all stylist have. I highly recommend Elvis and Jo!

5.description: Made an appt for cut and color by phone. She called later to confirm and to take credit card since it was my first time there. I just trekked all the way out here - it's -15 wind chill - and they don't have my appt in the computer. Seriously? After talking to someone at your place TWICE about it? Figure it out, Art + Science. Won't be coming back if you can't even book appointments correctly.

3.description: Obsessed with my haircut from Art + Science. I picked the salon because of its reviews and Yelpers did not lead me astray! I noticed that Tara had great reviews, so I called and made an appointment. She gave me exactly the cut I was looking for, but took into consideration my hair type and how I style it. She also straightened it for me (which is no easy task, since I have a full head of curly hair). Lastly, she recommended a Bumble and Bumble product which I love. I'm hooked and I'll definitely be coming back to Art + Science in the future - especially since I was given a coupon for my next visit!An important thing to note: Street parking is limited and metered, so give yourself a little extra time if you're driving.

35.description: This review is for Rob Reyes - he's truly a master hairstylist and the best and what he does. Love my cut!

19.description: Moving to Chicago, I had to find a hair place for a trim/refresh. Art + Science has great reviews and decent prices so it seemed like a safe bet.Hannah shampooed, cut and styled my hair. I loved everything she did. I also love that she did everything from start to finish vs. some salons where different people handle different parts of the process. She was nice, friendly and did a great job.The space is more hipster-y. I hadn't been up to Wicker Park in this area but since the entire block was similar, it made sense.I'll be coming back here for my haircuts. I don't do anything fancy, just like to maintain the length but keep the hair healthy.

28.description: I loved my haircut!

45.description: Moving to Chicago, I had to find a hair place for a trim/refresh. Art + Science has great reviews and decent prices so it seemed like a safe bet.Hannah shampooed, cut and styled my hair. I loved everything she did. I also love that she did everything from start to finish vs. some salons where different people handle different parts of the process. She was nice, friendly and did a great job.The space is more hipster-y. I hadn't been up to Wicker Park in this area but since the entire block was similar, it made sense.I'll be coming back here for my haircuts. I don't do anything fancy, just like to maintain the length but keep the hair healthy.

33.description: I tried this one in December via Groupon which once said It was good and a must try.On the paper, it looked good even though I prefer barbershop than "fashion" salon.Well, it was only on the paper...- check-in: hostess busy and don t look at you kindly,- A bit noisy and you keep your coat with you,- Timing: perfect !- Staff member was nice unlike the check-in staff,- She took my coat and put it near the floor surrounded by hair...(no hanger)- shampoo was fast and not something exciting...- cut was fast and my ears hurt."Art and Science", to me it's "Fart & Silence", sorry I pass.Ben

43.description: It would be great if they had someone who can do brown people hair. I have natural curls that are really easy to manage (conditioner & finger comb that's it!) and once in a while I would like to get it styled. Except I can't find a single place that employs someone who has the skill to even try. I came here a couple months ago, asked if they had anyone who can do curly hair and they immediately said no and continued about their business. I live down the street from here and it's a shame I can't contribute to a local business.

2.description: Mitra cut my hair yesterday and she's awesome. The consultation gave me confidence. We talked about my wants, her thoughts, and made a plan. We had good conversation during the cut. And I love my new hair -- it's is doing exactly what I'd hoped it would do. I'll definitely be back to see Mitra again.   I can't comprehend why I ever went anywhere else for a haircut. A+S is the best from start to finish. If you want a great haircut and to feel valued as a customer, this is the best place.

18.description: I am NEVER coming back to this place ever again. I was told that to get the blonde ombre I wanted it would take a few sessions because my hair was jet black and that would be a process. (Totally understandable, I get it.) Stephanie worked on my hair and when she talked about ombres/bayalages it seemed like she knew what she was doing. I had RANDOM streaks of brown in my hair, and there were patches of brown and black horizontally like they were horizontal stripes. I was not happy. They told me to come in for a 2nd session and I wasn't going to be charged, thought it would be better and we talked more about ombres and how they looked like, after being told I was wrong I felt tension and not good vibes. At the end it was the SAME thing after the second session only the streaks that she bleached were lighter. VERY DISAPPOINTED that I spent $140 to have random streaks in my hair, I've had to wear my hair in a pony tail. Even over July 4th, I felt very ugly because of my hair. I gave it a 1 star because the lady who washed my hair was very nice but that's about it. I posted a before and after picture also to show how horrible it was.

41.description: Steer clear of this salon! My mother had gorgeous hair and was looking to get her hair permed to curls. I called in on her behalf and was told that she needed to go in for a consultation first. We made the appointment and also took pictures with us of the "look" she wanted. The consultation lasted an approximate 5 minutes and we where told that her hair would look fabulous as they could get the exact curl she wanted. We set up another appointment and came in to get my mother's hair permed to tight curls. The experience was beyond horrific. Curl rods where placed in her hair, and she was left seated for a good 45 minutes with about one check up from the stylist. They then proceeded to remove the rods. I was standing next to her during this time and saw no kind of curl forming as the rods where removed. I saw the faces of both hairstylist removing them and they seemed to be questioning what was happening amongst themselves but assuredly said "beautiful curls". Halfway through the process my mother took her hair into her hands and began to panic. I also touched her hair...I was HORRIFIED. Her hair had NO CURLS and her hair was ELASTIC. She began crying. She was taken to the styling chair where the stylist STEVE took a diffuser and told her the curls where there even though there where NO CURLS. My mom was in TEARS. AND WHAT DID THE STYLIST STEVE DO???? HE WENT BACK AND LAUGHED IT OFF WITH OTHER CUSTOMERS AND STYLISTS!!!!! my mother's hair was destroyed and burned. She had to recruit to wearing wigs. She had to cut her hair completely off as it was destroyed to the roots. To this day, her hair is not the same. To this day we are working on a lawsuit against this salon for all the damages, expenses, and troubles (both physical and psychological) that my mom suffered. Beware....This place will ruin your hair. I must make this known to the public and customers. It doesn't deserve a star..it deserves to be closed down!!!!

52.description: I can't stand hipsters or wicker park. Wasn't sure what to expect other than indifference and high prices. I was certainly proven an ass by making that assumption. Staff were very attentive, the space is beautifully maintained, and my stylist, Katie, was amazing! $45 for a shampoo and phenomenal cut. One of the best I've had. I'll be back when I'm in town again.

50.description: Jessica did an incredible job cutting my hair! She really listened to what I wanted and gave me a great cut for a very reasonable price ($55). Also, she suggested some products for my hake without being overly pushy. She is a sweetheart! Will definitely be back!

4.description: Art + Science was the second salon I tried after moving to Chicago in 2014. The fashion-forward Logan-Square-esque vibe of the place appealed to me, so I decided to try it out.Seven is my hairstylist.  Ready to make a change, I requested a lob that would emphasize the semi-wavy texture of my hair.  I also wanted bangs back. She asked me a few follow-up questions, and ended up giving me one of the best haircuts I've ever received.  Seven was great at helping me to figure out what I wanted and at working with my round-ish face shape, hair texture, and concerns about maintenance [I like low-maintenance hair]. She also offered free bang trims between cuts, which is great.  The price is good for Chicago as well.  I've been coming to her for several months now, and I'll continue to do so.

6.description: I went in yesterday for a haircut. I have long curly hair. The stylist was nice, but honestly all I did was cut a trim. (4 inches) Nothing spectacular, I was charged 55 dollars. 55 dollars and I left outta there with my hair wet. I was so disappointed. That's just entirely too much for a trim. I didn't even get my hair dried.  I usually go to silk style salon, I just always forget to book the appointments ahead of time. The stylist are amazing. I recommend Caroline, she's awesome with curly hair! And you definitely won't pay 55 for just a trim.

22.description: I enjoyed my stylist, Hannah - she was down-to-earth and did a great job with the cuts. But the color I got was lacking - it looks like several strands are not evenly colored. Great location. Cool place without being too snobby feeling. I am moving, so I will not be returning.

15.description: Coco did my hair and I absolutely LOVE it!! I was here my first time over the weekend just wanting a trim but changed my mind literally 5 seconds before cutting my hair. My hair was long and I went for a long/medium assymmetrical bob and Coco did fantastic! She knew what I wanted. She styled my hair exactly like the photo I showed her. Get your haircut here! I left the salon feeling like a totally different person! ;)

57.description: I have been on the lookout for a good stylist for the last THREE YEARS! I have tried many many places and it resulted in pure hatred towards all the salons. Thank god i decided to give art + science a try! Jessica cut my hair and honestly I don't remember it looking as good as it does now. She was super helpful, informative and fun to talk to. I am totally coming back.I took my mom with me as well- she was in the same situation as me- Seven did her hair and she keeps praising the haircut everyday.I'm giving them 4 out of 5 only because of the receptionist- she seems like she's bored with her life- never looked up from her computer to ask if we need any help when we walked in, never offered us anything to drink. Maybe she just had a bad day, who knows.

20.description: I. LOVE. This salon. I came in to refresh my color (I'm currently rocking a grey bang) and Ivan was able to take care of me, no drama, and the color came out not only gorgeous but EXACTLY the way I wanted. He really listened to me, which I appreciated. I was blown out by Andy who was WONDERFUL, asked me how I blew my hair out, what products I wanted, and gave one of the best blowouts I've ever received. She also seemed to have a real understanding of my texture (her hair is naturally straight) and listened to all of my instructions. I left the salon with big, fluffy, beautifully colored hair and happy as a lark. Lol

36.description: I've been coming here for over 3 years and am a loyal client of Shana. Hands down the best colorist I have ever had. I recently moved to St. Louis and am planning a trip back up to Chicago next month to get my touch up done! It's not everyday you find a stylist who is worth that trip! :)

14.description: I have very fine, curly hair, around 2b/2c that goes past my shoulders. I do a low-poo routine for my hair - I'm not strict curly girl method. I like some silicones in my hair.After a terrible experience with another salon, I decided to try Art and Science. I was able to get an appointment about a week after I made the call (don't try to walk in, they're pretty busy).I asked for a curly hair specialist, and Mitra was my stylist. I feel like she did a really good job. She did not do a dry cut for my hair like many curly haired people prefer, but she was really good at estimating how my hair would react when wet. Mitra then used the Bumble and Bumble Don't Blow It hair product on my hair because I mentioned how I used minimal products and air dried. This is a silicone product, Amodimethicone being the main -cone, but WOW, this stuff makes my hair curly and bouncy. She did diffuse my hair in order to help it dry, but she did so gently. The end result was a bit poofier than it normally is, but I really liked the general shape. it's been about a month since I had my hair cut from her and I am very pleased still with the shape. It's not poofy at all, and every time I look in the mirror with it down, I'm just shocked at how well my curls are defined. i ended up buying the bumble and bumble Don't Blow It and I love it in my hair. It does not weight my hair down, it adds a lot of bounce and curl, too. And it doesn't feel like there is really anything in my hair, like other products.On top of all that, Mitra was very pleasant to talk to. I get anxiety around salons because finding a good curly hair stylist is unpleasant to say the least, but I felt really comfortable around Mitra and am happy that I found her.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring

3.description: After Lisa was the florist for my sister's February 2011 wedding, I just HAD to book her for my June 2012 wedding.  She did not let me down and did a WONDERFUL job on the floral for my wedding as well. I couldn't have been happier with Lisa, not only is she a pleasure to work with, she is very creative and has great floral ideas. Since I don't know a lot about flowers, I gave Lisa some preferences and she used her talents to create gorgeous bouquets for both my bridesmaids and I as well as the centerpieces at the reception.I highly recommend using Lisa at Color and Company for all of your floral needs!

1.description: A friend sent a bouquet of flowers to me after I commented on how cool the arrangements were that they have at Little Goat.  Lisa is awesome!  She delivered the bouquet to my doorstep and the flowers are gorgeous.  I can fully understand why Little Goat has her do their arrangements.

2.description: Lisa is the best florist in Chicago! She recently did my wedding (held at Sepia) and I was blown away. Her floral design was like nothing I'd ever seen, yet exactly what I wanted. I don't know ANYTHING about flowers or floral terminology, but through our conversations Lisa was able to grasp my very limited vision and run with it. The result was so beautiful! You can tell that Lisa really puts her heart into what she does. As a bride, it's so comforting to know that you don't have to worry or micro-manage your vendors. You can certainly trust Lisa to give you what you want and more!

0.description: I really loved working with Lisa for our wedding! She is like family to me and worked with me to realize my vision. I did NOT want "balls" of flowers...and she definitely made that happen. I nearly melted when I saw our reception room...THE CANDLES! Beautiful. She was as great friend throughout the process and I love her like family. Thank you Lisa!

4.description: There isn't  a Florist in the City of Chicago that could compare to Liza! She is truly a professional! Liza provided us with such great service and such amazing unique flowers and centerpieces for our wedding. It was magical because of her touch.  Her work is AMAZING!! She is AMAZING! You can't go wrong with Color & Company.. My Husband learned to appreciate the beauty of flowers and admire the work of a real professional!Maritza

58.description: I really liked this salon.  It was very clean and nicely decorated and the price is better than most salons you will find in the city.  Melissa did a great job on my highlights and I would definitely go back again.

56.description: I thought my hair was hopeless. I'd abused it so much with chlorine, swim caps, pulling it back in ponytails/buns for marathon training, that I literally had a line of breakage around my head. Disgusting.Given that Great Clips is my normal stylist (and knowing that they couldn't fix this mess), I jumped on the Rue La La deal to 4 elements. And I'm so glad I did.Rebecca was an absolute delight and did an amazing job with my poor damaged hair. After studying my strands, and listening to me plead not to cut it all off, she managed to salvage my hair AND keep it past shoulder length. It looks fabulous, and I can't speak highly enough of her and the fantastic job she did. Basia did a great job with my manicure, though I did manage to chip it a day later. But I'm sure that was from swimming, bootcamp class, and softball practice. There's a reason I don't get my nails done.Everyone at the salon was extremely welcoming and friendly, and offered advice afterwards on hair products, etc. (without trying to sell me on anything).I think I may pay for a real haircut like a big girl from now on.  And 4 elements will be the place.

29.description: I went to Rebecca for a cut and color and she did a wonderful job! My regular stylist couldn't fit me in and since I live close to 4 Elements, I thought I'd check it out. Rebecca did a better job -  I will be returning for sure!

42.description: If you want your hair to be cut by someone who knows better than you, go to Rebecca! If you want someone to cut a year worth of hair growth without being asked to do it, book Rebecca! If you want to spend months loking at yourself with disgust in a mirror, schedule an appointment with Rebecca today!I was in need for a haircut and couldn't go to the usual stylist I go to so I went to 4 Elements salon, which could acommodate me.I explained to Rebecca I wanted a round bob. She convinced me that for my face shape square bob would work better. I agreed, but told her I still want it to be a bob, and minimal layers (only at the ends).We ended up with short hair, not a bob. Mind me, I went there with hair past shoulder lenght, 15 inches. I ended up with yucky 3 inches layers on top, and the rest of my hair 5-6 inches longAlso, she chopped off more on side than another. The haicut doesn't even remotely resemble the one she herself recommended.It wouldn't have been so bad had she kept the lenght longer, as I told her, around jaw line. Mid me, I went there with hair shoulder lenght, so she had plenty to satisfiy her uncontrollable cuttning frenzy and still keep it medium lenght.What is particularily maddening in this whole experience, is that after the job was done she asked me: do you like it? I did not answer; I was speachless processing how can you just chop off a year of hair growth with no respect to what the client wants. Rebecca, however, answered her own question - "well, I think it's kind of cute". I am so happy you're pleased, Rebecca, after all it's what matters most.

23.description: Tim is amazing.I have thick, curly, frizzy, difficult hair. I came in yesterday to receive a Brazilian Blowout and a haircut (I was 6 months overdue for a trim). I had an idea for what I wanted my hair to look like and I showed Tim some pictures for inspiration.Not only did my hair turn out EXACTLY like the pictures, Tim was a delight for the 3.5 hours I sat in his chair getting everything done. He was so fun to talk with and the best part is that he TAUGHT me the correct way I should be blow drying, flat ironing, and curling my hair. I have been to many, many high end salons and never have I had a stylist actually teach me how to do my hair at home!I will for sure be back and you know without a doubt I will be scheduling my appt with Tim.

47.description: I've finally found my go-to salon in the city, and go-to hair dresser.  It's out of the way of the hectic downtown areas, yet still close to the city, and street parking is fairly easy to find.  Prices are reasonable.  The atmosphere is relaxing but clean and well run.  Front desk staff is really nice, as are everyone else I encountered.The best part for me was my stylist, Tim.  I almost don't want to talk him up even more than that other yelpers have in fear that he may become too busy!  I went in for partial highlights.  My hair had become pretty saturated with blond and I told Tim that I wanted it to be more natural looking, and a little closer to my natural color.  He did just that, getting the foils close to the roots, and making it look very natural.  However, after it was complete, I felt like it was a bit too toned down.  Tim quickly said that he guarantees his work, and that I could come back for a correction.  I went back, and my highlights are perfect.  I will be back :)

8.description: I got a manicure today and the woman was a delight! She was so kind, gentle and welcoming to me. It was my first time at the salon and I would definitely go back. I had a relaxing and enjoyable visit.

31.description: I started coming here because I moved and it's much closer to where I live. I have gone twice, both times Rebecca cut my hair. Very good job.

34.description: Just went to 4 Elements for the first time.  Everyone is super friendly and nice.   Tim did my cut and color and I'm very happy with the way it turned out (and I'm picky!) He took the time to show me how to blow dry and style my somewhat unruly hair.  Knowing what other salons charge for similar services I would say 4 Elements is a also a good value.

16.description: Tim is amazing.I have thick, curly, frizzy, difficult hair. I came in yesterday to receive a Brazilian Blowout and a haircut (I was 6 months overdue for a trim). I had an idea for what I wanted my hair to look like and I showed Tim some pictures for inspiration.Not only did my hair turn out EXACTLY like the pictures, Tim was a delight for the 3.5 hours I sat in his chair getting everything done. He was so fun to talk with and the best part is that he TAUGHT me the correct way I should be blow drying, flat ironing, and curling my hair. I have been to many, many high end salons and never have I had a stylist actually teach me how to do my hair at home!I will for sure be back and you know without a doubt I will be scheduling my appt with Tim.

13.description: I have been going to Four Elements for many years now. I love this place. Ricky is masterful. Since going red 4 1/2 years ago, people that I meet all think I'm a natural redhead. I always say, "What God didn't give me, Ricky does!" Sara does an awesome job with nails and waxing. My manny's with her last a good week. I have recommended friends to go here and all have been happy they did.

11.description: Alexis did a wonderful job with my haircut, was easy to talk to and really listened to what I wanted. I also had a relaxing express pedicure with Claudia who did a great job and suggested a good color combination for my polish. As a newcomer to the area I was happy to find this gem on my first try!

39.description: Loved it. I was visiting Chicago for my birthday and purchased the yelp deal prior to my arrival. I received the manicure and pedicure. I cannot remember the young lady's name but, she was excellent. Very meticilous and careful with my nails. All of the staff was very courteous and nice to me during my visit. My friend loved it as well. She raved about the eyebrow wax. I will definitely return to this spa whenever I come back to visit Chicago.

37.description: Amazing! Great customer service, great hair! Love Ricky!

0.description: I stopped in last minute today, needing my roots and color done ASAP. I spend a lot of money on spa and salon services throughout the year. I get extensions done regularly, blow outs, color, etc...  I have been very loyal to the person that does my extensions, have not found a good blow out and have been trying to find someone that can get my color right, bouncing between 2 people. I have gone to this salon before for blow outs and trims, but never color. I met Alexis when I walked in and explained my dilemma and what I was looking for. She was able to take me when I walked in, which was a godsend. She took me to her chair and proceeded to ask me more questions to really understand what I was looking for. This was the first time, in a long time, that someone actually gave me a true consultation. As we discussed it more, she was able to understand what I was looking for. Previously, I'm sure I was not articulating it correctly, this is partly my fault and mostly the stylist fault. Part of a stylist job is to consult with you to truly understand what you want. I was reminded of that today and left the salon very happy. I also was pleasantly surprised when I wasn't charged a ridiculous amount, like other places, which added to my positive experience. I could tell that Alexis truly enjoys what she does, she explained the continuous education they do (which was apparent), she walked me through my options and she did an awesome job. She just got a new client!

38.description: Great salon. I was satisfied with my hair cut and highlights for the price I paid with the yelp deal.

51.description: Great massage. Spa/salon a lot nicer than expected for neighborhood. Gave 4 stars instead of 5 because service ran about 10-15 minutes behind.

27.description: I give this place 3 stars as every time I'm in there I have mixed feelings about it.  The staff always seem slow to warm but once you get them going they are ok.  Also they are always behind schedule and you end up waiting a whole 15-20 mins before your appointment starts.  They do, however, carry great products, some of which I can't live without and they always have appointments available in a pinch!

32.description: I've been meaning to post a review for a LONG time but just never got around to it.  Well here I am, 10 months later after my bangs finally grew out.  I saw Rebecca back in February for the second time and wanted an overall trim but still something a little 'different' this time.  I decided I wanted side bangs and expressed to her that my hair has a hard time staying a particular way because it's so straight.  She told me that if she put a shorter layer of bangs under my side bang, it might hold...She completely chopped off my bangs. I was TERRIFIED. My face showed it too. I said "Oh..I wasn't expecting you to cut them that short". And she replied with "Well, it's hair, it will grow out." I was in disbelief and tried to hide my anger. I didn't even know how to feel for the rest of the haircut. I think I almost cried. I had one layer of short bangs way above my eyebrows and another layer of bangs that were supposed to be 'side bangs'. I've never seen this 'look' before and couldn't tell if she even meant to do that or not to my hair.I checked out and paid, and the front desk lady didn't even ask about my service and if I liked me haircut. In fact, she was kind of rude.Needless to say, I will not be going back here.

54.description: I recently enjoyed a spa pedicure at 4 Elements. The team was very professional and courteous. They greeted me as soon as I walked in, took my coat and offered me a beverage. I also saw the esthetician who was great. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is that the brochure said the spa pedicure was supposed to last 90 minutes and excluding the dry time it really only lasted a little over 60 minutes.

48.description: Tim convinced me to color my hair for the first time since college! And I really like it. he did a great job and really took his time with me. Like others said, he definitely educated me also! I had an event in the evening and he stayed late to make sure I was ready - I'll be back! Thanks Tim!

44.description: After reading so many fabulous reviews about Timothy, I had to go check it out myself!  I have never had a set stylist because of location, price or they just didn't listen to what I really wanted!  Timothy has got it ALL!  After setting up an appointment online SPECIFICALLY with Timothy, I got to the Salon and they said I was with a woman stylist.  I said I had specifically requested Timothy because of his great reviews.  I had to wait 30 mins for him to fit me in, but it was well worth the wait!  It was like love at first sight!  Timothy asked so many questions to learn what kind of person I was, what kind of products I use, and what kind of tools I have at home to work with!  He taught me so many things while doing my hair, he even had time to teach me how to curl it in loose waves!  My hair is perfect, the way I had imagined it and I am excited to say I have found my stylist!  Timothy also offers a referral incentive as well as discounted rate for first time customers (if you did not buy the Yelp Deal, which I had!)  EXTRA BONUS!LOVE LOVE LOVE!  Two thumbs up for Tim!!

24.description: I like Johanna.  She has cut my hair three times now and has done what I asked for and more.  I have long, very straight hair and wanted her to cut it so it curls a little on it's own or is easy to curl with rollers or a curling iron.  After she does her magic all I have to do is spray some curling spray into it and it has nice body.  When I actually curl it , it's amazing!

7.description: I had such a great experience at this salon! I came in not knowing at all what I wanted to do with my hair...just wanting a change. Alexis was awesome! I ended up getting a cut and color (the color was a last-minute decision and I'm so glad I did it!). I honestly have never been so happy with a haircut. Alexis walked me through how to easily style my hair (which is helpful for someone like me who doesn't always have the patience/time to style). She was also extremely patient with me as we figured out together exactly what I wanted to do with my hair. The salon was also very nice and my cut/color was very reasonably priced! I will definitely be going back for my next haircut!

49.description: I got a yelp deal for 4 elements salon, & made an appointment with Tim, for a color and cut.  I was ecstatic, & got a wealth of education while I was there.  I will definitely be back!

40.description: Timothy was awesome.  After seeing the same woman in Las Vegas for 9 years, I was reluctant to get a cut (and a bang trim) in my new home.  After extensive review searching, I made an appointment with Tim specifically, and couldn't have been happier! Extremely welcoming staff, and I will definitely be back for some highlights soon!

53.description: I finally found my girl!  Melissa was great.  Awesome color and cut.  Relatively affordable salon with a great atmosphere.I'll definitely be back.-Happy client

30.description: I started going here because it is so close to my house.  Everyone is very accommodating and friendly.  Ashley color's my hair and love the color.  Agnes cuts it, I get so many compliments on the cut.  My husband and step son's go to Ricky.  This is a great salon that is very accommodating and has a stylist for all!!

46.description: Good quality highlights. I liked my girl, but ended up being charged additional money because the girl apparently put in more foils than usual for a partial, which I never asked for nor was I told she was doing that.  Disappointed I had to pay additional money for something I never requested.

1.description: Fernando is the absolute best! He's honestly a hair genius that gets it. I really wanted to try a subtle Balayage look, but was afraid of adding to much blonde . Fernando not only conquered the look but made a plan for my hair to grow out perfectly and stay healthy.  This is my first Yell review ever! I just think other women should know that Fernando is THE guy for highlights in the city!

55.description: I needed to find a new stylist as my old one had stopped doing hair.  I made an appt at 4 Elements because it was convenient with location and time and had some great Yelp reviews.  I was not displeased.  My appointment with Rebecca was wonderful.  I got a cut and color.  She was knowledgeable about color and style and made some great suggestions.  A week later, I love it even more than when I left the salon.  Rebecca took the time to look at my hair, discuss color and cut options and what would work best for what I had going on.  She gave me what was right for me.  Another note, the salon itself is small, elegant and relaxing.  I'm looking forward to trying their massage services with my next cut.  Thanks Rebecca...Great Job!!!

9.description: Done my ombre hair color with Tim, he is super nice and knowledgeable. And the price is not high!He doesn't push product!!

26.description: Ask for Tim!  He is the best!I've went to many high end salons in the chicago area (Michael Anthony, Sean Patricks, Mixed Co, act... the list goes on) and this is the best salon in Chicago.Tim gives a consultation and listens to what you want. He also asks you about your hair care and gives you helpful tips.  He will not fry your hair like many other stylists do to clients who want highlights. I had a great experience here and will be making this my regular salon.  My search has ended!

25.description: Rebecca is the best! She is very friendly and easy to talk to. I had one up-do and one blow out/style. The up-do was better than the picture I showed her so I was very pleased! I received so many compliments at my friend's wedding. My blow out/style was ok...I expected a little more volume but still liked it. I will definitely be back.

12.description: Today was my first time here and I loved it. I called in the morning and they squeezed me in right away, adjusted my mani/ pedi to "express" so that my appointment would not interfere with the next appointment. This was not a problem for me, I actually thought it was a very considerate of them for the clients. My mani/ pedi was with Sarah and she was really great. I enjoyed every minute chatting with her and she did a great job. The entrance to the salon is where people can get their hair done and then you go through a glass door to the serene spot where im guessing all the other spa services are performed. It was really relaxing, as opposed to places that are all connected and you end up leaving with a headache from all the noise. I will definitely be going back for more services!

59.description: I had driven by this place several times so I decided to go on Yelp and check it out.  I saw nothing but great reviews.  I needed a haircut so why not try it?!  It was a great decision and I am now among the many Yelpers raving about 4 Elements.My appointment was with Tim.  He's great!  He actually explained everything he was doing and why he was doing.  I was getting my hair colored and a much needed hair cut.  He explained the different types of color options and what each means for my hair.  We decided on what was best for me and future hair plans I had.  He also showed me how to blow-dry my hair and how to curl it.  Neither of which I'd ever officially been shown.  It's now much easier to style my hair and takes no time at all.My color turned out great and the cut is awesome.  I definitely have a new hair home with 4 Elements.  It's not outrageously priced like some of the other salons in the city.  I beleive you get more than you pay for.  It's small and you get personal attention.  I felt like I mattered and so did my hair.  I'm telling all my friends about it.

21.description: Hair by Tim...now, go see him!

17.description: I had the WORST experience ever. I went for a brazilian wax with Sara as purchased a groupon. As I stepped in, The receptionist redeemed my groupon and I was guided to one of the spa rooms and Sara asked to undress so she can do the brazilian. Then she comes in the room and says that they cannot honor the groupon price since I am not a first time client and to proceed I will have to pay an extra 35$ on top of 30$ paid for the groupon. I found the attitude and behavior of Sara very disrespectful and unprofessional that I am never going to go to that salon ever. They could have told me about this before asking me to undress. It is so RUDE and indecent.  I live in the same community so have used them for some of the services before but from my experience last nite, it was certainly my last visit. I dont think this business is worth my single penny. They really need to work hard on their customer dealing especially in this highly competitive Chicago market.

10.description: Went here for body services (not hair) and was very impressed. Been going to the same person for almost 10 years, and after she had switched salons for the 4th time I decided I was done and needed to find a spot more convenient for me instead of her. Their ad on Milwaukee Avenue has 25% off for first time customers, so I checked it out and will continue to go back. The salon is well designed, clean, and modern. There is no pressure to buy "extras" like products, and there's a nice selection of coffee, teas, etc. while you wait. Top notch and excatly what I look for in a Chicago salon.

5.description: My favorite salon! Maggie is the best and always knows what great things to do with my hair even when I'm not entirely sure what to do. I always walkout feeling like a million bucks! Easily the best salon in Chicago, certainly the best in River West. Also the prices are way more reasonable than any other salon in the area.

3.description: I've been coming here since the salon opened; loved it then and love it now. I followed my esthetician here from another salon since Iryna works magic on my bushy eyebrows.They carry one of the best skin care lines (Yonka) I've ever used. I was also able to find a wonderful stylist, Timothy, whom I've been going to for at least 6 years now. He does a great job with my hair cuts and color and always leaves me laughing. This salon is like one of my second homes in the neighborhood and if it wouldn't seem weird, I'd probably go in there to hang out even when I didn't have appointments. The fire place and refreshments make it easy to get comfortable while waiting for your color to process.

35.description: I'm writing this one on behalf of my mom :--)  My brothers and I sent her to 4 Elements for a pedicure and foot massage. She came back feeling like more than royalty. Thanks 4 Elements!

19.description: I thought my hair was hopeless. I'd abused it so much with chlorine, swim caps, pulling it back in ponytails/buns for marathon training, that I literally had a line of breakage around my head. Disgusting.Given that Great Clips is my normal stylist (and knowing that they couldn't fix this mess), I jumped on the Rue La La deal to 4 elements. And I'm so glad I did.Rebecca was an absolute delight and did an amazing job with my poor damaged hair. After studying my strands, and listening to me plead not to cut it all off, she managed to salvage my hair AND keep it past shoulder length. It looks fabulous, and I can't speak highly enough of her and the fantastic job she did. Basia did a great job with my manicure, though I did manage to chip it a day later. But I'm sure that was from swimming, bootcamp class, and softball practice. There's a reason I don't get my nails done.Everyone at the salon was extremely welcoming and friendly, and offered advice afterwards on hair products, etc. (without trying to sell me on anything).I think I may pay for a real haircut like a big girl from now on.  And 4 elements will be the place.

28.description: Have been getting my hair cut by Rebecca since last summer, and I have no complaints. It's a short cut, styled beautifully. She takes her time and does not chop away mindlessly. She considers your face and color and what will look good.  If you are clear about what you want, she'll do it. Would recommend her to my friends. Compared to the $70 the Logan Square salon was charging, this is the same cut for half. And she dries and styles it, something the LS salon didn't want to do - yes, she told me to go natural. Honey, I don't pay someone $70 to go natural.

45.description: Bought a yelp deal to go to an esthetician. Cleanest wax I've ever experienced. They are extremely thorough and they use the best wax available. My esthetician was super knowledgeable about what she was doing and never hesitated to answer any questions. She made me feel pretty comfortable.Also got a manicure. The lady was pretty thorough as well. She took her time to make sure everything was well done. I would go again if I could afford doing this every month! The yelp deal definitely helped out but only for first-time customers.

33.description: I asked to go darker from a over-processed bad decision of caramel highlights.  Although my natural color is dark brown, I asked to go lighter than my natural.  When I came out, I was transformed into a gothic chick--dark BLACK.  I hated it but the ladies at the front desk insisted that it looked good.  Needless to say, I had it fixed at a different location shortly after.  Staff not very accommodating.  Will not recommend

43.description: Timothy is a Rockstar!!

2.description: I think this salon has the foundations of being great  with a beautiful space and fantastic product lines lines like my beloved Oribe, but my manicure and pedicure were so strange. I really liked my technician, I think her name was Sarah, but I've never had a manicure or pedicure where they don't apply a basecoat when using regular nail polish. I think everyone knows that if you apply polish directly to the nail, it will show ridges and appear super super thin! It won't have a glossy richness or smooth appearance. That's what happened here, and the polish I chose from CND was a classic blue red but it was a manicure I could've done at home for free. I paid $60 for my mani and pedi excluding tip. I wouldn't go back.  what a disappointment.

18.description: I've been meaning to post a review for a LONG time but just never got around to it.  Well here I am, 10 months later after my bangs finally grew out.  I saw Rebecca back in February for the second time and wanted an overall trim but still something a little 'different' this time.  I decided I wanted side bangs and expressed to her that my hair has a hard time staying a particular way because it's so straight.  She told me that if she put a shorter layer of bangs under my side bang, it might hold...She completely chopped off my bangs. I was TERRIFIED. My face showed it too. I said "Oh..I wasn't expecting you to cut them that short". And she replied with "Well, it's hair, it will grow out." I was in disbelief and tried to hide my anger. I didn't even know how to feel for the rest of the haircut. I think I almost cried. I had one layer of short bangs way above my eyebrows and another layer of bangs that were supposed to be 'side bangs'. I've never seen this 'look' before and couldn't tell if she even meant to do that or not to my hair.I checked out and paid, and the front desk lady didn't even ask about my service and if I liked me haircut. In fact, she was kind of rude.Needless to say, I will not be going back here.

41.description: I went to Rebecca for the first time for a haircut and make-up application, and I couldn't be happier with how both ended up!  I walked in needing a haircut that was low-maintenance, yet still retained some sense of style.  I also wanted to keep my length.  She listened intently, and she worked my hair a bit before washing it.  I absolutely love the style - I'm able to wash & wear it to work, but I can also style it into something nicer.  My make-up job was equally good.  I was attending a daytime event, so I needed something natural, yet more elaborate than what I normally wear during the day.  She explained what she was doing throughout the application, and she checked with me about color selections before applying them.  My make-up ended up looking natural and polished, but not overly done.  Perfect.  I initially made the appointment because it was the only salon anywhere near the West Loop that is open on Sundays, but I definitely will be returning to Rebecca very soon!  Location is perfect - near the blue line and the Kennedy, on Milwaukee Ave.  Prices are very reasonable.  The salon itself is very clean & comfortable.

52.description: LOVED my experience at 4 Elements!!!  Yesterday, I went in for a facial with Kinga and a cut and color with Tim - every bit of the experience was fabulous.  The staff is friendly, the salon is clean (and smells so awesome) and the day spa area is so inviting, I didn't want to leave!  My face is still glowing today from Kinga's facial.  She took the time to analzye my skin and she molded the facial to suit my personal needs which was so helpful.  I was relaxed, my skin was invigorated and Kinga taught me so much more than I knew about my own daily skin care routine.My hair appointment with Tim was just as amazing.  I tend to ignore my hair until the weekends when I just flat iron it to all hell and suffice it to say, my hair has definitely paid the price for my negligence.  Tim not only cleaned my hair up with a simple, stylish cut, but the color he did was perfect.  My hair looks more natural now and he somehow managed to fix my previously botched color job.  He took the time to explain everything he was doing to my hair which was really helpful for someone as hair ignorant as me.  Other amazing aspects of Tim's cut/color: the shampoo and hot towel treatment (to die for!!!) and a little styling lesson to boot!Be prepared for a more expensive salon experience but don't let that shy you away from 4 Elements.  Agnes, the owner, explained all of the pricing so that I felt comfortable with what I was spending.  She promptly replied to my email inquiries which I really value considering so many other salons are impossible to work with via email.Overall, my visit to 4 Elements yesterday really made my weekend!  I've already booked my next appointment and I have definitely found my new salon!

50.description: I really enjoyed the spa manicure. I bought the yelp deal to use on mani/pedi with my mom for her birthday. They ladies were very nice and pleasant. Nice atmosphere too.

4.description: Best salon ever!!!!   I was referred by a friend and had my hair colored by Agnes, the owner!!!  I had been doing it myself and it was a mess!!  In just a couple of visits my hair feels like hair again!!  I recently had a cut and it was one of the best I have ever had!!!  I am getting a keratin treatment soon and cannot wait!!!

6.description: Best place to go for natural nails and hair services! Ricky did an amazing job turning my bad dye job to a more sophisticated elegant look! Sara's nail art was on point!

22.description: Ricky is great.

15.description: Ask for Tim!  He is the best!I've went to many high end salons in the chicago area (Michael Anthony, Sean Patricks, Mixed Co, act... the list goes on) and this is the best salon in Chicago.Tim gives a consultation and listens to what you want. He also asks you about your hair care and gives you helpful tips.  He will not fry your hair like many other stylists do to clients who want highlights. I had a great experience here and will be making this my regular salon.  My search has ended!

57.description: I went here with a deal I bought on Rue La La.  Now I use Groupon all the time and often businesses are less than happy to see you.  Not here!  Everyone was very gracious and happy.  I had a great manicure with Basia.  I had an amazing haircut and color with Timothy.  I am usually very picky and it's been years since I have had such a great cut.  I love this place and I will definitely be back!

20.description: Tim is fantastic!!!!

36.description: I got the 60-minute massage after a long week and after developing several kinks and knots in my neck and back.  She (jinga or zinga?) was able to work it all out.  Relaxing environment, nice oils.

14.description: I love this place! Everyone is so friendly, professional, and just great at what they do. Sara is a masterful make up artist, I wish she could do my make up every weekend.

3.description: This place has been in the neighborhood since 1984. First as a private club, then with a great Mexican kitchen, and now just a bar. The never ending joke is that "Blanca," from the kitchen, was returning in two weeks. Three years later and I'm still waiting two weeks. With a new face lift, it feels like you're walking in to the Grand & Ogden version of Cheers. Everyone knows your name and if they don't, either the customers or the bartender are sure to ask questions. It's a great after dinner drink place. But I especially like the space for private parties. On occasion, there is a DJ on Fridays. Definitely will be back to have a margarita. Crossing my fingers that I get to order those sweet enchiladas or steak burrito soon!

1.description: I love this little place. When I lived across the street I was there almost every day/night and it's definitely in the category of 'neighborhood bar' but with benefits. Sylvia serves up a mean pozole on Saturdays, not to be missed! There's a pool table and a juke box and an old fashioned bar. The regulars are friendly and if you just want to hang out (or hide out) this is a great place.

2.description: This place is weird. First of all, the boyfriend and I have lived about a block away from it for over 2 years, and we always thought it was either closed, or some kind of private Mexican club or something. Turns out it's neither.We went there  last night for a friend's birthday. She discovered it a while ago and really loves it. It's kind of like a dive bar that happens to be in someone's basement.  The decor is totally strange- a combination of huge paintings of wine bottles, crappy pizza parlor-type tables and chairs, and faux fall foliage. There's a pool table and one tv, which was showing baseball. There is a jukebox, which the boyfriend confirmed had a collection which would be described as 'eclectic' at best: Mexican music, one Clash album, and other random selections.As for the actual bar. . . our friend and her friends were having margaritas, but we just stuck with beer. I honestly can't remember if I even saw a tap, but the selection of bottles was pretty limited, even for a dive. The bf requested something Mexican, so I came back with Dos Equis. Which were $4.50 a piece. Now, I would expect to pay that in a restaurant, but when I'm in a dive bar I really don't like to pay more than $3 for a beer. Maybe it's my fault for ordering a fancy import in the first place, but the other options seemed to be limited to Modelo or Bud Light.We might go back, if we have friends in town who are staying with us or something, since I can't really envision any of our city friends making the trip from Logan Square or something just to go here. It's interesting, that's for sure.

0.description: This place is very welcoming, laid back and casual. I love coming here with a group and hanging out or celebrating birthdays or special occasions. The bartender is very accommodating

58.description: Admission: I go to GREAT lengths to avoid grocery shopping. Takeout, delivery, Peapod, Foodler, leftovers, quick trips to 7-11 for eggs and creamer, random meals composed of things in the pantry. I could go months without a real, honest-to-God grocery excursion. I just hate it, the whole experience. Parking, fighting people with carts, standing in line. To get 10 items it could take an hour and I do not find this efficient. HATE IT! Especially in the winter when I must park 4 miles from my home, lug things up stairs, and for what!? To eat good food. Well, ok...you've got me there. /end rant. So, to sum things up...I'd been trapped. My significant other (who prefers real food) asked me to pick up items for dinner on my way home. Oy. I quickly scanned my options and when left with Dominick's or Jewel, I began to sulk and feel annoyed. Then, I remembered Green Grocer...right next to the Pinky Nails on Grand/Noble that I had walked by many times. Open til 9pm on a Sunday!? Let's do this!Quickly parked right out front (15 minute flasher zone), zipped in...picked up my lot of groceries, paid and was out within 10 minutes. No joke. Praise the lord, I can save face in front of my man (no delivery tonight!) get wonderful food, and get the hell out of here in record time!The bonus? They have a GREAT selection for being so small. Tons of wonderful organic (Gunthorp individual chicken breasts!) and local products (think local bakeries like Bennison's, Delightful Pastries, Fig Catering, etc). I picked up some great bread, cheese, tomato soup (this is as gourmet as it gets for me folks!), cookies, kombucha (tried a new brand that rocked my socks off made in WI), granola and yogurt.. Yes, a tad pricey...but WAY worth it for the quality and ease in getting in and out. The girls were pretty friendly, everything is well stocked and shelved and they have a great little local spirits/beer/wine section. If it's not enough there is a wine store just next door as well. Support local grocery AND save time. I'm in.

56.description: GG is a great place to find fresh, delish food and also to commit yourself to conscious, moral, healthful eating. Yes, its more expensive but you get what you pay for. I never worry about where Green Grocer's food came from or if it will make my family ill. Its like having the farmers' market open and near by all year long. I couldn't feed my family the way that I want to without them.

29.description: Great selection, great service! I love the fact that they have a "free" table in the back just to stop wasting food! I have never been disappointed here and whenever I cannot make it to the farmer's market on Saturday, this is always my go-to spot!

42.description: I've entered into the Promised Land! It overflows with milk, honey, and large succulent grapes the size of eggs! Baskets, crates, boxes full of organically vibrant fruits and vegetables. Shelves bursting with organic goods that would make Whole Foods green with organic envy. Organically made icing on this gluten free cake is its Eco friendliness to my recycled wallet. Before I sit to enjoy my organic meal, I'll bow my head and pray a blessing for the Green Grocer. Amen!Ok ok...I couldn't resist writing the above, and though it may be a bit overboard, I just really wanted to get across that this is really a great local store worth checking out. They have fruits and vegetables that are in season. It's a plus that they are organically grown and brought in locally. They accept credit (min $10) and cash. Anything that is priced above $4 are for items that are really rare and difficult to find anywhere else. The staff is super friendly and available to help out if you have questions, concerns, or just want to be social. Don't be shy about asking about their CSA program. It's a good deal!If your in the area, definately check them out before heading to Whole Foods.

23.description: This place is good in a pinch. I live close by and enjoy the option of buying local. I don't come here regularly but when I do I'm mindful of the prices. Yes it is more expensive but at least I know I'm buying produce good in quality. Fantastic local fair doesn't come cheap. Not to mention they randomly have a mini sale on produce that is about to expire. They have a basket/section of free or cheap items that are about to go bad.  I think it is great that they do that instead of just throwing it out.

47.description: I'm blessed to have a such an awesome store across the street from me. I usually don't cook much at home, but whenever I do, I make a stop here. Also, their craft beer selection is great, better than some places that are twice the size.

8.description: Local and organic items range from spices, wine, beer, spirits, veggie/fruits, meats and cheeses.  A little expensive but noted.  Owners are very nice, other staff could be a little more educated on describing specific items.  All in all, nice and quick store for an in/out run.

31.description: I like this place and go here regularly to support the excellent concept, but 4 1/2 stars is a little much IMO.  To be clear to those who are not familiar, this is more of a specialty store than a full-service grocer.  The space is not large and pretty much everything is locally sourced from IL and surrounding states, so selection of any category of item (produce, for example) can be fairly limited.  If you go there looking for a specific item, you might be disappointed.  Even if they have it in stock, you might not see it on the sale floor for whatever reason.  The owner is extremely friendly, but her hipster employees are much less so.  Prices are very high, which probably is necessary to offset the lack of volume.  That being said, they are excellent at identifying the best local producers.

34.description: Great place for yummy and organic produce! Yogurt, coffee and canned goods are higher priced than mainstream stores like whole foods, but that's ok since you can pick and choose what to get.  Staff is very nice and I'm happy to have this option in my neighborhood.

16.description: Good corner store if we need something in a pinch. This is one of the few places we have found that sells the ONE and ONLY beer I drink...Aria! Very helpful and friendly staff!

13.description: This place is good in a pinch. I live close by and enjoy the option of buying local. I don't come here regularly but when I do I'm mindful of the prices. Yes it is more expensive but at least I know I'm buying produce good in quality. Fantastic local fair doesn't come cheap. Not to mention they randomly have a mini sale on produce that is about to expire. They have a basket/section of free or cheap items that are about to go bad.  I think it is great that they do that instead of just throwing it out.

11.description: 5 stars...although I can't afford to shop at Green Grocer as often as I'd like!  I do love the store, though.  They have a very good selection of various healthy non-perishable shelf products, as well as produce.  Also have some not-so-healthy, but tasty baked goodies and sweets.  They're always a quick walk away for me when in a pinch I need a small quantity of something or other for dinner.  They even have a small section of bulk spices, nuts, grains, and flours which is nice.  I have had really good luck there with avocados in particular.  Although not locally grown of course, they've been the most perfect, beautiful, delicious avocados I've ever bought, which is a refreshing change from the ones I usually buy elsewhere that are all stringy, yucky and black inside!  I definitely recommend Green Grocer and supporting the neighborhood, independent business.  I'd happily shop there a whole lot more if I had disposable income!

39.description: While the prices here can seem a bit high compared to Whole Foods, the convenience and service make it worth the trip. The owner gives off such good vibes that a visit here could probably substitute for a daily dose of prozac. She's seriously nice, and obviously loves her regulars. When you can't face the chaos and stroller demolition derby/parking lot wars of Whole Paycheck, Green Grocer is a godsend. You can find most of your organic essentials here, and usually, a few garden-fresh veggies as well. The bulk bins almost always turn my head with at least one great deal. If you're running late for a dinner party, you can depend on Green Grocer to have an interesting bottle of wine or cool, indie brew of some sort. If you live in River West/Noble Square, this is a neighborhood gem you should know about.

37.description: As holiday gifts, I purchased some of Mama's Nuts.  I realized a few days before heading out of town for the holidays that I needed some more and I saw that the Green Grocer sold them.  The store is smaller, but it's jammed pack with organic goodness and other specialty type of products.  The place had quite a few people in and out and the service was extremely friendly.  I'll hit it up again when not on a mission to really see what they carry.

0.description: I was in the area and had some time to kill before babysitting..why not check out a local shop that sells local products? The Green Grocer is cozy and quaint.  with 2 aisles, it was easy to navigate and they offer a wide variety of products for specialty diets and healthy eaters alike. I ended up buying a lentil salad (with tomatoes, feta cheese, and a lemon olive oil vinaigrette) and a jar of local wildflower honey for under $12. I really enjoy the lentil salad; it was light and flavorful, a nice addition to a summer dinner! The honey has a smooth, clean taste and I was able to recognize the floral flavors more than I expected to which was a pleasant surprise. $5.49 for a 1 lb. jar was a pretty good deal in my book! The staff was friendly and happy to help, the cashier I spoke with offered some suggestions based on what I purchased which I really appreciated! I will definitely stop by Green Grocer again in the near future.

38.description: I love the GG, it's staff, owner and all the delicious food it offers. Sure, it's more expensive than your average grocery store, but what you put in your body is truly what you get out if it. After working in health care, I know that investing in good food is well worth it. Especially when you can support a local business, local residents, and small farmers. This place gives an overall sense of wellness and community!

51.description: I am so happy that I found this store and  thankful to the people who opened it!  You can park right in front w/ your flashers on and get pretty much what you need in 5 minutes or less. Which also means that I can just buy what I need because I didn't have to invest an hour of  time parking and wandering down 20 aisles.   I love that they have fresh organic milk in glass containers, quick and easy premade vegan options, organic produce, etc.  I intend to shop here all the time!

27.description: When I have the money I like this place. They have fantastic local fare but the prices are out of this world! Honestly when I go in, I prefer to check the "free/discount" section of produce in the back as it tends to fit my budget better. The service is good but I just cant see paying the prices.

32.description: Fantastic! There was a wine tasting as soon as I walked in the door, a good variety of organic/local foods and super nice people. I have to say an extra thanks for introducing me to Righteously Raw' Maca Bar  (chocolate bar)! Definitely will be shopping here often!
