54.description: We have been patrons of Green Grocer since they opened in our neighborhood.  Seasonal offerings are the best, with Cassie selecting the finest pickings from local producers.  If there is something you don't see in the store or would like to get from the Farmers Market (like fresh catnip!), Cassie will special order it!  My favorite items include fresh bottled milk from Wisconsin, natural pasture raised beef & chicken, fresh locally made pasta, scrumptious flavored ice creams & red velvet cupcakes that are to die for!  And the breads from Red Hen Bakery make my mouth water.And when it comes to holiday meals, Green Grocer carries practically everything to make your meal deliciously complete.  Turkeys, hams, pies & everything for side dishes.  Or you can simply stop in for a prepared sandwich, wrap or a wedge of fresh cheese & crackers.  And there's always the free classes along with food, wine & beer samplings throughout the month.  Stop in anytime & Green Grocer will make you feel like one of the family, always greeting you with a big smile!

48.description: Green Grocer is fab!  I did a lot of research on CSAs and Green Grocer's produce share program is (from what I can tell) the best deal in town.  Superb quality produce, huge amount for the price and no risks since you can pay month to month and cancel at any time.  That was the biggest factor for me.  On a social work salary, CSAs can been a daunting commitment.  Thanks GG!

44.description: We moved in across the street a while back and have been stopping by here a few times a week.  They have GREAT produce, a fantastic selection of beer & wine and a plethora or veggie and non-veggie meal options to satisfy everyone.  Cassie is very friendly and knowledgeable which makes paying that little bit extra worth it.  They have BBQs, wine tastings and other events that are a great way to say thank you to their customers.  Overall, it's a fantastic little place that makes you feel good about your purchase.

24.description: This is a cute little grocery store that has all organic produce and products. Very handy to live close to. The staff is super friendly and they always have amazing fresh produce. I'll go here if I don't have time to drive to the store to pick up something for dinner. Also, their wine and beer selection is very nice. They just got a new wine from Serbia, Obecanje, and it is superb! This is quickly becoming our house wine and whenever we run out, we just go downstairs for more. I couldn't give 5/5 stars simply because of the price. It's quite expensive so I can't do all of my grocery shopping here. Overall, I love coming to this store and it's wonderful having it so close by when I need something in a hurry.

7.description: Love this place! Good selection of all organic and many local items. Their farm share program is great, and the staff is super friendly too!

49.description: I am so glad this little store is here.  It has been my life saver for all the things that I have run out of at home.  What is great is that the stuff is organic and pretty fresh items.  In addition to fresh veggies, they have a decent selection of beer and wine, cute foodie birthday cards, and cleaning products as well.  The staff is very helpful and friendly.  The prices are a little more on the higher end, but is to be expected with a higher quality items and in a small location.  I certainly appreciate the convenience.

40.description: Where can you go and get fresh, seasonal, organic, local produce outside of farmers market season? The Green Grocer! They have an amazing selection of seasonal finds for such a tiny store. They also have local and sustainable meat and cheese and all sorts of other culinary treats. You can also buy a CSA subscription for pick up.

53.description: When is a grocery store more than a grocery store?  When it's a community center and a force for good.  How the gregarious owner Cassie packs so much diverse product and joy into such a small space is beyond me, but this tiny storefront is a big city treasure.  Some of my favorite products are the regional and organic produce, the delish local salsas, great dried bulk items, yum desserts and, ample wine, beer and booze.  And they have ready to eat lunches.  And they have great sustainable cleaning products and toiletries.  You get the idea.  Bored?  Come to one of their great cooking demos, lectures, tastings or parties.  Don't donate to causes in your your community enough?  Don't worry, they do.  Just stop in.  This great local business is more than worthy of your pocket change.

30.description: I like this place... but am surprised to see how high the average rating is.It's basically your typical hipster boutique grocery. Most things are overpriced, yes. And there are not a lot of options for each item. That said, each time I've gone there, they've had some version of what I needed. So, kudos for that. You just have to know going in that you're going to pay far too much.For example, I got a bottle of wine (which was probably a $6.99 bottle), plus a small bag of mushrooms, brie cheese, and basil. How much did it cost? Over 40 bucks. I was alarmed, but at the same time, it's my fault for not being prepared ahead of time, because I ended up shopping conveniently. Basically, I paid the convenience (or idiot) tax.To be honest though, they have what you need. So, if you're in a pinch, head on in. But if you can avoid it, don't spend the money.

46.description: I love this place and am so glad we live in the neighborhood. Super friendly people, great vibe. If it seems a little pricey, that's because you're paying the actual full price of your food here and not shrugging it off as negative externalities to be paid for with your health, your children's health, your environment, etc. Also: Tuesday Boozeday.

1.description: Just your average little corner store...If your average little corner store was run by tree hugging hippies. Green Grocer is what you'd get if you cross bred an NYC bodega with an exaggerated specialty store from the show Portlandia.  They've got an amazing amount of organic and locally sourced goods. Especially considering how small the space is. There's always a product that you've never seen before and often times they're even being sampled by the local vendor who's trying to pimp it the old fashioned way.The beer cooler is a nice touch too with more local stuff filling the shelves and some hard to find flavors as well. On most visits you'll be greeted with a smile by the owner and in addition to the awesome stuff they sell that's worth the premium you'll pay.

55.description: We were one of the 'locals' invited to assist Cassie and Gary with focus groups as they were planning the vision for the Green Grocer.  We love the groceries, staff and especially Cassie and Gary. We are there on a regular basis!  We love the Green Grocer!

9.description: Very friendly staff with good food selection. I had to stop going there cause it's too expensive for me, but I guess that's what you have to expect for legitimately organic and local options. If I want some good cheese or beer, I don't hesitate to walk on over. Their yearly BBQ in the back lot is fun too :)

26.description: I LOVE this place!  So fresh and so clean clean!  ;)Having this place right around the corner is a dream.  Although it's a small store, they always have a great selection of organic... almost everything. They have a really neat basket/section of free items that are about to go bad.  I think it is so cool that they do that instead of just wasting perfectly good produce.Only bummers are the prices... which are expected to be high when you're all-organic.  I understand what it takes to get the goods, but I certainly can't do my grocery shopping here on a budget.  The fact they use "Level Up" is cool and saves a lot of money. I highly recommend downloading it!The people that work here are really nice and knowledgeable of the beer and wine selection, which is fantastic.  I can find my favorites in here almost every time- Two-Hearted, Anti-hero, sometimes even Three Floyd's options.  I also LOVE that I can pick out my own 6 pack of random beers they have on the shelf and have an opportunity to try some that I haven't before without buying the whole case.Overall- Awesome, just wish they'd knock down the prices.  Not many competitors in the area! I hope the word continues to spread about Green Grocer! :)

25.description: Cassie and her team are the best! The groceries are always amazing and for a small neighborhood store, the selection is spectacular. This place is one of the many reasons I love West Town. The GG is a small business that supports many other small businesses and family farms. If you care about your health and supporting your community, shop here!!!

12.description: We just moved to Chicago from North Carolina, and I was bummed about missing out on our year round farmer's market. I am so happy I found Green Grocer, because they saved the day! I immediately joined the winter CSA and we are greatly enjoying the delicious organic fruit and vegetables. Everything is so yummy and I love that they source as locally as possible. I also LOVE the 50% off and free bins for overripe produce. I have found amazing deals here (like 2 bunches of bananas- perfect for smoothies and a bunch of kale that was good enough to be our Valentine's Day salad).Everyone is super nice and friendly! The music is always great, and it is a nice shop to just stop in and visit a few times a week to see what new treats they have. We are vegan and they have great options for us.I HIGHLY recommend! I LOVE Green Grocer!

59.description: I've envisioned one of the hardest aspects of leaving Vermont behind to move back to my true home, Chicago, is that I'm yet again leaving behind all of that local seasonal food (and might I add abundant and super reasonable priced?).  I have a pretty good concept of which foods you should only eat organic and which ones are safe to eat conventional.  I'm not a true localvore but I do my best, and I definitely like to know where my food is sourced from (which I tend to think is just as important as eating organic).  That being set, I pretty much set myself up for not being able to find the produce I crave each season and if I do, I would be paying out the ass.I'd heard a lot about Green Grocer and it is very close to where I live.  I gave myself a budget beforehand and envisioned myself only being able to buy some kale, apples, and a bottle of kombucha.  Well, I got that and so much more, only 12 cents over my budget!  Everything was in really good shape too.  If it's not clearly labeled where the food is sourced from the cashier was very knowledgeable about it.  She was also super enthusiastic about all the products I was getting and was sure to tell me which seasonal produce was coming in soon.  The prices were a little more than I would pay on a rural country road in VT but for in the city and being an independent store, the prices are excellent.  I also like how the produce is portioned.  I have roommates sure, and we share food  but some pre-divided portions are too big!  I like to buy my produce frequently so it's fresh, when the portions are manageable it makes it that much easier.  I'll definitely be making frequent trips back.

21.description: darling spot. darling staff. the summer csa was great! boutique-prices b/c of the attention to detail and level of excellent/local/farm-to-table products.LOVE.

17.description: Awesome store and awesome idea.

10.description: Nice little grocery store that has high quality food and grocery items. A lot of the stuff is organic too.

5.description: Meh meh meh. I wanted to like this store. Love it even. Yes, there are local options and many organic options, which is lovely. However, 90% of what is sold in this store can be found at Mariano's. I was really looking for more, I guess. The only thing that made me happy is to see that they had 4-5 Upton's options. Oh...and Justin's Peanut Butter cups.

3.description: I haven't written a review in ages, but I'm coming out of Yelp hibernation for this one.Green Grocer is awesome. I moved about a block away from the place last month, and it's been my savior on several occasions. It's the only viable grocery option in the area, and while the prices are higher than you'll find at a Mariano's or Jewel, the organic products are wonderfully curated and everything I've bought has been top notch. I'll be coming back on the regular for the pork jowl bacon ($7.99 for a package), which my friends and I confirmed is some of the best bacon we've ever had. Don't forget to check the "free" section, either, as GG gives away day-old bread and just-ripe produce. Don't let the slightly higher price tags drive you away--this place is a real gem in West Town!

35.description: Always fresh and always amazing!Pea tendrils,young garlic shoots,kale, arugula,spinach,,mushrooms all out of this world good and most of all O R G A N I C!!! Artizone delivers Green Grocer's goods -from farmers to your table,fresh and tasty!

19.description: I have been a regular Whole Foods shopper for years. I shop at farmers markets and local markets and even buy some "essentials" at Karyn's. Basically, I am choosy about what I put in my body and will shop at 4 different stores to get my week's groceries. That being said, I absolutely love Green Grocer! The staff is fun and friendly and always helpful. This store carries many things that I have to buy online. Instead of throwing out old product and products, they offer it for free. Even slightly ripe produce is discounted. This is the only place in Chicago that you can find coconut bacon!

28.description: Not a fan at all of this place...very small and you can't do a complete shop here. Why come if you only can get 5 basic items? Prices are high but it is Organic so there is a cost to that. They are out of stock most of the time as well. The layout is bad and the help is just ok. I will NOT be coming back at all here.

45.description: This place is amazing to get some great local produce and specialty items. I like that Green Grocer partners with the school up the street for introducing new food and teaching about agriculture and produce.I got our Thanksgiving turkey here and was told that it will now become a tradition.Overall for everyday shopping, it's a bit out of my way, but if I'm in the area, I plan on stopping in to get some unique treats....like their vegan "cheese" dip and meats.

33.description: Love this place!  They have hard to find chia seeds!  I love to stop in for a yummy pastry dessert.  Only the highest quality here.

43.description: I love having a convenient place to pick up a few items in a pinch, and it's a major bonus that it's local! Perfect place to grab some fresh veggies, cheese, and many jarred/packaged items that you find in the farmer's markets. Definitely going to join the produce share program!

2.description: This is a great little store. I am from The Pittsburgh area and needed some gluten free vegan snacks while here in Chicago.  I had a groupon and was pleased by the beverage selection also.  It is clean, and easy to get to via the CTA.

18.description: I like this place... but am surprised to see how high the average rating is.It's basically your typical hipster boutique grocery. Most things are overpriced, yes. And there are not a lot of options for each item. That said, each time I've gone there, they've had some version of what I needed. So, kudos for that. You just have to know going in that you're going to pay far too much.For example, I got a bottle of wine (which was probably a $6.99 bottle), plus a small bag of mushrooms, brie cheese, and basil. How much did it cost? Over 40 bucks. I was alarmed, but at the same time, it's my fault for not being prepared ahead of time, because I ended up shopping conveniently. Basically, I paid the convenience (or idiot) tax.To be honest though, they have what you need. So, if you're in a pinch, head on in. But if you can avoid it, don't spend the money.

41.description: Updating because this is even better than when we first moved in. They've rearranged a couple times and I'm amazed at how many different things they manage to stock in a relatively small space. Their produce is in-season and fresh, and there's more of it then ever before. Bonus that it's local and/or organic. We did their produce box program for a while which was excellent (we stopped because we got so stupid busy for a while that we were never home to use the food :( -- but it's good to know it's there when life lets up a little).This was also a frequent stop during the time I was unemployed -- I knew on bad days I could always get a snack and a smile. And I often still go in just for that (seriously, though, if they kept my purchase history, I'd probably be mortified to see how often I walk out with chips & salsa and blood orange soda ... ).

52.description: I love this place.  Yeah, the prices are higher than Jewel. They also have food you won't find at Jewel or Dominicks.  Great beer & liquor selection, some of the best dairy products I've had, unique vegetarian friendly options, and tons of local products - Nice Cream, Pasta Puttana, Grown Up Kids Stuff, Terrys Toffee.  Super friendly and helpful staff, always well informed and willing to investigate if you have questions that they don't know the answer to.  And a bowl of dog treats for the pup when we leave.

50.description: Green Grocer is a great local store.  I opted in for their summer produce share for the first time and it is going great.  The produce has been plentiful and of very high quality.  The owner sends weekly emails about that week's produce and includes a few recipes.  It is really a fun way to try new fruits and veggies and support a local store and farmer(s). I've picked up all sorts of groceries here and everything is great.  I am pretty lucky to have such an amazing store so close to me.  I love how they carry local Chgo brands also.

4.description: I love this place! Local and fresh produce, a great drink selection, and available healthy meals on the go. It's a great benefit to the neighborhood. Complaining about the higher price point is dumb, because this is a small and local business, so of course some things will cost more than at Jewel or Mariano's. Its the price you pay for convenience, quality, and supporting a local business. They have options for vegans, veggies, and carnivores alike. Thanks, Green Grocer, for always holding it down with my lox, local breads, kombucha, fancy cheese, and my favorite of all, the butter log!!!

6.description: My boyfriend and I find ourselves here on a near daily basis for fresh organic produce, meats and other little goodies. The weekly produce share is a great way to try veggies you wouldn't normally choose, we rarely eat the same recipe twice.

22.description: Awesome selection. Pretty much everything organic and not outrageously priced. And they had Oregon foraged chantrells.  Will go back here a LOT!

15.description: I LOVE this place!  So fresh and so clean clean!  ;)Having this place right around the corner is a dream.  Although it's a small store, they always have a great selection of organic... almost everything. They have a really neat basket/section of free items that are about to go bad.  I think it is so cool that they do that instead of just wasting perfectly good produce.Only bummers are the prices... which are expected to be high when you're all-organic.  I understand what it takes to get the goods, but I certainly can't do my grocery shopping here on a budget.  The fact they use "Level Up" is cool and saves a lot of money. I highly recommend downloading it!The people that work here are really nice and knowledgeable of the beer and wine selection, which is fantastic.  I can find my favorites in here almost every time- Two-Hearted, Anti-hero, sometimes even Three Floyd's options.  I also LOVE that I can pick out my own 6 pack of random beers they have on the shelf and have an opportunity to try some that I haven't before without buying the whole case.Overall- Awesome, just wish they'd knock down the prices.  Not many competitors in the area! I hope the word continues to spread about Green Grocer! :)

57.description: Fantastic store! I love that they have so much in this space - local, organically grown food!The staff is friendly, and I get coupons in the mail almost monthly (maybe bi-monthly - regardless it is a great deal). We have discovered new local brands we adore - Kilgus, Castle Rock Farm, Localfolks, CouplaGuys, Chicago Flats, Red Hen... the list goes on!Parking is on the street and surprisingly easy. They have a *ton* of gluten free items that I cannot find even at Whole Foods. I love it here. I do not have to even go to Whole Foods anymore - and I am saving money! And I am shopping local!!!

20.description: Cute local grocery store. Lots of healthy organic food, practically everything they have there is local. Their employees are very knowledgeable and friendly. Prices are a little more expensive than a corporate grocery store but you are getting a great product.

36.description: I wish this were in my neighborhood. Someone who knows quite a bit about food and drink is buying for this store. You can find pretty much all the best local products (Smoking Goose charcuterie and Mint Creek Farms lamb for example), plus great local spirits and other trendy foodie/health products like Seasnax and good coconut water. The good news for those of us who live in neighborhoods that lack a shop like this is that you can order stuff from them on Artizone now.

14.description: This is the perfect neighborhood grocery store: farm fresh eggs, milk in glass bottles, fancy cheese, fresh bread, free samples, excellent booze, a produce subscription and in store discounts on the day you pick up, plus the friendliest and coolest staff. They also have the truly awesome policy of giving away or discounting overripe or smushed produce and past date items...like even if the avocados arrived that day but were just too squishy for their high quality standards! Green Grocer deserves all of the numerous dollars I spend there.

3.description: I went here for a second time after having purchased a premade sauce which was very good.I know these people know their way around cured meats and rillettes.However, I would not recommend ever using them as a butcher. I called and asked if they could cut a 6 lb brisket with fat on the bottom so that it was not a pure lean first cut.  The person I spoke to said it was not a problem and that I could get it.After making a special trip to get this brisket I asked to see it and it was a slab of bacon!It was a stranger than strange looking piece of marbled flat and fat layered thing that looked like an entire slab of bacon and certainly NOT a Beef Brisket.  Sorry, but the Local Foods place is a pretentious farce of a warehouse with the emperor's new clothes all over it.When I noticed that all the sourdough loaves of bread were burned, I asked if any were not burned and was told by a man who sniffed haughtily, that "they are artisinal." As if that means they ought to be burned.  Having had plenty of good artisinal breads, I shook my head and walked out.  I will not be back again to Butcher And Larder and certainly not to this sad, silly, pretentious hole of a warehouse with dead produce and burned stale bread.You can buy local canned, bottled and pickled products at Whole Foods, Marianos, and The Chopping Block thank you.

1.description: We went here for lunch. Their restaurant area was surprisingly nice considering it's also a specialty grocery store. We sat at the bar/ lunch counter and shared the pastrami melt which was excellent. We did not know it was BYOB so ran down the street to Vin which was conveniently close. Can't wait to return and try some addition items from the menu. After lunch, we made a quick stop at the cheese counter and grabbed 5 different cheeses plus some great charcuterie. The lady at the cheese counter was extremely helpful and allowed us to sample whatever cheeses we wanted.

2.description: I love that Butcher and Larder is with Local Foods.  The breakfast patties are amazing.  Many of the sausage recipes change each week.  This week got chorizo.

0.description: Also known as the best butcher shop in Chicago - These guys and ladies know their cuts and they are all the friendliest (and funniest) people you will ever meet. If you're making eggs for a weekend brunch, they'll provide you with the perfect sausage pairing. If you like beef jerky, they've got it often. For the weekends they offer variations from taquitos, shepards pie and short rib max and cheese for an easy at-home meal. High quality meat from an extremely knowledgable and committed #butchersquad. Enough said. Tip: call ahead for any and all meat related questions

1.description: Honesty and Fairness is Excellent !Good People who care about your Consignments.

0.description: These guys are always so nice and helpful. Always there when I need some cash til the next payday. Plus so helpful in pawning things that others won't. I will always recommend these place to others that are in need of assistance. Also their store has so many different things from TVs to antiques!!

3.description: I had my newborn with me and the ladies loved him.  He's definitely a lady's man.  The store is a tad overpriced but there are 50% sales all the time which makes it more reasonable.  They carried higher end stuff that the other thrift stores in the area do not always have.  It is cleaner than a lot of the larger thrift stores.

1.description: As a self-proclaimed "Thrift Queen,"  this store is on the bottom of my Thrift Quality Scale.  Neat Repeats in Orland Park is a very small thrift store located in a strip mall on 159th Street.    It is ran by volunteers (generally older, retired women), who can be really friendly at times, but I guess it depends on who is there.  I have to admit, I have felt uncomfortable with a couple of staff "attitudes."  The prices are generally higher than most thrift stores and the items are generally not on the current trend, and not always in pristine (resale) condition. The shoe selection is very 80's... The women's dresses are mostly "formal wear rejects...."  The juniors selection is almost non-existent....  The children's items seem in peeling and poor condition...   And, the men's section reminds me of an old "estate sale."  Honestly, I have found some of my greatest deals here in the small home goods section.  This store also runs "daily specials."  The white board next to the front door indicates which department is on sale or if there is a 50% off the entire store special.On the upside....  This store is very clean.  This store is well-organized by department.  And, this store benefits a shelter.  In my opinion, this is not the greatest for thrift finds.  If you are not a "regular thriftier," this may turn you off to the "thrifting game."  However, as I always say, "You never know when today is your lucky day in a thrift store!"  So, I typically stop by this store at least once per month.Oh, by the way, there is no public restroom here.

2.description: Not the best resale shop in the area, items mostly overpriced.  If you shopresale stores often, the lack of items being displayed by size is very annoying.You can waste a lot of time trying to find something in the size you are looking for.Since the proceeds go to a good cause, I do shop here occasionally.The volunteer staff is hit or miss.  Some of the ladies are very pleasantwhile others are downright rude. Recently one of the staff was questioninga teenage girl like she was a criminal because the girl was just standing by a rack.  The girl was waiting for her grandmother who was in the dressing room.  Why the staff member thought this young lady was suspicious, I have no idea, but it's just one more thing that will keep me from shopping there more often.

5.description: I love this shop in Worth.  Every time I'm cleaning out my closets and cabinets, I donate to them.  The staff are so friendly and if you have several pieces, they will help you to get them out of the car.  It is clean and reasonable.  When I donate, I usually walk around and find something-- book or something.  I have gotten so many friends to donate their items,  too.  You have to learn to lend a helping hand and thank God you are fortunate to be able to donate.

6.description: Hmm, not exactly my cup of tea, but it's still a cute shop.  The first thing I noticed as I walked in the shop was that I was the youngest customer there.  Second, relative to the first, there were more items geared towards older women than a girl in her early 20s.  I already started feeling discouraged as I browsed through the first few racks, but I managed to find a nice, 100% silk wrap-around dress.  I saw the price tag and it was $8.  Really wasn't worth $8 to me, but I noticed the little board by the register and saw that everything was 50% off so I took it.  Some things were pretty pricey for what they were and others were fairly priced.  They don't have much in the ways of a Junior section.  Just a bunch of random tops.  There were a few good looking shoes, but not many that justified their prices for me.Also, the ladies working there were very nice and helpful.

7.description: This is not my traditional idea of a thrift store but that's ok. The merchandise leans more towards generic department stores and overpriced formal gowns. I really did not have time to browse the whole store thouroughly but most of the prices were leaning towards high for a 'resale' store. Daily sales make the prices more reasonable, looked as if they have some sale every day and the customers who appeared to be regulars seemed to know the days to come.Some prices were outrageous, like $120 for knock-off designer purses but I guess someone may be ok paying that. Not me but someone, else.Bottom line: I found a lovely chunky blue stone necklace that looks to be lapis but I really don't know for sure for 20 bucks. Again, a little out of my price range but the piece is pretty awesome and totally worth it. The women working were really nice and more than helpful. Super sweet, I like that.I'll keep checking in to get the scoop on their sales and hopefully score more than one item at a time.

8.description: Neat Repeats is a resale shop that gives all of its proceeds to battered women shelters! Their stores are clean, color coordinated and organized. This Orland store has a small selection of junior wear. They have daily sales on many items. I have found designer stuff for a very small price. However, like every resale shop, it's hit or miss some days.

9.description: I shop at all the area thrift stores and was excited to check out Neat Repeats. I brought my daughters in with me who are 6 and 3 and very well behaved. They sat down near the children's section and started looking through books quietly while I shopped within sight distance of them. A staffer looked at my girls and then loudly said to them (scaring them) WHERE IS YOUR MOTHER? And I was right behind her when I tapped her on the shoulder and said, "I'm right here. May I help you?" and she berated me and said, "You have to watch your children!" and I said to her "I am watching them. I'm right here and I was here all along. You didn't see me. Are they doing something that is upsetting you?" and then she said they aren't allowed to play with the toys. Well, Lady, if my kids can't touch your toys, I won't be buying them from you...or anything else for that matter. Terrible attitudes. Terrible staff...and from another review on here about the staff acting horribly this should confirm it for some of you. I highly recommend other area thrift stores. This is the only one I've ever had a problem with. They should be ashamed for treating customers like this.

0.description: Since this store benefits the Crisis Center - South Suburbs - what better way to contribute to victims of domestic violence than to donate and/or shop at Neat Repeats?  Kudos to those who volunteer here, and for the worthy cause that Neat Repeats supports.

4.description: Know the store well and the location in Worth.  Clean, well displayed, organized, usually fairly priced, lots of sales, etc.  Merchandise is clean, dusted, sized, etc.  Volunteers are lovely ladies.  I've walked out happy very many times.Unfortunately, an incident so enraged me, I could not respond or complain.  One day I was in there shopping.  Cindy(?) knows me.  What she doesn't know is my hearing is excellent.  She asked a volunteer where I was.  The volunteer responded, "She's looking at the pictures."  Cindy proceeded to take the volunteer behind a display and tell a horrendous story about me.  She had heard the story from someone else.  What Cindy did NOT know is I could hear every word she said.  Additionally, other customers heard every word she said.  Cindy had no first hand knowledge of the story.  She heard it from someone else.  ADDITIONALLY, Cindy does not know there is another woman in the area with my name.  It is interesting since I do not have a common name.  I quietly listened as I browsed through the pictures.  The story was vicious.  This little discussion between Cindy and the volunteer went on for over 2 minutes--heard by me, the cashier, customers at the register, other customers on the same side of the display as myself.  Here I was being viciously ripped in a store where most everyone (except those in the far off corners of the store) was hearing about me.  I crept behind the display and saw Cindy pointing in my direction.  How DARE she?  Just because someone tells you something does not make the story true.  Cindy wasn't there.  Who is she to rip me apart in public for everyone to hear and know she meant me.  This woman is a manager or supervisor?  She needs to read Dale Carnegie's book, HOW TO WIN FRIENDS AND INFLUENCE PEOPLE.  Big mouths such as Cindy's have a way of destroying lives, self-esteem and self-worth.  I said nothing and left the store.  I thought long and hard about this posting.  It has been more than a year since this incident.  I reflected carefully.  I just want Neat Repeats to know the character and integrity of its workers.

3.description: This place is totally making the come back it deserves.  The beer selection is remarkable, the menu has evolved to be a very well executed spin on traditional pub fair.  Burgers are ground fresh on site and in my opinion better than places like Au Cheval which for some reason is touted as one of the best in the city.  Great neighborhood, warm atmosphere and pleasant staff.

1.description: One waitress/bartender for 40+ patrons. Literally her and everyone else. Missed two trains, one uber and a few rounds of drinks we would have bought waiting for any service. Sat at the bar for almost 30 minutes waiting to close out after all this. Did I mention it's just a normal Friday evening. The sign says Keep Calm Under New Management. Ummm how about:Keep Calm We Have No ManagementOrGet Angry We Have No One Working HereOr Don't Come Here.

2.description: I loved the food. We got the bison burger, wings, and the burger with munster and grilled onions.  The fries had seasoning salt and were delicious.  Our sweet potato fries were cooked to perfection the way I like them crispy and not greasy.The staff was attentive and never let us go thirsty.  We had Corey and he was great.  There was a girl with a shaved side of her head that was beyond obnoxious. She was killing the vibe. Corey was polite to screeching Skrillex and her friends sitting at the bar.  Like a pro he switched her to water and encouraged her to close out her tab.  This will be a stop when we come back to town.

9.description: We love this place now that it's the Irish Nobleman! Had decided J.Patricks wasn't worth the price for the mediocre food, but now that there's new management and a new menu, we couldn't be more pleased. The food is great--kudos to the chef and the atmosphere is casual and inviting. Will continue to come back.

10.description: This bar is a great time -  the staff is awesome,  and the rehab to the place since the new mgmt took over is awesome. Highly recommend for a spot to check out with friends.

4.description: When I left this place on Saturday night, I was dead set on giving it 2 stars. However, while walking away, we actually ran into the owners who were aware of the issues that I was going to complain about and they were already discussing how things were going to change.Sures this place just opened. Yes, I want this place to succeed. I live and own property in the area and am a big advocate for neighborhood bars. JPatricks started off great and slid downhill so I really want this place to better.First off, I think a big issue was the timing of when we came here. We took a seat and the manager (I think he was the manager) greeted us promptly. Another couple came in clearly after us, sat in the table next to us, and they would get better service than us, which was strange. It started with the lady complaining about how her beet was flat. The waitress turned to me because I had ordered the same beer and asked me how it was. I told her it wasn't really flat and that it was ok. The lady was given a different beer.By this point, we were ready to order, but the waitress was so concentrating on this lady that she took their order first. No big deal, but it wasn't until 5 minutes later that she took our order. We saw the chef or head cook or whatever personally deliver food to the patrons, which we thought was really neat! However, this guy all of a sudden had vested his attention to this lady who was complaining and had stayed at their table in a discussion of some sort for like 10 minutes! Who was paying attention to our food? The guy then left their table and came back with a ramekin of some sauce, explained it to them, then left to get another ramekin of sauce! So that was three visits to this table that was complaining about the beer in the first place.The manager had gone to the table of the complainer and offered them a new line of oktoberfest beer, after he delivered them one of the beers, he came to us. We ordered 2 and was told that he only had 1 left because the other table had got one! Grrr!Then our food was not delivered by the head cook guy, but by the manager. The head cook guy came and just dropped off our fries and left. No explanation, no conversation, no extra sauces, just here are your fries and gone. Only to appear less than a minute later in street clothes out for a smoke.So yes, this table of complainers really ruined our evening. But we witnessed them getting better service and more attention. My bill had the "flat" beer, but I bet it was removed from theirs.But like I said in the beginning, I really want this place to succeed. The owners seemed to know some of the issues (including that lady who was complaining!) and was already in the works of remedying some of the issues. I really hope so. I'm looking forward to the outdoor seating when it become warmer!Oh, one last complaint. It was a Saturday night, it was not busy, but the bathrooms were trashed. They moved to a paper towel system instead of repairing the air dryers and put in a small trash can. This really needs to be emptied more often. I took a picture, but will not post it in hopes to not trash the place (figuratively).

6.description: The Irish Nobleman is a great neighborhood bar with a fun vibe. Prices are decent, food is tasty and service is great. Definitely recommend!

12.description: Chef Josh really has a passion for the food that comes out of his kitchen. The burgers are second to none. I nice throwback Chicago Irish pub.

5.description: Great bar with an awesome staff! Came here on a Saturday and it was absolutely slammed but the staff was friendly and attentive. Can't wait to come back to try their food - great neighborhood bar.

13.description: Great place to grab a beer. Not to mention the food is pretty great. Love the atmophere and the options of beer on tap.

11.description: A group of friends and I went on Saturday night for food and drinks. We thought this was still J Patrick's, but new management had recently been introduced. I am giving 2 stars because they have beer and we were given free fresh donuts with Carmel sauce during the Cubs game. The donuts were good, covered in sugar and warm. Everything else in our experience could really use some work. First the tables have all been changed. They seem really bulky and cumbersome. It was somewhat difficult to walk between. We happened to sit in a large booth. The seat...not too bad. The table was too tall though and it felt awkward to sit at and awkward to eat at. We ordered Guinness battered fried pickles and cheese curds. The fried pickles didn't really have much breading or any flavor. Because there wasn't enough breading, it seemed just like greasey crisp pickle. The cheese curds were just okay. I ordered the turkey club. It came with steak fries that seemed like they were oven French fries dirty little step brother. Not that crispy or golden, no flavor and dry and mushy on the inside. The turkey was cheap and slimy on toasted white bread with a Kraft single. The tomato and iceberg lettuce shreds were fresh. Our server was very polite. There was a mistake or two because of the new system they had and she was unsure of some of the beers they did or did not carry. No big deal, I'm sure that is something that will be sorted out. There were quite a few new TVs mounted, so that made it nice to watch the game.

8.description: The music was a joke, sounded like a bubble gum pop concert going on here. $6.50 for 14oz of Guinness is ridiculous.

0.description: This place is great.Good music, nice crowd, friendly staff, plenty of tv's, good choice of beers.Food here is excellent too. I had the Wisco Burger - definitely recommend! There has been a huge improvement under the new management - I'll definitely be back!!

7.description: Fun place really good pours , descent company some bimbo , good neighborhood good fun good donuts with the company I'm with . !!!!!!

12.description: Hot Vapes. What can I say. You seem to have some good juices but are lacking in customer service. I have stopped in multiple times and have actually found great juice here. The front counter staff is completely indifferent to me every single time. All the juices are laid out on a counter away from checkout counter which is cool. No pressure,  no one in my grilll every time I vape. But, there is no connection here. I don't know. Seems like if I'm looking for something and the dude at the counter knows it, he should make more of an effort to help rather than just point and leave me to struggle and wade through everything on my own. A couple of times I have tasted burnt coils in their tanks but I didn't wanna bother dude at the counter.  Seemed like he had better things to do other than help me. The juice makers in back seem cool. Once one came out and talked to me for a bit about flavors and juices and whatnot. Why can't the counter staff share this type of passion with customers? I don't get it. I feel like no one cares if I'm spending money here which there are plenty of other places that do care. I've received better customer service from random e juice websites. Not going back anymore.

7.description: My experience here has been pretty fantastic so far. When I first came in I was a pack a day smoker. I'd come across the e-cig concept for the first time during a trip to Morocco. A temp relocation to a smoke free bldg in Chicago and a desire to reduce the amount of cig I smoke made me look into e-cig options. That's when I first came upon HotVapes. The guys working the counter are well versed on their products and the differences between each of the models they carry. They gave me a quick rundown on the tech of vaping and the ups of e-cigs vs cigs. They recommended my first evo starter kit. I'd read about their e-juice illusion so that's what I walked out w. After going home, like most newbies, I got online and ordered more e-juices, but my all day vape so far is still HotVapes Illusion. Of course, this is more about personal preference than anything else. Also, recently I had an issue w the juice I bought and they swapped it out for a new batch without any issues. I've successfully cut down to 1-2 cigs which I sometimes skip altogether thanks to vaping. HotVapes is the perfect place to go for a newbie. They're so helpful and willing to take the time to help make the transition an easy one. Good luck to future transitioners.

3.description: My GAWD the never-ending selection of vapor flavors are fabulous! Seriously over a 100 to choose from and they have a selection for every taste!This place is a little off the beaten path for me but with such a amazaballz selection of e-liquids that are CUSTOM MADE on the day, a pretty cool rewards program, and really awesome prices, I will definitely be stopping in here often!PS: Chicago you suck donkey **you know what** for making e-Cig smoking indoors illegal. You buttheads.Final Verdict:YES! Go. Strawbango smoothie! Get it! Yum.

1.description: I have spent the past 6 years in search of a great vape shop in the Chicago area that could custom mix my go to juice flavor of orange/watermelon/bubblegum. I really wanted to be able to support a local business rather than ordering my juice from an out of state vendor. I stopped by Hot Vapes today and altogether they couldn't do exactly what I wanted, the mixologist that was there was able to come really close. He went out of his way to try to get me what I wanted and I am happy with what he was able to do. Both the guys that were in the store were extremely helpful, while one of them was mixing my juice the other one helped me find my new favorite battery. The prices are competitive and the selection of everything from juice to batteries to tanks better than most. I live on the far NW side so it's not exactly in my neighborhood but getting there on a Saturday afternoon was easy, parking was plentiful and the store was easy to find. Hot Vapes will be my new go to vape shop and it should be yours too.

2.description: One of the best, if not the best vape shops I've been to in the city. Employees are incredibly knowledgeable, nice, respectful, and genuinely helpful. Lacks the uppity, condescending tone that unfortunately exists in many vape shops. Regardless of your experience level, you will always feel welcome Their liquids are among the highest quality I've seen in the city, and they make everything in shop. Additionally, they have a great selection of mods/batteries/tanks/other accessories that will satisfy all vapers, from the newbie level all the way through to the advanced. I've had a couple great experiences, and definitely will be a return customer. I think I found my new everyday vape shop. Highly recommended!

9.description: This place is awesome. Definitely a 5 star ride. I'll just go over why real quick. * Knowledgeable staff.* Great prices. * Wide selection. * Solid, great customer service. It's a very nondescript shop, very clean and nice. I was in and out quick, and was shocked at how reasonable (and low) their prices are. Needless to say, I'll be visiting often.

10.description: This place is fun! Try all the flavors, get a customized mix, whatever you want! Great service and help for someone like me who is not a knowledgable vaper.

13.description: Cool Shop, Nice workers

16.description: I found this place on yelp looking for a place to get some liquid for my vape pen and they were absolutely great!  They were easy to find Rachel was so helpful their selection was labeled and simple to find and taste.  When it came time for checkout I was about fifty cents short rob was kind enough to help me out he and Rachel were also very informative they educated me about the different types of vaporizers and where I can find them.  I will definetly be returning for more I their delicious in house made flavors!

17.description: Tim and Helen are great people to do business with; very genuine!  Very affordable too!

15.description: This is the best e-cig shop in the city. The staff, products, and atmosphere are top shelf!

0.description: These guys are absolutely unbelievable... Incredible... Service, price, expertise, selection, professionalism, personality, the absolute best!

5.description: BOGUS RETURN POLICY! Don't go in here and buy something unless you're positive that you want it. The gentleman who works the counter might be misinformed or he might just be trying to get your money because "oh yeah take it home and use it!" and "30 day return policy" turned into .....it's yours forever. Also, didn't offer a receipt, possibly because YOU CAN'T RETURN ANYTHING ANYWAY. Be warned.

11.description: great place highly recommend to anyone great E-juice and best selection I been to a lot of stores I Chicago don't waste your time go here they know there stuff

8.description: By far the best eCig shop I've found in the city.  First of all, I should tell you about the people:These eCigs aren't all that complicated, but when you don't have a clue at what your looking at, the options and terminology can get a bit overwhelming.  This is where the folks at Hot Vapes shine -- they are awesome.  Unlike other shops I'd been to, everyone here was amazingly helpful, patient, and didn't make me feel like an idiot because I didn't have a graduate degree in electrical engineering.They walked me through all the options, from the basic kits on up to the advanced stuff.  They explained the differences and didn't try to "up-sell" me to the expensive equipment -- instead, they helped me find the device that fit me best.  Next, there's the equipment:They have most everything you'd want -- from super basic stuff, to the the advanced, and everything in between.I ended up falling somewhere in the middle and picked up an iTaste SVD ... It's easy to use, lets you customize power settings to adjust the vapor levels and taste, and is really durable.  It also holds a couple different types of rechargeable batteries -- I use a large one for when I'm at work which lasts a day or two between charges, and a smaller one when I'm heading out for the night and want something a bit more discreet.Finally, there's the "Juice" or eLiquid:THEY HAVE THEIR OWN LAB!  They have somewhere in the neighborhood of 100 different flavors to choose from, a tasting station where you can try them all, and are great at helping you find something you'll like.  They make everything to order, so you may have to wait 5-10 minutes, but it's well worth the wait.  You can also ask them to "customize" the flavors a bit if you want. For people trying to find a replacement for a "real" cigarette, they have the only liquid I've found that actually gives you the taste of an actual cigarette -- not just a tobacco leaf flavor, but something that comes amazingly close to the burning paper and tobacco taste you'd get from the real deal.  It's called... get this:  ILLUSION.So, on to the con:They have a sign, but it's on the inside and only visible if you're looking through their front window.  On my first attempt to find them, I gave up.  On my second attempt, I passed them twice despite my GPS telling me when I'd arrived.Guys!  Get a sign on the OUTSIDE of the building.  *** Update *** - No more cons!  They have a sign!Bottom line:Great people, amazing selection of flavors, good selection of eCigs and equipment.  They're my official go-to and the best shop in the city.

4.description: OMG! Why do I go to other vape stores? I just had some of the best vape oil I've had so far in my life at Hot Vapes. As of today, Hot Vapes will be my only vape shop. And no, I'm not telling you what my favorite flavor is. Everytime I get a favorite something, next time I go to buy it, it's sold out. That's why I don't fuck with certain stores,  like Wal-Mart. They never have my coffee cream flavors. I have to get there right after the truck comes to get my shit. I guess I know what is good. Hot Vapes is damn good.

14.description: I recently visited Hot Vapes, and had a very positive experience. They stock everything from beginners devices to advanced vaporizers. They also have a large quantity of e liquids, and all are available to try in the store. The employee that was working was very knowledgable on vaping, and all the products sold in the store. He was very friendly, and took time to talk about anything I had a question about. The store itself is a very nice environment. They have a lounge with couches and chairs to sit at, with a large fish tank too! My friend and I were very impressed with everything. Solid selection of hardware, tons of juices, and knowledgable employees. I definitely recommend checking them out!

6.description: A huge selection of flavors to try with organic juices as well! The kona coffee is my favorite! Had a bit of a mixup when i made my first purchase (the gave me the wrong flavor), went back in and they gave me the correct flavor free of charge! I love how they come out in scrubs too after making your flavor! You know youre getting good quality juices!

58.description: What the hell is this place?It's like a bar affixed to a train car with tiny tables and 50s pin-up girls on the walls.  As you sit there, it has a "secret clubhouse" feel - the kind of hideout you'd want up in a tree if you were a kid.The place is dark and cramped, so prepare to get cozy.Upon intense advice, I ordered the Three Little Piggy sandwich (double smoked & braised ham, pork tenderloin, bacon, fried egg & gruyere cheese).  I opted out of the fried egg because... well... ew.But this sandwich was a gut-busting bomb of pork pleasure.  Sickeningly enormous.  There's virtually no way to attack this thing without ham escaping out the sides.But it's good.  Really good!  Does my stomach hate me 12 hours later?  Yes.  Would I eat one again?  In a (ham-slowed) heartbeat.I also enjoyed my drink.  I think it was called a Double Ginger Pop.Although this place seems to have fallen out of the sky and wedged itself on an otherwise dead corner of Chicago, I'm sure I'll make the trip out of my way to decimate another herd of swine.Here's video of the meaty beast: eatmedaily.com/2009/02/b…

56.description: I live around the corner and have been eying this place for months on end. Last night, we finally made the visit.DRINKS:The Silver Palm is connected to The Matchbox. They even hand you a cocktail list from The Matchbox when you sit down. I would suggest just about everything on that list. My group of four tried about 6 or 7 different cocktails from the list, and everything was tremendously good. Good serving sizes too - you either get a very tall glass, or a martini glass with a sidecar.FOOD:The food selection here felt fairly limited. It's just one page, front and back. There were only two salad options. I had a Rutherford salad. It was pretty tasty, but the fried avocados tasted kind of gross. I ended up "shucking" them and eating only the avocado inside. AMBIANCE:Love it. Walking into an old school train car is just an exciting thing. They even include a little blurb about the history of the car (yes, it's a real train car -- it used to run the loop between Florida, New York, and Chicago). It's very dark in there, so despite the many tables it still managed to strike an intimate feel.OVERALL:Food selection is iffy, food is okay.Bonus points for drinks and ambiance.Planning to go back for drinks!

29.description: Ralph Wiggum would most certainly Choo-Choo-Choose this place if he had a hankerin' for a fried chicken sandwich. This old railroad car turned restaurant puts one bomb ass bird on a bun. Add the homemade onion rings and you'll def run a train on your dinner! (shout out to Augie from Role Models youtube.com/watch?v=kL-1…)Yes...quarters are close, but the staff is super neighborhood friendly and it is one of the more unique settings in all of Chicago. Definitely worth a stop in if you're ever near Chicago Ave and Ogden.

42.description: Start with a drink at matchbox, Chicago's smallest bar and then dinner in the silver palm, a railroad dining car. All at Chicago and Ogden. Then dining car should rock a little to make you feel like you're moving but the food was good. I had the smoked pork chop which was very good. Most of the menu has recipes from railroad dining cars.

23.description: I was in town checking out a cubs game and saw this spot on a foodie channel and wanted to try it out.I loved the train car as restaurant pretty cool.I ordered the the three piggy and was in awe.Great food one of my favs if ever on a Chi Town trip.

47.description: Get the Three Piggy Sandwich. It will be a good evening.

8.description: This is one of the places along Milwaukee that 'just gets it'.Great drinks, great food (don't overlook the apps or salads, all are fantastic). Typically we order a few things here and there, and share.I prefer the patio, but if its full, just head to the train car, its pretty fun as well.

31.description: Came in the night of the reopening with a friend.[it wouldn't let me do all caps here so read with epic movie trailer voice in mind] For far too long have we been without the three pigs sandwich...While the menu was LARGELY reworked, the sandwich and onion rings remained.Rejoice!!!!

34.description: It may be small but it is worth every second. Food is casual yet 5 star right down to their cheeseburger. Recommed Rutherford salad with fried avocado. Pollo with mashed and poblano peppers with cheese, all sandwiches, and best drinks in Chicago (manhattans and lemon drops). Alex is our favorite server. My fiance and i met and got engaged downstairs at their sister location "The Matchbox.". We can't love it more!

16.description: The food was DELICIOUS, service was fine. However, the experience fell short because the ambient music was being well overpowered by the music the kitchen had going on. The kitchen either had no door or it was kept open and they were blasting their music. Made the experience a bit unpleasant. I wish the server would have either closed the kitchen door or asked the cooks to lower the volume a bit as to not interfere with the dining area.Not to miss: The Three Piggy, quite a heavy yummy meal (stay away from it if you are on a diet!) and mashed potatoes were very good too, with small chunks and skin, not just a puree. Check can get pricey, but the food is great.

13.description: Very consistent restaurant. Food is good every single time. I'm a fan of their side dishes and their cocktails. I come here often now.

11.description: I came here for the first time a few years back for the 3 Pigs sandwich (after seeing it on No Reservations). I've recently moved to the neighborhood and returned to try some of the other sandwich options. I have not been disappointed, as every sandwich has been unique and a step above average (fried chicken sandwich may be the best I have had in the city). The atmosphere is one of a kind as you dine in an old train car, and the Matchbox next door is a great place to grab a drink before or after your meal.

39.description: Traincar setting was really cute & fun to dine in.  Very small but it was something different for sure.  Service was really good.  Our waitress was nice, fast, and made good suggestions.  Fried Chicken was delish!  Friends got the 3 Little Piggy sandwich and said it was good but not amazing.  The duck sandwich was really tasty.  Overall good food and service on the more divey bar side.

37.description: It has a very cool "I'm riding on train to New Orleans, but got delayed for an hour on Chicago Ave. while in the dining car" atmosphere. But then we realized eating on a train can be quite claustrophobic, and we wished we were eating in a big, wide open restaurant with large sunny windows.The vegetarian options are limited. I mean common' this place was featured on Anthony Bourdain's show, so I didn't expect much. However, even the garden sandwich was sloppy and greasy. Overall, the atmosphere is fun for a one time visit, and the food was decent enough pre/post hangover. We don't plan on visiting again, but the bar next door is certainly worth patronizing.

0.description: We do this stuff all the time, go out for a big dinner & hit other spots on the way home. By the time we're on the way home, I am so full I can't breathe! That said, pants unbuttoned or not, I am so very happy we stopped in here!Go big or go home, right?! Right. Here we go! Walking through the front of the house onto the train car was a pretty cool experience. It's not like I've never been on a train before but it felt different. I can't describe it. So we ordered a few of their fancy schmancy drinks (can't remember the names) & off to ordering we went. Here's what we decided to share:Pork belly Asparagus 3 piggyAlright. So , the pork belly wasn't cooked the right way & was very dry. It was nothing like we're used to & I was very disappointed. I was nervous moving on to the 3 piggy after how the pork belly was but fear not, my friend... That sandwich was out of this world! I don't understand how it went from one extreme to the next, but it did & you need to eat it. Like as soon as you can! So although the belly wasn't as amazing as the 3 piggy, I think we'll be back to try other menu offerings. If all else fails, that 3 piggy is worth the stop!

38.description: My fiance and I had our first date at Matchbox, so we thought we'd try the outside seating area at Silver Palm one warm summer night. Worst service I have ever experienced in my life. The waitress was clearly in over her head. But instead of asking the other servers for help, she just yelled at us. Very rude, very unprofessional. We really had no idea if she'd even put our order in for dinner bc we had to shout it at her as she was walking away from our table for only the 2nd time all night. Long story short, we won't be eating here again. At least as long as that bitch is around. We'll stick with the drinks at Matchbox only. They're strong.

51.description: Good value, simple, no fuss food. Huge portions...almost too big. A nice place, although I think the Anthony Bourdain hype is overrated. The ribs are amazing.

27.description: Severely disappointed.  The wait staff was mediocre at best, the steak sandwich (was supposed to be medium) was burned and over cooked.  In the train car, we noticed the staff right next to the kitchen eating food, the glasses- from the mixed drinks to the water glasses-had a very stinky rotten egg smell to them.  My advice:  keep driving.  There are far better places to spend your money and time worth being in.  The train car was an experience,  but the rest:  an experience we'd (my family) would like to forget.

32.description: Bring an enormous appetite and some Tums.I saw this restaurant on a Chicago-centric episode of "No Reservations." Mr. Bourdain's review of the Three Little Pigs sandwich was pretty intriguing, so I gave it a shot.It's just about the greatest sandwich simultaneously on the face of the planet, in the universe, and in the history of the world. It's enormous and stacked with everything you could want to die from eating: double smoked ham, pork tenderloin, bacon, Gruyere cheese, and a fried egg on a brioche bun.If you don't have the stomach of some freaky bastard of science rhinoceros-elephant hybrid, bring a pillow and blanket. Halfway through this sandwich, you'll want to take a nap.We also ordered a tower of onion rings, which was probably a mistake. They were fantastic, but they took up valuable room in my stomach where I could've stuffed more food from the farm.Let's not forget that you're dining in a rail car. It's close quarters to be sure, but it's quaint and adds an element of character to dinner. You won't find a spot like this outside Chicago. Seriously, don't even bother. The Silver Palm is a big, fat bullet point under "Why Is Chicago Awesome?"The only thing I would change is my arrival time. There's a tiny sliver of a bar sharing a spot with The Silver Palm and I really wanted to try it. After we ate, I just wanted to go home and pass out for three straight days.

54.description: Second visit - had the Steak Sandwich.  I don't know if it's just my luck, but between the rubber duckie I had last time and today's steak, I just can't get a lean cut of meat out of these guys.  I hate to throw out this 'old saw', but you'd think a $14 sandwich wouldn't have so much gristley fat in it, duck OR steak.  And what sucks the most is that steak was especially tasty, less the fat.  The tomatillo sauce was good, too.But the wife and kid got their 3 Little Piggies orders just fine.  The service was quick and the beer was cold.  I'm thinking they could go with a bigger serving plate for the 'Piggies' choice than the 9" one they provide.  There was more than enough fries on my steak's plate.  The chicken sandwich we ordered to go tasted great the next day.SP, you STILL need more train memorabilia on your train.  Maybe simulate going through a tunnel once an hour with the lighting/sound!  And get some real lighting in there.  Remember the train scene from "White Christmas"?  At least bring the lumen count up to that much?!!

48.description: Anthony Bourdain was not lying!  Of course I had to go here to try the "3 Little Piggy" sandwich....It did not disappoint!  I can honestly say that this was THE BEST sandwich I've ever eaten before.  On top of that, the service was outstanding and the atmosphere was great!  Just to give you an idea of how good this sandwich is: I at this at aprox 8:30/9pm, went out and drank til 4am on Division and took a cab back to the Silver Palm in hopes I could get my hands on another Three Little Piggy sandwich...needless to say, i did not get my second...I'll be having dreams of that sandwich until I get my hands on another!Goodbye my love; until we meet again...

44.description: The food, drinks, and energy at The Silver Palm is so great.  I have no problem spending an afternoon on the patio or an evening at the bar.  Trino is a den-O-mite bartender!

24.description: When opening a restaurant it's very important to have one idea of what it should be.  Things that seem to have been designed by committee never seem to work, especially when a place like a restaurant, bar, theater or lounge is in question.  Unfortunately it seems that The Silver Palm suffers from a bit of a split personality.  Upon arriving in front of the old school Florida-esque facade, you have a pretty good idea of what might be inside.  However, upon entering the old station bar decor you are greeted with alternative rock and backwards baseball caps.  This can be slightly off putting especially in light of where the rest of the meal might take you.  The dining car portion itself is quite nice and even a tad upscale.  Very much in keeping with the rest of styling (unfortunately however the alternative rock follows you).  The menu is extensive and appealing with a selection of old favorites and some new tricks.  The food however did not seem to be able to cash the checks the decor was writing.This is not to say that I was expecting 5 star food.  This is, after all, a restaurant inside an old railway car.  However, it seemed like perhaps today the shrimp used for the shrimp cocktail had been around for nearly as long as the train car.  The Italian Prime rib was tasty if perhaps a bit large and the Sidecar cocktail I ordered had a novel touch.... a powdered sugar rim.  Certainly not what I was expecting from a restaurant that seems to pride themselves so highly on their bartenders.  Now we come to the biggest split personality of the lot... the pricing.  It seems that while they are trying to capture a more casual atmosphere with the casually dressed staff, patrons and bartenders, they are trying to charge 5 star restaurant money.  A glance at that ever popular far right column on the menu would certainly seem advisable.The greatest shame about this place is that it has a lot of potential.  If someone who had a very clear vision of what they wanted bought it up, it could be a great retro bar.  For now, however, it seems like The Silver Palm is delayed indefinitely from departing to greatness.

7.description: Silver Palm has continued to be my favorite bar in Chicago. Great drinks, nice atmosphere, friendly and personable bartenders and waitresses. Where most drinking and eating establishments have become pretentious and over priced, Silver Palm has been able to maintain some real authenticity and fair prices. They have the same signature drinks as Matchbox such as gilmets, margaritas, etc. Great wine selection. The only reason why I am giving it 4 stars and not 5 is because of some changes in the menu. They used to have a great burger - thick and juicy. Now it has changed into two thin over cooked patties that seem that they were once frozen. They also used to have a great steak sandwich which they dropped from the menu. I will continue to go back, but no burgers for me there anymore.

49.description: Amazing place to eat, intimate atmosphere with impeccable food. Service is not the best but the food and quality of drinks definitely made up for it. BBQ ribs with spicy BBQ sauce were some of the best I've had.

40.description: Silver palm is one of the reasons why the west loop is my favorite place to hang out! Drinking in a matchbox car, followed by amazing food at the silver palm.  Get the duck club sandwich-- it's definitely one of the best things I've had and I usually don't even like duck.  Another drink special to check out is the gimlet-- get it with either vodka or rum! It's well worth the price as they leave the mixer with you to fill your martini glass again and again.  Great drinks, amazing food, and the smallest bar in chicago, what else could you ask for?

53.description: My buddy was in town for the Super Bowl and he happens to be a huge Anthony Bourdain fan. Going to the Silver Palm for the Three Little Pigs was on his Chicago bucket list. We went on Friday night after Second City. We got a table in the train car and loved the atmosphere. 4 out of 5 of us got the Three Little Pigs. It is definitely not low calorie. It was a good sandwich - not great. Definitely gets gluttony and unique points. I think my only complaint was that it was a little dry. Perhaps some honey mustard or some other sauce/condiment might have helped. The other person in our group got the duck sandwich which he raved about. There were definitely other things on the menu that I wanted to try. Pretty good beer selection as well.

30.description: New menu! All the goodies from before plus some improved items and some totally new items. Same warm friendly staff and neighborhood vibe. Have a new burger or the great fish tacos. Hopefully the summer warms up soon many of the newer items are patio drinking friendly

46.description: My review might only be quasi-useful as I have only had 2 things (plus many many many beers) - The 3 Little Piggy (fine, ridicule me for being unoriginal, but seriously, why would you have anythig else?) and the onion rings.  I will note that I almost did not darken The Silver Palm's door as, to my dismay, it apparently is a favorite of Mancow's, and I hate that imbecilic, simpleton, unoriginal d-bag.  I hope at some point in the near future he is violated by a syphilitic camel.  But I digress.  The 3 Little Piggy is, in my sandwich universe, second only to the Torta Cubana at That's It Market in the Mission District (the Torta Cubana, btw, might hold my lifetime achievement award in the food porn category).  Tenderloin, bacon, ham, gruyere and a fried egg.  If that doesn't make you tingle just a little bit, then I don't know what would.  And the onion rings are some of the best I've had.  The service is always nice, not rushed but not "hey we're still here."  Good variety of beers.  You can order a mixed drink other than a Jack-and-Coke or martini and not get a confused look from the bartender.  And perhaps best of all, The Silver Palm is a stone's throw from the greatest sh!t show on earth, aka Mahoney's.

1.description: Finding the entrance of The Silver Palm is way confusing for first timers! I was one such newbie when I went this past weekend and thankfully some gentleman on the street pointed us in the right direction. The Silver Palm is one of the cooler atmospheres for dining being in a silver train car...but you enter around the corner from where you see the train car. I've had The Silver Palm on my list for awhile since they are Anthony Bourdain approved. And when I went, I had to get their Three Little Pigs sandwich which Bourdain proclaimed as the "Best Sandwich in America"! I gotta say...he may just be right. It's beastly and indulgent and you won't be able to eat it in one sitting. At least I sure couldn't. The Three Little Pigs is a layer of cheese, topped with breaded pork, stacked with an insane amount of thick delicious ham, crispy bacon curls on top of that, then a fried eggs that has a nice runny center, one big deep fried onion ring,then more cheese on a bun. When you put it all together, its stacked so darn high...the only way to fit it in a mouth is by pressing it down a bit or taking out some of the meats. It's good though. Real good. Makes my mouth water just thinking about it good. It's $13.95 and comes with a side. I did the tater tots and really liked those, as well.I had one of their cocktails that cost me $13 and seemed a few bucks overpriced. It was decent though. We also tried the butternut squash soup which was also just okay....it was more chunky than expected. I'm used to a creamy version of this but it was aiight.Our server was robotic but I saw some other servers that were super friendly, outgoing and engaged so I think ours was just having an off night. I'm so glad I finally got to The Silver Palm and that sandwich made the whole trip worthwhile!

55.description: Excellent food for very fair prices. Great service, fun dining experience. Food is served to you very quickly which I like. The ribs are awesome and huge! And they keep me happy because they have Wittekerke.

9.description: Pros:Atmosphere is cool, the dining area is placed in an old train car. Drinks are very good. Food is aight. Cons:Limited space, don't bring a big group here (more than 4) otherwise you will have to sit at separate tables They only allow one card per group to pay. And very rude about it. "We only do one check here so it'll all be together" but their menu says they take 2 cards per table. So a little weird.

26.description: I was there this weekend after they closed down for renovation. The place still looks pretty much the same. Christmas lights, really how about LED's? The shrimp is gone!!! Come on, Bad move!!!!! Then this blonde waitress has the nerve to charge us for cold food?!!! Omg this place got worst!

25.description: Super delicious. Everything was great. We had the tilapia tacos and ceviche (lemoney) and tater tots were exquisite.

12.description: We enjoyed The Silver Palm very much. Love the train car! Great wait staff. Food was good, I had the fried chicken sandwich which was excellent - nice piece of chicken and it had pickles! Oh yeah! We had the crazy gator to nachos - so bad they are good. Just one of those things where you just couldn't not eat them! Nice night out.

59.description: Saw this place on Anthony Bourdain (yes i know, cliche right?) and had to try out the heart attack of a sandwich "3 little pigs" while I  was in the area visiting my brother.The place is located on a main corner, dining in the train car which is kind of a trip...as in school bus crowded trip. The area seemed a little seedy, and it definitely is a place where "regulars" and "tourists" can be easily distinguished. Nonetheless I still came, ordered, and stuffed my belly and arteries with delicious swine.+1 star for staying open late for me and a friend, literally we got there and they were about to shut the kitchen down and keep only the bar open. The guy/gal working were really cool about it though. Told them we would just grub/drink and leave asap...I've always hated being the "last person" in a restaurant/establishment, years of working in a restaurant will do that to your soul.The sandwich is massive, and loaded with ham...so much ham that I actually had to pull some out in order to take a bite.... :( and this was after splitting it with my buddy....sad I know right?  The thing tasted great a tad dry, and definitely will give you the meat sweats...the egg was a good touch but really seemed wasted since we split the sandwich...It all really about the yolkporn anyway right? The fries were good, but nothing special or greatIf I was in the area, then I would likely come back to try the ribs that everyone else raves about, but otherwise I feel that lots of area in Chicago can fulfill my artery clogging cholesterol needs...

21.description: A typical looking Chicago dive bar in the front, and a train car converted into a restaurant in the back. I had dinner in the train car portion. The train car was cool looking. Definitely the type of restaurant gem you should keep in your back pocket if you want to impress a casual date or tourist. The food was pretty good. I had the veggie burger. It was one of the better veggie patties I've had, full of flavor and colorful vegetables and more than just mashed beans in the shape of a patty. It was a very typical (and good) Chicago pretzel bun burger. I would definitely consider going back. Only 4 stars because the seating in the train car portion is really cramp yet the chairs are big with large backs. I had to push the unused chair next to me in my "booth" away from the table just to have room to move my arm comfortably. Also where I was seated, the heat kept coming on aggressively. Don't get me wrong, I love a good warm restaurant in the Chicago winter, however it was blowing directly in my face and it made it uncomfortable to sit where I was, I'm not sure if this is true for the rest of the restaurant.

17.description: I was in town checking out a cubs game and saw this spot on a foodie channel and wanted to try it out.I loved the train car as restaurant pretty cool.I ordered the the three piggy and was in awe.Great food one of my favs if ever on a Chi Town trip.

10.description: Ralph Wiggum would most certainly Choo-Choo-Choose this place if he had a hankerin' for a fried chicken sandwich. This old railroad car turned restaurant puts one bomb ass bird on a bun. Add the homemade onion rings and you'll def run a train on your dinner! (shout out to Augie from Role Models youtube.com/watch?v=kL-1…)Yes...quarters are close, but the staff is super neighborhood friendly and it is one of the more unique settings in all of Chicago. Definitely worth a stop in if you're ever near Chicago Ave and Ogden.

5.description: All aboard for a fun time!  I love the ambience so much here I'm willing to overlook the shortcomings.  And I'm definitely coming back.The Silver Palm is like no place else I've eaten in Chicago.  It's an authentic retired dining car, resurrected and dropped into the middle of River West.  It brought back wonderful childhood memories of traveling across rural Illinois with my grandmother.  I could go on and on about our "adventures," but enough with the nostalgia, this review is supposed to be about the restaurant.I scoured the Yelp reviews for suggestions, as I had no idea what to expect.
