Based on what seems popular, we started with the warm goat cheese appetizer.  It didn't look that appealing when the server placed it on the table, but the tomato sauce packed a real punch and a lot of flavor... a pleasant surprise.  The grilled calamari appetizer had a wonderful flavor but was a little overcooked.We split the 3 piggy sandwich, which is the big draw here, and it's massive.  I had a quarter of it, and it was tasty but too salty for me.  My friend devoured the rest, so it's definitely a winner.  The onion rings were not worth the calories.Not many people write about the desserts, but I'd left room and ordered the (molten) chocolate cake with warm chocolate filling, topped with ice cream.  Not the best I've ever had, but close.  I scraped the plate clean.  The coffee was pretty good, too.The downside here is the service.  The kitchen is slow.  The servers are friendly and accommodating, but the restaurant needs more of them.  I think ours had tables inside the train car and out on the patio, too. As for the patio, it was packed on a warm summer evening.  But the tables are just a few feet from a street with heavy traffic, and mixing exhaust fumes and food isn't my thing.

3.description: Straight to the point - get here, NOW, and order the freakin' "3 Piggy". This sandwich undoubtedly rivals one of my favorites, the Senor Pan Cubano.  A mound of smoked ham, crispy bacon, salty, breaded pork tenderloin, an over-easy egg, Gruyere cheese, and an onion ring...GO... RUN...NOW! Sheer perfection. Had our side of Pork Belly not been overcooked (still, its pork, and our stomachs enjoyed it), and the asparagus left on the grill a few minutes longer (tough to chew), we'd have ourselves a 5-star dining car. House cocktails were a job well done, flavorsome with our hats off to the barista. Return visits to this quaint train-car are a certainty when traveling the North Milwaukee Ave.

35.description: This place is everything you want it to be.  A train car!  Its fun because it maxes out at groups of 4.  If you're by yourself you're eating at a big table.  If you're a party of 6 then you're at 2 tables.  Although they do have that front bar area but I'm not sure if they're serving the full menu up there.  So if you have a problem with small spaces then maybe wait until its warm out so you can eat outside.  We came early and scored a spot by the window.  This is a great date place!  Of course the cocktails are great.  This is the number one gimlet in the city.  You get a little biscuit which we thought was just ok.  Then we started w/ the white bean bruschetta which was messy but delicious.  My boyfriend had to get the Three Little Piggy with onion rings (because they make them there)  If you don't get onion rings ask for the onion ring sauce because it elevated the 3 pigs sandwich.  He was in heaven.  And its not just a meal its like three meals!  I had the grilled shrimp which was very tasty but hard to eat.  I don't understand why it was peel-and-eat in all of that butter and sauce.  Have you ever tried to remove a shrimp peel with a knife and fork?  I would come back here in a heartbeat.

19.description: Well, it seemed that the "3 piggy" sandwich was a favorite here on yelp, so I figured I would try it. I mean, who doesn't love bacon, pork and ham on a bun with cheese and a fried egg? Well, I can now say that I too am now a fan of this sandwich! Be warned, it's a very large sandwich. I had to cut it in half just to get part of it in my mouth! The sandwich is a work of art in and of itself! Service was very good - waitress took good care of us. Atmosphere is great! Was a little stuffy in the train car, though. I can only imagine how stuffy it would have been had the whole car been full!! But overall, I enjoyed the experience and I will be back again!!

28.description: Three Piggy is the famous sandwich. It was really good and super heavy. The seating area in the boxcar is kind of cool, but not ideal for large groups.

45.description: Had the Three little piggy sandwich. After having seen it on Bourdain, I did not expect it would live up to the hype. It didn't, but it was a very, very tasty sandwich. Coupled with a unique setting and it made for a good experience.

33.description: 3 little pigs sandwich is SOOO salty. I didn't taste pork... Just salt.. Service was terrible. We waited almost 20 minutes at our table before a waitress came out to take our order. They charged us for a beer that we didn't order and when my husband tried to calmly explain that we didn't even have beer, she (not a waitress... Maybe a bartender or management?) handed us a piece of paper and asked us to write how much we "thought" we should pay for our drinks. Extremely condescending.

43.description: This place is ok. Sometimes even good. But waitress Lauren is an entirely unpleasant person.

2.description: Located in a vintage dining car, built by Budd for the Atlantic Coast Line Railroad in 1947.  However, this is not the place to look for a museum-like recreation of the mid-century rail travel experience.  Interior fittings are not true to period; in service on ACL's Florida trains, there would have been white tablecloths and napery, fresh flowers, heavy silverware, fine china in the railroad's own pattern.  And of course there would have been a swarm of uniformed waiters, presided over by a steward in suit and vest.  At Silver Palm, on a moderately busy Sunday evening, there was one waitress and one busboy.  They did their best, but service was a bit slow.(Ironically, one of our party of five was a current Amtrak dining car server, just off duty from a run from Oakland on the California Zephyr, and still in her Amtrak uniform when we arrived at the restaurant.)Entrance to Silver Palm is through a separate building, the Matchbox Bar.  Full bar service.  A small selection of wines, available by the glass at one quarter of the bottle price.  Modest beer selection, a combination of domestic and imported industrials and a few craft brews.  Our dinner choices:  - Louisiana fried chicken. A half chicken marinated in buttermilk, in a rather flaky-textured breading.  Tender,  tasty, and not unduly greasy.- Barbecued pork ribs, tender and mildly sauced; a spicier sauce would have been available.  Served with three large onion rings.  Fries or roasted vegetables would have been alternatives.- Reuben sandwich.  House-smoked corned beef, thicker-sliced and smoother in texture than usually encountered.  Grilled with Gruyere and sauerkraut on marble rye.   Accompanied by a side of house-made spicy remoulade.  Again, choice of onion rings, fries, or veggies.- Portobello sandwich.  Thick grilled mushroom with aspirations to burgerhood.  Topped with goat cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and red onions, all in a brioche.  Same three side options as the Reuben.Beer choice:  Six Points Resin Imperial IPA.The near northwest side location is a bit off the beaten track, but has good transit access:  near the Chicago Avenue Blue Line station; also served by the 56-Milwaukee and. 66-Chicago bus lines.

18.description: This used to be one of my favorite places for a while, but that changed recently and I'll get to that. The atmosphere is awesome, a nostalgic train car turned diner with quirky signs and mood lighting. A great casual date spot. The patio is really neat too, on the side of the train car, though next to a busy street it's not even a distraction. They have a nice selection of micro brews as well as some draft options. I always liked the menu, even though for me it's limited, till recently. I'm vegetarian and my friend is vegan, so we ordered the asparagus and kale appetizer, the veggie burger and eggplant sandwich. The kale was deep fried and super oily when it came out, but the asparagus was good. Eggplant sandwich was really fresh and tender. And the veggie burger seemed great, even ordered one to go, except then we learned that the frozen patty was cooked in pork lard... I mean WHAT? Oh and the kale we had for the appetizer... Yup! Oozing with greasy pork fat!  I mean who does that? I shouldn't have to check or ask. The only vegetarian friendly options on the menu should be vegetarian! Now I can't trust your menu and I can only wonder if the drinks are worth the risk. This was a big blow for a really cool spot :(

41.description: Yes it's a train car, the windows need washing for sure but overall the atmosphere was good. I had the best salad ever here, a BNSF Rutherford Salad, omg it was amazing.  The perfect amount of cherries, apples, proscuitto and the fried avocados were a great touch, although they could have used a bit of salt or maybe some spicy heat.  My boyfriend had the Three Little pig sandwich and ate the whole thing, it was too much even for him but he finished it!  I also had their key lime pie, delicious!  Will definitely be back again.

52.description: I'm not exactly sure why this place is rated so poorly and I refuse to look at my fellow Yelper's reviews for fear it will influence my sacred duty as an impartial ranker.  I also don't understand why The Matchbox is a separate Yelp entry, one that is held is such high esteem.  To me these places are one in the same and the reviewers got it right with The Matchbox.The Silver Palm is well above average bar food with very interesting twists. The Southern Pacific Railway's Duck Club Sandwich is my go-to but really everything they offer is delicious.  Plus, for the bold they offer the famous feat of gluttonous excess (redundant?), the Three Little Piggy.  If you love food, specifically the act of force-feeding yourself over-indulgent, artery-clogging awesomeness, then eating the Three Little Piggy should be an experience akin to seeing the Louvre is to an Art buff (Three Little Piggy:glutton::Louvre:Artist).

50.description: Went to the Silver Palm this past Friday with a group of friends for dinner and drinks.  Some of us got beer while the others got cocktails.  The gimlets were strong and for one of my friend's drinks, they gave her the shaker so she ended up getting 2 drinks for the price of one.  We shared some appetizers which included the fried calamari and caesar salad.  Both of these items were really good.  The calamari serving was pretty big and fried just right.  The caesar salad was really tasty also, great dressing!  For an entree, I split the Seaboard Airline Railroad's Shrimp and Scallop Po' Boy sandwich.  It was huge, but very tasty.  The decor inside was probably my favorite part as you are seated in a railroad dining car to eat.  The biggest party you can have is 4 and my group had 7, so we ended up having two tables next to each other.  All in all, it was a good experience.

4.description: Came here for the 3 little piggy sandwich. Hat tip to Anthony Bourdain. I came, I saw, and I somehow conquered that not so little triple piggy. The ridiculous (looking, tasting, and sized) sandwich aside, the atmosphere was really cool--the attached matchbox bar and the dining car make for a legit drinking and dining experience full of history.

6.description: Masters of the fryolater.While drawn to the Silver Palm for the challenge of taking down the 3 Piggy Sandwich, actually got to sample more of the menu over two trips.3 Piggy Sandwich was as tall as advertised; with an imposing tower of ham, baked pork, and bacon, among other elements.  While bites of pure pig were a tough swallow, the saving grace was the substantial fried onion ring on the upper sandwich, which allowed a change-up in texture.  So robust was this onion ring that it kept its shape and crunch through the sandwich's demise.Returned to have the Louisiana-style fried chicken.  Again, an impressive batter-coated half-bird offered massive crunch at every bite.  Unlike the sandwich, however, the chicken itself was a bit dry and lacking of flavor.  Sauces were offered, but why mask the taste of expertly cooked chicken (see Mission Chinese Food and Momofuku Noodle Bar, both in NYC for salient examples)?For the teetotalers and designated drivers out there, the Silver Palm offers Gosling's ginger beer as a non-alcoholic options.  Definitely the cheapest complement to a not-so-pricey sandwich.

22.description: The food was DELICIOUS, service was fine. However, the experience fell short because the ambient music was being well overpowered by the music the kitchen had going on. The kitchen either had no door or it was kept open and they were blasting their music. Made the experience a bit unpleasant. I wish the server would have either closed the kitchen door or asked the cooks to lower the volume a bit as to not interfere with the dining area.Not to miss: The Three Piggy, quite a heavy yummy meal (stay away from it if you are on a diet!) and mashed potatoes were very good too, with small chunks and skin, not just a puree. Check can get pricey, but the food is great.

15.description: Three pigs... Yep. Just eat it and don't ask questions. Ok, maybe on a subsequent trip you can look around, but not until then

57.description: Not very good. Pretty overpriced and slow service

20.description: Fun Fun Fun place BUT go for the drinks (they are FABULOUS), and leave the food behind!!! Not too many places can mess up fried chicken, but they did. And Mom's ribs tasted like lighter fluid. Like I said, the drinks are FABULOUS...potent and plentiful, and the place is a BLAST!Oh, and remember to ask the bartender for the brandied cherries...they are a TREAT!

36.description: The venue is cute and different.  Service was fine.  the grilled calamari was good, it comes grilled with lemony butter and capers - yum.  I got the corned beef - it was fine.  My friend got the three piggy sandwich.  It was bigger than her head and after she was done, it didn't even look like she made a dent in it.  She said it was good, but WAY too much.  Her dad was happy when she brought it home.The fried chicken and French onion soup looked and smelled good.  But b/c of our gluttonous choices, the smell of meat may keep be away for a while!  But definitely worth checking out.

14.description: Fun Fun Fun place BUT go for the drinks (they are FABULOUS), and leave the food behind!!! Not too many places can mess up fried chicken, but they did. And Mom's ribs tasted like lighter fluid. Like I said, the drinks are FABULOUS...potent and plentiful, and the place is a BLAST!Oh, and remember to ask the bartender for the brandied cherries...they are a TREAT!

1.description: We really enjoyed the thin crust pizza and breaded mushrooms. We decided to just get a cheese pizza and we thought the sauce was great, crust was nice and they cut it into squares at our request. It was also a great price vs other places that would deliver to us. The breaded mushrooms were good and didn't seem like the standard frozen kind. They may have been homemade...not sure, but we enjoyed them. We will definitely order pizza delivery again.

9.description: Love the fresh salads, pastas, and of course great service! Highly recommend it! Try their chicken and shrimp salad. It's spicy savory and delicious!! Also very reasonably priced. Perfect for small groups or even dates

23.description: Oggi is back at a new location and we couldn't be more excited!!! Same owner, staff and chef and food was simply amazing!!! We enjoyed the fresh baked dinner rolls and bruschetta along with entre's: Spaghetti Carbonara, Veal Parmesan and Veal limone...Congratulations to the owners & staff for all your hard work to make this happen...beautiful new location, people & food...what more could you ask for

12.description: Good food, octopus appetizer was great. My veal was very good. Only problem is service. We were there with only one other table and had to wait for nearly everything. I understand when it's crowded but when it's empty? Come on.

21.description: This place has excellent Italian food. I had the cheese ravioli, which had a really good sauce, or like the Italians say "gravy". It was so good i saved a roll that they give you at the start just to scoop up the rest of the gravy. My plate was clean. My girlfriend had the carbonara with grilled chicken on top. She loved it. I tasted it too and it was good. The chicken had excellent char marks. The atmosphere is nice and has a beautiful portrait on the wall. Its a great spot for family or if you just want to have date night. Either way they treat you so well. The prices are very reasonable

16.description: This place has excellent Italian food. I had the cheese ravioli, which had a really good sauce, or like the Italians say "gravy". It was so good i saved a roll that they give you at the start just to scoop up the rest of the gravy. My plate was clean. My girlfriend had the carbonara with grilled chicken on top. She loved it. I tasted it too and it was good. The chicken had excellent char marks. The atmosphere is nice and has a beautiful portrait on the wall. Its a great spot for family or if you just want to have date night. Either way they treat you so well. The prices are very reasonable

17.description: Elegant, classic Italian fare with a lovely owner and attentive waitstaff.  I look forward to returning to this neighborhood gem.

10.description: Our yoga gang have our quarterly dinner get together and we always pick Oggi.  The service is fantastic and the food never disappoints.  From the pastas to the meat and fish dishes, the taste is fantastic and very reasonably priced.  $8 for a very generous pour of NZ Sauvignon Blanc is super value.  The plates are large which is great because we get to have leftovers for lunch the next day.  I had the grilled octopus which was delicious.  Truly worth a visit and I bet you will go back.

5.description: sooooo we didn't try the pizza we went with the Ravioli and the Beef/Sausage Combo.  The Ravioli was great!  The Italian Combo sandwich was not that good.  The Beef was too thick and not really cut at all and the Italian Sausage was way too soggy and didn't have much flavor.

11.description: Love this place love the customer service the owners make you feel welcome every time would recommend this place to anyone out for a delicious meal

22.description: This is a good Italian place in a neighborhood full of Italian places.  The new location was designed well and the atmosphere feels authentic.  There is nothing earth-shattering  about the menu, but the food is prepared a presented well and the tastes are spot on.

0.description: Oggi consistently serves well-made, lovingly presented, classic Italian-American fare using fresh ingredients.  The pasta is al dente.  The pizzas are wonderfully crisp and pleasingly chewy.  The fresh seafood pastas really shine, and portions are generous - bordering on epic.  You're greeted warmly, treated well, and offered good value for the money.  The patrons aren't obnoxious and there's no "scene."  It's just a great restaurant, plain and simple.  Places that serve Italian-American food rarely put this much love and attention into their cooking.  But that's where Oggi shines, and it's why I've been coming here for the better part of the last decade.  Their relocation to a new space (next to Bari foods) has introduced a full bar to the mix, which includes a carefully-curated wine list with a range of classic offerings.

20.description: The food at Oggi Trattoria is very good. It's one of the best restaurants in the neighborhood.

19.description: This is a good Italian place in a neighborhood full of Italian places.  The new location was designed well and the atmosphere feels authentic.  There is nothing earth-shattering  about the menu, but the food is prepared a presented well and the tastes are spot on.

2.description: The rave reviews must be friends. This is what $11 worth of calamari looks like. Can you spot the two pathetic squids? Overpriced for what it is.

18.description: They are back. Stopped in tonight for a drink to see the new place. Beautiful. Very classy. Same great food. Great to see Sam and Luce, and the whole family. If you have never been to Oggi's make a point tonstop in for great food and great people.

13.description: Oggi is back at a new location and we couldn't be more excited!!! Same owner, staff and chef and food was simply amazing!!! We enjoyed the fresh baked dinner rolls and bruschetta along with entre's: Spaghetti Carbonara, Veal Parmesan and Veal limone...Congratulations to the owners & staff for all your hard work to make this happen...beautiful new location, people & food...what more could you ask for

4.description: Amazing food.  Ordered it on grubhub because I saw it on the way home one day and the food arrived earlier than expected, they made my dishes with the stated modifications, and their delivery man was very friendly.  Most importantly, their food was FANTASTIC.  It was very well done--the sauces were spot on, the pastas made properly, and even the complimentary bread was great.  Would order from here again.

24.description: They are back. Stopped in tonight for a drink to see the new place. Beautiful. Very classy. Same great food. Great to see Sam and Luce, and the whole family. If you have never been to Oggi's make a point tonstop in for great food and great people.

6.description: First time at this restaurant and I was amazed. I find it very hard to venture out and try different places, but I am sure glad I was introduced to Oggi. Service was great, very welcoming and family-oriented. Definitely returning! :)

15.description: Ordered pasta carbonara and it was rich and delish.  Their fresh baked bread is soft and yummy also.  Great addition to the neighborhood and can't wait to go back!

7.description: Eating the grilled octopus in this perfectly garlicky, spicy tomato broth is amazing!!! A simple angel hair pasta dish Oggi's pasta is so delicious with a perfect balance of basil, chopped tomatoes, garlic and sauce!!!

8.description: Oggi is a gem. It relocated from its longtime location at Grand and Noble to Grand and Ada (1118 W. Grand), and thank goodness it didn't close! Oggi is a warm, family-run restaurant where the owners will go out of their way to make you feel like you are eating at their home.  Oggi serves classic Italian American food, with a full bar and menu of homemade pastas, meat dishes and pizza.  My favorites are linguine pescatore, linguine with red or white clams, gnocchi, rigatoni forno (baked rigatoni with delicious red sauce with melted mozzarella cheese), cavatelli, chicken vesuvio and octopus.  And the Oggi bread is to die for!  Prices are reasonable and the restaurant is full of warmth and love.  If you are looking for a delicious, hearty, warm meal of classic Italian American food, Oggi is the place to go!

3.description: I've been here before and after their move, except since my last visit, I've taken on a particularly restricting diet due to health concerns. Basically, I have to eat very few carbs, and definitely no refined grains eg: pasta (it's called ketogenic). The woman was absolutely compromising, said they make all their food fresh so any combinations were possible. When I asked if they could substitute pasta for vegetables, she practically gave me a high-five. The result was delicious as usual and additionally, within my needs. At some other restaurants, it can be a pain in the ass to even get hash browns swapped out for a salad. They'll be seeing me again no doubt!

14.description: The thin crust pepperoni pizza was one of the best I found in Chicago. Bread rolls are awesome! Just had the grilled calamari appetizer and delicious with a lemon, VOO fresh herb and lemon sauce! Also love the Linguini Alla Pescatore seafood pasta!!

0.description: Love this place. I'm so glad I found it. It's located off the major path and it's very easy to miss. I have three pieces in my house from here. If you are looking for something original and personal this is the place! The prices are pretty good for original pieces. The ambiance is so nice. It really feels like a gallery full of beautiful art. I think everyone should check this place out. The owner is extremely nice and accommodating. I was able to get delivery next day and the owner even made certain adjusts to the furniture for me - free of charge! I will definitely be back!

3.description: A supremely talented artist has created an extraordinary space in Yo:u. Yolanda is by far the best hair stylist I've been to which is why I'd follow her anywhere (in Cook County, maybe beyond). Her new salon exudes warmth, accessibility, and love. As always, her skills with hair are outstanding. I receive compliments for months after each appointment. Also, my hair is so much easier to manage under her care and she provides useful tips to keep it looking great.   Looking forward to many more visits!

1.description: Everyone. Stop whatever you are doing and go see Yolanda. I got a terrible color a couple of weeks ago and she has truthfully transformed my hair, and I can honestly say in 32 years it has never looked better. Her gorgeous salon is neat, invited and her receptionist is equally as charming. Lovely art, fantastic bumble&bumble products... But seriously Yolanda. The lady knows her hair. Everyone's hair. She is also a barber (how cool is that?!).I've lived in Chicago for ten years, frequented various wonderful salons, but none compare to Yolanda and her sheer talent.

2.description: First of all....Yo:u speaks for the people and the community. Full of love and light. I love the staff and the overall ambiance of the shop. Yolanda has taken my hair from pixie short and dark to long, blonde and GORG. She is my life-stylist for a reason...she rocks! Back to the salon itself, how about the fact that they are offering yoga class among other community gatherings. The owner has a vision, come witness every detail come to fruition. GREAT WORK YO:U !!!

5.description: Such a fantastic experience through and through. I was warmly greeted and felt instantly drawn to the art and decor. The shop has an incredibly open vibe with subtle personal touches and photos that give you a cozy feel. Yolanda and company created this inclusive environment even while I waited for her to finish her previous client (I was early).  We're all friends here!My shampoo and scalp massage was super relaxing and then Yolanda went to work her magic. She says, tell me what you like, what you don't like, what we can fix, and then she's off and snipping. She nailed my blowout and always makes me feel like a million bucks. As a chick with curly hair, I'm super cautious about who touches it. I feel so lucky to have found her because not only is she skilled, she's such an enjoyable energy.

6.description: After recently moving to Chicago I was in desperate need to find a new reliable hair place.  Yolanda came highly recommended, and she absolutely lives up to the hype.  Firstly her salon is an eclectic mix of art, music, and design.  It does not feel like the typical barber shop or salon, it feels more like a place I would go to relax and socialize with friends. Yolanda herself was smiling from the moment I met her, she has such a warm presence and her passion is obvious.  After a few haircuts she has really gotten a feel for what I'm looking for, making suggestions to aesthetically improve things along the way. The entire staff is always friendly and accommodating, the whole experience is always great.  I will absolutely continue to go back.

7.description: This place is fab!  Best haircut of my life...even my husband noticed!  Not only am I happy with the service, I love the salon.  It's really cozy inside & right by the highway.  I couldn't ask for anything more.

0.description: Grooming splurges are pretty rare for me. My ceiling is usually about 40 bucks since my style is a simple men's cut, but Yo:u may have changed my whole perspective on primping. Got a $65 cut and beard trim, but I've never received so many compliments on my appearance in my entire life. Yolanda is the owner and totally makes a traditionally female dominated environment comfortable for a dude. She's excellent conversation, a huge Chicago Bulls fan, and from what I've heard around town, one of the best stylists in the entire city. I don't doubt it considering my girlfriends reaction after I returned home. She loved it and is excited to get in there herself. The place only recently opened, but will triple as an art gallery and event space once the i's are dotted and t's are crossed. Even though it's a little more than I'm used to spending on looking fresh I think all the compliments I've gotten in the past week justify the price tag.

4.description: Yolanda is a Rock Star, she gave me a very much needed updated look, this girls got skills !!! The salon is wonderful, great location, easy street parking, accommodating hours and very friendly staff.

58.description: First time there and we loved it. My boyfriend had the Ole Omelette: Chorizo Sausage, Jalapeños, Onions,  and Cheddar Cheese, while I ordered the December special: Brioche french toast dipped in a cinnamon and eggnog batter with pecans and cinnamon butter. Everything was great down to the BIg Shoulders coffee they serve.  It was fantastic and didn't have to wait an hour + to be seated - not to say the place wasn't packed, just a hidden gem in west town.  So worth and can't wait to go back to have lunch there as the looked incredible. Great staff, great food and great price (for two breakfast entrees, 2 coffees and a mexican hot chocolate it was just under $25 without tip).  Happily will return again and again!

56.description: My boyfriend and I love Windy City! We come in at least once a week. Today, we had a very good experience. They were extremely busy and it was noon on a Sunday... Now I will say that the service is usually very fast but today they were a bit slammed. Our food took longer than normal, but we received it fast enough and it was hot and delicious. A woman (not our waitress, but seemed like a manager) gave us our check and gave us a 50% discount for the long wait. That kind of service rarely happens, we were quite surprised!! The longer than normal wait today will absolutely not affect our loyalty to this great neighborhood diner!!! If you're still reading this, try the biscuits and gravy! ;)

29.description: This is my favorite hidden gem in Chicago.  1.  Great staff.  Always friendly and seems to be a 'family run joint' that is nearly impossible to find in chicago.2.  Food.  Pretty awesome stuff.  Skillets are great, omelettes are bigger than any other omelette I've eaten, and fresh.3.  Not expensive.  'nuf said.Keep up the great work

42.description: Love this place!  The staff is amazing. The food is always spot on and the friendliness can't be beat. I dine at Windy City once every week or two and I would encourage anyone to enjoy all of their offerings. A+

23.description: Simply astounding food! A great menu with so much good stuff to pick from. You will not be disappointed!

47.description: Had a great Apple Jack burger and my friend had the Rueben. Ross was our server and he was attentive and a little sassy, making our lunch there a fun experience. Great portion size for the money. Clean place with a bright fun atmosphere.

8.description: Order the coffee. It's nutty and wonderful. I did not regret it.  I had Eggs Benedict - the sauce was really yummy and we'll flavored. I would highly suggest it. Our waitress was friendly and overall I really enjoyed the experience. The potatoes were also really tasty.  The portions were good sized but not so much food that you would need to take leftovers.

31.description: We enjoy this spot, quality ingredients, big portion sizes.  My wife orders an omelette, I get a skillet.  A bit pricey, but you always have leftovers.  Their is parking on site, but it is tricky to get in and out of. Parking could be an issue, so plan to add that time in.  Wait is less than 5 minutes for a party of 4.

34.description: Polite yet somewhat indifferent wait staff doling out insipid, boring, lackluster food. Mediocre mediocrity with a half-smile.

16.description: I can't think of any other place in the city for warm oat meal and hot coffee. Here I feel at home.

13.description: If I could live above this place I would.  Although then I would probably go here for every meal.  The service is excellent.  Sometimes they offer coffee to go which is a huge plus.  Their Biscuits and Gravy are some of the best I have ever had.  Skillets are excellent, omelettes are huge, and their eggs benedict are on par with any other place around.  Big Shoulders coffee is also fantastic.  Can't say enough great things about this diner.

11.description: My husband and I stopped here for lunch after taking a yoga class at Moksha down the street.  We had a totally delicious, casual lunch.  I had a tuna sandwich and was very impressed.  I think my husband had something with eggs--can't remember what--but I think he got breakfast potatoes and they were really good.They also have iced coffee from Big Shoulders nearby, which is nice.  Overall, a great little place in the neighborhood.

39.description: My favorite neighborhood go-to breakfast spot. The service is always friendly and quick and has a nice clean, bright atmosphere with pictures of old Chicago days gone by on the walls. While my husband I don't have kids (yet!), this is a very family-friendly, vibrant place. We frequent this place on early weekend mornings. We always order the mozzarella sticks (yes, even at 8 a.m.) and either share the tuna melt or get the Health Club (cottage cheese, fruit and veggies, poached eggs, and an English muffin, add cream cheese, please!). They serve Big Shoulders coffee here, which is a little strong and bitter for my taste, but I can doctor it up with cream and sugar. I really enjoy having this place in my neighborhood.

37.description: We just moved to the neighborhood and tried this place last Saturday. Loved it! It's such a neighborhood-y place, packed with locals and super friendly waitstaff.Our waitress, Jennifer, was awesome super attentive and made good recommendations. I had the healthy eggs Benedict and the portion was huge. My husband had a healthy omelette and said it was really good. Good food, friendly staff, clean establishment, and very little wait. We will be back!

0.description: Breakfast is always a great option. A little bit of a wait on a Sunday but what you'd expect. Our waitress was so sweet and very pleasant to talk to! I order the burrito and a bagel. Both very yummy. Their coffee is Big Shoulders and that is some darn good java! I really liked that she gave me a to-go cup too!Place was small, a great diner feel, quick service, food was hot and everything was just delicious. Soaked up the alcohol from the previous night!Would recommend to anybody looking for a great sized portion of a breakfast with plenty of choices for healthy eaters or hungover brunchers!

38.description: A great breakfast spot. Great food prepared with care and amazing multigrain toast. Very reasonable prices and clean.

51.description: This is a pretty solid breakfast spot. I had a Spinach, Bacon & Cheddar omelet with potatoes(very good), toast and Big Shoulders coffee. It gets pretty busy pretty fast. The service is friendly and the prices are reasonable. It's in a pretty good location too for those on public transit.

27.description: I'm a regular here.  Apart from being the closer breakfast/lunch spot to me, it's relatively cheap, delicious and well staffed.  If you like spicy, get the South of Border Skillet.  If you want your traditional pancake breakfast, get one of the clubs. If you want healthy- they got it, I've just never tried it. Don't get their croissant though, unless you plan on using it as a bun. To clean leftover plate sauce.

32.description: Very good breakfast, you're set for about 7-12 dollar per person for a (very) large breakfast!Service is great too, the coffee was free refill and the pancakes were the best american pancakes I've ever had.

54.description: I took my mom here for a birthday brunch yesterday and we were both very pleased with the food. This is saying a lot because my mom is literally one of the judgiest (I know it's not a real word, but I need to use it here. lol) eaters on planet earth. She had the Edgar's skillet which is packed full of meat and cheese. I stole a few bites and was jealous that I didn't pick it as my meal. I had the omelet that was on special that day (forgot the name, sorry). It had avocados, spinach, cheese and applewood smoked bacon. Needed a pinch of salt but was extremely tasty with fresh ingredients. It comes with potatoes and a side of toast but I passed on the toast since mom and I decided to split a half order or french toast. The french toast was easily the highlight of the meal. You don't need too much syrup, they were moist and SO flavorful. I enjoyed every bite. The half order comes with two slices cut into four and it was more than enough for my mom and me to split with our entrees. The service was good, our server was very friendly and he was wearing a hilarious Christmas sweater that said "All I want for Christmas is Beyonce". Minus one star for the small space in the front with virtually no waiting area and my slightly cold potatoes. Despite the minor issues I liked the atmosphere and will definitely be back!

48.description: Food is good. I live down the street but don't come too often. I recommend this place to anyone in the area.

44.description: This place is just walking distance from me and I love it. The people that work in this great diner are always so friendly and accommodating. I usually order the Number 3 half order of french toast, eggs, sausage and my coffee. However my boyfriend ordered a breakfast skillet and that was the bomb! Those potatoes that came in his skillet were made to perfection and that ham was marvelous! I wanted to almost exchange my dish. But nahh, all just come back and order that instead! :-D

24.description: My gripe is they give you one slice of toast with omelet orders, esp take out.   That is a bit of a rip off. $10 omelet should at least get you 2 slices of toast.  2 slices of toast = benchmark

7.description: Great value, fresh food, and great presentation. This was a win.

49.description: My family and I have dined here 2x, and we'll be back for more! My son recently moved to the Ukranian Village and several times a month, I visit him. Our 1st experience with Windy City was noteworthy. Our server, Mujju was informative and attentive. The food quality was superior to other cafes/diners. I told our waiter I had to pay for parking on the street, cause the Cafe is located on one of those weird 6 corners of Chicago. He informed us that parking parallel to the diner was allowed and free and they had a private lot in the back. Good tip!This past weekend, we had the opportunity to dine at Windy City for a 2nd time....yeah! Parked in their private free lot... yeah, again! This time we arrived at the height of Sunday Brunch, 12/noon. Not to panic, the Host was like a orchestra conductor. He took names, watched when guests would leave, so he could clear the table(s) for the next guests, processed payments, and basically pitched in where help was needed. Gotta say, when you have a line of hungry guests at your door, I appreciate the extra effort a Host helps his team.Our waiter, Ross H. was awesome! Friendly, attentive and a sense of humor. Windy City changes their menu with the seasons, which keeps the family owned business interesting and you want to return for more. Our favs are the South of the Border skillet and anything with corned beef hash.

40.description: Windy City Cafe, y u never disappoint? Friendly staff and always quick service. My only suggestion is to stay away from the Sunday church rush. Other than that, I never have a problem getting a seat.

53.description: Great place for breakfast.  We were visiting and wanted to stop by a place before jumping on the highway.  Better value than eating downtown without sacrificing quality and quantity.  I had an egg white omelette with chicken, mushroom, broccoli and cheese...excellent.  Kids and wife also loved their food.

30.description: I came here on a Sunday afternoon for brunch with one other friend. The wait was less than 5 minutes and I was able to be seated while I waited for the other member of my party. The best thing about Windy City Café is the expansiveness of the menu. There is something for everyone here. Everything from the healthy to the decadent is covered. I had the smoked salmon benedict and whole grain pancakes. The salmon benedict was delicious. The English muffin was perfectly toasted and buttered. The egg was poached perfectly with a delicious runny yolk. My only disappointment was that it did not come with spinach. The pancakes were moist and fluffy (which for whole grain pancakes isn't a given). If you like diner breakfast WCC takes that fare up a notch. I'll definitely return.

46.description: Great selection (HUGE menu) and good service.  Had the Farmer's Omelet and it was absolutely delish.  Just the right amount of goat's cheese with spinach and chicken sausage.  I was pleasantly surprised with the side of fruit as it was fresh and had better types of fruit than other breakfast places.  My boyfriend loved the buffalo chicken wrap.  Great coffee.  Definitely coming back.

1.description: I popped into this place for lunch on a random weekday.  Sadly, I was too hungry to stop and take a picture of my food.  But that's a good thing, right?To start off, I wish I could give 3.75 stars.  This is a cute little place with a decent sized menu and ingredients seem nice and fresh.  I ordered the Caesar Wrap from their lunch menu.  Their breakfast menu looks really tempting, but it was past that "Oh, it's not too late to order breakfast" cut off time for me.  Thus, I ordered lunch.Location, easy peezy from CTA Blue Line stop.  Parking, however, looks to be paid only on the major streets.  Clean and tidy.  Friendly staff.  There is a back room for additional seating, so don't let the smallish front part scare you away.The wrap was decent.  Not exciting, but good.  Filling.  I have to admit I didn't order anything out of my "comfort zone" (the Caesar Wrap was my second choice.  My first choice on the menu had been discontinued very recently) so I ordered something simple.  But it was good. My only question was.... why are there tomatoes in a Caesar Wrap?  Caesar salads don't come with tomatoes.So, if you are in the area, this is a nice place to check out.  I'd definitely aim for breakfast. Their menu looks pretty good.

55.description: Good food, good people. Great spot for breakfast or lunch, and you won't have to wait long(or at all) to get a table like most other places in the city on Saturdays and Sundays. Food is basic but still really good. Price is great too.

9.description: We happened upon this place due to other Yelp reviews and we were pretty happy with our decision. The prices were reasonable and the portions were generous. The service was good, but the coffee was just okay.

26.description: This place awesome! I went for breakfast there this morning. They have a huge selection, lots of vegetarian friendly options. I opted for the veggie benedict with a fruit cup - nice and filling. They even put the hollandaise sauce on the side (I took it to go) so it wouldn't get messy. Great service, delicious food, awesome price point - everything you want in a local breakfast spot.

25.description: I have been a customer for about five years now and I've never been disappointed in the service, staff or food.  I've tried just about everything on the menu but my favorites are the frittatas, hangover burger, and the salmon eggs benedict.

12.description: Terrible line management upon entering paired with a member of the wait staff lecturing us about the inner door being opened as if she was our parent wasn't a great experience. This should be rectified as I'm sure I'm not the only one who has had a negative experience like this.

59.description: Growing up and now living as an adult in this neighborhood, I've really tried to give this place plenty of chances. While the food is generally good, it lacks many diner qualities. Cons: -The service is slow. Don't think you can order out either because you'll wait just as long.-I've had my order mixed up on my last three visits now. -The prices are pretty higher for a diner. $6 for a bowl a soup? $12 for an omelet? For that price I'll go to Summer House. Pros:-As I mentioned, the food generally tastes good-Friendly wait staff

21.description: Order the coffee. It's nutty and wonderful. I did not regret it.  I had Eggs Benedict - the sauce was really yummy and we'll flavored. I would highly suggest it. Our waitress was friendly and overall I really enjoyed the experience. The potatoes were also really tasty.  The portions were good sized but not so much food that you would need to take leftovers.

17.description: Huge, huge menu, very friendly hipster-ish staff, eclectic clientele (big table of cops, neighborhood guys, families with kids), low prices, quality diner food (as someone else mentioned, fresh-squeezed juice at low prices was really nice surprise!), large portions.  What's not to like?

10.description: This place awesome! I went for breakfast there this morning. They have a huge selection, lots of vegetarian friendly options. I opted for the veggie benedict with a fruit cup - nice and filling. They even put the hollandaise sauce on the side (I took it to go) so it wouldn't get messy. Great service, delicious food, awesome price point - everything you want in a local breakfast spot.

5.description: Great diner in River West.  It's an easy spot to grab a good breakfast on a saturday or sunday ( or any day!).  The menu is large with lot of options and the prices are great ($28 for two breakfasts and two coffee's).  Service is beyond friendly and they really strive to create a welcome environment.  I also never felt rushed, despite the line out the door.

3.description: They're friendly. And everything looks clean. Seems like their menu is always under construction. I've been here 3 times and every time I order something they hit me with the "ohhhhhh, we don't have that today.." Even though it's a "cafe" the don't have anything but plain old coffee. No lattes, cappuccinos... The plus though is that the coffee they do have is from "Big Shoulders Coffee" from across the street. Yelp them. They're awesome. Anyways, don't come here for dessert, for you will be highly disappointed like I was the first time. Oh, and they close at 3 pm.

35.description: Probably one of the best breakfast places I've ever been to. I ordered a veggie skillet. It was very very very fresh, I actually ate all the vegetables. The only downside is that my water tasted a little funky and the the food took a little to come out, otherwise it was amazing!

19.description: This place is just walking distance from me and I love it. The people that work in this great diner are always so friendly and accommodating. I usually order the Number 3 half order of french toast, eggs, sausage and my coffee. However my boyfriend ordered a breakfast skillet and that was the bomb! Those potatoes that came in his skillet were made to perfection and that ham was marvelous! I wanted to almost exchange my dish. But nahh, all just come back and order that instead! :-D

28.description: My husband and I stopped here for lunch after taking a yoga class at Moksha down the street.  We had a totally delicious, casual lunch.  I had a tuna sandwich and was very impressed.  I think my husband had something with eggs--can't remember what--but I think he got breakfast potatoes and they were really good.They also have iced coffee from Big Shoulders nearby, which is nice.  Overall, a great little place in the neighborhood.

45.description: Super friendly service, delicious food (and a massive menu), cosy and bright atmosphere. And my coffee cup was never half empty before a top-off was offered.  Great place all around.

33.description: I live in River West and this is definitely my go to spot whether by myself, or if I have family/friends visiting. The staff is very friendly, the service is quick, and the food is delicious. They use Big Shoulders Coffee (across the street) which is awesome!Some of my go-to items incude the "Capone Burger" and any of their egg's benedict. I really don't think you can go wrong here. Keep up the good work!

43.description: Went to brunch here after Pilates at West Town Pilates, and it was absolutely amazing! While the place doesn't seem huge upon entry, there is a second room around the corner that allow for more seating and has several booths. The potions were generous but not too huge, and the price was excellent! Our server was polite, attentive, and offered various suggestions and modifications to accommodate the diets of our group. The huevos rancheros was prepared very well, with the eggs not too runny, and just enough salsa verde. The biscuits and gravy were not soggy or mushy, but also not dry, which seems to be a challenge for some other restaurants. Th coffee was also delicious, and is roasted just across the street, and the servers were quick to fill an empty mug. I would definitely go again, and would recommend to a friend/family member.

2.description: Good place to relax on a lovely Sunday.  My favorite things are the wraps, cinnamon bun French toast, breaks fast burrito and their pancakes.  Yum.Update:  The Buffalo Chicken Wrap could have been better.  It was literally breading with hot sauce, diced tomatoes, lettuce and a little blue cheese.  I barely and I do mean barely had any chicken. Disappointing.

18.description: Came in for very late breakfast 45 minutes before closing.  We were cheerfully greeted, and our late breakfast omelette a were prepared to order perfectly!! I love the fluffy moist egg white (up charge $1.50 for egg whites only) omelets here!!! They were out of mushrooms so we were allowed to request a substitute vegetable. Found out that Windy City Cafe has over 30 kinds of bread, including marble rye and multigrain, you can choose for your toast! No up charge for tomato slices or a 1/2 cup of fresh fruit instead of potatoes with your eggs!! Love this.The husband's omelet was soft without brown edges anywhere, just the way he likes it!  I love not listening to, 'No one can properly cook eggs anymore! The test of a good chef is how well the eggs are cooked.' while trying to enjoy my meal!Lovely and on a tropical Chicago Monday afternoon.Now, that's how I like it!!!!

41.description: Ordered a breakfast sandwich.   It's nothing to write home about.   The english muffin wasn't even toasted.   I won't be back, the traffic isn't worth it.

52.description: You can find me here at least twice a month on a weekend morning and although it is always crowded, I've never waited more than 10 minutes for a table. Everything I've ordered has been wonderful and the service is always excellent (coffees and waters always filled).

50.description: Great food, GREAT service, great prices, and great variety on the menu. Haven't been disappointed yet

4.description: My favorite diner in the River West area. The food is good and the staff is friendly. They also have parking in the back. Yesss, I would definitely recommend them!

6.description: This is a great neighborhood diner that is on my rotating breakfast spot. The food is delicious, the service is top notch and the prices are reasonable. I highly recommend

22.description: I am a big fan of egg bennies and this place is on point. Great service and decent prices.

15.description: Very good food.  Also very conveniently located next to St. John Cantius for after Mass meals.  Food is good and decor is comfortable for a breakface place.

57.description: Great food for a great price and friendly service. I recommend the huevos rancheros, but you can also piece together a great meal from the list of sides.

20.description: I love this place! Great customer service! Great food! Great prices! and Great music!

36.description: Just moved to the area and went for breakfast this morning and had the linebacker omelette. It was fantastic and so were the potatoes.

14.description: Friendly staff and a big menu started our lunch. I ordered my typical lunch salad and it was tasty. In hindsight I should have been more adventuresome. Be prepared for a short wait, it's busy and vibrant. All the other entrées I saw looked delicious and few plates had anything left for taking home. Can't wait for my next visit, I'll definitely avoid my standard salad.

28.description: I've lived in Hawaii, San Diego, Kansas City, Milwaukee, and Chicago.  And in each of these cities I have tried a minimum of three places for deep tissue massage (not to mention massages I've had at resorts while on vacations).  Copper Spa is my new go-to place for massage in Chicago!  I'm definitely a deep tissue massage snob...and Karen at Copper Spa totally hit the spot(s)!I went there on a limb, based on the few reviews the place had and knowing that they offer a $50 for 60mins special to new customers.  I pulled up and was TOTALLY sketched out by the window front and signs on the front of the place.  I almost thought about not going in, but I was in a lot of pain and REALLY needed a massage...so in I went!I was greeted immediately by two young women, Jessica and Karen.  Since it was snowy outside, they had me take my boots off and gave me flip flops to wear back to the room.  They had me pay before going back for the massage--which I don't think I've ever had to do at any other places.  I always pay after the massage, which makes sense so that the customer can give an adequate tip based on the massage they receive.  I would've tipped more, had I known just how great the massage was going to be!!  Oh well, next time--because there WILL be a next time!Karen was my masseuse.  She has a small stature, but was able to apply a very deep pressure.  She found the massive and countless knots in my back and worked them out.  She stuck with the trouble areas until they broke up.  Karen also seemed to incorporate some Thai type techniques, by using her knees for parts of the massage and also passively stretched my arms, legs, and back.  The best was that she also cracked my back, which was great!!  Karen made sure to check-in with me regarding if the pressure was enough or too much.  The massage was finished off with the use of hot stones...with no extra charge (awesome!).As far as the atmosphere goes, it wasn't anything special.  I am not picky about the environment that I get a massage in...aside from wanting it to be clean (duh!).  This place was definitely clean and in a private room.  I was able to hear the phone ringing up front and could hear the conversations going on up front and on the phone.  Those things didn't bother me, but I do realize that those types of things do bother some people...so I figured I would mention it.I also got to meet one of the managers, Kevin, as I was leaving.  He was just as welcoming as Jessica and Karen were when I first got there.  Go check this place out and ask for the new customer $50 special :) **I almost forgot to mention--if you use a debit or credit card, there is a $3 fee added...that was the one downfall of the place...

1.description: I was having a lazy Sunday and decided to call to see if they had availability. No one answered and I immediately got a text from a different number asking what I wanted. After the "who is this" convo i realize it's the manager and they said be here in 15. I rush over for a massage and facial. They tried upping the price and did not make me feel comfortable. They were yelling at each other while I was getting my facial (which is a cleansing portion, a massaging portion and a sheet mask portion, I could have done myself) it did not look clean, and when I paid they tried having me tip more than my 20% I left.

9.description: Excellent Deep Tissue Massage however it was the first one I've gotten where they didn't use any lotion. I thought that was strange at first however after one of the women jumped up and walked on my back for 30 minutes I was in heaven.

29.description: I recently discovered the Copper Spa on Milwaukee, just before I-94.  Traffic wasn't moving and a parking space opened next to me as if fate was calling me in, so I went in to check it out.I was greeted by Lilly with a big smile and quick sampling of a neck and shoulder massage.  Wow... That feels awesome... I mean AWESOME, but somehow managed enough will power to inquire about their services, prices and facilities.  I got the grand tour and the place was very clean and the sauna appeared brand new.   I liked the showers in some rooms so you can wash off the massage oils, but they will also wipe you down with hot towels; which ever you prefer.  One room also has the poles for walking on your back.  As I continued to study the menu, I was given a few more firm squeezes on the neck and shoulders and could not resist any longer.I saw only Asian staff, but I'm told they also have European therapists, all licensed and skilled in various massage techniques.  All spoke good English and are very accomodating.  Nicole was my therapists and asked if I prefer a soft or hard massage.  I like strong deep tissue and Nicole is clearly skilled at her profession, exerting the perfect amount of pressure in the exact spots as if she could read my mind.  I paid for an hour massage and got nothing less than an hour.  I state this as other places such as Massageluxe or Massage Envy advertise an hour but it's barely 50 minutes.  When I'm in heaven, I want every second I'm paying for.  I never felt rushed and on the contrary, was offered the sauna in addition to my regular massage time.I returned the following week, but did not make an appointment with Nicole and apparently she is in high demand.  Again, I was offered the sauna until a therapist became available and got Lilly.  I was slightly concerned because of Lilly's petite size I assumed she could not provide the hard massage I prefer.  Well I assumed wrong and discovered that Lilly is probably the best back walker on the planet and is deceptively strong.  I'm hooked.For those looking for anything more than a wonderful massage take your business elsewhere.  These are hard working ladies providing professional services at better prices than lesser Spas.  They are friendly, personable and make you feel at home.  I suggest making an appointment, though I'm told there are at least 4 to 7 therapists available on a daily basis for walk-ins.  My only complaint is that they did not offer dedicated foot massages, but that is supposed to be available soon.Sure beats fighting rush hour.  I highly recommend for men, ladies and couples looking for a little time in heaven.

23.description: Had a great time! Went for my birthday yesterday and had Jessica as my therapist. It was so relaxing. Also, since it was my first time I received a discount! (That's always good) The other good thing is parking was great!  Oddly enough if you park on the same side of the street that the shop is located on, then you will have to pay; directly across the street is free parking! (Weird I know) They even included the hot stones at no additional cost! I would only have 3 suggesstions. 1.) Get some better spa shoes! Those ugly gray shoes are the pits. 2.) Burn more oils and incense directly in the front. For some reason there is an off putting semi musty smell when you first walk in. 3.)Lastly, try and time the massages at the times the train does not run. lol. That one is impossible I know, but when you are in a such a serene state of being, you don't want to hear the rumbling of an urban train! Over all, this is a great place when you are "balling on a budget."

5.description: I love trying new massage places in different cities. The service I had by Jessica was one if the best massages I've ever had. It was also my first back walking experience and it was pretty intense.  You can't get deeper tissue than back walking, and Jessica was damn good at it. Don't give this place a second thought if your Looking for the perfect deep tissue. See other reviews for their determination of the environment. The place was clean and my eyes were closed the whole time so I don't really care if it's über luxe.  They are Super Talented and you should give them a try.

25.description: On the best day off ever, I did a sort of walking tour of massage spas on my block. I only intended to go to one, but when I walked by Copper Spa and saw that a 30 minute foot massage was $20, I thought, "hey, it's a day off. Let's make it the best day off ever and go for gold."And gold it was. The ladies here are all so sweet and accommodating. After grabbing a box of Nerds from the candy dish, I was led down a dark stairwell to a very dimly lit basement. Sounds sketchy, right? It's totally not, so don't let this deter you from going. They do their foot treatments in a spacious, cool setting with uber comfy reclining chaises (and you get a super soft blanket to snuggle with). It's dim and peaceful, and some chick was asleep on the chaise next to mine (they are separated by light curtains).The foot massage was more than you'll get anywhere else for the price, and my masseuse, Peggy, was super kind and communicative. If forced to be critical, I would say the basement did smell faintly of must (as basements are wont to do), and the 2005 Lucky magazine in the waiting area could use an updated replacement. But that won't stop me from returning!

12.description: Best deep tissue massage I have ever had!  I went yesterday as stiff as can be and I feel amazing.  I will definitely be back soon!  Thank you Copper Spa for having such a great massage and setup!

21.description: Last year for my birthday, a good friend gave me a gift certificate for a massage at Copper Spa. Being the procrastinator that I am, I waited until the day before it expired to redeem it ... but I'm mostly glad that I did.  Upon entering the spa, the appearance is nice but nothing special. The spa seemed clean and the staff was very friendly. The massage itself felt great; she used just the right amount of pressure and the hot stones are AMAZING! The room was dimly lit and warm, almost balmy which I found really nice. The only thing was, I've never had a massage where they've focused so intently on my buttocks. Just when I thought she was done, she'd go back for more. Not only that, but there was a length of time where I was lying on the table totally exposed - whereas with massages I've had in the past they've always kept a sheet covering you at all times. There was also a point where she straddled me without warning, another first. After that I couldn't get the thought out of my head that the whole thing was being videotaped for some sort of softcore Asian fetish porn ... or at the very least, that I had stumbled into the sort of place where sad men in sexless marriages go to get happy endings. But the massage felt good, so I just went with it. All in all, despite my mild discomfort with some of the techniques mentioned above, I got a really good massage. I would likely go there again.

16.description: You get what you pay for.Very nice workers but no technique used during massage. Just rubbing, some great some not. Thought hot rocks (free) would be nice, but again, just pushing them around roughly doesn't really feel good. Open late which is a plus. Has shower and sauna access, also a plus.Parking was somewhat easy on a Friday night around 815p. Pay meter until 9p.Takes credit cards but tip line was missing so luckily I had cash.

17.description: I had a phenomenal hour long massage here! My masseuse really focused on loosening up my back and shoulders, which can get very tight, but she did it in a way that felt amazing (I've had Thai massages that are supposedly good for you, but have never actually felt good). Beyond that the massage was really thorough -- didn't feel like a single part was left unrelieved. Also, for the price point, you really do get the full spa experience. She used hot stones at one point, the room was calming, and there are showers/etc. available to use afterward. I was also offered tea afterward. They were able to accomodate me within an hour of me calling, which was awesome.  A great, stress-relieving experience.

10.description: Please be aware. Yes the deep tissue massage is nice but there is a blurred line of boundaries when it comes to "private areas" and respect for that. I would not recommend the body scrub as that is where things go completely strange and the sense of privacy is out the door. The masseuse made suggestive comments in many occasions. I left there feeling less relaxed and a little out sorts. Additionally the whole pay with cash thing upfront and credit car not preferred even adds to the odd experience. Definitely tried to get out of there as quickly as it was over!

11.description: Great place for your money.  Place is not as nice as going into a 5-star hotel but then again they are about half the price.  We went late on a Friday night and the massages were awesome.

26.description: Excellent.  Nice quiet environment. Massage was spot on with the pressure I requested.  Use of feet, knees, elbows, and hands work beautifully.   This will be my new "goto" place when in town.Thank you Copper Spa!

27.description: This is my first review. I felt compelled to comment on Copper Spa since it exceeded my expectations more than any restaurant or service in the past year.  When I first walked in and noticed the copper trim around the ceiling and some of the Egyptian wall hangings I thought...interesting. Jessica's warm welcome and cute accented "Hello" made me smile.  It has a spacious front area with the seated massage chair and couch.I was happy to see an immaculately clean room with its own shower!, fresh towels, and a wide , warm table.  The lighting was bright enough to change and lowered when Lilly entered, introduced herself and asked about my pressure preference which is deep tissue.  I could feel the tension melt away as she worked all the knots out of my neck and shoulders and may have dozed off as my entire body was totally relaxed. I was sold.I returned again and Lilly was booked so I hesitantly went with Jessica. I knew it couldn't match Lilly but I didn't have time to wait.  Jessica took it to a whole new level by walking on my back. Amazing! She worked down every disc in my spine with her toes.  Needless to say, I highly recommend you check this out.

0.description: I called at 1050am, I was greeted and offered a $10 discount as a first timer.then Elaine gave a fantastic deep tissue massage she walk on my back, then gave my hot stone treatment followed by a Swedish style massage. After an hour and a half massage I got a complementary 20min sauna use and a shower.definitely worth every cent.I will be going bi-monthly for sure

20.description: My bf and I came here today for the couples massage to celebrate our one year anniversary. We were led downstairs and entered a dark room. my bf received his massage from a small blonde girl who he called "gymnast Barbie" afterwards because she was stradling him and cracking his back with her knees lol. He was surprised how good of a massage a tiny little girl could give. We both really enjoyed ours and the hot stones were a nice touch as well. After the massage we went upstairs to the sauna and sweated our asses off for about 15 mins. then we took a shower after and luckily they had shampoo, lotion, hair dryer etc. we were there for about 2 hours and had a great time! We mentioned yelp and got $10 off so it was $105 for both of our 60 minute massages, hot stones, and the sauna! sure the place is a little sketchy from the outside, but you cant beat that price in Chicago!

19.description: Had a great time! Went for my birthday yesterday and had Jessica as my therapist. It was so relaxing. Also, since it was my first time I received a discount! (That's always good) The other good thing is parking was great!  Oddly enough if you park on the same side of the street that the shop is located on, then you will have to pay; directly across the street is free parking! (Weird I know) They even included the hot stones at no additional cost! I would only have 3 suggesstions. 1.) Get some better spa shoes! Those ugly gray shoes are the pits. 2.) Burn more oils and incense directly in the front. For some reason there is an off putting semi musty smell when you first walk in. 3.)Lastly, try and time the massages at the times the train does not run. lol. That one is impossible I know, but when you are in a such a serene state of being, you don't want to hear the rumbling of an urban train! Over all, this is a great place when you are "balling on a budget."

2.description: This is a fantastic Chicago spa that has all the standard services (deep tissue, hot stone, cupping, couples, etc.) as well as an amazing ambiance. They do body and facial waxing too. When you walk in, it's almost like you're transported to some kind of ancient Egyptian temple. This joint meets all the important spa criteria:-It is VERY clean. There are also showers in most of the rooms.-Incredibly friendly and caring staff. I would be hard pressed to say I had a favorite therapist here, since I've walked in without an appointment many times and have ALWAYS had top quality massages (hard elbows and back-walking are my preference!).-Great pricing. The Yelp deals are another bonus, but even at standard rate, for city prices this place is excellent value.In the Chicagoland area I would say the therapists here are without doubt the best around. I live close by but I would easily make the trek to Copper if I lived in the burbs.

18.description: Short version: excellent massage, not so good presentation / some amount of sketchiness.My girlfriend and I went here for a couples massage. The price was reasonable at $100 before tip (it's actually $110, but mention Yelp for a discount). Copper Spa is located on a quiet section of Milwaukee and on the evening we went we were the only customers. Upon arriving we found the door was locked and thought we got the wrong address. It seems they lock the door for security reasons.They made us take off our shoes and gave us sandals to wear, which I hate because I don't know whose feet have been in them. Next time I will probably bring a pair of flip-flops. Then they asked us if we wanted to pay in advance. That seemed odd since we wouldn't know how much to tip and the door is locked so we can't massage and dash anyway. The massage session took place in a room in the basement. They also have rooms on the first floor.The final presentation issue was my towel had a big yellow stain on it! I'm hoping it was from massage oils and not anything else.As for the massage itself, it was very good. My girlfriend got a Chinese masseuse and I got a European one so they do indeed have both types. Her technique was excellent and she even employed hot stones! At one point she straddled my back which was surprising at first but it did give her good leverage to apply pressure. The quality of the massage made up for the problems mentioned above so I would come back again.

13.description: My legs and back have been hurting so I've decided it was time to get a massage. With the husband in tow, we went for a friday night couple's massage. We got to the door and as the other reviewers said, they do lock it (which I like for safety reasons). Just buzz in.As for the massage, it was excellent.  The husband asked for a lot of pressure and he got it. I was entertained by his snoring towards the end. You can definitely say he loved it. Mine was also great, knots and pain gone.  Will for sure come back!

4.description: Copper Spa was the perfect start to our date night.  My wife and I came downtown from the west suburbs recently to enjoy a nice massage, dinner and a play.  This is now our third trip to Copper Spa and we both came away saying, "That was the best massage I have ever had anywhere!"  Peggy and Anna were terrific.  What do we love about Copper Spa?  1)  It's affordable, and that's always a plus.  We don't need the uber-luxe spa experience.  We're looking for a great massage in a relaxing, clean environment, and that's what we get.  2)  We love the overall style of massage.  They use just the right combination of deeper pressure, flowing strokes, stretching movements and hot stones.  Depending on the therapist, they may even do back-walking.  You might not be accustomed to some of their techniques, such as climbing up on the table to put the perfect amount of pressure in just the right place, but it feels terrific, and the result is so much better than a typical Swedish massage.  3)  We love the fact that we are not over-draped.  Some places make us feel like we're being wrapped in a diaper, or worse - wrapped up like a mummy.  We think that too much draping interferes with the massage.  Our experience at Copper Spa is that, when lying face-down, they will sometimes remove the draping altogether.  This allows for wonderful, flowing strokes from head to toe.  It has never made us uncomfortable, but if you were to become uncomfortable, just let the therapist know and I'm sure they will drape you to your level of comfort.  For us, their approach is perfect.  4)  Hot towels.  When finished on one side, they wipe you down with hot towels.  It feels so good, and it removes any extra lotion.  Afterwards, we don't feel like we need to take a shower, but one is available if we did.5) The sauna.  We try to arrive early so that we can enjoy the private sauna together.  It's free, and it's a nice way to unwind after the rush of traffic, and to warm up during the cold months.  To sum it up, we've had massages at many locations around the world, and this is still our favorite.  So keep up the great work Copper Spa, and we'll keep coming back.

24.description: Short version: excellent massage, not so good presentation / some amount of sketchiness.My girlfriend and I went here for a couples massage. The price was reasonable at $100 before tip (it's actually $110, but mention Yelp for a discount). Copper Spa is located on a quiet section of Milwaukee and on the evening we went we were the only customers. Upon arriving we found the door was locked and thought we got the wrong address. It seems they lock the door for security reasons.They made us take off our shoes and gave us sandals to wear, which I hate because I don't know whose feet have been in them. Next time I will probably bring a pair of flip-flops. Then they asked us if we wanted to pay in advance. That seemed odd since we wouldn't know how much to tip and the door is locked so we can't massage and dash anyway. The massage session took place in a room in the basement. They also have rooms on the first floor.The final presentation issue was my towel had a big yellow stain on it! I'm hoping it was from massage oils and not anything else.As for the massage itself, it was very good. My girlfriend got a Chinese masseuse and I got a European one so they do indeed have both types. Her technique was excellent and she even employed hot stones! At one point she straddled my back which was surprising at first but it did give her good leverage to apply pressure. The quality of the massage made up for the problems mentioned above so I would come back again.

6.description: The massages are actually decent,  but the overall experience is odd.  Locked front doors,  virtually no communication from therapist  (they walk right in and starting doing their thing--no introduction or asking about problem areas).   They want payment up front (also odd) ,  and they asked me for a higher tip after I tipped 10 dollars the last time I went  (not acceptable).   It has a real sketchy feel.  I will  gladly pay 15 dollars more for  a relaxing experience,  not this strange place from bizarro world.

22.description: I came across this place on Yelp because of the $10 off a couple's massage and the ratings, of course. Like with any other massage place, I check out the website just to get a feel of the place. On it, they list "special prices" only for their first time clients and then a separate list for regular clients so be aware. It was my first time there, so the couple's massage cost $110, but I told them about the $10 Yelp offer, which reduced the price to $100 without tip. It was like a Groupon deal except an additional dollar! I called to schedule an appointment and mentioned the Yelp offer. The place is run by Asian people, so there was a language barrier, but for the most part, I was able to understand her. Be sure to mention any deals when you book an appointment otherwise they won't take it. So I'm all set for the appointment when the lady said, "You pay cash, right? We prefer cash." I assumed I could pay with a credit card, but she wanted cash, so I said ok. I guess it was nice of her to tell me. That said, pay with cash.So my boyfriend and I are about to enter, but the door is locked. Confused, I pull again thinking the door is stuck and then I look inside to see a lady behind the desk who is coming towards us to open it. She let us in, but didn't offer an explanation as to why the door was locked. After we came in, she locked it behind us, which was a bit creepy. Then I thought, oh, they probably don't want to take any walk-in customers, which I could understand because it was 8 at night; I mean, I wouldn't want to work that late. Let me back track to the exterior. It may look a little iffy because the design screams Vegas, well to me at least. Also, there are huge signs taking over the windows that advertise their massage deals (for first time clients only). The interior is nice with couches to sit and a water jug to quench your thirst, but the lights were dim. It makes it a bit difficult to fill out the forms. You do have the option to go into the sauna, but we didn't due to time constraints. She'll take you down the hallway to a closet like room where you have to change your shoes to their Adidas like sandals. I hope they clean them after each use because I hate wearing other people's shoes and these didn't fit my size 5.5 feet. She motions us to follow her down the hallway, while I have difficulty keeping up because of the ill fitted sandals. Then, she takes us down the stairs to what looks like a basement, which I found a bit strange. The room was on the right and she opened the door for us and then left without saying anything. There were 2 tables and nicely folded towels on each. Usually, the masseuse tells me what I should do with the towels, but not this time. I  thought you're supposed to get under the sheet on the table, but you don't; you just lay on that and use that nicely folded towel to cover yourself. The massage itself was great. It's by far the best one I've ever had. She asks how much pressure you prefer and will periodically ask if it's the right amount. My masseuse was great and she did straddle my back (without warning) at one point to get more leverage, so be prepared. Also, my boyfriend's masseuse left during the massage without warning after she and my masseuse conversed under their breath. She came back with hot stones. My masseuse just put them on my back and then asked if it was ok. I said yes, but I would've liked her to tell me what she was going to do next. Again, be prepared. The hot stones felt amazing.
