At the end, they both left without warning and came back with hot washcloths. She used it to wash the oils off my body and then asked if it was ok. I said yes, and again would've liked her to tell me what she was doing. After that, they said they'll be waiting outside once we dressed. They gave us each a cup of water and then led us upstairs to pay. Overall, a great massage, but I didn't like how we weren't informed of what they were doing. I would still come back, though.

15.description: Initially I was sure what to do when I first arrived - It was so quiet and no one else was there. However once Peggy began, she gave a GREAT Massage & Hot Stone Treatment!

7.description: I loved the massage. However, when I handed them a tip at the end (a pretty good one, I might add) I was rudely asked to tip a higher amount. Excuse me? That is not acceptable. That is never acceptable. Take your business elsewhere.

8.description: The worst experience I ever had. I went there to have a nice massage but it wasn't as good as you expect. For a piece of mind, don't try this place because the people there are not really friendly. Also, they would rudely ask you to tip them a very high amount when they did a very bad job.

30.description: I've walked past this place a couple of times and had to wonder...is it legit or is it not??? Today, I was in desperate need of a foot massage after moving into my new place and going up and down 3 flights of stairs ad nauseum, as well as unpacking 98 boxes. I figured I would walk over and try my luck; worst case, I'd have a good story to tell if the place turned out to be dubious.Copper Spa doesn't look like much from the outside, but there's a massage chair in the window so that made me feel better. (I get a little nervous when a place advertises sauna and couples' massage, you know?) You have to buzz to get in (probably to keep the crazies away), but they saw me hovering and let me in.I asked if they did reflexology and they said yes and that it was a $1 a minute. I asked if they had any immediate openings and they did so I booked myself in for 30 minutes. I saw Peggy, who was a nice woman in her 40s. Her English was passable, but a little hard to understand at times, but it was fine. She explained that first she would use hot towels on my feet and then do the massage and then she'd use the hot stone. She had me lie face down on the massage table, which is a bit different than other places I have been where you sit in a chair, but that's okay!So Peggy got started and the hot towels felt great and the foot massage was awesome. I am pretty sure I  fell asleep, I was so relaxed.  And now my back and neck and shoulder muscles feel AWESOME. I'm like a new person.Peggy explained that they just re-opened under new management two months ago. They used to do tanning but now they are all massage and facials. First time customers get a discount on massage. I liked it so much that I'm going back tomorrow for a 60 minute accupuncture massage.  (No needles...just pressure points.)The room I was in was very clean and there were all fresh towels. They played soft music and the lighting was soft too...almost like you were in a more upscale place, but without paying super bucks for it!

3.description: As I lie naked on my table awaiting my therapist to come in, I hear a fight break out between the lady at the front desk and another employee. Screaming their heads off for over 5 minutes. I was probably the last appointment of the night, so the only person in there. And clearly one of them was going to be massaging me. I had to pay upfront, so I got dressed, and demanded my money back. Not relaxing and will never ever go back.

14.description: This Spa is Great!!! the rooms are nice and comfy with a shower..they also have a sauna thats nice....the staff was very friendly and made me feel comfortable from the beginning....the massage was fantastic, love the deep tissue and back walking...highly recommend this place...one of the best in the city as I've tried quite a few but not as good as this place....don't know about some of these reviews about tipping but i tend to tip at least 30% since the service is by far the best and the atmosphere is so relaxing....i suggest you give them a try as you can't go wrong with this place

3.description: I go here kind of a lot - not weekly but probably more than most of friends get massages....anyway yesterday I go and had a very odd experience.  It was a little painful!  She spent a lot of time on my butt! I felt like she was trying to rub the cellulite right out - which I would SO appreciate - but I don't think that is possible.  I guess I was too confused to say anything.  I'll go back for sure - just an odd experience and not at all relaxing. I still love that you can virutally go anytime without a whole lot of notice.

1.description: Wow. A real massage.  Have a very sore shoulder and a huge improvement over yesterday.  This is therapeutic massage, Thai style.  They mount you to get the best angle...Not always comfortable but you will be loosened up.  Ask for Bella.

2.description: People, people, people...how can you give this 4 or 5 stars??? Yes, it's clean I guess but they have no idea what they are doing and the place is 100% a rub and tug! It's so shady.I went in out of desperation b/c I had several painful knots in between my shoulder blades from traveling. I specifically told the girl that checked me in AND the 'massage therapist' (I put that in quotes because I am sure you don't have to be certified in anything to work here) what I wanted them to do and she just went ahead and did the whole massage like she would have done any other person without paying attention to the knots until, after 3 times, I guided her there. They use this Ben Gay like spray that is sticky and smelly and doesn't make it easier to massage. I made her stop early and asked her to leave. I didn't tip and I have never ever done that. She had absolutely no idea what she was doing though and didn't help me at all.and, the table had paper down on top of it...totally for the rub and tugs. ugh. sketchy, shady and no good whatsoever.

9.description: I am also impressed by this location.  There's plenty of (metered) on-street parking and a few nice restaurants et cetera that can be added to the overall experience once you've had your massage.The facilities are very clean and the staff quite attentive.  I'm also a fan of deeper massage and am very pleased with the technique (Tui Na) employed by the masseuses. If you bring your wife (or girlfriend), you can wait in front and have a cup of tea while she takes her time to get dressed.I've recommended this place to a few friends and they've also found it to be a great value in a pleasant, convenient neighborhood.  Communication is never a problem, especially if you speak to the front desk about any issues on the way in.

10.description: Very friendly staff. They speak reasonably good english. I had a 1 hr massage. As i was sore all over from a lot of sports.,i opted for the hard deep tissue massage.The masseuse did a very good job. Asking questions about where it pained and explaining what she was doing.Their showering facilities are very clean as well.

4.description: I had a very enjoyable experience. I called and was able to set-up an appointment an hour from when I called, they were very polite and professional when they greeted me, and the massage was excellent and very affordable. The facility is also very neat and clean with perfect lighting and relaxing music. If you're feeling very tight and need an affordable full body massage (including hands and feet) check this place out.

6.description: Best massage in the city and surrounding suburbs. Very nice and professional staff. Have been here many times for single one hour massage and couples massage. Very happy and extremely relaxed each time!

12.description: awesome place, really cozy, clean. the tables and linens are soft and they give you hot towels. have had massages from lena, christina and emily and all are amazing. i like my massages light and they are really good about toning it down for me. great prices, easy parking on ashland.

5.description: Not bad for a one-hour, $70 massage. They work your body very well, but fair warning: the ladies mount you. They use their whole bodies to get all the kinks out. They also use hot towels at the end, which I think is a nice touch.

13.description: wow, not sure about those other reviews, love this place!!!!

11.description: The massage was really good, and hard, even a little harder than I wanted. The girl was very sweet, and very comfortable with me...getting on the table and working me from the top. At first it was weird, but it only made the massage better. There was a slight language barrier, but all in all they did a good job and were very nice and clean.

8.description: This place was the frickin' bomb! That is if you want a little extra relaxation at the end of you massage. I didn't opt for said ending since my wife got the massage for me even though my buddy said it wasn't cheating since she got it for me.The only awkward part was the table shower. If you've never heard of it, Google it. I don't wanna get into details... Ok, I will.So, I change outta my cloyed in one room, leaving my underwear on under my towel and they take me back to the showers. Now I'm thinking, I'll just rinse off because they're gonna use some oils during my massage that need to stay on my skin or whatever. I walk in and there's a table with a shower head laying on it. Uuhh... I spent a few months in South Korea when I was in the Air Force, this looks badly familiar, I'm thinking. The masseuse then tells me to undress and get on the table... This is how that conversation went;Her: Take off your towel and climb on the table.Me: ...what?Her: take off you towel and climb on.Me: uh..everything,Her: yes. Take of you towel and underwear.Me: all of it?Her: yes, all of it. It's a shower.Me: uuhh..Oookkaayy.She then hands me a tiny towel to cover myself.Thing barely covered my hand let alone my business.So I climb on face down and she starts soaping up my whole backside! She just cut straight to business! I layer there petrified I was cheating but I wasn't really sure if I was. She didn't touch my mommy/daddy bits. Not yet so I wasn't sure. I said to myself, self, if she touches you business, you've still got your new watch on, just run naked down Chicago Ave. I didn't want my lady at home to kick my ass. She keeps a shovel in her trunk so I know she ain't messing around...So, the nice awkward shower gets over and I stand up to dry myself off. I reach for my towel on the other side of the room and she says no, she'll dry me off...Oh God. Imma have to run naked down the street in a minute.I stand there as she dries me off... I stood there waiting for the... whatever...So that's over and she takes me back to my room and the regular massage starts. I was naked with a towel on me so it was a little uncomfortable but it was a nice massage. At one point she did tell me that it would work better if I would just relax. I told her I was trying.So, overall, it was a good massage. Just awkward. I'd totally recommend this place if you're looking for a regular massage or one with a little extra, something. If ya know what I mean.

0.description: On a whim and in desperate need of s deep tissue massage, I decided to try this place did to its convenient location to my house. I was able to get pretty much a walk-in appt calling 15 minutes before coming in which was lovely. I had Katie who was absolutely great, she gave one of the best massages I've had and the place is incredibly clean and aesthetically pleasing as well as very well kept. Couldn't be happier also pretty reasonably priced!

7.description: It always surprises me how clueless some reviews are. It's impossible to go to Sunkiss and not be enamored by Connie, their beautiful receptionist, and the whole relaxing and yet professional atmosphere. And then, if you are lucky to get Christine or Annie, you will be in heaven as your pain, and stress will miraculously go away. Best massage ever!

28.description: I had some issues with toilets dripping. Called The Faucet Guy at 9AM when they opened, by 10:30AM, my problems were fixed. (20 min job)What happened was, I had the City of Chicago install a water meter at my home, this I was told would save me over 50% on my current bill. Instead of the flat fee of 450 a year, it should only be about 35 bucks every two months for water usage.The problem I saw after the meter was installed, was a spinning meter dial indicating there was water leaking somewhere, and it was from my two toilets. Roy was my plumber, who told me he had been doing this kind of work for 40 years, he obviously knew what he was doing, not only fixed my toilets, but caulked a sink that was not level, and gave me some advice on some issues regarding changing our shower stall around. If you need plumbing, ask for Roy at the Faucet Guy.  Fair pricing too.

1.description: In one word Roy was super terrific! (well I guess that was two words). I had several tough plumbing checklist items that had to be fixed in order to prep my condo for sale and  Roy was the only plumber that I could find that could and would do the necessary work. A no nonsense guy who completed the work quickly and efficiently at a very reasonable price. What a relief! I highly recommend Roy who is one of the contractors for Faucet Guys. He is a great professional to maintain contact with for all of your plumbing needs.

9.description: Yes 5 stars! Here's why.Roy was GREAT! On time and knew exactly what he was talking about and more importantly, knew exactly what he was doing! Quick and easy service. I am highly recommending him to all of my friends AND to all of you. Sorry to see the that some people didn't have the same experience but call Roy first! you WILL NOT be disappointed!Thanks again Roy You are the man!

29.description: What a godsend to find someone in the city that has plumbing parts for older plumbing!  The valves and diverter in the bathroom in one of my mom's apartments were very old and leaky.  I had replaced the seals a few times, but the valves were beginning to rust.  They were probably at least 60 years old, so they were not easy to find near by.  Consumer Plumbing recommended the Faucet guy.   I can't say that it was cheap for the parts, though.  I could've bought 2 brand new shower valve sets for the price I paid for just 2 valves and 1 diverter, but then I'd have to take the wall apart to install it.  I really didn't have the time for that, so I paid the money.  I may have found them on the internet more cheaper, but it'd be extremely hard not knowing the part number, specs, etc.  So, sometimes it is worth to pay more for less effort and time put into a job (time is money).  Mitch was very helpful as he knows his plumbing parts!  I will visit him again if necessary.

23.description: Mitch was so helpful and attentive!  I merely brought in a picture of what I was dealing with (a broken shower diverter) and he researched until he located the right part.  Then, he was able to order it and get it for me the next day.  Amazing customer service!

5.description: Needed a small part to fix a leaky toilet, they had it in stock for $6 and told me how to repair so that I didn't break the thing. Very helpful and no hassles!

31.description: The Faucet Guy is a great company to shop with.  Mitch the owner is pretty good guy needless to say. He's pretty honest and straight forward. He not trying to get rich off person. In other words, his prices are not breaking the bank either. I work in a large building with well over 100 units, that uses gerber cart. I was getting thim from Algor's and paying like $98.00, at faucet guy the part is only 68.00 that's a $30.00per cartridge saving for my company and a lifetime customer for guess who the Faucet Guy. I am a female engineer and he treats me with the utmost respect. I've gone to other places and when I walked in I was looked at like I arrived in a space-ship. I would have to stand there several minutes before I would even be waited on. Mitch on the other hand immediately took my order just as I was any other customer. I've been going back to hom since. All I do is give him a call, tell him what I need. He gets the order ready, when he's done HE GIVES ME A CALL!!!! How often does that happen..... KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK.....

25.description: Roy is awesome! Our kitchen faucet leaked and needed to be replaced. We called the Faucet Guy in the evening and they came the next morning at 7:30am.Roy went hove and beyond, b/c our plumbing was really screwed up and he had to take everything apart and put it back together. These guys are really responsive and did great work! Thanks, Roy!

12.description: Went here to find a piece for my jacuzzi tub. Brought in the old piece and the guy quickly found a replacement for about $10!  Expensive prices, quick service and friendly guy.

37.description: This is the absolute best plumbing place in the city.  The Faucet Guy is family owned and operated by a husband/wife.  I give them a lot of credit for working together and even more credit for running an excellent plumbing part supply.Mitch has helped repair both my business and home plumbing.  So many times I've brought in a picture and it's great to watch the process.  He'll go off digging through a drawer or shuffling a few boxes.  The next thing you know he's showing you the part you need.If he does not have the part in stock then he'll show it to you in a book.  When I've ordered parts they've arrived on time, he calls upon arrival, and it's exactly what I needed.So far he's helped me replace sinks, faucets, pipes and of course parts for things you never would know anything about.  When I have a plumbing need I stop by to see Mitch and he's super helpful.  Hope you will do the same to support Chicago's family run businesses.

21.description: I also can't say enough good things about Roy.  Long story short, I just took my first satisfying shower in years and Roy's to thank (because of his plumbing skills, I mean).  Very professional, knowledgeable, tidy, and courteous.

16.description: After doing some rehab work on a two flat home I purchased, I noticed that the second floor shower smelled like a sewer and to top it off it leaked heavily into the first floor bathroom. I called the Faucet Guy and they forwarded me to Roy. He was informative, professional, and quick with the work. I am just happy that the bathroom will drain properly without turning my ceiling into a mold farm.

17.description: Granted the Faucet Guy has lots of materials/repair items for dated faucets/bathrooms.  However his prices are ridiculously high.  Since I needed the things right away, we ended up going to him and spending more than 2 times as much for stuff that I ended up finding online that night (but wouldnt have received in time for the contractor to finish up our bathroom in a timely manner). save yourself the headache and look for things online from other vendors.  even with shipping and delivery from amazon or other folks, his prices were ridiculously high.  Six dollars for two screws for a bathroom trim plate! WTF!

10.description: This experience has been a nightmare!Received several quotes to install a dishwasher and replace a water heater. His came in the lowest (first sign something was wrong). After purchasing the units at a nearby appliance store he installed them. Prior to completion of the work his estimate shot up 4 times what was originally quoted. What do you do, have him uninstall? He failed to properly inspect the dishwasher which caused thousands of dollars in damage hours after being installed. His response: "Theres nothing I can do about it. Its not my fault". If you pay $1200 to for work it should be done properly. Now we are stuck with lots of liability and thousands of dollars in the hole. If could go back in time we would just have hired a different plumber. Save yourselves the headaches and surprises.

11.description: Expensive!!!  But he has much if you're have having trouble finding an item.I needed two sets of parts;  I found one set at Faucet Guy for just over $70, then I found the identical set of parts at Algor in Cicero for $45.  None of these parts (from either supplier) were "generic", all parts were identical and all were from the same major brand manufacturer.

26.description: This experience has been a nightmare!Received several quotes to install a dishwasher and replace a water heater. His came in the lowest (first sign something was wrong). After purchasing the units at a nearby appliance store he installed them. Prior to completion of the work his estimate shot up 4 times what was originally quoted. What do you do, have him uninstall? He failed to properly inspect the dishwasher which caused thousands of dollars in damage hours after being installed. His response: "Theres nothing I can do about it. Its not my fault". If you pay $1200 to for work it should be done properly. Now we are stuck with lots of liability and thousands of dollars in the hole. If could go back in time we would just have hired a different plumber. Save yourselves the headaches and surprises.

27.description: I had an issue with a leak in our jacuzzi tub. I called that day and Roy came on time at 5pm. He wasn't able to fix it because the heater unit was broken but gave me great instructions on how to fix it myself (after buying supplies). He even called back to give some additional instructions. Overall, extremely impressed with politeness, knowledge, honesty etc...I would absolutely use these guys again! Simply an awesome experience.

35.description: The Faucet Guy is awesome. My shower handle broke and I searched all around town for a replacement. My quest ended here, though I didn't even need to buy a replacement. Mitch was super-friendly and first tried to fix the part for me gratis.  When we determined it was irreparable, he referred me to the manufacturer, who is shipping me all the parts I need for free.Also, it was very interesting to watch Mitch and his associate figure out how to deconstruct the part to get at the problem; he is clearly an expert and a veritable scientist of plumbing. And I liked the vibe of the place - he and his wife had a fun rapport and there was art their kids made hanging on the wall. Hooray for honest and friendly service! I would highly recommend this place.

8.description: A great store & a great find. I had some major plumbing issues in my bathroom & called my usual plumber for a quote. He gave me a quote and said if I wanted to buy my own fixtures (rather than use the ones he would install) I could do that. He recommend to not go to Home Depot or similar big box store, but to a plumbing store. So I turned to Yelp for answers & found The Faucet Guy. I'm glad I did. Not only did Mitchell take the time to show me (and spoke to me, not my husband -- which doesn't often happen -- ladies know what I mean!) the different types of fixtures I would need and the differences in cost. While we were there, other plumbers had come in to buy fixtures, so you know it's a good sign.Additionally, he was able to give referrals for another plumber, who could work with a carpenter to get my shower plumbing fixed and the wall replaced same day (my plumber didn't have a carpenter to work with). Not only could I get it done in a day, but the referral was $150 cheaper than the quote from my plumber. Mitchell is an old school, no nonsense Chicago guy, selling a good product. I've recommended him to others.

0.description: Roy is the greatest plumber in Chicago, bar none. He's quick, he's friendly, he explains things   with clarity and without condescension, and he charges a fair price every time (trust me, I've paid WAAAY more for WAAAY worse work before). Roy's the real deal, a great plumber and a great guy. Can't recommend him highly enough.

38.description: I stopped here for a broken part that a customer asked to have replaced. I learned that the part had been grafted from two other parts by a "creative construction & plumbing company" that did not return calls.  Mitch helped as best he could, but the part just did not exist.On my second visit, I waited patiently while Mitch gave the customer he was helping his complete attention. It was worth the wait, because when it was my turn, i received that same attention. He needed to do some further research, & told me that he'd call back. He called when he said, with the information that he promised !!I like the way Mitch treats his customers, & would make him my first stop for faucets or parts.

20.description: Faucet guy was great.  The service was prompt and courteous.  He did everything that I needed and I felt the price charged was very fair.  I'd call him again for any plumbing issues.

19.description: Faucet guy was great.  The service was prompt and courteous.  He did everything that I needed and I felt the price charged was very fair.  I'd call him again for any plumbing issues.

33.description: I live in a old home and one of the faucets for the tub started to leak I thought uh oh how easy is it going to be to find a replacement as the original could be older then I am. Well after a trip to 2 Home Depots and 1 to Menards and no help I found the faucet guy her on Yelp. 5 minutes in his shop he repaired my what he said was at least a 50 year old faucet ( and yes older then me) all for only 5 bucks. Great service great prices and tons of knowledge. Ill be going straight to the faucet guy with all my plumbing needs from now on.

2.description: I was in town visiting a friend whose kitchen faucet was broken.  Someone at Home Depot referred me to "The Faucet Guy" and I couldn't have been happier that he did. Instead of replacing the whole faucet, they saw exactly what was broken from a poor quality picture on my phone and explained exactly how to fix it. I was able to fix the sink without replacing excess parts, and it ended up being much cheaper/easier than I expected. I couldn't have accomplished it without their help!

34.description: The owner, Mitch, was a breath of fresh air after the awful experience I had just endured at the other faucet shop.  He was pleasant, helpful, and had everything I needed.  He made it clear that if there was anything I'm taking that I don't need, he'd refund.  He spent a lot of time helping problem solve. If you have old faucets that need new guts and you want to be treated as if your money has value,  the Faucet Guy is the guy to see.  My job isn't quite finished, but I'm confident that Mitch will problem solve and come up with a solution.

32.description: I know nothing about faucets, but I walked into the store with a friend to find a solution for a broken shower head and Mitch took the time to help us figure out exactly what was needed. Over several visits. All dealing with the same issue. He was pleasant and patient throughout. We would still be working on it now if not for him. Mitch is the man!

18.description: We have been having problems with our toilet lever and could not figure out why it wasn't working. Our plumber told us we should replace the whole system (a cost of about $180). We went in to see Mitch and took photos of the toilet with us. 5 minutes and $8 later we had the pieces we needed and a full explanation of how to install them. One working toilet and two happy customers. We will be back!

13.description: These guys are awesome and Roy really knows what he is doing. Also, he is polite and explains the situation. I would highly recommend using them. I got a brand new power vent water heater 50 gallon installed by them. Ask for ROY!!!

4.description: I called The Faucet Guy with an emergency: I discovered my toilet was leaking and I had to leave town in 2 hours!!  I was hoping someone could come within the hour to fix the leak...and The Faucet Guy did even better!!  They had one of their best guys call me within 5 minutes, he asked me to text him a photo, and he walked me through the whole process of fixing the leak!!  It was a pretty easy fix, but I couldn't have done it without his guidance. I was able to leave the house an hour early, instead of waiting for an emergency plumber- The Faucet Guy was a total lifesaver!

24.description: let me second the positive comments on Roy at this establishment: I got stuck with a dead hot water tank on Tues aft - called the Faucet Guy and Roy came on Wed am after giving me a reasonable quote ($845), which he stuck with, and had my new tank installed in about 2 hours.

6.description: I had some issues with toilets dripping. Called The Faucet Guy at 9AM when they opened, by 10:30AM, my problems were fixed. (20 min job)What happened was, I had the City of Chicago install a water meter at my home, this I was told would save me over 50% on my current bill. Instead of the flat fee of 450 a year, it should only be about 35 bucks every two months for water usage.The problem I saw after the meter was installed, was a spinning meter dial indicating there was water leaking somewhere, and it was from my two toilets. Roy was my plumber, who told me he had been doing this kind of work for 40 years, he obviously knew what he was doing, not only fixed my toilets, but caulked a sink that was not level, and gave me some advice on some issues regarding changing our shower stall around. If you need plumbing, ask for Roy at the Faucet Guy.  Fair pricing too.

22.description: I had no running hot water and was worried about getting someone on a Friday afternoon. Called the Faucet guy and Roy called and came within the hour to give me a free estimate. One look at the water heater and he realized that the problem was not as simple as the pilot going off! The entire tank had a leak at the bottom and there was some dirty water oozing out. He gave me a fair estimate which included removal and disposal of the old one, buying a new one and fixing it today itself. He came in the evening and in a couple of hours we had running hot water. Reasonable time and cost estimates and efficient job done. Highly recommed the business and Roy in particular.

15.description: I had no running hot water and was worried about getting someone on a Friday afternoon. Called the Faucet guy and Roy called and came within the hour to give me a free estimate. One look at the water heater and he realized that the problem was not as simple as the pilot going off! The entire tank had a leak at the bottom and there was some dirty water oozing out. He gave me a fair estimate which included removal and disposal of the old one, buying a new one and fixing it today itself. He came in the evening and in a couple of hours we had running hot water. Reasonable time and cost estimates and efficient job done. Highly recommed the business and Roy in particular.

7.description: I called them for a problem with a shower in an apartment I rent out.  He told me it would be $700 to fix or else he'd have to rip the tile out which would end up costing about the same.  I asked why so much, and he said it needed a new cartridge which would cost about $500.  I thought this was strange since the whole fixture cost under $300. Fortunately a friend referred me to a different plumber who came in and gave me 2 options, to get the shower working for $80 or to replace the cartridge for $100 more.  It pays to shop around.

36.description: This place is the best kept secret in chicago.  My plumber at A&S plumbing who is aweso,e knows the owner and recommended the place.  We needed to find a new fixture for out tub and not only did he have what  we needed but wow did he have the parts and pieces.  From what I could tell the owners carried everything for repairing existing fixtures but what I really admired most was the top quality plumbing fixtures the owner has access too.  Mitch has ethic, knowledge and looks for manufacturers that have products that last.  .  Although, some items are not cheap they at least  will last longer than the junkie stuff I have found in the past at places like home depo or other stores.

30.description: there are 2 places in the whole chicago that sell parts for the old fixtures and this place is much cheaper , and better service , better attitude , more helpfull then the place on elston the young who run the faucet shope on elston are just plain rude and $$$

3.description: Roy was fantastic.  He showed us exactly what was wrong, and explained in laymans terms why the work was necessary.  He was on time, efficient, and true to his estimate.  The work was impeccable, and we would hire him again in a heartbeat.   There are a lot of plumbers and contractors out there, but he earned our trust and respect with honesty, integrity, and great work.  Highly recommended.

14.description: This is my local go to place for all plumbing parts.  After my shower went on the fritz I went to the Faucet Guy for a replacement part.  Replacing this shower piece was not going to be a job for the amateur plumber, so I was referred to Roy.  Roy called me back to set up an appointment the very next day.   My shower is finally working properly thanks to Roy.  I would definitely refer him to friends and family.   You wont go wrong with Roy.

58.description: This place is about as spacious as a hallway and the service on the patio is questionable, but boy do they have a quality old fashioned.  They are not skimpy on the good cherries here either.  Despite the cramped quarters, those old fashioneds will bring me back here for sure.  Maybe I'll even try the mysterious gin and jam next time.

56.description: This bar has the best drinks in the neighborhood. They make a mean Pisco Sour and it's hard to order wrong when all the drinks are made this well. They have a large amount of seating outside and that is much more comfortable than drinking inside. It's the size of a matchbox so if you are drinking at the bar inside every 40 seconds someone will graze your back trying to make it down the narrow walk to the bathroom. That can be annoying. It gets less annoying the more you drink. The bartenders here are awesome. Inside this bar you really feel like you've left the city and are in your own little world.

29.description: I love this place, it's one of my top places to get a drink it the city. Cocktails are amazing and they make the best Gimlets. People complain about rude pretentious bar tenders but they're what makes the place. Nothing makes me happier than to hear them talk to dumb girls who "like OMG want a Cosmo like literally"

42.description: I used to bike past this place every day or two. The Matchbox is small. It is very very small. If you get a seat at the bar keep it. Hold on tight because in five or ten minutes the place will be packed and you will basically hug everyone who walks past. Oh, there is that guy who sits and pretends to read! I get a kick out of that! Man, he can do perhaps 1 page every 10 minutes. Oh, but the atmosphere. This place has it. It has the after workers, the graduate students going on about gentrification (which they cause), and the industry people here having a beer. You may see lots of bartenders and servers from other places. I did. I thought that was funny. Lots of "Haven't you?" or "Don't you?" and that wasn't me. Anyhow, if you can find a seat or a wall to hang against grab a beer or a cocktail and hang for a bit. Classic Chicago joint.

23.description: If we're being honest...and as most know, I usually am.  I was walking home from Binny's in Lincoln Park and my bladder was starting to protest.  I have been curious about this odd little Bar since I moved here last May.  I get off the Blue Line right across the street when I am traveling for business and I always look across at it when waiting for Uber to arrive.  I decided to stop in and have a drink so I didn't feel guilty about using the loo.  What an awesome surprise!  It's shaped like a sliver of aged cheese with pressed tin ceiling and a brick outer wall.  The spirits selection is impressive and they have a few decent craft beer choices.  The wine selections look decent as well.  I am guessing this place holds 30-40 people tops.  The bartenders are super nice and last but not least the cocktails are the most reasonable priced I have found for the quality in Chicago.  You should add this to your list of places to try in Chicago.  Next time I fly home and get off the Blue Line stop at Chicago Ave., I think I will stop here for a wee nip before I summon Uber

47.description: It has been too long since I came here for a cocktail!  Ha ha, looking back at my old review in 2007, my cocktail taste has definitely changed.  If you want a classic non pretentious dive for a classic cocktail, go for it.

8.description: Oh, Matchbox. If only you'd been five minutes closer to my apartment -- then, I really would have been a regular.This place is small (ok tiny, but everyone else's review can hit this point), but it feels more comfortable than that (except when you're skirting by five people to get to the bathroom). It looks like a dive, but it feels more like a no-nonsense bar where you go for some drinks. It doesn't have a specific time or occasion -- it is there for whatever you may need. I don't know how to explain it, but I just felt welcome here.I'm not big into cocktails, but the cocktails here came in a reasonable end (all of the normal things) and a higher end (fancier drinks). I had something made with jelly and gin that was shaken up and it was delicious and I would get it a million more times.Good beer selection too! Some interesting things, some normal ones, more or less reasonable prices.When it comes to it, five star reviews are reserved for places that force me to give them. As a consumer, I really value feeling welcome and belonging -- and I got that sort of calm, no-nonsense vibe here.

31.description: The Matchbox may possibly be my new favorite bar for cocktail drinking.  The bartenders are very knowledgable and are perfectly consistent with their drink creations. I recommend the sidecar which is a classic but strong and delicious.   I couldn't believe how good the service was despite the crowd.  The bartenders are very laid back and the patrons are extremely friendly (mostly regulars).  I was lucky to fall upon this bar while walking through river west and turns out it is the smallest bar in Chicago.  I hope to return soon :)

34.description: When you are entertaining out of town friends, you try and provide them with the best Chicago experience, even if their idea of "going out" involves Bud Light and horseshoes (oh them Nevada folks).  After dining at one of my favorites- Ada Street- I looked for a bar to continue the evening, as uncomfortable as it already was.How I would describe Matchbox (besides the aforementioned tiny): In one of the many, MANY OK Cupid quizzes, there's one that asks what a perfect first date would be: a really divey bar, a nice restaurant or a day at the beach (there might be one more choice but I can't remember).  Matchbox is an oxymoron- an upscale divey bar.   If you judge a book by it's cover, you will be sorely disappointed when you miss out on stellar drinks (try the margarita), a decent bottle beer selection, a pretty extensive choice of liquors, and the caveat of "no red bull, no Jager." (praise Jesus for that one).  Yes, it's cozy, but if you're on a date, what better way to see how the night is going to turn out than being squished up against someone (unless, like me, the person you are with is completely uninterested in you).I will mention that I found one of the bartenders to be friendlier than the other, which would bum me out if I came here alone but otherwise wasn't a big deal.Definitely this place is bookmarked for good.

16.description: We were told to come to the matchbox to experience real bar in Chicago. I think it's the narrowest bar in the planet. It's really cool though. You definitely get to know people around you. We tried a couple drinks there. The woodmans are really good and refreshing. They make the best margarita and old fashion. Totally recommend coming to this place.

13.description: im visiting from california. on the night on 12/13/15 i came to this bar around 6pm-7pm and the bartender was bluntly rude, giving me the most stalest answers back. visiting from another state and reading all the yelp reviews i expect some kind of customer service but it seemed like right as we walked in (being a group of asians) he had this attitude that could be handled with a ass whooping back home but i kept calm and continued to ask questions on what he did have, politely of course. after answering no to all my questions, i decided to leave. i wasnt greeted as i walked in or out. to the bartender working that night. go fuck yourself, you are a blight in the world. idk why this bar has good reviews. its fucking tiny! the walk-way into the bar is no wider then 2/12 ft wide. fuck this place.

11.description: it might be the smallest bar in the city, hardly anywhere to stand, tho i suppose if you can get a seat at the bar its ok, but still you gotta keep scooting up for people to walk by, but i suppose thats the charm, some good beers on tap, reasonably priced, tho i doubt id come back cuz its so small

39.description: This place is pretty amazing, but a star off because cramped quarters are not my thing.  Is it worth a visit though?  As long as you've braced yourself to get VERY cozy with everyone in the bar, yes!We arrived shortly after 5 on a Tuesday and snagged two of the few chairs left (yes, at 5:15 most of the 15ish bar stools were taken!)  Drinks are delicious and reasonably priced.  My friend drank Ladybirds all night (gin, ginger and yellow chartreuse concoction).  I sampled the pisco sour (pretty solid), the gin & jam (sweet but worth a try, it's definitely different - any yes, there's literally jam in it) and the Ladybird.  Word to the wise: eat first.  After 4 cocktails each, we were pretty gone.  We snacked on the salt & vinegar chips available, but regretted that decision the next day....  if you're looking to drink in moderation, you're in the wrong bar ;)

37.description: Nothing but great things to say about the Matchbox.  It has everything you can want in a bar:  friendly, knowledgeable bartenders; a superb drink list featuring classic as well as modern cocktails; a great beer list with a couple of cool Belgium beers; and shockingly good wine should you be in the mood for that.  We've never had a bad time here, and it really is thanks to the bartenders, who couldn't be nicer and make a mean cocktail.Word to the wise:  it is very small, so get here early and snag a seat.  It opens at 4pm, so it's a great early bar should you want to get the day started before the normal 5pm bar opening time.79/365

0.description: This has been our favorite go to bar for years. Go here. Order a vodka gimlet. Drink and repeat. You're welcome.

38.description: It's a dive bar is fantastic cocktails. Reasonably priced. Right next to the Blue Line. Nothing else matters as long as you can find a spot to stand (it's rather small). If you're hungry, there's the Silver Palm right next door.

51.description: It's already been established how tiny this place is so I won't bother mentioning it.  I will mention that they have an absolutely amazing selection of liquors, with an equally amazing bartender that was a master of his craft.  I went on a very uncrowded Saturday afternoon.  This was the perfect place to have a perfect martini with an old pal.  There's no other place like it.  This place is a must.

27.description: If you don't like the grit of this place, then this place just isn't for you. This place is small, if you don't get in, or if you are cramped........its always expected, don't base your review on level of service, because.......they don't care. And neither should someone going to 'the smallest bar in chicago'.I believe that only a few places do certain things extremely well, and you should judge those places, based on those few things. Get a margarita. Order the 1/2 ribs. Order the shrimp cocktail.If you do this, you should expect to give a great review - Service is by bikers.....so you shouldn't rate just based on that (because its not bad......its just cold/expected). If you want warm service w/ great bartenders, go to the Silver Palm, which is basically the same place (upstairs). Then, and only then, should you order the fantastic fish tacos and many other their other great food options.

32.description: I don't get it, or maybe I do. The matchbox is the size of a matchbox. It's a tiny bar that seems like it was built as an afterthought and smells exactly like a college frat house. We came here on a recommendation of a rather lovely gal and was sorely disappointed. The bar is small enough for patrons to sit at and just enough room behind the seat for ppl to walk by and bump you with their sweaty arms. The drinks are alright, they looked imaginative and the tenders make a large portion. They shake up your drinks and give you the shaker to pour out the rest. I wanted to give this place 2 stars, however, the drinks bumped it up. The drinks are cheap, sweet and refreshing. I suppose if the outside area was open my review would be completely different. I just, hate the smell of college frats.

54.description: You just can't find places like this anymore. Authentic and original. The Sidecar was awesome!

48.description: The name of this bar, Matchbox, is very apropos to the space. It is simply one long bar. The decor is very casual and relaxing. Seats up to 29?! Depending on the crowd it can fill up very quickly and without a seat can be very tight. The people are friendly as many times I've frequented. They have their popular powdered sugar gimlets but they also have a pretty decent whiskey collection. Their prices are very fair & the bartenders' alcohol pour are generous. No food. Unless you consider a bag of chips fuel for the stomach which it had been for me on several occasions.Definitely a stop on the dive bar crawl. It's easy to become a regular there. Oh and there's a silver train diner parked just behind the place. Never been inside but an excellent visual nonetheless.

44.description: If we could, both Rob Thomas and I would give this place 20 stars. Since we can't 5 will have to cover it. Not necessarily applicable in this winter weather, but the patio is pretty dope with way more seating on the sidewalk then inside the bar itself. Until a warmer climate comes you''ll have to fight for one of the maybe 30 spots inside, but if you're lucky enough to get one you'll enjoy awesome drinks cheaper than almost any craft cocktail bar in town.Perfect to post up at alone and enjoy some convo with the bartenders or bring a date to showcase your coolness. Matchbox makes for an awesome spot to start off a night of almost any occasion if you're not rolling with a deep crowd.

24.description: I'm still working my way around the area, but this is way up there with my favorites. It's tiny, touting being "Chicago's most intimate bar". That's not a lie, it's very little, like nine stools in a hallway, and it's divey. But the beer selection was very good, they also made Old-Fashions and other cocktails with great care. Silverpalm next door is amazing as well, I believe there owned by the same people.

7.description: This place is definitely small, or should I say narrow.  I stopped in before happy hour though, so I was able to nab a seat.  Right in front of the show too (where the bartender mixed up fine concoctions that had me at hello).  It's dark and a great place to come if you just don't feel like dealing with the world or the hassle of a busy trendy bar.  The cocktails are on point, and I did get checked for my ID.  Kudos to the bartender for being on the right side of the law.  The music brought me back to a time before I was 21... Portishead.  I actually stayed longer because I felt like I was in a perfect time warp.  A few creepers straggled in, but I kept to myself and then ordered a Please and Thank You.  Rightful moniker too, I would have followed it with a "yes SIR, may I have another!!, " but it's still mid day and I had to drive home.  It tasted creamy and gingery.  If I had to date a drink, it would be this one.  Bourbon, brandy, apple pie shrub, demerara, lemon, and ginger beer.  Topped with citrus peel, and the straw right through.  I am for sure coming back, probably around the same time, as I've seen other yelpers having difficulty grabbing a seat later.  #doyouevenmatchboxbro  Yes, yes I do.  btw, there are no "bros" here, thank the lord.

49.description: Solid drinks that are not wimpy, great atmosphere and always interesting people in there.  Great selection of spirits!Patio is nice in the summer.  The service is consistent.  The place is small on the inside.

40.description: The Matchbox is a great hangout.  Tiny, and quaint - with knowledgeable bartenders.  The Blue line is right across the street, so a very convenient for people visiting from out of town.

53.description: Small, narrow watering hole that holds a very eclectic vibe.  Great hidden gem if you're looking for a unique drink in a unique location.

30.description: Went in 8/15.When I walked in I realized just how small this place is. We weren't sure if out door seating was seat yourself. As I stood at the bar while the bartenders were figuring out what kind of shot they wanted to take I interrupted to ask. Yes. Seat yourself and he said first come first serve? We sat ourselves on a sticky, unbalanced table. We waited about 5 minutes before we were greeted. Where I had to ask if the table could be wiped down. The menus were really sticky as well.I went with the mule and my friends went with the gimlets.The drinks were really delicious. I really enjoyed sitting outside. Our server seemed un interested in us,  I felt like we had to flag her more than her actually popping in.No small talk nothing.  She's a blonde with a pixie.We ordered guacamole,  calamari,  and bruschett a,All amazing. We asked the server for a salad about 20 minutes after our apps,  and she told us they already had last call. (Which we weren't told)She then said she'd ask if the kitchen could throw a salad together,  and literally never came back,  until they closed the patio.Even when closing the patio I felt like they were really rude. Why would you bring me a full drink ten minutes before you close the patio, then say everyone has to drink up. It was awkward.Food and drinks really good. Service.  Pretty bad.  This could have been a 5 star.

46.description: smallest bar in Chicago! decent parking around the area.. good vibe! good prices!look for a bartender named Trino ! dude is nice and will make anything you want from fruity girly drinks to i wanna black out drinks.

1.description: It's small. It's a bar.They have a few beers on tap and they are more unique options, which was nice to try. Lots of rye, whiskey and bourbon options for people that like those drinks. They have a TV, but since it's so small in there you really have to strain your neck to get a view of it. All in all, I would stop back in if I were in the area, but I'm not settling up weekly visits any time soon.

55.description: Love Matchbox.  Best Gimlets anywhere. I'd 5 stars but they need more tables outside as inside is well, a matchbox.  Always a great place to grab a drink plus Silver Palm is next door and same owners so bonus.

9.description: Its a bit tight on the inside - hence the name, but what they lack in size they make up for in strength - of their cocktails.  Generous pours at the watering hole, highlight are martinis and ice cold bottles of beer. I never pass by and don't stop in for a taste here.

26.description: Great cocktails hands down. Tony the bartender rocks.nice neighborhood spot.

25.description: Great drinks. The space lives up to the name, you ar certainly a match in the box with no wiggle room. Perfect for the datin' and romancin' folks. Excellent drinks.

12.description: Good ambiance, tight squeeze, and fruit flies in your drink. What more could you want from a Chicago strong hold.

59.description: Best bar in Chicago. Good beer. Great cocktails. You can order deliciousness from next door. It's small and cozy enough that you can talk with everyone there. The resulting impracticalities (the restroom; sometimes getting hit with a door) weed out the folks who would rather be on Hubbard or in Wrigleyville. The service is always spot on. Love it.

21.description: After 2 years, our extensive research and data collection has lead us to the conclusion that the Matchbox best ginger gimlet that Chicago has to offer...  Especially when Chris is behind the bar and accents the cocktail with his fabulous rim job.... A special nod to Colleen who comes in a close second.  LUV this place and happy to see cheetos return on the menu...

17.description: Went in 8/15.When I walked in I realized just how small this place is. We weren't sure if out door seating was seat yourself. As I stood at the bar while the bartenders were figuring out what kind of shot they wanted to take I interrupted to ask. Yes. Seat yourself and he said first come first serve? We sat ourselves on a sticky, unbalanced table. We waited about 5 minutes before we were greeted. Where I had to ask if the table could be wiped down. The menus were really sticky as well.I went with the mule and my friends went with the gimlets.The drinks were really delicious. I really enjoyed sitting outside. Our server seemed un interested in us,  I felt like we had to flag her more than her actually popping in.No small talk nothing.  She's a blonde with a pixie.We ordered guacamole,  calamari,  and bruschett a,All amazing. We asked the server for a salad about 20 minutes after our apps,  and she told us they already had last call. (Which we weren't told)She then said she'd ask if the kitchen could throw a salad together,  and literally never came back,  until they closed the patio.Even when closing the patio I felt like they were really rude. Why would you bring me a full drink ten minutes before you close the patio, then say everyone has to drink up. It was awkward.Food and drinks really good. Service.  Pretty bad.  This could have been a 5 star.

10.description: If I'm in the mood for a cocktail, I go to The Matchbox. In my opinion- it is the best gin gimlet in town. I suggest going on a weekday when it is quieter.. or in the summer when you can utilize the patio space.

5.description: Meh. Nothing special, and its a pain to come with a group because they don't allow splits on credit cards.  The only thing keeping us coming is that there are not many nearby options.... Matchbox is too small.

3.description: Literally a hole in the wall. This place is tiny and made a little person like myself slightly claustrophobic. I truly wonder how grown men can sit elbow to elbow like sardines and have a good time. The alcohol probably helps...Only one bartender that doesn't seem too chipper. He seemed pretty shocked that we ordered straight shots and the concept of shot glasses also don't exist in his world. He pretty much served us a half a glass of vodka each (equivalent to at least 2 shots). The shot in itself was also warm and did not go down smoothly. We also tried their Dark and Stormy which was AVERAGE and their banana daiquiri which was borderline undrinkable. Wouldn't go back or recommend.

35.description: I had always enjoyed my trips to the Matchbox: terrific cocktails, affordable prices, "intimate" setting. Ask me a couple weeks ago, I would have had nothing but praise for this bar.I recently went with some friends, and after my latest experience I will never, ever return. We were sitting at the end of the bar having drinks and some pizza. (Normally you can order in from the hotel restaurant next door, but since the place was temporarily closed, the bartender recommended the pizza joint across the street.) I hadn't paid much mind to the folks next to us until one of the guys left, returning a few minutes later with an unmarked white box. The contents of this box? Several hunks of raw meat. Which he proceeded to remove from the box, place on the bar, and cut into smaller pieces for his friends. Did the bartenders ask him to stop? Did it ever occur to them that raw meat on a bar is a pretty significant health hazard? Of course not: the guy was cutting the meat into pieces for the bartender. Admittedly I can be a little bit sensitive about things I find icky, but I rather think that raw meat on the bar can reasonably be considered unacceptable for a certified public eating and drinking establishment. I am never going back to this bar and I sincerely hope that they get shut down.

19.description: This place is about as spacious as a hallway and the service on the patio is questionable, but boy do they have a quality old fashioned.  They are not skimpy on the good cherries here either.  Despite the cramped quarters, those old fashioneds will bring me back here for sure.  Maybe I'll even try the mysterious gin and jam next time.

28.description: Can't live without this lovely slice of heaven. Best margaritas (according to CNN, second best in the country).Awesome ambiance.No bullshit.Best bartenders.Best food from sister restaurant, the Palm (try: veggie burger, fried, asparagus and ribs)If you don't agree, please don't come back - I'll happily hog your spot!

45.description: This was a great little surprise. The staff is super friendly and helpful, and the drinks were great-- I loved the maple leaf. It's very small, but it's a fun little place that's off the beaten path. Wouldn't plan on spending the whole night here, but if you're in the area and want a couple drinks or are looking for a unique find to add to the list, this is definitely a good spot.

33.description: It tries so hard to be cool, kitchy, and hip(ster), in one of the cool Chicagoan neighborhoods (it's kinda cool).  But, when have a place that is indeed the size of a matchbox, it's impossible to go during any hours respectable to grab a drink.  Fortunately, I was drinking when it was not indeed respectable, so rather enjoyed myself, but it was still almost impossible to find a seat.It's one of those places you have to try at least once, because of its trendy appeal, but it'd be hard to go regularly if every time you might not actually get to stay.

43.description: wonderful. tiny, little bar. the bartenders here surely know how to make a drink and they do it without pretension. the weekends can be a bit of a sardine can but once you get your order to your lips it'll be worth it.

2.description: This place has it all:Small: YupCheap Drink options: CheckSurly Bartender: Fo ShoGents who appear to be regulars looking at you funny because you wore a cardigan sweater: Indeed that happened.Overall good time: You Bet Your A$$$

18.description: When you are entertaining out of town friends, you try and provide them with the best Chicago experience, even if their idea of "going out" involves Bud Light and horseshoes (oh them Nevada folks).  After dining at one of my favorites- Ada Street- I looked for a bar to continue the evening, as uncomfortable as it already was.How I would describe Matchbox (besides the aforementioned tiny): In one of the many, MANY OK Cupid quizzes, there's one that asks what a perfect first date would be: a really divey bar, a nice restaurant or a day at the beach (there might be one more choice but I can't remember).  Matchbox is an oxymoron- an upscale divey bar.   If you judge a book by it's cover, you will be sorely disappointed when you miss out on stellar drinks (try the margarita), a decent bottle beer selection, a pretty extensive choice of liquors, and the caveat of "no red bull, no Jager." (praise Jesus for that one).  Yes, it's cozy, but if you're on a date, what better way to see how the night is going to turn out than being squished up against someone (unless, like me, the person you are with is completely uninterested in you).I will mention that I found one of the bartenders to be friendlier than the other, which would bum me out if I came here alone but otherwise wasn't a big deal.Definitely this place is bookmarked for good.

41.description: $7.50 for a well drink at happy hour? Definitely does not qualify as a dive bar. I suppose they have to maximize profit for their small size. Save your money and elbows and go to a real bar.

52.description: Our favorite bar in Chicago by far. Whenever we want to go out and have a drink we always go to matchbox. Cozy place, Amazing staff with great taste in music and tasty drinks. They are very creative with the menu and the drinks they create are all great. Try Woodsman :) you can always order in some food from Silver palm next door too. Whenever we have visitors in town that's one of the places we take them too. It's one of the highlights of Chicago...

50.description: Bottom Line Up Front: Interesting layout, good selection of booze, fun clientele. It's "smallness" forces you to meet new people. Hanging out at the Matchbox is kind of like drinking with my brother. Like my brother, the Matchbook is dimunitive in size, lives off the blue line, and doesn't really bat an eye if you fart. Even if you've never been there, it has an "everyone knows your name" familiarity that larger, less tattooed, more successful bars (brothers) can match. I like dive bars, primarily because they usually lack the requesite 25 Flat Screen televisions on the Sportscenter loop. It seems to me that the less "entertainment" at the bar, the more human interaction. Well, the Matchbox adds the element that every time that you want to go to the bathroom, order a drink, or turn around, you're literally bumping into another patron. some might rate this as a negative, but it was kind of cool to be absolutely FORCED to meet the people surrounding you at the bar. Matchbox DOES have a small television right above the door. It was playing "Last House on a Dead End Street," a 70s slasher movie. The aforementioned restroom is unisex, and at the far end of the bar from the entrance. It was pretty clean.The Box had an incredibly impressive selection of craft beer and spirits. Only 3 draught beers, but a good selection of local midwest microbrews from Bells, 3 Floyds, Left Hand, and Great Lakes. Behind the rail, the Box has 10, 12, and 15 year old Pappy Van Winkle Bourbon... pretty much the most delicious bourbon in the world. You know it's good because it's featured prominently on the TV show "Justified" - a drama where a Sherrif's Deputy drinks bourbon and/or moonshine, slays all of the goodlooking babes in this town, and shoots with impugnity (because it's justified). Sidenote: if you're looking for a guilty pleasure TV show, give it a watch. Long story short. it's a great place to grab a drink if you're in the neighborhood.

4.description: This tiny bar has that cozy feel that I loved during the winter - although I am not sure I would be as much of a fan on a hot summer day! Even though I usually am easily claustrophobic, the communal and friendly environment made this place seem larger than it is. Cocktails are creative and delicious!

6.description: Not my idea of fun being jam packed in the tiniest bar.  It's uncomfortable being in there, but I guess they have their regulars, so good for them.

22.description: Great local spot in the neighborhood! Room for maybe 15-20 people in the entire bar, it makes for an intimate outing where conversations can easily be held. The prices are also spot on as a $10 cocktail comes with a shaker which is basically a 2 for 1 deal. They make the best gin gimlet I've ever had and you can't beat the price. This is a very unique bar in Chicago and a definite must-see.

15.description: Great cocktails and strong drinks!The place is SUPER narrow but definitely check this place out. The decor is fun and the bartenders are pretty nice. The booze selection is great!

57.description: Great, cozy neighborhood bar on one of the best street corners in Chicago.  In my book, this is definitely a winter-feeling bar, but even on a late summer Thursday night, it was just perfect.  Great booze selection and creative cocktails.

20.description: It may be small and cramped during peak hours but the bartenders are great and the silver palm next door tends to be less crowded if you want a more cozy atmosphere. The vegetarian options for food are pretty good and I enjoy the whiskey options! Its a neat place to talk to new people and its even got a great laid back atmosphere in the early evening for a drink with a friend

36.description: Question: How many people can you fit inside this bar. Answer: 20 children.  This place is miniature. I guess anyone who likes "small" things would like this place.   I prefer to drink my liquor while not stepping on someone.

14.description: I'm still working my way around the area, but this is way up there with my favorites. It's tiny, touting being "Chicago's most intimate bar". That's not a lie, it's very little, like nine stools in a hallway, and it's divey. But the beer selection was very good, they also made Old-Fashions and other cocktails with great care. Silverpalm next door is amazing as well, I believe there owned by the same people.

3.description: Honestly, shopping is not my thing and a friend of mine suggested I get a consultation from Jason at "My Style i." I didn't really know what I was getting into, but he came over, looked at my clothes, and immediately made suggestions based on my own limited fashion sense. Since that first consultation he has come over a half dozen times, each time with tons of clothes that fit well and align with my own style. And it's so reasonably priced! I feel like I am saving money, not leaving my living room, and getting clothes that I would not be able to find on my own. What more could you want out of a shopping experience? Plus- Jason is a great guy, who I actually trust. When I'm out on the town or at busy at work people have noticed that I have been dressing better and I always give all the credit to Jason. Why not? He's great. This has been the best shopping experience possible for me, and I'd imagine there are tons of other people like me out there who are looking for the same thing. Could not recommend this more. Keep up the good work!

1.description: I really had no idea what to expect having a person doing shopping for me. The idea sounds amazing since Im a professional consultant plus entrepreneur and have NO TIME for shopping.  Since my new business is around fashion I .eeded.an upgrade from my boring engineer clothes. I hired Cheryl and... wow. Besides a very realistic questionnaire, she came to my home, listened to my concerns, to what I like and...  few weeks later as agreed (actually even earlier) she came back with amazing pieces and everything fit amazing as well. Be careful, you are going to love then all!!! She is great!!

2.description: I just started a new position in an industry where my clients range from corporate business executives to local hardware store owners, so my attire must be flexible and I was really struggling with how to keep a balanced look.  The consultation and survey were comprehensive, yet painless and the final looks that Cheryl & Jason pulled together gave me so many wonderful options and really complimented what I already had in my closet.  They worked around my time and budget and presented pieces that I would not normally consider, but completely love.  The service is friendly and professional and I will definitely be coming back to them for my fall wardrobe!

0.description: I would like to start out by saying that I do not have much fashion sense.  I'm the kind of guy that would think it would be okay to wear socks with sandals or a blue shirt with black pants.  That is why I decided to go see Jason.  He is extremely nice and best of all not judgmental.  He started off by asking me what occasion the clothes were for or what setting the clothes would be worn in.  I told him I wanted some nice clothes to go out in. The clothes he brought back to me were perfect.  They were trendy, comfortable, and in the price range I wanted.  One of my main concerns was finding a nice pair of jeans that weren't too skinny.  I can't stand how they feel.  Jason even managed to find a pair that looked tight fitting but aloud for good mobility.   Overall this was a great experience and I plan on using Jason's services in the future.

3.description: This Family Dollar location is my go-to store for household items like cleaning supplies, toilet paper, and paper towels. Not only is it within walking distance of my house, but they have most of the same name brand products I'd buy elsewhere and they're typically cheaper than Target.The line always seems long because there are only 2 cashiers, but usually I'm in and out pretty quickly.

1.description: I cannot believe the way this dollar treats its customers.  About three or four weeks ago, I went in only to buy a bag of chips.  There was only one clerk and a long line.  So I went elsewhere and when I returned, the line had not shortened, but something else was going on.  A man with a full shopping cart was being told that he could not take the cart out to his car--but the car was parked on the curb DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF THE STORE!!!  He had to walk out his entire purchase two bags at a time.  He was incredibly pissed.  I would have been, too.  Were they worried that he would put the shopping cart in the back seat of a brand-new SUV and drive off?I complained about their Uptown store, but it clearly did no good.  Their prices, of course, are more than reasonable.  However, I would rather pay a little more at a store where they appreciate my business.BTW, I never did get that bag of chips.  It is just something I will not wait in line for.

2.description: Oh, hey. Did you hear we're in the middle of a recession? Yeah, me too! Which means that even the gainfully employed folks are trying to pinch a few pennies when possible. Guess what? Dollar stores suddenly became socially acceptable places to buy household stuff. Now, I wouldn't buy my undies or shoes here or anything, but Family Dollar sells items like cleaning supplies, light bulbs, clothing hangers, toothpaste, etc. at an absolute fraction of the cost of Target and CVS. Duh, you know that, right? So why the hell don't we go to the dollar store? The "creepy" factor, I'm guessing. Interestingly enough, Family Dollar on Chicago Ave. manages to be relatively clean, semi-organized and even has a decidedly non-scary clientele. Sure, there are missing tiles on the floor, which is also kind of caving in a bit near the Tupperware aisle, they're frugal with the air conditioning and there's only one cashier, but I'd like to think these things happen because they're keeping the overhead low to deliver cheapie goods. And I can deal with that. I walked out with three enormous bags of stuff for about $13. Can't beat it. And they take credit cards! Double bonus: No weird smell. You know what I'm talking about, all dollar stores have that slightly icky smell of must, dust and old Christmas decorations. Not the case at this Family Dollar!

5.description: Look, Family Dollar is amazing. I believe, very strongly, that if you can't find what you're looking for on Chicago Ave, then you don't really need it. AT CVS recently, I spent 15 dollars on sensitive skin sunblock, and nail polish remover. Then I realized I needed to cash a check at the bank, and decided to stop in the olde family dollar. for 23 dollars I bought the big tube of Colgate with Scope, a nozzle for my hose, a flashlight with batteries, lavender bubble bath, 2 things of mineral water, 3 packs of Orbit gun, AND the nail polish remover. If you're some sort of bougie, high maintenance person, don't bother. however, if you're a person who's willing to suck it up and deal with chaos for 10 minutes in exchange for an amazing, one- stop shopping experience, hit me up, I'll show you the ropes.

6.description: This was a really sparsely stocked and poor selection for a store- I mean come on I know it's family dollar- but it was gross and most products they do carry they didn't have it was very strange. I left confused and saddened it was the higher rated within my new 'hood. I may have to go north to visit my old one when needed. Also, I'm used to them having at least a small lot, the meter parking was a pain and I've never had such an inattentive sales person I get your making minimum wage, but he was so aloof he dropped my items several times when putting them in the bag.

0.description: Going around the supermarkets I've noticed how expensive cleaning products and basic household goods are in this city!! Thank goodness for this shop! Finally a place which understands that "the basics" we all need in life shouldn't cost a small fortune. I managed to get everything on my shopping list and a bit more as I went a bit wild due to the prices! I am such a bargain hunter and hate being ripped just because the supermarket was "convenient". My bank does not find it "convenient"!! Most polishes, hand wash, cloths, shaving foam was $1 each so not too bad. There's a cheap linen and bedding place next door as well as clothes shops to kit you out and find everything you need!!

4.description: are you on a budget? Family Dollar can help you stretch your dollar till it screams. while Target is fun, it's not that budget friendly. i like Family Dollar because it helps me save on things i don't need to spend top dollar on: cleaning products and non-comestibles.(do *not* buy food here. just...to be safe.)why should i spend full price on toilet paper, feminaries or dishwashing liquid? with Family Dollar, i don't have to!

3.description: If I could give Spencer and his employees 6 stars I would!  First his team did a great job with a number of different prints I needed finished.  He gave me a bunch of options and never looked to upsell me - just to find what was best for my taste and pricing options.  Also When he found out I needed to ship one of my framed prints, he went down stairs and packaged one up for me at no additional cost - probably saving me $50 at the UPS store.  These guys truly love what they do and will go out of their way for you.  Top notch!

1.description: I'm an avid poster collector and have worked with Spencer for nearly 10 years. Spencer is very knowledgable about his art and has a great collection/selection from which to choose, whether early lithographs or more contemporary originals. His in-house framing and restoration shop is also second to none. I've always found him to be honest, reasonable, and great to work with. I just wish I had more walls to fill!It's always a pleasure visiting Spencer and his gallery.

2.description: Spencer "fixed" two vintage propaganda posters for me several years back. One had slight water damage that needed repair. He was very nice and convinced me that he could do the repairs and would use the best ink/archival ink that would not fade. The posters looked amazing when I picked them up and they went right into proper storage. About a month ago I pulled out the posters. The poster he repaired looks atrocious! The ink he used has more than noticeably faded. It would make sense if I had the poster displayed near a window with direct light on it for the past 3 years. Any art that has been properly stored with NO light should not look this bad. Very disappointed to say the least. Any company or person that is trusted to fix your cherished art should be ashamed when they use sub-par ink and less than promised techniques, basically ruining your pieces! Would NOT recommend!!

5.description: This man is amazing! Spencer is a wealth of knowledge with posters as well as antique furniture. He helped me and spent at least 1/2 hr and didn't charge me anything to help me understand the lithograph I had brought in. I learned so much in a such a short amount of time. He is thorough, fair, and knowledgeable. He does not cut corners.

6.description: Great with selling you something. But if you want any help after that, you can forget it. Doesn't call back when he says he would.

7.description: I met Spencer at a vintage poster exhibition in downtown Chicago earlier this this. Having been to the same exhibition a year earlier, I was interested in making a small purchase to start my collection. Spencer was the easiest gallery owner to talk to at the exhibition by far!After searching Spencer's website for available posters; which by the way was very easy to do, I found what I was looking for. So I made the drive into the city and found his gallery... Awesome is the only word I would use to describe his collection, his support staff and prices of his vintage posters in comparison to others!There is so much to see, so many different styles to choose from... I guarantee, you'll find something you like. Check out his website from time to time for new additions, I do!

0.description: I walk by Spencer's gallery nearly every day on my way to work and finally, having a few things needing framed, popped in to get an impression. Spencer, from the moment we met, was very friendly and professional. He steered me to a group of frame styles that he keeps in bulk to help keep the cost down for clueless folks like myself. He gave me a general quote, shook my hand, and out the door I went. This was a Wednesday evening.Fast forward to Thursday. I drop back into Spencer's gallery with my art. He was out, but I was able to leave the pieces there. I got a call from Spencer not long after, letting me know that he LOVED my art and that he was excited to set me up. I came back after work and Spencer gushed over the prints I had dropped off and gave me a final number. Now I'm no framing expert, but I've asked about custom framing before and the responses have always sent me running. Spencer's pricing was incredibly reasonable, even for a chain store like Michael's. He promised that they'd be finished sometime next week and gave me a slip with the agreed upon price.Friday afternoon, I'm busy at work when I get a call from Spencer letting me know that the art has been framed and letting me know that I'd be very happy. After work I popped in for the 3rd day in a row to see Spencer attaching the brackets and wire to the back of my frames. When he flipped them up, I was blown away. His suggestions, materials, and final product beat my expectations at every turn. Now this isn't your standard framing affair - at least from my understanding. Where can you get custom framing done in less than a day and at incredibly low prices? I hadn't found it until the day I stumbled into Spencer's gallery and I may never find it again. It's worth noting, that Spencer's frame jobs are totally legitimate. The materials are great, he makes sure he's using acid free backing paper and uses Plexiglas that protects your art from UV light, and uses a heavy duty wire to hang the frame from. This is "museum style" framing. And if you're interested in vintage art, you'll want to spend some time in this place poking around. Great stuff.Spencer will take care of you - trust me.

4.description: Spencer is extremely knowledgeable and helpful with all my custom framing questions! I had a couple items custom-framed. Not only did he do an excellent job, but the turnaround was very fast (a few days). Pricing was totally reasonable (as a comparison, one place near downtown quoted me a price 5x more with a turnaround time of 2+ weeks).
