1.description: Near the Chicago blue line stop and got a sweet tooth? Stop in here for some pretty decent gelato or a dessert crepe. You won't be disappointed. They've got some different flavors like avocado or wasabi almond which are my favorite features. More of a savory guy myself though and those options aren't very plentiful or tasty for that matter. Not terrible, but not really noteworthy. Just some veggies wrapped up in carbs. There is parking even though the place is super tiny and the guy working was incredibly nice. Other than that...just stick to the sweets and it's a great little spot.

9.description: Eh, it's okay, but I've had better.  There were 8 flavors to choose from and one scoop was pretty much $5.  It was tasty, but not that thick.  To be honest, I didn't think it was gelato at all.  I thought I was eating plain ice cream because it started melting incredibly fast.  Wait, I know what you're going to say -- "Amanda, gelato pretty much means "ice cream" in Italian."  Thanks, Grandma.  So, do you think that maybe they could stick to an Italian recipe then?  Whole milk vs cream, Yo!  Slow churning?  No quite frozen?  Capite italiano?I would go back, but only on a hot day when I'm desperate for ice cream and can't get anywhere else.

23.description: FINALLY! they are open....its just such a convenient location and I felt like by a place called GELATO GRECO to be sitting there tempting me and not being open...it just really made me want gelato even more! So tonight on this exact rainy night I saw 2 ladies working and went in. I tried the flavors they had to offer and I liked most of them. I was very fond of their Hazelnut, Chocolate, and Ricotta flavors. I can not remember the exact names of them but they were delicious. I went with an affogato which is one of my favorite treats...I went with the hazelnut gelato and a decaf espresso to top it. It was very good. For $6 I got a big scoop of gelato and a shot of espresso. I've paid $11 at other places. Fair price and delicious. I'll be back to try the crepes next!

25.description: This place is way overpriced.  $4.50 will get you a tiny of scoop of mediocre gelato.  Save your money and go somewhere else.

12.description: FINALLY! they are open....its just such a convenient location and I felt like by a place called GELATO GRECO to be sitting there tempting me and not being open...it just really made me want gelato even more! So tonight on this exact rainy night I saw 2 ladies working and went in. I tried the flavors they had to offer and I liked most of them. I was very fond of their Hazelnut, Chocolate, and Ricotta flavors. I can not remember the exact names of them but they were delicious. I went with an affogato which is one of my favorite treats...I went with the hazelnut gelato and a decaf espresso to top it. It was very good. For $6 I got a big scoop of gelato and a shot of espresso. I've paid $11 at other places. Fair price and delicious. I'll be back to try the crepes next!

21.description: Had been waiting for months and months for this place to open and was so excited when it finally did! But man, what a disappointment. I've definitely had better gelato in the city - for example, Mariano's who gets theirs shipped daily from Milwaukee. So so sad because we were going to make it our dessert place to go on a nice night. But the price just doesn't match the quality, unfortunately.

16.description: The best peach gelato I have ever had.

17.description: The ice cream is definitely worth the price. They offer a variety of flavors that are not easy to come by.

10.description: Best gelato in Chicago. Full stop. I'm new here just moved from Italy, so I remember pretty well how gelato should be. Guys, few flavors but well done. This is the trick. Suggestion: pistacchio. Nocciola. Gianduia. Fiordilatte. Amen. Giovanni

5.description: I live by Black Dog and you can't compare the two. Go Greco or go home. It's obvious the other is owned by a bunch of hipsters who had the bright idea to start a gelato shop without the skills and panache. Skills and panache in abundance at the GC.

11.description: Went there on Friday around 7, lights were on but the chairs were put up and no one is there... no signs..  yelp says you guys a open...   I am not sure what the deal is..

22.description: By far the best crêpes I've ever had. The staff are always so welcoming and nice. Great place for a date, or to hang out and catch up over awesome dessert. Chef krystin is imaginative and creative, this place is a hidden gem that deservesTo be noticed

0.description: Came here on a whim in Chicago--kind of because I am a female who demands ice cream be fed to her on a regular basis, else all hell breaks loose, and kind of because, well, gelato is freaking delicious. Can you blame me? (This is a rhetorical question, but if you were to answer it, the correct response would be "No.")It's so conveniently located that I can't even fathom where else they could possibly put it that would be more convenient. So simply for that, they get another star. It's right off the exit for the Blue Line subway, so you can make this pitstop whenever you like.The only flavor I ended up liking was the Strawberry Yogurt, which was actually really really good. Their portions are also pretty generous considering they're only one scoop. Sure, it's a little pricey, but it's gelato we're talking about here. What do you expect?

20.description: Bought 3 pints ($$$) for a special occasion and was greatly disappointed.  We had 3 different flavors, expected high quality (especially for the price) and experienced low quality gelato.  It was grainy - and not very enjoyable compared to other gelatos that we've had (for much cheaper).  We will not be back.

19.description: I've been to dozens of gelatorias in nearly every major city and region of Italy, and my Italian husband and I were very impressed with this welcomed addition to our neighborhood.  All organic ingredients and made right there in the shop.  Nice selection of classic flavors, plus we've seen some bold concoctions as well that look interesting.  Looking forward to trying different seasonal flavors.  The small outdoor patio is also pretty cute and cozy place to sit with a friend or sweetheart and enjoy a cup of gelato.

2.description: Is this place ever open!? I live right by it for about 2 yrs now and any time I would like to try some gelato from here it is always closed! A sign giving hours would be nice...

18.description: Had been waiting for months and months for this place to open and was so excited when it finally did! But man, what a disappointment. I've definitely had better gelato in the city - for example, Mariano's who gets theirs shipped daily from Milwaukee. So so sad because we were going to make it our dessert place to go on a nice night. But the price just doesn't match the quality, unfortunately.

13.description: Amazing place. My wife and I spent time in Italy and this is exactly what gelato and sorbet is in Italy. This place is amazing. If you want a true taste of Italia than this is it. Go and I mean go now or the the next they are open because this place is a must for anyone looking for true Italy.

4.description: I took a flyer on this place because the CTA bus was 15 min away and I saw a "Dulce de Leche" flavor.   I won't be back. The flavor was only mediocre.  Worse, the gelato had ice crystals in it -- more than a few.  That's a sign of poor craftsmanship.  And they charge $3 for a single scoop?  Black Dog gives you two scoops (and better flavor choices) for $4.  And I've been to Black Dog at least a dozen times and never had ice crystals in my gelato. Heck, even Marianos gelato is much better quality, and you get the same amount for $1.25 than this place charges$3 for.

24.description: Ermahgerd, I've died and gone to heaven & no one can convince me otherwise.I had an extremely busy day yesterday & forgot to make dinner, and my morning has been so hectic that I didn't have time for breakfast.  I stopped at Gelato Greco for something to eat and I found utter bliss!!!Typically, I temporarily avoid "Now Open" restaurants because I like to give it a week or two so they can get their stuff together and work out the kinks.  This place has worked it all out and is running as smooth as smooth can be.  And who came up with those recipe ideas!?  I LOVE YOU!I ordered the Peanut Butter Maple crepe.  Not only was it an absolutely delicious, melt-in-your-mouth, flavorful crepe, but it was priced nicely and decorated beautifully.  Someone has their food artistry down pat.I also ordered the Coconut Custard Latte.  If it wasn't for the fact that I had many more things to cross off of my heavy to-do list, I might have bolted myself to the chair and just ordered lattes all day long.  I have never, in my entire life, had a better latte (psst, I was a barista, and I made some bomb-diggity-awesome lattes).The atmosphere is lovely, up-to-date, and super clean!  Seems like a friendly place for all!  The employees are superb, too!  I tend to expect snotty baristas who wouldn't know foam art if it hit them in the forehead, but Krys knocked the foam art out of the park and had a fantastic personality to boot.  Her professionalism and eagerness to please her customers was astounding.  It's always so refreshing to see a true artist (of any medium) to exhibit a love for what they do.  She's great.  Gelato Greco is great.  Great is such a small word, but look up the definition... GREAT 1st time visit.  I will be a regular, just you wait and see.

6.description: Get out of here. You're kidding me. Who is giving this place 5 stars, and has your tongue been injured in some sad accident?The price is ridiculous for the smallest adult size. Granted, it's a sizable portion, but I'd take half the portion for half of the cost. Just because the name of your company is exotic sounding, I don't want to have to pay the conversion rate prices for a frozen dessert. Odd selection (would you like the sweet corn, mushroom, or the sun-dried leather?) And here's a snippet of conversation from my visit."Would you like to try a sample?""Well what is Fior De Latte""It's like vanilla.""Oh...hmmm""It's vanilla"Too many other places out there.

15.description: This is where we go for a special summer treat. The flavor are always unique and quite delicious. It's a bit pricey but go for it!  Spoil yourself, you won't be disappointed!

7.description: Not happy at all. Chocolate tasted like some sugar free ice cream or something. The salted caramel, which is usually my favorite flavor, was way too salty. I wasted money on this. The guy behind the counter was really nice but not enough to where I would want to try this place again.

8.description: Stopped by on a Saturday night and they had 4 flavors. I repeat... just four flavors.It's worth it to keep going up Milwaukee to Oberweis, or trekking over to Wicker Park for Black Dog Gelato.

3.description: Yes yes and yes! First of all it's right in front of the #66 bus stop annnd right upstairs from the Chicago Avenue Blue Line. Win! Secondly, The service is awesome! Win! Anthony was very nice and helpful and just cool af. Best of all, the chocolate gelato is slamming! Win!The honey bourbon strawberry -goood and the organic whipped cream-sinful! They use natural, organic and locally sourced products. WIN WIN WIN! It's a small place but there is some window seating inside  and some outside seating as well. The prices were reasonable too. Yeah, I like this spot. It really made an impression on me.

14.description: Ermahgerd, I've died and gone to heaven & no one can convince me otherwise.I had an extremely busy day yesterday & forgot to make dinner, and my morning has been so hectic that I didn't have time for breakfast.  I stopped at Gelato Greco for something to eat and I found utter bliss!!!Typically, I temporarily avoid "Now Open" restaurants because I like to give it a week or two so they can get their stuff together and work out the kinks.  This place has worked it all out and is running as smooth as smooth can be.  And who came up with those recipe ideas!?  I LOVE YOU!I ordered the Peanut Butter Maple crepe.  Not only was it an absolutely delicious, melt-in-your-mouth, flavorful crepe, but it was priced nicely and decorated beautifully.  Someone has their food artistry down pat.I also ordered the Coconut Custard Latte.  If it wasn't for the fact that I had many more things to cross off of my heavy to-do list, I might have bolted myself to the chair and just ordered lattes all day long.  I have never, in my entire life, had a better latte (psst, I was a barista, and I made some bomb-diggity-awesome lattes).The atmosphere is lovely, up-to-date, and super clean!  Seems like a friendly place for all!  The employees are superb, too!  I tend to expect snotty baristas who wouldn't know foam art if it hit them in the forehead, but Krys knocked the foam art out of the park and had a fantastic personality to boot.  Her professionalism and eagerness to please her customers was astounding.  It's always so refreshing to see a true artist (of any medium) to exhibit a love for what they do.  She's great.  Gelato Greco is great.  Great is such a small word, but look up the definition... GREAT 1st time visit.  I will be a regular, just you wait and see.

1.description: Crizen ROCKS. Great service, very personable, and accommodating. Chicago's best haircuts are here. Cool atmosphere in a loft setting. Thanks!!

9.description: Lesley and Michelle did the hair and makeup for me, my 7 bridesmaids, and the mothers of the bride and groom last weekend and WOW were they good!! A couple weeks before the wedding, Crizen sent me a detailed spreadsheet that outlined how they were going to get everything done that day, and they were able to stay on schedule even with all the moving parts.  Everyone's hair and makeup looked GORGEOUS and both Lesley and Michelle were so fun to work with and put all the girls at ease (especially my mom who was very emotional that day!).  Michelle even purchased the MAC products that she used on me so that I could keep them and touch up my makeup as the evening wore on.  That was so awesome of her and came in handy that night!  Thank you both so much for everything!!

23.description: Crizen did my hair and makeup for our engagement photos and our wedding in France this past summer. All I'm going to say about her is that she is the kindest, sweetest most amazing ARTIST, woman, mom, wife, sister, daughter I know and have grown to think of as part of my family. I am so blessed to have met her, not just because she made me look GORGEOUS on my day in France, but because I now have a sister and friend for life. The day I got married, I got a new husband and a new sister!!

5.description: Crizen was extremely easy and fun to work with. Her relaxed, easygoing personality, along with her professionalism made the whole process seamless. She listened to all my ideas for the trial and when I wanted some small changes on the day of the wedding, she was so accommodating and I couldn't have been happier with the end results. I looked exactly the way I envisioned it in my head. My hair isn't always the easiest to work with (it's thick and I have a lot of it!), but she was able to tame it so that I could leave it down and curly like I wanted. My curls lasted all night, and even managed to look good the next morning after being slept in! As a makeup artist, Crizen knows how to strike the fine balance between being made up for a formal event while still looking like yourself. As my best friend says: Pictures last forever. Thank goodness I had Crizen to make me look good for them. =)

25.description: She's awesome.  I will follow her wherever she goes (well..it'd be helpful if it were in the South or West Loop) :)

12.description: Crizen was hired as a makeup artist for my wedding during the fall season. She was absolutely wonderful to work with especially with her long history of working with brides. She worked around so many other people in the room and she coached me on staying calm when things were somewhat hectic. My makeup was fantastic. It lasted all day and more, brought my whole look together and made me feel gorgeous! In the photos, I still looked like me and flawless. She also did my mother's hair and makeup and adjusted it appropriately to her style and age. She too looked great! Her talent, personality and professionalism makes it all worth it!

21.description: Crizen did my hair and makeup for my wedding, as well as the hair of all my bridesmaids.  Everything went perfectly. Even though I was planning my wedding from another country, Crizen made herself available for a trial according to my visit schedule, and made sure I was happy with everything. She was amazing both at the trial and the day of my wedding. I could not have asked for more.

16.description: Crizen is nothing short of amazing! She works wonders with hair and makeup. Crizen and Ashley - a stylist on Crizen's team - traveled to Michigan to do hair and makeup for my wedding. With seven bridesmaids, my mom and me, Crizen and Ashley were asked to do nine completely different hairstyles on very different hair types, and all came out flawlessly! Everybody was thrilled with their hair and makeup, and thanks to Crizen, I couldn't have felt more beautiful on my wedding day. Equally as important, Crizen is a fabulous addition to the bridal suite! She's so much fun and fit right in with my friends and family. I HIGHLY recommend Crizen and her team - they're the very best!

17.description: I would highly recommend Crizen Hasegawa for any bride or bridal party (or anyone else who wants their hair and/or makeup done for an event). Results were perfect and more beautiful than I could have dreamed - including my bridal hair (2 looks) and makeup, hair and makeup for my 7 bridesmaids and one flower girl. Two assistants helped with various bridal party members as needed. Crizen is creative, meticulous, and professional and worked very patiently with me as I worked to figure out what I wanted. She takes and implements feedback exceptionally.  She clearly takes great pride in her work. She also showed great versatility, responding to the needs and desires of many bridesmaids with divergent styles, hair textures, facial features, and complexions. Every single member of the bridal party looked both *stunning* and wonderfully individual, and that's owed in no small part to Crizen.  Logistically speaking, Crizen was very flexible and accomodating with our demands, which included a large group, very early morning start time, and additional afternoon touchups. As a bonus, she is generally wonderful to have around, with a boundlessly positive attitude and great converstion - something I came to appreciate having during the many hours I spent in her chair (at trials and on the day)! She's simply great to work with and results could not have been better.

10.description: Based solely on online reviews, I hired Crizen to be my hair & makeup stylist for my wedding in Chicago. What a great decision that was! Crizen is so talented, artistic, kind, warm, and fun to be around. I scheduled to get my trial done for my engagement photos, and I couldn't stop gushing about how good my hair and makeup looked after we got our engagement photos back! On the day of my wedding, Crizen and 3 assistants came to the place where I was getting ready at and helped do hair and makeup for myself and 9 others! Given that there were so many people to get done, the team led by Crizen was prompt, professional, fun, had great energy, and in the end felt like friends. I loved my hair and makeup, and would highly recommend Crizen for anyone looking for a hair or makeup stylist!

11.description: I used Crizen's Senior Stylists for my wedding day and I would not recommend them for your wedding day. I coordinated everything with Crizen, however she was unavailable for my wedding day so I booked her senior stylists.  A good friend of mine used Crizen for her wedding and had wonderful reviews of both the schedule, ease of the day and overall look of her bridal party.  I wrongly assumed that I would have the same experience by working with Crizen's Senior Stylists.In working with Crizen to arrange my wedding date, I told her many times how important the timeline and prompt schedule is to me.  While she understood this priority, it did not occur on my wedding day.  The make-up was the biggest issue - the schedule Crizen made allotted 30 minutes for per bridesmaid for make-up (with 1 make-up artist).  However, the make-up artist took over 45 minutes per person resulting in nearly a 2 HOUR DELAY. No bride has an extra 2 hours on their wedding day - I certainly didn't.While working on the 2nd bridesmaid of the day, I informed the make-up artist that she was already 40 minutes behind schedule and I asked her to be more prompt.  She continued to take 45 minutes per person when only 30 was allotted.For hair - I had insisted on 2 hair stylist and Crizen scheduled 45min-1hour for each person.  This was adequate and they were on schedule; however, the make-up delays caused some delays to their schedules as well.  Also, I was personally frustrated that my stylist deviated from the hair trial and needed day-of decisions.  It was very frustrating to be behind schedule and troubleshooting my new hairstyle.  Additionally, I noticed in pictures that many of the bridesmaids' hair became undone throughout the day. I expect up-do hair styles to stay put like a statue until the girl unpins it at the end of the night.  Overall - this is the 1 and only vendor from my wedding that I cannot recommend.  The schedule delays were beyond frustrating and I'm disappointed I paid for a pricey service only to have sub-par results.  In bringing these issues to Crizen, she apologized profusely and offered salon, hair or make-up services for a future event.  I do believe her apology was sincere, but she failed to follow through on her offer after I accepted her apology and provided my contact information.  Therefore - just a disappointment and I would caution other bride's considering using Crizen's stylists.

26.description: Crizen did my hair and make-up for my wedding in August 2008.  She rocks!  She somehow managed to give me a gorgeous up-do for my wedding even though my hair was quite short at the time.  She totally listened to me at our trial to create a style and look that was funky and unique.  I'm not one to wear earth tones, despite the fact that everyone says you should stick to neutrals for your wedding day.  The make-up stayed perfectly all day despite the warm August weather.She was very accomodating and also did the hair for one of my bridesmaids.  I appreciate the fact that she was willing to work with me even though she could have booked another wedding that had a larger bridal party (and would = more money for her).  I would absolutely use Crizen again (except that I only intend to get married once).  I guess I'll just have to find a fancy party for an up-do!

27.description: Crizen did an exceptional job for hair and makeup on my wedding day and rehearsal dinner. She listen to exactly what I wanted but also gave me some ideas. I didn't want too much makeup for my wedding day but she said putting little bit more would come out nice on photo's and she was absolutely right. My makeup looked so natural  and came through so beautifully on the photos. For my hair, I brought pictures but with her creative style, she put a spin on it and made me look elegant.  She would do things that wasn't required for her job. She touched up on my aunt's hair and makeup, who flew in that morning.I would definitely recommend Crizen for hair and makeup! I was very ecstatic with my look on my wedding day and rehearsal.

0.description: I booked Crizen and her team to do the hair and makeup for myself and my entourage. I had seen her a month prior to do my trial and was very impressed. She was very easy to to talk to and answered all my hair and makeup concerns.  I saw her at 10am and did not do my prewedding shoot until around 4pbut I did not have to do any retouch. A week before the wedding she sent me a spreadsheet with the sched for the entire group which I was able to send out so not everyone had to come to my suite so early. She ( and her team) were amazing! They  came on time and was finished before they were scheduled  to get done. She help made my wedding day less stressful! I would definitely recommend her to everyone.

20.description: Crizen and her team did hair and make-up for me and my large wedding party in June 2013. She did a fantastic job and is just a pleasure to work with. She is so talented and a true professional. She is also a super kind person. Before the wedding, I had a trial with an entourage of family and friends in tow, which can be overwhelming, but she handled them with the utmost respect and professionalism. She's so charming, that everyone enjoyed talking and being around her. She and my mom quickly became great friends. In the weeks leading up to the wedding, being that I am very particular and indecisive, I had requested a second trial to incorporate last minute changes I had made and to finalize the final look. She made time in her busy schedule to do this and was very patient with me in addressing my concerns. She made sure I felt comfortable and was happy with everything. She even gave me a much needed haircut, which was great because since she knew the hairstyle for my wedding, she was able to cut it in a way that would make my hair look even better on the day of. Crizen has my highest recommendation!

19.description: Crizen did my hair and makeup for our engagement photos and our wedding in France this past summer. All I'm going to say about her is that she is the kindest, sweetest most amazing ARTIST, woman, mom, wife, sister, daughter I know and have grown to think of as part of my family. I am so blessed to have met her, not just because she made me look GORGEOUS on my day in France, but because I now have a sister and friend for life. The day I got married, I got a new husband and a new sister!!

2.description: Crizen has been my hairstylist for sometime now and it was a no brainer to use her for my wedding day.  Everyone knows that it takes one bad haircut to ruin your day.  I have been seeing Crizen for my haircuts and she has always done an exceptional job that when I leave her salon I get that extra pep in my step..lolOn my wedding day she spent even more time on my hair to ensure it was perfect and my wedding pictures reflected that.  I could not ask for a better hair day than I had on my wedding day.  Thanks Criz!!!!

18.description: I found Crizen based on her online reviews. I knew within the first 10 minutes of my trial that I had made a great decision choosing her for my wedding hair and makeup. In addition to being extremely talented, Crizen is warm and funny and immediately made me feel at ease. On my wedding day Crizen and Jenai came to our hotel suite to do hair and make up for my bridal party and me. Although it may be a little cheaper to go to a salon, the time and stress saved by having them come to us was well worth it. I have never felt as beautiful as I did on my wedding day. My hair and makeup lasted the entire day through tears and dancing and looked great in pictures. I highly recommend Crizen and her team!

13.description: I found Crizen online for my wedding hair and make-up and selected her because of the many great reviews she had. She did a wonderful job with my hair and make-up for the wedding day! I did a trial a month or so before my wedding and decided I wanted to modify my hair and make-up a bit for the actual wedding day. She really listened to what I wanted and gave me hair and make-up for my wedding day I couldn't have been happier with. Her team also did a great job with the bridesmaids hair, everyone looked beautiful!

4.description: Crizen is amazing!  She is so talented and great with customer service.  Thanks, Crizen!  You are the best!

24.description: I found Crizen by listening to other Yelpers and - woah! I am beyond pleased! Crizen is delightful and talented! She listened and gave helpful advice. I explained what I was going for and she went with it. She even pushed back when she disagreed with a style choice. Listen to her! She knows what she is doing!She arrived promptly at my home on my wedding day and easily got me and three bridesmaids ready ahead of schedule! I looked absolutely stunnning on my wedding day and I have Crizen to thank for helping to bring it out!I will add photos when the professionals prints come in!

6.description: We just got married September 13 and we feel blessed to have had Crizen and her team. Crizen and her team did my hair and makeup beautifully! My husband said he got the goosebumps when he saw me! She made our experience enjoyable with her communication and being so organized throughout our wedding planning.    We liked how she provided a timeline for the wedding day. This way our bridesmaids and family were on time and punctual.   I will definitely refer her to my friends, who are getting married this year!

22.description: Crizen is very professional. She make us feel very comfortable, and she did a very nice job making our makeup and our hairstyle beautiful. We got very good compliments with everyone. I will say she is the best of all the professional hair makeup artist I ever met.

15.description: I found Crizen by listening to other Yelpers and - woah! I am beyond pleased! Crizen is delightful and talented! She listened and gave helpful advice. I explained what I was going for and she went with it. She even pushed back when she disagreed with a style choice. Listen to her! She knows what she is doing!She arrived promptly at my home on my wedding day and easily got me and three bridesmaids ready ahead of schedule! I looked absolutely stunnning on my wedding day and I have Crizen to thank for helping to bring it out!I will add photos when the professionals prints come in!

7.description: Hired Crizen and her team for my wedding. The trial was amazing and ladies did an amazing job for the wedding. Lesley and Michelle, both senior artists, did my hair and make up as well as my bridesmaids and Mom. All of us showed pictures of the hair and make up we desired and both came out almost exactly alike. All services were provided in my home. The hair and makeup both lasted all night however, for the price I would have liked to receive a complimentary lip gloss or something. I would definitely hire them for a special occasion again but visit the salon to save on the price.

8.description: I got married June 14th, 2014 and I couldn't have been more pleased and happy with Crizen and her amazing team. I'm so grateful I was referred to her by a friend. Crizen is so amazing at what she does and I fell in love with her work from my hair/make up trial to engagement photo shoot to the wedding day. I had about 7 family members who were getting ready with me on the wedding day, plus my mom and my mommy in law and Crizen and her team of 4 got everyone's hair and make up done in time. She was so organized,professional, flexible, easy to talk to, understood exactly what I wanted and made the process so enjoyable. I really appreciate all she did and would definitely refer her to friends to family. I look forward to having hair and make up done by her for other special occasions. Thank you Crizen.

3.description: After standing up in several weddings where we had to drive to get our hair and make-up done I have to applaud Crizen again. It is so worth it to have Crizen come to you on your wedding day!! What a hassle it was driving to salons and back to change, than to the wedding venue! The brides were worried and frazzled and the weddings ended up being LATE! My wedding day on the other hand was so relaxed and laid back. Because we weren't driving around I had more time to enjoy all my family and friends being there together with me. So worth it. Thanks Crizen.

14.description: I can't express how amazing Crizen made me feel on my wedding day!  I didn't know I could look that good!  I have very thin hair, so she suggested extensions since I wanted to wear it down.  No one could tell at all!  Crizen is also a wonderful person and a joy to spend time with.  She also did hair/makeup for my sister's wedding and we were just blown away by her expertise.  She is a true wedding FIND!

1.description: Well this review is LONG overdue (Jennifer, I apologize) but there is not enough I can say about the experience with Jennifer. I found her two years ago and was reluctant to try her out, or any other personal shopper, because I was worried that she couldn't really find good outfits for a man in his mid 40's. Boy was I wrong! Not only did Jennifer put me in styles that really complimented my frame and skin tone, but she was able to transform my style from one that was non-existent to one where I am not ashamed to go out in public and show off all the clothes she picked. I receive so many compliments, I have lost count. Going out socially doesnt bring me apprehension because I know I have something that looks good and I look good in it. I wholeheartedly recommend anyone try out her service as you will not be disappointed. She is WELL worth the expense and you will be so happy in the end. I use her frequently and look forward to each session we have together. She is going to transform my entire wardrobe. Her knowledge is top notch. Never doubt her, trust her, and LISTEN to her. She is the best!

9.description: I was very unsure about what to expect from a personal shopper. I was worried that she would be only concerned with buying clothes that she liked and not what I was looking for, kind of like a sales associate on commission at a retail store. Jennifer not only proved me wrong but she worked in my budget, listened to all of my concerns, answered all my questions and really addressed my needs. She is very knowledgeable and she taught me about the brands and clothing that would fit me. She is very aware of what trends and clothes are appropriate for my age group. I showed up at the store and had a dressing room pre-filled with clothing that actually fit right. I now not only have a wardrobe that fits, but Jennifer really took the time to explain why she was picking out certain clothes for me so when I was on my own, I could pick out appropriate clothing. It was without a doubt the best shopping experience that I have had. I would recommend Jennifer to any gender and any age group.

23.description: I am never one to spend much time looking for clothes and dealing with the chaos at each store.  However I needed some new options that could fit for both work and weekends out.  Jennifer removed all the stress and complication by simply asking the right questions as to what I was looking for.  Then she found solutions based on our conversation and literally took care of everything.  Jen is wonderful to work with.  She has an eye for style, will give you honest opinions and isn't too pushy.  I am very happy with my new looks and would recommend this to anyone looking for a quick and easy wardrobe update.

12.description: I hired Jennifer to help my husband shop for a new wardrobe. She was fantastic!! Seriously folks, she was professional and was able to understand my husbands style and requirements in one meeting. All of the clothes she picked out were perfect and we were both so pleased with the results!! A new wardrobe from underwater to suits in 3 shopping trips !! And this included fittings. I cannot recommend Jennifer highly enough. My husband looks charming and handsome in his new clothes, and best of all the FIT!! No more saggy pants and baggy shirts! Thanks Jennifer!!

21.description: My friend Brian who stayed with us recently had to travel in to Chicago on very short notice.  He wasnt happy with the clothes he brought for the 5 days that he would be here.  He found Jennifer from a recommendation of a friend.  He took a cab straight to Michigan Ave from the airport to meet her at a department store.He was so thrilled with the clothes...the price... and the fact that he was able to make it to dinner (a wee late) that he plans on making it a habit EVERY time he comes to Chicago. .  He looked pretty damn good I have to admit.  He picked up a bunch of evening clothes and some day staples.Only one complaint...He bragged about how damn good he looked all weekend. ... it really got annoying...so we kicked his ass out of the house a day early.  ; )Regardless, he was so impressed (we all were) with how easy it was...and the outcome... I felt compelled to write a review.

16.description: Don't really want to share my secret but you have to give credit where credit is due.  I needed an upgrade and have been thinking about how to make this happen for quite a while when I received a business oriented "Groupon" like coupon.  I bought it, let it expire as usual but Jennifer allowed me to extend the deadline which surprised me but I'm glad she did.  I was buying the wrong sizes and though my tastes didn't get blown out of the water, she pushed me to expand my thinking, after all that what she does.  I will say that though we still have another round of shopping she's been worth every penny.  Dude, I shouldn't let you in on my secret but she's really good.  And she's a smart shopper.  I think I saved enough money buying clothes, especially considering how I shop to pay for her services.  Saved time and money.

17.description: My friend Brian who stayed with us recently had to travel in to Chicago on very short notice.  He wasnt happy with the clothes he brought for the 5 days that he would be here.  He found Jennifer from a recommendation of a friend.  He took a cab straight to Michigan Ave from the airport to meet her at a department store.He was so thrilled with the clothes...the price... and the fact that he was able to make it to dinner (a wee late) that he plans on making it a habit EVERY time he comes to Chicago. .  He looked pretty damn good I have to admit.  He picked up a bunch of evening clothes and some day staples.Only one complaint...He bragged about how damn good he looked all weekend. ... it really got annoying...so we kicked his ass out of the house a day early.  ; )Regardless, he was so impressed (we all were) with how easy it was...and the outcome... I felt compelled to write a review.

10.description: This review is way past due, but I see the results of this service everyday.  I met with Jennifer in June and immediately felt comfortable with my decision.  She put so much effort into trying to give me what I wanted, while making it seem effortless.First, Jennifer met me for a consultation and was prepared for anything I wanted to ask.  She is very knowledgable about what she can offer and what differs her from her competitors.  I threw out my desires and she threw some questions back at me.  Very professional, but very casual and confidence affirming as well.Next came the shopping day.  After a few emails and strategizing when to shop based on upcoming sales, we both met for a long, but not long enough day (can't believe I say this now about shopping lol).  She knew my budget, she knew my time, she knew me.  She had already gotten to work, she was knowledgable about the store(s) and had me try on everything before buying it.  TIP: listen to her, she has a great sense about shopping and what you may like.  You can pick up a few shopping tips for next time too.)IN THE END, I am still happy with my purchase and the service I received.  Thank you Jennifer.P.S.  Soon after the shopping experience, a lot of personal tragedies occurred and that is why this review is so late.  But I want to give a endearing thank you to Jennifer because she helped me not have an additional problem(s) with my wardrobe.  Be confident in what you have to wear can be a real comfort when the unknown comes knocking at your door.

5.description: I'm going to start by saying that going shopping with Jennifer was the only time I actually enjoyed shopping. She makes it fun and has such a great sense of style.When I arrived at the store, Jennifer had lots of outfits already picked for me. After about two hours we narrowed them down to what looked and fitted the best. I have to say that I get lots of compliments about the way I dress. She even suggested a hairstyle that looks great. By the way, really listen to her, she knows what she's talking about. She will teach you how to shop for the right clothes.

11.description: To preface this review, this was my 1st time working with a personal shopper and I am not a very fashion-savvy gentleman.  Thus my seeking out Jennifer's services in the first place.After a call to setup our appointment Jennifer met me at a coffee shop nearby to do an initial consultation to discuss my goals, her methods and take measurements etc. We agreed upon a date to meet at local shops to hammer out a new wardrobe collection that I needed.   When I arrived at the store to meet Jennifer she had many items already picked out between the two stores that she had picked out to  visit and she made certain that any item that was missed at one location was covered at the next. During my experience with Jennifer It was clear that work method was very savvy, quick thinking and on point.  It was obvious to me that she had listened to my taste preferences and knew how to blend those with her own taste and knowledge to find what I was looking for.  I found Jennifer's service to be in a word, awesome.  We had a lot of ground to cover and she was very expedient and attentive throughout.  In the end I spent a bit more then I had budgeted for but I also I got more then I expected (turns out I had a bit of hard time choosing between blazers and just bought several of them)  :)   Overall I would highly recommend Jennifer's services for any guy who is looking for a personal shopper to get quality service from and someone who is professional, a good listener with great taste and vision.

22.description: I recently hired Jen and she knocked it out of the park! I had her complete a "closet clean out" yesterday and the before-after images are amazing! I highly recommend Jen and her services! Excellent for the business class guy that doesn't have a lot of time to organize this area.

0.description: Jennifer was great - professional, knowledgeable, and energetic!  She had a good sense of my style and fashion needs, gave me a lot of choices, and was teaching me about styling in the process.We met beforehand to go over what I was looking for and what I needed in my wardrobe and to take some measurements.  A few weeks later, we met at the store and she had a dressing room full of clothes to try on.  Even though my sizes were not standard (falling in between two sizes), she tirelessly went back and forth to find the right fit or to work with the tailor to alter it just right.  I went a little bit over what I had planned to spend but I feel like I came away with a great value and a wardrobe that makes me feel excited to get dressed in the morning!  After we were done, Jennifer sent me an email summarizing what I had gotten with measurements so I am better equipped to shop in the future.

20.description: I've made a number of changes in my life recently and my wardrobe was overdue for an update. In fact, waaaay overdue. Jennifer started with a wardrobe review and identified a collection of things ranging from "Could be better" to "Not right for you" all the way up to "No!" And when I asked her to explain why, she did, in a way that made sense to me.So we moved on to personal shopping. It was fast, convenient and actually fun. Most importantly, I knew the purpose and why I was purchasing items, consistent with what we had agreed to accomplish as part of the update.I was so pleased with the "Phase 1" efforts that I elected to purchase some custom suits and shirts for those times when I absolutely need to be at my best. And that was so enjoyable that I decided to get my son a custom suit as a Christmas gift.I've still got a little work to put things together correctly, but I couldn't be happier. Thank you, Jennifer.Kurt B

19.description: Jennifer did an outstanding job of reviewing my wardrobe for Fall. Next we went through a list of items for me to pick up to complement what I already had, donated some things I've never worn, and then we went about getting my needed pieces. It was a total blast and now I know when I walk into a spot, I'm looking good!

2.description: I desperately needed to upgrade my wardrobe and dress more like an adult, so I sought Jennifer's help after seeing all the positive yelp reviews on here.While you might end up spending a nice chunk of money between the clothing and her services, I couldn't have asked for more from her. You get what you pay for.All e-mail communications were addressed quickly and professionally and our initial consultation was as convenient as can be. Jennifer met me in my office building and we went through a full questionnaire she had prepared. After getting my feedback and expectations, we set up a date for the shopping.Upon arriving at the stores, Jennifer had already put in a ton of effort arranging everything before you even get there and this made the process pretty painless. It was a whirlwind of trying on various outfits, noting the fits of the different brands, and coming to agreement on what looks best and what doesn't.In the end, I was able to totally revamp my wardrobe and was very happy with my purchases. From begging to end, Jennifer was a true professional and I could not have asked for more. Considering how long the wardrobe revamp will last me (not to mention the value in learning which brands and sizes fit me best), I found the experience worth the splurge.

18.description: I was in a wardrobe rut and needed a independent third party expert to help me out. During consultation Jennifer asked all the right questions and got a pretty good read of me. She suggested a stress free shopping trip and indeed it was. I abhor clothes shopping so all I had to do was show up and try a bunch stuff on, easy! She even found some great deals so it didn't get too spendy. Now I have a whole new set of wardrobe building blocks to mx and match for the summer. Done, whee!

13.description: If you desire to dress in a way that best compliments who you are, you're in the right place.  Jennifer will assist you in figuring out what exactly you're looking for in clothing, from casual to formal. In the consultation meeting, I threw a ton of ideas at her ranging from all different types of clothing but she helped me prioritize my fashion needs and really nailed down the most important.I chose to have her shop for a suit for me.  When I arrived, she had several picked out in the dressing room and had shirts, ties, shoes - you name it, all ready to try on.  Needless to say it was a great experience and I found a great fitting stylish suit.  If wardrobe is on your mind, you owe it to yourself to get it off your mind and in your closet.  I will definitely be working with Jennifer in the future.  -Steve

4.description: A pleasure to work with.  Made shopping fun.  Got a fresh new look.   Was great.  Highly recommend.  And snagged some complements on my new look at recent meetings.

6.description: important facts about me:  I'm a slob, I like way oversized clothes, and I hate shopping.  I'm definitely missing that gene.  I may as well be color blind in terms of putting stuff together.  I had a great experience with Jennifer.  I received a consultation as a gift and Jennifer listened to my likes/dislikes and then explained why she would choose certain clothing over others.  All of it made sense.  The shopping day itself was about as painless as it could be (I hate shopping so having everything picked out ahead of time was pure fried gold).  I also learned a ton about clothing from Jennifer - like the difference between a dress shirt and casual button down shirts (seriously, I'm that style-stupid.  Jennifer had her work cut out for her.)  She also taught me what was appropriate to wear for particular occasions.  Christmas Eve - I looked great.  Sport coat (now i know the difference between a sport coat and a suit coat), great shirt, and spankin pants.  Lots of complements.Plus I'm much more confident about wearing clothing that I would have never even considered before because I didn't know how to size it correctly, or when to wear it, or what to wear it with.  This was a big investment but it was worth every penny.Thank you Jennifer!

15.description: Jennifer is excellent, professional, smart, and has impeccable taste. I personally hate shopping for clothes which is why I sought her out, but was still weary of this process. She made it painless and, frankly, a joy. I worked with her to update my winter looks after starting a new job, and I will be using her again this summer.

7.description: Gentlemen,If you feel that no clothes fit your body, if you are sick of trying on shirt after shirt, if you are sick of settling on clothes only to get rid of then after 2 wears--there is hope.  You need to stop what you are doing and call Jennifer now.  Jennifer knows what she is doing.  I was skeptical when my wife told me that she got me a personal shopper.  I thought I would be blowing a lot of coin, only to get things that didn't fit right.  I was convinced that I needed custom clothing.  Jennifer not only worked in my budget, but taught me about the brands and clothing that would fit me.  I showed up at the store and had a dressing room pre filled with clothing that actually fit right.  It was single handedly the best shopping experience that I have had.  Ladies, I strongly suggest you call Jennifer for you significant other today.

8.description: I've worked for Nordstrom for two years and have had the pleasure meeting and working for Jennifer.   She has a great eye for fashion with knowing all current trends.  Every single guy she shops with she nails it.  She brings shopping to a whole new level. **She keeps it fun**.  Jennifer's got a great personality and very kind.  If your un sure about style or fashion Jennifer is your go to.  I highly recommend her!!!!!

3.description: Awesome. Simply awesome.Growing up, I had never been too worried about what I wore. To me, clothes were just clothes and I didn't give styling much thought. So when I moved to the Chicago area a few months ago and a few of my friends recommended some style updates, you could say I was a bit surprised. The more I thought about it, the more I decided a wardrobe update was clearly needed, and after some searching around I found Jennifer. I'm so glad I did! Jennifer had ideas and styles for me to try on and her pre-shopping made my experience a painless one. Because of her, I was able to find styles that were tailored just to me. Shirts and pants that were in my price range, contoured to my body, and felt GREAT. Not only did Jennifer give her honest opinion on clothes, but she happily gave me suggestions for which clothes went well together and which to stay away from (and I needed some definite direction here). Overall, I feel so much more comfortable and confident in my new clothes, and I have no doubt Jennifer was the right woman for the job.If nothing else, it's worth noting that I rarely use Yelp and this is my very first review. Jennifer deserved every bit of it.

14.description: Jen,Great experience!  You surprised me with the volume of apparel you pre-selected, your tenacity for value and your native intelligence of  "all things retail." I felt as if I had an "insider" working on my behalf who knew me.  The comments and inquiries from other shoppers clearly validated the premium experience I received as a result of your experience and work on my behalf. Plus our banter regarding what "made the cut" and what "got tossed" was not intimating. My opinion mattered yet you pushed me and I'm excited about wearing stuff I would have never  "seen myself in." Count me in from skeptic to advocate... for your service but more importantly, your personal interest in my expression of style/fashion and all the Stonies you worked with here at One Smooth Stone. You brought a renewed passion for style, fashion and fun to our culture that has been refreshing. Thanks again.Kevin

58.description: Great service. Delicious wine. We didn't eat- but the food smelled wonderful (for their BBQ Wed). Check them out!!!

56.description: I can't recommend the place. The first thing we noticed after going inside it really smelled bad, like old fat or something. The Atmosphere not really what I expect of a Wine Bar!

29.description: good for a date night.

42.description: I love wine and cheese type places, and so I've been wanting to try this place out for at least a year but never seemed to make it over.  Finally last night I made it in.  It was a great night for some wine, and the space is warm and inviting, with a nice patio in the back.The service was a little spotty.  The table next to me was seated after me, but got all their dishes before I'd gotten one of mine.  I also ordered what they call "Red Wine Experience of the Week," which is basically a random glass of red wine.  Right in the text it says it'll be delicious, they "promise."  Well, they didn't bother to ask if I liked it, and I didn't like it.  I tried to like it.  I drank it by itself, I drank it with food, it was incredibly sweet - something the server didn't mention when I ordered it, but should have.  The server should also have made sure I liked it.  Finally, I told the server I didn't like it and requested something else. She brought something else, but still charged me for the Red Wine Experience.  Not much of a "promise" if you still charge me even if I don't like it.  When it came to the food, I tried three of their cheeses.  Three cheeses is $24.  At Naha, you can get a cheese plate with 6-8 cheeses for $28, with better accompaniments, and they're in the heart of River North not on an abandoned stretch of Milwaukee, so I'm not sure where the price point comes from.  Of the three cheeses, two were ok, one was quite good.I also ordered an endive/tuna salad.  The menu said the tuna was made from belly, which is usually best just plain so the higher fat content can really shine.  But they'd made it into a tuna salad mash, where the benefit of it being belly is completely lost.  It tasted fine, but I think turning belly into tuna salad is silly and a waste of money on their part.After I'd eaten, it started to rain.  I took the better wine with me, and left the "Experience" wine on the table - that's how much I disliked it.  They didn't bring it in or ask me about it.Inside, it was lively and I talked to some local patrons.  They were friendly and nice and made it a pleasant evening.  Overall, I'd say I was disappointed mainly due to price.  The service wasn't horrible, the food was acceptable and most of the wine was good.  But they were all more at a neighborhood level, yet they were charging downtown prices.  I can't justify spending over $100 for dinner for what was really at best an average experience, and it really did bother me a lot to be charged for a wine I obviously didn't like - no other restaurant I've been to would do that, so I'm not sure why 694 thinks that's acceptable practice - it's a deadly fault for a wine bar.

23.description: I came here with my boyfriend on a rainy Thursday evening when I realized my $100 groupon was about to expire. I'm very happy I didn't let this one go to waste because it was wonderful!I showed up just as it opened and was seated immediately. The boy was running late, so I ordered a glass of wine (vinho verde, my favorite!) and looked over the menu while I waited for him. Honestly, I could have ordered everything. The whole menu sounded delicious. While it is a small menu, it's more than made up for by the quality of menu items. I decided to put in for an order of Devil's Bread so it would be coming out right around when the boy showed up.He ordered the Prairie Path when he arrived, despite not being gluten free, and said it was great. The Devil's Bread came out and was akin to a very fancy french bread pizza, with spicy salami. Delicious! It sounds simple, but sometimes simple can be simply great! We decided to order the hot sopressata (sp?) and the mole charcuterie, along with the delice de bourgogne and cheddar cheese. The plate came with nuts, honey, and dried fruit, and a generous amount of bread. All SO tasty! The mole was incredibly unexpected, as it was very sweet, but went very well with the creamy cheese. I ordered another glass, this time the rose cava. While it was tasty, it was a bit too sweet for my liking. He ordered a glass of the Red Wrangled (I think that's what it was called), a mix of a few different reds. I wish I had ordered that too! So good! For dessert, we split the brownie flight, which I can only describe as orgasmic. Good lord. So good. We didn't quite hit the $100 with all that, so we split a glass of the Red Wine Experience of the Week, which, once again, was delicious. The ONLY downside to this place is the rather sketchy block it's located on, and the prices. Without a groupon, I would have a hard time justifying spending this amount of money on a wine and cheese night out.

47.description: What a great find! My friends had an engagement party in the upstairs space and on the upstairs deck. It is a great place for a party. The staff was great and they have a great drink selection. The upstairs deck is lovely.

8.description: Visited on my touristy trip to Chicago and loved it. I passed by the area on accident and that's how I found this gem but it's one place I crave since then...The atmosphere, the wine and the grilled cheese sandwiches... Yes please! However, everything in the menu looked amazing due to its selection and menu layout itself...The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and playful. I loved this place and I'd recommend it in a heartbeat.

31.description: We love this place, it is one of our weekly stops.  The wine selection is great, the staff is awesome and the cheese and meat selection is yummy.  Wednesday night they have grilled specials that are always wonderful but get there early.

34.description: Love this place. It's super close to our house, has a great selection of wine, and seller patios - there are 3 so no shortage of outdoor space.  The food selections are limited so don't plan on grabbing a full dinner here.  Grab some friend and catch up over wine!

16.description: I've been here a couple of times before and actually recommended the place to friends. However, tonight I took a girlfriend there for her birthday celebration and we ended up with a cheap wine, stale bread and old cheese (not in the correct way). My friend threw up at the end of the night. And you would think a restaurant/bar would be more accommodating instead we received the most horrible service and were asked to leave right away (after we paid the bill)..by some random guy. He ket saying "how could you throw up". The last I checked throwing up is involuntary .

13.description: Surprisingly, the salads are always my favorite and the beer/wine/liquor selection is great. Everyone's very friendly and it's a really chill place to hang out.

11.description: Came here last night for some cheese, meats, and wine. They recently had a groupon, and it was totally worth checking this place out. I live 5 blocks away and had no idea this place was here. The customer service was great, the wine was delish. This is a good place to catch up with a friend and share small plates. The selection and pairing of the meats and wines were perfect.

39.description: I have been to 694 Wine & Spirits which is in the same location as the original 'Iggy's' restaurant that was so popular 10 years ago.  I love the decor of the restaurant and thoroughly enjoyed dining there on a Wednesday which is the night that the owner grills several specialty items for guests.  The Jerk Chicken, Sizzling Jalapeño Brown Sugar Burger and grilled swordfish were all awesome as well as our wine selections!  The music and ambiance were terrific and I highly recommend this place.

37.description: I threw my husband a surprise party here, and it was perfect. I rented out the entire upstairs which includes their beautiful outdoor patio, for a very reasonable price I might add. I paid for the space rental, small bites, and a nominal fee to bring in a cake from an outside bakery. Guests bought their own drinks from the bar. We had about 35 friends and family, and it was a phenomenal evening. Our bartender was friendly and accommodative. The wine, beer, and cocktail choices are incredibly pleasing to experienced winos and easy-going, nonchalant drinkers. The party food included lots of cheese and charcuterie and this delicious, warm cheesy bread that everyone devoured. I think it was supposed to be from 7-10pm, but we were not at all rushed out. It was just so simple. Jenn was the events coordinator and answered all of my questions via email. The space is gorgeous, so other than some balloons, we didn't need decorations. The candles twinkled in the dim, artsy surroundings. It's not too large where an intimate party will feel overwhelmed in a giant space, but we easily could have had another twenty people move around comfortably.  Lastly, it was really quite the perfect spot for a surprise party because the second floor space is well-suited to gather everyone opposite the stairs and scare the bejesus out of the honored guest. When my husband realized so many of his friends and family had come out to celebrate his birthday on a Friday night, it was just so damn adorable. And 694 really helped to make that happen so easily!

0.description: Seriously one of my favorite places ever. We moved here a few months ago and assumed this adorable wine bar would be a special date night place that we would go to occasionally. Who knew we would be going at least once a week if not more. Bacon night on Tuesdays has become a tradition! The owner and staff make you immediately feel like they've known you forever. They always make the best recommendations of wine, cheese, etc. I couldn't say better things about this bar. I recommend it for a fancy date night or an easy relaxing night with your friends. Also, they have a great upstairs that can accommodate parties - perfect for engagements, birthdays, graduations, etc. You're missing out if you haven't been here!

38.description: My favorite wine bar in the city. It's a hidden gem. Their flights are unique and reasonably priced. On top of that, their cheese is amazing. I love their almonds and could eat and drink here every day. Unfortunately, I would then be dead.They have very cool modern pop art as well. Music is good and the place is perfect for a group outing.

51.description: You should go here.  Honestly.  Great food, excellent cocktails - really great whiskey selection, fantastic wine selection.  Cheese plates are outstanding. BLT is amazeballs.  Service is always very good, nice outdoor area when weather is pleasant.

27.description: I had luck on my side tonight :)Called 694 at 5 p.m., hoping to get a table for seven ladies at 7 p.m. Fortunately they had a spot. Once we got there, we had a fantastic time. Jen, our server (pretty much everyone's server on the street-level floor!) took great care of us and gave great recommendations based on the bottle(s) of wine we got.Full marks for everything we got, from the almonds to the olives to various meats and toasts (devil and angel; how appropriate).Didn't wander upstairs. First time meeting some of this group, so we wanted to talk. To that end, downstairs was perfect for us.Sad to admit that, although I live about a 10-minute walk from 694, Saturday was my first time going there. Good news: it won't be my last!

32.description: This is  a cute spot in an odd stretch along Milwaukee.  There is basically nothing around....  We got there around 6:30, and there were only three other patrons.  Odd...  The wine, cheese, butter flight (yummmmm), and service were all great!  The cheeses I selected were enjoyable (one soft and one "stinky"). The butter flight  was delicious, with three types of butter and sea salts.  Can't go wrong with bread and butter!  I loved the pop art on the walls!  We drove by later in the night on our way home, and it looked to be packed inside.

54.description: This place is great!  I went there last night with a group of 7 girlfriends for a birthday.  We did the wine tasting and had the whole upstairs to ourselves.  Jenny was are wine sommelier and she did a great job.  We were able to taste 5 whites, 5 reds, a sparkling wine & a dessert wine and then after it was a free for all and we could drink any of the wines we tasted. The food was delicious. I would highly recommend this place for a special event or just a good night with friends. We all had a great experience and will definetly go back.

48.description: I do enjoy Groupon deals and this one was useful to discover the place. There was a private party that night so all the top lounge and rooftop were privatized. But I'm sure it's a great place to go. Food and wine were great. Nice choice of wines. You will have a good quantity and quality concerning the food.This will be a great spot for outdoor summer seating.The only thing is the location

44.description: Met a friend here on a sweltering hot July summer evening and opted to sit on the back patio (I savor hot nights).  The patio was super cute and secluded from the traffic on Milwaukee.  Our wine, cheese plate, and killer BLT were all delicious.  Service was incredibly friendly.  Parking was easy.  I'll be back!!

24.description: My favorite wine bar. But my absolute favorite place to get jerk chicken on a Wednesday night! 694 has a great atmosphere and a super friendly staff. They know just the right wine to recommend every time depending on my palette mood. Ps. Their angel bread is pretty amazing too!

7.description: Love this place! Such a hidden gem. You've gotta check out DJ Rod on Thursdays and Fridays for some good soulful house and disco music!!

49.description: great local spot a bit off the beaten path.  great vibe and cool artwork make this wine bar a great spot for dates.  bartender was awesome with his recommendations and food pairings.  while they don't have a full kitchen, the apps are delish.  we got a tour of the upstairs, which has an outdoor patio... will definitely going back this summer!

40.description: I thought about not writing a review - as they say,"if you have nothing kind to say then say nothing at all."  Allow me to break that rule. There's nothing warm and friendly about this place. I came here to meet a few friends for drinks and this silver haired guy with glasses had this, " Why are you here" look on his face. Was he rude? Yup. While I was outside the service was slow so I had to go inside to get an overpriced beer.I like the décor of the place however the only thing missing is a "No Colored Allowed" sign. To the owner: Every guest that comes through your door, is the most important guest you'll ever have.

53.description: Eaten by myself: about 24 whole olives from the olive plate, the bread and butter, several ounces of cheese, half of the enormous thick-cut BLT, and an entire large format farmhouse/saison ale.Yea, I'd say it was a pretty good night. The best part: somehow I didn't need my water re-filled.

30.description: I went there with a groupon. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Food was great. Art Deco good diverse music. Swanky, dim lighting, drinks were great but this is strictly a wine bar I tried a dirty martini and I sent it back for my champagne.

46.description: Great wine bar! The downstairs is great if you want to sit at the bar or out on the patio on a nice day. We've had and been to private parties upstairs and it has a more club feel (not in a bad way, DJ playing, darker). The servers have always been very knowledgeable and have given great recommendations.  We've been introduced to a couple of our faves here! The food is very good too - great meats and cheeses to snack on. And I love their art!!177/365

1.description: The space is small and cute with a cozy feel to it, but for a wine bar, it has a VERY limited wine list. In fact, I would give them 3 stars if they didn't call themselves a wine bar. Its just an insult to the concept. In my mind a wine bar is an establishment where you can taste rare, unusual wines from different places of the world and learn more about it. This place has 6 red and 6 white by-the glass options some of which are similar to one another blends. The have only 2 options on the sparkling!!! 694wineandspirits.com/re…There are no flights at all! On Thursday night they were missing a wine selection from their list which already offers slim pickings... They do not make up for it in food. Again very few options to snack on (one of the cured meets missing) and the breadbasket contained a 5-day old baguette. Our waitress agreed to have it toasted, but without much enthusiasm. If you are going to make cheese and cured meat board, your main focus - you had better make sure your bread you serve with that is fresh and memorable. Other than decor, this place is sad

55.description: I purchased a groupon for this joint.. It is a very cool place to hang out, the ambiance is great and so was the music.. and the food was greatNow that is out of the way.... here we go... We walk in and my buddies girlfriend describes what kind of wine she likes and he tells her "you're describing wine that is out of your price range".... She did not tell us what he said til we left, which was lucky for him... And she has enough money to buy this joint btw.... but either way what a completely disrespectful thing to say to a customer, especially considering we were the only ones buying bottles in the joint lol... Our server also was very, very rude the whole night to us. If it wasn't for my buddies girlfriend being so nice I would have left her absolutely no tip!! And our server had no idea about how to serve wine... after the first bottle we asked the busser for new wine glasses, she stormed over, got mad at him and poured a different wine in the same glass we were drinking our original wine in!!! I told her not to and she informed me "Don't you know it doesn't matter because it's from the same varietal", LOLOLOLOL I think she needs a lesson on how wine works... I was stunned, and just the disregard for my request was just rude and disrespectful!!! And their wine list is sub-par at best

9.description: We live about a block away so 694 is one of our favorite spots for a glass of wine and cheese plate.I will preface by saying that 90% of the time we stop by after work on a weekday so I cannot attest to a weekend evening atmosphere. I've noticed other reviewers comment on the music volume. I have noticed this as a bit of an issue, but on the occasion that the music is a decent volume, it can be a relaxed vibe. I'm not offended enough to not return.Service has always been great because we are either the only ones there or one of two or three parties in the entire restaurant. LOVE LOVE LOVE the assorted butter plate (can you just pass me the tub??) and pretty much every meat and cheese plate they offer. The honey, nuts, figs and other garnishes are unexpected tasty treats on the side. I'm no wine expert, so their wine selection suits me just fine and I have enjoyed everything I've ordered.4 instead of 5 stars because it is a bit pricey and the music volume issue.Plan to return.

26.description: Don't let the outside appearance fool you, you must go inside.  It's located on a pretty dead block of Milwaukee.  The place is really small, but really funky inside and the music selection is really nice.  Good eclectic mix of alternative, pop. electronic and some other stuff I have no idea about.  The artwork is not my cup up tea, but overall it has a really nice vibe.  There is an upstairs room that fits about 70 people that would be cool to rent out for a private party.  Will definitely keep it in mind should the need arise.Food was AWESOME. The spinach salad and devil's bread were amazing.  Couldn't have improved on either of them.  We found out on Wednesdays they BBQ outside.  By the time we got there (9 pm) they were sold out of burgers and chicken, put the pork chop was just perfect.Wine selection was really diverse as well.  I was hoping they had flights, but only glasses and bottles.  Service was great as well.  The owner was very friendly.  It's definitely the place to become a regular and I would def recommend it as a place you would bring a date to whom you really wanted to impress.

25.description: My favorite place in the city of Cheese and Meat plates, always a great selection of both with exotic meats too. The service is always great downstairs, the wine selection is awesome. They dont have much of a liqueur selection and dont ask for a cocktail.I have been coming here for over 3 years and I highly recommend it, always cool local artwork on the walls and pretty close to the blue line.

12.description: Great ambiance especially on their outdoor patio.  The owner was very helpful and gave us suggestions and even changed wine she suggested but noticed we weren't THRILLED by (regardless of our willingness to enjoy it). Fabulous local spot with some really fun cheeses and meats to pair with what we thought was all distinctively delicious wine!  A great little secret must visit spot in Chicago.

59.description: A good wine list with good food to accompany your wine.   Service was very friendly.

21.description: After being somewhat disappointed with my previous experience here, I decided to go back to 694 last Friday.  I sat at the bar and ordered the delice cheese with a glass of the rose cava.  Now I remember the first time I came here and ordered cheese and they didn't give me enough to even spread on one slice of bread.  This time however, I received what I considered a normal portion size and it was exquisite! They paired the cheese with some honey, dates, dried apricots and cranberries that all came together and were delicious.  The bartender was very nice as well and overall, I had a really nice experience.  I will be back!

17.description: I really enjoyed 694 Wine and Spirits. It is like a cool little hole in the wall that you would probably never wander into if you are not nosey. So I am happy that I am nosey because this place is awesome. While the menu is small, I can actually say I walked away feeling full. I came here with my boyfriend one evening before the rush and I am sure glad we decided to try it out. I have no idea what he was drinking but I know I had a glass of the Hooked Riesling... Um what can I say it was super delicious. Honestly I had a couple of glasses of it.Then we ordered the devils bread which was really good. It had a spicy marinara sauce with smoked paprika salumi and truffle oil on a texas toast type of bread. It was good, But what amazed me was the salt and butter flight. Who ever knew bread and butter could taste soooooo good. Then our waiter suggested that we try the Finocchiona which is just meat that was cured with black pepper corn and fennel and that was delicious. I think we also had the coppa but I don't remember. What I do know I do is that my boyfriend had Valdeon Blue cheese and omg. I took a whiff of that sucker and I swear I almost puked. It was a strong pungent cheese and somehow my boyfriend got me to try some of it. I can honestly say it was rich and creamy, it was good but I good not get over that smell. Its imbedded into my brain. However what made my night was the special of the day which was a grilled cheese sandwich with jelly and bacon. I know it sounds weird but it was actually good. So glad I got to experience this place, I think we will be back soon.

10.description: Amazing find in River West! We just moved to the neighborhood and have been meaning to try this wine bar. We came in on a rainy Friday right as they opened at 5p. Wine was amazing - everything we tried was good. Ordered 3 cheeses and a meat board and the portions were much larger than charcuterie you get at other places. Garnishes included honey, nuts and a few other things. Lovely presentation and sooo yummy. Staff was nice and friendly. This is now our new go-to spot!

5.description: After two years of living next door I just found out that they do a secret menu every Wednesday night that's incredible! The owner brings a bunch of meat to throw on his grill and serves up some hearty eats other than the cheese boards they normally do. What he grills up varies, but he does it every Wednesday year round and this stuff is so damn good it's truly surprising that hasn't decided to do it full time.

3.description: Service was great, wine was great& the cheese was great! Jennifer, our server was very knowledgeable on the wine & food. A cute little place that plays awesome music- Tears For Fears, Duran Duran, Madonna, etc.

35.description: Meh.  Have some real food!  No idea who wrote all the good reviews....what am I missing at this overpriced so called wine bar  that only has a handful of wine choices?  How do they pay rent?  Oh I know, it's the 40 Malbec that you can get at the grocery store for $8.  And don't let me forget about the "pork" dish.  Another $9 for 8 slices, think standard pepperoni slices here mind you, for $9...and calling it pork?  It was a type of salami similar to what you get in one of those cheese/salami plates from Jewel when you're running late for a party.  Brutal.After your loving response to this post; I had to make a few things even clearer-  check out the "not recommended reviews section". Here you will see more truth about this dump.  Many and I mean MANY other local choices that actually have food beyond a grilled cheese.  17 whole bottles of red wine?  And you're boasting about this?  I have more kinds in my house....and also a more palatable food selection too!

19.description: 694 officially gets bumped up to 5 stars by me. I went for dinner on my birthday and had an amazing experience. It was not as packed as my last visit and when not packed to the brims, I love the atmosphere here. The servers are very knowledgeable about their food & drinks which makes for a pleasurable dining experience. I love the setup of 694 and the booth-tables. I'm a fan!Once again, I had a glass of bubbly The Saint - best champagne ever, I swear! We had an amazing cheese and meat plate and I'm happy to say they had all cheese and meat selections in stock unlike the last time I went. It's succcccchhhhh a good plate and selection of cheeses they have. I got their grilled cheese once again because I know it's the best grilled cheese in the city. It didn't fail me one bit. And we made sure to go on a Tuesday for Tuesday BLTs! They have the best BLT I've ever had in my life. We ended our meal with the brownie flight for $10 which had three different kinds of brownies. The types are always changing but on the night we went, I liked the toffee brownie best. Yum! They were a bit more dry than I usually like but the flavor was very good.694 has THE best cheese plates, THE best BLTs, THE best grilled cheeses and THE best champages. Plus the prices aren't bad to boot. I wish lived more closely to 694 because it is beyond amazing.
