Next time I need to remember to get a grilled cheese to go for the next day because I'm madly in love with it.694, I heart you like crazy.

28.description: Came here on a chilly, snowy night in January. Cute little spot tucked in River West. I expected more of a wine by the glass selection, but I think the unreasonably loud music and loud crowd made it an unpleasant experience for my friend and I. We ended up leaving after just one glass of red.I'll venture back here in the warmer months for the cute patio I've heard so much about.

45.description: Yum. Everything is being done right here, or at least that was my experience. There is a cute upstairs deck and upstairs lounge, front seating, inside seating, but the star is the back patio, airy and spacious, private and warm, breezy and shaded. It is inviting and pleasant. Waitstaff is extremely friendly, explains the wines well, and is attentive to the glasses as they get low.For me there were a few highlights here that I don't see often or ever at other places.1) There is a BUTTER & SALT appetizer: Served with sliced Red Hen baguetteThree amazing butters from three amazing regions, paired with three equally amazing sea salts. 8One was hints of parmesan, one was cow with a black salt, one was goat with a red salt. The salt really brings out the taste in the butters and you've never been so excited for a butter appetizer.2) On Wednesday nights only the owner grills on the charcoal grill, this time making amazing chicken and pork chops. The pork came with a hint of mango, steamed asparagus, chives, and was terrific. The sign of good pork grilling: ability to get some edge on the outside while not drying out the inside but still bringing it up to medium or medium-well.3) Wine appears to rotate regularly and is carefully selected. The unisex bathroom was clean and classy, with no wait. This place is tucked down the street from the famed Matchbox bar for a nightcap. What a little gem!

33.description: Funky interior,  but fun.  Very, VERY pleasantly impressed.  Wine and small plates place, the bread and butter is phenomenal.  Had a Groupon, otherwise never would have tried this place, but the experience will definitely bring the wife and I back on another date night, probably with friends.

43.description: This is a very nice wine bar- a little more on the divey side. They have a great wine selection, some good appetizers, and the staff is great. The outdoor seating area is great for a sunny day (or in Chicago, non-rainy and only partially cloudy).

2.description: Stopped by here for a friends birthday. What a great wine bar!The place is really cute. The decorations are different are a great conversation starter.  The service was great. We were able to enjoy different wines. They also have a upstairs area but were weren't able to go up due to a private party. We plan to go back again for some great wines. I may have to go on Wednesday for the secret menu.

18.description: Well, hellllo Juicy...Oops...I mean, 694.  It's been awhile, you see.  I'm still used to referring to the place as Juicy as I've had so many great memories here through the years.  (Just refer to my previous reviews if you don't believe me!)I was a little afraid to see that Juicy morphed into more of a "sports" bar.  Something to appeal more to men.   But, as soon as we set foot in here, I could tell that everything was still the same.  Classy, yet fun atmosphere, as always.  Glad to see that the moscato was still lovely and that the cheese plates were a plenty.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive and, even though we were at a wine bar, clued us into fantastic bourbon.  (Banker's Club, ftw!)    694 is still the perfect spot for one of those chill nights out.  Next on my list to try?  One of those amazing looking paninis.  Yum.

41.description: Have been here twice with friends and it is a great spot for appetizers and eclectic wine. Near my office for after work cocktails and easy to park!

52.description: Loved this place! Everything we ordered was divine, our waitress was so friendly and informative, and the ambiance was perfect - not too casual, but not too snooty. It is a bit pricey, but we came with a Groupon, so that helped. The cheese is phenomenal - I highly recommend the Delice de Bourgogne. You will never want to eat plain old Brie again. We ended up getting a 2nd order because it was so delicious. We also got the Manchego and Gouda, which were outstanding. We got an assortment of meats as well - Salumi, duck prosciutto, pork shoulder prosciutto - all melt in your mouth perfection. The devil's bread was tasty as all hell (hehe) too. I would go back in a heartbeat.

50.description: Buying a Groupon for a business I've never visited worked out this time around. (Trust me - I've had some unfortunate experiences with other Groupon gambles.) For $49, I got $100 worth of drinks and snacks that equated to about two rounds and two plates to satiate me and four others. Not bad, considering the hip setting and quality of products.Ambiance with attitude-On a Friday night, it was bustling but we were able to snag a cozy corner booth. The music was pumping but not too loud that I couldn't hear what the person next to me was saying. Local comic book-type art adorned the exposed brick walls. And despite the small space, the high ceilings made it feel bigger.Sipping and dipping-Glasses of wine ranged around $8-18. I am more into semi-dry reds, while one of my gal pals with me likes sweeter whites. The server was knowledgeable about suggesting what we would enjoy.However, when my husband inquired about the beer choices, the server incorrectly claimed to have a "triple IPA" available from a Grand Rapids, Mich. brewery that we actually visited recently. He ordered this drink and ended up with a tripel dubbel. At least, it was from one of our fav microbreweries - Brewery Vivant.Lastly, the cheese plates are addictive - We loved our super soft Triple Creme with the honey and dried fruit on top of thinly sliced French bread. Just wished it was on a bigger plate overall because it seemed a bit crammed.

4.description: The outdoor patio is so cute! We came here after work one night with a group of friends to enjoy a couple bottles of wine, cheese, and some food. I was intrigued by everything on the menu and loved how they have weekly specials. We tried the "stinker of the week",  manchego, and the creamy sexy blue cheeses along with a bottle Pinot Noir and Malbec. I also had the Angel's Bread while my friends had the Tuna, Devil's Bread, and bacon. The Angel's and Devil's Bread were good but my friend said the tuna was not, and you can't really go wrong with bacon. However, the portions are not terribly large so I wouldn't recommend this place for dinner, but, overall, we had a great time and loved the atmosphere!

6.description: Went here with some girlfriends to continue our happy hour(s), and five of us were able to sit down right away around 7:30pm on a Friday night. Staff gave great suggestions!

22.description: A completely off the beat path wine bar, which is good because that means it doesn't get crazy crowded.  They have the downstairs area which is cozy, upstairs which features a DJ many nights, and the lovely outdoor patio where they grill out.The servers know their stuff, and the owner is a wine genius.  Try the Bigaro, an Italian dessert wine.  Close to a Moscato, but tastier.98/365

15.description: So so good, a friend suggested that I visit to get the best grilled cheese sandwich in town, and boy....it was so good.  The detail to the top notch ingredients cannot be beat.  Truffle honey....yum.....great cheese....just go! And I had the best Moscato.  Great date location!

57.description: The atmosphere, food and drink are all great.  But the place smells terrible of fryer grease or whatever and our clothes and coats all had to go to the cleaners to get the smell out (it was still in our coats 4 days later.  I'm sure you know what I'm talking about....reminds me of a greasy taco joint)  I read this same complaint on one of the other reviews here.  So, if they could fix their ventilation system, we would be back for sure.  Or wait until the summer when the windows are open :-)

20.description: I really enjoyed 694 Wine and Spirits. It is like a cool little hole in the wall that you would probably never wander into if you are not nosey. So I am happy that I am nosey because this place is awesome. While the menu is small, I can actually say I walked away feeling full. I came here with my boyfriend one evening before the rush and I am sure glad we decided to try it out. I have no idea what he was drinking but I know I had a glass of the Hooked Riesling... Um what can I say it was super delicious. Honestly I had a couple of glasses of it.Then we ordered the devils bread which was really good. It had a spicy marinara sauce with smoked paprika salumi and truffle oil on a texas toast type of bread. It was good, But what amazed me was the salt and butter flight. Who ever knew bread and butter could taste soooooo good. Then our waiter suggested that we try the Finocchiona which is just meat that was cured with black pepper corn and fennel and that was delicious. I think we also had the coppa but I don't remember. What I do know I do is that my boyfriend had Valdeon Blue cheese and omg. I took a whiff of that sucker and I swear I almost puked. It was a strong pungent cheese and somehow my boyfriend got me to try some of it. I can honestly say it was rich and creamy, it was good but I good not get over that smell. Its imbedded into my brain. However what made my night was the special of the day which was a grilled cheese sandwich with jelly and bacon. I know it sounds weird but it was actually good. So glad I got to experience this place, I think we will be back soon.

36.description: Great wine bar. Small and quaint on the inside. Good selection of wine and all the menu items we tried were great.  Service was excellent.  Definitely going to make this my new neighborhood wine bar.

14.description: Came here with a friend who could not stop talking about this one wine. Anziano and  Gournier white are my favorites now.  The place is small and tables are actually right next to each other but it was cute. Angel's bread was amazing. We had some cheese and meat as well but I will stick to the bread and meat next time.Street parking wasn't hard at all and we went on a Saturday night around 7.

12.description: Went to four different Tmobile stores to find thw customer service I require.  Yesterday, I found Zeke. He was as patient as I needed. He answered ALL of my questions and did not rush me or seen annoyed at all. (I ask a lot of questions.) He gave me honest a answers to help me decide what phone would beat suit my wants and needs.  Even when there were other customers waiting, he still patiently took his time with me. He made me feel like an important individual and treated that way. He was happy to help. Thank you! I would highly recommend THIS tmobile store! Happy shopping!

3.description: The 3 Stooges work here... No joke...None of them know what they are doing nor are they capable of giving you the correct information.  However, this is a direct reflection on  T-Mobile.Took a damaged phone in.... Charge me $50 deposit for a late model loaner.....Tell me to call their insurance provider to replace phone at $150.... Insurance provider says I am able to upgrade for $175.... take it back to this location... the 3 Stooges look bewildered for like 10 minutes... tell me my account is not cleared or something ... it should be OK in the morning... WHAT? .... Call T-Mobile... representative in the Philippines I talked to says I am not eligible for an upgrade and to fix the phone it costs $175.  LIVID!I just want my cell phone back, I use it for work.... Never again T-Mobile... You're done!Inexperienced service!Lost time and a big hassle to do business here.Avoid this location especially.To followup... I go to return the loaner phone... and set up the new one... these a-holes just hand me the phone without setting it up.... I'm writing the CEO of T Mobile....!  ... Best way to get results!

1.description: Let the ridiculousness commence. I called to check a price on a specific phone (because T mobile engages in this not - so - fabulous practice of advertising one price on their website and then jacking up the price in their stores... AND they will NOT match the price in store. )I ask the store girl what the price of the phone is... she tells me "if you qualify, it would be no money down then just a small payment on your monthly phone bill." Whaaaaaaatttt? This is part of the problem with the financial situation in this country! You know this script works on plenty of sheeple. Bad form.I politely clarified my question- and asked again what the price was "in dollars." I was put on hold....and.... CHRISTMAS MUSIC! ITS FREEKING JULY 4TH weekend, why oh why would I want to hear Santa Claus is coming to town?She comes back with $849. Guh? Me: Your website says $649.Her: yeah that's for only QUALIFIED purchases.Me: is that the same price you charge in the store for "qualified" purchases?Her: no.Me: well, what IS the price? Her: $699Me: finally, that is what I wanted to know.WTH... ?

2.description: I bought a pre-paid plan for my dad a month ago for 2 months with 4g internet.. For 40 minutes we were waiting for a store manager to figure out how to activate 4g internet on my smartphone. Finally, he admitted that he cannot figure it out. I said that we don't need this plan without high-speed internet and asked to disconnect it and give us money back. He said that it is impossible and we need to deal with edge. Next day we've got a message that our service is good for only 1 month. I came to the store again and been told that since we paid for 2 months I don't need to worry about it.And here we go, 1 month later our service was disconnected and the store is closed "due to unpredicted event". Very low quality service.

9.description: Great Service! Highly recommend! Ask for Zeke!

10.description: This T-Mobile Store has excellent Customer Service.  I was assisted by Zeke. He was very patient and knowledgeable. He answered all of my questions and really took time to help me get exactly what I wanted and needed with my phone upgrade in a minimum amount of time.  While I was there, more customers were assisted by other employees, who also seemed very patient and friendly.  I highly recommend this T-Mobile store.

4.description: Add a half-star to this.  I am no longer anxious about going to a T-Mobile store!!!I always walk into phone stores a little guarded because I always feel robbed after leaving....This visit was different!  I walked in after a long day of work and buried in the stress of having the world's sh-ttiest phone.  I was immediately acknowledged.  The place was busy but it was nice that they know I'm there and was told that they would be able to assist me as soon as possible.  There were several people ahead of me but some minutes into waiting, Zeke came by, properly introduced himself and told me that he would be helping me.  That really set the tone for the rest of the time I was there- over an hour!I essentially updated my phone and service for a fraction of what I expected to pay, got an amazing deal, got hooked up with sweet accessories and yet that entire time did not feel like a chore at all.  It felt like I was shopping with a close friend. The stress of dealing with your phone service is gone when you go here.  I'm going to start going there just to pay my bill!

6.description: Since I have to give this place one star, I have to find some way to justify it. The star that they automatically get is for the cleanliness of the store. beyond that this  is the worst T-mobile retailer I have ever been to. I came in to upgrade my phone. I got a Nexxus 4 and my husband got an iPhone 5. They have a sign outside that says upgrade your smart phone for $99. So I thought nice, $200 for both right? Wrong! The guy then tells me it's really $150 per phone because you have to pay taxes on the entire original price of the phone ($700). Whatever, I pay the additional $100.  After a few days my husband decided that he liked my phone better and we decided to take it back and exchange it for something better. First of all, there is a $50 restocking fee that isn't credited to the price of the new phone. okay whatever we pay the fee and want to move forward with getting the new phone. They then say they refunded the excess I already paid onto my credit card and that it would be refunded in three days... Why couldn't they just apply the rest to the new phone? Well, I was planning on using that towards the phone so I decided to wait the three days when the funds come back. Well they never did. I went back to the store to tell them that they never sent the money and that they needed to credit the money back to me, the man tells me "we don't refund something we already refunded". Well that's great and all, but you didn't refund it. I then call T-mobile customer service to see if they can do something, but they inform me that only the store can refund the money. So they call the store and get the same response, except the T-mobile customer service rep said that wasn't acceptable if the money never posted to my bank account. We were then told that the "manager" would have to handle it, but he was out until Monday and that he would call me then. Monday comes still no money in my account and no phone call from the manager. Tuesday I go back to the store with my bank statement. The manager tells me that sometimes the credit card companies hold refunds for 30 days and to come back then. Thirty days later I come back still no refund. And he refuses to give it back. I have decided to depute the original charge with my bank. I seriously would stay clear of this place!

0.description: My phone decided that it no longer wanted to work right, so I visited this T-Mobile to see what I could do. That's where I met Marcus English. This man's customer service game is ON. POINT. I practically yelled "shut up and take my money!" to him. Marcus was very, very helpful, answered all my questions, explained everything I needed to know in plain English AND took a picture with me and my new phone. Thanks Marcus & everyone! This T-Mobile Rocks!

5.description: This store is awesome. Marcus E., Edgar S,. and Zeke N. were all so very helpful. They have great personalities, and don't just have the sales mindset in their approach. They explain everything so you understand it..because let's be honest, cell phone contracts, charges and all of that can get confusing. They all seem to love their jobs, and it shows in their attitude. My boyfriend and I went in to get info on the promo they're having to have you switch from any carrier to tmobile, and we left as tmobile customers. We will always go to them for any future help. I highly recommend these guys and this store. Guys, I can't thank you enough for all your help, and making it FUN to get a new cell phone. You've got customers for life!...well as long as we live here anyway...and if we move to another neighborhood, I'll probably still go out of my way to come to your store! Keep doing what you're doing!Oops. I just realized I gave my review on my boyfriends yelp...but I read it to him and he agreed. So it's from the both of us! (Don't worry guys, I'll do a separate review on my eom account. Hehe)

13.description: Awesome customer service, went in to switch to t mobile from a different service provider, and also get a new device. They were pretty busy and ended up staying late making sure To explain the different plans and options, and to get me set up with my new phone and service. Ask for Zeke!

11.description: I just went in to this store about half an hour ago because my My-Touch 4g phone locked up on me and I was not able to open it at all. This is the sixth one of this same phone I have had from T-Mobile (though not from this store. T-mobile has a policy of inconveniencing their customers, so I had to order them over the phone) each one of which has been "refurbished" which is tmobile speak for "broken." The young woman who helped me looked up my account and said I could get a free upgrade, which of course I could not just do in the store, but this is not her or the stores fault, it is the policy of t mobile- inconvenience, you know. So she set that up and I thought I would have to wait til tuesday to use my phone again, but after setting up the free upgrade, she messed with my phone and somehow got it working again. yay! I just want to say this is the ONLY positive experience I have had in a T-Mobile store in the past two years, or since the AT&T merger fell through and t-mobiles service has gone straight to hell. I have to give this store 4 stars just because it was fast, courteous, and effective help. The exact opposite of what I have come to expect from T-mobile. If you are stuck in a contract with these monsters or just really like terrible service, I would highly recommend this store. You will have enough headaches dealing with the service reps on the phone. At least this one store has their shit together so you can get a respite from the nightmare that is typical of t-mobile.

8.description: Set out to get my contacts and number transferred to my new T-Mobile phone. Pretty straightforward, right? They apparently couldn't do either of those things, and redirected me to another T-mobile. Wat???

14.description: I walked in just browsing around for service I was at the moment with AT&T and I was fed up with their service so I was just shopping around I walked into this T-mobile to ask some questions as soon as i walked in i got greeted by the rep that was busy with a customer , after waiting a few minutes he walks to me and asked me if i needed help with anything i told i was just browsing and i had a couple questions and sure enough i walked out with a galaxy s 4 and paying way less then i was with AT&T. I was really happy with the service and the customer service.

7.description: Customer service was great really recommended working with Edgar and zeke.....great experience

3.description: If you want awesome mid-century pieces from a super cool guy with a great eye, hit this place up.  Fair prices and superb quality.  Always new inventory and great assistance from Tim.  Stop in, you won't regret it!

1.description: Such a gem! The furniture here is carefully curated and always in amazing condition.

2.description: Purchased an old Ulferts leather chair for a very fair price. The chair is in overall excellent condition (especially given its age), and the owner was nice enough to deliver it, free of charge. The chair actually ended up smelling slightly of old, sweet cigar smoke, but it's actually sort of pleasant.

5.description: THIS SHOP IS THE BEST! Incredible selection of mid century and scandinavian furniture. Awesome style. Price points are on point and the owner is chill as hell.

0.description: Tim is really passionate about mid-century furniture and hand picks everything himself. He makes sure everything looks great and is in good condition even though most of the pieces are 40+ years old. He's also really personable with customers and hears just what they're looking for. The store is really well curated and my #1 for mid-century.

4.description: Got a sleek Milo Baughman chrome and glass coffee table to balance out the heavy wooden furniture my friend dismisses as "Old World." There is a lot to covet at Dial M and Tim's affable skater personality makes it easy to geek out about furniture with him. Good guy, great store.

1.description: I went in on opening week....thought they would have had a special to attract new clientele but no same rates as all places around. Paper in table / massage was just okay / not sure there was any order to the routine but the girl had strong hands. I'll probably try again.

2.description: I went for 30 minutes but wish I did an hour! Good head massage at the end and also a hot towel too! Good massage for the price! I will go again and try a foot massage as well!

0.description: Been twice now and both times the masseuse provided a nice combination of a swedish massage overall and deep tissue where needed.  Two thumbs up for Grand Spa.
